reviews.review: Surprise bonus. What more can be said about Monet's masterpiece in its custom created settings? Glorious! We had a surprise bonus in seeing famous art dealer Guillame's collection of 1870-1930 art AND a French curated display of US Depression Era art- which certainly gave me a fresh viewpoint.
for Monet lovers. Small museum not to be missed if you like impressionist art. The ground level is all Monet watercolors, but be sure and visit the lower level.

Want a quiet spot to meditate?. I always thought the water lilies were light in color and they were much darker than any print I had ever seen. If you need to settle and collect your thoughts or meditate this is the place to come.

The Water Lillies. After a lovely walk through the Jardin du Tulleries we spent some time looking at the lovely Water Lillies of Van Gough - a relaxing place to sit for a moment and enjoy the beautiful colours 💐

Monet under natural lighting. The Orangerie is available as a combined ticket with the Orsay and represents one of two not to be missed museums. Fans of Monet will marvel at the panoramic installation of large panels in two rooms that are viewed under natural light. The detail is stunning.

One of the most lovely galleries ever devised!. The gallery is so beautiful and the Water Lily's are so absolutely breath taking it is easy to overlook the fantastic collection of Impressionist art downstairs. I ran straight up the ramp to the Monet masterpieces, but my tip would be to start downstairs, then go up to the two galleries. We went for a re-visit and sat down with the Lily paintings. It was crowded, but there were moments when the crowds parted and you feel some alone time in both rooms. Monet was lucky he got to design how his masterpieces would be displayed and they look magnificent! Do not miss downstairs though. Talk about right time and place for getting into art dealing.

Not worth the price of admission. The coolest thing to see here at the Waterlilies, spread out across several rooms with perfect lighting. This museum is very small, worth a quick stop of ~1 hour if you have a museum pass but otherwise skip it in favor of larger collections where you get more bang for your buck.
Wonderful. Simply Stunning. Take your time. Read some literature before arriving. Friendly security and cloakroom workers.

Not convinced this is one of the 'greats'. If you are on a brief visit to Paris I think there are better places to visit. The building itself is interesting turning a rectangle into an oval - but personally I was not enraptured by the art. Perhaps we have just been over-exposed to the water lilies? Took a stroll in the Tuileries and an early lunch!

Worthwhile if you have a museum pass. A small but lovely collection. It only required about 30 - 40 minutes to see all of the artwork in the museum. I'd recommend L'Orangerie if you have a museum pass that includes this admission and have the time for a short visit.

Excellent collection. This is a fantastic museum for a couple of hours, meaning that you can fit other activities in your day. Starting from the basement floor, the collection covers a range of artists from the turn of the 20th century, before leading visitors to the iconic water lilies. Delightfully cogent and well curated.

Worthwhile on the Paris museum pass. We did this after the Louvre as it is located at the west end of the Jardin des Tuileries. You can see la Tour Eiffel from the patio of L'orangerie. The museum itself was a former greenhouse.
Plan your visits to all major museums so that you don't plan to visit on a day when they are closed. This one...


More

Very pleasant museum. I did enjoy this museum much more better than Louvre. There were no queues and place was not so overcrowded as Parisian bigger art museums. I would recommend visiting Orangerie in the morning. There is really lot to see - huge Monet "Nymphae" canvas, Renoir, Utrillo, Derain and many more.

Stunning!. I remembered this museum from a trip taken in the 80 s. As a lover of the Impressionists, this is a wonderful museum to vist. The murals done by Monet and placed here by him are bathed in soft diffused light are unlike anything we have here at the Met in NY. Absolutely worth a visit!!

Restful. I came here just to see the large Monet waterlily paintings. There may have been other paintings there, but I did not have the energy to see anything else. Having only finished 6 months of cancer treatment a few weeks prior, I enjoyed the opportunity to just sit and admire the amazing canvases. It wasn't too busy either which was...


More
Breathtaking. So glad we went to see this. The Waterlilies alone are worth the price of admission. Paul Guillaume exhibit was the icing on the cake.

Small and Perfect. This is such an easy gallery to relax in, and to enjoy the paintings without the huge crowds at the Louvre. This is so much more peaceful and it's easy to see everything at a lleisurely pace in beautiful surroundings. It was lovely to know that the rooms for Monet's water lilies were constructed exactly as he requested. He was...


More
Amazing. Go early and spend some time admiring some of the great impressionist works, particularly Monet's huge canvases. This is a small museum but well worth the effort.

Great special Paul Guillaume exhibit. The Guillaume collection of impressionist artists is totally amazing and not to be missed. To see this great group of famous works in one location is something special. The "Monet " great water lillies is also at this location.

Just fantastic . We bought the two Musee pass for D' Orsay and here for just 4 euro more than D' Orsay alone.
What a fantastic place.
The magic Monet pieces that fill the walls upstairs are breathtaking and well worth a visit alone.
I was further surprised but the other great collections downstairs, mostly of impressionists.
The size of the Musee was...


More

Bateau Mouche on River Seine. It was a good day to stand on the top of the boat as it toured the Seine and a commentary was given of all the highlights.This was also a good way to see many bridges & people. There are many of these & they have become a joke to Parisians. They can be boarded close to the Eiffel Tower.
Romantic View. There's no other place in Paris for a romantic walking with your spouse - Beautiful scene and smells so good that you really feel the Paris scent...
A beautiful night in the city of lights. I took the night tour of the River Seine it was very beautiful. I met a couple from Canada and we shared a bottle of wine.

A beautiful river. We toured along the Seine which provides access (and a different perspective) to the majority of attractions you'll likely want to see.
Tip: Consider doing an evening cruise - the city is beautiful at night from the river. Very romantic.

Fantastic. Fantastic in views around it and also the course of it . It goes through main parts of city , on both sides of river , stands many important buildings , monuments , museums and at last goes around Notre dame.

Cruise on river worthwhile!. Great to see Paris from the river and even more beautiful to do the sunset cruise with dinner and see the monuments and sights at night. Both worthwhile and both a must to do!
River Seine. Being Ok n the river in a boat was a welcomed relief to my poor aching feet. ! The red bus was something that took us to long to figure out do that!

Essential city tour . City bus tours are fine, good orientation. But in this magic city where I live, I'd recommend a river tour, even in bad weather. It's a unique insight into the heart of Paris, and romantic to boot. There're many companies operating from various locations along the river: you can choose get-on, or get-off versions. So if you have time, you can wander around the Tour Eiffel or Notre Dame or wherever. But if not, or you'd rather just enjoy the cruise, do the non-stop: personally, my preference. I've taken more visitors than I care to remember on this experience, and the joy never wanes.

The best view of Paris is from the River Seine. One of my favorite memories from our recent trip to Paris was simply walking across the river Seine and gazing back at such a beautiful city.Bonus tip: The bridge called 'Pont Alexandre III' is the most beautiful to walk across at night!
A must do in Paris. Going to Paris and seeing the river is almost inevitable.When in Paris try to walk a long the river and enjoy it, it is just magic.If possible try to do also a river cruise.

Beautiful and serine . Charming river walk through beautiful Paris. Not good in very cold weather. One can view almost every Paris attraction if you like to walk. And you could break off and frop into a museum or cathedral as well. Old book sellers line the banks in warm weather. Sightseeing ships plough the river under many old and beautiful bridges.

A REVIEW?. How does one write a review of La Seine? You do not. You experience how the world's most beautiful city has managed to integrate one of its resource treasures in a way that maintains it natural character while accentuating its presence in an urban landscape.

Walk along the bank . The Seine flowing through Paris on a chilly evening is an absolutely beautiful experience. Walk along the beautifully maintained pathways next to the river and enjoy the evening. A must do experience whilst in Paris :)

Took the Batobus. Booked the Hop on Hop Off combo with boat tour. Bought the two day tour. So much to see that you need at least two days if not more. Loved riding at night to see the Eiffel Tower lit up. Always lights at the top of the hour for 5 minutes.
looks beautiful ... Crossed the river bridges many times during our family visit to paris in april 2016 .. saw many cruise boats on the sides .. looks good ..
Great way to get an overview of Paris. Be sure to take a boat ride on the Seine to see the heart of Paris. A great thing to do either by day or by night.

Ride the BatoBus!. An all-day pass on the Batobus (a large water-taxi) gives a good view of the pleasant quays and fabulous buildings along the Seine in central Paris. Hop on and off to visit museums, Notre Dame, the Eifel Tower, etc.
Take a hike!. Walking is the best value for a Paris tourist. Walking in Paris is best in the general vicinity of the Seine. Bring your lunch and enjoy the sights between attractions.

Riverboat Ride. There are many boat rides on the Seine. Choose the Vedettes by the Pont Neuf and go at night. Try go on the half hour. It is an hour ride and the Eiffel Tower blinks on the hour. We have been to Paris 3 times and always take this open air ride on the Seine. Truly is Paris at its best!!!!
Dinner Cruise on the Seine. Such a nice way to spend the evening especially with a special someone. A little pricey, but it was a 3 course dinner.

Les bords de Seine. We have not done this in a long time, but on this day, we decided to walk along the scenic lower banks of the Seine. Lots of watering holes and bistros. Many joggers and bikers. Rock climbing along the walls for kids. Many green spaces to sit and rest. An occasional boat docking along the quai. It felt so good - just like we were out in the countryside...

River Seine Tour and Lunch. Great tour as you enjoy lunch while the boat slowly travels up and down the Seine. Nothing compares then seeing the historical buildings of Paris from the river side. The staff on the boat were great and explained what we were passing as they poured wine and served dinner....Takes a few hours but totally worth the time.

Cruise after dark - not to be missed. We booked a one hour evening cruise with Bateaux Vedettes du Pont Neuf. One boards at Pont Neuf. There is a refreshment stand at the dock where we purchased a split of champagne (glasses are supplied) to toast our 25th wedding anniversary during the boat ride. The cruises leave every 30 minutes. By leaving on the half hour, one can see the Eiffel Tower twinkling on the hour. The cruise is narrated - best heard on the open top deck; the lower deck is enclosed. There is a discount if one books on the internet; purchase the ticket and it can be used at any time during the evening. (I believe it is actually good for an extended time period but cannot recall how specifically how long.)

Awesome walk by the river . We did not take the cruise - let me be clear. We walked from the Eiffel Tower along the river to the Alexander bridge to the grand palace. So beautiful. We could take our time to appreciate the architecture, the artwork, the statues etc. We also got a good sense of the French culture. The weather was also quite nice. Would certainly go for a walk again. The river with the boats and bridges was pretty at night too - with lights up in the darkness.

Fresh & friendly, tasty. Just after à one man show (Gaspard Proust), we were at 10pm hungry and starving. I booked here, as it's a brand new place, in front of parc monceau, a quiet borough of paris. 1st, people welcome you with friendliness even having booked at 10 pm and being late (oups). 2nd you can very fast select your wine, in a short but well structured winelist. As usual in paris a lot of bordeaux, but also an excellent Italian from Sicilia. 3rd food has been extremely fresh and tasty, I strongly recommend the tuna toasted and the risotto. Two excellent main courses.Knowing it's an opening menu, as the final list is not yet set up, excellent performance.I will come back the weeks to come

Cruise trip on Seine. We took a cruise from near the port at Eiffel Tower. It was a good cruise with very few people and a good guide who told us about all the historical places that we could see sitting in the comfort of the boat. Light snacks were served under our package ticket and it was good to have hot snacks while enjoying the cold breeze on our faces.
Worth the time. Great ride and well priced beats walking with some great photos opps Eiffel,Notre dame, plus great little bridges and sights
Beautiful. Went down the Seine river. Breathaking views. We went on guided boat cruise and only paid E10 due to having museum pass.
Great summer day stroll. Love that the banks are pedestrianised. Great walk any time. But especially on a lazy Sunday morning,

Flow with the tide. Once in Paris it is recommended to have a late evening boat/ cruise on this river. Not only one can witness the beautiful bridges of Paris come alive but one can also see the beautiful buildings, Eiffel Tower in colorful glory.

Gentle voyage.. Our boat trip was part of a double ticket along with the Eiffel Tower. The good thing about this was the ticket was valid for a year. We chose to take the trip just after our ascent to the top of the Tower so this was very relaxing.We sat on top and had unobstructed views of either side of the river. We used our paper guide although there were headsets with commentary in the very comfortable seating area below, also with good views, but there is something about being out in the open.The whole trip lasted an hour which we felt was excellent value for money.The trips run every 40 minutes and are very efficient.
Unusually Lovely. You can walk the banks of the Seine, either side, or take a cruise, or all three. Whichever you choose you will be captivated. I recommend all three!
Cruise worthy . Hopped on at 6:30 pm cruise! Best of the sunshine and evening view of the famous sights along Paris. Especially the Eiffel Tower great photo opportunity not to be missed!
relaxing. The weather was perfect on the day of our cruise - a great (and relaxing) way to see the sights of this beautiful city.

Great way to orient yourself to Paris. There are several ways to cruise on the Seine and get to see the heart of Paris. If you just want a day's worth of transport, go by Bateaubus! For a reasonable charge you can hop on and hop off all day long, from the Eiffel Tower, to Louvre, Notre Dame and Museum d'Orsay. There isn't any commentary, but it's efficient way to travel without being squished in a metro car, or having to battle traffic. Plus you get the river cruise!There's also a tour boat with commentary in a few languages, including English, regarding the major sites, history and bridges. Vedettes de Pont Neuf leaves from the tip of Ile de la Cite, and is open to the sky for great photography in clear weather. The boat goes from Notre Dame area down to the Eiffel Tower and back in about 45 minutes. The docking location is close enough to walk from St Germain area. If you time the cruise right, near sunset, you'll see the Eiffel Tower light up. If you want to go in style and have dinner along the way, there's the Bateaux-Mouches or Bateau Parisiens or Le Carife. You can research them online to find out about scheduling and pricing. These boats are usually covered and you're more protected from elements. Some have rooftop bars. I haven't done it yet, but it looks like a romantic thing to do for couples!

Lovely sunset cruise. My fiance and I took a lovely sunset cruise on the River Seine. We got on at one of the cruise companies just below the Eiffel tower. I would definitely recommend this however it does get quite packed with other tourists.

A must for every trip to Paris. No trip to Paris is complete without a tour of the Seine on the Bateaux Mouches. I especially enjoy doing this as evening approaches and the lights go on everywhere. It's beautiful and romantic. It is my favorite thing to do when visiting the City of LIght.
Best way to see Paris. An hour cruise along the Seine lets you see most of the main sights of Paris and is probably the best way to see the Eiffel Tower.
Romantic walk. Lovely walk and stunning scenery. Disappointed many of the cafe and bars closed even at lunchtime.Lots of photo opportunities.
Romantic!. I think the most romantic place at Paris is the river cruise along the Seine River, try to get botabus around 4-5 pm the last ride would be great to catch the sunset on Paris

Cruise by night. Perfect to see at night with the lights. Especially the Eiffel Tower. It's worth seeing and doing. The commentary is only on the inside level, however who wants to be inside. :) Enjoy.
Good Time on the Water. I took a cruise on the River Seine, and it was a lovely way to see many of the beautiful bridges, and also some of the attractions of the city.
Nice and relaxing. Had an hours cruise as part of a day tour to Paris, nice and relaxing, the boat was not packed, worth doing when in Paris.
Nice walk. We especially like the night walks by the river. So pretty so Paris! Try to take a river cruise if you can. See all the sights and the bridges all lit up.

Relaxing and informative. The Seine river cruise is well worth the time and money. The east and west banks are both extremely interesting and beautiful. Narration is great and very informative. We sat on the top level until it started raining so we moved back down to the lower deck.

Prelepo . Vredi otići u obilazak brodom. Toliko prelepih objekata za pogledati. Pravo uživanje.
It is worth to go to a boat tour. So many beautiful buildings to see. Real enjoyment.

One hour boat trip. Part of a city tour, we had a one hour trip on the Seine from the Eiffel Tower to just past Notre Dame. Boat was comfortable with both inside and outside (on deck) seating and from the river you do get a different perspective of a lot of the major sites.
River Seine. Virtually any part of the river has some interest. Wonderful restaurants and bars line the river with a fabulous atmosphere.

Good by day, Best by night. Seeing Paris by day is wonderful. Of course, seeing the "City of Lights" by night is best. The same goes for its river. Boat traffic along the River Seine is most scenic and romantic when their lights are on, their parties come alive, at night. Make your trip to a favorite river-side spot, park or bridge, with a bottle of wine and a baguette, to enjoy the river when illumined after dusk.

Our back yard for this stay!. What a view to enjoy the difference of Isle St. Louie. Loved the local jazz playing most nights, and being on the water added depth to this small gem of Paris.Could do w/out the boat trippers, but know some people see City this way. Microphone speaks in numerous languages and bright Lights at night interrupted the beauty, but would stay on the Seine again!

River Flowing in between city of Paris. This River is flowing in between the city of Paris.
This River has 26 bridges over it for transportation.
There are many cruises which takes you to see the River and all Bridges..
Night cruise on the River is awesome.
Mostly all Attractions are situated on Banks of this River .
Regards ,
Sunil Gandhi

Busy with tourist riverboats.. A clean river free of flotsam or jetsam. Riverboats ply through central Paris, taking in the Notre Dame, the Louvre, and the Eiffel Tower with the Trocadero on the opposite side. Apparently there are no tidal issues with the Seine as there is in the Thames.

Take a Cruise. The best way to see a lot of old Paris is to take a Cruise. There are many offered. From short and sweet to long evening dinner cruises. I recommend a dinner cruise! We took one and it was the highlight of our visit to Paris.

Highlight of my timein Paris. Took the River cruise as part of a tour, Skip the Line: Eiffel Tower Summit, Louvre Museum and Cruise. I can't seem to review the excursion so I am rating each piece. The river cruise was a highlight. In 1 relaxing hour I was able to take in many wonderful sights of Paris. Great photo opportunities of the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, and more. Please note that if you are doing the combo tour take a look at the times. We did the tour with a 2:00pm start for the Eiffel Tower, by the time we were done we took the 4:00 cruise and we didn't waste any time. We finished by 5:00 but the Louvre closed that day at 6:00 and we needed time to get over there. Our tickets were good for a few days so we went to the Louvre another day. It is not noted that it might be impossible to get all done in one day, so check the times if you are short on sightseeing time.

Dinner River Cruise. Taking a dinner river cruise along the Seine was an excellent way to get a feel for Paris, have a great meal, and see the city turn on it's lights. This was a great way to "get the lay of the land, before setting out on our own the next day" the service and food were wonderful, may be a bit pricey, but well worth it

Ideal for picnic. Let make a picnic here, just relaxing eating drinkig from your own bag. Best place is to do that around the bridge Le Pont Alexandre IIIVásárolj be és piknikezz a Szajnaparton. Koraestétől. Ideális hely a Le Pont Alexandre III híd környéke

Idyllic river. Great to get the bato bus ( river hop on hop off river bus) andsee the skyline and all the sights from the river. Lovely walking along the river. Lots of seating and along the right bank lots of little cafes and restaurants

Diners Croisieres - Paris en Scene Boat . Did the Bistro dinner at 6:15 (still light but saw the sun go down over the Eiffel Tower - can't beat that!). The food was great- and we thought we got great value for our money. The cruise is short but just enough. Saw all of the monuments and was able to take a lot of pictures. Go!
Must do in Paris. Take the Batobus ticket and just relax in the two hour boat ride. Excellent way to see the points of interest in Paris. Siene river is beautiful and definitely a must visit.

walk the river at night too. to walk the river is a tour of history from the Isle de la Cite and Notre-Dame to where ever you interest lies you will really see Paris and see many beautiful gardens and monuments.

Relaxing ride down the Seine river. There are so many things you can do in Paris but one of the most unforgettable one for me was the river ride down the Seine river. After leaving the Eiffel tower our tour guide escorted us over to the boat for our ride on the Seine river. If you are going to go see the Eiffel Tower you must take a ride. It is so relaxing and so interesting. One of the best ways to see Paris and take photos along the way. I truly enjoyed it. The 1.5 hour ride was just enough and not too much. There is a tour guide on board to provide information on what you are seeing. There are also audio guides in every language to help you follow the many sights on the way.
The River Seine!. A walk along the River Seine is part of what Paris is about for the young and the young at heart. Make sure you experience it.

Views of Paris from the famous Seine. You cannot visit Paris without a trip on one of the boats that cruise up & down the Seine day & night. During a night tour you see the brilliant lights of Paris but during the day you see it in a different light. Night & Day trip recommended
The artery of Paris. So many features and diversions. Tourist boats for sightseeing and dining. Just stand on any bridge and gaze down. So much water under the bridges in this historical river.
Amazing at night. . See Paris in all its glory as the city of lights, leaving the dock and returning on the hour to see the magnificent sparkling Eiffel Tower.
Breathtaking. A cool place to grab some lunch and a beer and just take Paris in. Don't miss the opportunity to do a boat tour with one of the many companies located up and down the river.

Beautiful at night. There is nothing lovelier than strolling along the Seine at night. We did not take a water tour but crossed it and walked beside it at different times of the day and night-- it's a must to take a stroll along the river when in Paris and of course there are all kinds of vendors along it's banks and locks attached to its bridges.

Its just a river. We walked gym the river as we left the eiffel, Tower to walk to the Arc de Triomphe, yes on a hot sunny day it is a beautiful view down the river, I'm sorry but to me it is jusg a river with boats on it and bridges and roads going over it.
Romantic River Ride. One of the highlights of out trip. The boat trip is spectacular, but I thought a bit short. Went during the day.

Don't bother going to Paris if you're not going on the river. Some of the best photos you can get of the city are from the Seine. Also, the hop on hop of boats like the Batoboat are inexpensive (be sure to get discounts if you're a student, etc.) and save you some blisters from walking between tourism sites. And, at night, you can't beat a cruise down the river with all of Paris lit up around you.

The place to be!. One of our favorite things on our trip was picnicking along the Seine River. This is where all the locals hang out at night. Everyone comes with their group of friends with wine & beer and they just drink all night. There a few places there that will sell you wine and cheese and if you run out, there's lots of guys selling bottles of wine.

Relaxing. A sunny October afternoon is perfect for a trek along the Seine. It's relaxing and a nice break after the exertion involved in viewing part of the Louvre. We passed several bridges; on one of them some students were playing jazz classics. Very enjoyable!

Magnifique. . One of the great rivers of the world. Constant activity of commercial traffic, barges, cruise lines, water busses and barge homes. The center and dividing line. The very life of Paris itself. Endlessly fascinating, stimulating and mesmerizing. Everything is measured by its proximity to the river. Cruises offer great views and commentary of major Paris locations and buildings.

Such a great experience!. Yachts de Paris did such a wonderful job! My husband and I honeymooned in Paris and when we made a comeback this trip, we wanted to do a river/dinner cruise. He booked this in advance and it was so much fun. I have certain dietary concerns due to allergies and these guys were accommodating and very nice about it. They served an amazing meal, you can purchase all you can drink or only couple of drinks, and the views are amazing. We were fortunate enough to go out on the river during a full moon and the pictures I got with the Eiffel Tower with the moon behind are amazing! These guys do it well, you won't be disappointed :)

Mesmorizing!. My first visit to Paris. Our hotel was right across from the River Seine. We walked alongside and over bridges to see different angles. What a beautiful river surrounding by the Paris architecture, filled with boats and couples lovingly seated at the riverside. Folks had wine with picnics along the Seine.

Dinner Cruise. Four of us booked a dinner cruise and were very pleased with the meal and the experience. It was a little tricky finding the ship on the dock: there were GPS co-ordinates but I didn't have that feature. But after inquiring at one of the yachts we discovered our ship. Very few people on the ship and it was rainy but no matter we were in Paris, had wine and the lovely company of friends.

A part of Paris you cannot miss. The river runs through Paris and you will likely see it many times during your visit. While I skipped the river cruise this time, it was scenic to cross some of the bridges, as well as walk along the river to enjoy the sites and observe other people. It is very scenic in the Notre Dame area as it passes along the cathedral.
Lovely & chilled. We were fortunate with the weather but an ideal way to see the amazing sights of Paris I.e the Eiffel Tower & notes dame, while sailing down the river.

This is a must. This will give you a great sense of where things are and what you should make plans to see. I would recommend you do this on your first day. Then map out the different arrondissements to visit each day.

Iconic and must see. River Seine is one of the truly iconic places in Paris. It flows through Paris and you should get all the famous landmarks like Eiffel Tower, Alexander bridge, Concorde square etc. with the river. In fact the Seine river cruise will cover all this and is an enjoyable experience.
Romantic walk along the river. Just beautiful. First ever holiday without the kids. We walked a ate, and drank and kissed. What else would you do in Paris?

Waling along Canal St Martin AR19. In all cities one of our favorite things to do is walk around. This particular location has been overcome with people who have take the banks of the canal and surrounding area as their new home. Many live in tents or other temporary structures. I would recommend this be an area you not travel late in the day.

Ms. The River Seine what an exciting relaxed place to be strolling along and just enjoy the sights it offers .I did a 7 day River Cruise from Paris to Normandy Paris this was a dream come true in all senses holiday , the scenery on the way breathtaking, villages, mountains, farmland, and the return back into Paris at night was magical.. will do it all over again. Love ❤️ Paris

It wigles through Paris,often in sight.. Following our noses and an occasional sneak peek at the city map, we got to the popular Left Bank of the Seine. The river is a Paris Landmark. Book sellers greet strollers The magnificent Notre Dame is a constant backdrop. There are multiple opportunities to see or cross over the Seine. Bridges are magnificent. You can't miss it.

River Seine Cruise. We did a one hour cruise with commentary in English and French. The journey goes up to the Eiffel Tower then turns around and goes back to Notre Dame. It was 12 euros each and was very enjoyable in the sunshine.

The river is wonderful to walk down; I would skip the tour. I enjoyed walking by the river multiple times. We ended up taking a tour and I found it to be not so good. The presentation was a little hard to follow and I think that the tape was "off" relative to what we were viewing. I would just take a walk and call it a day

lovely in the summer, picnic. Great place to visit during the summer. Walk along the Seine or do a picnic with friends. The wine and rose will go down smoothly. The only problem is that there are no public toilets so try to be close to an area that has a fast food chain or a bar. I like going to the place behind Notre Dam Cathedral. There is an area where you will see hundreds of people drinking and hanging out over the summer. Otherwise, there are boat tours there, but I have never been on one. You can always try.

circumnavigating the city. We took two different trips in boats on the Seine while in Paris. The Bato-Bus was a pleasant way to go from one stop to another to different stops, and we liked it. We also took a sunset tour around the city, and it was beautiful and relazing. I don't remember the name of the one we used, but it was a great way to see many of the sights in different lighting. The whole trip was about an hour and a half. We got lots of excellent pictures from this vantage.

We took a boat ride after our bicycle tour.... We did a BYOB boat tour and it was very nice. They highlighted all the points of interest in several different languages. It's also nice to walk along the river at night and have quite a few bridges to cross it.
Great trip. As part of the Big Bus ticket, saw views of Paris from a different prospect. Definitely take your camera for some great memories

Especially Good for Night Viewing of City. Do this boat trip at night and enjoy the city lights as you pass by them. At least one trip. Not so exciting during the day. Walking along the Seine day or night is wonderful and should not be missed. Traveling alone or with someone you won't be disappointed at the night time festivities and views.
River trip from the Pont Neuf worth doing.. An hour which gets you familiar with many of the landmarks along the river from The Tour Eiffel to Notre Dame

Much better than the Thames. If you've ever walked along the Thames you'll find walking along the seine far more enjoyable. You can literally walk right next to the river all the way thru the city and several years ago they closed the road next to the river and now it's full of bikes, runners, walkers, bars, restaurants, picnics you name it. It's a fab place to hang out for a evening with loads of bars and restaurants to choose from. So why not head down there and soak up the atmosphere!!
Worth every cent. We took this cruise and worth every cent. Look forward to doing it again. The food no complaints and the service very good.
You can't miss it.. It runs all along Paris so you can't miss it. Lots of restaurants and cafes along the way. Some of the bridges crossing it are a must.

Trip Boat along the Seine. The trip along the Seine was good and we could hop on and off at different stop which you could have done all day for €17. This gave you time to get off and walk around spending time at each attraction. The name was called Batobus.
First day in Paris. It was a beautiful trip down the River Seine with a tour group. It was sunny, but cool. I think this was a great way to spend my first day in Paris.

Sunset picnic on Seine was the best thing I did in Paris . If you want to actually feel blissfully alive, awestruck and experience the ecstasy of the present moment, here are your instructions: 1) Go to the grocery store with your travel companion(s), stock up on wine, cheese, fruit, croissants, snacks, etc. 2) Grab a blanket then head over to the banks of the River Seine to watch the sunset and the world go by 3) Take lots of photos 4) Pinch yourself that this is actually happening and this is indeed your life experience right now
Lovely. Walked it on a sunny September and it has amazing views.Would highly recommend , you get to see a lot off different people and buildings.
Take a cruise at night. take a river cruise at night and you will not regret it. You will experience history, modern Parisian culture, and an amazing view of the city while cruising on the Seine.

Fun River to Watch. We sat by the Seine for a couple of hours and watched the foot traffic in front of us and the river tour boats. We took a bottle of wine, some cheese and French bread and made a picnic out of it. I have been on a tour boat before and it's a rest way to see some of the major sites from afar.

River Cruise on Seine. An absolutely fabulous way to see life in Paris. The cruise takes you past so many attractions and it's also great to see so many people just chilling along the river. Wonderful.
nice view from antother perspective to Paris. you´ve just to invest a view hours to get a new perspective and another view to Paris and it´s sights - it´s worth doing it.

Romantic and ideal for bikes. Had a nice walk allong the seine on a nice everning only bad point being the food festival which sells cold foods from around the world and charges 3 euros for the privalige seems to run daily till 10 pm yet is all closed at 8pm some stalls great others not cold indian food not really my thing.. hence river loses a star as things like this needs to be monitored in such a iconic place once again this weekend france letting itself down but river itself well worth 4 stars just monitor your consesions love the free wifi and bikes and bike paths on fiver too
Great place to take a walk. . Nice place to take a stroll. I did a river cruise also which was a nice way to see some of the sites.

Riverboat cruise at night. We did this our last night in Paris and loved it. Everything looks so different lit up at night. There were tons of young people all along the banks of the river. So cool! There are many different types of boats and cruises so walk around and decide. We were not looking for food or drink but did want an open air roof. All the boats are in the area just below the Eiffel Tower and they have different queues and different prices. I think we paid around 20 euros each for a 45 minute cruise.
River Tour. A very nice way to see some of major sights and overview of Paris, especially with children. Choose a nice day.
Great surroundings with picturesque views!. Endless great surroundings with historical buildings. It's great for either walking or running around the river in the morning enjoying the view.
Beautiful. I took the boat ride on this river many years ago and it is still a very beautiful memory in my mind. I would recommend it.
A lovely walk along the Sena. Not to be missed. Beautiful city river. If you can go on the night cruise with the lightings of the buildings. We had dinner and champagne!!. So romantic.
Beautiful. I love walking down the River Seine it is such a wonderful cultural experience. See what is essentially Parisienne as you walk through the city.

"Walks along the Siene,laughing in the rain."-ABBA. "Walks along the Siene,laughing in the rain."-Abba,"Our Last Summer".
Well it wasn't raining,but actually very HOT when we visited but never the less,really enjoyed seeing this famous river.
Take a boat tour or picnic along the banks…or both!

Awesome City Cruise!. Take the cruise when you visit Paris! It's not so expensive but you will see exclusive view of the city. Clean river with clean air. I really enjoy the ride. It keeps me amaze how the people from the past had this brilliant ideas! I recommend the evening ride so you can see the lights of Eiffel Tower from the river. So, romantic!

The Seine. It appears that Parisians love to relax. That is what we saw all along the Seine during an evening cruise. Many colorful bridges, people relaxing along the banks, a full lit up view of the Eiffel Tower....

You are here so touch that river. When folks are in Paris, hardly anyone actually goes down to the river Seine. So be the first in your neighborhood to collect a few drops of the River Seine to take home

enjoy the sights. booked on line and get boat ride tickets at a discounted rate. travel at dusk, see the historical buildings while listening to the boat guide commentary. enjoy all the historic landmarks minus the hustle & bustle of Parisian traffic; buildings and the river banks are lit up. as night approach Parisian gather to relax on both side of the river banks - you might catch a glimpse of people dancing the Tango.
Walk along the river. Beautiful to stroll along the Seine and take in the vibe of the city. Make sure to visit the booksellers along the river bank.

One ways to explore part of paris. This wonderful one hour tour is really wonderful and enjoyable. Manage to get the evening time slot and even took great lovely picture of the evening sunset Eiffel Tower and the shining glowing Eiffel Tower in the night.

One of the top 5 items in your hit list when visiting Paris !. We had booked the tour through Viator which proposes the "Eiffel Tower Skip-the-Line Ticket & Seine River Cruise" in the same package at a good price. The meeting time for the 1st part is fixed but you can take the boat tour with Bateaux Parisiens at any time of the day ... just take into account some queuing time during the peak summer season (we had to wait for about 30 mins. in July and it was scorching hot , so don't forget to carry a good dose of water !)...As for the trip, it lasted about an hour and was magnificent; the views of most of t he famous places and bridges of Paris from the boat were breathtaking. It's a to-and-from trip so you get the views from both sides and angles. BTW, even if seating space is provided, you end us standing outside or on top to get the best views and pictures. Indeed, a unique experience and highly recommended. Next time may be we'll try the night tour...

Batobus is Public Transit. We walked the Seine and took the Batobus. The Seine was worth the walk and we did see Paris from the Batobus. But the Batobus is expensive public transit. 40€ for 2. The experience is like any city bus or subway: Crowded, pushy, stinky, noisy. Very touristy.On Saturday September 24th, a EDM DJ set up on the river outside the Louvre. That was awful. Again hang on to your wallet and watch around you.

Great way to spend an hour and see many sights.. Great way to spend a sunny day hour. The boat takes you on an hour ride where you are able to see sights from different vantage point. The young man who did the narrative was great.

Champagne Cruise!. As we sailed down the Seine from the Eiffel Tower, our excellent sommelier gave us a tour through history, through the city, and through various champagnes. The venue was outstanding, and so was he (Richard). We had a private area at the front of the boat, away from the crowds, inside and outside. A most lovely evening!
Beautiful ride. If you in paris... Dont miss this ride.. We took a boat ride in this river... Evening is the best time but not very late evening... Beautiful view of the city.
Good. Well worth taking a Bateaux Mouche for an overview of the buildings along the Seine. Good for photographs of' Les Ponts' and the Eiffel Tower.
An hour boat trip is perfect. There are plenty short cruising options along this historic and scenic river that should satisfy almost everyone.

Magical!. Loved 2.5 hours on the "batobus", which allows you to get on and off at 8 different sites along the River in the center of Paris. Relaxing, not expensive, a great way to see More Dame, the Eiffel Tower, and beautiful old buildings all along the way
Great views!. A relaxing boat ride up the Seine on a sunny day is the best way to enjoy some of the architecture and sights if Paris.

Boat tours are really good. We did a boat tour from Notre Dam bridge up to the town and back around the island and learned so much. Got to see the smallest house in Paris and the building the white house is based on along with lots of other major sites in the city. The tour guide was so knowledgeable and friendly. Would defo recommend a boat tour
very scenic. there are many bridges that cross the river. There are many scenic and dinner cruises on the river located between the Eiffel tower and Notre Dame
Awesome views. Had a picnic with my wife for our anniversary atop the Seine river. We had a fantastic day wit a wonderful view!

Lovely. Take a walk or boat cruise along the river seine. Take in the culture and architecture of lovely Paris along the way. Best views are whilst on the river. Night cruise is delightful when the Eiffel Tower lights up, you won't be disappointed. You will have to queue for boat trip with or without a pass or prepaid ticket.
Romantic. Boat cruise is a nice way to see this river. You can see all the major monuments along the way. The bridges are so beautiful.

Nice walk to avoid busy roads, beware of roma scam. My B&B host recommended that I walk along the River Seine to avoid the busy roads that parallel the river. She was right. Once down next to the riverbanks, the traffic noise immediately dies down and is replaced with water sounds and a few other people enjoying the stroll. Just be aware that as in all of Paris, there are occasional scams. When I began walking down the stairway to the river, a man appeared to pick up a gold ring from the ground and approached me wanting to sell it to me "cheap.". Aware of this scam, I just said, "non, non" and walked away.

A must have tour by boat to see highlights of Paris. A tour on the Bateaux Mouches or whatever river boat cruise gives you a wonderful perspective on Paris and its layout and beautiful buildings. Despite any rain these tours are run and offer inside and outside viewing areas and run frequently. The audio guides aren't the greatest sound and you should really go up on the top deck to truly feel the Paris air!
Lovely!. You will see a mix of people and experience the local culture on any walk along the Seine. If you have time, book a river/dinner cruise.

Great activity to do!. I only have great memories from this activity. Me and my husband paid for a 1 hour boat trip. The price was 19€ each, and it included a glass of champagne or a crêpe. The boat company was Vedettes of Paris.While you're on the boat, the staff is narrating in 3 different languages (English, French and Spanish) the places you're passing by. Like I said, it's great activity to do.

Bateau on the Seine. A cruise up and down the Seine is one of the most scenic, rich and historical cruises one can take, it takes you back in time and wonder at where the world has come from. The creative architecture and practical technology. These views are timeless no matter how many times you see them.
Romantic. You need to walk along the river seine, especially along the City Island. Take a scenic cruise (day and night) to really appreciate all the bridges and monuments you can see along the river
crusing down the river. We did the dinner river cruise it was very good as it gave you a different perspective on Paris The food was excellent
Beautiful. Beautiful...especially at night. Too bad idiots have defaced it with graffiti. But still exciting! Stopped for dinner & wine at a spot on the river

A Bateaux Mouche is a must!. Enjoy a slow boat ride down the Seine to see all the sights from a different angle, or just go on a leisurely stroll along the banks of the river! In the summer there is even tango dancing along the left bank.

The best way to see Paris.. We spent a lot of time visiting the sights of Paris by water. The Seine is magical. Along its length lots of colourful boats filled the way and offered a lovely visual backdrop to the city. You can stop along the river and dine on the banks or use it as a stop off for all the different sights. I loved the boat travel along the Seine. It offered a little relief from all the walking. A moment to catch your breath and just be amazed by the passing view.

A great walk, amazing views. What an amazing amount of atmosphere can be absorbed by walking the Seine. The best walk is on the Left Bank from the Eiffel Tower to the Pont Alexandre... The gold decorated bridge. You can either walk at street level on broad pathways lined with trees, or take stairs or a ramp down to the river side. I walk up at street side, then down riverside on my daily walks. The river side walk is so vital. Along the river you find the tour boats, working barges, people having picnics at well placed public tables (free!) , outdoor cafes near Pont de Alexandre, climbing walls, and more. It feels very safe as there are friends, families, tourists, singles all out and about at all hours. A must do in my opinion, and not strenuous at all.
Beautiful river. To properly to see the Seine you should do two cruises one in the evening say in conjunction with the Eiffel Tower and a longer one doing lunch in the daylight.
Ah Paris. Taking a bateau along the Seine is always a great choice. You really see the beauty of Paris from a different point of view!I highly recommend it

Not as dirty as the Thames. Some nice views along the bridges. Often spoiled by pushy salesmen. There is nothing too special about the river. Looks fairly dirty, but still alot cleaner looking than the London Thames
Cruise on the Seine. The banks of this river are full of stunning buildings and views. Be sure to take a cruise at night to see everything lit up and also the eiffel towers sparkling lights.

WOW experience. G8 place to spend limitless time... can be there with friend with bottle of wine or champagne, can be there with loved one keeping hands in hand with red roses...there are several options to try... river cruse to see around area. even you can have food on cruse.. cruse travel cost from 18 euros to 30 euros.. each beer cost 8-10 euros on cruse.. also you will find at the river front artists performing various road side shows like playing instruments, dancing, adventure things, magic shows etc. visited at least 100 times

An empire was once here. It's clear by the grand statues of gold lions and large bridges that Paris was made for an emperor. Walking down the River Seine, enjoying the fresh air, the trees, and the people around you who are in just as much awe as you are is a great way to experience the love that is in the air in Paris.
Nice and clean. Passing by the River Seine and quiet busy river too. Beautiful to see and take pics because the surrounding buildings are historic site. Nice one!
Bato bus. We took the bato bus hop on and off for a day. It is a lovely way to get around, or you can just enjoy the ride, .We bought tickets at a booth by the Eiffel Tower.

Go in the eve for a walk. Turns out that this is a popular resort for young people- around 7 in the evening the sidewalk near the river was packed with young ladies and gents sitting and drinking wine. it was a scene out of the movies!
nice walk along pretty river. there are many areas to walk down and sit along the river. just a river but the architecture is obviously history !

Take a boat tour. Fabulous way to spend an afternoon .. Take one of the many cruises offered for a couple of hours on the seine.. You will see many of the buildings from a different perspective while a guide will explain all the historical events associated with them.. Passing under all the famous bridges after crossing them is also a treat. And on a sunny day you might even get a tan.. Refreshments are available on board but if you want to make your own picnic bring your own.Get seats on the top deck near the rail to make picture taking easier.
Beautiful River and surroundings!. We loved our Seine River cruise! A great way to see the city of Paris! Loved all of the bridges and great architecture along the shores.
Fab place to relax. It's so relaxing to sit by and watch the boats go past.. depending on when you sit we sat in front of the Effie tower and the views were stunning

Disappointed by Viator Seine River Evening cruise. Took so costly package from Viator for evening cruise dining -3 course meal.It was huge disappointment ,adress mentioned on the tickets were wrong ,when called on number mentioned ,they were not able to understand anything,waste of money.

Great view on Paris. This is excellent way to have another perspective on this beautiful city. Hop on hop of on Seine, guided tour, very informative and very interesting way to find out something new about this amazing place on Earth. Scenery from the river cruise is spectacular.

Lovely highlight of Paris. This river winds its way through Paris and you are never far from it when on the tourist track. I definitely recommend a boat cruise, we started ours in the daylight and finished at night as the lights came on at the Eiffel Tower - stunning!

River cruise if youre a first time visitor.. Took a river cruise along this, informative with the earphones to help. A good way to see lots of sights in the city and a decent legnth of ride too, not too long to be bored but informative enough for the price paid.Would not go on it again as I have seen everything I want to see, however if it is your first time in Paris, worth a visit.

See it. Take a boat ride.. We took a boat ride on the Seine. It doesn't really matter what cruise you get on the scenery will be spectacular. We opted for an evening cruise and later visited Notre Dame and saw it again. If you are a foodie or wine lover you can find boat tours that offer lunches and dinners. Sky's the limit!

Ride the boats!!!. On a lovely sunny day, ride up on top and see some of the most beautiful views in Paris. Several ways to see the Seine, you can walk down the steps to the river and walk along several parts or take a river cruise for an hour, it was lovely!
Day tour. We did the river hop on hop off pass up an down its was cheap an relaxing an again another good way to get to see the main points of Paris

Love to run along the boardwalk. I always try to stay someplace near the Seine as to try and run through the streets would be challenging. I love being able to run along the river in the AM when there are significantly fewer people.

For a walk or a cruise it's wonderful . We did both! Took a dinner cruise, which was fantastic & walked for a couple of miles during the daytime, as well. Such a special river & one of the best parts of Paris for us!

Trafalgar. Provides great riverboat view of Eiffel Tower at night, as well as the micro copy of the Statue of Liberty. Pretty grimy in some areas but still worth walking by it. The night boat ride much better.

Boat ride to see the amazing architecture in Paris. Amazing views of Paris from a boat ride down the Seine. There are also romantic dinner cruises. Most cruises have lower decks for rainy days.
Don't miss this experiment when visiting Paris.

september 2015. we went on a river cruise to celebrate my 50 th birthday
lovely day out weather was excellent
river cruise was lovely ,commentary was very informative
such a relaxing afternoon

good starting point for your Paris exploration. Visit the Eiffel Tower and then take one of the many boat tours of the Seine. Get a different water view of all the sights and then decide which to visit on land. If the day is hot and/or sunny make sure to take enough water and sunscreen. The evening tours with all the lights are very dramatic.

A Must. If you can; once in your life go; this City is worth a visit. A place of history,culture and design. There are not enough superlatives to describe this place.
Tick it off your 'bucket list'!

The lifeline of Paris. Take a cruise down the beautiful river Seine.This leisurely experience is 45 minutes to 1 hour of bliss. You can also choose to use a water taxi to get around from one attraction to another.

Still lovely. It is still a treat to walk along the river Seine in Paris. While I was here this time there was a wonderful air show going on overhead. Some areas are a bit trash laden, however, there is still great beauty here.

Only way to enjoy Paris!. We bought tickets for the Bateaubus ( Hop-on / Hop off) which is an excellent way to see this part of Paris, looking at the many buildings as you glide along really gives the traveler a different perspective of the architecture and grandeur of the buildings.there are many ways to enjoy the Seine from private chartered boats to floating restaurants, and you will never cease to be amazed by the colorful barges and scenery as you sit back and relax.

A tour at night is best. I was surprised how affordable the tours were. Tours with open air decks on top are best for night time viewing. We opted for a dinner cruise but did not like the food at all and wished we had just done the standard tour.

A true Yorkshire review. just beautiful, the lovely weather really showcased this river with its cafes, shops and restaurants at the side. We cycled a long way along the Seine and loved every minute. Lots of pleasure trips going up and down and although we didn't do that as we had the bikes, the prices looked reasonable and everyone seemed to be having a lovely time, waving and blowing kisses haha
So historic--so romantic. The River through the heart of Paris is just such a treat! Bustling with activity and so beautiful!!It is a delight to cross it, walk along it, or just simply stare.

Beautiful river which Paris is built around. Very lively riverbanks, with many people eating/drinking outside along the banks. Many beautiful buildings, bridges and trees along the river to enjoy. A lot of music happening both planned (at restaurants/bars/venues) and impromptu (people sitting around a circle playing) as you walk along.
"Relaxing time out". We took a cruise down the river Seine starting at the Eiffel Tower. It's a lovely way to see the sights and have a rest after a long day sightseeing. Well worth doing!

Take a river cruise. Either a day or night cruise is a wonderful way to see this beautiful city.I caught the Metro to near the river and then walked along the esplanade where there are plenty of boats offering 1 hr cruises.
nice river. The river is great. You can sit along the shore and watch all the boats pass by. Access is easy to find.

How to enjoy.. Buy some bread.
With your love, Walk along this river.
You can get anywhere.(Museum, Church, Restaurant).
Just look around riverside.
It was the best experience in Paris.

belle riviere. i was at the top at some point of the day and looking at the river. it looks so calm yet so agressive. the river is very beautiful and there is a boat which goes round Paris. amazing trip

Relaxing way to see Île de la Cité. Rode one of the cruises (Bateaux Parisien) along River Seine after six hours at the Louvre. Walked all the way from the Louvre to the Eiffel Tower, so the cruise was a very welcome way to sightsee. It was so nice seeing the riverbanks and the beautiful buildings while we rested. Some Parisians even waved to us when we passed by.The boat was spacious and felt very safe. Each seat had a headset where you can hear short summaries about the notable buildings we passed by, thankfully with a couple of language choices.Great way to rest after a long day of walking, but I don't recommend to do when it's sunny because it can be pretty hot. If your boat has a secure top deck, I hope you try it! The downside is, no headsets.Note: This was part of our Paris City Pass.

Charming Waterway Running Through Lovely Paris. There is nothing more French than a stroll along the Seine or perhaps a trip on one of the many tour boats (romantic in the evening if warm, buzz kill if cold). The bridges, the architecture of the buildings that line it, and the overall ambiance are absolutely lovely. The crowds can be a bit daunting, but hold onto your wallet and stroll along for hours of enjoyment. Cheers!
Take a cruise. Loved the Seine River, loved taking in the views, so much to see. It rained a little but they closed the roof so it was all good. Nice and relaxing.

A hive of activity . We stayed in accommodation along the river and were so glad. It was lovely to be able to stroll along the Seine morning and night. So many people picnic along the edge of the river. It's busy but somehow tranquil.
Beautiful. Love everything about Seine. We visited everyday we were there, even when it rained. Had a dinner cruise one night and it was wonderful.

Take a cruise at night. Enjoyed the river cruise . The Eiffel tower is beautiful at night and sparkling lights on the hour is wonderful. Can see many of the important building while sailing up and down.

Great tour & new experience. Loved the tour specifically during sun down & it was full of amazing sceneries. Its a good chance to explore all the Paris river side in a fun trip. You can take really nice pictures

Incredible. Seine is indeed the heart of Paris. Spent a couple of days walking around Paris and the Seine was a constant companion. On one visit, the floods in Northern France had caused the Seine to rise to its highest levels in decades. Most museums were closed on account of the rising waters. It was bursting it's banks and had swallowed the pavements and roads along its banks. One could see the tops of the trees and some structures. It looked powerful and beautiful. On another visit the waters had fallen and I spent evenings with lovers, friends and other travellers in time, listening to musicians, philosophers, and the sounds of Paris along the banks.

Take a river cruise. We signed up for a river cruise with Viator when we arrived in Paris as a way to get the lay of the land. It's a fantastic way to see the City. You get off at stops with your guide and then come back and catch another boat to continue the tour. The river is lovely and we saw many things that we went back later to explore.
Just Beautiful!. We never tired of gazing at the river and all the ships, boats and people. It is beautiful and peaceful!

Boat Ride. We too a one hour boat ride at the beginning of our vacation and were able to get a feel for all of the iconic attractions, and a brief description of them. It is a cheap tour and well worth it.
Amazing boat tour. This river gives some of the best views of Paris,You must go on a boat cruise down the Seine and take in the jaw dropping views in front of you.

Take the river cruise at night!. We took a night-time river cruise on a beautiful clear night in September. With everything lit up, Paris was beautiful in ways I didn't expect. People line the Seine eating and hanging out and the sights from the river (such as Notre Dame) give you a unique perspective on such masterpieces.
Beautifully clean.... The River Seine is a great place to go for a cruise on a hot summer's day, passing by many places of interest.

Boat Tour on the Seine. You have to do this! There are many tours available. Go down to the pier near the Eiffel Tower, or better still, book before you go much easier. Beautiful River, amazing architecture and history.

Be sure to take a scenic barge to tour the river!. Best appreciated when on one of the numerous barge companies that take you around the river and best when its sunny and not too hot , as you will want to be on the outside deck

A cruise is well worthwhile.. We took a lunch cruise this time round, very enjoyable. Photo opportunities are in abundance including the national library (you'll struggle to make out its "3 books" architectural style), Notre Dame, Tour Eiffel and some lovely bridges.Soak up the scenery, just avoid the water!

lovely! you must do a cruise!. we did the cruise, lovely! the tour is on a head set attached to your seat, well it was on our boat....and big screen up ahead, but plenty of room to get up and take your piccies! the we strolled up and down the left bank and found a nice place for lunch....v.romantic!

The Seine. Whether cruising on the Seine or strolling along the Left Bank or Right Bank, crisscrossing along one of the many beautiful bridges, you are in for a great time. So many historical and beautiful areas to explore and all just a step away from the river
Walk by. Drive by. We had a stroll along the river. Over the bridges to the other side. Drove by with car to the further points. Lovely day and not crowded at all in sept.

Cruise . Had a nice night time cruise down the river with a tour guide explaining facts about our surroundings which was really interesting. Theres so much nightlife along the river at night, full of bars and people all the way along the waters edge
Lots of things to do along the river..... Beautiful restaurants serving delicious food, other sites as well. Only negative was how dirty it was and how the French don't know what a trash can is for.

Pleasure at nearly no cost in Paris .. The river Sein cruise is one of the sources of pleasure in Paris . and you can just walk nearby the river and will get pleasure as well . Open Area around it , suitable for walking and sure for photo shots . different levels of cruises are available , and you can also enjoy walking , running , doing any kind of sports for free .

Great way to see Paris from a different perspective. Fun side trip, especially with a group. There were 7 of us and we brought along wine and cheese (yep, you can bring your own) and spent a relaxing hour on the boat away from the throng of tourists. BTW, the tours are of various lengths and the most convenient location to buy tickets and get on the boat is right next to the bridge by the Eiffel Tower.

As mystical as it sounds. We saw a beautiful view (just like this picture) from the Eiffel Tower. It's a part of history, and its just amazing to see it in person ....just to say you have been to the Seine River....why not? A boat trip on the river secured the excitement!
So pretty. Go for a picnic either day or night. Super pretty everywhere. Go for a long walk if your up for it. Don't bother with the over priced boat tours/shuttles
Cruise with music and food. Booked in advance for early evening cruise price included meal wine and entertainment perfect way to spend a sunny September Evening !
A Paris must see. I took a bateau mouche trip for one hour and had a lovely trip without listening to the translation of what we were seeing. For an overview, take a walk or a trip on the seine.

Beautiful bridges. . We love the river, the bridges, and the way it keeps you orientated in the city dividing the northeast and southwest. We love the batobus( river bus you can ride all day as much as you want for 11euro). Much cooler down on the water as it is 90 degrees here today.

Don't miss. Even if you only buy a Botobus ticket for the day, a trip down the River Seine is a must when in Paris. You get an amazing appreciation of the beautify of this City when you see it from the River.

Im in love. I celebrated there my birthday with husband ) we took a tour for dinner night , it was so romantic and the best think that ever happened to us untill now our emotions is a same like was before there ...this place amazing for a date ...for family ...for friends...for some celebrations...) music is a live and so relaxing, the menu is nice also ) there hVe a 3 types of seats ) do not econome on seats because the best veiw will make u fly

Paris holiday. Top recommendation to do the river Dinner cruise - 3 courses and wine for €99. Go on the 830 session and you spend 2 hours staring at the lovely lights while enjoying your food and drink. Do check out how you will get home the 2 closest subways both closed when we did this - a bit scarey for us foreign girls. 3rd time lucky when we found 1 over by Diana memorial.

Great mode of transportation. The river had a great breeze going on, so the Batobus was the way to go. We hopped off and hopped back on. Worth the day. The river itself is a busy but very romantic spot to hand about at.

Take a romantic stroll along the Seine!. The Seine splits Paris into the right and left banks. It is fun to walk along the river and watch the boats traffic as well as see all the fun houseboats with their gardens and eclectic styles. There are several companies that will take you up the river at night for a spectacular view of the city of lights. It is quite romantic. Just be cautious of pickpockets.
River cruise. We took a Viking river cruise from Paris to Normandy. The scenery along the Seine is not particularly interesting. The scenery on the Duro river in Portugal is much prettier.
Tourist Trap. This attraction is nothing more then a tourist trap where boats are trying to rip off tourists. I was diappointed to see the unimpressive surroundings of the river.

Take a tour during Night Time. Although it is much more difficult top appreciate some of the architecture of the bridges at night, the view of Paris lit up at night from the river is breath taking. Take a tour, shouldn't be to expensive and enjoy!

I know it's a little touristy but you really must!. I loved our little trip along the Seine. It was an hour long trip and just about right. We saw everything we needed to, got some great photos and it saved us actually going to the Eifel Tower (again) because the obligatory Facebook photo with the tower in the background looks great from the boat.Also, Paris is sadly quite short of tourists right now and so the trip was easy to get on, easy to see and a pleasure to enjoy.

Nice to see the Seine. Didn't do the river cruise but we did walk partway to the Arc De Triumph along the Seine. Occasional vaganonds but they don't bother you. There are some picnic areas which are really clean. You don't get to see a lot though as it is lower to street level.
Champagne river boat cruise. Excellent value for money and a beautiful way to look at the city and gives you very good idea of all the other places of interest
Very nice way to spend an hour or two. We took the Batobus from Notre Dame to the Eiffel Tower and really enjoyed the experience of viewing buildings built mostly in the 1700's

It's a river. It's a river with water and boats and buildings alongside. The beauty of this river, though, is that it runs through the wonderful city of Paris.If you get a chance, take a river cruise to see some of the sights. Take a night one too to see the Eiffel Tower in its sparkling glory.Or stroll the banks for a different view.

is it green or was that just me?. the river was great with loads of beautiful bridges to cross to see various landmarks. we took a trip down the river which was great and the weather was amazing which made it even better. although its appeared green so I'm not sure if tis my dodgy eyesight or it was actually green lol

Try the Batobus!. We bought a regular day ticket for the Batobus rather than one of the passes designed for tourists. It was a fantastic way to see many sights and so much fun. On the day we travelled it wasn't crowded and it was a thoroughly enjoyable trip. It can be a bit tricky working out where the Batobus stops are as they are not massively lit up or signposted. Once you find them there are ticket offices and there are good deals available, especially as you can jump on and off the river boat for as long as you want to. The approach to the Eiffel tower is fantastic it's so exciting seeing it beginning to loom in the distance!
Morning jog along Seine. Run the quais with French locals. Can be a bit stinky under bridges but car free and how cool to see Paris this way. Buy croissants and coffee on way home!!

Great. Did a boat cruise along the river seine and it was fab. Definitely recommend it to anyone visiting. We went past the Norte dame, saw the Eiffel Tower and a Statue of Liberty replica. A different way of seeing Paris.

Miles and miles of river banks to wander.. The Seine in Paris is a great place to see the city, you can walk along it or zig zag across the bridges to either side, each bridge is something to see as it hold a piece of Paris' history. Many attractions are situated along the Seine too. From the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Petit Palais, Grand Palais all the way down to L'intitute du Monde Arab...In the spring and summer there are lots of activities along the Seine, including Paris Plage, where they bring in LOADS of sand and you can site eat and play there.
Cruising the Seine. This cruise was relaxing and the food was delicious. We were able to see the beautiful architecture of the city from a whole different perspective.
The River Seine. Cutting right through the middle of this incredible city! Passing several beautiful bridges with a view of the Eiffel Tower, mused D'Dorsay Place de la Concorde.
Walk along the banks. Walk along the banks, cross its bridges, and ride on a batobus. It is such a part of Paris. We have enjoyed it.
rivver. a couple would never miss this. walking down the french river bank and maybe sip on a good bottle of wine
This is Paris. There is a lot that happens on & around the River Seine. We walked along the river, on many occasions & it was always pleasant on the summer evenings.
Enjoyed the river on the river. We did an evening boat trip from Pont Neuf bridge. The view of the buildings (esp. with night lighting) was perfect.
Take the cruise!. You must take the river cruise to see Paris in a totally different way. It's magnificent at night with knowing after all this is the "City of Lights!"

Worth it and had fun. . Family of 4 (2 rather young children) sat at upper deck of ferry. Good views and an hour around the river was just nice. Took lots of beautiful pics and many attractions. It's safe for young children and mine enjoyed themselves. Only drawback was those of us who sat at upper deck had not access to commentary. Beautiful and clean ferry with ample seats by the way. Would do it again.
Many spots to view and relax.. Whether you are looking at it from a bridge, the Tower, walking next to it, on a boat or having a bite to eat the Seine must be seen.
wonderful river cruise. had an amazing cruise this afternoon which lasted one hour. Perfect way to see many sights and relax.

Hop on and off ferry. This is a great way to get around Paris one day pass €17 or €19 for two days and worth it as you won't get to see everything in a day. Valid from 10am until 9pm daily and waiting time approx 15 minutes for each ferry. Places of interest close together and. Only 10 to 20 minutes apart. No tour guide with this option but to be honest you don't really need it . Enjoy
Grand. We went on a boat trip, mostly to cool down, but it is well worth it to see the grandeur of Paris...

Great time . Wow we had a night tours me & my wife enjoyed lot great place to come for celebrating & people will enjoyed 100% this place when you on boat you can see all the light & lovely Sean to take photo & great time if not rain

Alternative View. A different way of seeing Paris but you'll only need to do it once. Our boat trip was part of the hop on/hop off bus tour we used (yellow Open Tours), so we made the most of the offer.

Very nice. We drove along the river one day and took a night time river cruise another. The river cruise was great as we saw everything going by slowly. Lit up at night was incredible. The line was long but once we got on the boat it was not crowded. I would recommend this to everyone.
Bateaux Mouches. I love this places because i sightseeing little bit Paris because this cruise around Paris . I can saw Eiffel Tower from River
Seine River Cruise. Great way to see the sights of Paris from a distance. I highly recommend doing it in the evening. Paris at night is a lovely sight.

Great for walking along it or boating on it. Paris wouldn't be Paris without the Seine. Many great walks along the river. Also, Bateaux Mouches and other lines offer reasonable boat tours that take you past many of the greatest Paris landmarks.
My Favourite place For Ending Holidays. Multilanguages:English,Spanish,Russian,Chinese,Japanese,Italian,German.You could know the Deepest Secrets of Paris Area.Dont'Forget your Camera...Pics Required

Clean and beautiful. Such a delightful river through a magnificent city. It's a great way to see the city during the day or at night -- or both. We loved the way they set up a "beach" along the river near Notre Dame.

Helpful. Did this on a recommendation from friends who had visited Paris previously.
Great tip it's the best way to get your bearings hop on hop off at several different locations. There are quite a few boat tour operators to choose from.
Take a walk!. We stayed on the Seine. It was wonderful! The views are breathtaking, and we always felt safe. Must do!
underwhelming. the river is not very wide and while the sites to see are okay, too many boats diminished the views. worth walking along side one time.

Seine still runs. The river was indeed very narrow. But it has many near by attraction as well as the resting place for people in Paris. With full of night life along the river, make sure you plan for quality time for nights.
Calm and relaxing. To sit by the Seine and spend an evening is one of the best ways to enjoy the city. One can never get bored of this activity.
Lovely . Lovely relaxing one hour mainly if good weather. The best to finish all activities in Paris doing boat trip

Lovely relaxing place to visit. We spent quite some time walking along the Seine visiting various tourist attractions.
We didn't do a river tour but I don't think it's necessary to enjoy the river. It was a lovely relaxing place to be on a gorgeous sunny day.

A wonderful perspective. There is so much to see and do in Paris, but always a challenge for the disabled. A river cruise is definitely worthwhile, provided someone can carry the wheelchair down and up 30 steps to the river promenade.

Dinner Cruise. Had a nice cruise for dinner; the only downfall was the airconditioning on the boat was out of order and it was very hot; felt sorry for the staff working under those conditions.
The river is very popular for people taking a picnic and sitting with their legs over the edge enjoying the evening.

Cruising. We did the River Sienne by riverboat. It was amazing. We went from Paris to Normandy.
You can walk the river in several areas of Paris. Walkways available.

River Boat. How fun to take the river to get to the most wanted sights. The river divides the city so it's a natural thing to take to the river on kind of a hop on hop off deal. Fun and cheap for what you get.

Sunny day at the Seine - best idea. Does not matter if you hit the city beach or take a tourist river cruise, on a nice sunny day the River Seine is just the place to be and relax - next to all the parks of course.

The perspective to all buildings form the river is amazing. Boat tour are not really as expected. The PA sound system on board not good. Seating system could improve and make it a bit more comfortable.
Gorgeous Scenic River. I was lucky enough to be able to a night cruise on the Seine and it was seriously gorgeous. It cost like 20 euros and it was worth every penny. You must do it.

Seine River boat ride. We took an hour and half ride on Bateaux Mouches boat starting about 9:30 pm. Plain boat ride sitting up top without tour descriptions. I liked that but we were part of a bike tour so our bike guide did offer a few descriptions and answered all questions. Better than getting spieled at by loud speakers. Wonderful views of Paris from the river. River banks are lined by citizens enjoying the evening in groups of 2 to many. I recommend a boat ride on the Seine as a wonderful experience as you see great views and get a sense of local ways too.

Beautiful. Beautiful river ( a lot cleaner than the Thames) with plenty of bridges scattered across it and lots of sightseeing boats constantly moving up and down the length of it offering various trips, sightseeing, meals etc.

Over rated, unless you have time to kill and like cruising.. I wanted to book a cruise tour in advance online - but so glad I didn't waste my money! Whilst walking around Paris, the Seine was always around the corner, so became less of a feature. We sat beside the city canal (as suggested by tourist websites) and ate our home packed lunch. I wish we hadn't - it was a horrid experience and dirty. The London, River Thames is more pleasant and England has some lovely river walks with pubs, beautiful canals and punting in Cambridge is devine in comparison. Perhaps the English are spoilt for choice!?
Scenic. Love this river with the trees growing around it. Beautiful views and scenes, you should take a walk river side.
