A walk through Paris. We walked using this route to all the great landmarks in Paris. Truly amazing and romantic. Would do it again at night to enjoy Paris at its best. A must-do!

We took the Batobus. €17 for a 2 day pass, hop on/hop off at any one of the nine stops. If you just want a leisurely couple of hours seeing the main landmarks of Paris then this is perfect. It's also a good way of taking a rest if you're on a mission to pack in as much as possible in a limited time.

Romantic. I went here while on my honeymoon and the river was surprisingly romantic. All along the river throughout the city at night couples were sitting together with picnic dinners, wine, etc, and it was very safe and well-lit. Our last night there we also took an hour long sightseeing cruise and it was so beautiful and peaceful. A great way to see the city. Definitely carve out some time to just walk along the river and take in the sights.

A nice stroll. Strolling along the banks of the River Seine is a must do when visiting Paris. There is so much to see and the river goes from The Louvre to the Eiffel Tower and farther. This is a free activity although they do have boats you can pay to tour the area which also look good but we chose to walk.

Good way to explore the city. I didn't do the boat tour. But I rode a bike from Ile de la Cite to the scyscraper are. So I had a chance to see the river side. it is the best way to understand what is where geographicly which is something really important to me when I discover a city.

A Wonderful Spot for a Restful Walk. You can walk along this famous river from the Louvre to the Eiffel Tower to the Arch of Triumph. Large tour boats, barges and a few white swans make their way up and down stream as you walk under large shade trees. A nice way to see some of the famous sites of Paris.
Lovely day on the river. You should not miss the boat tors up and down the river. You'll be singing "Under the Bridges of Paris" Fascinating view of this wonderful city.
Amazing!. The cruise along the River Seine is definitely the best thing to do in Paris. I could do it again every day, very beautiful and realxing, simply perfect :)

Fabulous Walk - a must do. Walked along the Seine for miles during a recent visit to Paris. It is better to walk along the street looking down at the river rather than along the river path itself which is strewn with obstacles from metal girders, hose pipes, barges etc etc. The Seine is a beautiful river and the walk along its banks is a must for any visitor to Paris.

GO FOR NIGHT CRUICE. If you want to see the beauty of all Paris go for night cruise, you will understand how they have maintained the different eras buildings and culture Unless you take a night cruise in river Seine you have not seen Paris

Views, Walks, Boats, Dancing, Beach, child play areas. No visit to Paris would be complete without a walk along the Seine. Descend from the hustle and bustle of busy roads, traffic noise and pollution and soak up the romance of Paris. Stop at one of the little beaches, pull up a deck chair and have a picnic al fresco. The children can build a sand castle as you relax or even have fun in the managed play area. Have an impromptu party on one of the bridges, or join in the "old time dancing" in the afternoon sunshine. Lovely. A welcome part of Paris without coach loads of tourists, and the views!! Do this, you won't regret it. Everyone will go to the top of the Eiffel Tower - take a time out just to "be" in Paris.

Take a river cruise. One thing to do while in Paris is taking a river cruise over Seine River. Get relax and enjoy the view over touring around Seine River. This tour is passing trough Eiffel Tower and it is very pretty to take photos.

Take the boat!. Paris is gorgeous! You have to take the sunset boat to see everything that makes it the city of blinding lights <3 <3 There are 3 companies I guess, and you are better off booking online, coz the lines are huge, but its totally worth it.

Paris Stroll. The quai is a great way to see the city, especially in the summer. The artificial beach, complete with palm trees, sand, beach umbrellas and chairs is great. The misters keep the children happy, wet and cool.

Don't miss a boat ride along the Seine. Loads of options to choose from to purchase tickets for a river boat ride along The Seine ! We took Batobus hop-on/hop-off option from The Eiffel Tower to The Latin Quarter. You pass Musee D'Orsay, Notre Dame Cathedral and many other beautiful Paris landmarks! Definitely worth the price of the ticket. Best option is to buy the two-day ticket, only $2 more than the one day ticket.

The spirit of Paris. Winding through Paris is the Seine. Would Paris be the same without it? Doubtful. I recommend walking along the river as much as you can and both day and night. The book sellers are along both sides and have great stuff.
Great photo op . This is another excellent way to capture the beauty of Paris from the historic River Seine. Would definitely recommend it.

Bateau Bus. The best way to visit if you don't want to spend a lot of money by choosing a tour or a restaurant boat. It's like a bus on the river and stops nears the main attractions. We used it a lot and we recommend to do one complete tour specially at night to enjoy the lights in the monuments.

Nice walk - especially in the evening. A walk near the Seine in the evening is very romantic. You can walk for instance from the Notre Dame to the Obelisk while crossing some nice bridges - seeing sightseeing ships, Lit houses and of course many locks tied to fences (at the end of the island of the Notre Dam) that want to show there eternal love to each other.

Stunning. Beautiful river. Very clean and very long. Lovely little beach in places with sand and deckchairs. Really wide in places and looks very popular with lots of sunbathers and locals on lunch breaks

Ethereal. To be in such a historic site that gave the city life it is but a great experience. The many stories and the around it and the major sites actually area built close to it. View from the Eiffel and the bridges is good at every angle. I would love to go back

Bateaux Parisienne. Took a boat ride on the famed Seine River. It was beautiful to see the city and historic buildings and monuments from the river. This was a very moderate thrill--not too expensive. Plan on it!

So Beautiful & so Romantic. You can never tire of the Sein, it is clean looking water unlike many other City Rivers. The river tour boats are a great way to see not only the river itself but many iconic parts of Paris.To to walk along the Sein is a true pleasure in life and enriches your experience of Paris.the various bridges are wonderful, the craftsmanship and use of gold leaf is tremendous.Everyone should see the Sein at least once in their lives. To be by the river and simply watch the world go by is a wonderful thing to do - you sure see all walks of life which makes the Sein and Paris so utterly wonderful.
Unavoidable. Take a cruise on it, or meanderingly walk beside it, cross it's many bridges.... as it's an intrinsical part of Paris. If you miss it, you've missed Paris!

Take the Batobus boat. The Batobus is great value at 17 euros for the day. A bit more will cover 2 days. You can use the ticket on the tour buses as well., Hop on and off as many times as you like. The round trip takes about 2 hours but I took all day an explored the various stops

Do a river cruise at night.. You have to do a river cruise at night to fully enjoy this river with the magnificent buildings along the riverfront.
Do not miss!

Beautiful. A few times whilst in Paris me and my boyfriend took the opportunity to sit down beside the river which runs throughout the city, it is lovely and peaceful and is a great place to take a moment out.

the heart of Paris. One can hardly visit Paris without seeing the Seine….Notre Dame sits right in the middle of it, on a quaint island, the Eiffel Tower looks out on the river, the Louvre runs along a stretch of the river, and many Paris bridges cross it…and wonderful boat rides are offered up and down the river, an excellent way to see the city.
Beautiful lazy day cruise. Must do on a lazy summers day. Great for family with kids of all ages, couples, friends, young and old. A must do when in Paris.

Croisi Europe Seine River Cruise. I took a Croisi Europe Seine River Cruise from Paris to Normandy. We sailed on The MS Botticelli. It was a great value and we had French Cuisine with a European Flair. The ship had 75 cabins. Youreally got to know your fellow passengers. The itinerary included many charming French Towns with an emphasis on Impressionist Art.

Very romantic!. I walked along the river everyday I was in Paris! Very romantic, very beautiful and all the major sites are on or very close to the Seine. We also took a river cruise dinner on the Seine and that was great and I would recommend that as well as it lets you see the river from a different point of view.

Enjoy the walk. When staying in Paris it's essential to take a walk along the river. Enjoy the boats passing by and take in the views of the locals engaging. There are places to stop and grab a bite or drink, and of course the lovely decorated bridges you are able to see. Enjoy!

Live Music. We spent our last night in Paris wandering the River Siene and were pleasantly surprised to find a Jazz Band on the river bank. Already armed with a few cans of beer and a tube of pringles we enjoyed the night on the river just chilling out. If the weather is warm it is great to get a few beers and chill on the river.

Nice way to get see locations for major sight seeing from outside. I took the Seine river cruise on the first day itself soon after arriving in Paris at 9am. Although it was a long overnight flight and baby and me were s tired, I did not want to waste day 1 of our trip by staying at the hotel. It gave a good idea about the location of all attractions in Paris. It was very peaceful and I was really happy to finally fulfil my childhood dream of visiting Paris :)Do check the weather and be prepared for wind and rain ( it actually adds to the drama in a good way ....Hehe )
Cruise. The crusie down the Seine was part of our PASS tickets. The boat glided gently down the Seine and give you a view of Paris.

Lovely to stroll along its banks. Tranquility in the heart of Paris - a lovely stroll along the banks of this famous river watching the passenger cruisers going past, and avoiding the many cafes and beach areas ~(what a great idea!). It felt totally safe with no problems.Escape the hustle and bustle for an hour and see the famous bridges from a different perspective.

Peaceful. Highly recommend with any trip to Paris you spend sometime walking along the Seine river. It is so calming and graceful exit and a pleasure to stroll and gaze at all the famous buildings along the way.

Do a tour . We did the batobus Paris tour along the river, this is basically a hop on hop off boat tour to the best tourist sites in Paris. It's 17 euros per adult for one day, for the pass that takes you to 9 different hotspots, totally worth the money though. Would definitely recommend.

Walk or boat. We spent hours just strolling along. They had an artificial beach set up which was really nice, with cute park for the kids. Lots of places to get cold drinks or ice cream. I recommend buying hop on hop off for boat. You can see different perspective of buildings, and bridges.

Delightful and restful way to see this beautiful city.. We booked a standard river cruise from our hotel in Montmartre and caught the local bus to the Trocadero. From here we walked down the steps toward the Eiffel Tower, crossed the Seine and descended to the tour dock. The cruise lasted an hour and went in both directions having turned at the islands where Notre Dam is located. The cruise had a good commentary and gave a great opportunity to see many remarkable landmarks. This view of Paris is not to be missed.

Very busy river with lots of bridges, great in photos!. A long distance shot of most sights in Paris tends to have the Seine in it. Heading towards the evening reflections of the lights add to your photos. Beautiful bridges crossing it. Pause between sights and enjoy the views!
The best place to see Paris. With Bateau mouche services, the best road to see Paris.... Everything is around : Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Orsay Museum, Le Louvre etc...
Beautiful Even on a Rainy Day!. My Flat in Paris overlooks this breathtaking river. There are so many things to do on the Seine year round. You must experience a dinner cruise while in Paris.

Boat trip. A cruise with the Batobus is a good way to ride on the Seine. This is like a "bus" on water that takes you on the Seine from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame, Hotel de Ville, the Louvre and the Champs-Elysées. The ships are quite stylish and clean and stop in 8 stations along the river. It is a Hop on - Hop off system, which we know well from tourist buses.
Seine. A stroll, a stroll, photos! Sip coffee - Breathe it in. Tons to do and see along this river. Left bank, right bank.

A must. We took a romantic dinner cruise. It was exceptional. A must for any couple. Great food , music and sightseeing . Watching the Eiffel Tower sparkle from the boat was incredible. Never was choppy so my weak sea legs were not an issue.
Fun hop on hop off trip on Batobus!. Beautiful river with spectacular buildings on the riverfront. did a hop-on hop-off trip on Batobus. Lots of fun for the entire family!

Wonderful. It was actually the best place i've visited in Paris. It's amazing. You could easily go to the Bateau-Mouche and have a small tour with explanations in different languages (french, english, chinese, korean, spanish and italian) the view is beautiful and it's refreshing in such a hot weather.

Lovely River. It was indeed a nice feeling to see such a world famous & beautiful river, enjoyed a cruise on it.Saw many interesting & famous buildings from the boat.A lovely experience.Well worth a visit.

Dancing by the River Seine. Lovely place to chill and relax with a bottle of wine or to have a picnic. Good seating available.Easy access by train with Botanical Garden nearby, also not too far from Bastille.
Walk along the river. looking at the beautiful circumstances. Just walked along the river at day time. on Saturday evening it is crowded. Recommended
Take a cruise. We took a river cruise to capture a different viewpoint of the city. It was rather hot, but definitely worth it!

Serenely Sailing on the Seine.. I bought Batobus tickets at the Quai de Louvre and went down the Seine to Notre Dame. It was a rainy day and luckily we managed not to get wet at all as we were on the boat when the rain started and the rain stopped as we disembarked. It was a peaceful journey. We stopped at various locations to allow passengers on and off at the attractions. On our return trip, it was late evening and the sun had almost set. I captured some beautiful video footage of the Seine. At dusk, the river was lined by people sitting on the banks, relaxing and talking. Seeing part of the city from the river was a novel experience and one that I would recommend if you are looking to slow down, relax and enjoy the views.

River cruise. Me and my partner decided that as well as purchasing a 'hop on hop off' sight seeing bus ticket we would purchase a one hour river cruise tour down the river seine. The price was roughly around €40 per person for 2 day unlimited tour and a one hour river cruise. This cruise had seating upstairs and down with available telephone handsets which has a range of different languages that talks you through the sights. We highly enjoyed this as it was great to be able to see all of the gorgeous views and learn a lot about the history of Paris.
Ride a boat. Had lunch on a boat with an amazing view. Took a different boat to the Louvre round trip and a great way to train and see sights

Try to go along the river when youre in Paris. If you dont wish to spend with bateaux Mouches, then you can use the Batobus which can drive for one day along his patch and can give you a perfect view of the city center from the river. Nice and calm and you dont walk, your feet are safe.

1 week on the Seine River . Having been on several rivers in Europe, I have to say that this is the least scenic. Very few castles or striking views. We sailed from Paris to the English Channel and back. Fair amount of litter in the water too.

Queen of Rivers. The River Seine is everything a river should be: it has a magical quality in it's movement, it shimmers with light at night. It has beautiful, historical buildings along it's banks. The city has created great areas for citizens and guests by blocking street traffic in the summer and creating "beaches". It has many beautiful bridges of a variety of styles--pleasing to the eye as well as providing crossings at frequent intervals and the river is narrow enough to cross and re-cross to enjoy both sides.
Stroll the beach. If you go in August enjoy the sand beach on the right bank near Notre Dame -- wonderful to sit, picnic, people-watch. But all seasons, enjoy the riverbank.

Boat trip at Seine River. We had a rainy day in Paris at first, the the sun came out and we took the boat. Allows you to see many monuments and historical places from the river, the guides were young girls, knowledgeable and enthusiastic.Had a wonderful break and rest to restart walking around Paris.

A lovely experience. Well worth a trip cruising down the Seine River, you get to see sights that you might not make it to see. The experience of cruising through Paris also allows you to see Parisian life unfold in front of you. Good value. Take a jacket on a windy day.

Walk or Boat. It is Alive With History and Culture. We both wkaled along the Seine and took a cruise on the Seine. I would recommend both. Walking gives you the time to stop and look and explore. Looking at all the spectacular displays of boats is incredible. People live on them. Some have full gardens on board. So interesting to look at. There are different stairways that take you down to the water from the sidewalk. We saw many people with picnics and wine having group and paired meals together along the river. They also have an outdoor bookstore which is difficult to explain. There are individual vendors who keep their stores permanently built onto the ledges of the water and it goes on for what seems forever. A cruise allows you to see more in a smaller amount of time and really get a feel for the waterway. Seeing an island built from stone with interconnecting bridges was one interesting thing discovered. And fabulous views of the many sites around the city. And so many bridges with their own stories. Especially the Eiffel tower; Just gorgeous.

Romantic. Nice place to hang around while in Paris . Romantic and je ne sais pas quoi If you are in July and August - don't miss the dances which are taking place in Tino Rossi gardens on por t Saint Bernard banks. Lovelly - all kind of dances - latino, folklore We saw the dancers while doing the bateau mouche on the Seine and went the night after to see the dances. We stayed until 11 pm
Great ride. We walked along the river and then and rode it in a boat. Both are well worth it. Did you know there is a small sand beach along the Seine right in Paris.

River Cruise - Seine. I did a river cruise (included with my Paris Pass) for bout an hour, and it was well worth it to go! There are so many sights that are lined up along the river that you can get some great photos, and a sense of their layout in the city, while relaxing in the sun (or in the shade if you prefer the indoor ride and the accompanying guide's informative chatter).
What to say....if you are in Paris. ....if you are in Paris you have to enjoy a walk or even a cruise. Pay attention to the bridges, they are all different and with so many details.

A walk to remember . Walking along the river Seine is a poetic experience itself. Paris has the artistic vibe worth all praises and then walking along this river (preferably with a partner) can be a delight. There is music here and there, there are people relaxing and sitting around and it would fill you with warmth and put a smile on your face to be there. A lot of Parisian students come out here every night. So if interested in student activities, this is sure a good place.

Beautiful River. Spectacular and picturesque river running through the heart of Paris. The river cruise(s) are a must. There are a few to choose from, but highly recommended for views of the city from the river.

cruise on river seine. The cruise was awesome with immense opportunities to take pics. we had option to sit in the inside the cabins or sit on top of the cruise with better view. My wife preferred to sit inside with better privacy.

The beauty of the Seine. This river is so long and it has many sides and characteristics to see. It's a great point of reference when moving around the city to find your way home. I enjoyed seeing a different side to it on a bike tour where we got to see a hidden away Marina which really was not that hidden away when you start looking. Seeing many joggers use it as their track was nice.

A great way to see part of Paris. Take one of the river cruises and see Paris from the river Seine. It is always a fun way to see things from the river. You can catch a cruise from several spots and with several operators, some with a meal included. The tour boat is inexpensive and fun.

This is a must see, take a boat cruise, or take a walk!. My husband and I really enjoyed the boat cruise that took us for a tour of the seine river. We went in the evening, and the view was amazing! if you have time walk down the river as there is great places to sit, eat, and relax!

Worth a daily visit. The Seine is indeed the pulse of Paris. Cool evenings after hot days, locals picnicking at 1am on the bridges, fantastic views on every bridge, unparalleled people watching, great place to sit and have sorbet or Gelato. Only drawback: the ubiquitous smell of urine.

Serene Seine. Cruising down the river provides an allure for more of Paris. Ours was an hour long with auto guide devices. Another operator offers a hop on, hope off feature which may be a great option to explore some of the spots.Have camera ready shortly after the boat turns around; there is an amazing view of Notre Dame cathedral which is breathtaking taking.The Seine holds very rich history along her banks, the left and the right. The architectural majestry of centuries old structures is awesomely mind boggling.Paris and all her lovely functioning antiquities has stolen my soul. I wanted to stay.

Beautiful Bridges and Joy to Wal. The Seine is nice open walk from which to view not only the river but also the wonderful architecture in the area. In hindsight, the walks along the Seine were some of the most relaxing and memorable times during my visit to Paris.
Bateau mouches. We did the cruise with bateau mouche (apologies I think I may of mispelt) was 1 hour 15 minutes along the river and was fantastic a must when in Paris it is 17 euro per person

A rather cheap experience. By boat, we probably did not choose the best option. The trip was not an experience, but more like we did sometinhg instead of doing nothing...We will look for a more comfy and cosy solution to explore La Seine!

Boat Cruise a MUST!. What a great way to see the City. Relax, take in the views, sneak on some bubbles and enjoy a boat ride down the Seine. We went at dusk....the colors of the sky...natures beauty. Was truly amazing!
Take a stroll along the river. Magical river with wonderful bridges. Take a gentle stroll along the river and spend some time on the bridges. Leave a love padlock.

Romantic cruise. Took the dinner river cruise which is about 2 hours. The views of paris are something that cant be easily explained unless you experience it. The food was equally amazing and very tasty. The shepherd's Pie with Duck was a real filler.

Paris from the Seine. One way to see the historic monuments in Paris is through a cruise on the River Seine. The cruise itself gives you a nice view of the Louvre, Museum of Orsay, Notre Dame, the Eiffel Tower among other historic buildings & several beautiful bridges. You will also get to see the locals sun bathing or having a picnic on the banks of the river or couples romancing. The commentary on the cruise adds to the flavour.

No matter which part always worth a stroll. The Seine is the heart and soul of Paris. No matter what you are doing you're bound to cross over it. When you do you'll observe lovers walking, people eating or a group meeting. It is vibrant and alive. Take your time enjoy, it is so Parisian. not only cross it you can stroll along it and see all the watercraft activity or board a passenger vessel and take a ride and see it up and down. If you do take a snack and some wine and share it with your neighbor no better way to make new friends.

Nice relaxing walk from N otre Dame to Eiffel Tower. Easy walk from Notre Dame to the Eiffel Tower. Beautiful views on pedestrian only promenade along the river. Walk does take about an hour, but worth the time spent to really take in the Seine.

Meet the Parisians. Spend a Day at the seine, sit watch the people. Have coffee, and interact. Find a green spot and Lie Down for a rest. Ile de la jatte is good for is though slightly out of the city
Beautiful. Beautiful espescially in summer and make sure you check out all the bridges and get on a bateau mouche

Enjoyable and informative boat ride. Although we stayed near to one of the bridges, we took a boat ride on the Seine which travels from the Eiffel Tower to beyond Ile de la Cite and back. It was very enjoyable, informative and we met some very nice fellow travelers. We were also fortunate that the weather was perfect, so our photos turned out great!

One of my favorite things of Paris. The seine is excellent to enjoy an afternoon picnic with some wine. It is very calm and you will find runners, people reading and picnicking at any time of the day.

A lovely walk by the riverside. There are walkways along the bank of the Seine or you can walk above on the pavement and look down on the river.
The bridges are so beautiful and each on is named and has unique feature. Its exciting to see the various pleasure boats, and working boats pass by.

Highlight of our trip was the cruise down the river Seine. Check the different cruise companies and whether you want dinner or not. We chose a one hour cruise with no dinner, as we didn't want the distraction of the food while seeing the sites around the Seine for the first time. (It is also much cheaper!) We chose to go after 9PM to see the city lights. The tower sparkles every hour for about five minutes after sunset. That is a spectacular sight! I strongly suggest you do take a cruise the first day you are there. It helps to put all the tourist attractions, like the Louvre, Eiffel tower into perspective in terms of distances. The tour guide will tell you what attractions you are crossing. We took the Bateaux Mouches cruise. Not very expensive and it goes every half hour or so. Also enough seats on the top deck for a lot of people. If you don't get a seat on top, just wait for the next one.

Relaxed and informative. Two families looking to get a different perspective on the Paris experience. So we jumped on a river cruise and were not disappointed. the guide was knowledgeable, funny and made the hour long trip flyby in no time. we then set out to visit a number of the attractions he pointed out such as the Military Museum, Diana's flame and others. Overall well worth it.

The Long and winding River Seine. Clean and beautiful, a hive of activity. It was soo interesting to see the river boats-either houseboats, or restaurant type. Chatty tourists going back and forth on the river carriers. The activities, the beach and all the little stalls along the river are amazing. We opted to walk the whole river length crossing the beautiful architectural bridges to vier off hunting for must see sights in Paris- Many stop and ponder spots along the way-security was vigilant and friendly. Many cyclists and dog walkers as well as happy locals eager to assist with directions in broken English-beautiful buildings and parks visible on the walk way. We took pictures of every bridge and boat. I loved it!!

This is Paris...... The Seine is as beautiful as ever and Paris is very safe to visit. I was shocked to see the decline in tourism since the bombings. Security is very high and as far as I am concerned I feel safer in Paris than in Florida or Texas where you don't know who is carrying a gun. Visit Paris ......it is the most beautiful city in the world and as safe as any city these days!!

Pont de Alma Bataux-Mouches. We walked up to the Pont de L' Alma for the Bataux-Mouches. While there appeared to be an enormous crowd fro to 9:40 pm departure, the boat is quite large and we were comfortably seated on the top deck. I cannot describe the beauty of the architectural wonders that line the Seine. One just has to be there to appreciate it. We were fortunate on our timing because the Seine had been closed due to the historic flooding 2016 until just a few days before we arrived. This was a relaxing final evening in Paris.
great river. we did not get the chance, but we should have grabbed lunch and ate at the river. This is what u do in Paris. There are artists near the bridges that will do your portrait. very good!!!

River seine. On arriving in Paris and staying in the Latin quarter we walked out to see the famous seine river, bigger than I expected and clean with a strong currant. Beautiful walks along the rivers edge will be in my memory forever!!!💖
Picnic and stroll along the river. Lovely place. Take a stroll on the bank. Grab a picnic basket and a bottle of wine. Enjoy your lunch on a sunny day.
River Boat Tour. Although I did enjoy the tour, the only way to could get a description of the sights is by sitting inside. Make sure you check ahead of time before choosing a tour.
A Paris must: A stroll by the River Seine. Make sure not to miss this stroll by the River Seine. It is perfect for any time of day or night. Very safe even late at night.

Perfect river cruise during summer time... Perfect evening outing with your family and friends on a cruise, with French history surrounding on both the banks.. One of the first things to do while visiting Paris..

Take a boat!. To chose guiding by boat at the River seine is a good start on your visit to Paris. Its a quick intro to where things are located and gives you a chance to get photos from some good angles. Look closer at the bridges. Some good stories there!

Lovely evening trip. Pre booked with the hotel €18 for 2, really enjoyed this as it was nice a relaxing after walking all afternoon. We went while the sun was still out and returned when the sun was setting. Amazing views
paris cruise. Sights were awesome recommend getting on the far side of the city away from the Eiffel tower the upper deck is the best

Touristing around. I go to Paris a lot and I can never get tired to admire such a majestic architecture , I always get a baguette and some wine and sit on the park and people watch, lots of local street artists that sell beautiful paints at a great price , going to the top of the tower is worth it, but not for the faint of heart , and during the summer there is a little Marie go round crossing the river and great place to People watch and also a couple of blocks from the famous moulin rouge... On a side note you can also catch a boat tour on the Seine right there on the banks of the river and it is not expensive at all and worth it ...go ahead, have fun in my favorite city in the world

River Seine Cruise and dinner in the Eiffel Tower. We did a package tour of the Seine and then dinner in the 1st floor restaurant in the Eiffel Tower. This needs to be pre booked and is well worth it. The evening lights of Paris are beautiful.
Classic. Its one of the most beautiful rivers going thru the romantic city of paris. A cruise on this river is a must as the history of paris lies on the banks of the river seine.
clean. took a cruise and was able to see so much of Paris and the monuments and the locals going along as routine life
BOTOBUS. travelled on the river by Botobus you can go ang get off as many times as you like to all the attractions Eiffel tower the louvre notre dame, at your leisure

Eiffel Tower to the Louvre. We just visited the Eiffel Tower and felt like a walk. Also because we travel with our dog (since it's difficult finding a transportation which allows pets in Paris).It's a nice walk along the Seine. Not difficult and with good stops for pics (you pass points of interest like the "Pont Alexandre III", the "Jardin des Tuileries" etc.). We started on the southern side of the Seine. But it was very windy that day and dust kept flying into our faces. We decided to walk on the other side, which was a lot better.Some parts are a bit unexciting, but all in all if you are visiting the Eiffel Tower and want to go to the Louvre (or the other way around), it is a rewarding stroll and you really don't need a taxi, metro or bus to do that. One way was enough though :)Wanna know more about me and my trips? Check my profile.

Seine river cruise. Me and some friends went on a dinner cruise in the Seine river and it was a very nice tour passing through the main attractions. There was a guide that was pointing the attractions plus the food and atmosphere was very nice. Definitely something worth doing in Paris and good as a romantic date.
great view. I love walking there for the extraordinary view. You can stay there or walk for long you will feel happy and calm.

River cruise . Found a river cruise location close to where couples hang padlocks on the bridge - very informative and relaxing hour trip down the river. Helped us to navigated where places were and what we wanted to visit!
love the boat ride. did a tour which included the boat ride on the river...it went from the Louvre to Eiffel tower...there are many interesting sights along the way

Lovely Walk. A lovely way to see Paris. Walked down the Seine toward the Eiffel Tower is a wonderful way to spend a summer evening. It can be crowded in places and the fake beaches didn't look appealing to me so I skipped them.

Nice way to see attractions. Took an hour cruise the river as were beat after all the walking. A lot of information provided and opportunity to take some great shots of different places in different perspective
Beautiful Scenery!!. Cruised along the river and saw so many amazing things! The Eiffel Tower from the water is a beautiful sight. An amazing experience is the evening boat tour!
Cruise with dinner. Great sightseeing cruise with 3 course dinner with Champagne.Excellent way to see Paris..Booked it with Viator.

Pure relaxation. What a super way to have lunch! Thoroughly enjoyed our Champagne 3 Course lunch on the river boat cruise. We pre-booked but you can just pitch up on the day. Everything well organised, prepared and presented. Crew very professional, boat adequate, food average but just being on the Seine and looking at the beautiful sights from a different perspective was magic. Could have done with a bit of commentary from the Captain regarding landmarks, but he seemed pre-occupied with his mobile phone for the entire 2 hours!Loved it!

Beautiful anytime . Just walk. Along the river. From Austerlitz Gare to Eiffel tower. Then back. Daytime or in the evening, it has an amazing atmosphere to it, when deserted early in the morning or crowded on a Saturday's evening... Always
very Romantic . one of the places that you must spened time there with your soul mate ... you will be flow with its clear water and amized with the boats .inaddtonal with eveill tower reflaction
Very relaxing. Went on the boat trip with friends one afternoon. Sat up on deck but the guide talk is only inside which was a pity.
Day and night it's worthy of a boat ride. We did a boat ride both day and night and it was beautiful. Great weather certainly helped. But for photo opportunities it is worth the effort.
By Night. Book a dinner on a boat and enjoy the experience and spectacle offered by Paris. During the day take a hop-in/hop-off ticket and enjoy Paris along the river Seine.
Relaxing attraction.. This event was a welcome change to some hectic touring. It was about 1 hour long, but with no audio guide. It offered fantastic view of some awesome buildings.

A Lovely Stroll. Of course you must walk along the Seine when in Paris, you have the most lovely little market stalls selling souvenirs and lovely old and new prints. And from there you have many sights to visit also. Eiffel tower, Notre Dame etc etc...

The tide is high. Having walked, driven and bateaued the Seine many times I felt awful seeing one of the great rivers of the world so devastated as it was in June after the great flood. I took pics to compare with other visits. The landings were all submerged and nothing was working the river. I returned in Jul and August and the majestic waterway was back. The route that tourists usually take and what lines the Seine is hard to beat. The D'Orsay, the dome at Sorbonne, Notre Dame, Versailles, St Michel, Pont Neuf, Pont Alexandre III, etc. Having extra time in August I walked parts from Gare Austerlitz toward St Michel. Don't miss it.

Beautiful at night. I loved traveling the Sein at night via Batobus. It's Romantic and you get the views that you can't see from the street. A day pass is inexpensive and it take you by most every major site to see.
Awesome place to run. We went to Paris in January, 2016 and the weather wasn't too cold. One of the highlights of the trip for me was an 8 mile run up and down the Seine - great place to run!

Great place to catch a breather. . If you need some time to catch a breather take a stroll down by the river, sit down, relax or walk by all the vendors selling things from typical Paris souvenirs to prints to paintings. Some great views and great boat tours to be seen and explored.
Outstanding romantic river . A must outstanding view is Paris, romantic and just a must in Paris. If you have time you should take a bateau mouche

La Vendette or other river cruise. We booked a one hour cruise on the Seine from Pont Neuf to La Tour Eiffel and back around the islands to the base. Nicely narrated in French and English, more than enough time and great views. We went in late morning by the afternoon things were much busier. Best €9 spent so far.

Treat yourself to a river tour of the Seine. Some rivers do not impress with their city tours (the Thames comes to mind). However the Seine does not disappoint. Just the quality and history of the many bridges dating back to Napoleon's time are impressive. The number of attractions view-able from the river is amazing and if the weather behaves, it's a trip well worth taking.

Beautiful view on both sides of the river. River Seine is one of the major attraction and part of the city of Paris. The river is 780 km long and flows for about 40 km in bisecting through Paris. There are 37 bridges on the river within the city. The best way to get a flavor of this river is to take a cruise boat on the river. We took the boat from Concorde and the cruise continued up to Noterdam church and back to Concord in a 45 minutes cruise. On the way you can see famous Alexandre III bridge, Eiffel Tower. It was the best and cheapest mode of seeing the riverside Paris.
Simply nice. Nice river. Give a great view of Paris. Looks fantastic from the Eiffel tower. I think much more great to spend time at night.

Mid-City River. River Seine flows through the Paris city.Many important monuments and buildings can be seen from the river Therefore one must go on the river cruise.Good photography can be done while on cruise.

The flow of the river goes while the city remains eternal. I recommend to take a boat tour, there are many options based on you time, interest and budget, I took one at sunset near by the Eifel tower, that way you can see the city with natural light and on your way back you can see the lights at dusk on buildings and in the tower. This ride had a tour guide in different languages so you can get to know more about history facts of the city while you are navigating over the Sena River. It is a great experience, totally worth it.

Bateaux Parisiens evening tour. This 1 hour evening tour originating from just below the Eiffel tour was perfect! We had a beautiful, warm evening with a full moon. I also highly recommend the Bateaux Parisiens because there are just two rows and all seats face out (unlike the Bateaux Mouches where there are several people in a row and you may have an obstructed view during the tour). The price of 15 euros was also reasonable.
Paris heart. Take breakfast and walk down sena river, enjoy the people, the wind, the painting stores, the soun of this incredible lovely city

Great river. This river is pretty cool, it runs through Paris and has some beaches inside the city where people play petanque and where there's music and bars on the sidewalks. Awesome. It also has its fair share of party boats which are highly recommendable!

A fab way to see Paris. We booked our tickets for the batton's,boats, before we left, you can see attractions like the mini Statue of Liberty which I never knew existed, Notre Dame and where all the Mo Matre eating and hugely arty location. It was very relaxing and you can get back on board and off whenever suits.

The Banks of the Seine. It is wonderful to walk along the banks of the seine as there is so much to see and so many bridges to cross.The Berges de Seine where you can find a floating garden , the Paris Plage in the summer months and the Jardin de Tino-Rossi with it's sculpture gardens.We even found a flea market near the Pont Alexander III bridge

Lovely trip to view Paris monuments. took the river cruise on 25/7/2016 with familythis trip was better than the Paris city tour by busthe detailed announcements are made in English, French & Mandarindinner/food cruises are also available

Integral part of a visit to Paris. The bridges, the boats, the Cite island, the views - Paris would not be the same without its river. Luckily you're probably not gonna miss it if you're visiting Paris.

Lovely afternoon cruuse. Everyone visiting Paris should take at least one cruise on the River Seine.It is a wonderful way to see a lot of the famous landmarks of the city in the comfort of a well appointed river vessel. It's medium priced... But well worth it. Suggest sitting inside during the summer months. It can get very warm on the exposed upper deck.
Amazing view of each place from the river. This is a must go place as you can see the entire city from the river in an hour. also very good view of Eiffle from here.

Le bateau calife. Dine and cruise a fantastic period boat with top quality service and food !! A perfect way to see the seine and sights at night !!
The boat was so pretty and not your usual tourist tat !! This trip made our break and my wife's 50th
Take a river boat tour. By taking the 45 minutes river boat cruise, we were able to see much of the beauty of the city with little effort. It affords great views of many of the detailed bridges.

The river Seine a memory lane. I used to come down for fun in my youth. The place has lost lots of its charm and Paris, is now a hodge podge of things. The Seine still has its taste. But I have changed and the river has lots of brown color to it, The Seine had grown but it is an attraction for all.

See Paris from the River that gives it life. To the people of Paris the Seine is not an incidental but integral part of the city. It invites you to its banks. Every afternoon Parisians come to it to spread a blanket for wine, cheese, baguettes and conversation. It is traversed by majestic bridges. It is alive. A 1-hour cruise along its course is not expensive and a must to more slowly and effortlessly explore the city.
Went on a ferry ride!. Worth taking the ferry ride and get a good number of photographs. It was a wonderful day to be on the boat and take pictures.

River cruise. Was handed a 2 euro off voucher for the Pont Neuf Cruises and never normally use things like that but I did and it was great. 1 hr with live commentary. At sunset! Super view of the Eiffel Tower,
Nice but dirty. The river was long and beutiful, but there was some trash floating in the water. Nice bridges and boat tours. You can see the Eiffel Tower from one of the bridges. I liked it.

Dinner cruise. We opted for a dinner cruise with Paris City Vision tours, the night was warm and we had a good time the food was good and the singer was very good as well, if you are a large person it was crowded in the seats I am 6 ft 4 and 300 pounds and it was a tight fit for sure, the lights were nice to see and the service was good and the package included the Moulon Rouge after the dinner

Another Paris Symbol. It is THE Symbol of Paris, it is its heart and its soul. If you are visiting the city, take a boat trip and you will enjoy seeing the life of the city from the river, it is a great experience with interesting sights.
Take a cruise. It's a great way to see the city. Best to go right before dark so you get to see both night and day views.

Best to do in the evening. The evening is the best time to take a cruise down the River Seine, when the beautiful city of Paris comes to life!! It gives Paris such a different perspective with all the lights on all the buildings which reflect off the water. It is especially nice to see when the lights dance on the Eiffel Tower. This is a must after a long day of walking around Paris and seeing all the beautiful sites on foot.

Along the river . We took a bateau along the river for an hour, my advice is to take it in the morning or after 5 pm to avoid the hot weather and sun exposure. We got our tickets from the hotel but there are a lot of ponts where you can find a bateau, also there are ones with dinner or lunch or a brunch. It is a very nice experience, you will enjoy it :)
City trip to Paris. No visit tot Paris without a trip with one of the boats in the Seine. Used the bato bus as transport tot visit the things i want to see.
Fantastic. The boat tour is a fun way to look at the major monuments in Paris. Try for the tour after it gets dark as it is much more beautiful with all the lights.

Cruise of happiness . River Seine is a river flow in the heart of Paris. You can walk and hang out beside it like most of locals do. Otherwise go for the River Cruise which offer by various operator. The tour guide had arrange everything for us so we just line up to get into the ship. The tour is only last for 1hour and it start just at the foot of the Eiffel Tower specifically at port de Suffren. The cruise stroll along the river and pass by the legendary Parisian attractions like the Notre Dame Cathedral, the Louvre and Île de la Cité and pass beneath charming bridges while your cruise glides along the UNESCO listed river banks. Wave your hand to the people who hang out at the bank and they will wave to you back. It's like an interchange communication of have a nice day to me. There is many option of the cruise like include dinner and so on. It is one of a ride to do to enjoy the other side of seeing the Paris.

perfect for walk. perfect for walk or jogging. You can easily walk along the bank and see most famous places in Paris (Nottre Damme cathedral, Louvre, Eiffel Tour etc.) It is also nice place where Parisians meet with friends for a drink or dinner
River Cruise. Fantastic way of seeing Paris's amazing architecture. We were on board about an hour. Bar on board. Seating inside and out.

RIVER OF SCULPTURE. We had a boat cruise along the river seine, and the views of the back of the buildings were amazing. When walking on the road, you get to see how spectacular the buildings are in the front of the buildings, however it gets even more spectacular when you see the back of the buildings when on the River Seine

Nice way to sightsee but becomes boring. Having done this cruise twice along the Seine, I am still uninspired. The views left to right are nice, and the seating is okay. The headsets are often hard to hear and you get tired of holding them to your ear. The various different languages being explained can get distracting. Teenagers may find this relaxing and a nice place to sit down but overall not massively engaging. Nice descriptions and historical facts appear occasionally, and there are good photo opportunities but I have to admit that once was enough and upon returning I slept through most of the journey. Make sure to take suncream in summer! Also drinks & snacks for younger members of the family may be required.

River Cruise . Lovely boat where you can sit outside and take the views in better of all the major landmarks. The start just below the tower and down to Notre Dame and back. You can also have access to a commentary in various languages to tell you the history with video as well. Even teenagers enjoyed it but was a lovely sunny day.

The the BatoBus. This is a ferry that works like a hop on hop off service. Just 8 stops but a great way to see the main attractions of Paris. Take a trip at dusk and see the bridges light up. Magical.

A must!!!. After the Louvre, walk along the beach to cool down. There are misters, artists & free foosball. I also recommend the sunset cruise. There were people dancing along the shore, beautiful bridges and a great way to see the sites.

Relaxing. Our family did a cruise on the Batobus and it was informative and interesting and very relaxing after all the walking we did. Beautiful buildings along the sides and lovely bridges. Well worth doing.

Beautiful and educational Cruise!. Really enjoyed this beautiful cruise on the Seine River! It is a 482 mile Commericial waterway with views of France's many historic features.They told us that if you are in love and miss under any one of the bridges during the cruise that you "lock in your love forever!" So we did!

Avalon Waterways River Cruise on the Seine from Paris to Normandy.. I have done 5 river cruises and this one was probably the best one. The ship is the Tapestry II of Avalon. It's a small ship with no more than 150 passengers. The service, food and attention to all details is awesome. The itinerary is marvelous starting in Paris, traveling through little cities along the Seine River. The highlight of this itinerary is a visit to the beaches of Normandy to follow the steps of thousands of American soldiers that died in the invasion of D day: a very moving experience.I highly recommend this cruise line and this itinerary.

Seine River Cruise from Pont Neuf. For 14 euros each minus the 2 euro discount leaflet we picked up near Notre Dame, this was a great deal! We went on a double decker boat cruise, sat on the top deck with a tour guide telling us about everything we passed. It really is a brilliant way to spend an hour in Paris. We saw the Eiffel Tower, The Louvre, Notre Dame Cathedral and many other sights of interest along the way. Took loads of pictures and enjoyed the breeze of the boat cruising along on a very hot August day. Bring your hat and sunglasses and keep your camera at the ready. We did notice a boat cruise that passed us where you can hop on and off at 8 destinations, so to save on walking, you might want to try that instead. But if you want to sit back and enjoy the experience rather than use the boat as a mode of transport to get to places, then I highly recommend it. There are also dinner cruises, very good in the evening I hear. Something on the Seine to suit all tastes :)

Beautiful river cruise!. Relaxing, interesting, beautiful ...one of the best things we did in Paris. Perfect weather for strolling down the Seine River. Especially liked taking in all of the beauty of Paris from the water. Highly recommend! Will do again!

Different View of Paris!. My husband and I are usually walkers so we decided to see Paris from this other point of view. We were on the Batobus which makes a loop that takes 2 hours to complete with several stops where people hop on and off an the loop. It was interesting, but maybe not the best way to see Paris as visibility is limited due to being lower on the water.

Walk. Sand and deck chairs/ grassed areas with cafe's and well its amazing so walk take in the relaxed atmosphere get jealous of the joggers going by who must live there. Soak in the ambiance and wear sensible shoes. It is currently being re-paved and upgraded and what a fantastic idea to add the seaside, plus by walking you can pop up and discover cafes and streets you would miss on a Boat.

Great sights from the boat. We did a 1 hour cruise as part of a cycling trip and was great to see all the bridges and buildings. Especially as it was just getting dark and when we came back the Eiffel Tower was all lit up and had great views on this.
Fab 1 hour cruise.
We also walked along the banks. Lovely to see

quite large. I loved seeing all the boats that are unique in design, whether it was day or night the river had something going and it was lovely. To see the lights on the bridges in the evening was something. But most impressed with the wood boats looked like out of another era

Full of variety.. A walk along the Seine at any time of day is wonderful. At night, when everything is lit up, it is just amazing. You can walk alongside the river for a good way, but there is a lot of security. Check out the paintings on the walls.

Take a boat ride!. The Seine is the main river in Paris connecting the left bank and the right bank. I would recommend taking a boat ride on the Seine as your first stop in Paris! You can hop on to any of the companies right next to the Eiffel Tower! This helps you to navigate and understand the layout of the city and it also helps you to see all the sites!

Counting bridges. Lovely trip by night and again in day time. Very smooth trip with great commentary and lots of seating inside or on top allowing great views. Bridges are amazing and the beach on the embankment is a stroke of genius.

Visit the infamous Love Lock bridge. The bridge has thousands of locks where lovers have put a padlock on the bridge to signify their love and thrown the keys in the river to immortalise it. You can buy locks from a non-authorised vendor on the bridge from 10€
Belle Seine!. River Seine is what Thames is to London! Beautiful and as romantic it can get.A Cruise on the seine at night! and you are sorted.

Very nice and pleasurable . My second time in Paris and it is always nice to take the boat tour , any of them. It is a very nice way to take a break from the crowded streets and see the most famous monuments from a different view. You can make it a romantic trip or just a family get away.

Grab some picnic supplies and head down in the evening. This is where it is at. There is activity galore all day long. My favourite is to grab some picnic supplies and just go down and hang out with the crowds in the evenings. Totally casual and a great way to people watch... but remember to be aware of the pick pockets.... you will know them when you see them if you keep aware.
Enjoyable!. During our two weeks in Paris we spent a lot of time here. Sitting on the banks or bridges and taking it all in. Did a one hour river cruise. Pick one, you will have a good time.
River cruise . The only way to go! You'll see lots of history in Paris just from the river and you'll get some outstanding views of the Eiffel tower.

Favorite experience in Paris. 1st trip to Paris; spent 1st of 4 days on Batobus river cruise (18 Euros); get on/get off. Turned out to be best idea, gave us view of most of the major sights, opportunity to understand layout of Paris & flexiblity to join cruise at multiple locations. An evening view of Parisans sitting on Sience river banks, enjoying life was the highlight of my day. All ages, families, couples, friends - it seemed as if all of Paris was sitting on the river banks - I decided they had the secret of happiness & joy. Just like the movies, enjoying wine, picnics, friendship. Babies & grandmas, lovers & friends. Is there anything left to ask for. The Batobus was a great introduction to Paris. We bought tickets online, but can also purchase along the river at their docking stops. HIGHLY recommend!

Wonderful by Foot. I didn't have enough time to do a boat tour (but plan to my next visit) so I walked some parts of the river. It is very picturesque with the constant boats going by, markets on the side, book selling vendors, clean paths/water and beautiful architecture/buildings on the side. It was romantic to walk the paths holding hands with my boyfriend and stopping at markets/watching the boats go by. A very relaxing part to our trip :)

One of the best ways to get a sense of Paris. Paris is the Seine; the Seine is Paris. Taking a boat up or down the river is one of the best ways to get a sense of the city. Paris is one of the most beautiful cities in the world, and the river is a core part of what makes it beautiful. Do this early in your trip; you will see a least a dozen sites that you'll want to visit later on.

Cruising The Seine. A river boat cruise on the Seine is a must. You can see all of the sights, and it will allow you to determine what you want to visit in detail. Also, the boat makes frequent stops, and you can hop on and hop off and then rejoin the boat tour later. However, there is a flight of stairs up/down so you must be able to climb. It's very relaxing, and it saves on taxi fares too.

Beautiful, peaceful. We didn't do a boat tour we just strolled along the river and crossed a couple of the bridges. I don't remember what the name of the bridge was but there was one bridge we crossed that was used in a scene from the movie Inception. The river was so beautiful I wanted to go for a swim

By foot or by boat. Get a map and walk both sides. Have a little fun and cross at each pont. Make a day of it as you will come across famous gardens, Places like Notre Dame not far of as well as the Latin Quarter. Stop and browse the artist stalls or buy something from one of the artists set up at the end of the bridges. Cafes and restaurants everywhere so grab a coffee and crepe or a beer or wine with a baguette and cheese.
Batobus journey. A laid back way of enjoying and exploring the Seine and the significant places along the river is by Batobus.

A beautiful way to see Paris from the Seine River. Tickets for these attractions are from 12Euros to 15 Euros or more if you want to take one of the boats that offer dinning options. I went with my husband and 10 year old boy. We all enjoy so much the hour on the cruise. I wished it had been longer but an hour is okay if you have children. Nice views from the Eiffel tower, Louvre museum, Notre Dame! Totally worth it in good weather conditions. If it is a cold day make sure you bundle up; it gets cooler on the river.

So charming. The Seine River crosses the french capital from East to West.The best way to discover the river and to see a lot of Paris charms is to take a boat. Some of the bateau mouche allow you to hop on and off and thus to visit at your rhythm.A must see
Nice views. Nice views of most of the landmarks in Paris and you can hop on and off using the batobus and literally spend all day using this mode of transport to explore.
A can't miss!. My husband and I had a great time walking from the Eiffel Tower to the louvre at night. Very romantic! There are many beautiful bridges to take photos on.
River Cruise. We took a Cruise on the Seine River and got a good tour of Paris on Cruise. It was nice to see people actually sitting near the river and just chilling. the one hour Cruise was nice

A must for your trip. A trip on the Seine is a must for any new visitor to Paris or in fact all visitors. Many of the major sites are along the river and the commentaries are usually very informative.
Perfect for a long walk. Nothing beats a stroll along the Seine with its classic cobblestone paths and many bridges to cross over!

Just breathtaking by ship. Again, we went before the times they allow me to click on below..it was in the early 2000's. The river has not changed nor has the sights along the way to the best of my knowledge. I recommend you take the dinner cruise and you will sail past Notre Dame, the Louvre, the Concierge where Marie Antoinette awaited her beheading. They play music on these dinner cruises which last as I recall about two hours and it's all soft French making you feel the place your in. The food on these ships is very good. The lights of Paris are spectacular from the river. Enjoy.
SPECTACULAR!!!!. A 'must' for those travelling in PARIS...the sights at night are unbelievable...the hi-light of my trip.

Great versatility - hop on hop off. We used the hop on hop off service which does a similar out and back trip to the bateaux mouches service. The boat stops at all the key tourist attractions including Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame and The Louvre. Being able to hop on and hop off meant we could spend as much time as we wanted at each attraction.

One way to see the city. The hour long trip takes you down to the Eiffel Tower, passing many sights which you would not see unless spending a lot of time in Paris. It then turns round heads back past Notra Dame Cathedral. The commentary is in French and English

Another Famous River. There are a handful of famous rivers to be seen in the world. The Mississippi, the Thames, the Nile, the Amazon, the Yangtze, and the Seine. The mayor of France would like the Seine to be swimmable by 2020, but I imagine that would be a pipe dream. There is no better way than to spend a lazy summer evening than walking along the banks of the river, watching the boats go by, and the people wondering about. There is also a great man made beach that is welcoming in summer but for those coming from the US you'll probably think it's a little too cool to strip down into s bathing suit for all but an hour or two of the day. My only regret is not doing a dinner river cruise.
Nice view of Paris. Took a bus / river combo with a bus company. We hopped on and of on the River Seine free of road traffic jams. Don't visit Paris without sailing the River Seine.

We only saw the Seine as we crossed either on foot or on the Metro, but is was always a lovely view. No matter where we crossed the Seine looked lovely, maybe next time we'll catch a boat down it, beautiful way to see the city.

PAris's star attraction. Great walk along the river on the lower level quays. Just strolling next to the Seine and under the different bridges. Just a word of warning - wheelchair access is only at certain points and the stairs can be slippery.

Amazing sights!. Me and my wife took 2 different seine cruises while we were in paris, one at night and one in the day, I think it cost 14€ per person for the tour cruise with a tour guide, we got to see everything along the seine, you will see the locals on the rivers edge having dance classes and waving you, the day cruise was a hop on hop off service called Bato Bus, basically a boat bus, it stops at the 9 main attractions in paris, from Notre Dame to the statue of liberty, a great way to get around, I think we only paid 11€ each for that ticket which let us hop off at all the stops and catch another boat after.Definitely something to consider doing while in paris.

RIVER'S EYE VIEW. A MUST MUST MUST cruise on the river, to get an outside(r's) view of all that is grand and a must visit inside. This cruise is the 1st thing you should do to short list what would like to do in the nest few days

Clean and Clear. Husband and I enjoyed an afternoon boat tour up and down the Seine. The water was clean and clear and did not smell as some other rivers do. We had a fun cruise and enjoyed the views and being out on the water. We hope to return to do it again in the future!Visited August 2009
A must to go if you're in Paris. The Seine, is well-known all over the world. I loved when I when with my wife on a ship and enjoyed the views of the city from the river. Romantic, no doubt.
Paris pass cruise . I enjoyed the river cruise because of the nice views of the major attractions. It's easy to see a lot this way. I suggest to bring sunglasses if the summer and a good camera.
Seine Brook. Flow through the Paris city chatting her beauty with the bubbles and foams of the river a moment to think how long and deep

Clean,,, great views.. Un like the Thames the seine is clean and we'll maintained, the views are as good as London, they are a bit closer to see, the boat was of better standard than London, give it go...
Night dinner. Enjoyed a romantic dinner with my group as we watch the light display of eiffel tower in the cold october weather

River Seine. The Siene makes for a great walk or boat ride, whatever you prefer. Or even do a dinner cruise- search bateaux mouches and find your reservation! Great way to see Paris and save the feet.
Beautiful River Walk. The Seine is such a beautiful colour compared to other rivers! it looks clean, and is pleasant to walk along one of the many bridges there.
Beautiful . Very beautiful! We did a boat cruise up and down the river, very decently priced and you get some really good views and pics!! Well worth it!!!

Nice stroll along the Seine. When visitjng Paris this is a must and one which you can not avoid.We took a nice stroll along the banks of the Seine which has a number of small parks and entertaining spaces along with street entertainers which really gave this walk some great atmosphere.Due to the heightened risk in the area, there was as you would expect a high presence of military and Police with guns. This could either worry or put you at ease, either way we felt safe in Paris throughout.The only downside to this walk was the smell of urine, norm ally under the bridges but this could be down to the lack of public conveniences in Paris.Overall, a great stroll anytime of the day in the sun!

Wonderful views of either side of the land . Try to buy combined tickets in the hop in hop off bus it's cheaper. If you stay out in the deck the view is wonderful. Although commentary is available inside. All boat trips usually start opposite the Eiffel Tower.
Dominates the City. Relatively clean river spanned by numerous interesting and different styles bridges. Best enjoyed on a Calife river cruise

Left bank. A walk along the left bank of the Seine is a must from near Place de la Concorde to the Notre Dame Cathedral. A long walk but with lots to see and photograph together with sidewalk vendors displaying souvenirs etc for sale and tourist boats a plenty.Early walks on a Sunday can be spoilt by urine smells after people party until the early hours , but workers are out early cleaning up. we walked along both sides of the Seine many times on the way to attractions and loved it every time.

Romantic, relaxing and fantastic . Wonderful attraction in Paris, taking a cruise is a relaxing option where you can admire all the scenic buildings and monuments but also renting a bike will make you feel like a local!! Don't miss this attraction, top in Paris!

River Seine. How can you visit Paris without a walk along the River Seine, left or right, you simply must do so. Like so many great cities of the world the river, River Seine, is an essential part of the design and action of this great city. Along the way you will marvel at the city sights from Louvre to Musee d'Orsay, L'ille de France, Notre Dame and much more, and you can stop to by a trinket from the many stalls along the way open and catering to locals as well as of course the tourists.

Beautiful. A wonderful place to relax. We took a cruise at the start which was less than 20 euros, and it lasted for an hour. The city is so beautiful, and as we went in the evening we got to have a feel of how people in the city unwind after long days. Don't miss this! You get to see everything!
Calmy the river flows. The original Statue of Liberty is beside river. The river Seine flows through the heart of the Paris city. Wonderful ! There is also a cruise along it.

Very relaxing cruise on the Seine. As part of a full day tour, we spent an hour or so cruise on the Seine (round trip from just in front of the Eiffel Tower). It was extremely relaxing and it was amazing to see the city from the river. Just the various architecture of the different bridges was fascinating and passing right by Notre Dame was great. I would highly recommend this and am so glad we did it.

What a River. I'm not sure how to review a river, but I can tell you that walking along the Seine is a must-do activity in Paris. There is so much to see along the banks, including the adorable floating restaurants! Grab a pain au chocolat and take a leisurely stroll. Make sure to visit Ile Saint-Louis when the Seine branches near Notre Dame.

Lovely in summer. We had a lovely walk along the seine . We found deck chairs and sand such a treat .. Later we had a drink on the banks of the seine lots of people were enjoying the warm evening . Very special

Batobus. Used the hop on/ hop off batobus. It was excellent. Surrounded by Windows so you can see all around you. Very reasonably priced at around 16 euro for a day pass, which was the best price we found. You can easily jump on and off at all the major sites. The ride was smooth and a very pleasant way to spend the day travelling around. We expected to wait 20 minutes at the eiffel tower but they were arriving every 5 minutes. Brilliant. Would recommend.

The Scenic Seine. We loved viewing the beautiful architecture of Paris, especially the amazing bridges, from our tour on the river barge. Don't miss this relaxing way to see the sights -- hop on and off at your own pace.

Dont miss the River, but the canals?. Its best to do the Seine first, as the canals are a bit tedious, Hot afternoon, full boat, long time spent in the locks, the first was fine but after the 9th ...ummm Commentary was disappointing as we had asked to hear an English Guide, he spoke lots of French, but very little English so we felt we missed out lots of interesting parts, that might have made it better.

Beautiful at night!. The most romantic place in the world? Yes, but also a great place to people-watch and relax. Night time views of the River Seine are beautiful and the Eiffel Tower at night (if you don't mind walking a bit further from the Left Bank) is stunning.
Beautiful! . Such a relaxing cruise that shows all the major sites in Paris. You get to see some amazing bridges and learn the history as you cruise.

Don't miss the Seine River cruises. We decided to take a river cruise on the Seine and it was amazing. We went about 7:00 pm and the sky was amazing. It's a wonderful way to see the sites along the river and it's very relaxing. We really enjoyed it and its one of our favorite memories in Paris. It's a must do while in the City of Lights.
Cruising on the Seine. We did a Viking River Cruise on the Seine River from Paris to Rouen and back and it was just lovely. Beautiful countryside and views.
Fun. So much going on on the river. From the boats with restaurants and bars, to cafe and boat trips. Not to mention lots of joggers and free wifi... Not to be missed just walking along.

Touristy but you gotta do it!. It gives you a short and sweet overview of Paris, the main sites along the Seine and some fun facts. It's very tourist and kitschy but it's still a fun thing to do even if you are going to see all the sites themselves.

A nice place to walk. Our first day in Paris, there was a strike and we ending up walking along the Seine to get to Notre Dame. It was a nice walk and we were able to view so many of the bridges and buildings that are on the Seine.

River cruise at night? The best!!. We took a cruise on the river about 10:00 on a Saturday night. The buildings were illuminated, and bridges were beautiful, and there were people dancing on the bank! Different deejays were playing different types of music...we saw ballroom dancing and salsa. Made us want to sell everything in Texas and move to Paris forever. There are many cruises on the river, pick one and GO!

Take a boat trip . It's definitely a good idea, there are companies that do a bus tour with a boat trip, had a fab time. We were really lucky and our boat dropped us right next to the eiffel tower just as it sparkled in the night, truely magical

Walk alongside or take river bus. You don't have to go on expensive river cruises. You can just hop on and off the river buses at various points. Research it a bit before you go to see which areas you may find interesting to explore. Just standing on the bridges and taking in the beautiful sights is wonderful also.
Lovely Trip. This was purchased as a package with the big red bus, both the bus tour & the river trip was very enjoyable, excellent way to see Paris on a short trip

Essential Parisian Trip. This is probably the best value for money in Paris, either strolling along the Seine or taking one of the ferries. You will see a large percentage of the famous buildings and monuments of Paris from the tourist ferries. An absolute MUST if your are visiting Paris. I would take the trip, rather than the trip plus dinner. You can eat great food anywhere in Paris.

Most romantic River in Europe. Sit by the side of the river and forget about the world (although watch out for your bags!!!).... Its serene to sit along the bank of the river.. there are lot of street performance which will keep you buy. If possible do take a cruise ride...

river tour. We were lucky enough to catch the first river tour after a flood that prevented these tours for days. And although we couldn't stay at the top deck of the boat the view was nice from the lower deck. The only problem was the hundreds of chinese people who were very rude and didn't let us approach near the edge of the deck. Actually, because of that, we had to let the first boat go and take the next one because we couldn't find a place to sit. Baton Mousse is 2 euros cheaper than the other company but next time I will try the other one for sure. The boat was quite old and dirty but at least it took us till the statue of liberty.

River cruise and meal. Excellent Trip down the SeineMeal not too bad but be careful of extra chargessome of the waiters were asking if I wanted a taxi back to Airport when I leave paris whilst serving me beef Lol

River Tour. Took a boat tour of the Seine. Well worth as the view from the river is lovely.The cost was only 15 Euro per person. The pre-recorded tour audio wasn't especially impressive but the river was pretty and the view onto the buildings were nice to see.

Picnic on the Seine. We took the time to enjoy a bottle of wine on the Seine one night, and it was fabulous. We enjoyed the sunset, watched the boats go by, and people watched. We enjoyed it so much that the next night we had a picnic on the lock bridge, which was equally enjoyable.

Relaxing and scenic. We took a boat cruise on the Seine and it was lovely. It was wonderful to see the famous buildings and structures that line the Seine from the River's perspective. The bridges were so magnificent and can not be appreciated from street level. They were all different and so detailed. They were actually my favorite sight on the cruise. After walking all morning, it also was a relaxing interlude. It was not expensive and a fun memory of Paris!
Beauty and history together!. Is worth it to book a cruise of one hour or more around, you will see the most interesting places and its history.
Wonderful . Had a great journey on the river. Much better than the hop on hop off bus routes. We were lucky as the weather was cool. A must see in Paris
River tour with Fat Tire. Champagne tour that included skip the line to the Eiffel Tower. Very relaxing river cruise and was great to skip the line to the Tower.
Peace. You just need a bottle of beer near river seine and you wont understand where the time passed it would be even better sitting with your girl

The lifeblood of old and new Paris - a river of history. The Seine is a river like many famous rivers of the world, well known and yet always surprising. The river divides Paris, not in half exactly, and it gives life and and a focal point for so many major sites within the city.The buildings and structures that line this remarkable river include the Eiffel Tower, Louvre Museum, Notre Dame Catheral, Place De la Concorde, just to name very few of its amazing places.
Amazing. My family and I chartered a yacht for a birthday dinner. The views were astonishing as we went right past the Eiffel Tower. I would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting.

Batobus. Took the batobus which allows you to get on and off at 8 stops along the seine this was a lovely and relaxing way to see the sights and different to the hop on and off bus which is also good but not as enjoyable
Beautiful Scenery!. The river is a wonderful way to see this gorgeous city! There are many charter boats or even walking along the side, It's a great way to see many landmark places in Paris!
Beautiful :) . Walked along here quite a few times from bridge to bridge to bridge! Great things to look at on the way along and so much always going on! Highly recommend :)

must visit. a trip to Paris is incomplete without a trip on the Seine, you see so much from the river and there are several companies offering trips, all of whom seem pretty reasonable and professional
It's a beauty.. Do you know what color the river Seine has? Go and see for yourself. The internet won't tell you. Stroll along the bank gardens or promenades.

So much to see and do.. What hustle and bustle around this river! There are bridges crossing over from one side to another all over the place. At some locations, there are boats to go on to go up and down the river, places to sun bathe, mostly to walk along and definitely to people watch. Always lots of activities!
Nice way to see the city. Me and my gf took a cruse on one of the many boat taxis. Saw some lovely sites and very good way to get around the city.
beautiful. A boat ride in the river can help you to see most of the famous tourist sight of the city. Worth trying it.

The Seine is the heart and soul of Paris. We had walked the Seine many times to get to destinations but we waited to our last night to take the evening boat ride. We wanted a special way to say goodbye to our favorite city. The lights twinkled as the sun set and the Eiffel Tower was magnificent all lite up. A beautiful end to a perfect trip.

Take a walk down the banks of the river.. Many of the bridges over the river are very interesting. One even has a small statue of liberty on it. I suggest taking a river dinner cruise you can find one as cheap as 40 euros per person.

Fresh Air, Fresh Views. We went on a public tour through the River Seine on a big boat during the night. I totally recommend the tour during the evening or the night because you avoid the harsh sun, and you get to be in a less crowded space. Plus you get to see Paris, lit up, in its nocturnal phase! The views of the city are amazing!

Great trip . We went on trips night and day ! A must at night when the Eiffel Tower is all lit up. We went past at 10pm when the tower lights flash for 5 minutes ! Nice to see the city from the seine but it's always packed so be prepared to find a place to sit upstairs if your one of the last on.
