Take a tour, it is magnificent. The rich choice you have worth to take a tour of any ans see "La Seine".You have air conditioner inside, but the breeze is awesome.

A boat tour . Very good boat tour along the river seine get to see all attractions on the way nice calm gentle ride bit wet but can't help with the weather staff very helpful as my husband is disabled

A dinner boat trip is a must.. A Seine river cruise with dinner is a marvellous way to experience this famous waterway - and romantic too! Food was good and a bottle of wine was thrown in for good measure. It isn't cheap but the memory lasts forever.

Relaxing walk along the river. I was traveling solo and enjoyed the river-bank life along the Seine. I recommend spending some time simply walking along the river. On any given day, there are some cafés, bars, exhibits, performers, and parks.

Fresh tour. Don't hesitate to take the bateau moûche and make a tour in the river seine around paris. You'll be able to see all the historical buildings and pass under different bridges as the guide will tell you about their names and stories. You'll see literally everything, specially couples sitting on the border. You must sit on the roof of the boat to be able to breathe the fresh air and relax.

Relaxing way to see city. A nice alternative to the open top bus. Cruise down the Seine and see all the major sights. We got on at Eiffel Tower and the trip lasted 1 hour.Calm and relaxing on a dry day as the majority of the seats are outside on top of the boat.

Beautiful river. It doesn't matter if your travelling by foot or by boat there is something magical about the Seine. For a city river this is one of my favourite. We always ended up just walking along the banks and its beautiful to watch the sunset and rise over. Try taking one of the river cruises and you will find out a lot more of the history of the river itself. I believe they do a wonderful job with all the walk ways alongside the river.

Walks along the Seine. Clean river, ducks, many boats, "romantic" walks only somewhere, relax, also mini bars at the river but beware of some of the places which surround the homeless and dirty people!!!
river cruise. we did a night cruise to see the city of lights, got great shots of the sunset , eiffel tower , and moon lite sky

Walks, picnics, romance. It's true that it can get a bit touristy, messy or loud and in some points even so dirty it's not even remotely nice but almost everywhere is wonderfoul! I had a pic nic at sunset there and it was really fun! Also some of the best walks ever and I suggest you arrive to notre dame walking from the Bastille along the Seine
must-see. We took the batobus on the Seine & it was great fun. The major tourist venues are easily accessible: Eifel Tower, Notre Dame, Ste. Chappelle, Louvre, & many others.

A great river. The Seine is probably not as important to Paris as the Nile is to Egypt, but it is the hear and soul of the city in many ways. It is beautiful and seductive, especially at night. It runs in the middle of the city and a boat ride, or a cruise, can take you to see many sites. It has countless bridges along its path, and the views are spectacular. A walk along the river banks is very relaxing, just as standing on one of the bridges gives you a breathless feeling. It is just a great river.

Cruise with Bateaux Parisiens. A cruise on the Seine is a very nice way to see Paris. I guess the cruise companies are pretty much the same, but I would advice to see if you can book a tour where you do not have to stand in line to get on the boat. We had to stand in a very long queue for 45 min (not possible to sit down) to get on the boar which was a bit of a drag. But once on it, its a very nice excursion and they have headphones so you can listen to the pre-taped guided tour.

Relaxing afternoon ride. The Seine River Cruise was a nice was to relax and cool down after spending hours at the Eiffel Tower. Although we had skip the line tickets, they weren't necessary as the boats leave every hour. A refreshing view of the city from the water gives you an opportunity to see many of the museums and beautiful architecture to add to your must see visit in Paris.

Great views. We went for a cruise on the River Seine which departed near the Eiffel Tower, the boat went up the river passing many monuments then turning around and ending in the same place where you can get excellent pictures of the Eiffel tower from the river.
Nice. Beautiful. ..you hear about this river many times, on tv, through history and I finally saw it. The boat ride was not worth it to me, just strolling was more valuable
boat ride on the Seine. very enjoyable trip on the Seine visiting and observing points of interest, cheap and a great way to see historical sites...well worth it.

Lovely jaunt on the river. Everything in Paris is on a giant scale. A trip on the Seine by boat is well worth it.
There are a few companies so check if you get a discount voucher with your airplane company checkin ticket as we did.

Music by the river. After settling into our accommodation we strolled down to the river and were delighted to chance upon pop up places to eat and drink; a 3 piece jazz ensemble entertained . The setting was perfect to unwind to after a flight from the other side of the world in the late afternoon sun.

A special place to visit in Paris. The Sienne runs through Paris and is a good way of exploring the city. There is a get on/get off system where you buy a ticket and jump on when you need to get to a particular place. Works well.There are also dinner cruises which are truly romantic. Food is usually good and wine excellent.I often use the Sienne as a landmark to find my way around to various places around Paris. Like all things, take your time to explore and savour the experience.

Excellent combined ticket with Eiffel Tower. We took this boat trip as part of a combined Eiffel Tower Skip the Line Tour and Seine Boat Trip booked through Get your Guide. You can wait for up to a year to use the boat ticket but we went straight to the boat after out trip to the Tower. It was a nice relaxing experience after the Eiffel Tower which was very busy. The Bateaux Parisiens are state of the art trimarans and you have the option of the airy cabin with a multi lingual handset and CCTV screens of the views ahead and astern, or on the sleek wooden upper deck which has the best view and you enjoy the atmospheric moments as you pass under the famous bridges. However, the commentary is, inevitably, rather indistinct. The combined ticket meant that we covered both these "must do" Paris attractions in a long afternoon. Tip; if you fancy one of the (very good) photos that the roving photographer takes at the start of the trip take your opportunity to buy them when you disembark including any extra copies as the photographers don't keep the pictures.

Lifeblood of Paris. The Seine is artery which links all the major sights in the fabulous city of Paris. A boat trip is a good way of getting orientated for new visitors. An evening boat trip gives the city a different look, pretty, twinkly, illuminated, just gorgeous. You can eat while you sail, you can eat while enjoying views of Notre Dame. It has beaches in August! The batobus is a great hop on hop off taxi. The Seine is a working river which works for its city.

Birthday treat . We visited paris on an extremely hot day. Getting onto a river cruise was an ideal way to cool down (a little) while seeing this beautiful city from a different perspective. We had a 1 hour cruise and got to see so many amazing places, sites and architecture. The children were amazed at the scale of the buildings and all the different bridges. There is a running commentary of all the buildings and bridges. What they used to be and what they're used for now. Worth a visit for an hour, although they do a two hour meal cruise too.

A mixture of tranquility and liveliness. The good people of Paris really make good use of the Seine and it is such a pleasure to see so many of them out sitting on the concrete and stone plinths in twos and groups enjoying themselves - even in these troubled times. The views down the river are terrific and if you get the chance to have a dinner trip on a glass topped boat then take it.

Of course. If you have a little time in Paris (poor you) a river cruise is a must. There are plenty to choose, We picked the one under Pont Neuf Bridge. Was excellent. If you have more time , a picnic on the lower walkway is a peaceful break from an incredibly busy city.
riverside walk. there are lovely walks along the banks of the riverthey were bringing in sand to create a beach effecta lot of security in the areaa lot of activity on the river

Excellent tour. Please do not miss this trip .Online You can get Paris tour ticket which includes free access to the tour bus and the tour boat , unlimited till the expire of the Paris ticket .You will see most of the attractions especially the Eiffel Tower and the small version of the Statue of Library.While you are enjoying the boat trip , You will take the best ever pictures for all the attractions .

Walk along the river is a must!. We had a great time walking along the river on many occasions, during the day or snacking by the river. One of the things we enjoyed the most was the groups that often dance in close vicinity to the river bank all over Paris. Lot of people take the cruise on this, I recommend the cruise if you do not want to walk much and intend dining on the cruise with the beautiful sights of Paris going by. The most beautiful bridges over the river connect the west and east bank in Paris, it is a lovely sight to sit by Pont Neuf or Pont de la Tournelle looking at the gorgeous Notre Dam, spires of Sainte Chapelle or the Eiffel Tower.

Great river. Do the sightseeing cruise it's only 15€. The best way to see the best parts of the river is by doing a sightseeing cruise, it's only 15 euros for an hour of cruise, you will see a lot of bridges and some of the most iconic attractions.
cruise. It was flooded during my visit this year, last time i took the cruse its the best way to see Paris city
Great Tour. What a great way to see the city! From a cruise down the beautiful, serene Seine you can see so many of Paris' most famous attractions. Highly recommend.

Timeless. Elegant. Eternal.. This river, this slice of water, IS the lifeblood of the city. If you are a visitor, I highly recommend that you stroll along it's shores, especially around Ille St.louis where I normally haunt. I am there early in the mornings when the sun strikes the windows and i am there walking under the bridges with friends. I am there waving at boats beneath the bridges and there watching the reflections in the water as the tower lights up each hour. Blood has flowed here and flowers have as well. Kisses and curses and kings crowns have all been drenched here. Add to the narrative the next time you visit.

Boat trip. Me and my boyfriend went for 1 hour boat tour on the river Seine. The guide speaks slowly and clear and we enjoy in the view and the story for the towers and monuments on the both side of the river..It was round trip and it doesn't cost too much

Good for transportation. We used the Batoboat on the river to get around places to see the tourist sights. Has lovely views whatever the weather and would highly recommend going to see the sights from the water.

Lovely River. We were in Paris hot one week. Our apartment was one block from the Seine. We found ourselves crossing the river at various points during the week, so many lovely bridges, offering different views. One of the prettiest rivers.

Dinner cruise is a must!. It was our first night in Paris, and we booked a dinner cruise. Such a great idea! We got to see the Eiffel Tower for the first time as it got dark and it was amazing. The choice for dinner was chicken or salmon, and both were better than I expected. We got a small bottle of champagne and water as well. The dessert was small but satisfying! So romantic !!

A lovely river cruise. We did a one hour river cruise from Pont du Neuf that went down towards the Eiffel Tower, then back up to Notre Dame Cathedral. A very interesting cruise with good guides on board and a different perspective on Paris. Good photo opportunities!

Central Respite. Whether you want to get away from the road traffic and noise, have a quieter place to eat and drink, have a riverside picnic, or simply go for a long uninterrupted stroll... then a walk along the River Seine might be what you need. There is still plenty to see, but less people, less traffic and less roads to cross. It's also a more leisurely option for getting from A to B if you have a map and you're not in a hurry.It's good for sleeping, running, cycling and other exercise too.
Loved the cruise... A cruise on River Seine, offered my many travel operators, is a must during your trip to Paris. The cruise is approximately an hour long but a worthwhile experience.

Pleasant Trip. Took a short boat ride on the Seine. It was pleasant and I'm glad I did it. Nice to see the different bridges--the famous Love Lock bridge, and the other attractions from the water. Sometimes it was difficult to hear the pre recorded historical information over the speaker but it was done in English and French.
Cruise is worth it.. You get to see the city from a different perspective. You go under several bridges, around Notre Dame, and you can see the "beach." We enjoyed it on a hot day.

Walking along the river. Walking along the river Seine from the Eiffel Tower to St German can be a wonderful experience in any kind of weather, if you like walking in the rain (just remember to bring an umbrella and good walking shoes). As you stroll along from Quai de Branly onwards, you watch the boats sailing the river and wave to passengers. Between Pont de l'Alma and Pont Alexander III you can go over to the floating gardens, see ducklings swimming nearby, or go on to the playground where children can climb the wall and hop on the pirate boat. Bring lunch and refreshments, as there are tables and seats along the way. Or you can stop at one of the cafes and get something to eat or drink there. Then continue to Musée d'Orsay or cross over to Musée du Louvre. A lovely morning or afternoon walk with the whole family.

Breathtaking views. We took the bateaubus, prebooked through trip advisor and worth every penny as we saw the most beautiful sites from this tour of the Sienne. We also spent time walking along some of the bridges and stopped to have a characature drawn and bought an artists impression of the tour Eiffel Highly recommended to see most of the main sites of Paris along the way!

See Seine, See Paris. Cruising the Seine gives you a different feel of Paris. Haven't been in the day but it seems like it would be a good option if you want to see some landmarks without traffic on the streets.
Been dinner cruise twice. Loved it both times. Food ok on the cruises but atmosphere makes up for it. Love how relaxed everyone is. You will enjoy there

Wandering along the Seine. My adult daughter and I happened to be in Paris when the Tour de France was occurring, so after we watched it for quite awhile we wandered along the Seine. It was very picturesque to do so. What was a total surprise to me about this was finding areas where a small sand filled area was. There were beach chairs and umbrellas, and water misters for all, young and old alike. What a charming find!
Beautiful. Lovely cruise on the river, stunning views and the weather was also really good. We did not eat on the boat but the food looked good.

take a boat for a cruise. from the river seine you see Paris from a different perspective, impossible from a walking tour. It is worth admiring the famous roofs of Paris. Unfortunately most cruises are crowded, forget your neighbors and take this hour to admire an open air museum
River Seine Cruise. We did the cruise in the afternoon. It was lovely and relaxing. It was a great way to take in some of the sites we didn't have time to go and visit.
Beautiful for walks. Delightful setting for a nice walk, romantic or otherwise, along the bank of the river. Several cool bridges to visit.
Not a must do thing.. It is just any other river. One may take a cruise if you have no time to visit all the places. It's better in the evening just before the sunset.

Worth It !!. We took the one hour cruise near the Eiffel Tower and enjoyed it.
Do arrive a bit early for the upper level seats. It was a pleasant one hour and well worth it. There are limited vending machines on it so pack some snacks.
Lovely !
Scenic. Walking the Seine was scenic and romantic. We could have gone on and on. It seems endless but beauitful

Police everywhere. We took a hop on & off Seine river cruise & a lot of the time when we got off there were police & military personel everywhere. The military were carrying around maching guns-which felt a bit off but I'm glad they were keeping everyone safe. The police would do bag checks of purses, backpacks and shopping bags. There were places along the river that smelled of urine but other places that were nice. There were children's areas, beach areas and using the river was a great way to get around even if the river smelled a bit.
Do a river cruise! . An hour long river cruise is an inexpensive way to see major sights and relax at the same time. Lots of beautiful bridges to see!

Beautiful way to see Paris. We saw a another side of Paris we would have missed. The view of the bridges were amazing. Great views of Notre Dame and Eiffel Tower. Very relaxing. You can plug into audio system and listen to the overview or just enjoy the view. Sit inside if it is rainy or too warm. The boat we were on was new and quite comfortable. All organized very well.

The Bridges are amazing. The Seine boasts a host of decorative historic bridges each with their own story! We did a sunset cruise. The boat was equipped with lights that shone on the many historic buildings on shore. The taped guide provided information atikn on the bridges and buildings clearly in several languages including Japanese, Chinese, German, and English

Great cruise - wheelchair accessible. One of the most scenic cruises I have ever been on. This one hour cruise is a must. The commentary is very informative and interesting. It is fully accessible to people on wheelchairs but there are several companies running them so ensure before going on it. We used our Paris Pass for this cruise. What we didn't know is that most things are free for people on wheelchairs and for their carer.

Romantic. Get on any bridge and a photo with this river is amazing. My favorite is the Pont des Arts, the "love lock" bridge. Even though they took down the locks on this specific bridge, there's still plenty of love in the air.
Easy flowing. It you walk along the banks or take a boat trip the seine is the heart and soul of Paris. Impossible to miss and leave out.

We will walk along the bank every day. All along the Seine, thousands of people, one historic site, then another, then another. All kinds of boats, from working barges, to tour boats. Lots of people buying padlocks, inscribing them, then locking them onto a bridge, locking them, then throwing away the keys,...into the river! What fun!Tom and LisaBroomfield, CO

Stunning River Seine. We visited the Seine River on the Bateaux Parisiens Dinner Cruise for a 3 hour fine dining sunset to dark cruise. We saw all the sights along the Seine while drinking fine wines, gourmet dinner and meeting new people from Washington DC and Colorado. What a fun, evening we shared! Boarded just below the Eiffel Tower on a beautiful dinner ship! 5 stars for sure!

Lovely to walk along the river. We walked along and over the Seine for the week we were in Paris. It is beautiful! Fun to see the book sellers in the museum area and we enjoyed watching the boat traffic near the Eiffel Tower. Always something to see - a great spot to just relax and enjoy being in Paris!
Great base for any walk in Paris. We didn't take a boat ride this trip, but I would definitely recommend it. This trip had many walks along the Seine.
Boat trip. Had a lovely boat trip up and down this river. So much to see. Took thousands of pictures and throughly enjoyed it.

Calming. Went on the bateau bus. The trip all the way round takes about 2 hours if you stay on. If you decide to get on and off to visit places near the river it is fine because the ticket lasts all day. Well worth the money and much better for getting round than using the metro. You can st inside or stand st the back to get the best pictures. A great way to see all the sight.
Nice wslk. Most enjoyable walking along the Seine River and watching the people and the boats on the river. Relaxing just to stop and watch

Great river in a great city!. River Siene is a great river. The history of Paris is build on this river. I took a river cruise trip on Seine and loved the experience. You can see all the great structures and monuments from this river. Like Eiffel tower, Pont Alexander 3 , Notre Dam cathedral etc.

Take the Seine River Tour. Catch the Bateaux Mouches, about an hour trip past many of the key sites in Paris - anytime spent on a river is good, and the scenery and architecture around you is amazing.

The artery of Paris. An evenings steamer ride on this river allows you to take in all the sites of this wonderful city. That followed by dinner on the floating restaurant is a truly romantic experience whether you are alone or with your family.

a nice river cruise. Seine river is dividing the whole city in two parts. we took the normal cruise which gave us the outside view of many landmarks the trip is good for photography but for that the time of cruise is important if you go at twilight when sun is setting so that you get to see the sunset and the night lights also. better if you can take a separate boat instead of the normal ferries full of people.

It's a river how do you rate a river. Seriously how do you rate a river. It's a lot of water and it nicely divides the right and left Bank. Beyond that what's important isn't the river itself it's the bridges which send over it with each have their own history. The buildings which were developed along it which ranging from the Senate to the Louvre to d"orsay are all amazing. The stores along it the places to sit with a glass of wine and talk with friends little alcoves in special places on its banks each in their own various ways are unique In the end the river is the river it's what occurs around it which is important.

Walk, walk walk. Some of my best times in Paris were walking on the Seine. The walks were endless, and peaceful. Plenty of places to enjoy a meal and watch the tour boats, people walking....its such a wonderful river.
It isn't a visit to Paris without a walk by the Seine. Quintessential Paris. Walk over bridges, walk down the promenades on the banks, sit under a tree and watch the people and the river. Ahhhhhhhh

An awesome place in Paris. River Seine is located in the heart of Paris. Many tourist attractions are at the riverside including Eiffel tower are just at the riverside. There are many historic bridges above it. The views are admirable both daytime and nighttime.

Hop on hop off and 2 hour guided tour. I did the 2 hour guided tour that gives you a bit of insight as to where all the mesumes are and a bit of history about each one it's informative.I then decided to do the hop on, hope off to visit the various areas. Very easy to navigate and a boat every 15 min or so.Amazing views. Worth the tour doesn't matter what option you choose.

Paris mirror . there's no doubt this is amazing river.
we saw reflection of beautiful side view in water . we also confused that which side of riverbank is right or left
this is very good activity.

Always a pleasure to cruise the Seine. We took a cruise which lasted just over an hour and it was pleasant enough. Its always interesting to see the sights from a cruise boat. However, these tours are a bit formulaic so you need to be prepared for that.

Needs a good tidy up. Walked from the Eiffel Tower along the river bank to the Tuileries. Spoiled by a generally scruffy unkempt appearance. Weeds growing everywhere, grass not cut or brown and unwatered. Seating is sometimes broken and scruffy. For an area full of tourists it was extremely disappointing. I was so looking forward to my walk along the riverbank but wouldnt bother again. A very poor comparison to a similar walk along the Thames, for example. Shame, as the buildings, stautes etc are superb

Sparkling sunny breezy day! . Bateau mouche - No better way to experience the magnificence of Paris in an hour. €13.40 per adult. Sparkling day with magnificent views of all the magnificent buildings from the Louvre to Musee DOrsay to Invalides to Notre Dams. Worth every cent.

Cruise trip worth it. We took the cruise trip on Seine river and trip started somewhere close to Eiffel tower. Cruise passes through across all the major touristic attraction, bridges, etc. Some of the views from Cruise are excellent,. Happy Clicking.
This is a must!!!. If you happen to be in Paris, either for a few hours or for a few days, you need to walk by the Seine River...
Lovely ride down the Seine!. We had the very best day, it was organised perfectly and there was no stress of missing out or not having enough room to enjoy this lovely adventure!!
So much fun to people watch.. It was a beautiful day and seeing all the people on the river was quite a blast. Watching the boats go by and just enjoying the view.

The Seine is a mighty river!. Being Australian, it is impressive to see various sectors of the Seine, in Paris, towards Giverny, or further afield. In Paris, it is wonderful just to wander along its banks and see the surrounding architecture and the locals heading off to work, jogging, and relaxing in the sunshine. And there is plenty of boating action on the river to keep you interested, as well.
Stay by the Seine. You can't do better then staying close to the Seine in Paris. Along its banks are many of the most popular attractions, lovely restaurants plus you never get lost.

good place to visit. there are few companies that do the mini river cruise. You can choose lunch, dinner or just the cruise. I went with an orange company (that i can´t remember the name). they are really great and friendy. there is a audio that explains everything while you are cruising.

If you can squeeze it in your trip, do it!. What an amazing way to see many sites of the city! Notre Dame, Orsay museum, Louvre, Eiffel tower (especially at night around 11 with the light show ). Not to mention the great bridges and foot paths with their old character and new additions (locks etc). Leisurely sight seeing on a famous route that makes as much or more than any walking, bus or other tour! No suggestions for method of transportation, because we were on a party boat. Just find a way to do it, it is worth it.
Lovely walk day or night. It connects you to all areas for tourists...very nice. Can walk along to get to Louvre, walk along to get to Eiffel, walk along to get most places!

An excellent scenic experience. An evening walk along the banks is an amazing experience, you should do the boat trip at least twice, one in day light another one in the night. This will get some good views around

Well worth the cost of the cruise. Our cruise on the Seine provided us with the opportunity to get our bearings on the many landmarks of Paris that we wanted to visit whilst we were there. The commentary was very interesting and informative and viewing some of the very well known landmarks from the river gave us a different perspective of them.Very enjoyable hour or so and well worth while.

Beautiful!. This was my first ever river cruise and it was pretty amazing! I definitely recommend taking the cruise because it is a good way to see almost everything touristy without spending too much. You will also be able to click really nice pictures. If you have the time, take a walk along the river at night, by night I mean when it is dark so around 11 pm. It is absolutely beautiful!

Riding downing the river seine. Taking a boat riding down the river seine gives you a different view of the city...The view from the river gives travelers an wonderful opportunity to see the city in a different light

Beautiful Scenary. Seine river flows through Paris and next to Eiffel tower. The tickets are sold near Eiffel tower and ride lasts about 40 minutes. This will show many beautiful ole buildings along the river as well as Notre Dam church. The cruise is a must in Paris but make sure to ride towards the evening if it is the summer time.

Out on the water. We went on one of the tourist boats,it was a beautiful day but slightly cool out on the area to back of boat.Families boarding,couples, there is plenty of room toaccommodate a good number of people seated which is all enclosed under a type of perspex?? Take your own snacks and beverages and something to read...The artwork all the bridges posess is beyond words,indescribable!!! It might drag out a little too long for some,kid's?Not sure if there was a toilet on board...Not sure how much a ticket was but it was booked on line before travelling.

Viva la France!. `What can you say about cruising the River Seine? No words can describe it. My husband and I, along with other seniors were on cruise with the MS Amadeus Diamond cruising the River Seine. We enjoyed every second of it. Awesome! Incredible! Glorious. So much to see. Snap....Snap...Snap. I took 1,000 pictures and I am still going through them. No words can ever describe the cruise we took. We are ready for another one. Lots to see and lots to sightsee and lots to snap pictures of. Something for everyone. Go there and you will have NO REGRETS.

Serene. A cruise on the river Seine is an absolute must in Paris - it's an amazing way to see all the beautiful buildings and bridges - yes there's a whole lot of them :) we did an evening cruise, which was great! We returned to the banks of the river to just sit by and share some wine!
Boat trip. A good way to get a different view of Paris, is taking a boat trip on the river Seine. It's not free but the view on the Notre-Dame from the water is spectacular.
Scenic view . We went under the river and it was a wonderful walk in the evening. You can take a boat ride on the river. We went for a picnic with our food and sat near the bank of river.

Should not just visit once!. You will see nice Seine in paris you want it or not!
Some tips:
- go twice , once in morning once at night to take pictures.
-surely do the cruise on Seine , it might be your best experience in paris.
-walking in paris is great everywhere , maybe the best place for lovely couple walk is alongside Seine..

If you manage to see Paris without seeing the Seine, you're doing it wrong!. There's always a good river central to any capital city and it's worth visiting to get some of the best views and experiences that the city has to offer. It's one of those things that if you had to design a walking tour, you could just go up one side for half the time, and back for the other half. You'd see as much of the city as you needed to and keep cool with the little bit of air that is only close to the river - as soon as you get into the streets, it can become very still.If you can, it's great to get a boat trip and see the city from the river.

Very relaxing . This is a must do while in Paris. There is no nicer way of seeing a city than from the river. It is a great way of traveling the waterways of Paris. The commentary was very informative and I would highly recommend any one visiting Paris to do this.

Beautiful. We were there in June and it is a river that runs through Paris. In June Paris experienced quite a bit of rain and the river was flooding. It was interesting to see the high water and see some docks and steps under water. You can't miss it while in Paris.

Take a Bateaux Mouches & chill. Combine it with an open bus tour & see Paris from la Seine in a chilled out way See the changing architecture & districts , the beach open 20 July to about 20 August , take it up to Notre Dame and visit. V pleasant way to travel

Boat tour. There are numerous companies offering tours along the Seine, it is well worth the time and money. We did an hour tour, there was a guide who gave a commentary in both French and English. Some buildings and bridges can only be fully appreciated from the water.

at least take a walk along the river - it's the heart of Paris!. The River Seine is an iconic landmark all on its own - so much of Parisian culture has grown up along its banks. Anyone who is looking to see the city before the rest of tourists descend can wake up early and take a walk or a run along the river. The sun glinting on the water and the varying paths and parks along the river are lovely in the morning. Or, just take a boat tour and experience the river as a passenger.

The River of Parisienne Dreams. Youve seen the pictures of the River Seine, but nothing beats walking along its quais, watching the families at the summer plages (artificial beaches) or taking any of the number of ferries or the Bato Bus down the river. The views of many of the major landmarks of the city (such as Notre Dame or the Louvre) are a bit different and somewhat suprisinh when seen from the river and Parisienne life seems to flow that little bit easier on the water.

The calm in the middle of the bustle of Parisian energy. I love the many spots where you can descend by stone stairs and end up right up next to the river, to leave behind the craziness and the busy-ness and experience the romance and the calm of the river.
Just beautiful. On one trip we used the boats that go up and down the Seine as our transportation. Thinking back the subways are quicker but not nearly as beautiful.

Take a cruise. Take a cruise of the River Seine, the views are very nice, specially Notredame, you get a different perspective from here. It was very sunny and hot, I recommend to do it in the afternoon, when the sun is not that strong, and I like to go in the upper part of the boat
A great view of Paris. Great hop-on hop-off boat tour with fantastic views for photos. Smooth sailing and relaxing journey.

A true gem, but maintain common sense. We found profound enjoyment of Paris and its people while walking along the Seine going anywhere. The beauty of the river and its views of surrounding Paris highlights without the distractions of city auto traffic cannot be appreciated until you descend the steps and walk along its banks yourself. Be careful that this relative isolation doesn't put you in danger- in other words, walking along the Seine alone very early or very late in the day may not be advisable, depending on where along its course you are. Best to stay in a group or walk during well populated hours. We particularly enjoyed the stretch between the Alexander iii bridge and Pont Neuf. Beautiful.

Paris. Boats and more boats travelling down and up the River Seine. People enjoying the beautiful building on each side of the river. Dance classes on the one side and the other side people just enjoying the views. Another must do
Fantastic. At least an hourYou'll be glad to see the main sights of Paris, for example, the Church of Notre Dame and bridges on the Seine and the Eiffel Tower
Worth taking the boat trip. Kind of overview style sightseeing. Not spectacular.But an option if you don't have much time to visit a lot.Great when on a romantic mood of course.
La Seine. Take a cruise on the Seine River and along it you will see the historic Eiffel tower, the Louvre, Musee de Orsay and Notre Dame

Boat tour around the River Seine. No trip to Paris without a boat tour in Seine River. We went for the Bateaux Parisiens Boat Tour and it was a fine day. Along the banks of the River Seine are the major tourist attractions. It will be a good overview for first timers like us and for those with limited time.
Take a tour. We enjoyed the river so much we did two tours one during the day and one at night. It was awesome to see the Eiffel at night from the water.

I was seen on the Seine!. My family took a the river dinner cruise and it was spectacular at duck. Loved watching Paris slowly decent into darkness only to watch it become the city of lights before my eyes.

Strolling along the Seine. A visit to Paris would not be complete without strolling along the Seine. At any time of the day it's a great place to take a walk, but with sensible footwear, as the cobblestones are very uneven with gaps between them. Find a shady bench, or sit on the edge of the quay and watch the boats, and people, go by. Or pick up a picnic dinner, a bottle of wine, and a blanket and head down to walkways along the Seine for al fresco dining with fellow Parisians as the sun sets (remember: drinking alcohol in public is allowed in Paris)

Night time Cruise. We took a one hour cruise up the Seine. The cost was €15 each. It was an ideal way of seeing attractions such as the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, The Louvre etc at night. The Eiffel Tower is beautiful at night. The River Seine is frequented at night by large numbers of people who sit on the banks enjoying a glass of wine etc. I would recommend this at night but it does get cold - bring a jacket. Refreshments can be purchased on board if desired

Beautiful and not to be missed. We bought water bus 2 day tickets for 19 euros. You can hope on and off all day long and there stops at most of the main attractions. It's a pretty river with lots to see along the banks. There are many restaurants and place to just sit and relax.
Cleaner than the Thames! . Its worth taking a cruise down the river. Lots to see and the water is quite clean as well. Lots of beautiful buildings and monuments can be seen.
River Siene. this river runs through the heart of Paris and has developed banks with boat restaurants and benches to spend an evening or a day.
always lovely to walk along the footpaths. Walk along and see the variety of boats on the water. Enjoy the shade of the trees, see the bridges and the sights. well worth it

Relaxing and Peaceful. Such a beautiful river that runs through France. We bought baguettes and drinks for lunch and sat next to the river while we ate. At times the river is empty and then at times boats go by to wave to. Always changing atmosphere. Very relaxing!

Night Boat Tour - Magnifique!. Watching Paris light up as the sun goes down will make you fall in love with the city. Our tour lasted 90 minutes and was thoroughly educational. From the river you check off all the major sites (Eiffel Tower, the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, Notre Dame, Pont Neuf, etc.) as you slowly begin to orient yourself geographically. It's a fantastic way to plan out your future walking tours. So be sure to bring along a city map. Plus, as an added bonus, both sides of the river banks are lined with Pariesiens enjoying the summer night, drinking wine, and dancing.

Great river. The Seine fascinates me - its size, the number of houseboats along the Parisian banks, the beach created in August, the ability to walk along it. The river cruise commentary points out all the important buildings you will want to disembark and go tour. For me the river is peaceful and relaxing.

Unimpressed . On our first day in Paris we took a scenic boat tour of the Seine that included dinner. It was a relaxing tour and it allowed us to get a feel for the lay out of the city. It was nice to see so many couples sitting on the banks of the Seine enjoying the July evening. The river itself is very narrow and unimpressive. It is easy to see why the Vikings were able to attack the Ile de la Cité. You could have practically walked across the Seine.

Amazing . Superb place to visit especially at night and safe and many French police around to ensure your safety . Music , lights , walks , a place for romance . Absolute must visit place to visit for lovers at night

Take a Cruise its Beautiful. The Seine is an absolute must if visiting Paris. We took a river cruise after a couple of hours up the Eiffel tower as the dock is essentially next door. An hour round trip took us past all the key sites.The majority of these buildings are a little set back from the river banks so compared to a cruise on the Thames for example you don't get as good a view.After the tour we walked the route, crossing the river a number of times as we went and took it all in properly and some time to chill out in the parks. This stretch of Paris is beautiful and cruising/walking the Seine is the nicest way to take it all in.

Fun to walk along . There are so many people that hang out along the river. If you choose to take a boat down you will see people sitting along the edge everywhere you look. There are so many Beautiful buildings and landmarks along the river. I highly recommend taking a cruise on it.
Must do the River Cruise.. A Cruise on the River is a must if visiting Paris. Reasonably priced and a good way to get your whereabouts in this beautiful city.

Great way to get an overall tour of Paris!. The Seine River is the heart of the city of Paris. We arrived from California so very jet lagged and decided a relaxing river cruise of the Seine would be something 4 sleep travelers could manage! We are sigmas we did. We took the boat cruise from Point Nuf just a short walk from our hotel. The commentary from the hide was excellent as she pointed out all the key landmarks & gave great info such as the details on the bridges. She pointed out fun facts like which was the smallest apartment in Paris & where the restaurant was that inspired the movie Rateatoullie! We got a head start on pictures of the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame & was a great way to orient ourselves for our tours in the days to come. Highly recommend!
A must. Very relaxing. So many sites to see as you cruise along. Lots of photos available to take. Took the "taxi" where you could get on and off at the sites if you wanted to.
Always lovely!. The River Walk is a peaceful walk. The river winds through Paris and I adore taking a river cruise to see a different perspective of Paris.
Evening Cruise. We took an evening river cruise on the Seine. It was simply delightful. The cruise began at dusk and ended after dark. I understand now why Paris is called the City of Lights.
Take a cruise after dark. This is so beautiful during the day, but you get to see everything lit up at night! So worth the late day of sight seeing to be able to see everything all lit up!

River Seine Cruise. one of the best experience in Paris. This is very near to Eiffel Tower. Online ticket booking in advance is recommended. A very good experience of 1Hr. The running commentary provide a very comprehensive overview of Paris and highlight significant landmarks with rich history You can even take a dinner cruise.

Batobus was a great idea. We were only in Paris for three days and we didn't want to commit a meal to a river cruise so we did the hop-on, hop-off Batobus and it was perfect for what we wanted. Got to see a lot of cool sites and is a cool way to get to them.

Definitely worth a river cruise. We did a river cruise that was included with our Big Bus tickets and it was so worth it. You can sit above deck outside or inside with an audio guide. We were up top and really enjoyed the unobstructed views of the river banks. It was gorgeous to see all the bridges and the main sites from the river.

Make sure you get the right boat ride!. If it is hot, say around 38 C, then you don't want the river taxi, the boat ride associated with the L'Open Tour. It was overpriced, there was no guide to tell you about the trip, and you couldn't hear the announcements. Worst of all, the side windows prevented any breeze. We baked on the river. Awful.

River Seine. The week before we were in Paris, the Seine had risen to record levels and flooded the surrounding area. As a result, we did not reserve a river cruise, which looking back, I regret. If you are not able to book a cruise, you can still enjoy the Seine from one of the many bridges that cross it. The closer you get to the Louvre, the more impressive the bridges are. Also, try to be at the Seine at sunset - truly glorious! There are pathways close to the river. You can walk or jog along the water. I'm not sure if it is because of all the rain, but there were a lot of mosquitoes along the river at the lower level. I recommend bug spray during warmer, wet months. No restrooms. If you need to use a restroom, you will have to buy a coffee or beer in a nearby cafe and say "Si vous plait" with giant puppy dog eyes. In return, they will let you go. The French are merciless when it comes to this. I actually had to pay 70 cents at the train station to use the potty. Anyway, the Seine is gorgeous. If you are staying in Paris, it will be hard to miss.

So pretty. In the hot days of summer, being able to walk along the River Seine is a treat. Get your bearings as there is a lot to do on the waterfront. We never got to take a boat trip and it was on our list. We walked along the River and took in the sites.Do yourself a favor and plan a trip in the evening by boat. It looked so pretty and I'm sorry we didn't get to do it.

A must do river cruise. The hop-on hop-off Seine River cruise is an excellent way to see and visit the main tourist attractions. You can spend a great day hopping on and hopping off the vessel and spend as much time as you like at top attraction such as the Eiffel Tower, Louvre and Notre Dame. It certainly saves the feet and the cruise is particularly worthwhile if you have limited time.

Didn't know the river split . We went on a one hour river cruise where we thought we would see all the land marks better, and we sat in one side thinking that when the boat turned around we would see the other side, we were wrong, the river splits so we missed 1/2 of the sights. The boat had hand held audio commentary devises on the lower levels only so we didn't really know what we are looking at. Do your research on the tour

As romantic as imagined!. We had a wonderful on our river dinner cruise on the Seine! Beautiful evening and what a way to see some sights. The Eiffel Tower was lit as we passed. We had walked along the Seine several times, as it was located near our hotel (Latin Quarter, 5th) and near so many sights we wanted to visit. Everything was clean, even though we were there only a couple of weeks after the flooding. We loved seeing all the "love locks" on the bridges and walls. What a romantic place!

romantic cruise. we did the dinner cruise. champagne and lots of wine which was good as i thought the food was just okay. you cruise up one side and down the other for about 2 hours and it can be very romantic. at least it was for us
Euro 2016. We took a hop on hop off river taxi trip over two days and used this as a way of getting to see the sights of ParisFully recommend a trip down the Seine

Boat cruise on Seine. We really enjoyed taking a boat cruise (one hour is adequate); Used Bateau Parisienne from the Effiel tower area; it was a lower boat and from the taller boats you would see more details but we enjoyed the lower boat. Be sure to be on an open top in good weather!
The Romantic Seine. Enjoy the river and the romance around it. Take a river cruise or walk along the banks. Stop to enjoy a drink in one of the bars along side it.

Go by boat. Took a Batobus tour of the river hopping on and off and different locations, which was nice. River looked quite clean after recent flooding and it was a pleasant way to see the city and some of its sites. Highly recommended at only €17 for a day long ticket.

A must do activity in Paris. If you haven't seen Paris from river, you haven't seen anything. You will see most of the city monuments from the river tours, usually takes around 1 hour for river tour. It's a worth going on the cruise. You will see why Parisians are called laid back people.... Try the experience, you won't regret.
Boat tour of the river. Tour cost you around 16 euro which take you on river under 22 bridges with long long history. Audio tour is be available in most of the languages.totally worth it

A lovely cruise. We had a very pleasant trip down the river seine, lots to see, we went on a lovely sunny day so stayed on top of the boat so we didn't get any commentary but if we went down below you got the commentary but we wanted to enjoy the views and the sun, it was very leisurely and saw some beautiful sights, fully recommend it, very enjoyable. You got your photo taken on entering the boat which cost 10 euros.

Great way to get around and avoid the traffic . This is an excellent way to get around and avoid the traffic. Get one of the boats which stop at different places. Ours did 9 stops. Although a lot it's good if you really want to explore.
Always interesting.. It is the centre of what makes Paris the city that it is. There is always something new to see. The Batubus is a fabulous way of seeing the river and the sights cheaply. Love it.
Beautiful. I did a river cruise with my daughter and it was amazing! Loved every minute and enjoyed the stay in this magical city!
Beautiful Scenery. Not to be missed cruising along the river Seine, with very beautiful scenery to look at from the both side of of the river.

Very interesting tour. Many companies offer tours of the river. Its a great way to see lots of places if you are limited for time or if you just need to rest your feet a while. You will see many interesting sights and may learn a little too
Nice . Lovely area & you can take a packed lunch & also allowed drink . Busy but lots to see & do . People watch & lots a boats going by too . Stunning area loved it with bridges to walk over x

This is where I want to be sprinkled when I die. I never get tired of walking the city of paris along side the seine. it is peaceful and comforting and makes navigating the city a sinch...theboat bus is fun too
Cruise on le Bateaux Parisiens. My husband and I went on a day cruise down the Seine on a tour boat, and it was amazing! Would definitely recommend this!

River Seine tour from the foot of the Eiffel Tower. Relaxing tour of Paris sitting on the top deck on a not so sunny day in July was a great tour very relaxing. Great opportunities to take pictures of the many sites along the river. If it is sunny make sure to take a hat.

In Seine. The River Seine is beautiful. On our last night in Paris, we booked a cruise. We went at sunset and it was the perfect time. The boat was quiet, whereas in the daytime tours, the boats are packed. And travelling up and down the Seine with the changing light was fantastic, as we got to see Paris by day and night. And we spent our final day having a picnic along the Seine.

A Must Do! Bateaux Cruises. There are many Seine river cruises. You can take the family on an inexpensive river cruise approx. 15 Euro's per adult. Or a lunch or dinner cruise on the River seine that allows you to see the same many Sites during one magnificent experience. The river cruise is wonderful because you start at the Eiffel tower and cruise past many monuments. Your photos will be fabulous. You will cruise under The Pont Alexandre III, an ornate bridge in Paris, with Gold figurines displayed which were built to symbolize Russian-French friendship. Actually, the bridge connects the Champs-Élysées quarter with those of the Invalides and Eiffel Tower. This is the most ornate bridge I have ever viewed. We also had a close up view of Notre Dame Cathedral from the water. It was a most memorable experience.
Walking across a bridge is adequate. After seeing the Seine I was surprised there was no obvious appealing promenade. It is a nice pass over only.

Sorta beautiful. The Seine is walled with walkways on both sides and passes beside the important museums and the Eiffel Tower. It is beautiful, but vendors have built wooden stalls above the walls elbow-to-elbow, making it difficult to see the river and enjoy the view.

Stunning by night!. If you have the opportunity, try to take a cruise along the Seine at night (I suggest a company Bateaux Parisians who do the Cruise really well - good food, plenty of drinks and music and entertainment). Book the later cruise to ensure you see Paris (and particularly the Eiffel Tower) lit up - just gorgeous (take a camera with you) and gives you a different view to the day time photo's. I know this sounds a really 'touristy' thing to do, however, it is really worth doing (from someone who doesn't particularly do all the 'touristy' things!).
To see it all. If I could do only one thing in Paris it would be this or the Hop on, Hop off bus. This was relaxing and a perfect view of all the sights

Afternoon one hour boat trip. On one of the hottest days in the year, this was an ideal way to spend some time looking at Paris from the river. We went on a one hour cruise on Bateaux Mouches. The only complaint was the charge of 3 euros for a small bottle of water! A bit exhorbitant even for Paris! The commentary in four languages over a Tannoy system was not too intrusive, but was usefully informative. Well worth a visit.

I was expecting a little more. We arrived just after the floods so the lower paths were still flooded. Saying that I don't think it would have made much of a difference. Spend your time at the major attractions or shopping. Not much to see here.

Sightseeing Cruise on the Seine. After about 1/2 hour in line with our prepaid tickets purchased from home, we were on one of the many tourist boats for a ride up the Seine from the Eiffel Tower area. Being toward the front of the line, we could sit almost anywhere and decided to give up our window seats inside the boat for a bench seat outside. The view was short lived as a couple crowded between us and the railing where they stood between variously positioned selfies for the remainder of our hour trip. I circled the boat inside and out to find a better spot, found none, and returned to where my husband was on the bench. The rest of the trip I perched on the edge of the seat, but could see nothing downstream past the standing couple. The high water from the previous floods covered the sidewalks next to the river, and made the river too high to go under the bridge closest to Notre-Dame so the boat turned around just short of it (totally understand....they can't help the water level). Altogether it was a less that hoped for experience for both of us.
Absolutely Seine. The river Seine, runs through the heart of the city, and you can take a boat day or night or for a dinner cruise.It's a nice way to cool off, or walk a bridge over the river.
Evening Boat Trip. Enjoyed the evening cruise that was part of an evening bike tour of Paris. It was cold sitting up top, but also a great way to see the sights and get some fresh air.
Boat Ride on the Seine. Very Nice experience. The tour guide spoke English quite well. We decided against a dinner cruise. Instead, this one hour cruise worked out quite well.
Evening boat trip. We spent a lovely evening on a boat trip along the Seine, at dusk is a great tome to see the sights from the water as the light is amazing
Awesome experience. To walk along the river and see all the incredible landmarks is an experience not to be missed. I didn't talke a boat, but one can hop onto one and do a trip along the Seine.
Short and beautiful view. It lasted just an hour and a half, nice views, nice break between the many walking tours. Just don't buy tickets through Viator.

Best to see on the Dinner cruise. Book the dinner cruise and enjoy the food, sites, and French music.
In a glass top boat, enjoy a 5 course meal, wine and learn to relax as you cruise down the Seine.

Superb. Trippers this is an absolute must do after the eiffel tower..Take a boat across the river seine going under 22 bridges and taking photos of famous buildings like notre dam cathedralAnd the list goes on.Unfortunately I only have video on this and am unsure if trip advisor allows this as an option? Just adding a few more pics tho..

boat tour of River Seine. Had a lovely one hour boat cruise down the River Seine. It was a lovely day. We cruised past the Notre Dame cathedral and back to the Eiffel tower port. A must do for Paris tourists.

Scenic River Seine. The river seine is better seeing in person than postcards or photos. I took various pictures and enjoyed walking the bridge. There are several boat and cruise tours. All are great and the food on the water is a good option if you want a nice tour of the city!

Take a stroll or boat and enjoy the views of Paris.... Having visited the Eiffel Tower area and with Euro 16 underway makes a good vibe in the city. Wandered past the Notre Dame and along the Seine and some of the views you take in along the way gorgeous. Lots of little stalls with art, tourist tat and so forth. Lots of little cafes just running parallel in places for drinks, bite to eat. Loved it. You can't leave lovelocks any more as they are removed which is a shame.Visited June 2016 YB Paris.
River with various activity. We had come as part of our tour. We seen various bridges and monument of liberty's replica. One can enjoy boat ride here also.

An Interesting River lined with Beautiful Buildings and Bridges. Seine is a reasonably wide river lined with beautiful architecture on both sides and bridges running across. We got to visit Paris when it was affected by its worst flood in a long time, so we also got to see the mucky side of the river.Nevertheless, one can take a walk along the river on either side on earmarked pedestrian walkways and enjoy the view across both the banks.Another good way to enjoy the river and the views is to take a river cruise. There are audio guides on board in many languages and give a good perspective of the city and its architectural history.

don't sit at the front inside, sadly, no food available. Do this in conjunction with a L' Open Tour bus trip as it only costs about three Euros extra. Boats leave every half hour on the dot. There trip takes 70 minutes and there is no food available so take something with you. And a waterproof to sit upstairs to get the best use of the narration. If it's raining, then sit outside on the lower deck so that you can run inside to avoid the showers but don't sit too far forward [or near screaming children!] as you will not hear the commentary [English & French] over the sound of the engine [and the children!].

Magnificent Strolls Along This River. My wife & I walked along the River Seine numerous times during our visit to Paris with a different feeling each time depending on the time of the day. In the morning, the river is a tranquil beauty around Notre Dame when we visited, bustling around noon near Musee d'Orsay, and romantic silence around Eiffel Tower towards the evening.Recommend visiting at various times to fully experience the different feel of this magnificent river running through Central Paris.

Enchanting . We went at nine pm when sunset was due at nine fifty pm. Beautiful temperature, breezes, and light. Everything was a pleasure. The ticket was only 15 Euro, but the feeling was beyond monetary value.

A must do - stroll along the Seine. So much to see! Take in the architecture, people watch and absorb the feel of Paris. If the weather is nice, consider taking this route rather than the metro at least one way.

Nice views of Paris. Cheapest way to enjoy the views from the sienne is to take the batobus. Ask for the family discount if you are getting family passes. It gives you a way to travel between the various tourist areas in Paris and serves as a kinda tour, without any audio narration or washrooms though.
Boat travel. If had the chance go through the Scene river in the night, great views of Eiffel tower and some other Paris landmarks great way to go around.

Artery of Paris. Very long river with nice view in middle of Paris, we took in one big boat and had around 45 minutes in Seine river to visit different area from river, it's very good activity in Paris and you can see many famous locations in small time.
It's not blue!. This picture is most definitely photo-shopped. LOL! But it is an amazing way to see all of Paris. Don't forget this one.

Wonderful for picnics, strolling and the water taxi views of the city. We had picnics by the river many days while visiting Paris. There are a lot of beautiful grassy areas for picnics. Bring bread, cheese and wine and you're in good shape. We rode the water taxi for views of the city from the river and it was slow, but beautiful!
Holiday. Lovely trip down the river. You get to see most of the views in paris by doing this trip. The cost is reasonable for an hour trip
Book a River Tour. It's a beautiful river. The people that line it are so friendly and welcoming. Beautiful monuments and views of the city from an unexpected angle.

The bloodline of the city. As we spent a week in Paris and saw as many of the wonderful things to do, places to see we loved walking along the riverbanks. Just to quiet us from shopping or whatever, just slide down y the river and see a whole other city. It is true it was still quite high when we arrived but the banks re opened and for the locals it was business as usual. The constant picture of Paris in your mind, sitting at a riverside café on the left bank sipping wine and watching the world go by. Doesn't everyone want to enjoy that moment for themselves? We made a point of it. Our now 18 year old grand daughter enjoyed the experience with us. Never to be forgotten.

Lovely place to walk.. Great place to just walk, grab a cafe chair nearby and have a drink while watching the many tourists flock by. The book stalls are open in good weather and usually open about 12pm..but hey it's Paris...they might open late. ;)
cruise ride in river seine. we went for a one hour long cruise ride in river. So many beautiful sculputures in every bridge we crossed. Beautiful houses building along the banks of river. Nice ride
A loverly river. Seine flows through Paris and creates some stunning views. It's particularly nice to walk by its side in the evening.
It was is a view. It is a beautiful walk by the River Seine. The view from the Eiffel Tower shows its true beauty as well.
Nice views. There are great cafes on the Rive gauche. I recommend to have a tour before relaxing in this great place.

Magical at sunset in summer. If you want to see Paris at its magical best, take a river cruise at sunset during summer. The light was golden & gave the whole city an extra bit of magic. There were many similar boats doing the same route but you hardly notice them & just sit back & enjoy the beautiful scenes unfolding. There were commentary available too but only if you say on the inside of the boat. Though the roof is the only place I'd want to sit

Leisurely stroll. After days of seeing the sights we needed a low key thing to do. We walked from our hotel to the Alexander bridge for the best photo ops in town. Then took a staircase to the river front and walked and took in the sights. We popped up to see the locks on the Passerelle Solferrino left by lovers . I asked my companion if combination locks meant you could come back and change your mind? We walked along each bank, saw the Tuileries and Louvre and had some crepes at a small shop along the river bank. This walk is under rated and let's you soak in Paris at your own pace.

Must choice to sightseeing. We walked several times along Seine river but we enjoyed more with a cruise tour on the river. There are many bridges which cross Seine river. You should choice this tour to sightseeing Paris.
Peaceful. This is a beautiful river. It allow you to see all the main attractions in Paris from the comfort of your vessel. If you take a tour at night the lights of the city are incredible.
The river that defines Paris. Take some time to walk along the banks. The walk from the Eiffel Tour to the Musee d'Orsay is especially good as is near the Ile de la Cite.

Off limits. Due to record flooding since 1909, the River Seine was off limits for many activities. Our evening riverboat dinner cruise was cancelled. Many museums/attractions near the river (incl. the Louvre) were closed due to the high waters. Regardless, we made the best of our stay. Although most of the attractions re-opened mid-week, there was little time left to cram everything into. For this reason I can only give it an average rating.
So lovely. So many hidden treasures from gardens to places to play. Loved our three hours walking along the Seine. Better than a cruise I reckon. Check out padlocks for lovers at Pointe Neuf.

Do it at night !. The cruise is great but only at night. During the daylight ( still light at 9:30 in June) it's pretty much a dirty river with no elegance at all. However remember Paris is the city of lights and at night esp. in the winter around Christmas it's super and highly recommended. !! The meal is really not that bad.

Must do!. You must take the bateau bus (boat) tour of the Seine! The notable sites as well as the stunning Parisian architecture is prevalent through the whole trip. I went in the spring of 2007 and was fortunate to have a bright and sunny day on which to do this. There is an audio tour along the way that talks about the big things as well as somethings you wouldn't think much of; like the many and varied beautiful bridges that cross the Seine.

Book a dinner cruise!. There is a dinner cruise in essentially what is a glass boat. It is a great way to see sights of the city and the river. The cruise was also very nice with good food. Thoroughly enjoyed it!

A beautiful way to see Paris. We used the BatoBus water taxi service to tour Paris. It was a wonderful way to see the city, and appreciate the way the heart of the city is around the river. Be sure to bring a picnic lunch to eat along the river.
Loved our visit. Small museum but the Monet rooms were fantastic. And Picasso, Renoir, Cezanne and Matisse are here as well.

Amazing and varied bridges, dinner cruise, romantic. There is something about rivers and cities — Thames and London, Chaophraya and Bangkok, Danube and Vienna, Seine and Paris. From our dinner cruise on the first evening in Paris with awesome views of Eiffel Tower and the city, to the bohemian left bank, to countless bridges life in Paris revolves around the Seine.

ordinary cruise. I viewed this cruise after the floods and on a drizzling day so my opinion was swayed by that. There are audio guides to give you a history, some were not working so good to have information prior to boarding so that you can absorb the history.

I lived on the Ile St. Louis for a month and was surrounded by the Seine River.. A hint for you is that you can buy a 2-3 day pass for a boat/bus that stops at all the major attractions in Paris. Excellent value and you can ride just for the joy of it.

Muddy. The Seine is a very busy river with tour boats constantly going up and down it. And while the tours are good, the water is pretty murky. There is a lot to see on the river and all the Parisians seemed to like sitting on the ledge of the river or on the stairs in the evening.

Bateaux Mouches Sightseeing Cruise. I had always wanted to do this - even though I knew it was a touristy-thing to do. It was a great ride - with commentaries in several different languages. They describe all the sights and there are tons of chances to get good pictures!

Just cruising. We and our friends took a cruise on the river Seine, starting at the Eiffel tower and it´s charming. You can sit on deck or inside and enjoy another view on the city. We did it by day time, but at night it´s great as well.

Keep calm and feel River Seine. You can make your visit in Paris easy just by following River Seine. It is one of the most significant landmark of Paris, or is it watermark? No need to explain, put this river on your to-do list. Feel and enjoy!

Les quais de Seine. It's always nice to have an "apéro" on the "bords de seine" in Summer. People gather there to enjoy being outside and there's a bunch of different activities to do along the Seine.

Good view of Paris if sunshine . Recommend to take boat tour since you can see many sightseeing from river , and no traffic jam compared to tour bus, and It's comfortable and feeling great if it's sunshine day.

Perfect river seine through historical paris. High quality boat. Amazing views for historical paris. Soundsystem with different languages for guidance. Souvenirs also availabe. Unforgetable tour.recommend to any one visiting paris. It is a must.
😀👍

Boat Cruise. Enjoyed our one hour boat cruise that came with the Paris visitor pass. It was a bit tricky to understand the narrator, but it was a beautiful way to see some significant buildings in the city before actually going to them.

Go at night. We did so many things in Paris but this river cruise was the best. Please tip the commentator at the end. This was one of my high lights and we took the last cruise and I am glad I did as the lights were awesome

Picnic on the banks like a local. We saw so many people enjoying picnics on the banks of the river we had to experience it. Fabulous watching the boats and barges on such a busy river, champagne, cheese and a baguette makes you feel like a local.

boat ride. This river affords such a nice overview of many of the Parisian attractions and sites. The boats are easy to board and purchase tickets. They were not too crowded considering the busy time of year that we visited.
Numerous bridges crisscrossing the river and great cruise. It is a pleasure to walk down the numerous bridges with nice architecture when you walk. The cruise on the river is also very enjoyable.

River cruising. It's a great day out on the Seine on the river boats
Book online is suggested
There are many boats and they make stops along the river
You can get on and off at your leisure
Wonderful way to see the city
Must do . You must do a river tour. It was very lovely and very informative. You learn a lot about the history of France and see a lot of landmarks.
Amazing. Did the river boat tour twice , it was so good. Lovely views and although there was electronic commentary there was also someone telling us some of the not so known facts about the places.

full of character. Beautiful to explore, whether it be a walk along the river side admiring the view or finding a rare book in a bouquinistes along the banks. Or on one of the river cruses exploring the city from the water. Its a wonderful place to be.
A trip to Paris has to include this. A river cruise is the perfect way to get a different perception of beautiful Paris - it is a relaxing and interesting way to appreciate all it has to offer.

Relaxing way to end the day. The food was better than we expected, and the walls and ceiling of the boat were all glass, so there was really no bad seat. People who paid 10 Euro more than we did were closer to the window, but we could see well from the second row and thought the trip was a bargain. Not wine drinkers, we bought beer on the boat. No other alcohol available.Our boat was half full of high schoolers, so it was less than romantic, but it was a relaxing way to end the day. In July, it was still quite light on out on the 8pm cruise, so if you are wanting to see city lights, take the later trip.

River cruise. My family enjoyed the river cruising along this river siene....
The view of the ancient buildings are spectacular....
Memorable experience...
Water water . The views of the city were great from the boat on the river. Very comfortable trip to be able to shoot photos without people in every pic
Good way to see the architecture.. The boats are covered and narrative is in all languages, but on rainy days it can be hard to see through the glass.

If it wasn't for all the pee... There is pee everywhere. The stench from the stairwells leading up to the streets is like a cat box.Don't be surprised to see people peeing while walking along the Seine. What is the most awesome aspect of the Seine in Paris..? The partying that takes place on Friday and Saturday nights. I kid you not.. The amount of people who line the Seine during the weekend nights who are drinking and hanging out is insane. Grab a bottle and a blanket and have blast mingling with the locals. Now, granted.. The next morning it is like ripe cat box and you don't want to step in any puddle. It is a spectacle that any tourist should experience while in Paris. But seriously.. Be careful. Many a drunk Parisian has drowned by falling into the Seine after a wild night.
Beautiful Cruise Trip. Beautiful Cruise Trip. If you have one day metro pass then some companies will give trip for 10 euros. We took one hour trip and its awesome.enjoyed alot

Seine River and Paris Illuminations Night Cruise. My wife and I took a Bateaux Parisiens Seine river cruise at dusk on June 24, 2016 while visiting Paris. The river cruise was great with thoroughly beautiful views. Paris is a very beautiful city especially in fading natural light and the city lights just beginning to take effect. We would recommend this tour to others.

Love,y cruise. Enjoyed a cruise aloneg the Seine. If we had more time I would have walked the banks too.Found the cruise beneficial after we had Ben on the hop on hop off bus, as we saw places from a different angle.
Fantastic way to see Paris. We really enjoyed our one hour cruise. Lots of bridges (including the famous Lock Bridge!). I took a ton of pictures!

Wonderful . You really can't take in the beauty of the river until you are up high enough to see all the bends. Walking and boating along it are recommended but for the true beauty get as high as you can to see as much of it as possible.

Pretty. The river is pretty especially good if you take a boat tour. It is fun to walk along and to see all the hustle and bustle. If you didn't go to work you could see the whole city from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame.
The Seine makes the city. The river is the center of the city in every way. The bridges and the cobblestone riverside are enough entertainment for any day in Paris.
Cool. Didn't do much, just looked at it from the edge. Not much to do from where we were and it was dirty water but locals were all around as well as tourists, generally a cool experience.

Best to visit Seine by Boat. Loved the boat ride! There was an audio guide that played French music and gave a talk about the river. I love history so for me this was interesting ~ facts like there are 37 bridges that cross the Seine in Paris. My friend just rode in quiet ad chose not to listen to the headset. So there is that ability for both! We also walked along the Seine many times during our two weeks in Paris. It is lovely to stroll along the river and watch the people and the boats. This is still very much a working river so you will see barges and working ships.

A Must See. This is a must see when you are in in Paris. No trip would be complete without walking along the river or taking a river cruise. We have done both and each is equally nice. The river's location is central to the city so plan to visit here as often as you can.

What a great way to see Paris. This boat ride is one hour long. Good views of the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame and other notable buildings of Paris. I greatly enjoyed this boat ride. Put this on your must-do list! NOTE: Cooler on the water than onshore....
Lovely tour. I myself like the rivers especially when they are clean and full of services and cafes. If it is not rainy day, i recommend you to take a tour by boat and enjoy it.
Sail on the Seine. Arrived mid afternoon and immediately took the Metro to Eiffel Tower to join one of several tour boats. This gives a good introduction and geographical layout of the city.

Take the river tour, it is very nice.. No walking! That was the allure for this one. We sat in the top front of the boat and were able to get some great pictures. The guide was fluent in both French and English and we covered a lot of area that we would never have gotten to see. We did get "Mooned" by several young people on the bank but it was all in good fun. There are several companies running tours up and down the river, research and pick the one that most meshes with your interests.
Summer, sunset. Walking along the Seine in the Summer evening with your loved one is something not to miss. Gorgeous weather, incredible scenery and super romantic.
Lovely River but Beware of Pickpockets. Lovely experience. Take a dinner cruise, have a picnic by the river, or leave a lock on the side of one of the bridges by Pont Neuf.

Boring cruise . I was very disappointed in our cruise down the Seine. The boats pack everyone in and if you're not first on there's little opportunity for good views. I found the commentary annoying. Overall we got better views from onshore than on the boat.
Romantic River. Taking a boat tour, you'll notice a lot of couples would be sitting on the bank of this river drinking wine, cuddling etc. Best place to be while the Eiffel tower on the horizon.

River cruise a good place to start . We enjoyed a river cruise on the seine on our first afternoon to Paris. It was nice to see the Eiffel Tower and lots of other sights to orientate ourselves. The kids enjoyed this as a way to see the sights. In the following days we enjoyed walks along the river as went between tourist sites. There is the odd playground and market and other things of interest along the way.

Sightseeing the Seine. Taking a trip down the Seine was a bonus with the Hop on Hop Off Bus Tour Pass. It was easy to get to the dock and there was a place to eat, a souvenir shop and well as a bathroom before getting on. It was a peaceful ride & was narrated. It was about an hour or so ride.
River cruise, good view. Take a river cruise for the trip. The view of the city is quite good. Better to be done during the evening and make it to the top of the boat for the best views.

Romantic - walk along the riverside. One of the reasons Paris is beautiful.Find some stairs to head down to the riverside walk with someone you love for a romantic stroll, read a book in the cool summer breeze or grab some food, a bottle of wine and a picnic mat to chill with friends.Whatever you do there, you'll have a good memory of the seine

Really. Paris and La Seine are one. Take un Batesu Mouches to discover. There are some who offer romantic dinners, too. If this is your first time, take advantage of learning about history of the bridges, and much more.

Meal on a boat sailing down the seine . We went Paris for my girlfriends 40th last year and had booked on at some cost a meal on a boat that would go down the seine and back capturing nearly every iconic monument, we wasn't disappointed. It was run very well we were seated by the window and still talk about it now, the night drawn in on the way back and by then it was dark and as we passed the Eiffel Tower the lights came on and we sat amazed at the sight, this is without mentioning the food that was the most tender piece of steak I have ever had in my life the mash was something else, beautiful doesn't do it justice if you want an amazing day go on one of these trips

Fun to see!. We enjoyed walking along much of the river. It is quite beautiful seeing the city across the water and the boat tours passing below. We had a nice, sunny day, so it was more beautiful than if it was rainy and cloudy. I preferred to walk along the river than take a bus or taxi to each site, but wear good shoes and be careful of scam artists as they were lurking.
