Must see!. One must take a ride with the tourist boat! There are also few discount coupons to be found for example in public toilets.

poor trip. we only went on the trip as it was part of a package with the Eiffel tower. so i recommend you don't waste your time on this trip. so the trip starts in the middle go's up turns around go's past everything you just seen down to the statue of liberty and go's back up again. you have to hold a telephone to you ear for the audio and the view of passing buildings is not great.
Late night dinner cruise. We did a late night cruise with dinner. Well worth it. Food was lovely. Views were great. Got some amazing photos of Paris illuminated. The staff serving food were lovely.

Peaceful River. My family and I encountered the Seine while on walking tour and canal cruise. It seems like it's a place for people to sit and relax and just enjoy watching people sail by. People would sit in the wall edge and read the newspaper or eat a snack/lunch. Some people were sunbathing. It was awesome to ride along the river and get the perspective of Paris from a different viewpoint. We really enjoyed the ride and spending time on it. There are a couple of canal tour companies in front of the Eiffle Tower. If you take a tour make sure you check out the bridges. Details are beautiful.

Great way to visit "less-travelled bye" places in Paris. In Paris, excursion boats offer sightseeing tours of the Rive Droite and Rive Gauche, where you get to see the Eiffel Tower or Notre-Dame de Paris. Those excursions are interesting because you get to go under many of the 37 bridges within Paris. Enjoy the view.

Lovely River in Downtown Area. Take a boat ride and stroll the banks-When I was in Paris the river was much higher than normal. Don't be overly concerned. When the river gets more than 20ft above normal start getting concerned. Paris is blessed with such a wonderful river in its downtown area. You can stroll the banks in nice parks, take your lunch or find a sidewalk food vendor, watch fireworks over the Tour Eiffel and then catch the Metro back to your apartment. The boat trips up and down the river show you most of the major sites and they are much easier than walking everywhere. The early morning and late evening boat trips show you a part of the city you would likely not see otherwise.
Watched the light show at the tower. Great place to sit along the river, drink some wine and watch the light show. Highly recommend it. Bring your own champagne purchased nearby.

1h pleasure cruise. We went on a 1h cruise experience. We chose the pleasure option, which included a drink and a crepe. It was great and very relaxing after the long queue to get into the Eiffel Tower!

Evening cruise on the River Seine. Unfortunately the timing of this cruise was not ideal .. due to the River Seine being High from the previous weeks flooding, thus making it difficult for the cruise boats to go under all the bridges.This was the evening cruise & was not able to pass the Cathedrale Notre Dame de Paris which is particularly beautiful to see at night. However the cruise team did apologise doing the best they could, & the fee charge is fair.
Good views . Went around and saw more places to visit from a different perspective. It was and relaxed and maybe next time i want to go for a cruise with a meal, call it pushing the boat out.
Beautiful. Walk along in, go on a boat trip, walk over the beautiful bridges. Especially at night it's a magical and romantic way to see Paris.

More water in there than you could shake a stick at! . We did a 1hr boat tour down the seine and had fun. You get to see lots of different buildings that are along the river and wave at everyone passing by. Good precursor for checking out some of the places later on.

Good for a walk and dont miss a cruise!. Beautiful views, anybody looking for a scenic stroll and beautiful photographs needs to look no further! You can also take a cruise down it, but be aware it gets a little cold - best to carry a jacket/shawl. You can always have a coffee later, in one of the little cafes right where the boats drop you.

So beautiful - take the bateaux to see Paris from the water!. The seine cuts through Paris and is a wonderful way to view some of the beautiful architecture of Paris from a different perspective! We took a boat dinner cruise but I have also taken brunch cruises that were just as nice! You get a different view and it is just another enchanting way to see Paris!

A River Cruise to Remember. In 2016, France had the wettest May/June in 100 years. On June 3, the Seine River peaked at 6.1 meters (20 feet), which was a 34 year high. Having arrived in Paris May 30, we couldn't help but notice that the many dinner cruise and sightseeing boats were unable to sail under any bridges: entry booths were flooded, bike racks invisible under water, and gang planks led from the boats at a very steep angle, if they hadn't been removed already.Our eight-day Paris-Paris Seine River cruise with Avalon Waterways - scheduled to begin June 7 - was also in serious jeopardy. On June 4, Avalon advised us of the situation and offered two options: a full refund, or a partial refund if we continued. Choosing to continue, we met on June 7 and they bussed us to Rouen where the ship was docked. For the next 8 days, Avalon rearranged itineraries, buses and cruise schedules to accommodate every tour normally included in the package. And for good measure, they threw in a previous extra-cost tour to Honfleur at no cost.With just about 1/2 the full passenger load, the ship (Avalon Creativity) was spotless inside and out; the crew were excellent, the food wonderful. Guides at each stop were interesting and spoke excellent English, and the buses were clean and comfortable. By June 14, the Seine had receded enough to allow us to dock in the northern part of Paris, which was as close as possible to the regular dock given the circumstances.Special accolades to the Captain and Cruise Director who worked tirelessly to keep us up-dated and provide the best experience in the safest manner. Kudos to Avalon Waterways for putting on a first-class effort to ensure a great holiday.
Beautiful, even when flooded. We saw the Seine and got to cruise on it, came back a week later and all traffic was closed and the walkways were under water - beautiful from any angle.
Take a river cruise. I have been to Paris several times and never got around to taking a river cruise. I did this time and it is a great way to see Many aspects of this great city.

Another way to see things. The water was still quite high in places and running very quickly as they had just had the bad weather the week before, it only takes a couple of minutes to cross the river over any of the numerous bridges along the Seine, we did a river cruise which was quite good you get to see the some attractions from a different view. They have many river cruises, hop on hop of boats etc.
On the river. Cruised in the daytime and also at night time. The daytime is a must so you can see where everything is. And at night time it can be romantic to view all the city lights.

Cruis'n. Did a dinner cruise, the food was incredible as the views! Romantic. Also did a day cruise to see the city sites, lots of kids, hard to hear descriptors of sites, bathrooms are horrible on day cruise.
Seine river cruise.. There are many boats available for a tour along the seine, I took a return trip, with no stops. But a hop on off boat may be better. A nice way to see paris.

Take the sunset river cruise!!. The sunset cruise was beautiful! The lights from the buildings start to come on and reflect off of the water. The eiffel tower can be seen lighting up and it is a great way to see the city. Get in line early or at least go buy the tickets! Like an hour early! If you are in line early you will get the best seat on the boat. There is no standing allowed on the boat so if you want to take pictures you have to get a good seat in the front or on the top. The sunset cruise is very popular and sells out quick!

Lovely river, goodvibes. The river is a really good to remember where you're heading or come from. If you follow the river you can walk from the 'Bastille' or the 'Notre Dame' to the 'Eifel Tower' and 'Pont des Arts' for put a locker on the bridge.

River Seine, a bit smelly, but offers great views.. For someone on a quick visit to Paris, there is no better way to see many of the main sites that Paris has to offer. If you are on a quick visit to Paris, take either a boat taxi, or book yourself a lunch or dinner cruise on the river Seine. Strolling along the river, did not offer much to my husband and I. It is a bit smelly and not very clean, though we saw many people enjoying a drink or a smoke along its banks. For us it lacked natural beauty, as everything is stone. It could use a bit more natural features (i.e. grass, flowers, etc.) to increase its appeal.

River time. This river is wet and goes through Paris. Part of me wants to see how other people 'reviewed a river' ?! In some places, its wider than in other spots. It has some stunning, historically significant bridges crossing it - although they are not strictly 'the river' so I won't let them colour this river review overly favourably. The Seine itself is a fine specimen of a river with great cultural and historical significance. It has the whole Paris thing going on, which helps.
Beautiful Scenery. The River is scenic and calm. Wonderful for families. There are many boats that will take you on a scenic cruise rain or shine.
Trip down the Seine River. Very fun and relaxing due to the heightened security and attacks on Paris during our visit. This was relaxing and fun aversion from the tension in the city.

Main river through Paris. While neat in movies and TV, in person less than spectacular. The river is a central feature of Paris, but not as clean and beautiful as it could be. The walkways ate cluttered, the graffiti is depressing and there is no way any aquatic life exists in the water. Worth one stroll, not a boat ride. Museums are better.

Lovely river. Everyone say Seine river paints Paris to be more romantic. That is true. If you would like to spent your time in Seine. I recommend to buy the ticket for 17€/day or 19€/2 days of Batobus ship. It works like bus with 9 stops. Ticket is for all day. You can use it "as much as you want" :)
Relaxing cruise in beautiful river. Took a cruise on a medium vessel. Very relaxing. Beautiful views along the way. Gorgeous river - lots of bridges, houses, rock formations, watercraft.

Bateaux Parisiens Cruise. Straight forward no hassle getting tickets, the Bateaux Parisiens Cruise was a fantastic way to relax, travel and see some of the sights of Paris.Towards the afternoon the service becomes very busy, we had to queue around 30 minutes to get on at one point.

All sorts of fabulous photo opportunities!. Both Banks of the Seine have superb opportunities for that perfect photo. From ornate bridges to water craft and magnificent buildings, it is all here. The left bank is a little scruffy at the moment but the right bank offers the famous stalls, artists, boat rides etc. As well their is Ille de la Cite to visit. It is flowing strongly at the moment due to past rain, so it is clean and fresh smelling. Take a moment to sit and watch the world go by.
Enjoyed the river cruise. A nice way to see the city without traffic. Relaxing and low key. Inside and outside seats offered. Inside offers audio commentary but outside does not
A wonderful cruise on a Dinner Boat with my Welsh Bus Tour.. Food surprisingly good and fun people to be with. The walls all along the river were silent with secrets and the bridges were exquisite.

Enjoy the Seine on a Tour Barge. A river boat ride, which is modestly priced, is an excellent way to get some different and unique views of Paris. For those with a romantic bent, you consider boarding the boat about 8 or 8:30 and enjoying the sunset and watching Paris as it lights up, including the Eiffel Tower.

What's not to love!. I've been here several times. Once, my river ship was able to dock near the Eiffel Tower & to circle the city. This time, the river was too high, due to recent floods, but that also was interesting. How many movies have been set here? One can "feel" them all when they visit.

Great hangout to experience the Parisienne way of life. You can stroll along the Seine or get yourselves a Baguette, some red wine and cheese and just "do like the Parisiennes do" and chill out by the water with or without company to feel the French vibe. You can also take a tour by boat, preferably at night. In the summer, 10:30pm is great to board, it's just starting to get dark and buildings get a glow. During the ride (one hour), Paris slowly lightens up. Magical!!

VERY NICE PICTURE OF PARIS. river seine is running throughout of paris and if you take river seine cruise,you can see the best perspective of paris of course nightseeing is very beautiful than day.many of young people are sitting around the river and the best picture of river is next to louver.
Good Cruise. Cruise on this river not only gives you a view of many monuments but also tells a lot about the city

Beautiful River. We were in Paris for 5 days and it rained virtually the whole time we were there. We kept putting off a Seine River cruise, but in the end, the Seine was closed because it was at flood level (14+ feet and rising). It's still a beautiful river to walk along and offers great views of Paris.

Pretty river but crawling with scam merchants!. The river is picturesque and some of the bridges are gorgeous. The view from the Louvre side over to the Museum is very nice. Beware the endless crowds of children/young people trying to get you to sign a 'petition' and then donate money. It's a total scam and they can get very verbal! The police don't seem able to do much as they are underage and their criminal slavemasters are nowhere to be seen. Sad all round : (

Take a cruise in the river Seine. This is a great way to see the city with so many beautiful bridges across the river. The view of a smaller version of the Statue of Liberty in the middle of the river, and that of Eiffel Tower at night were some of the highlights of the cruise. Quite enjoyed it!

If you are young have a picnic and more than a little wine at night . The thing that amazed me about the seine at night is the sheer number of young people who are hanging out with some food, more than a little wine and a blanket. Some spots are more boisterous than others: find yours! Both banks near le de la cite.
Views from above. Amazing views of the Seine and so much more from atop of the Ferris wheel near the Louve. Such a gorgeous city.

Very Relaxing . We did a River cruise, and a dinner cruise on back to back nights. We enjoyed being able to see the city and the bridges during the day and then at night also. The people relaxing on the river banks as you peacefully float by. A wonderful time.

Quite a wide river with many bridges over it. I say many bridges over it as that's about the only way to experience it whilst we were there - the whole city seemed to be along both sides of the river when we were first arriving in Paris - all watching the river rise. Hence we did not get to go for a cruise along the river, we did get some photos of the water rising

Stand on One of the Many Bridges and Just Look Around You!. Traveled here in May of 2013 and if you walk to the Seine, you can stand on any one of the bridges and just look around you and see the different architecture and at night there is nothing more grand than seeing the fantastic architecture and seeing the boats motoring down the seine. And most of them are walking distance from many of the great cafes.
A relaxing cruise.. I enjoyed the boat cruise down the river seine. Sadly it was not a nice day, but you can still enjoy the cruise and see so many places.

The Cruise at Night. On our first day at Paris, we decided to take the last cruise on the Seine. It costed us nearly 15Euros per person but it was definitely worth all the money. The Cruise leaves every 30 minutes and we took the 10:30pm cruise on a rainy night, the angry Seine throwing big waves at the cruise but one cannot have a better view of the city.

Heart of the city. I would suggest a whole morning for exploring river seine......the life line of this beautiful city.Take a river cruise. Explore all the stops. Each is unique and different. Start early in morning so that you have plenty of time to explore various sites. The beauty of the river. How it bends and flows is a reward in itself. A must see for the tourist and a fun way to explore the city.

the hart and the blood of Paris. Fascinating from all the locations and point of view, from the bateau mouche navigating on its waters and seeing the monuments from below or from the third floor of the tour Eiffel. Even more simply from the numerous and beautiful bridges or from the banks- Interesting also the line of the riverbus. Someway curious its aspects during the heavy rains of the June 2016
Wonderful place . A nice place to relax and sit back and consider the blue water that takes you to a place beyond your thoughts and imagination wonderful place to visit .

Really lovely to see the riverside by boat . The city looks beautiful from the water but for anyone wanting to travel along the Seine, I'd recommend not using the 'batobus' as Customer service is below average.

Cruise on the Seine. Paris had a lot of rain this spring/summer so the river was very high.Went on a river boat ride from Pon Neuf Bridge, the same bridge in The Bourne Identity Movie.Boat could not go towards Notre Dame due to high water but went extra long towards the Eiffel Tower.DO NOT SIT in the very front of the boat, we got splashed with water as we went under one of the bridges.
flooded. Flooding made a mess of the banks and stopped boat service for a while a water too high for boat to go under Bridges. Most up and running by end Of June

A bit Pricy but worth it (2for1 eurostar works here). As I said it was a bit Pricy but worth it (2for1 eurostar works here).It cost me one price for two for showing my eurostar tickets(finally) everywhere else french attractions simply refused it.So there are 2 types of enjoying the river Seine:1. 1 ticket 8 stops whole day or2. 1 ticket 1 hour most of the attraction from the river viewing:Warning: if you take the later evening tour be aware that you will not reach Notre Dame because of the high tides(twice daily)CONS: the speakers are bad quality -so you cannot really understand what the person talks about while you are traveling here and there, so get your GPs maps to see precisely where you are.
Great view. Very nice view. I walked an entire day, near Seine... it is beautiful. Weather was great, I felt the true Paris atmosphere - nice paintings, old books, nice people.

We are staying in an apartment close to the river.. There are so many Paris attractions close to the river that it seems you are always walking near it. Stand on one of the bridges at night is recommended.
Nice. If you are there take the boat for the river Seine. It is nice to see Paris from an another perspective

Nicely banked but very dirty. Seen lots of boats go up and down but the water itself is very polluted which downgrades it's beauty.The bridges make it even nicer and the boat cruises with dinner are nice because you experience Paris by night.

Take a night tour. We took a night tour on December 24. Dinner was great but the best part was seeing all the attractions by river. We saw all the lighted buildings, something different from walking through them during the day.

The Flood!!. During our visit to Paris, we had a chance to see the city completely shut down! The Seine flooded for the first time in centuries. No boat tours, what a historic moment to share with my daughter. It was still beautiful to see this iconic river. An experience to have for sure!!
Very nice place.. It was an amazing place and I enjoyed it, you need to go and walk around if you want to see that place in a sunny day.
Walking by the river. When you are tired of all the traffic all around It is a Great walk with lots of activities and place to snack or even boats to enjoy a drink or have lunch or dinner .

Unique!. There used to be a saying to the effect that in Paris only the river is "Seine" / sane... Few - if any - cities in the world can boast such a wonderful collection of dramatic buildings on the Left and Right Banks of the river which cuts right through the middle of the city. All architectural styles are represented and history is constantly at hand: from Notre-Dame to the Palais de Chaillot, from the Eiffel Tower to the Conciergerie. Spend a couple of hours just taking a leisurely walk along the embankments taking everything in; hop on a "bateau mouche" for a leisurely sail up- and downstream again. Why not treat yourself to a cruise and enjoy a meal at the same time - lunch or a romantic dinner? The possibilities are endless.

A must. This is really a must to visit. A river cruiser around the river will show you what Paris is about and you can choose to jump off at some points, or take the cruiser which makes a trip without jump off points.

A lovely way to spend the day, or evening.. We bought a 2 day pass on the Batobus, and thoroughly enjoyed gliding along the river. A great way to get a feel for the way local people use the Seine to socialise.

"Rain, Rain, Go Away! Come Again Another Day!". During the 3 nights I was in Paris, the River Seine was flooded, so I was not able to walk on the river side. Mother nature was not too kind to me. I still did enjoy taking a stroll. Such artistic work to view. Also I was happy about viewing the key locks! =)
boat trip on the river. We took a boat trip on the river to see the building - interesting, but definitely needs sunshine for the best experience
Five days in Paris. We cruised down the Seine River and was such a fabulous experience to see a major part of Paris through water.

Picnic over the River Seine. I did not do a boat tour, but walked up and down the river along with spending my last evening in Paris on the Pont des Arts, watching the sun set over the River Seine. It's a beautiful view and something I'll remember for a long time. I did a lot of people watching as I spend a few hours taking it all in.
Fun and interesting. You can take these as a break in a walking day, have a glass of champagne or a beer wile see the scenery and relax to decided what to do next

Cruise your way to the sights. We only had two days in Paris so taking the river boot saved us a lot of time and footwork. The sights from the river are quite stunning and you get from Notre Dame to eiffel in comfort.
The heart of Paris. The Seine is the heart of Paris. So beautiful to just wander the banks and watch the people and the sights. Would have loved to do a river boat tour but all closed as in flood.

Interesting views. Didn't go on a boat but did walk over several bridges, I can't believe how fast that current is. Just a nice spot to take pics. The bridge architecture is interesting. Worth a walk along the side walks taking in the views from different angles and locations.

Worst Flooding ever so missed out!. I happened to be there in one of Paris's worst flooding times ever so the river was almost an ocean when I was there. Dirty and filling the banks. The day I left it was almost to normal and you could tell that it was beautiful and fun for a boat ride or walk along the banks but I didn't have that luxury!

Perfect place for jogging. Theres so many things that you can do on the banks of the Seine River. My favorite one is taking a jog along its banks near the Notredame and St. Germain area. Much better than your average view from ur neighborhood gym.

A nice way to travel. We traveled by ship on the RiverSeine headed toward Normandy for two weeks. Leaving Paris for the first day or so it was pretty much tree lined banks. But soon after that it became more scenic with small towns.The locks were interesting to go thru.A nice way to travel.
Beautiful. I went on a night-time dinner cruise down the Seine. It was truly beautiful the food was amazing as was the staff on the cruise. If you're in Paris you must spend some time on this river!

Fast waters...be careful at the edge.. You can walk a fair distance along the river. At some points you can stop and eat at the cafes or other vendors along the way. There are lots of people selling cheap souvenirs or wanting to draw your caricature. There are even those that will sell you a bottle of wine or beer you can sit and drink while you watch the fast waters swirl by.There are lots of places to catch a boat ride and sail under the many beautiful bridges that span the Seine. Recommend a night cruise perhaps with dinner.

Seine River cruise . Nice cruise down the river late in the afternoon. Weather was cool and overcast. Option of indoor or outdoor seating. Was well priced for a one hour cruise. We enjoyed the views from the river and saw all the familiar famous landmarks and buildings. Great photo opportunities of Eiffel Tower. Was not crowded and we had a choice of seats. There were earphones provided for commentary in multiple languages. That was the downfall - this smarmy voiced couple commentating in the most irritating way. She was speaking as though she was the river and he was 'joking' with her - it was BAD. However I would still recommend taking the cruise - just skip the earphones!

A good way to see some parts of Paris. A cruise down River Seine is a good way to see some iconic buildings in Paris. As I was cruising during sunset, the view was especially beautiful. The boat may be a little crowded as section of it was closed due to safety issue.
river tour. a lovely way to see paris is to take the seine river tour.... take a one hour tour to see all the beauty of paris
Relaxing. Great relaxing trip up and down the Seine and you can see some great attractions and architecture whilst cruising at leisure

Nice. You gotta walk down the river or make a boat trip. :)
You'll able to see many intersting buildings or the eiffel tower.
Great tour trips.. You can find many boats who offer trips on the river along its shoreline. A convenient way to discover the bridges with their ancient statues.
Nice. A beautiful walk along the river , beautiful bridges , beautiful part of the city , recommendations for a boat ride .
Central Paris. This large river runs right through the middle of Paris. You can find your way to most major Paris attractions via the river because they either flank it or are on an island in it.
Floodwd. The river just showed off her strength by overflooding recently. Reminds everyone who still is in charge: mother nature.

SEINE yes!!! by boat Day and Night. Seine..I took the boat in the twilight and during the day..and if I go back I will take it again.. the 2nd time I took the Vedettes de Paris not Vedettes de Pont Neuf..has a more classic design and you have chairs instead of benches and the last one leaves 2330hours!!!!!!! Paris by night is impossible to describe it... a must .. and look forward to another ride...

Rivers, givers of life!. A big part of the beauty of Paris is the ever present River Seine. The light green water, the many elegant bridges across it, the streets bordering and many a thing of beauty lined along its bank like garden shops, makes the River an integral part of the city.

Another must. A boat trip along the River Seine is also something that needs to be done when visiting Paris. There are a range of options and it's probably worth doing twice. Once in the daytime and again at night. Make sure you have have warm clothing on or a coat as the wind can be very cold and you see more outside than you do sat inside.

unique and wonderful. The Seine, although muddy and swollen after the rains and flooding now, is still amazing. Walking along it and across its bridges in the middle of Paris is a treat including, for example, original sculptures in the middle of the Pont Des Arts and various attractions along the riverbanks. Great people-watching too! Don't miss it! No visit to Paris is complete without it!

nice. unfortunately when we were in the city the river was overlflowing because of the recent floods so we could not do the cruise trip on the river .... overlooking the river from a brigde gives you nice calm feeling
Wow so magic - Seine Cruise. We take this cruise first time in August 2014, on sunset and was gorgeous, so this time we take it around 15 o'clock and also this one was magical.
Worth a long walk. We walked almost 15km on our first visit of our trip. It was great to get ourselves oriented and to soak up the Parisienne atmosphere
Cruise along the Seine. Just lovely on a beautiful sunny day. On the top deck vewiing all the sights of Notre Dame, the beautiful bridges at a leisurely pace. Just missing a nice ice cream.....

Not quite as romantic as in the movies, but worth a bicycle ride along its banks.. Rather than a romantic river, the real Seine is a fast stream meandering through Paris. Best enjoyable with a bicycle tour along its banks. Beware however, the roads are plagued by motorized vehicles and full of peril..
Lovely way to see Paris. Was a great way to see the sights of paris especially with a tour guide to point out all the top attractions on route.

An evening in Paris. As you know, the beauty of Paris is added by the Seine river dividing the city in two halves. Cruise in the river especially in the evening hours when its about to get dark is the most ideal time. If you are a Paris pass holder ,this trip is included free of cost. There a guided commentary on the boat which goes under nearly 20 odd bridges . You can see most places of historic importance during the cruise which is of one hour duration. You can buy drinks and snacks on board. Also, there are boats which offer you dinner with french wine while you are seeing the beauty of the city. The start point is just 200 metres from Eiffel tower. Dont miss this unique experience while in Paris
Overflowing!. Couldn't approach it too closely since it was a roaring, muddy river. Didn't expect that in the month of May. Apparently some places saw it overflow. An unusual experience!
Big river. This is a very big river and it is full of water...which is very wet. As rivers go it's possibly the best river I have ever seen!

Nice river in the centre of Paris. The Seine is a much better city river than the Thames. This river is crossed by many beautiful bridges and has lovel walkways to enjoy the river views. Plenty of river cruises available, with barges converted to bars and restaurants available too.

River Seine. I was in Paris during the major flooding. We were not able to walk near the river because of this but still the river was very impressive. You can see the river in almost every major sight in Paris. It is incredible to look down on the river in the Eiffel Tower and also at Notre Dame. I wish we could have taken a boat tour but because of the flooding we could not. A must see in Paris!
A quiet interlude. With recent flooding, the route had to be changed but we still saw key landmarks. Unfortunately the audio part was not working properly, which was frustrating.

Beautiful . Beautiful river crossing the large city of Paris. Pretty much it pops in front of you during every ride you might be taking. You can rent a calm boat ride along Paris for a small amount of Euros. However the water is disappointingly dirty and poluted and occasionally smells bad.
Flooding. We went on a walking tour of Paris. We walked across the River Seine many time. It was quite high with a lot of debris floating in it. The next day they closed the Louvre due to flooding!

River Cruise on the Seine. Following our bike tour with the Seine river cruise was really fun seeing the landmarks from the river instead of on a bike in traffic along the streets of Paris. We already learned the history of the landmarks so we could just focus on viewing and taking photos of our subjects. There is plenty of room on the boat, it did not seem crowded, both sides of the boat get a chance to see all of the scenery. The ride is 1 hour long.

Must see. Check out the Love Lock Bridge where lovers lock a padlock with their names and throw away the Keyes.. Famous River did not disappoint. Checkout Love Lock Bridge where lovers buy locks to mark the names of their loved ones.
just walk here. It's the best way to spend a day in paris. Walking along the river. maybe buy a portrait or a door knocker, something special for your home.

If you are in Paris you should go see Seine. I walked by the river for hours, enjoying the summer day looking at the ducks, people enjoying the water. Theres a whole new world around the river, the bridges, the booksellers, the souvenir shops. Amazing!
Beautiful cruise. We had a beautiful lunch cruise on The Seine. We also had a night cruise and went past the Eiffel Towerand watched the lights sparkling. Both experiences were fabulous.

Tourist Trap, but a decent one. When we were there, it was flooded and river cruisers couldn't use it causing problems. There are some good views of Paris, but it's better to walk and see them. Still, if you're there many days, it's worth it.

AMA Waterways. We had a 7 night cruise on Seine River on MS AmaLegro scheduled from Paris and back to Paris. Flooding in Paris caused us to have bus to boat but the trip was very pleasant. Rooms are small but very clean and updated. Free Wi-Fi with computer-tv in each room. Food was fabulous. Enjoyed it all. Staff all spoke excellent English. They were all so very nice and helpful.

Lovely walk. While we didn't take a boat cruise down the river, we did walk along it for quite a way and it was lovely. Unfortunately our experience was plagued with aggressive gypsy scammers all along the river, first ones with clipboards wanting "donations" for the deaf and mute (obviously not real), and then by women offering up found "gold" rings. You'll find these people everywhere in Paris so don't let that stop you from walking down the river, just ignore them and be alert and cautious while doing so.

Romantic. One of the most romantic destinations i was a solo traveller but its highly recommended for couples , i visited in Winter any place a round with a cup of hot chocolate or red wine is so much worth it
Still quite flooded. The river was still quite flooded due to continuous rain. The color of water was dirty and water was quite smelly.
Just walk!. A wonderful place to walk along, so much to see and stop at, walk there day and night, you will always see something new.
Exceptional. This is an exceptional river that runs through the whole of Paris. To walk along the Seine is beautiful despite the weather.

Tranquility in the centre of the city. I spent many hours walking along the banks of the River Seine looking at artists at work, watching boats go up and down the river. A little piece of tranquility in the middle of a big city.

Nice view of the River Seine.. We sat and watched all the river boats go down the Seine when we visited the Tower. We were lucky we visited just before the flooding. There were some house boats moored as well.
The centre of Paris. No trip to Paris is complete without a boat trip on the Seine but try and see it differently by walking on either side. plenty of seats to just sit and watch
Must do.. This is one of the touristy things you really need to do when you visit paris, we took the 1hr boat trip was really relaxing taking in all the main attractions from the seine.

A boat ride here is needed. We took a boat ride on the Seine and liked it because you could get off anywhere, and then reboard at a later time during the day. A good way to get from one end to the other.
A lovely walk. We walked on the lower road alongside the swollen river from Bastille to the Notre Dame. A lovely walk which takes in all the interesting buildings on both sides of the Seine.

Best river cruise in a big city. You can't do better than Paris for a river cruise.
Everything is beautiful, throughout the cruise, left or right.
Paris - plage also allows you in summer for a make-believe beach experience. Swimming forbidden.

river cruise. the river cruise was a relaxing way to see River Seine. We just took our time enjoying the view and landmarks from across the river. It was quite romantic too. When we buy the big bus tour, you will pay separately for the river cruise. Depends on the time you have to stay in Paris.If you have plenty of time to stay in Paris, I recommend River cruise, if not, I highly recommend museums instead.

Plagued by Aggressive Beggars . A famous site plagued by aggressive beggars with a new line: Do you speak English? (Everyone does speak some); then pushing a clipboard and petition into your hands and demanding you sign a petition supporting the "Deaf and Mute" of Paris, then demanding a 30€ donation - while teir hands explire your pockets! My suggestion- put your hands in your pocket and drop the clipboard, say nothing, ignore them and walk on, ignore all provocations!Good luck.

Quick and easy snapshot. The bateau tour is a quick 60 minute appetiser of some areas and sights you may wish to visit in greater depth at another time. On a stormy Parisian afternoon, with the Seine breaking the banks in its flood, it's a wonderful introduction to a city that offers a lifetime of experiences.

Picnic at River Seine. Just across the street from Tuileries subway station you have several food shops where you can buy food to eat inside Tuileries Garden or, as we did, by the River Seine if you go across the Tulieries Garden and cross the street to the river side. You can find seats and enjoy a "picnic" by the river looking to the Musee d'Orsay. There's even a Cave that has cold wine/champagne and disposable flutes (Rue de Rivoli & Rue de castiglione) . Don't miss a picnic by the River Seine, it's an unforgettable experience.
Beautiful boat ride. We took an hour tour on a boat up and down this river. The architecture you see is out of this world. I mean we were oooo'ing and ahhhh'ing all over the place. Take your camera!

Not as I'd thought for walking along. Rated it poor, which might be harsh, but it didn't live up to my expectations. To be fair, it was raining, looked dirty, and I had thought access to it for walking would be easier/better. Only saw Eiffel tower section. Cross main busy road for a kind of promenade path .And from Jardins Tuileries near musee de l'orangerie where there was a very busy main road between us and the river so it was viewing only.Maybe different from other access points

Overflowing and filled to capacity. okay, this is a review about a river. It's flowing water, not exactly the most exciting thing in the world -- it doesn't provide a great meal or great entertainment, but what it did do for us because we just so happened to be there in early June was provide a great show. why, you ask? because there was so much rain leading up to our visit that the Seine was nearly filled to capacity. this allowed us as well as all the other tourists to see something that may not happen again for a very long time - and to capture it all on film (okay, not film, a memory card). to see the arches in the bridges almost fully submerged was pretty cool to see. and then to compare it to the Thames in London just a few days later, you could really appreciate just how much water was in Paris. The best part of the Seine is the bridges, the art on the Left Bank, and all of the people walking around taking in the sites. If you are visiting Paris, you definitely need to see the Seine River.

Cruise along the Seine . Best way to see most of the tourist attraction without physically visiting them is to take a cruise along this mighty river. We took a sunset cruise. There are many different ones you can do even a dinner one. As we were already on a tour we took the 9pm one just beautiful seating was great cruise was 1 hr they was food & drink on board, we really couldn't hear the commentary to well. On the way back the Eiffel Tower light up which was quite magic

Sit on a bridge or side of the river. In a busy Paris it is sometimes just nice to sit and take in the view and scenery either on or beside this river. Many locals go down in the evening with their food and wine and just sit by the river and relax. Well worth doing.

Calm waters. It helps preserve the memory of the great Paris of the '60s . It is a calm and soothing view. It is a must to go on a boat ride. Restaurants can be found right near to the boat place. Enjoy!
River Seine Cruise. Went on a beautiful evening cruise and it was amazing. Can't remember how much it costs but I would recommend this sightseeing trip to anyone visiting Paris.

The pulse of the city. Paris has some amazing buildings with fine architecture. marvelous museums, an astonishing array of good restaurants and so on, yet Paris would not be Paris without the great River Seine. I regard this river as the 'pulse' of the city - adding atmosphere with its flowing waters and bridges in all seasons and at all times of day. There are ample opportunities to boat on the river but one of the joys of traveling around the city on foot or by vehicle is seeing the wonderful bridges (over 30 of them) and river views. No two scenes are the same and the river has inspired so many writers and artists over the years. A city definitely to be recommended.
Very beautiful. The river is very beautiful and goes around the heart of paris.If you happen to be there then dont forget to take a cruise
Take The Cruise!. We took the bus tour along with the cruise and took it near sunset. It was very cold but it was well worth it!

Hop on hop off bus includes river as well. By booking the hop on hop off bus you can also include the river. It was wonderful to see the sights during the day as well as. Having a very affordable city of lights tour by taking the river bus at night as well

A world Heritage site . Wander along the river from Hotel de Ville on the right bank to Pont Akexandre III on the left bank and you will know why UNESCO stamped the vicinity of the Seine River as a landmark of mankind heritage.Do not miss the Ile St Louis and its amazing Hotels Particuliers alongside the River. Buy a sorbet at Bertillon's in the center of the island Buy second hand books at the "bouquinistes" shops alongside the river.Admire the breathtaking architecture of the Hotel de la Monnaie built under the reign of Louis VXI (Marie-Antoinettes'husband) or the Academie Française built around 1680 under the reign of Louis XIV.There is so much to say not to mention the Louvre, a palace built during 1000 years, and la gare d'Orsay, both edifices hosting astonishing museums.A foremost please do not leave a love locker on one of these beautiful bridges. It so ordinary and outdated...
A MUST IN PARIS. see it all from the Rive Seine!! day or night but we went in the daylight ! bridges and the architecture ! C'est belle City~

Bateaux Parisiens Boat Ride, May 2016. My wife and I enjoyed a 1 hour ride with the Bateaux Parisiens boat cruise company on May 7, 2016. This cruise is included when you purchase the Paris Pass Lib, which also includes unlimited rides on the underground metro system, 1 day of hop on/hop off bus touring with L'Open Bus and fast track entrance to museums.  The boat cruise was definitely a highlight of our weekend in Paris. We decided to ride on Saturday evening after visiting the Eiffel Tower. The office and boat dock for this company is located very near the Eiffel Tower, on the same side of the river.  We had good timing, as the sun was setting over the river behind us. Plenty of outdoor seating was available and we chose to sit/stand at the back of the boat to view the sunset. The ride is very smooth and pleasant.  Various tourists and locals would wave at the boat from the bridges we passed under and from the walls along the shore. Locals really enjoy their river and the shores were filled with people just hanging out...eating dinner, talking, kissing or playing music.  In my opinion, the essence of this beautiful city is well represented while cruising through the heart of town along the Seine. By just being there and being a part of it...waving back at friendly locals, watching the sunset while passing the Notre Dame Cathedral, returning to the Eiffel Tower lit up. I highly recommend it.

Any time - walk the River Seine - you know you are in Paris!. As soon as I arrive in Paris - I walk the River Seine - early morning, mid day, early evening, it is different everytime, everytieme season. I love the vendors that set up their wares - I love the busstle of people and then then absence of people. It is truly Paris as it's core and it's finest!

Flood Stage. The poor river was at flood stage when we were in Paris. Couldn't do the river cruises because you couldn't go under the bridge. No one's fault, just a freak of nature. The highest water since 1910. It was a marvel to see but very unfortunate for many reasons.

Lovely to walk along at night!. Either by boat or walking, the River Seine is best when viewing the unique bridges. It is not blue as the picture suggest but still great to walk and people watch. We did a boat ride without dinner, but could have easily dropped that from our itinerary. I like to just walk it best. Be sure to check out the bookstalls along the left bank.

Definitely a must . This was a great wee attraction. Fun to just sit back and relax while you were taken up and down the river. There's a audio you can listen to for some history on the buildings you past by. Very fascinating.

Beautiful. . We loved the River Seine and enjoyed an amazing evening cruise which was the best way to experience it. We enjoyed dinner on George V and then wandered along the river before catching a cruise boat. It's a beautiful river.

Very nice. Had a cruise down the seine courtesy of my Paris pass again! Little gem Very good way to relax and take in the sights without walking everywhere. Covers all main sights too.Photos - gives a different view/ angles of all the sights Helpful tip - Try get a good weather day as views are great when sat outside on the boat and of course don't get wet. :) Paris pass lib - available online from Paris tourists board. Red pack gets you museum passes . Train and underground pass and open top bus and river cruise. Plus selected fast pass of cue ( louvre etc)

Best way to enjoy the Seine is a night cruise. The Seine cuts through Paris and is an excellent way to see a lot of the landmarks of the city. I would suggest taking a river cruise. There are a couple of companies that offer cruises and the prices are pretty reasonable for a short cruise. We started our cruise right below the eiffel tower and took it all the way beyond Notre Dame cathedral. It was one of the highlights of our trip. Very relaxing and our 9 year old loved it. Some landmarks are hard to see because the boat may be low, but we were able to see a lot of things from the boat. Night time is the best because everything is lit up and beautiful.

Bateau Mouches...great!. Lots of fun to take a trip down the Seine...a good start to a visit to Paris as you can see many of the sights from the boat..it is relaxing and the tour guides can point some things out to you that you may not know!

Very high during our visit. We got to Paris just after the Seine had been at record levels. We were able to walk on the street level but not on the riverbanks themselves. We missed out on our evening cruise. Ah well....just something to look forward to on my next trip. :)

The River Seine. We stayed on the Ile Saint Louis, an island in the River Seine, using tripadvisor's rental website and had a wonderful time in Paris. You can't get lost in Paris if you're staying on an island in the middle of the River Seine. The Ile Saint Louis is listed as one of the best Paris walks and this small island can be covered in a very short time unless you are tempted by its Michelin rated restaurants and charming shops.

Walk the Seine and See Paris. I have been to Paris a number of times and while I enjoy walking through the neighbourhoods, nothing beats a walk along the Seine as it winds its way through the city. there are so many places you can start from and they all offer a very different, usually peaceful view of a very vibrant place.

a scenic river in the heart of Paris. Though flooded during our group tour visit to France, still can't stop capturing its scenic beauty thru' the drizzling rain drops. A cruise would have been boon, and I recommend not to miss the cruise

Beautiful River but can be a worry!. We were in Paris at the end of May/beginning of June this year when there had been much rain upcountry. The Seine rose a daunting 6.5 m above normal. All river transport was halted, several roads and metro stations were flooded, and the Louvre was closed so that staff could move artworks to higher levels. Fortunately, this happens only very rarely - the river is usually a beautiful place to walk along.
A walk to remember. The stroll along the river Seine is sure going to take you off your feet. Amongst the bucket list of todo items in Paris.

Boat trip for sure.. Get on the boat at 9pm and see paris in light (in the summer) and in dark after you return in dark and you will see how Paris is called the city of the lights after dark. Best to board at the eiffel tower for the best tours.
Paris Experience. This is all part of the Parisian experience. Just going over the many bridges gets you a little piece of what Paris is all about.
Pretty views from the river. Having recently flooded in Paris last month, several sections of the riverside path were still under water.Poor signage for cyclists and walkers.

La Seine en crue. We have experienced the peak of the river flood. It was spectacular to see the water rise to the top of the bridges arches and the water flooding the banks, engulfing trees and light posts. All activities were cancelled and every Parisian came to take pictures of this historic event!

The River Seine in the city of Paris. The River Seine flows right through the heart of beautiful Paris. The river seine has a great history and associate with the culture and artist. Tourists can enjoy dinner and lunch in cruise.

Water was high but still gorgeous!. We went about a week ago and the flooding had calmed but we still walked around it and it was beautiful! Next time for sure will do a boat tour around. Absolutely impressive!

River at the Heart of Paris. No matter how we see the River Seine, it always has the charm of Paris. The river acts many different roles from thoroughfare for cargo as well as sightseeing boats and the promenade on its banks serve as lover's parks, bike lane and other. By walking on its banks, visitor will come across variety of bridges which have its own character and being built through centuries. Spend sometime to walk the River Seine and appreciate its beauty.

Great views and a nice walk also. A walk along the Seine is a must do when visiting Paris!Along the walk you will find the Eiffel Tour, amazing bridges, The Louvre; It is a great way to navigate a day in Paris and is in itself, a great attraction.The riverboat journeys are nice and can be quite cheap or even a nice place to enjoy lunch!

River Seine During Recent Flooding. I was recently visiting Paris during the recent flooding of the River Seine. Check out the photos. Like the Eiffel tower the river Seine is viewable all through Paris. I was not able to take a boat ride on the river Seine, but I would highly recommend that you do. The pictures from the river of the many landmarks would be awesome.

Nice Scenic short cruise.. We went there before sunset. We got both sunlight view and lighting Paris view as well. It was a nice short cruise. We bought ticket with Hop on Hop off from internet and we found that this price is cheaper than on ground price. So, if possible, buy ticket before from online. We sat at the top, so we could see the city in an open eye. Again if it is too cold or raining, you can get down to the inner side box for shade.

The Seine at record highs in June...Paris was swamped. We ended three days of cycling by following the Seine on our London to Paris bike ride...however, the river was so swollen by excessive rain water that many of the roads and cycle paths were under 2-4m of water. Change of plan...we took some roads into Paris and will save the Seine tow path for another day.We did walk along the river and took into the fast flowing river...wow.
Its a beautiful experience ..River Siene. Its a must .. also try to be there when the sunsets ..the eiffel tower is amazing ..shinning goldI took the tour at 6.30pm in June 1st week.
highly recommend it!. I did a tranquil dinner cruise and it was fantastic. the views were great and the food was very good.

Nice Views!. You can't miss the river when it Paris! It follows you around the city. I personally enjoyed standing on bridges at night and watching the brightly lit boats go by. Some of the best views of the river is from behind Eiffel Tower, in front of Notra Dame and from Musee D'Orsay (across which you can see the Louvre).

Flooded for several days in late May/early June 2016.. The flood was not the highest this year but it did cause the Louvre to close a day so the workers could move art from the lower floors as a precaution against flooding. Tour boats had to stop because they could no longer pass under the bridge arches. It is so romantic to walk over one of the many bridges in Paris with the Seine flowing under you and beautiful architecture to gaze at and enjoy.

Relaxing, historic and scenic.. While visiting in May 2014 the Seine River cruise was a relaxing, scenic and historic tour of Paris and its iconic landmarks. We purchased the River cruise as a package with the hop on, hop off city bus tour, definitely recommend.

Beautiful scenic cruise. We started cruise from underneath Eiffel tower, downstream pass the Notre Dame and back up. Great timing as we started earlier but came back at dusk just as Eiffel lit sparkling. Amazing! Wanted to do the dinner on the boat but that one was sold out. Shame as it would have been extra special, although it was already.
Water Too High. River hit record high levels and closed some walkways and lower roads. River side bars and eateries got washed away. Good on the people for the quick recovery.

The more you see it the better you shall discover Paris. Each time we walked near and over the River Seine we became more understanding of its significance. Spend the time at the lock bridge to review what others have left.

Take a boat trip. In my opinion to enjoy this river, take a boat tour. You can also see all the famous landmarks from a different view. Take the trip late in the day and when the night falls, you can enjoy the best of both. Recommended.
Flooding on the Siene. June 2016. One of the most severe flooding in the last hundred years. The water level more than 6 meters above normal.

Wild "floating". We were in Paris during the floating (flood) and it was a sight to see! No bateaux mouche for us but over ten days we were able to see the water level crest and then recede to expose the riverwalks! Fascinating watching all the activity!

River Strolling. The river had been in flood so was moving very quickly during our visit. The river splits the city in half, but there is no shortage of bridges to get across. The river is bounded by roads that support secondhand book sellers and the Paris souvenir options, along with works by budding artists. Some parts have a VERY tourist feel while other areas eek of the Paris of old, with vendors sitting reading their books and not a care in the world.
Floods. The floods prevented us from going on a boat trip a week or so ago and they were pretty sensational.

Can't Miss It. Seems a little silly to have a review of the River Seine. You can't avoid it in Paris. It is a beautiful river and you will get a chance to see it from multiple angles as you make your way throughout Paris. The view I would recommend is from the Pont Neuf which connects Paris to the Ile de la Cite (where Notre Dame is). There are plenty of river boat tours all along the River as well.

The best show in town. The river is not the main attraction but what happens over it on the many bridges (all beautiful and historic), along it on the levees and banks (dancers, lovers, loungers), and on it (with boat rides and sight seeing). Of course, just watching the waters roll by can also be a nice respite!

Even at flood levels, she's beautiful!. We visited Paris at the end of May, after the highest rain levels in recorded history since 1910, and still she was a gorgeous sight! Flanked by some of the most incredible architecture, any river cruise through the city would certainly be worth the time and € spent. Since her levels were so high, we could not enjoy a river cruise on this trip, but I certainly will plan on one next time!!
Got to see the Seine at it's peak. No boat rides this trip. The Seine was flooded. It was at it's highest level since the 90's and almost historic levels. Fortunately little damage in Paris.

Flooded over 18 feet over banks. Our luxury barge trip was suppose to terminate by the Eifell Tower but all locks were closed due to flooding so we could not get that far by boat. The river attracts many viewers esp when it was so flooded. UNfortunately it is very dirty and all kinds of debris can be seen, An effirt should be made to clean it up.
Great walk . Great to just wonder down the river, so many interesting things to see. It was a great way to get between attractions. Very relaxing

Seine at Twilight. After dinner at Eiffel Tower, took a Seine cruise and what a wonderful experience this was, seeing the great beauty of Paris from the river, seeing the many people enjoying life on the banks and the history of this Paris city everywhere I looked.

Flooded . It was still interesting to see the sights along the river and compare the old pictures with the flooded river now. Tons of tourists taking pictures of the high waters and the lower streets and sidewalks under water.

Make sure you do the Bateau Mouche. I have been on the river several times. It's really one of the best experiences of Paris. This time we had a nice meal on the boat which was nicely done. I would also recommend in the evening because the lighting is lovely

walk all day. Walking along the Seine is a great way to spend time in Paris. Shops, cafes, workout areas, art displays and so many other things dot the riverbank, and other main attractions are located very close by.
Paris trip. River is beautiful in the night. The cruises were lit up and the lights reflecting off the waters were magnificent.

One hour cruise on the river worth doing. We took the boat from by the Eiffel Tower and did a one hour round trip. We opted to sit outside on top which meant there was no commentary, this was available via headsets below in many languages. We saw all the major sights possible from the river. Cost about 15 euros each, half price for children.

Seine River Cruise . We did the Seine River Cruise while in Paris a very pleasant experience and perfect way to see Paris historical buildings and churches. You can get on the ferry at the jetty near the Eiffel Tower cost 15 euros p/p great way to take photos of the building, churchs, and the many bridges you go under. If possible take the cruse in the day time and then take the same cruse at night for some excellent photos of the building lite up by lightning but take a jumper or jacket as it gets cold, also take a walk along the Seine as well by doing both you see a lot of Paris.

Enchanting River Seine!. As always, the River Seine is a fascinating experience, just sitting by the river or walking along the river and watching Paris life go by. Previously, we had a lovely apartment which overlooked the river. We loved sitting at the window with a glass of wine and watch the river boats glide by. The river has a special attraction at night as well. This time (last month) we did a River Seine luxury cruise which took us from Paris through Rouen, Giverny, almost all the way to the estuary on the Normandy coast. Beautiful and enriching experience.

You can't miss this if you are in Paris.It is right in front of you.. Fabulous river,best seen by bateau much at twilight. In summer months,the banks are filled with sand brought in and makeshift clubs pop up . The natives call it Miami Beach in summer

Wonderful hop on/off boating transport. The views from the River Seine are outstanding and the hop on/off public transport boats were easily accessible and were reasonably priced. The boats stop at the tourist attraction and run regularly around 25 minute intervals. A great way to see inner Paris.

The most romantic river walk in the world. A walk along the Seine on a pleasant day or evening is a joy. The live-in barges, young people chatting, and views of lovely homes, medieval bridges with remarkable sculpture are all there for free. It will draw you back day after day.

So Very Parisian. The Seine is one of the loved rivers in France. It plays a prominent roll in the life of Parisians. Unfortunately, the recent rains shut down all the river boats while we were in Paris. We did spend an hour just walking next to the river as there are nice benches and grassy areas to relax.
It mesmerizes.. The Seine is like a Frenchman, to me. It's reserved, it's stately, it's gentile, it's in no rush. Then a barge barges under the bridge, on its way to work.

A key part of Paris' beauty. Paris is a stunning city - a wealth of things to do and see that would take a visitor many weeks to explore with any depth. But one of the key components of the city's beauty is the Seine. Bisecting the city, many of the kettractions are located on or near the riverbank - the Eiffel tower, The Louvre, The Orsay, Notre Dame, etc. The river is alive and active with a constant stream of barges and tour boats. My wife and i love walks along the river and have walked from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame on many occasions - with historic bridges, fabulous architecture and a constant flow of tourists, there is always something to see.Be sure to make time to take a cruise (or two) on the river - the scenery is stunning during the day - and takes on a completely different look at night when the sun sets and the city lights up.Don't miss it!

Boat ride on River Seine. It isn't surprising why so many of Paris attractions are along this river. The boat ride we took was from Eiffel tower and was a pleasant experience - a walk down the history lane. Worth it!

When in Rome, I mean Paris.... We took a boat tour of the River Seine and it was fantastic. We had great weather and the company we used, Bateaux Mouches, was excellent. Some may say that's the company "all the tourists" use. Well, we WERE tourists and it was great! Such a perfect way to see a LOT of Paris and get your bearings on where everything is for your visit.

Flood time. We arrived the evening of the highest level for the river flood tide. The bridges and river banks were packed with people taking pictures. Despite the high tide, it is always a pleasure to walk along the Seine, up to the Eiffel Tower, or down river near the Louvre and the bridges to Notre Dame.

Boat trip a must. Fortunately we were able to do a boat trip just before the rains came which closed the river due to flooding. We did an afternoon/evening trip which was great. Nice way to see another part of paris. Well worth it.

a great river tour. Took a river cruise from a jetty near the Eiffel tower, it took you under all 28 bridges on the Seine, music and commentary in perfect English accompanied the cruise, it lasted an hour and it was sunny and we had fun waving to other visitors on the bridges we went under, well worth the 15 euros.

A must do while in paris. If you are in Paris you can not miss the Seine. Taking a bateau mouche, or picnic on the Berges on the left bank, the river Seine allows you to enjoy some of the best views of the city

Avalon waterways is fabulous. The real test of any service provider is not just how they do in the best of conditions (which in this case was superb) but also how they handle unforeseen situations. We were on our cruise of the Seine River during the flooding this past week and had to leave the ship 2 days early. Avalon put all guests up in a fabulous hotel, Le Collectioneur, provided meals -- even giving us lunch money because the hotel didn't serve lunch, comped several optional tours, and on top of this gave us a 50% refund for the two nights. The cruise director was with us the entire time. They had us all checked in when we arrived and made the two days absolutely pleasurable. The ship, Tapestry II, was beautiful beyond expectations. Cabins were beautifully appointed, large, immaculate and the toiletries were first rate. The staff couldn't have been more courteous or efficient, tours were excellent with superb guides, and food was surprisingly good and consistent. I highly recommend Avalon for your next river cruise.

The heart of Paris. You just have to travel on the Seine some way , this time I used the Bateau Bus which travelled the length of the Seine in the city stopping at the major sights ,Make sure you read the timetable as it is a circle ..I got a 2 day pass with the Hop On Hop Off bus as well for 49 euro ..have done a night tour before on a cruise ship ...a bit of a tourist trap but still a once in a time experience . A great way to see Paris and the Eiffel Tower

Not much to see... Considering we came during the floods, there wasn't much to see down this half flooded Blvd.While we left hungry, we did see someone's bike that got trapped and a kid that almost fell in; now that's entertainment!
The most spectacular of boat trips.... Try to take an evening cruise to see all the lights. It's the best way to see the iconic waterway. And don't miss the houseboats.
worth a cruise. purchased the cruise with hop on hop off and is very nice, to see a different view from the river, is cheap and nice
Date Night. Taking a bottle of wine and a baguette down to the river before dinner every night was my favorite part of my trip to Paris.
Flooded. Nothing much to say, there was flooding so most of the streets near the river were under water. Fairly dirty water too
Dining in the Seine. We had a Dining evening on the Seine! Just such a wonderful experience. Love that we saw so much of Paris in just 2-3 hours!! A must activity....

Rising waters!. No river traffic this week as rains gave way to floods! We managed to catch the Fat Tire evening bike /boat tour just before the worst of the rain. Unity was a great guide and the tour was a wonderful evening experience!

Very relaxing boat ride. Get on any of the open air boats that will take you along the river and give you a view of the famous monuments like Eiffel tower and Louvre museum. Take photographs from the boat with the monuments in the backdrop. The photos come out to be really good.Have fun watching all the different bridges as you pass under them and wave to the crowds on top of them. Have fun waving to the crowds seated on the river bank and also get to admire the beautiful buildings along the river.Must do activity while in Paris. The boats have food and drinks you can buy too.

River in flood. The River Seine offers a lot of businesses income and it was both disappointing and fascinating to see it in flood. The low lying pathways that follow the River couldn't be seen and the restaurant boats that are moored to these paths looked as though they were in the middle of the River. Very strange.

Great sight. The Seine River runs through the heart of Paris. It would be a great experience if you get the chance to take a walk/run by it. There are many restaurants next to it with sunsets that are beautiful.

History of it all was ok but the cruise itself was 5star. We booked lunch on cruise with bateaux parisien cruise on wowcher for two. A day trip to Paris for my husband's 40th birthday surprise lunch. The cruise was amazing. The food was so delicious and lots of it. Drinks kept flowing. The waiters worked tirelessly and were very attentive to detail. Even the man in charge of the coats in the cloakroom was very polite and all smiles. Will definitely go back.Oh and hubby was well impressed too.
Hard to Miss in Paris. The River Seine dominates and divides Paris. Walking along the river is a great experience and free. There are also numerous riverboat ride options if you wish.

Do miss taking a trip up and down the Seine River!. We had this on our bucket list to do on our Paris trip. We were not disappointed and will definitely do it again during the evening. Although it was a cool, somewhat rainy day it was
wonderful to see all the various monuments and extraordinary architectural buildings from the boat. Great visual perspective to enjoy this amazingly beautiful city.

Magical Even at Flood Stage. With water levels way above normal in early June 2016, the Seine attracted many amazed onlookers.
A tall ship moored in the river gave the illusion of being a ghost ship underway.

Walking to Seine. We were here for a week of the worst rain they've had in 16 years where the louvre was shut down remove art from the bottom levels and the Seine was full full tide it was truly amazing to see how high it is however it hasn't stopped us from doing any thing during our stay.

Not like on the photos. The river Seine is brown, not blue, it's not like on photos, it's choppy, full of tourist boats, the walk ways are all broken concrete, old and need of repair, nothing like the romantic way it is portrayed in movies.

Nice way to spend an hour or so. We had not been able to do a cruise on our visit before due to floods and lucky it was this month as a week later - floods again! It was just a sightseeing cruise but we saw Paris from another perspective and the commentary was informative and we were able to take a lot more interest photos.

Boat tour of the Seine quite interesting.. We took a boat tour and found that we saw most of what we wanted to see from the outside. The bridges, I believe there are 37 of them were quite interesting.

No need to take the River Cruise!. There are so many restaurants along the river and very neat atmosphere. You can take the river in at your own pace as well as still have the ability to be on the river with the numerous restaurants that you can eat at along the river.

Sail through the history. We took a one hour cruise which took us through River Seine. The river is calm surrounded by chestnut trees on both sides, walkways and gardens. It is really beautiful and one gets to see all the historical buildings and churches while sailing through. Everytime you cross a bridge, there are people waving hands at you and children screaming with happiness. A nice experience overall and you can cover so much of Paris in no time.

Trip on the Seine. We took a tourist boat trip on the seine from opposite the Eiffel Tower. This was lovely as lots of interesting landmarks were highlighted on the commentary. Also as it was our wedding anniversary going under the 'kissing bridge' made it romantic as well ! There are lots of nice cafes along the banks of the seine where you can enjoy a coffee or lunch and take in the Parisian atmosphere!It is easy to get to the Seine on the metro which is a cost -effective way to get around in Paris we found.

See the Sites from the Water. This was our first visit to Paris. We did a lunch cruise on the Seine River. It was a romantic meal while we leisurely glided by the sights. Starting from near the foot of the Eiffel Tower we passed under the Pont Alexandre II and by the Louvre and Notre Dame Cathedral. From the river you get a magnificent view of the back of the cathedral with the flying buttresses. Turning around at the National Library we sail back up watching the people enjoy the warm afternoon sun. The cruise took us up and around the Statue of Liberty so that both sides of the boat could take pictures.

Great Way to Get an Overview of Paris. We took the Seine River Cruise with a company called Vedettes Du Pont Neuf - they were pretty reasonably priced if you buy online. It was a 1 hour boat ride. We enjoyed it very much. You can sit outside - sit close to the heater (on the right side of the back of the boat) - so you can stay warm. Do wear something warm - since when the boat goes, it gets breezy. The views were nice - we took it around 9:00 pm so we got the twilight hour which was great for taking pictures. You get a nice overview of all the main sites of Paris. It is romantic and sweet.
Loved the boat ride.... Great!. A nice clean blue River.... nice views. We took a boat ride and just loved it....Nice experience....

Great River cruise. We took an evening river cruise of swine our first night in Paris. Was great orientation to city. It was cool but we thoroughly enjoyed it. Price was quite reasonable and cruise was about an hour in length. Was so near to see all the locals on the river banks enjoying music and wine!!

Interesting but not all that Picturesque. While the Seine is certainly interesting to look at from other tall buildings near by, it is not all that interesting from street level. It is blocked off in many spots and the streets are so crowded that it is hard to get close. I would recommend a boat cruise if you really want the best views of this famous river.

Take a river tour, well worth the time especially at the end of a long day of walking. Walking along the river is lots of fun and free, but you should also catch one of the river barges right on the river next to the Eiffel Tower, plenty to choose from and all pretty much the same price. I suggest you spend a day or two walking along the river banks, perhaps one of the good walking tours, and seeing the Cathedral de Notre Dame. Then as dusk starts to set head down to the river and catch a tour as it starts to get dark. The Eiffel Tower gets lit up as do all the bridges and buildings and the the tour really becomes magical. If you want to hear lots of interesting facts then make sure you are inside (some boats only have speakers on the inside) but the best view our outside on top deck. The trip is a great way to rest from a long day of walking about, then it's off to dinner!

Do a day on the river Seine and the see the sites better!. We did the Hop On Hop Off Seine River bato boat for the day. It was great do to being able to stop at 9 different place but to get off and to walk to the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Arc de triomphe, and many other sites while seeing the sites from the river during the day or night too!

Spectacular! . This cruise is a definite must! The amazing sights are much more impacting on the cruise. You have the option to sit in the boat and listen to a tour guide in your language on a receiver or sit on top and just relish the views! We sat on top! I would do this tour every time I come to Paris!
Lovely - take a boat trip. Always impressive and a thoroughly pleasant way to see some sights and learn information about the history of the city.

Take a ride along the river. We booked the Viator Hop On Hop Off Seine River for two days. Due to a flight delay we missed our first day. The ticket operator called Viator and was able to change our dates so we received the full two days. Very helpful and nice gesture. It was great to walk to the Eiffel Tower and then Hop On and cruise up the Seine seeing the sights from the river view. It was great to see people waiving from the cross bridges and other boats as we cruised along the river. When you are tired of walking this is a great alternative.

Take a stroll ... from anywhere to anywhere on the Seine.. So just walk it ... visit all the little vendors on the sides, keep peeking over the edges, cross each bridge just to get to the other side. It can take hours but will be just an amazing stroll through Paris. You will get to see nearly all of the great attractions as they are all close, plus in between you will actually get a chance to see the real city and it's citizens.
Great place to run. running and walking tracks on each side with few interruptions, and some parks and exercise equipment here and there.

River Seine. The river Seine meanders its way through Paris. Indeed many areas are identified as left bank or right bank. It is straddled by a myriad of bridges including Pont neuf, Pont d'alma etc.A boat trip on the Seine is a must as you can view many of Paris' attractions from the river. As well as the tourist boats there are river buses which are hop on hop off affording an opportunity to visit sights of interest.Evening cruises are also available, with or without food and these can be quite romantic.All in all this is a great way to get an appreciation of the sights you can later visit in more detail

Took a river cruse. We were given a great lecture on the history of the buildings along the river and had a lot of fun. The bridges you travel under are carved and I highly recommend you look up the history of the architecture.
river cruise. a nice break from walking all over Paris. cost about 17 euros p/p. u can stay on all day or get off and reboard later that day. no bathroom facilities.

wow. Totally worth taking the time to do a river cruise of some sort when you are there. Interesting to hear about the different sights but also enjoyed viewing the many people that are on the banks of the river, picnicking, dancing.

River of Romance and Poetry, Seine !. The water below the Bridge over River Seine might not serene and blue, the slow silky flowing water is the awakening of the sense of endless romance and poetry. Feel the love in the air and nourish one's existence:from the river of civilisation, the river of Paris !

She gave birth to Paris.... It is clear that Paris owes Seine all it has today, as the place survived and grew up as an important religious place,a trade point between England and Europe. Should there be no natural protection against enemies in the face of the river, there would never be the Isle of Cite, the religious treasuries and the capital of France as we know it currently. Because of the river the city has the bridge of Alexander the Third and several others,, that always please your eye. The river itself in May was of the greenish-dirty colour, leaving no special impressions as it is.
ITs Paris!!!. of course you have to float down the River Seine...its Paris...home of all things romantic. Take an evening cruise with someone you can't wait to kiss

mesmerising beauty. The boat tours on River Seine are a must and no one should miss that for anything if they are in Paris. They operate till late so you can spend you day looking out other monuments and then just sit & relax enjoying Parisian architecture in River Seine Cruises
Beautiful River for the cruise. Very Beautiful River, to cruise and see Paris. Pretty much all the amazing sights were close to the river.

A good way to view important sights. A trip down the Seine is a must. Often this comes free with other booked attractions as it was with us. Informative guide through a translated recording if you want it. Took about an hour and the boats go every half an hour from in front of the Eiffel Tower. Nice and relaxing way to see many of the important buildings that line the river. Good with kids too.
