Filled with romance. The Seine, with its banks and bridges is a central part of French life. Couples have declared their love for each other here for centuries and it's easy to see why. We took a dinner cruise to see the sights and it was alive with Parisians young and old having picnics, dancing and generally celebrating life along this beautiful river. Make sure you take some kind of cruise to really experience the river Seine.

Not So Much the Seine but the Banks of.... Surrounded by glory the river its self is the artery of all that typifies Paris every side of the banks and all it encloses is wonderful including the pontes and buildings on either side. Left or right bank a stroll along the Seine is truly remarkable - wonderful stalls and vintage booksellers, artists and the occasional busker!

Historic river. The River Seine runs through Paris with a fairly strong current and splits apart a couple times. Nice walking paths to walk on next to it with many places to stop and relax. Consider a dinner or lunch cruise on the many long flat almost luxury barge like boats that fit under the frequent bridges in Paris. At one point you can see a small version of the Statue of Liberty on one of the bridge structures.

The Center of the City. Everything in Paris seems to gravitate to this historic river as it meanders through the center of the city. It draws crowds to its shores, to its many historic bridges (or ponts) with their individual art pieces. We saw it on walking tours, on hop-on buses, on river cruises, and just about any time we left our rental apartment. Paris has cultivated this natural wonder and taken advantage of all its splendor, and visitors and Parisians alike enjoy it daily.

A cruise on the Seine is a lifetime experience. A 1hr cruise on the Seine gives a panorama of the most celebrated places of Paris and of the Ile -de- la-cite. With passage under each bridge, a new landscape of history and heritage unfolds on both sides. The cruise has a long lasting effect on the viewer. A walk along the Seine is equally important for the explorer. Finally, standing on a bridge and appreciating life around the Seine is rewarding.
Dinner cruise - nice respite. . We had already been in Paris for a week when we took a dinner cruise. It was nice but I would recommend doing this earlier in the trip.

A River Cruise up the Seine. We went on a river cruise up the River Seine during our visit to Paris and glad we did as we thoroughly enjoyed it. It was good to see the landmarks from a different perspective and it seemed all the bridges we passed under had some lavish architecture built into them. Overall, the cruise took about an hour and when we travelled back, we took a different 'fork in the river" so we're able to view Notre Dame from both sides. I would have no hesitation in recommending a river cruise.
Amazing views of the city!. I came here to go on a river cruise on a Tuesday evening with my friends. The things around the city that you get to see while on it is amazing and deffinetly worth doing.

Nature walks. Along this river with the cobbled stone paths and the classic architecture along its route makes this a fun experience. No matter what district u r in, walking along the river u get to see a diff Paris each time.

Boat trip. On Sunday we enjoyed a lovely relaxing trip with guide on the river up to the Eiffel tower and back up river to the Notre dam. It was a fair day and the guide was most informative. Very enjoyable.

Best part of our trip to Paris. We enjoyed this part of Paris because it was relaxing and informative as well. No long lines, very reasonable are the various boat tours. Just walking along the banks of the river checking out all the picinicers is allot of fun.

Night river cruise and dinner on the bank of the river. Taking a dinner on the river bank, like the french do, is awesome. And by dinner I mean champagne, grapes, cheese and pate bought from the supermarket. Was the highlight of our trip! A very romantic experience. Also we took a night river cruise from Pont Neuf (21:30 hours) at 14 E/person and it was totally worth it. The views of Paris from the water as it is lighted up are something to remember all your life, especially the Notre Dame area and off course the Eiffel Tower. Just walking besides the river is relaxing and romantic and quieter than walking on the crowded noisy boulevards.

Beautiful walk . I started out on on the right bank opposite the Eiffel Tower. I took some pictures in a few places and then crossed over to the left bank. Long lineups at 10:30! Glad that I have been before. I then continued my walk along the left bank to Pont Alexandra III but stoped on the way to view the barge gardens of the Seine - innovative idea! More pictures in that area on both banks. I then followed the right bank but diverted at time into the gardens of the Tulleries and the Louvre. I finished my walk by looping over the Pont D'Arts to the left bank and then back over to Ile de la Citie. At which point it started to rain so time for a late lunch - about 11km.
GOOD BUSINESS JOURNEY END. We participate in a Summit Conference (Footwear CAD / PDM). In the afternoon, at the end we did the Sena travel
River Cruise. If you have the time take a river cruise to get a different perspective of the city of light. Great photo opps and a history lesson as well. You just can't beat it!!

Great Boat Ride Opportunity to see Many Historical & Unique Sites. Took a river boat cruise on the River Seine and it was quite delightful. There are many historical buildings, churches and unique structures to see (bridges of all shapes and sizes. Bring your camera and your excitement. You will need them.Dr. Marc, PS 63:7NOTE: Take time to read the other reviews that I’ve posted on TripAdvisor on Paris sites: Eiffel Tower, Notre-Dame, St, Etienne-Du-Monty, St. Sulpice Church, Au Petit Café, Le Buci Café & Bar, Saint Chappelle, Trocadero, and the Gardens of Luxembourg

For lovers all ages. Impossible walking along the river and not getting enchanted with its magic appeal. The river, the bridges crossing over, the palaces, cathedrals, museums along side, all unforgattable

Take A River Cruise. Besides being able to sit for a short time, Paris is beautiful from the Seine. We took a normal river taxi that was cheap and covered all the important sights and you can get off and back on as you wish.

Picnicing in Paris is an Art Form. A wonderful spot to sit, relax, enjoy a picnic and people watch. By 5 pm the river walk area is filled with locals sitting by the river with their families, friends, and lovers with of course a bottle (or two) of delicious French Wine to go with their pate & cheese. Plus you've got the runners, the skateboarders, bike riders and children playing everywhere. To top it off....it's free.. A must do! Paris in Spring Time....how can you not enjoy yourself.
Boat Tour was Beautiful. Booked a boat tour with my friends and family which was one of the highlights of the trip. However it was quite expensive and packed with overly enthusiastic tourists.
This is a beautiful river passing through Paris. River Seine gives the city of Paris it's character. It is clean and has numerous bridges across it. They also have a river cruise which is recommended
Unmissable Landmark. Most of the iconic landmarks in Paris (including the Eiffel Tower and Musee D'Orsay) are to be found along the banks of the river. Take a river cruise to experience it best.
Cruise on the river at night . Beautiful views we did a cruise on the river which started at the Eiffel Tower and went past most of the main tourist attractions , a good quick way to see Paris

Lifeline of Paris. I think not Eiffel Tower but River Seine is the most enjoyable, romantic, sportic, social and adventures point of Paris. I loved it! We walked under the shade of trees and had a breakfast picnic on the river banks. Last confrontation of the two main characters (Valjean and Javert) in Victor Hugo's Les Miserables vividly comes to imagination...River Seine would be my main reason in wanting to live in Paris.

Relaxing and beautiful views. I have visited the River Seine many times and have always enjoyed the sheer beauty of it. Some on here have commented that it is dirty. I have never seen that ever. Aboat trip is the perfect way to see some interesting views of Paris.

What can you say? It's a river. But.... Don't even think of taking a dinner cruise. The prices are outrageous, the food is not terrible but certainly not up to Paris standards, and the service is, in a word, snotty. Take a day cruise or go for one of the evening cruises with boats that light up the building along the banks. They're worth every penny.

Seine River Batobus. Totally worth the price of admission. Add the 2nd consecutive day for 2 euros. You will not be disappointed. We were able to get on and off at will, over the course of 2 days. It was a great way to see what there was to see, and to decide where you wanted to hop off or on. The trip itself is relaxing and informative.

A great way to see different Paris neighbourhoods.. There are many different ways to meander along the Seine. You can walk from the 16th arrondisement all the way to the Eiffel Tower. You can walk along the Seine to get to Shakespeare and Co. Bookstore and new cafe. You can walk along the Seine to get to Notre Dame - just pick a point on the Metro that follows the Seine and start walking - if you walk along the Seine beginning from Gare d'Austerlitz ( line 10) you'll happen upon lovely garden spaces to enjoy. You cannot come to Paris and not walk along the river Seine
Very different view of Paris. We had a river cruise with Bateaux Parisiens and it was an enjoyable hour which provided a very different aspect of Paris.
Beautiful for a stroll. There is a lovely section of the Seine which passes by the Notre Dame Cathedral on the south side. Great views, and wonderful photo opportunities.

Heart of the City. I could stroll the banks of the river for two or three days and love every second because there is something new at every turn. This is the heart of the city and tour boats are a constant presence, as are people longing on grassy areas along the banks or strolling the sidewalks to view the wares of the booksellers. If you want to truly FEEL Paris, spend time by the river in each arrondissement and just take in the sights, sounds, and scents.Practically, this is also a great way to orient yourself in a big city where it would be easy to get lost. Then again, getting lost may not be such a bad thing!

Not Pretty. If you're looking for a clean, pristine river, don't come here. I've gone during different times of the year and the river is always green/brown and muddy. You can't see into the water at all. I love Paris and I love walking along the Seine, but go somewhere else if you're looking for a beautiful river.

Romantic walk .. Or luxury cruise dinner. Along side the river numerous places to hang around ... River passes just below the Eiffel that gives perfect view ... Different cruise offers different packages , worth spending time and money ...!!!!Perfect location to hold your partners hand and just stroll ..

So Many Sights. We both walked and cruised the River Seine on our recent visit to Paris. The walking part began at the Eiffel Tower and took us well past the Louvre as we strolled for over 3 hours admiring the many sights along the Seine. We also did a river cruise on the Seine and saw the Eiffel Tower "sparkling" light show at 10PM. There is a whole community of people living on houseboats, boats serving as restaurants and what looked like B&B's too. The many locks on the river were a surprise but fun to experience just the same.

Serene. I saw the River Seine on a boat cruise, the batobus and just walking in Paris. I found it very peaceful on the boat cruise moving along the river and it gave a new perspective on all of the buildings. The river is a pretty significant in Paris and taking a look at it is well worth it.

it makes a difference !. Just imagine paris without this beautiful river ... it would not be the same ... crossing over to rive gauche and back use different bridges as every one offers different sights ... just beautiful !
Batobus is a great way to see the River Seine. We jumped on and off the river all day long with a Batobus pass - sailing right by the Eiffel Tower in itself is worth the ride!
Mesmerising. The most scenic, inspiring, beautiful sites in the world, not least due to the beautiful Parisian architecture! One of the reasons I wish to return to this city.
Every time a good place to walk. I was walking from the Eiffel Tower to the Musee du Louvre along the river. It was very good to see a lot of attractions.

Nice for a walk but, watch out for gypsies. On a quick trip my husband and I took a long walk from the Eiffel Tower to the Tuileries gardens walking along the promenade near the Seine river. We were just enjoying being together in Paris. Watch out for little old ladies trying to give you a gold ring they claim to have found on the ground. They are trying to con you into some major trouble with law enforcement. They want you to give them euros for finding the ring. Do not let them near you! My husband knew about this con and quickly pulled me out of their reach. Do not let them near you. It was a beautiful day for a walk too bad for Parisians that they have to deal with this in such a beautiful location.

River cruise is the attraction which you have to add to your list!. Spectacullar Views, especially at night, all the banks and its buildings are clearly visible due to the massive reflectors from the boat! It is so nice to seat and watch busy Paris around you.Fantastic view of Eiffel Tower from the cruise in the night, it looks like covered in glitter!!!
Great scenic tour. Went on boat tour. Good tour to view Eiffel Tower from a distance to get full nice view. Worth going. No toilets on the boats, better go prepared. Preferred on sunny days.

Seine River Tour. We had the most enjoyable dinner and tour while riding down the Seine (and I'm not a water person at all). We met interesting people from Australia. We passed a lot of interesting places, the food and drinks were good.
Beautiful every step of the way. Lovely walk along the river that goes though the city. I recommend a stroll in the evening. Get yourself a bottle of wine and a baguette and enjoy.

Just beautiful!. I have a picture in my living room of the Eiffel Tower in the background of the Seine and I searched and was able to find where my picture was taken. We did a Seine riverboat cruise and it was fascinating! All the history and all the people who had been at the same place in a different time just filled my mind. As soon as it became dusk and all the lights of the city started coming on it was a different story. The city came to life and all of these exquisite building that have been there centuries became alive with excitement of what the night had to offer! Getting to see the Eiffel Tower from the Seine was quite the experience and a must see!

A good way to get another perspective of the City. You'll find a variety of options for the brief river cruises. Dinner cruises, narrated and bare bones excursions, trips with (annoying to most) flood lights for after dusk trips. Be aware, the trips are not all pretty much the same. We were expecting to have a narrated trip pointing out the major landmarks and offering some other local knowledge - we were disappointed. The company we chose also inexplicably closed the upper observation deck to passengers under the premise that the river level made that an unsafe seating area; this despite other boats with higher profiles safely accommodating their guests topside. I'd suggest avoiding Bateaux Parisiens, located just to the east of the Eiffel Tower on the south (left) bank. There are better options for you.

Beautiful view and brief introduction to the city!. we took a tour in the morning. It was perfect weather, no line we cruise a river for 1.5-2 hour. It was perfect for getting to now short history of the city and where everything is located. I took tons of pictures...you will get one of the best view of Eiffel Tower and Notre dam Cathedral. Totally worth it.

Wonderful river walk!. It is always fun to stroll along the Seine with the lovely tree lined boulevards. It is fun to look at all the houseboats moored alongside. Watch out though, especially around the crowded tourist areas near the Eiffel Tower- a pickpocket came very close to getting my husband's wallet.

Cleaner banks than you'd expect!. My wife and I went to Paris in May, it was a little rainy during this time, but really, Paris as a whole was quite clean, which included the beautifully set River Seine. You can tell that the City of Paris has spent a lot of time making this river attractive again with new business and new park like facilities throughout the rivers stretch. Can't miss it!

If you have energy walk!. We walked by the river starting from Eiffel Tower to Cite Island. It was a nice view and we got to see and stop by at some must see places. We went off the route by visiting St Germain (you must do so too), then went back on the track. It's a nice walk if you have the chance. Stop by at Ponte Alexandre III, Ponte Arts was under construction when we went there.

Beautiful waterfront. We talked along the River Seine while in Paris. It was pretty to see the fantastic architecture and watching all the tour boats. We spend time just sitting on a step and enjoying the surroundings. In some areas, there are a bunch of boats tied up and they look like boats that people live on. Also there are a bunch of working boats and barges tied up. We took one of the boat tours of the waterfront and it was a nice 1 hour excursion. During the day we felt safe and I cannot comment on safety at night.

INTERESTING CRUISE ON THE RIVER SEINE. Like any other river or canal cruises in Europe, the river seine is best seen from a boat cruise. An hour of sailing on the river boats taking you under the bridges and seeing the life style of Paris is a wonderful way to explore this beautiful city. Fun to be on the boat and sail down the Seine.
Great picnics. We had a couple of picnics next to the seine near to Notre Dame in early may when it was sunny and about 25c. very peaceful and scenic part of our holiday

Leisurely boat trip. Lovely way to relax and give our feet a rest on what turned out to be a wet afternoon. Seeing all the landmarks of Paris from a different perspective and sheltering from the rain proved to be a winning combination .An enjoyable experience.

A beautiful scene from atop the Eiffel. I saw this from atop the Eiffel during the day as well as the night. I must say it is so beautiful as it is illuminated and is indeed something my lens need to capture.

In-sein. Paris is so amazingly beautiful. It seems appropriate to begin my tripadvisor adventure here. One thing that you should understand about this city is that it was levelled at one point and then rebuilt to be aesthetically pleasing. Before that the place was a mess, streets had no layout and were generally just going here and there after the middle ages. After they revamped it it became one of the most beautiful cities to behold in the world. And I think the best place to start is on the river. We took a boat cruise along the river and there were audio guides for us to listen to but for the life of me I can't find the company that ran it. But there were other boats so I think you can just go along and join them spontaneously.

River cruise on the Seine. We took a river cruise along the Seine and we loved the views from the river.it was great to see the house boaters and sunbathers on the sidewalks. It was really fascinating to see some of the crowd favourites like the Eiffel Tower from the water
Fascinating Journey. We had a 1 hr river cruse. There were audio guide through out the journey. But very interesting to be up on the boat
Very Nice trip. A river seine is ideal for everyone, you can sit relax and enjoy all the sightseeing (main) of Paris. A tour leader will give you all the information that one needs.

Good overview of Paris. We took one of the boat tours of the city and it was better than I remembered. It helped to identify some of the buildings and bridges and to cover more territory than you could on foot. We had alrady taken a two hour bus tour of the city the day before so this was redundant, but we got to go around the Ile St. Louis which the bus tour cannot show you, and on a beautiful day it would be a nice relaxing trip.

One of the most beautiful rivers ever. . We loved seeing people sit and relax at the edge of the river. We don't get that in England and also the water was so clean, the river itself was so beautiful.

California Travelerd. Took the one hour crude at night and it was magical. Nice pace great sights. Too bad the English speaking French guide couldn't be understood so no history lesson. Comfortable with great vision

Think about French artists and Go!. Think about French artists and Go!Imagine you are in a late eighteen century city, next to a well traveled river, filled with artists and their funny hats trying to make a living out of some riverside 'sketches' . This mindset will transport you in time. And you'll actually be able to buy some art from local artists!Enjoy a riverside coffee break. It's nice.

The heart of the city - but almost closed off from the rest of the city. The Seine is the heart of Paris - however the way the embankments have been built on either side means that the river has almost been cut off from the city that surrounds it. Much of the riverside has been taken over with banal uses, such as coach parking - so much more could be made of the Seine.

So much to see!. We took the Batobus, which is a kind of shuttle taking you between several stops and close to all major sightseeing areas. But any cruise on this river (lunch, dinner, night time, etc) is worth doing as the landmarks such as the Eiffel Tower can be seen very clearly. And, of course, it's very romantic!

Something for everyone along the Seine. The Seine is one of Paris's highlights especially during good weather. On the left side you'll find Les Berges which is such a fantastic place to walk along as there is not only lots of lovely boat restaurants and cafes along the quay but you'll find everything from a mini nature wildlife reserve complete with otters popping up now and again to say hi which is delight for children and adults alike, to wall climbing and for those who fancy putting in a quick workout you can find many small groups with instructors doing everything from weightlifting to HITT classes. If just watching all that doesn't make you thirsty or for those who prefer their walk a little less strenuous then head to the Pont Alexandre to the one of the many pretty cafes and river bistros and partake in the Parisian pastime of people watching accompanied by 'un verre'. On the right side it's less active but for those wanting to find a quieter spot to picnic and watch the many bateaux passing along loaded with tourists all enjoying the beautiful scene from the Seine then take yourself to this side of the river . During August the right side turns into a real life city beach as tonnes of sand is deposited along the banks, deck chairs are unfolded and parents whether local or just visiting can take the kids for a fun filled day at 'la plage'.
Took the cruise, just lovely!. I'm sure all the cruises are great, we bought ours through the Big Bus, saved us some Money! It was located across from the Eiffle Tower

Dinner Cruise. We have done a few dinner cruises at other European cities and been disappointed, But not with this. We had a great evening, excellent food, music and sights were breathtaking, especially Eiffel Tower all lit up .

Always worth taking the trip. Have done this trip a few times as a couple and with kids. It's a good way to spend some time seeing the sights along the river.
Have always used the boats at Pont St. Michel.

Paris by Boat. One of the best ways to enjoy the sights is a leisurely 2hour cruise. Take the champagne package as prices on board are steep. There are many packages to choose from and several companies competing for business.

WALKING IN THE FOOTSTEPS OF HISTORY!. We took a bike tour and rode along the Seine in mid morning. We walked along the Seine on a Sunday evening when it was bustling with filled cafes and ice cream stands and people sitting on the walls. The Seine is such a beautiful backdrop for all the historical and beautiful buildings that sit atop the walls of this river. Whatever time of day you walk,scooter, or bike it is a transforming experience! We also took the ride down the Seine on the boat by the Eiffel Tower......at night!!!!!
Beautiful. We did the sienne boat cruise..it gets quite cold in late noon so if in that time of year dress accordingly..lots of photo oppurtunity on the way...
Good way to view landmarks. We were on the river cruise to tour the famous River Seine. It's a pleasant experience if you want to view all the famous landmark in central Paris.
nice time. its a nice time to take a boat en spend an hour crossing the river.there are many business and they can take you to a tour on the river.there is a lot of wind, so get a coat.

Start your stay in Paris with this. I always start my stay in Paris with one of the many river cruises on the Seine. It is the perfect place to get the lay of the land. This time I did a night tour and it was beautiful! The Eiffel Tower was lit up!

So much to do and see. A great area. Markets cafes the notre dame. The love lock bridge. Artists mimes its awesome. We spent another day here. And this is by no means our last trek back. Whether you walk bus or boat the sights are endless. Give yourself plenty of time here. Thrn come back and do it again n again it is a beautiful city and has so much to offer everyone

A trip down the river is worthwhile. By taking a river boat cruise you see the sights of Paris from a different angle and it is well worth it. There is commentary on the boat which explains the history of the buildings and bridges.

Visit the River Seine when rain or sunny. We went on the Batobus for hop on hop off trip around the Seine visiting different attractions around the city. The round trip takes along time and there is a commentary in English. Best to have a guide book. You get a good view even when raining, and it is magic seeing Paris on the water, more interesting than the metro to get around Paris by the river, Eiffel Tower, Norte Dame etc

Beautiful views of Paris from BATOBUS. A wonderful way to see Paris is from the Seine.Batobus operates continuously along the River calling in at nine popular tourist destinations and attractions.One can get on or off at any point.If you have a Navigo Pass then there are discounts. A two day pass has advantages.Get oriented in Paris and see the City in style!We saw the city in both rain annd sunshine - it is wonderful.
Nice. We walked along the river a couple of evenings and it was wonderful. We also took a boat ride on the river it was great. The area around eiffel tower is very lively.

Beautiful boat ride!. For 19 euros each you can get a two day pass to hop on and hop off the Bateaubus which makes ten or so stops up and down the central Pagis river between Grenelle and Jardin des Plantes. You can never tire of boating between all the famous landmarks of Paris and enjoying the boat activity on the river and watching all those people! A treat is taking the last Bateaubus at 9:30 pm from Eiffel Tower and doing the round trip returning at 11 pm and seeing the city at night! It's hard to imagine any other city that has such a polished tourism product, interesting and diverse history as the Seine through Paris!
Relaxing river cruise . We took a boat taxi down the river. Was a nice change from walking or catching the metro, and stops at a number of sights like near the louvre and eiffel tower.

Lots of room for walking. There are wide paths along the river that many people use for strolling or biking. There is easy access to the paths from the street using steps that are every block or so. There are so many bridges over the Seine each with great views of the river and the city.
Picturesque Tour. Very scenic and one of the best river cruise taken. Price maybe a bit steep but its worthe every penny.
Lovely!. Simply lovely! Shame we didn't have time to go on a river cruise. But we saw it most of the time during our train ride, our climb to the Eiffel, etc..

Walk along or by Boat. When I first viewed the Seine from the Eifel Tower I was not impressed. However, when walking along it both during the day and at night, my attitude changed to one of enjoyment. Take a boat ride at night and see the Eifel Tower lit up!

A fascinating walk.. We had several occasions when we wandered along the banks of the Seine when staying in Paris and there is always something interesting to see. It is so well set up for walkers with plenty of space and wide paths there was ample room for us along with cyclists which frequent the paths also. The bridges encountered along the path are ornate and all have interesting stories. Make time to stroll along the Seine when you are in Paris.

Do take a cruise. Even an hour cruise, yes. It's worth it. If you take a tour you can listen to the recordings (they have them in various languages), if you're a dreamer - like me - then you let the sights tell a story... just for you.
Walk it. Whether you're traveling solo, with friends, or as a couple, a walk along the Seine is a perfect Parisian experience. This is what I miss about Paris when I'm abroad.

Not in Paris unless you have a stroll by the Seine.. This impressive river is full of life.The magnificent bridges with their history and architecture.The lively hustle and bustle of the street traders.The fantastic boat trips with their entertaining commentary..This river has it all.
One word of warning unless weather is really warm wrap up it can be cool by the river.
Beautiful !!. Great river cruise and witness all the attractions for Paris with an excellent view of Eiffel tower.

Try a river boat cruise. River boat cruises are an idyllic way to relax and take in some of the most famous Paris landmarks. The boats leave from the foot of the Eiffel tower, the one we were on was glass fronted providing a panoramic view.We went on a lunchtime cruise and the food was fantastic.Lovely relaxed atmosphere with a mixture of classical music and a Edith Piaf (esk) singer.At 50 euro each, it was excellent value for money.

An Unusual and Unforgettable Experience. “Evening in Paris”, “Paris by Night”, “Paris for Fashion”, “Paris on Bus”, “Paris by Boat”, and “Paris for Art” are some of the heavily-used proverbs and idioms to describe Paris. Countless opportunities offer to discover, experience, explore and walk-around to ‘unearth’ Paris in a fun and enjoyable way. The river cruise gave us a unique and uncommon experience. The boat departed from the Eiffel Tower travelling along the river passing by the monuments namely Assemblee Nationale, the Orsay Museum, Institut de France, Hotel de la Monnaie, Notre Dame Cathedral, Institut du Monde Arabe, Hotel de ville, Sainte Chapelle, La Conciergerie, the Louvre Museum, Obelisque de Louxor, Palais de Chaillot, Pont Neuf, Grand Palais, the Concorde Place, the Love Lock Bridge, Rio Sena and the City Hall. The multilingual audio commentaries were helpful in grabbing the keys to Paris history and legends. Concisely, the guided cruise carried us away by the mythical charm of the Seine’s banks taking us to the heart of Paris and we admired it’s amazing and remarkable architecture. Paris is a perfect place for pleasure and play.

cruise tour a must visit even if stayed next to eiffel. river cruise dine in while cruising the tour watch d main attraction from the river itself and yes enjoy more in the evening and transit in the night timing get photo clicked the eiffel and towers of notre dame cathedral kiss as a couple

The lifeblood of Paris. You must walk the banks of the Seine accessible by stairs at every beautiful bridge. See it from the street too, but to feel Paris is to walk along the quays along the Seine. You must take a tour boat called Bateau Mouches and sit back as you glide between the Left and Right banks . Also take a night boat excursion to see the histopric building lighted and the Eiffel Tower glitter with its several time an hour show of strobe lights.
Had a lovely boat ride.. Had a lovely trip up the river Seine we passed all the great landmarks. We got off and on when we wanted to. Had a really great time.

A variety of things to see and do. We took a stroll from Place de la Bastille square along the canal to meet up with the Seine and ended at the Louvre. Many picnicking spots, and places to drink and enjoy the beautiful spring evening. It is packed with locals enjoying time with each other and there were plenty of boats to watch cruise by. Artists were painting and the vendors have lots of treasures to look at

There is not much for free in Paris. This is.. Beautiful, relaxed and a cracking landmark. We cycled down by the river and a little higher. This is a cracking river with a relaxed atmosphere on the banks. They even close some of the roads on Sunday so you can really take your time to stroll, run, cycle, skate, exersize or just sit and take it all in.

FANTASTIC VIEWS. Our one hour cruise down the Seine was most enjoyable. Our cruise vessel had bench seating on the top, making a 360 degree view of all. Great photo spots along the way, too, including the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame! Very interesting house boats lined part of the river, as well as parks and many people sitting and walking on the banks!

River Seine bus boat.. We took the "hop-on/hop-off" bus boat. It's great as it gives you the chance to see all the main attractions, and if you wish you can leave the boat at the nearest stop and rejoin another boat when you have finished your visit. Your ticket covers all the hop-on & hop-off and is worth every penny; $; £ or € !!! One really good surprise "no sea sickness"! No need to reserve just go to the kiosk on the quay.

great place to relax and have lunch. Pick up a baguette sandwich with your favorite ingredients and head on over to the Seine for a relaxing lunch by the river. There are many spots along the Seine to sit and watch the world (water world that is) go by. It's so relaxing and a great place to have a little lunch or just watch the boats go up and down the river. Then go back up to the street and take a stroll along the many little places selling art, books or souvenirs. Fun!
Best way to travel.. This is a great way to get around, get the hop on and off tour and on a sunny day it's a fantastic way to see Paris and you avoid traffic fumes and noise.
Beautiful. The River Seine is so nice to walk down and really see the city of Paris. Take a boat cruise down the Seine to really get a great view and see the city.
YES to the cruise. debated on day or night time cruise. So pleased we did the day cruise. Helped to plan our tour for the rest of the day
Water taxi is an inexpensive way to see the Seine.. We did not bother with a river cruise as the water taxi was 17 euros for a whole day and enabled us to hop on and hop off wherever we wanted.

Lovely walk, boat cruise not worth it . A walk along the Seine is magical. You have a wonderful view of the architecture, shops and boats. You can cross some of the bridges with their locks and adornments or peek into the lives of the Parisians sitting and chatting on benches along the river. I've done the boat cruise which felt very touristy and boring to be honest but the walk was lovely. It's something that can be done with pleasure, repeatedly.

Sit, relax and enjoy Paris' beauty on the river. During this one hour river cruise you can admire and enjoy most of the hidden views. Find a good shiny day and avoid rain to enjoy this cruise. You can enjoy the numerous bridges and monuments as never before. The commentary is both in English and French. It is very difficult to find English speaking in Paris, they are to proud of their language. You can find two piers one located close to Eiffel Tower and one close to Pont Neuf Bridge (close to Notre Dame).
Lots of things to see on the Seine!. Paris plage is a part of the Seine where Parisians are on a kind of sandy beach, Near the Musee d´orsay they do sport....

The River Seine Has It All. The river route has something for everyone. There's strolling for lovers; rest spots for relaxation; fun for children and history at every turn. I haven't explored it all but I'm working on it.I suggest starting with a boat ride, not the dinner cruise-food is not worth it besides you can hardly eat and take in the views at the same time.

Illumination Tour. Recommend the boat tour at night. Massive open boat with giant lamps on the dude lighting the river side buildings. Tour guide explaining what is being lit upEasy. Bought a package so trip was inexpensive. The Eiffel Tower was all lit up with laser lightingWorth the time and effort Take the latest hour possible.
Romantic. A great attraction, full of romance and history, if you're in Paris you have to do a cruise on the river

Not the prettiest but still worth a cruise. We took a 1 hour cruise and enjoyed seeing evening lights from the river. Lots of graffiti under the bridges and the river looks quite dirty but many of the bridges themselves were detailed and beautiful.

Boat cruise on the Seine!. We took a boat cruise on the Seine at 8:30pm. It was just starting to get dark and we were able to see a beautiful sunset and the lights turn on at the Eiffel Tower. It was so fun to see all the fabulous buildings along the river and watch as all the people are picnicking down by the water. A must do in Paris!
Boat ride on the Seine is a must!. We took an 8:30 PM cruise so we saw the landmarks at night with all the lights on the banks. You get a different sense of the city from the water.

A Beautiful Snake. We traveled the Seine from Honfluer to Paris on our Grand Circle Cruise and enjoyed the serenity and the sights along its banks. One gets a sense of the history of the area while traveling the many turns of the river.

amust in Paris. very nice way to see the building along the river, a pleasant way to relax from walking for an hour.Avoid the boats directly below the Eiffel tower , nice boats and nice speed but you cannot hear the commentary on the top deck
Mesmerizing. Clean river with lovely, well designed and well developed banks. A cruise on this river, watching historical monuments is an experience beyond words.

Saved the best, for last.. We spent three crazy days seeing sites and getting to know a bit of Paris and I don't think three years would be enough time. We decided to save the boat cruise for our last site and am so glad we did. Cruising up and down the Seine, past most of the places we had toured was the perfect ending to our trip. It was Sunday afternoon and I was awed by the people everywhere, enjoying the day with family and friends. All the bridges are amazing and have histories all their own. This was just the perfect way to say Goodbye to this amazing place.

Nice trip . A good way to view alot of sights. Pre purchased tickets but make sure you have your print out and not in mobile phone add they don't have technology to scan from mobile.
Worth doing the trip.
ckckck. u must took one hour tour down the river, u will know how clean, how beautiful it is, but always beware of thieves

Highlight of my stay. The River Cruise at night was the highlight of all my tours in Paris. The staff were amazing and highly informative. Even willing to share a joke or 2. The view of Paris from the river at night is a must see, must do.

Just like the movies.... We went back to the Seine and spent at least 2 hours just sitting there and admiring the beauties it had to offer. We didn't do the cruise this year, but just sitting there and looking at its beauty was enough this time...what a gem this place is!!!
A perfect afternoon actiity. Such a nice and relaxing activity to do on a sunny afternoon! I liked the open air and it was just great chilling for an hour seeing the Notre Dame!

Whether taking a ride or walking beside this a perfect experience. The Seine can be enjoyed at any time of the day. Early dawn is impressive but at night it takes on an entirely different deminsion. Going for a cruise can be very informative but also walking along the Seine offers the opportunity to enjoy the different neighborhoods.

Magnificent Looking Architectures along the River. I went there last december and took the River Seine Cruise around sunset. The cruise lasted about 1 hour 10 mins and costs 35 Euro. The view was just amazing especially when the sky started turning dark and the lights from the surrounding architectures were switched on slowly. As the cruise was about to come to an end, it started drizziling and the Eiffel Tower came into sight. I was sitting on the open deck of the cruise and thank goodness my camera was waterproof and I did not have to worry about it getting drenched. Even though it rained while I was on the cruise, I would still recommend to go for a cruise with a open deck as there wont be a roof obstructing your view in every single photo you capture. However, do also make sure to check the weather beforehand to avoid disappointment if it rains really heavily! :)
A must. Siene is the spirit of Paris. Don't miss to walk on both sides and to cross as many bridges you can.

Great Guide for Exploring the City. The Seine is unavoidable when visiting Paris. You can spend a good long while strolling along its banks, stopping here and there to admire the views, gaze at the art displayed by street artists or browse through the collections of used books for sale. you can also take a river cruise, and while I did this during the day, it would probably be even more stunning at night with the city illuminated and the lights reflected off the river!

Not a fan. It is probably my 7th time to Paris and not a fan of the river. The color is brown and not good to look at. Also did the boat tours before but not much to see. I would prefer a long walk by the river.
Part of a beautiful city !. Flows right through the centre of Paris. The banks are lined with typical Parisian structures and the river flows under many stunning bridges
vacation. It was fun and pleasurable. You can find out many interested things and see many places when they explain as we ride the boat.

A must!. A ride along the river is the perfect way to see the city and to get accustomed to the lay out Its a beautiful ride and convenient to all the major sights in the city. Makes for a perfect day.
It's a River. You will see this river if you visit Paris. It was very nice to walk along and provided a great backdrop for pictures.
only go at night.. Take the evening cruise at 9 or 9:30 to see the city at night. It was spectacular. Starts and ends at the Eiffel Tower.

Evening Cruise!. The evening cruise of the Seine was fantastic. It was raining but our enthusiasm was not dampened. We saw every uniquely beautiful bridge and landmark from the boat at night. This is the best way to see the City of Lights. I can still picture Notre Dame lit up from that vantage point. Amazing!
Worth seeing. We walked up and down the River Seine. It was lovely and a lot to see along your travels. Artist painting, nice restaurants to outside and have a drink, Very French!!

Great way to take Paris in. We walked almost the whole length of the central part of the river seine, it was lovely and peaceful. I had a buggy and was great access. Although beware of the cyclists whom it is really popular with. Lovely place to get photos of the eiffel tower from further up the river

One of the great walks of the world. For me, the high point of a visit to Paris is a walk along the Seine. The wonderful buildings on both sides of the river, the trees, the passers by, the water, everything combines to create an unforgettable experience.

Look but don't jump -- River currents are deceptively fast moving. Other than romantic strolls by couples the river is popular for an end-of-life technique for jumpers almost always fatal (about one a week). The points is that the river is melancholy and not for the loners, the lonely. Loving couples only (preferably sober) when strolling the river edge.
Boat tour. Did 1 of the boat tours and it's not very executional from the board end. The views and scenery are excellent. Getting go view all the major historical and culturally important landmarks
Locks. Bridge with locks is very interesting. Wonder what year this began. I think it is Pont Neuf. So many tourists visit. The river Seine is so peaceful.Carol6440
Pristine. The river also has some riverside restaurants. Most of them are expensive. But having a heavy lunch with kids playing around the river is a great feeling.
Of course. You can't really visit Paris without checking out the river in between your walks to the museums/chapels.

Sit on river front/ do a cruise. Siene river flows through the centre of Paris and most of the place to visit are nearby (situated on either side of the river). The river front is very amazing especially the one near to Eiffel tower. The bridges to cross the river are covered with locks (wishes made by travellers). The best view of the river is from top of Eiffel tower, it looks greatWe also did a small crusie and was intersting to see all monuments from the ship.

Beautiful at night with all the lights on at the Eiffel Tower. Used the Bateaux bus a water bus. Lots of fun great way get around get a pass for the day and night. You can see everything during the day and the night lights up tres magnifique!

Take the River Boat Tour. The river boat tour is one of the best ways to see the city if you're limited on time. Well worth of an hour spent. You will see key landmarks including Notre Dame, Musee du Louvre and Tour Eiffel.

Lovely trip. If you want to visit all of the main tourist attractions then take the Batobus, you can buy an all day pass and get off and on as much as you like, it is a very refreshing trip on a hot day, with lovely sights.

Adds to the beauty of Paris. Can be explored in multiple ways. Walking down the bridges (one of them being the beautiful Pont Alexandre 3) or going for a cruise, you may include it in multiple ways in your itenary. The view of the river from Eiffel summit is equally good or I should say better.!

Watch to world pass by!. When we visited it was 25 degrees and the banks were lined with people having picnics for as far as you could see. River boats travel up and down it non stop. Lots of little pop up bars along it. Great place to go.
The main River in paris. Many landmarks are around the river, with beuatiful bridges all along, The riverside is very popular for gatherings and picnics on a daily basis with Parisiens.

Amazing views. We travelled on this boat at night after visiting the Eiffel tower to see all the different buildings that my fiance is into if you want to take photos I'd recommend taking a good camera as we didn't so we shall go again with better camera

Iconic River Seine. We enjoyed the River Seine in several different ways. We walked along it, and crossed it's bridges. We took a bus tour which told us of the history, and we took the river boat tour, which was quite enjoyable and shows the river from a totally different view.

River Seine. We were able to take a ride down the River Seine, it was a misty and rainy day but we did not mind. It was just awesome, it was in the package we bought for touring the Eiffel Tower. So glad we did this....Thanks VIATOR...

Many Different Options. There are many different ways to experience and enjoy the lovely Seine - as a pedestrian, on-off boats like the Batobus, sightseeing or dining on the Bateaux Mouches, or taking a river cruise. We did a very nice Viking Paris-Normandy cruise, which actually goes not from Paris, but from suburban LePecq. Best to enjoy the river up close with all its charm. The Seine offers wonderful views and romantic ambiance as promised.

enjoying on cruise on river seine. fantastic visit of the city by cruise on river seine... it was a little rainy evening .. superb visiting of city... momument copy of " statue of liberty" was very good
Perfect from the boat. We bought a batobus two day pass and could explore Paris from the river - wonderful! Not too many tourists and we could just sit and watch aftera a long day full of walking.

Unexpectedly great. Have never done the cruise before and have been 4 times to Paris so this was my first experience and I loved it. You see a different perspective of Paris and get to see beautiful places along the river. Great cruise would recommend.

Dinner cruise a must. One of the highlights for me to be able to sail gently down the river and see all the sights in one go. Well worth finding a trip - we went with Calife and would highly recommend.
Beautiful!. although it was a long queue to get the tickets - it was well worth the while. I would love to do this again.
You can see amazing monuments all while cursing the river!. Cruising down the river adds a little more history and romance as you travel down taking in views of so many famous places and sites.

The Heart of Paris!. As you wander around this city, you will undoubtedly cross over the River Seine many times. The book stalls, old historic buildings, special islands in the middle, and many other sights all along it will give you plenty of reasons for why this river is a wonderful venue passing thru this great city.
Romantic. We did this on our first day so we had a good idea where all d sights were, was so relaxing and romantic, we even had a glass of champagne while we cruised

You have to spend time and the Seine. Walking along the Seine taking a sightseeing cruise or just crossing some of the bridges: You have to enjoy the Seine and the special feeling. I think I light most going for a cruise during the day to see a lot of Paris, but also walking from Notre Dame across the bridges and enjoy the view is nice. Important: Do not miss the Seine!

River cruise and bike ridding . We were lucky enough to take a tour along the river on bike and a dinner cruise taking in the Eiffel Tower and the Statue of Liberty. A truly beautiful part of the world.
Shipping in Seine. Its possible to go shipping for just 20 Euros in the famous river Seine.Most of the important attractions in the city are situated on the river banks

Live art. We took the Seine hop on hop off boat and walked along ithe river wherever we could. With the many bridges, play of light and shadow, and river activity to entertain and enthrall us, we couldn't get enough of the Seine.

Must Do. We took a boat ride on the Seine river getting on the ship near the Eiffel Tower (I believe it was Crossier sp). The cost was approximately 15 euros each). The cruise lasted one hour. You could ride inside or like we sat on the top, outside for the best viewing. We recommend this cruise. We went during the day right after going up the Eiffel Tower. Some people from our tour went back a night for this cruise to many see the Eiffel Tower lit up at night. The ship returns you back to the dock where you started. A ship/cruise leaves every hour. There is food available in the dock area.

Lovely riverside walks.. We spent many hours during our stay just walking along some of the many riverside quays. very relaxing with many riverside restaurants (on boats) where you can stop for a coffee and just people watch.
wonderful. rent a bike search for the river of seine and enjoy all the famous site seeing on it ,im sure your best pictures will be taken there .enjoy
Nice Place to have a beer. When you're in Paris, grab some beer and watch the sunset over the river seine. It's a great place to hang out after a long day on your feet.

The perfect way to see Paris. We got tickets for the Batobus river cruise and could hop on/off all day long. The price for two days is only minimally more so we considered it an absolute bargain. On a sunny day in Paris there is no better way to explore the city. Stopping at all the major sites (Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Champs Elysees, etc) the river cruise offers beautiful views come day or night.

Unesco heritage. We were booked into a morning day cruise along this cruise which takes about an hour ride to and back. Having whether lower window or open upper deck for a free move view. Very romantic cruise along the Eiffel Tower all the worthwhile.

Enjoying very famous monuments of Paris from Seine River.. It's must be take a Bateaux on Seine River while you are in Paris. You can enjoys the beautiful scenic of Paris and it's historical monument from the Bateaux.

We went for a stroll . We were out walking and sightseeing when we passed the entrance for the river. We walked down the side of it. About 2 hours before sunset it was coming to life some music here some dancers there. You name it. Be wary of the crazy book vendors on the bridges there is a female who is super crazy. Just don't make eye contact with her. Other than that there is a bus at the end of the river walk to take you wherever you need to go if you know the bus routes.

How great to take a cruise on this for an hour or two .... There are plenty of tour companies .. and .. we had a great one.It's about an hour cruise to see it all, and, I could have done it every evening. Just beautiful .. Wish I had done it in the dark, at least once. Snuggle up in the spring time. It was cold, but, I snuggled with the wife, and, we were just fine.

Relaxed Walking. What a great way to walk off a wonderful meal and peruse the vendors kiosks along the river banks. We felt safe enough to walk back to our hotel after the Crazy Horse show which was a few kilometres.

Lifeblood of Paris. The Seine is the river that runs through Paris.It is no longer a commercial artery as it was when travel by water was the most practical means of commerce and communication, but it is still interesting -- go for a cruise, if you like. The Seine is Crossed by numerous bridges

Beautiful . There is so much to see as you walk along the Seine. Go over the many Ponts and then go back again. It's totally beauful and many many stunning buildings adorn the banks of this mighty river. You will love it and I guarantee will go back numerous times.

Easy relaxed spot. Get your bread, wine, cheese and meat if you ,Ike and go sit. Just a fun place to watch the river traffic anywhere and enjoy the calm life. Take a pause and enjoy the quiet scenes, you won't regret it.

Seine Tour. this was a very informative tour. We sat on the outside and it rained a little but it's PARIS so who cares!! I loved seeing the sights from this vantage point it also allowed the opportunity to mentally map the area so that when we were done I could finger what else I wanted to see and what direction it was in. It helps that the cruise picked up directly across the street from the Eiffel.
Lovely Place to Walk. A beautiful waterway with pedestrian walkways, used book stalls (bouquinistes) and gorgeous bridges. The Seine provides a beautiful backdrop for Paris. Enjoy!

Wedding on the Seine!. My son was married on the Cachemere while traveling down the river! Absolutely stunning views and relaxing trip. Billy with Luxe Paris Events who is the most gifted planner you could ever use...please reach out to him if you ever need to help plan a wedding!
Beautiful. I saw it both morning, noon, and night. Photographs of the river with boats at sunset help keep my trip memorable once I got back home!
Spectaular in every way!. Riding the Seine and seeing the sights of Paris is a great experience. Lots of boats with lots of options; but, the key is the river itself. A must when visiting Paris.

Beautiful, Beautiful Paris!!. When people talk about the light being different in Paris, I think a lot of it has to do with so many spectacular views of the city juxtaposed against the Siene. Each morning I ran along the river, and saw some of the most lovely sunrises in a city that was still sleeping. And every afternoon, while walking around Paris, we saw bridal parties posing against the Siene in the background. It was much cleaner than I thought it would be, and with all the beautiful bridges, was a lovely, lovely part of the city.
Try a stroll along the river bank.. We start at the Pont de L'Alma (visit Lady Di) then along to Pont de la Concorde, followed by Pont de Neuf and the finish line is Pont Sully.
River Seine. Beautiful and you can see most landmarks from the water! An absolute must in Paris! It was great and affordable.
The Seine, full of history.... Took a river cruise to Normandie...magnifique! The Seine cruise was a wonderful experience, one I would encourage anyone to take.

It's a fine river. I've never reviewed a river before. But as someone who has always enjoyed various bodies of water I'm comfortable saying that this river meets all expectations...it's wet, it flows, has banks, bridges and boats. It does not disappoint.

A Boat Trip on the Seine is a Must Do!. The boat cruises all take essentially the same route. You gain a different perspective of Paris from the river. It is particularly nice on a sunny spring day. You can appreciate all the bridges. It is interesting to see the different boats tied up along the river.
Very serene and Beautiful. We didn't take a tour on the River Seine, but walked around and took photos several times. Very beautiful, lots of tour boats, day and night.

This is what you have to do!!. Choose carefully the boat you would like to ride on keep in mind the further you go the further it is to come back 1 hour maybe two is plenty to see everything I would not recommend having dinner on the boat unless you're going to be there for several weeks as there are so many good restaurants that are not on the boat I thought the dinner was mediocre at best.
River Seine. Stayed in Paris three days and walked along the Seine. Took a river cruise on the Seine for 7 days after.
River Seine. We took a cruising boat, well because it was rainy day- we wnjoyed it and saw Paris from anouther perspective.
My favorite place in all of Paris!. Pack a meal, bring some alcohol, and hopefully an entertaining date, and sit near the Seine and watch the boats and people go by.

Great cruise on dusk. WE went for a cruise on the river Seine on Bateaux-mouches boat just before dusk to view the many sights along the river. Close up views of the Notre Dame and the islands of La Cite and St-Louis. Also past many of Paris's main attractions. The highlight of the cruise to view the Eiffel Tower as it turned on its lights for us. We were witness to a show of hundreds of flashing lights draped over the Tower,
Wonderful to walk beside.... Or take a boat trip to see the sights of Paris. While daytime trips are delightful, the evening boat rides can't be beat.

Without the River, Paris would not be as special. A number of major sights in Paris are within an easy walk of the river, The river adds beauty and romantic views of everything from the Eiffel tower to the Cathedral of Notre Dame.
Take the Seine tour. Take the Seine tour during sunset and stay on the top of the boat, no matter how cold it is. The photos will be spectacular.

Lovely wide river with floating bars & restaurants on. Lovely river to wander along on a summer evening.
Many bars and restaurant on floating platforms line the river and are great at night.
The tours on the boats up and down the river are well worth doing and very relaxing.
Lovely walk. Great to walk along the river when the weather is nice, look at the bookstalls and watch the boats go by....
Awesome river, awesome cruise, beautiful.. Awesome, awesome, and awesome its was beautiful and there are many cruises, and dinner cruises the one I'd suggest is the le calife or the Beautax moches.
Lovely . Lovely to walk along in good weather, unfortunately we had rainy weather on this trip, so a river cruise was a good alternative - and also a great way to get a different view of the sights.

What a lovely way to spend an hour.. Taking a tour along the Seine is a lovely way to spend an hour.There is so much to see from the river and add a new and interesting perspective on many of the sights of Paris.Travelling through the heart of the city you realise that Paris is built on and around two islands in the river and is connected via the many bridges best viewed from the river.By taking both the boat and bus tours you will really begin to appreciate the splendour of the buildings and other landmarks and get an overall sense of what makes Paris so special.

A great walk. I'm not sure how one reviews a river, but: my favorite part was the quays along parts of it. You can walk on street level or descend by stair or ramp to the quay for a lovely stroll. There were always boats or barges on the river. We spent a lot of time walking along or watching from the many bridges.

cruising is the way to go!. While we walked along the gorgeous riverside, we also took in a dinner cruise recommended by our hotel. It was fabulous! Such a romantic place! We also were lucky to get a gorgeous bird’s-eye view of the Seine from the Eiffel Tower. Both must see places when you visit!

Boat trip on the river not that exciting unfortunately . We visited Paris in April 2016 and it felt safe and secure. On our sunniest day there we went on a boat trip on the Seine. The boat was airy and whilst we enjoyed the experience, there was nothing exciting about it. The boat does take you along the river so you see the front or back of various sites such as Notre Dame, but there was sadly nothing to shout home about.It was restful but just not that exciting.

Batobus on the Seine. Wanting to avoid the Metro, I bought two day tickets for the Batobus. We really enjoyed this water transportation to get from from major site to site, and the boat ride became an event in itself. Highly recommend, not too expensive, and very enjoyable.
A must. During any season. Magical and mysterious. Beautiful light. Great people watching and shopping for used books. Music too. Do not miss, even in the rain.

So romantic!!!. The Seine is romantic, especially when you are with someone you love or like. I see many scenes from movies - a couple are walking along this river. When I really walk along it, it's beyond any descriptions.

Walk this river from Louvre to the Eiffel, stopping at the Ferris Wheel!. Just a wonderful stroll along this river, with beautiful views of boats. Stop on the bridges and take it all in. Criss cross back and forth through neighborhoods, taking in the architecture, beautiful carved doors on residences, and greenery. Lovely part of Paris!

A bustling fabulous river!. Along the edges are large boats which are floating homes. Apparently anyone can just up and park their boat along the edges. A constant stream of hop on hop off tourist boats keep it looking busy. The edges have young Paris lovers looking doe eyed at each other and after work small groups of predominantly young men sit around in small groups chatting over beers or spirits. Well behaved, they all seem involved in conversation . A really interesting river to tour along and oh so Parisian!
River is beautiful . Did a river cruise for the first time and loved it. It was cloudy and cold but that didn't spoil the magic of the Seine and its surrounds and the photos were spectacular.

Nice cruise. This is a nice cruise to take to get stunning views of the city. You can get a cruise as part of the 'hop on, hop off' bus tours, but the guides do not really talk about what you are seeing. That was fine for me.

The best way to see Paris!. Its a must do in Paris. There is no better to see all the attraction than a river seine cruise. We took the boat a bus pass and saw all the attractions one after the other. You can chose at which place you want to get and can take the next boat to go the next attraction. Most beautiful way to look at a beautiful city.
Romantic. You must walk the river, alongside it as well as at street level. Easy access throughout although not handicap accessible that we saw. Walk the Seine to see Paris. We won't forget it.
must do!!. If you are in Paris I personally recommend the bateau mouche on the river seine you leave from a dock near to place de la concorde and see almost allof the landmarks.
Boat trip down the River Seine. Good idea to take a boat trip, especially in the evening, to take in all the sites. Great to see if you want to explore them further on foot!
Beautiful. the Sein should be enjoyed over the bridges. personally did not enjoy the boat rides. they are so crowded and rather boring.

A different perspective. We decided to catch the Batobus to get to see some of the highlights from a different view. At 17E each we had a pleasant view with relatively comfortable seats in cruising between the various sights. It was really nice to cruise the river and see some of these famous places from the water. A very enjoyable two hours on the river.

Take a boat trip to see it at it's best. The river is a delight but not all of it has lovely walkways along it, so I suggest the way to see it is on a nice boat cruise. It is also a long old stretch through the middle of Paris, so give yourself a break and see it the way a river should, on it!
River Seine. I took a nice cruise that comes with the Paris Pass. You get to admire the coastline on both sides. Before boarding make sure you have a coffee at the nice nearby coffee shop!
River trip with lunch. Spent a couple of hours on the river having lunch looking at the sights. Food was very good, staff spent time pointing out the key sights and were very responsive to questions.

Fantastic. We took the river boat tour down the seine and what a great way it is to see Paris.The guide was great pointing out all the iconic Paris landmarks.Really is a great way to see Paris and I felt really good value for money.
Evening Dinner Cruise. An amazing meal afloat a cruise along the Seine looking at the attractions lit up in the evening sky. The staff were attentive and we were entertained by a singer.
Get Lost at the Riverbank. Just walk along or sit at an empty spot. The River Seine is welcoming and adds an extra touch of beauty to an already breathtaking city.

Romantic. The walks along the river are very romantic. Hand in hand imagining what life would be like living on the boats moored on the banks.We walked both banks. Both just as romantic. Better at night.
Beuaitful. It was perfect for weather with it shining the sun and no rain, so having a cruise down the river Seine in our last hours in Paris was a perfect way to end our holiday.
Wonderful . I had a wonderful dinner at the Ricer Seine. This is an absolutely must go ride. Delightful experience with a Gala Dinner through all the river.
Relaxing and informative river cruise. Great views of some iconic Paris buildings but it would be much better in warm weather, so wrap up warm at this time of year.
fantastic. What a highway! The original route of transportation from the last millelenial . so many p!laces to see along the river! So very historic!
River Seine Cruise. Enjoyed the River Seine boat cruise on a nice summer day in Paris. Found it very leisurely. Good view of the Eiffel Tower and The Paris Statue of Liberty.

A Load of History. Cruising the Seine was a fantastic opportunity to see Paris from a different perspective. We had toured Paris by bus so this was a great change. Paris is rich in history and spectacular architecture.
Since the bus routes and boats stops inter twine, easy to change.

The Artery of Paris. No matter where you go in Paris you will always stray back to the river. The walks along either bank are superb. Beware of the conmen and street scalliwags that
you get in any big city and enjoy.

Cruze through dis blue flow. Just a min away from tower is dis River Seine .Reastobars on the River banks worth sit place .Cruises /Ferries take u around for an hour .Whole visual treat for eyes is unparalleled .

Seine River boat cruise. We had a lovely 1.5 hours cruising the river and you can see so much from these glass domed boats.You really get up close to the Pont Alexandre 111 and the beautiful architecture of Paris

River opposite eiffel tower. This is usually a must to do thing if you are a tourist in Paris. This river cruise happens right across Eiffel tower. You can book the ticket, directly there as many cruise operates there. Its usually a 1 hour ride in river cruise where they will show you all important landmarks and tourist spots while cruising. You can take lots of pics as you can come on top of this boat. Eiffel tower in the evening looks mesmerizing from cruise especially when all lights lip up there. Cruise charge around 15 Euros per person without any meals.

Great view of Paris (from a different perspective). We took a one hour river cruise (with champagne) yesterday. (We had taken the traditional bus tours earlier in the day.) I really enjoyed the cruise as it gave us a different perspective of Paris . We got to see most of the same major sites but the view from the river in some cases was much different.
Spectacular. Great way to see a different side of Paris. You can stay on all day or ride to stop and get off and get back on later. Beautiful and relaxing way to see Paris.

Just walk!. Hard to be disappointed with a stroll along the Seine, it is so evocative whatever the weather or season. You need to switch sides occasionally though, to keep away from the car traffic. Go down to the riverside instead - that way you avoid the cars and also all the annoying book sellers whose stalls almost entirely block the view of the river in some places

Many historical places around it. We did not take the cruise as we walked along it many times, while on our way to the next destination. The houseboats were so cozy looking too. Makes a pleasant walk!

Lazy boat ride. Choose to get a batobus ticket which was excellent boat took you to all local attractions and you could hop on and off all day with the one ticket very clean and staff very helpful very enjoyable.
Recommended for strolling. it was nice walk crossing the river. Though it was very hot on the day but still okay to enjoy it. There are some cafés that can visit for short relaxing.

Lovely. I may be biased, since my husband proposed to me along the River Seine, but it's one of my favorite things about Paris. Walking along its banks and taking in the sights and sounds of the city around you was one of my favorite parts of the trip. Be sure to take in at least one sunset over the river, and if you can catch a river cruise while you're at it, better yet.
River cruise. We did a one hour river trip complete with tour guide on a microphone telling us all the history of the area from Notre Dame to the Eiffel Tower. A real must do !

Viking Cruise Lines brand new ship, the Kadlin. We traveled the Seine the second week that the Kadlin was in the water. The ship is gorgeous, comfortable, and intimate. The crew is excellent, attentive to our every need.

Best Way to Enjoy Paris. With the security concerns in and around Paris, we decided to use the 2 days Batobus pass (hop on/hop off) along the Seine River. This is highly recommended to move along the different famous sites along the river in a relaxing way. We had 2 kids with us with strollers and it was breeze for us to move in and out cruise boat.
great. the river is very clean, very romantic and a visit by boat is a must, terrific views specially at night, an evening to remember
The Cruise of a Lifetime. One of the must do's in Paris is a River Cruise in river Seine. It covers major historical attraction around the river and one should not miss it at any cost.

Do take the night cruise!. To have a great view of all lit up monuments, take a late night cruise. We took the last one. It can be breezy and you will need a cardigan even in June. A sunny day by Siene side is that you will cherish. Just relax, watch pigeons, touch your feet in water and then sun bathe...makes an absolute delight.
Travel by boat. Lovely river cruises are a wonderful way to see all of the Seine. The guides on board are very knowledgeable and you get a great view of all of the sights.

It is awesome walking along the Seine. Going from the latin quarter to the Torre Eiffel it is quite a nice walk. After a little while there is an interesting brodge (the one with all the locks) and the walk continues on a road where traffic isn't allowed and with exercise stations and other built in features (pictures, gardens, etc). Very pleasant.

NO ORDINARY RIVER CRUISE. I wanted to do a river cruise at first, but they were quite expensive for such a short time. So I booked a ticket on the BATOBUS. it is a bus on the Seine and it has 8-9 stops where you can hop on and hop off as many times as you want for a whole day. so you can make the most of your day on the seine. Keep in mind there are no toilets and no bar on the boat.

Must do: bateau mouche ride & a walk beneath the bridges. One of the main attraction of Paris! It is really nice to take the ride at one of the bateau mouche and contempate Paris from within the river - it gives a whole new perspective of the city. Must do is the walk beneath the bridges, especially during summer, when it turns into a lively place with lots of cafes, activities & Parisians enjoying the sun!
Boat trip in Summer was very lovely. We took a boat trip in the river Seine, the trip was spectacular, you can see what Paris architecture along the river, lots of amazing building and church

Cannot miss it :). You will definitely come across the Seine. There are some spots (E.g. next to Musée d'Orsay) where you can go and take a snack and relax next to the Seine. I recommend that you go along the seine with a bike (there are a lot of bike stations called Vélib - these are run by Paris Mairie - you can rent a bike paid per hour and there is a deposit of €150, you can find these stations throughout and closs to the Seine) and then stop and have a picnic in a spot where you like, good way to cross the city.

Beautiful. If you can, I'd highly recommend taking a boat tour as there's so much to see on the river. My husband and I took an hour tour that took us under 22 bridges and we passed the Notre Dame Cathedral. Well worth the time and money.

A Must for Paris. Therein No Better Way of seeing the Sights along the river but ensure you "Know Where Your Boat is Going and What You Get on Board" There are many Boat Operators and many Different Packages - The Cheapest is not likely to be the best.

A different way to see some sights. We were lucky to have a beautiful sunny spring day and thoroughly enjoyed our boat trip along the Seine. A great alternative to being on a tour bus and seeing some sights from a different perspective.
View by Boat Tour. The Seine River Cruise was great. My sister and I went at night right after our dinner at the Eiffel Tower. The lights were gorgeous. The view Amazing!

Refreshing and beautiful. The Seine is typically Parisian. Beautifully paved along the river with lots of places to sit and enjoy the breeze, the fresh air, the buzz and the exercise. Great for families and friends. Take some fruits, baguettes and wine and sit on the bank. Also take a jacket in case the weather turns. If you live far and you walk to the river there are several metros along the way if you get tired.

ferry trip. A must do activity when visiting Paris. A cruise is quite cheap to purchase and if you have Tesco Club card points you can purchase tickets before you go. Tour guide was very knowledgeable about the sites along the way. You can hop off and on when you like all day and visit the land marks along the seine.

Nice but not exciting. We got this cruise as part of a tour to Versailles. It was the Vedettas at Pont Nuef. The boat was very nice but it was quite chilly to sit up top in the open air even on a sunny 60 degree day. Towards the end we headed downstairs where it was warmer. I am sure upstairs is spectacular in the summer. My problem with the tour was the guide. She spoke in French, English and I think Italian (or Spanish?) My daughter called the speaking Franglish. We could not tell when one language ended and another began! It was rapid fire with a heavy french accent, so we actually could barely understand any or what was being said as we went buy all sorts of beautiful buildings and landmarks. Luckily we are familiar with Paris so we could kind of figure out what she was saying. If you go on a cruise, just enjoy the view!

Just take the ride and forget all else. this is one activity all tourists must do.. I did it atleast 40 times in my 2 years in france.. Kids get to see all the buildings in one trip and compare them. Perfect photo op too

A nice walk in the heart of Paris. A nice walk in the heart of ParisAt a time of exacerbation of ecology, it is good to note that the nineteenth century has contributed sometimes to spite him pleasant places where one breathes.The driveway Swan is one of those small pleasant walks in the heart of the capital, with a view of the districts of Paris and the Eiffel Tower.A reproduction of the Statue of Liberty a gift from France to the United States of America was built west of the island, the place is soothing.
Boat Cruise. I went to a Boat cruise with my friend, we took the boat from Eiffel Tower, you will have a good chance to take special pictures

Most beautiful at night. Paris really is the city of lights and the well lit bridges over the Seine prove it. We have walked along the Seine many times on many trips to Paris but my favorite time to walk is at night. The banks of the river are crowded with young and old enjoying their city. I especially love how some of the bridges form below an acoustically perfect place for music to be played and heard.

River Day Drink. Whether you're strolling the streets and browsing the books and wares of the vendors, or taking a bottle of wine and some cheese down to the banks of the Seine, it is a welcome reprieve from the bustle of the city and the museums and speaking bad french and then mumbling things in English because you got real self-conscious. Do it. Get a bottle of wine from Nicolas, 64 Rue Saint-Louis en l'Île, 75004 Paris, France (on the island) and walk a few minutes to the banks, or out to the tip of Ile de le Cité and enjoy an hour or two.

Beautiful . We went on a one hour sight seeing cruise late afternoon it was really relaxing after a day on your feet, we went up to the top as it was sunny . People were waving as we went by it is a nice way to see all the different bridges well worth the money.

Well organised. A good way to see the main attractions from the river. Very long queues but very organised. The boats have seating both inside and out. Toilet and drink facilities on board. However should you wish you can book boats with on board dining.

Cruise plus many important places in Paris. We took a river cruise of about an hour. It takes you through many important monuments including Notre Dame.
The walking spaces on river banks are beautiful and ideal for a romantic walk, adorned with art work, gardens, etc.

Idylic. Having just been proposed to by my now fiance at the top of the Eiffel Tower we had a celebratory meal on the Bateaux Parisiens cruise boat. Excellent food , drink & friendly service.
