Lovely sights to behold during 2 magical hours on The Seinne...a perfect way to celebrate a truly memorable day.

Take a river cruise !. We took a cruise down the River Seine and enjoyed it very much. There are a few neat houseboats and glimpses of a few places we wanted to visit along the way. Our cruise was only a half hour and i wish we could have gone a bit longer.

Sienne River Tour. You can embark on the trip from the pier near the Eiffel Tower. The Tour is very entertaining and one can see many of the important buildings on both sides of the River. Also, you will pass under many of the beautiful bridgees of Paris.
Fab picnic. A perfect place to gave a picnic with friends. It's April, do not too crowded, weather was ok and a great place to snack, feed the pigeons and watch the people go by

Relaxing Boat trip. Had a lovely boat trip with commentary relaxing and good way to see the sights. Right by the Eiffel
Tower and offering lots to do along the way
Seine from the eiffel. Seine very nice. Located in northern France. Is located near the city's main centers. View the River Seine from the Eiffel Tower will be very enjoyable

Right versus left bank. No secret, the French say you are on the right bank if the river flows under you to the right. If on the left bank it flows to the left. You truly need to take the time and walk over one of the walking bridges.

The liquid heart of Paris. During our visits to this wonderful city, we love walking along the banks of this beautiful river. If one were on a budget you could occupy yourself all day, just criss crossing the river taking in all the amazing sites Paris has to offer. The seine also has a dark side, the river has become a popular place for suicides and the dumping of murder victims, see wiki for more interesting trivia.
Batobus is the choice. Not much can be seen while taking a river cruise. Here Batobus will be the best choice since you can step off on every stop and take next boat afterwards.

Night time cruise with beautiful view of Lights at the Eiffel Tower. We walked along the river by day and cruised it by night. The evening cruise was very relaxing and we saw things we did not see from land. The architecture of the bridges was very interesting as we passed underneath them. We passed by the Eiffel Tower all lite up and twinkling which made the evening. There was also a full moon which made for a great photo shoot.

Immense in scale. The whole riverside of Seine is most awesome! So many activities, so much to do.You can see the faithful tying locks on the grills near the steps. Dining on the riverside, while musicians play live music. Parties on the boat-roof etc. If anyone has read Somerset Maugham's description of Seine then you are likely to find it totally different.

River cruise. Book a river cruise over the river and it will make you enjoy all the highlights alongside the river banks. As I was only 2 days in Paris, it was a nice way of seeing a lot in a short time.

A great way to see heighlights of paris. We went on a river cruise which I highly recommend , it is the only way to see the architecture of the bridges plus get the historical background of them. You also get info on the buildings and can decide where you want to visit.

Bateaux Mouches and the Seine. We've cruised the Seine before with various companies. On this occasion we used the Bateaux Mouches leaving from Pont de L'Alma. The access is excellent and easy, especially for those with mobility issues. This is not so for cruises leaving on the opposite bank where there are a number of steps. Bateaux Mouches has a ramp leading down to the office.The price is good, as is the service. Couldn't fault the cruise but do advise that you might like to sit on the port side as, when you pass Notre Dame, if sitting on the starboard side you may miss the view and the cruise doesn't return in the same channel. The sites along the Seine are always worth a visit. Very well recommended.

Excellent nightime boating experience. We toured right of pond neuf (bridge number 9), there you will find boats that take you around the Seine. We opted for a nightime cruise, was outstanding. The views are breathtaking, you see Notre Dame cathedral up close, Eiffel tower all lighted up, Musee D'Orsay and plenty more.Highly recommend doing this excursion, unbelievable pictures and we were lucky to have a great guide who translated very well I believe Phillipe was his name.This is a fantastic boat ride along where you go under many many beautiful Parisian bridges. An absolute must !!

Paris River Cruise. Took a Seine River Cruise in the evening from the Eiffel Tower area up past the No tor Dame Cathedral watched the lights of Paris come on very beautiful site to take in. On arrival back at the dock the light show on the Eiffel Tower came very impressive lasted 5 minutes come on once per hour. Take the ride it's worth it.
Take a Seine cruise. There are multiple options for a cruise on the Seine. We went on a 2 hr dinner cruise which was enjoyable. Good perspective of the city from the river. Good activity for evening.
Worth your time and money. Very scenic, covers the main attractions of Paris. In my opinion, more enjoyable than one on Thames, London.

Always romantic. I travel on my own and have feasted on the beauty of Paris. Nothing beats strolling along the Sein. Early in the day when the sun bounces of the wakes of the many river boats, late on the day as sunset changes the color of the water and in the night when the city of light sparkles and shines it's reflection on the river. Stop and cross cross the bridges. Savior all the many views. Browse the bookstalls and the joy of a living river dancing it's way to the sea

So much to see!. We did a river cruise down the Seine and loved it. There are so many small towns to see; castles, ruins, the beaches of Normandy, Rouen - - the list goes on an on. If you have done many ocean cruises like us, it is time to move inland and see what there is, and this is a beautiful way to see it.

Time your cruise. If you ever consider taking a Seine cruise, do it at night. And start right on the hour (instead of the .30). The cruise usually last about an hour and if you take the cruise on the hour, you’ll start or end your cruise down this romantic city when the Eiffel Tower is lit up in a dance at night.

Beautiful and fairly inexpensive way to see Paris. We loved the batobus tour for 17Euros and hop-on and hop-off privileges. We actually took the batobus one afternoon and one morning to early afternoon and it was so lovely to go from end to end a few times. We were able to hop-off at the Eiffel Tower and that was great plus there were so many stations that we actually got on at one and got off at another when returning to our apartment. The views are spectacular and fulfilled one of my dreams since very young. Highly recommend this way of seeing Paris. It was a warm day and we particularly enjoyed the space at the rear of the batobus-even made acquaintance with a few other amateur photographers like ourselves-trading picture taking.

runs through the heart of Paris. again seems like a silly review. The river runs through the city. Take a bateau mouche ride if you haven't, to see a different aspect of the city. Otherwise a stroll along the riverside and viewing the many pretty bridges is part of the charm of Paris.

OH MY ! ROMANCE INDEED. What a place I could quite happily move here . Stunning views from every angle . There's so much to see its crazy . I didn't know which way to aim my camera for fear of missing something ! Walk it , boat it ...however you do it ........just do it ! Daytime and night time such a beautiful river .I want to go back !!! we had our honeymoon here in 2011
A dream. Since I was 14 I had a dream to make a cruise on Seine. Almost 50 years later I made this one hour dream trip with my husband and my 15 years old grand daughter...

Standard river really . Although on a rainy day this is just another river, la seine can really light up on a sunny day - the river turns from a dull grey to a turquoise blue. Great to walk along to find many of the galleries which lie close to the river - in the heart of the city much like many rivers in major cities. Artificial sand is brought to make an artificial beach in the middle of the city!!

Nice way to view Paris. Using a Batobus ticket for €17 you can hop on / hop off and get a good tour of Paris with nice views from the river. The Batobus is a bit on the slow side compared to Thames Clippers in London, but otherwise very pleasant. The open space at the back is fairly limited for those wanting to take photographs.

Take a boat!. Well from the tower eiffel , you can take a boat and go all over the River Sena ist amazing, and the tour ist just one hour, you will find many historial places next to the canal and the tour ist included you a guide that explain everything.
Bateaux Parisian. We had a lunch cruise on the Seine. We enjoyed great views and amazing food. This is a must do in Paris.
Seriously the boat cruises are worth it. So great for getting oriented and otherwise impossible pictures - the shots we got of Notre dame were worth the price
Great way to see the city. Great way to see the sights of Paris while relaxing on the boat. Sailing down the Seine allowed us to see the sights from a totally different angle.
Awesome cruise. Went to a river cruise on Seine in the evening and it was great. The cruise lasted 1 hour and we saw many monuments and beautiful places.

Beautiful at night. Our tour group went for an evening cruise. It was beautiful. It was cold, late March,so we stayed inside the boat.  But after awhile, we went on top. Recommend you view from top deck. Dress accordingly to keep warm. Better all around views on top deck.There are other evening cruises you can take. Check at Aviator or consult with your hotel concierge. An evening cruise with dinner would have been very nice.

Despite the rain, it's still beautiful. We've been in Paris for a week and even though it has rained for a short while each day, it's still a magical place. Just about every day we've found ourselves on the banks of the Seine and you get a different perspective every area that you go to. From the iles to the city it's calm and relaxing. The scenery changes from moment to moment, don't forget to visit the Canal St Martin which is now filled again. It is truly a beautiful city.

River Cruise on the River Seine in Paris. We started and ended our river cruise on the River Seine in Paris. What a perfect location as our basecamp. We would start each day with a view of the Eiffel Tower, wade through the masses of people touring the tower then explore the city from there. When cruising the river it changes from an urban river with warehouses to a bucolic countryside. The locks along the way to Normandy were amazing to experience. Try the river cruise way to explore!

Take a boat trip. There are a seemingly unlimited number of choices - I selected essentially randomly the one associated with the big red bus tour as my time was limited. It was well worth the hour as the river view is quite different than strolling along the walkways. Great views of all the sites along the river and an opportunity to see up close this is still a working waterway with commercial barge traffic as well as tourist craft. Did not take a romantic dinner cruise in the evening sadly - will do that the next time

Walked and cruised. We spent a lot of time along the river. We crossed over on foot as many of the bridges as we could (more than 10) and then we took a scenic river cruise in the late afternoon and got some glorious pictures! There is so much to do around the river and yet at times, some of the most peaceful place to be in Paris!
Walking across . It was a great walk across the river seine. Though it rained in the day, would recommend taking a stroll by the river and visit the cafes.

Take the river crusie. We have visited Paris on many occasions in the past -- always promising to enjoy a nighttime ride on the Bateaux Mouche. However, our recent family trip found us on the banks of the Seine in a queue for the Bateaux Parisien. The nearly one-hour tour was exactly what we needed to orient our children to the city. As it was a beautiful day, we decided to ride on the rooftop of the boat. This is excellent for those who know the city; however, for first-timers, its best to stay inside. The multi-language tour is only accessible from within the boat, where each seat is equipped with a personal handset.
Cruise along the river. Took a cruise along the river. Well worth doing this as it covers all the bridges and monuments in the area. Great photo opportunities and is perfect on a sunny day.
Visit. Book a cruise on riverGreat to see ParisBridges are beautiful. Maybe hop on hop off cruise is best.

Very nice indeed. Went for a long long walk along the river - yet again - after many years. Lovely. The sun was out, the birds around and yes, holding the old fellow's hand..... Very memorable indeed.
From Cruise or From Eiffel tower.!. you can cruise the river at evening at evening wich is very pleasant or you can see the river from top of Eiffel tower which is very amazing to me.

best photo with Eiffel Tower in background~ included with Paris Pass. It's great to see many sites - we enjoyed it - we even got mooned, complete with a special choreographed dance :-) - I wish I had it on video - when the boat comes back take the opportunity (timing is important, but there's time) to get a photo with the Eiffel Tower in the background -

River Cruise.. I went on a river cruise on the River Seine whilst in Paris.Whilst the River Cruise can be a good way to see Paris, the seat that you sit on will depend on the view you get. I presume that a seat at the front would give you a good view but the seat I was sitting on (on an aisle near to the back) did not give you a good view of Paris at all.Also, the seats were quite uncomfortable to sit on for an hour, having said that you are allowed to move around the boat.But overall, unless you get a great seat, the river cruise is not something I can recommend. I would, instead, recommend you to see Paris on foot, where you know you will be able to see the magnificent structures that Paris has to offer.

Rest for the weary legs. Cruise down the Seine for another perspective of Paris. Enjoy people watching as they sit at the edge of the river having lunch, wine or even kissing!No walking required so great chance to sit, watch and enjoy.We bought our Seine boat ride tickets as part of our l'open hop on hop off bus tour. Nominal additional cost. Great wet weather activity on enclosed glass ceiling boat.
We took a boat ride. This is a great way to see Paris and should not be missed. It was a bit cold on top when the sun retreated so dress warmly.
Take a boat ride at night.. It's the best way to relax and spare your tired feet for a couple of hours. Take in the lights. Bring a bottle of wine to share. You won't regret it.

Batobus is ideal. When wanting to explore I would recommend the hop on hop off batobus. You see the sightscfrom a new perspective but also have plenty of opportunities to get off and explore the city.
River cruise . We took a cruise down the river and the sights were lovely! You can see so much and even the bridges are pretty.
Great night cruises and daytime walk/runs. I had some great runs along the Seine in the mornings and we had a great nighttime dinner cruise. At night, the lights are amazing.

Batobus, what an nice way to get the big picture. I like the water and every means of transportastion related to it.In Paris,were the Seine is splitting the city,they offer the Batobus service that brings you to most of the TOP 10 attractions.It's affordable,efficient and relaxing,plus, you get a perfect view of the beautiful city !

Biding time walking the river siden of Seine is wonderful. On a sunny day, what would be nicer than to walk along the sides of Seine. During the wee-ends there are lots of Parisiens with their whole families, spending the afternoon. Lovely!

Best way to see this is by boat!. Make sure that any visit to Paris includes a walk along the Left or Right bank of the Seine, but the best way to enjoy this river is to take a river cruise and observe the multiple bridges and beautiful boulevards and building.

Beautiful. So Paris is spectacular & then there is also this beautiful river running through it... wow! You can just walk along it & over it on the numerous bridges & take in all the amazing architecture & beautiful buildings along the river.
Nice. We took a stroll at the side of the river and it was lovely to stop and see all of the boats going past. Back in 2010 I took a boat ride on the river and it was amazing!

Glorious!. The river is central to Paris and just charming. From the beautiful bridges, you can watch the boat traffic and the vibe of the city. The old Parisienne buildings lining the avenues make this a not to miss area when visiting. Perfect for a stroll!
Stunning, especially on an evening. The Seine runs through the heart of Paris ensuring that a walk along the pathways of the Seine is a stunning experience, both day and night. Highly recommended.

Beautiful River. Walk as it meanders along a beautiful series of roads and bridges. You can take a tour boat, or even have lunch on one of the barges moored along the river. Walk across one of the ancient bridges that cross the river and take in the breathtaking sights. Very romantic at night...well lit.

Fabulous cultural experience - not to be missed; see it sitting down when tired of walking. The Seine by boat is not to be missed. See the best museumes, palaces, monuents etc from the water with unobstructed views and take your best pictures sitting down during a 1 hour pleasure cruise.

Take a tour. Great value on a sunny day.. This is my 5th visit to the city- but first on the tourist boats.I have avoided in the past as thought they were over priced and a bit 'touristy'- wrong on both counts.Really enjoyable. Perfect length - 1 hour. Not the 'tourist' rip off I expected. All the main sights pointed out in English. We paid an extra 5 Euro for a glass of champagne- great value and made the trip that wee bit more special.

You MUST take the day and night Bateaux cruises. Bateaux Parisien and Bateaux Mouches both have multi-lingual guides on board to point out all the sites.The day tour allows you to see the detail on each of the bridges and buildings, at night it is magical because they light all the major attractions along the river and it is a totally different and excellent experience.Not expensive and well worth the time.

River Seine by Bataboat!. We went on the '"Bataboat" glass covered ferries you can stop at 8-9 stops get off, comes every 10 minutes, and get on at each stop all day long for one ticket. Perfect way to get to see the Eiffel Tower, to the Notre Dame, everything "must see" is along there all in one trip.

Lovely river trip. Boarded a boat by the Eiffel Tower for a tour cruise, roughly an hour. Would recommend on a sunny day as a little cold and drizzly when we went. Lovely way to see parts of Paris and have attractions pointed out. Fabulous architecture. Note, children 12 and over pay the adult price.Equally lovely to walk along. If you walk by the Pont Alexandra there are stalls on one side selling antiques etc. Interesting to potter around.

Go Cruising!. My favorite way to see the city at night is by cruising the Seine! While there are many options take advantage of this great viewpoint of Paris and the lights. If you go at night keep in mind the Eifel tower sparkles for 5 minutes at the top of every hour.
Terrific way to see the city!. We traveled on the river by boat just to get an overview of the city. We went back and did a trip at night which is a fantastic way to see the city.
Hire bikes and ride along. We rented the Velib bikes and rode around Paris, particularly along the seine for hours. Wonderful on a sunny day.

Heart of the City. When you're in Paris, you will often walk next to or cross the Seine. It's a great river with its numerous bridges. A river cruise is the best way to get a quick overview of the city and the most important sights.

Wow . We went to a famous Paris market, then picnicking in the park beside the Sienne drinking wine I might add, then followed by a dusk boat tour on the Sienne. A once in a lifetime experience I can't wait to repeat
Nice river. The river is beautiful, although the water is not as clear as I thought it was. I bought an hop on hop off bus tour to go around the city, along the river, very relaxing experience.

great night cruise. We took an evening cruise on Bateau Parisienne
There were lots of young people from the USA so no seats available on deck but still enjoyed the trip

The River. There is so much to see along the river and what trip wouldn't include photo's of yourself next to it. It is at the heart of the city and as you walk along it, you come across so many things that are worth seeing. From Places to museums to stopping at a café to enjoy a meal and watch the world go by
Picnic, stroll, people watch. Romantic stroll, perfect picnic spots! The bridges are my favorite part, and there are so many to experience.

Day or Night. We recently returned from our first trip to Paris. We had the Paris Pass which allowed us the Hop On Hop Off Bus trip as well as the Seine River Cruise. We chose to do the bus trip on day one shortly after arriving to help orient us and the river cruise that evening to see the sights at night which are beautiful. We planned to catch the 7:00 but didn't realize you needed to show up at least 30 minutes early to get in line. We arrived at 7:03 and asked the attendant if it was still possible to catch the 7:00. There are SO many riverboats there, we had no idea which one was the one included in our Paris Pass. The attendant rudely responded, "What time is it?" Guess we got our answer. We strolled around in the area to kill until we could catch the 8:00. Warning: there are no restrooms in this area so plan accordingly. The boat does have facilities thankfully.While the sights were pretty at night, I am not sure I would waste time doing this particular cruise again.

Nice accent to the city.. During a trip in Paris, you'll find yourself walking along the Seine quite a bit. Its a very nice river that accent a bunch of tourist attractions. However, walking down beside the river stinks like pissue because it seems to be where all of the bums hang out. So if you walk on the sidewalk above the river it's a pleasant experience.

Lovely boat ride.. This is a must do on your travel list to Paris. It was so relaxing and seeing the sites while going down the river Seine was truly beautiful. What I did love about the boat ride was everyone waving to you... what a friendly city.
Great experience. We went on a cruise of the River Seine during our 8-day trip to Paris. It was a very pleasing experience and would certainly do it again.

Walk along the River Seine and use the Batobus. This is a beautiful river in the heart of Paris. The best way to start a trip in this city and get a feel of the architecture and the famous buildings / monuments is to take the Batobus; this is a water bus that goes up and down the Seine, and you can hop on and off as you wish (in order to visit the sites/ take photos). Get a 2-day pass as visiting everywhere cannot be done in one day. Start early in the day as there can be queues at the more popular stops. Staff are usually helpful at getting a stroller on-board but there are multiple steps up and down to the quai which can be difficut with kids and stroller, especially if you are alone. Once you have a feel for the city, then just walk along the Seine, and explore the surrounding streets and shops. That will give you the best experience.In the summer along the Seine, there is the annual Paris Plage; the city creates a beach with activities for everyone on the right bank.. amazing and a must-do in the summer.
A long walk. A long walk along bridges, people, monuments, boats, waters and noises that tell you the story of a monumental city second only to Rome

A Beautiful River with Lots to Offer. We enjoyed a Seine river cruise from Paris to Normandy with an added 3 days in Paris. We loved experiencing all this exciting river has to offer, something different at every port. On our last day in Paris we explored by foot many areas along the Seine. Definitely at the top of our list of favorite experiences and we have traveled extensively.

Excellent boat Cruise. Spent one and half hours on a boat cruise on the Seine. 14 Euro's.Excellent value and a great way to see all the sights of Paris. Boarded the boat at the Eiffel Tower. Note that at the hour in the hours of darkness in the evening the Eiffel Tower puts on a Fantastic light show.

The Life Blood of Paris. No trip is complete without a long walk along the banks of the Seine.The time you take the walk doesn't matter, nor does the weather because the Seine is the most beautiful river in the most beautiful city.If you can afford spend an hour on a cruise it is well worth it.
Paris Marathon 2016 & Sightseeing Trip. . Beautiful location. Viewed the Seine at varying locations. Just a pity we hadn't time to do the boat trip.
Some good Arcatexture along the river.. Take the boat trip down the Sane and have them serve you wine and cheese. You can see Notre Dame from the boat
Awesome at night and day. The hour long boat ride from the Eiffel tower area and back was nice. A great way to see a different perspective of all the architecture Paris has to offer!

THE REAL ESSENCE OF PARIS IS CAPTURED BY THE RIVER SEINE. The river Seine flows right through the heart of Paris bordering 10 of the 20 arrondissements. It was no accident that the city evolved around this gigantic avenue for commerce and transportation, or that the early Parisi tribes on the river's island were attacked and overthrown by the Romans. This early coup took place on what was later to become some very prime real estate. At that time the river was called by it's Latin name: Sequana. The river is still the chief commercial waterway and half of the water used in Paris still comes form the Seine. Don't think about that when you look at the sick green water flowing under the bridge, or when your waiter brings you a glass of tap water.Paris, the river Seine looking downstream Tourists are often confused about the terms "right bank" and "left bank" and spend hours on street corners with crumpled maps trying to orient themselves and figure out which side of the riverbank they are standing on. The system is very simple and was devised because the river's curvy nature often does make orientation difficult. The trick is to remember when you face DOWNRIVER the left bank is on your left and the right bank is on your right. If you can't tell left from right at this point you should not be traveling alone. If you can't figure out which way the water is flowing (don't look at the boats, they go upstream too!) drop a potato chip or look for some debris and see which way it's floating. Then you will be able to make it to the Café Les Deux Magots on time, and not end up at La Defense. There are 32 bridges on the river in Paris, some of them more impressive than others. The Oldest bridge is the Pont Neuf which has been immortalized by artists and poets and even 20th century films. (see The Lovers of the Pont Neuf) There is a beautiful little island crossed by the bridge which the riverboat tours now use as a docking station. In the spring or summer it's a wonderful place to hang out on a bench under the willow trees, or sunbathe on the slanted stone embankments near the tended gardens in its center. To get there, simply make your way toward the equestrian statue of Henri V and find the steps leading down toward the docks. If you are the kind of person who likes watching boats this is a great spot. Actually it is one of the nicest places to hang out in all of Paris.Beyond the mere technical facts surrounding the river and its environs is a deeper and more inexplicable attraction. The water speaks to us of a past we will never experience but nevertheless find ourselves linked to by association. Staring at the murky river from a cold bridge in a Parisian winter it is impossible not to think of Paul Celan, the tormented poet of the holocaust, who plunged to his death in those same waters, or the less known victims of French revolution when hundreds of bodies were dredged from the depths, or simply the unnamed who also met their ends at the river bottom. This is not to say the river represents a cult of death, but it's interesting to conceive of it as part of the full cycle of life. Great triumphs and great tragedies have occurred near the river which less aware tourists view as the background to their photo collection.  Note: The BATOBUS sails up and down the seine from the Eiffel Tower to the Institute Du Monda Arabe with stops along the main attractions. It works just like bus service which you can hop on and off. You can buy a day pass or a two day pass and use it to travel up and down the river at your pleasure. The boats are nice too--- wooden decks and glass walls and roof. See Batobus Cruises and Paris Cruises, Mini & Dinner CruisesFor all those who love rivers, hotels close to or on the Seine include the 3-star Hotel De Orsay, Hotel Verneuil, the Hotel Albe. The 3 star Hotel Le Notre Dame, Citadines Apart'hotel Saint Germain Des Prés, and the 4-star Les Rives de Notre-Dame are right on the river across from the cathedral. All located in the Latin Quarter

Soak the history. A boat ride on this river is the best attraction one could enjoy to the fullest while in Paris. The boat ride is romantic in a way - crossing beautiful bridges, sailing past cathedrals, seeing palaces makes this ride a-must-do-activity-in-paris !
Boat trip a must. The bateaux bus is a great Wat to. See the sights and see the river from a different perspective. Listen to.the guide as facts are fascinating.

Go on a cruise at night time!!. There are cruises that go from the base of the Eiffel tower (check the net for times) and it's only 11€ I think. And it's beautiful to see all the sights of Paris from the boat.
Bring warm clothes and weather the cold on the top outer level of the boat!!

If you have not walked along the quays of the Seine you have not been to Paris !!!. My happiest moments in Paris were along this beautiful river. There is always something happening on the quays so prepare to just stroll and see what pops up !! Browse the bookseller stalls to pick up souvenirs an occasional book in English and other memo-toes of your trip. Just don't take pictures unless you have permission.Pending where you are activity along the Seine can be busy or quiet and low key. The quieter areas are great for picture taking . You can get some breathtaking pictures of Notre Dame from here. During the evening the lower quays take on another life they come alive with bands people dancing .During the day the lower quays are generally quieter with beautiful parks and open spaces in some places. While walking across many of the bridges you will find artists painting and occasionally someone selling something they just created.
Boat tour. What a pretty river weaving through the city with all the bridges crossing over it! Do the boat tour at night. It is so romantic.

One thing you must do. You really have to cruise on the Seine if you are in Paris a definite must do. There is a local ferry where you get a great view and you can travel on it from The Eiffel Tour to Notre Dame...really, really good!!!
To do it with bicycles !. Wonderful balade you can do with public or private bicycles around the Seine, the view is wonderful and the experience is sensational! Totally enjoyable.

Relaxing and an experience on itself.. A boat ride on this river will be the best attraction you could have while in Paris. You'll be able to see all the great buildings, architecture, bridges and the entire city from a great perspective.
So Paris!. No one can come to Paris and not visit the River Seine! Whether one walks along one of the sides, crosses a bridge, or travels along the water, one will feel the essence of the City here!

The Lovely Seine. A walk along the Seine is one of the most satisfying activities in Paris. The various art work, the way they have utilized commercial cargo crates for public interaction, people watching and just the wonderful scenery make this a great way to spend an afternoon.
Boat trip on the river a must!. We did a late afternoon / evening boat trip on the river and it was just amazing. The sun going down behind the Notre Dame was incredible!!
beautiful. Loved it so much especially in sunny days. The boats are lovely but a bit expensive to get in. My children enjoyed it!
Beautiful River Cruise . We had a river cruise included in our Big Bus tour! It was a beautiful cruise down the river viewing paris from the river! I would definitely recommend doing this!

The first to do in Paris. My friends recommend me to start with Siene Cruise that was a very good idea. You get a chance to see almost all touristic place of Paris in 1 hour; the tape was French English and very helpful.

A relaxing way to see the main sights. There are many different companies plying this trade so look around to see what suits you best. All offer a reasonable commentary and the view is the same for all!
Dirty water. but it's nice to see the river in the center of the city. The boats cruising it looked lovely. A walk along the Seine on a sunny day is perfection!
What's to say about a river?. The Seine continues to divide Paris and remains a working water way with some commercial barge traffic. Tour boats are expensive, maybe worth doing once.

Seinne river cruise. Don't miss it and try to do it when it gets dark. The lights on Eifel tower and you can see all the famous buildings and bridges. Do not need to book it just go there and buy tickets from vending machines or the desk.

Soul of Paris. The river itself is not that special but all the nice buildings ob the side of the river make it look very nice.
The best time is when it's dark and Paris shows why it's called city of lights...
River cruise. Well worth the trip. Hour long cruise. A handheld telephone in various languages which was both interesteing and informative.
Sunshine day . Lovely to walk along the river and if it's a sunny day even better. Get a map and walk in the river line and that will help you to understand and move around easily in Paris!

Walking down the river from Musee du Louvre to Notre Dame cathedral.. As first timers, we chose to walk down the Seine river from the Louvre to the Notre Dame. It was indeed a long walk. But you can cross the wonderful bridges, sat down under the tree along the river, saw the river flows, waving to the people on the boats, enjoyed the paintings of artists, grabbed some crepes, ate your baguette, take photos with the Eiffel tower on your back and the river on your side. It was enjoyable and memorable experience. You must try it.
Romantic walk. romantic walk along the river in the city of love, what could be better than that, you'll enjoy every moment and will remember them forever

Still So Romantic!!. I've walked across the River Seine more than 300 times, with my wife, with my family, and as a bachelor. I have walked over at least 7 bridges there. I've spent more than 4 months in Paris, and I doubt there was one day when I didn't see the Seine. I've even rented an apartment in the Left Bank overlooking the Seine & Notre Dame.
Seine River. Make sure you take the night boat trip. take a bottle of wine and a loaf of bread and enjoy the scenery! See all the monuments illuminated in this hour boat ride. Well worth the money.

Short break. Lovely river to walk along. Plenty of interesting things to see and do.Fantastic architecture. Numerous water taxis. If you are eating then use the back street cafes etc if you don't want to pay top dollar.
Great trip even in the rain. Well recommended- we enjoyed this on a rainy evening in April at 2000 just as everything was going dark - romantic with the champagne which was good quality.

Pleasant cruise on the river.. Called in to bateux mouches dock near to alma marceau metro. Line 1.Upto to hare austerlitz the back to the eiffel tower and to dock.About 1 1/4 hr. Cost not sure we paid 14 euro 50.They do a lunch trip as well. Enjoyable. Didn't have to wait very long.There is also the batobus. Eiffel tower stopping at 8 places and back. Didn't use it because found out later. It would have been a good idea to use metro to batobus to visit Louvre, orsey and Plas du concorde.

River Trip. We booked a three-in-one trip before we went to Paris. Coach, entrance to Efifel Tower and a boat trip, well worth it if you have never been to Paris before as it gives you a overview of the city. Nice to see Notre Dame from the river and the many lovely bridges.
Nice walk . Very long! Loved the fact there are activities to do along the way, climbing wall, 100m sprint track, boat bars and restaurants, galleries etc sure it would be nice in the summer.
Boat trip. Get a boat. Hop on! Hop off! Visit as you cruise along this beautiful river surrounded by all the sights you have read about in travelogues.

Great views of Paris' splendid bridges and architecture. Took a river cruise and although the weather was chilly, we sat inside. The cruise allows one to see and appreciate all the beautiful architecture of Paris, and the historic and splendid bridges!

A must do. Rather than take an Uber or taxi places, highly suggest you walk down the Seine. A great opportunity to get a lay of the land and you will find some hidden gems like small restaurants, a rock wall for kids, and locals enjoying a relaxing day.

Beautiful. We crossed bridges over the river, overlooked it from our hotel room, walked along it, and took a boat ride on it. We took the boat at night and it was a lovely way to see the city at night. The water was very high while we were there. I particularly liked going under so many of the lovely bridges in Paris. The boat ride on the Seine was one of the most relaxing activities we did in Paris.

Lovely and clean and full of history. This is a lovely river to sail down via many of the tours available. It is very clean and a great way to see many of the attractions and a different view of many amazing architectural delights.

Just like the movies. I've seen this river in several movies but never thought I would actually see it in person. It runs along several landmarks and you can walk for hours along this river. The only thing I didn't like was how dirty it was but if you know the history you would understand. Great historic value and worth seeing.

A good way to get to know the city is to walk along the Seine. Walking along the banks of the Seine you will pass or see many of the key sites of the city, and also get to know its layout. If you are new to Paris, it is a good introduction to the city. Alternatively, you can take a trip on one of the many sight-seeing boat trips and get a guided tour (most have audio guides in a variety of languages - check before you buy tickets).

Historic Views. The Seine is a lovely place to stroll along or on which to take many of the bateau-mouche tours available in Paris. Watch for 'beaches' set up in summer. You may join in crowds doing zumba or some other activity!Easy Pass/Fat Tire offers a champagne cruise that includes a skip-the-line tour of the Eiffel Tower!

Sundown is a treat. Look into a Batobus ticket. Like a bus, but a barge on the water, that you can get on and off with the right fare. It lets you see the sights from the perspective of the river, rest your feet and sunset as you circle the island... Beautiful!

Nice walks. It is nice to walk along the river during your stay in Paris and it is easy to follow the carefully designed path along its edge. The bridges are gorgeous and many of the main attractions are along the edge of the river, making it easy to walk between them.

Need a rest but want to continue being a tourist!. It was our first time in Paris and we tried to do everything which led to alot of walking but the tours on the Seine are very well organised always on time and a comfortable way to complete areas of history!

Book a boat trip!. Unfortunately, I didn't get to add in a relaxing cruise down the River Seine but I wish I had once we were there. The river passes many photo op monuments like the Eiffel Tower and is a better option than walking in the rain!
Paris's heart. As the title, it meanders in the centre of Paris and a cruise on it will show you lovely landmarks. We took a Bateux tour for it.
Walk along the river bank. Beautiful walk, we just crossed many bridges back and forth, taking pictures. Lovely way to spend a sunny spring afternoon.
Beautiful !!!. I highly recommend taking one of the many boat tours the Seine has to offer.... You won't regret it!!
Always nice to take a boat. When weather is nice it is nice to take boat tour, to have new angle on a lot of sights that are around.
Walk to your hearts content. Take a long stroll, morning, noon or at night and admire Paris by the waterside. A true artistic pleasure to be freely enjoyed in what can be a pricey city.

A new perspective of the city. We received tickets for a river cruise with our tour package and it was well worth while. You get a new perspective of the city and the layout from the river. Of course it is lovely to see people strolling along the river as you cruise by.

Lovely to walk in fine weather. Unfortunately we found bad weather during our stay in March in Paris. However we still walked along the River Seine. It can be a relaxing experience and I imagine it would be much nicer when the sun shines or on a summer eve. I especially liked the stalls selling books etc on the banks nearer to Notre Dame.

Perfect spot for a cruise. . I'd do this just to get the lay of the land. It is perfect on a sunny or rainy day. The price is reasonable, and it gives you history and perspective on the city of light, the city of lovers, the city of my heart.

Awesome . River Seine is Beautiful. Scenery a must see. We did the bus tour. The building around the river Seine is so picturesque. We did not do the cruise as time was limited for us but you also can do the bus tour and still admired it. I love Paris will definitely visit again for a long time to see more attentions

More Romantic At Night. The River Seine is in my opinion even more romantic at night. The boats are lit up and sailing up and down the river look great. In addition the lights of the city work their magic.
Feel the serenity!!. We did a boat cruise and walked along and across the Seine - what a magic place - highly recommend going with no plans and just let it take you for a journey.

We took a one hour river cruise. The Seine is a must see. Not only does it divide the right and left bank, but many landmarks are on or just off othe Sienee. Our cruise started at the base of the Eiffel Tower, and you get to see Nortre Dame, etc., while sipping a glass of champagne.

SEINE. On one of my days in Paris I used the Batobus opposite the Eiffel Tower and it was a great way to get around and see the sights. The Seine is beautiful and the views all around are magnificent. What a wonderful way to experience some of Paris. Its definitely a must

A great way to enjoy the Seine!. We took a one hour boat cruise from Pont Neuf during the day and it is a great way to enjoy the surrounding architecture and sights. It is very relaxing and a guide points out all the features, buildings and museums you glide past. Make sure you get on a boat that meets your needs and desires such as covered areas to sit (or not) and upper decks for better viewing. It's just a fun way to sit back, relax and enjoy the sights. We have also done the night time cruise with a dinner. Sights and lights still godd, food is okay and not that great. Still a fun trip.
Beautiful . An extremely beautiful river. If you're in Paris you defiantly should go on a crosse on this river. Picnics are another great choice

Wander the quais. Slow down long enough to relax along the historic and beautiful Seine. Have a picnic on wine, cheese and a baguette while sitting on the banks of the river and soak up the ambiance of 2000 years of culture. You can't go wrong.
Bateau mouche. Been on these a number of times & they are a must do attraction for tourists. Best done on a sunny day or at least when there's no rain.
Beautiful. Me and family of 4 with two young children took an hours boat cruise on the seine. Very good views of all the famous landmarks and a very clean river with some very nice bridges.

A must-do!. Take a boat trip on the river Seine, and see some of the beautiful and historic buildings of Paris from this romantic river. It is anice way to relax and see some of Paris sights without any hassle Buy some wine, sit down, enjoy!

See Seine, See Paris. Cruising the Seine gives you a different feel of Paris. Haven't been in the day but it seems like it would be a good option if you want to see some landmarks without traffic on the streets.

A beautiful river.. Take a boat trip in the evening for a beautiful 1-hour excursion from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame and around the island. It's inexpensive and they give a running commentary. During the day you can walk along the river as you visit the sights.

Romantic and educational. This is another excursion included with the Paris Pass- River Seine Cruise. If it's not to cold make sure you get a seat outside. The perfect opportunity to experience Paris from this unique perspective. A definite must do.

Wonderful. This is a wonderful river making its way through historical Paris. The river gives the city life peace and happiness. We walked along the river during the days getting a cool breeze in our faces. Worth doing very time your in town.

Great river. One of the great river trips due to the surrounds and what the river passes through... all the very best and most prominent monuments... the cruises themselves are great as it is a different vantage point

Beautiful by night!. We organised a Paris River Cruise voucher through conciergie.com along with other tours of Paris. This voucher gave us flexibility to fit this in where we could with so many other must sees in Paris! We took a night cruise of the Seine River which was lovely to get a different perspective of icons like the Eiffel Tower and bridges crossing the Seine by night. It was beautiful!

A gorgeous to be had.. We strolled for about 8 kms along this river bank. Filled with beautiful barge homes, restaurants and beautiful bridges to walk under and share that kiss. A lovely walk on a sunny winters day.

Welcome to Paris. Paris is even more beautiful in the rain? Yes it is. And taking a walk along the River Siene is memorable and beautiful at the same time. I don't recommend taking a train in Paris. If you are there for the first time. Walk along the river and take in the enthralling scenery that you will never forget.Very recommended if you are with a date/wife/girlfriend. Seeing the Eifel Tower at night while walking here was amazing.
Fun. I was fortunate to be there during a flea market meet. There are all sorts of boat rides too. Dinner rides, sight seeing and so on.
Forget about the river cruise. Do Paris by bike - much better value and amuck better way to see Paris - the river cruise is boring..

Hop-on-hop off cruise on the Batobus. We went on the Batobus. It can be joined at any of the 9 stops it makes along the Seine. You need to start early if you want to make a few of the stops, such as Notre- Dame, Jardin des Plantes, Musee d'Orsey, Eiffel Tower etc. Its not easy for people with disabilities as there are stairs or steep drives from the river stops as well as failry long walks to some of the sights. Families with prams seemed to do well. We were disappointed that 2 stops were closed as it was not yet summer season. However, it would seem that one could manage 3 stops well and then do quicker sightseeing stops at the others. The boat comes past every 30 minutes, but one cannot always time it well. It might be better to do a two day pass, especially if one's hotel is close by. There was no commentary but staff did speak a few languages.

A few bridges and sights.. From the River Seine you can see any landmark close to the river. You can get some amazing shots with the right weather and lighting. Other than that I got a river cruise in a tour package nice 1 hr get away.

The window of Paris . Paris is a city that started on a island in the middle of the river and than stretched on it's banks. You can understand better the city of you start your visit by taking the seine trip first. Don't forget to take a good look at the bridges that you will be crossing some of these are works of art.

Nice to see at night . You can enjoy the view of Paris landmarks at night from seine river. The expensive and romantic choice is dinner in the cruise. You can see the sparkling eiffel and other landmarks
Boat cruise. It's a must while in Paris, went on a night cruise to see the sites. Notre Dame etc lit during the evening it spectacular

Not as expected. A strangely different experience to the romantic atmosphere always portrayed. Every English person is "painted" the romantic, intimate image of the Seine but the imagined cafes and atmosphere just are not there in real life. Not the river's fault, of course, more the expectation placed upon it. We found it very difficult to even find a floating restaurant that was open on March, much less an actual river-side cafe. Plenty up on the streets with no view of the river. These had prices of around €25-30 per person.

You simply Must walk along the Seine. Paris is a lovely city to just walk around and there is almost nowhere better than along the River Seine.Be sure to take the steps down to the river level and get the full experience.
Great flea market on Saturday . Along the river seine is a very small deal market in Saturday with all kind of antique artifacts. Generally it's nice to stroll along the river.

What a lucky city. This river adds so much to the city experience. Meander along the side of the river, take a boat, eat dinner moored at the side or simply stand on a bridge & take in the wonderful sights in all directions.

Paris' Most Notable Feature. Paris is separated by the River Seine creating the Left Bank (South Side) and Right Bank (North side). Both areas have taken on their own style and culture. Take a river boat cruise and check out the numerous bridges that cross the river throughout the city.
Great for a walk or river cruise. So many beautiful bridges and buildings alongside the river. Definitely worth a walk (we did daily) and a river cruise.

A long history on the waterfront. As you tour Paris you`ll want to stop every time you walk across or get near the river. Everything that comes close to it seems to have some type of historical significance. The river itself, that is the water color, etc. isn`t what`s so amazing, it`s the bridges, buildings and boats that come into contact with it. And just so you know a boat tour is a great way to see it and it`s also a great way to do so while relaxing and giving your feet a rest.
River cruise... Nice views. Was on a cruise to see the river... Very nice... Some nice sights all along.The eiffel tower, louvre, Notre dam.... To name a few

River history. Great way to spend an hour. Lots of history to see along the river. You can get onboard right next to the Eiffel tower, across the road. If you like sight seeing and history you will love this. Does not cost much. You can buy your tickets online before you travel, we did and we had no problems.

Beautiful Evening walks. My wife and I walked the Seine every evening for the last seven days. It's beautiful especially if you go past the crowded tourist areas and have the river all to yourself. We would usually start at Notre Dame Cathedral and walk toward Orleans. Once you get past the latin quarter there are no crowds at all and it's a nice romantic walk. Walk down one side, cross over, and come back on the east bank.

Beautiful at any time of the day or night. Either a walk along the river or a cruise boat tour, both are a must do while in Paris at anytime of the day. I do recommend the boat tour cruise. If you’ve never been to Paris before I recommend to do the boat tour on your first or second day so you can get all the information on the important places and check them out later. Start from the Eiffel tower and walk to the Notre-Dame cathedral along the river and you can already pass by some of the most important places in Paris and its several bridges.
Boat tour. Took a boat tour at night. The city is much prettier in the daytime. The river is dirty but it's a fun way to see the city.

Great way to see Paris. There is much to observe on the river from the many bridges and walkways in Paris but it also an ideal way to view Paris from the river on one of the many river taxis or excursions. There is just so much history to the river itself.
Iconic waterway. Ok, not the greatest or most scenic waterway in the world, but it allows for a walk with views of some of Europes architectural treasures.

Amazing tour on the river. Delightful tour on the Seine. We had boarded one of the tours which provided a pretty reasonable rate for hop on hop off service for 2 consecutive days. One can see some of the major attractions in Paris along the ride.

Night tours of the Seine. Every trip to Paris needs at least one cruise of the Seine. Many operators will offer packages if you are wanting to tick a few boxes. I went on the 6.30pm cruise, Night time Eiffel Tower and a night time Illuminations tour of the city. I walked into Paris City Vision agency and they had some daily specials at reduced rates. You can google their offices two of which are near the Louvre. The night cruise dependant on what time of year you go can be cold so you may have to rug up. Paris comes to life of a night time. Bus tour Ok but there are only a couple of seats on the bus where you get a good view.

Beautiful river . This river is a beautiful river in the heart of Paris. Being ftom London Instantly compared it to the Thames and I think it's much more pleasant and the view of it from the Eiffel tower is amazing. Worth a walk along this river.

Marvellous. A beautiful river meandering through the city.
Full of carachter and busy with a tourist boats.
Most sights are near it

Enjoy a River Tour on the Seine. Cruising the River Seine in the late Afternoon /Early evening through Paris is a great way to enjoy the many wonders of Paris. With it's multiple bridges with fascinating stories of their history, it's a perfect adventure. Once the lights turn on the sites take on another life.

Lunch cruise 1.5 Hrs. €41pp, a bargain on a freezing cold day in Paris, while waiting for a rugby 9pm KO! Great lunchtime 'activity'. Picked up cruiser near to Pont Neuf near to La Louvre, opposite side over the Bridge. Not far from Highlander Pub, what else do you need on a rugby day!

A Delightful Stroll. My last visit to the banks of the River Seine was nearly seven years ago and since then, it seems like it's being transformed into a walker/cyclist-friendly destination all its own. From restaurants to permanent game boards, the banks of the Seine offer beautiful views and activities for the whole family.

Went On A Boat Trip. I wouldn't bother, just walk to places to see things properly. Catching a glimpse of things theough gaps between people's heads while freezing cold isn't as good as just walking to the places.

Lazy river tour. Very interesting way to relax and learn about what you can see and do during the rest of your trip.
Make sure you sit right at the windows, or you may not be able to see the sights.

Breakthtaking!. We took a river cruise that sailed along the River Seine.
We also took a stroll along the riverbank.
It was nice to see people just hanging out by the river.
Definitely a great experience :)

Summer by the Seine River <3. If you like dancing get your shoes ready! In the summer, along the Seine, you will find diverse groups of dance groups open to the public, such as Latin, Tango, Swing/Lindy Hop, Folk, etc. If you don't know how to dance, don't worry, they offer free lessons!!

Batobus can not say enough to praise this service. Two day pass allows travel up and down the river in a loop for under 29 euro, the ticket is like gold any stop as many times as you like all day, has stations at major attractions and is a dry and relatively warm way to see the city from the water
It's a river. The Seine is a river, plane and simple. Having said that it's Paris's river and is worth looking at - and maybe a boat ride?

Difficult to visit without encountering the Seine!. Very difficult to visit Paris without encountering the beautiful river Seine. But for my money, the finest way to experience the Seine is by booking a lunchtime cruise on a Bateau Mouche (restaurant boat). Menus are available in English.
Wonderful way to see many sites!. We did a tour that included tickets for a river cruise. This is a great way to see many sights. Also the bridges are worth the trip alone.
Excellent view. River Seine surrounds the Paris city, gives excellent and beautiful view from Eiffel Tower. You will love the cruise trip with your mate and walking over the Seine bridge.
Charming scenery. We walk along Seine River and it's well worth to spend your day here! I like the book stall along the Seine River. I've bought some postcard here.

Lovely evening cruise!. An evening cruise along the Seine is a must when staying in Paris! It gives you the opportunity to take beautiful photographs of the surrounding landscape!
Most of the tours have very good audio guides too! Well worth a trip!
relaxing. sitting by the river is so relaxing, just watching the world go by and forgetting all you'r worries. its gorgeous day or night, i prefer night as its all lit up. go have a little sit.
River dinner cruise. We did a Sunday 18:00 dinner cruise, expensive circa 85 Euro a head, excellent service (a rare thing in Paris) very good food and great bridges over the Seine.

Dinner Cruise. Excellent option to see everything from a different perspective if you can find one fairly priced. I used Bateaux Parisians and the food and boat were great, I just wish we had a longer time to enjoy the sights!

Stroll Down the Left Bank and Take in Paris. There are few better ways to take in Paris than by walking along the Seine. You'll pass some of the greatest architectural gems on the way. Alternatively take a river cruise. Great way to see the city

Lovely cruise on the Seine - an absolute must. Took a river cruise on the seine as part of the Big Bus tour.. It was fantastic going down the river listening to the interesting commentary on head phones.. and watching all the historic buildings and bridges pass by.. Inside the boat it gets very hot like a green house , so it makes sense to go outside and get the cool breeze once yu are done with the commentary.

Day long scenic walks for the physically active. The sides of the Seine River are both scenic and idyllic at times. The city of Paris has put a lot of work into making it a pleasure to follow the Seine along on foot or on bike.Interspersed with lookout, places to to take a break or even picknick, it is a great way of getting a real feel of Paris.Beyond being worth it by itself the river will take you past many interesting sites. From the Eifel Tower, to the Louvre and the Musée d'Orsey, Notre Dam and the Ilse de la Cité up to the more modern Bibliothèque, not to mention the myriad of interesting and historical bridges crossing the river itself.Worth it for many many reasons.

Spectacular cruise. We took a river cruise in sunny day . It was fantastic cruise . we saw every thing in Paris beside the river . I would definitely recommend that everyone do this ... It's worth a visit

Take your lunch break around the water, relax and catch your breath!. The river itself is relaxing and there are plenty of spots to sit down with a baguette, cheese, and wine. Take a break from all the walking, sight-seeing, shopping, etc.

See Paris from a new perspective: the Seine River. We prepaid for the Seine river cruise from the Bateaux Parisiens company and were quite pleasantly surprised. First, the flexibility of the hours were much appreciated, as our tickets let us board any time every half hour between 10:30am-10:00 pm. The boat has glass for walls and ceiling so you can see tall buildings on both banks. It starts at the base of the Eiffel Tower at pontoon 3, and ends there as well. They gave us ear phones to plug-in with about 15 channels for various languages. The dialogue was a little bit hokey but we laughed and enjoyed it. Most of the boat is enclosed but there is a narrow outdoor deck with railings if you want to feel the breeze. Paris is a city built on the river and it was fantastic to see the familiar monuments from a different point of view. We highly recommend it.

Beautiful!!. We took a river cruise on the Seine!! It was totally worth it! I would definitely recommend that everyone do this! You get to see all of the main attractions!! And this helps in choosing which ones to visit!!

Pre-eminent water "Landmark" of Paris. The River Seine figured prominently during my walking tour of Paris last month. My colleagues and I strolled along the bridges and the path along side the water, and was our navigational and scenic pathway to other sites, such as the Notre Dame Cathedral, the Louvre, and Jardin des Tuileries. Many a runner and walker strode the same footsteps - a future visit will definitely include a running the route along the River Seine (à la Paris Marathon). A "landmark" in of itself representing Paris to visit!
If you can, take a boat ride. It is worth the views, especially of the Eiffel tower and a great way to still sight see without having to walk around, while enjoying the air and sun.
a must see in paris. took a cruise down this river after he proposed at the eiffel tower absolutely amazing. the cruise was included in a BIG BUS TOUR we purchased
River Cruise. We went on a cruise on the River Seine. It was a nice cruise and we had a great time. It's not that long if you're looking for a short tour.

Best use of Euro's in Paris is a boat!. The tour on the boat was worth more than anything else we bought. You're getting a great setting, a safe and peaceful tour, and a real feel for what Paris is. One thing everyone could enjoy doing in Paris!

Boat cruise on the Seine. The cruise on the Seine was worth the money to see Paris from the water. Be sure to be careful on the name and location of the boat line as a number of them have similar names but are long distances apart. Seeing Paris from the water with a tour guide was a good experience

Boat ride is must when in paria. Good neat boat ride the ride is one hour fifteen minutes and it is good fun.
Must have to see the city in one hour, the cost is around 24 euro

Dinner cruise. We took a cruise on a Thursday night at 8 pm. There is a good amount of confusion about location for cruise departures along the river. Verify this when you book; we even tried using GPS coordinates and they were not accurate. We didn't find the cruise to be that good on this occasion because the water was too high for the operators to make all scheduled stops. They issued walking tour vouchers to all guests to make up for this but we were leaving the next day and couldn't use the vouchers.

Can't miss in Paris. You definitely won't miss the Seine if you're spending time in Paris, since it runs through the center of the city, but it's a lovely place to have a picnic if the weather's nice or you can walk along Paris' various bridges and admire the lovely views from there.
Nice one. Nice, big, calm river. Definitely take a cruise so you can see every major point of interest in Paris. You will go past Louvre, Notre Dame, Eiffel and many more and also many bridges.

This is a very busy water way and is very brown. The current is very fast and it has lots of boat traffic on it. I do love walking along the river. If you walk along the river you will get to a lot of the sites you want to see and the shopping as well. This is Paris hold tight to all bags and be very aware of your surrounding as Paris is the worst for scams and pickpockets. Know who's up on you and around you at all times.

Definitely do. The cruise in the river Seine was really nice because we had a guide that gave details about the buildings we were seeing. The price was not very expensive. The negative was that during Christmas time there were so many tourists and you had to wait a lot.

Rio Sena..... When in Paris take a boat trip up the Sena. Shop around a little on the quay as prices vary. On Quay 3 the price was 18 euros per head. If the day is sunny it is a very pleasant trip. There are also trips that include dinners and lunches (obviously at a higher price). The boats are docked near to the Eiffel Tower.

Go on a river cruise. We got a cruise along the river at sunset. it was nice to see the city from the river. You get to go under all the bridges as the people wave at you . would be nice in summer aswell as winter
Amazing area!. I would recommend to take a boat tour on Sekwana and a walk around after that. It's a lovely area with many street artists and well known attractions.
Just Wander. Seriously just walking next to the river is the best way to spend an afternoon. Shop, people watch picnic. Watch paris go by.
You Can't Miss this River LOL!. No cruises on this trip because it was cold and windy but I can say that I've walked along the Seine River in Paris!

very seine-sual. To get the most out of your next trip to Paris, do the town first by boat. Purchase a day pass about 16 dollars at any one of the following stations clearly indicated - tour eiffel, champs elysees, musee d'orsay, louvre, saint germain des press, notre dame, hotel de villdm jardin des plants. It operates on the hop on hop off concept and is certainly the best and the most romantic way around the great monuments of the most beautiful city, probably in Europe. No false notes. The personnel is helpful and English speaking. Be sure to choose a sunny day.

Promenades . Just a few minutes walk from Notre Dame, it's a very lovely walk along the river. It would appeal to people who like taking pictures, running outdoors or just chilling. There are several Cafes around and the love bridge is also a few minutes walk from here.
Stunning. Next time we're in Paris we have to do a cruise.It was still nice walking along the banks but on a boat would be the way to see it at it's best

Beautiful to walk along during the day. The river is very pretty and acts as a great "guide" to Paris. If you start at the far end by the Eiffel Tower, you can walk along it and hit almost all of the touristy stops on your way (Champ Elysees/Arc de Triumph, museums, the Louvre, Notre Dame and the Latin quarter). If you're fit enough to do that amount of walking, it's an easy and healthy way to see a beautiful city without spending a ton of money.
A grand river.. With it's central location it's hard to miss. Nice walk along the side with great wiews on both sides.
night dinner cruise. meal was terrible, but they were catering for large tour bus, maybe a bit too hard. boat ride was lovely, views were spectacular, commentary was good.

River cruise. You will see River Seine quite often when you do the sightseeing in Paris. Many bridges in the city. For example, at Eiffel Tower, Musee Orsay, Notre-Dame, etc. I am sure during summer time, the boat ride will be nice. The river is quite clean, didn't see much garbage. At the Eiffel Tower, there is a stop for the river cruise tour.

All Day and All night. I love to cycle and walk along the Seine. I don't know why, its not particularly attractive, the bridges are nice. But perhaps some of the quite contemplative characters that make their appearances at all hours to think about whatever they are thinking about captivates me. The river changes depending on whether you are heading east or west. Its possible to cycle this using the Eiffel tower as a reference, but the journey westward is less interesting.

A different perspective. We did the croisiere tour which lasts 1 hour and 10 minutes from Pont de l'Alma, using the Bateaux Mouches boat company. Great value. Wonderful views. It's one of the "must do/no argument" things one has to do in Paris. You will kick yourself if you don't.

Beautiful and Ugly. The river seine isnt an attraction, it is just a river. Try jogging along the river pathways until you get to stinky pathways, then get out of the river. The river also goes through the Louvre, so you can make a visit to the Louvre and get so exercize. What i didnt like is that some of the river pathways smell weird, it made my insides want to come out. Otherwise, the river is beautiful.
Amazing. Romance, history. So many amazing attractions within walking distance from one another along the river. Worth coming to France for!
Very pretty!. Beautiful river. Great for pics and if you can get some history about the river and it's use - really interesting.

Walk on the seine. After walking the jardin Tuileries and admiring the beauty of the building that is the louvre on a beautiful March day we decided the que for the gallery was just too long for us on a weekend break so we took to our feet again and headed for the river. Walking to the pont neuf and Norte dame along the river discovering a quiet square along the way beautiful and typically French .My new girlfriends heart melting in the atmosphere....

Lovely river stroll. Tip: Do this first when you come to France. It can show you around the attractions and puts your perspective on the places that you'll later visit. The perks of doing this in the daytime is that you'll see the structures of the buildings clearly.The perks of doing this in the nighttime is the lovely lights illuminating the bridges. Pray that it doesn't rain, because then you'll have a plastic covering your boat. THe tour will still push through, but you can't appreciate the sights through the plastic. Come early to secure the seats near the sides of the boat.
cruise. we could see many momentum from the river I love it .relaxed while enjoying the river cruise while seeing the history of Paris we went on the day time cruise

Beautiful River to walk along. This river and the bridges that pass over it are absolutely stunning. You should walk along it at least once if you plan on visiting Paris. A lot of tourist destinations are along this route to include the Louvre, Notre Dame Cathedral, and Pont Alexandre III.
Last day.. We took a day cruise on our last day, and glad we did. So much to take in along the river. Night time must be awesome.
River Cruise . U can see many momentum from the river I love it ...cos u r enjoying the river cruise while seeing the history of Paris

A must Tour. We took river Seine cruise in evening and it was spectacular, you experience Paris by just being on this river, we got to see various highlights and important monuments while travelling on river.
Wow! Lights reflected off the river . It was our first trip to Paris. And that evening, seeing the lights reflected off the river was what made us fall in love with the city of light. It is magical.
Love the many ponts (bridges) that connect the neighborhoods.. The bridges allow nice viewpoints of the river, and the walks along the river Seine are enjoyable and picturesque.

Amazing views. We got a Batobus hop on and off boat trip, the river seine is amazing with great views of Paris. If your in Paris i would recommend a ride down the Seine i great way to see Paris and relax. With a Batobus ticket it will allow you to get on and off at Paris top attractions which are located by the river or just a short walk away.
River cruise . Cruised the river with Avalon to visit the Normandy Beaches. It was chilly at times going out and about but such great fun.

Historical waterway. My husband and I visited Paris 4 times, and every time we walked along or took a cruise down the Seine.In 2015 on a Trafalgar Battlefields Tour of Europe, we were given the history of The Seine." It was one of the original objectives of Operation Overlord in 1944. The Allies' intention was to reach the Seine by 90 days after D-Day. That objective was met. An anticipated assault crossing of the river never materialized as German resistance in France crumbled by early September 1944. However, the First Canadian Army did encounter resistance immediately west of the Seine and fighting occurred in the Forêt de la Londe as Allied troops attempted to cut off the escape across the river of parts of the German 7th Army in the closing phases of the Battle of Normandy." Research the history of this magnificent waterway before you go, take a tour of it, and definitely a river cruise.

You absolutely must take a boat ride on the river. There are various companies offering rides on the Seine. Some are just tour boats, others are dining boats. Prices vary, but find one that you can afford and do it. This is the best view of Paris. Well worth spending your budget on this splurge!
Batobus River Boats. The trip on the Batobus had 9 different "on and off " stops which enabled you to hop on and off as often as you liked, depending upon the attraction you wanted to visit.

truly lovely. very pleasant walking along the River Seine- seeing all the cruisers and boats to dine on. Also River taxi which is great for sight seeing. We enjoyed walking down there in the evening all lit up and sitting outside and having a coffee/cocktail and bite to eat even in March with the patio heaters on was pleasant.

River cruise. Wonderful experience, we got to see some of the beautiful sights from the River Seine, the 1 hour cruise went so quickly! I would defiantly recommend during a visit to such a beautiful city.

I love the river. We rented a place on the Seine and i could watch the ship traffic all day, walk its bridges and enjoy the many sites nearby, up and down the river. We used the ferries as transportation but didn't take a cruise.
It's a river. . Some places on the river are more charming than others, so walk a little and find the cute places otherwise it's just a river. Chances are if you're in Paris, you'll see it!
Lovely walk along . Take sometime off to walk along the river between the attractions. On a sunny day watch the gulls and the mallards and spend a quite few hours if possible
riverview. It's a bit dull, somewhat better in French than in English. It isn't a long trip, but, all in all, dull is the best word for it.Maybe other tourist boats go farther along the river

Take a boat trip on the Seine for the experience. We took a nice boat trip in the Seine that included fine dining and entertainment. We really enjoyed seeing the sights from the boat. There are some things you will only see from the water. We created some great memories...
Lovely walk. It was a cold and blustery day but the walk was refreshing. Lots of boats up and down to get on to...we didn't feel the need for boat travel but the Seine is great.

A great way to see Paris at a different angle. Our river cruise was efficient enjoyable and a great way to see several special attractions from the very different angle of a boat...we cruised at twilight and saw Paris light up through our journey ...even to the buttresses at the back of the Notre Dam which are lit to appear like the cathedral may fly

Great for a stroll, jogg or just feel the atmosphere. If you have 5 minutes over in a tight schedule, take a walk along the Seine to breath the atmosphere. If you want to run in the morning, run along the Seine. It is a world class run!
It's a river❣. Beautiful yachts, floating restaurants, and quaint houseboats to look at tho…. I would definitely recommend!! It's wonderful place to walk/jog along!

Truly fun experience. We went on a river cruise up the Seine at night and saw all of the beautiful lights of Paris along the way. Upon our return down river, the lights of the Eiffel Tower began flashing at the top of the hour. It was a beautiful view and experience.

Relaxing boat trip. At the end of a busy day we decided to take the hour boat trip. Started at the Eiffel Tower, went down the Seine around Notre Dame and back to Eiffel Tower. Relaxing trip with commentary on head phones. Great views of the Tower.

A MUST DO. The Seine is amazing, the view you see when you travel along it can be breathtaking, from run down river boats, to huge river restaurants and all the beautiful architecture Paris has to offer.

A great way to see the city. If you are in Paris for at least couple of days, you can get a two day BatoBus Pass, which is not much more than a one day pass. The pass allows you to hop-on and hop-off on the river at key tourist sites/areas. This is NOT a tour guide service, but a cheap and lovely way to travel along the river.
Beautiful. Lovely hour or so spent wandering down the embankment for the Seine, it was early evening and the sun on the water was beautiful.

A lovely river. we enjoyed a wonderful boat ride on the River Seine and enjoyed all the beautiful scenery it had on a day trip. Would have loved to experience it in the evening as well. Next time I reckon :)
Big and breezy. Runs through the heart of the city so great for keeping you bearings. Pathways along both sides so you can get really close. Can't say much more

Dreamy. You can find yourself walking along the seine or simply jumping onto a boat to sail down the river. Either way you cannot visit Paris and not take in this beautiful sight. We caught a day trip boat ride just opposite the Eiffel Tower and spend a couple of hours sailing up and down the Seine which had to be one of our most favourite experiences whilst in Paris. If you travel down river far enough you will also find a smaller 'statue of liberty'. You spend the entire trip relaxed with numerous glasses of french wine (whatelse), fine foods and thw most breath taking views along with the stories of the city along the way. One of my highlights was going under the bridges. The architecture is simply the best I have ever seen.Please take the time out to spend some time on this beautiful river.
Great place to wallk. Take a stroll on the River Seine and enjoy the activity on and off the water. This is a good place to see artist and perhaps purchase a great momento of your Paris trip.
Cruise dinner. I enjoyed our cruise dinner here. Also in this river u will see the love lock bridge. Not so many padlocks now but still pretty to experience it.
Splendide!. I went through the Seine river by close to chatelet. The sun was beautiful, and the view one the most fatastic I had never seen. Again!

Winter visit . I hear a lot of people complain that it smells. I am here in Paris winter, and smell nothing. It's nice. Really good walk along the river, beautiful views. But I suggest to do it in winter
River cruise was beautiful at night and so peaceful . This was the end of our second day and we walked miles round Paris so this was a lovely way to relax and enjoy it at night *****
Grab a Crescent & Enjoy!. The best way to enjoy the River Seine is to grab some amazing French pastry, go for a stroll, and and just savor both!
