Night time river cruise down the seine . Definitely worth doing, especially as the sun is setting. You get to see so much on the cruise. Get on at the Eiffel Tower, the cruise lasts around 45 mins with champagne. Also walk along the seine during the day!
Tranquil. Nothing better than a walk along the Seine. Didn't take a boat trip on this visit but well worth a day pass for 16 euro ( use it as a step on/ step off bus.)

Running. I think what struck us the most about the river was the amount of people that were running on either side and along the river. It was very safe, friendly and what a great place to get a few miles in. Of course Paris, isn't warm by any sense and being a big city there are places that aren't the cleanest, but nonetheless it beats a treadmill!

Walk from Pont de l'Alma on the Left Bank as far as the Notre Dame. There is no entry on Trip Advisor for the Jardin Flottant Nikki de Saint Phalle, which is a relatively new green space on the left bank of the Seine, one of the places on my "to see" list on this trip to Paris. The roadway for cars was replaced with a green space, bike paths, walking and jogging paths, play areas, etc., and it is a delightful walk right next to the river (not on the upper sidewalk, which we've walked in the past. The Floating Garden is just one part of this whole development, and, unfortunately, it was not accessible in the winter - the little cross bridge was raised. But there was enough to see and enjoy and imagine how delightful it must be in the spring and summer months. There have been some interesting articles about this development in Paris, reclaiming areas for pedestrians and making it harder for cars to pollute the city. Sure, some motorists are not happy, but I think the trend is great - I understand the project is not yet complete and I hope to see it extended on my next visit to Paris. This is what I returned to Paris for, and I was not disappointed.

beautiful river,beautiful feeling walking along Seine. When you are in Paris for seven days only,you have to visit every part of the city to convey the spirit and life of Parisians..at first it is this beautiful river Seine..One evening my boyfriend and I had bought some beer and set on the wall next to the river,looked around,have some photos..all around us there were young people,sitting,talking,laughing..it is wonderful atmosphere..Otherwise, the river is beautiful, you will see beautiful boats along the river.There are the ships tours, so if you like to look left and right sides of the city and beautiful art buildings rising on both sides this is nice way to do it.The price is about 15 e.They made the entire children's workshops, models of buildings and cities, tables and chairs to enjoy playing chess and other board games.You could see that walking one side by the river.Really nice,we enjoyed ..

Boat tours are cool, but not a place for a romantic walk like you might think. Boat tours are cool, but not a place for a romantic walk like you might think. Couple of joggers along the few paths that are only in lil areas, but definitely not a place to plan a romantic walk as there is nothing down there and the paths are few and far between. Take a boat tour instead
Beautiful river and tour. Highly recommend. Very nice views of the city at night! One of the best tours we found during our trip. Beautiful and the history is incredible.

do the autobus hop on hop off to see the river. the autobus was the best way to see the river and hop on hop at your convenience, off at the primary attractions along the way. 16E per adult, but saved a lot of walking.
Hubby is a photo taker, this really helped him get great views of the eifel tower, notre dame
note; THERE IS NO WASHROOM ON BOARD.
Meets all expectations. Walking along the River Seine is a lovely experience and despite the hype it does have that romantic feel to it.
Iconic. Really great to walk or run along the banks and absorb the atmosphere and architecture. Truly great and not at all 'stinky'
River Cruise. We could not do the Eiffel Tower, so we did a river cruise. It was very enjoyable and we saw quite a bit.

A backdrop to some of world's most famous sights. We have visited Paris many times since 1978 and have walked and jogged along the banks of the Seine in both directions several times in each visit. The river is amazing as it flows around Isle de la City, and Isle St Louis at a great rate. The bridges are lovely and numerous making walks along the river as long or as short as you want. Sometimes in the early mornings one sights the river police in their boat going downstream with one or more officers in wetsuits, masks and snorkels swimming alongside.Before peak hour, if you are a runner, jogger, or walker you meet many locals doing the same.

Night dinner cruise on the River Seine. Totally worth it to experience so take your family or romantic interest on a cruise during the day but I recommend a night cruise. You get to see the city lights and sites at night and the Eiffel tower as it illuminates on the hour with blinking lights, very romantic. Enjoy

Just love rivers running through a city. And the Seine is no different... it adds an air of tranquility to a busy city... an air of steadfastness and reliability, which affects everything in town... whether they are aware of it or not.... I love the Seine, walking along it, and it's "ripples'....
Beautiful and historic. Paris is an amazing city. My husband and I throughly enjoyed walking along the river and picnicking with locals!

Trip up the River Seine. We took the Batobus up the river from behind the Eiffel Tower and for 14 euros there were 8 stops which you could get on or off at your leisure. Seeing all the beautiful buildings at the side of the river was really amazing. It was a brilliant way of getting around the city!

Relaxing Overview. I find a Bateaux Mouche cruise along the Seine to be a ritual and relaxing way to see the city sitting down. Take Metro 9 to Pont de l'Alma. Cost for one adult was €13.50. Although many on my outing braved the cold and sat on the upper deck, they joined me in the indoor seating area half-way through. The colorful tickets make a nice souvenir for your scrapbook. No need to order online to avoid long lines in February. Background on the sites passed is presented in several languages so is brief. Recommend reading up before you go to fully appreciate what you see.
Essential Paris. The Seine dominates Paris, its history, its pictures.. see the vendors along the top...Walk below and touch the river. Ride a boat. Listen to the stories.
Neat. We walked the Seine from Notre Dame to the Eiffel Tower. We had a couple drinks and shopped along the way. All in all great plae to spend the day.

Batobus on the Seine.. The Batobus on the Seine Is an absolute must. Talk about fun and convenient and inexpensive! You can sit and ride all day or get on and off whenever you wish. Such fun waving to the locals gathered along the banks in the late afternoon. They have bread, cheese, wine, their friends or sweetheart. Often, someone is playing musc and people are dancing in small groups. A beautiful way to see all the major sights in a fun, safe, easy, convenient, inexpensive way.

See it at night. A lovely sight, running through the center of Paris. It is especially beautiful at night, with the lights of the city reflecting off the water. Take a cruise - it is worth the effort.

Wonderful. This was a lovely trip even for my dad in his wheelchair. The crew were very helpful getting my dad on-board & we were given priority boarding & exiting. It was a lovely sunny day & the cruise was brilliant
Peaceful walk by the river. To get away from the traffic walk along the riverside. Plenty of restaurants to stop and dine if you want some refreshments.

A must to visit during day or night!. The views are completely different between day and night time. If you can, try to time your river cruise just before sunset. The view is incredible of the Eiffel Tower. Many many historic building along the river! We went on the "Bateaux-Mouches" river cruise and we had a wonderful time.
Magical. Rivers are always beautiful. The river Seine is just awesome. Great for romantic walks and cruises or simply relaxing while watching traffic across it.

Beautiful view along the river. We walked a lot along the River Seine and I have to say.. Paris is really romantic and beautiful city, just like they say in the movies. We were walking from Notre-Dame de Paris to Tour Eiffel, and it is just amazing to experience the city by the river.
Beautiful. The river boat cruises would be great here, so much history on the Seine and surrounding it. Really is a beautiful view of Paris from the river.
Big and long. This river is visible throughout the middle of the city and has many points of access. The current is strong so its not suitable for swimming.
Beautiful!. I kept on going back to the Seine on multiple occasions one of which was a morning jog.. Beautiful river nice for a walk alongside the river! (When its not raining.)
Ticks all the boxes!. Went on a cruise aroound Paris, and I got to see so many things and also we were provided with an audioguide in many languages..

Evening Boat Cruise with Dinner. A cruise down the Seine at night is incredible. You will see the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Louvre and many more beautiful buildings and bridges spectacularly lit-up. We opted for a dinner cruise booked through Viator which was fantastic value.

The River Seine was in Flood!. This is no ones fault but the weather, but we had booked a tour with Batobus, for Wednesday where you hop on and off at various locations on the Seine, this of course was cancelled, due to the River Seine in flood. Yet there are no refunds, and I brought the tickets online in the UK, to save time queuing.
Beautiful. We loved being around the seine, took a boat ride and it was truly lovely to see the sights from the river.

stunning views. we walked along the river , even though it was quite cold it was stunning. whichever bridge you decide to go over the views are amazing. we sat on the bridge near Notre Dame just to enjoy the view & it was spectacular

Take it or leave it. We purchased a one hour cruise with our Hop-on-hop-off bus tickets.If you're keen then sit outside for the best views. We found you cant see the sites the best from down in the river, except the rear of Notre Dame. If you are an avid history buff you'll love the bridges but if you dont know French history you may get lost in it all.I was disappointed there was so little said on the audio, more silence than sound. We also never heard what the river was used for, only the buildings at the edges.We just sat back and enjoyed the hour of rest in a big day of walking.*note: cruises board at Eiffel Tower.
Paris. The river is a central (no pun intended) part of Paris. Walking along the river even in the rain is a must do. It is also very peaceful and pretty.
Great experience! . This was the highlight of my trip! It was very cold on the top deck of the boat but it was definitely worth it as we got amazing views and some great photos!

Boat trip. Great views and a great way to get an overview of the city. Relaxing and beautiful. Lovely ice cream stalls to visit. You can buy a picnic basket to enjoy on the boat trip too. Great way to spend an afternoon!

The spine if not the heart of the city. Although this river travels for miles beyond Paris it is sinonymous with the character of the city.It is still a working river and some areas are quite industrial but as it flows through the centre of Paris it's banks reflect the character of each neighbourhood it travels through. The bridges over the Seine each have their own character and history and are worth spending time investigating too.
Glad God put it there.. A wonderful aspect of visiting Paris is to stroll along the Seine. Not to be missed.Pretty hard to do that and see Paris.
Family Picnic Time!. We had two great picnics on the river! Many of the local families are there with you. Don't miss out! Something you'll always remember!

Amazing walk in history, Paris. Walking along the Seine you can imagine the history of that has come before, little shops and the historic landmarks along the way. People and professionals take pictures while painters immortalize the scene on canvas. A brief walk along the banks of the Seine is a must while visiting.
Great trip on Seine. Only 14 euros for a 1 hour trip well worth the money, the sights to be seen from the river are great

A lovely walk. Its nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of the metro and busy Paris streets. Walking from the Eiffel Tower to Île Saint-Germain does exactly that.....quiet and some great boats and views of this wonderful city

We took and amazing Cruise on the SEINE. Great Way to sit back and relax and take in the sights. The cruise put Paris into perspective for us, it mapped it out and allowed us to get to know the layout of the city and where everything was. Once we got off the cruise we knew exactly where we wanted to go back to.

Cruise along the seine in the rain can be fun. We explored the Seine with a cruise on a rather wet day. To some that may sound hideous but inside it was a lovely way to see the sites and for once just sat down relaxing!

Lovely photo opps. Saw the river Seine by the Eiffel Tower stretch, can only imagine how it must be during the summer months. Lovely restaurants. Saw a lot of runners and dog walkers. Nice place to take pictures.

Fun. Went in 2011 with a large group of girls. Very fun, if with good company for the boat trip, and its best to go in spring/summer time as the weather won't spoil the views that way. Definitely would go again if in Paris! :)

Popular River. The River Seine is a popular attraction and maybe at other times of the year it is more appealing as it looked rather dirty and uninviting. The structures and bridges are still alluring and it makes for a good backdrop pic. There were still boats available even in this season although everywhere you walk in that area you are surrounded by the River.
Beautiful waterway. Take a trip by boat, or walk along the rivers edge. A wonderful way to see the city and best at night enjoying the city of lights.
In full winter flow. The river was constantly tumbling And turning and lapping over the pathways creating a beautiful tumult through the mid of Paris. If it wasn't so cold you could watch for hours
Cruise. Was a lovely experience to see Paris from a different perspective - really lovely to get pics of Eiffel
Do the tour at night. We had a great nightly tour! Paris is a blaze at night! The river cruise is well worth the price we paid! I would recommend a tour on the Seine!

The water stinks bcuz of the sewage, but it's very pretty. This is very pretty river, you can literally see the heart of Paris on a boat ride... We booked a tour with fat tire and the tour took us on a boat tour also! It was spectacular! Highly recommended

Best Views of the Seine River. Here are our favorite and best places to see the Seine River are these places:Square du Vert Galant. Any of the bridges crossing the river to Ile de la Cite and Ile St. Louis.

What's not to like?. Take the Bateau Bus if you have never been to Paris before, or if you are with children of any age, or if you are with someone who basically hates cities. If you are not a child and love cities you will still love this great cheap way to see Paris and understand how to get around.

An urban river with a whole lot of history and lots of Cafe's. This is a typical big city river with one huge exception. The historic buildings and their stories are what sets this river apart. Whether it is awe of Notre Dame or the riverside tower of the Conciergerie ( called "the Babbler" from the pain induced sounds emanating from it), history is what the Seine is about. Of course, its beauty helps a lot.Take a stroll, see some history, enjoy a meal at a cafe and all is good with the world.However I still miss the Bridge of locks

The Main Artery through Paris. This is such a majestic way from which to view some of the many attractions in Paris. It passes right next to the Notre Dame Cathedral and near the Louvre Museum just to mention two. It is accompanied by many public walkways, passes underneath many historic/ awesome bridges and even the Metro can be heard snaking past hidden ventilation ducts. It's very easy to forget about the River Seine when confronted by so many appealing historic buildings and attractions but this river was actually there before all of that. This river has a history of itself which laid witness to the building and creation of Paris...
Night cruise . Definitely has to be on the agenda! Just went way too fast. Something about cruising @ night while enjoying a lovely meal & great company
Nice. Beautiful scenery, great place for relax. Fantastic river cruises and wonderful views. Definitely worth exploring.

Cool sight, nice to walk, but not really a main attraction.. The river was dirty when I saw it. The sights from the boats were cool. The area was a secondary site for me, though. I wasn't as awe struck with it as I was with the Rhein in western Germany or the Thames in London.

Valentine's holiday . Beautiful way to see Paris and some of its amazing history and buildings. I highly recommend the Parisien trip as it comes with commentary that helps you understand the history very nicely. Best to do it on a Sunday day to get the best from the trip.

Honeymoon . I would advise you take drinks on the boat with you as you can't buy them on the boat, we had a talk whilst on the boat of everything you get to see so if you like the history part will be fab, was beautiful weather and I would say this is a must to do whilst in Paris

Dinner River Cruise worth a go!. We had a fantastic summers evening cruising down the Seine. The relaxed atmosphere was great and being able to enjoy a quality meal made it even better. Highly recommend if time allows while your in Paris.

Valentine's weekend . A walk along the banks of the Seine on Valentine's Day is just the ticket if you want to impress . Add in the excitement of a 10 k race , Bands playing pop , jazz and band music you could not wish for a more pleasant day .

A Visit to Paris is Not Complete without the River Seine. The river truly sets the scene for any visit to Paris. It's beautiful to walk along; and the bridges are absolutely gorgeous. Easy to have a picnic along; sit on the numerous benches or sit along the edge of the river and let your feet dangle. No visit to Paris is complete without spending some time along the river!

Seine River Cruise. The River Seine has always been inseparably bound with the image of Paris in my mind. The river and its banks are incredibly beautiful. Many of the most precious Paris landmarks are situated alongside the river. No wonder the banks of the Seine are designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Take a stroll along the banks or, better yet, a cruise along the river and absorb centuries of Paris history. I highly recommend to take one of the river cruises on the Seine. It’s one of the best ways to explore the beauty of Paris. You will see all the famous attractions from a totally different point of view. Besides, passing under all those beautiful bridges is a great experience in itself. No matter if you take the cruise in daytime or at night, it will be one of your most memorable and unique experiences in Paris.

we walked for days along the river. we stayed in the latin qtr and used the river as our main navigation tool. just stay along the banks and you can reach the Louvre, other museums, the Arch, Eiffel and Notre Dame. Beautiful bridges every few hundred yards & lots of vendors along the walls
River cruise. We used this as we were only visiting for a day and it was a great way to see a lot of the views including an amazing view of the Notre Dame Cathedral
Best Scene. If you are visiting Paris. River Seine gives you a lot of opportunity to get a good photo scene. If you are near to eifel tower, try to include it as part of back view.

Romantic. Historical. Charming!. Very historical. The Seine river is one of the most historical destinations in Paris. Along the river, you will be able to see many tourist spots like the Eiffel Tower, Cathedral of Notre Dame in Paris, the upscale part of the city, and many more.

Start your visit with a cruise. Finish your day with a stroll.. The hop on hop off cruise through the core of the city is a good way to become oriented and find the sites you'll want to visit on foot. Then spend at least one evening walking along the river. It's unbelievably romantic.
Bridges and seine. Paris is very famuse with river side, bridges and ofcourse with seine riverTake a boat tour wit a glass aof champagne and enjoy beauty of paris

No one to help.. After not been able to board the river boat as my husband uses a wheelchair we decided to walk back to our hotel in the Republic.Quite a walk but scenic.went past the stables for the president an enjoyable experience.we just couldn't get any one to help us we won't be going back to Paris

Romantic and Charming. The river is very nice and romantic for the tourists and locals. You can see the city from every angle and gain an understanding of the charm of the city. It's very nice and relaxing to walk along the river.

Different Class!. After visiting the Thames a good few times. This river is super organised and incredibly clean with hundreds of different places to view especially if you take one of the numerous boat trips.

A Romantic Evening Cruise. Taking a romantic evening cruise along the Seine has to be a highlight for any couple. You get a different perspective of many historic buildings along the river (Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame). Excellent photo ops.

Another statue of liberty!. It was cool to see another statue of liberty standing in River Seine.
It was not as romantic as it looked in movies, but the bridges and surroundings were interesting enough to walk along the river.

The heart of Paris. Paris was establishet because of the river Seine, which one can see while walking along it or sailing on it. You get by l'Ile de la Cité, Le Louvre and so many other parisian monuments. La Seine is like the essence of Paris. I usuallly go cycling along laSeine every Sunday and Iove it. Try the 13th arrondissement with la Bibliothèque Nationale Francois Mitterand. You'll discover a new, different Paris.

Romantic . This river flows straight through the heart of the city. If you're lucky enough to have the time and the budget, a river cruise is an excellent way to enjoy a meal and take in the beauty of Paris.Many photo opportunities available as there are many bridges (ponts) to stop on and strike a pose.Fabulous thing to go and see

Amazing contfast of old new. We walked along the river and got to experience a farmers market where folks from the country were selling delectable stuffs like pate, cheese, pastries.We ate lunch, sitting on some granite ledge with our feet dangling over the riverAnother time we took a boat tour, got the history of the seaport aspect and could see old worn stones here/there as well as the new as repairs are done over time.

I crossed the River Seine and loved it!. On my way to the Eiffel Tower I crossed the beautiful River Seine and I stopped to take in the beauty of the river, the river boats and the lovely buildings surrounding the river. It was a very pleasant experience. There is also a beautiful footbridge.

Essential Paris. River Seine wouldn't Seine without Paris and vice versa. It meanders through one of the most celebrated cities in the world and one can absorb all that is Paris either walking along it or boating on it. It is mystically romantic and the river itself is alive with French culture and tradition. On a cool summers day a boat ride on the river is not to be missed if you are in Paris. The river looks so wonderful even from top of the Eiffel tower. Its French, its European to the core.

Beautiful . Since I always studied Sean river in geography classes for me was an excitement being there, the place is beautiful and u can walk freely. Just be careful with your belongings there is a lot of thieves

A Must For Your Paris Visit!. We saw in numerous places that this was well worth the effort. We generally don't go out at night after touring all day but were very glad we did this. Paris is the city of lights and nothing shows it off better the a relaxing ride of the River Seine. It is located below the Eiffel Tower and takes about an hour. Very romantic.

River Cruise on the Seine - See all the sites. My partner and I took a river cruise on the Seine at Sunset, it was amazing, you start just down the steps behind the Eiffel Tower and then spend about 45 minutes going down the Seine and then back up. You take in so many of the sites on route and see some amazing bridges.

Cruised from Paris to Rouen. The Seine is a beautiful river with gorgeous scenery along the banks. The water appeared to be very clean and we often saw swans swimming below our cabin window. We also enjoyed going through the locks and went up on top to watch the activity while going through them.

Take a cruise. If you really want to see the river and get a different view of the city, take one of the river cruises. They are not expense, last about 90- 120 min and give you a good view with some useful commentary.

Take a boat ride and get a very good orientation of Paris. There are many tour boats running on the Seine throughout the year. I recommend if doing it in winter try to pic a day that will not be cold or windy otherwise you'll probably stay inside more than not. The boats usually take you on the stretch between the Eiffel tower and the end of Ile St. Louis going around both sides of the Ile la Cite and St. Louis. You will see many of Paris's greatest attractions from this vantage point and give you an idea of how far they are from each other. Along with that its so nice to pass under all of those gorgeous bridges.

The Seine. This is the river right through Paris. Boat rides are available, we took a ride in the stroke of evening, as a result got to witness the beauty of Paris both in day time and night from the midst of the river. The river has many cross overs and boat ride is really enjoyable. There are lot of spaces on each side of the bank where one can seat and relax.

River running through the heart of Pris. this river runs through the heart of Paris. A lot of touristic sites are located on either sides of its bank. at night the sight of the bank from the river looks so heavenly. u can take a river cruise to explore its beauty.

Walk along the Seine. Took a walk along the Seine on our way to the Eiffel Tower. It was a nice walk with benches and trees along the way, where we sat and had a packed lunch. There were children, families, couples, and people out for a jog. It seemed a popular walk for tourists and locals. There were a lot of amazing sights to see along the way only about a block or so on either side of the Seine, so we got to think about some future outings along our walk. The weather was quite windy and a little raining, it would have been better if we took a jacket or a hoodie, so if you're planning the walk in February dress warmly. No special equipment is needed for this walk, but would recommend a camera for some pictures.

Winter River Visit. Had taken the one hour cruise with snacks in the afternoon. Since it was winter time i.e January it was breezy and not warm at all. The cruise was nice with commentary in English & French. The cruise had washrooms on board which is a must during winters.

A boat ride is a must. Take a boat from one of the many locations on the seine, please try the river bus and hop on and off. The views from the river is amazing just gorgeous to see Notre Dame from that view.

You can't see or visit Paris with going over the Seine on bridge or boat. Excellent for people who admire natural beauty, the Seine offers areas where people can sit, eat, talk and take a break while walking through Paris. Excellent photo shots place

Fantastic. Go on one of the many cheap tour boats around 17 euros for an adult and 11euros for a kid if you take the last tour in march around 7pm then on the way back you will see the Eiffel Tower illuminate a sight that will never leave youx

Beautiful for a relaxing stroll!!. We wandered from the Eiffel Tower along the riverbank down to Île aux Cygnes (Isle of Swans) where the replica Lady Liberty can be found, where there is a workout space and clean benches to stop and rest, enjoy the views, share a spot of lunch, from there we walked back along the riverbank as far as Notre Dame, stunning views all the way along.
Walk it!. A walk along the banks of the Seine is one of the most beautiful walks in the world with wide pathways, amazing views, interesting people and activities going on, the bookshops, etc.
Stunning. The views of this river from the topic of the Eiffel tower are absolutely incredible, even more so at night.
Amazing . We went on a bought trip down the river seine of a night! It was beautiful! Boat trip lasted an hour I would defiantly recommend doing this you get a free drink on board also.
Boat tour. Vedette tour was lovely but its a straight river so we just went down & back up which could have been done by walking. Was relaxing though.
Lovely walks. It was always good to walk along the river and we used this alot! there many fantastic picture opportunities.
Beautiful view. I walked down here on many occasions with my boyfriend as we were staying quite close by. Its a super romantic walk in the evenings when all of the fairy lights are on down the river.

Beautiful Stroll. Its a lovely river walk filled with locals and tourists alike. Beware of scam artists asking if you dropped your wedding ring. Do as the locals do and completely ignore all strangers.They will leave you alone. Its a safe place to walk alone morning throughout early evening.

Seine River Cruise & Illuminations of Paris by Cityvision. Our visit was actually August 2014 but I never got around to posting a review.The drive included a tour through Paris’ central avenues past main monuments such as the Arc de Triomphe, Notre Dame, the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre, Vendome Square, Concorde Square & Champs-Elysées.The boat tour took us along along the River Seine going under bridges & past famous landmarks. Good idea to record the cruise so you can remember all the places you go by. Great opportunity for memorable pictures of Paris.The last stop is close to the Eiffel Tower to watch the light show. Pretty amazing.Take a jacket as it does get chilly on the boat tour. We actually bought a couple of souvenir jackets at one of the small shops by the Cityvision tour office as we didn't think about taking one.
Lovely trip. We had a really long walk and come back by boat, enjoyed a baguette and a cold beer while watching the sites. Very enjoyable would recommend. The boat was a bit if a wait but was worth.

Great way to see Paris, take a cruise.. Go at night, the lights of Paris are special. Same goes for the EiffelTower at night, they do a great job lighting it up. These cruises aren't expensive, they take perhaps one hour, and you get a fun idea of what is right there up next to the river.
Do it, Salida1048

River cruise at it's finest!. If you have time make sure you go for a cruise on the River Seine. You can only see so much from the roads but so much more from the river. Each bridge you go under has it's own history and is totally unique from the others. A beautiful tranquil trip and definitely worth while.
Beautiful view. Had high hopes about Paris after watching movies and reading books. After visiting I felt it's overrated. Good to spend an evening by the river Seine.
Cruise or walk bank side, wonderful.. Relaxing early evening cruise along the Seine. Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, the Louvre and more top Paris attractions from the water, a must see.

Paris Portrait. I belive that few things can express Paris as the River Seine. You can walk, go by bike, make sports, run, lunch, drink or just be there!
I experienced a boat guided visit and was a good choice!

Travelled by water taxi. Amazing site to see, take a water taxi, I spent $18 and my ticket was good for a whole day. It takes you through all the major attractions and brings you within walking distance to others. The views you see from the water itself are breathtaking and picturesque, if you have the time to spend a day along the river I would do it.

Beautiful!. We experienced the Seine River from several angles - walking on paths along side it, viewing it from the top of the bell tower at the Notre Dame Cathedral, and riding upon it in Paris's boat transports. All angles were beautiful, serene, and majestic. Even in the middle of the day with the bustling tourist season, the Seine is a wonder.

Iconic View of the Paris. Whether on the river itself, wandering along its banks or crossing one of the numerous bridges you will find a myriad of differing views of this wonderful city.This year we spend a wonderful hour sitting on a bench in the early September sunshine eating a hot Panini and gazing across at Notre Dame Cathedral. A day later we crossed over a bridge crowded with padlocks to the Tuileries Gardens and the following day we crossed further down the river to the Bastille.Impossible to avoid, the Seine is indeed the heart of Paris.

Beautiful Seine - Feel Love. Any travel to Paris won't ever be completed if you do not experience Seine in your own unique way. This beautiful river has many different beautiful sights, you may experience a romantic evening taking your lover along the banks of the Seine, take a lazy walk together enjoying the beauty at the dusk, you may sit with your friends or alone in a bistro cafe, enjoy a hot latte coffee looking at the Seine, you may take a cruise through the river in the evening overlooking all the famous monuments or beautiful buildings of the city across its banks, you may even just stand beside and watch its gentle ripple - no matter what, you will always fall in love with the Seine...
Memorable trip. i recommend a boat trip in the river.. it is so beautiful and you get to see Paris beauty from a different perspective

Walking the River Seine. We did a lot of walking along the river. It is the center of the city to me. The banks have history that make me think of the life that happened on the Seine so long ago. It is still very active. You can cross many bridges and just stare down the river. I will do more of that in my next visit. There are locks on the gates from lovers who placed the lock and threw the key in the river to symbolize their love will be forever.❤️

Paris to Normandy Beaches on Avalon. Absolutely loved this cruise. Visited Monet's Garden, the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre, Normandy Beaches, WWII monuments and American Cemetery, several churches anad abbeys, and small towns along the way. Food was delicious, service was outstanding, definitely recommend it.
Nice experience.. Went on a night cruise on a november so, it was seriously cold. You have to be a bit prepared. Wear a hat and scarves. It was a nice cruise seeing everything all at once.

Your feet will be happy. River Seine is the core of Paris and nearly all important buildings (except Montmartre) are close to its banks. Strolling along its bank streets with all the little art shops is great. But as good and very helpful is the hop on and off river bus (batobus). This can easily take you from one historic building to the next without wearing out your feet and by the way opening stunning views from the waterside.

Must see!. I did a boat tour on the river seine. It was very worth it & a lot of fun. It is a beautiful site. You can hop off & take pictures at the popular attractions. The river seine also has shops and nearby restaurants.Highly recommended!
Love it. Beautiful river, particularly at night. The Eiffel Tower lit up, and other magnificent buildings is stunning particularly viewed from a boat while drinking pink champagne

Use the hop on and off river bus for stunning river views. Enjoyed using the river bus (batobus) I think it was called , it's a hop on and off , stops off at major attractions ....stunning views of the Eiffel Tower .
Romantic River. My wife and I walked along the river, it was very beautiful! It kept our pace slow and let us enjoy the wonderful moment in Paris.

Beautiful River Seine!. Heart of Paris and beautiful too! Sundown cruise on it is absolutely magnificent as it takes you through amazing history and architecture. Loads of bridges over it and you simply can miss it!

GREAT TO STROLL. When in Paris go down to the banks of the Seine and walk along the Quais. You can still see the sights but it is an oasis of calm. We walked from Notre Dame to the Louvre and it was great!

River Seine and Boat Cruise. Wonderful way to experience the sights of Paris is on a sunset cruise down the central Sein river. The river is close to soo many facinating sites and the boat's informative commentary was facinating to listen to via ear phones (or remove the ear phones and enjoy the sunset). Relaxing. Professional. Great value for money. We sat outside along the sides of the cruise boat in summer. rested our weary feet as we had been site seeing all day. Lovely and cool and efficient way to see many of the must see sites. Eiffel tower breathtaking from the river in the dark.
Very beautiful Reiver.. River Seine is very beautiful and you can see a lot of attraction once you take a tour on it by boat.
Loved walking the river. Paris is best seen on foot. Just walk everywhere. Stop and smell the air, watch the people and look at the buildings. Absorb the history.

The true heart of Paris. No visit to Paris is complete with out a river boat tour. Many types and prices are offered with or without dinner. The bigger boats now have recorded messages in many languages as opposed to the original tour with live guides but the experience is only slightly diminished . The Seine was the true heart of Paris and the city grew up around the island know as the Ile de la Cite and the Ile Saint- Louis. Two other must see destinations.

Cruise on the Seine. We took an evening cruise down the Seine and listened to an audio tour during the cruise. Unbelievable to think of all the beautiful art that was produced by this river and being on the river was a great experience.

A Tale from the River Bank. This was something that I've always promised myself I'd do one day and it didn't disappoint, not even a little bit.We walked along the river everyday we were in Paris at some point and covered its length from Pont Mirabeau to Pont d'Austrilitz. There were one or two points were the traffic intruded a little but the easy solution was always to cross onto the south bank it seemed.We spotted a number of sights we'd have missed had we been jumping on and off the metro to cover the distances between some of the other attractions we wanted to see. On our last day we walked well over 4 miles alongside the river along the south bank (we did have to back track a little as I may have made a slight error in navigation) and this provided some of the best views of the holiday.It was peaceful and really rather relaxing and although it was also very very cold we were both well wrapped and there were plenty of spots to be able to stop and partake in coffee or in my case hot chocolate. Wifey did initially think about us taking a river tour but by the third day she'd changed her mind and I have to say I'm rather pleased she did as I found it a far more satisfying experience being able to explore at ground level and to be able to take in all the sights, sounds and textures at first hand rather then sit listening to a diesel engine working away.

Perfect trip. After have a trip with big bus ... we continue with a cruze in alseen river ... the boat is very good and has a two level for sit inside or on the dick ... the river nearly pass throw all the famous places of paris, it takes nearly one hour to go and back to the start at effil tower
classic Europe. cross it to see the Eiffel tower from both sides of the river, worth it , on both sides you find things to do , carrousell, , champs of Mars, great

The views on both sides of river were nice . We walked along the river to get to the landmarks we wanted to go. The views were nice, there were riverside stalls selling posters, postcards and old books which made the walk interesting. Didn't think one needs to make its way specially to see the river seine, just passing it by to get to where you want to go eg Lourve, Arc du Triomphe, etc, is good enough. If you plan to stroll along it, do it during the day.
Pretty. You can't miss it since you're there... We took an evening cruise and it was fun and worth it but bundle up... Went in sept and it was COLD!!

Famous River Landmark. Walking along the Seine is what every tourist does when in Paris. There are river boat tours available. Vendors along the street and the famous locks you can purchase and throw the keys in the Seine. Another Bucket List item checked off.

Great Boat Trip. We took an hours boat ride on the Seine and loved it. We got to see a lot of the stunning architecture on the river banks and gained a little insight to the history of the buildings and Paris itself. Would highly recommend as excellent value and cosy inside the boat on a bitterly cold January day.
Excellent way to see the Paris sights. Took a River Seine tour and it was worth it. Showed a different side of Paris. After a long day walking around the city, taking the ferry was a welcome respite.

Best Backdrop. This isn't as famous as the Nile or as big as the Amazon, but it sure has the best backdrop. The romanticism of Paris is in the allure of the Seine, and no visit here would be complete without a stroll along the riverside or a ride on the water. The river flows westward through the city, so the Left Bank refers to the south side and the Right is the north. Notable bridges that connect the 2 banks are the Pont des Arts (A.K.A. the Love Lock Bridge) and Pont Alexandre III (Paris' most intricate bridge). The river also divides the city into two halves, with districts like Le Marais and Montmartre in the north, and Saint Germain and Montparnasse in the south. Landmarks on the Right Bank include the Louvre, Sacre-Coeur, Champs-Elysees, and the Arc de Triomphe, while the Left Bank has the Eiffel Tower and Luxembourg Gardens. Use the Seine as you reference point to navigate the city.

The Artery of the City. The Seine is to Paris as is the Thames to London. Most of the major attractions of Paris are located alongside or close to the river. Weather depending the Seine provides a navigation to museums, cathedrals and other places of interest while at the same time putting on its own display of river traffic, tour boats and working vessels included.If you get too tired of walking then the hop-on-off boats can provide some respite and different angles from which to see the riverscape of Paris.

Traralgon Band tour. The city of Traralgon band toured the Western front before playing in Paris. part of the trip was acruise down the river Seine. It has changed a lot since my last trip in 2006 much cleaner and attractive.
Take a cruise and see the major landmarks. We took a dinner cruise along the Seine which pointed out the landmarks along our way. They were beautifully lit up and easily noticed.

Timeless, lifeblood of the city. When we think of paris, the first things that comes to mind is the Eiffel tower, not so much the seine, however during our visit to this amazing city this wonderful river played a big part, we walked along it night and day, walked across it, using the many ornate bridges and even cruised on it, seeing the tower come alive at night. After accomplishing all this, one of our must do's, was having a browse of the book sellers on the banks of the Seine. Unlike us, there were only a few souls hardy enough to be out in the cold and rain, but so worth it.

Have to!!. I recommend the hop on, hop off boat up and down the river. Very reasonable pricing, although it does finish around 7pm. There is a little more walking involved compared to taking the bus but it is wonderful for sightseeing!

Walk down at the Seine. I don't care how you get down to the river, but I will tell you there is stairs, all over in the summer, as the road is blocked off from car traffic. And in the winter their are stairwells all over. Go for a Walk, don't just view from one of the many pretty bridges. Talk a ride on one of the boats, it doesn't matter which one, and it's not too expensive either. I had never done this year after year that I came to Paris, and last winter I finally did it, Now I may do it everytime! It is exciting to see Paris from a boat slowing moving down the Seine River. Whether you go by boat or go walk, get near the River it is a magically sport, trust me and DO IT, you will see what I mean once you are there. Enjoy Yourself Mon Ami

Stroll along the Seine. A wonderful way to start out your stay in Paris is to walk everywhere. I recommend strolling along the Seine from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame (must stop at Berthillion for THE best ice cream). It's a long walk but worth it!
Took a night ferry. It was a good experience to take the cruise in the evening just before dinner. Got to see the historic buildings & architectures from a different angle.

A ride on shuttle boats worth as any.. A ride on shuttle boats worth as any.
I went with my wife and we moved from various attractions, was a fantastic experience. In several places the river are nice coffee shop you can enjoy your coffee.

River Seine Romantic Cruise. My husband & I went to London & Paris in November 2015 to celebrate our 39th wedding anniversary. The River Seine Cruise reminds us of our younger days and helps ignite the fire of romance in us as we sail along enjoying the picturesque sites and beautifully sculptured buildings. As we disembarked, we told ourselves, it is worth coming back to Paris!
Love to walk there again. It's just one of the most beautiful parts of this city. Walking, sitting for a beer, grabbing a sandwich in the small parks around and looking at beautiful views.
Take the BatoBus Hop on/off all day. It is very special taking this boat in the evening.The whole of Paris is alight and romanticVery reasonable price
A night cruise down the Seine. I went on a night cruise and it was absolutely gorgeous seeing Paris by night. Definitely recommend a night cruise.
Paris' Main River. Took a boat tour with a company I couldn't remember the name too. Lot's of interesting stuff happening on this river.

Nice to see even winter time. If your visit Paris, you can not avoid this attraction. This River is everywhere in the center of Paris. And even winter time it is also nice. The great view is night time Seine.

Too much of stories . Seine is the river being told a lot of times in many movies and songs, so you might have some fantasy over it. It is just a narrow river snaking through Paris. Regardless, the boat tour at night is good.

Worth doing. Doing a cruise always let you see buildings from a different view. Being down on the river made the large stately buildings, museums and cathedrals very imposing. Such a good place to get a excellent photograph. Commentary in English as well as other languages. We past under many bridges all ornate and all different. You wouldn't see them from any other angle. We really enjoyed our trip and would recommend it to anyone.

Bastille to Louvre. On a crisp but clear winter's Sunday we walked from Bastille to the Louvre - first follow the canal then pick up the river - a walk of about 1 1/4 hours. There were joggers and skaters galore and river-side book and painting kiosks to browse and pick up bargains. Shops and cafes abounded as we came into the more popular areas.
Take a river cruise!. We booked a river cruise, approx. 70 euro pp for a lovely lunch and includes live music and wine! Was the perfect way to experience the Seine

Oo La La!. What a fun and exciting excursion to travel down the River Seine! There are so many sites to see while leasurely floating down the river. The sites along the banks, the bridges, and all kinds of other views from the boat are very exciting.

A great way to see the city. I spent three cold, rainy, yet wonderful days in Paris with my mom & sister. On a whim, we took a cruise down the Seine. It turned out to be a delightful way to see the city. We alternated between sitting inside the cozy boat, sipping warm beverages and enjoying the panoramic view through the large windows; and going up top to stand at the rail, enjoy the sights in the crisp air, and snap some goods photos.

,,And I'll find where I lost her,by the lovely river Seine" :). If you have time,rest and cruise down the river Seine.A different view on Paris,and finally you can sit back and just watch the true life here.The bridges bring a new color to Paris,a new experience as each of them seems different.I enjoyed every minute of an hour long tour.I cannot remember,but I believe it was the Batu bus I've taken.
Relaxation . Definitely worth finding time for a river cruise which is totally relaxing.. After which, a Cointreau crepe by the river.

Cruise around the river to see this lively city. We took a cruise from near Eiffel Tower which we had pre booked for that particular day but the timings are flexible. We passed through many Arched bridges and the famous lock bridge. Took this tour in the evening at around 8 pm and saw how lively this city was with people city around the river enjoying a drink and waving to the tourist like us. Don't miss this experience.
A Romantic route to take!. I've enjoyed taking the Batu-bus of the city of Paris, where you can travel as much as you want in the whole day of your valid ticket.

Brings Paris to life. We travelled along the Seine both during the day and then again on an evening guided tour. This attraction is an absolute must and the various views of the buildings are incredible. The evening tour gives an excellent recap of the history of Paris along the Seine and the night views with the lights enhance the experience tremendously.

The Heart of Paris. The Seine is the lifeblood of Paris. Flowing through the heart of the City, it embraces so many highlights, The Louvre, The Musee de Orsay, The Luxemburg Gardens, Notre Dame Cathedral, all accessible along its beautiful shores. Viewed from the Eiffel Tower it is magnificent.
Beautiful place to be. Very beautiful area, and it can also be seen from the Eiffel Tower. Both easy to find and budget-friendly because it's free.

Cruise through the heart of Paris. After spending days walking beside it and crossing it numerous times, we decided to take one of the many river cruises....climbed aboard not far from Notre Dame and slowly motored west, passing Notre Dame, after awhile, we turned and cruised all the way back, passing the Eiffel tour, then cruised back again. All along the way you are able to see many of the incredible sites that you have visited, or will visit during your stay in the city of lights.

Some of the most Amazing Bridges. Take a trip on the bateau to see some of the most amazing sights, you can hop on and off and all for 11 euros, we visited some fantastic places inc the louvre and the Eiffel tower and notre dame
Good Views. The place opposite the Eiffel Tower is a good choice for a cruise on the Seine. Offers great views of the lovely city which otherwise is not possible.
It is really windy in winter.. A lovely place to visit but very cold in winter.Each one of the bridges are beatiful. I would suggest to go on a cruise along the river.

Worth the walk. Loved the fridaynight feeling along the river as everyone gets together to dance and relax, the boat trip for dinner is definitely worth doing and allows you a great view of the sites and Parisian life

One of the best parts of Paris, especially if traveling with kids. The Seine is a huge part of Paris's appeal in a way that is not true of rivers in New York or London. It's far more peaceful and pleasant. You can leave the bustle and go down the stairs right to river level, where there are wide paved pedestrian areas.And if you have kids, this is a life saver. There are playgrounds and other interesting things where kids can burn off energy and have loads of fun. One of the things our 7 and 12 year olds found amusing was a map of the world painted on the pavement. I took a photo with each of them standing on the area they were from and my daughter standing on Paris. We were all endlessly amused by this. I've attached one of those photos here.I would heartily recommend a Bateaux Mouche tour, because it offers a very different and lovely perspective of the city. But walking along the Seine is one of my favorite pastimes in Paris.One of my fondest memories is taking a break on a stationery barge that served coffee, crepes, wine and more. I've attached a photo of that here.The Seine provides a great way to relax after long hours of sightseeing. I would suggest everyone ending their afternoons there or taking a wonderfully refreshing mid-afternoon break.Even just walking along it, up one side and down the other, while looking at all the surrounding buildings is great fun. Both City Hall (Hotel de Ville) and the Musee D'Orsay can be reached this way.

An enjoyable stroll. How can you not enjoy the chance to walk along the Seine, where millions of people for hundreds of years have strolled. It was a bit cold when I journeyed out, but seeing the wonderful architecture, the Eglise Notre Dame, and the Eiffel Tower, how can the cold take away from that?This is a must do when in Paris.

A walk along the Seine. Our first time in Paris, and with help from Tripadvisor, we chose a hotel right on the Seine across from Notre Dame. When we would get back from touring, the Wife and I would walk along the Seine looking at all the wonderful little tourist shops. We saw so many things from pictures that were risqué, to wonderful water color paintings. It just adds to flavor of a wonderful city!Many times we would open our windows in the hotel, and look out and see all the little shops lining the river and all the people. The sights, sounds, and fragrances add to the appeal of a dynamic city!!Will we go back.......You bet, no doubt, we love it!!!!!

Seine by bike. So Here is a Tipp for Everbody: we Rent bikes from one of the velib stations and drove along the seine from gare de lyon to tour eiffel. The little streets and Promenade are fantastic! Just beautiful
Beautiful. As part of my walking tour, included cruising Seine in travel between Eifel Tower, Louvre and Notre Dame.

River Seine, such a beautiful part of Paris! A+. The river Seine runs through the heart of Paris. It is most beautiful in Spring and Summer when locals and tourists flock to picnic and just hang out the Parisian way. My friends and I rode a "party boat" once that drove under all the beautiful bridges of the Seine and passed through the Tour Eiffel. What an amazing night that was! You can also bring food and wine and spend countless hours under the sunset and stars and never tire of the atmosphere and view. It is a unique experience dedicated to people living and visiting Paris.

Paris at it's Best!. Take a Walk along the Seine at sunset. Bring a baguette and a bottle of wine. This is the true Paris experience.Just watch the people and enjoy the view. Pass along the amazing bridges and their interesting history.Listen to the accordion man, take a photo, meet some locals. It is all there.
The Heart Beat of Paris. The Seine is the center of Paris. It ties the city together. Try and take a river cruise at night. We took a river cruise on the Calais that was wonderful

Everything I thought and then some!. So beautiful and picturesque! Many very old bridges take you from the right to the left bank. Wonderful to walk along the river and people watch or just get your exercise. Numerous places to eat or to sit and have a picnic. The Louvre is located on the river as is Notre Dame and the Orsay Museum. So many things to see and do along the river!
Lovely for a walk and a picnic. When I first arrived in Paris, I went on a walk from Gare du Lyon to my friend's apartment, using the Seine as my route. It was absolutely lovely.
Magical. It's everything you expect it to be... We did a boat cruise by night and we walked up and down too.... It really is true back bone of Paris. At night is really tranquil and romantic.

Relaxing boat ride. We took the boat ride at night and sat on the upper deck of the cruise. Shame we couldn't hear the commentary from the upper deck as there were no headphones available. However we still enjoyed the night scenery from the river seine and the view of the Eiffel Tower from the cruise is stunning.

Backbone of Paris. The best part of river Seine is that it flows in the middle of the city and it touches almost every important attraction like Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Notredom. Either you can get a cruise ride or you may like to walk along the river. The view is so beautiful that you may forget to rest in between the walks and picture clicks.

A wonderful boat ride in Paris. During our visit to Paris we went on the boat ride down the Seine River. Very nice trip and we were able to see many places that our guide pointed out to us. Our trip was during the day, and when we go back I would highly recommend the night trip to enjoy all the city lights. The trip we were on was a good trip also. Even the kids around us seem to be having a great time.

Boat tour. Took a boat tour along the seine, we were 23 or 25 euro each which included a drink and a hotdog (MEH) it lasted an hour, and was actually very good. would do this again. maybe on a warmer day as it started to get quite cool.

Fabulous at dusk.... We went on a river cruise just as dusk was falling and the sights along the river were wonderful. An amazing sunset and when our boat turned and the Eiffel Tower lit up we were in awe. A truly wonderful experience.

New Years Eve on the Seine. A night river cruise on the Seine is a must. Paris at night is must see. The bridges and building along the river are lit up in a way that make the city shine. We did a dinner cruise on New Years Eve and it was just magic. No guide just friends and good food. There are many ships to choose from to meet your taste and budget. Our cruise was about 3 hours, and a coat was essential, then took an UBER to our Hotel.

Affordable luxury that's worth every centime. Readers are going to get the impression that I am on commission, but with 17 years of experience in the travel business, anything that makes a visit more enjoyable from an experiential perspective is to be both lauded and shared. So, before you walk the sacred banks of the Seine, pop into a branch of 'France Tourisme' and book yourself on a lunch-time boat-trip. We chose a dejuener croisiere with Bateaux Parisiennes and haven't had a more memorable meal in a long while - and we live in France. If 53 euros per head sounds like you're, well, pushing the boat out a bit, remember that it includes live music and two bottles of excellent wine!The views along the river bank from the glass-topped vessel are truly spectacular and the service a delight. Yes, you will be photographed half-way through [at extra cost], but you can choose the pics that flatter you and they beat your iPhone snaps and make for a memorable souvenir.Go for it!
Paris at its finest..beautiful way too see city. We went on the Bateaux Mouche--restaurant boat-and had a good meal with beautiful sights. This is a romantic way to see Paris kick back and enjoy.

Brilliant . Must see, wonderful bridges fantastic street scene along the banks can't be missed. Any time of the year the activity is fascinating, from street sellers to occasional entertainers boat trips with of without food and drinks.

Would highly recommend!. Beautiful scenery, perfect for a boat ride, especially in the evening! We went as part of a package deal with a coach trip, the boat ride and the eiffel tower. The cruise took about an hour and it was really spectacular, and the weather was perfect which was a bonus! I would love to do it again!
Pedestrian Friendly. We walked from the Eifel tower to the Louvre, completely on the river path. Beautiful, easy walk, lots to see and do. Seemed like everyone was out on our mild January day.

Simply beautiful. There is nothing nicer in my opinion than a stroll down the river banks. Even in winter its beautiful, with the numerous bridges and boats skipping back and forth. The buildings that line the banks are beautiful and if history is your thing, then there is a lot of it to see.

Simply superb way to see the sights of Paris. Have river cruise along the Seine might sound like a cliche, but weather during the day or night, what a fantastic way to see this incredible city.We prefer the evening because of the lights, and I possibly slanted because of the Eiffel tower and it's incredible night lights… but seriously, there is no bad time of the day or night or year to take a cruise on the seine… Do it no matter what…
Boat trip on the Seine. Take a boat on an organised tour of the city. This is particularly special at New Year but can be enjoyed at any time of the year

brown water, nothing special. went to Eiffel tower and also took the dinner on the boat along Seine river. I must say that both the view along the riverbank and the river itself were nothing special. during my visit in May 2015, the water was as brown as the rivers in Indonesia.

Good and Windy in Winter. I went here on winter. Trust me, sit on the second floor in winter is freaking windy and freaking cold ( I mean its very nice ). But I'm getting bored there, just interested in some view, even I sleep for a minutes there because the wind is very nice hahaha. Watching the eiffel tower from here is really nice !

A Must See and Experience Sight.... The beautiful River Seine twists and turns around the majestic city of lights. Take a day cruise to see the cities most beautiful sights or enjoy it at night for a romantic perspective from the waters edge. Many cruises available. Simply a "must do" close-up experience as you journey through Paris and it's most famous sights.

Great Way See Sights On a First Day or Short trip. Hit this the first day to kill jet leg and get yourself excited about Paris. You can do a day or night tour or get a hop on hop off 1 or 2 day ticket.

Enjoy by simply walking. The river offers a wonderful walk through Paris. Get down close to the river and walk along the banks, experiencing the smells of the river and cafes. We really enjoyed walking along it and it will bring you to almost any sight you would like to see. over all a must do when your in Paris
Beautiful. This very beautiful river with majestic backdrops and stunning boats afloat the water will take your breath away.
Beautiful. The river is amazing. It was beautiful seeing it from the Eiffel Tour, but i recommend you take the cruises available there which was one in a lifetime experience
Take a Walk. A beautiful part of Paris to take a walk along the water. The many bridges along the river are all covered in love locks and are a rare and beautiful site to see.

See the Seine by boat. I did the Boat tour of the Seine River. It was very nice and relaxing. Gave me a chance to rest my tired legs. You get to see Paris from a different view and get a great view of the Eiffel Tower, bridges and people sunbathing along the river.

Pleasant experience enjoyed by all. I have done this cruise during the day and also at night, in a standard boat with a commentary. The tour does not really look like what it does in the photos posted on here, but it it still very nice. People are saying the water is filthy, but I wouldn't say it is extreme as that. It doesn't affect your enjoyment anyway. It is nice to go on a boat cruise after walking around Paris, as it is sort of a mini rest to sit down. There is a commentary on the boat, who speaks in English, French, and Spanish. There is interesting facts given about each building / bridge you pass. There is also music played. At night everything is lit up and it is really beautiful to see. People who are walking along the banks, bridges, on passing boats or even dining on the floating boats restaurants wave as you go past. A pleasant experience overall, though quite chilly if you go in an autumn/winter month.
LOVED it here. The Seine was beautiful. Great views, loads of picture possibilities. The bridges were all beautiful as well.

Choose Boat Carefully. I love a great river cruise anywhere, and in Paris there is no better way to see all the sights. If you would like a narrated cruise, be sure to choose such. The hop on-hop off boats still afford a nice view, but come with no commentary or frills. They are a nice way to get around, but not a great tour.
Drove around it. We drove over the river quite a few times on the L'Open Tour Bus. It was very quiet on the river itself. I loved the bridges going over them.

Nice view of Paris. I took a metro from Citadines hotel at Place D'Italie to River Seine area, walking across the bridge then going down to take a picture with Liberty Statue which is smaller than in New York. I took a Seine River Tour by cruise to travel along River Seine, from boat I can see famous Eiffel Tower and other nice buildings, bridges around. It takes about 1 hour for shipping.

Great. We did a illuminations cruise on the seine for 1 hour and we loved it. you get to see the attractions from a different view. Would recommend to see the attractions during the day and the do the cruise at night as everything is then illuminated.

A must in Paris. You must walk along the river at day and specially at night.The bridges and boats are very special.At the corner of Alexander bridge, the view to the very close Eiffel tower is great. Good spot for photos. I recommend to take a river cruise at night it is charming.

Incredible view. There are plenty of ways to enjoy River Seine. You could either take a leisure walk along the riverbank, have a picnic in the small triangle park near Pont Neuf, or do the river cruise! I booked it from the hostel I stayed in and paid 9€. The cruise is perfect to see all the landmarks, however I suggest to take the day tour, instead the night tour, especially if you intend to take lots of photos. The night tour was not very enjoyable because people kept using their camera flashes.

A pleasant promenade. Clean river. A tour on a river cruise boat offers an alternative viewpoint of Paris and a good look at the many bridges. Many of the beautiful Parisian landmarks line the side of the river.

history cruise. We had a limited time to see Paris. A tour the combined a bus ride and a river cruise seemed like the best option to see the major attractions. Very pleased with all views from the River Seine!
Leisure walk. Walk from Notre Dame to the Lourve. It was serene and though it was at night and winter time, it wasn't cold. Love the serenity of the place.

Great place to dine and take boat tour. It's old but well maintained and still have that romantic charm. Lots of good dining spots along the banks. Lots of nice bridges to enjoy view of river. A boat tour is nice to see all the landmarks and glide over this history water

A must. They say if you don't hold hand and walk with your better half on river Siene - your trip is not accomplished. A must for any body. The river cruise is awesome. You can feel the love in the air.

seine river cruise. if your going, pay the price and get a night river cruise with dinner, it is so beautiful you will not be disappointed, the food is really something to look forward to , I'm a vegetation and the meal was superb . totally worth the money
Canal cruise. We took a canal cruise at 7pm in the evening and it was absolutely beautiful. Took a picnic on board and enjoyed the city lights.
A good activity in Paris!!. We did a 1hr night time cruise on our first day and it was a good way to get acquainted with the city.

Cruise it for another perspective of Paris. The river has clear water as I could see the pebbles on the river. Take the Big Bus tour and add extra euro to get into the river cruise. Pay another extra and you get to have champagne and sandwich.

Walk it!. I had to walk from my condo in Vincennes to the Champs Elysees to exchange dollars for euros. In the Marais I walked down to the Seine and strolled along the right bank all the way to Place de la Concorde, one of the best parts of my trip! I chatted with several locals along the way when asking if I was close yet, and they were delightfully helpful. Also, it kept me from wandering down the wrong street on the way. I saw the houseboats, passing tourist boats, fishers, bridges, and ordinary Parisians jogging, walking dogs and playing on the bank. It was a mini-tour and took less than an hour.
Must see on your trip to Paris. A great way to see this beautiful city is by boat on the river Seine. Must do when in Paris. See all the sights by their watwr ways.

The river Seine . Cannot appreciate the vastness of this river till you go along it. A boat cruise is highly recommended as along the river there are countless national monuments which you will not be able to visit all unless you spend a month in Paris only. Going up the Eiffel Tower also gives a magnificent view of the river and how it has become Paris.

River Cruise w/ Champagne. Took an afternoon river cruise from the base of the Eiffel Tower, down past Notre Dame, and turned around after Pont de Sully. It was almost an hour tour and was an amazing way to see the attractions along the river. We selected the champagne tasting version of the tour, and it was well worth it. We got to sit at the front of the boat. Had 4-5 tastings/ half glasses of champagne, and had a personal tour guide. Our guide told us all the major historical information as we passed buildings, and in between major topics answered questions we had. Great way to do the boat tour, was $20 more, but well worth it. We had champagne, a personal tour guide, and the best seats on the boat.

A great way to see this beautiful city.. Travelling along the Seine on a boat trip is a must when visiting Paris as you can see many of the fabulous sights from it. I personally love going along it in the evening when all the buildings and bridges are lit up at night.
Restless. Go for a stroll along the shore or try a ride on the river Seine, ex. bateau Mouches. It is your money worth.

Take a walk along this river and discover Paris. The Seine runs through Paris and can lead you to many of its most popular spots including the Notre Dame, the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower and Pont D'alma. Part of the magic of this city, especially watching the boats float by.

peaceful and calm. The river Seine stretches a long way and is below the city above , making it a peaceful place to escape the hustle and bustle of Parisian life. You can walk most of the path that stretches alongside it but better still take an inexpensive Bateau and see all the sights with a commentary. There are trips throughout the daytime and early evening , better still book a slightly expensive dinner while you are guided past the monuments that line the Seine. Whether you want to walk , sail or simply sit down and have a picnic the Seine can be a cheap way of soaking up the Parisian life.

pretty sight. The river is the equivalent of the hudson river, nyc and Thames, London. The difference is this river runs right through the middle of the city! There's street vendors all over near the river and it's just a pretty sight.

Enjoy the Cruise on this river with good view of the famous monuments in Paris. Just next to Eiffel Tower this is a must do Cruise! If you have missed any part of Paris it will be covered by this! Enjoy one hour and also, the bar is great in it the boats!

Beautiful walk. The River Seine takes you through the heart of Paris, from one end to the other. As you stroll down it, you will come across many historical points of interest and famous tourist sights. Along the way there are many restaurants, lounges, bars and onstreet vendors to grab a snack or drink from as you make you way up and down the river. It's a pleasant walk and experience.

Lifeline of Paris. Major attractions of Paris exist around river Seine. Most famous are left bank and right bank walks, Ile de la Cité, point Neuf, Pont des Arts, Pont Alexandre III, Eiffel Tower and Pont de Bir-Hakeim.

Relaxing View but Not That Impressive. I've taken the boat tour, and I've spent a few hours sitting on its shore. The view is really relaxing, but I've visited much more beautiful rivers (i.e. the Nile).

Locks removed. I am totally bummed out that they removed the rail on the bridge that held my lock. They have moved a lot of locks to Ponte Neuf but it's not quite the same. The river is beautiful and I captured a nice pic of Notre Dame late at night across the river.

To enjoy Paris, the city of light.. The best time to take the ride will be at the sunset, when they lit up the entire city its just wow!
Budget trick, you will save 4euros(i paid 10euros per adult) on the bataeux parisean (cruise ride along seine river for 1hour) when you present the Paris visite card at the pier number 3.
Boat ride in River Seine. Oh, what a wonderful experience, Unforgettable. The visit to Paris will not be complete with out this.

Night time visit!. The seine cruise runs from morning till night. A night visit gave us a completely different feeling than that during day time when we 1st visit 10 years back. The illumination made the building much more lively than day time.

Take the Batobus - its cheap and easy. There are so many different services on the river or you to enjoy. If you want to be pampered in luxury then the Batobus is not for you.If you are looking for a good way to see what it is like from the river, take the regular boat service from one of the many halts along the river. You can go all the way up and then back down again for one ticket. It is way cheaper than the tourist ones. You get the same views.We loved it, but our kids (early teens) began to get a bit bored after one half of the trip which I can understand as they were seeing the same stuff, but just from the other direction. However, it took us back to our start point which is what we wanted.Recommendation - worth it as value for money and you get to see everything from the river and can hop on/off to suit your own itinerary.
Love lock bridges. Put a lock on a bridge with your lover, or bike past this river. Rent a Velib' and you can pretty much bike past it for a long time!
Good to take a cruise to view the scenery.. It is good to take a dinner tour to River Seine as it takes you close to other attractions like Notee Dame, ,,l.
The River. This is a magical river in the midst of an outstanding city.Take a tour that starts in the day and ends at night.Worth it.

Night Cruise on the River. A cruise on the river Seine is a must for any visitor to Paris. The cruises from the Pier near the Eiffel Tower are relatively inexpensive and a great way of experiencing the city. We did the night cruise on a sultry summers night and the riverside was full of people picnicking and dancing. It was a great experience.So watch the sunset at the Eiffel then go on the cruise. An excellent evening

A very fun Touristy thing to do and hey, it's Free. The Seine is a fun place to come in Paris. The city can get to be a bit much at times and the river can be a place to recharge. The bridges have lots of history and are beautiful linking you to lots of cool neighborhoods. You can walk and drive along the water. Just fun.

Relaxing. Took a afternoon cruise with teenage sons
All the landmarks could be easily from boat
Better than walking great distances
Take a vedette. We enjoyed a vedette trip on the Seine from near the Eiffel Tower. Startedv on deck until cold drove us downstairs where snacks anddrinks available. An enjoyable trip
Another view of Paris. I enjoyed to cruise down the Seine. It took around an hour and the tour guide was very good at explaining all of the sites. It is another way to view Paris

Great. These is my 2nd visit to paris, everything is so beautiful, if I have the opportunity to go back to Europe I can go again to paris, The transportation is great, the food is awesome, architecture has no comparison.
Best visit at sunset.. Sadly the river tour we took didn't have English commentary, but a trip up the Seine is a must when in Paris. At sunset the Eiffel tower looks fab with its lights.

Pleasant ride on the sightseeing boat.. We enjoyed walking along the river but decided to take one of the river cruises as wel. It was very nice to see the landmarks from the river. We enjoyed meandering down the river and seeing the sights. A nice way to spend an hour or so.
Boat trip . Is a must. Great views of Paris from the water. Some boats are very resonable too, cruises can vary. Enjoy!

Vantage River Cruise: Seine and Normandy. Traveler Beware if you plan on booking a river cruise with Vantage. Their brochures guarantee value but there is no guarantee: at the time of booking they urge you to pre-pay from a checking account where you have no recourse. In my cruise, they changed the entire itinerary without notice, offered no service when questions were asked, and we spent more time on buses than the river due to "broken lockes" only for their ships. The other cruise lines were able to cruise. The company did nothing for eight months and did not stand behind their guarantee. Never cruise with them. You will be incredibly disappointed and you will not see the cities you pay to see.
Beautiful . We went on the river cruise at sunset and is wort every dollar ! Its a roof less boat and you really get to see alot of the buildings and Paris ! So beautiful would go again !

Take a boats tour at sunset on the Seine. Visiting the river or walking along it in the city center is rather boring because the buildings and attractions on the land side will always steal your attention and there is no interesting path along the river that I could possibly think of. So its best to enjoy the river view from the river itself taking a tour with a cruise at around sunset.

Crossing lines,,,, you can´t miss it!!!. Paris from the Seine !!! what a view !!! the ride is quiet. I did it day and night, and really love the view at night, with Paris illuminated monuments and buildings, through the numerous bridges is really a must !! You can buy the pass for 3 days and used as transportation to other points ... but you´ve to try not to be alone..... ==)))

Beautiful Sceneries. We decided to do a boat trip in paris during our last night there. We left at 7 pm and it was for one hour. We left from the Eiffel Tower and went all the way to Notre Dame. The trip is amazing at night when you can see the Paris's night lights, Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Notre Dame towers, etc. It is really worth worthy!

The main artery of Paris. The Seine River serves as the main artery of Paris, flowing east to west and dissecting the city into the Rive Droite to the north and the Rive Gauche to the south. On previous visits to Paris we had enjoyed a River cruise timed to see the Eiffel Tower at sunset when the light show is most wonderful. On this trip we enjoyed extensive walks along the banks, near the created sandy beach front near Ile de la Cite, and beside the Pont Alexandre III.
