Riverfront sights not to miss include the Eiffel Tower, the Palais de Chaillot, the Liberty Flame, the unofficial memorial to Diana, Princess of Wales, at Pont de i'Alma, the Grand Palais, the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay and Notre Dame.
Superb!. The Seine river is a must see in Paris! We took a Cruise and thoroughly enjoyed it! The many bridges on the river are simply fabulous!

Take a boat ride on the Seine for a unique look at the city. We took a few rides on the Seine during the day and greatly enjoyed the different perspective on the city from the water. It is not as convenient a mode of travel as the bus or the metro but it is definitely an experience unto itself.

Seine, not Thamed.!`. A boat ride is great. At night, it becomes so much better.The boats have potent lights, that used to shine on the loverson the Banks, thus the name Bateaux Mouches (Flies, snoopers)Noisy boats, but for the best experience, book the dinner ride and indulge. It would be a good meal.
River Seine. Forget Walking...take a River Boat Ride instead.You get great views of the city of ParisGet sets by the outside rails to take pictures, gets crowed.
Exciting and Beatutiful. Our stroll along the River Seine was great. You really knew you were in Paris. Much to see including the Effiel Tower and the many floating crafts going by.

First Night Cruise Gives You A Great Preview To What Paris Holds!. We bought one of the bus/boat passes that allow you to get on and off a bus and/or boat anywhere they go in Paris. It worked out great...allowing us to see everything in a day. Then if you're staying longer than we did (two days), you can decide to what attractions you'd like to return to spend more time. It's a beautiful river with many fascinating bridges.

gorgeous. Go see it by boat. Beautiful river in Paris. Check out the locks at Pont Neuf. You can walk along the river easily. Also check out the bookstalls. They also sell souvenirs, some unique prints too.

Night or day find the time to take a cruise on the river Seine. This trip we took an evening cruise (1hr) on a boat with plenty of seats inside and out and with an option for listening to a guided tour tape that provides fun facts on the sights you'll see along the way. An hour is long enough. We boarded and ended nearby the Eiffel tower (accross the street). Beautiful and great perspective from the water.

Two suggested Seine walks . Long daytime walk, which will really help you to understand how Paris fits together: Ile St. Germaine to Pont Austerlitz/Jardin des Plantes, keeping on the left bank, walking most if the time along the quai, and exploring bridges as you pass them.Evening walk, after sunset, with prettiest lights: start where you wish, maybe Notre Dame or Concorde, but then make sure you walk on the right bank, past the Alexander III Bridge, enjoying the lights of the Eiffel Tower, and passing boats.
Amazing. This was a great ride around Paris on the river. Very affordable for a couple or family! The views from the river are amazing and breath taking.
Desapointing experience. We made a cruise, but, after an hop-on hop-off bus tour, there was nothing amazing to see. Desapointing experience not to repeat.

A beautiful river throug the heart of the city!. The River Seine can't be missed! you'll eventually have to cross it at some point if you're sightseeing in Paris! I didn't take any of the cruises however, just walking past at day or night its magical. Definitely a great photo opportunity.
So special, what can I say?. Unlike the Thames, the French have protected the Seine from being surrounded by ugly buildings so the beauty is timeless and well worth visiting in any season.

Walk it at dawn or dusk. No need to make a special trip, the beautiful River surrounds the city. Enjoy it from all its different vantage points. Some of the best photo oops will come from the bridges surrounding the ile de cite, and ile St Louise. Make sure you walk at night as well

Cruise the Parisien sights. There can be few better ways of viewing the Paris landmarks than from the deck of a boat on the capitals iconic waterway. From the luxury bateaux mouches to the hop on and off ferry which plies between the major attractions, this is top value for money.Away from the hectic traffic and fumes; above the ground and direct access to the main attractions of the Eiffel Tower, Musee d'Orsay, Notre Dame, Louvre, Left Bank and the original statue of liberty. If your time is limited, its the best way to "do" Paris but if you are fancy free just sit back and keep going round and round!
Take a cruise!. This is a great place from which to see the city of Paris. Take a cruise. Maybe even a dinner cruise. It is really beautiful and romantic. Did I mention that you should take a cruise?

Walk along the banks of Seine.. Urban rivers are decorated with bridges and structures along the banks and so is Seine. Seine is a friendly river. You can go for long walks along either side of it. There are numerous boat trips offered as a form of either transportation or a way to explore Paris. Walking along Seine is a good way to see as much Paris as possible if time is limited. You will get that way to see many famous Parisian landmarks and iconic buildings.

Big Bus Cruise. It was great value to buy the package deal with the Big Bus open top tour and the cruise along the Seine, we were guided by a very helpful and talented bilingual man who showed us and any others the wonderful views of Paris from the river. A must do, we did it in the afternoon but the evening cruise looks beautiful. The skyline is lovely as well.

we took the night cruise of the Seine. recommend you go for the day tours. avoid taking the tickets from the city pass as they make you que up for almost 1.5 hours. there are several local tours that you can take that can help you save some time.

One of the world's great rivers.. There are not many people would not get the question wrong when asked which city the Seine runs through. Stroll along the banks or take a river cruise and take in this great city from the River Seine.

Simply amazing to live around Seine.. I can't imagine life in Paris without the river Seine. It has been almost 2 years for me in this beautiful city and Seine tops the chart of 'the best things to do'. It is long and runs right accros this city. There are iconic landmarks and many many small but beautiful places worth visiting along the banks of this river. One can go for a stroll along the banks, cycle, walk or spend an afternoon in the parks and gardens on the banks. Canal St. Martin is a very beautiful spot to be enjoyed. There are also cruises available which last for around 1 hour approximately and one can see Paris in a unique way. One can see all the major landmarks from the seine. They also provide guides in different languages.

Nice to walk along. This is pretty much what you'd probably expect - it's a river. But it's still very nice to walk along and go across the bridges, looking at the beautiful architecture along the way.
Relaxing cruise. We booked an hour cruise with Vedettes tours. Very well organized, and informative commentary. Enjoyed the interesting landmarks which were pointed out by the audio guides.

Summer Vacation with son. Boat Cruise in the open decker boat in night is must especially flashing eifel tower along with well maintained palaces even 3 to four hundred year old buildings is some thing which you must never miss

A must see / do. The Seine has lots of history to it just like Paris, so be it a walk above it i.e. next to it or in its heart on the banks as well as on a boat ride would all be much appreciated by any visitor or tourist. My wife and I tried them all and enjoyed them all, therefore, we highly recommend it.

enjoyable. I enjoyed taking a bateau trip at night. it want through paris. it shows u different monument and u enjoy the river. very nice experience where u get to see the old island (old paris) and the new one. the river is clean.

Lovely river cruise at night. Did a river cruise in the evening and loved every minute. There was a commentary on board as we moved along though I would have preferred even more details. Lovely, relaxing way to spend an hour seeing the beauty of this great city.

Lovely place for a walk!. We have enjoyed walking along, seeing the many boats and bridges along the way. No matter where you are in the city, it is there! Even though the weather is cool and windy, people seem drawn to it. Lovely views from the many bridges!

We went on a boat ride! . It was lovely! It was pretty cheap the one we went on (I can't remember the exact price but somewhere between 12-16 euros ). It was an hour long and since it was December it was pretty cold but still a nice ride. It had commentary in English and French so it was nice to cosy up with my friend, relax and listen.

A trip up the Seine. We did a sunset trip up this lovely river. What an awesome way to see some of this beautiful city. I would certainly recommend doing this trip. So much to see, and then we went past a lot of the places we had already seen on our night time trip of the city by bus. I think this was a must do. - The best part about the river trip was you get to see so much more, minus all of the traffic. If I did this again I would definitely do the Dinner Cruise.

The best way to see Paris minus the traffic.. The River Seine cruise is among the best way to see Paris. You see many of the buildings that are found in Paris minus the peak hour traffic. The river cruise is also the best way to see the Eiffel Tower at a distance The best angle to take photos of the tower is from the river.Paris has 37 bridges across the Seine, of which 3 are pedestrian and 2 are rail bridges. Three link Île Saint-Louis to the rest of Paris, 8 link Paris toÎle de la Cité and one links 2 islands by the river.

A Must See While In Paris. This is the major waterway going thru Paris. There are great avenues for walking along a lot of the river. I rode the train yesterday to the Eiffel Tower stop then decided to walk to the Holiday Festival which was about a 30-40 minute walk almost all along the river. It was a wonderful walk showcasing the many cafes and homes in the historic buildings along the way. There are several tour boats serving the waterway with the ability to get on/get off all along the river. There are also several riverboats that serve as restaurants.Of course the Eiffel Tower is one of the busiest and more popular of the stops along the river. When in Paris this is one of the sights your really need to see.

Definitely cruise worthy!. We did both a dinner cruise and a 8 day river cruise to Normandy. The scenery was quite lovely. We lived all the picnicking and couples enjoying the early evening hours. It is difficult to describe all the lovely scenery!

Its a river in the heart of the city.. It is not much more special than the main river in any other city, but it is nice, and has a long river walk. Many of the main sights of the city are on its banks.

Soothing . Better way to see most part of Paris than navigating through its traffic. The river cruise starting from Eiffel Tower covers almost all historical points of city. It's same as hop in/off bus.Sometimes it may be crowded making you to stand. One can walk over sides of the river , evening you have cafés & bars opening up on the river front. One can sit all day along on banks & drink.
a walk to remember. check out the artists,just walk & enjoy the feel of Paris,restaurants & eateries & little lanes to see

River that divides Paris and joins hearts. Take a cruise on this river from the bottom of Eiffel tower and you will start loving the city and its all famous attractions are falling in your way. Recommended river cruise.

Romantic Seine cruise. Any one who ever visits Paris must make time for a dinner cruise on the river seine followed by a walk along the embankment. You will remember it always. Great for a long week end to celebrate a special occasion!!!!
Walk along the river. Best way to experience is to just walk on either side, cross the pedestrian bridges, take a lunch and bottle of wine and have a picnic.

walk or take the river cruise. The river seine can lead you from one place to another easily without getting lost. You can sit along the river to people watch. Have a nice stroll along the river or even take the river cruise with a voice commentary that gives you more information about the places you're cruising by.
Pretty overall but DIRTY!. Walked over the bridges dozens of times during our week stay. Beautiful scenes but.....if you look too closely it is dirty. France clean it it!

Great way to see sights . This is a great way to see Paris and especially at night with a glass of wine, we totally enjoyed a cruise along the seine at night and didn't realise how much there was to see, a must do.

Lunch cruise on Bateaux Parisiens. We took the lunch cruise Paris Irresistible, menu Privilege from Bateaux Parisiens on November 26.It was an excellent experience: very friendly service, good food and wine, boat very clean and of course magnificent, and different, views of Paris monuments seen from the river Seine.Several companies offer cruises on the Seine river. For sure, if we go again, we will be sure to use the same provider: Bateaux Parisiens. Also, there are three available menus. We chose Privilege (the middle one, 77 Euros). As noted before, food is good, but more importantly with this menu comes upgraded seating by the windows with a much better view than if seated inside. One last thing: make sure to downlaod the access map, the dock can be a little difficult to find without it (that was the case for us!).

Different view of Paris. There is several companies offering boat trips. You can find them on the left riverside. Routes and prices are almost the same. Some boats have sun decks, others have only roofed decks so choose according to your preference and weather conditions.
Take a cruise on Seine. The best way to see a lot more of Paris, without putting up with buses and crowds. And the tour boats (hop on and off type) stop in lots of places (like Notre Dame).
Lively body of water. The river Seine is loaded with attractions and lovely views all over. We took the night tour on a cold evening. To see the Eiffel Tower at night from the water is priceless.

Right out of the Movies. The Seine is the lifeblood of Paris and where everything happens, just like in the movies. There is so much to see and do along the Seine and a moonlight cruise is one of the best ways to see it. It is pure magic and romantic, no matter your age.

Don't miss a journey on this famous river. We love boating down the Seine...have tried many different Bateaux companies. It's definitely something you have to do on your visit. Hopefully it's not cold and/or raining, because it's quite lovely when the weather is nice. It's also fun to just walk along the river and sit at one of the many benches to watch the world go by.

Viking comes through. We took a Viking cruise and I wrote a review on it as we were not happy with them after we had some difficulties regarding illness and some boat failures. Since that review Viking has come through with flying colours. They have partially reimbursed us with a voucher on another trip. I do want to clarify a few issues. My wife and myself just wish to say that apart from the way they handled the illness on board, the cruise itself and the tours and guides were exceptional. We would sail with them again.
Romantic. What's not to love about the River Seine? It's beautiful day or night. Take the time to stop walking - be a tourist and just enjoy the view!

Do the boat tour!. There are a number of tours. Do them at night too - you get a different view. I recommend the late afternoon, so you get a bit of both. Beware of all the trinkety souvenirs, and the champagne they offer is a bit tart.. Just go to learn and enjoy the view.

The MOST romantic trip Taken!!!!. At first I thought this would be touristy and cheesy BUT it was anything BUT!Very nice dinner beautiful music and a lovey way o spend an evening with someone very special.It s divinely a MUST-DO

Stunning views from the Eiffel Tower. I would love to explore this river so much more. I've only explored it from above so far. Amazing to think that the Vikings once rowed along here to attack Paris. History and geography is amazing.

Wonderful site. We were in Paris for Disneyland with our Son this weekend (12th Dec) and had a walk around to see some attractions. My Wife and I had been to Paris last year but we wanted to show our Son some of the sites. We went down to the Seine to have a brief look at the Eiffel Tower. The river is beautiful and serene and gives Paris a wonderful feel. A must for all travellers to the city. Enjoy.

a walk at the riverside or on the water. Explore your own ways along the river Seine - it is always a nice and calming time. If you do not feel like walking, get yourself on board of one of the river cruisers and experience Paris from a new perspective.
Trip down the Seine. $ of us caught one of the cruise boat for 12 euros, fabulous itinerary on board despite the cold, got some fab pics.

Always delightful. Weather walking along the path or cruising down, the Seine has the best views of Paris and is always alive with something to do. Take advantage of the paths along the water level for a stroll or run.

Holiday. We had join GLOBUS tour we join que but only few minutes then we get into Revir Seina Cruise very nice the building full of architecture very beautiful place we had good tour guide took us arround Paris
By night the Eiffiel Tower is very beautiful and the river

Summer In Paris. One of the best ways to see Parris is to do a tour of the Seine. This tour takes you by boat pass most of the interesting land marks in Paris. It is one of the must do's when in Paris.

Beautiful romantic evening. I came here with myself and I guess got a one hour cruise in the evening time around 5 or 6. It was amazing and so romantic to see Paris in the river seine cruise. You can get the cruise just beside eiffel tower.

An hour on the Seine. An hour in a tour boat from Tour Eiffel past Norte Dame and back. - Under numerous bridges and past many of the massive buildings on the banks of the Seine - for 10 Euros - great value and a good perspective from the river.
Take a walk down the river synonymous with romance. The river is surrounded by the artsy crowd, stops for the musicians, portraits, and antique sales. You might stumble on a surprising treasure.

Iconic Waterway . Oh my this river is worth the look for so many reasons it is impossible to even start the list. It seems to tie everything in central Paris together. Beautiful anytime of day or night I can go walk it over and over. Cruising would be wonderful or just sitting in a favorite spot and letting it pass you by. Each bridge and edifice seems defined by it.

People-friendly Banks of the Seine. A December 4-day visit, and some walking in sunshine and wind on both banks, and the Quais of the two Iles, de Cite and St Louis. There was interest everywhere, and the sellers of books and knicknacks along the railings also had a smile and a 'cheery 'Bonjour', despite the wind. Despite the season, the whole area bustled - and kids were fascinated with the Vedettes and Bateaux, and the cosmopolitan good-natured crowd. We took a Vedette trip, from the Pont Neuf landing, on a clear early evening, with the lights coming on at all the buildings and bridges, while the Tour Eiffel showed up - brightly lit - above the rooflines. Do take a camera for the spectacular bridges' statues and decoration, and windproof coats - although the bateaux have closed canopies.There are plenty of cafes and small restaurants all along the banks, so there's plenty of good cheer when 'vin chaud' or cafe-cognac is called for.

Beautiful river. I met two guys in the Hostel and we decided to walk from the hostel to the Notre-dame Cathedral and Louvre Museum. Walking along the River Seine is incredibly pleasant, the view is amazing.

A cruise on the Seine. We cruised with UNIWORLD on the Seine and I would highly recommend this to everyone. Being on the ship I'm front of the Eiffel Tower at night is not only romantic but truly remarkable. There are many dinner cruises on the Seine as well as day tours but we chose to spend a week on the Seine. Very memorable!

Glorious. We visited in December and enjoyed walking along the banks of the Seine. No matter when you go there is always something to see or do.
We stopped of for a rest at a floating garden near the Pont d'Alma. Wonderful!

Boat Tour down the Seine. I hesitated to take a boat tour, but was glad that I did. It was a brisk kind of overcast day, but the ride was smooth. There are audio devices for you to listen to the commentary on what you are seeing, the history of the bridges, etc. The ride lasts about an hour. Provides great photo opportunities.

15 minutes or 3 hours. I love the River Seine, whether walking along it, driving along it, taking a boat ride. You can get the effect in a few minutes or spend half the day. There are places to eat or snack and quite different views, depending on where you are. Don't miss it.

Viking River Cruise, Paris to Normandy and Omaha Beach WWII Area. My wife and I did this river cruise the first of November 2015. My uncle was in the D-day invasion and I always wanted to see the Normandy beach area. Great trip! Viking folks met us at the airport, took us to the ship and pampered us all week. Food was good, service great and room comfortable. Views along the Seine were always good and changing. Never a dull moment on this river cruise with only 150 passengers. Also saw Monet's place where he lived and did his paintings in Giverney. Several other stops along the way, all of which were interesting. We felt like we really got our money's worth. Group tours with individual headsets were great. All the guides and Viking crew spoke good English.

Nighttime cruise on the Seine. The cruise line was located just across the street from the Eiffel Tower, and was a short walk, where we enjoyed a drink waiting for the hour trip up the Seine, which boarded at 8:00 pm. A perfect event for just after the Eiffel Tower. One suggestion, the Bateaux Parisian, I recall from my last trip to Paris, would translate the tour into several languages, however, the boat tour we were on, was only in French, so be sure to ask, before you buy a tour, as there are many fascinating details regarding the many bridges you will pass under, some dating back to the revolution, and you don't want to miss hearing about this, like my wife and unfortunately did. I cannot recall the name of the company, however, it was on the same side of the river as the Eiffel Tower. After experiencing both, my vote goes to the Bateaux Parisien company.
Nice. Well, the trip in the boat was nice, but it was too crowded and too hot. But overall the experience was really nice, and it should be done during the sunset.

The beaurtitful Seine. The Seine is indeed beautiful as it meanders through Paris with its numerous striking bridges. Viewed from one of these, or from the riverside walkways it has to be seen, and indeed can hardly be missed, by those visiting this wonderful city.
Bookstalls. The weather was nice, so we walked along the Seine and spent hours looking at books. The books were very cheap, so we bought too many.
Roler tour. At The first day u Must take this your, its give you in one hour a good location of The Best sites in paris.

wonderful place to stroll especially at night and in the summer.. if you do not want to take a boat trip, which is kind of fun. stroll along the banks of the river. Sit in the sun. Watch the sunset over pont neuf.
Nice to stroll along the Seine. Great place to stroll on a sunny day and look at all the shops along the way. Next time we would like to take one of the boat tours.

Walking the Seine. We arrived two weeks after the recent troubling events and found the city to be friendly and open to tourists. We walked the Seine - left bank one day and the right bank the next. With a museum pass in hand, walking the city allows you to take it all in at a reasonable pace.

Batobus on the Seine. Being in Paris we had to go to the Eiffel Tower by the Batobus ferry. Very convenient and gives you a chance to view the sites from the river. We then returned to Notre Dame therefore missing all the traffic.

Cruise at river seine. In you are in Paris, do not miss the river cruise as you can view some of best landmarks of Paris during the cruise. Also, taking a walk/jogging along the riverside is a very pleasant experience. There are good eating joints and pubs too!
Amazing cruise. highly recommende. we got in the boat for a cruise on the seine and it is well worth it to see the sights and the city
Jogged Along, Cruised Along. Every morning I went and jogged along the river. We took a fabulous 1 hour river cruise at night to see The Eiffel Tower all lit up...spectacular!

Magical!. If you spend any time at all in Paris, you will have opportunities to see the Seine as some of Paris' best landmarks such as Notre Dame are located right on it. You can take leisurely walks along "sidewalks" that are lower than street level. In France they are called "quais". For me, the most enjoyable part was when my friend and I took a riverboat ride down the Seine as we passed many of the landmarks we had visited on land, but had the opportunity to see them from a different perspective. I highly recommend doing this just before dusk! That is when we did it. We were here in 2008.
Highly recommend the river cruise. The river cruise is only a couple of hours but you will be given all kinds of information about the bridges and buildings you pass by.

River cruise on the Seine. Had an enjoyable cruise on the river Seine for a number of hours. A beautiful cruise as you went and seen many, many of the local landmarks and the numerous bridges Paris is famous for. Enjoyable and recommend the trip.
Nice view. Nice view, a must visit when in Paris. Good place to take a Seine boattour and to take pictures. Pont Neuf

Lovely views of Paris and a romantic place to roam. We found ourselves crossing over the Seine river over and over again. It was always a pleasure to see the views, the gorgeous buildings and all the many pretty bridges crossing the river. My favorite time at the Seine was at night... All the bridges light up and the trees lining the Seine at this time of year are decorated with fairly lights which just adds to the charm. A trip to Paris would not be complete without a stroll on the Seine

Walk along the riverbank!. If you enjoy walking like we do, you will love walking along the banks of the Seine. It is mostly car free with lots of walkers and bicyclists. The walkways sit down from the street levels, blocking noise from the bustling streets above. We kept intending to do one of the many boat cruises on the river, but time got away from us!

Beautiful and romantic. The River Seine is truly a most beautiful and romantic river running through Paris and crossed by many beautiful bridges. There are lovely walkways either side with restaurants situated alongside parts of the walkways.The River is busy with normal working river boats and also the tourist boats constantly going up and down but it all adds to the energy and excitement. You can simply enjoy the walk or eat at a restaurant and watch the boats go by, or have lunch or dinner on a boat - whatever suits you. Shop aound as some of the boat rides/lunch and dinner cruises are expensive.

Seine cruise by night. So I left from the docs outside the Eiffel tower travelled for about an hour in a multilingual tour. It was cold so bare that in mind if planning to sit outside but seeing the city from that vantage point was wonderful. The number of languages (4) mean there is a lack of information just the top level stuff. Also going under the bridges it was hard to hear the broadcast from the loud speakers but I'd recommend it

On off. So many of Paris' major attractions are within a stones throw of the Seine, that an on/off barge is a natural way to see the City. You might want to terminate at Notre Dame, cross the Ile de Citie, and head back toward the Terminus at the Eiffel Tower. Early evening is the perfect timing
Great way to see Paris. Plenty of boat options to be able to see paris from the river, and also provides a good spot for taking a walk along it.
Riverboat Cruise. Very relaxing to cruise down the river and see several attractions. This was not a dinner cruise, but those looked romantic so may have to do that next time.

A pleasant Sunday walk in Paris. We began our walk from Notre Dame Cathedral after attending Mass on Sunday morning. The Gregorian Mass is always an uplifting experience. We had set ourselves the goal of visiting the Picasso Mania exhibition at the Grand Palace and decided to walk along the Seine to get there. We diverted into the side streets of the left bank through the Saint Germain area and finally worked our way back to the river opposite the Hotel de Ville. We then wandered along the left bank of the river along the various quays past the Musee D'Orsay and the Invalides and headed for Pont Alexandre lll. Along the quay on the opposite side to the Tuilleries there is a large recreation stretch with various spots to play games, skate board, jog, or cycle. There are also several shipping containers which have been converted into places to play indoor games and to have a meal. Each container is comfortably appointed and could accommodate about 8 people and comes equipped with a range of board games and indoor activities. There is a nearby kiosk where food and drinks can be purchased. We duly arrived at the Pont Alexander lll - a most attractive bridge with its views to the Eiffel Tower and on to the Champs Elysee - and then to the Grand Palace for the Picasso Mania exhibition. If we had been bolder we could have walked home on the right bank past the Louvre, Hotel de Ville etc but the weather had turned cold and showery by the time we finished our visit to the exhibition so we went home via the Metro. Acjheap day out really and a pleasant way to see Paris at walking pace.

Delightful River Cruise. We took the Bateau Parisienne river cruise. It took us down and back the entire length of the Seine in Paris. I had purchased our tickets in advance. Arrive early for your desired sailing. There are several companies that offer river cruises. Directions to each are poor. We arrived at exactly the right time and were told it was too late to board. We had to wait for the next sailing.

Yes. The seine, synonymes with paris, romance tales fill the air, most enjoyed by taking a river cruise that I guarantee will put a smile on your face and warmth in your heart, enjoy the bridges and all the sites that you will pass by, a must...
Through the center of Paris. Walk the Seine, which has many low walkways away from the traffic. Take a boat cruise to see all the major sites and bridges.

Great to take it all in, but.... Walking down the Seine of an evening with the Eiffel Tower in the background and the hubbub of Paris all around is a beautiful experience. Well was, till I stood on a dead rat. There are thousands of them. Ugh.

Great to Just walk along. It wasn't the nicest day while I was there but still wanted to soak it all in. my walk along the river and watching all the boats go up and down the river was very enjoyable. Wish it would have been a nicer day but what can one do. Rain or shine I think if one is in Paris to see the sights a walk or a boat ride on or along the Seine is a must.
Lovely views. This is a very lovely river running through the city. they have many attractions along the river for visitors to enjoy. Many runners run on the paths along the river.

Walk, run, sit, read, enjoy--. How could anyone give the Seine less than five stars? It's such a beautiful feature of Paris and one that is greatly enjoyed by residents and tourists alike. You can get off the very busy (and often dangerous for pedestrians!) streets of Paris by going down the steps and walking along the river. We found one section that must have been Paris' Muscle Beach, because everyone was exercising, doing pull-ups on equipment, and so on. The best way to enjoy the Seine is to take a cruise, which I'll describe in my review of the cruise boat, Le Calife.
Wonderful. River Seine is a very Nice place to see the City and to take a walk on the side. All the beautiful brigdes you Will see is just fantastic.

Magnificient, Picturesque, Historic & Romantic River Seine & its views through Walks & Cruises - Must Experience!!!. Seine River with its history, beauty , romanticism attached to it is one unique River to experience.There are around 37 bridges constructed around the river in Paris including 4 person only bridges. It presents truly romantic views whether one takes a cruise (lunch, high-Tea or Dinner) around it, just taking pctures, romantic viewing or just walking along it among countless bridges, beautiful sites that you cross by such as Eiffel, Notre Dame, Ponde De Alexandre, Pont De Alma, Trocadero, Grand Palais etc.... to name select few.Don't forget to indulge in any such acts described, as it offers the travelers such exhilarating experience through whatever options one chooses.There are River Seine Cruises, Beautax Mouches cruises during day, evening or night to experience Lunch, Hig-Tea or Dinner Cruises to experince this beautiful river!

Seine - a beauty!!!. This river flows close to Eiffel tower. River cruises are available for an hour, which I say a must. There will be narration by the crew during the cruise on the places on the banks of this river. A splendid river cruise I would say! Buy a Paris Pass, which covers bith cruise ticket and transportation ticket before in hand to visit this place.

Better experience than expected. We heard so much about the river seine and thought it would not live up to expectations. To our delight, we found it wasn't overrated. We walked along it and caught the batobus. The bridges over are beautiful and any picture taken with it in has come out looking really good. Take time and stroll along, there is something different at every turn

Amazing!!. This river cuts across the city of Paris and one can see some of the famous monuments from the boat Cruise. One can go on a river cruises to explore Paris.. .or for a more romantic moments have a dinner Cruise on this river. There are plenty of options.
Very Serene. This was a great way to see most of the attractions of Paris. Very romantic as well. Saw the Louvre along the river as well. Great experience
Love the river!. I truly love to be near water, and what better place to take a romantic stroll than along the River Seine in Paris! You can't miss it, since it runs through the city!

Beautiful Seine . We are so fortunate to have views over the river from our hotel.
And we are also fortunate to be blessed with good - but cold weather - enabling us to wander the banks of the river taking in all the sights.
Beautiful river.

Romantic River. We walked beside the Seine taking in the views along the river. It was worth getting off the buses and slowly strolling, able to view the monuments famous and not so famous. From the banks of the river we were able to see so much more, looking along the bends in the river at the wonderful buildings, each bridge more statues. Then there were the stalls selling paintings and some really quite unique artifacts, old records, books, post cards. eventually we stopped at a cafe for the best bowl of ice cream and watched the crowd pass by. A day or so later we saw another view on the way to Monet's garden, the river gently flowing through the country side, willows dipping gracefully into reflective waters.
Nice trip. . If you are in Paris then don't miss the boat tour on Seine River. It is really amazing specially in morning time.........
Boat trip . Great views from the boat, loads of landmarks to see. Takes about an hour to finish. Best in a sunny day.

Summer hot spot to chill with friends. As a Parisian, I can say that the river is just awesome! It's not the river itself (it's extremely polluted even if it's not as worst than decades earlier and therefore quite toxic) but the activities to do nearby, especially during the summer.I personally enjoy just chilling with my friends, drinking, smoking and snacking during the evening, by the riverside on the Ile Saint-Louis or just next to the Hôtel de Ville (city hall). You can also just walk by, do your running, sit down and read a book, and many other things! It's up to you!
Cruise!!!. An hour n half cruise on it enjoy the Parisian architecture all along n also the various monuments!!!
Quintessential France. Walking along the River Seine was relaxing and one of the most authentic experiences of visiting France
Feel Paris in at it's best along this river. It's the one of the best part when you walk along river Seine and fell the atmosphere of Paris, if you are near Eifel Tower or Notre Dame.

One of My Favorite Parisian Moments.... One of my favorite moments in Paris was gathering a picnic from a local market (cheese, baguette, Spanish ham, a fig tart, and white wine) and taking it to the banks of the Seine. I sat by the river on a bench. The day was so peaceful with boats making their way up the river full of happy tourists drinking wine, taking pictures, and enjoying the splendor of Paris. After lunch, go back up the stairs and wonder along the upper banks where book vendors are set up selling interesting knickknacks.
Lovely boat trip . The river Seine is always good for a boat ride. Got some close up on the little lady Liberty and real good view of the Eiffel Tower

Life in Paris Happens Along the Seine. I can't think of anything I'd rather do than walk the banks of the Seine, looking through the booksellers' stalls and passing the day away...whether it's spring in Paris and the buds are forming on the trees or I'm wrapped up in scarf's and a parka. It's simply always beautiful, always amazing, and simply buzzing with life!
Sunday Stroll. Weather was so good, joined many others strolling along the River Seine. Plenty of seats to sit and watch.
Great way to see all the major sites around the city. You can book in advance. Hop on, hop off options available when you buy a day ticket. Reasonably priced too!

Essential and Inevitable in your Visit to Paris. Paris is build around the Seine on it's two islands. It is wonderful to stroll or jog along the upper or lower paths day or night. The barges passing by and the slow moving river.

Outstanding. there is no other place like paris and NO better activity than to stroll along the river seine. alone or with a friends it is outstanding with so much to see you'll be over stimulated with amazing culture and history

Boat tours along Seine, fantastic. The boat tours in my opinion, are great value for money.I think this would be a good thing to do on your first day in Paris as Seine runs through the city, you can really get your bearings, hear more about the sites and relax!We were lucky enough to have sunshine, i'm not sure it would be very nice to do on a rainy or foggy day...

Changes color. In my several visits to Paris, I have seen the Seine with many colors. It looks like it keeps changing colors may be the weather has an effect on that. However, be it a cruise or a stroll along it, a visit to Paris without seeing it is never complete.

Cruised the River...and walked along it's banks.... Can't experience the real Paris without walking along the banks of the River Seine and taking a river cruise... We did both! The Bateaux Mouches took us for an hour cruise along the Old Paris with its splendid architectures. The views were amazing...and the cruise was very informative, a must do I say.
Enjoyable walk. Strolling the river you'll see magnificant view of Paris. Spend an afternoon and took lots of pics....

A great place to start in Paris.... There are many places along the river seine that has beautiful parks and even statue exhibitions. Of course their are also many interesting canal houseboats around Pont Neuilly, check em out.If you like walking, this is a great location to walk in Paris with many different sites to see on bothe the right and left bank.There are too many places to mention. If you are a runner and want to run some where, this is a great place to run.Do yourself a favour, get a map of Paris and check out the many interesting sites along the Seine.

Stroll the Seine!. No matter where you're going or headed, make sure to take some time to walk along the river. Its such an important part of the city and its history to ignore. We also took a boat tour at night, its a unique perspective to take in the sights.

You'll fall in love. Had a nice river cruise. Boarded just below the Eiffel Tower. There are many options from different locations near the Eiffel tower area for the boat rides. It is a must do to have the complete Paris experience. During cold days avoid the open top areas as it gets really cold in the waters. If unavoidable carry a cap and muffler(scarf). It is a lifetime experience more enjoyable in the evenings. You have options to have snacks and drinks on the boats at an extra cost. Overall excellent experience with the boat ride. The river Siene is the main attraction in Paris and adds beauty to the city's landscape. Just keep walking along the river and most of the attractions are located around it. An Open tour Bus would be a good option to go around. The original Status of Liberty is also located on an Island in the Siene river about a km from the tower. Do see it.....though it is much smaller than its American Replica (which was gifted by France to the US).
Impressive historical river, life blood of Paris. Great to cross some of the old beautiful bridges and take a boat ride along the Seine river. Great way to see some of Paris' most famous attractions
Beautiful by boat at night. Find a small boat sailing the waterway at night - one of those offering dinner perhaps. Very romantic and well worth the time.

Join the river cruise. There are a lot of stores selling souvenirs and food within the area. The surroundings here is not very clean that is why I am only giving 4 stars but the cruise that I joined is the deal breaker. You can see a lot of attractions, just admiring every scenery that we passed by. Will be doing this again when I come back in Paris!
brilliant. A trip down the seine is a must when in Paris. Many boat trips for sightseeing with commentarys. Last about an hour well worth it

Best seen from a boat. We started a river cruise to Normandy in Paris. The river must be seen from a boat. If I visit Paris again will take a night cruise down the Seine. Fortunately, the sun was out when we were in Paris and for the first day of our trip.
Beautiful by land or by water.. I travelled down the Seine on a river boat and I got to see so many lovely things. I would highly reccomend going on a river cruise while in Paris.

Just gorgeous. I have walked or jogged along the banks of this river each day while I've been in Paris & each day I'm inspired by the variety of views & the atmosphere along these banks... Make sure to spend some time here next time you're in Paris.

Nice boat tour, sightseeing in different perspective. Worth trying a boat tour. Seems different in comparison with city tour by walking or city bus tour. There is a nice promenade for walking. Worth visiting in day and at night, looks differently.

Take a one hour boat cruise down the river Seine.. We thoroughly enjoyed being guided through the heart of historic Paris and discover the beautiful banks of the Seine,You get a different perspective during a boat cruise. Go when the weather is fine.
Scenic . Take one of the boat rides as you get a lovely view of the city. Seats do not have a lot of legroom tho

City of Lights Reflrcted on the Water. We took a night boat on the Seine a mere six days before the great tragedy turned out the lights on this magnificent city. The tour was really nice. All the bridges and beautiful buildings are well lit, as are monuments and occasional trees. The guide in our case was reasonable with his explanations. We had front seats, which I recommend to photographers. Come back and light up this city with your presence. This world belongs to us, the lovers of the living and of life.

Enjoy your Time. The Seine itself along with the Notre Dame is the heart of the city. If weather is nice buy sandwiches and drinks and go down stairs and have a casual picnic. In any event walk the bridges and descend the stairs to get closer to the river. A boat tour is nice if the weather is good, especially at night to get oriented to the city. If you are in Paris for a long trip, definitely do the boat tour, but on any short trip having a feel for the city really does depend on getting close to the river a few times to feel the heartbeat of the city.

Beautiful place for a stroll. The river Seine gives Paris a lot of character. It flows through many parts of Paris. You can stroll along the scenic banks of the river as it is very romantic and relaxing.

Amazing sites. My first experience of the river was a dinner cruise. What a fabulous experience. Good food, wine, and live music. Eiffel tower, Notre Dam, The Louvre, and many other amazing sites along the way. My wife and walked along the river many times and really enjoy ourselves.

Everywhere!. Walking along the Seine is easy--it's near most of the sights in Paris. No need to take a boat to enjoy the views. Just look over a bridge or two--provided you have time to explore Paris. On the other hand, if you are pressed for time, and want to see the sights, this may be a good option.
A beautiful walk along the Seine. Was impressed with the views and walking path. Beautiful on a sunny day. Free and romantic! Had a glass of wine and a small picnic with my wife there.

Paris at Night from the River Seine. We climbed down the steps looking for a bateau going down the River Seine. Our search lasted about 30 minutes but we finally found a fixed tour. It was not the jump on jump off bateau we were looking for, but it was still a magical ride. Paris at Night seen from the river is something no visitor to Paris would want to miss. Our boat took us up and around the Isle Saint Louis and down toward the Eiffel Tower and back. It provided a great opportunity to capture the architecture of Paris from a different point of view; looking up from the river. Color, light and life; all that make Paris the incomparable city it is. We loved you Paris and will return.
A 1 hour cruise. We went on a one hour cruise on the Seine and enjoyed this very much. The sound system was very good and was spoken in English.
Lovely river trip.. Would highly recommend this to anyone in paris. Very cheap for a daily ticket and can be used as hop on hop style. A must while in paris.
Great by night. The cruise is only one hour. Seeing the view from the aspect from the water gives a completely unique perspective.

Magnifique. The Seine, just like the Thames for London, is a very integral part of the city, and the banks are kept in pristine condition by the City of Paris. A cruise along the River has to be on your list of things to do in Paris, well worth it.
seine river cruise. take a boat for seine river cruise.Many halts and almost all tourist attraction sited along seine covered.

A lovely trip along the Seine. Whether by boat trip or just a gentle wander along it's banks, the Seine is a beautiful way to spend a few hours. Beautiful architecture to admire and shops and restaurants are only a short walk away at any time. You MUST visit Paris

Fabulous place to stroll. We loved just meandering along both sides of the river taking in all the sights. There are so many bridges to cross and all sorts of boats to watch. There are private boats, sightseeing boats, some of which serve meals while you take in the sights along the way. The vendors on both sides sell a variety of souvenirs. While walking around the city we used the river as a landmark to know where we were. It's beautiful, romantic and peaceful and in an expensive city it costs nothing to enjoy it.
A river that runs through Paris. We went on a boat tour of all major tourist attraction by buying a day pass.You get the chance to see the whole of Paris from the river

Nice views during day and especialy at night. By some of the riverboats you have a serious discount with the Paris Metro Card ( witch is valid for 2,3 or 5 days ) you will see all the important buildings from a different point of view.The trip in the evening has a ´´special´´ romantic sphere and you see Paris as it should be ´´ the city of lights ´´Do not book a ´´diner cruise´´ because while eating you miss the beautiful views of Paris.If possible go on the open boat deck because here you will see the most of Paris.

Beauty along the river. Another attraction not to miss in Paris. The river passes beautiful bridges and among many beautiful and historical landmark. This is less than 2 hour tour so it will not bored anyone. Also, it's nice to hear about the story that comes with it, gorgeous sunset and the lights is beautiful at night, so worth it!

River Seine divides and unites. The River Seine divides and unites Paris. Boating is a favoured pastime. Bridges such as the Pont Neuf are famous in their own right. The Seine's Left Bank is well known as a center for the nation's avant guarde. Can one think of Paris without its iconic river?

Take a river cruise!. Take a River Cruise--- a relaxing way to see the famous landmarks along the equally famous River Seine--- or better yet, take a stroll along the river, be it night or day--- both are quite pleasant walks--- I'd say there is no better way to see Paris than walking!!! If you want to take a rest, sit in one of the benches on one of the many bridges crossing the River Seine--- there are so many interesting souvenir items being sold by local peddlers along the River, and some great paintings,too!

Best viewing by the Bateaux Mouche. We traveled the river at night by way of the Bateaux Mouche. This is the best way to see the bridges and get an overview of the major landmarks all lit up at night. It was cold on the river at night but we wrapped up and enjoyed our beautiful little cruise. The narrations were in English and about 4 other languages. Very worthwhile way to see the river.

Ah, the River Seine.... What could be more Parisian than the River Seine? Each bridge is special in their own way and the views are wonderful. (Unfortunately, it was pretty grey when we were there.) We especially enjoyed walking around the vendors on the sides.

Great way to make your way through Paris!. 2 greats ways to explore the Seine: chose on of the boat tours OR lace up some great walking shoes, and make your way from one end of Paris to the other! Easily navigable sidewalks, just stop to visit many of the landmarks along the way. Particularly pretty is Ile de la Cite, and it's hard not to feel romantic when you catch a glimpse of all of the French couples in love :)
Sensational Seine. We could have sat and relaxed along the Seine for an entire day. It was so peaceful and serene. A wonderful pause during a busy day!

An Autumn walk along the Seine. Rather than using the metro each time we walked along the Seine both during the day and on an evening. We were due to have a champagne cruise but due to the attacks in Paris, all activities were halted. Despite this, it was a pleasant walk and there was a photographic exhibition being displayed outside which was very interesting.Lovely to just walk and avoid the crowds in November

Always nice to walk on the lower level.. It is advisable to take a stroll along the Seine, on the lower level. It gives a good insight in Paris and it is nice because you do not have to deal with traffic. Think about the forecast conditions!
Just beautiful. Wonderful experience walking along the River Seine, seeing so many interesting bridges and crossing over them to take photos.

A glorious view.. The photograph showing is most likely taken from the Eiffel Tower.The first level of the tower gives you spectacular views of the river and craft using it. There are river trips available although we did not have time to take a trip. Some of the trips are boarding right near the tower so you can combine the two attractions at the one locality. The toilets for public use are behind one side of the tower and be patient as the queue is nearly always longRayem

Dont miss the opportunity to travel along the Seine River. Take a tour, the best way possible to experience the enchant of the River Seine. The river itself needs a bit of attention in regards to cleanliness. The history along the channel is incredible!
Best place for lunch!. My sister and I picked up some baguettes with goat cheese, with rosemary and olive oil (delicious!) and enjoyed a beautiful sunny lunch by the river Seine. Very relaxing.

Cruise the River Seine. While in Paris you must cruise the River Seine. Just cruising along this water way you can see a lot of tour attractions. The cruise is a narrated two hour tour for a small cost.
Must DO. You must do a river cruise! Just for the bridges alone they are a must see. I would suggest doing it at night as well

Ideal place for quality time. The best option would be to take a walk around the river during the day covering points like notre dame, louvre etc while opting for a night cruise. The temperature at night drops with the air being quite nippy, so warm clothing is recommended as you would spend more time outside.
Beautiful river in the center of Paris. If you are looking for somewhere to sit and just be - find a spot along the Seine and watch the passing traffic.

Beautiful river. We crossed the river at the Eiffel Tower and the carousels and walk along the river towards George V Boulevard and thought it was lovely even in on him with very few leaves on the trees on the banks.

Gorgeous. On our first night in Paris while trying to find a particular river cruise company, we spent a lot of time walking around the Seine. It is a gorgeous walk and an interesting one as well. Lots of the main attractions such as the Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower can be seen when walking around the Seine. There are also a great deal of dinner boats on the Seine that looked very interesting.

Bateau Mouche!. As part of our travel deal, we had free tickets on a Bateau Mouche, best way to see & admire the River Seine (a lot of Japanese tourists who wouldn't sit still!). Informative commentary and saw all the riverside sights in the 70 minute trip. Recommended.
Need to do it again. Great experience but would like to do it again. So many historical buildings to see, it went so fast.

Fantastic River. First of all this River is very well clean in comparison of Rivers in other places. fantastic view special from Eiffel Tower. Don't miss a tour by Boat in the Seine , but in a none Rainy date in order to enjoy

Never a disappointment. By Night, By Day, in good weather and in bad, never a disappointment. In central Paris, just looking into the houseboats is an experience with an alternative life style. Take a cruise, cheap or expensive, and get out onto the water or even better yet, up some of the smaller canals.Seing the city from the water edge or looking at the working traffic on the water, the hours are always fascinating. The landmarks take on a new perspective when viewed from the water, and the historical time line seems to shrink and it becomes hard to imagine which epoch you might be traveling the river on.Even if you just grab a baguette and a bottle of wine, sit on the steps of the quay and soak up the atmosphere.

Up the river . Had a Seine River Cruise & dinner, it was just ok, you cannot go outside to take pictures & inside the windows are curved & you can't take pictures through this glass. You do see some of the sights

City Ahoy.. The River Cruise is a superb way to see many of the many sights in Paris from The Eiffel Tower to Saint Martins Canal entrance. The Seine is a welcoming water course with quiet flowing water and typical picture postcard photograph opportunities. As with all landscapes the night views and daytime lighting are both beneficial in contrast.
Europe tour. On the seine going and coming from the Eiffel tour on the tour was good worth doing different modes of transport to see the city
Must-do!. Everyone who goes to Paris must travel through the Seine River! See all the sights in a truly unique Parisian way. Amazing!

Great to spend the afternoon on a boat ride. Beautiful river surrounded by green areas and decks. There are a number of stops which will get you close to many attractions if you get on a boat for a ride around it.

Perfectly good urban river. Lots and lots of water, looks reasonably clean. If you visit Paris you can't miss it. Some fairly decent bridges span it. It's helpful when you sprain your ankle and can't walk very well, because there are several perfectly decent boat trips you can take. You sit down for an hour and a nice person tells you about all the sights you can see from the Seine, and there are quite a few. Go for it.

Traverse the River. Beautiful at night and during the day, this was a charter event but plenty of boats to hop on, the restaurants on boats not recommended. Dicey at night, have a taxi waiting for you.

Siene. If you are on a tight clock , this is a quick fix to see the major sites from afar. The river tour takes you up one side and down the other, along the way you see the Louvre, Notr Dame, Museum de Orray, the lock bridge, Eiffel tower and much more. So it will give you a quick fix if strapped for time

Magical River. Romantic boat ride back up the river from the tower. The sights are magical, hopped off near Notre Dame. Hopped off and did the love lock thing on the enarby bridge. Recommended river ride for everyone.

A week of paradise! Viking River Cruise. Loved every minute of this river cruise. Stress free from the moment we landed in Paris until we flew back home. Wonderful ship (Rinda,) crew, food and tours. Viking thought of everything and made this very pleasurable.

Night Tour is GREAT !. We took a boat tour at night on this river, it lasted about one hour and it was great. We went down up and down the river and we did see all kinds of different buildings and the Effile tour with their lights on at night and it spectacula. Be sure to take this attraction when in Paris.

there is always something to see iron do at the Sein. the area around river is always busy but pleasant it is mixed with local pub goers, runners and tourists who ate either taking a river tour or going for a dinner, ...or just to watch other people.you can find there boat bars and restaurants, climbing wall, floating park, game area, river tour operators, runners or just families relaxing along with others.
super!!. you'll see quite a lot of important sights when on the River Siene cruise. the Eiffel tower, Notre Dame Catherdral and lots and lots of bridges. Paris is beautiful.
the seine cruise is well worth the time.. we cruised the seine by night, a wonderful experience. bateaux parisienne do a gourmet cruise. the seine is clean and bordered by stunning landmarks

fantastic cruis. Went during the evening, and saw everything (under see through cover) as it was a bit raining. Whole cruise took an hour, and we returned, just as the Eiffel tower went berzerk with coloured solver and gold lights. very impresses. Took cruise from peir number 3 outside the Eiffel Tower, and returned there 1 hour later. Cruise details were in French and English
Follow the Seine.... ...and you will see most of Paris' main landmarks. Walk under its bridges, picnic in its parks, and in the summer visit Paris plage (beach).
Lovely atmosphere. Went on a riverboat with meal and passed all the landmarks of Paris, watched the locals salsa dancing on the river banks, a lovely experience in one of my favourite cities
stunning view. one of the best things you have not missing it to take a tour in the river of seine verrrrrrry beautiful very nice view specially with the tour of the boat .... amazing....

Wonderful views during the day or night. I was lucky enough to travel on the river via a dinner cruise.
It was a great experience, especially when seeing the Eiffel Tower lit up at night. We also went past the Louvre and Notre Damn. The river is surrounded by wonderful architecture. I would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Paris.

A great hike. It's a weekend must. A beautiful place to walk or jogging. All along the Seine river band. It's clean, very well arranged to enjoy watching historical building, 'peniche' river boat, and houseboat, or just come with a bunch of friends and cheese and wine to savour.. Enjoy

A match for the Thames. For a long time I preferred the River Thames in London for a long walk with great views - but Paris has now matched that for me with the River Seine. Gorgeous walk for the most part, great cafes and restaurants and the usual boat trips! Very green river walk and a nice way to spend a sunny afternoon.
cruising with charming time. have a cruise or a dinner ( with piano and violin live romantic music) is a unique experience : starting with champagne, a delicious dinner waits for you ...

Take a river boat cruise at night for dinner! Bateaux Moches - it is worth it!. Love the lack of litter and how well kept the paths are. People at night come and have little picnics, the feeling is positive (not like you're by a river path with drunks lurking about). It is well lit at night and many people are about, walking, running, socializing.

Taking a boat trip is a must in Paris.. Floating on the River Seine affords you an instant, relaxing and romantic way to get your bearings in Paris. Starting at the Eiffel Tower, cruising past Notre Dame, the Left Bank, and the castle where Marie Antoinette spent her last hours is breathtaking.
Worth the money and the time!
Romantic Walk along the River Seine. Nothing like walking with your loved one while walking along the River Seine on a beautiful day! A must while in Paris!!!
The River. Very nice to cruise down the river and see all the attractions and the statue of liberty save your feet and hop on and hop off bus a must

Didn't get the chance to walk the river side.. I saw La Seine, but really didn't get a chance to walkabout the River seine.
Anyway, still good and pretty.
Huge and massive than what I've expected.
Cruising. We caught the ferry from Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame, great experience, great scenery, We loved every minute of it, worth while doing it

Highly scenic!. Lovely pictures from the bridges and walks along the Seine. Lots of activity and attractions and restaurants on both sides of the river. Great for picture taking. You can stay busy for more than a day walking and visiting cafes and attractions along the river.

Stroll the river bank and melt your stress away. There's so much to see along it's banks plan a day strolling from Notre Dame to Eiffel Tower; yes it's a long walk but you don't need to be in a rush. The street vendors have some very nice collectibles ( and some touristy trash) and there's a nice bar on a river barge near Pont Alexandre bridge so when you get to that point stop for a rest and enjoy a glass of wine. Bring your camera and definitely stop at one of the numerous side walk cafe's.

Lovely River Cruise. Enjoyed a lovely river cruise from point neuf which if tickets were bought at the shop which was along the river bank was only 10 euros each (14 on boat). Saw the Eiffel tower, louvre, parliament, first hospital built, Russian coat of arms, love lock bridge, Notre Dame and more. 100% worth the money. Can walk to the point neuf cruise from Notre Dame although there are more river cruises available from other points.

Dancing on the left bank at the quai Saint Bernard. whenever the weather is nice, usually starting late Spring and always during the weekends during the summer and beginning months of fall, spontaneous dancers come with their own music (sometimes musicians with their instruments) and everyone is invited to participate.

Lots of joggers. A great way to get some exercise and avoid all the street crossings. Just go down by the river and you will see a lot of other people jogging it is very scenic especially in the morning

Lovely views from the boat. Went on a one hour cruise along the Seine and this was great as it was raining slightly. Good views of many of the attractions and quite romantic for couples, have to say the seine did smell a bit in places.

Just amazing. I've been blessed with sunny balmy weather on my trip to Paris. The river is a great navigation tool while in the city so the apartment I have rented is on the river across from Notre-Dame de Paris. I have not seen a bad view of the river yet
Beautiful River!. A stroll along the Seine at night is so pretty! We wanted to ride the BatoBus, however we arrived too late. We also enjoyed looking at the wares of the vendors along the sidewalk.

Romantic River In A Romantic City.. One of the most romantic cities in the world has an equally romantic river to either walk alongside or catch one of the many cruise ships that sail up and down. There are many beautiful bridges to stop and admire and perhaps add a 'Lovers Padlock'. This is being frowned upon due to one side of a bridge falling down with the weight! There are many cafes to stop for a drink and a bite to eat and watch the world go by. Try an evening walk....wow!!
RIVER CRUISE WITH DINNER. We did the river seine cruise in Paris and had dinner and wine included through Viator tours and it was just perfect.

Boat trip up and down the Seine. We stubbled across a boat trip that ran from near the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame for about €20 total
It was about an hour, with a wonderful guide and a lovely day. It was certainly value for money and a nice random tour.
Highly recommend seeing the city via the beautiful Seine.

The Perfect Place for an Evening Picnic. The river is beautiful, but the wide sidewalk and frequent staircases leading you down from the streets made the experience so unique. I recommend an evening picnic along the river. You can sit quietly and watch the Parisians strolling by as well as the boat tours on their way.

fantastic. Did the boat trip on the seine. Loved every minute of our trip. Got to see so much which we would have missed if we had been walking or on bus trip. Love how clean the seine is. Would highly recommend this trip.
Loved the night river cruise. At night it was amazing all lit up. The guide gave us a great tour of the history of the bridges while sharing a bottle of wine.

River cruis. Took a river cruise why does the Eiffel Tower was lighting up which was amazing. Be careful with children on any of the riverboat cruises as the people on the shore sometimes decide to discard their clothing to be funny.
Great views great area.. This 100 year old basilica affords fantastic views. If you are eating up there get away from the main street for better value.

Birthday celebration. We took a night tour of the Seine River. You can either take the tour that stops 8 times or take 1 hour and 30 minutes one. It was interesting to do it at night with a great view ofhe Eiffel Tower. Paris is an unique city.

Nice to walk near.. I had thought about booking a boat tour but glad I didn't spend the money.
most of the main sights are near the water and there are so many bridges I don't feel I missed anything. The only thing I remember cruising down the river were tour boats.
Bato boat. Loved the bato boat. It's a hop-on hop-off boat. The cost is cheap and you get allot from it. Loved it.

Beautiful. You can't really miss the River Seine when in the centre of Paris. Whether you're on a boat trip, strolling along the walkways or taking in the sights from the top of the Eiffel Tower, the River Seine is beautiful from every angle.

Cruise. Took a tour of the River . very informative.. Loved that the tour headsets had so many different languages. This left no one really left out..The bridges that crossed over the River..my god the pain staking time that must of went into them. Fantastic

A night crouse. We walked around seine many times, especially around notre dame , but one night reserved a crouse with dinner, it takes from 7:30 for about 3 hours , we enjoyed the seine, dinner and our boat.
Collette tour. Your best bet, to view the seine, is to walk up one side and own the other. There are many, many bridges so, you can pick any bridge to get back to where you started.
Take a tour on the Seine. There are many cruise boats options offered in this area. Great way to get an idea as to where the sights are located. You can't go wrong with seine tour.
What fun!. We went on a boat ride on the River Seine. The guide was great, pointing out different bridges, etc. It was wonderful to see both the right and left banks!

A different view of landmarks. There are a number of different companies doing tours on the river. Plenty of seating, inside and out, and you get an alternative perspective to the famous landmarks. Also it is beautiful to walk along the side both at night and in daytime.
Lovely walk. A lovely place to walk. And one can find numerous tourist attractions all around it. Loads of places to eat. And if interested, there is boat ride also.
Great Views. It's Paris, and it's the Seine river. What more needs to be said. Beautiful. We went on the boat as part of a paris in a Day tour. Well worth the value.

Unique!. There are a lot of thing in can do here: a picnic, walk around or you can take a boat! I took the boat for a sighseeing at night and it was unforgetable! It was so beautiful that made me wanna cry! It definetely one of the best ways to see Paris!
Use as a travel syestem.. We used a Hop on Hop off two day pass which was great. Boast or on time with drop off point covering all the main attractions. We also saw this at night which was beautiful.
romantic place. sitting besides the river, empty the brain space, just enjoy the paris moment, take like you're the local people in paris
Take a cruise at sunset/early night and take amazing pictures. I went at the end of a long day, the sun was setting so it was a perfect temperature and light for great pictures.

Not that impressive. Took a river tour. Very boring no guide batobus. Goodnprice though and could stop at 8 of the main attractions. Coukd buy 1 day or 2 day ticket hop on and off. Another way to see Paris.

Cruising on the River. A great way to see Paris a nice relaxing cruise on the river Seine to see some great sights from different views with some great information along the way. I would highly recommend and next time I might go more romantic and go for a night time cruise with a meal for a special experience
Excellent overview of Paris. The Bateaux Parisian boat is a must do activity! See almost all Paris attractions and decide where to go from there. The narrator spoke several languages.

A beautiful way to see Paris. If you have just one day in Paris and wondering what to do a trip down the river Seine is a must as it is a great and beautiful way to see Parish.We took one of the boat tours from the dock close to the Eiffel tower and it took us through a lovely ride under the beautiful arched bridges.

Dinner cruise on the Seine River. This was a fun way to enjoy dinner and see Paris from a different view. The dinner was wonderfully prepared and delicious. There was a violin and piano playing the whole time. The seating was great mostly everyone was near a window. I recommend going at night because the lights of the town were beautiful. There was a upstairs too which had an open roof so the pictures I took were amazing.
Nice walk. We walked to the shore and went long on the river boat. We saw an interesting bridges and beautiful buildings. We liked very much.

the only way to admire some of the Paris building. when travelling into Paris and I don't want to spend a lot of money on cruising La Seine,I get myself on the bus boat ( batobus ) from Beaugrenelle L'île aux Cygnes, then Eiffel tower all the way to Notre Dame, a total nine stops a long the way for a day pass Euro16.00 or two days pass Euro19.00In winter the boat has heating and in great weather use the terrace and enjoy. Station are M6 Bir Hakeim M10 Charles-MichelRER C Javel

Cruise Along The Seine To Experience Parisian Bliss. While some say that cruising is one experience that is not very different no matter where the river is, I disagree. The Botaboat cruise along Seine in Paris is one such experience. The views are outwordly and make sure you cruise along at night. The Eiffel and other hot spots appear to dazzle. The botaboats are priced at about 20 euros. Top Facts-This is one cruise experience you should save up for enjoying with your partner.The Cruise along the entire stretch last about 3 hours.
Nice for tourist. This river runs thru Paris and is a nice option for tourist. There are many boat tours that take you on the river and show you the various monuments / places along the river.
Seine River. The river is just beautiful. The view of this river from Eiffel Tower is just so awesome that I cant express it in words. Cruises are available.

A good way to see Paris. we did a boat trip along the river and enjoyed seeing the beautiful Parisian architecture and of course Notre Dame. Autumn was an especially nice time to visit with the leaves changing colour along the banks.
Great views. You can walk along the river or take a tour down the river. Either Way, make sure you take the time to soak in the views from the river. Both at night and during the day!
In Love!. Paris is the city of love, and this river is very romantic. If you have the time, take a boat excursion.

Magic in Paris. Very amazing attraction. Seeing Paris at night on a boat, very romantic. The city looks very different and even more impressive. Enjoyable even in Oct. Must be extraordinary during the summer months.

River Cruise not all equal.... We were told all cruises were equal when looking back, we think it is best to get one of the cruises without a second story as it affected the narrations over the intercom of what we were passing and viewing along the cruise. It was still enjoyable and comfortable as well as cheap tickets, but next visit would do a one level clear covered cruise.

Take a cruise down the Seine. I took a batoboat down the Seine, which allowed me to hop off and on at the different stops along the way. The Seine is a beautiful river from which you can see almost all of the amazing Paris sites. the price of the Batoboat is about 20.00 US for a one day pass, but I recommend buying the two day pass for a couple of dollars more so you can take your time to cruise the river and stop to see the sites. It takes about 2.5 hours for the entire cruise.
Beautiful french landmark. La Seine is maybe one of the most famous rivers in the world.It brings life to the city at night with the "bateaus mouches" as well as transit for goods within Europe.

unforgottable cruise on it. I did a cruise on the river and it was awesome. A little bit expensive (42 €) but its Paris, so do it if you have the chance, you will have another perspective of the city!

Great to just walk along the banks but also many riverbuses/navettes available. Worth buying a guide to the bridges and monuments. The area around the 'islands' is great but also further west at Eifeel Tower etc.
of course go to the Seine!. You can't walk around Paris without seeing the river at some point, and it's worth strolling along its banks. No city river in the world is more majestic.

Evening River Tour. The River is lined with trees and together with the autumn leaves falling, makes the location very romantic.There are plenty of bridges along River Seine which each have their own history and feel.We went on the river cruise at night, which was slightly on the cold side. But it is a romantic view with the night sky and the effiel tower shining behind us.Definitely recommend for the couple.Alternatively, the riverside has side walk where people can enjoy the walk down the river, which is also very nice.

A good evening cruise. i and my wife did the river seine cruise as part of thomas cook package in august. We did the evening cruise. I recommend going for the evening cruise as the weather was awesome and people who did the day cruise where complaining that the wheather was hot. It passed through all the bridges and we opted to isit out in the open place rather than the closed. Except the announcements which were loud and disturbing. It was a short cruise while returning we saw the illumination of the eiffel tower which was really mindblowing. Then only people near by us told that in everyone hour the illumination will happen. Its a must do if you are visiting paris.

fantastic. Fantastic tour!!! Worth every cent.Our guide was wonderful and his knowledge of the history of Paris and the Eiffel Tower made the tour a great experience. His passion for this beautiful city and his country pride were clear.Very much enjoyed the Seine River Cruise, very relaxing and a great way to see the city.

Paris by Ferry. We saw Paris on a beautiful sunny day in September. We caught the Batobus which cruises up and down the Seine River for about 14 euros for the day. You could get on and off wherever you want. Paris has most of its attractions such as Notre Dame, the Louvre, museum Orsay, Eiffel tower are close to or on the Seine. I recommend going on the Batobus as soon as you arrive in Paris so you can acquaint yourself with this beautiful city. A nice way to do it cruising along ,with a commentary as well., which was very informative and helpful.

We LOVED this experience! (except the waiting part). Here are my comments about this tour: -- This is a GREAT way to see Paris. -- Our tour guide was great. He did the tour in 4 languages!-- This was relaxing and fun but I can tell you that the worst part was the WAITING in line just to get our ticket, then we waited again in line for a boat. -- We bought our tickets as a package deal along with our Big Bus Tour tickets. I "think" it saved us some time and money but actually I am not real sure about it saving us time. It seemed like we still had to stand in a long line to "pick up" our boat ticket.-- This is a great way to see the bridges in Paris.-- There are toilets on the boat! This is very helpful when you have kids and elderly grandparents traveling with you. Keep this in mind and go and use the toilets as soon as you get on or off the boat : ) Hope this helps!

Follow the Seine. Walking along the Seine on a nice day is a terrific way to enjoy a day in Paris. Recommend taking a tour boat on the Seine. I did a 1 hour, that was plenty. Other time we did a dinner cruise on the Seine which was also really nice.

nice activity. Different companies offer boat tours of the Seine and it's a great activity after a long day on your feet. It's also a nice way to see the city. The different companies all seemed pretty much the same.

Beautiful day and night. Wandering along the banks provides fantastic views of many beautiful buildings, but to really experience this historic river make sure you take a boat cruise. During day or night you will get great views of some of the beautiful landmarks of Paris.
