Sunset and night can be tricky to take photos due to reflections on the glass of the boat - something to bear in mind - but the buildings look spectacular at night.

Paris and the Seine. Paris is for me the most beautiful city in the world and the Seine is part of it. We made a short stop in this city before our trip to Turkey and we walked for a while along the banks of the river to get to Notre Dame. On our return we will do the dinner cruise on the river.

Beautiful at night time. It was a beautiful night At River Seine when me and my husband do the river cruisin. Specially doing at nighttime .Seeing all the lights from different building and seeing different bridges while cruisin the Seine river is totally awesome.

Take a walk on the riverbankl. When you´re in Paris don´t miss to take a walk on both of the riverbanks of the Seine. It's very beautiful. One side is very quiet, and the other side is full of acitivities and alot of people exercising. It´s a nice place for a walk, in the day or in the evening.

Take the Viator Tour. We took the Viator Tour with Adam as our guide. He was knowledgeable and funny; and he kept us safe during our walk (lots of pickpockets). The Seine is beautiful at night! We took the Champagne Tour of the Seine and Eiffel Tour on our first night in Paris. This helped us to know the history of many of the buildings and areas that we subsequently visited.

Artery of Paris. The Seine is a long river and an important commercial waterway within the Paris Basin in the north of France.There are 37 bridges within Paris and dozens more spanning the river outside the city. Examples in Paris include the Pont Louis-Philippe and Pont Neuf.

Good cardio. Walked from Notre Dame all along the River Seine around to the Eiffel Tower. Watch as the cruises go by from one of the many restaurants. Bike ride around it or book one of the many cruises that you can see heaps of landmarks from. Cruises are actually rather cheap. They have places to fill up your drink bottles on a hot day, either really cold still water or really cold sparkling water just blew my mind cause its free.

Awesome alternative to see Paris. Its quiet an experience to see Paris through the waters. They run a number of hop on hop off cruises through the river. these cruises stop at all major attractions. Yes a few might be a little far from the main ports, but the fact that you sail under the numerous bridges and can say a small prayer/wish each time you cross one and admire the collossal structures at the same time , gives an altogether different perspective of this beautiful city.

very over rated. The locals call it the drain it is part of Paris and the tourists seem to love it with brides lining up to have photos taken the parts of the River Seine near Notre Dame are very grubby mainly along the walls I was beginning to think the locals are not on the same page with the tourists I formed this opinion after 2 weeks

River cruise. If you are picturing a romantic cruise on the Seine, you might have to rent your own boat. The tour boats are very big, not comfortable, and the "translator devices" not great. But it is something I'm glad we did.

Amazing Trip. We did the River Seine cruise and it was amazing! Saw so many landmarks from which we had some fantastic pictures. We took the open top boat and didnt pre-book, there was no queue, so just purchased our tickets & jumped straight on..it a must when visiting Paris as its nice to relax, sit back and listen to the commentry
Amazing History. We took a river cruise. The view is amazing. Take the open cruise ride to get good view.A must do thing.

Lifeblood of Paris, day and night. Everything is happening on the Seine. It's the central throughway of the city, full of boat traffic and lined on each side with pedestrians and commerce: book vendors to romantic couples. A ride on the Bateaux Mouches is essential for one who is here for the first time. One gains the sense of the history and the evocative beauty of the ancient city and the modernism of the peripheral neighborhoods.

.Pleasant sightseeing. Do not forget to have this tour. i took the river Seine tour in the evening after tour Effel Very attractive and beautiful. Beautiful scenery , ever . We can have the chance to pass by the tourist places in short period. Must recommend.
Good way to see the sights. Went on an evening cruise. Was a great way to see the lit attractions and beautiful bridges of Paris.

The “life-blood” of Paris!. This was our second visit to Paris. During our first visit to Paris, two years prior to this visit, we had been captivated by the River Seine. When we returned, we were pleased to be able to spend some of our time walking along the banks of the river. Our first visit had seen us be able to take an evening cruise along the Seine. This visit, we were unable to squeeze another cruise into our busy schedule but we were able to see quite a lot simply by walking along both sides of the river. The attractions located along the banks of the river are too numerous to list here but amongst our favourites were the Louvre, Notre Dame Cathedral and of course, the Eiffel Tower.The river itself was a busy waterway, with a seemingly never-ending parade of both cruise boats and work boats. During the early evening, crowds of people, both locals and tourists alike could be found sitting along the banks of the river, having a drink, “shooting the breeze” and watching the water and the boats flow by.If you are visiting Paris, do make an effort to spend some time either by, or on the River Seine. It really is the “life-blood” of Paris!

Wonderful Amazing History. You never get sick of cruising the Seine, either for a dinner cruise lunch or just for the pure pleasure. Lucky enough to have experiences all. Relaxing taking in all the view. Enjoy the commentary the history of the river. The view of the Elfie tower is a bonus especially in the evening with all the twinkling fairy lights. Never get tired of this experience .Love Paris.
What a river. The Seine is a seriously great river. It flows, it rises, it falls. It does all the good stuff you want from a river. Please don't throw stuff in it.
Stunning views at night. Get down to the banks of the Seine after dark. Every hour on the hour for five minutes the Eiffel Tower sparkles with lights, making a wonderful spectacle across the river.
loved it. We took a boat ride up and down and was able to get on and off as we pleased. very good idea and the narration was enlightening x

Timeless just timeless. Huge river and interesting, weather permitting to just watch the river and the numerous craft go about there business. Busy busy place yet somewhat mesmerising. Take a trip and fine dine on the boats. Great food great views in a timeless slow fashion just do it

by Musee d'Orsey. Obviously everyone knows the river runs through Paris with so so many places to select. After a day at the Musee d'Orsey you can catch a few rays down on this left bank little boardwalk right outside the Museum and watch the people and boats go by....very relaxing and not crowded at all.
Beautiful trip. Another Paris MUST! Indulge yourself and take one of the open top boat trips on the Seine - walking the sides is a great experience, seeing it all from the water is well worth it.

Beautiful!. Gorgeous city and lovely to walk along the Seine or take a river cruise. We took an evening river cruise from the Eiffel Tower down to past the Notre Dame and back, very enjoyable and a wonderful way to view the city. We came back just as the Eiffel Tower evening light show began - very enjoyable and gorgeous views from the river for photos!

Bateau Mouche is a great way to see Paris. I like to take a night time trip on a Bateau Mouche when I first arrive...great way to see a lot of the bridges and monuments lit up and to get in the mood of Paris. Or just stroll along down by the Seine and people watch. Paris would not be Paris without the Seine!

RIVER TRIP. Sat on the top deck for best view - that was until a lot of people decided to get up, wander around and stand in front of us, very rude and inconsiderate. However, interesting to see another view of some of the buildings we had visited.

Amazing Cruise. It was my second time to take the cruise. Still I'm at awe.Great way to be with your love one by just sitting and looking the view of Paris...a romantic way to explore Paris....I love Paris!

Boat Trip ...Good One. All nice, except we had a hard time to find out our boat entrance locations, (there are many operators, many bridges). Take the trip during evening to watch litup paris especially Eiffel Tower
You can't miss it. We took a boat ride for an hour at night to see the lights along the river. But we saw different views as we came and went to various attractions during our stay.
Cruise is Amazing. Did the River Seine cruise and it was amazing! Saw several landmarks from the river view and made for great pictures. The best boat ride ever!
Dinner party on sailing boat.. We had a dinner party on the sailing boat, it was pretty awesome. I would recommend for group to must ride the boat at night.

Nice for strolling. We walked along the river one afternoon and saw some really good views of the Eiffel Tower and daily life in Paris. You can also get a tour boat that either has stops or just a ride up and down the river. I think it is worth a couple of hours and most people will enjoy the break and slower pace for a while.
Boat trip at Sein. On a cloudy day it was really perfect to make a boat trip at River Seine. It was ideal to see the part of the city from another angle. Highly recommended

boat trip on the river. By a boat trip on the river one gets value information about Paris and the many bridges. Mocking bridge's history is interesting. Choose a nice weather to go for a boat trip. Also you can walk alonside the river.
Identity of Paris. This River is carrying the identity of Paris as a City. If you have not seen the beauty around the River, then you really missed the Paris.

Hop on hop off I simply awesome . The hop on hop off of River Seine is simply awesome. It connects to all the iconic places of Paris. The cruises comebqbd go frequently to ensure that you visit all the places in one day. The view from the cruise is truly amazing
Breathtaking!. After having seen the sights, taking a Seinne River cruise is a must. You see where you were but this time by water. The architecture is incredible!

Lovely. Quiet, about 2 hour boat tour. You got to see Paris's famous landmarks to familiarize yourself with the city and where everything is located. It's nice to just relax after a long day of walking.
Very pristine. This is my first city visit outside my country and I was very very excited to see seine and paris lovely river clean and pristine
a must walk. if its a nice day its a lovely walk to go and see some of the attractions, i wouldn't bother with any of the cruises though

Walking besides the Seine on either bank is a must experience in Paris.. Well of course one takes the boats that partially cover the Seine in Paris,especially when its dark or at sunset(preferably)but you must stroll at leisure and will find many interesting,historic,points worth stopping and seeing along the Seine River.And there some excellent picture taking spots,for example Notre Dame or The Louvre.Take with you a map or tourist guide pocket book and it will be much more easy to tell where you are,whats ahead and what you missed!Keep on walking!

The seine . Walking along the seine in the fall is one of the most beautiful experiences. It basically leads you to all the tourist destinations and the scenery is lovely. Take a look at the various houseboats docked they are very cool!

Touristy but gotta do it!. We took the river cruise without the dinner. Once again, lines are long but worth it. French can manage crowds really well. This should be your first stop in Paris as it gives you the "lay of the land." Night time would be interesting to see the lights but we were more interested in seeing the actual buildings to see which ones we wanted to explore in great detail.

River cruise. Lovely river cruise, bought this ticket as a package deal with eiffel tower tickets, an hour long cruise, good to see all the sights from the river. Information given as you are sailing along.

a River view. After our Eiffel Tower Tour we decided to take a cruise of the River Seine. A sunny day was in our favour. Absorbing the rivers edge with the history and architecture - very fascinating. I would not hesitate to take on the Seine again ;-)
Outstanding. River cruise is absolutely stunning and amazing. The boat runs every one hour and it will be good if you book the tickets in advance.

Great place to enjoy the walk... River Seine passes through Paris City. To get the best view of the River Seine from top you must visit the Eiffel Tower top. It is nice feeling to walk or jog along the River Seine. The River Seine also offers scenic cruises and dinner cruises. There are may bridges across the River Seine and each one is more beautiful than other.

A Boat Ride on the Seine?. While we enjoyed a boat ride up and down the Seine, we found walking along it much more enjoyable. We found the boats crowded and hot even in the cool October weather. Ultimately, we used the ability to get on and off the boat more as vehicle for public transportation from one Paris location to another verses as an entertainment unto itself. There are a lot of interesting sites along the Seine, but most are better explored up close.
Like. My family and I enjoyed the bateaux-mouch trip on the sine river. If its Oct or Nov. Take a heavy jacket with you.

Paris. A lovely stroll along the River Seine, especially in the summer months when there are games and a beach all along the walk way. Boats trips usually prebooked which I used avitor website or at the tourist information, near The Louvre. There is a bus boat that runs at regular times with many key drop off points.
A great dinner Cruise. The dinner cruise was very enjoyable, the food was not fantastic, but very good. Ther service was extremely good, the wines served were very very good

not so special seine. Dont see how this is a must do .The river sits well below street level (unlike many other city rivers ie thames etc) so you are often looking up at everything Paris is a beautiful city but not one to necessarily to be seen from water

Breathtaking. The seine is absolutely stunning and you'll find yourself drawn to it throughout your trip. Just walking along the river and hanging out on the old and lively bridges is worth the trip to paris alone!

A super sunny day boat trip. At the foot of the Eiffel tower is the pier for quite a few of the popular boat trips.We took the "Croisiere Bateaux Parisiens" boat trip which is a large boat carrying lots of people, but it works and the guide was fairly good though her accent was fairly strong French and not always easy to understand.I dont know how much I paid as it was part of my package from "Kirkers City Breaks ". though this boat trip is a must early on in your visit to Paris to give you some ideas of where you might want to go as there is so much culture and fun to be had in this wonderful city.

Scenic Cruise Excellent. Just finished the Scenic Cruise Gems of the Seine, from Paris to Honfleur return an 11 day cruise. The vessel was first class, the staff exceptional, the food excellent, and off ship tours and tour guides excellent. Strongly recommend.
Great place for walk or run. Ran and walked along the river all three days I was there. Great atmosphere, gives you the feeling of living in Paris. Not to be missed

Amazing. This river provides one of thw best places to see Paris. You can see some of the many attractions from the range of cruises. However, the Seine provides an insight into the daily lives of the Parisians. This includes the early morning in which you will see the local residents walking their dogs; lovers of all ages enjoying quiet moments on the banks of the Seine; the early morning reflections of the buildings; the different and ornate bridges that cross it.It is a photographers paradise and a focal point for any visit to Paris.
Amazing view. Walking around the River Seine is so romantic , you have the chance to overview paris in a romantic way

Beautiful spot for a walk. We walked along the banks of the Seine near the Orangerie and the D'Orsay. The views are beautiful & the area right on the riverbanks is remarkably free from crowds. You can stroll with locals as they go for a run, walk their dogs etc.
River cruise . River cruise is a must as part of the Paris experience. It's relaxing and informative. Beautiful views and interesting stories all along the river like the narrowest house in Paris.

My second favorite place in the world to walk around idly and people watch. I'm a sucker for rivers and bridges, so when I'm in Paris I absolutely love walking along the Seine between Pont Alexandre III and Ile-Saint Louis. I've done this walk rain or shine and it always brightens my day. It's especially beautiful in the fall.

Night time cruise. We booked our river cruise, from vedettes du Pont Neuf online and paid €11 instead of €14. You can pick up any cruise on the half hour, March 15 till October 31. Then it all changes, best to check online.
Sit upstairs for best view but make sure you wear warm clothes.
Night time was spectacular.

Boat ride along River Seine is a must!. Boat ride along River Seine is one of the best ways to enjoy the beauty of it together with other famous attractions like Notre Dame, Pont Alexandre III, The Louvre etc. Boat ride after sunset is especially romantic when the Eiffel Tower and bridges light up. If you want a panoramic view of the river, go up to the top of Notre Dame or The Eiffel Tower, you won't be disappointed. Or simply take a walk along the river, a very Parisian way to enjoy it.

Pronounce Sinn.. Part of Paris, take a walk across the bridges, add a padlock to the millions adorning several of the bridges, There are vendors selling padlocks, it maybe hard to find a spot. Take a boat ride on the river, embarking from several spots or near the Eiffel tower, or just a casual Sunday walk people watching.
Lok It's Okay. My wife and I strolled on the bank or the Seine many times on our stay this fall. It is an historic river to be sure however it is not that spectacular a site in and of itd oen.

A Central Theme of Paris. There are so many great views along the Seine it is hard to narrow it down. My wife and I were staying on the Left Bank with easy access to Notre Dame, the classic bridges and so much more. On past the Orsay Museum to the Eiffel tower, you will have memories to last forever!
Boat trip. We went on a boat down the ~seine and viewed all the sights, including Notre Dame and le Pont Neuf from the water. It was gorgeous day and we all thoroughly enjoyed it. Well with doing.

Wonderful boat ride and tour. The tour included a pleasant 2 hour boat ride showing many different areas of Paris. Many of the ancient bridges are architectural marvels in their own right. The river has been cleaned up but is still a working commercial river used with barges and many pleasure boats as well.

Walking along the bookstalls and seeing the boats is a relaxing way to spend the afternoon.. To get the flavor of the bookstalls one must walk along and look at the various items. This year it seemed like less of the stalls were open on any given day, possibly because it was September. Nevertheless, one can enjoy seeing the river and the boats and identifying all of the monuments which are visible as you walk along.

Beautiful, beautiful place to stroll around. The river banks and bridges are the perfect backdrop to a lazy, romantic walk. It provides a great view of the river and you really do feel like singing "la vie en rose" the whole time you are there. Some gelato to go with the walk and man, do you have a wonderful memory to remember for a lifetime :)

Being on the Seine anytime is fantastic.. Years ago, Dean Martin sang the song How Would You Like To Be Under The Bridges Of Paris With Me. I now know he was singing about the Seine. The banks of the Seine can be followed to many Paris landmarks. It is a beautiful and interesting walk with lots of wonderful distractions.

Taking a cruise down the Seine in Paris. Taking a leisurly cruise down the Seine in Paris is a trip of beauty and history. Wheter it is a diner cruise or an hour sightseeing cruise it is a great value. You get to experience the sights of this beautiful city by water - and most in 3-4 languages. learn about the Eifle Tour, gaze at Notre Dame Cathedral, marvel at the grand exhibition halls, listen to the history of the Louvre and see the house boats and river cruise ships along the banks. It is a good way to get an overview of the city from the river perspective and decide what you want to visit as you return to land.

Excellent. The real parisian spirit is by the river. You can't get lost in Paris if you are following Sein. Don't miss cruising on Seine, the view is pricless.The bridges (all of them) are breathtaking.

A low river level spoiled most of the attractions. We visited in September and the river was low and most of the banks on either side were very high. Saying that it is a romantic way to see Paris at night especially the twinkling Eiffel Tower on the hour.

A BEAUTIFUL PLACE FOR A STROLL. The Siene is a wonderful place to stroll no matter what area your in. its lovely by day and lovely by night. Any area along it is nice. if you happen to find yourself up around the area just north east of the eiffel Tower you will find a bridge called Pont de Alma, on the northern side of this is the "flamme de la Liberte". This is a monument which is a replica of the staue of liberty flame, but this tunnel underneath this is also where Princess Diana died, so this is now a sort of make do monument to her.

October Visit. Really lovely way to see Paris especially after lunch!Lots of different boats/trips to choose from and although we did not do it on this recent visit really nice to do evening cruise and have dinner on board but not cheap

River view.. The best way to get an over view of Paris is all about ,before you get your walking shoes and go and discover Paris and all its Little's streets full of little gems..Get the boat from the top end of the l ile de la cite,because the boats are smaller and you are in the heart of the Latin quarter.and Notre Dame.go and discover.!!
Worthwhile!. It is worth taking a cruise on the River Seine. It is very informative and relaxing atmosphere. Commentary in many different language. One hour boat cruise.

Beautifull View. So, one of the most romancing spectacles that Paris has to offer is walking by the Seine river. Either accompanied with a beautiful tune on your playlist phone, or simply enjoying the view of a bateau-mouche passing by near you.You can take a boat too, and slowly enough to sightseeing views of Notre Dame, the Louvre, and the Eiffel Tower.

Go on a cruise. If you go on one of the cruises they will tell you about the history of various bridges and buildings as you go past - a great way to START any trip to Paris as it will give a good orientation to the city...
River Seine. Be sure to take a lunch cruise. You can eat while viewing some magnificent building along the way. You will surely enjoy it.
The beauty of Paris. La Seine is a very essential attraction that contributes to the beauty of Paris. Either in the bateaux mouches or in a promenade on both sides, the fun is equal.

Very relaxed. I love walking along the west bank they have a lot of repro art for sale, books, posters pictures, you name it.And the best part is no body bothers you to buy .your free to browse undisturbed
lovely walk out. Walked out one evening onto the banks of the Seine the sun was going down and it was beautiful. Mind you its not quiet or peaceful, its busy and bustling.

Perfect picnic spot. When the weather is nice and especially near the weekend, hundreds of people gather all along the river with wine and picnics. It is an amazing gathering of humanity! We also took a boat ride down the river during the festivities and even saw a group of salsa dancers along the way.
Must see in Paris. Beautiful Paris. Take a boat ride if you have time. Very romantic. See the bridges from the bottom if you are on a boat.
wonderful atmosphere. During our trip to Portugal we drove through Paris, and crossed the river Seine several times. This beatiful river in the middle of this magnificient city. Coming back soon

A very special river cruise. My husband and I caught the 9 pm river cruise with a tour group. This proved to be a great time slot because we cruised in one direction the river in full day light and on the return journey the sun began to set. With the setting of the sun the view changed as the city lights came on. By the time we reached the Eiffel Tower is was beautifully lit up. We sat outside on the top deck which was also a great choice as you have a full 360 degree view and get the full experience as you go under the many bridges along the river. This river cruise lasted about 1.5 hours.

The Sightseeing center of Paris. Many if not most of the sights of Paris lie along the Seine. Traveling by boat along the river is a great way to see the Louvre, d'Orsay, l'Orangerie, Eiffel Tower and others. We used the Batobus to travel the Seine as it was the only one we found which allowed a traveler to hop on and off at the various stops. We bought a two day ticket on the shoreline at the Louvre. A two day ticket was only a few Euros more that one day and it proved a godsend before we mastered the Metro.

A beautiful stroll. We walked from the Eiffel Tower to the Luxembourg Gardens along the Seine and it is a lovely leisurely stroll in the sun. Lots going on with Buskers and Locals on bikes and playing games. Good to see Paris in a less busy mode !!

Beautiful. Took a cruise along the Seine and it is gorgeous. Perfect timing as the trees turn and it is magical. So awesome passing the bridges and seeing the different areas and those ones under the bridge too.

A really good way to have a cruise tour of Paris. It was a family trip on the cruise and we enjoyed every bit of it. There is also a French and English audio guide for important landmarks on the cruise.
River boat tour in the evening. This is a must do in Paris. Evening is tremendous as Eiffel Tower is lit and city lights/atmosphere is tremendous.

ALL of Paris. Paris is all about the Seine ... from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame. Invest in a time on the river ... a dinner cruise is a good idea. There are many options and each one we have used has been equally good weather we booked/got on at the Eiffel Tower or any of several other locations. A day/multi day use ticket is offered and we found to be of value to travel up and down the to the venues of Paris.

Beautiful and romantic and so very Paris.. What a beautiful, romantic and well kept natural site. The seine is like an oasis in the middle of the city, clean, with parks and seating, steps and plazas all alongside it for people to enjoy it's beauty. Great river tours available as well.

The Most Beautiful City River in the World. A living treasure, the Seine winds its way through Paris and (mostly) has been treated like a jewel by the city's planners and builders. Beautiful bridges arch across the river, the banks are paved for walkers, and the views of the river and city are breathtaking. Viewers will never forget a stroll along the bans of the Seine.
Restful. Nice to just walk along the river, watching the boats and people, listening to the sounds and experiencing the atmosphere.

Good but nothing special. We took a evening cruise on the river starting from Eiffel. A lot of Parisian must sees lie on either side of the river hence this is a good ride. However the boat was packed, way too loud with kids shouting, the announcer was talking non stop in both French and English and it became quite a headache as time passed. A quiter 1 hour cruise if available would have been better.

Magical Seine River. What a charming, romantic experience as we walked along both banks of the River Seine in the evening ! I truly enjoyed the walk! It's just beautiful and it's just like in the movies. They say Paris is a romantic city, I finally immersed myself in this magical romantic city walking along the banks of River Seine, especially walking at sunset and even though it was crowded with tourists from all over the world. The experience just 'wowed 'me so much. I felt peaceful and blissful here, a breath of fresh air ! The stunning sunset along this quite and peaceful place called the Seine River...isn't it the joyful peaceful feeling everyone has been searching for?

Great way to see alot of Paris. If you are on a limited time frame to see Paris and all that it has to offer, then a boat tour on the Seine river is a good choice. The tour we took was a little longer than an hour and we enter our tour boat near the Effiel Tower. We headed down the river in which commentary was heard on all of the important buildings along the way. It was interesting, relaxing and a good way to rest after a long day of touring. Take a boat tour and see the best of the Seine River.
Amazing tour. We took a half day River tour, it worth every penny you spend. We really like the French songs and wishing come to see Paris soon.

Seine river Cruise. This was part of the Paris Pass so it was included free. We finished the Eiffel Tower and this cruise was located right down the block from it. Since it was included with the Paris Pass they seemed to jam as many people on the boat as possible. A lot of the seats were broken and we had change seats a couple of times.It gives you an overview of the bridges and sights along the Seine but there seemed to be much better cruises if you wanted to have dinner or go at night. The guide did not give much history just what you were looking at. She seemed tired of repeating the same thing over and over.

Fantastic sights. Walking along the riverbank leads you to many famous Parisienne sights. Lots of stopping points for drinks too!Watch out for the girls trying to get you to sign their sheets as they are after money and we saw some tourists who did sign being hassled for money . They don't bother you if you firmly say No!

A fantastic cruise taking him most of the Paris landmarks. We went on a cruise of the Seine, during a magical day trip to Paris (from Disneyland). My eldest was somewhat reluctant (a teenager) - but even he enjoyed the cruise which gave a beautiful perspective of most of the landmarks in Paris, including Notre Dame, the Eiffel Tower and many more.

Cruise or Walk-- a Must See in Paris. The Seine winds through the heart of Paris and can be enjoyed on foot (either bank) or by boat (either bank, with or without meals). When in Paris, you can't miss it and you shouldn't miss it.

Really not much to see. The Thames cruise in London was WAY better. Seine just didn't have much to see and it wasn't as informative. Our guide really didn't give us much of the history as he spent most of the time translating into 4 different languages. It was ok and if you have the Paris pass, then sure do it. I'd recommend doing it at night though. But if you don't have the Paris Pass, don't do it. Not worth the money.

By night. If you are travelling at night in a covered boat its not worth trying to get photos because you get all sorts of reflections off the glass. Seeing the Eiffel Tower lit up, with extra twinkling lights on the hour each hour, was beautiful

Take the batobus, avoid traffic and enjoy the river!. Don't take the metro or the bus for central attractions like the Louvre, Eiffel Tower ,Musee d'Orsay and the Menagerie. The Batobus goes to all these stops as well as Notre Dame and the Hotel de Ville (for shopping at Bazar Hotel de Ville). Buy your ticket for the day and hop on and hop off. I think it might be cheaper than the bus and metro and you get to see Paris from the Seine. Just make a note of where you get off on the quays and walk back down to get on the bus again. You can see the Louvre, Tuilleries gardens and the Arc de Triomphe if you get off at the Louvre and walk through the tuilleries when you are finished in the Louvre. You get a map to keep you right and some staff speak English.
Great walking around. The section near the Museum of Natural History has a great riverwalk with some nice cafes and spots to chill out and relax.
Walked along the left bank!. Pretty cold but it's so beautiful you just don't care! Paris definitely lives up to its romantic reputation!

Strolling the river banks. On a spring day strolling along the river Seine can be beautiful, photographs everywhere you look, the bridges, the padlocks, the book stalls, ferries full of tourists taking photos of tourists taking photos of them.....

Great Way To See The City Of Lights. Our group decided to take the 8pm river cruise and it was a great decision! The views of Paris were breathtaking in the evening especially the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame. It was quite breezy which made it "cold" on the upper deck. The young girl that explained the sights in French and English was very knowledgeable and very easy to understand. So glad we got the views of the city from the river!
Relaxing. A wonderful way to see some of Paris sights - especially Notre Dame. Can be disappointing on a wet day but is worth it.
VIP River Cruise and Access to 3rd floor of the Eiffel Tower!. We took the VIP river cruise and Eiffel Tower trip through City Tours. Rhonda was our tour guide and was great!

Wonderful river. The river and views are wonderfulAlthough we took the batobus which although nice took forever to get to our stopAnd we couldn't see as much as I had hopedBut myself and my daughter enjoyed walking along the side of the river We even saw a diver clearing the river Although this was nice in a way to see (as in it was possibly an only chance)In the back of my mind I was thinking if so many silly people wernt defacing the city with horrible padlocks that poor man would have to be stuck in freezing water in the middle of October But other wise a lovely experience

It's a happening place.. Whether you walk the Seine or take a tour boat, you'll find so many interesting things and people. One of the funniest I saw was two young men urinating in the river as a tour boat passed their way.

Great views all around the river!. Notes:>Eiffel tower is on this river bank.>Notre dam cathedral is near this river.>Lot of activities happen here, eg: Cruises show around, romantic dinner over cruises, Some artists on the river banks will make your poster etc.If you have some spare time do take a walk around 3-5 km on the river bank - it will complete your day :)

Wouldn't waste the time. I was so excited to do this view of the city but very little info was given during the cruise. The exhaust fumes made us all sick and it's 1 hours of our trip we didn't get back. Super disappointed.

Heart of Paris !!. It is indeed the heart of Paris. I was amazed to see how Europeans conserve and highlight their rivers and lakes and actually have developed the city around it. Take a seine river cruise which may be a bit costly especially during night , but the experience will be etched in your memory.You will see almost all the attractions of paris as they all are situated near the river and you will have a good vantage point point for photography.
City of lights. The night cruise is beautiful, we choose to go via Pont Neuf, the cruise was for and hour and gave an opportunity to see the lights.
Bateau mouche. We took a one hour tour down the Seine.. The view was fantastic. The best part was the narrative from the tour guide

Ride with the Seine!!. If you love water then please go on a boat ride along the River Seine its just calming and quiet and the water is baby blue clear and you see others taking pics and smiling arms out taking in the fresh air hmmm
Seine !. something special but if you see some cities with river before so not so special, but we make a tour just for tourists
Beautiful. Walking around the seine river was an amazing experience especially in evening time. You can find people around the world partying and enjoying.
Running along le Seine. highly recommend to have a light jog along le Seine early in the morning, to feel the silence and enjoy the scenic beauty.

Walk along the Seine. Take the time out of the hustle and bustle of the streets and walk along the river. The view is beautiful and there are several houseboats of people who live there year around. The people are very friendly and each houseboat is very unique making the walk even more fun!

A wonderful river. A pretty river passing through the centre of Paris, it is great area for walking along the riversides and seeing some spectacular views of Paris. Trying to get on the river boats can involve a lot of queueing even late at night.

Trip on the bateau mouche. Great trip... In order to visit the seine river and see paris in an hour, take the bateau mouche and visit all the landmarks in an hour. Make to wear a jacket in case its cold.

Great Views of Paris from the River Seine. We bought a two day pass for the Batou Bus - great value for money. You can stay on for a complete circuit and enjoy Paris' beautiful architecture and bridges. Pass by the Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Liberty, Musee D'Orsay, Norte Dame, Hotel du Ville etc.
Hop on off at the major tourist locations.

It's a different world out here. Nothing we have experienced before. Cruising Seine river watching people and attractions. In the evening people just get together near the river banks with their picnic rugs wine bread and cheese. Families walking around. Dance groups with music. What a lovely atmosphere. Best of all cruising in the evening watching city lights was amazing. You can see Eiffel tower lighting around 11 pm what a sight. A must cruise.

River Taxi Bato Bus. Took the Bato bus along the river. Great way to get around. It is a hop on hop off boat. It stops at all the great tourist spots. 18 euros for one day. It comes around every 20 minutes. The scenery is so great. Would definitely do this a third time. :)

River cruises the Batobus. Great value and a great way to end our 9 days in Paris ,when too tired to walk anymore we Aston the boat and remembered all the great sites we had explored, it was a great way to farewell the city and a from a different vantage .

So much history. It was not the romantic 'under the bridges of Paris' moment that I had imagined. Instead it was a cruise illegal. With history and beautiful historic buildings. Guides were wonderfully informative and friendly. It rained a little but that improved the lighting on the photos and we were still dry. An excursion 'must' in Paris.
Take the Seine River Cruise atnight...lovely. Although cruising the Seine any time of day is wonderful, by night adds another layer of beauty...never disappointed

Wonderful walk & observe. This is a much neglected place in Paris, great to walk along the river (either side) and enjoy the views. Each side is different in what you see and what goes on. Also, easy to access from almost any of the many bridges and especially nice on the West side of the river. Be sure to go to one of the bridges at night and watch the Eiffel Tower light up at 9:00pm.

Great for a boat ride. lovely to walk along the banks. Lots to see all along the ripper and the boats are very good. Avoid Japanese tourists with selfie sticks if you can but otherwise plenty of photo opportunities and a commentary.
Busy River. There sure was a lot going on, tour boats, houseboats, barges, a swimming pool, restaurants, recreation of all types.

Beautiful, amazing city. Have been here twice = it was so exciting to take our kids back with a bit of knowledge.Hopefully they enjoyed it as much as we did and they will take a trip back there one day.Never disappoints.

Cruise the Seine River at a bargain. There are many cruises organized to see the Seine River and a lot of them take you on the Seine at night and include dinner. These are expensive and the food is far from great. Instead choose the 9:30 p.m. cruise with the "Vedettes du Pont Neuf" and for a bargain (with 2 euros discount if you print a coupon online) you will see 38 of the most famous monuments of Paris illuminated. As you get on board, climb to the top level where the views are best.
It's Beautiful way to explore Paris thru the cruise.. It's Beautiful way to explore Paris thru the cruise. Book the cruise at the deck itself, no advance booking reqd.

Romantic walk. We walked along the river Seine when we visited Ile de la Cite, and eventually took a boat cruise. We lucked out on the weather and got some lovely photographs of the sunshine glittering off the water.

river cruise. the history of the river amazing wonderful building along the river the cruise was so relaxing not suggested if raining
it is a something must do

Definitely do a Seine River Cruise. We had a dinner on the cruise that took us out past Notre Dame etc and the cruise was a wonderful way to see the city from a different perspective. This was one of my favorite things to do.....just watch the attractions glide by as you float down the Seine. Food on our boat wasn't that good, so I would suggest eat somewhere else and just have wine/ drinks on the cruise.

tour boat. you get to see everything and you are told what you are looking at, usually by an articulate bi lingual student making money to get through school. upstairs and its full of the air, the Seine and the locality is bigger than life in all respects. somehow everyone is friendly on the river, unlike everywhere else in Paris you feel like you belong even as a tourist. just fun, and need not be expensive.

Do the touristy thing and take a boat cruise. The Bateau Mouches is a must do for all. It`s such a great way to see some of Paris from the insides out view. Also, certain landmarks get pointed out that are truly gems and not readily known or identified by travel pamphlets. And it`s not that costly.

Relaxing!!. If you travel around in Paris, you will cross the Seine at least 10 times in a day. But the beauty of the river comes out in the night. Sitting by the river and having a glass of wine, or going on a cruise boat ride in the starry night has its own charm....

Night boat cruise. We did a night dinner cruise. Got to see a lot of Paris at night. The food was good an included a bottle of wine. They has a good music group playing. It lasted about 1.5 hours. We did get to see the Eiffle tower light with many flashing light what a good site.

Beautiful way to see paris. The seine is a major part of paris where we stayed in the Maria'sWhether walking along the banks or over on a bridge or on a boat it is beautifulYou can take the batobus which is a functional transport service get on get off or there are many specific tourist boats from pont Neuf or further up at almaYou also get great view of Eiffel tower

Left bank now lovely walk with parks all along. In the past few years Paris has taken nearly all the road way and converted it to a walk and bike riding way. There are places to sit and eat as well as bathroom facilities. You can walk from the Latin quarter all the way to the Eiffel tower

Delightful afternoon cruise. The hour long cruise down the Seine, around the big and small islands and back again is architecturally enthralling, relaxed and informative. We caught the ship from just near the Eiffel Tower as part of a package which allowed us to join any cruise that runs every half hour or so. The tickets were valid for twelve months so bad weather could be avoided, day or night could be chosen at our leisure. There are moderately priced snacks and beverages including beers and spirits available on-board to really get in cruising mood. The recorded multi-lingual narrative was interesting and not intrusive.

Nice River but boat tours are mediocre. A nice to do (riverboat trip) but definitely not a MUST DO. You get some nice photos of the Eiffel Tower all the way to Notre Dame Cathedral. Sound system not great.

were else. On a green line open bus tour even in the rain cannot dampen the beauty of this amzing river in one of the most beautiful/romantic capitals love it and every bridge over it Get an open top bus ticket go look at the sights get off athe places you wantto see and hop on again

Great way to see the city from a different perspective. This is a great way to see the city, giving your feet a rest. The guides are very informative. The hop-on, hop-off boat is a great way to see the city.

Breathtaking!. We enjoyed our time strolling along the River Seine! There are wonderful booksellers and merchant stands along the river (nice items, not cheesy) and there is just so much to take in visually. You can opt for a boat tour or maybe purchase a lock for you and your love.

Beautiful! Especially at night!. If you can stand the wait to get on one of the boats that glide along the Seine at night, it's gorgeous! We got in line about 5:30 and got on the boat a little before 7, I think. Long wait, but the sun was just starting to go down as we got on and consequently the ride was fantastic.

and the river runs through it. The Seine runs the length of Paris. this was our landmark. River looked clean, saw seaweed & I know it isn't correct but I got a kick out of all the lovers' locks on the bridges!
River Stroll. Me and my gf had a stroll along here, even though it was a little cold it was still enjoyable and looking across the river at all the old style french buildings was nice.
seine. its boring but you see a few places that you will not get to go inside but just a view of paris. you go through 22 bridges so its ok but nothing to do on the boat

Such a great way to see lots of Paris. We went on a boat tour the day we went up the Eiffel Tower and we purchased the ticket with our 2 day bus tour pass which was about €46 for the 2 days pass and the boat tour. This is a great way to see Paris and is such a lovely trip down the river under all the bridges. Would definitely recommend but if it's not a sunny day make sure you take a jacket!

its a busy river for the tourists. The French have sorted out their tourist needs with the way the river offers a procession of pleasure craft plying its length.Take a trip on the Bateau Mouche. Its a must. And spot the miniature Statue of Liberty

The River Seine - a walk along its shore. I remember eating a freshly made cheese and ham crepe as my wife and I sat on a bench overlooking the Seine. We saw all the tour boats but also the variety of people walking along the river. At night it's a whole different feeling than during the day. Do them both.

Not to be missed. See Paris from all viewpoints. The river is a fantastic way to view the people of Paris and see landmarks from a different perspective. We went close to sunset which made our photos extra special.

For a terrific view of Paris night or day, I highly recommend a Seine River excursion. Beautiful day or night.... The architecture of Paris is beautiful from any angle, and this is an easy relaxing way to view it during day or night. The view of the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame lit up at night from the Seine are worth the money alone. I highly recommend it.
Great Views With Super Weather. We enjoyed the boat trip and saw much of Paris. The staff was a bit snippy, but aside from that, we had a great time.

Beautiful . The river boat rides are spectacular! The views just don't stop! You can see so many sights from the water, and get a great feel for the city. We traveled a few times via boat.... It's a great way to get across town! The down side... Going down the steps to get to the river can be trashy, smelly and.... In one are, we actually saw a lot of rats running around!!!!! Definitely not what we expected!! If you can avoid the bad areas, it's an amazing experience!

"Very Peaceful On A Sunny Day". It is great when you seat on the river seine, watch the boats go by. There are cruse you can take and it is wonderful gliding on the water.along the seine you have all the book shops.

Walk and walk some more. Be sure to spend time walking along the Seine, both levels, to get a feel for the real Paris. Suggest crossing at Notre Dame, walking along the Seine through The Louvre, into Tuillerie and down to Place de la Concorde and back across to the Eiffel. It is a long walk (8 miles) total, but you will know Paris when you are done.
River Seine. The water in the river is not clean at all. Lot of trashes around it. It is nice to walk along the shore.
Like oil piantings. The river in fall is absolutely amazing. Don't miss the boat tour Batobus on the river. They sell day tickets so you can choose whichever stop to pop up or off.
Bring your camera. Took an evening cruise of the Seine that was very nice. Seeing Paris at night is lovely. The hi-lite of the cruise was seeing the Eiffel Tower all lit up.

Beautiful river and stunning bridges. Obviously a beautiful river. We did a river cruise which wasnt that well organised. We pre-paid for our tickets but still had to queue for an hour. Separate queue for individuals and groups and the groups seemed to have preferential treatment. This was the main cruise company and the guide giving the commentary was wandering around the boat with a microphone and her english wasnt that great so we missed a lot of what was said.
River cruise. We did a tour with dinner cruise on the water. The food was great and you can see a lot of sights as well and the Eiffel tower looks great with its lights on too.

Don't walk - sail.. We got Batobus day passes - much cheaper than cruises, friendly staff and good service. Hop on and off where you want, save the legs. All the big attractions viewable from the river.

Charming. The charm of Paris is largely due to the River Seine. The bridges linking the left and right banks and the Ile de la Cite Island in between make Paris so charming. Also a cruise on the Seine gives a great vantage to all attractions along it's banks.

The Seine is as beautiful as you hope for!. I loved walking and running along the Seine! It's magical bridges cross over every couple of blocks or so. You can go to the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay by following the romantic river! We also has a dinner cruise and that was fabulous as well!

Take the umbrella with you in case it rains.. Amazing experience! We took the hip on, hip down boat that takes you along Le Siene. It was very relaxing and you can see many historical buildings and an astonishing architecture, including the Eiffel tower.
charming. the river and its beauty with surounding architecture make the soul of the city. We had a river walk which was absolutely fantastic.
Beautiful sights. Take an open air boat ride.. The views are spectacular. The ride is about 1 hour and very well worth your money. Take an open air tour (no roof).
Historic Part of Paris. Lots of boat tour options on a historic River in the middle of a city. Take a tour to get a feel for Paris. Lots of historic bridges and riverside historic buildings.

50th anniversary in Paris. Disappointed cruise on River Seine, very bland, if you have a choice take the bus tour which covers virtually all the sites you will see on the cruise but with much more visuals & details.
Serene . It was a Serene experience. We visited on a Sunday and were able to witness many rowing groups. It was a nice experience.

Always beautiful to look at. Wherever you are in central Paris, the area by the seine is beautiful. The bridges are all different, and interesting to look at and walk over. The boats going up and down, whether they are cargo barges, or pleasure boats, add variety and colour. The seine by night with the lights is spectacular
Paris at its most seductive. The Seine and its surrounds are Paris at its most seductive. We haunted the bouquinistes along the Seine for vintage posters and naughty post cards.

I could watch the Seine all day!. A Seine River cruise is the best way to see many of the monuments of Paris. The guided tour takes about an hour and a half and is well worth the money. We booked in advance from home and this included in the tour. The view from the Eiffel Tower (also part of the tour package) is not to be missed!
Best Bargain in Paris. Take the time to stroll along the river, it's a good way to get around and the views get better and better. Skip the cruise.

Bridges one after the other! Cruising must!. The River is very nice with lots of ships, steamers and cruises cruising by! There are a number of bridges and the specialty is that all are different from the other. A cruise ride in the river is a must!!
Breathtaking . The cruise for Seine should be done near sunset when it is getting dark , the lights make it more beautiful. Be sure to wear something because it is windy.

Breathtaking. The River Seine was more beautiful than I had ever imagined. We took a river boat tour and enjoyed every minute! We passed the Eiffel Tower, the Museum d'orsay, the Louvre, Notre Dame...and so much more.
Pleasant Excursion. Grab your favorite beverage and take in the sights with a beautiful walk alongside the river. Day or Night it is a beautiful sight.
Beautiful & quintessential Paris experience . Can't be missed. Visit the banks & bridges by bike, foot or batobus for the best views and sights of Paris.

Castles along a river. There is no more beautiful river which runs through a city than the Seine. What is there not to like about floating down a river and seeing castle after castle along the way. And, in the summer, to men's delight, you will see beautiful French woman in bikinis (or just bikini bottoms) sunning themselves. It is a trip down a river that is not to be missed.
Always something to look at. Great place to stroll along in between visits, time goes quickly as so much to look at and all very very beautiful

Take a relaxing cruise on the Seine. After arriving in Paris and viewing the Eiffel tower we took a relaxing cruise up the Seine on one of the many cruise boats available. The weather was beautiful and the sights from the boat were fantastic. The cruise lasted about an hour and took in all the significant sights. Very relaxing and informative.
Pretty waterway. Nice for a stroll. It's surprisingly clean and well kept considering the number of people who come through here. Pretty bridges and of course lots of tourist sites near hear

Best way to see Paris. Great way to get from A to B in Paris was just walk the River Seine. Broad footpaths, ornate bridges, lot of local activity and, depending on the bank and time of day, shade from the heat. A few lovely spots to sit down and recharge as well.

marvellous views on of the City from the River Boat Cruises, highly recommended.. Lot's to see and do anywhere along the majestic River seine, you will love your time here, especially if you take the boat trips.

Well worth spending your euros on the trip. We live at the Clyde estuary in Bonny Scotland and are well used to the sightof a river surrounded by beautiful scenery, but take a trip on one of the manyriver boats that ply up and down the Seine and there is a different type ofscenery. Magnificent architecture, and I think there are 34 bridges to passunder. A trip that will always be remembered in comfortable boats that allowexcellent sight of the wonderful surroundings of the river . You won't regret it.

7 Days on the river Seine. Took a River Cruise and enjoyed the ship and the river. We visited small and large communities spending a day or more giving us a chance to explore. We went fro Paris to the Normandy Landing Beaches. I would not miss this experience

Winding Waterway Heart of Paris ..... Can't imagine Paris absent the Seine, but they've been together since Lutecia times. The banks are laid stone which has protected against flooding over the ages. The bridges are the most notable feature, my favorite is Pont Neuf. Explore the Seine by boat / Bateau Mouche & observe it from the heights of the Tour Eiffel ...

Dinner cruise. Interesting cruise. Bridges much different from the states. 4 star full dinner. Wonderful. We had dinner on valentine's day. Take the opportunity to have a wonderful dinner and wine. ENJOY

I love the river Seine. Every time I visit Paris I always make time to go along the river seine by boat , it gives you a chance to see so much more in regards to famous buildings and it is so relaxing . Don't forget to have a camera with you and take photos of the bridges

A very interesting view of Paris. We bought Batobus tickets (a great deal) and cruised along the Seine to recover from jet-lag. Fun to see the monumental sights (Tour Eiffel..) but really fun to watch the local sun-bathers, peep at the houseboats, and check out the party barges.

Take a Cruise in History!. We would recommend taking one of the tour boats, or even better.....take a dinner cruise. We had a great experience, a nice dinner and wine and watched the city slip by at twilight.
BEST DURING A SUNSET STROLL. Highly recommend taking the time out for a sunset stroll along the river banks. Something very romantic about this old river.

A Truly Beautiful Peaceful and Iconic River. We had a weekend break in Paris we stayed in La Defense just across the River Seine. The River Cruise was included in our weekend package. Although the River Cruise Ship was a little crowded the Cruise was an excellent and romantic experience. As this ship gently meandered along the River Seine we passed some iconic sights that included the Eeffel Tower and Notre Damme.

Like the Seine needs another review. Yeah; I crossed it. Twice. Once, on the way to Sacre Coeur from Montpanasse, and the second time on the way back. Did it the old-fashioned way, on foot, even though it was crowded in spots. Didn't jump on a boat, which might have been interesting, but did watch several boats shoot by. Many bridges; suggest mixing it up for variety. Wouldn't drink the water.

Good alternative to the hop on off buses. Lovely foot paths next to the river, great way to look around Paris, for us was good alternative to the hop on off buses. Very romantic way to watch the Eiffel Tower light show.
very clean. very nice river and seems very clean. You may take a boat ride up and down and see various things on your journey.

Sweet place in Paris. I suggest you to enjoy the river Seine by the boat. I enjoyed it with my friends on boat, how beautiful the view around River Seine. The building by the side of the river, and the local people waved their hands to us, the light surrounding the building, so sweet and so nice.

Icon of Paris. Took the glass topped boat ride around the river....wonderful!!! Get on and off throughout the day at any stop. A great way to get an overview of Paris. But the Seine...whether on the water or looking down from above, or sittig on the banks daydreaming....is Paris!!! All the action, all the romance is centered and around the Seine.
The artery of Paris!. Every visit must surely include a trip along the Seine....at very least to see the Parisian Statue of Liberty :)

you must spend time here. Whether you walk along it, or gaze at it from one or more of the lovely bridges that cross it, or take a boat ride along it...don't miss out when in Paris. I recommend doing all of the above!

Still need to get tickets of the cruise by presenting the paris pass. A place to see Paris in a romantic way. Having sitting down and just taking pictures of all the beautiful sights are quite relaxing to me and my husband. The cruise took just an hour and then went back. No toilet inside the boat. I still need to line up to get tickets from the counter even if I have a Paris pass.

The Heart of Paris. Do visit the Seine and either walk along the bank or take a boat trip or do both! You get a real feel for the city. We did a boat trip and got a great sense of the history of Paris. It was well worth the effort and I would recommend this as a way to view the city, in comfort.

Paris Paris Paris.... Paris visit is never complete without a walk over the Seine ..each and every single bridge has got its own charm. You must do both, walking and taking a boat. You will just feel " love is in the air".

Certainly worth a walk along the river. Walked beside the River Seine and it was lovely, with trader lining some of the streets, stunning buildings on either side, bought a lovely painting from street artist, saw the padlocks with messages of love attached to a bridge.. was really nice

Boat Tour in the river Seine. This is a wonderful way to see the sights or just walk around like Parisians do. We had a short boat tour (1 hour) where we were shown most of the major attractions and were explained the same. It was a beautiful experience and a wonderful way to have a first view of the city of love.

River Seine Cruise at Night.......an Ideal Tour of PARIS.. River Seine is the major river that winds throughthe city of Paris. It is so strategically located within the heart of the city that all the major landmarks can be seen. Major bridges are lit the whole night providing a very picturesque setting against the dimness of night with hundreds of stars above. Fifteen of us took the River Seine Cruise meeting near the Eiffel Tower on our last night in Paris. Just before sunset such that we were in time to catch the changing cityscape from day to night. From the warm golden glow of the sun bidding goodbye to the lighting of the Eiffel Tower, the lamps along the river banks and all the building landmarks in the City.....Musee d Orsay, Notre Dame. Palais des Justice and the famous bridges...Pont Neuf and Pont des Artes. Truly an enjoyable one hour that the boat leisurely brings you to breathtaking masterpieces of Paris landmarks.

Great way to see the layout of the city. The river is relaxing and offers nice views of the city. Take a cruise if possible, it's a great way to get acquainted with the layout of the city. The bridges are all have their own style and character. The bridges also offers nice views especially during sunset. It was also a compass for me, I was able to identify where I am by the River Seine, especially if you familiarize yourself with the layout of the major sites in Paris. Some buses and metro stations are near the River Seine. The lower portion walk way in some part does not go all the way around the seineis. Stay with the crowds when possible when walking on the lower portion, especially in the quieter areas of the river.

Always beautiful, always changing. We rented an apartment right down the street from the Seine. We walked by it every day and enjoyed it every single time we saw it. We walked from Notre Dame to the Lourve and the Musee d'Orsay right along the Seine; it really helped us find our way around Paris and back to our apartment. So many activities take place on the Seine from weddings to festivals and entertainment of all kinds; we always headed down to the Seine when we were looking for something to do. And the sunsets are gorgeous!!

The River Seine is striking, especially during a full moon. My wife and I strolled along the Seine or crossed one of its picturesque bridges each day of our weeklong visit to Paris. The Seine gave off a certain ambiance that set a mood of relaxed elegance among the stunning architecture that borders the river.I will always remember standing on the embankment in front of Shakespeare and Company and taking in the beauty of the full moon above Notre Dame Cathedral reflecting off the Seine.
Fun on the West Bank. Really enjoyed the West Bank with my wife. Coffee in the morning, light lunch and wine, bread and fruit in the afternoon.
Not to be missed!. A river cruise provides the opportunity to see many of Paris' leading sites and experience the city from the river.

Set your own pace and see Paris peacefully!. We really enjoyed the flexibility of "hopping on and off" the boats, so we could explore the many sights of Paris. Get a two day pass and sit back and soak in all Paris has to offer!
M Ramadan Family Paris Trip 2015 River Seine. River SeineSeriously, it was a nice place to get a boat ride and see the cityVantage river cruisesM Ramadan Family Paris Trip 2015 River Seine
River cruise with dinner. We went with Pariscityvision on the river cruise with dinner.The service was amazing the staff were brilliant and the food was fantastic.Definately worth going

Moonlight cruise. Our cruise corresponded with the blood moon eclipse and it was breath taking! However, too many different translations made it difficult to know what you were seeing. It was understandable, but annoying.

Time to relax. River Seine cruise was part of a Paris highlights package tour where we visited the Louvre, cruised the Seine, lunched at the Eiffel Towel and finished off at Notre Dame. Cruise was a good time for relax and take in the lovely sights along the river.
Houseboats on the river. Went for a couple of strolls along the foreshore of the River Seine. A very pretty place with lots of photo opportunities. Very tranquil
Serene. . It's great having a river running through the city. Walking along the river makes you get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. They have some fabulous bridges.

Great way to see Paris. We took a 1hr trip from Pont Neuf,near Louvre & Notre Dame.€14 each seemed reasonable.English & French running commentary was good & informative.Trip gave a different view of Paris.As this is a circular trip,does not really matter where you sit.Beware,it can get very windy on the river,even in summer! Getting down stairs to the moorings looked difficult for less abled,worth a bit of research in advance,as there are plenty of trips along the river from other locations

IT was ..............a river. What a river, I mean this was a nice river. traveling around Europe, I saw a number of rivers and this was a good one. Seriously, it was a nice place to get a boat ride and see the city. Probably NOT a MUST SEE, but definitely worth it if you have the time or need a low energy activity to decompress.
Bit crowded in August as expected. It was crowded on the boat so this marred my experience- what did I expect in August eh! I would still recommend it for a lazy walk in the evening or early morning.

Vantage river cruises. Thiais the best cruise company on the Seine River for Americains as it is the only cruise boat allowed into the port of Honfleur. Viking does not even show their guests on the 4 boats on the Seine the amazing port of Honfleur. The ship is great, good cruise directors and the local guides in Normandy are the best on the river. Some will only work with this ship so there must be a reason.

Something to be Seen. Enjoy a picnic by the river but at night the kids or younger people were in little groups all over drinking and smoking. We did not feel that safe at times and broken beer bottle all over. Better just to view from the bridges than walk down by the river at night
Night cruise of the City. Wonderful meal, beautiful sights of the city by night, the lights of Paris shimmering on the water, just a fantastic experience

Nice view of the Eiffel tower. Nice long walk and a great view to the Eiffel tower !I personally dont like the cruises but they seem nice especially if you are not up for walking to check all the attractions.

Siene river has Loads of history. Make sure you choose one of the major providers. Our was included in a combo tour on Viator. The vessel was very full and had cover which was helpful for rain but did not help much with the wind. Best photos from the back of the vessel. The Cruises was about 1 /12 hours and in three languages. Loads of interesting things on both banks.

Fun river cruise through Paris. My daughter and I recently spent some time in Paris and ended up taking a little evening boat ride in the Seine. It was great to see the historic center of town from a new perspective. There are also great areas to walk along the river below street level.

try the Bateaubus. For an alternative transportion, go on the Bateauxbus. IT stops at strategic locations (Notre Dame, Eiffel Tower, Louvre, etc.) by traveling on the river. You can see much more than on the Metro and it's not as crowded. A two day pass is a really good deal. This is not the same as the Bateaux Mouches which are tours. This is more of a taxi.

Take a boat ride, just do it. You won't regret it.. It's nice! There are plenty of boat rides to go over the Seine, we went with the Bateaux Mouches which also includes diner.
The river looks nice, doesn't smell bad and the attractions along the river are nice to see.

Beautiful by day and night. The Seine is beautiful -- enjoy the many personalities of the different bridges that cross the river within the city. I took a night riverboat cruise to see the City of Lights all lit up, which was a real highlight of my recent trip there.

On my top ten things to see in Paris. I was not sure where the River Seine was. I did not know it stretched for miles throughout the city. There is many bridges you can walk over to see it. We did not do the river cruises however we heard they were wonderful. The days that we were there were a little colder so we did not want to be out on a boat as I had a cold. But I would recommend this if you have a chance.
Lovely river. This is probably one the best attractions of Paris. Take a boat ride and enjoy the many sights, or walk along the riverbanks to relax. Very very enjoyable, the water even seems clean.

Easy way to see the highlights of Paris. Best way to see the highlights of Paris attractions is a cruise down the Seine River - cruise past all the major landmarks, and look out for the other statue of liberty
Lovely River in the centre of the city. Great River in the centre of a city. Do a Bateau Mouche river cruise and see lots of the major sights
A must. Well worth walking along the seine to capture the atmosphere. It was filled with families and cyclists but a lovely walk along to the Bateaux for our cruise.

Great way to spend a couple of hours along the Seine. Very enjoyable taking a cruise along the Seine. Great way to find out where everything is situated and to learn something about the history of Paris. Would recommend this to everyone.

Learn the story of the Paris bridges and its buildings. A cruise down River Seine is a must for any visitor. There are several such cruises available. Choose one which has a live commentary to make you see things you otherwise wouldn't. Each bridge has a story and it is fruitful to know about them. You also learn what Paris has given to the world. Our cruise helped us know about the city and its history. Watch the Eiffel go by.

A lazy day on the river. One of the many tour boats that ply this river will suffice.We used the bateaux rouge and were rewarded with a wonderful tour on the river which afforded us a glimpse of most of the famous sights of Paris. Plenty of picture ops .A comfortable hassle free way to get around if you have the time and it is not raining too much!..
Crepe boat ride. On our first day in Paris we wandered up to the Seine and took a boat tour which included a lovely crepe and beverage. What a nice way to spend an afternoon.
A great stroll. Who could ever get bored of wandering along the riverbanks? Green, lively and always a great escape from Paris' traffic buzz.
Hop-on-Hop-off Boat. We booked a 2-day Hop-on-Hop-Off boat for our first 2 days in Paris. This was an excellent way to get familiar with the main attractions.

Not So Much a River as a Waterway of Beauty and Romance. If you have seen some big-city rivers, such as the Mississippi from Memphis, the Hudson from New York, or even the Thames from London, you see large waterways of world commerce which seem mostly outside of the realm and the life of the city. Yes, those rivers are there, but if they weren't the city life would not be such an immensely different experience. But Paris without the Seine? Impossible! Whether seen from a cruise (some of the luncheon and dinner cruises are wonderful!) or from a stroll along its banks or from the Eiffel Tower, the Seine breathes Paris and Paris breathes the Seine. A stroll along its banks, past the small postcard and nick-knack stands, while taking in the surrounding Parisian architecture, can fulfill a whole day. Stopping to eat at a café along the way (there are some wonderful ones at Blvd. Saint-Michel) will only enhance the lovely experience. Go breathe in Paris!

Good views. Late afternoon was great for photo taking. Not too crowded , bought our tickets same time as buying tickets for On Off Bus. Saves money. Safe to take children as well. There is a bottom deck and top deck. Bottom deck has Audio to hear sights as you are cruising past.

Must do in paris. Best way to see most amaizing buildings of Paris in minimum time....Value for money and time.....Walking on the banks of the river takes you in a different era.....A must do in paris.

Big Boat Tour. Part of our combined day tour was the boat trip on the Seine and it was really great to drift along as the famous scenes and buildings of Paris passed by as we "sailed" under the many bridges of Paris with a tour guide providing all the details of whee and when everything was built and who lived where and so on. I enjoyed every moment of the Paris Tours trip - all too short but we had lots to do and not lots of time. A great way to see Paris and very quick really although it did not seem that way as each new attraction flashed into view - cannot image seeing all that by road.

Beautiful centre of Paris.. This river is the central point of Paris and has the most amazing bridges from which you can get views to die for. The pont neuf by il de la cite is amazing as are all the bridges dotted along the river. Suggest a night river cruise. It's well worth it.

Great way to see Paris. Travelling by river provides fantastic photo opportunities especially of Eiffel Tower but also all the building riverside. Combining a Metro card gives you access to all of paris and save lots of walking
Take a boat ride. Paris is beautiful from the river.. As touristy as some of the boat tours look, it's worth it. Bring a camera and have a look at Paris from the angle of the Seine.

River Seine Bateau. We pre ordered our tickets through Parisians Bateau, lovely trip. Only need to arrive 15 minutes prior the departure time. We departed at the Notre Dame bridge. others depart near the Eiffel. Makes no difference where you depart, the tour passes all the great sites. it is one of the most inexpensive costs and very worth while.
Worth the money. Was lovely and a great way to see Paris This is when you can see why people call this a romantic city The many bridges and lovely architecture are worth seeing from the water

Interesting trip along the river.. lovely to walk along the river or take a river trip. We did both but was fortunate to have beautiful weather. The river trip was very interesting as there was a commentory of all the interesting buildings, bridges etc. along the river.
A must in Paris. Beautiful cruise ... Evenings are better with either sides lighted up beautifully , including the Eiffel! The cruise starts near the Eiffel and lasts for an hour .

A great tourist attraction in Paris. Have done a few trips on the river when visiting Paris. Took a cruise 1 evening on an open air boat, all the great buildings are fantastic lit up at night, many buskers, people eating and drinking along the river banks. Another one was the Batobus which stops at 8 different places so hop on hop off. Went along one Sunday and the river was buzzing people busking, dancing, eating and drinking. You pass under all the beautiful bridges, lots of love locks attached to bridges, lovely view of Notre Dame. Make sure you stop your tour at Eiffel Tower around 8pm when the lights are on and every hour after 8pm they flicker as well great sight.
Best view in Paris. When in Paris, it would be difficult to not see this beauty. We were within walking distance and each day made our way along it to our sightseeing day trips we planned by foot.

Has a nice feel to it. We bought a package deal that got us a visit to Eiffel, a city bus tour, and a cruise on the Seine. Although it was a large boat with a lot of people, there was still a certain aura about being here. I would go as far to say it was a bit romantic as well. You get to see some major attractions, and beautiful architecture along the way. Would repeat
Always a fun adventure. Historic river cruise is always fun with the family. Just the right length with lots to see. A nice perspective from the water with a good value.

Fantastic. Took a night time lights cruise along the river and saw all the major buildings lit up, Eiffel Towel was looking fantastic, boat was very crowed but that is to be expected in tourist season. Headphones are available for all English commentary. Fantastic Cruise highly recommend
Beautiful river. The river flows through the city of Paris . Without all the small bridges you will cross this river countless times throughout your city tour .

take the Batobus. highly recommend taking the Batobus, which allows passengers to "hop on hop off" at 9 locations along the Seine with a 1 or 2 day pass. Beautiful views of many famous Parisian sites.

A Favorite Experience!. Took a boat ride along the River Seine and it was a wonderful experience. After walking the city, it was awesome to see it from a different angle and see many things I missed walking. From the river, you can see the length and breadth of the Louvre, which is hard to comprehend when there or walking. The day we went was sunny and beautiful - grab a crepe and a cafe au lait for the ride.

Nice Evening on the River Seine!. We took a sunset champagne cruise on the River Seine as a part of a combined Eiffel Tower and Champagne Cruise guided tour package on June 21, 2015. Very enjoyable as we had the front quarter of the cruise boat all to ourselves and they kept the champagne coming. We could go out on deck or stay beneath the windowed canopy. To realize you are cruising through downtown Paris underneath the beautiful Alexandre III Bridge and out past the historic Notre Dame Cathedral while sipping champagne is a very enjoyable and relaxing experience. The view of the Paris from the river is extraordinary. There is only one River Seine and you will see areas you would not otherwise know existed were it not for a knowledgeable guide pointing them out to you. While it was still light outside during the early evenings in June, I have seen Notre Dame illuminated at night as cruise boats passed and it is truly spectacular! Well worth the time and cost.

Romance and Art. Even if you just walk a few blocks and over a few short bridges (or not on the bridges), it's great for a stroll anytime. There are lots of artists out painting on canvas, or other forms of art. If you want to take a river ride on one of the many river boats for a view of parts of Paris from the water, that is also available for you. I loved visiting Paris. We had crepes on our way home in the evenings from the vendors and visited some of the many pastry shops around the area. We went for 7 days and that was not long enough to sight see...
River Cruise. Take the one hour river cruise...not the jump on jump off one. Or you could walk most of it by the shore.
