River trip on the Seine. We took a trip with Batobus which costs 16 Euros for a day pass and 19 for two days. It stops at all the main tourist spots and you can hop on and hop off at will. No continuous commentary either.

Delightful and wonderful to watch. This beautiful river flows right through the city and definitely makes its impact on the city of lights. Also, it's quite a helpful directional. As long as you know where the river is, you can't get lost in Paris. Walking along the Seine is a delight in itself. Just do it during the day. At night, it can get a little scary for foreigners.
All part of Paris. Beautiful River that meanders through the city of Paris, lovely to walk over the bridges and see all the river cruises going by.

The Seine - the best way?. Lots of options. We went for the dinner cruise from south side of river near Eiffel Tower / Point towards Trocadero /fountain, then take steps down to Port Bordonnais. All very efficient and exceptional politeness. Service was top drawer, food very good. early evening daylight, dark on way back so best of Paris by day and night. Incredible by night...so do an evening cruise of some description, dinner or not. 2 hours or so.
It's a river. Nice walking through town along the river bank. I guess,to me, it's just famous that's all. Get some pics...

Nothing much to say about this tour. Overall just OK.. I would prefer to tour Paris by bus. If you are on a tight schedule, choose HOHO bus. Get on this cruise since it is included in Paris Pass package.You cant see much from this river cruise. But the tour also come with audio guides that explain to you on attractions that is not available via HOHO bus.

IL ya tellement de magnifiques ponts!. So many bridges and so little time to see them. Plan on taking a lot of photos, because you will. Have extra photo storage on your camera. The river boat captains are master at navigating this river, which pretty swift with a strong current. Great vistas of the city from the Seine.
Romance or not and great treat. Definitely take an evening cruise for a romantic experience. Not a romantic travel? then take an early evening dinner cruise.

A different view. When in Paris try to plan a trip on the Seine. Whether you travel during the day or at night you will get a different view of Paris that cannot be had from land. Many of the most famous sights border the river and are especially beautiful at night when they are lit up.

River Cruise to see the Sights from another angle. Take a 1 hour river sightseeing cruise to see the sights and hear an interesting narrative. Come early or late but late afternoon sees the longest lines; up to an hour wait to board (standing in line; and no access to toilets) looses a star.

The heart of Paris. This is the heart of Paris, whats not to like. We took an evening cruise (highly recommended) as well as walked along its banks for hours.
We saw rescue divers performing training one afternoon, they were amazing

Lovely!. The River Seine is one of the most beautiful in city rivers in the world. A most romantic city, Paris is not itself without this wonderful river that winds through the city, dividing it into the Left & Right banks. Walk across the numerous bridges. Walk in the morning, walk at noon, walk at night - come rain, sun or snow - the River Seine, it's bridges and the streets of this city of lights & romance - make for a wonderful experience. Rcently took a long walk in Paris with a dear friend. Splendid. Not to be missed. Highly recommended!

Boat Tour is a Must!. Take a boat tour but DO NOT prepay for one of the more expensive tours advertised on travel websites. Wait until you arrive in Paris before you book a tour. They usually run every 1.5 hours and you can book them at the dock for 15 euros. You can also bring your own food and wine on the cheaper tour boats.
Lovely time on the Seine,. Took a night time tour of the Seine and its attractions. Learned a lot about the city, the famous buildings and attractions. Also gave us a chance to rest our feet.
Seine River Cruise. Took a river cruise (from under the Eiffel Tower), which takes you approx. 12km along the Seine river, passing by the most famous landmarks.

Beautiful river. Whether you stroll along the Seine or ride one of the bateau muches, this is not to be missed. This is a beautiful winding river with some stunning bridges. Take a visit to Pont Alexander 3rd, it is gorgeous.

Great Views. I did a boat trip down the river Seine and would highly recommend doing it, you get to see all the main attractions along the way and it is a lovely way to spend a couple of hours seeing the city from the river.
Can't beat the scenery. Took a boat from under King Henry 4th statue on the Pont de Neuf. Wonderful hour spent on the river and taking in all the sites.

River cruise - fine way to spend an evening. My folks and I spent our final evening in Paris on a dinner cruise on the Seine, which departed from and returned to the Bateaux Mouches. It was a genteel, relaxing way to enjoy the views while enjoying a fine meal and pleasant music. Admittedly, it brought home the fact that the river is much lower than some of the sights along its “banks” (read: concrete and stone), so if you’re hoping for fabulous river shots of Notre Dame, prepare to be disappointed. Also, our boat was glass-enclosed, which created real photo-taking problems with reflected interior lighting once it got dark. Nevertheless, it was a fun experience and worth the time. A good way to unwind, too.

A great way to get a different view of this romantic city. I would caution people to be sure they know where the boat they are purchasing tickets for launches. There are several vendors outside of the D'Orsay where we purchase tickets only to find that our boat was located by Notre Dame. Not what we planned, but a great way to see the sights and understand the importance of the Seine.

Always a great walk and lots to see. The river runs right down the city center and most of the life starts right around the river. You can sit and walk along the river. In the summer they make mini beach's which is very cool. Walk along the top of the river or along the base, it is both very nice and will bring you to something fun or important to see. They also have fun kids play areas, restaurants on boats, and bike path. There are even a club or two during the summer months.
Evening Cruise. Every book I read told me to make sure I included this in my trip. We went on an evening dinner cruise down the Seine and it was lovely worth every Euro, do not miss this.
Dinner cruise on the Seine. An absolute must do. The evening dinner cruise was great. A real highlight of Paris. Great food, wine and the best views, who can ask for more

Great way to see the City of Lights!. We took the boat tour of the River Seine and were very glad we did. The tour guide was very knowledgable and we went in the evening so we're able to see the sights lit up for the night-beautiful!
See Paris from a different perspective.. A boat trip on the Seine is a 'must do' for anyone visiting Paris for the first time. You see the city from a different perspective.

Bateau Mouche. Did a tour at the end of a full days sightseeing walking around Paris. Really good to see the buildings from the river although disappointed that there wasn't a running commentary. Booked on-line on the morning of our trip and had no problems getting on the boat - plenty of space.

Walk along the Seine!. Walking along the Seine is very, very cool! You are surrounded by history, by culture, by art, by beauty. It really is magic! My wife and I walked from Pont d' Alma (up by the tour Eiffel) to Pont d' Notre Dame. We shopped the book stalls and just took our time. We went by the bridge of love locks (Pont d' Arts ). The right bank is shaded and beautiful and the people were very nice. There are plenty of cafes. If you need a restroom you can use one in a cafe (buy a coffee) or a departrment store. (If you see girls with clipboards heading your way, just wave them off, they're creating distractions for pickpockets...but don't worry this is common...dismiss them and enjoy the magic!

The River. The river was like a magnet for us....we walked her banks every day whilst in Paris. Night-time is just as busy as during the days, as locals flock to her shores to meet, drink, eat, stroll, jog, people watch and enjoy the scenery. While we were the it rained heavily for the first couple of days and the river over flowered her backs...so walking along the lower embankment wasn't possible in certain areas. Further, some of the dinner boats could not be accessed as the rivers was high. Every vendor imaginable is along her upper banks...great place to stroll and see the city.

The Seine, personification of romance. It's the Seine! If you have experienced it in song and story, it's a must. If all you see is a river running through the centre of a city, you can pass. If you belong in the "must" camp, the most expensive but romantic tour is an evening supper cruise. The most cost-efficient and comprehensive cruise is a full round on the Batobus.

Paris and the Seine..nothing like it!. We took the Metro to Ile de La Cite to see Notre dame and just walk along the Seine. We also took a boat cruise along the seine, which gives you a unique perspective on all the architecturally different bridges and landmarks.
The Seine, the Seine.... Walking along its banks one sees lots of book stores, paintings for sale, along the water there are boats for tours, lovely
Take the boat. Lovely no matter where you are on the river. I recommend taking one of the boats that go up and down the river to see the many sites.

River Trip along the Seine courtesy of Bateau Parisiens. We were nine people ... The queues were horrendous but we had vouchers and were able to 'jump' them. The sun shone and it was a very enjoyable trip. The stretch of river we traversed had the Notre Dame in all its glory plus several bridges, the Eiffel Tower, the lucky mascot of Paris, and a bridge that had a rail track atop the road. There was some commentary but generally we were left to our own devices. Disappointingly there were no refreshments aboard. We could have done with a glass of wine to accompany the views!
Take a boat. Walk or take a boat trip need I say more we had diner an excellent experience try it. You will not be disappointed Peter

Bateaux Mouche. Make sure to take a ride on the Seine on the famous Bateaux Mouche. Not only is it very relaxing but you also get to see many of the wonderful monuments along the river, including the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, and the amazing bridges that cross it. My favorite bridge is the Alexander 3rd.
A must do. A boat trip is the best way of experiencing both the river Seine and the surrounding buildings. Trips come with commentary which helps picturing how it all was and worked in olden times.
You just have to Stop and smell the roses. This river is busy, nice to site and watch the boats go by on a sunny afternoon. Loads of activity going on this river

Seine on a Bâteau Mouche with Dinner and Music in the evening. Very romantic with my spouse. The welcome drink (Champagne) at the reception pier near the Pont d'Alma are in a warm colored room with great pictures. Dinner & drinks were ok, middle class. The view on the Seine and its building on the banks are beautiful - especially with the illuminated Tour Eiffel.

BEAUTIFUL. Take time to walk along the Seine, it's wonderfull.
Beautiful view on Notre Dame.
You can also walk along the harbour to place de la Bastille.
River Seine. The ride was approximately of 50 minutes,they shown all the historical places during the ride,worth to go on it.
River with a lot of history. This is very interesting river -- it has a lot of history. The walk along the river is really worth.

What's not to Love?. The River Seine is so beautiful and all the bridges going over are so lovely. So wonderful to stroll alongside and take in all the sights. I can't imagine going to Paris and not experiencing it!
Very relaxing. This is a relaxing boat ride gets you away from all the hustle and bustle of the streets for about an hour or so. This is the best way to see the Alexander and Pont Neuf bridges.

Magical boat cruise. On our first evening in Paris, we took a boat cruise down the Seine. Before boarding, we stood on the Pont Neuf and saw the Eiffel Tower in the distance, all lit up - and suddenly it began to sparkle and glitter! It was magical! We also saw the Louvre and Notre Dame illuminated. What an awesome way to begin our first visit to Paris!!!

Seine River. Not a great River compared against other amazing rivers, like in Budapest!It has a nice view near the eiffel tower, but still not great.I advise to walk through and go to the centre, where is much more beautiful!

Walking along the River Seine for both day and night views. We were very fortunate to find an apartment across the street from the River Seine. Because everywhere along the river is a photo-op, staying next to the river lends itself to great photos. Walking is my number one choice in Paris. I want to be close to the beauty and history of this great city. The River Seine never fails to provide just what I'm looking for on my trip.

Cruise the seine at night...... If you want to do something truly romantic, take a night cruise on the Seine... It is a unique vantage of the beautiful architecture of Paris and the famous Eiffel Tower...

Natural and FREE attraction in Paris!. Beautiful river, especially when seen from high points like the Eiffel Tower. Lots of houseboats from all over the world moored along the way. Access at all major bridges along the river, so you can walk along the river paths. Be savvy and keep safe.

Viking River Cruise Paris to Normandy. We just return from a Viking River cruise from Paris to heart of Normandy, spend 3 nights in Paris on a pre-cruise package, we received a package from Viking with details information of the whole trip, each of us have a booklet with our name printed, flight and transfer also hotel information, with telephone number to call in case one have any problem, almost foolprove, it's wonderful for Viking to make sure no one miss the boat, on Sept 3rd we left San Francisco, after 12 hour flight, reach Paris about noon, they advice us, put on Viking Cruise tab and cabin number on our luggage, a Viking River cruise sticker on our shirt, when we came out the gate, a Viking River cruise staff wave us, take us to a car waiting to take us to the Hotel Du Collectionneur, there we met a Viking staff with our check in cards for our room, he also told us, if we need to speak to him for any reason, his telephone number and the time he's on duty, first day is free time on our own, 2nd day after breakfast, group morning walk at Marais, the older part of Paris, once upon a time, this where it all began, interesting neighborhood with historic buildings, lunch and dinner not included, we bought tickets for Effel tour, after lunch, take a taxi to Welcome center to meet the tour guide, wait to enter and wait for elevator, all together total about 3 hour to complete the tour, too many people to handle, anyway we were glad for the experience, a taxi to take us back to hotel, on the 3rd day, bought skip the line tickets at hotel to Louvre museum, taxi to the museum about 9:15am, first we go see Mona Lisa, it was early, not many vistors, we were able to take picture of Mona Lisa and spend sometime appreciate her smile, it's a very big museum, for 4 and half hour to see what we plan to see, I imagine if one want to see everything, one need at least a whole week's time, taxi back to hotel and walk to a local restaurant for dinner, 4th day is first day of the River cruise, a bus take us to the ship at noon, free lunch on board and settle in our cabin to rest, dinner on the ship, 5th day is second day of the cruise, after breakfast, bus take us to Paris to see some of the main attractions, a stop at Notre Dame and Eiffel tower, then back to the ship, that evening the ship start sailing, what follow is everyday, we visit towns along the way with a tour guide, history informative and interesting places, all the personnel at Viking try their best to accomodate everybody, first class all the way, breakfast, lunch and dinner with good selections, wine are included, except drinks at the bar, we were satisfy with all the arrangements of the cruise, everyone serve with a smile, this our first time on Viking cruise, thumbs up, will do another cruise with Viking in the future.

Trip on Batobus. Spent a very enjoyable 90 minutes sailing from Notre Dame to the tower on the Batobus (hop on off boat). Great for seeing the riverside attractions and giving your feet a rest. Also saw the statue of liberty which was a surprise.
beautiful. the river is paris in all its glory! just but a cup of coffee with a corrosion or take lunch, and eat it one the river side- you would feel like a true Parisian.

Beautiful. Beautiful and clear water river, something that speaks of the care that the people in the city stand for. River cruise with refreshments on board is something that one can look forward to you. The view of the river from our Hotel room was also very nice.

Stroll along the quay. You must just stroll along the river. Before you know it you will be down by palace de Concorde. There are wonderful exhibits along the way once you are beyond pont neuf heading towards le tour Eiffel. Another area where the Parisians gather with friends.

So much to see ..... Wow. You just have to take a river boat tour. There is so much to see, sights are many and varied and well worth it. Loved every minute of the the river boat cruise, which takes about 1 hour.

We really enjoyed the Le Seine river.. It is a must-see and I loved being there throwing in our keys after locking our love. The river boats were wonderful and were very special to wonder at who might be living on them or traveling on down the river.

River Seine bus boat . A great way to see the sites and jump on and off the bus boat as many times as you like to take in the tours. A cheaper option for families and the day pass is great to enjoy a full day out of site seeing 😊
What's Paris without the Seine?. Need not to say much. The Seine brings dream and hope to all people who look at it, whether it's from the Pont Neuf, or along its banks.
WOW. We did the night boat ride. Seeing Paris at night was breathtaking and romantic. This tour was the prefect way to end our first visit to Paris.

A cruise is a must!. La Seine: the reason why Paris started as "Parigii" a long time ago. Till this day, it remains the life of the city. Most great Parisian monuments are lined along its shores: The Eiffel Tower, Trocadero, fashion palace, the "grand palais", the Alexandre III bridge, place de la concorde, Musée d'Orsay, Pont des Arts, Sainte-Chapelle & Notre-Dame etc...That's just as many reasons to take a cruise on it!!! We'd suggest a dinner cruise at sunset/night to see the city all lit up. It's an incredibly romantic experience. Besides, you can also have a picnic along its docks or dance Tango/ Salsa with strangers during summer evenings...
Cruise!. We took the river cruise from Eiffel tower which was of an hour. the view all the beautiful monuments was excellent.

So romantic . We decided to do the hop on hop off boat tour on the river as it was 16 euro and the 45 minute cruise was 14 euro. With the hop on tour we got on at one stop and got off in another which was very convenient. We opted for the day trip but ended it around sunset which was very romantic. Would highly recommend everyone to enjoy the river.
Great trip. Seeing the city by boat gives you a totally different perspective of city. Highly recommend taking a tour a night when all the buildings are lit up.

Viking Rinda River Cruise. Never anticipated spending my vacation herded on a charter bus. But since we were docked in LE PEQ, an hour outside PARIS, that's what happened. Adhering to their schedule with extremely limited free time on all excursions. We book 3 day pre-cruise stay in "5 star" hotel, 3 more like it. The location was the best part of those 3 days. Bed, sheets, towels in hotel and on ship were mediocre at best. Service excellent on ship but couldn't make up for the other disappointments. Food not memorable. Doubt any of us will ever step foot on a Viking Cruise again. And it was quite $$$$$

Walk, stroll and Enjoy!. We got off at the Metro Bastille and meandered our way next to the Seine. Walking down by marinas, over to the island back across the Lover's Bridge and to the Louvre, ending at the Eiffel Tower. We took the Metro back into town. What a wonderful stroll on a Fall day!

Beautiful city but dirty river. The city of Paris is beautiful however the amount of trash floating in the Seine River thru the heart of Paris was very disheartening. All of the bridges crossing the river have elements of history beckoning tourist to photograph and enjoy however, when you glance at the water below and see lots of trash such as plastic bottles drifting with the current, it's not an image you want to photograph.

beautiful. A classic if you go to Paris.
Best time is to go early in the morning and take a morning walk before all the tourists get there and invade all the beautiful spots. Just walk around and enjoy.

Great boat trip. The best way to experience the river is to take one of the many boat rides down it lasting about 1 hour they give the best views of the architecture on the banks and the many bridges it goes under
Scenic. My only recommendation - take the tour in night when everything is lit up. Book online I'm advance it is cheaper that way.
A summer chillout. Took a boat ride - it was 1 hour long and had the possibility to see Paris from a different angle. The ride is cheap, so you should definitely make it :)

Cultural and physical lifeblood of Paris. Leave the museums and shopping behind and stroll the river. Every day. Several times. Take the evening boat tour, not the expensive ones but the $10 one with an English speaking guide. Walk the Seine again. Not enough lifetimes to do this enough

1-hour Cruise with the Paris Pass on the beautiful Seine. We were able to walk right up to the line - show our Paris Pass and receive a ticket for a 1-hour cruise. So nice! Boat was clean; windows were spotless; open air top or sit below to stay warm. Clean restroom on board. Very enjoyable cruise. You see a lot of the Paris sights from your seat on the boat. Very comfortable for all ages. The Seine is gorgeous and it's fun to pass under all the bridges.

A Lovely River. Whether you chose to walk along the brick lined banks or take a cruise, you will never forget the Seine. There are areas where tourist boats are so thick it's hard to see the water, but in other areas you will find ordinary dockhands working their boats. There are many bridges and it's almost impossible to visit Paris and not cross a few.
Majestic. It actually brings a special character to the city! Amazing spirit when walking down through Notre Damme, Painters bridge, Alexander III. A boat trip is a must here

A different perspective of Paris from teh water!. Strongly recommend one off teh many 1 hour river excursions to see Paris from the Seine.Suggest that you select one of the boats that has open top deck seating for the best views of both sides of the river (some boats only have enclosed seating)

The heart of Paris.. This is the heart of this great city of Paris, like the Thames is to London, the bridges are grand and imperial as are the buildings on either side, walking by the river is fabulous.

Essential Parisian Waterway . The beautiful Seine features in many movies and you can see why. Stylish romantic bridges, riverside terraces for couples or joggers, attractive trees and plenty of traffic on the water, there's always something happening that you can watch. Dining at night is such a treat with Paris illuminated, and in particular, cruising past the Eiffel Tower is very special.
A must do. We had a beautiful cruise down the Seine. Our guide was very helpful and swapped languages very quickly. Everything was pointed out and explained very well. A beautiful trip.

River Cruise in the City of Lights . We did a river cruise at night on a whim and it was amazing! The whole city is lit up and the Eiffel Tower sparkles! It was so romantic and perfect. Definitely recommend to everyone, especially if you're there with a special someone.

Beautiful Views of City. Walking along the banks of the river and crossing any of the many bridges that connect the various parts of the city gives the visitor a real sense of Paris, but it is just as lovely to look at the landmarks from the river itself. There are several boat companies that cruise the river and offer day and nighttime tours. Some offer meals as well.

You'll take lots of photos on their river cruises.. Took a 3 hr. dinner cruise on the Seine. Best money ever spent. You'll get photos of most of Paris' major attractions lit up at night right from your dinner table.

Nice trip. My friends and I went on the river seine in a cruise boat!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It's so much fun, and most of the people are really friendly if you wave at them on the boat, while they are walking along!!!! It's a really cool fun trip!!!!

Beautiful Sunset cruise. My family did a sunset river cruise on 8/9/2015 from Eiffel Tower. Notice "Sunset" is 9pm in Summer's Paris. The cruise go around Seine so include both left and right bank. It covers most of the attractions along the river. Suggest you do this cruise first thing after you arrive Paris. it will give you a good overview of Paris. Try to sit left side of the boat cause you can get better view !! We bought cruise ticket with Hop on/off bus ticket to get a discount. You can use the cruise on different day of your bus ticket. Eiffel Tower lit up @10pm so on our way back to Eiffel Tower, we see the beautiful Eiffel Tower cover with lights. Highly recommended.

Watch all the traffic, runners, tour boats, and commercial ships.. After 12 years, do not get tired of looking at the Seine.....romantic, beautiful bridges, and the views are fantastic. Wish I could live on one of the ships.
River Cruise by night. We just loved cruising down this river at night and the weather was dry and the busy life of paris is so amazing at night. really is the city of lights.
Picnic by the river. Take a stroll through nearby Rue Cler and buy the makings of a picnic. Then wander down to the Seine and watch the people and the boats. Very pleasant!

lovely for boat trip and walking. It is a very nice and very romantic place for boat trip by the sunset and during the evening. I did it both and love it very much.
Summer time is the best for the boat trip with lovely friends and family
Seine at her best.. On this cruise during about an hour you can view all the beautiful landmarks of Paris. Before you are going to visit the Notre Dame and others first take a cruise!
River Cruise. We took a lunch river cruise - pre-booked and expensive - but very worth it! Bateaux Parisiennes - Silver service

Nice . the only thing I enjoyed not to much que 1 hr trip worth the price.
but again to much people on boat cant see much and take clear photos😞

Wonderful & Bustling With Activity-Late July & Early August. Great Suprise! The riverbank is made into a beach for 6+ weeks in the Summer. There is something there for everyone. You can get wine, beer & food. The last night we brought our own drinks & snacks and got a table for Sunset! Great to people watch. We were a couple so we tried to avoid the playground areas.

River Seine!. River Seine is one of the must do attractions in Paris apart from Louvre and Eiffel. I would personally recommend river cruise in the evening. Always ensure to get advanced ticket as it is twice as crowded at the ticket counter.

On foot and by boat, always something fascinating to see. We walked by the Seine on Sunday, crossing the bridges and seeing the padlocks that still cover some of them. We enjoyed seeing the vintage book and magazine vendors, people watching, and reveling in actually being in Paris. A couple of days later we took a boat ride from the Eiffel Tower down the river past Notre Dame, and back. We got an even better look at life along the heart of Paris. It's obvious that Parisians treasure their Seine, and we learned to as well.
very nice and relaxing. did a 1 hr criuse down the river. Very enjoyable and relaxing just taking in all the lovely views. disappointed that you couldn't purchase refreshments on board.

It is definitely worth it!. This is my second trip to Paris. I had gone to a lot of places before. This time I got a travel and sightseeing package through Paris Passport. (That's a really convenient thing to get as well!) part of it is getting to go on a river cruise right at the foot of Eiffel Tower! It was a short walk once you cross the street from Eiffel and gone down the stairs to the pier area. We were thinking it's just some small boat fitting 10-12 people and a rough ride. But to our pleasant surprise, the boat was gorgeous inside and out. Very steady. Glass windows everywhere. It even has a top / 2nd floor which you can get a panoramic view. The cooperative weather did help the experience. My wife thoroughly enjoyed it! And I got to see some of the sites, like Notre Dame, Assemble Nationale from another perspective! It's very cool! Its about an hour and I would highly recommend it :)
Better at Night. Best to do the cruise at night. Gives you a very different perspective than what you have seen during the day

Peaceful Dinner Boat Cruise on River Seine with Paris City Vision. Perfect way to ease yourself into Paris the first night. Why not go on a dinner boat cruise with Paris City Vision. Dinner was great - you get an appetizer, main course, desserts and coffee. Very friendly host and waitress / waitresses. The sights are magical especially when you see at dusk and night - the Notre Dame Cathedral, a glimpse of the Eiffel tower and much more.

Quietly flows the Seine. We stood on the Passerelle de Solférino, now known as the Passerelle Léopold Sédar Senghor (for the former Senegalese President). This charming footbridge over the Seine connects the Jardin de Tuileries on the Right Bank to the Musée d'Orsay on the Left Bank. This is a perfect location to imbibe the essence of Paris - the Eiffel Tower soaring one way, the towers of Notre Dame the other, while the Seine itself smoothly flows beneath through time and history. In this city of lovers, couples leave a romantic memory locking a padlock on the side of the bridge.Enjoy this lovely river from this peaceful crossing point, or take refreshments at one of the little restaurants on the Left Bank at the foot of the bridge.
Beautiful iconic river. just strolling along the riverside feels such a Parisian experience with stalls, shops, cafes and gorgeous buildings on the side.Just a lovely thing to do.
Yep, it really *is* romantic. Walk along the seine... it is pretty romantic. I highly recommend taking a night boat tour (one without food, like the Vedettes du Pont Neuf)
Fun. Its fun to walk over the little bridges and even talk a boat ride at night. There are artists and vendors along the river and its fun to walk along side it.
Romantic. I found this place very romantic and artistic. I saw a lot of young couple coming to this river to take the photo of their married.

Relax and Enjoy Cruise. Tickets can be bought at the hotel but it is cheaper to get them at the Seine. There are many different options, dinner cruises, etc but we went for a one hour cruise that started at 9:00 pm. The cost was 14 euros per person. Also, one could not bring any liquor so wine had to be bought there pre boarding. Not much of a line since there are so many possibilities. We choose to stay downstairs as it was a bit on the cooler side that night but many people were still on the top deck. Either way, the view is unobstructed. It was very interesting to relax with some wine and see all the famous monuments from an ocean view. The most fun part of the cruise was seeing the party atmosphere on the shores by the French people who were lined up dancing, drinking and just having a good time. Since the sunset was about 10:15, we did not get to see everything lit up for too long. If we ever did this again, we would take the 10:00 cruise.

Boat cruise. We took an evening boat cruise to view the City of Lights in the evening from the Seine River. It was a fun experience to see many of the buildings lite up. I was surprised by the amazing detail on Notre Dame in the evening. This cathedral actually looks better at night with the lights shining on it.

It's Just a River. It's ok but nothing extraordinary for me . The day we went on seine River it rained heavily. So don't go there on a rainy day . As we pre booked the river cruise & we had limited time in Paris we had to go on that day . I saw the river on a sunny day too but there are more beautiful river cruises in other parts of the world . Sure this is a historical place .

Great for Exercise, People Watching and Seeing the Sights. Love walking along the River Seine. It is a great way to get exercise, people watch and get a great view of some of Paris's most beautiful and popular tourist attractions. Rain or shine, I loved this.

Dusk boar. We chose to take the dusk boat ride down the seine (cost 14 euros per person for a 1 hour ride) and were so glad we did. I had heard that Paris at night is magical and you get that feeling as you float by the attractions all lit up. The people on the banks and the bridges shout out and wave and it feels like you are truly a " part of Paris" in that moment The grand finale is when you return to the Eiffel Tower and it sparkles on the hour bell

nice place shame about the people. took a boat along the river in th evening every thing was lit up and it look lovely was very good fun with my friends all of us enjoyed it , shame about the horrid french people. they were rude all the time
Just wander. Pick any part of the river Sienne and ample along. Magnificent sites to be seen in all directions enjoy. And then come back at night to see the lights. All free just beautiful

Seeing Paris by water. Paris, like many great cities, is best enjoyed on foot, but to travel the waterways a boat helps. We purchased day passes for one of the boat companies which ply the river in the central section of Paris. It is an excellent way to obtain another perspective of the buildings and the bridges of the Seine. Warning, the boats have a closing time which may leave you stranded at one end of their route, so be prepared to get home by metro.

The best way to travel - Batobus. The Batobus stops at 9 different locations. All main attractions, it is a 'hop on, hop off' service. You can combine it with the open tour buses i.e. on and off either for 1 day or 2 days etc. Or do like we did..... 2 day ticket on the Batobus Boat, which was a really relaxed way to get around, then purchased 2 a day ticket on the open tour (open top) buses (green). This was equally a good way to get around, hop on, hop off or just stay on and tour the city. Having done the metro for years, we would never use this as our preferred method again, you miss too much.

The river Seine Paris. A cruise on the River Seine does not have to be expensive. There are many types of cruises one to fit every pocket. You can sail for as low as €14 an hour on the Parisian bateaux cruise. There is no need to pre-book. Just buy your ticket and go at your most convenient hour. For those who want luxury, you can get that also, dinner and a cruise, that will cost you up to €650 according to the options chosen. But there is so much to do in Paris sailing on the Seine is sailing on the Seine. The cuisine is fantastic all around so for those looking for a simple cruise, don't get bugged down in the exotic dinner and cruise, just sail from €14 an hour. Get your ticket before hand. We got ours at the hotel desk " the Novotel Tour Eiffel without a line and without any commissions. Ask your concierge if you are staying at a hotel.

One Hour Tour of the River Seine . Advantage of being disabled you go to the front of the line, the disadvantage is you are inside unable to make it to the top of the boat. In the end it worked out because the you could only listen to the commentary from the inside. We were taken back in time to France centuries ago. We enjoyed it so much that we bought the DVD of the tour to be sure that we didn't miss anything and, of course, we could do the tour over again as many times as we pleased. There are a few tours to choose from, one hour tours (which we did), lunch or dinner cruises and the Batobus which is a hop-on hop-off style tour, along the Seine. Obviously I can only recommend the first since that was our preference.

Take a walk along the Seine. Paris is a great walking city. One of the best (and most romantic) is a leisurely stroll along the banks of the Seine.Not on the street level - get down on the river. There is a paved walkway all along it.We took a 2 hour stroll on the right bank from the Rue de Bac to the Eiffel tower and captured many a photographic moment. The boats that are tied up along the river, the views of the Musee D'Orsay, Eiffel tower, and the numerous bridges (including Pont Alexander) from this viewpoint should not be missed.And it's relaxing!

My favorite river on the planet!. This may be the most famous stretch of river in the world, and in my opinion worth the fame. This trip (and every trip!) I spent quite a bit of time biking up one side and back down the other. You can access most of the most visited sites, Tour Eiffel, Invalides, Grand Palais, Tuileries, Louvre, and Notre Dame from the river banks. Great people watching too! You can cross about 12 bridges and photograph the ever changing vistas too!

Nighttime riverboat cruise!. Took one of these at night, and it was super romantic and wonderful! The food and crepes on board were not worth it so eat before/after. Make sure to get a seat outside on the top and front so you can see everything!

A River. It's a river...
I have no desire to see more of it. It s not a river that takes me to history.
I am intersted in the Loire River Valley....

AMAZING SCENERY . The best part from being in the perfect hotel was the walking distance is was to get to the river.....then knowing the available tours every hour on the ferries allows you take a slow walk to enjoy the view of the river and wave hello to thd sightseeing tour and the ticket counter people was very helpful in giving the right place to be on the tour of many choices.....I love how the river is so calm just makes you feel loved. It was surreal
Fantastic!. The water by itself, has a huge impact on the city.I mean, city with water (river, lake or ocean) is much nicer then the other way. The Seine river is magnificent! Worth it! Paris! Love!

Walking along the banks. There is a pedestrian/bike path along either side of the river, bustling with activity. It is a wonderful stroll, and a great way to get from A to B without worrying about cars!

When is a river not a river?. So, how do you write a review for a river? Was it wet enough? Yes. Was it flowing? Yes. Was it attractive? In places.We stayed in the Bercy part of the city near the Seine, and it was nice to be able to walk along the banks of the river. They were a bit dull, though, as all concrete and nothing to break the monotony. There were not very many boats moored on the river or moving along it here.When we were nearer to Notre Dame, there were a number of companies offering river tours, and this was a nice way to see the sights and historic buildings that line the Seine.I think I have little else to say - my comments have dried up!

Hard to miss.... You can't really miss the Seine if doing sightseeing in Paris. Some of the bridges are absolutely beautiful and each bridge has its own story! I would definitely recommend doing a boat tour!!

Peaceful and Majestic - A must do!. One of the best things to do in Paris is just relax and enjoy the Seine. There are multiple ways to do this. Either by grabbing a drink down at one of the places along the river, enjoying a boat cruise on the Seine or just strolling on the pathway on the Seine. Anyway you choose to do it gives you a different view and perspective of the city. We tried to experience all three while we were there and found it very relaxing continue to be down on the Seine during our trip. However, like other areas of Paris, be careful of Scammers down there who may try to get you to "sign" a piece of paper. They are there to scam you or rob you. It is easy to just say no and walk away though.
Cruise on the river. Booked an hours cruise on the river Seine in a very hot day, great views & guide in a number of lanuages
A pleasant place to spend time. The river winds through the city with lots to see all along its banks. Plenty of locks to traverse when heading north after you get out of the city.
Seine river tours. makes sense to take a boat tour on the Seine, If you are visiting during summer, then the evening tour makes sense, stick to the day tours if you're traveling in winter

An integral part of Paris.. If you are a tourist in Paris, you can't but see the River Seine at some point. What I like most about it are the small little shops along the side, as you get closer to Notre Dame. The walk along the river is where the local lovers go to walk and get away from the tourists. It is a nice place to see most of the highlights in Paris, as most of them line up along the river.

Take a cruise of the river to see the city from that view. The bridges that cross the river are worth a look in their own right. And a walk along the rive is a must, with stops in to the many museums along the way.

Rived ride. It is nice to see the river and there are several cruises you can take down the river. River cruises can also be part of longer trips. Fun just walking along it and seeing the love bridge.

8 Day Cruise. My husband & I enjoyed an 8 day river cruise on the Seine with Avalon Waterways through Normandy. It was very relaxing & we loved the little towns we called into. We highly recommend this way of touring.

Life Blood of Paris. The Seine is the "Life Blood of Paris", it flows straight through its heart and if you follow it, you can find your way to many of its sites, Notre Dame, The Conciergerie, The Louvre, Place De La Concorde, Museums, Parks and The Eiffel Tower.We took a night river cruise and it was fantastic, the whole city under lights is a wonderful sight to see, the boat travelled from Notre Dame to the Eiffel Tower and back.A beautiful river in a wonderful city.

Lovely cruise and great way to get around :). The big glass boats are ideal for cruising around, hop on, hop off way to see this beautiful city. Very smooth ride too :) better that catching a bus and quite roomy.
Lovely. What's more to say about this river in the city of love? All this shops close to it and all the restaurants and cafes make it unique
Gentle cruise. A gentle cruise along the Seine is a wonderful way of seeing the Parisienne architecture without the hard slog on foot

CALM and TRANQUIL is what you will experience on the RIVER SEINE !!. We took a dinner cruise on the River Seine and it was lovely...just a beautiful way to see Paris from the water.. If you have the time take a cruise down the River Seine !

Part of the Beauty of Paris . This river sets this city apart from others. It adds such beauty and interest. It's relaxing and enjoyable to see all the river traffic, barges, tour boats, and river cruise ships. It's truly magnificent.

A great cruise ,loads of history and buildings to be seen.. Cruise on the Seine a great tourist thing to experince.
Effiel Tower at night is a spectacular and breath taking sight.

Bateau Mouche/ Bateau Parisien. We took a Bateau Parisien lunch tour on the Seine. It was spectacular! You can see many of the attractions and get a feel for the city from the water. Plus, the food and drink -- and musical entertainment -- were lovely. Highly recommended if you've never done it before.

Unique views and a pleasant escape from the hustle & bustle. Took a cruise down the Seine - got some awesome views from different perspectives to seeing it on foot or by bus.
Would recommend the hop on/off boat, although we stayed on it for a complete loop which was equally lovely.

A trip on the Seine is essential. We did the open top bus trip, but the boat trip is a must.. The river is so wide so you see so much and it goes down one way and up the other. Don't do it on a rainy day as you need to be upstairs.Don't do the big bus offer as you can not hop on and off
Must try when in Paris. A must try! There's counters selling the ticket for the river cruise.So romantic as the boat went along the river.

A nice walking destination. Get a walk at the riverside. Spend some time on the small bridges crossing it and enjoy the view regardless if looking to Eiffel tower or Notre Dame Cathedral. Relaxing and nice views, with cruise ship tours available.PS: pay attention tough to the surrounding people (pickpockets) and do not enter under any circumstances in any street games. They are well organized cheating groups (up to 10) with well limited action roles (tourist, teen, father, grandma) playing all together to get the feeling on easy money earning possibility. Avoid them!
Peaceful. Went on a cruise and dinner tour. Totally beautiful to see all the historic sights in one go. I'd highly recommend.

Dinner Cruise. Went on a river dinner cruise. Unfortunately it rained that evening. Otherwise the cruise was very nice. Fortunately we had already toured and visited a number of the attractions and landmarks that are visible from the boat. I would recommend a day and and evening tour.
Romantic. Took a romantic cruise and the Eiffel tower sparkled took our breath away. Will leave special memories in our hearts forever. A must to do when in Paris

Awesome night Seine cruise. Have to do the night cruise where the buildings are lit up and spectacular Eiffel Tower. You will see the highlights of Paris. Night tour is different from day tour because most buildings are lit up. It only takes one hour

Walking along either side of the Seine was the highlight of our Paris trip. My wife and I probably spent 2 hours every day of our week trip to Paris walking along the Seine, often times going back and forth walking to other tourist attractions. Make sure to walk across each of the 10 or so bridges that cross Isle de La Cite and Isle de St Louis and east and west of the two islands. There is a cute park just under the Pont Neuf that is worth spending an hour sitting on the benches. You can walk along the main roadways on either side of the Seine or you can walk down to the "lower level" along the Seine at various points onto just pedestrian walkways. It is so wonderful to stroll along and watch the people. It is also worthwhile taking at least one of the tourist boat trips on the Seine just to get an overview of the City early on in your trip. Our favorite spot on the Seine was when we walked down some stairs at a small park at the far eastern end of Isle De St. Louis and sat on a bench all by ourselves, watching the water and the boats going by. What an amazing scene.

An Alternative Means of Transportation. A fun way to get around Paris. The boats are reasonably priced and make many stops. However, the stairs leading to the river smell like urinals and there are rats at night.

Cruise.. Went on one of the cruises along the Seine, it was an hour long and we had phones for translation. The staff very helpful as I have to use a walking stick they gave me assistance getting on and off.

River Seine Cruise. I would suggest taking both a day time trip and and evening one as both have highlights that the scenery offers by day and the Paris lights in the evening with the bridges illuminated and the twinkling lights of the Eiffel tower.

Take the river boat cruise.. We got a 2-day pass for the river boats that would drop you off at the tourist attractions (Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, etc.). A great way to waste a few hours by travelling up and down the Seine.

Relaxing boat ride after busy day.. After walking all day I needed a rest and this was a great way to continue seeing the sights. My tour went under all the bridges and had an audio commentary available. Lasted about an hour.
Watching the Seine!. Very beautiful with trees hanging over on the embankments, kiosks along the bridge for shopping, watching sightseeing ferries cruising by.
RIver. It goes through the heart of Paris. Have done many walks by it. Major tourist attraction for anyone there.
Relaxing. I regularly walk or exercise along the river. It is well set up for either with plenty of entertainment and dining options

Its ok, not clean. I know people love Seine river and find love in the air, but i found it ok and smell most of the time. The river is not clean, the boat trip was nice, but you can get a much better scenic boat rides in other parts of the world at much cheaper price.It was ok but nothing great.

Walking or Boating. The Seine provides you with an amazing appreciation of Patis. A boat ride will help you get points of interest firmly in perspective.
A walk on either the left or right bank brings the history and elegance of this beautiful city to life. River life is enjoyed by those lucky enough to live on one of the numerous houseboats

Just lovely. It's always been a dream of mine to sail down the Seine. Not only did I take a sunset cruise down the Seine, I also walked along it. Take some time and just walk along the banks. At night, there is a bar/restaurant that is awesome! People were having a great time and it was very laid back and low key--not uptight and pretentious at all.

The Glow of Paris, The Bridges of Paris at Night. 35 bridges cross the Seine, the best way to see them before going is to get the book titled, The Glow of Paris, The Bridges of Paris at Night, available at Amazon. *5 beautiful black & White Photos of the bridges at night with the mesmerizing history of each of the included, available at Amazon

City of Lights. You must go and go at night so you can partake of the beauty of the City of Lights. You get to view Paris and some of its attraction at night when they are all lite up beautiful!! Also romantic if you are with your Boo.
Beautiful. From the Eiffel Tower to the Notre Dame cathedral, the views from the Seine are probably the most beautiful city views in the world, definitely worth a trip on one of the bateaux mouches.

Can do trip . Do the trip if you want to spend an hour in the evening doing nothing and getting a good view of everything. A romantic dinner with the cruise will be a money well spent. Do a open his tour otherwiae if you want to see the city fully.
Dinner Cruise along the Seine.. Stunning dinner river cruise along the Seine. We enjoyed seeing Paris by the water. Eiffel Tower was awesome to see.

Good and Bad. Good Lord, get some personal pride! This river as well as the surrounding areas is full of bottles, corks, wrappers, bread, you name it. Filthy and disgusting and disappointing. Could be the most romantic place on Earth.

River Stroll: great place to view artists, and stop for coffee and pastries. The river seine is the life blood of Paris. It's a wonderful River to walk along in your way to a major attraction or just to enjoy an afternoon stroll.This last trip we watched some young people practise tossing lighted battons done by the river near the Latin quarter. In the evening you can watch the dinner cruise boats motor along the Seine and during the day people walking their dogs or picnicking.
Beautiful. Walking along the river bank is very romantic and there is so much to see, places to eat and bars along the bank (as well as in the water).
Cruising the Seine. We took a week long river boat cruise not the Seine. Big cities, small villages and beautiful countryside. Swans every where you turn. A wonderful way to spend a week.

Valentines in Paris . The river cruise is a must do in Paris.
1. Purchase a bottle to wine at the location liquor store to take with you. Ask for the wine of the week
Great price and great quality.
Sail as you toast the city.

Boat cruise. Had dinner on boat was fantastic for money. Gorgeous food served up. Seen riffle tower lit up at night and other attractions from the boat. Louve museum. On boat for good 2 hours. Take camera do have to take pictures whilst eating other wise you'll miss them
Sights from the Seine. A visit to Paris without a boat trip is unforgiveable. If you have time have lunch but better still dinner and a night cruise. Views give a different perspective day or night.

Love in the air. Really like that one.
U can just relax and eat some picnic on the seine with ur love like u in a movie.
Lot of dates and love on thia river.
Go also on a boat - there are lot of companies close to aiffel tower - 10-50 euro for 1 hour trip.
Love it
Walk along the river. Cross bridges back and forth over the Seine. And don't forget to walk down the steps so the water line so you can walk on the cobblestone right alongside the river.

Kick back and chill :). We were not able to go on a river cruise as every time we decide to go, the queues to get the tickets are always way too long.So instead we've decided to go for a stroll along the bridges, then sit and relax while admiring the beautiful sites and watching the world go by.It's worth it to do either or even better if you can do both at least twice, during the day and in the evening.
Historic river at night. Beautiful at night, indeed the city of lights. Boat cruise would be the best way to see it. Souvenir stands on both sides of the river
Boat trip. Get a river trip Well worth it,get an idea of geography of the city, sit downstairs if you want the commentary but then you don't get the views

Take a Ferry ride. Take the ferry from Notre Dame for a great relaxing ride along the Seine. You can see a lot of Paris and it is very inexpensive. The front of the boat is best. I especially liked the "first" Statue of Liberty. Nice and cooling in August.
Worth doing !. Well worth taking a river trip , boats pick up adjacent to the Eiffel Tower and last for about an hour.

Pretty way to enjoy Paris. I prefer it at dust when the street hawkers close shop and you can enjoy the beautiful bridges lit up by the sun setting. It is much quieter than during the day. Strolling along it is a lovely way to enjoy Paris.

La Seine short cruise. Pleasant tour up la seine - the boats are long and it's a wonder how they turn in a narrow river.
Informative audio and a good way to view the city.
Beware of diesel fumes on a balmy day.

Serene. The river which lies in between all the tourist attractions of Paris. A must-see when you are there. The first thing to take is the River Seine cruise. Its like browsing through the catalog of tourist attractions in Paris. Best photo ops with the decors on the bridge and so on. Once you are back on land, you can start your walking tours on either side of Seine

Best in both day and night. You should buy the boat ticket to go around the Seine river. The dock is near the eiffel tower if I'm not mistaken. Its not as pricey either if you think about it. The other land tours with the buses you can just use a car or taxi to pass them by briefly, but using the boat you could see the different parts of Paris.They explain it in English, Chinese, Japanese. The history behind most buildings are detailedly explained and its very fascinating. The sceneries are great both in day and night time.Its up to you which you prefer. The buildings are clear either way.I advise u to do it as it allows u to see a different and clearer picture of Paris. Its also very relaxing! Theres a little bar inside!

Boat Ride. Each time I do this I enjoy it just as if it were the first time I was seeing the sights of Paris! It is definitely a Paris highlight. I recommend taking the ride during the day and then experiencing it at night too, to gain a different perspective.

Love love love. I am not sure anything makes me happier than walking along the Seine. Walking from Eiffel Tower area to Note Dame is not that taxing and there's so much to see. At the riverfront, there are various points of interest and at street level you have the bouqonistas (sp?) and their wares to inspect. I usually walk along the Left Bank, so I am not sure what's on the Right Bank!

A river cruise is a cheap and very pleasant way to tour the center of Paris. The inexpensive river cruise we took left from Pont Neuf (by Notre-Dame) and went past the Eiffel Tower then back all the way around the Isle de Cité. About 45 minutes underway. If you can be one of the first on board, by all means head for the prow of the boat so you have a completely unencumbered view of the sights. Otherwise, the middle area of the boat seems about the best with a seat on the outside next to the water giving overall the best view when seated amidships. There are many different cruises available at many different prices. Some stop at several places along the way and visitors can hop off to visit a sight then hop on a later boat to move on to the next stop. Others include a full high quality dinner. Night cruises can be very pleasant and do give a different view of Paris than the day cruises. It is nice for the newcomer wanting to get an overview of the sights along the Seine or for the old-timer who just wants to relax in a pleasant environment while refreshing old memories.
Wait till its dark... It's a river.......At night its a great place to view paris in all its illuminated glory. Walk along the banks and over the beautiful bridges or take a river cruise.

Beautiful paris ...through River Seine. Beautiful river ride .....i have visited multiple times once during the day you can see beautiful pairs and in the night when its all lit up .... its upto you when you want to see Paris ...i prefer both actually

Stroll among Paris' 37 bridges. The Seine is perfect for taking photographs in the glorious city of Paris. We enjoyed a bistro cruise, Strolls along the banks, and views from the bridges. If you happen to be nearby, go to the pont St. Michel at 10:00 pm and you will see the Eiffel Tower sparkling lights. It is an alternative if you are not close to the Tower.

Just about ok. Well the river seine is just about ok to look, over the years the color of the water is going really bad hence its no swiss river for sure!!But still !! If you are in Paris a boat ride on the river is a must, its a very nice way to discover the city and its beautiful architecture. One can either take the whole package of the river cruise with lunch or dinner ect or you can take a simple boat tour ticket for 13.50€. There are many companies to choose from and most of the time the tickets can be bought online too.You can take the bateau mouche from Pont Alma, if you are planning to sit on the open roof carry a light pull with you as it can get windy. Try and time it a few minutes before sunset so you can get both the before and after sunset views of the city, and you can see the city slowly light up. Its really nice when you get around the statue of liberty and then it's a feast for the eyes when you end your tour near the Eiffel Tower all lighted up !In any case if you dont have the time or the wish to do the boat tour one of the more popular way the locals do it is to grab your lunch to go and sit on the steps of the river seine and enjoy your lunch while watching the boats pass by and see the people waying at you!

Must have a cruise on Seine. Enjoying a cruise or boat tour on Seine is one of the things you'll enjoy most on a Paris tour as this river flows through this beautiful city, it has different scenes to offer and different attractions of Paris on its banks as well. And you can choose from an average cost boat to a lavish dinner cruise.

Great value. For €16pp the hop on hop off river cruise is one of the truly good value things to do in Paris. Apart from the scenic views of beautiful Paris, the cruise offers an ideal way to get to main attractions especially if walking long distances is difficult or not preferred.On a sunny day there can be few more enjoyable ways to enjoy this most beautiful city.

It's as magnificent as I always imagined. I really wanted to stroll along the Seine and I did front different vantage points every day I was in Paris. There are different views as you walk different parts of it. Bridges to cross over. Little market vendors selling their wares to tourists. Places to sit and relect.

A BIRTHDAY TO REMEMBER. Only spent a day touring Paris, wish we had more time to see more of this amazing city. We criss crossed the River Seine on the hop on hop off bus which was a fantastic way to see Paris in a short time.
boot tour. be sure to take the right boot tour ,were you can sit on the roof ,must take the evening boot when passing near the eifel !

Fun River Cruise. This dinner cruise was part of our all day tour package that included Versailles. My wife and I enjoyed the cruise, seeing parts of the city that provided a different perspective from the River.One thing to be careful of is when the servers offer Champagne - it's extra and not included so beware that you'll be paying an extra 30 euros for so so Champagne. Food was ok, nothing spectacular. But it was getting to see different parts of the city that was worth it. Still fun nevertheless.
Take a River Cruise. The Seine is a beautiful and very scenic river, with old towns built on the river. Very busy in Paris with dinner cruises and sightseeing boats.

Different angles!. You have to do the views from the River Seine and pass underneath all the bridges from Paris they are all different and you get to see the monuments from a different angle, worth the trip

River Cruise. We cruised to Normandy on one of Avalon's new ships, Tapestry II. Food was excellent, ship is clean and beautiful, crew was cheerful and friendly and rooms are nicely sized for a river ship. Highly recommended.

Beautiful way to see so much of paris. If you're not in Paris for long and want to see a little bit of everything then this is definitely the best way. We went on a river cruise on a tour boat and you got to learn so much about the city and its history. It was the highlight of my trip to Paris.
Grand old lady waterway. She's fairly clean now, still moody, but bedecked with gaily adorned house boats, well kept stairways to bridges, and hardly any graft to, look for locks on certain bridges

River Cruise. The Seine certainly defines Paris, and it's a nice way to see the sights from a different perspective. I have to say, though, that I was somewhat disappointed with the river cruise. It was way too crowded, and it seems that whenever the boat passed under a bridge everyone onboard felt the need to whistle. Cute the first time. A little irritating after a while.

Beautiful winding,clean river with great attractions. Just a beautiful feature of Paris,so much to do and see for many miles on both banks.The charm is still there if not a little too commercialised in some places now.

Very Romantic Cruise. My husband and I selected the lunch cruise (Premier ticket). The view of the river as we cruised down the Seine was truly amazing. The cuisine was delicious, very tasty, and beautifully prepared. Each dish we were served looked like a photo from a gourmet food magazine. A beautiful and wonderful experience. We will definitely be doing the cruise again when we visit Paris next year. We plan to also do the dinner cruise. Highly recommended!
Evening Cruise. It is good but if you a planning to do a cruise do it on an evening. Its a nice way to get an overview of the city.
exceptional. A must for all tourists visiting Paris. The evening cruise along the river is highly recommended. Absolutely stunning.

Beautiful Seine and its surrounds. We had a ticket problem as it did not print out on the computer but we took all our details to the staff of Vedette Cruises and they went out of their way to sort out our tickets so we could take the cruise. It was well worth the wait for the tickets to be resolved as the day was beautifully sunny and warm. The water sparkled and the commentary explained which historic building we were looking at. We preferred to be on the deck not sit on the seats in the main tourist area so feel we saw more than those in that area. We decided we would return for an evening cruise as the Seine and surrounds would look magic at night but the weather interfered and we were unable to go. We have however promised ourselves a cruise in the evening next time we are in Paris.
Stroll .... Seriously. Wake up early with your favorite person and enjoy a quiet stroll before the throngs of tourists wake. Grab a coffee and indulge in a sinfully delicious carb just be.

Relaxing. I think this is the most convenient way to see the city of Paris. We were able to take pictures comfortably. I also liked the option of been able to sit on the deck of the boat and audio guide was clear.

Night River Cruise. Highly recommend one of the evening river cruises that are available all along the river at 20+ boats. Most of which offer dinner, that is nothing to write home about, but if you time the trip right you will catch the Eiffel Tower sparkle for a few minutes on the hour (we saw it at 11PM). Expect to pay ~100 Euro/pp.

Nice to view the city along the River from a River cruise. Take a boat tour on the Seine. you get to see the sites from the River, what a relaxing way to see some of the sights along the river and get information from the tour about the various buildings.
Seine cruise. Dinner cruise down the Seine is pleasant and most views are nice to see. A slight bit smelly but worth a visit.

Very Enjoyable and Informative. We took a guided champagne cruise on the river at sunset (followed by a tour up the Eiffel Tower at night), and enjoyed learning of the history of all the different buildings.
River Seine. A most romantic scene. Goes through the city. Lovely to walk around down by the water, saw several picnicking. Took a riverboat cruise at night. Very informative.

Beautiful. I recommend renting a bike. They have many little stations very you can rent them for less then 2 Euro. And drop off all around the city.My husband and I had a great little bike tour from Champs-Élysées, to the Eiffel tower and then alone River Seine to see Notre Dame. Loved it

Beautiful. We did a cruise on the river Seine as part of our city tour with Panoramic bus tours. It was a beautiful day for it and it was lovely to cruise under the bridges and see all the Parisians enjoying themselves along the bank of the river.
River Boat Tour Was Sensational. Amazing experience that is a must do. We did river boat tour during afternoon with a tour guide. Can't leave Paris without doing it.

Honeymoon. The river is lovely, we got a 2 day pass for the bateaux bus (river taxi) which was great value as you could hop on and off as much as you liked, most of your main touristy bits are a short walk from a bateaux bus stop

ROMANTIC. What can I say....the Seine River is simply the heart of Paris...we very much enjoyed walking along the banks, looking at all the little booths with souveniers, etc. Boat cruises are also available, though we opted not to take one. Simply sitting by the river bank and relaxing with a picnic basket was oh-sooo-nice!!

great way to see paris. We paid for the Bus tour and Boat tour on a combined ticket, A bit expensive but how many times will you be in Paris!.The bus tour was great as you can get off at places you wish to visit then hop on to the next.The boat cruise was very relaxing and a great way to unwind, The information about places on the river was very informative.Well worth a visit.

A brief French history lesson with a view.. We decided on an hour trip on Bateau Mouches - just a short walk 2 bridges down from the Trocadero/Eiffel Tower. It goes up and down the river a half hour each way and was accompanied by a succinct automated commentary in about 4 languages. Unfortunately this meant the description/ history of each individual museum etc. was quite brief.Tips - There were plenty of photo opportunities but a Selphie stick is essential to try and compensate for the low level of the boat on the river. Take the 10.15am cruise to avoid the midday crowds - the best pics of sites are better done on land.Also, consider whether you might prefer to lash out on an evening trip with dinner included with all the sights lit up - the Eiffel is very impressive - (always take an inside table to keep warm).

Paris floats by you. The painters painted it and the writers wrote about it. There is a sense of moving beauty when it comes to the Seine. Take a river boat tour and see Paris from a different vantage point and and night to see "the city of lights" come alive.

A River Cruise to be remembered.. We took an evening cruise from the Eiffel Tower down the Seine on our final evening in Paris.What a wonderful finish.Sat on the top deck of the boat so couldn't hear the commentary but this was not a big issue.To take in the sights from the river was memorable but the true memories was of the Parisian people all along the bank enjoying the sun mostly with a bottle of wine.Young ones enjoying each others company and the various areas where dancing took place.The cruise took us past the Louve and with a view of Notre Damme before turning around and returning to the start.Cruise was part of the Paris Pass and I would recommend purchasing this pass as it has great value.For a different perspective of Paris take the cruise down the river its about an hour and well worth it.
Spectacular. Took a dinner cruise on the Seine. The views were fantastic. Great way to see Paris from a different angle. Very relaxing.

Offers many things. Walked at various points and sides during our stay and it offers peace and tranquility in this very vibrant city. Yes, we didi succumb to a river trip, just to save our aching feet, and it was very pleasurable and informative.
River Cruise is a Must. Great way to see the city! Tours are priced just right. We did the hop-on-hop-off one and it was perfect!

Choose Your Seat Carefully. Nice trip, but spoiled slightly by thoughtless people who stood right in front of where we were sitting at the front of the boat. We moved and found a better spot to the side, where there was no room for anyone to stand in the way!

Good walk. We stayed at the 3rd Arrs. in Paris which was a 15 minute walk form the river.As we took the bridge to cross banks there was the love lock bridge.As we walked on lovers had locked their love from one end to the other of the bridge a visual delight for travelers.As we got off the bridge the locales were enjoying street gambling & river side cafes were filled with tourists enjoying a bright sunny evening

Beauty..... Paris is a wonderful city with a lot of culture and something for everyone, but for me the Seine makes Paris truly truly special and really gives 'The City Of Light' that picturesque look! Could you imagine Paris without the Seine, no i couldn't either.
Walk and Enjoy.. Stroll along the river on both the upper and lower levels. Enjoy browsing among the many bookseller stalls. Not sure there are many bargains, but fun to look and walk.
Night cruise. Took night cruise close to dusk. Lots of tour buses brought in lots of people. Suggest to take side water level view under plastic roof if there is a threat of rain. Small cafe on site.

Fantastic views along the Seine.. Paris is a great City to take a stroll along the Seine and just explore the sites. There is so much to see and do if you follow the river and cross the bridges, each with their own unique story to tell. If you fancy speeding up your adventure just jump on a bus or the Metro. We bought a carnet of tickets for €14 giving us 10 single journeys that lasted us from our arrival at Gard du Nord to our return 2 days later.

A cruise with history. The visit of Paris is not complete until you take a ride in the "bateau mouche". From there you can enjoy a different view from Paris while you get to know some histroic facts from the city. Saddly it starts to rain in the middle of the traject, but it worth it anyway. You can choose between two rides, one shorter and one a little longer. I take the short one, but I'm sure that I will return for the longer one someday.
Beautiful river with not so beautiful smells!. Simply stunning views of the river all through Paris, but the urine smell wafting up from stairlwells overlooking the river was gross

Hidden on the Seine is the Statue of Liberty. ITs wonderful to walk along the Seine or to take a tour boat around it to see the hear t of the city and the city sites. Look out for The Statue of Liberty which is on the river.

Paris trip 2015. If you are traveling for a day, be sure and get a day pass for the "BATOBUS"! You can get on and off at any point and experience Paris while enjoying a nice summer breeze on the boat. Beautiful River Seine!

Beautiful . Had a VIP Champagne Cruise on the River Seine as part of a combined tour to the Eiffel Tower!The Seine is absolutely beautiful and the tour was very informative, we got to see many French landmarks and see the Eiffel Tower from the River!It's only a shame the weather wasn't on our side, it was very cold but still worth it!Would recommend!

More than a river. More than a river. Even if not fundamental (as for example the Danube river for Budapest) this river is one of the main elements of this amazing city. Enjoy it in all the possible ways.

See a different angle of Paris. Take a river cruise to see a different angle of beautiful city of Paris, perfect time to tour this river is while the sun is setting, see the surrounding buildings slowly turning their lights on while having a glass of champagne, its so romantic

Relaxing Cruise to Enjoy the Scenery. My husband and I pre booked a trip on the River Seine cruise and we were very lucky to have the most glorious weather to enjoy the many amazing sites of Paris.The on deck tour guide was very funny with his commentary and he made the trip interesting and informative in a non-boring way!The cruise lasts approximately 1 hour and does a loop of the river whereby you get to see all of the fabulous bridges and surrounding famous buildings.I would absolutely recommend this, it is very good value for money and if you are lucky to have fantastic weather then you get some brilliant photos.

Well worth a visit. when in Paris it's a must to sail down the seine , you get to see so many of the sights and bridges at a very relaxed pace Its also nice to walk along you come across many things and the atmosphere was very relaxed a nice way to see the sights and spend an afternoon

Great walk through the heart of the city . You could say that the water in the river is dirty (as is the case in a river through any major city). However, the real charm of the river is the beauty around it and it's central location in the heart of the city. If you have nice walking shoes and it's clear day, it's a great days walk to start at notre dame and walk along the banks to the Eiffel Tower. You will pass through many great sites on both sides of the river and get to see lots of the Parisienne's selling books and souvenirs through the charming green cabinets on both banks of the river. Also there are plenty of bridges along the way so you can cross at various points. You'll pass by the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, place Concorde and end up at Eiffel. Lots of restaurants and shops on the way so it's a great way to see the city sites on a leisurely walk. Also, the river banks are not crowded and busy like the other tourist sites in Paris.

Great way to enjoy some of the highlights and save your feet. Wonderful river cruise seeing the sights from a different angle, we were lucky and had lovely weather, we even saw some nudist sunbathers at one point! Oh la la!

Paris city tour on the Sienne. As a part of a pre booked package including a coach tour, the Eiffel tower and a river cruise this was excellent value for money booked through attractionx on line. The cruise was very relaxing but unfornutenly for everyone on the cruise who spoke English, the onboard guide in English did not work and nothing was done to rectify this or no apology recieved. My advice, check before you get on if you would like to learn or doscover anything on your cruise.
The beauty of Paris. There are several boats that cruise the Seine with speaking tours. I highly recommend it to see Paris from a different point of view and experience this beautiful river.

...what is so great about it?. I don't know if we were just on the wrong spot but we walked for quite a while and there was no green, there were no restaurants and nothing special about this river at all. Instead cars and streets right by the river. A big disappointment. Next day we tried a one hour cruise which was good but I still didn't get the "magic" about this river... where was the romantic feel everyone talks about...? everything seemed so grey and dirty. As a pedestrian not so beautiful... I'm sure though if you take a cruise at night time it can be a lot more beautiful.

Take an evening tour to enjoy the famous sites from the water!. We took a tour that included an evening boat tour of the famous sites from the water. The boat was clean and warm (it was a cool evening.) We liked that our boat had a clear top so we could fully view the landmarks through the ceiling. No food or drink was for sale on our boat, but other boats offer a full bar. The bathrooms were very clean! The tour guide spoke over the intercom in English and shared interesting details of the landmarks, history of Paris, and the local culture. Enjoy!

Batobus - an alternative to enjoy the Seine River and reach major Paris attractions. If you don't have time for a river cruise dinner option, try the Batobus, where you can buy a single day or multiple days' pass and can "hop on-hop off" at approximately 9 stations. It is a convenient and enjoyable way to ride on the Seine and to get to the attractions not far from the river.

A trip on the Seine is a must do Paris experience!. We used the Batobus both as a water taxi as well as a way to see the whole Seine. It really gives you such a wonderful perspective and view of the city and some of its main attractions!

River Seine. Lots to see along the River Seine with some iconic landmarks visible in the distance. There's also lots of mini markets to purchase momentums of Paris and occasionally you able to see artist doing portraits and cartoon drawings of people on demand. The view of the Seine is also breath taking and relaxing, just sitting around or walking.

Anniversary celebrations . Very worth a walk down in either direction or either side beautiful scenery and good people watching. Lots of cafes and bars on the side or in the boats so worth a romantic walk down

Wouldn't Miss it for the World. Most beautifully designed, as it travels through the boroughs. Strongly recommend a ride to capture the event in the late afternoon and early evening to see the best the river has to offer.

An Icon in Paris. We was on a dinner boat trip on river Seine, which was quite nice, the city flows around the river, Also you get a great view of the river from different points in the city, from bridges etc.
