They also provide little radio receivers (about the size of a cell phone) with earpieces so you can hear the tour guide speaking even if you're 100 feet away; that worked out great since the museums are loud and packed solid with people and we didn't have to stand next to the guide in order to hear her/him.Day 1 - Le Pecq & St. Germain: You can tour the town of St. Germain with a guide in the afternoon to see churches and a former palace, and you can buy wine or other essentials at the Monoprix store in Le Pecq, just a few steps from Rinda's pier. There is a pretty good view of Paris in the distance across the Seine from the Palace in St. Germain. We found an ice cream shop just across the street from the Palace where we sat and enjoyed a break from the walking as we watched the locals for a while. If you arrive from the airport early enough, you can take a Viking bus to Paris, and skip St. Germain, but we arrived at 3 p.m. after the last bus to Paris had already left. St. Germain was interesting since it was our first stop in France; plus we were sleep-deprived from the flight so I'm not sure we could have survived an intense afternoon in Paris. Bottom line: St. Germain was an "OK" stop on the itinerary, but not very special when compared to Paris, Rouen, Versailles and Normandy.Day 2 - Notre Dame & Paris: We took the Viking tour of the Notre Dame Cathedral in the morning, but our group had to stand in line for about an hour waiting to get in; no timed tickets there. Then we spent the rest of the day exploring Paris on our own: walking to the Latin Quarter, walking past the Louvre, walking through the shopping districts and walking around a lot of monuments. We had lunch in a small cafe in the Latin Quarter - Pizza and wine no less. Then we walked up the Champs-Elysses to the Petite Palace to catch the bus back to the ship at 5 p.m. So, except for lunch, we walked the entire day. Bring comfortable shoes. The Eiffel tower was plainly visible off in the distance, but it was too late in the day to visit it, and we were booked on the night tour of Paris on the last day when you get to visit the tower when it is all lit up. Bottom line: The first day in Paris was "good." If you can't read a map, and/or you can't walk long distances, you should plan on bringing money for a taxi or a bicycle rickshaw so that you can get around Paris and make it to the return bus on time.Day 3 - Vernon, Giverny & Monet: If you're into art, this is like dying and going to heaven. We took the Viking tour (including express tickets to enter the property and a guide to provide the walking tour) to visit the vast gardens and ponds (complete with lily pads) that Monet used for inspiration when he painted. It was kind of like actually walking through some of his paintings. Then we took a tour of Monet's house (after waiting in line for 40 minutes) including his personal art collection. The gift shop there has a wide variety of unique items, all geared toward Monet of course. There are a few museums and cafes there in the small town of Giverny, but we didn't have time to visit any of them. Day 4 - Rouen - Joanie on the Pony: Rouen was where Joan of Arc was burned at the stake, not exactly Disneyworld, but if you appreciate the religious and historical perspective, you'll probably enjoy the trip. The town is fascinating because a lot of the original medieval structures are still standing and the narrow cobblestone streets wind through the city - it's "Old France". Rouen offered endless shops, cafes, and fast food opportunities (think: chocolate-filled crepes, ice cream, chocolate/ candy and McDonalds) along with small art galleries and clothing stores. There's a modern church in the square where Joan met her maker; it's just across from the restaurant where Julia Child became interested in French cooking. Rouen was one of the better venues on the itinerary.Day 5 - Normandy Beaches: The first thing we found out on this tour was that the landing beaches at Normandy cover over 50 miles; that's more than the distance from Atlantic City to Cape May, NJ. It was a 2-hour bus ride from the Seine to the coast. Along the way, our guide provided a large amount of background information along with personal stories about her grandparents' dealings with the occupying Germans during the war. The trip focused on the American cemetery and the beaches where the "Mulberry" artificial harbors were used to offload men and supplies after the initial invasion. Unfortunately, we simply drove slowly past many other beaches that contained dozens of relics and several museums on our way to Arromanches where we saw dozens of the concrete breakwaters still sitting on the flats at low tide more than 1/4 mile out from the shoreline. We lost about 20 minutes after arriving due to the long lines at the restrooms. The museum there was packed with people and we had time to watch a 30-minute film that documented the preparations and landings, but we didn't have much time to walk through the extensive museum because the Viking tour focused on feeding everyone lunch at a local restaurant - an hour and a half of valuable time that we would have skipped if we had known how long lunch was going to take. (A crepe or an ice cream on the street would have been sufficient; you might want to consider skipping the sit-down lunch if you go.) It's a shame that we spent more time in the restaurant than we did in the museum or on the beach. After the stop at the Arromanches beach, we headed for the American Cemetery where we walked through the sea of marble crosses and Stars of David that marked the graves of more than 9,800 servicemen and women. We witnessed a memorial service there which was quite moving. The visitor's center/museum was excellent; we spent about an hour there. Then we headed to Omaha Beach at Saint Laurent Sur Mer to see a memorial and the beach where the Americans landed.Day 7 - Les Andeles: They could have skipped Les Andeles all together. When we arrived, a carnival had taken over the docking area so the reality of the surroundings didn't look at all like the Viking Cruise commercials that we saw on TV. There's a partially-destroyed castle on the top of a high hill near the town, and it's a long uphill (steep) climb to get there - maybe a half mile or more. The cruise director previously warned us that the castle tour was not for everyone. We had to stop several times along the way to let everyone catch their breath and wait for stragglers. The view of the Seine and surrounding areas from the castle was beautiful (see photo below). The Cruise Director acted as our guide and he provided an incredible amount of information about Richard the Lionheart and the history of the castle. There was a quaint restaurant at the bottom of the hill and the nearby town provided yet another gothic church, one or two cafes, and a shop or two, but spending an entire day there walking the cobblestones felt like a waste of time since we had already been to Giverny and Le Pecq. We actually resorted to playing miniature golf on Rinda's sun deck for a lack of things to do that afternoon. Les Andeles was one of the most disappointing venues on the itinerary.Day 8 - Louvre: We paid 69 Euros each for the Viking-provided Louvre tour. We arrived with our tour guide at a few minutes before 9 a.m. just before the doors opened. We were the second group in line at the "Group" entrance so we got in very quickly. The Louvre is enormous and 10 million tourists visit it each year. Our guide walked us through several sections over 2 hours which included the "must see" Venus de Milo, the Mona Lisa, and the winged goddess of Victory statue. You can take pictures as long as you don't use flash. By the time we got to the Mona Lisa, the room was crammed with several hundred visitors, each of whom were determined to get a "selfie" with the smiling lady. As you can imagine, the pushing and shoving got pretty intense (we were warned about this prior to the tour) not unlike trying to get into the Sistine Chapel on Easter Sunday or trying to get near the Trevi fountain at noon in Rome. They also warned us to be careful to protect ourselves against pickpockets. We had some free time after the tour ended (hello gift shop), and we decided to skip the bus trip back to the boat for lunch and head out on our own to explore Paris. We had "brunch" at a great little cafe just a few blocks north of the Louvre; it was called Le Pain Quotidien Saint-Honore (address: 18 place du Marche, they also have a web page!). Our selections included: wine, salad, a baguette, and Quiche Lorraine - all for 37 Euros (for two). Very picturesque, very relaxing, great food, good portions, and they had a one-at-a-time unisex restroom! They even had an English menu and the waiters spoke enough English to take our order. After wandering through Paris for another hour or so after brunch, we were able to get the Viking bus at 2 p.m. that took us from the Petite Palace to Versailles for the afternoon Versailles Palace tour. Day 8 - Versailles: We paid 79 Euros each for the Viking-provided Versailles tour. We arrived on the Viking bus around 2:45 p.m. The Palace at Versailles was huge, and the crowds were even bigger. They told us that the gardens covered 750 acres - that's big. This place was the king's hunting lodge! The reflecting pool was a mile long - that's big. The first thing you notice is gold; gold on the gates, gold on the roof, gold on the statues, and that's before you even get into the building. Once inside past the metal detectors, there is gold on all the walls, gold on all the furniture, golden clocks, golden sculptures, golden lamps, gold on the chandeliers, gold on the ceilings, gold woven into the fabrics, and the place is littered with priceless paintings and other sculptures. No wonder the starving masses staged the French Revolution. We had timed tickets for 3 p.m. and our guide got us in the door a few minutes before 3 so we were just a little ahead of schedule. Once inside, we (again) lost 20 minutes for a potty break. Then we became part of a traveling beehive of humanity that swept us along the halls and rooms like a huge mass of logs heading down a river toward a sawmill. The camera on my battery died after 300+ pictures that day, just before we got into the Hall of Mirrors, so I had to switch to my iPhone for the remainder of the day. Our tour guide described the incredibly staggering opulence enjoyed by the king, queen and several thousand of their closest friends at Versailles while we viewed the endless rooms, chambers, halls, and a chapel that looked like a small version of the Sistine Chapel. After our guided tour ended, it was "hello gift shop", and then we had an hour or so to visit the gardens (they required a separate Viking-provided ticket). The fountains, sculptures and reflecting ponds were endless and literally breathtaking. We noticed two soldiers carrying assault rifles while we were there; the first time for that. In Paris you will see police with pistols, some on rollerblades, some on motorcycles, most in cars, but Versailles was the only place we saw assault rifles. Day 8 - Night Tour & Eiffel Tower: The Viking bus drove us around Paris on our last night to see the Seine, and all the significant monuments, bridges, palaces and shopping districts. Then we stopped at the Eiffel Tower to disembark and watch them put on the 10-minute light show at 10 p.m. (See photo below). It was quite spectacular - definitely worth the trip, especially since we didn't visit the tower on our previous treks across Paris. The grounds around the tower were packed; similar to (but not as large as) people watching fireworks on the 4th of July at the Washington Monument in DC. It was a great way to end our trip before heading back to the ship to pack our suitcases.Bottom line: Day 8 in Paris/Versailles was "very good." We finally got to see the Louvre, Versailles and the Eiffel Tower and we got to sit in a little cafe for a very nice meal and some wine. It was a very long day, but it was worth it. Too bad everything had to be crammed into one day. Day 8 was a Sunday in August, so lots of stores and cafes were closed, but enough were open to meet our needs.12. Viewing the Seine from our Private Balcony: The boat usually travels at 15 to 20 MPH with plenty of quaint villages/towns along the way. Chalk colored cliffs lined the Seine for about 25% of the trip. Occasionally we would see rail yards and industrial areas with graffiti on the walls and bridges. We passed lots of barges and a few powerboats. We enjoyed our private time on the balcony with wine and chocolate; if you don't book a room with the veranda, the sun deck is the best option.13. Language Issues: I confess, all I really know about the French language I learned from Pepe Le Pew cartoons as a child (smile). 95% of the time English was spoken fluently. Everyone on Rinda spoke fluent English. Most people that we met on the tours (waiters, shop keepers, cashiers, and museum staff) spoke English. Of course, the tour guides spoke fluent English. In one chocolate shop in Rouen the staff didn't speak English or they refused to but we still managed to get some samples and purchase "Tears of Joan of Arc" chocolate drops. Please note that although just about everyone speaks English, they typically have thick accents and they may not speak "American English" so you might have to ask for clarifications from time to time. We bought one of those "Learn French Fast" CD courses at Costco for $39.95 a couple of months prior to our trip, but we never got much past "Hello, goodbye, thank you very much, please, where is the toilet," and counting from one to 10; and as it turned out, we really didn't need to speak French although it was fun trying. 14. Money: Bring Euros with you; except for the airport gift shop in Iceland and gratuities on Rinda at the end of the cruise, dollars are not accepted anywhere, although credit cards seemed to work anywhere. 15. Conclusion: Now it's back to work, back to a low carb diet, and I have to download 1,000+ photos and videos from my camera and iPhone and create a DVD Slideshow for posterity. I can't wait to read your assessment of Rinda after you get back from your trip. We are not planning to book another Viking River Cruise.

Nice, relaxed trip.. Take the croisiere from the riverside by the Eiffel Tower - 14 euros for an hour's trip. The best view of the bridges over the Seine with a commentary. Rest your feet for a while!

The beautiful Siene river. River Siene runs through the heart of Paris and makes the city even more beautiful. It has beautiful old bridges and lovely walks on its banks where the artists and the tourists mingle.

Mesmerising. We took a boat tour from Point Neuf it was fabulous from the Siene you can see practically all of the tours spots of Paris and will give you ideas of places to also see apart from the normal top 4. Great weather helps which we were lucky to have (July?Aug in the 30s!) even got a tan! The tour guide explained/spoke both in French, & English. Foumd the Boat tour more Value for your Money only cost 14 Euros and lasted 1 hour. You also get a fantastic all round view of Notre Dame from the river also. You can just turn up and buy your ticket. Tours run from that spot approximately every 20-30 mins.

River Seine. We did two trips son the River Seine. There first one was an hour long tour with no stops. The second one you could hop on and hop off and it stopped at about 9 different places which is a cheap way of seeing all the various places. I personally enjoyed the first cruise where there were no stops. The average cost was about 15 euros but very enjoyable and a lot to see. Very relaxing.

A batobus gives the best river views. The Seine is beautiful as far as rivers go. There is plenty to see and we found te best way to travel is by Batobus. This allows you to travel as much as you want for up to two days and is well worth ticket. It stops at all of the big atttractions, Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Notre Dame etc but also allows you to see the river in all its beauty. Paris Plage is held on the river near to the Louvre stop so you can get off there. Sitting on a man made beach next to the river is a little surreal but fun!
Seine by day/night. Best way by batobus or take a cruise and the Seine in Paris by day is a very different picture at night, no better or worse, just very different
Seine cruises. Bateaux Mouche cruises are popular and leave regularly, especially on nighttime. There are other companies available which ar less crowded and maybe at same price.

Nightime Seine River cruise with City Vision-not to be missed!. We took a nightime cruise on the Seine with City Vision. You will not be disappointed by the food or the scenery. One of the highlights of our trip complete with the light show of the Eiffel tower at the end of the 2 hour trip.

Bateaux Mouche. Best way to see the river is by boat we took the bateaux Mouche, they have open commentary in several languages. Weekends you can take a lunch trip or night dinner trip to see the lights, I light that one which we did over ten years ago! This year it was just a day trip.

Scenic. We took a boat tour and walked both banks of the river. It is a beautiful walk with lots to see. The Seine is Paris and all of Paris was built around it. There are lots of places to sit and rest. The main walking area is below the street level and it is amazing what a little elevation does to separate you from the busy streets above. Many picturesque bridges and views.
lovely. Lovely pristine waters - so clean and blue and the entire shore side on both sides is so well kept and maintained. Walk throughs, eateries, games, etc...Lovely!

Serenity by the Seine. What an enchanting area within a busy city. We found that a respite by the Seine was the perfect antedote for crowed Museums and Tourists. The evening was especially lovely with locals and their picnics lining the banks to enjoy the evening lights. Don't miss this!
Take the Batobus. What a wonderful way to see Paris in the spring.... Get on & off the Batobus to visit most of the sights.... Very convenient .
Picturesque. I love walking along the River Seine. There is always so much to see whether it's famous landmarks or good ol' fashioned people watching.

River Seine - take a cruise. Our experience of the River Seine was via a 1+ hour cruise on the bateaux mouches cruise. The ride along the River Seine was relaxing and had tremendous views for many different sites or Paris...
Beautiful. The best way to cruise this river is at night with one of the boat tours. It takes you right by all the main attractions on the river and if you get a live guide, you learn so much.

Cruise along and soak up the atmosphere. My kids and I cruised along the River Seine and it was an amazing experience listening to french music, such as that of Edith Piaf, admiring the architecture, the locks on the lover's bridge, the lovers eating their baguettes by the riverbank and the gathering of people dancing along the riverbank. It was like a scene from a romantic film. We went on a cruise around 5pm and upon returning to dock, the Eiffel Tower lit up and sparkled in the sunset. Overall a fantastic experience and can't wait to go back and do it all again. Except next time I will stop and join in the dancing on the riverbank. :)

A summer's day on the Seine. We caught the metro to Bir Hakeim and walked the short distance to the Eiffel Tower. Directly across the busy road from the Eiffel Tower are the tourist boats.We got there early just prior to 9.00am and immediately bought tickets for the 1 hour cruise at 12 euros each.The early boat had few people aboard and sitting on the top deck afforded the best photos of iconic places we passed.The many ornate bridges of the Seine can be captured in one shot when the sun is on your back as well as many places to have the Eiffel Tower in the background.Don't forget to have that passionate kiss (french style of course) and make that wish as you pass under the most romantic bridge in Paris...The Marie Pont has 5 arches and niches in the abutments to house statues, however none were ever placed here.What a beautiful way to spend an hour.
weekend in Paris. Liked the idea of seeing places of interest from the comfort of a river boat but the trip is too short and a little difficult to hear or understand the commentry.

Boat ride on the Seine.. I was just there and made sure to take the ride during the day......The next night it was the evening cruise. I did not do a dinner cruise. Our cruise left at dusk and returned to dock in the dark. It's one of those things I think is a must do! I felt they were both reasonably priced. Someone suggested getting out of your seat.....no one stayed seated. You had to be up to see things. On the hour during dark, the Eiffel tower sparkles instead steady lights. That too is a must see.
Memorial trip.. Take a boat cruise down and around this river especially by evening to see by day light and return by night.

The river Seine. The river Seine is a spectacular and much loved asset to Paris. This city lives its life on and around the river. Examples are the man made sandy beach with locals gathering there with a bottle of wine and a picnic basket, enjoying the ambience of those walking or jogging past or sailing or motoring by. Fabulous tourist options are also available day and night. Spectacular in every way!!

Take the night cruise!. This is a beautiful river to stroll alongside but even better to experience it during the evening on one of the boat tours. You will be able to see the Eiffel Tower lit up but also if you time it right, you'll see the tower "sparkle" for the 5 minutes of every hour in the summertime at night.
I wouldn't recommend getting in but ..... .. it offers a different perspective on the beutiful city. And when Paris-Plages is up and running its fantastic. A great experience for all the family.
Relaxing. We had a hop on hop off ticket for boat bus which meant we could come and go as we liked just like the bus. It was well worth it, we used it to go 1 stop one night when we were tired
Messing About with Boats. So wonderful to see such bustling boat life on this river - such a hub. And the Paris Plages are the an excellent idea for those who cannot get out of town.
The Seine - WOW!. One of the most beautiful rivers I have ever seen. The activities along the river are wonderful. People relaxing, people reading, people eating. Great place to be!

AMA WATERWAYS AMALEGRO. Took a trip on the Amalegro of AMA Waterways last of July 2015. This cruise line is well above the standards of Viking. The staff were very friendly and the shore excursions included were all worth attending. Main segment of the trip was a visit to the Normandy Beaches. Information obtained during the trip was great. Now have a better understanding of WWII and those who orchestrated the landings.
Saw the sights. Went on a dinner cruise along the Seine river and saw a lot of the sights right from the boat it was great
Great Value. Great value for money, we went on the boat/bus 16 euros for hop on hop off at every landmark. Very hot but great scenery.

Take the cruise on dusk and see the sun set!. A river cruise shows the Seine to its best advantage. Daylight on the way up and sunset and dark when you arrive back at Eiffel Tower. It just screams PARIS!
Did a quick cruise as part of our Eiffel Tower visit. Lots to see on the banks of the river as well as viewing landmarks from a different perspective. Enjoyable way to spend an hour
Cruise. The 1 hr river cruise is okay. Paris from a different perspective. For a full view and experience, I'd suggest getting out of ypur seat to take pictures
Short ride . The views were great but we could not hear well due to equipment failure. The earphones were fine but the equipment that was suppose to speak in different languages was not.

Relaxing way to see the city!. We took a boat tour on the Seine mainly because our feet were getting tired after walking all over Paris for three days, but were glad we did. Our tour started at the Pont Neuf and went past the Eiffel Tower (good to see it from the River as it looks very different from that angle) and many other sights. Lots of interesting house boats to see, as well as some riverside parks, art and very decorative bridges. Relaxing way to see the city!
So romantic!. Who told that Paris is not romantic? And the Seine is one of the most romantic place in the city!!! Walking by the river make you feel so in love!

A Great Way to See the Seine. We used the Batobus service to see the Seine and many of the sights along the river. It runs from the Eiffel Tower to Norte Dame and is a one flat fee for a full day of hop-on, hop-off service.

Lovely!. The river you can find in a lot of different spots in Paris. Sometimes you can observe if from a bridge, other from the street or a builiding. Anyway, the thing is that this river is the most beautiful in Europe in my opinion. Its water seems to be so clear and bright. Love it!

Cruise is the nice way to see the Seine. We took the 1-hr cruise that departed from the pontoon close to Eiffel Tower. It was a nice way to see many famous landmarks that are located next to the Seine. The best part for me is that you could see how Parisiens enjoyed their life - we saw people having a good time, either just having a picnic next to the Seine enjoying their wine or hanging out enjoying the weather. Make sure you get on the top deck to get the best view. It is touristy but a must do for the first time visitors.
Paris by river. Batobus us a good option. Except that it goes only in one direction. Round trip. Stops at Louvre, eiffel, notre Dame, almost all of the attractions.

Great views and nice ride. We took a night time dinner cruise on the River Seine. Very beautiful and leisurely. Many different cruises to choose from but a must see, especially at night since you can get some great pictures
ROMANTIC!!!. ROMANTIC!!! Go with your new love. Expensive, but you'll never forget a Seine trip by night, enjoying the lights of Paris. Guys, perfect place to propose - just sayin'...

A river cruise is a must!. Taking a sunset cruise on the River Seine was the highlight of my trip to Paris. So many locals and visitors enjoying the summer afternoon and early evening with lovers and friends. So many sights along the way.
Rest your feet!. Taking the water bus down the Seine was a welcome break from walking.A relaxing and enjoyable way to enjoy the sites of Paris.
Not to be missed. Great views, have your cameras on stand by. A must do when in Paris. Buy tickets online to avoid disappointments.
Lovely way to experience the beauty of Paris. Lots of little open air bars and art installations, very pretty- go at night and enjoy the city of lights at its best!
Great River. Beautiful views of the river from the bridges and up and down the two sides of the river. There were many sights to see on both sides.

Nice and romantic. Very nice for long walks along the river, just start from near to Notre Dome, and go to Eiffel Tower,
If you go in the evening, I'm sure you will not regret
Its much better than it was. When I lived in Paris, the Seine was disgusting, smelly and dirty, but that was 20 years ago. Now it is beautiful and an asset to Paris!

Good Cruise along the Seine. I went along the seine in a Batobus. It was great! The water was green-blue colour. The boat went under lots of bridges like Pont-Neuf.
Callum Groom
Age:6
Enjoy Paris from the Seine.. The Seine is a wonderful river winding through Paris with much to see when walking along its banks. We took an evening dinner cruise which is highly recommended.

Best picture of yourself with Eiffel Tower in background. do it at night - watch the tower light up and then get on the boat - we were disappointed that there was no commentary up top - but views were great - weather cooperative - lots to see and the best part is coming back into dock you pass the Eiffel and then turn and dock - so great photo op for Eiffel in the background - It's free with your Paris Pass (which is worth it for all the entrances and skip the lines) - it also include the Big Bus TourGreat tour ~

definite must do. definite must! We walked along in the summer. Artists everywhere and gorgeous river and gorgeous spot. Definitely lives up to the things people say. Beware of pickpockets and the Gypsies.

Fireworks on River Seine. We booked a cruise on July 14th for Bastille Day and it was the best decision ever. The River Seine is so nice and calm. You can see a lot of the landmarks and beautiful art all along the river

River cruise - relaxing. We took a river cruise. It was nice to see all the couples sitting on the side of the river drinking wine. The bridges were built by Napolean and the sights are beautiful. They tell you along the cruise all the interesting sites
Batoboats. We decided to ride the Batoboats on the River Seine. Good for hop on hop off service with a boat every 20 minutes. Ticket lasts a whole day with the last boat at 9.30pm
Excellent evening. we took an evening dinner cruise along the Seine and it was well worth it. The food was excellent and the highlights of Paris at night were magic.

Paris has captivating river walks. The Seine may not be the most beautiful river in the world, but when it flows through Paris, it flows past some of the most beautiful urban scenery in the world. There are many beautiful strolls along the river, but the most beautiful in the city are the Quai du Louvre and the Quai des Tuileries near the museum on the Right Bank (north side of the river) and the Quai d'Orsay (famous for the location of the French foreign ministry) and the Quai Branly on the Left Bank. The city that we know as Paris originated on two islands in the middle of the Seine, the Île de la Cité and Île Saint Louis, which are jewels of history and architecture, from Nôtre Dame to Saint Chapelle on the larger island to the beautiful 17th and 18th century houses on the smaller one. Both islands are worth walking around at length. Probably the best view of the Île de la Cité is from the Quai du Louvre at the north end of the Pont des Arts.
On board along the River Seine. You will surely enjoy your trip along the River Seine! You can see the city in a different way on board:)
Beautiful trip. Went on the river cruise on a magical trip in April 2015. The views are breathtaking seeing all the attractions from the river. Is a must when visiting this magical city

Lovely. Amazing it is.
Boat ride was just a superb experience.
Seine river passes through main Paris city.
Beat part about the boat ride was looking at different different artistic bridges.
Each small bridge which crosses the river is designed beautifully and different from each other.
A view of Eiffel tower from the the river is really amazing.

The Seine, it's just everywhere. No matter here you go in Paris, you will have to cross the Seine at one point or another. Every bridge is different. A lot of people miss the romanticism, the history, the feeling of just walking along the Seine. It is such a great feeling to walk those cobblestones along the river and then, suddenly, there she is : the Notre Dame. Wear comfortable shoes and take water. But you will discover a more personal side of Pairs. We walked from the Louvre all the way to the Notre Dame. I have pictures other than the regular tourist ones.
Beautiful!. The river is magnificent and somewhere you would never tire of visiting. Even just sitting watching the boats pass you by is wonderful.
Lovely sights along banks. Lovely seeing this all along our walks beside is, especially in the evenings when people sit by it having picnics. Nice to go along it and see sights whilst on the Batobus.

Superb City River. A cruise on the Seine is a great experience and a perfect addition to any visit to or tour of Paris. In fact a walk along the seine boulevards is also a lovely way to spend a few hours, watching all the activity on the river pass you by with the hustle and bustle of the streets above just far enough away. A must do on a visit to Paris

Romantic. We took a boat tour on our first day in Paris. Very romantic, middle of the afternoon. A great way to get a comprehensive review of multiple famous attractions in Paris. As we enjoyed the cruise, we planned our itinerary for the days following. This is a must do while in Paris.

Do not book with Viator! You will regret it. We recently booked a tour of the Seine River with Paris Illuminations Tour. What a disaster.We arrived at 6:45 for a 7:15 departure at the tour office. An hour later the tour bus was still stuck in traffic. We missed our departure time and then the tour was delayed to 9pm start time! When you have a young child this is a) a long time to wait for something to start and b) far too late. The tour was supposed to be 2.5hrs in total meaning that we wouldnt finish until close to midmight.A number of us asked for refunds since this was not acceptable. We were promised full refunds due to the excessive delay. Its been over a month...Viator still has not paid. We did get a goodwill gesture but this is not what we were promised.As an aside, i would stay clear of this area in peak season. It was a total zoo. There was literally a traffic jam of boats in the water and thousands of tourists and pickpockets. Not exactly the quiet, romantic evening one might expect.

A different perspective. We took a boat along the river Seine and it was nice to have this different perspective. It was much calmer and still so much to see. It was woth the trip although we already had a bus trip beforehand.

Concrete and stone river in the city center. Nothing terribly exciting. A river that flows through Paris that has been totally "tamed" by concrete and stone and crossed by many bridges and it travelled by multiple tour boats daily. Not very scenic but it adds some color to the city center.

Concrete and stone river in the city center. Nothing terribly exciting. A river that flows through Paris that has been totally "tamed" by concrete and stone and crossed by many bridges and it travelled by multiple tour boats daily. Not very scenic but it adds some color to the city center.
Must to River Cruise at night!. We did a river cruise at night and it was absolutely amazing to view all the important buildings and monuments illuminated at night.

The romantic life blood of Paris.. Beautiful river which is very busy due to the plethora of tourist cruises but it is nice to walk along the banks. They also had a "beach" on the Seine which was cool, have seen it done in other cities too.

To do list. River Seine has great views of the site of Paris ,include the more modern and industrial part .
Definitely must see and if possible take one hour tour on the boat or water taxi ( it's a lot of fun)

Other view of paris. If you gotvthe chance to takeca boat trip on the Seine, do it! Is really cool to see all the stuff from the river. It gives it another perspective.
Its s cool substitude for drinking expensive drinks on a touristic tarrace.

Sandy Beach complete with palm trees, umbrellas and beach chairs along the River Seine. I'd been in Paris in late August, but early August has a completely different feel. I'd heard about the Parisian's August vacations, but didn't believe shops would actually close and lose a month of revenue. Well, it's early August and many local shops, cafes and restaurants are in fact closed with paper signs on the door: returning on this or that day in mid-late August. The town is full of tourists, but a new experience, the makeshift "beaches" set-up along parts of the River Seine and the sandy volleyball courts in front of the Hotel de-Ville. Worth an August trip just to see that!It's hot so I'd advise to stay off the roasting Batobus and instead stroll the banks of the Seine (though another word of caution: with the heat comes some unpleasant odors).

Seine River Hop On Hop Off. Even if you buy ticket online, you have to print the conformation (voucher) and exchange it with the ticket when you go there which means standing in a line for about 20 minutes; very stupid. Do not waste your time. There is no guide during the tour. Don't go when it is sunny and hot, it will ruin your day. It is just a way to go from one attraction to the other; don't expect anything more!!

Seine River Dinner Cruise. excellent dinner cruise a must for visitors to Paris. I travelled with my wife and adult daughter and experienced a very scenic cruise along seine. There are many optios to select from and browse through the catalogues or just go down to the river bank and walk to shop around.

The thread that sews the city together. I find that in any great city, there are great bodies of water - Paris has the Seine, London has the Thames, etc. It can be the most ancient reason why the city grew up in that place, and remain its most enduring quality. I find simply taking a river cruise in a busy, bustling city like Paris is a way to slow down and enjoy all of its attractions. And I have noticed that things can heat up at night - I have noticed there are night-club like atmosphere on the some of the boats later in the evening. On the other side of the spectrum, as an early morning runner, I love to use the river as a touchstone for my runs, and hug its borders to keep track of where I am. I see that in the summer, sandy beaches are set up for everyone to enjoy. Just don't jump in for a swim!

Just cruising. We took an evening riverboat cruise down the Seine and it was breathtaking! Definitely something you shouldn't miss when in Paris....you see the lights of the city from a totally different view. There are dinner cruises too, but we simply took the basic cruise and then enjoyed dinner in the Eiffel Tower itself. Win, win on both!!

Ever moving. A constantly moving river filled with river cruise boats, restaurant boats, music, and great places to just sit and watch the river roll by. All the bridges afford long views of the river. There's also a hop on hop off boat which gives great opportunities to see sites and avoid the walking if you're tired.
One of the few free sights in Paris!!. It would be hard not to pass by the Seine at some point in Paris. Makes for a great point of reference when finding locations. rent a bike and ride along it!
Nice Cruise. We took the classic cruise in Seine for a couple of hours and it totally worth it. I wish we had a bigger tour!! We passed through quite a few great sceneries and enjoyed the ride.

Idyllic and Amazing. Book a river cruise. It is a must! It was a great way to start off my trip and to see all of the attractions before visiting them later on. It is a great way to get into the "vibe" of Paris!

Canal Boat Tour to Park de la Villette. Great alternative to standing in line in sun to enter any very hot museum in July. Different view of Seine River, historic buildings, life alongside the canal, plus underground section of the canal, and SIX LOCKS. Relaxing, especially after many days of walking in sun.

Water of dreams. Every night we went to the river to relax and finish our day. There was always a lot of activity. The bridges over the water are so charming and makes it easy to explore. The boat ride at night was special.

Beautiful summer cruise. How relaxing to take a lovely river river cruise up and down the River Seine and see most of the sights of Paris from the other side! We had no idea how many bridges had locks attached to them. Evidently it's not such a special thing after all-many of the bridges in Paris will collapse from the overload. In any event people along the route waved hello and made for a jolly ride.

Very nice on a hot summer day. You pass a lot of the 34 bridges and will see hear about many of the big sights in Paris. It is very nice on a hot summer day and you get the information both in French and in easy understandable English

A romantic part of Paris.. The Seine, like other great rivers of the world like the Mississippi, the Nile, the Danube, the Hudson and others, offers so much more than scenery. There are excellent paths to walk or ride a bike, sun bathing is allowed and the river traffic is incredible. A boat ride on the Seine was on my bucket list. Scenery from the river is a great way to see Paris. It doesn't look super clean so I would not advise swimming.

Picturesque. The most important river in France which flows through Paris. The evening Seine river cruise is an important event which cannot be missed. You get ample food & drinks. The atmosphere is serene.
Relaxing....... A cruise along the Seine is a lovely way to view some of the main sights of Paris. Better still in the evening, when the building are all lit up.

beautiful. Its a busy river with so much traffic running up and down it. Lovely barges and boats glide through the waters which I have to say looked pretty clean to me.Nice place to sit and watch the world go by or even take a boat trip if you have the time.I did not. So it was just a fleeting visit, quick stop for some photographs and off to the next place.Well worth a visit.
Historic, pretty clean!. Much improved since last visit. Ran for several miles along the banks, taking in the sites/views, very impressive. Passed on the boat tours, maybe if I had a lot more time?

Picturesque but don't go swimming. One of the things I didn't realize before embarking on a river cruise, was the amount of commercial barge traffic on the Seine. There are a number of river cruise boats as well, so with the houses, villages, country estates and other stuff, there is a lot to see while cruising the Seine. While tied up at the quay in Paris I did notice a lot of trash and refuse floating in the water and an unpleasant odor very similar to sewage....

New Year River Cruise. As you would expect it was cold on board, only to be expected really. the scenery was great as we cruised along the buildings look even more impressive from the river. Could not hear the commentary due to the talking of the other passengers and the noise of the wind but we still enjoyed the trip. Next time we are going to take one of the dinner cruises,
Great Time. It was our honey-moon. We had a great time there. We have also got a photo while we were in the tour. It was fun!

Boat Ride on the Seine. Breathtaking views from the rooftop of our boat. We left the dock just before 10 so we were able to see the Eiffel Tower sparkle! What a sight! The boat ride was worth the time and the fact that we were freezing because we were able to see many sights of the city at night. Gorgeous!

After the boat cruise, take a cruise on foot. After my boat cruise on Sunday along the Seine, I decided to walk along the riverbank of the Seine. It's quite a cool scene. Many little cafe's to enjoy and tons of interactive art and sports going on.
Beautiful River!!. This is a very romantic river. We took the Hop On Hop Off boat down the Seine to see the sights. We were able to see the locks on the bridge and the bridge that Napoleon had built.

Enjoy Your Seine River Cruise. The first thing you want to do when you arrive in Paris is to take the Seine River boat that tells about each bridge you go under - you will also see much of Paris you will want to explore later in your trip!

Smooth and fun ride at night. We enjoyed a glass of champaign in a boat with a few others while being informed about various points of interest we passed by on this one hour tour. It was arranged by our Kingsbridge Travel agent, Diane Ross.

Worth the ride . Catch the Batobus and hop on and off all day. Beware no toilets though!
Amazing views and lots of bridges.

Very pretty. It is hard to miss the Seine while you are in Paris. To make the most out of it, go for a stroll along its bank. Perfect for a romantic Sunday morning walk. The bateaux-mouches are also well worth doing. While cruising along the river, you get the chance to see a large number of Paris' most iconic buildings.
Relaxing way to visit the Eiffel tower. Great way to see Paris , would highly recommend. We bought mixed boat / bus tour tickets for two days.
River Seine. Amazing view,nice ride along the river,suitable for all .Beautiful weather in July,awesome view.I am not sure about toilet facilities etc but i did notice people with puschairs on board

Cruise. We took the one hour cruise at the end of isle were Notre Dame is.
We cruised up the river viewing all the main sights including the Louvre, Eiffel tower and Notre Dame and many more a definite must

Sit back and relax. A nice hour of relaxation to see the sites after a day of walking.......the views from the boat cannot be seen when you are on foot, spectacular.....also gives you great ideas of places to visit!
Cannot miss this if you walk or drive around Paris.. Take a boat ride - walk along - just enjoy. Some areas better then others. Convergance point at tip of Ile St. Louis is quite nice view.

Traffic thoroughfare. Cleaner than the Thames, sometimes blue and sometimes green. Very pleasantly viewed from Bateaux Parisiens audio described (optional languages) river cruise. A very busy waterway through the city of Paris
Excellent. We had a lovely boat tour on the river Seine. It was 14 euros each. We really enjoyed this and seeing the sights from the river.
Night cruise is Must, very enjoying. River Siene cruise is worth going especially during night as all historical building are illuminated and gives amazing views. U can sparkles of Eiffel tower.
Go for an early morning run along the Seine!. Many people do not know about the walkways right on the Seine, it is the perfect place for a run for a stroll, away from the hectic traffic above.
Dream come true. Every thing about it was great. We did a dinner cruse and we had a lunch on a barge as well. Both were magical.

A treasured memory .. Booked this dinner sightseeing trip with Paris travel and we were really surprised because we thought it would be one of those cliche quick traveller rip off jaunts , but how wrong we were.... We booked for the late cruise and it was Absolutely stunning , we were shown to our table and and offered drinks straightaway , then ordered our meals ( which included garlic snails .... Mmmmm .. Deliscious ) We set off down the Seine as it was getting dark and the fabulous meal was punctuated with glorious floodlit views of Notradamme cathedral , the Eiffel Tower , and host of beautiful views from the river . The waiters were very friendly and one of them used our camera and took a really good snapshot of us , the food was really good and topped off with baked Alaska which was paraded up and down the restaraunt by about six waiters with silver trays with the giant sweet flaming away above their heads . All in all a really wonderful experience and a treasured memory of Paris .

It is well worth a cruise. Down this amazing river. We organised a river cruise down this wonderful river on a sunny day and it was divine. You could see parts of Paris from the water you can't see on foot, highly recommended.
Take a night cruise. Stroll along and enjoy the many amazing landmarks, better yet - take a night cruise. Best to go on dark. Check out Paris beach during the day
Boating and Walking the Seine. The first time I was in Paris (in 2011) I took a boat ride and it was fun, but what I liked best was to be able to walk down by the river.

To be done when you are in Paris. It is definitely the thing that one should do when in Paris, just to make a tour of all those lovely landmarks and feel the freshness of the water while doing it. Better do it at night though, and specifically at 9:30pm tour since you will see the sparkling Eiffel Tower at 10pm while passing by it.

Gem of Paris. We loved walking along the seine river and we also took a romantic boat ride that included dinner. I would definitely suggest trying to ride a boat through the seine. The views are amazing and you can see most of Paris riding through it.

Pretty at Night. Take a boat ride at night - great rates can be found online at last minute/day before. We took the Vedettesdepontneuf.com, but you can find dinner cruises, day cruises, etc... Most amusing were the Plages du Seine. They've trucked in sand and put up umbrellas along the Seine near /between Pont Neuf and the other bridges, so people can "go to the beach"!
Relax on a tour of Paris by boat. A river cruise on the Seine is a must. Relaxing overview of the city and all its incredible landmarks. Great views of the city!!!

Take the night illumination cruise. We pre booked a night cruise on Seine River to watch the lights of Paris. The views were amazing and you can see lots of locals along the banks of the rivers, fishing, dancing or just waving to us. Effiel tower was of course the best part and do bring a light jacket, it does get chilly at night.

Champagne cruising down the river seine!. Booked a cruise down the river seine and was amazing and well worth the money - €24 for both my husband and I. It only lasts about 30 minutes but a great way to take in the beautiful sights from the water. There is a bar serving champagne which was a treat as I was celebrating my 40th that day! There is a surprise monument to be seen - statute of Liberty which was given to Paris for the 100th birthday of the statute! A must do!

The River Seine Should Be Seen By All. The River Seine is beautiful, breathtaking, divine. I saw it from the levels of the Eiffel Tower, near the water's edge, and on the River itself during a dinner cruise. You will always find your way back to it while in Paris because it is a body of water like no other.
Boat ride. Wow, the sites you can see on the Seine are beautiful. Picture perfect all way around. You can see the Eiffel tower, Musee D' Orsay, Notre Dame etc.

Romantic. If you focus on just the river and the water, then you'll think that there is nothing much to it. The water is pretty dirty. Even our tour guide said that if you jump into the Seine River, you will get instant cancer. Lol. But kidding aside, strolling right next to the river, with the Eiffel Tower in view, how much more romantic can that be?We saw a staircase right next to the River Seine, quite a wide staircase, meant for people to sit down and relax. There were a lot of Parisians sitting there and just hanging out. There was a band of strings playing music at the bottom of the steps, and after a tiring walk in Paris, this was just the perfect setting. A place to relax and watch the boats go by or people walk by. There were some pretty cool restaurants right next to the River Seine too. Some bean bags on the floor, hopscotch, basketball hoops, just a great place to hang out with friends, family, or your lover.

Relaxing stroll along the river banks. I went to Paris in the middle of summer when the sun only sets after 10PM and the weather stays warm and dry all the time. The River Seine is absolutely perfect for a stroll at night particularly around the Saint Germaine and Notre-Dame areas where the nightlife is always bustling! The street performers and groups of locals gathered along the river banks is truly a spectacular sight, and a perfect time for people watching! I wouldn't suggest going on the typical cruises along the Seine, especially around midday. The blazing sun makes some people go inside the boat where it is shady, but you miss the breeze and sights you get from above - along with the burning sunlight! The cruises are also often crowded and noisy, so going at night by yourself is a much more pleasant experience.

A beautiful stroll along the banks.. A great place for a stroll along the walkways and gardens fronting the river. The bridges, "love locks", canal boats and most of sites in Paris can be seen from the river.
A nice place to stroll. Romantic, crazy, etc.. The Seine is the heart and soul of Paris. I advise taking the small river boat tour from the Pont Neuf. It's cheaper and a nicer experience.

The most beautiful city river I ever saw. The banks and walkaways along side this river is probably the most beautiful of such places I ever visited. There are numerous places of attraction around both the sides of the river including the Louvre Museum, the Eiffel tower or the cathedral of Notredam. During my veryfirst visit I mistook the dome of the Grand Palace to be that of Louvre nevertheless realized it is not what I thought it is later on. Time almost pass on unnoticeable while sitting by the side of the river and watching the tourist crowd and numerous artists paintingportraits all around. I recommend the walk in bright sunny days and also during the late afternoon its very soothing to be here. And during the evening the wonderfully lit surroundings make it even more beautiful especially with the glittering Eiffel Tower on one side or the bridges connecting both the banks of the river and lit up in the dark. The river cruises on the Seine are very nice This is a true treat to the eyes. There is also a small island on the river called la Cité which I could not visit due to time
relax while watching the river banks. Great way to see the sights along the river. Get in early as alot more tourist during the aafternoon. Round trip on a batobus takes 2 hours and cost 16 euros.

Enjoy the Parisian romantic river walking. The different period of the river has its unique romantic atomosphere. It's suitable for everyone to relaxedly walk down and get to know Paris. A magic place makes ppl fall in love with someone.

A River that boasts everything. Every time we visit Paris, the Seine captivates us. best visited at dusk to appreciate the beautifully lit buildings on either side. The commentaries on the boat rides are rather drab and humourless but you just need to take in the extravagant architecture of the buildings that line either side of the river. Even more interesting is to walk from around Pont Sully to Pont Austerlitz and just gaze at Parisians simply chatting and relaxing by the river bank. East of Pont Sully is a stretch of river bank where people congregate to execute different genres of dance and even take dance lessons. Another captivating spot to appreciate the Seine is from the Ile de la Cite and Ile St. Louis. Get a Berthollins sorbet or ice cream from the main outlet on Ile St. Louis and then walk around the island to enjoy the magnificence of the river. Another great view of the river is from Pont Neuf-also one of the most impressive bridges on the river.

Evening on the river. When in Paris experience the city like a local. Go to the river in the evening and sit with Parisians, enjoy the river sights, bring a libation, wine, beer (the favorite drink in Paris, no wineries, many breweries), etc., bread, cheese and take in the evening. You likely will hear only French spoken. Go to the Pont Nuef bridge (Pont) and the park on the East end of the Ile de la Cite, Notre Dame, beautiful. Watch your belongings, there are pickpockets everywhere waiting for people to become distracted. Lost a nice looking, cheap, empty bag while kissing my Sweetheart, not much of a loss, but a warning to always be aware of your stuff and surroundings.

Relaxing cruise on the Seine. Took a boat trip down the river to get a glimpse of Paris from the river. Relaxing cruise and learnt quite a bit of the city. Boat trips leave from near the Eiffel Tower. Opportunities for some really cool pictures, especially near the Cite and Notre Dame.

Relaxing. If you go to Paris and think that taking a Seine cruise is a very touristy thing to do and not for you, you are going to miss out on another perspective of Paris. Just sit back and watch Paris from another angle.
A welcome break from walking and interesting vistas. This gives a unique perspective and an opportunity to rest your feet. However, the city is walkable and each of the sights is best seen up close!

Must try!. Try not to dwell on the smell and color of the River Seine, but immerse yourself with the views of both banks. Don't sit inside the water boat cruises, get on the back/topside of the boats and enjoy all the French architecture and bridges. Choose a stop and walk around - feel the vibrant culture of the locals. It's also a great way to get around Paris without jostling around the people in the subway.

Boat tour is a must. Take a boat tour from Pont Neuf and have a look at Paris from water. It really worth it if the weather is good. You'll see the most famous attractions during one hour tour and then can decide where you want to go to have a closer look.

Strolling the Seine. An excellent place to orient yourself to the inner city of Paris. Lots of beautiful bridges where glimpses of cathedral spires, Eiffel Tower, palaces and lovely old apartment buildings can be seen. You can choose to have a short stroll, or meander for hours with a rest on deck chairs or visit to a floating cafe/bar to stretch out a beautiful summer day.

Best evening activity in Paris. If you truly wish to appreciate the gorgeous architecture of Paris, take an evening barge cruise up the River Seine. It is a breathtaking evening, very romantic, and memorable.

The romantic Seine. I was gobsmacked when I strode up the Seine to watch thousands of people picnicking on the banks of the Seine with blankets and sipping wine and enjoying the company of family and friends. It was moving.

So beautiful strongly recommend. Our group took a one hour cruise on the Siene.It was so beautiful. I highly recommend going before dusk at about 9 pm in the summer. It was an optimum time for pictures. You can buy your tickets across from the Eiffel tower near the docks and there are some booze cruises and dinner cruises as well. The beauty of Paris is showcased with a beautiful boat ride and optimal picture taking!

See it all by boat. When in Paris you must take a boat and ride along the Seine River.We were lucky enough to be on our friend’s private boat but even if you take a tour you will get to the Eiffel tower, Notre Dame, Musée d'Orsay, Île de la Cité and more. Lots to see and its nice and relaxing to be on the water and have such amazing views. Give you feet a rest and do it.
Romance with a view. Very romantic river in the heart of Paris. Thousands of lovers' padlocks. One is meant to throw the key into the Seine. Bit like coins in the Trevi fountain in Rome.

Your in Paris. Being in Paris there is realistically no way not to experience the River Seine. You see it movies all the time and wonder what is like in person. You have the chance. You can get boat rides to go up and down, or simply just walk along it as you are sightseeing.

The most disgusting waters!!!! . I didn't like the Seine river, and I don't advise anyone to visit it, since the waters of the Seine were full of carbage and wastes and had very awfull smells. And I was shocked to find out that there are live fish living in the river which was a very bad environment for it.

Beautiful sights from the river to be seen. Such a wonderful sight and even more so that they have built a man made beach on the bank opposite Notre Dame it's also refreshing to know that it's not just a river for pleasure we river home boats and even some freight passing by. And adds a cool oasis in the heat of the city.

Beautiful and calm. Absolutely brilliant we had a walk alongside the river and it felt so calm. It was amazing to see the wall with the locks reminds you how true love is and how many people believe in it!

Beautiful. Took a boat ride down the river seine and it was magical. Could see the eiffel tower glistening whilst cruising along. You don't need to be in a boat to enjoy it however, walked along the river bank many of times just taking in the river seine its truly beautiful.

A must do when visiting Paris. We went on a cruise on batobus which was part of Paris bus tours..see my review. Cruise stops at 8 places which is hop on and hop off. In total cruise is roughly 2 hours and ten minutes. Lovely way to see Paris. Loved Paris statue of liberty. Would highly recommend doing cruise. Very worthwhile.
Tour. I took many pictures great comfortable ride. Guided tour was very informative. Learned alot. A must do!
Boat ride in Seine. A very sedentary river of France, it reflects the nature of Parisans, calm and quite going. One should travel length of the river to get a glimpse of the city.

Seine boat tour. We took a boat tour that boarded near the base of the Tour de Eiffel. The tour lasted for about an hour. There are bathrooms on board, but use the one in the waiting area of the dock prior to boarding if possible. Take a water on board and sit along the side of the boat if possible. Certainly you'll be seeing one side more than the other, but the boat turns and doubles back down near the Louvre. Gorgeous way to see many of the bridges.

Great Place to Sit and Watch.. This is one place just could just walk up and down all day. So much to see and very picturesque and peaceful. Perfect to take a picnic and just sit and survey the scenery.

H and P take Paris. We were on a Viking River Cruise and our boat was docked along the Seine a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower. We walked along the river to get to the tower and were surprised at how many house boats there were docked there. We also walked along the river from our Hotel du Levant to get to the Louvre. Took a Bike About Tour and while we were stopped along the river saw someone fall in. She was OK and was able to climb out one of the ladders spaced along the sides but Gendarmes came along and wrote her a ticket. That's not something you see everyday!

A comfortable way to see the city landmarks. We used the BatoBus as part of our L'Open bus ticket. These are perspex covered large area boats that lack the open air seating of some other boats and that would have been preferred. After so much time on our feet it was a great break.

River Taxi. We used the river like a taxi service. Buy the all day pass and jump on and off at all of the best spots to see the city. Great way to get around and make sure you catch one at night for the lights!

Amazing trip - morning activity. Amazing trip, preferable to experience it on morning after that going to effel towermust pre book it through any agent or their tart point ( for high season )start point for most of cruises near to effel tower

Breathtaking Views. The cruise was wonderful and the views breathtaking. I went with a group that reserved the whole boat. Our food appetizers and fine cheese plus wine was outstanding! I would recommend.
Ah!. Take a boat cruise down the Seine River and enjoy all the bridges and pass by Notre Dame. The island is where Paris really began. Wonderful ....

Very romantic. Such a lovely place to spend your time there with your love! We spent numerous hours. Its a must visit in day and night! It even gets more beautiful at night with the lights of Eiffel Tower!

great way to start your holiday or sight seeing.. Best way to learn the main sights in Paris, I will do the curise first before attend all the main sights, as you can learn a bit of history of those places... if you then go and wonder about, you will at least know what you are looking at

Cruise by morning. It's nice cruise, but with crowded and noisy around can't enjoy it except when have second time close cruise and could enjoy explanation and look everything where it better to have by morning not night :)

A Ethereal experience. nice experience...felt like the crowd on the banks were with you. We took a cruise in the night, and it was wonderful experience to see the Lighted up eiffel tower from the seine as was the rest of Paris.

Romantic walk to the Eiffel Tower. Celebrating our love story by taking a pathway along the Seine river, it's absolutely beautifull at night. Mid August 2014 was undescribeable beautifull night, not windy - not cold and so we are spending a long walk of more than an hour from Place St Michel to the Eiffel tower. Thinking back to that time nothing so special with the river itself beside the gold ornament of the bridge or the calm water of the river. The history behind it, was bringing you to a different moment that will surprisely send you to another special feeling that you will not ever forget.

sightseeing & dining. Excellent way to take in the sights, very relaxing after walking the length of paris. Definitely don't pre-book tickets as they are dearer. Plenty cruise boats go up & down and will only cost you around €10 each instead of pre-book price €30-40 each. Unless you wish to dine and cruise then pre-book at the pier office & not on the internet. Lunch / cruise for 2hrs was €59 each , evening meal / cruise was €69 each. Times were lunch 12.30pm - 2.30pm & evening 6.30pm - 8.30pm.
Great trip.. Wonderful river boat cruise, enjoyed seeing all the sights from a different perspective. Highly recommend.
Good to comtemplate. Good to comtemplate on early mornings or late afternoons. Very romantic, a must go to couples visiting Paris.

Disappointed by the smell!. Walked along both banks of the river for 4 days and the water is clean and doesn't smell at all. The problem is the bridges. Every single one that we walked underneath smelt awfully of pee. I am disappointed that the authorities don't jet wash these areas. we had dreams of picnics by the Seine but this didn't happen for this reason. The only smarter place as 'Le Plage' which is a man made beach where they have sun loungers. This area had been kept much cleaner.

Can't be it for a walk. Absolutely gorgeous! We did a day trip from London and spent some time near the river. We walked from Pont de l'Alma were Princess die was killed, to the Eiffel Tower along the river. Lots of little places to eat and sit along the river, it is very gorgeous.
Peaceful. Very peaceful. We can have a ancient buildings surrounding with leisure and drinks. Very peaceful moment. Always great.

Seine . The river is an amazing place in the center of this unique city. It was unforgettable spending time near the river after a long day of sightseeing and walking around. The thousands of musicians and groups of people dancing, laughing and having a picnic on the grass creates an atmosphere that makes Paris even more attractive. Moreover, if you look for a place to socialize and meet people, both from Paris and all over the world, that is the right place for you. Highly recommend visiting this place, which I guarantee you'll never want to leave.
Pretty. It's pretty but don't do the river cruises it's so not worth it everyone stands up and you can't see anything... gah. Just go visit the main bridges that's pretty.

Beautiful. If you really want to experience Paris, live like a local.Grab some food and a bottle of wine and sit next to the Seine.You need take a cruise,The cruise takes through the whole historical town of ParisThe lighting and the buildings looks beautiful from the river in the evening.

The Seine by Batobus and Paris Plage. The best way to experience Paris from the water is the Batobus, Hop On, Hop Off. It's also a good way to cut down on the amount of walking through Paris. It stops at all the best sites. You can get a 1-3 day pass. We like to take the last cruise (around 9:00pm), heading toward the Eiffel Tower and sunset.Also, along the Seine from mid-July to mid-August is the Paris Plage. Sand, palm trees, playgrounds for children, petanque, cafes are brought to the shores of the Seine for all to enjoy--free. We love to play boules there, followed by an expresso (or beer), overlooking the Seine, Conciergerie, Eiffel Tower.....
Yes!. I wouldn't drink or swim in it but it's a beautiful river that is woven into the fabric of the city. It's especially beautiful at night. Love.

best seen at dawn or dusk. I recently spent 4 days in Paris, pretty much all in the 1ere arrondissement and thus spent a lot of time walking along the Seine, crossing the bridges to and from the nearby attractions. Like everything else in Paris, there is loads of history and you'd do well to read up before arriving. That being said, you just have to look around to see the history, and the best time, IMO, is when there are few folks about. I was pleasantly surprised to find the walkways along the Seine pretty quiet after 10pm and downright empty at 6am. You cannot get much better atmosphere than fresh pastries at 6:15am while watching the morning barges on the river. It contrasted nicely with the normal hustle and noise of downtown Paris in July.
Lovely. Beautiful river...it seems the scenery is different everywhere you look. Don't miss taking a boat trip on the river to see all the sites.
Relaxing Cruise. We took the roundtrip boat tour and it was amazing. The views were breathtaking and it was a great way to spend a few hours taking everything in. Paris is a magical city.
Nice walk. Nice to walk along Seine and enjoy river and beautiful houses around ,crossing bridges and avoid traffic mess
Simply Awesome. Please make sure u choose to leave by 9.30 pm its perfect timing to be back and witness both day n nite effect
The ambiance of Seine!!. Just the beauty of the Seine river and all the activities in and around the river really enhanced our stay in Paris. Such a sight to behold!!!
Lovely river. Lovely views from this famous river that runs through all Paris. There is a sidewalk that you can walk along

best way to see-and learn- a lot; take a narrated river cruise. We booked a skip-the-line river cruise through Paris Pass in the early evening. Narration through headphones in many languages (10, I think) provided just enough history, comments on river-associated activities of the locals, references to current events at spots we passed. The cruise wound up at the foot of the Eiffel Tower, a great place for dinner on a neighboring boat. Fun and interesting way for tired travelers to see a lot in a most relaxed way.

Romantic getaway steps below the vibrant Parisienne scene. What a romantic way to spend a warm afternoon by taking a picnic lunch and sitting along side the Seine. We saw lovers kissing and strolling hand-in-hand, children playing, fashion photo shoots, you name it. Another world!
Beautiful and Relaxing. Surprisingly Clean and Blue. I enjoyed a walk along the Seine and a Boat Ride for one hour. Outside the Musee D'orsay you can sit and enjoy the river.
A relaxing hive of activity.... A relaxing hive of activity in Paris, whether you take a leisurely stroll along it, catch a cruise, or sit near by.
wonderful stroll. so beautiful, just stroll along and take in all the wonderful sights. street musicians, artists, and so much more

Champagne river cruise. Had a beautiful afternoon river cruise down the Seine complete with champagne and all. Fabulous views of Paris from the river and you get to see most of the main sights while cruising along. Highly recommend that you take a cruise!
The Seine is amazing!. Make sure to buy a Batobus pass and cruise this amazing river to get amazing views of Paris' landmarks!

'Beach' along N shore in July annuallly. Boat tours, most of which leave from Eiffel Tower base, are a fun way to see the museums, notre dame, and other buildings from a different perspective.
In July, they dump sand along north bank of Seine with lawn chairs and umbrellas creating a 'beach' for city dwellers to relax and dig their toes in the sand.
The best views of Paris. For the most amazing views of Paris take a cruise in the Seine, if you are a photo aficionado you will love this trip.
lovely river. took a river boat cruise, the seine was a lovely view of all the museums and the Notre Dame. Loads of places to eat around the Seine.

So Much Beauty!. We did a river cruise of the Seine. There was so much to see and so much history behind every building. It was nice to sit down and be able to see all of the sites. Definitely worth the money

A lovely walk on a sunny day. A walk down the left bank of the Seine can be very pleasant on a nice day, you may come across markets or street players at any point or there are lovely landscaped parts where you can sit and watch the river traffic. A bit past the Eiffel tower you will see a long island at the end of which is the original statue of liberty, you can get on to the island from the bridges and see it up close. As always in any city be aware especially in less frequented places.
Paris Plages!. Oh the beach on the Seine is such a fun time. Walk along and discover mobile photo booths (with wi-fi!), playgrounds, glacé, and sand!
a ride not to be missed. check the seine with bateau mouche , by day or by night with dinner or lunch what ever you do don't miss it

Evening cruise on the Seine. We did the evening cruise and it was so much fun seeing all the people enjoying the river area. And when the cruise ended it was time for the sparkle show on the Eiffel Tower. Wow!

This is what Paris is all about. My husband and I took a romantic cruise along the River Seine and it was amazing! We were able to take in so many sights from the water. The view of the Eiffel Tower from the water was breathtaking. This is a must see!
Lovely. So beautiful - spent many hours walking along the Seine and admiring all the lovely and creative bridges.

Lovely. Lovely river, lots to do around it and lovely walks. Downside in some areas (latin quarter) there were lots of tents and gangs of homeless under the bridges. They didn't cause us a problem but can be intimidating.
Trip Maker. We went cruising down the river and it was one of the best parts of the trip. Passing by the river banks you got to see Paris in action and it will always stick with me.

See the river. Excellent experience..My suggestion ride the bikes. great way to get around. Plenty of shopping near the river. See the lock bridge even though I hear they are removing alot of the locks

City river taxi. A river cruise to see some of the remarkable sights of this beautiful city is worth the few euros. Take the city boats for the best bargain. It is an on/off trip with 8 stops along the river.

Evening River Cruise with Great Sunset Views!. We took an evening river cruise at around 8:30PM The sunset was beautiful and made a great back drop for all our pictures. This was our last day and what a fantastic way to cap off a great 10 days in France. We can't wait to return.
Lovely to walk along. A nice place to walk and chat about your trip. we did a boat trip but didn't feel that it was worth the money

Essential visit. Great to get away from the bustle of the city, walk along the footpaths or down on the river trails.
Get a boat for at least a part of the trip, most are hop on - off.

Relaxing Seine River Boat Ride. We took a relaxing tour on the Seine River on an open air boat. It was very relaxing and gave us a very different perspective of the many of the sites of which we only walked by or drove by. Definitely recommend it.

Beautiful and active. I love rivers. This one is great. There are many boats going back and forth, making for a great sight at night. There are plenty of places to stop and have a drink- or just bring your own. At one point there are even activities for the whole family. It's a great area in the city where you see people lounging, playing, and enjoying life and time in Paris.
On the banks of The Seine. We thoroughly enjoyed walking along the banks and the various islands. The Batobus is good value for money (all day hop on hop off service to the major landmarks)

Clean and clear. Didn't cruise or dine on or near the Seine but we strolled around it a few times and would have if more time allowed. It was very clean both in the water and the banks which was a very pleasant experience. We were wandering around the river area on Bastille Day which was a privilege.
quick romantic Parisian getaway. Worth the walk and buying a lock for the bridge! We enjoyed all the art displays along the river walk..prices were reasonable and staff were friendly and informative!

Great Place to relax. The Seine River is the icing to the cake of Paris. Its natural beauty draws millions of people and artists there every year. It has such a soothing color and calming tide. I would definitely suggest walking along the Seine, taking a river cruise, and also sitting alongside the Seine and watch the boats and the people pass by.
Lovely river. Another landmark that cannot be missed. enjoy a boat trip or just a wander along the side. Watch the boats from the bridge.
A long romantic walk along the Seine. The river Seine meanders through the City. A witness of much history , good and bad. I found the Seine a grand lady, very civilized and romantic

Addictive. Seine is the best attraction in Paris.Take a river cruise or a boat taxi, the Seine won't disappoint.We walked along the river every day and or night and never got tired of it. The walk along the river from the Louvre up until the Eiffel Tower takes about an hour and it's delightful. Grab a cup of coffee or a bite to eat or just enjoy the view. The river is beatiful late at night too. Don't forget to wave at the people sitting on the river banks, they wave at every passing boat.You can even observe the fishing men.We saw a three foot cat fish being caught and released back to the waters

Skip the tourist cruise, grab a bottle of wine & live like a local instead. If you really want to experience Paris, live like a local. Grab some friends and a bottle of wine and sit next to the Seine. It will cool you off on those summer nights plus it will be much more memorable than the tourist cruise - you can see all those sights on foot, which is better anyway! Go at sunset and see Paris in that beautiful golden light.

Different perspective. Riding on a boat on the River Seine gives a very different perspective of sights- and the other variety of boats is interesting. Especially unique is the undersides of bridges, decorated quite lavishly that can only be viewed by boat. Although the river is busy, a view from underneath is more relaxing, a break from the bustling city.
Love the river. It is really great to take a walk along the Seine river! It is just perfect if you want to just chill and enjoy Paris.

River Seine - A Great Way to reach all The Attractions in Paris. There are different types of cruises available on the Seine but if you want to hop on / off along the River get the Batobus. Its literally a river bus with 'bus' stops along the way. Louvre, Tour Eiffel, Notre Dame. Palaces etc etc. Its quick and you can do a full circle on it to bring you back to your starting point - or hop off along the way.Inexpensive with great views for pictures - recommended

River Cruise. Went on a wonderful cruise at dusk with a company called Paris Cityvision. This was an hour long guided ride by boat along the river. The sunset was magical and was a relaxing end to the day. Highly recommended after a long day of hitting the pavement in Pais on a hot summer day.

Beautiful Day on the mini cruise. I hour trip on a boat. All the beautiful sites/attractions eg Eiffel etc which are pointed out whilst on the boat. Comfortable/relaxing journey. Drinks and food can be bought on cruise and a picture is taken and at the end of the journey you get the photo. Very nice no extra cost, already in the fee.
Wonderful . We brought are own boat from Le Havre to Paris and thoroughly enjoy the Seine. It's a great river all the way. Paris, with its bridges and landmarks is very impressive night or day.

Great way to relax. We took the Seine sightseeing boat at the foot of the Eiffel Tower three times in a week. It is a great way to relax after walking all day. We usually sit outside because we are not that interested in the commentary given inside. Remember, the lines are very long on the weekends.
