We bought extra tickets so we would not have to wait on the ticket line the next time we took a ride. It is very enjoyable day or night. Be sure to wave to the people on the shore. They always wave back. There is also a boat ride from Pont Neuf near Notra Dame but we have never taken it.

A must-do boat ride on River Siene if you are in Paris. We took the boat ride on River Seine. This was probably my best time spent in Paris. We loved it, with the river moving past a lot of Paris' must-see and famed attractions (or was it moving past ALL of Paris' attractions?! ) The interesting and beautiful bridges across the river, the walk-ways on both sides of the river bank, and the cool and clean Paris air brushing your cheek as you stride down Siene on your boat viewing all heritage monuments is an experience you should not miss at any cost if you are in Paris. You need not go for the Souvenir photos clicked though as they are quite expensive. I suggest you go click-click with your own camera instead, and maybe take help from a few friendly fellow passengers to have your group pics clicked :)
River Seine, a must do in Paris. Wonderful way to see Paris, book a boat tour and get to see wonderful sights from the river, nice and relaxing, with an audio commentary in several languages,

Perfect summer/warm-weather activity. Having a picnic near Pont Alexandre/Invalides is one of the best spots to be on a summer night. I bring my own picnic or order one. Best part here is the people watching and the fact that there are a ton of bars and restaurants down by the water to buy replenishments of wine.

Walk Along the Seine. My partner and I walked along the Seine often during our visit, crossing the various bridges to check out each side, viewing the incredible architecture. Make sure to take the time to walk at night when the lights come on--after all Paris is the City of Lights!

Beautiful river cruise. Taking a trip down this river on a boat was so beautiful you're able to see the Eiffel Tower from several angles including the nighttime view when it lights upThere are even some riverboats that serve dinner I prefer to choose my own restaurant and then take a cruise afterward
River Seine. I did the one hour tour that was booked in a trio with dinner at 58 Eiffel Tower and the Moulin Rouge. It was a great experience.
Spectacular Seine!. Magnificent - so much history and amazing architecture, something to see on both banks. What a truly spectacular city!

good for transport. we used the batobus as a means of transport along the seine, which is very handy. travelling along the seine offers a different perspective of sights and is especially nice as you pass the Ile de la Cite, but otherwise I found the views a little stifled. there's a certain novelty to passing under the bridges but you're ultimately there to see things and I just found the views limited to trees and house boats.

An alternative view of Paris. After walking round sightseeing for days, the River Seine cruise was a welcomed change - seeing the places we had visited from another viewpoint whilst resting our very tired feet - and as the boat had commentary in a number of languages, it was interesting to hear a different perspective too.

The passage to sooth the soul. . To look along the tranquil waters is just a taste of medical insurance to sooth the soul. Yes u might ask it's just water. It oozes with history enough to send you in the times of land has forgotten. To be their to experience the moment is only the answer to your questions. By day you can travel among the many boats to tour to feel the winds dance apon you while you're Imagination take control of your senses, or by night to fill the dream of many, choices you make you will not regret. Bon voyage.

Hectic yet tranquil. We did a cruise on the Seine late on a July day when it was still light. The air became cool as we sailed along but the excitement on board kept us warm. The beautiful old buildings were magical in the evening light. The view of the Eiffel Tower from the river is one of the best.On other days and evenings we walked along the river bank and enjoyed the peace and quite. On early morning walks we encountered teams of council workers ensuring that the area was kept clean.

Great to walk along and see the people. It's great to walk along the Seine and see the people. We stopped a few times to listen to bands playing on the boats for dinner parties. We also stopped a few times to look at artists who were selling their paintings, and, of course, you'll like seeing the lock bridge, actually there is more than one. Highly recommended and relaxing.

In-Seine!. When you think of a classic Paris postcard or attraction, you invariably picture it with the River Seine in the foreground. Whether you are standing on the bank, taking the bato-bus or the bato-mouche, at some point you must see it. TIP: In the summer the city brings in sand on the right bank near Ile de la Cite.
lunch on the Seine. we had lunch on a cruiser that went up and down the Seine and the meal was fantastic the cruiser was called Diamante. We even got to see the original statue of liberty

A ribbon that ties the city together. When it's hit and humid a short ride on the Seine will lift your spirits and give you close up views to most of the city's greatest attractions, including the Eiffle Tower.

Excellent River Cruise in the Night. A must during Paris visit. The cruise takes through the whole historical town of Paris - which would otherwise be missed through Road trip. Moreover, the lighting and the buildings looks very beautiful from the river. And the culmination with the marvelous view of Eiffel Tower is the most amazing experience.

Beautiful Cruise. The cruise is a lovely and relaxing way to see the city from the river.
The bridges and commentary are interesting. The smooth ride won't disrupt even the most sea sick of cruisers. It is certainly a must do fr any traveler to Paris.

wonderful day cruise. amazing architectural colossal buildings to see and feel so near with beautiful waters of river, reasonably priced, does not include food and beverages. perfect for small kids - afraid of dark and cold.
dinner on the river. one of the best extravagences is to have dinner on the river and go the whole hog and get club/upper class.
River tour. Take the River Tour. It gives you a snap shot of Paris. Try and get an open top boat. Well worth the dollars.

Easy way to see the cities monuments if you're short on time.. If you don't have time to see everything in Paris, which I imagine most don't.....you should take a boat ride of the River Seine where most of the city's monuments are visible.
Visit Canals. Try walking down the canals off of the Seine. Many of them have water locks and you can watch private boats using them. There is a great example in the Republique district.

Friday Night on the River. A late cruise for sunset to end the visit in Paris was a very fine finishing choice in this great city.The people on the shore even put on quite a show & applaud your presence.Students of The Univercity entertained with a "full mooning" & a Village Peoples rendition of "YMCA" skit for laughs.But the crowning glory of this boat ride is to approach the Eiffel Tower at night in lights.We missed the sparkling effect that is shown at a certain point of the evening but "damn", we'll just have to come back for that one day.
Paris = la Seine. You have to see the Seine when you visit Paris.Go to a bridge in the center of Paris and look at the cathedral with the Seine. Just beautiful.

Dinner and Cruise. Whata great way to see many parts of Paris and to enjoy a wonderful meal, we did the evening dinner and the Eiffel tower was on full display with all the lights running up and down it.

Cruising down the Seine. This is a really great way of getting some amazing photos, the famous landmarks & the sights you see are breathtaking. It's really a nice relaxing boat ride, bit of music playing, lots of happy people taking happy snaps. I think it took an hour and a half & it was well worth the money! Afterwards you can have a drink or lunch in one of the lovely restaurants by the river & watch the world go by, although they are a bit over priced for what they offer!
Cruise. We bought a Paris Pass which included a cruise on the river. We learned about the history of all the buildings and saw them from a different view. It was fun.

Beautiful Place to Relax. Although I cannot remember the name of the boat tour we did, I enjoyed sitting along the River Seine just as much. It is a calm place to get away from the business of the trip or the summer heat. Just sitting along the river with a group of friends sounds simple, yet it was a favorite part of my recent trip to Paris.

Wonderful when your feet are just too tired. Loved it... Time to sit and soak in the beautiful vistas. You can get on and off. Watch out for the ticket offices, they are hidden away in the river bank!
Ideal Picnic Area. We enjoyed some nice picnics along the Left Bank with wonderful views of Norte Dame near the Love Lock Bridge.

Beautiful trip on the river. We had a lovely boat trip on the Seine the weather was beautiful and hot, the sights were amazing to see. All the major sights were pointed out and it was a most enjoyable trip.

River seine cruise. River seine is the best way to see all paris monuments in short time.There is cruise near Notre dame cathedral, which is generally available and can be booked from the office below the road.They also offer discount for paris visite card

Travel on the Bateaux Mouches for the great sites. Plan ahead as during the summer the departures are plentiful and have the full run of the river but in poor weather and in other seasons the departures are fewer and the full tour of the Seine in Paris may not be navigate able. Many find the illuminated after sunset tours quite pleasant as many of the buildings, museums, palaces, Tour Eiffel and Notre Dame are bathed in light. Take a pass on the food service as it is overpriced and not up to café standards.

River that takes you around Paris. River Seine, give you a splendid view of Paris architecture. Take a cruise just below the eiffel tower and see around Paris on the boat. You can see people enjoying cycle, sitting under the sun and may be even Pilate and yoga. Also you can see the beautiful bridges that cross the river. The river gives you a very different look when in the night.You would surely enjoy the city of lights.

Ahh, Paris. Summertime in Paris is wonderful for sharing a bottle of wine and a baguette/cheese with your favorite person along the banks of the Seine. Or take a boat ride down to the Eiffel Tower in the evening and watch all the lights twinkle.
Beautiful walk. Lovely to walk along the Seine on a sunny Sunday morning. Wide paths away from the road and traffic.

The lifeline of the city. The Seine divides Paris (Right Bank and Left Bank as you go down stream). It allows you to see some of the great sights if you tour it by boat. You can sit by it's side and just dream of who may have sat in the very same spot. There are the booksellers and the bridges. It is Main Street, Broadway, and Lover's Lane. It even become the beach in August.
Relaxing River Walk. Walk along the calm river near the Louvre to relax after a busy day of visiting the great art. Beautiful views from both sides of the river and plenty of cafes to enjoy.

Informative. The cruise down the River Seine was informative and interesting. Unfortunately the boat we travelled on had not been very well maintained and many of the seats were broken. It was relaxing and enjoyable

Very disappointed. Was running late to leave. Booked a cruise with aircon and was at the front of the que and was told I had to go on another boat.The people running the cruise were not at all interested to be of help as lots of people were complaining about the heat. The other boat did not have aircon and even with all the windows open it was totally uncomfortable and perspired the whole cruise. For the price the food was not great at all,the main meal was a chicken leg.The wine tasted like paint remover. The cruise itself was good but this did not make up for all the other problems experienced.

Lovely way to see the city in the evening. We took one of the boat tours on the river, it is a great way to see the sights of the city and orient yourself in the city. It's also relaxing! Most of the boat tours allow you to bring drinks aboard as well. I would highly recommend taking a tour at the beginning of your trip. For the reasonable price, it can't be beat.
The lifeblood of Paris. Beautiful river with more history than you can comprehend. Go to the middle of any of the bridges and take some time looking up and down the river. It is magical.

A perfect end to a perfect trip around Paris. As our time was limited we packed as much as we could into our three day sojourn in Paris and on our final evening we took a trip down the River Seine and we were not disappointed. The journey was a little like a recap of all the key attractions we had seen but this time we viewed them from another angle. All along the banks of The Seine we watched tourists and locals alike gather with picnic and bottle or two in hand to relax after a weeks work. it looked idyllic as the sun set and we absorbed our last few hours in this wonderful city.

The river that makes Parisians tourists, too.. I went with my Parisian friend and she started taking LOTS of photos, that's how pretty the view of la tour Eiffel was walking down the Seine near sunset. It is a great walk and not too crowded like the Thames. It almost feels like a getaway from the Parisian hustle-bustle!
Nice views of Eiffel tower. The whole boat trip was fine, the best part was the view of eiffel from seine. At night with lights it is definitely something different.

What a fabulous way to see the city from a different angle!. We bought a Seine River Cruise ticket prior to coming to Paris. After a remarkable tour of the Eiffel Tower we decided to go down to the boat. What a good decision!Get on the boat, head to the top deck. And sit with camera phone in hand. You will take a hundred pictures before it's over. You pass the lock bridges. Views of Eiffel Tower. Incredible bridges. Sculptures. Palaces. Beautiful, colorful flowers. Just more, more, more of everything. And you don't have to walk to see it. And the angles from the boat are amazing. There wasn't any tour guide or captain talking into an intercom, which I appreciated. It was wonderful to just turn your head in 10 different directions every 20 feet, to see another remarkable sight.The boat ride took a while, and I could have stayed all day. This is an absolute MUST DO if you are visiting Paris. It offers absolutely fascinating views during the day.

Random boattrip. If you have time, take one of the riverboats an discover Paris from them. You will see alot of interresting buildings and also sit and relax in the sun and feel the city from the waterline. I have been on better cruises but it is always something nice to do when here.
Stroll down the river. Lots going on as you take a lovely walk down the river be warned though you have to pay for toilets and the trendy bars you see come with a hefty price tag on drinks and food.

We enjoyed a river cruise of the Seine at night. I would definitely recommend taking a river cruise of the River Seine at night. The buildings are aglow and it brings out their natural beauty even more than seeing them during the day. There were hundreds of people sitting along the banks of the river, listening to music, enjoying a picnic, dancing, relaxing and of course waving to us on the boat! And at the end of the cruise we enjoyed amazing views of the Eiffel Tower glowing and then twinkling -- such a dream come true for my daughters!

History is written. I have been on the Seine many times but every time I catch something different about it. It's not just a river it's a moment in history , because every Mile of this river crosses something historically significant.

A river that defines Paris. Slow and meandering, the River Seine defines Paris. It cuts through the heart of the city and is as beautiful and romantic as it was in days of the kings. By all means take a stroll along its banks.
Great perspective. Great way to see the eiffel tower - from the river. This is not a very long cruise but definitely worth doing
take the Bateau Bus. we always travel up and down the Seine by Bateau Bus. It is the cheapest and most comfortable way to sight-seening along the river.
"Flying" on Seine..... Nice feeling "flying" on the river, see great part of Paris Historical Monuments very comfortably! Absolutely fantastic experience!!
Very romantic . An evening stroll or one of the boat tours. We did both. A fun way to see a lot of the sights. The boat rides will save your feet and that air condition feels amazing lol.

Don't Even Think About It, Just Buy a Boat Ticket!. Our first day in Paris (3 Adults, 3 Granddaughters ages 15, 12 and 8) we went on a 3 hour walking tour and continued the rest of the day to walk all over this beautiful city. Many times we walked across the bridges of the Seine and it was magical. About 6 pm, we decided to ride one of the many boats that goes up and down this lovely river, and even though we may not have chosen the best boat company (sorry, I can't remember the name) it was still delightful, a great break from walking, and a not-to-be-missed way to see Paris. Do it, do it, do it!
Nice resting place. Pretty area, varies through the city. Boat rides are very touristy but also a great break on your feet after a long days walk. Crossing near Notre Dame is a beautiful spot.
Take a river cruise. You must take a river cruise. Whether daytime or evening, dinner or just tour. The bridges are so beautiful!
Good way to get a sense of the city. For your first trip to Paris, take a boat tour. You'll get a good sense of the layout of the city, and it's a leisurely, uncrowded way to see the sights.
It is an area to walk and enjoy the peace.. I liked walk around this area during the morning and at night. It is beautifull area and you can enjoy also the impressive Tower.

Private boat ride on the Seine River. Memory making experience with "My Paris River" private pontoon boat. We had a wonderful skipper named Benjamin who had so much knowledge of the sights and a warm, friendly personality.
Relaxing. Try taking the hop on hop off ferry, well worth it as one can get off at all the important landmarks or simply just enjoy looking at landmarks from the tranquillity of the river.

The heart and lungs of Paris. During a heatwave this is the best place to be - on the river. Take a batobus or other tour and enjoy the breeze coming off the water. All the main sights are within walking distance from the river. Friday and Saturday evenings are best when the locals come out to play, dance and picnic.

Gorgeous River cruise. Simply amazing! We did both a cruise along the river in the day and at night. The night cruise was amazing! 3 course dinner, amazing views, wine and great service. Highlight of the trip.

exciting. Took a boat tour of this exciting river as the sun was setting. Make sure you have your camera. Trip took about an hour and cost about 12 euros....well worth it. Went down as far as the Eiffel tower from Ile de la Cite and back. Bring something warm as it cools down as the sun disappears. We were there late June and the river was completely lined with people enjoying an evening out...mostly young students having a glass of wine or a cold beer but they seemed to be enjoying themselves. A walk along the river bank can be very enjoyable also. Great place to snap some pics also.

Dinner Cruise. I did a dinner cruise that went along the entire river at night. It was truly gorgeous! The boat really set the mood offering wine and champagne. I was able to see every building that aligned the river from my boat.

The heart of Paris. Any time or day or night, Parisians are out along the Seine River. The views of the boats and the bridges are charming. You can't go to Paris and not spend some time walking along the Seine. Plus you can look for the "locks of love" on the bridges. Paris authorities remove them periodically because of the weight on the structure of the bridges, but love finds a way!

The wonderful Seine. When we don't have a plan for the day we just go down and sit by the Seine. The many boats and barges are entertaining and now Paris has its 'beach' area. A road converted to a sandy beach in the summer time. The street vendors selling books and postcards add to the atmosphere and each time you go to one of the bridges something different is there.
Riverside lunching. The Seine in Summer is delightful, whether cruising along it , promenading on either side or having lunch at a riverside bistro.

very nice. We took a ride on the Seine River at night and I thought it was very beautiful and you saw a lot of the buildings lit up including the Eiffel Tower. Lots of activities along the River. I recommend this.
CLEAN and unpopular (yay!). Such a (surprisingly) clean river. Stand on any bridge and you have stunning views. Not very busy either.

Wonderful Boat Trip. La Seine runs through the entirety of Paris, so it is impossible not to come across this well-known river when you are there. We decided to go one step more and take a boat tour on the Seine. It was a worthy and valuable experience, as we not only had the chance to repose on a placid ride, but also viewed many famous Parisian monuments from our boat.

Paris from the River. The boat tour I took on the Paris Pass took us from the quay at the Eiffel Tower up past Notre Dame and back. The seats were just comfortable. No provision for life jackets. Ventilation inside the cabin was poor when the sun came out. And quite unfortunately the boat's pilot kept it quite close to the next boat thus spoiling some of the river view. But the views of the buildings along the river were very good.
Wow...Wow....Wow. We did a boat ride along the river seine....commentary was helpful as we enjoyed the beyootifuul architecture. Worth the trip. A must for all travelers!
enjoyable river experience. short tour of major monuments from river...comfortable boats available for tours allowing for relaxation on a hot afternoon

Views are awesome, boat is crowded. The views are amazing, but the boats are overcrowded and takes away from experience. The tour guide is soft spoken and no one seems to listen to what they are saying.

A River test bears Witness to the History of France. The city of Paris started out as an island in the middle of the river Seine. This unique geographical location helped protect it from invaders. We crossed the river Seine daily going to and fro our Latin Quarter hotel and every sight we visited. We also went on an afternoon river cruise, which I wholeheartedly recommend. The Cathedral of Notre Dame (setting for the coronation of France's kings and queens), the Louvre, (the royal palace of France before King Louis XIV moved his Court to Versailles), the Musee D'Orsay (former train station and now impressionist museum), are on its banks. If I had the time, I would have loved an evening river cruise.
Not romantic. Dirty and smelly. Not romantic. Looks like a swamp, views are better walking a long the river. Don't waist your money.
Very enjoyable. Great way to explore the river, commentary inside and downstairs only which was a shame as the best views are from the top of course.

One of the most beautiful rivers and quays in the world.. Beautiful river, much prettier than the Danube. Interesting old book sellers, plus the usual touristy art displays. Lovely walks across the various bridges.

River Seine Dinner Cruise. Dinner was much better than expected. Almost fine dining standards. River Seine was as expected and no surprises. It may be better to go at night as our dinner was an early seating.
Beautiful trip. For those visiting Paris,please make it a point for a boat trip across Seine,it will cover most of the tourist spots.It looks absolutely amazing in Evening
The Seine the heart of Paris. During your visit to Paris take a tour and see The Seine is a great visit and then walk near the river enjoy the artist and the places to take sun during summer

Beautiful river across the city of Paris... loved doing the Seine waterboat rides across the city..Its a good way to relax and see all the Parisian attractions as one gets to go all across the central Paris districts, all around the great attractions...Good part is the river tours typically start from Eiffel tower, recommend an evening boat ride by the river, a must..

Take a river cruise!. The River Seine courses thru the heart of Paris and allows you to get a feeling of some of the most important landmarks and buildings there. And its pretty cool to see all the people having picnics and drinks along the banks.

romantic view. walking along the seine is so romantic. i and my husband and our daughter hold hands while strolling the riverbanks, that is one moment to treasure. recommended for lovers to take a walk along the riverbanks esp, at night time.

Awestruck. Riding the bateau mouche is the best way to appreciate the architectural grandeur of Paris. Wherever you look, beauty accompanied by a strong sense of history, abounds. I deeply admire the success of the French people in restoring and maintaining historical buildings, bridges, statues... Awesome.
Beautiful River. This was a beautiful part of Paris. We took a river boat cruise and enjoyed the view as well as people watching.Our cruise ended with the Eiffel Tower all lit up.

Nice 1 hour river cruise. This was a nice ride on the river. It was a relaxing ride with beautiful views of the city. They didn't run on time though and they turned around, before getting to the statue of liberty, which was disappointing.

River Seine is the. It seems that the River Seine is an integral part of Paris as it appears to have some type of presence through the city when you least expect it. Some of our best photos were obtained from taking the photo from the Eiffel Tower Jules Verne restaurant of the river. From there, it is easy to see how it is such an integral part of French history and a beautiful adjunct to the city of lights.

Cruising the River Seine. I was on an Avalon River Cruise which docks near the Eiffel Tower. However, the cruise cannot navigate too far into the city, so we took a smaller tour cruise prior to starting the main cruise the next day. It was beneficial and interesting as it pointed out many of the interesting spots always more fun via water. The River Seine is a great river to cruise on and we love river cruises through Viking, Avalon, or Uniworld. We even saw where people live on boats. The River Seine is worth a visit, especially via a week long river cruise.

If you like the River do it.. It was windy cool day we sat on the outside edge of the boat where you have a large about a foot long listening device that you hold to your ear. The commentary was educational but the view was not so great you were too far down from the buildings .
Really crowded. We tried to take a boat ride on Seine but all the boats were extremely crowded I guess in the heat of summer in July this is what to expect

Lovely River in the Heart of Paris. We love the Seine! There's several spots where you can stroll along the river and take in the grandeur of Paris. Highly recommend a river tour and/or a stroll along the Seine. Love!

How does one not walk along the Seine?. Just a wonderful place to walk, regardless of the area you have explored. Watching the boats, the people, etc all very relaxing. In summer they create a Beach area that is really fun for the family.

How does one not walk along the Seine?. Just a wonderful place to walk, regardless of the area you have explored. Watching the boats, the people, etc all very relaxing. In summer they create a Beach area that is really fun for the family.

The best way to see Paris. We took a river cruise during our recent trip to Paris. Seeing Paris from the River Seine is a different experience that seeing the city from within. As the river winds through the city, one can truly appreciate the beauty of the city through its architecture and scenery. Highly recommended to get out onto the river.

Lovely trip on a river cruise. Boat trips available at Pont Neuf bridge. The weather was fabulous so it made the trip. Great guide who pointed out all the sights and places to visit along the way. A great view of the Eiffel Tower from the river.

Evening cruise a great way to see the Seine. An evening dinner cruise is an excellent way to see the Seine and the beautiful buildings along its banks. People sit all along the banks enjoying picnic style evening meals with a bottle of wine. Barges cruise up and down carrying freight. Dozens of short sight seeing cruises move up and down. The Seine is a major part of the Paris culture.

Major waterway in the city, can't miss it. It is nice and as it is the major waterway you can't miss it. The water is better than the Thames river in London, but it is not the most beautiful water in the world. I don't think you need to spend any time taking a boat ride on it, as you stay in Paris you will see it an enjoy it but don't need to plan any extra time to look it more closely.

Great river. Life in Paris is pretty much based around the Seine which divides the city into the left and right bank. Every night, Parisians picnic, sit, dance, etc on the bank of the Seine. There are beautiful building all around the river and gorgeous bridges that crosses it. You should definitely take one of the cruises in the river as well as walk along its bank.

Summer cruise the Seine!. If you do one thing when you arrive in Paris (1st visit) do the river boat trip. I would advise an evening / night cruise (more atmosphere). it's a good way to orientate yourself and the views are truly amazing.
cruise. Dinner cruise was wonderful, Paris landmarks @ night with good food and entertainment.worth booking a trip.

Seine River Cruise. We took a river boat cruise from the base of the Eiffel Tower at 10:00 p.m. and it was still light outside. It was very enlightening, beautiful and informative. Just as we returned to the Eiffel Tower the lights were flashing all over the tower. Beautiful!!!
Love is everywhere.. The boat ride is serene and beautifully attractive. Just forget all your worries and enjoy everything that passes by the ride..you will feel love everywhere.
Cruise at River Seine. It was a nice experience on cruise here. The cruise was very nice. Big and well designed. Nice music and a very good sightseeing on the way.

River in the middle of the city.... Situated in the center of the city, it gives the city of love more romantic feel...We did a cruise of this river which allows you to see different monuments and visit points in the city from a distance...
This was very relaxing and great photo opportunities. This was a lunch cruise and the meal was a la carte 3 course we had a very relaxing and inexpensive cruise only 41 euro each
Nice to See the City from the Seinne. We took a hop on and hop off tour that included the bateaux bus, which was a great way to get back from the Eiffel Tower without worrying about taxi's!

great river boat ride in the evening. You won't be disappointed if you take the river boat cruise. In the evening all the buildings including the Eiffel tower are lit up and make for great pictures. We went in May and it was quite chilly so check the weather forecast and dress appropriately. There is a heated enclosure if you want to get out of the elements. Get there early to select the seat of your choice - lines start forming 30 mins before departure,

The shore was lined with people quietly enjoying this wonderful river. Enjoyed seeing all the nightlife on the river from a dinner cruise boat. We chose Marina de Paris, but there are several. The water is much cleaner than it was years ago, so bravo for that. Loved seeing the peniches and party boats as well.

Cruising Paris. The many cruises that go up and down the River Seine all provide a great view and a prime opportunity to orientate yourself and get a great view of the city. It also provides you with a chance to sit down and rest you feet.Pick your provider but the route remains much the same. Then sit down, relax and enjoy the ride. Well worth the cost.

Walk the river for great views of Paris. If you're in Paris, get out of your vehicle (car / bus / taxi / subway) and *walk* along the river. Cross the bridges. See the views of Paris landmarks like the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame. Experience the neighborhoods along the river. My wife and I chose to walk rather than take transportation, and we never regretted it. Even the 2.5km walk from Tuilleries to the Eiffel Tower passed quickly, and we had spectacular views of the Eiffel Tower in the twilight.

Ah the Beautiful Seine.... Beautiful. We got a Seine river cruise included with our Eiffel Tower and Louvre package with Get Your Guide. This is the only time we had to wait in line. The boat leaves right by the EiffelTower and doesn't stop. You see some amazing sights. We didn't have a lot of time in Paris so it was a great way to see Notre Dame, Ile de Citi and all the lovely bridges. It takes an hour and returns to where it left. Our boat didn't have drinks or anything- I saw some of the cruises had bars. It did have a WC. I was amazed at how busy the riverbanks got in the warm, summer evenings: groups of friends sitting on the banks, dangling their feet over the water, chatting, laughing; always with a bottle or two of wine in the middle. Nobody was obnoxious or misbehaving, just relaxed and enjoying life. I don't think I'll ever forget that.

Views of the Seine Aplenty - Very Relaxing.. Wide River, blue sky and lots going on along the River Seine, we were very happy to sit and watch the various boats, pleasure craft and tourist vessels motoring along. Always something happening on the Seine. A nice spot to relax for a while.
Excellent Lunch aboard Bateaux Parisiens. Beautiful lunch setting while cruising the Seine. Ample food & beverage which was a notch or two above average. Very enjoyable 3 hours.

We stayed in an apt. Overlooking it by the pont neuf bridge. Great river tours, and we watch the Bastille day fire works on the bank. Couldn't be happier that night. As I looked down the water was actually pretty clean too. Must check out the ile de la cite.

Messing about on the water. A very leisurely way to see some Paris treasures, tours are just over an hour and can to caught at the foot of the eifle tower by the carousel, a great way to catch the breeze and relax
Paris lights. It is always fun to take the evening cruise down the Seine. The commentary is mediocre, but the lighted monuments and buildings are beautiful.

Beautiful walk. What I enjoyed so much about the River Seine was just strolling along, looking at the beautiful views, enjoying the summer air, and people-watching! It can be a nice leisurely afternoon!

Beautiful Walk. The walk along the Seine is wonderful. Along the way you will see beautiful architecture, artist painting and sketching their master pieces, loving cafes, little outdoor vendors selling everything from books, photos, to plastic tourist stuff. The experience was fabulous. I would recommend doing the walk both day and in the evening. The city is beautiful in the day but magical in the evening lights along the river. A walk we will remember for a lifetime.
Lovely scenery. Really enjoyed this. It was so peaceful and yet able to see many of the sights and get good photographs without all the hustle & bustle of people.

Take a boat ride. The boat ride was beautiful and well worth it. That is a must do. It is nice the walk by it on the street and cross it over the bridges, but don't bother going down the stairs and walking right next to the river. It is filthy, smelly and disappointing. In many places you feel like the riff raff of the city lives down there. The river is much better experienced from a distance or on a boat.
Take the 1hr river cruise. Wow! Worth taking the river cruise (I think it was less than 15 euros per person). You will see Paris like you can't any other way. Fantastic Views!!!
Fantastic. This was fantastic if you want to relax and just cruise we would highly recommend this, But read up on the Paris pass as you have to buy the tickets at the Eiffel tower before entering!

beautiful. Had a Seine cruise one evening, boat very packed, need to prebook tickets if possible. Scenery along the river just super, all the lovely iconic buildings, student life on the banks, other boats (some with dinner and parties). Bridge lights, then the Eifel Tower, lit up and sparkling on the hour after dark, just wonderful!

Super place for some quiet time!. After all the walking around in Paris, me and my friend took a bottle of red and sat by the Pont des arts bridge by the bank of the river. we spent 5 hours here with bagles and philladelhia cheese and some music, just enjoying the view and looking at the cruises passing by. Best time spent! :)
Different view of Paris from the boat. A pleasent jurney on the river Seine. In a short time you can see most of places you have visited by foot. On a hot day this is a thing to do

Nice leisurely afternoon. We did a Seine River boat (BatoBus) to just cruise up and down the Seine. The BatoBus is a Hop On, Hop Off system so it's not really a "tour" but they do point out major attractions. The nice thing is that you see a lot - the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre, the Statue of Liberty - Paris. BatoBus seemed to be the only boat that went around the Statue of Liberty. I definitely recommend cruising the Seine.

Most beautiful river. I could walk by this river forever. There are so many places from which to contemplate it -- from a boat ride, or the walkway along the two banks, or any of the fabulous bridges. Try to get a hotel within walking distance and spend lots of time by the Seine.

Beautiful Night on the Seine. We had a perfect night for our cruise on the Seine. People everywhere along the river enjoying the beautiful evening with friends drinking their wine and waving to us on the boat.

A must to see. A river is just a river you say but, if you start out by crossing over Pont Alexandre 111 bridge which is the most ornate bridge in Paris you wil I guarantee that the walk to the Louve wil get you into the Parisian mood. In our pleasant walk along the seine we saw site seeing boats filled with tourists enjoying themselves, merchants selling their wares, and like ourselves drinking in the atmosphere. Now if you really want a good look at the river your next stop should be the Eiffel tower were the view is spectacular. Good luck and enjoy
Relaxing hour. Took the 1hr round trip. Very relaxing gentle cruise down the Seine from the Eiffel tower down to Notre Dame. Would have gave 5 stars if the audio guide was better quality.
It was ok. It is better than the River Thames but not as good as other rivers. Its got graffiti around, if that bothers you.
Boat Tour & Plenty of Vendors. Plenty to see, our boat tour was cheesy and not great service but the bridges along the seine are not to be missed for wonderful views.

Tranforming before your eyes. Thanks to Mayor Hidalgo's vision and unfailing efforts to reduce cars on the streets of Paris, the roads are being returned to the people of Paris - and for us tourists. We had a fascinating introduction to the latest reclaimed area on a Sunday. We discovered rentable tents and teepees, pizza places, restos and pop-up bistros and lots of people. Where else can you sit and play checkers, chess or backgammon on table tops already designed for play? How about ping pong and bat balls and railroad ties artfully placed and stacked to rest or relax during your walk. Just wonderful.

Cruise. we took a cruise along the seine this summer and we really enjoyed it! It gave you a change to take in the views while learning a bit about them and all from a different arena, 15 euro for an adult ticket and staff were very friendly
nice ride in the river. Many rides along the river offered and we took the service with a special champagne or crepe. Kind of nice to complete the ride.

River du pee?. This time the seine river cruise was a disappointment. Booked the vertu du nuf, tour which was one hour long and strictly okay. But the guide didn't know english properly and was a little flippant about it. Also the walk around the river was spoiled by the stink of pee, maybe it was the hot summer and the lack of rain but really Paris, Seine cannot be like one big urinal.

It flows!. It's a river and it flows. The wide bridges and roads around it are beautiful. In the evening, young people would sit around with wine but at no point we felt unsafe or unwelcome. During the day I was able to find some lovely Babar prints.
Boats.... Saw a beautiful elegant looking lunch cruise, something I'd like to do on my next visit! A must see when you visit.
What needs to be said?. Every city needs a river like this! London has one, but Paris even beats that.Wonderful! A Bateau Mouche trip is a must.
Beautiful stroll. It's hard to miss this famous river, as it circles around the heart of Paris. An early morning or late night stroll along the river is a great way enjoy the city.

A wonderful place to walk.. I have just come back from a walk along the Seine here in Paris. I am from Las Vegas so I live in the desert. I went over the Sully Morland bridge and down the other side and walked all along the river. So beautiful. I walked quite a ways and then turned around and came back, just as beautiful !!!
,. was looking forward to this tri and wasn't disappointed. the weather spoilt things however, a pac a mac was very useful that day a very pleasant tri with informative guide to boot.
Visit. Batobus was excellent with very good information onboard. Its a great way to get about, just hop on and off and you can get more than a one day pass.
river sight seeing. Great way to see Paris at a leisurely pace. So many bridges! Reasonably priced and very informative.
Stroll along Seine. Nice walk along Seine by Notre Dame. Street performers and lovely views great way to get away from hustle and bustle and relax and enjoy Paris.
Beautiful Paris !!. This is one of the best place to see in Paris, Everything is awesome about this place..... If you are there is Paris Must Visit this place !! :)
Floating down the River. We did a Champagne Cruise down the river with a guide from City Wonders. It was worth every Euro. They also took is up the Eiffel tower and skipped the line.

No river with prettier surroundings. I have travelled to over fifty countries in the world, but will be difficult to match any other river with more interesting sights. The boat cruise and the walk along the banks is something will always remember. The city is so clean.

DON'T GET IT....it's not pretty but..... The Seine River is an essential means of fast transportation to get around to the major tourist attractions in Paris with acceptable graffiti along the way with views of unlanscaped pathways but this is your best way to get around.
Cool river in the city. We did the river cruise. Great cruise where you can see all the highlights of Paris. Great to just sit by the water.

Boat Tour. When visiting Paris one MUST go on a boat tour, for an even better experience, go on a boat tour at night. There are lots of tours to choose from, dinner boats where you can sit on the deck and enjoy fine dining or just a tourist boat where you can sit out and watch Paris come alive at dusk.
Take your cruise at Dusk. You want to cruise by when the Eiffel Tower lights blink for the 5 minutes at dusk.....you can't to to Paris and not take a cruise on the River Seine.
Day or Night - Very Paris. we did 2 tours....by day & by night .... both interesting, informative, relaxing & visually special - Especially the bridges & the Tower.
Good Views. A nice way to finish a day of sightseeing. A chance to sit down & enjoy the views. A running commentary helps identify landmarks along the way

Scenic walk from Louvre to Notre Dame Cathedral. On a sunny day, take a stroll from the Louvre to Notre-Dame Cathedral. It's a wonderful way to appreciate the views, the city's architecture and also market stalls along the way.

Excellent. A 1hour cruise down the Seine on an amazing warm blue sky day in Paris .
Floating past the stunning Notre Dame , under all the bridges & seeing very up close .
The buildings along the river & the history .
Not crowded & very enjoyable way of seeing a tiny part of the amazing city of Paris .

Nice Cruise. Definitely must go on the river cruise....especially in the evening...you will enjoy it. You get to see a lot of the buildings, and its fun to see all the parisians sitting on the banks of the river having a party

Great for Tours and Picnics. We took an evening boat tour of the Seine and it was beautiful. At night everything is lit up, so you can still see the attractions - plus, you get to see the Eiffel Tower shimmer. If you don't fancy a boat ride, grab a few nibbles from a local shop and have a picnic along the banks. It is magical!

An essential part of a Paris trip. Since you can't avoid the Seine, the real question is how to build it in to your schedule for your visit. The answer is to keep going back. See the river by day and walk along its banks. Spend time in the booksellers' stalls. Come back at night to one of the bridges, and if the weather permits, take your river cruise then. The buildings along the river are beautifully floodlit.

Got to do ti!. No visit to Paris is complete without an evening cruise on the Seine - great views, beautiful architecture and really rather magical! Preferably take your lover and be enchanted by Paris!
River traffic. We spend about an hour just watching the different boats using the river. The pathways also had shops which my wife and daughters found to be interesting and entertaining

Essential Paris. You must see Paris from this river. I have not done a dinner cruise, but took the Batobus daily somewhere/anywhere. From this vantage point, you can travel to many points of interest in the city, and feel the pulse of the river...see the views from the river..become enveloped in these lively banks. Such visual richness. If you don't want to get on the Batobus, get some wine bread and cheese and find a place to sit on the banks and watch the world go by from that vantage point. There is nothing like it.

Romantic walks. Avoid the noisy busy streets and head along the river walks. Some areas are lovely, but under bridges prepare for the smell of urine!
It is advisable to wear good walking shoes and the cobbles can trap and trip feet.
An early dinner cruise. A fantastic way to get exposure to Paris and enjoy dining with family or friends. A relaxed way to end a summers day in Paris.

Take a cruise in the late evening. As first I thought the cruise would be "meh" as the young kids say these days. It was so much fun!! And my teenagers loved it. We went on the 8pm boat. We bought tickets at the base of the Eiffel Tower, last minute and still got seats at the front of the boat. The explanations of the sights were good and in multiple languages. It's totally worth the money!!

A lovely trip on the river through Paris. On a sunny summer's day what a great relaxation .......a trip along the River Seine looking at all the sights along the River. One of the best ways to do it is the reasonably priced circular tour.........no refreshments on board but you can get off at any of the stops with the one price ticket, walk around the different areas and then get the next boat twenty minutes later to go on to other stops.

The most peasant and most admired. If you are in Paris and have time - nothing like taking a walk all along the Siene - starting at the beginning and ending at Effile tower . This will give the magnifecient view of the most well known monuments lining all along the Siene . Do not forget the pair of good walking shoes . Takes about half the day . You can take the break - the eateries lining up the enchanting walk .

go on a boat tour!. for just over 10 euros, definitely book a boat tour, we went on an evening one which was just lovely, hearing about the history (we had a lovely guide) and also seeing everything lit up, especially the Eiffel Tower!!!beautiful!

Lovely view of Paris. It is great to take the seine river cruise. One gets to C the Paris architecture plus has a chance to visit al the main tourist attractions. Thou be prepared for some heat in summer!!

lovely river. Great . Get the river bus then you can hop on and off, you will want to go up and down a few times as so much to see. A nightime cruse is magically and the effrel tower is splendidly lit up, so go later in the evening for best experience.

Beautiful in all seasons, especially summer nights. You cannot go to Paris without passing by this river tens of times. Just be careful in winter and make sure to cover your ears as it can be freezing cold near the water. Such a beautiful place to see in every single season, but in summer most of all; go there at night and stand on the side facing the Eiffel Tower and wait for them to light it up at night. It is lovely especially since the sun doesn't go down till almost 10 PM in summer; and tends to wake up the sleeping writer in you! Absolutely beautiful!

Cruise. the cruise is amazing and you can see almost all of paris while on cruise. right from eifiel tower to notre dam etc.......have an ice cream or coffee by the river banks.....in fact its even more wonderful in the night.

Roimantic lifelinnethrough the heart of Paris. What a beautiful river to have flowing through the city - lots of bridges to cross over from left to right. Lots of picturesque photo opportunities. I was surprised at how clean it was considering its past history. Paris has truly embraced the Seine as its heart & soul.
Evening Tour. An evening tour on a boat is a must for any traveler of any age or any budget. This is a great way to overview Paris. If you could only do one thing in Paris. This would be it.
Best way to see Paris in the evening. We took a night cruise to see Paris lit up at night, best way to see all the glamour of the historic monuments.
Relax. What better way to relax than a River cruise on the Seine? Just made the day. Something I will never forget. Likes. Everything. Dislikes. Nothing.

Wine and Dine on the Banks. If you're from North America, this is a novel idea, but take a bottle or wine, or beer, and go sit on the banks of the Siene after dinner.We sat near the tip of Ile de la Cite, a great spot. It is filled with locals. We met a Parisian couple and talked the night away about the city and life.A wonderful experience.Couple it with some cheese and meat, and you're now enjoying a truly authentic Parisian experience, something you won't get at the tourist stops. If you don't want to sit on the ground, there are numerous cafes and bars along the Siene as well, right on the water.Obviously a boat cruise is great too, but do it the way the locals do. Head down at night, and watch the sun set over the city.
# 1 Reviewer. nice boat cruise at night time takes you to Notre Dame and back again, but not much in between. see the Eifel tower lit up at night, pretty good.

Early Dinner on the River Seine. A great way to have a good meal and enjoy the sights simultaneously, and would recommend it for all. The waiters were extremely attentive, even taking photos of us all. The food choice was good and varied-something for everyone, and the meal lasted the duration of the trip...2 hours. Views of the Eiffel Tower from a different angle. The price included the trip, 3 course meal, wine, water and coffee and was extremely good value and something you can only do in Paris!

Great views, wonderful place to see people. Great views of the Eiffel tower, lots of cheap eats, lots of great people watching. Even with all the touts (and there are many), it was fun. About a thousand roller bladers came skating by. DH said there were fire dancers at night.
Very scenic. Took a river cruise on the Seine and went by the Louvre, the Eiffel tower and other famous landmarks. Observed the Parisians picnicking and strolling all along the river.

Beautiful. A beautiful part of a beautiful city.On either side of the banks there is a lot to see, visit and discover.You can spend entire days walking from one part of town to the next via the borders of the Seine.

A second view. In a city like Paris, investing in a hop on-hop off is a great thing. The bus, more or less, takes you to every corner of Paris. A boat ride does something similar in that sense however it gives you a completely different view of the city. It actually gives people some insight into life before roads and bridges came into being. And if the weather is good, then it's quite a nice relaxing and romantic ride that it isn't a very expensive proposition. So if you haven't been on many cruise boats, then it's something worth doing once.
Night Tour. I would highly recommend any of the Bateaux Mouches boat tours along the Seine. The Paris monuments are just beautiful at night!

Excellent way to see sites from the water. We travelled the city circuit on the Seine by water taxi . It was a comfortable ,cheap way to see some of the city sites and you can hop on and off. The view of the Eiffel tower from the water is excellent . It is easily accessible we boarded at Notre Dame .

Batobus ride. We took the Batobus during the day and did a loop. You can hop on and off and it is just nice to get out of the hustle and bustle of the streets. Finishes at 9.30 pm. In the darker months you could probably use this to do your own illuminations tour.

RIVER OF DREAMS. GO on an evening dinner cruise on a floating restaurant like the vintage boat Le Calife. Sail for two hours under the romantically lit-up bridges of Paris and marvel at the Eiffel Tower when it explodes into a mass of sparkles each night on the hour. However, at the height of summer it may be too light to see this spectacle until 11 o'clock.
Lovely boat ride. Peaceful and lovely, another way to see highlights of city, could have something to eat and drink, especially at night time

Magical and heart warming sight. Walking along the Seine was one of my favorite parts of my holiday in Paris and its magical in the evening. The piers are packed with people enjoying the sunset - Bar Boats with music and drinks, children playing hopscotch, picnics on blankets; with views of the city's bridges, Notre Dame, river boats and the Eiffel Tower. Lovely to see.

Romantic. It was such a good experience for me to walk from Bastil to Eiffel Tower during almost 2 hours,but I enjoy every moment along both sides of River Seine.Such a beautiful architecture alone the way.You can make many stop for a picture.It is such a beautiful walk

A walk along the beautiful banks of the Seine is a must.. An early evening walk along the bank of the Seine from the Eiffel Tower to Invalides is just relaxing and mind blowing. As I was all alone, I really enjoyed the cool and calm breeze, watching the sunset. You could see the Seine and Notre-Dame from the Bistro downstairs and were able to see the Eiffel Tower all alight in the evening.

Basic river cruise. The river cruise is a must for nice views of various attractions along the Seine, but the upper deck gets very crowded, people pushing for seats on edge to get better photos. Need to book in advance to do cruise close to sunset. Cruise supposed to go for 1hour 15 mins, but barely goes an hour. Time is made up with getting on and off with the crowds.

Scenic Corridor. Wonderful to walk along although keep an eye out for the pickpocket ploys. And you MUST get a Batubus day pass to sightsee from the river and to travel to the many attractions along the river from the Eiffel Tower to the Ile Saint-Louis.
Stunning in blue skies. Really beautiful on the boat cruise in brilliant blue skies and historical buildings on both sides. Different views from the boat. Definitely worth the boat cruise ticket.

Touristy but still a must!. The bateaux tour is very touristy nonetheless a must once in Paris. It is certainly a romantic view of parts of the city specially if you are able to go during sunset or evening. We were able to purchase the tickets in advance, but the tour was very crowded. Once onboard it went as expected. It was nice to see the Parisians enjoying their evening, sitting alongside the river, sharing picnics or just chatting. Definitely a must while in Paris!
Not worth the money. Didn't care for the river tour at all. Best way to see it is by walking or biking... If you do decide to take a tour on the river take it at night when the city is all lit up.
A birthday treat from a teenager. On a hot April there is nothing more wonderful to enjoy a stroll along the seine not only enjoying the view but the wonderful sights that are included :-)
So romantic ". What a beautiful river walk along the bridges people on a hot night sit along and enjoy the night people even dance along the banks take a river cruise for dinner well worth it !

one of the best ways to travel in the centre. Batobus was a great way to travel , a two day pass economical , allows you to hop on and off to see many places and enjoy the cooling breezes at the river on hot days.
Dinner Cruise. Great way to see the city. they all depart from the pier in front of the eiffle tower. ours went from 8-11.

Walk the Banks. When we live in Paris, we are in the 16th about two blocks from the Seine. So, we frequently walk into Paris along its banks -- we can walk on either the left bank or the right bank. It is a great way to see Paris as long as the weather is cool. We can also take the 72 bus from Pont de Bir Hakeim to Hotel de Ville. It is the best bus route in Paris, going past every major attraction adjacent to the Seine.

Seine River Cruise. The Seine River Cruise is an amusing way to see many of the sights of Paris. It is NOT a luxury tour! You sit and see the sights as you pass them, with humorous narration in 5 languages. That is it. Our boat was fully enclosed so it did not matter that it was cold and raining. With the tickets we had purchased in advance through Viator on-line, our wait-time to board was approximately 80 minutes. The cruise lasted about the same length of time.

Dinner cruise. I thought this was a great way to see the attractions along the river. We had a nice dinner and went up and back along the river. We saw locals and tourists sitting along the banks of the river enjoying the sunset with their food and drinks. Nice experience for sure.

LOVELY WAY TO SEE THE CITY. I saw London, paris and Bristol by boat and definitely recommend tis as a fun way to get around a city and see it from a different P.V.v and give feet tired from walking a rest. We took the batobus hop-on-off which was lovely and inexpensive but for the high heat day we took it on. Go prepared to walk and walk or take taxis between destinations.

See Paris from The Boat!. Yes, you have to see Paris form the boat, this is a must! You will get to experience the city from a different view, from the Notre Dame Cathedral to the Eiffel Tower. You get to see that and much more. There is no commentary on this ride, but it is a way to see the city in a completely different way! Trust me, this is a "must"!!!

walk or take a boat ride. you can loose youself on the lower walkways of the Seine or on the Boat that tours the river taking in the bridges and the street proformers, scate boarder, cyclists and courting couples

All over Paris, the Seine is a must see. Either you take a touristic boat (Le Bateaux de Paris) or stroll through its banks, the Seine is a full attraction in Paris. A good suggestion is to walk by all the bridges because each one has a different story.

spectacular dinner cruise. The food was outstanding and the band was spectacular. The range of music was perfect. Unfortunately there were no CD's of the music to buy to relive the memories. However, the song "Happy" will forever remind me of my best evening in Paris.
Brillaintand better than going going up the eiffel tower. Do this at night when the lights of the city are dancing and the bands and couples are partying on the banks of the Seine...

River Seine. Buy a reverse ticket and take a boat down the River Seine and see Paris from another angle. The boat houses are interesting and some of them really made an effort to create a home on the water. One can get off when you feel like it, eat a light lunch and then get back on the boat and enjoy the trip back. It's a must if you visit Paris!

Seeing the Eiffel Tower light up on our return trip was one of the highlights of Paris. Highly recommend especially if you take one right before dark because you are coming back to the dock you will see the Eiffel Tower light up. It was pretty amazing! Great memory! Plus the headsets were great at letting you know where you were and all the history as you floated down the river.

Excellent Place to be in. River Seine, I personally liked it very much, place is nice and beautiful, must must visit if you want to spend some quality time. I recommend you need to spend at least 2 hours in this place to feel the beauty of the place.
Baat Rides - book on French Tourism site for a discount. Excellent 1 hr ride down the Seine for 10 Euros. If you book online before and print out the tickets, it is better value. Highly recommended

Sprinkle my ashes here, please!. If there was one thing that defined our visit to France, this river would be it. We walked along it, dined along it, ate ice cream perched on it's banks, floated over it in a balloon, crossed it many times over bridges....but I still couldn't get enough. It's amazing how a river that slices through a huge city like Paris, has managed to became an integral part of French culture. I'd never think of laying down a picnic basket and popping champagne at any other river, but La Seine. And it is a very pretty river, clean, with large embankments for people to sit and enjoy themselves. In that respect, it beats the Thames hands down. I've made my will.

River Cruise . Definitely do this. Boats take you up and down the Seine River to see Paris sites along the river. It is relaxing, very fairly priced, and a good first night activity. You are picked up and dropped back off right by the Eiffel Tower. Take an evening cruise and you will return just in time to return to see the Tower light show - another "don't miss."All of the different companies do the same tour route so just pick the one you want but try to get a boat that all seats face one side or the other not seats facing forward.

Ah, a river runs through it. After hearing all sorts of bad things about the Seine, I found strolling along this river very enjoyable. The water looked decent (not that I would swim in it) but even with all the tour boats chugging along, there was a cleanliness about it. And the best part, there are all those cool bridges to walk ovear or look at. Well worth it.

Watch your pockets. the river cruise was fun, but the pickpockets in the area are a real threat. Almost everyone we met, including me, got pickpocketed at this site. Not worth the risk, even if you are very careful.

Museum on the water. Eight centuries of the history of Paris are along the river banks. Bridges, palaces, offices, Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame are waiting for you. It takes only one hour and many boat companies do this tour. The boats leave every 30 min so no rush. If you are tired of walking have a sit on the boat and relaxe. Night tour is romantic and mysterious as the boats have very powerful spotlights. Below the Orsay museum is a pedestrian area along the river where you can relax without being on the boat and the kids can play around. I like the pedestrian bridge Pont des Arts, no longer loaded with thousands of padlocks which were removed recently and there is no more possibility to leave yours.
seine river cruise. Took a cruise at night, buy tickets from your hotel and get there early for night cruise in the summer. Have your camera ready!

Great way to see Paris. Splurge and take one of the many Seine cruises it is a great way to relax and take in many of the wonders that Paris has to offer. Especially pretty at night, the view of the lights is incredible.

Loved the floating tour!. Great prospective for a romantic look at the river side sights. Water appeared really clean and the skill of the captain was evident... Much less harrowing than the street traffic above... Loved the fellow swimming and then getting pulled in by the river police....

Overpriced with no commentary. I used the Batobus and would not recommend it if you are a tourist wanting a guided tour of the areas surrounding the Seine. It was very expensive and there was no commentary. It was literally a water bus with 6 stops.It is worth doing a trip along the Seine as you get a different perspective of the city, but I would recommend the Bateaux Mouche, where you get a guided commentary.
You MUST take a cruise when in Paris!. We took an evening cruise from Pont de Neuf, no reservations necessary, and it was gorgeous...everything all lit up! It's a wonderful way to see the city!
Coolest way to see some of the major attractions. Especially during a heat wave, this is the best place to be, and also a convenient way to get around, with the various boat services available.

The Seine. The River Seine is beautiful. I think it is more beautiful than the Thames River in London, because of the scenery along it. As we drove along it, we could see people walking and enjoying their Saturday. Also, an extra treat was to see a Viking River Cruise docked not far from the Eiffel Tower.

A Quintessential Paris Experience. Wonderful experience hanging by the river at Notre Dame and walking along the river on NYE to the Eiffel Tower with champagne in hand the whole way. Gorgeous day or night, but the lights at night lend to that magical feeling of Paris! Plus, this is Joan of Arcs ashes were spread. Can't wait for next visit to bike ride along the banks.

River or Canal Seine in Paris. Somehow I thought it would be nicer. My husband and I did go down the stairs to sit my the River? more a canal. We had wine, cheese and a baguette. It was peaceful; but there aren't that many benches to sit on. I really wasn't impressed. The San Antonio River walk is much nicer and it is in the old USA.

Enjoy in the evening. The Seine is a great place to enjoy in the summer. No matter where you are you will often find many people enjoying beer/wine and food. We even witnessed a jazz band one night which was free and playing the best music!

Relax Along the Historic Seine River cruise. We took the dinner cruise along the River Seine. We did the early cruise at 6pm because we had to get up early the next day. It was a lovely experience. We purchases tickets with a window view table and it was amazing to see the town and sites from a river view perspective. The dinner was actually quite good for a boat food and beverage perspective. We really enjoyed this experience and would highly recommend it - very relaxing - not too crowded.

Nothing like a boat ride on the Seine. I took two boat tours on the Seine River while in Paris last month. One was a Bateaux Mouche tour which runs all day and goes up and down the river on 1.5 hour rides, pointing out the major sites (the Louvre, Notre Dame, the Eiffel Tower). My friend and I bought some wine and sandwiches at the ticket office area and had a lovely late afternoon ride on a beautiful sunny day. It was perfect as we had been walking all day. Later in the week, I had a business dinner on a boat on the Seine. It, too, was nice but a rainstorm and dark skies made it a little more difficult to see the beautiful sights along the way. All in all, I would recommend a ride on the Seine -- touristy but well worthwhile. The boats do not rock much at all so do not worry about getting seasick.

Serene experience. Sitting beside river Seine in the shadow of Eiffel Tower is a feeling one can not describe. Despite being such a great tourist attraction, there is a calmness and silence about Seine. There are artists, dancers, musicians all doing what they know best. But you could sit there for hours, soaking the beauty and stillness of Seine.
Night time cruise!. Best time to enjoy the river would be around 9 pm. The cruise at this time affords a beautiful lighted view of most monuments of Paris. Fabulous and well organized.
Very cool area. Loved our walk along the Seine. It's definitely local and a lively area. Very cool atmosphere, especially at night when lots of people have picnics and enjoy nightlife.

Love sitting on the banks of the Seine. We went there two nights in a row. It is peaceful and gives you an insight into the Parisan way of life. They love to pack hampers and sit on the banks of the river. There is music by local artists and the cool weather and ferries down the river - just let life take you by.

Great way to see the city. The river flows right through the heart of the city, with all the major attractions situated along it. A very good introduction to the city is to take a cruise on one of the many boats along the river.

Beautiful wherever you were. We walked so much in Paris, and there was the River Seine wherever you were. When we were there, the water was placid, cerulean all the time. I took so many photos of that magnificent body of water that just embodies all that Paris is!

Nice River Cruise - Gives Different Views. Taking the river cruise on the Seine was a lovely way to see the sights from an entirely different perspective. The boats have guides that give a narrative in both French and English. It's a lovely way to spend a late afternoon or early evening after lots of walking and sightseeing.

The beauty of Europe. Beautiful experience cruising the River Siene. It was a hour boat ride which was well worth it. My husband and I saw old stone and castle like buildings. We saw the Lourve as we travel down the River Siene, the Eiffel Tower which was awesome. The beauty of each bridge we passed had gold trimmings and wonderful statues.

Central river in Paris. We spent 7 days on a Viking River Cruise of the Seine, and then 3 more days afterward in Paris, so we saw a LOT of the river. The good: it has lovely views on both banks in Paris & many beautiful bridges. The bad: it It is green, unclean, and doesn't smell good. The ugly: (see "the bad").

Parisian city life. While strolling along the River Seine one weekend evening, we happened upon a Parisian way of life along the river. There were hundreds of mostly young people picnicking along the river as the sun was about to set. It was so cute to see all the young people group after group along the river enjoying wine and conversation. And boy do they like there wine...many bottles lined up on each blanket. Very cute.

Great way to start a visit to Paris. We got lucky -- it was pouring rain in the afternoon when we arrived, but had stopped to a slight trickle by the time we decided to take the one hour boat ride on the river. So, the boat was nearly empty! The hour was well worth it, especially in the late evening when all the lights were on the structures. It was a great way to get a feeling for the layout of the city...
Great morning on the river. My wife and I really enjoyed the boat trip up and back down the Seine, with excellent photos taken of Notre-Dame and Effel Tower

Evening cruising on the Seine. We went on a Bateaux Mouches cruise one evening in June 2015. The food was really nice, and the one bottle per couple wine supplied was well chosen. On our particular cruise the pianist and violinist were amazing, obviously having worked together many times and developed a routine which they worked through with vigour. No tired old 'done it too many times' attitude here. Expensive (minimum 99 Euro), but worth it.
hot. we got there during 90 degree weather so the banks were packed with people trying to cool off and visit. the boat was a leisurely pace doen the rivers going by popluar spots ,

Wonderful experience. Saw (&crossed) the River Seine so many times during my visit but had one of the greatest experiences doing a dinner cruise with Bateaux-Mouches. The scenery traveling down the river during daylight and then back up at night was breathtaking! Seeing the many landmarks light up makes you realize why they call it the City of Light.
Lovely trip. Saw Paris from a different perspective, the left bank is lovely, very relaxing, especially at sunset.

It's all about the river. In Paris, it's all about the river. Take the time to explore both sides and each bridge. It's a great way to find out about Paris neighborhoods and Paris history. And it's beautiful.

Steeped in history. Any cruise will take you past the most famous structures of Paris. You get good photo opportunities and the river appears clean with lots of locals along the way. Most offer English and French Commentry. Audio for other languages are on some too. Beat the crowds by seeing 'it' from the Seine

More serene than expected. Although hustle and bustle of sightseeing boats abound, the river is such an important part of Paris. Fun to walk alongside when going from one place to another. Did not have time to do a river cruise, which I think was a mistake.

Seine in the Sun. Our brief stay only permitted a couple of venture besides a passing glance. This boat ride covered details that provided an overview of information for later points to visit. The unusually hot, sunny weather made the topless boat we were in a little uncomfortable.
Great walk. Strongly recommend walking along the river near sunset or at night. You'll pass many of the famous attractions in Paris, and have a unique view, not to mention good exercise
Breathtaking scenery!. A cruise on the Seine is a must - especially if the weather is nice. The hop-on cruise was the best way to get around!
Nite River tour. we took one of the boat tours at night. We loved the night lights of Paris. This was our 3rd night tour

Great photo opportunities. A great way to see many major landmarks of Paris is to board the bateau mouche and relax. Although the commentary is a little monotonous, it is very informative and spoken in English, French, German and Japanese I think.Notre Dame, the left bank, Eiffel Tower and the bridges are easily photographed. You can move around to get the best views but go to the toilet before you board!!

O bateau taxi!... Made a real difference to our trip to Paris. Great views from the river and time to look at the beautiful buildings. People devoted to their selfies missed a lot! Used for visits both sides of the Seine and saw a lady singing - practising for the Opera?

Lifeblood of Paris. Beautiful river for sailing on or walking beside, plenty to see as it meanders through this gorgeous city. We took a boat trip at night, arriving at the Eiffel Tower just as it lit up. You can see many of the iChat's just by walking along the banks.
Great on a hot day. It was a very relaxing way to see some of the sights from a different prespective. Cool breeze on a hot day

Probably the best way to see Paris. Paris, like many other European cities, is based around its river, which means that most of the beautiful buildings can be viewed best from the river. There are a number of boat companies, we used Bateaux Mouches, which although a bit on the expensive side, meant having a good deal of space (especially when going on one of the late afternoon boats, when most of the coach parties have departed) and a good view of the sights.

Stunning City of Lights by boat. Make sure you take a boat ride, preferably at night, to see the lights of Paris. We chose the Vedettes du Pont Neuf for the ride. I checked the website the afternoon of our intended trip and made a reservation. When I checked back a few hours later, I was able to download a coupon for 25% off the ride (10 euros as opposed for 14/per person)! It was an hour long with the tour guide speaking in both English and French. There's nothing like seeing Paris at night by boat -- so gorgeous. We disembarked just in time to watch the Eiffel Tower sparkle.

Bateaux Mouches. I always take a trip on the Seine with the Bateaux Mouches when in Paris and this year's visit lived up to expectations. The highly informative recorded guide is good, but the views are the best. Paris from the water, especially views of the Eiffel Tower, is wonderful. A must for any visitor to Paris!

Long walk across the river. One of the best way to explore Paris.You can either take the cruise at River Seine or walk across the river.Its a long walk which connects to different districts of Paris.Its lovely to see people walking or simply just sitting across the river.

Absolutely beautiful!. This river is absolutely beautiful! There are so many cruises you can go on to enjoy the view and hear about the history. The river is clean and shines in the sun. I loved nothing more than strolling down the river in the sun taking in the sights! It is popular with both tourists and locals.
Boat cruise on the Seine. We did this late afternoon and while we had a lovely time looking at all the buildings, the Eiffel tower was wonderful when it lit up at dusk.

Seine river. We went on a boat tour of paris and covered most of paris.It was a guided tour and views during tour is good and get a feel of paris calture .Seeing importent buildings and different types of people give a real glimpse of paris
Night Boat ride. Beautiful is the word which this describes it , I took night cruise & it was so beautiful , could not have imagined this . Truly an awesome experience
Hop On Hop Off River Cruise. This is a brilliant way to see the major sites of Paris. You can relax with a glass of Merlot and a sandwich and not worry about traffic.

Lovely!! . Whether you see it from far or you cruise it, it is a Paris' must!!! We took a boat cruise and it was really enjoyable, we also took a long walk by the river and crossed some bridges. By the Eiffel Tower there's a little garden and a playground for the children, or you just can sit by the stairs and enjoy!

Strolling Along the Seine. What a wonderful way to spend a couple hours strolling. Along the south shore of the Seine there is a very wide walkway for strolling, cycling, running, whatever.Along the way there are bicycle rentals, paddle boat rentals, all kinds of playground equipment for kids, ping pong tables, rock climbing up the concrete walls, a juice bar with dozens of lounge chairs for enjoying your beverage, people watching, or napping.This is truly a great family or couples outing.

Go the boat tour. I would recommend a river cruise up the Seine. Great atmosphere, many people out walking and a lot of street entertainment and beautiful landmarks to keep you occupied whilst you cruise.

Take a cruise!. We took a 'sunset cruise' from Easy Pass tours-really worth it to get out on the water. Some of my best pictures from Paris are from this cruise. We went around the Isle de la Cite, and saw a lot! There are a lot of boat options, but get on the water, I say!

Dinner cruise. Another romantic experience. Took a night dinner cruise on River Seine. Was a great time, food, music, and view. Highly recommend a dinner cruise along this river. Beautiful experience. Will never forget.
