Must do on first visit. Get a Bateau and float down the Seine and see its beauty from the water. You will get a recorded history tour and if you go at night a beautiful show of lights.

Beautiful River Seine. Perfect way to see the city of Paris. Take a river cruise on the River Seine. They go by the sights and give you some history. But also a good way to get your bearings of the city.
Dinner cruise. We took a dinner cruise down the river. We really enjoyed it. Worth every penny. Nice views especially at sunset.

VIVA LA PARIS!. There is no city like Paris and the River Seine makes it so special! The Season changes, but the river is inexorable. It is beautiful regardless of the Season or the weather. The bridges are a big plus and each has its own character.

Romantic. We strolled by and sat on benches along the River Seine. It iflows through Paris with sites such as Notre Dame Cathedral and Musee D'Orsay along its banks. It gives the real feel of Paris, especially on a river cruise. We took a dinner cruise. The boat stopped and shone lights on the cathedral while a violinist played Ave Maria. It was completely unexpected and a touching experience. I will never forget it.
Batobus and the Seine. Comfortable, not too crowded, hop on/off boat which was a god-send in 40 C heat. Saw all of key sites from the boat and enjoyed the breeze too!!

The feel of Paris. Hanging out whichever way around the river Seine is fun for all age groups. There are plenty of pubs, restaurants, benches and grass patches to hang out, have a glass of wine and enjoy life!
Seine river was really lovely. We did the hop on hop off tour and it was lovely. Didn't have time to do it at night but I hear that is the time to go on a boat ride.

River cruise. An inordinate amount of choice from the small boats to the monstrous floating restaurants and the price is relative but still overall very good value. Chose carefully the most popular cruises become very crowded.

Did you plan of missing it?!. Never ever miss that!!One of the best things you can do ! get a boat in the river, get in a dinning cruise or even just grab some food and drinks and sit by the river and enjoy the view and the breath and the surrounding!! Don't stay on the street level, search for stairs and get to the river level and sit down and forget about time and everything and enjoy your time! amazing experience !

Romantic and Historic River. We had a voyage down the river with cruise ship and it was the highlight of our traveling to paris. you can see the old Paris and the romantic Parisian people at the side of river .
By boat or Walk. The river is nice to walk on the side or to take a boat tour. Also many bridges are crossing the River Seine. I would say, take a tour, if not possible just walk beside it.
Good boat trip. Took a boat tour with my family. At first I thought would be time-waist, but turned out to be really nice. Had the luck to be on a superb sunset afternoon which made it really special

Self tour. Gorgeous time on The River Seine. Champagne and crepes river cruise. It was so worth it even in a little misty rain. Nice and cool evening. Coming back, The Eiffel Tower was lit up and was twinkling. Beautiful. I was in heaven. This place is so romantic!

Business meeting and Dinner. A cruise on the Seine for a business meeting and dinner with colleagues is an excellent way to combine scenery from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame with an informal business meeting

ExHilarating!. Paris the beautiful by day or night. We loved it! My wife overdid the Museum visits but I got lucky and forgot my museum pass a few times (thought she had it :-) ) The underground was great! We had to figure it out. The musical events in the stations on on the trains was delightful.FOOD ! Wow, the French know how to cook. They mad chicken taste so good! Im going back soon and want to travel more along the River Seine. We enjoyed the short trips Awesome place

Honeymooners' dream. My husband and I were in Paris for our honeymoon. Our voyage down the River Seine was one of the highlights of the whole trip. We traveled right at dusk, so it was light when we went east and dark as we came back west. It was incredibly romantic and a great view of the city. We spent time on the banks of the Seine on our last day there as well. A great place for alone time for couples.
Nice Place to Walk. The river is brimmed with many architectural masterpieces and beautiful bridges run across it. Make sure to take a walk along it!
Beautiful!. Take a boat ride and discover Paris in a way you cannot see it from any other vantage point! Simply wonderful!
Batto-bus. Economical way to travel up and down the Seine. Very relaxing after a long day of walking and touring museums.
A parisian post card. This river is so charming and it's so full of history. I took a walk alongside and I could felt how special it was.

Great location. The river runs right through the heart of Paris. There is lots of boat activity and the opportunity to take a river tour, including meals and drinks if you desire.
The many bridges that cross the river give you many advantage points for great picture taking. I got a view amazing pictures of the Eiffel Tower at night.

Party on!. Hordes of friendly (mostly young) people pack the left bank quays every summer night, with their own wine and picnics. It's a free party with the greatest view you'll find. There are also a few bars and pizza joints. Between Pont Alexandre III and Pont de la Concorde.

Relaxing and A Nice View too. The river goes right through the city and affords a great way to see the city from a differ angle. There are house boats, tunnels, art works, fisherman, tourists, lovers and locals to look at as you sail along. It's nice to walk along too!

You Must View Paris From the River. My daughter and I took a tour on one of the boats on the Seine. What a wonderful way to see the city. The narrated tour was excellent and helped me to get a sense of where things were located early in our trip. The tour lasted an hour and many major points of interest are visible from the river. Grab a seat at the front of the boat for the best view and you can not help but be impressed by the vistas.
River Tour part of Hop-On, Hop-Off Bus. Nice boat ride on the Seine,commentary if you sit inside but best views are outside. Really enjoyed it.

So Beautiful and so much to see!. The river is beautiful and everything around the city revolves around the river. They have great little vendors selling books and pictures up and down the river and at night everything is lit.

Great view of the city. We travelled along the river on a one hour tour which was somewhat expensive but this is tourist city right next to the Eiffel Tower so expect a hole in your pocket. Unique view that on a scorching hot day was very enjoyable especially seeing Parisians utilising the space relaxing next to the river. If we had been there longer then a re far better use of the river is the hop on hop off ferry, ticket prices are far more reasonable though still hefty, pity Paris can't follow the example of other major cities and have a free service.

Beautiful view. Came on a school trips, the boated down the river was a major highlight, the open waters are clear and cool, a must go for tourists who wish to snap major landmarks in Paris but don't have time to visit them all.

Paris Canal Cruise. We did this canal cruise. Started off nice with view of Notre Dame etc. About 15 minutes in, we started to go through locks. We went through one lock after another. The fumes from the engine almost knocked us out. There was no view, just lock after lock. We then went through a tunnel that was about 18 km long. It never ended. You spent the entire cruise going through locks and this tunnel. You come out on the other end and get off. What a waste of time. It is good, if you want to have a sleep, but do not do it on the upper deck as you may never wake up from the fumes. Oh, one last thing. Could not understand a word the driver was saying. My Mother speaks French and she did not understand the French version. The English version sounded French. Not worth listening to.
Must do a cruise along this river.. Did a river boat cruise along the Seine. It was so beautiful. They did a running commentary to give you the history and played beautiful French music.
Get the batobus. Get the batobus, not only can you get to travel the Seine, you can hop on and off at key points. Great to see Paris from a different viewpoint.
Up for a Romantic Stroll or Cruise. Stroll or take a bateau ride down the Seine. Enjoy Paris' architecture and beauty. It is truly a magical city.

Take a tour!. Take a boat tour of the Seine. Seriously. It is super relaxing and really helps you see the city of Paris. It is a beautiful view and a very fun experience solo, with friends or with family.

Spend a morning/afternoon to walk along the river. If you have time, spend a morning or afternoon walking along the river Seine and you won't be disappointed with the beautiful sights, cafes and views you will discover.

A different view of Paris. Viewed from the river, bridges and buildings are seen in a different light.
The Canal St. Martin adjoins the Seine River near the Ille de la cite.
From here you can travel under Paris, an unforgettable experience.
I travelled in a private boat, but there are commercial boats that take passengers.

Travel the River Seine - It is worth the trip!. Well, this was a nice boat ride down the river, but the real treat was listening to all the historical gems the guide was telling the visitors. Also, you get a nice view of a little "petite" statue of liberty and its very surreal to see it right there in France along the river! From Wikipedia: Pont de Grenelle - Statue of Liberty on the Île aux Cygnes, River Seine in Paris. Given to the city in 1889, it faces southwest, downriver along the Seine.Replica of the Statue of Liberty in Colmar.A second Statue of Liberty in Paris is near the Grenelle Bridge on the Île aux Cygnes, a man-made island in the Seine (48°51′0″N 2°16′47″E), 11.50 metres (37 feet 9 inches) high. Inaugurated on July 4, 1889, it looks southwest, downriver along the Seine.Worth the wait!
Strolling the river is a treat!. Just strolling the river was an outing in itself. We walked along the paths as much as we could and took a sunset cruise on the river that was wonderful.

Romantic and scenic, especially at night. The right and left banks of the Seine River offer a great view of some signature icons in the city. Whether you take the hop-on-hop-off river cruise, or just book a cruise with any other company, the experience is largely the same (depending on the vessel size and no. of people on board with you). Try to go onto the cruise at night and marvel at the City of Lights!

Cote D'Azure to Paris By River Boat and Land Transfer. South of France and Paris is a breath taking experience from Monte Carlo with its casino of total opulence by river ship up the Rhone River with visits to quaint little towns along the way.Fast train to Paris was an experience which we have not had in North America and was worth the trip.And then Paris, ahhhhh Paris, what you you say but magnifique. From the Eiffel tower to the Arc de Triumph and all of the other amazing sites and museums. The hands-down highlight was attendance at an evening performance and meal at the Moulin Rouge.

Heart Beat Of Paris. If you have time, hike along the tow path of the river, picnic on the banks of river, take a boat tour along the river. The rive Seine is the heart of the city; mush of the city's history is tied to the river.

An indispensable part of Paris, bringing life, but also showing the impact of humans on the environment.. Beautiful river. Contributes to the character of the City and its mystique. I wish people, Parisians and tourists alike, treated it a bit better.The view from the river offers a relaxing slower pace alternative to taking in the city's monuments and sites. The view of the river from the various sites is magical and romantic.

Great for marriage proposal . So romantically proposed to my wife 3 years ago. Happily married ever since. Beautiful sights and sound. A bit too windy and your hair can get pretty messed up if you stay out for too long. Nice experience...

Seine boat trip through Paris to tour at Giverny in Normandy. The Batobus "hop off hop on" trip along the the Seine is a relaxing way to view many Paris landmark key buildings from another viewpoint, especially going round the Île de la Cité and viewing Notre Dame on all sides from the river. On a bus tour to Giverny in Normandy it is possible to view the rural Seine with its surrounding countryside away from the bustle of the city.
Hotel overlooking Sienne. My boyfriend and I staying in a hotel overlooking the river. The views were beautiful throughout the day, at sunset and at night.

River flows through heart of Paris,. The River Seine flows through the heart of Paris and crosses through all or most of the districts. I got a hop on hop off boat ticket for the day and got on and off along the river at different spots. It was great! One of the boats played Edith Piaf singing and it was so appropriate...I sang along with odd faces looking at me but I didn't know anyone on the boat so I figured when else would I get an opportunity to sing with Edith Piaf on the River Seine in the city of love, Paree.

Cruising around the river. cruising around the river... it was a different part all together and must do in Paris. We was at the upper deck with open top. and the view of the city ,specially the Eiffel tower was breath taking.
You'll Fall in Love With Paris. Paris Highlights would include a trip to le Dome Restaurant where Hemingway wrote, and a walk down to the Luxembourg Gardens
Dinner on a River Cruise. Dinner on a cruise after a day of beauty was so special; the meal was delightful. We have a picture of this experience that is a favorite!

beautiful and relaxing. most sights in paris can be seen from the river. it's very relaxing to ride and take photos. many companies doing this. didn't compare prices, but imagine they're similar since they compete. saw several during our tour. a lot of history backs up to these banks. recommend

Magnificent and Romantic. A Seine River tour is a must for every Paris visitor and well worth the modest fees. Seeing the great monuments of the city from the water adds a whole other perspective and vantage point of this exceptional city.

Winding life blood of the city of Paris.. PROS: cool houseboats; bridges over the famed river; fairly quiet riverbanks;
CONS: murky; apparently dirty according to the locals.

cruising on the Seine was wonderful. We did the Paris to the Heart of Normandy Viking River cruise in April of this year and we loved it. The scenery was wonderful as was the history of the many places we toured. My favorite was Giverny where Claude Monet lived. I didn't know we could review stuff like this or I would have immediately. It was a wonderful trip, tres bon! As I look at the rest of the options I worry I'm in the wrong place. This was a river cruise on the Seine, I don't know if this qualifies as an attraction.The cruise was 8 days.
Nice walk. It was a beautiful day and I enjoyed the walk. So much to see and do. Was approached once by the "Is this your ring scam?" Just be aware of your surroundings and you will love it.

The Seine is a great way to beat the heat. When faced with the recent taxi strike in Paris, the river boards (in particular the Bateaux-Mouches) that operate on the Seine make the river a great alternative to getting to some of the major attractions. The Seine is a lovely destination on its own, allowing great views of mainstays such as the Louvre, Hotel de Ville and Notre-Dame. A great way to enjoy the afternoon and escape the summer hear is to visit one of the many street markets and shops (particularly around the Latin Quarter) and bring a picnic lunch of French cheese, breads and pastries, and of course some wine. Be sure to stay in areas that have good traffic / populated and nearest major entrances / exits.

Murky and free.. Oh, how beautiful you are. Flowing wild and free along your banks. Now sure what else to say about a river in France, but it has boats and bridges. Not the kind of place you really want to swim, though! Enjoy!

Plan a picnic along the Seine!. If you're a water lover or even just a lover, you must have a picnic along the Seine. It's where all the cool kids hang out. Our favorite night went like this... we visited Rue Cler (also a must see). It's a small, quaint street, lined with open air markets. We purchased baquettes, cheese, grapes, and wine. The wine merchant will open the bottles for you, provide cups and chill the white wine while you wait. Take all your goodies to the Seine and find your spot. It was pure heaven, can't wait to do this again!

The romantic River, la SEINE PARIS. One of the most recognized spots in Paris, the banks of the River Seine!Any time is a good time to visit and walk along the banks. A tip for photogrpahers, all bridges are lit at night and the balade is quite an experience! the "Bateaux mouche" enlight the monuments on their way, so it's another good way to disvocer Paris from a boat! (some of them provide meals, cocktails, drinks, but one can just go onboard for a simple visit!!) The best part , going downstream, departs from la Bastille. One can start there, and take a visit to the "Port of Paris" then down West, pass the "Hotel de Ville",the CityHall then Place du Chatelet, then chack Notre Dame, St Michel, St Germain des Pres, the "Musee d'Orsay",.... down to the SDtatue of Liberty ( shorter than the Famous one in NYC!!! but that one was a "scale model" of the original project by Bartoldi. One can cross bridges at will, don't miss the Solferino Bridge (one of the most recent ones) the "Passerelle des Arts" but forget your "love locks" ... 50 tons of them have been collected and distroyed (they weight geopardized the stability of the bridge!!)

A fascinating evening. Lovely cruise, magnificent sites, a must. Went on the evening cruise. Sorry there was not a small cafe on cruise. The lovely archeticure and many bridges with stories was a thrill.. But vending machines just didnt cut it... still would do it again
Cruising the Seine. Cruising down the Seine, is a great way to see the city of Paris and admire the architecture of the buildings and bridges
let yourself flow. The charisma of PARIS is also looking how the river row slowly shaking the white bouts and shining with the night lights ..

The Heart Of Paris. If you spend any time at all in Paris you must spend some of it walking along the Seine. Watch the boats go by. Check out the houseboats at dock. Cross over and back the many bridges, each with its own distinct style. On the Left Bank stroll along the upper side and check out the bookstalls. This is the true heart of Paris, its center its reason for being just where it is.

Great views from the river. If you want to see a lot of Paris from the Seine then try the Bato Bus. It is a hop on hop off service and costs only 16€ for a day ticket. It runs every 30 minutes and the whole route takes 2 hours.

Relaxig. When walking around Paris you're bound to cross the river seine along your path somewhere. It's nice to get a closer experience by taking a boat up the river and back. There are different companies that offer this, one is >€100 with classy dinner and drinks with proper tables, and another is just more touristic and around €14 with a very very long cue. For that it's advisable to use the machines around to purchase tickets so you won't stay in line for an hour!

River cruise. We walked from the Lurve to the Eiffel tower. There is lots to do on the walk down the river, there are lots of weird and wonderful greations on the river bank, including chess tables and things. We went on a river cruise which was very informational!

Take at least 1 river cruise. We were in Paris for 5 days, we took 1 cruise that is non-stop about 1 hour that gives you a great overview of the city. We then got a 2-day hop on hop off boat that has 8 stops and is a great way to travel the historic areas of the city after you've been walking for 3 days!!

What a wonderful way to see Paris.. We got a ticket on the Batobus which is a hop on hop off run on the Seine river in Paris. Only way to get around and avoid being stuck hours in traffic. We got to see all attractions in one day using this as our transport. You get some great photo shots also from the river. It is not expensive either

Vagrants and urine. Stayed near Gare de Lyon and decided to walk to the key tourist area via the river. Whilst the views of all sites is wonderful doing this you soon realise there is another side to Paris. Masses of tent cities pop up on the banks and you just couldn't walk there after dark. All along we smelt constantly urine , seriously it was like a third world country.

"A river runs through it". Like the old saying, a "river runs through" the centre of Paris. If you visit Paris you will inevitably see the Seine, but an evening stroll along its banks will enable you to see some of the most memorable landmarks of this great city from a new perspective. The Tour Eiffel, Musee D'Orsay and Notre Dame are all situated next to the river as are many other notables. I suggest you just take a walk wherever you are as, although the well known buildings are great to see, admiring the bridges and the other less well know buildings along the embankment is likely to bring you as much, if not more, pleasure.

Lovely way to see Paris. We took the one hour Seine river cruise. It was very well organised. It was very busy but there was plenty of room to feel comfortable. It was a great way to see the various sites and places of interest from the river. A very enjoyable experience - would recommend to couples, singles, groups and families. A definite must in Paris,
River Seine. History, and beauty and charm. Loved walking next to it and seeing the life on the river and around the river. Missed a river cruise and sorry for that.

A lovely place to relax. The River Seine provided a good opportunity for a peaceful rest (away from the crowds) after a wonderful sightseeing session of the Musee d'Orsay and the Musee du Louvre. The seats along the bank were a very welcome sight, and the shade was much appreciated on a very hot June day. The views of the river traffic and surrounding environment were very interesting - such a tranquil contrast to the busy tourist attractions.

Romantic Boat Trip. Perfect, romantic and lovely boat trip through the heart of Paris over looked by a lit Eiffel Tower. Was so pleasant, specifically booked this with a meal up the Eiffel Tower and both were amazing. A little more information after booking is needed though
Take the boat trip!. Great way to relax for an hour and see Paris form the water. Worth the 14 euros and wait for a ticket.
Cruising is nice. Good trip down Seine...long days made seeing at night impossible. But....waving at people in boats and on the bank provided a diversion. Wished I was on a party boat!!!
Dinner on the Seine is a must. Yachts de Paris did an amazing job...friendly staff...fabulous food and to experience Paris at night in lights...you will fall in love

Beautiful River. We took a 7 day cruise on the Seine. The river itself is beautiful, with many swans swimming on it. We traveled to Normandy...there were some wonderful villages along the way...but also a lot of the industry is along the river...not so pretty.

River Cruise. We booked an evening river cruise. Unfortunately for us, the ship was full of young French children who disrupted the cruise narration. The staff was kept busy trying to bring the children under control.
So romantic. Love to go there again with my spoon. So romantic even with the kids. But one advice don't drink your coffee here unless you can afford it!

Romantic & Beautiful. Having see & walked along with River Thames, I liked River Seine more romantic & at peace. Few years back I enjoyed the river at nite & this time in day time. The best way to enjoy Paris is to walk along the river as far as you can go, sit wherever you feel like, enjoy your meals next to many restaurants on the river. River cruise in nite is must to enjoy & feel the Paris city.
excellent and relaxing.. highly recomend to do the cruise. i ve been on day time.guess it would be great to do it on night time as well.

THE BATOBUS IS A KEY TO SEEING PARIS. The River was our connection to the entire city. Instead of hailing taxies or attempting other public transportation, we bought a BatoBus pass that allowed us to get on/off the entire day. This allowed us to get off a certain points, venture into different arrondissements, and then return to the water where the cool breeze flowed over us and we could put our feet up while still seeing the beauty of the city.
Lackluster. We did the dinner cruise down the Seine. The most exciting thing was the Statue of Liberty. The food was good but the river was just a river.
a Grand river. I loved viewing all the live aboard barges and boats that tie up in the Seine. Many communities are formed with these. It's fabulous

Discover Paris by walking next to the river Seine.. Lots of the magic of Paris is found walking next to the River Seine, especially on the Notre-Dame and Saint-Louis islands, but also from Musee d'Orsay to the Eiffel Tower.
A chance to sit. The Seine river cruise was nice to see Paris from a different view. It was nice to sit for awhile also. This was included in our Eiffel Tower tour.

Best thing to do in Paris. On a sunny day, get the ingredients for a picnic which should include at least a half bottle of your favourite wine, preferably champagne (bring glasses from your hotel room) and of course a decadent Parisian dessert, and then find a bench by the Seine with of view of the Notre Dame or Eiffel Tower if you're over in that section of Paris, and then just sit and enjoy the experience. You are now sitting in a place that millions of people have on their bucket list and many others only in their dreams. You might want to do this more than once.
Heart of it All. At the heart of all great cities you find its river. The bookstalls and the bridges are especially lovely at sunrise and sunset - if you like the Arno, you'll adore the Seine!

Nice, but smells of pee.. Nice to picnic by the banks and watch the boats go by. Great areas to hang out, but it is really dirty and smells of pee, which I understand is an improvement over how bad it used to be. I guess it is hard to keep a body of water clean in a big city.
Don't miss the chance to walk along the Seine.. The tree lined promenade is lengthy and provides a lovely overview of the city, bridges, monuments and parks. It's also a great area in which to run.

Weekends lined with well wishers. My apartment was across the river from the Louvre. I crossed in nearly everyday. It is beautiful and soaked in history. I took a tour down to the Eiffel Tower. The tour talked about all the bridges and their meaning. We floated past Notre Dame and all the governmental building and heaps of history. We passed hundreds of couples and friends sitting on the walls of the river who waved as we passed. On top of the bridges people waved to us as we passed. Just a very friendly atmosphere. I loved Paris the most from the river.

The river which runs through it.... I love the Seine - from the Quais. Only ever took one trip on the riverboats to find it was crowded with tourists... although tat was amusing too, as we rounded a bend in the river a schoolboy from England pointed to his fellow students... There's the Trifle Tower...
Very Scenic. We took an evening Seine river cruise and enjoyed it very much. Of course, the river is very recognizable from multiple attractions in the city. It is also nice to walk along the river.

So clean and romantic. We did the evening river cruise atop a boat and passed under several bridges new and old, with fine buildings boasting of french architecture on both sides of the river. The river banks on either side were full of people enjoying the beautiful Sunday evening, waving at passing boats. The river water was calm and free of floating garbage.

So much to see from the comfort of a boat. We joined a cruise at Baton Rouge with a company called Bateaux-Mouches, just turn up when the boat is full it goes and you really won't have to wait for very long. It lasts just over an hour.The top of the boat was full so we sat outside along the side which actually didn't seem so windy. If you don't see things on the way up you get them on the way back.We also had a long walk along the river, there are lots of footpaths and seats. Just watch out for the bikes you'll share the paths with them.

Don't bother. After having a couple of hours spare we thought we would like to cruise the seine. We walked along river and had just missed one cruise company so the next one was batobus cruise. They only have seating inside with no roof and glass walls, so on a very hot day it was very uncomfortable, no seating outside and no commentary only to say which stop was next. Would not recommend this company at all, try someone else.

A boat tour on the Seine is a must-do. I am not recommending any particular boat tour of which there are many. There is everything from open air boat tour ( and hour or so) to gourmet food experiences. I like the night tour the best. Also, you must take a leisurely stroll along the Seine preferably with a significant other. Consider a picnic. There is city-sponsored dancing along seine as well.

Cruise the Seine. A cruise on the Seine is a great way to see Paris. the historic bridges and the ancient buildings seen from the river give a totally different appreciation of the city. All the boats moored along the river also show the diverse living conditions available to Parisians
Beauty. One of the most beautiful places on the planet peaceful and a boat ride is a great way to see the sights

Must do experience. Didn't enjoy the crowds but the experience itself was unforgettable. We went on a 9pm trip; It was very cold but the advantage of seeing the Eiffel Tower in lights and the 10pm 'fairy light' show on the Tower as dusk fell more than made up for the cold (and the antics of a very disinterested group of secondary school children). It's a wonderful way to see Paris but I think I would have enjoyed it more after I had seen the sights of the city so I had a better idea of what I was looking at. There was a commentary but it was hard to hear.
Nice Cruise. Paid for a cruise on the River Seine which is pretty worthwhile. You'll get to see a lot more than just walking around in about 1 hour.

Great way to get around. A great way to view the many attractions and sites of Paris. Sail pass Notre Dame, the Tower and under the famous bridges of Paris. A great way to travel from one site to another is by the water taxes which operates multi day passes, making this an easy, faster and cheaper way to travel and still be able to see the city pass before your eyes. Enjoy an evening cruise with dinner and see the city all lit up.

Seine cruise. We saved money by buying a ticket on the banks of the Seine at a short distance from the boat station. It was amazing to see so many tourist boats on the river, navigating without any problems.The commentary was good and the views spectacular. We made a day trip but would also have liked to do an evening one.Well worth the small cost.
The Unesco World Heritage. I enjoyed this river by boat, Batobus after reaching Pais. Wonderful cruising to visit another Unesco World Heritage on this river.

Walk the bridges of the Seine.. Walk the bridges of the Seine, but be aware of con men and women! We were stopped numerous times by people who wanted us to listen to their stories, then asked us for money. One even tried to sell us a gold ring for a few euro.... You could see the gold paint coming off as she spoke! Great city, a must to see.

An Evening Cruise. View of Paris at night is more romantic.The river cruise was informative since we have an English-speaking tour guide.We also get to see how the young Parisians chill out at night along the river banks.It is not too commercialized.We opted not to take the dinner cruise because we preferred to have dinner in a more formal place.

Good cruising. It was a lovely sunny day so the cruise was very pleasant. A good look at the sights along the Seine, due to the high river level it did not go the full distance which was a bit disappointing, but to compensate it turned around and went back up the river a bit further in the other direction. Well worth the cost.

The best way to travel around historical places in Paris.... The best way to go around all the must see places in Paris is to take a river pass and hop on and hop off on the river taxis. The views are simply stunning....

A great way to take in the sights of Paris!. We spent a lot of time on and near the Seine. It is so beautiful! We walked most of the bridges in Paris both in the day time and at night. The lighting is so beautiful at night and taking a river boat gives you an even better view of the city. I recommend taking a river boat at night in time to see the Eiffel Tower sparkle at the top of the hour...definitely worth it! It was also wonderful to wander down the sidewalk by the Seine and poke into the various sidewalk pop up shops along the way...the artwork, the book sellers, the trinkets. There is something for everyone. We felt very safe at night walking by the river, maybe because there are always a ton of people around, but we never once felt unsafe at any hour. Be sure to catch the lights reflecting on the river from the various buildings. It makes you realize how the master painters came up with the stunning scenes they did.

Go left and right!. The Seine is the second longest river in Paris and divides the city into North and South. The northern section is known as 'the Right bank' while the southern section is the 'left bank' both are worth strolling along. A cruise down the Seine on Bateaux Parisiens is also worthwhile.
An experience. We took a boat trip on the Seine and it was so relaxing. Just sit back and watch Paris go by. The views are so worthwhile.
Relaxing!. We used a "hop on/hop off" boat on the Seine, to get around Paris. Great way to see the popular attractions and much more relaxing and enjoyable than dealing with traffic and the tube!

Slice of history while you ride on the boat. An evening ride on River Seine is an absolute must. Its not only romantic but extremely delightful for the eyes. The twinkling, reflection on the river, the arches of the bridges, beautiful architecture on both sides of the river and drink on boat - you cannot miss any of these.
Amazing Dinner Cruise. Whenever I visited paris I had a dream of having dinner on the cruise on the river seine. It's a amazing delight to have dinner while watching the artistic beauty of Paris.

A Walk Along The Seine. A walk along the Seine is the most romantic thing one can do in Paris. I know it is for lovers of all ages but many years ago I took Mom and we walked Parisian style, our arms looped together, and it was the most heart warming memory of our trip. It was her first trip to Paris, my 8th, and seeing the city through her eyes made me so appreciate the gentle beauty of this river and what it has come to represent for lovers and family members.

Nice Sightseeing Cruise. We had a beautiful family cruise along the Seine. The weather was gorgeous and the boat was not crowded at all. The tour went from the base of the Eiffel Tower up past Notre Dame and back. We saw many bridges and landmark buildings along the way.
historical. Loved the view, and great historical summary from the guide on this river cruise. Definitely worth doing.
great for a walk by the river. I would say its not worth taking the river boat, its good enough to walk along the river and stop and take pictures when you want to

Be Uncool and take the Seine dinner cruise. For years when visit Paris I was always too cool to do the tourists thing, especially the dinner cruise on the Seine. I cheated myself and my wife until finally I did the uncool thing. We took the dinner cruise. Its worth the price and the night. It was corny and fun...real fun. Full course dinner, wine, entertainment and the magnificent sail along the Seine ending in dark at the foot of the Eiffel Tower where a miniature version of the Statue of Liberty lights up as your boat spins to "New York, New York." There are real dividends in being uncool.

Amazing experience¡. It is an excellent way to visit Paris and see all the wonderful view of each side of the river, so you have to hire one of the boats that take you right through this route.Try to hire only those with shuttle I think Vedettes du Pont Neuf are a good option.

a must to experience Paris. The first time I ever visited Paris I spent a morning walking along the Seine. Every time I've been lucky enough to return, I make a point of spending some time here - walking , sitting, and just staring at the river, the boats and the people. Paris and the Seine are one and should be enjoyed together.

you must go down the Seine..... This is a must do- walk along this river, take a boat down this river, and enjoy being in the center of everything and the views from the River Seine. We didn't do an especially wonderful boat tour- just the basic, and were totally satisfied!
Historic River...good view of the Paris. The river flows through Paris but taking a bateaux down the river seine gives great views of the city. It is one of those "have to" items. Enjoy...
Batobus. Great hop on hop off boat with comentary, stay as long as you like at each stop (9 in all) go around as many times as you wish, booked online worth the money

Gorgeous. Just gorgeous. If you are going to be in Paris at night, you must buy on the river tour's. Several boat companies start their evening tours right at the bottom of where The Tour Eiffel is. Buy your ticket for a tour that starts after 7pm. so you can get great pictures! Buy it early because they will sold out if you wait until 7 to buy them. Some of the boats are so big, ours had 600 people! sit close to the doors so you can go outside if you are a picture maniac. Some smaller tours include dinner, for a more romantic option (no picture maniacs here). At your return, the Tour Eiffel will most likely be all lighted up and you can take pictures from a perfect close-up location with no-tourists in front of you!
Good experience. I used a coupon with 6 euros discount for one day pass. It's good if you have enough time as it takes about 2 hours to take a whole trip.

Bike ride. Rent a bike (easy to do with cash or a card) right by the river, and return it at any of the many bicycle points along the city, easy way to move around and really enjoy the beauty of the river and the local's watch.

The heart of Paris!. Paris would not be what it is without the River Seine adding the romance to the city as it winds itself around the city and splits the city of love into left and right banks. It's a joy to spend some time either walking along the river or taking a ride in one of the many large long boats either as a tour or evening dinner cruise. You can also enjoy it simply from the top of the many bridges that span the river, or sitting along one of the banks in the Latin quarters with a jambon-beurre baguette and a bottle of wine. This body of water is what brings life to the city.

Calm and peace in the midst of Paris. The Seine river tour in motor boat was simply great. During late evening, you get to see all the monuments lighted which makes the Paris, the city of lights. The cool breeze around riven Seine make it more attractive.

Night river cruise is a must. Like: The night river cruise was magical. An hour long but it does not feel long at all. Seeing how Paris and the old buildings light up after dark is so beautiful, enhanced by the nice breeze blowing as one cruises along. A great way to unwind after a hectic day touring Paris.Dislike: The queue (or lack of a queue) getting onto the river cruise made me wonder if I was in a third world country.
beautiful. You can have an amazi g time just walking or get the botobus lots of people to talk and share experiences

Breathtaking. Took two bateaux cruises down the seine at different times of the day, just lovely, afforded a view of the tops of stunning buildings over the sculpted trees, a view of the Eiffel tower, notre dame, the Louvre. A must when. Visiting paris

Nice tour!. We made a boat tour on the River Sein for an hour and we really apreciate the tour. We seen different views of Paris that we didn't see before. Passing under the bridges and cruising slowly through this river is an unforgettable experience.
Beautiful Views, Enjoyable Walk. I didn't try the boat cruise but walking along the river was already nice. Recommended to see Paris city in the morning and also at night.

Good stroll. We walked down the banks of the seine so we could take more in. It was a great walk and good to people watch. It's like the heart of the city with activities and things to see all around. Called for a few refreshments on our way round. Would do it again really nice way to spend the afternoon

Seine cruise. If you are in Paris, Seine cruise is a must thing to do, river runs through the heart of paris and offers extremely good views at different locations!!!! Also seinne cruise helps you relax and travel without the city traffic!!!!

Batobus lovely tour . Getting to see river seine with good hop on and off options on 9 great sights for 16 € per pax per day.€10 for EU students with student id. Highly recommended. Enjoy a relaxing way to see sights.
River walk is amazing. Rent bikes, play Swingball, Ping Pong, do mazes, have a cocktail, relax in a chair, climb a wall, just hang out. Such a great pedestrian area!
Awsome. Loved our boat trip which was part of the hop on hop off bus experience. Great way to see the wonders of Paris from a different view

Lovely way to spend an evening. Sitting along the river in the evening was just delightful. There were various musicians either playing an instrument, singing popular songs that everyone could sing along to, or dancers and acrobats doing their thing. And lots of Parisians sitting along the banks with a glass of wine and something yummy to eat. I felt right at home and loved being part of this magical landscape. I encourage you to do the same.
Very Scenic. Took one of the boat tours that cruises from Eiffel tower past Notre Dame and back again, very beautiful views of the architecture and bridges of Paris
Nice, but dirty. Just a plain river, did take one of those dinner cruises and walked a long but just dirty and not quite pretty.

Can't miss it if you are in Paris for any sightseeing at all. All roads lead to the Seine. Nice walkways along the river if you take the stairs down. Also docking piers and boarding the Seine boat tours. Scenic and highly recommend some kind of boat tour, whatever suits your fancy.

A Wonderful Walk. On your visit to Paris, you should take the time to walk along the Seine on both sides of the river. Fantastic views and you will discover interesting places to see. If you walk over the Pont Neuf , walk down the stairs and you will find a small park with benches, An oasis in a chaotic and hectic city. Sit and take the time to reflect on how lucky you are that you are able to come here.

Great fun and beautiful. We went on a boat trip and it was such good fun and it was so nice seeing the Eiffel tower lit up at night. We saw the sights from a different angle and it was beautiful. Really nice thing to do.

A wonderful way to see the city. We took a cruise on the Seine on a Sunday afternoon. This was especially enjoyable as the local French were enjoying the surrounding banks of the Seine, we saw large groups Salsa Dancing, Jazz musicians playing and other French pastimes taking place. The beautiful and well known sights can be really appreciated from the water, a lovely relaxed way to sightsee.

River Seine. A really great night was cruising the River Seine at night listening to all the travelogue of beauty that we saw. Beautiful buildings, lights glistening everywhere, music, romantic as well and not to be missed. And of course seeing the Eiffel Tower as we cruised.

The heart of the city. Unlike most visitors we didn't sail along the Seine we walked it. We go to cities to explore them on foot and covered 103 miles in Paris so we explored both banks of the river for miles in all directions. In many places you are on the embankment in others you have to divert, like the Thames in London. It is beautiful and like many Parisian places there is a buzzing but relaxed atmosphere. There are bars and restaurants in static boats and stacks of things happening to entertain people, particularly on a weekend. It really is part of the essence of Paris. As you leave the tourist centre you come across more industrial sights, it is a working river with barges loaded with containers and building materials being a constant sight.The downside are the camps of homeless, presumably, although not entirely, migrants, in tented villages under the bridges. Anything that offers shelter will have a makeshift bed in it. The smell of urine is overpowering, even in the tourist area any corner is peed in extensively and it stinks. The migrant camps could be quite intimidating but during the day there are plenty of people around and generally the police are sat watching nearby so you just walk on by. I got some head shaking for taking photos but it was minimal, I just kept moving. Many of the people appear out of these one man tents dressed just like tourists, not the alcoholic vagrants in filthy rags. They are washing clothes and hanging them on the railings to dry.A beautiful river but there is the Seine as a tourist attraction and the Seine as a working river and a home as well, the two are very different.

Let your imagination run.. we loved all the stalls and views of Paris, the weather was perfect, people great, river was dirty, many house boats and launches moored on the banks, again your imagination is very important, l imagined Maurice singing and walking along the banks of the river, he was a great actor.
Nice. Nicely done was very intrigues and besotted to the surroundings of this great place. May not go again as it may ruin my first grand experience.
Ignites "magic". Have toured the seine by day, by night, with friends, with my children and with my partner. Never fails to ignite "magic".Visited 5 times in last 30 years

Great Cruise!. This is a beautiful river running right through the heart of a beautiful, historic city. We took a one-hour scenic cruise on Bateaux Parisiens. Great boat, friendly staff, very comfortable, good audio guide, vending machines & toilets on board. Loved it!

River side view of Paris in the evening/night. If you have opted for Eiffel tower tour with a Cruise , you will get a ticket that could be used with in the next 12 months !!!! Good idea to take the cruise in the evening around say 9 pm . Paris wears another look by night . All the key monuments look gorgeous at sun set . Clear Summer Blue sky with Orange sky at Sunset is magical . Key monuments of Paris are visible from the boat . Return trip , sky gets dark and illuminated monuments look amazing . Audio is helpful . You understand history behind many of the bridges on Seine .Summer weather with out biting chill makes it a thorough enjoyment ! Strongly recommend !!!!!!!

A must do in Paris. If you are a first timer to the city of lights you must take a boat ride on the Seine. It will give you an up close look at some of the city's iconic buildings, especially the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame cathedral, Musee D'orsay among others. The tourist loop ride will go up and back but beware as the ride back down the Seine goes around the other side of the cathedral so make sure to get your photos of St Germain and the cathedral on the ride upriver. For extra ambience ride the river at dusk to see sundown and the city and The Eiffel Tower lit up
A lovely way to see Paris. We travelled under 22 of The 38 bridges in Paris, very clean along the river banks and under the bridges. Interesting sites along the way.

Vendettes. We took the vendette from the Pont Neuf. Book online for a significant savings and you don't have to commit to a time, other than morning or afternoon. Great view of the Paris sights from the river. A guide gives the commentary in English and French, as well as answers questions. The tour is about an hour.

A walk along the banks or by boat?. It's hard to say which is best, but I'd recommmend you do both.The banks along either side are always filled with life and make great walks both during the day and at night.The various boat cruises are really relaxing and informative but you see all of the buildings along the river from a different angle than on foot but you tend to pass everything quite quickly.My preference is to walk along both banks. Some parts are far more vibrant than others, but all appear to be perfectly safe.
Nice cruise. A great many things to see on our cruise. Nice views of The Louvre, Notre Dame and the Eiffer Tower among other things. A nice way to end the day.

heart of the city. We walked from St Germaine down to the Eiffel Tower on a wonderful fine winters morning. Then much later we took a cruise at dusk and drank champagne while watching the city lights. On other days we walked across the many bridges to see the city sights.It is such a big part of the heart of the city.

Beautiful especially at night. Get hop on hop off ticket with Batobus. Timely and clean boats stopping at all the major attractions. Try to be at Eiffel Tower stop at 11p or midnight...the tower has a light show that is wonderful.
do the night time boat ride. more important than the scenery was seeing how laid back the French are and how they come to the banks with a bottle of wine and picnic. across all ages. even late hours.

Enjoyable Evening on the Water. We arrived in Paris early and decided to have dinner aboard a cruise ship on the Seine. The offering was a three course dinner and a 75 minute trip up and down the Seine. Well worth the time. Food was excellent and the service outstanding. Enjoyed the trip, the food and the service very much. Nice way of seeing Paris in the evening without the rush of traffic and the crowds.

Save This Boat Trip for mid to late Evening!. Based right beside the Point Neuf Bridge: I think we got the last of the boat trips that night, around 9.30-ish ... Paris offers the best presented river of any Capital City I have ever seen. With the evening light slowly fading, people everywhere were out sitting and drinking all along both sides of the Seine & the city skyline rose gracefully behind them all - and on a warm summer's eve, a truly great mood washed along the banks. Bring your own drink - the small bottles for sale at the start-point landing are pricey. And bring an extra garment for the last half hour as the night's river breeze picks up...

Take a Champagne Ride. The ride down the Seine is peaceful and informative on the guide boats. You can get one near the Eiffel Tower. If possible, book a champagne tasting river cruise on the Seine. You will get a narrative of everything along the banks of the river, plus taste three different types of champagne.
Batobus tour. A nice tour along the Seine by covered open boat. Can get on and off at various stops, but note steps up from the embankment to the street level.

Worth the time to walk the river!. Boat tours, bike tours, or just getting lost - this is a lovely spot! I love it early in the morning and at sun set when the bridges start to light up. So beautiful... remember the wind on the water can be chilly in the winter to bundle up.

Boat Ride awaits through the middle of Paris. We could not get the famed boat ride on La Seine, but we did spend a lot of time viewing into the depths of this beautiful river. Flowing almost right in the middle of Paris, the option of visiting all Parisian landmarks via boat is tempting. The river is clean and there are multiple options for a boat ride. This landmark is something you cant miss.
Beautiful views. The cruise we took was really beautiful and a good idea before heading out to many of the locations on foot, as it gave you a better perspective of proximity etc. than just a map.

Cruise for fun!. You can't miss seeing Paris from a Bateaux Mouches! It is a view of the Paris of the Revolution. It is a trip down the history of the city. It is also a great way to get your sense of directions in the city and what you would like to visit.

You haven't seen Paris until you've seen it from the Seine!. We have toured Paris upon the Seine a number of times. Often we use the bateaux-mouches; sometimes with dinner, or just taking a bench. These tours are good rain or shine. The beauty and spectacle of Paris is so perfectly planned as to be viewable from the river almost in its entirety. And if that statement is an exaggeration, it is one so comfortable and pleasant to experience upon the River Seine you will come away a believer.

So beautiful and romantic place to sip wine!. Another must see if your going to Paris. Take a river cruise, drink champagne and take it all the beautiful sites. A fun thing to do and enjoy with family or your special loved one.

Nice one !. When you go to Eiffel Tower take this hour long cruise which introduces you to Paris Monuments... All visible from the boat.. Take this on a weekend evening and you can see Parisians partying and living the nightlife..
Take a boat tour. Great way to spend your first day or night, especially if you're tired. We did a night tour which was relaxing and fun.

walk the seine. I was there in june and walked the seine. It is a long walk so allow enough time, but there are planty of places to stop and rest. And many eclectic shops to look at! I didnt do a cruise, so I cant comment, but I highly reccomend a walk and a picnic..it's free!

How would you like to be, down by the Seine with me!. That was our anthem everytime we saw the Seine on our weekend in Paris. My elderly mother loves the song and finally at this stage in her life she got to enjoy it.

A Trip to Remember. We took a trip up the Seine on the on and off again boat on our first day in paris to become acclimated to our surroundings. that evening using the same ticket we took the last trip so that we could enjoy the city of lights in all its glory. a wonderful experience and of great value.

Twice... And still couldn't hear!. Went in 2013 on a Seine River cruise and there was a group of school children having lunch, so missed most of the commentary,, went again on Sunday and for at least the first 15 minutes it was impossible to hear. Maybe book a dinner cruise to learn about the Seine. The Seine itself is beautiful.
Romantic!. There is nothing lovelier than an evening stroll across a bridge, with the Seine on either side. Lovely views on a clear evening.

lovely. a beautiful river.
i loved doing a boat tour on the seine. it was a hot day and the breeze was enjoyable. we passed gorgeous buildings and bridges. what a way to enjoy paris. looking forward to the next one.

Relaxing. Even through the hustle and bustle of of daily life, i just found it nice and relaxing, peaceful and calming. I guess just something about the water. It really adds to the scenery and atmosphere of Paris.

Parisienne delight!. Such a delightful experience and a 'must' when visiting Paris! The scenery changes along the river and we found the atmosphere so Parisienne taking a twilight cruise. Great photo op! Inexpensive as an optional excursion ... but then it's not optional ... it's high on the priority!

Never get bored of travelling down the Seine. I loved the experience of travveloing around paris on the seine, there is always something to look at - we had batobus tickets for a few days, which is great value, and also went on a guided cruise. I would suggest to do the cruise on the frist day if you are new to paris as you can plan some visits once you've seen what's out there.

wondering around. Nice to wonder around, relax and enjoy your time. Don't do it if it's raining: it may be miserable. Otherwise enjoy a bit of souvenir shopping in the street market that every day takes life along the river, or simply walk around near possibly old pictures, old books, old souvenirs... Nice.
It's a good river. Of all the rivers in the world, is it the best? I dunno, hard to tell. But it's a really nice river, with nice stuff on either side.

Heart of Paris. Walking or cruising along the River Seine will give you the true feel of Paris. Be sure to do it at night as well as during the day. I will never forget walking along the Seine watching the sparkling of the Eiffel Tower.

A different way to see Paris. Taking one of the many cruises on the Seine available is a wonderful way to see the city through a different lens and to appreciate the magnificent bridges built over the centuries.

A Nice Thing to Do - but Not a MUST-DO in Paris. We knew we wanted to take a River Cruise on the Seine before we left, and I guess we are glad we did this. There are so many different companies that offer this type of service. We used one that was a Skip the Line Eiffel Tower pass and a one hour River Cruise anytime you wanted (day or night). We used Fat Tire Tours - and they were very affordable and had exactly the dates we wanted available. Again - so many other ways to see the sights and learn about them along the Seine that I think (if we had some extra money) I would do a more upgraded boat with a small, select group of friends and rent it for the few hours. Some boats had a yacht look to them, with private table/chair seating areas, small bar, and an intimate feel. I bet you get a personal guide speaking about the sights as you sip nice wine along the Seine River.The water is not that pretty or clear - not at all. It's about the history of what surrounds the river that people take this river tour.
Bridge Across the River Seine. While walking near my hotel in Paris, I was enthralled with all the bridges across the River Seine. It was so peaceful and romantic. Just lovely.

Nice to stroll along. The Seine isn't a massively wide river, but it's still very peaceful to walk along on a nice day. There are tons of restaurants and coffee shops to lounge at all along the river and a lot of museums to visit, and there are many bridges that are architecturally intricate and beautiful. It can crowded because there are a lot of river cruises and boat tours, but walking along the bank is lovely.
Beautiful. The River is a must see with all 22 unique bridges to Paris. Its a great walk to see the views and makes amazing pictures. Take a stroll and enjoy the sights.
Cruise. Lovely way to see Paris and rest the legs at the same time. Interesting commentary and a different perspective

We live off the Seine on Rue Saint-Louis-en-l'Ile . We moved to Paris in April 2nd 2015 and found a wonderful large apartment on the Magical Island of Saint-Louis-en-l'Ile. Every night we walk after dinner and never grow tired of the magical color of the river Seine.

The beautiful river Seine.. We loved the views from the bidges in the city and enjoyed the
boat rides along the river seine
We took quite a few photographs as we travelled along the river seine.and were very pleased with them..
Batou Bus experience. We really enjoyed the hour long tour on the Batou bus. The young man giving details and different stories about

Go just before sunset. This cruise was brilliant, we saw many landmarks and as we were only in Pais for a short time this was a really great way to see them. However, the highlight of this trip was that we got on a boat at sunset (9:30pm in June). This meant that as we went down the river we saw everything in dimming daylight, and on the way back in golden sunset into darkness when things started to light up- it was like getting two different tours in one! A highlight of our trip.

Yet another great sight seeing. We went on a boat trip in the night on this river(Bateaux mouches). We could see all the carved and nicely designed old buildings as we went along. The Eiffel tower was a great site to see with it's lights on and we passes many bridges and saw people enjoying themselves on either side. I think summer time is great for such a trip.
loved it. We took a non stop river cruise. It is kind of city tour from river. you see eiffel tower. its lovely.

Wow.............. I have chosen the word Wow.............for the Cruise on the River Seine because...1) Great atmosphere all around the moment we started the boat cruise.The wind was blowing at a perfect pace.2) On both side of the River banks....thousands of youngsters gathered and celebrating the festival of freedom.....Loved it3) The small music bands performing on the river banks were adding to the flavour of cruising.4) The famous Monuments and Bridges on the way left us spell bound. No words to describe....What a feeling ....you have to feel it.5) The boat was big and spacious and took at least an hour to complete the tourAnd I should confess we had a life time memories in that one hour journey.Still missing it.....No Regrets and Complaints of any sort.Just a big thanks to the people of FRANCE for there LIVELINESS.......

leisurely cruise. Not a whole lot to see from the river, and it seems fairly crowded wit tour boats, but it was a pleasant relaxed trip. Could have used more commentary options, like the hop on and off buses had with earphones
Relaxing river cruise. A great way to spend an hour or so on a sunny afternoon. We had great commentary from a sweet girl who was a tourism student.

"Beautiful river and bridges". We thoroughly enjoyed walking along the Seine River. It is very scenic with many boats cruising .There are so many bridges across the river and if you look closely, you will find they are all different. There are so many shops and restaurants, museums and buildings along the streets parallel to the river. The architecture is amazing. Just so much to see and do!

False Advertising for Viking Rinda ship on River Seine. One of the ads for the Viking Cruise from Paris to Normandy features a woman who says that the cruise was "every bit of what they advertised." Too bad this isn't true! Ads for this River Cruise on the Seine show appealing shots with the Eiffel Tower in the background. But if you happen to land of the fourth boat, Rinda, you won't find yourself in Paris, but in a suburb 50 minutes away. And you won't know about this "change" until five days before your cruise when you'll receive an email from Viking which reads as follows: "The port authority of Paris has unfortunately not issued the required permit to allow Viking Rinda to dock where we had planned to." But after speaking to other angry passengers, you will discover that Rinda has never been docked in Paris and that Viking knew all along this would be the case. One passenger who had spoken to Viking's home office learned that Rinda is too big to go under some of the bridges in Paris because of its third deck.To be fair, I can say that the food was consistently delicious and the staff engaging and entertaining. Most of the tours were well done, although the day after Normandy was a bit slow.But had I known this cruise would not be docked in Paris I probably would have changed my plans. Because by being stuck out in the suburbs of Le Pecq, you are deprived of the excitement of being in Paris and you are stuck with very long bus rides to and from the various attractions.I'm not sure I could ever consider doing another Viking Cruise after being duped like this.
Great views of Paris!. Don't miss a quieter venue to see the amazing sites of Paris. Take a boat tour and listen as the guides tell you about famous land marks.

What's not to love. The Seine is romantic, history, beautiful ro view and has so much history. Whether you stroll along its banks or along the quai above its a lovely relaxing experience. Strolling along its banks, I feel, is quite romantic even on your own and the sites any way you look is stimulating. Take a rest, sit, and watch the barges go by. Take a site seeing river cruise (better price point) and have many sites an monuments pointed out. From there you can leisurely decide which you'd like to see up close and personal afterward.

Night time river cruise. this is a must do while in Paris .Food was exceptional service very good .Passed the Eiffel tower bang on 11 pm to see it lit up and sparkling .This trip will remain long in the memory

Simply Awesome. Everybody should take a cruise along river Seine to have a feel of old Paris and it's history. The buildings and monuments on both side of the river along with the towering presence of Eiffel tower are simply awesome....and a lifetime experience...

A River Cruise. This is a spectacular way of seeing the sites of Paris. There is definitely an old and a new Paris that blends together and you can see both from the river cruise. I highly recommend it.
Paris River Cruise. The scenic river cruise is a must as you see all the buildings and attractions along the river with a narration in multiple languages.

Bateaux Parisians. Paris pass let's you go on the tour once for free, it takes about an hour. Running commentary in various languages through handset, not all working. Photos taken as you board available for purchase afterwards.not the comfiest seats and kids parties can be annoying. Lots of tour companies available, some offering meals,but no others through Paris Pass. hop on hop off boat stops up and down river.

Great place to take a scenic cruise or sit along with a picnic. Lovely. You can cruise along here and see The Eiffel Tower. Norte Dame. Musee D' Orsay, as well as other famous sightsNothing to dislike
Lovely!. Took a very nice boat tour of the River. Very informative regarding the significance of the different bridges and also interactive! I really enjoyed it! Would do it again!

A good place in Paris to train for running. Our apartment in Lavallois is only 800 m from the Seine. So yesterday when I was working out where to go for my Sunday morning run I checked on Google Earth for suitable places and saw the close proximity. I ran to the river along Rue Anatole then east along the Quai Michele, Quai de Clichy and Quai de Seine to Avenue Louis Roche. Crossed to the north side and ran back west along Quai Aulangier and Quai du Marechal Joffre back to Rue Anatole via the spiral staircase. Very enjoyable run.

Riverboat ride on the Seine was wonderful. The riverboat ride was very relaxing and we enjoyed seeing some of the places we had just seen or had planned on seeing. On the Seine just before sunset was wonderful and beautiful and then a short walk to the Eiffel Tower to see the lights.

The Seine. The Seine is a beautiful river flowing through Paris. You can buy day tickets for the river boats that go up and down the centre area and have stops along the way, it's a great way to view the city from the river and to get around without going underground where you see nothing. Watch out for the original Statue of Liberty in the middle of the Seine. I love walking along the Seine anytime I visit Paris.
Sunday afternoon. walk along the Seine on a Sunday afternoon and you will fall in love with Paris. Dancing, music, child play, creative napping, etc.

Trip. We were visiting Paris and had taken a bus tour and decided to,have a leisurely walk along the banks of the Seine. The sun was shining and it was a very nice way to while away an hour. It was very cal,I got in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the city. We would have taken a boat cruise but sadly ran out of time.

Walk along the West bank. In Spring when the weather is great and its the weekend, there is just not a better way to spend the afternoon walking along the Seine and checking out the booksellers and boats and taking lots of pics

Take the Batobus. For the same price as a fixed tour, use the Batobus all day to get you around the sites. There is no guide on the boats but they do point out the main buildings that can be seen from the river.

Great Place for a Walk. I took a walk along the river on my recent visit, from Ile de France to Gare de Lyon, about an hour's worth. The life along the river felt like the local's life. Groups listening to music in numerous small ampitheatres. Barges that have become homes, restaurants and bars. Students sunning, studying, snacking, smooching... joggers, strollers, the occasional dancer. The Seine is accessible at multiple points, so you can descend and reascend conveniently. It is so quiet and peaceful coming back up to the surface felt like emerging from an alternate reality. Definitely worth a visit.

Wish we had taken a boat. Saw the River, very active, on the next trip will take the riverboat tour along the Seine. Saw locks of love, however, they were being removed. Busy area and just wished we could have explored more

Follow the Parisians and have a picnic on the banks of the river. Watch the packed cruises go by from the banks of the Siene. Get down via a bridge off Notre Dame cathedral and cool down over a picnic. Perfect for late afternoon.

Romantic summers night walk. We were in Paris on our honeymoon and had a romantic walk along the Seine - there were lots of couples with the same idea, and lots of people having picnics or enjoying a glass of wine on a warm summers night. Lots to see too - books and crafts markets, houseboats, outdoor dance lessons, and the sparkling lights on the Eiffel Tower.Paris doesn't get more romantic than this - and it's free for everyone to enjoy!

Best views of Paris. Walking by Seine would be one of the best ways to explore Paris, all the essential landmarks can bee seen either cruising it with a boat or walking on the banks of it. Notre dame, Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, Orangerie, Eiffel tower, Grand Palais, Place de la Concorde, all the bridges of course. Very vibrant, full of pedestrians, mainly tourists, or even locals just taking a walk and relaxing.
So romantic. After visiting the Eiffel Tower we went on a River Seine cruise. Commentary excellent with so much to look at. Lovely time and very romantic cruise.

Do the River Seine Cruise after Half Past 9. It is nice to do the River Seine Cruise as you get to see the important sites one should visit in Paris, In addition, there is a complimentary introduction to these places of interest during the ride. However, I chose to do the cruise after dinner due to the summer heat in the afternoon. Amazingly, the weather was cooler and best of all , we were in time to see the Eiffel Tower lit up at 10 pm as our cruise started at half past nine. Gradually, all the bridges started to lit up as the sky became darker. No regrets doing the cruise and more importantly, the place became alive due to the youngsters who turned up in droves and started partying around. Well, it is a Friday night afterall!

Nice romantic walk. It depends on which side your on. Some sides were nice (i.e., you'll see the lock bridge (or panels now)). I walked from St. Michel to Gare de Lyon and the walk was long. I would walk to the river just get a glimpse of the water, but do note that walking all the way down/up is a long walk!

A romantic boat ride.. We were in Paris June 2014. We decided to take a boat ride on the river Seine. It was a great treat. You get a glimpse on the different part of Paris. You see people along the river dancing, having fun. You get a different view of the Eiffel tower. It was one of our best photos. Good times!

Excellant cruise. those visiting Paris must make a cruise through the river seine.it is a wonderful experience sitting in the open deck of the boat and watching all the wonderful monuments and buildings that has stood and seen the history of Paris.the boat cruise takes half hour one way and another half hour back. the tickets can be bought at the entrance of boat service and there is live commentary of the important places and buildings that pass by which is very informative.do not miss it if visiting Paris

Romantic and serene, but watch out for the thieves. On our first day in Paris, we went straight to the river saying to see beautiful Notre Dame. The serenity of the river and the staggering beauty of Notre Dame were tarnished by a band of thieves who surrounded me and tried to take my money.

Paris from the water is a different perspective. We took a Bateaux Parisians cruise from near the Notre Dame costing €15 per head for just over an hour cruise up around the Isle De Luis up to the Eiffel Tower and back. We deliberately chose not to take meal cruise as we wished to focus on the sights. The boat was spotless including the toilets and a great view of the wonderful architecture was had from the open top deck.The commentary was live and in both French and English and the guide was open to answering questions, he was very informative but not over the top. The one hour cruise was all that was needed, any longer and like many boat outings can become a little tedious. Fully recommend a tour of the Seine using this company.Note our experience of the snack vending machine delivered stale produce, if our experience is anything to go by take your own snacks. The river breeze can be quite cool suggest you take a light coat even in summer as you do not want to miss much of the scenes by being indoors.

Get on the Batobus. We used the "bus" as a taxi, and as a cruise. We saw the whole area from the Seine. The sunset was perfect. I loved standing outside on the back. There are also seats under a clear covering so you get a panoramic view, while bing out of wind and rain.

Looking up from the River.... Take a boat tour on the river to get a different perspective of the amazing city of Paris.I was amazed at how big Notre Dame is and to look up at it from the river sure made you wonder how one thought to build the cathedral where they did. You can get a combo Eiffel Tower / River ticket which we weren't aware of ahead of time, so we got a discount river tour through our hotel.It was nice that we didn't have to book for a specific time just a specific day as things are always further away than they look on a map and I had to stop so many time to appreciate an area or take just more more photo; well maybe 10 more photos...

Enjoyed our walks along the river.. Having the river as a landmark was helpful as well as a pleasant walk. We took a river cruise which is an interesting perspective to view all the famous sites in Paris.

Do the batobus add!. We did the open top bus tour while in Paris, we felt this would give us the most options for transportation and get us to the most sights without having to use taxi, metro, or walk. We were right! I definitely recommend adding the boat to your tour as a stay in Paris would not be complete without a float down the Seine!

Bouquinistes Book Sellers Along the Seine River!. When you visit Paris and stroll along the banks of the Seine on the right bank from the Pont Marie to the Louvre, and on the left bank from the la Tournelle to Voltaire look for the Bouquinistes, book sellers. They have become one of the iconic symbols of Paris and sell old books, documents related to fashion, history, cinema, foreign writers. Their green boxes where they store their merchandise close completely when not open for buisness. Once many used books that once stood on the library shelves of the rich and powerful found their way to the stalls of the bouquinistes. They tend to buy their merchandise in clearance sales, flea markets, house clearances to keep costs down to make a living. With the internet and TV nowadays more people get their info from these sources and less people know the feel of reading a good paper back. Many will never know the comforting smell of old paper that brings back childhood memories. Many bouquinistes in order to make a living also are allowed to sell a small amount of souvenirs. On our visit there I discovered an original Beatles album for an excellent price. One vendor was also selling paintings from art students that attend an art institute in Paris. We purchased a lovely painting and now hangs in our entry hallway. My husband found a couple of paperbacks that he has enjoyed reading. So, my advise is don't pass the bouquinistes without having a look you may find that book or music album that you've search your whole life. Happy Reading!

Nice summarized view of some of main Paris monuments. I think one of the first things tourists can do after arriving in Paris is take this river cruise, especially for those that do not have a very good idea of Paris and its monuments/attractions. The river cruise is about 45-minute long tour of Paris monuments/attractions and the history behind them - quiet informative. This is more like a summarized tour of these landmarks. This tour only covers those landmarks/monuments that are by river Seine (and there are quiet some!) - of course there are some that are not on the banks of Seine, which this tour does not cover. Nevertheless, one could get a good and brief glimpse of these landmarks their significance and plan to visit them (or skip them) depending on interest and priority. It costs around 12 Euros per person if purchased on site and has some discounts if purchased online.
Historic. It was very historic and amazing to walk along the Seine. Loved the bridges, especially those with the locks on them. There are art dealers and souvenir shops along the river.

Boat trip on the River Seine. We were on a round boat trip - hop on and off - which stopped at the most important attractions, but we preferred just to enjoy the ride. It was nice to see the Parisians relaxing along the riverbanks while having a picnic or just enjoy the sun with a book.

River trip on seine. An hours boat trip gave an quick over view of the city. With ideas of places to visit during our trip. Finishing at the base of Eiffel Tower at 10pm just as it lit up was a brilliant finish.
The famous river. Walking along the Seine people watching. The many little shops along the banks. Looking at the love locks.Nothing to dislike.
Don't Make it a Priority!. OK...its not to big a deal, only do it if time is not a factor! I would get on the Big Bus Tour or Paris Movie Tour first.

A must see. you can't help it!. Historically , this river was the life blood of the city but now its importance is for tourism! Lovely way to view the city but suggest you see it by road first.A great relax in a very hectic tourism itinerary!

Take a Cruise on the River Seine AT NIGHT!. Me and my friends took a cruise on the River Seine during the late afternoon, after a long bike drive to Monet's Gardens in Giverny. The cruise was nice and it was very cool to watch the throngs of locals that were dining, drinking, and YES dancing along the riverside. But, everywhere we went, we were told to take the cruise at night. I'm definitely going to do a night cruise next time! We bought the cheapest tour that we could find online through Venere.com . The food that was available for purchase was vending machine snacks.

Boat trip. Had a lovely boat trip travelling from Eiffel Tower past the Louvre and Notre damme under beautiful bridges. Bit noisy as school children were encouraged to cheer every time we passed under a bridge. The commentary was clear and informative. Enjoyable hour.
