River Seine is the Lifeblood of Paris. Paris is a beautiful city, and the River Seine is the lifeblood of Paris. The river itself is an attraction, offering a beautiful backdrop to the many sites along the banks. My wife and I walked along the river from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dam, crossing the many bridges to get from side-to-side. It was quite a walk, but it made a lasting memory. Note that Parisians crowd the banks of the river after work. They bring wine and cheese and bread and more to enjoy with their friends. It is quite wonderful. They also rent bikes along the river.

A Guide to Everything Paris. The nice thing about this river is almost everything Paris is along the way. Start at Eiffel or the other direction start at the ND Cathedral. You can stop at the Louvre, D'Orsay, among others. Of course, crisscross every bridge and catch the art stands and restaurants. Walk along the bottom and top walkways. Get a list of all the movies filmed along this river. That's fun.

Take the Boat Tour. The most enjoyable tour of Paris is by boat in the Seine. Get tickets and board next to the Tower of Eiffel. You will be treated to spectacular views of many of the city's attractions without the hassle of traffic and noise.

Seine river cruise gives you opportunity to explore Paris from the river !!!. River Seine flows through the city of Paris. One can enjoy the city by taking a boat ride across the river. There are regular river cruises from near the Eiffel tower. Its about 90 minutes ride and really gives you to enjoy the city from the river. Almost all the famous landmarks are seen during the cruise. There are several beautiful bridges on the river. Its a must experience cruise and preferably during the late evening so that weather is good and one can see the city slowly glowing to its beauty.

Must do this criuse. I took this criuse with the company opposite Eiffel tower. Priced around €14 per head it was a wonderful experience. The commentary was very informative and drinks ( paid) were a great add on. I did not choose the Bautex cruise as they have people packed like sardines. This was more exclusive !Will definitely recommend this company .
A wonderful way to see Paris - on a boat ride down the Seine. Beautiful views of paris. take a river boat ride in the afternoon and you will be glad you did. absolutely a wonderful way to see Paris!
Batabus too expensive. Loved the idea of the Batabus but they need a bit of competition! Too expensive 40+ euro for 3 ppl even when booking 2pm!!!
Great River Cruise. Lots of City cruises available and starting point for many river cruises. Great ship restaurants all along the river.

Beautiful way to see the city. We took a dinner cruise on the Seine on 4th of July. It was awesome as expected. The dinner was great, but the view of the city from the river was breath taking. The cruise was about 3 hours long, and definitely something I will do again....

Imagine a watercourse of history: celts, romans, et al. I first saw this historic river from a limousine; I asked the driver to slow down for a moment. I imagined the Romans with their nearby baths, the Crusaders en route to save Christianity, Charlemagne and then especially Monet ( hah, an artist, may fave). The river is clean accessible and a visit unto itself. We walked several bridges and, trying to ignore the traffic, enjoyed every moment. A dream. I want to see the house barges next trip.

Eiffel lit up ooh la la. Nice relaxing cruise. We went twice, day and night. A little disappointed with the lights of the night cruise. The Eiffel was spectacular lit up though, it's worth it just for that.

Go In Seine in Paris. We went on the evening river cruise. The weather was perfect for sitting on the top of the boat, leaving from Pont Neuf. It is an excellent way to see the city. Seeing the Eiffel,Tower from the bottom was most interesting and also,a neat way to see Notre Dame. Get there early to get a good seat on the top of the boat.
Flowing memories. As you crisscross the bridges of Paris, take a moment to look at the river,- the boats, the barges and their occupants, the buildings, and the pedestrians.

Take a cruise!. We took a really cool river cruise on our first night in Paris. It was fairly inexpensive - about 14 EUR per person for an hour cruise with commentary. It is a great way to get an overview of the city. Also, just take a walk along the river.

You MUST take a boat tour. We bought the Parisian Pass (it’s a must have) and it included a boat tour. I loved it, it was relaxing, you learn about the city itself. It was about 1:30 hr, it was the great spot to eat our homemade sandwiches like a true Parisian eats lunch at the Sienna banks.

Peaceful and a great way to see the city. This is a relaxing way to view the city and all the famous bridges. There is an optional tour voiceover on some of the boats so you can listen with the headphones or just sit back and take in the views.
river cruise. We have an outstanding evening cruise the Bateaux Parisenne on the Seine. The boat was beautiful and the meal excellent

Relaxing. We look the river tour next to the Eiffel tower and the views were great, there was a tour guide pointing out all the land marks as we passed them. We had great weather for it so made it very enjoyable.
Batobus. Recommended by a French teacher. Much better to have no continuous commentary when you know the paris landmarks already. Useful for on again, off again facility

Bateaux mouches was boring. I went during the day and it wasn't very excited. prepare to hear the automated tour guide speak in 8 languages.
I'd suggest seeing it after sun down, but even then....i think it's a waste.

The river curises are a great way to see the area along the Seine. Leaving nearly every hour, the boats are large comfortable crafts with large windows inside and plenty of seats above and outside. Cocktails and food are available. Great experience

Many ways to enjoy the trip. Sena River, has a lot of attractions walking, biking or in a boat the trip will be priceless, I did a run since trocadero - Louvre and the trip was beautiful in the morning, but I did the tour in a boat and was very nice too.If You are in the boat, I recommend sit seeing inside the river because during the Tour most of touristic spots will be in your left side.

A story to each Bridge. I loved walking along it and finding old postcards, paintings and people dancing...But most of all loved the bridges with stories to tell. Padlocks on some, paintings on others and just over all history to them all.

Join the Locals. We noticed that in the evenings a bunch of people sit by the Seine, drink wine and eat snacks. We gave it a try on our third night and it was a blast. I don't think we were the only tourists, but the locals, especially college students, outnumbered us by two to one. We purchased a couple of bottles of wine, some bread and some cheese. They we simply sat on the side of the Seine and watched the boat traffic. It was my favorite experience while in Paris.
Really nice especially by boat. If you really want to enjoy the river you should go on a typical bateau mouche..thats what we did! and it was really nice

We got to see the Seine in flood!. Beautiful walks along both sides of the river, and many picturesque bridges to stroll across. We were there when the river was a raging torrent, so the river bus was not running. (you would have had to swim to board it!) So cool to see such a famous river, brown with silt, raging along and overflowing it's banks. Not what you picture when you think of Paris! -- wouldn't have missed such a sight for the world.
lovely scenic walk. lovely to walk along the banks of the seine. Lots of things going on with artists bars and just the beauty of Paris all around you.

What a Walkway!. OK, first the a cruise (Bateaux-Mouches) to get your bearings then enjoy the walk to see your favorite landmarks from yet another perspective. My favorite is the walking bridges (which may not be on your maps) but they allow you sufficient and safe time to enjoy the sights, take your picture and make your own memories.

Romantic Lights of Paris on the River Seine!. This is the second time in my life I've taken a night time riverboat cruise on the Seine and for good reason....it's Paris! The city of lights is best seen at night on a cruise. There are ones that include dinner and/or champagne, however they are very expensive and honestly, we enjoyed just taking in the sights, taking pictures and relaxing on the boat after a long day of sightseeing. It's the perfect way to wind-down in the evening. Time it out so you experience the Eiffel Tower lights going off during your cruise, the light show is absolutely dazzling and you'll love the pictures later!!

Sightseeing in comfort!. If you want to see the major sights in Paris in a relaxed & comfortable manner than take a river cruise!! We were lucky that the weather was fab & it felt so nice floating down the seine taking in all the sights & sunshine!!The tour only lasts an hour but it really was a lovely hour spent. Highly recommend doing a river tour, sit back & relax in the hustle & bustle of Paris City!!
See Paris from the Seine. A unique prospective of the city while enjoying a bateau ride, a nice break from walking to each attraction along the river.

The Heart of Paris. Anyone visiting Paris should take an evening boat ride along the Seine--but try and take the cruise just as it turns dark. You will then see why they call Paris the "City of Light." The building along the river are decked out with lights as are all the bridges. And it is such fun to see all the people who line the sides of the riverbanks waving, dancing and partying. If you are lucky you might arrive back at the dock near the Eiffel Tower on the hour and see the lights on the tower twinkle for five minutes.

Viking Rinda does NOT leave from Paris !!!. Viking River Cruises advertises this trip as "Paris to Rouen to Paris", but in fact it never gets to Paris!! The trip starts and ends in Le Pecq, a far suburb an hour outside Paris. Less than a week before the trip, Viking notifies you that the departure point has changed, but in fact, the Rinda has never left from Paris.If not for this, we would have rated the cruise 5 stars. But being docked 3 nights in the middle of nowhere, versus a short distance from the Eiffel Tower, with no adjustment to trip price, was inexcusable. This deception makes us unable to trust Viking in the future.
Watch the world go by. Many times we grabbed a baguette or ice cream and just sat by the river relaxing. It was perfect, especially on warm summer's days.

Great way to see the city. I didn't think the Paris Pass was worth it. However, the Seine River cruise is included in the pass and is a wonderful relaxing way to see the city. Late in the evening seemed the perfect time to do this. However, I am sure it would be nice any time of the day.
Riverboat fantasy. One boat non stop views of Paris! Do the boat trip and Eiffel Tower the first day you are in Paris just to get your bearings straight. It was a beautiful and relaxing tour.

Beautiful views. Stunning scenery, would recommend a guided tour on the Seine, there is so much to see, and if possible, be at the Eiffel tower at 10pm for the 5 minute light show - a truly awesome experience.
Boat trip. The boat trip was great only thing is now they have lowered the tannoy on the boat so you can miss some words being spoken by the tour guide system.

just wondering.... We never bothered to take any of the boat rides, but the water level is so far below street level that we wondered what could possibly be seen from the boats except the high walls on either side of the river?
Boat Tour on the River. We took the boat tour down the Seine. With our Paris Pass it was free. Great way to see alot of the city and I recomend it.

Marvellous River Cruise!. We took a one-hour River Cruise, from very close to the Eiffel Tower. Our package included a sandwich and beer/water, and was reasonable value. To be on the river on a hot day was fantastic, and people from the riverbanks and bridges were waving at us all the time.The old buildings and Ile de France were a joy to behold, and we could have easily done the trip again. Definitely a good way to view the City.

Viewing Notre Dame from the river side. It is a beautiful and historic riverside walk with lots of browsing and shopping stall opportunities. Great views of the city and major tourist attractions. Lots of cafes and bars to enjoy and it feels quite safe.

Bataux bus. There are two different ways to do this sightseeing trip along the Seine. Either a 8 stop journey (about 2 hours) or an hour non stop tour from near the Eiffle Tower. Wear a hat and plenty of sun screen. Brief commentary in both English and French.
A river boat trip. Great way to get orientated to the cityWatch the people walking and enjoying a picnic on the banksSee the riverside stallsGreat to walk along also

Cruise through the history of Paris/France. The river Siene cruise is not just a river but a walk down memory lane. The river itself is beautiful and runs through the important monuments in Paris. Every cruise has a live commentary in different languages informing tourists about the culture, tradition and rulers of Paris. A must see
Great views from the water. A cruise on the River Seine is a must. This is my 4th time to Paris and it's just stunning from every angle but especially from the river.

In Loving Memory. Both on a tour boat during the day, and later on a gourmet boat organised by our son for his Mom's 65th Birthday, travelling through Paris on its waterway is a beautiful way to see the city. The daylight sailing allowed us to see and photograph the beautiful architectural nuances of the bridges and buildings and the magnificence of the Notre Damme. Cathedral' The evening sailing on board the Le Calife was a joy to behold.The exquisite food, and wine, The timing of the sail past of the Arc de Triomphe was impeccable, where the light show on the tower coincided with the presentation of a birthday cake with sparklers, and a beautiful chorus of "Happy Birthday" from our most attentive staff. In truth is was all her birthdays combined. We planned to return to Paris again this year but my little, beautiful butterfly died on 27th. May. So this little vignette encompasses all the wonderful memories of our last holiday together. Truly I can state with total love and a broken heart,...."We will always have Paris"

Great experience!. Lovely journey across Paris. Great sights to see and chances to capture memories.Highly recommend visitors take a ride on the cruise.They describe all the sights and sounds in different languages catering to a lot of tourists.I am unaware of the price as we didn't pay for it as it was a part of the package for our stay there in Paris.Do it!Much love,Navid & Zeena

When your feet are tired from walking - cruise the Seine.. Walking along the banks of the Seine and crossing its many bridges is one of my favorite things to do in Paris. When your feet are tired take one of the river cruises. We like the one at Pont Neuf. 1 hour long, live narration of highlights.

Beautiful cruise!. Lovely cruise, which lets you see most important attractions of Paris. Starts from Eiffel tower, lets you see most important structures / buildings/ monuments including Mussee de orray, Notredamn cathedral etc. Must do both in day and as well at night to enjoy the beautiful lighted monuments.

The heart of Paris. Highly recommend a stroll along the Seine. The later in the night, the better.The best of the city is settled along the river and to get a quick Birdseye view on the city, you might just start with a river cruise.

River of piss. Omg it looked great from afar but the smell of piss is overwhelming. We saw at lwast 10 joggers drop their pants and pee directly into the river. It was horrible. It is dirry and not safe to touch or be close to. We saw a famiky letting thwir child put their feet in the water. We do not advise this.

Excellent Water Taxi!. Best way to travel and see a different aspect of Paris. The bridges are lovely. The on - off (16 Euro) all day boats coming every 20 minutes at eight interesting stops are great. Money well spent.

I can't believe that I have travelled up the Seine.. The beauty of the magnificent buildings, I know so little of the history of Paris - I want to learn more. The friendliness of the Parisienne people as we sailed past - a wonderful memory.

Romantic Cruise down the River Seine. I loved all of it! Beautiful tranquil summer evening! A Night to Remember! Sailing past all the historic buildings, as the sun was setting, sending shadows across the waters! Travelling under all the old Bridges of Paris!

Pleasant and relaxing. Paris is known for its romance and charm! Well.... taking a cruise at river Seine just makes you fall in love with the city all over again!!!!You will not know which way to look and what to admire because everything around it so beautiful and magnificent!
Tour. You must take the hour tour. Our travel instructor spoke 4 languages and she had a lot of knowledge of the history of the bridges, statutes etc

Interesting Perspective. While a little (or a lot) touristy, the perspective of the sights while gliding along is interesting. It is a linear view with excellent narration. It is worth the time and the modest cost to take the boat ride. Some of the boats are configured with obstructed views so check out the boat before you buy a ticket.
Lots of traffic. I did walk the river quite a bit but did not take the river boats....Long lines and too much chaos...But still pretty

Cruise . I don't really know how to rate the river, but you need to take a cruise on it. I did it a long time ago and did it again today (first time was at night and today was during day) and it was memorable again. You can make arrangements via a kiosk by the Eiffel Tower. Again, I don't know how you can rate a river so high... But the cruise on it, no matter the company or style, is a must
Best Run!. If you stay on George V the run to the Eiffel along the Seine is sensational. It is hard pack dirt and a good surface and very safe.

Yes, took a trip on a Bateau Mouche. Lovely day. Excellent views of the city. Walk along thre banks of the Seine from the Eiffel tower to check prices before taking a trip. Not cheap if you are doing a dinner! But you pay for what you get. Daytime trips do lunch but again, check prices for menu boat entrance ticket

Must be experienced from a variety of formats. Whenever we go to Paris we walk along the Seine. We also ride along the Seine. We enjoy seeing the house boats, historic sites and gorgeous bridges. The bateaux mouche is a must.

So worthy!. Everywhere should take a stroll along the river which divides the city!There are many boats and barges that go up and down it and it's all so clean.Such a wonderful spot to take in and when you got tired we sat at the one of the many benches and just took in the few and people watched!
Excellent evening river tour. wonderful way to see the City of Lights in all its glory. I recommend taking an evening boat tour- and the Tour Eiffel lights up every hour on the hour at night.

This you have got to do in Paris. Several Ports to choose from to get on a boat. Suggest you go just before sunset so that you can view Paris as it lights up. May encounter large groups of tourist but the boats are really big to accommodate everyone even on the deck.

Be Sure to Walk along this River. There are walking trails, gardens, local artists, bridges, and scenery to soak up all along the river. We took the one hour boat cruise as well. I wish the U.S. had something to compare!

Spectacular views from Montmartre, as usual.. The last two times we were in Paris, the temperature was in the 70s and the weather was gorgeous. How lucky! I have to say I'm glad they're removing the padlocks from the bridges. It's not very romantic for sightseers to have the views from this fabulous city blocked by a lot of ugly hardware. We were unable to take the bateau this time, but I highly recommend it as a wonderful way to see the City of Light.

Beautiful part of the city landscape. The River runs right through the city. It's fun to take a boat down the river, walk down the sidewalks along the river, walk over the bridges that span the river, etc. We got some food from a bakery and just found a park bench by the river and soaked it in.
charming. I had a boat trip, with sunset it makes river so romantic. Unforgettable experience. Also most places of interest are placed along the river.

beautiful view in the evening. we also took an evening cruise .. it feels like a Bollywood movie scene.... locals also sit on the shore and have a great time with beer and snacks... at night the whole area luks beautiful

Viking Cruise was relaxing and educational. We took a Viking River Cruise and enjoyed every minute. This is very well organized and the accommodations and food were exceptional. the staff is able to give you special attention because the ship is not very large. the shore excursions were included in the cruise price and the guides were very well informed. I would recommend this form of travel on the Seine which is beautiful at slow speeds.

See the Seine many different ways. The Seine winds gracefully through Paris and is worth going on for a ride. Many know of the Bateau Mouche which is a dinner cruise. It's okay but there are so many little bistros with much better food that I suugest either a short River cruise (no food, thank you) or, my favorite, the BateauBus. This is a small ferry that takes oassengers from one point to another for a nominal fee. For example, If you have just visited Notre Dame and want to get to the Eiffel tower, you can get there on the BateauBus and see some great scenery on the way. You can go on line to find where they stop or just look for the sign above their stops as you walk along the Seine. Great funLeslie D
Gross water but beautiful buildings. Rather than walk along, I would take a tourist river cruise so you can see all the sights with English commentary

Just hanging out. East for Ile Saint Louis. With French salat from Gare de l'est, red wine from nearby, some cheap cloth, sun glasses and with my mobile absolutely shut Down. Coming from the arctic, it is really nice time with Soleil with boats passing by. Although it wasn't fun not being able to find toilet nearby.
An evening stroll. A wonderful way to start or finish an evening meal. A great way to admire the lights of Paris. Stroll across one of the many bridges and take in Paris in all her beauty.
Pleasant river views of Paris. A enjoyable way to view the bridges and riverside of Paris . Takes about a hour and you can get a combined bus/cruise ticket which is easiest.

Great Walk to discover Paris. This is a great walk you can take in Paris to get a city insight. Always full of both parisiens & tourist who go there to take a walk and enjoy the weather. Also if you like to run, jogging at both sides of the river it's a great experience.
Calmmm. When you visit Paris, Seine River is one of the must. Just take a river boat tour and enjoy of river and to see Paris from a different view.

Cruising in the River Seine was one of the highlights of my Paris Tour. Its lovely. we had taken a cruise on the Seine river and it was worth it. the river meanders through the different point of attractions in paris like Eiffel tower, Notre dame cathedral, Musee 'd Orsay and its a lovely sight. also we got very good weather which made it even more beautiful and enjoyable

River Seine Cruise. A nice thing to do. My husband and I have been down the Seine a couple of times on a tour boat. It's nice to do this. Going under all the bridges is really exceptional, you get a different aspect of them from the water.

See the city from the river. By crossing some of the bridges over the River Seine, or taking a ferry trip along the river, you can see a lot of the historical places of Paris. Notre Dame Cathedral is on an island in the middle of the river, and the Eiffel Tower is near the river. From the rooftop of the Institute du Monde Arabe (Arabian world institute) which can be reached from the Rue des Fossés-Saint-Bernard, near Quai Saint-Bernard beside the Seine River, you can see a view along the river. This building looks down on the Île Saint-Louis and Pont de Sully, but you can also see Notre Dame further along the river. Take the lift up to the rooftop, where there is a small cafe and soak up the view along the river while having a mint tea. The Musee Branly is also near the River, and the rooftop restaurant has a view over the river and of the Eiffel Tower.

Lucky the Seine is there - otherwise NO Left or Right Banks!. Of the 37 bridges across the Seine the Pont Neuf is the oldest - 1607. But if you wish to see the statue of The Seine - go to the Pont Carrousel; or the most spectacular - the Pont Alexander 111.The most serious flood to affect Paris was in 1910, but in 2003 100,000 works of art were removed from the city because another flood looked imminent. The average depth of the Seine in town is 9:5 metres.It is said that Joan of Arc's ashes at Rouen were thrown into the Seine in 1431, but no one seems to know who actually said this. Maybe a tourist.In the Summer of 2002 Paris commenced the Paris Plages (The Paris Beaches) by introducing truck loads of white beach sand along the edges of the river so that people could relax and enjoy the sunshine, improve their tan, and display their new bikini.On my 1st trip here I took the River Cruse. It took forever. You see so much more by walking along the banks.However, to conclude on a sour note; in 2007, 55 suicide and/or murder victim's bodies were retrieved from the slow flowing river.Brian, from Perth. W. Australia.

Multifaceted. Depending on where in Paris you are, this river can be beautiful, especially at night. I once took a boat trip down the river Seine and found myself staring at a miniature copy of the Statue of Liberty. There much and more to discover and guided boat trips are offered in various languages. The river banks invite you to have a nice picnic or just stretch your legs. The river is one of Paris' most worthy attractions.
BEAUTIFUL RIVER CRIUSE. We took a river cruise via Avalon..great way to see the sites. We traveled to Normandy...saw every sight, attraction on this fabulous Seine

A spectacular way to take in the Sights. The Seine River Cruise is a spectacular way to take in the sights along the River and the commentary is very good as you learn about the river and buildings along the way. A good low cost thing to do while in Paris.

Different view of Paris. Did the seine river cruise as part of our guided trip and enjoyed it a lot. The tour lasted approximately an hour and was a good way to enjoy the city and its beautiful buildings on our first night- and off course the amazing view of Paris and Efffiel tower at night.

Nice. Didn't know this river ran right by the Eiffel Tower! We took a boat sightseeing and really enjoyed it. Although a lot of people come down and sunbathe or picnic on the cement " beach" on both sides of the Seine and watch you in the river as you go by! You can see a lot of landmark buildings from the river too!

Make sure you do the trip. Went for the 1 hour river trip which started from Eiffel Tower and went just past Notre Dame. Suggest getting an evening trip if possible for the following reasons. 1. On a good day the banks of the Seine will be filled with people enjoying themselves which adds to the atmosphere. 2. If timing is good and you return to Eiffel tower on the hour mark you will experience the light show which lasts 10 mins. Well worth seeing. Commentary is fine although not always easy to hear but the views speak for themselves.
Beautiful. A beautiful river to take a cruise on or just take a break and sit on a bench and people watch. The area near Notrae Dame cathedral is crowded but yet a nice place to enjoy the views.

Gorgeous scenes throughout Paris . The Seine makes Paris what it is because of its glittering water and its place in the middle of literally everything in the city. The river divides the city and is dotted with numerous bridges. You're constantly going over the river during sightseeing ventures (and loving it).

Lots of locks. Place a lock and inscribe it with your names. Toss one key into the river. We placed ours in the chain link fence on a bridge along with thousands of others. These are now being removed, as the weight of all this metal is damaging the bridge.
Skip the boat tours - Walk!. We enjoyed seeing Paris much more on foot than the boat tour. Much better view of the sights, and no herding off and on the boat.

Another lovely part of Paris in the evening. Walking the quay is one of the fun things to do in Paris. The bridges are a highlight of any evening walk. You can also do the river boat tours. But walking in the evening? How much better can you get??

Dinner Cruise. We took a dinner cruise and what a great idea that was. Saw many different sights and the servers were great at pointing them out and giving us more information on each one. We started and ended at the Eiffel Tower and stopped just in time to see it sparkle :)

Beware if you have to cancel. Had a wonderful dinner cruise on bateaux Parisienne a few years ago so booked again for 50th wedding anniversary. Sadly had to cancel this trip. Cancelled 2 wks before 60 day full refund. It has taken 11 weeks several emails and phone calls to get lot less than half back. :-(
Backbone of the capital. They said that River Seine is the backbone of the capital, and flows through the heart of the city of Paris. Its a lovely place to view iconic surroundings.
River Seine. Beautiful river seine framed by blue skies at sunset. There's just something magical in the air, in the architecture, the people that leave one breathless.

River Cruise. We went on a glass top boat for a meal, it was so hot like eating in a greenhouse with no ventilation, the food was poor and the boat smelt of "wee". We would recommend just the cruise without food as there are plenty of beautiful restaurants close by.

Beautiful. We had a lovely river cruise during dusk time which was best as it wasn't hugely busy as it would have been during the day. We sat up top which unfortunately meant there wasn't any commentary.

Beautiful scenery even it was very cold in April <3. Grab a seat inside if you go on Seine cruise on a cold day. People will take turn walking up and down to enjoy the view. Highly recommend if you are in Paris! The scenery is absolutely amazing. We originally planned to include the meal, but then changed our minds as there are so many nice restaurants to try in Paris! Please see my photos and vote for me if you find this review helpful. Thank you very much.

Its Paris. In a week in Paris, staying in the 1e we were around the Seine all the time yet never too much. The views on, over, across and reflected make Paris what it is. While we never got on a boat, we constantly watched, waved and gazed on the bridges and from the shore. Dirty, smelly, scummy but beautiful in every way. Its Paris
Great view of Paris. A water view provides a different look @ Paris. Take your camera.We enjoyed the chance to sit and drink it all in.

Lovely at night particularly it you take a cruise from below the Eiffel Tower. The river Seine traverses Paris. It meanders through all of the key tourist sites and is popular with couples, lovers, families etc. who sit on the embankments, take picnics, have a walk or enjoy the sunshine. It is also lovely to take a cruise down the river which we did. Keep in mind that some cruises start at one point and drop you off at a different point. An exception are the cruises on the Seine starting next to the Eiffel Tower. They start and return to the same location. You can do a 1 hour cruise for around 14 Euros (discounts are possible from various vendors, e.g. Sandeman's New Europe Tours) or take a dinner cruise down the river. I highly recommend doing the cruise at night when you can see the lights of the city, including Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame lit up at night. Eiffel Tower is spectacular when a light show from the tower occurs every hour and lasts for around 5 minutes. It is magnificent to behold from the river.

Batoboat Hop on/off. The batoboat is a hop on off ride on the Seine stopping at major tourist attractions. It runs often and makes stops at Notre Dame, The Louvre, Museum d'Orsay, Eiffel Tower, etc. Save yourself some walking and enjoy the river ride.

Les jardins de Paris. For sure a great place to visit ! Very cosy, and only a few meters away to be completely away from the busy traffic! Even birds are singing! Take your sandwiches and have a picknick around the river and chill down.

Book a Meal. The highlight of the weekend and worth every penny. We booked in advance and asked for window seats although the views are great wherever you sit in truth. A lovely meal and a great boat as well as lots to see and something we will always remember on the day of our Ruby anniversary.
An hour cruise on the Seine. Definitely worth a few euros to sit down and enjoy the river views, just to relax if nothing else. A great buy under most of the options.

Great Tour of the City. We took a daytime boat tour down the Seine and it was great. It was a different view of the city. My only suggestion is that you look up the times that the boats leave because if you miss one you will be sitting there waiting for the next one to leave and it may be 40 mins or so.The boats are crowded with tourists so try to get on and sit at hte front.

Learn about the city by boat. We took a boat cruise along the river Seine and it gave us the opportunity to learn about the different landmarks and monuments along the way, lasted an hour and was worthwhile.

Good overview. If you want to have a picture about Paris, some of the most important monuments you can see from a Seine river cruise. Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Pont Alexandre III, Pont Neuf, Museé d'Orsay and much more to have a general impression from the city

Do the cruise. A cruise down the river Seine is a must according to me. One passes under its many bridges and the best time is to go late evening so you get a view of Paris with its bright lights.We were lucky to see the sparkling Eiffel tower just as our boat docked at the end of the cruise.
Cruise time. Take a cruise along the River Seine. Its 45 mins worth the time spent. Can see the important land marks of Paris at a slow pace.
river cruise. river cruise is an excellent way to see the historic buildings,and the various bridges.It has a running commentry too

Beautiful views along the river . Took a dinner cruise along the river and truly enjoyed every bit of it. Especially the view of the city of Paris at night fall.The view of the Eiffel Tower twinkling like a huge star at the hour was amazing

Beautiful River in a Beautiful City. Paris...that's a review all by itself, but the river that divides it is certainly a contributing factor to the beauty of The City of Lights. Its banks are the perfect place to enjoy a sandwich or crepe from a nearby street stand, or to simply relax and bask in the beautiful, Parisian sunset.

Dream the day away. We often sat or walked along the side of the Seine for a brief rest bite from our hectic days in Paris.The river is very calming and its lovely just to sit and take a picnic beside it.We took a Batobus day pass during one of our days in Paris, and hoped on and off at various stops.
comfortable place. very lovely and give a good comfort in this lovely city,especially the place beside the grand cathedral.

Plenty do on and by the river. From the restaurants along the bank to the boats for hire (many with restaurants or on board bars) - there's plenty to do along and on the river. Along the left bank is a great variety of small restaurants, well maintained public restrooms, pylons for sitting and picnicking while people watching. Very social scene, lots of people, and well maintained. A riverwalk of colossal proportions!  Runners, cyclist welcome, and a great place to exercise - seemed very safe and well used.

Whatever the weather. Lovely walks along the River Seine, great for anytime of year - in the blistering heat bar hopping to keep the thirst at bay, or strolling along with a hot chocolate taking in the views.....

See the city from another view!. Great way to see the sights without walking. Do NOT take the peddle cabs located outside attractions! These guys are crooks who will tell you that the fare is one amount, wait until you are at the location and then double it and say it is for two passengers!
Midnight in Paris. It's a must to wait until it is dark, around 10.00 pm in summer to see Paris at sunset and watch the lights on the Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe. Absolutely beautiful
Cannot miss Seine in Paris. Seine remains with you all throughout your journey in Paris. However a cruise is a very different experience. A must do, will recommend a dinner cruise.

SO WONDERFUL !!. I have been fortunate to have taken two wonderful cruises on the river seine in Paris . I highly recommend the night cruise . The lights are amazing . The Eiffel is wondrous all lite up in her finery!! I don't recommend the food cruise .... To make the most of this amazing river ride you really don't want a fork in your hand . Stand on outside top deck & enjoy the beauty of Paris . The dark does not cast its spell till late so plan this adventure when the sun has set . The river Seine will cast its magic spell on you!!

Great place to people watch. It's so much fun to sit by the river and have a picnic. You can stroll for hours and not be bored is there so much to see and look at along the river. Currently May 2015 there a lot of cool installations along the river . Urban camping was one of our favorites , not too far from Orsay. In certain parts along the river you can stop for a drink or little bite to eat , it's also a great place to run if you have good ankles because the cobblestones a little wobbly in places. Instead of locking up above on the street whenever you're walking along the sand always go down and walk below it's quieter less polluted and much more interesting .

The Seine. The river is very clean, people were sat on the banks eating an drinking but no one was actually drunk. It had a nice relaxed vibe at ne point we were sitting there and a brass band was playing.

Just like the movies!. We had to walk along it! Met some wonderful people, mostly locals, walking there. The river was unusually high due to heavy rains last 3 weeks. At places it was overflowing it's banks slightly. Not like most of the picture we've seen. Still it was worth it!
Take the boat .. One of the best ways to see the river is by taking the Batobus. Pay for your ticket and you can get on and off as you please. Grat way to see Paris from the Seine.

Make you sure you visit the Pont de Bir-Hakeim. The bridge from the movie "Inception" (DiCaprio). This is a pleasant walk with stunning views of the Eiffel Tower. You an also see the Sacre Coeur perched away on the hill in Montmartre. There are many photo ops as well as places to eat.

Romancing the city . The river flows through the heart of the city....you will love being by its side...the breeze,the bridges over it,sitting on its banks,taking a stroll by its side,not to forget taking a cruise which will leave a strong memory etched in ur heart....if u can afford go on a dinner cruise cause paris by night on a cruise is breathtaking.....

Beautiful. A lovely big river with a lot of life on it, tour boats, restaurant boats. Little shops built into the walls. The best thing? It's used and loved people were sunbathing, treating it like a beach. It's not lost and forgotten and built over
river seine cruise. nice...you'll receive discount when you present your train pass ( 5 zones) on taking the river seine cruise. don't forget your sunblock & bottle of water when your riding on top

A different view. Paris from the streets is one thing, but seeing it from the Seine is another. This was the perfect thing to do on a rainy day in Paris. The boat was covered and you could get on and off as you wish.
very nice. I liked the shops around the river and really enjoyed the Seine cruise. The river winds through Paris and is an integral part of the beauty of the city.

Wow. The your of the river Seine in cruise specially in the evening is a must do in paris..........
Its so romantic beautiful.
U will b able to see glimpse of whole city.

BEAUTIFUL RIVER DAY OR NIGHT. After strolling down the banks on either side and enjoying the cafes, we decided to take a trip down the river. We thought about the lunch or dinner cruises, but were advised just to take the 1 hour cruise for 11 euro and spend the difference of a good meal at one of the many cafes. Proved to be good advice. We saw everything from the water on a late evening cruise...clock tower lights at the Orsay Museum...Notre Dame...and the on the hour sparking of lights on the Eiffel Tower. We took the Bateaux-Mouches tour.

Eye-Opening. We took a nighttime Seine River cruise. My favorite photos of our Paris trip were taken that night. The lighted eiffel tower, the bridges, Notre Dame, and so much more. One of my favorite things about this cruise was seeing all of the socializing along the banks of the Seine. We saw and heard a group singing and then further along a group dancing and many small groups of friends hanging out together. Fun!
Fun. It was fun taking the Seine river cruse seeing a lot of the sites that we visited earlier, Notre Dame, Musee d' Orsay, Eiffel Tower and the Louvre.

Gentle River Cruise. The cruise tour is nice while you crosses the bridges, all with different stories on it. The one which impress me is the Love Lock Bridge. To the end of the cruise, you will see the Statue of Liberty (exactly the same which France gave to USA @ New Jersey at Liberty Island) but at the smaller human size. Remember to catch the Eiffel Tower taking from the view at the other side. Lastly, if you like the river, you may take a stroll along the river banks when low tide. Catch it during low tide as high tide, boat/cruise will not cross and the river is flooded.
Take a boat trip. Be a tourist, get on a boat tour, or the hop-on-hop-off boats. The views of this beautiful city are spectacular. A night-time cruise is also a must.
Not as expected. The romance of walking along the seine was ruined by the smell of wee everywhere along the banks. Was soo disappointed , I couldn't even breathe.

The River Seine. You can walk beside the river and take a boat ride along the river Seine. We chose the walk from the Eiffel tower back to Notre-Dame and it was worth it. Just enjoy every moment of Paris

take a boat tour well worth the price. It is a total tourist thing to do like the Eiffel Tower. The sunset cruise on a beautiful day is terrific to see the city from the river. I have done it many times and feel I always see something new.

I am so grateful to have an opportunity to rate a river.. Frankly, no comment. Who reads a review of a river before they enjoy it?It is a gorgeous river in a perfect city.Get off your phone. It's gonna be fine.

Plus ca change. Running along the Seine towards la Tour Effiel has always been an enjoyable part of my trips to Paris and the new creativity and investment along the river bank near D'Orsay is a marked improvement. The city has installed water fountains (2), hopscotch, bocci, shrubs, exercise equipment, climbing walls, and all sorts of benches and resting areas where once there was nothing but sexually-frustrated and groping teens, and sketchy squatters. The Seine has become a family and friendly destination. There are even restaurants in the area. Now, if only the city fathers and mothers could get rid of the stench of urine under the bridges, it would be perfect.

Viking Rinda - DECEPTIVE ITINERARY - NOT DOCKED IN PARIS. DON'T EXPECT TO SPEND 3 FULL DAYS IN PARIS!It was difficult to decide how to rate this cruise. The trip was from Le Pecq to Roen which was very good. The problem was that we were supposed to go from Paris to Roen. Instead of being in Paris, docked just below the Eiffel Tower, we were docked next to a modern bridge in the small town of Le Pecq, which was 1 hour from Paris, if you were lucky. Traffic made one trip 1 1/2 hours. Instead of walking off our ship to tour Paris at 9:00AM, we got off our shuttle bus at 11:30AM. Viking lied to use as to the reason. They stated it was due to excessive rainfall and the level of the river. The truth is that the Viking Rinda has never docked in Paris, or had a license to dock in Paris. We were never informed of this at any point until we showed up for the ship at the docking location in Paris, where the ship was supposed to be, only to be shuttled off to Le Pecq.
Paris. The best way to discover Paris. River Seine is part os a picturesque area of Paris. It is nice when you take an open boat and enjoy the best view ...

A beautiful walk with many viewing places. One can never get tired walking along the banks of the River Seine. I've walked all along both sides and every time I discover something new. Today was a beautiful sunny afternoon and I crossed the bridge in front of the Jardin des Tuileries. If you go below one can be still and quiet and someone is always playing some nice music in the background. To the right is the new exhibit on the Avenue des Berges.

Can't go wrong on the water. I wasn't sure what to expect with a one hour tour on the Seine but it is always fun to be on the water. The sights were all above us so if we hadn't been to the Louve or Notre Dame we would have only seen but a glimpse of it from the water. We had fun and the price was right

Paris In An Evening. The Seine, the most scenic and romantic river in the world! You can literally catch all of Paris in an evening if you take 1 of the river cruise. In the 1 hour boat ride you will be able to see the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, the Louvre, D'Orsay etc. Apart from catching the sights, you can also catch a glimpse of Parisienne life as you see the locals hang out by the Seine either in groups, families or couples. There seems to be a hive of activities on the Seine from the cruises, people on the many bridges that crosses it and the many locals and tourists along the waterfront. The best time to enjoy it is in Spring and Summer where you can be outdoors on a cruise with clear skies and get to marvel at all the sights. A cruise on the Seine will definitely be 1 of your highlights when visiting merveilleux Paree..

La Marina Dinner Cruise. Our small group purchased dinner tickets in Canada prior to arrival and it was a great savings. The food was great, views awesome and the service was quick but courteous...would do it again in a second. Easy to find on the waterfront...just in front of the Musee de Orsay.

Hard to miss if you are in Paris. Any visit to Paris will almost inevitably include strolling along the Seine at some point. Its mood varies from sunny and sedate to blustery and swollen depending on the time of year, but there is almost never a bad time to feel the pulse of this iconic waterway. My favorite bridge is the pedestrian Pont des Arts, although it will surely be different without the metal grill railings that were removed because of the epidemic of 'love locks,' a wonderful idea that unfortunately ran amok, in my opinion.If it is warm enough, consider shopping for a picnic lunch or supper and eating it on the western tip of the Isle de la Cite, in the park or right on the bank with your feet dangling over the edge. I am often amazed at how this spot, which is smack dab in the middle of the stressed-out city, can be one of the most serene places of all. Call it the eye of the storm. One last note of caution however, as much as I hate to say this, you must absolutely be alert for pickpockets anywhere in Paris and take standard precautions ahead of time, please be safe rather than sorry ...

The veins of Paris. Seine seems to be near all the major attractions, all the famous buildings. It is like a road, guiding the tourists through the city of Paris. The river boats on it are superb, people are relaxed, they smile and wave at the tourists on the bridges. I especially enjoyed the idea of City Beach, which appears for 1 month during the summer in the area of Pont des Arts.

Either cruising or walking is great.. The river cruise gives you another perspective of Paris and the many things that can been seen around the city. We left from near Notre Dame but think maybe it is better to leave from near the Eiffel Tower. Also there is so much to see and take in just walking along the banks of the Seine. You can spend a day or more just concentrating of the river. So much to see.

Beautiful at night. We did a dusk into evening tour and it showed another beautiful side of Paris. Going along the river and seeing all the bridge tunnels,the greenery on the side of the banks with people enjoying the evening was wonderful. Paris is a clean and beautiful city and seeing it from the water enhances this even more.

A different perspective by boat. We took a 1 hour river cruise after coming down the Eiffel tour. It was enjoyable, although we had seen all the sights from walking already. It gave a different perspective. It was also fun to watch all the romantic couples walking along the river. The dinner cruises looked like they might be a lot of fun.
The best way .... The best way to discover Paris. Walk either on the right or on the left bank, both are great. If having a cruise on the river ? The evening cruise is definitely a must ;-)
River trip is part of the experience.. Try to take an open boat for best views and best photos. Also, smaller is better if you want good pictures.

Perfect starting point to a weekend. River Seine is part of a picturesque area of Paris. Walking along the banks it can be a central navigation to reach the Louvre, Notre Dame and Musee D'Orsay as well as offering great vantage points for pictures of the Eiffel Tower.

Great Trip. One of the best ways to see the sights. Lovely to take a picnic beside and just take in the air and meet people, who were all very friendly, watch the world go by, literally. We met folk from all over the world, just lovely.

Boat trip. Travelling down the river with an audio commentary starting after the first bridge. You get to see some of the sights you may have missed. Please be aware that the commentary is inside only.
Well worth spending a relaxing hour.
Beautiful River. Amazing river and they keep is so clean. We loved our trips up and down the river on the Batobus everyday.

Scenes on the Seine. The River Seine Paris is the old original route through all of the most popular scenic attractions in Paris. Hop on the Bato Bus Boat and Hop off at any of the 7 conveniently located stops along the River Seine where you can explore the rich architectural history. The Boat cost about 15 Euro for a day pass with unlimited on/off options. One of the most beautiful sites is the Notre Dame Cathedral as you approach at sunset.
A fun visit to Paris.. Went on a walking tour on a three day visit. We had a chance to board a lunch boat for an extended tour that was well worth it.

Baton Mouches river cruise. Easy and scenic river cruise. What is more romantic than Paris by boat at night. Well narrated trip past the lovely surroundings including the sparkling Tour Eiffel. Take a jacket it can be chilly at night!

Beautiful Views. We walked alon the Seine and also took a one hour cruise down the river. The cruise was relaxing and gave great view angles for the major monuments along the way including the Louve, Eifel Tower, Notre Dame, etc. well worth the 28 euros.

Want to feel like a Parisian? Walk along the Seine on Saturday night!. The banks of the Seine are lovely. There are people having picnics and glasses of wine as the sun sets, there is a rock wall for climbing, among other fitness-focused installments. One of the highlights of the trip was strolling from the Eiffel Tower into town along the river on a Saturday night.

Romantic - and safe. Seemed odd to me having walked at night in many cities in the US. But at midnight my girlfriend and I walked along the Seine and had no concerns at all about our safety. It was romantic, of course. But if you are from the US, don't even compare it to our cities at night. Go! Walk!

River Trip. I don't like boats but glad I did this trip as its a great way to see Paris and you can get on and off whenever you please. It stops at 9 of the major attractions with some stunning views on the way. Good value fore money.

EVENING CRUISE. After our Eiffel tour, we took the evening cruise on the River Seine and it was wonderful! The boat cruised at just the proper speed for picture-taking and watching all along the banks. The cruise lasted approximately 1 hour and we timed it perfectly upon docking at 10PM, the sparklers went off the Eiffel! Couldn't have been more beautiful while we were still on the water!

A lazy 1 hour cruise gives perspective.. Had a 1 hour cruise before going up the tower which allows you to orient yourself, and the information given during the cruise opens your eyes to the magnificence of this old city.

Romantic. Loved loved loved this trip to Paris and especially our trip along the Seine. We went for a wedding anniversary and took the trip along the Seine in a glass covered boat. With meal included, this couldn't have been a more romantic experiance. As the boat sailed up the Seine we passed couples dancing on the banks, when we sailed by the Eiffel Tower the timing was perfect as the lights began to twinkle all up and down the tower it was a magical moment and very romantic. What a beautiful way to spend an anniversary or just a beautiful trip for lovers <3

Relax your feet tour by boat. After a long day walking in the beautiful city take the time to take a boat tour on the river Seine. Glide true this fabulous city on this historic river and view the sites of Paris from a totally different perspective you won't be sorry you did. You'll see of course the many bridges, The famous Eiffel Tower and of course the Cathedral of Notre Dame. River cruises are generally rather short comfortable and the boat we took was a spacious modern cruiser which had an open deck on the upper floor and a closed in area down below. We left the harbor late at night when the city was a glow especially the Eiffel Tower which stands out like a radiant bacon at night. We enjoyed this and gave us a chance to relax and yet continue to enjoy the city.

Son y Lumminee. In the summer of 1964, I traveled to Paris France. I was part of The Salem College Choral Ensemble from Winston-Salem, NC.We visited five countries. Our final stop was Paris, France. We only had 2 days there, so I visited as MANY attractions as I could. There was a "Son y Lumminee" Show (Sound and LIght) on The Seine River. This was a memory I'll never forget. Jane
A must at night. Sunday is a great time since local Parisians are out having picnics along the river but for the best(and most romantic) time --go at night. Sadly the love lock bridge is no more.

Excellent .. Combine a walk along the Seine and a walk around the Eiffel Tower for a nice afternoon. Start at the Place Concorde and cross the Seine and walk to the right toward the Eiffel Tower. You cannot miss it

A Different View. We took the cruise boat from pier 3 which lasted an hour. When combined with the Red Bus tour for 2 days you save €5. The boats facilities are adequate but we found some of the seats were not useable. The trip up the river took in 22 bridges and the commentary was scarce but the lady on board provided additional info. Worthwhile to see the main attractions from the water angle.

Romantic. For our anniversary trip to Paris my husband and I took a river tour of the Seine. It was beautiful and a great way to see the city!After that we bought a bottle of wine and some cheese and sat down my the edge of the Seine and had a picnic. It was a perfect romantic day. I highly recommend spending an afternoon drinking wine on the Seine. It is a true Paris MUST!
Dinner cruise. Fabulous night. Booked through Viator. It was expensive but worth it. Romantic night seeing the city of lights....Paris. Good food and good wine!

Excellent scenes from the river!. We took a river cruise at night and as it got darker the views got even better! The Eiffel Tower was amazing at night and so was Notre Dame! Highly recommended to take a cruise at night! it is worth it!

The lunch cruise was perfect!. We chose lunch because as a family, we felt we would see more, and we weren't disappointed. Next time my wife and I will take the romantic dinner cruise and see what Paris at night looks like from the river.
Must do in Paris. Walking on the Sena sidewalks is a must on your visit to Paris, it has the charm and coziness of the old walks that parisians do to walk around town

Lively and lovely. We walked over many of the bridges, looked down at the river and enjoyed the views. We saw sight seeing boats, cafes and the bridge with the locks where the locks were removed this week.
The Seine!. This is a great river to walk or run along, with bridges easy to cross. We took a dinner cruise which gave us the chance to see much of Paris from the river.

bad weather spoilt this. we were on the seine on a very wild wet night,such a shame it spoilt the views,but interesting,being evening many monuments lit up,the Eifel was twinkling top to bottom,lovely.Could see into appartments,folk dining in lovely homes,many buildings 4 stories high,many retired bargies live on old barges moored to bank,fasinating seeing inside,quite roomy,very diff.

Nice cruise to relax your feet from the walks in the city. Takes 1 hour, no queues to take tickets... be there 30min in advance. We took the BATEAUX PARISIENS (you have discount on these if you purchase the 1-2-3-5 days metro card).

Batobus service. Bought tickets for the Batobus service that is hop on hop off and took us around all the main attractions on the River Seine. You will see the river or cross over it at some point and it is nice to sail on it be it with a cruise or using the Batobus.

Afternoon delight. A beautiful afternoon with my girlfriends on the Seine, enjoying wine, cheese, Charcuterie and of course PEOPLE WATCHING. Great cafe with a pizza oven too, Rosa Bonheur sur Seine. If you have a couple of hours to relax and drink it all in.

Paris River Walks along the Seine Riverbank or Cruise. The Seine is lovely for a walk along its banks. Often we walked from the Eiffel Tower to the Pont Alexandre III bridge where we could then catch a metro from Invalides to Notre Dame. We found this a lovely walk, full of people drinking on the rivers banks for us to people watch.The best thing we did all break however was to get a 2 day Batobus river taxi ticket which allowed us to hop on and off as many times we wanted. Enabling us to visit all we wanted along the river and enjoy several trips up and down to sit back and relax as well.

River cruise with dinner. A river cruise with dinner is really worth the time. Remember to choose an enclosed boat if the weather is even a little chilly. We had a great though small dinner with nice desert, but the wine served was disappointingly not up to expectations. Evening cruising brings out the city lights really well.

Beautiful but be aware of thieves. Indeed also a must visit in my home town. Go here for a long walk, stop at a cafe have a coffee and pastry and enjoy. How ever unfortunately there are a lot of street thieves watching out for inattentive tourist and steal wallets etc. Keep you belongings close to you. Enjoy
the heart of paris. I would say walk along seine during the day and walk along it at night.the wonderful bridges that i kept crossing ...alomg with the sound of seine makes it a wonderful experience.

Perfect for romantic walks, boat trips, dinning.... The seine is part of what makes Paris one of the most romantic city. Take a walk along from Notre dame to the Eiffel tower or take a boat. You'll find also nice restaurant with great views on la Seine.
Bateux Paris Lunch Cruise. We did the lunch cruise where we traveled across the Seine River. The lunch cruise were very reasonable, it included a 4 course meal and lasts 3 hours.

Provides a different view of things. Took a one hour cruise from the base of the Eiffel Tower. Relatively inexpensive, very relaxing. Interesting to see some of the Parisian landmarks from that perspective.
Excellent for relaxation. Either stroll along its banks exploring the delights of Paris as you come across them, or take a cruise down it. Either is highly recommended.

Nice cruises. Cruises start from near the Eiffel tower. They also tell you a bit about the points of interest around as you cruise by them. Tey and find out first if the ammouncement will be in your language before you buy a ticket. Normally the ticket without any food may offer better value.

Great walk. One of my favourite things to do in Paris is to take a long walk along the Seine on a sunny day. Without much (or any) forward planning you will see many of the sights on this walk which would no doubt be on your to do list anyway. I'd recommend this as opposed to taking the metro everywhere.

the heart of Paris. was pleasantly surprised - came back to Paris after about 6 years - they have really developed the walk along the river on the north side - great little parks/eco spaces and relaxation areas. Perfect for an afternoon walk

Short / pleasant / amusing commentary. Went on a 1 hour cruise on very large capacity boat - efficient but commentary rather unusual (gave some factual information about various sights along the way - but in a romantic story way). Okay way to spend an hour.
nice trip. One of the attraction you have to make dont forget the trip on siene river.. we enjoied too much better to book with red bus ticket to get discount
River Seine. We cruised up and down the River Seine and the trip was lovely. The water was calm and it was a pleasure to see all the beautiful bridges and sights of Paris including the Eiffel Tower.

Good for walking, sightseeing and uh-oh dining. We traveled with a handicapped person and decided we would try lunch on the River Seine and the taxi driver eventually led us to Les Bateau Mouches where we could only get snacks--sandwiches, beer, colas, candy rather than a sit down lunch (we were late for lunch at about 2:00).The taxi dropped us off at the ticket booth and we were able to get cruise tickets.Entry for handicapped persons is the same as everyone else, but since our traveling companion could walk limited distances, he was able to get on and wait through the large line.The cruise route differed for us since it was springtime and the water level in the river was high, preventing the boat from going beneath some bridges.We were able to get very scenic views of the Liberty Statue, the Eiffel Tower, and many recognizable places. The River features walking trails on both sides and my husband and I were able to walk safely and see much of the river which is quite pretty, although somewhat muddy due to the spring conditions.The bridges are maintained well, but I agree with the decision to have the locks removed off of them--get a ring and where it around your neck to plight your true love.
Weekend with family. The good way to see different attractions in an hour on the cruise and rest your legs. Bring some snack and drink. Enjoy!

Romantic river Seine. The nicest walk that one can do in Paris, is along the river Seine.We walked from La Notre Dame ( the cadtedral), under lovely bridges, looked at the passing boats, enjoyed resting when someoneplayed the guitar, and just when we arrived at the Eiffel tower, his light went on. Beautifull!

Got on within 5 minutes - no delay on bank holiday Monday.. There was alot of talk about 'Book early' - 'Book in advance' etc. But we just walked upto the Eiffel Tower, saw lots of boats nearby ready to pick up tourist & JUST BOUGHT A TICKET, GOT ON WITHIN 5 MINUTES and sailed away on a busy bank holiday monday with no delay for those who have not booked in advance (like us).There were many boats lined up, and some also returning... We chose 'Croisiere Decouverte' which has a kiosk right by the foot of the Eiffel Tower on the River.The 18 Kilometre trip along the River, on a comfortable cruise boat, took about an hour.... And you see wonderful building all along the way. All the buildings along the route are very architecturally good & very well kept (Unlike many Cities that have some good, some bad buildings on their river banks, Not Paris... Credit to the council for keeping up a GREAT STANDARD all along the Seine.We found the cruise to be very nice, interesting & educational as the commentary was both in English and French & very informative.Well Done team for a GREAT & ENJOYABLE TRIP (costing about 14 Euro each)They do another with a snack, but the Bar on the boat is open to buy a drink or snack.

Took the night tour- wonderful. River Sienne has a wonderful view. There are tours in the river. I took the night tour and it was awesome. The last ride was at about 10 but one of the companies had a tour at about 11. Also, you can just sit and enjoy the view. Lovely
Romantic Views. Arguably most scienic river cruise romantically in Europe. Worth taking a dinner cruise. History all along.
Lots of walking. We walked from Le Jardin des Plantes all the way to the Louvre along the river. So much to look at. People were even sitting by the river with their own wine,
River dinner cruise was great. Good views of the city at night. Reasonable prices. califfe boat was great. travel to and from by metro was painless

Beutifull . My granddaughters and I went on a dinner cruise down the Seine which was really good
We saw many of the sites from a different view. It is also nice to have a stroll along if you have time

Dinner Cruise with Bateau Parisienne. We went with an upscale dinner cruise expecting the meal to be so-so, and the night lights to be special. We were so wrong - top food AND great sights at night! They must have some great chefs to get food that good to all those people. Just an amazing evening memory of Paris. Romantic and beautiful.

Make sure the boat ride goes thru the old Paris. It's a great way to see Paris and enjoy a snack at the same time. I highly recommend it and ensure your route is towards the old part of the city. The other direction has nothing worth seeing.

how do you rate the river seine?. really, how? it's stunning, it's great to walk on each and every side, the bridges are how you figure out where you are as they connect everything. finally, the sunsets by the seine are magnificent. so i guess you have to give it a high rating. certainly grabbing a sandwitch and hanging out for a while down the stairs is not a bad thing.

Cruise on the Seine was interesting. Enjoyed my cruise on the Seine, however it is difficult to take good photos through the glass walls especially when it is raining. Try to get on a boat with an outside area if possible for good photos.
A different perspective. Seeing Paris from the river is a very calm and pleasant way to take in the sites. The cost of mot cruises are very reasonable

Afternoon crusie and then the Dinner Cruise with the Bateux. the day cruise is wonderful, you can sit on top and view the skyline, inside th ecabin, you can wear head sets to get all the history, it was facinating, must do this, price was pretty good also, and then the Dinner Cruise, OMG, this is a MUST, the Dinner was OUT of this world, I felt like I was a princess, there is a Lunch Cruise but we chose the Diner one, the nite lites were outstanding,
Great 5 day river cruise. We took a river cruise down the Seine. It was amazing. A great way to see France. The cruise ship cruised up and down the Seine at nite and it was incredible.

Excellent birds eye view of Paris. The river cruise is a must you get to see most of Paris's historical places and monuments. In the cruise you even get to know a little history of the place and monuments.

Beautiful, clean...romantic...all you'd hope for. Plenty to do around and along the river. While the city and neighborhoods are crowded, you don't feel the glut of humanity around the Seine, and adjoining neighborhoods will provide the Notre Dame, the Louvre, Musee d Orsay, other cathedrals, and the St. Germain area, which is loaded with restaurants. A river boat ride can be fun, but walking is better, IMHO

Take the dinner cruise. The Seine river cruises are pretty cool, and I highly recommend taking one of the night dinner cruises. They seem expensive but for the service we got, we were thrilled with the experience. We were picked up at our apartment and returned by private service. The food was fabulous and the wine plentiful. There was pleasant live music from a three piece band. The dinner included glasses of champagne and snacks to start. Then a appetizer course with a bottle of white wine. Then the dinner course with a bottle of red wine. We finished with a desert course and coffee.Every course was fantastic. The appetizers were four choices of things I could not relate to or identify but they tasted fantastic, which made this a great adventure. My choice was a cold soup with shrimp and almond slices and cheese. I forget what it was called but it was yummy. My wife had a warm dish that was a type of cereal, and it was also great. Such a nice adventure and we were very pleased. Then we both ordered the filet mignon for our entree and it was absolutely delicious. Cooked perfectly and tender, with a fantastic light sauce. The olive oil mashed potatoes that were served with it were also fantastic. Simple but tasty.The desert course was delicious too, but not as memorable as the previous courses. The cruise ends with a night view of the Eiffel Tower all lit up. What a finish to a very pleasant 3 hour cruise. The only thing left was a drive back to our apartment by our private driver and we slept like happy babies....I would do this cruise again anytime I return to Paris, it was that great!
For Strolling. Absolutely must go for a stroll along the Seine. So much to see and at such a relaxed pace to see so much more. Stop at all the little stalls and enjoy watching the bateau boats.

Take a river tour or a walk alongthe canal. A beautiful river. Must take a river trip by a glass top boat or you can even walk along the river and enjoy its beauty.The tour may be taken from the Eiffel tower. If you take a hop on hop offbus tour like the Big Bus tour, you will get an option to take this trip. The tour takes around an hour.You can also take a hop on hop off river tour whereby you can just hop on and hop off the boat at various stops.

The Soul of Paris. Everyone goes to the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triumph (from the 1800's), but the Seine has been the soul and lifeblood of Paris for thousands of years and it still entrances. If you want to feel Paris, walk along the river--morning, afternoon, evening and night time it's always open, free, always beautiful, always changing, and yet timeless. More than anything else the Seine defines Paris.
Walking. I enjoyed walking in the early morning and it is very enjoyable. Getting coffee before 7:00 takes a little planning.

Statute of Liberty. Do not forget to visit the Pont de Grenelle and the see the Statute of Liberty. If you take a boat ride around it you will be able to get a picture of the Statute of Liberty with the Eiffel Tower in the background. Real cool.

Romantic!!. this is the place where you feel the romanticism of Paris. An evening / morning stroll along the paved path of Seine as one of the best and most romantic walks of my life. It was topped by a night time boat trip which helped us see Paris at night which to me was more romantic than the Paris i saw in the morning.

Great night walk. Of course you can enjoy the banks of the Seine at any time of day but I love walking at night looking at the reflection from the river and the beautifully lit Notre Dame, and the skyline of moonlit Paris.Great for photos and generally musing on life.Quite safe too, nobody bothers you, most are just mutually enjoying the moment too.

River transport. A brilliant way to get around as you can get on and off at the various venues. Great for getting photographs of the places you visit.Down side they get very busy at 5 o'clock time and there are no toilets aboard.
River Cruise On Reiver Seine. Dinner Cruise was wonderful. Great food,good wine & beautiful scenery very pleasant. One of the highlights of our trip! Would highly recommend this.
Perfect. Very picturesque. Busy with street vendors and the water was green. Very nice walk and it's what I think of when I think Paris!

Pleasant Cruise and view of Paris.. We took the river cruise from the base of the Eiffel Tower. The cruise lasts an hour, is reasonably priced and you get decent narrations of what you were seeing. I believe it does not make much difference which company you choose but you should be guided by convenience. A pleasant interlude on the often hectic tourist trail.

Wedding on the Seine. We were in Paris to attend a friends wedding and the reception was on a boat on the Seine.wonderful sipping champagne and watching all the sights and people. And then there was food too. Fabulous
Relax on the river. We took the bateau bus twice as an add on to the bus tour. Really good value way of seeing Paris from end to end from a different angle.

Relaxed way to explore Paris. It's a beautiful, relaxed way to see the city. The audio commentary is definitely entertaining and you can get some great photos along the way. We started our cruise at the foot of the Eiffel tower, and there wasn't much of a wait. It is a good way to get oriented with the city and learn some of the history. The upper deck can get a bit windy and cold in spring, but you also get the best views from there.

Take A River Cruise. What a lovely, romantic and relaxing way to see Paris from a totally different perspective!The boats dock across the street from the Eiffel Tower. A guided speaker phone in different languages is provided and you just sit back and enjoy the view. Many major points of interest and landmarks are passed and it is a great photo opportunity for different not seen from the streets parts of the city.Tour is 90 minutes and well worth the cost.
Nice way to see the landmarks. The Seine was very high and we were not allowed to sit up top, but the tour was wonderful and the dialogue clear. The crew also spoke several languages.

Take the cruise!. Just do it. The Seine is the life blood of Paris. Take the cruise, become oriented to the city landmarks, glide under the fabulous bridges, each with its own history. Most cruises have either a guide, or an audio system with excellent commentary.

The most Romantic River. Beautiful river dividing the city in two. Walking along the Seine is magnificent. We took a cruise along the Seine which gave you fantastice views of all of the buildings lit up.
Boat Tour. We scheduled an early evening boat tour along the Seine so to see all of the sights from a different perspective. Paris in lights, especially the Eiffel Tower, was magnificent.
Beautiful walk. The Seinne is a busy river with sightseeing boats and working boats. The walkway along the Seinne is lovely. A leisurely walk to and from various sights

River Adventure. I had a pleasant trip down the River Seine the boat provided a three course meal which was very good. The ride was fairly smooth hit some rough spots, I think because the water level was down overall great trip.

Walking. Walk along the seine. The scenery is great with all tour boats going by or artisans selling their crafts. Stand on a bridge while the boats go by and listen to the street musicians. Extremely calming. Now get yourself to Paris.
Lovely Cruise at night!. This was a relaxing evening cruise passing so many famous Paris landmarks. I would definitely do this again on another visit to Paris.

My favorite in Paris: the banks of the river Seine. The banks of the river Seine is the perfect place to enjoy your time under the sun in a clear day in Paris. They view from there is really amazing! One can enjoy the atmosphere beauty of Paris while having a relaxing time on the banks of the river, especially near the Pont Alexandre III. Another way to do it is by cycling along the river.During my visit to Paris I always took some time to cycle along the river. I would say the view around the time of sunset is really unforgettable!
Romantic cruise. This was a birthday treat a 3 hour champagne dinner cruise, I cannot fault the organisation, quality of food and wine and entertainment. Expensive but worth every euro.

New walk. Would highly recommend the new Berges walk along the Seine. Very fun and family friendly and a great place to get a drink and sit to watch the Pont Alexandre and Eiffel Tower light up at 10pm. It was a very popular spot in the evening for locals and visitors.
A good 1 hour sightseeing cruise. A chance to see many of the Paris landmarks from the river when one is only there for a long weekend

Dinner Cruise. There are lots of boats to choose from. We chose the smaller friendly and relaxed Calife. It leaves from the quai opposite Louvre at St Germain de Pres. The meal was fantastic and all tables have a window view so you can see the sights of Paris by night. Well worth it for a special treat.

Good way to explore the city. The cruise was a ‘free gift’ from the hotel we stayed, so at first I did not bother to use it as I thought it must be bad. After repeated persuasion by my husband, I went with him and two children, and thankfully I did! What a fun and easy way to explore the city! The commentator did a good job on giving us some brief ideas about the history of Paris and how it related to the landmarks. The ride was smooth and so we were able to take some good pictures. I highly recommend it to those who are not very familiar with the city. Enjoy!

Seine is the blood of Paris. Visiting Paris in Spring it was great to cross the many bridges, walk the banks and tour on a river cruise along the Seine. We took a cruise at 9:30 pm noting that sunset would be during our cruise - leaving Eiffel. We saw the major buildings from the Seine with a low sun and on our return at night. The bridges Pont Neuf and nearby make a useful loop walk or you can take a Bus or open top bus tour for panoramic views over the bridges.Walking on Pentacoste holiday Monday or Sunday on banks near Notre Dame are very busy, and shops full of trashy souvenirs. For a drink or meal it is worth heading a block or two away from the Seine.

Very nice. . It's a lovely way to see beautiful Paris all while sitting down and relaxing. Also if you pass somewhere near your hotel, you may discover things that you would never even thought were close by, or you walk towards and realise you saw these places while you were on the boat. It really was lovely.

Nice boat ride. There are countless boat rides along the river with many stops. It's a great way to see many sights of old Paris and get familiar with the surroundings. Enjoyed it very much in great weather.
Great boat ride. For a reasonable price you can get a boat ride which will show you the best of river Seine and all architecture around, along with English voice guide
