Loved cruising this river!. Such a pretty river with lots of lovely bridges to admire! A lovely way to explore/sightsee in Paris.
Beautiful. It's beautiful, you can walk calmly and actually reflect on the beauties that Paris has to offer. The river is clean, with boats and you can see many attractions from the river bed.

Nice Cruise. I enjoyed my day and was happy that the weather was quite good. The cruise is something you got to see if you have some time.post your cruise, make sure you get to walk around to see the nearby locations.

Just do it. We used the Batobus to navigate the Seine. It is like a Hop On Hop Off bus. We had only 1 1/2 days in Paris sonwanted to do the " greatest hits tour". The views are lovely. You can hop off and do a walkathon get back on. Or you can do the circuit & decide later where you want to spend time. In any case the Seine is peaceful & beautiful.
Cruise. Took a cruise from the eiffel tower area, down the seine and back. Was a very nice trip, and line wasn't so long for the tickets.
Great boat trip. Did a 1 hour boat trip that we picked up from the river downstairs just beyond Eiffel Tower. It gave a great perspective and a bit of history of the area and was well worth it.
Great view of Paris. Take the boat ride and you see beautiful Paris. Even walking along the river is great. Most tourist locations - museums are along the river.

Exciting cruise. We enjoyed a cruise on river seine in May 2015 during our family trip to Europe. It showed about 8 - 10 spots of public interest and had english commentary also. The cruise was for about an hour.

A few days in Paris. It was a brilliant day we thought the best way to get a feel for part of Paris was a cruise on the Seine. Took us as far as the Eiffel Tower then turned around to come back. Awesome views of the Tower, Notre Dame, The Lourve . There was commentary on board & not expensive. I think about 14 euro, but be careful, have the cash, they don't take credit cards in spite of the visa signs!
beautiful experience. amazing view from boat.. we really enjoyed ths ride.. it was for 1hr almost..the view of Eiffel Tower from the boat was amazing.. superb i must say..
Scenic route. Lots to see and do along this river. Beautiful photo opps from the Notre Dame catheral area. Lots of bridges with locks.

All It Can Do Is Flow. Lou Jordan says "all it can do is flow," but oh how beautifully it does just that. The legends surrounding the Seine seem to be imbedded in the quais that border its banks. Each bridge has its own chracter. Some elegant, some plain, but all of them are enchanting. This review is, of course, for hopeless romantics, like myself.

Either go on an expensive one or don't bother. Went on a short ride onboard a big boat with hundreds of people (as part of the Seine Cruise and Paris Illuminations tour) - boy it was so noisy that you couldn't hear what the commentator said.
Walk or sail. Whether you walk or cruise in a boat down the river many of the main attractions are very near by so it's a good location to spend a day

Hop on hop off boat. They way to relax after visiting the various sights on the river. Visit a museum, hop on the boat, cruise and get off at another stop. Pleasant pathways along the river to walk or sit

Romantic Walking at the Bank of the Siene but be careful of pickpocketing.. For the backpackers, there are two bus routes can be tried that pass many favorite sites. Bus no 42 will show us the sites along Gare du Nord to Eiffel tour. Then, bus no 69 will attract many places from west to east from where I suggest to be continued by walking from Notredame cathedral along the bank of Siene river heading to Royal Palais. The scene is so romantic but be careful of pick pocketing. The Paris Police will not give you any help at all. I think they just part of this terrible. See my photo attached, me and the theft (photo 1) and the police who just acted desperately.
Beautiful!. Nice way to see Paris in a different way. Really enjoyed the cruise and the bridges along the way. Cruise was free for Eurorail pass holders, nice perk.

The River Makes the City. It is hard to imagine Paris without the River Siene. Crossing the river on the grand Paris bridges to explore attractions on the left and right banks makes the Paris experience complete.

The boat tour we took was "so so".. The boat tour advertisement mentioned nine stops along the river and a two hour tour. After paying the fee and boarding the vessel and leaving the dock, then THEN mentioned that due to high water they would only visit three stops..... many people felt kind of gipped......

Lovely Paris waterfront. Loved our recent visit to Seine waterfront near the Eiffel Tower complex.The waterfront is filled with restaurants and small cafes that are teaming with people who come to the place just WO walk alongside the river or better still, take a scenic boat ride.We also took the 1 hour plus boating ticket, which was not too expensive considering that Seine is amongst the top attractions in Paris and one of the most sought after place by tourists.The boat ride was fun and had good views of many tourist attractions like the Notre Dame Church and the Louvre museum. On the way back, the sun had set and out came the lights at the Eiffel...made for some breathtaking views.The walk later alongside the river banks was fantastic too.Needless to say, we hope to be back someday to this lovely riverfront

Paris's Wonderful River. Walking along the Seine is a wonderful experience. The many vendors hawk their books, magazines, art prints, posters and every other kind of arts and crafts. The trees lining the passageway make the stroll on a warm day all the more pleasant.But the real joy of the river comes from taking a cruise, or better yet, a dinner cruise, along its course. The river brings travelers by all of the prime sights go Paris and gives tourists views of the sights they would not otherwise enjoy. And, of course, these cruises, whether short like the one we look, or those of a more extended time, also have guides to tell the traveler what they are seeing and why the particular landmarks are important.No visit to Paris could be even half-way complete without a trip along the Seine

fantastic seine. I would recommend the parisian boat for a tour cruise along the seine in paris. I had lunch there, on one of the boat during a cruise, the food was decent, not tremendous, but truly it was worth it. The view is great and it's well organized, you will definitely have a nice time.

So many options. Obviously, the Seine is an enormous river that spans the whole length of Paris. The Seine by the Eiffel Tower is a completely different experience than the Seine by the Jardin des Plantes. Nevertheless, throughout all of Paris strolling along the Seine is a superb experience.I recommend:1. Walking in the Notre Dame area on the Left Bank (south) - there are plenty of little shops with books and posters2. Checking out the boat clubs and bars in the 13th arrondissement on the river3. Pont des Arts, better known as the love-lock bridge, is a great place to stroll with your significant other4. Pont Neuf is the western tip of the Ile-de-la-Cite, which is the island that Notre Dame is located on. Go to Pont Neuf on a warm night when the sun is setting. Bring some wine and snacks and you will have a great time.

Beautiful at night. Went down on the night cruise and it was beautiful. So much can be seen on either side of the river while going down it and the bridges are lovely. A trip down the river when it is dark is a definite must.

Night Cruise. Take a river cruise at night. The sights are spectacular, especially the fully-lit Eiffel Tower. We did the cruise, then our driver took us to other spectacularly-lit places throughout the city. Definitely worth doing!

Have a picnic and take a cruise!. Such a lovely waterfront. Paris is beautiful from the river especially at sunset. The river cruises are a nice way to enjoy the ride but a picnic on the banks is nice as well.

Night Cruise. We were on a weekend sight seeing tour. Took in a night cruise on the River Seine after dinner, it was a lovely warm summer evening, the river was so calm, taking in all the sights and the twinkling bright lights on both sides of the river made it a relaxing and enjoyable trip.

Nothing like a good river cruise. On a warm Parisian evening, after spending hours on your feet, there is nothing like taking the weight off your feet by taking a cruise along the river Seine.You can hope on one of the scheduled cruises that departs at regular interval near the Eiffel Tower. The cruise last for about 90 mins with excellent running commentary of the various attractions along the river.Both my daughters and wife enjoyed it throughly. As for me, I must admit I fell asleep r a short while. Not out of disinterest mind you but I blame it on the evening sun shining on my face. That is my excuse and I am sticking to it.

Bateaux Bus at Night. Absolutely a must-see for first-timers or Paris experts. Take any number of taxi buses (some are included with the Paris Pass) and relax for a brief history lesson or decline the speaker and just chill. AT NIGHT is the best time. If you time it right, you can see the Eiffel Tower's lights glitter on the hour. If not, just seeing it glowing in the dark is spectacular.

This is dumb. How do you rate a river?. So, when you rate a river do you rate its role in commerce? In support of agriculture? Do you focus on its role in history? I am only filling this out because the idea of rating a river is so amusing. It's not as big as the Amazon. It's not as commercially important to navigation as the Mississippi. It is not as important to history as the Tigris or the Euphrates. It is not as religiously important as the Jordan River. But the river boat cruises for tourists are great, and walking across the bridges at night is great as well. All in all, a 4 star river in a 5 star location.

A Can;t Miss In Paris. Everywhere you go in Paris you'll pass over a bridge on the River Seine -- look for the bridge with the lovers locks near Notre Dame. There's also a Batobus (hop on/hop off boat) that cruises up and down the river with several drop off points. Just don't book in advance -- sometimes the river is too high and the Batobus can't get under the bridges.
European Wonderland Travel. We had an excellent river cruise at night after dinner. It was marvelous as sights both sides of the river were brightly lighted.

Great day spent along the Seine. Best part of our vacation was walking along the river. We rented bikes from the automated bicycle booths, and just spent the afternoon exploring. This is a wonderful way of getting a 'true' flavour of this magnificent city. There is so much to see in Paris that we were starting to get overwhelmed. Walking/ cycling along the river was just what we needed. Amazing how much activity there is!
Nice place to relax. You can relax after a long walk in Paris at this place. There are lots of benches and the view is spectacular. Also you can pay some money an go on a boat ride too.

Bateaux Parisien Seine Tour just perfect.. The evening Dinner Cruise on the Onyx with Bateaux Parisien was a perfect way to enjoy the Seine and the wonderful sights of Paris. I can highly recommend this Tour.
River was at flood stage!. We actually took 2 different cruises on the Seine and enjoyed both of them. We also took a long walk along the river one afternoon with our bottle of wine and a picnic.
Romantic. You can't beat a boat ride at night on the River Seine. What a romantic evening. The sights are absolutely beautiful.

It's a river. That says it all. It divides the Left and Right banks of Paris. There are footbridges to access the side you are not on. For a river it's relatively clean. Down from the M D on the Left Bank towards the Louvre-on the Right Bank-there are painters

Jeffrey & Laurie 5/14 thru 5/19/2015. Took a river trip of Paris sights from the Pont Neuf location on the Seine River. We'll worth the time, day or night. I would put this on our agenda again. We loved seeing paris from the river Seine.
Lovely walk along the River Seine. River didn't look very clean, however it was lovely to walk along the River Seine on beautiful Easter Monday in Paris

Piquenique by the River or ride a bike. Renting a bike is very easy and you can actually do the main attractions around Seine paying as little as the basic fee for velib. Take the map and plan the stopping points, changing bikes every 30 minutes. If you want to have a better idea of what you are going to see or do, take a boat trip before.Resist and do not dive into the water, neither hang a hardlock on the bridges, but buy a nice bottle of champagne or a good wine, some cheese and a baguette and enjoy the end of your day.

If the weather is good, walk the Seine..... Lots to see, easy access to bars and food and you can even get a day pass for the river bus - great value! On a Sunday, they restrict traffic on the roads/bridges, so walking is even easier and less busy.

Relax and see the view. Take a river cruise that leaves from near the Eiffel Tower. The buildings along the river are beautiful and it's a great way to relax and see some sights at the same time. Snacks available on board.

Take a boat ride or walk along the Seine. We took a boat tour of the Seine when we first arrived in Paris and we spent a lot of time walking alongside the Right and Left Banks and crossing the many bridges.

Great to Get around. We travelled by Batobus, they run every 20 minutes, have 8 stops along the Seine and just continually go around, its a lovely way to travel through Paris without the hustle and bustle. We booked a 2 day hop on hop off trip, which was very useful and we highly recommend it

So worth the walk. Walk along the Seine from the Eiffel Tower to the Louvre. There is a wonderful eco park along the way and you can cross of the many bridges with the "Love locks" covering the entire railing.

" City of Lights " @ Night!. You MUST take a Seine River Cruise AT NIGHT! This is Romantic " City of Lights " Paris @ its very best!! Bridges, Lights, Buildings,etc. glow with the stunning beauty that IS Paris! DO NOT MISS!See the Eiffel Tower @ " Top of the Hour " from 9-Midnight before your Cruise. They light it up with fantastic sparkling lights for ONLY 5 minutes @ top of the hour! Bring your Video Camera!! It is a keeper 5 minute Video for the folks back home!
Romantic. My husband and I went on the Batobus along the Seine. Hopping on and off at all the sights and a night ride back to the Eiffel Tower just breathtaking x

Sit near a speaker!. The trip on the river was fantastic with lots to see. Unfortunately I could not hear the commentary because of the noise made by people around me. It was our first night in Paris and a wonderful trip was spoiled by some thoughtless individuals screaming and waving at people on the shore and talking loudly amongst themselves, obviously not interested in the commentary. Perhaps headphones would be the answer. Got some great photos though!

Best views from a cruise. We did the 3 hr. dinner cruise, but you can take any cruise and see the magnificent architecture and learn the locations of some of Paris's most frequented attractions.If you can, get to the Eiffel Tower around 11:15 pm. They light it up with running LED lights; it looks like a sparking Xmas tree.

A beautiful historic river. Watching the different boats cruise up and down the Seine is a relaxing way to spend an hour of your day. The thousands of personal locks on the bridge rails over the river are entertaining to look as are the people if you like to people watch.

A national treasure. You must take the one hour boat ride on the Seine. Gives yourself time to recover from the walking and you see many of the famous buildings and bridges. Don't do the dinner cruise, it's expensive and food is not that great. Take the cruise from the dock located at the west end of Isl de cite.

Good views from boat. The river was at flood stage so limited boat traffic while we were there. The police canceled all traffic some of the days. We finally got to use our Paris Pass on the last day. The river was like a large canal that runs thru the city. I didn't think it was pretty but maybe at night with all the lights it would be different. It was good to have another angle of the city and sites from the tour boat.
Romantic walks on the Seine. My wife and I walked along the Seine most days, usually at night. Very romantic and interesting watching the people and the scenery as well. Ron H.

Important waterway. The Seine is almost 500 miles long. In Paris alone, it is crossed by more than 30 different bridges. It flows through Paris and into the English Channel. There is a very nice promenade very close to the river itself. Just look for the steps around most bridges. It is a very nice and relaxing place to walk. There are a variety of boats that offer cruises, including dinner cruises.

Must do - if on a romantic vacation. If you are in Paris, its likely to be a romantic getaway. Taking the cruise along the Sein is a must do activity in that case. The river cruise would take you along the river whose banks have the most historic monuments. Quick tipTake the cruise which starts and ends at the foot of the Eiffel tower. Because it makes a round trip you get a good view of both sides of the river bank.

The city from 'her' eyes. Very relaxing. We went in the day time and saw the city from the canal. The commentary was available in multiple languages. Appropriate for all ages. Approximately 1 hour. Might be cooler on the upper deck so bring a light jacket
River. Nice to walk beside and lots of street vendors to see on way, river tour is probably best was as its so long €39 for a hop on and of your or €29 for round trip

You must take a boat trip. By doing a slow boat trip up and down the Sene - including maybe dinner on the boat , you will see many of the most famous sights of Paris - take the latest boat if you traveling in the summer as Paris by night is still incredibly beautiful -

Never a boring sight on the Seine. We walked hours and hours through Paris and I never tired of seeing the Seine. It is truly the life blood of the city and has so much surrounding it. We had a couple of lunches near the River and were struck on how cool it all was, even filled with tourists. So many attractions on the River, so enjoy!

Walking over the bridges, watching people hang out on the shore - pure Paris. I like to stay close to the river. I love walking over bridge after bridge. I like taking the boat down the river (super touristy but I love it), watching all the people sitting and visiting with wine and snacks...it's so Paris.

Breathtaking. I totally enjoyed my ride down the Seine river. It was amazing sailing down the river and seeing so many famous sites from the river. We boarded the boat accross from the Eiffel Tower and the price was only 14.95 . We even had a glass of wine while we sail.

Lazy Sunday. My wife and I enjoyed a boat trip on the Seine river on Sunday 17/5/15, and what a lovely way to spend a Sunday afternoon, the trip was so relaxing, and seeing all the people along the banks of the river having picnics and ecercising and enjoying the Paris sunshine was great.

Take the lunch cruise. Liked: food aboard the lunch boat and clean restroom
Disliked: no announcements whatsoever about the structures visible from the river. All you get is a printed brochure. The cruise felt rushed.
Seine river trip. There are many wonderful boat trips down the Seine that travel various distances for varied amounts of money. Most have a recorded tour in French, English and German.

The lifeline of city. The river Seine (pronounced as Zein) is excellent place. One must take the cruise. There are 3-4 good operators and they have English, French and Japanese commentary. This way you will be able to see various monuments in Paris with very different angle. we specifically enjoyed seeing Statue of Liberty. It is a small replica of the one in New York

If you visit Paris you can't help but to enjoy the Seine. Take a river boat ride, or just walk along the river pathways. There are many bridges along the way and several great locations to take amazing pictures. You can start from the Statue of Liberty and walk past the Eiffel Tower, Museum d'Orsay, and the Notre Dame Cathedral.
Take a boat ride. Beautiful river to float down on a boat. Informative guide give a history all the interesting building as you go past on a conformable trip down and back for a very cheap price.
Go, GO, GO. It was worth every dime. I am so glad we decided to do it at night. At night as the beautiful lighted bridges and building adds to the charm.
nice. this river gives Paris a nice touch. It just completes the scenery. Either if you just stare at it or take one of the boats no navigate it, it is just wonderful.

Makes for a beautiful stroll. Stayed in the Latin quarter on the left bank of Paris. Took a stroll along the river seine from our hotel to the louvre museum early on a Saturday morning which took around 30 minutes. It's a beautiful walk, we passed the 'love lock bridge' and notre dame on our way.
Cruise on the river. For a cruise on the river we took the Bateaux Mouches which is the most famous there. The cruise is interesting and we can learn a lot from the history of Paris.
Up and down. During summertime, you may take some sun as if you were on a beach. At any time you can find old books and images at the bouquinists' shops along the quays.

Cool Soothing Breeze from a clean charming River. Need I say more than the Title?? Really beautiful river, very well maintained and clean. You will cross it like a million times while travelling Paris. But for once, you need to sit on the riverside and enjoy the cool soothing breeze it has to offer.

Seine River Cruise. The boat was not overly crowded, which added to the pleasant experience,,, I do have to say I was a little disappointed to learn, as we were boarding, that the 'top' of the boat was closed - had that been open it would have been that much MORE enjoyable and allow me to see 'both' sides of the river simultaneously. All in all a lovely cruise/experience

Fun Tour. Great way to see historical landmarks. If you go up the deck, you can take endless pictures with the Eiffel Tower behind you, on your head, next to your cheek......The audio guides didn't work properly so that was useless. They also looked a bit unsanitary.
Nice. go here on s boat, guides available in all languages, plenty to see on the route, thoroughly enjoyable experience
Stroll or Bike. Do not avoid it. Stroll, bike, boat... This is the heart of the city. Each pont has its own flair and the neighborhoods they connect their own personalities.

A Walk Along The River. Nothing is more Romantic than a leisurely down the banks of the river Seine, where you can buy a small Ice Cream cone or Crepe from one of the many stands, and enjoy perusing the many sellers of books/antiques/postcards from the roadside sellers. Many great Cafe's dot the street, but beware, some common scams read about in the Rick Steeves "France" guide will be seen there. Best advice, keep your wallet in your front pocket along with your phone, or in a S/O's Purse or handbag.
What's not to like?. Walking along the Seine at night or during the day ... you just know you are in Paris! The bridges and lights at night are so romantic.

Hop on hop off river boats. The river boat Batobus at 16 euros each is a "hop on hop off" and was perfect. Took us to the major sites (the Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Orsay, etc), along the Seine, dropped us off and when we finished with the site, it was a short wait for the next boat! We did "the loop" three times just for fun and to see Paris from this vantage point. The evening was particularly pleasant and it was enthralling to see the lights come on and to see that Parisians actually USE the banks for picnics and gatherings.

You can walk, run the river by boat bus!. I visited Paris 4 times except short stay for the transit in north station. River Saine runs the center of Paris. As long as you walk along the Saine, you do not worry about losing way. Boat bus is also very convenient. With sighseeing without trafic jam! The River Saine is very historical and modern place...

Nice stroll from Etoile to the Eiffel Tower. I enjoyed a stroll on both sides of River Seine between Etoile and the Eiffel Tower witnessing how busy the river with tour and cargo boats.I wish I had more time to watch the various kinds of vessels that pass every minute on River Seine.

Great Way to Spend a Sunny Afternoon. One of our favorite romantic walks. Between joggers, bicyclists, tremendous architecture and river traffic-tons to see, but didn't seem crowded. Lots of benches to sit and people watch. We brought a picnic lunch and loved it.
All at sea.... We took the opportunity to have a sunny afternoon cruise on one of the many boat trips available to the tourist, a very enjoyable time seeing the sights along the way!!

Beautiful and serene.. cruise by the Seine River!. Must experience this cruise when in Paris. The tickets for the cruise can be bought on the spot and just below the Eiffel Tower. We went on the cruise which had the tour guide explaining the history behind the various monuments of Paris which could be seen on the banks of the river. Paris is a well planned city and so is this cruise. It covers a panoramic view of the entire city while enjoying the cruise ride.

plan out your activities and decide on the length of your pass. Sorry, couldn't find a specific entry for Paris Pass.....I opted to pick up my four-day (me) and two-day (sister) passes at the office. If I had to do it again, I would have it sent to me in the US. Lines are long outside the office in the morning, but the office staff IS helpful.The Seine River cruise was refreshing after the crowds at the Eiffel Tower, on the bus, etc. You pass under historic bridges and see the Orsay, the Louvre and Notre Dame from the water. If you step off the bus at the Eiffel Tower, walk across the street to the Bateux Parisien area and (we were told) section 3 is where you present your Paris Pass and receive your ticket to board.NB: DO NOT GO TO PICK UP YOUR BUS PASS UNLESS YOU ARE USING IT THAT DAY! I made the mistake of trying to pick up our bus passes to use several days later, but they are 'activated' for use the day you pick up the passes. Wasted trip there.If you plan to visit a lot of museums, and enjoy navigating the Paris Metro system (which is quite excellent save for the long staircases in/out) and the one-day Big Bus tour, then buy the pass. As an FYI, the Big Bus people will ask if you want a second day for only 6E more, which is a bargain. We only wanted one day, using the metro throughout our stay.
Dirty...but beautiful. Take some time and strolling alone the river if you have it. It's the image that most comes to mind when people think of romantic Paris.
Nice ride. . The very best thing about the trip is if you are American you get to take a picture of the statue of liberty (their smaller version ) with the Effile Tower in the background. Amazing.

Romance in Paris? I think so. The river floats straight through the heart of Paris and is certainly worth a visit. Take a couple of hours to stroll along its borders and discover what is happening around the river. Find one of the little parks on one of the little islands and sit there to enjoy the river floating by. Enjoying your stay in Paris.

Lifeblood of the city. Our four days in Paris meant we would cross the River Seine on a number of occasions, mostly while walking. There are many bridges to make the crossing easy, and this enables you to see so much of the city's amazing architecture at one time.
relaxing. takes an hour to have river tour on the seine. You see all the famous sight of Frances and breathtaking scene. Very comfortable trip.

Batobus River Seine Shuttle. Buying a one day pass enabled us to see all the main tourist attractions by hopping on and off the Batobus stations in a leisurely fashion! Good value and a stunning way to see the city
Nighttime tour is All Lit Up. The boat ride at night had excellent views of the Eiffel Tower and Sacred hart all lit up. Also interesting sculpture on the overpasses

A walk on the right bank riverside. Tranquil, deserted save for the occasional jogger or walker. Idyllic, scenic, historic. I entered by the Pont Neuf and exited at the Pont Alexandre III. The paved stretches can be slower but well worth the effort. Heavy iron rings mark the working river, domestic barges docked, explanatory signs.

Avalon knows how to do river cruises well. This is our second Avalon river cruise and we are hooked. It is hard to see how it could be done better - wonderful ships, efficient and friendly staff, outstanding cruise director, and fabulous food. Lots of interesting and included excursions, and we chose the optional ones too - The Eiffel Tower, Honfleur, Versailles, and the Louvre and all were good. For the included tours, we chose the visit to Monet's garden was a real highlight, the taste of Normandy was excellent, the thatched cottages were good too. The cruise did not make it back to Paris, because the Seine was flooded by over two metres, and the cruise director arranged for us to be transferred to a Paris hotel, where we continued our tour. Despite this, Avalon could not have done better to ensure we had the best time possible despite the change of plans. they discounted the two days off the ship, added a optional paid tour for free, refunding the money for those who had paid for it, and bent over backwards to make sure we were taken care of. Excellent and we would highly recommend them for cruises. We will happily go with them again.
River Seine Cruise. Took a river Seine cruise and was able to see a lot of the city that way. The boat ride was very smooth and I didn't feel like I was even on a boat.

Brown and mucky. Rather what we expected although the colour of the water did seem odd. Didn't get to go on any of the restaurant boats as the water had flooded the walkways and we couldn't access the gangplanks. A loss of earnings for them!!

Lovely Evening In River Seine. It was an awesome experience in River seine ,the Windy air & the cool climate & lot more ,its good attraction for paris visitors. The perfect evening strolling down the river. The best thing is that u can have biggger & clear look of Eiffel Tower in the evening the Eiffel has lightings from Top to Bottom and a Light from the Tv tower situated in Eiffel Tower. The cruise are really safe and you can sit on the edge of the side walk to watch cruises passing by. Very romantic and you'll enjoy every second on the cruise

River cruise is awesome. We took both the formal river cruise and the public transport one which is cheaper. Both cruises were very enjoyable. The views of typical Parisian life are best seen from the river boat. In the evenings people line the river banks to relax and it's very vibrant to watch. The Paris monuments and beautiful artchitecture is enjoyed even more from the water. I'd highly reccomend doing any river cruise that you choose. It's a fantastic experience and way to see the city from another angle. Thanks
Take a quiet stroll. Walk along the Seine during the day, it's great for people watching. But to have the best experience, take a stroll late at night. It is magical!

Bring Your Walking Shoes. We traveled to Paris from Nemours by train and decided we would go to the Eiffel Tower by walking along the Seine. Although this is a very long walk (I wouldn't recommend it unless you're used to walking) it was absolutely beautiful and well worth every step! Of course you'll see Notre Dame, the D'orsay, and the Louvre along the way, but you'll see some of the most beautiful views of the city, musicians along the way, art...both good and bad...and so much more. Stops along the way for coffee, wine, snacks, or a meal are easily done, by rivers edge or up on the street. This walk is what vacation is all about!

Skip dinner.... We took a night tour by boat. I was told dinner tour was not really worth it. Our boat tour lasted an hour and the site of the Eiffel tower all lit up was well worth the inexpensive 12 euros. That was enough for me.

Fantastic Voyage. The boat tour is an absolute must. To me, it provided a nice overview of the core sights and offerings of Paris-- without having the trouble of taxis and/or metro. You can then later go back to the places you saw from afar. The tour was very informative and relaxing all the while. Take a snack or drink-- especially on a warm day or if traveling with small ones.

Beautiful in the evening!. All you need is the love of your life and a bottle of French wine, then you'll have a perfect evening strolling down the river. It's really safe and you can sit on the edge of the side walk to watch cruises passing by. Very romantic and you'll enjoy every second.

Bartobus is Awesome. Great way to see the sites and attractions in Paris is the Bartobus - it is actually a hop on hop off boat on the Seine - stopping at places of interest for you to get off and explore and hop back on for the next attraction.Very affordable for a day pass. Highly recommend
I love watching the river cruise boats go by.. Very romantic to walk along. I did not book a river cruise because I was only there one day , so I walked everywhere.

Beautiful views. The river is beautiful, the barges traveling up and dow, the tours that can be taken, the walks along the bank it has everything. The best time to view is at night. We had the privalage of doing a tour in the evening in the rain, when the river looks magical. Would highly recommend it. It can't be missed.... No seriously it can't it runs through Paris :)

Flooded and a great navigational tool. People in Paris start giving directions by saying if something is on the Right or Left Bank- the Seine really divides the city and can be a great route to find your way from one central neighborhood to another. Moreover, there are so many pretty things to view on the banks (booksellers, views of the main attractions, the variety of bridges, and the two islands).It's overflowing just a little right now, and it's fun to go the park at the tip of the Isle de la Cite' to watch the waves wash over the pedestrian path (while we were there, a duck and her ducklings had made the area home, and were very fun to watch wander about in the short waves).

Paris,dinner at the foot of Eiffel tower. I finished my walking tour around 9 pm at the foot of Eiffel tower and I had dinner right there near the Seine,it was an absolutely unbeatable experience,having a rest with a nice lamb dinner&glass of wine with the illuminated Eiffel tower behind me.

Brown, but everything's along it. So the Seine isn't much to look at. Very filthy brown. But Venice has filthy water and look how famous that is! Actually, the Seine is very romantic with so many of the famous Paris buildings on either side of it. Lots of romantic bridges crossing it, the most beautiful of which is the bridge leading to Place de la Concorde. The ferries are very popular too.

People everywhere. All day long the people of Paris and tourists spend time along the banks. Whether they are having a picnic, playing music, romantic interludes. Lovely to walk along, sit and enjoy Paris from a different viewpoint.
Great for a day wandering the banks. Very beautiful though was swollen by floodwater so couldn't access some of the walkways and boat trips looked a bit rough. No fault of Paris though.
No Dinner cruises due to flooding. Due to heavy rain no boats are allowed to offer Dinner cruises. This was back on from the 11th as the river started to drop

Battobus. This is a grwT way to get to the major attractions. 9 stops at the best locations by river boat. This is a hop on hop off. A 2 day pass is 16 euros. Well worth the money. The views from the boat are wonderful. Best kept secret in Zparis

Take a river cruise. We rode Mouche Bateau for the tour. We sat on the covered deck, so we couldn't hear the guide, but enjoyed the scenery anyway. Even in the rain, we loved it. We had walked all day, so we could still see sites, but relax.
Flooded. While we were there it was flooded and we were unable to do our ride on the Seine or do the river walk. But we did get some great pictures of the flooding!

Spectacular Eiffel Tower looked fantastic from the River Seine Cruise. The cruise in River Seine is relaxing and incredible. Eiffel tower looked beautiful from the river side view. The cruise time was almost 1 hour giving sufficient time to view the river side beauty.

Take a Walk, a Long Walk. There is nothing more enjoyable than a long walk, either up by the road or down by the water along the Seine. I particularly enjoy the pedlars with their green boxes who sell everything from old movie posters to plastic Eiffel towers. You will always see a number of things that you just have to buy.
Little Stores along the river. My favourite thing to do was to browse and buy at the stores along the river. I bought gifts for myself and some to take home for friends and family.
great trip. A lovely fine warm day, what more can you ask. Great to see all the famous places from a different perspective.

Take a boat trip down the Seine. One of my highlights from my weekend in Paris was taken a boat trip down the Seine. The trip was an hour long, and you get to see so many famous buildings including Notre Dame, the eiffel tower and the bridges. You get alot of interesting information about the buildings whilst sailing down the river.
Watch out. Very touristy with many pick-pockets. Be cautious and aware of the people next to you and don't fall for the golden-ring on the ground scam.

Admire Paris while walking along River Seine. I would not specifically set aside time and walk along the whole River Seine. We did however walk along sections to get to our destination and were able to admire the scenery.
Go at sunset. I generally don't like river cruises, but I am glad that I went on this cruise. We went just before sunset & were able to enjoy the full daylight, gorgeous sunset & night views.

Watching the world go by. Condition of the river that flows directly through Paris is variable and dependent on the weather. It was dirty from all the rain this day. Regardless, there is activity all times of the year, even winter when we were there.Enjoyed sitting in one of the stone staircases leading down close the water with our purchased lunch and wine and watching the world go by. The river is an integral part of Paris and whilst it is mainly tourist boats now it would have been trading commercial vessels in the past.
Unbelievable tour. There are so many historical landmarks along the River condensed into such a short distance the boat tour gives an interesting view

Your wife will love you if you take a walk along the Seine at night!. I rented an apartment near Norte Dame less than 50 feet from the Seine and it was the best decision i made during our stay in Paris. My wife and i walked along the river, next to the Notre Dame, every night and it was the most memorable and romantic part of our stay there. This is something you can do over and over and it's always different and it never gets old.

A good way to see the city. We got a voucher for a free river cruise when we booked the break. It was a nice dry day which was good. The queues were long and we had to wait for the next boat to get in but we didn't wait for ages. The boat is huge with a lower and upper deck. It can get quite windy on the upper deck so wear a jacket. There's lots of room and the views were fabulous. Paris has beautiful buildings and a river cruise allows you to appreciate the architecture. You can take loads of photos if you've got a good camera. On the lower deck you can hear a commentary in different languages and try to get a seat next to the window. This is a nice relaxing way to see the city.

Lovely walk. We walk areas of the Seine daily during our visits to Paris, especially enjoying the views of the various bridges sometimes crossing over one side to the other. You can view the Eiffel Tower and other glorious buildings from the bridges.This year we walked along the fairly new "Les Berges", the walkway right next to the Seine that used to be for traffic and is now pedestrian and bike friendly. It can be very lively there, particularly toward evening near the Concord Bridge by the bar.

A boat ride on the Seine, beautiful, majestic, historical. We decided to take a boat ride for 20 euros. For that price, I got one small glass of wine (a tiny plastic cup) and my first chocolate eclaire. The view at night is absolutely gorgeous: the Eiffel Tower erupts into waves of sparkling light, Notre Dame looms tall and the carved bridges are lit with rows of lamps. Parisians and tourists alike line the banks to watch the passing boats, drinking from bottles of wine, or eating packed snacks. It's a must do.

Boring. Almost 2 hours up the river and back, wasn't allowed to go out onto the top deck due to the swell, and commentary was really boring, coffee was like it was from a supermarket machine.By doing the hop on hop off tour bus, you get to see very much the same views
Take The Night Cruise. The best way to see the city and to see several buildings lit up. Very romantic. Take photos because the views are incredible. Be sure to sit outside on the top deck.
River Cruise & Dinner. WE had a brilliant dinning experience eating our evening meal and sailing down the River Seine. Was magical

Splendid. A long and beautiful river that runs through the heart of Paris. Tourists and locals alike venture to the area just to hang out. When I was there, there were public board games, places to exercise, and intricate art installations. Definitely brush up on your history of this river as it is very special.

Good trip. Good to take cruise in the evening time from effiel Tower to see the Beauty of paris in the night. If you are taking hop-on-hop-off bus to travel in place of Metro Train (good choice) than take boat adder for litle amount (9 Euro) for unlimited travel. Only disadvantage is it takes Little longer time to explore the monuments on the river bank.
Canal dinner cruise. Took the basic dinner cruise. Was great, started near the Eiffel Tower in daylight and finished at the same place in the dark. Arriving back at the tower was splendid!

Beautiful way to travel around the city. We took boats around the city and loved it. Plus we walked by the River and enjoyed the scenery. We had happy hour one night at one of the bars on the river. Definitely worth walking along the river.

one of the most amazing places in paris. to me the seine river is one of the most amazing places in paris. in the summer it turns into a beach and all year round you will find lover romantically walking along its back hand in hand. i recommend to visitors that come for the first time to take a glass top dinner night cruise along the seine.

a night to remember. do an evening river cruise and you will not be disappointed- the food is gourmet, and the style and comfort is wonderful- you see all the sights lit up by night- it is quite magical- bateaux parisiennes is the cruise I have taken for the last three visits to paris and it has never disappointed- a little expensive if you opt for the top standard (premier) but you will not be disappointed
Night tour is a must. Boat tours at night are a must. Nice to see the sites all lit up. French couples line the Seine and watch the boats go by. The Eiffel tower twinkles on the hour.

So many ways to enjoy this river. Use the Bateaux Mouches to chug along under Paris's famous bridges. Or walk along les Berges de Seine, two and a half kilometers on the left bank from around Pont Alma to Pont Royal. Innovative use of recycled industrial hardware for recreation. And plenty of bars!

A nice place. A walk down the river is a must, I discovered some lower walkways that take you away from the street level, however even walking along the street is nice. I would also recommend the Batobus, it's a cheaper way of cruising the river and gives you the opportunity to get on and off as you wish.

Romantic Bridge. We saw this river all the time, it was so beautiful. the bridges were full of love, we couldn't resist. Many have now been closed because the weight of the metal is weighing down the bridge, but there are still some area's open! We were so lucky to still get our love locked in on the famous bridges of Paris! It was so beautiful, walking across any bridge, the views, the lights, the reflections!! You can't miss it if you're visiting!
River Seine. historic river with lots of houseboats along the side. Many bridges including one with padlocks on it that newlyweds profess their love and throw the key into the Seine.

A relaxing way to spend time in Paris. We got on the Batobus outside Notre Dame and there are 8 stops where you can get off and then hop on again. We got off at the Eiffel Tower, spent some time there then got on again back to Notre Dame but the 16 Euros pass lasts all day so you can visit several landmarks.

An interesting walk - colourful, active, varied. Walk from the Latin Quarter to Eiffel Tower and then back - so much to see and enjoy, people, boats, barges, cyclists, runners, dog walkers, lovers and tourists galore.Down at water level or up on the boulevards, take your pick but beware; free public toilets are few and far between.
Magical. Great alternative to the hop on hop off bus. We found this out too late. We stayed on the boat from start to finish which took about 1 hour 45 minutes. Very enjoyable.

Spectacular river cruise at night. I was on a night cruise for a wedding reception. The "City of Lights" is just amazing at night on the river. Since our boat was chartered for the evening, I do not know about other boats/trips.

Sit back and enjoy the cruise, don't waste too much time with photos. This was a very interesting and informative (if you listen to the commentary along the way) Seine river cruise. The seats are definitely small and there is little/no leg room if you sit in a row. There were definitely some awkward moments where the person sitting in front of me shifted around and his behind was resting straight on my knee. I usually like to take photos on things like this, but this is the first time I wish I hadn't. The walls along the Seine make it very difficult to get a good view of most of the buildings. Most of the time you could see the roof of what you were trying to see. If you want a view of the Notre Dame and the Île de la Cité, make sure you sit on the RIGHT side of the boat.I would still recommend going on a cruise like this - just save your camera for when you are walking around instead. (Side note: one exception to this is the Eiffel Tower - there is a great view of it from the river.)
A trip In-Seine. Took the boat trip. Well worth it. A pleasant and informative hour. Didn't do the restaurant one- just the talk tour which was both live and by hand device thingy.

Boat Cruise and a walk along the Seine. If the weather is nice definitely take time to walk down the Seine or take a boat cruise down the river. Its a good way to get your bearings and hear about the city.
re river cruise. this really is a must and worth every penny loved it and it wasn't expensive you get an hour cruise for 14 euros each well worth it even better if the weather is good

Pleasant cruise on CroisiEurope to Impressionist contry.. Good food and casual atmosphere with largely French fellow-travellers. Erratic guides with only one truly bilingual in French and English. Although not one of their themed cruises, more emphasis on Impressionists and their painting locale would have been beneficial

Une Croisiere sur La Seine. it's a long river that runs smoothly through Paris and it's actually one of the best ways to see the city, take pictures and have a bite on board "le bateau mouche". you can see whole Paris, from distance, and to help, there's a map on board which tells you about the landmarks you're going to see.. have fun

A Must Do!. We did one of the river boat cruises and had SO much fun! They point out all the interesting building and facts about them. They also point out buildings/bridges etc. that someone famous may have lived or visited. Highly recommend.
You must. Walked from the a Museum Louvr to the Eiffel Tower at dusk. Arrived just in time for the lighs to come on.

The best way to see Paris?. The River Seine epitomises the romance of Paris and there are so many sights you can see just from walking along the banks. Take your time and explore. It is fun to stand on the bridges and just absorb the atmosphere and people watch. On good days, take a picnic and enjoy some leisure time on the banks. There are lots of boat trips to be done and these are recommended as they give a different perspective from the water. Explore the book stalls near St Germain/ St Michel.
Heart of Paris. So grateful to set eyes upon this historical river....could only imagine all that happened along it's banks.
Take the Boat Tour. The river is dirty, but the history is fabulous. The boat tour gives you a great perspective on the city. It will help you to better understand where everything is located.
The River of Paris. The life of Paris moves along, across and from La Seine.A romantic way to move around Paris and a great way to see the city.

Seine River Cruise - Fabulous. We took an Avalon River Cruise from Paris to Normandy. A river cruise is a fabulous way to see several great cities without having to navigate to them on your own. The river is beautiful and being able to enjoy the sites with cocktail in hand while someone else took care of the logistics was so worthwhile. Seeing the countryside from this river view was unique. We saw several landmarks and the boat stopped at major locations quite often. Highly recommend.
Wonderful. The cruise in the river seine is one wonderful thing to do when in Paris. The river runs through the heart of the city.

Avalon River Seine Cruise. Cruise from Paris to Normandy and back to Paris, 8 days on the Creativity was amazing. The top deck cabins are a must for viewing the amazing scenery from your room, lower decks would not have as good a view, the cost a little more but worth it. Meals were fantastic and additional alcohol can either be purchased on board or bottles can be bought on board at the different towns you stop at. All bottles have corks so at the place of purchase they will open them for you or pay a corkage fee on board.A choice of included tours were offered at each town and all were very well presented with guides from each area very informative (only one guide was over the top offering her own opinion on everything).Monet's Garden was the highlight, the day being warm and sunny at the start of spring flowers were beautiful and our tour given priority entry so not too crowded.Taking into account the cruise included your first class accommodation, fantastic meals, nightly entertainment on board, transport and the ease of entry and viewing of all the tourist attractions this cruise was very good value.We stayed in a different hotel to the Paris Pullman where you meet in Paris to join the cruise. At half the price the La Fabe was within walking distance even with our suitcases and was a nice little boutique hotel.With only 140 passengers on board this company and cruise is highly recommended.

Wonderful cruises on the river Seine. We Parisians live on the river Seine : - Batobus, buses on the river (very cheap) - One hour cruises to show Paris to our visitors : the best show in Paris at a very reasonable price - A meal during a cruise for a special occasion (birthday etc...) lunch or dinner;;; - Privatization of a boat for a wedding or a retirement party. I was often invited for such occasions : wonderful memories of these marvellous cruises.

St Martin Canal. A scenic River Seine cruise through the locks of Paris was very enjoyable. The St Martin Canal cruise is a little different to the popular River Seine cruise. It travels through locks,an interesting exercise for those who haven't experienced the lock system. Usually it is an automated system but on this day there was a a strike in Paris and a man had to cycle to every lock to manually work the gates. It kept us entertained.
River Cruise. Excellent cruise, Paris to Normandy and back.It was very enjoyable,stopped at different towns on the way.
Amazing. It was a cold but dry day so perfect for a cruise. Thoroughly enjoyed by both of us and a good way to see the sights of Paris

It's a River.... There's not much you can say about it. It's a river. We did do a boat cruise (1 hour long) that left from Pont Neuf, and returned there. We went up and down the Seine at twilight, to see some of the major attractions lit up from a different perspective at night. It was beautiful. Cross the many bridges throughout Paris, and you'll see the fast moving Seine beneath you. We wished upon a few 0.01 euros, as well as a US penny that we found on the street, and threw them into the river. We did read that during the summer, the city puts some sand on a parallel road, and creates a pseudo beach for the visitors, and Parisians alike.
Lovely. Watch locals take a break at lunchtime. With the sun shinning and some bread cheese and wine there a fabulous view on the riverbank to watch the world go by.

Always a joy to walk along this river... ...enjoying the scenery, bridges, people and lovely french buildings. One of my favorite places to visit while in Paris is walking along and criss-crossing around the river..
Best way for quick view of various parts of Paris. I did a river cruise. Best way to view Paris, people watch, see the museums and key landmarks of Paris. Definitely a must!

Seine au nuit. Take your boat tour at night, and only at night, and you will be in love with everything you see on the one hour boat trip. The banks with throngs enjoying the night, the apartment houses along the side.....and the Tower lit up. Must see at night!

Cruise of river Seine. We did the Batobus hop on hop off cruise, it stops at 9 major landmarks and we had a ball - highly reccomend - you can also buy a pass which includes buses as well so work out where you want to go and buy the most suitable pass .

Both Banks are Wicked Cool!. The River is the heart of Paris! Going on a tour down the river at night is a must as is sitting at a sidewalk café watching the river flow. Wine and espresso flows as does the river. If you fine the river you can never get lost in Paris.
Beautiful at night!!. We did a riverboat ride down the river at night. Just beautiful. It was cool at night, but so worth being outside the boat to get the 360 views up and down the river.
Batobus is the best!. Hop on and Hop off as you please all day for around 12E. 9 stops including Eiffel Tower, Musee d'Orsay, Louvre. Easy to use.

"memorable boat ride". the cleanliness of the river makes this river beautiful.though there are immense cruises runs in this river they are well maintained.
our guide was an knowledgeable lady who explained smallest of the things around.
make sure your memory card is free to take lot of click !!!

Great Ambience!. The river looks lovely with its many bridges ,overhanging trees along the edges, numerous grand statues, many people either sitting or strolling along its edges and the tourist boats moving up and down. In some places there are tourist stalls and painters along the edges such as opposite the Notre Dame and Eiffel Tower. There are stairs down to the walkway along the river at regular intervals allowing for easy access.The atmosphere provided by the river is wonderful and not to be missed.Take the time to take a relaxing stroll.

Magical river!. We took an evening Dinner Cruise which was spectacular in December with all the Christmas lights. Food delicious and relaxing cruise along the Seine and around the Ile de France! Highly recommended!
SEINE LUNCH CRUISE. Took a lunch cruise (3 hours) and the food and wine were great. It is a great way to see Paris from another aspect.

Ride Le Bateau. Had a super boat trip down the Seine, passed under 22 bridges and saw all the places of interest as pointed out by the guide. There were also headsets to each seat and you could select your own language which was handy. Well worth doing and very enjoyable on a nice sunny day.
Parisian river. The river Seine flows through Paris city. It provides Parisian serene walkway along its bank. Boat tours on river Seine is popular among tourists.

Grab a baguette and have a picnic. On a lovely spring or summers day this is one of the nicest places in Paris.
I've grabbed a baguette from a local bakery and had a picnic along the banks of the river watching all of the river boats, barges and cruises pass by.

Photoshoot.. The guy doing the commentary was great.
The seats are SO uncomfortable!
Preferred this trip than the last time we went a few summers ago when the the sun shone down on us relentlessly.
Interesting Walk. Lots of vendors selling tourist items and food stalls....................................................................................................not much more to say.

A different perspective, and efficient way to get about. We didn't go on one of the guided tour boats, but instead used the 'Batobus'. This is a hop on/hop off service constantly plying the river from the Jardin des Plantes in the East to the Tour Eiffel in the West, calling at places like Notre Dame, the Louvre and the Musee d'Orsay. There's one every 20 minutes all day, and a day pass is just €13 - great value.
The Serene Seine!. Very serene indeed. I took the boat ride form right opposite the Eiffel Tower. This is probably the best way to experience the river!
beutiful. walk in the island and there is such a feeling of romance day or night. The trees aligned are filled with character. it is a magic area

Paris Is for Lovers. Here's Proof. It is said to have started in Russia or Italy, so maybe Paris wasn't first. But starting seven years ago, Parisians, or more likely Paris-smitten lovers, have been head over heels, or more likely over themselves, professing their love along the bridges of the Seine. Not that they're risking an actual plunge into the barge-stirred soup. But over these years, 700,000 couples, by one published but otherwise undocumented account, and more likely more than a million, have marked their names or initials on hardware-store padlocks. They have hooked these locks to gates along at least three bridges that cross the Seine, or to locks of older locks locked to the bridges. They have created such dense thickets of steel and brass that gates along one bridge have fallen into the Seine. Parisians evidently take this "love lock" phenomenon in stride as perhaps a routine expression of the hormonal ardor long attributed to them. But a few Americans, prudes perhaps or current or former tourists, have been raising alarms and urging the authorities to stop the desecration. They might succeed, so it behooves visitors to the celebrated city of love to visit theses bridges before more land in the drink.

Take a rest. Walk down the steps to sit by the beautiful Seine. If you are lucky enough to be on the Left Bank, you can look across at the Louvre and watch the boats go past. A calm and peaceful respite in the middle of the city!

Great for getting about around Paris to see sights. Bought a ticket for the water bus along the River Seine. Money well spent, was able to hop on and off the boat at certain sights along the Seine. Well used so I imagine could get busy in holiday times, but a very good alternative to the Metro. Covered area on board if weather take a turn for the worse.

great way to get about. We bought a batobus ticket which lasts all day so you can get on and off. Boat comes every 20 mins and essentially does a large circle round the centre of Paris, so not only csn you look at the city , you can also get off and visit the various sites, Notre Dame, Eiffel Tower, Louvre etc to name but a few.
Had a little cruise, it was lovely.. It is a lovely sight. We cruised for an hour as part of our Hop on Hop off bus ticket. Really nice. Left from the Eiffel Tower.
Ride in the Seine. A ride on the Seine river will give you a glimpse of Paris. Best ridden with your loved-one to really experience Paris.

Can't be in Paris without a view of the Seine...boatside!. Beautiful Paris, more breathtaking through boat sire....enjoyed it particularly for the 1.5 hour ride we too touring the City. It was a hop-on, hop-off setup, and on its own was quite enjoyable. Batobus is fun and affordable!
Nice tour. Enjoyed a leisurely cruise down the river, quick way to get to the sites and absorb the atmosphere. Rug up if you are going in winter or early spring, it is really cold!
By night. We did a night cruise and it was spectacular to see everything lite up and sparkling in the night sky
Very Quiet Cruise. The Seine was surprising quite clean with many notable historical places along its banks. I enjoyed our informative cruise but would have enjoyed more had it been a bit warmer.

All aboard. Grab yourself a trip in the Seine and enjoy the views from a different angle. We went on the batobus which stops at 8 different attractions and costs 16 eur for a day so you can use it as many times as you wish.

Suprisinlgy clean. I couldn't believe how clean it was considering it runs through a capital city. Paris should be very proud of it. It was a lovely green/aqua colour which probably sounds gross but compared to the brown of the Thames it was amazing.We walked along the Seine with the sun beating down, we sat along the river just watching the waves and the boats go past. My only criticism is... not really about the river itself but the walkway along side it. Which is fine for the most part however where it passes under bridges there is the occasional homeless set up which wasn't too bad but what was bad was the smell of urine. Which kinda spoiled the walk as you find yourself holding your breath when a bridge comes along.

Fun and informative.. We took a river cruise that lasted an hour or so. It was fun to sit outside and watch all the sites from the water. There are some that you pay one price and can get on and off all day. It would be well worth the money, we did not realize it until too late. They also sold snacks and beverages for the tour, which was fun.

Its a interesting guide to adjust to the city sights.. We followed the river from the Notre Dame Cathedral, the Catacombs, the Louvre and Musee Dorsay, Eiffel tower, even the World famous Longchamp Race Track . Paris locals roller skate , walk , bike ride, eat, drink, smoke , picnic while watching tourists from all over the World visit their country .

Seine cruise. We took the seine river cruise during the evening when it started to get dark and windy. It is the best time to take the tour where you will see all the best places in day and night. Its very near to the Eiffel tower and can be booked from the point itself.

Fantastic view. Beautiful view of Paris and eiffel tower, Great experience to see the bridges and buildings along the Seine, with commentary. Its a must do in Paris. We took the evening river seine cruise to see the sparkling Eiffel tower.

Typical river--smells of urine near and all around the city. Walking along the river may seem nice but the city itself is dirty and smells of urine....everywhere! So disgusting! This city needs to provide more free bathrooms around!

River of dreams. We've walked long stretches of the Seine on both sides, in the sunshine, and just today, in the rain. There's something special about this waterway, not the least of which of course is its amazing history. Coming from Perth Western Australian where the river through the city has little commercial use, it is great to see all the commercial vessels plying their trade on this narrowish waterway, carting materials for industry and building. On our first day here we boarded a Batobus and traversed the part of the river this covers in the centre of the city, but we found the view of the buildings and surrounds hidden to a degree because of the high walls along the Seine. Still a good experience but I think we've enjoyed walking along its borders more. We also saw a lock operating at the bottom of the small port where pleasure boats are kept, and assist their entry and exit to the Seine. A special feature of this amazing city.

Excellent. Lovely way to spend an hour. We got on a boat by the Eiffle Tower and chose the tour with a glass of champagne. The views were wonderful and less busy from the river. A must do in my opinion and very reasonably priced.

A visit to Paris is never complete without it. It was my second visit to Paris and the Seine river whilst it was the first for our nine year old daughter. We took a boat cruise along the river right after going up the Eiffel tower and before that a bus ride touring the city's main attractions as part of our half day tour program. We were given a set of earphones each for the running commentary detailing what we were about to see along both sides of the river. The earphones could be cumbersome but since it was our second time on such cruise, we could enjoy looking around without being really bothered with it. It was such fun to see how much influence the river has on the city and its inhabitants. After the cruise we walked along the Seine to return to our hotel. Took us one and half hours instead of the estimated 45 minutes, because there were just too many interesting photo stops, beautiful monuments and buildings, and people watching activitiy that was just too fascinating to miss. We walked along the Seine again and afain after that basking in what it had to offer. We felt that the citizens of Paris are so lucky to have the Seine. Although it was not a crystal clear, beautiful, picturesque river, it has its charms that invites you to return everytime you are in Paris.
Hunt's Paris Trip. It was a lovely ride up the Seine! I got lots of BEAUTIFUL pictures on the way to the Notre Dame Cathedral....
Beautiful. We overlooked the Seine from Lovelock Bridge, a lovely day out, straight after our visit to Notre Dame, then we walked along the banks looking at the art and stalls - magic!
boottour. I would totaly recommend to do a tour on "La Seine". it is very romantic and you can enjoy all the buildings and the atmosphere of Paris!

Relaxing way to view city. Lovely relaxing way to get around Paris and see main sites. We got boat at Notre Dame cathedral and travelled along Seine. Fantastic bi lingual guide pointed out important parts of city. A lovely way to see Paris.

Try to enjoy it (not) like a tourist :-). Don't feel like you are missing something if you don't do the cruise, like advised by all the travel guides you read about Paris. Seine is magic on its own. It is enjoyable in so many ways. Not just by hopping on a boat. My husband and were just back from Paris a couple of days ago and guess what, we walked along the river hand in hand, watching the people, buildings, cafes, and the life around it- and that was simply romantic. We did it on bright afternoons with soft breeze, on majestic orange sunsets, on quiet starry evenings, and those were moments we'll not forget. Of course you can join other hundred of tourists cramming on a boat which can also be fun I am sure, but we chose to have lovely dreamy peaceful walk on ourselves admiring the view, sit down on the edge gazing at the sky, the stars, accompanied with slices of delicious French baguette, cheese and wine. We started, stopped and continued again as we wished. No queuing, no tickets, no deadline. It is for us, a true (boat-free) Parisian experience. :-)

You don't have to visit it , you see it everyw!. Walking in Paris is going by or crossing a bridge on river seine .The nicest bridge you need to cross is Alexander bridge .Don't miss watching the thousends of lovers locks on the bridges .There are also boats you can enjoy sailing .
Romantic Seine. Walk the Seine holding your sweethearts hand or arm in arm. There are quieter places even in the city. Enjoy the booksellers, stroll, relax, stop at a cafe! Enjoy!

'Vive La Batobus'. What an excellent service. This is a public service and we found to be most efficient and reliable. we had a 3 day pass and this proved to be great value for money. we managed to make full use of this service during our 4 day stay. Plus great views along the Seine Highly recommended. Malcolm S Stott 9/10

Beautiful afternoon on the Seine. We went on the boat in the afternoon, just before sunset. The boat was packed with people on both decks, but everybody had great views of the city from the boat. The banks of the Seine were packed with people enjoying a great afternoon after work. People were waving from passing boats and the banks of the river. It was a great experience and worth the while.

Beautiful. Beautiful river running through the centre of paris! Paved on both sides, you can walk along it as much or as little as you like! Walked most of the central run and was so nice, lots and lots of nice cafes either side selling amazing food. Lots of cruises and boats float on it and I think they are quite affordable, Wish I had done one!
Sunset cruise. Loved this...music and interesting commentary as you float along one of the most famous rivers in the world..you cannot have the true Parisian experience without a river cruise!

One of the best walks and photo opportunities in paris. We to a couple of long walks along the Seine, people watching and looking at some wonderful buildings ... It provides easy walking access to all the great monuments of Paris If you get tired walking as I did, there is something called the bateau bus. The small shops along the edge are pretty neat if you have time to see what they are selling. At dusk when the lights come on is an awesome experience in Paris.

Cruise up the majestic Seine !. Cruise up the majestic Seine & see how beautiful Paris famous sites are released from a new perspective. From the water it is possible to see the bridges & monuments of Paris. This hour long river cruise delivers spectacular & hidden views of this magnificent city. An informative historical & cultural commentary is available in English. The main Bateaux Parisiens pier is located close to the Eiffel Tower. Do not miss this wonderful opportunity for any Paris visitor to better understand the geography of the city.

Enroute to all the attractions. The perfect way to enjoy seine is by taking a stroll along its bank and experiencing Paris on foot. As such there is nothing to call it a special must visit place since seine flows through the backdrop giving a very scenic atmosphere. To enjoy, hop into a restaurant or try outdoor cafes and you will have a better experience of Seine.
River cruise well worth it. A river cruise gives an entirely different perspective of the oldest part of the city. A comprehensive commentary gave a great overview of the city from ancient times.
Great way to see the city. We did an hour trip on the Seine, it was great value and gave you a different perspective to the city

Heaven on water. The boats are marketed very well, and are easy to hop on and off - I had a great time seeing what each stop had to offer, and then back on again and up the river a bit more in the sunshine. Never unmanageable crowds

a bit disappointed. The buildings surrounding the Seine are very nice but the fact you don't find a lot off outdoor small eating opportunities along the Seine were a bit disappointing. Also quite a lot of traffic.

A Romantic coast of Paris.. River - is a landmark of the city. It is necessary to explore it in two ways. 1. take a walk along the promenade. 2. book a tour by boat and see the Paris's view from the the river

Even in the cold and rain, it was great to walk along the Seine.. We could have walked all day along the Seine had it not been for the weather. So much of Paris is right on the river. And, when you get close and take your time, you see all kinds of things, like the houseboats, the uniqueness of each and every bridge and lots of Parisians going about their lives. The tourist mob up certain parts of the river (obviously near landmarks), but we found it very peaceful and relaxing with so much to take in. If you're a jogger, there are miles to jog. If you're a photographer, you might run out of digital film. If you're a couple, you might just reconnect.
very romantic and exciting. We spent a lot of time wandering along the Seine as we were in Paris for 11 days. We also did a boat tour of the river.

Cruise on Seine. Going in this cruise I found some locations I didn't know they existed. We wanted to go during night time, but it was cold and windy so we went during day time. It's just nice...to spend an hour and have another persepctive of central area.

Beautiful. You can't go to Paris and not walk along the Seine. Start at Notre Dam and just wander down till you get tired. I would also recommend getting a boat ride. you can book a boat ride for about $14 and I would recommend going down the river in the day and night. They don't call Paris the city of lights for nothing.

One of the world's great city walks!. You can walk along the Seine for miles - do it! Many booksellers, cafes, and you can see the houseboats and restaurant boats. You can take the Batobus instead of the bus to see the City. You get an unlimited pass for one or two days. You can take the Bateau Mouche - bring your own wine and bread for a picnic. Walk the length of the Seine and see how many bridges you can walk on! Just do it!

Boat Tour. Boat tours abound here. We booked the BatoBus for one day. This boat stops at eight different attractions along the Seine. Very convenient for us to see the attractions that were farther away from our living quarters. The Batobus runs late on certain evenings. We hopped on an off during the day, went back to our apartment for some wine,cheese and baguettes, then got back on the boat at about 8:30pm. This time, rather than hopping on and off, we just sat back and enjoyed the "round trip" at night. If you do this, you will know why Paris is the "city of lights"! Just beautiful and relaxing. Highly recommend.
River Seine. The Seine winds through Paris offering you a perfect way to see the city, especially at night. Take a bateaux cruise with friends or famlly and enjoy the slow sights along the river.

wonderful. we caught a tourist boat very near to the Eiffel Tower and went down the river to the Ile de la Cite, you can actually use the hop on and hop off tickets which makes for a more interesting adventure.
Great. Take the hop on hop of boat and visit all the interesting places from the Seine charmingOnly on tour Eifel a queu to get back on board
This is Paris. How can one see Paris without following th River Seine at least from the Ile St. Louis in the east to beyond the Tour Eiffel in the west?

Introduction to Paris. Lovely boat ride with a guide to get an overall sense of Paris sites on our first day. Its a good way to begin your stay in Paris. Not too taxing so you can do it on jet lag but remember to stop first for coffee and some pastries to wake up.

Strolling the banks. It was nice to walk along the banks in the day time calling in a couple of bars. At night time it look fun but in parts it was intimidating. Stick to the well lit parts of areas were groups are around the bars.
very nice. scenic; great place to stroll or stop for picnic. must be terrible during tourist season; too many pushy people. WATCH for PICKPOCKETS; we were robbed on the metro.

Walk along the riverbank. Take the time to walk alongside the river and enjoy the book and art stalls laid out showing their Parisian wares.We had a clear, crisp day which made the walk enjoyable and the sounds of the river and the views from the many bridges made some wonderful photo opportunities of the city as well as the cruises and other life along the river front.

Excellent value - pleasant on a hot day. We took a one-hour trip on 'Vedettes de Paris' We had a discount voucher giving us 20% off the ticket price, so for 11Euros each, had a lovely trip along the Seine, under bridges, past lots of landmarks, with an informative audio guide in French, English & Spanish. On a hot day, this was a lovely treat.
Relaxing after noon. After a day of walking and touring, our River trip was relaxing and enjoyable. It lasted about one hour and the commentary was very good.

A must. Difficult to avoid if you're in Paris, but think about viewing it from many different places, you shoud not be disappointed. And do take some time to stroll alongside it, close to the water, on one of the "sidewalks" provided far from the maddening cars and scooters.

hat better way could you spend a spring day in Paris?. Took 14 on Batobus from Tour Eiffel to the Notre Dame. Plenty of seating and wonderful views. WE were particularly lucky as the cherry trees were in bloom
See the bridges and Paris at night!. A fun trip to see all of the bridges and a different perspective of the Paris. We did a night trip and seeing everything lit up was great.

River Seine. Relax by River Seine and enjoy the ambience of Paris on a sunny day, take a walk and watch lots of lovers walk by.
Its a must do whilst in PARIS

a must in paris. beautiful view of paris and eiffel tower. a must if your visiting paris for the first time. very enjoyable. beautiful middle century buildings and old bridges....the commentary was very informative.....an everlasting memory for us

Nice Ride on the Seine River. We enjoyed our ride on the Seine River looking at all the sights. The only thing we disliked, was the amount of people on the same boat. It was very busy. Going earlier would be better than later.
Cruise on River Seine. The cruise on the River Seine from Eiffel Tower, was a enjoyable excursion in Paris. Lovely to see the bridges and buildings along the Seine, with commentary. Recommended.
Take the time.. Take the time to walk leisurely along the river. It is a wonderful way to see sights, people and get the ambiance of Paris.

River trip - Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame and return. Great experience, and an excursion not to me missed. The trip lasted 1 hour and cost 14 euro per person. Wonderful buildings and a running commentary in multiple languages.
A cruise is a must..... A river trip on the Seine is a must-do for any Paris visit. You really do see the city from a different angle.

River Cruise with AMA Waterways. Now this was one of the best things we've ever done. Absolutely wonderful in everyway. The Seine was beautiful to cruise on, and we saw so many things along the way. What a trip.....a lasting memory in our lives.

Beautiful trip. Lovely trip down the River Seine to celebrate my husband's birthday. The translation on the intercom was good so you always knew what sights you were looking at and the history - would thoroughly recommend.

romantic walk along. This is sure a must visit in Paris. So many bridges with nice & historial buildings. You can spend a whole day to explore it's romantic atmosphere. Join the cruise if you have time & best to find a fine dining one, you willl have a very nice experience expecially in the evening of summer. Walk along both side & you will find the memorial flame for Lady Diana near by the Eiffel Tower.
