just walk and see. just walk by the river you will see places that are there for centuries, the small book shops and go down stairs enjoy walking right to the water,you will love it.

When in Paris,you must visit the river,and take the tour with the boats!. It is a beatiful river,when we were there it didnt smell at all,as others rivers within cities smell,we went on the little tour with the boats that take you up and down the river and you can see the sightseeings from the river!Dont miss it!Extra romantic and quite useful too!We did ii at nightfall,and it was great as the lights from the Eiffel tower and of the bridges were on,so the view was fantastic!
a trip you can't never missed. Really enjoyed. fantastic view. worth the value and time. The evening trip we took to see the lighted eifel tower with the history narrated on the cruise was fantastic,

walk along the river-- amazing views throughout the city. I've walked along both sides of the seine throughout the city-- and it's my favorite way to see Paris. On my last trip, we had rented the velib bikes and rode them along the trail that parallels the river. Fabulous also... although i do prefer the calm and quiet of walking. The city changes all along the river-- and it's truly one of the best overall views.

It's a river, just like any other river,. Listing this as an attraction in Trip Advisor is simply stupid. It's an urban river, what's to say? The sights of Paris are all around and the river is simply a geographical backdrop. Yes, you can take a boat ride...but asking readers to rate the river is simply dumb.
Beautiful view. Hanging out by the river with fresh orange juice and a pastry for breakfast. It does not get any better than that! So pretty.

A beautiful riverside walk. Paris wouldn't be complete without a romantic walk along the banks of this gorgeous river. Monuments in gold lining the way..! We strolled for hours from one side of the city to the other with this beautiful river for company - a must do for any tourist ✨🌟💫

Great way to see the sights of Paris. Grab a bottle of wine and a snack and take a cruise down the Seine. This is a great way to see the sights of Paris. You can see Notre Dame from the front side and the backside -- amazing. A must do while in Paris
Scenic Cruise Along the Rive. Must take the cruise along the river. It's very beautiful. We took the 1-hour cruise that departs from the foot of the Eiffel Tower.
memorable evening. the evning trip we took to see the lighted eifel tower with the history narrated on the cruise was fantastic, it still echoes ... romantic trip :)
The River. The Seine looks like most French rivers. Very picturesque and romantic. A dinner cruise is the best way to see it. Be sure to have a bottle of Bordeau nearby.

Take a stroll. The river is gorgeous! Grab some food from a market and have a long picnic. Don't forget the wine! It can be a little uncomfortable to sit on the stones for a long time but its worth it

Bridges and promises. Beautiful place to go walking and the bridges have stories with locks that people place to symbolize promises and true love. Disliked panhandlers near the Eiffel Tower area but otherwise it's worth planning a walk between the bridges from Eiffel to Ave saint Michel.

Romantic, purely Parisian. So romantic, walking along the river from the louvre, sat on the stone walkway as a musician played his sax, beautiful summer day, took a river diner cruise , le calife, it seemed like many locals were taking a night out, this by far was the highlight of my trip

Great weather, great place. We had really good weather, sunny and warm so a stroll by the Seine in Spring was a must. Book sellers all along the pavement on the left bank are interesting before going down to the river. Clean walkways, places to sit and watch the world go by. Lots of interesting boat traffic although it did not seem busy. Several eating place right by the water but most people seem to bring their own food and just chill on the bank. I can recomend a bottle of chilled champagne with plastic flutes from the wine shop and fresh bagettes down near the water. An eclectic mix of people, bridges covered in padalocks and a relaxed afternoon.

Evening boat trip and meal aboard Le Calife. We have just returned from a wonderful trip to Paris. the highlight of the trip was a riverboat cruise down the Seine aboard Le Calife.The food and service by the staff were excellent and one of our group who is a vegetarian said it was the best meal she had eaten in Paris. The boat is an older vessel but has loads of character and provided an excellent ambience for the evening.

Paris at a glance. We bought the 2 day hop-on hop-off bus tour with a river cruise. There was commentary in around 15 languages but the commentary was only available inside (and downstairs). If you just want to see the buildings, just sit up top and look at all the architecture as you go by. A great way to see the sides of the bridges up close. Find out about the Parisian water level indicator (a statue on one of the bridges). If you don't have time to see all the sights this give you the chance to go past Notre Dame and other sights.
Beautiful. Walking by the Seine in early morning as the sun rises or at dusk when the City of Light lights up, is its most beautiful time.

Avoid the Tour Groups. It's hard to avoid the crowds in Paris but get up early and try. Certain groups of tourists from other countries have different social customs and rules. Where they come form it is quite ok to push and shove and violate the personal space of others. If this bothers you, get moving early to do your sightseeing before these groups hit the streets.

Bateaux Mouches. Mouches are flies, in French, but Bateaux Mouches have nothing to do with flies. Mouches is the family name of the founder of a ship company which takes tourists on the Seine river. Quite enjoyable.
Great was to see the sights by boat. Very enjoyable way to see most of the sites. You can see most of the iconic buildings of Paris by talking a boat down the Seine

Low maintenance. Siene river was not so clean as I was expecting from one of the developed nations of the world .it was a big disappointment for me .river was looking great when seen from effiel tower ,it surroundings were also beautiful that includes measuems ,chapels ,many bridges especially the lock bridge .It is must go thing when u visit Paris .don't throw any garbage in that ,keep the river clean .I suggest to use some non fuel boats which can be run manually ,to stop water pollution and fuel spillage .

see this on a dinner cruise. The best way to see the Seine River! Great food, great staff and a very romantic time. Buy your tickets through Viator. There were great ideas while traveling and this is one of them.
The banks are the best bit. The river itself is just a river and to be honest the boat trips are a bit boring but if its a pretty day then the crowds on the banks are very interesting to watch.

Showcase of monuments and buildings. As rivers go this would be one of the best as regards the magnificent buildings and monuments on both banks, and of course the islands in the middle, significantly Isle de la Cite where Notre dame is found! The Bateau Mouche is a good way to see the many landmarks of Paris and it crosses a good number of bridges.

Great way to see some of the sites of Paris. Visited in late March. There are many different types of cruises you can take, with or without dining. My family and I signed up for an hour long cruise. Departure was walking distance from the Eiffel Tower and was easy to find. I suggest purchasing tickets ahead of time. Our cruise line was "Bateaux Parisiens". They gave a tour as we sent, in multiple languages (via headsets), with plenty of seating, so you get could a good view. Also, they had many flat panel TVs so you could easily see the view from the front of the ship. The ship had an open air upper deck, but it was only in the 50's so we stayed inside, but there were many people who chose to sit up top. Still I was able to get some nice pictures of Notre Dame from inside. We did this after touring the Eiffel Tower, so a nice way to end the day.

Great way to see some of the sites of Paris. Visited in late March. There are many different types of cruises you can take, with or without dining. My family and I signed up for an hour long cruise. Departure was walking distance from the Eiffel Tower and was easy to find. I suggest purchasing tickets ahead of time. Our cruise line was "Bateaux Parisiens". They gave a tour as we sent, in multiple languages (via headsets), with plenty of seating, so you get could a good view. Also, they had many flat panel TVs so you could easily see the view from the front of the ship. The ship had an open air upper deck, but it was only in the 50's so we stayed inside, but there were many people who chose to sit up top. Still I was able to get some nice pictures of Notre Dame from inside. We did this after touring the Eiffel Tower, so a nice way to end the day.

Cruise on river Seine. Very nice experience during the day. We saw most of the interesting stuff from the boat and it was easy to locate them afterwards. You get basic information from the guide so maybe it's better to take the cruise in the beginning of your trip and then decide what to visit. We saw Paris by night from the Eifel tower and agreed that the cruise might be nicer during the evening. We'll defintely try it next time.

The famous Seine. Every important landmark in Paris is on the banks of this river and you just can't miss it. The river makes for good photo ops and its banks are a pleasant way to spend summer afternoons.

spring cruise is fun!. Windy but still fun to go cruising the Seine river by bateauxbus. U can see the "summary" of Paris in 1 hour. So u should try. And the Pizza truck just by the cruise station is awesome, delicious!
A great walk. A great walk down the left bank my favourite thing to do in Paris and put a padlock on one of the bridges
fantastic. A good way to see the sights of Paris. The boats go every 30 minutes and are quiet big, so no need to stand in a long queue.

Dinner Cruise expensive. The tour of the Seine itself was amazing - great of photos of the attractions at night. the dinner cruise was not worth the price, the cheapest option was 99 euros and the more expensive options only got you better wine and a better seat on the boat. the food itself was ok - Starters and Desserts were amazing but Main was only above average and far from the best steak I have ever had, My wifes Veal on the other hand was amazing. Would recommend the cruise for a photos you could get and the sites you see but the dinner I would rather find somewhere highly rated on Tripadvisor and go there instead.

Exciting and romantic. Action packed full of people during the day. Fun shops along the river to shop and cafés to sit and enjoy a glass of wine and watch people. At night, it is very romantic to walk along the Seine with the beautiful lights and just hold hands and be glad you are there.

Wonderful views!. If I only had one day to spend in Paris, I would definitely make time for a River Seine cruise, just before the sunset is the best time! It showcases all the grand architecture that defines Paris and the boat services are clean and run efficiently. It's a romantic and picturesque experience!!!

Locks galore!. We took a stroll down the river Seine and went to the Love Lock bridge. It's really cool to see this in person. Locks are everywhere on this bridge. There are loads of people selling locks on the bridge so don't worry if you didn't bring one, they give you a marker aswell so you and your loved ones can sign your names and attach it to the bridge. This was one of my favourite things I did in Paris!

Best thing to do in Paris on a budget.. So I've lived here a little over a year now, and done many of the tourist attractions, some of them multiple times as I've gone back with houseguests who have come to visit. Paris is filled with wonderful museums, fabulous cultural sites and activities, and history galore. But my favorite thing to do is to walk along the Seine. Or take a boat ride on the Seine. Or picnic along the Seine. Well...you get the idea. Walking the banks of this beautiful river is romantic. Ditto the picnic idea. And a boat ride allows you to enjoy all of the Seine's gorgeous bridges, each of them different. If you are on a budget, take the Bato Bus, which is your least expensive option, otherwise, spring for a dinner cruise or sightseeing tour.

The lifeblood of Paris. Walking along the Seine, watching the comings and goings of everyday life in this beautiful city, is one of the joys of life. It provides easy walking access to all the great monuments of Paris (i know, I know, some are a few blocks off the river, but it is the thoroughfare). If you get tired walking, there is always the bateau bus. The sun setting on the Seine, with the lights coming in the city, is an experience everyone should have if they visit Paris.
The River . We crossed and walked alongside the river every day we were in Paris - very relaxing and you can head down the steps to sit and enjoy lunch along it!
River Seine. The river was beautiful and so busy with lot's of queues and people selling stuff. You can go on the boats or in a private cart by people from the area.

Excellent. One must take an evening cruise.. which typically start at 7.15 PM. Sit in the open area and enjoy the ride. The tour ends with a spectacular view of Eiffel Tower at night. Its really nice to see all lit-up Eiffel Tower. Every hour starting from 8 PM there will be a sparkling lights on the Eiffel Tower. This will only be for 5 mins. DO NOT MISS THAT VIEW.

The river through Paris. River Seine flow through Paris. The river bank is a visual treat equally for locals and tourist. Locals love to jog along, tourist should have a boat tour must in their schedule. Bateaux Mouches is one of boating company along other options.
Beautiful Walk. Enjoy the walk along the River Seine. The people, the options, the guide to all Paris has to offer. Take the high road or the low you won't be disappointed.

delightful. Delightful hour spent floating down the Seine. Saw most of the sites and the bridges. the boat guide was quite informative.Very relaxing after a day walking around .worth going on the trip.No toilets aboard so go before!

Go for a cruise but get there early. Get here for 0945 get a ticket and wait then you will e done by midday for your next visit. Really good way to spend an hour and see all the sights from a new angle

floatring away. We spent 2 weeks travelling on the Seine, 1st cruise Paris to Normandy, just great, scenery beautiful, the River baroness"very comfortable great food, great staff. The highlight was the beaches of Normandy. a very moving experience... 2nd week Bordeaux to Paris on the River royale"again super food, very helpful staff..The vineyards and Chateaus were amazing, around every corner was a new experience...

Take a Sienne cruise to appreciate this river. Loved the views of Paris from our boat. Passed all the landmarks and for a couple this would be very romantic. I loved the cruise but if it's not summer then wrap up well.
Great to walk by and ride on. Follow the river to see and feel Paris. Boat rides are fun and relaxing too.. Each bridge has a story, check out the padlocks the lovers add to them

Worthy in the evening. The night cruise is definitely worthy. There are many companies who can offer all the kind of cruises, with or without dinner. You can enjoy the view of a very illuminated Paris. A picture of the Eiffel Tower from the river is a must, as well as a pic of the beautiful Notre Dame.

Night Cruise. This is a great way to get a view of the beautiful city at night. Fairly priced, the one hour cruise starts at the tower and takes you down past Notre Dame and turns back. Great end to an evening!

Watch the Brazilian Capoeira dancers on summer evenings. Along the banks of the Seine on warm summer evenings you'll find all sorts of events taking place, most of them spontaneous. My favorite is the Brazilian drumming and Capoeira dancers. It's strange to find Afro-Brazilian dancing (come call it a martial art) in the heart of Paris near the Jardin des Plantes, but the rhythms and fun are infectious and if I hadn't been too old to do handsprings and back flips, I would have joined in.

Walks along the Seine. The Seine was just lovely to walk along. When you got down right next to it, there were many smells but I do not think that was due to the river itself. My husband and I enjoyed strolling along the river and seeing all the street vendors selling their wares. It is just the perfect way to spend a most pleasant afternoon :)

Pretty and helpful!. I love that this river is running through the city. It's part of the beauty of Paris. I loved walking along the river looking at all the sights. Plus, I used the Seine as a point of reference and a guide to places.

Lovely Walk. We walked along the river through the city centre. Lots going on along the river as well as a great way to see a number of tourist attractions such as the many bridges, Eiffel Tower, Musee D'Orsay, Place du Concorde.

River tours. A beautiful way to see some of the cities fantastic scenery. We chose an hour long tour. Good value for money, we paid 14€ per head. I do love a tourist photo but was unfortunately disappointed with my tourist photo, they rushed you through and mine looked like a rabbit caught in the headlights of a car, so I kept my 10€ in my pocket!

Consider which service you choose.. There are three main services to choose from. For guide and dinner choose the Bateau Mouche. For an hour long tour the Bateau Parisiene. But perhaps the best choice is the hop on - hop off Batobus service unless you want a guided tour. The boat stops at all the major sites, is less expensive than the others - it is of course a river bus not a tour- but is frequent and spacious. If you are unsure of getting around by bus or Metro then Batobus is a good alternative. Not much chance of confusion or missing your stop or long walks between lines and nexus points.
Nice to have a river. I always like seeing a river in town; water is very peaceful. I didn't like how dirty the river was in parts.

Gorgeous!. Always heard about how beautiful the Seine was! Oh how true that is! It is best seen in the Spring, Summer and perhaps Fall seasons when the flowers and blooms are still out. There are hundreds of people lounging along it's banks and plenty of views of the City of Paris. It's right in the middle of things in the downtown Paris area and affords access to lots of attractions there! We took a boat ride one evening along the River Seine and enjoyed seeing Paris lit-up, including the Eiffel Tower! A MUST see and do!

Beautiful. We didn't do one of the boat trips because I was a bit put off by the reviews I'd seen. And I prefer walking anyway as you get to see more. We walked along the river from Eiffel tower to notre dame, stopping at the Concorde & the louvre museum. And the lovelock bridge. It was a long but beautiful walk. Much prettier & cleaner than im used to seeing in London

River Seine. River Seine is a river which separates divides paris into two parts. Actually all hotel and main attraction are along this river and you will never miss it. also this river has different names as it pass by.
Great stroll!. Stroll along the river bank on a sunny day and enjoy the beauty of the city beside it. Some great photo-ops, too.

Great way to see the city!. We decided to use the river as an alternative means of transport when sightseeing. The river boasts great views of the main points of interest and is much more relaxing than using the metro!

The heart of Paris. You can navigate your way around Paris by following the Seine. It is a beautiful route to walk along and there are also many, many boat trips available along it. Walk along one side past the Musee D'Orsay up to the Eiffel Tower and back along the other past Cleopatras needle and through the gardens de Tuileries to the Louvre. There are also dinner cruises along the river and many activities along the pathway such as tables with board games, a climbing wall, totem tennis and many small cafés to sit and watch the world go by from. It's a beautiful place to stroll.

Take a walk on the lower level.. The Seine is part of Paris like the lake front is to Chicago. On a nice day a walk along the lower level is a must. You can get a better view of the bridges from there, and it's very romantic.

Good price value 60 minutes 12 euros. You wil get good idea about the city and many of the main buildings. The guide was not very knowledgeable but was able to name the major buildigs. Buy your drinks at the kiosk before entering the boat. Prices are very reasonable. 1 hour sailing is well worth the money.

Most comfortable way to see sights. We took a dinner cruise of the River Seine. It was pricey--we went very first class. It was worth every penny! Comfort, fine dinning, a tour by water, and live entertainment. Very romantic!

No trip to Paris is complete without a walk along the Seine. Love walking along the Seine, especially at dusk when the lights are coming on in the city. Seeing the monuments and sights lit up as well as the charming homes is an incredible sight. I love this city!

Great view from our boat. We stayed 4 days on what is classed as a river hotel - MS Renior and each night we sailed up and down the Seine River it was glorious and showed Paris in al her night time glory.
nice ride. this was a very relaxing event that we all liked. It was nice seeing lovers embrace on the banks of the Seine.

Great views. We used the Bat o bus which is a circular route we saw everything, very busy but we got seats and stood outside. The whole City can be seen and lots of great things to see worth the ticket price.

BEAUTIFUL RIVER WITH LOTS TO SEE. We went on the hop on hop off bus which showed us clearly all the attractions along the river - it also gave you the scale of the size of Paris which helped when deciding later in our trip whether to walk or ride to the various attractions

Romantic, walk by the Seine and take a boat "bateaux parisiens". Poetry, that s the word that mince walking by the Seine, those bridges, one more fantastic than the other, stop in each one, take pictures and read about, you can see the magnificent of Paris from the river taking a boat-bateaux-is a total different view, but both become essential to admire this city

Perfect for River Boats. My friend and I took a Viking River Cruise on the Seine, spectacular! The very scenery reminds me of impressionist paintings. So many marvelous stops along it's shores, including Rouen, site of the death of Joan of Arc and Giverny, Monet's homesite. Eco efforts at keeping the river clean has resulted in the return of salmon.

Lovely stroll. There are some beautiful sights to see walking along the river, At dusk it's very romantic. There are plenty of places to stop of for dinner or a drink. Make sure you have a good pair of walking shoes on.

an hour will do it... alot of tour boats that offer dinner and a 2 hour cruise for 99 euros, we went for an hour tour for 14 euros they run every hour from 9:30 to 9:30, we went for an afternoon cruise which was nice but I bet the evening cruise with the lights would be great, there are to many great restaurants to eat in that serve much better food then the tour boats, money well spent:) remember always buy attraction tickets on line, cheaper and you by-pass the lines.
Nice trip, lots of information. Nice trip up the river on a boat, commentary in English gave plenty of information on the sights on the bank, would recommend

Lazing on the river. Nice easy informative way to see and learn about many of the Paris landmarks we took one of the commercial tours and not the hop on hop off which was extremely well patronized will long queues at every stop

See everything from the river. Take the Batobus, and hop and off at each major attractions, or sit and have the complete circuit. Lovely to see everything from the angle of the boats, and the skyline is majestic.

I good view of all of Paris. I recommend a cruise on the Seine and preferably a night cruise. I had a 1hr day cruise with Bateaux Parisiens and it seemed the best would have been at night. The best part of the cruise was the point where you get view of the miniature statue of liberty and the Eiffel tower "side-by-side"

cruise . due to on my being in Paris for a day we did the cliché thing of jumping on a boat after a visit to the eiffel tower, least to say was a amazing hour and a half tour we loved it tour guides command of English was great got to see all the sights just hopefully going to explore them on my next visit to Paris.

You need to walk along this river to experience. The city the way it is meant to be. The various neighborhoods and the people you will meet and see along the river will give you an in-depth appreciation of the Parisians who are France.

Flaneurs in Heaven. If all I did in Paris was walk up and down the Seine at all hours of the day, I would be happy. Pick pocket artists also like the path, so keep your pouches zipped and do not make eye contact with anyone who, say, wants to show you a gold ring. Keep moving. It's so peaceful there. Cross the bridges, zig zag along, eat at a diner, or just follow your whim.
You can't miss it!. It was nice to be able to walk along the Seine and enjoy the beauty in the old style buildings as well as the sights and people enjoying cruises along the river.
Beatiful River. You must visit Seine River AND if you have time must getariver tour by boat in Paris. You must take a Photos with you kobe in one of the bridgesover Seine.

An Essential Piece of Paris. I cannot imagine Paris without the Seine. The river separates the city into two sections with six arrondissements on the Left Bank and 14 on the Right Bank. Boats regularly ply its waters, and many carry tourists, who gaze at the beautiful structures on both banks. I find evening to be the best time for a cruise when the buildings are awash in artificial light -- a truly magical sight. Myriad bridges cross the river with Pont Alexandre III and Pont Bir Hakeim my favorite connectors. Ornate Pont Alexandre displays artistic elements that include sculptures and Art Nouveau lamps. I've always been able to get excellent photos of the Eiffel Tower from here. Double-tiered Pont Bir Hakeim offers passage to Metro line 6 on the top and to pedestrians, cyclists and motorized vehicles on the bottom. From the center of this bridge, steps lead down to an artificial island on the water that features a 35-foot-high replica of the Statue of Liberty at its Western end.Les Berges de Seine on the Left Bank stretches for 1.5 miles along the river between Musee de Orsay and Pont de Alma. This recreation area for pedestrians, walkers and joggers offers a variety of things to do, from children's play areas to shipping containers that can be reserved for naps. I sometimes stop at one of the cafes for a bite to eat and to watch the passersby. To the West, Quai Saint-Bernard holds the Musee de la Sculpture en Plein Air. Visitors stroll near the water, looking at scores of sculptures by famous artists, such as Constantin Brancusi and Emile Gilioli. This same quai attracts dancers on warm nights in three amphitheatres and two esplanades. Tourists are welcome to join in the dancing -- tango, salsa, etc. -- or to simply watch, perhaps with a picnic supper.Booksellers along the sidewalk above the Seine on both banks present an iconic scene as do strollers along the water. I consider it a pleasant pastime to walk by the river in the direction of the Eiffel Tower when its lights begin to twinkle at night. More than anything else, the Seine says "Paris" to me.

River boats with the plastic roofs. Do not go on these boats unless you (1) want to die from the heat, (2) get soaking wet if you are on the front observation area. Go instead on one of the open top boats. I guess it matters if it is cold. It was very warm while I was there in April....

Amazing sunset boat trip along Seine. I higlhy recommend you to take boat trip along Seine and better it will be in the afternoon closer to sunset.Take some warm clothes even in April or May as it can be a bit cold in the evening near water.
The glue that holds Paris together. The Seine is just like Ol' Man River...it just keeps rolling along through the most beautiful city in the world. Without the Seine, there would be no Left Bank.
Amazing wiew. We've been on Seina in the night. I just can say that from Seina is one of the best wiews to the city. Mainly in the night becouse whole city has mystic and romantic atmosphere😊

One of the magical things to do in Paris for free. We always walk along the Seine no matter what time of year it is, even if it is snowing, raining or freezing cold. It is magical at anytime and I do like the feel of the different times we have walked it. The views of the Eiffel Tower at night are just breathtaking. It is a must do.

Must take a walk. you must go to Paris just to walk around - up and down this river. So much to see and it's free! Take a look at the art on the side walk or just sit at a cafe and watch the people go by.
Take a boat tour. I have been to Paris 3 times but never took a boat tour of the Seine. It is a must! You see all the beautiful buildings from the water and gives you a great perspective of the city.
LOVELY TRIP. took a trip down the Seine on the barge boat and thoroughly enjoyed it. definitely worthwhile the visit. We did the trip at night and can say that Paris is truly magical at night

Romantic. Booked for lunch on one of the varaity of boats on the river. The lunch was excellent with the boat moving slowly up the river seine and seeing all the views along the banks. the boat trips combined with lunch is a beautiful experience of Paris.

Just Stare at the Water. We watched the water and took pictures. We didn't do the boat tour this time although it is well worth it. There is something wonderful about moving water and the architecture and gorgeous bridges are just the icing on the cake!
Nice walk ways. Enjoyed a lovely walk along the sidewalks at the river on Christmas Day. Too cold for a river tour, maybe next time!

As rivers go, it ticks all the boxes.. If you're looking for a waterway that extends from Burgundy to Le Havre, taking in Paris on the way, this is the river for you. It's full of water, it's got tributaries, it meanders and it has an estuary.
In short, it ticks all those crucial river boxes.

Disappointed with Graffiti on the walls, but overall great experience. We were disappointed with Graffiti on the walls, but overall we had a great experience. We took a river cruise with lunch and got to spend about 2 hours on the river. You'll get to see most of the major locations from a distance. If you are wanting to get close-up pictures of the major attractions, this isn't ideal for that, but it is nice to sit back and relax and see Paris from the river.
Boat rides are worth it!. If you come to Paris you must take a boat ride on the Seinne. We took a one hour boat ride on the Bateux Pariesienne this month and truly enjoyed the sites.
Beatiful night. What a beautiful ride on the boat at night! Indeed Paris is the city of light! Something you should not miss!!
river seine. i take river cruse from eiffl tower and its was one of most remember in my whole trip where u saw all paris from river and they give you information
Different view on Paris. It is worth you see Paris from a boat, you will see it really from a different perspective. By night the view is even more romantic.

Take the Bateaux Mouches!. Every year we take an illumination tour of the city via the Bateaux Mouches. Get a bottle of wine and board at sunset or later. It's the best way to relax and see all of the sites all lit up for the evening!
An amazing river. We walked several miles down the River Seine to Notre Dame, need good walking boots as cobbles most of the way.Would be better to cruise down it you get to see more on both sides.

Enjoyable and scenic. In the middle of the Seine, Paris was founded. Now, the river helps to establish boundaries for neighborhoods. It's relaxing to walk along the banks or over the bridges. Not to mention romantic.
Take your picture on one of the bridges!. It is something one will cherish. Parisians will be eager to help you to take pictures! The area of Isle de France is beautiful and wears a calm look!

Nice travel in Cruise. It was excellent to have a ride in a small boat across the river. We were lucky to have bright sun on this day otherwise it becomes foggy and the pictures do not come clearly. I think every one visiting Paris should go the ride . It is easy, go to Eiffel tower and after finishing trip to Eiffel, get a cruise across the road. there are two to three companies offering one hour ride across the places and drop you back at Eiffel tower.

Le Bateau sur Le Seine. Highly recommend cruising on any one of the bateaus that will take you up and down the Seine - the river itself is amazingly clean. You see all the sites and at sundown, the photos are superb!!!

What an amazing river. We walked several miles up the River Seine just to take in the Paris area and all it's splendor. It's a romantic walk and there's so many picture opportunities. We started near the Eiffel Tower and walked up to the Statue of Liberty. There's an island in the middle of the river that you can walk on and we had a such a great time.
Good, but once is enough. Could really benefit from a better sound track / commentary. Interesting to see the sites on both banks, but wouldn't be high on my "when in Paris, you must" list.
relaxing. We went at sunset so the view was different. Nice was to spend an hour. Very relaxing. Well worth the euros
Beautiful & Relaxing. A relaxing cruise down the Seine, beautiful sights and interesting information given, a nice way to end our day.

Romatic River. Just the idea that you are standing on the banks of the River Seine gives you that feel that you are some where wonderful. Other wise it is just a river. I would rather go with the romatic notion. Check out the Bridge of Locks but it not the same with the plywood covering all the locks. Shame on you Paris.

Start you trip here- you wont be dissappointed. First night we arrived in Paris we did a Seine River highlights cruise and OMG what a fabulous way to begin. If you get the chance to sit outside on the cruise - do it!!! Granted we did get cool but wow what a way to see Paris in all its glory. Was love at first sight for me.

Night time dinner cruise. Highlight of our weekend ...great food ..plenty of wine..and plenty of sights..boat was a surprisingly smooth ride...highlight was to Eiffel Tower not only lit up but flashing...brilliant..trip lasted 2 hours and cost just under £160 for 2...expensive but well worth it

Pleasant stroll. We walked and walked and just loved every moment down by the Seine. My only tip is watch your step when walking under bridges, the homeless people have a tendency to wee etc in these places and it gets abit squishy and smelly underfoot. I guess they have to go somewhere.

Walk down belOW. Walking right next to it for miles was serene. Not many boats were in operation that day so that made for calm waters and a peaceful stroll with hubby all the way to the statute of liberty.
River Seine Cruise another great way to view Paris. My teenaged daughter saw Paris by foot, train, taxi, metro and really enjoyed the view from our cruise along the river.

Wonderful sights by night!. We took a Valentine dinner cruise and had a very nice evening. The sights along the way were spectacular lit up. The downside was waiting to get on board ( it was raining and the process was very slow!) also, we were promised live music which was an elderly lady playing a squeeze box. Not quite the romantic setting expected on Valentines evening. The 3 hour cruise was cut short and we docked before dessert and had to watch the poor passengers on the next trip standing in the rain waiting to board when we were finished. They looked freezing and it put me off my food, so it could have been organised better as it was not a cheap evening!
Good food for the price.. The service and food was a good value. The restaurant had a lovely ambience. The wait staff was friendly. And the price was reasonable.

Bateaux Parisiens river cruise. This boat trip is accessed at the foot of the Eiffel Tower. Take it in the evening as the city lights come up. There are headphone commentaries in many languages, and you can sit in comfort as the story of Paris unfolds. Children will love the experience of sailing through the city, and all cities look amazing and quite different from the river.

I love the bridges. I could spend all week looking at the bridges, from the water, from the embankments. So varied in materials and construction. Watch out for the traffic. The river keeps on flowing.

Fantastic way to see the city. I'd recommend doing a boat tour at night. You may want to have dinner before or after though, because you can easily be in fo3 more than 100 € per person if you eat on a boat.

Scenic...Adorned with beautiful buildings. Walked from the Louvre museum on a March Sunday morning around 8am along the seine all the way to the Eiffel Tower. It was a lovely scenic walk...there are many famous buildings and bridges en route...it was a lovely walk. Joggers and families on the river bank. Lovely.
Beautiful view. Nothing much to see but a very beautiful view. Go on the ship ride to enjoy the view. Make sure you have your cold clothes ready as the air is too chilled.

Favorite nighttime spot in Paris. Forget the expensive restaurants and do yourself a favor and wonder downt to the Seine in the evening. Before you go....grab some salami, cheese, a baguette and a bottle of wine and have a picnic on the rivers edge. Ohhh....don't forget some chocolate too...or maybe stop at one of the riverside gelato joints. What an amazingly romantic place. If you forget to stop by the store on your way, don't worry as there are plenty of cool little eating and drinking spots along the river. Finish your evening with a starlit walk along the banks or even hope a boatride and view the amazing city lit up beautifully at night.You just can't go wrong spending an evening along the Seine.

Lovely river cruise. We stayed on the MS Renoir, when we stayed in Paris, which was beautiful, could not say a bad word about it, everything about the boat and it's crew were excellent. And a wonderful cruise through Paris, which gives a different view of the city from the River Seine.
Seine River Cruise. If you take seine river cruise you can see the famous museums, architecture of paris from outside and you can take photos of Eiffel tower from the cruise nicely.
swept up in the current. Grant it, it was a bit chilly when I went, but I took the Batobus and was able to go to all the stops and explore the beauty of the water surrounding it all.

Locks of Love...too much Love. We walked along this river for more miles that I care to think about.Stuff that struck me: There is a bridge so overloaded with "locks of love" that it's becoming a problem. There are plenty of people hawking locks in the area for twice their price, so I'd suggest you bring one pre-engraved from home if you wish to join this movement. It didn't do anything for me, other than being a colorful distraction.The river is lined with merchants, who keep locked covers on their materials while they are home sleeping. There are magazines, books, jewelry and artwork available on the walk. be ready to haggle for the price if you'd like, most of the merchants are willing.The river provides a cool respite on your walking journey, and was nice to walk along. We never got the swarms of mosquitos that we would get where we live - just nice waters, and a nice backdrop.

Priceless. Words cannot describe this area of Paris. Absolutely breathtaking, the epitome of romance, adventure, style and love for life. The hatred towards Americans is totally overplayed, if you act like a jerk in someone else's country of course you will get treated badly. As long as you are polite and cordial, people will generally be nice back. Just remember that this is one of the world's largest cities, and both good and bad are here. Research Paris before you go, you will have memories to last a lifetime!

A wonderful stroll along its banks awaits you. The Seine has wonderful paths to stroll along and watch the boats pass by. If you are in great condition, you can walk the Seine from The Eiffel Tower a (few blocks away) all the way to the Louvre and Notre Dame. Yes it is a long walk, but with so many interesting bldgs., and people to see and watch the stroll goes quickly. There are many houseboats along the Seine and that alone will keep you interested. There are also many bridges to capture on film, and don't forget your lock to attach to one of the many "locked" bridges. Single, or with a friend this stroll is a must in Paris!You could also run, ride a bike, or rollerblade!
A scenic way to see the sights. Do take one of the Bateaux Mouche, it's a really good way of seeing all the popular sights plus some different ones, particularly on a,lovely spring day.

It's beautiful regardless of what season it is.. My fiance and I went to Paris for Valentine's day, it was chilly but the view was incredible. You can take pictures along it, it's great for walking along. You could also go for a boat ride under the bridges (we didn't but I'm assuming it would be lovely). We went to the love lock bridge (not nearly as pretty as some of the pictures let on due to graffiti, but still a nice sentiment), and many other attractions along it.
pleasant walk. we walked along the river to get to everything we went to see, very pleasant walk, much better than along the road.
Nice river cruise. Its a wonderful way to see the monuments all at one time in Paris. Make sure you do the river cruise with Champagne!

Romantic Place. The cruise of the river is just awesome. It is very Romantic, if you are couples. It is best to cruise around 6 PM as by the time you are returning, the lights on the Eiffel will be on. There will be lot of reflections from other boats. Excellent place for Photographers.

had a great walk. on the day of my departure I decided to wake up earlier and just have a walk. the weather was gorgeous, the sun was shining so it made my little walk perfect. there were tour boats, I saw couple of bridges including the Alexander's one with amazing architectural ornaments and lanterns. loved it!
Use the "Bateaubus". Forget the trips - just get a ticket for the Bateaubus. It is so much better value and convenient for sightseeing

Lovely picturesque river. Just got back from a spring break to paris . Meals out , moulin rouge and the sights ! Took a brisk walk down the river seine on a sunny Sunday in march , lovely walk with lovely views and bridges ! Would highly recommend . Plenty of cafes on route too for a pitstop. Enjoy

Central To Paris Understanding. Take a boat ride under the famous bridges and see most attractions from the outside first. By taking a boat ride, you can get your bearings on Paris and plan the rest of your trip. Also, the perspective of the boats will give you better insight into the heart of Paris and you can cover more area than walking and at slower speed than in a taxi

River Seine boat tour and walking paths. So glad we did this, great for learning where things are located. Enjoyable and restful after walking 7 miles all day. Helps you get your bearings in the city, better than a map!

great at night time. we travelled down the seine on a night time cruise on a monday evening in March...the boat was warm inside (and it was chilly out) and there were too many people on board. On our boat there was not a bar but there were vending machines....the trip was approximately and hour and your were able to listen inside to phone like devices that tole you the history of Paris as you sailed past the various buildings. The trip ended at the Eiffel tower where we were able to watch the tower's flickering lights that are turned on for a few minutes on every hour...there were single, people, children and couples on the trip. It was an nteresting and lovely way to see Paris at night.

Beautiful River across magnificent city. Across the seine river in Paris is a must. You will see all the historical building along the river. The price for bateaubus is not expensive and affordable. Hop on and hop off bateaubus as cool as with the bus. But river seine is so romantic so you must definitely do not miss this river.

Great way to explore Paris. The Bato bus boat is a great way to explore Paris. We started out by doing the whole loop (8 attractions) then did another round on the boat getting off at each stop and exploring the area.

Nice view of the Tower and city. A tour in a boat is a must. You will see a very nice view of the Eiffel Tower and some bridges. Very famous places with a lot of history like the miniature Liberty Statue.

beautiful night lights. The beauty of Paris by night made the cold quite bearable! Bundle up and take this trip down the Seine (sin) with a your best cuddle-mate. There are covered and open areas on all the boats. The lights at night only enhance the beauty of Paris and the majority of iconic structures are visible from the boat. The boat is also slower so photography is easier than on a tour bus.

Leisure cruise. My wife and I stayed in Paris for a four day break, to celebrate our wedding anniversary this month. After our lunch in the famous restaurant in the Eiffel Tower, we decided to take a one hour cruise excursion on the river Seine. This is a very good way to view a lot of the tourist attractions, and buildings, travelling under beautiful bridges, with an informative English documentary throughout the trip. I thought that the boat ride was excellent value, plus an effortless way to see a lot of very interesting buildings, and learn about there history, and former owners etc.

True Essence of Paris. While Paris can be associated with so many landmarks, all worth their weight in gold, the River Seine provides the mirror in which the whole city can coquettishly glance upon its beautiful reflection, especially on a warm summer/spring day, so that any person who may happen to take a furtive glance on the water as well, will for certain be enamoured. On our last trip to Paris in February, we took the afternoon river cruise with Vedettes de Pont Neuf. It was my first time to take the cruise so I braved the freezing gusts of Parisian winter wind on the second level of the boat just so I could marvel at the landmarks ahead and on either side of the river banks. La Tour Eiffel, Musée du Louvre, Pont Alexandre III, Pont des Arts, Notre Dame, Place de la Concorde, Grand Palais, and many more enchanting landmarks can be seen from the boat as it gently glides along the water. The cruise itself lasts for an hour or so, with the guide speaking in a combination of English and French for the benefit of the non-residents on the boat. There is a food and beverage shop at the dock, so you can buy snacks before you take the cruise. But if you're not too hungry, I suggest you skip the snacks and just go for a decadent meal and dessert at any of the brasseries cluttered around the riverbanks. The river cruise costs between 10 to 14 Euros. Though I think they have promo rates being offered depending on the season. Not to be missed when in Paris.:)

Simply wonderful!. A river trip down the Seine cannot be missed. It is like floatingthrough history. The magnificence of the buildings, the elegance,the ambience, will delight the true traveller. It is something you will always remember. I made three trips while in Paris and frankly, I could have done it every day. So much to see, so much to drink inso much to drown in. Commentaries can vary and sometimes people do not appreciate all that they see. Chose well and you willbe delighted.

The Best Way to See Paris is from the Water. The beautiful river Seine and it's many bridges is the lifeblood of Paris. A must for all visitors is a walk along the banks, or a cycle or best if all, a cruise to enjoy the spectacular array of palaces, monuments, churches, apartments and people that line the route.

Great way to see Paris. Taking the boat down the Seine was a very relaxing and enjoyable way to see a lot of the major sites. We left from the Eifel tower and made our way down to the Notre Dam passing many famous sites on route.The activities on the left and right bank were interesting as people were involved in many activities. An hour well spent and extremely enjoyable.

Romantic!. The arrival of spring was in the air ! Crowded streets of French families for walks in the evening , although it was still cold . The view of the Seine River is breathtaking , especially if you are close to Notre Dame Cathedral and a special person ! Walk leisurely first holds up in the details, then take pictures .Come back whenever you can !
Paris Plage. In the summer France trucks in lots of sand and creates a "beach" on the back of the Seine. Vendors set up stands and you can get crepes, ice cream, cigars and wine as you stroll along.

Have a calming couple of hours on the river. If you really want to admire the sight's and landmark's of Paris there is no better way than to jump on one of the many tourist boat's offering tour's along the river Seine or you can even use the BATOBUS HOP ON HOP OFF SERVICE,just brilliant.We took one of the many cruiser's on offer by the EIFFEL TOWER,price 's differ ,between €12 and €14 depending on what tour you want.You pass lot's of major sight's,EIFFEL TOWER,NOTRA DAM,PLACE DE LA CONCORDE,GRAND PALAIS just to many to list,all with a running commentary.We especially enjoyed the tour at night,all the building's and river channel's all illuminated,truely breathtaking and great for taking photogragh's.Tour's last between 1 or 2 hour's it just depend's on what you want.This is a great experience and a great way to see Paris plus you learn about the great history of this wonderful city.

Walking along the Seine. On Saturday morning we walked along the Left Bank on the South side between Notre Dame and the Tour Eiffel, watching the early morning joggers and Les Bouquinistes opening up the riverside bookstalls, admiring the Bridges - Pont Neuf, Pont des Arts with it's padlocks all along the bridge (many bridges are covered in padlocks), the splendour of Pont Alexandre III. Once you get passed Tour Eiffel, the bridges are less glamourous - Pont de Bir Hakeim, although from the next bridge along - Pont de Grenelle you can see the Statue of Liberty facing it's sister statue in New York.

Interesting Stroll. We took a stroll along the Seine on a beautiful August morning. Loved the art installations which have popped up and that it's largely pedestrianised. There was lots to see and play with en route and we spent the morning just being kids and re-discovering what fun it is to discover and play! Would highly recommend doing this and there are lots of places to stop for lunch etc.

The beauty of Paris come from the Sena!!!. The Sena is the center of Paris beauty!!!At both sides You will find from Notre Dame to Eiffel Tower, passing for the Louvre Museum.Walking in the sideways of the Sena and feel Paris!
a great place to sit. on warm day sit and relax , take your lunch find a spot , our spot was close to Louvre, I could have sat for hours

What to expect on a boat. We caught one of the many tourist boats going up the Seine, which we got from beside the Eiffel Tower. Sadly the boat was packed out with tourists eager to get photo's rather than look at the splendour, and so we spent about 2hrs struggling to see anything.The tour boat was in English too but i suspect many of the people on the boat could not understand as they just talked the whole time.I cant believe we paid for this experience.

Nice river tour. My wife and I took a tour of the river seine from the quai near the Eiffel Tower. The tour lasted about one hour and cost 14 Euro each. It was very comfortable with on board refreshments available and a continuous commentary on the various points of interest along the way. I would recommended this as a way if passing a relaxing hour whilst taking a different view log the city.

Stroll the River Seine. While I can't comment on paying for a ticket to cruise the River Seine, I can say a leisurely stroll on the pathways of the Seine at any time is worth doing. Walking the Seine on a sunny day, at twilight and well into the evening, while very different are equally enjoyable.
Use the Batobus. Great way to travel around Paris. A hop on/hop off water bus service, it is brilliant and has stops at The Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Notre Dame etc. Good value and fun.

Great way of visiting attraction. We took hop on off river seine cruise and it was awesome to visit most of attractions through it. Information on cruise was nice and gives you a bit of history about attractions.
amazing city view through boating. boating on seine was wonderful. it was lucky to see the whole paris through boating on Siene. river visit looks wonderful during night.

The heart of Paris. I really enjoyed strolling along the bank of Seine river which was calm and relaxing. The river also is very scenic with numerous bridges over it. Most of the major attractions in Paris are located near the bank of the river. So, if you are visiting Paris, try to get a river cruise (esp> Batobus) to visit all these famous landmarks and museums.

Hop On Hop Off. Enjoyed our cruise on The River Seine, We used The Batobus which has a hop on hop off service and visits 8 attractions. Last stop is The Eiffel Tower in the evening( 6 or 7 oclock) which is beautiful lit up. Small vending machine to purchase drink and/or snack. Good value for money. 24 or 48 hour ticket. Buy 2 day ticket, not much more than the 1 day.
fun walk!. very fun to walk along the paths around the river and see all the boats. I recommend going at night to see and the bridges and buildings lit up!

Must do!. At sunset take a boat down the Seine. Some great boats are near the Eiffel Tower. With a great ride down the Seine watching the sunset! There are quite a varieties of tours some with dinner, some with just wine and cheese and some are just a quiet ride down the river! Just very serene and a beautiful time.
Magical. Just one word - Magical. Take a cruise and remember the movie 'Before Sunset'! Loved being on a boat and watching the city pass by!

Boat Tours are ok. So the Paris Pass includes a free boat tour. I got stuck on one with a school group made up of raucous Spanish pre-teens. In any case the views are that amazing, but its still a nice trip, though I would not make it a priority for my trip. Better to take a nighttime dinner cruise if you are with your significant other and not travelling with children. Kids like the boat, but the narration provided isn't all that good - if you do take the free boat tour provided with the Paris Pass, bring headphones and use them. Its a lot easier than trying to hold the silly phone thing to your ear. But you don't really need them - they rarely tell you anything that interesting. Go outside and enjoy the ride if its a nice day instead and take the Bus tour first - then you'll know all the sites already and just see them from a different angle.
Heart of the City. We took a tour with Batou Mouche. The Seine River serenades the hearts of the city. There were many pedestrian passageways to sit by the river to enjoy a nice picnic or reading.
Wonderful. The flying boat on the seine should be done during a visit week-end.You can see the whole city via this way.Really a good choice to do

Boat trip with beautiful views!. We we're lucky enough to have time to do a boat trip up the River Seine!It was wonderful, if you get a chance - do it! Great to see Paris and all the famous attractions from a different view!

An Alternate Way to See High Profile Landmarks. The river cruises are a unique and ideal way to see sights that are popular as well as mundane. They begin generally adjacent to the Eiffel Tower and proceed in each direction in the Seine for approximately an hour. The common sites were Notre Dame, Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Army Museum and other sites. It is recommended to try to sit in the front portion of the boat, be on the upper level or lower deck in an effort to get ideal pictures. Note - some patrons on the boat are not polite and will stand in front while taking pictures and at times there was the need to ask them to move aside. After a while it seems the "norms" of the conduct on the boat were adhered to by nearly all of the visitors. Would definitely do this again and/or recommend this as a way to see some of the highlights of Paris.

Fantastic walk. Spend some of your time in paris walking along the seine.The pathway are clean and very flat and easy to walk along.Even better go and rent a bike and cycle along it.It's a great place to sit and read a book on a sunny day.You're even make the guys on the boats day by giving them a wave.Every time I visit paris I take some time to walk along this great river.
A must do. We almost skipped the night tour and it would have been a mistake. Paris is the city of lights and to not do this is too miss a great visual expience.

Must go with your wife or girlfriend or friends. Must see and must enjoy the river, you can have it by batobus or boat, there are many company provide this transportation in many different location.And also you can just sit and hangout with your friends in the side of the river, just like Parisian do, I saw them and I was very envy with them that they have such a beautiful city and nice river.

Best way to see the sights. Having taken a boat trip by day and also by night I can categorically state that this is the best way you see the majority of the sights in Paris. The River Seine itself is amazing with all the ornately decorated bridges and historic buildings along the way. At night the river is ablaze with lights from craft of all sizes sailing up and down. During the day you wil see Parisians taking lunch along the river walkways. A bottle of wine and some cheese. What could be better.
Nothing Special.... An average river cruise, wasn't expensive... nice way to spend and hour or two.... maybe the Dinner Cruise may add a bit more sparkle to it...

Loved it. We had lunch then decided to take a river bus. You can hop on & off as you choose. It really is the best way to see all the "must see" things. The last boat leaves at 19.00. Probably later in the summer. It's great. Comfortable, you can see tons & they tell you what stop is next & what you can expect from the area you are visiting.
Just Beautiful. Definitely a must do in Paris....either walk along the river, or take one of the many boat cruises. Both are worth it. Make sure to appreciate the beautiful bridges along the way.
One hour boat cruise. We were first trip of the day at 10.30 on a vessel equipped to take 1000 persons, there were only around 80 on board. Good comentary in three languages

The grand old lady of Paris. The great thing about the Seine is that it is the people's river with access more a less all along it's banks. There is even a beach down there in the summer we were told.With boats, small and large constantly cruising by it is a great place to pass the time in contemplation.

How can you rate a river?. La Seine is so full of history, and at the same time, it is new every minute. Vikings came up it and sacked Paris once. It froze in the past. It has flooded. Once it was the main road in town, and because of that most of the sites worth seeing are along it. In the past I have taken water taxis and water tours and they are fine. In March 2015 I walked along it, near Notre Dame, on the left bank (left and right banks are in relation to looking downstream), with all the stalls of booksellers. I bought a worn out book of the history of the Commune, the short-lived Paris revolution after the second empire. The river flowed past.

Beautiful when lit up across the city at nite. So many bridges and walk ways allow you to get close and take in the beauty and significance of the river seine. Plenty of different companies offering river cruises you can choose to have dinner on the seine also which is nice.

December 31 st 2014. We thoroughly enjoyed our cruise on the River SeineIt was a great experience and an easy way to see many of the Parisienne sightsFriendly folk everywhere waving and smilingThere was a queue to buy tickets and to board but with anything popular that would be expectedWe would recommend this as a worthwhile activity to add to your tour of Paris
the way to see paris. We did a river cruise which I can't recommend more,it was stunning to see Paris by night from the rich to the homeless ,you see it all

wonderful sight seeing at night. Take the boat clise to the eifel tower and do a tour. If you have money eat on the boat otherwise just a ride. but you will discover Pzris by nitgt from anotehr perspective. Many bridges are lighted and monuments as well. Tzke a nice boat a many of them have their own lightingA must when visiting Paris
a romantic place!. paris with the Seine!it's the wonderful place!this river, romantic and historical!you have to go there!to enjoy all your sens!
A Beautiful Way to See Paris. A chilled out relaxing experience to do in Paris.. Well worth an hour of your time to see a beautiful city....
Walk along the Seine. We walked from Notre Dame to the Eiffel Tower - about 3 miles. Highly recommend if you are up to it. Magical!
Iconic River Seine. Talk a walk along the river....right, or left bank....all lovely!! Sit and watch as the river boats sail past you, or hop on one & see soe of the wonderful sights of Paris

good to walk. Our hotel overlooked the Seine and one could look out the window for hours watching the changing scene. It is one of the most walkable rivers I have seen and we tended to walk along it every day.

Wondeful place to visit. River Siene is one of the best attractions of Paris, but probably one that many people discard.We choose to get the batebus, and move with it to visit Notedram Cathedral, Latin Quarter, Louvre and Tour Eiffel.It's quite well maintain, is not dirty, and someone could have another view of Paris sailing in one of the many boats that are available.Definitely, is a one must to do when visiting Paris.

Pretty way to see the city.... Took a boat cruise up the River from near the Eiffel Tower (round trip) great way to see many of the landmarks/attractions of Paris... And the BRIDGES! Each one is a work of art!

Great. Went on the boat tour from Pont-Neuf. Saw the President's boat go right past us in the middle of the tour. Tour was awesome and the whole area is quite lovely. walked along the riverside after the tour and saw some fire dancers practicing in the moonlight. Truly a wonderful experience
Seine River. Be sure to take this cruise. You get a very different perspective of Paris. Even if it is raining, the boats have seats inside and covered areas outside.

Sailing Away. River boat trip from the quay by the Eiffel Tower, all the way down to Notre Dame, around the Ile de la Cite and back again. Passed many of Paris' famous sites on the way with a very good commentary to enlighten us.
Romance is in the air. You can not be in Paris without walking past this lovely river. Ideal location for taking pictures with your beloved on one of its many bridges!

Take a cruise. Please take a cruise along the seine river. The cruise starts from near the Eiffel Tower and takes you along the different monuments and attractions along the river seine. You can also opt for special cruises/ dinner cruise though it is more costly. A typical cruise will cost you around 14 Euros

River cruise. It's an expensive experience but I suppose you have to do it once.
I wouldn't do it again.
It's a lovely trip along the river, catching sights of famous landmarks on the way.
I just didn't feel the service or the experience matched the price tag.
Beeautiful waterway. A leisurely float via tour boat will show the beautiful bridges of Paris and you will glimpse th urban houseboats along ith th major points of interst. We loved it.

Really is a must - but not a wow!. do try to fit in a trip on the river -
we used the batobus service with a 2 day pass which was a bit indulgent as the first day was only a trip from the eiffel tower back towards our hotel. Up to the end of March the boats are about 30mins apart but are more frequent after then.

Simply Great. We had the river cruise along the Seine river starting from and ending at Eiffel tower. It was an amazing experience watching many of the main buildings like Louvre and Notre Dame from the boat.

Batobus. Limited time in Paris...and how to get to the sights we needed to see efficiently and without trying to figure out the metro...Batobus is the best answer we found. Daily tickets or for $2 more a two day pass $18euros each. unlimited use.Stops at the major attractions Tower, N.Dame, Louve , etc. Very clean and smooth glass domed boats, hold probably over a 100 people. Every 30 minutes or so they come by...hop on and then off at the next stop. We used the river as our point of reference...and the boat to get to the different districts..Very beautiful way to see part of Paris. Drivers of the boat will give good advise and directions to places near the stops....No need to pre buy tickets...the ticket place is open at 10am across from Notre Dame..down the stairs close to water...

Rivers are pretty. there are a lot of beautiful bridges crossing the river. As you walk out of Orsay museum the river is right there. As you go over the bridge you will find many locks from lovers placed there (it locks them together in love I guess???). It is also close to many other must see attractions such as the Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Arch De Triumph, and shopping district. I am sure I would have rated this higher if I had seen it outside of winter. I have also spent a lot of time in cities with rivers and bridges, so if you have not then it will seem that much better.

A lovely way to see Paris. A beautiful way to walk through Paris and see much of what the city has to offer. Some of the walkways are very quite as they are away from the main streets so if feels like a more relaxed way to see everything. I would start near Notre Dame and wander towards the Eiffel Tower and look up at the bridges to see the romantic love locks.

Beautiful. It's a lovely walk along the banks of this river . There are many boats to choose from for a little cruise . There are also som hop on hop of ones so that you can visit some of the famous sites .

All different views. Amazing Seine River has all different sights if you visit different parts of it and different time of the day. Could have the feeling of chilly loneliness, or warm sunshine, sweet love too, or maybe tough history...

Some nice River views from Batobus. Pretty much a nice way to get from, say, Notre Dame to the Eiffel Tower. Good views of buildings and museums along the way but you aren't going to get any commentary about what you're seeing - at least not on Batobus.
Champagne boat!. We went on the evening champagne tour on the Seine and I would recommend this. The views from the boat are amazing but in the evening when Paris is lit up it is something else!

Seeing Paris From The Seine. Seeing Paris from a boat tour along the Seine, or just getting around Paris via the Batobus is an excellent alternative to all-day walking! Also, you can reserve dinner cruises along the Seine for a nice romantic dinner!

River cruise is a must!. If you've never experienced Paris you must do this trip! It was lovely to see Paris at night and learn about the rich history behind the city. We started on a tour bus at 7 and the boat trip started at 9. I would highly recommend buying dinner as well as the cruise which was £69 each from Viator. The dinner is in a restaurant which you will be taken to after the cruise, I would advise you to have a small snack before as dinner is rather late. But everyone should experience this!
Day or Night Amazing. We did 2 river cruises. One in the day and one a few days later at night. Both tours had different commentary which was refreshing. Paris by night is gorgeous! Worth a go!

Anniversary. We went on the night time cruise which was just fantastic seeing everything lite up was great it was not to expensive either but would recommend the cruise at night to get the full potential of the surroundings

Memorable Trip on the river. The river cruise starts and ends at the Eiffel Tower banks and goes few miles up stream crossing main buildings like, Louvre, Notre Dame and island of Paris the middle of the river (said to be the origin of Paris).

Batobus. Great way to relax and see some of the major attractions of Paris including the Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame and Champs Elysee. Hop on and off all day and never wait more than 25 minutes for the next boat to come along.

Must experience the River Cruise. You must take the Seine River Cruise to experience the other side of Paris. It is a different take of the city looking at the museums, churches, other buildings from the river and the bridges are just as beautiful to see. take the tour on a sunny day so you can go outside of the covered area and take more pictures from the back of the boat.

Beautiful and lovely Seine. No matter where you are, it is great to walk near the Seine. We enjoyed a late afternoon boat ride down the Seine. We were totally amazed to see all of the wonderful activity of Paris with people and events happening along the Seine. The bridges that you pass underneath are beautiful. The architecture, yoga classes, dancing classes, a manmade beach where sand is brought in along the Seine. Wonderful restaurants and some of them were on large boats. Activities of people living in Paris and enjoying Paris is so amazing. We would never have seen all of those things if we had not taken the one hour boat ride. Now I am glad we did not take the boat at night because there would not have been all of the activities along the banks.

Lovely scenic part of Paris. This river is the heart of Paris and is so picturesque. We walked along the Seine on one evening and took the river bruise during the day. It takes on a different atmosphere at night and is very romantic. The bridges have a magical edge with the locks that are placed by lovers...I hope they dont all get pulled down and they are part of the story of the Seine

Dirty and not so nice in the winter. It was cold to take a river cruise, but still you can see most of the monuments etc from a different view. Buy a daypass for about 12 Euro, then skip the subway that day to get around Paris

night cruise. After our time on the eiffel tower we strolled across the street to the river and boarded a night cruise along the river. The cruise was very romantic and tge cold night added to the experience. We sar outside wirh the headphones on and enjoyed the commentary. The buildings are well lit and looked so beautiful. Would highly recommend this to anyone visiting Paris.
river cruise. if your in Paris you must do the river cruise great value great sights fantastic to see paris from the great river seine

So much to see... The is so much to see and experience on the Seine, Lovelock bridge is beautiful (i really hope it doesn't go) the book stands by the river have all manner of quirky things to look at, so many of Paris' main attractions are along the riverside. It's a wonderful place to just stop at with a drink and watch life go by.

I've been on river cruises before, bu none like this.. This is the one of the most recognized rivers in the world. Take your time to enjoy it and take plenty of pictures to remember it. The beautiful bridges and landmarks that you will see will make you never want to leave.

Not to be missed. We took a seine river cruise as part of a day trip on then hop on hop off bus. The views of Paris from the river during the guided tour was absolutely great and something we did not know we would do. Loved it!!
River trip. Well worth a trip on the river we saw soo much more of Paris this way, and the commentary was very informative.
Seine. To walk along the river gives you a great feeling of Paris. We didn´t have time to take a boat but that is surely great too. The bouquinistes, the bridges, the water, great buildings.
Beautiful. Beautiful river...we strolled along the river and took a tour in a boat. So many beautiful sights along the river that it's hard not to take a tour.
Simply beautiful. Such a big beautiful river well worth talking a stroll along the promenade and embracing the city. Also a dinner cruise is highly recommended as the city at night is quite special.
Batobus. A wonderful way to see all the sights of Paris with a very good commentary in English. Being able to get on and off at different points made it a wonderful day.

Romantic walks and dinner cruises. The Seine continues to inspire romance, walking along the cobbled pathways at river level. However, the bridges are now weighed down by the thousands of love locks - padlocks with names inscribed - which gives it a trashy appearance at street level.If you want a memorable dinner, book a dining cruise - but avoid the large, garish bateaux-mooches and find a small, intimate boat (we loved La Calife): good food, ambience, seeing the Paris landmarks illuminated from river level. And the highlight: the Eiffel Tower sparkling with hundreds of lights on the hour for five minutes. Magic!

Cruising. Really enjoyed the cruise up the seine with the commentary.Lasted about an hour and a half. Wonderful and romantic if you have a loved one with you.Beautiful at night as you pass all the riverside attractions lit up..

Romantic. Yes, Paris is romantic city and River Seine is the most romantic part of it. I recommend to have one hour for a cruise. There is plenty of ships, I think they all have same routes. Our cruise was based to music, which was changed by the location. I liked that, and I did not miss any guided tour. Restaurant ships and dinner cruises are good choice if you really like to be romantic.
PARIS. This is another way of seeing Paris which all tourists do.There are many day and night cruises offered by many travel agents.It takes about two hours.

Wonderful way to see many sights while relaxing on river.. I went on this cruise because my poor husband & parents were exhausted with my marathon tour through Paris. This cruise seemed to give everybody a break and it was a great was to see multiple sights.
I really enjoyed the view around and behind Notre Dame.
River Cruise. Really enjoyed the cruise up the seine with the commentary. The weather wasnt very good so stayed in doors. If you buy your ticket with the hop on bus makes the cruise cheaper.

Beautiful at night near Eiffel Tower. If you cross the river at night to take pictures of the illuminated Eiffel Tower, the river reflects the light wonderfully. During day, however, there isn't much to see, although when walking around Paris we passed it fairly often, so don't go out of your way just to see it.

Miss a boat trip in Paris? In-Seine!. Loads of choice, you might even want to try a little bartering between providers. You never know, you might even get a wry Parisian smile to go with your Euro (or two) discount!
Although you'll be surrounded by hordes of other tourists, it's a fantastic history lesson abbreviated into an hour. Highly recommended.

Don't miss a cruise. A cruise down the Seine provides a different perspective on the city landmarks. I went on a 1 hour trip with Bateaux Parisienne which provided a running commentary in several languages.
I declined the opportunity to buy Paris souveniers on the boat or in the gift shop on the pier - they are much cheaper elsewhere!

the romantc river. River Seine is really romantic. When I was walking along the river bank, or when I was taking boat in the river, I always felt it the most beautiful river in the world. Under the sunset, the bridges becomes golden bridges. The more interesting, there is a bridge named "Love and romantic bridge"! River Seine reflects Paris' style: beautiful and romantic.
Captivating. Long casual stroll, artists and shopping. Taking a ride along the Seine has awesome architecture, just beautiful.

Romantic and Refreshing. When I live in paris for a month to study, I always spent my time to see river in paris. I dont know why I love river in paris. Maybe there's a little ship and clean water. The river look fresh when morning and noon and become romantic while sunset :). I suggest you to bring camera, macaroon, and orange juice to enjoy the seine :)

Sunset cruise. One of the best ways to appreciate the Seine is on a cruise. Vedettes de Paris leave from a jetty beside the Pont Neuf. A trip lasts an hour and costs €14. The taped commentary in French and English is played over speakers on the boat.There are over a dozen bridges across the Seine and you can only fully appreciate them from the viewpoint offered by boat.Pont Neuf is the oldest bridge, dating back to 1607, it has a wonderful set of grotesque faces along it which can only be seen from below. The bridge with love locks attached (Pont des Arts) is now totally ruined and boarded up, the practice has shifted to Pont de l'Archevêché close to Notre Dame.

A beautiful river. From the river, either walking along the embankment or travelling by boat you can get some wonderful views of Paris.  Berthed along the quaysides are also a selection of interesting old ships, and little stalls selling interesting niknaks.  A beautiful walk can be taken either by day or night.
Just walk. Just walk near the seine... or take a cruise and admire all Paris.. the amazing buildings, bridges,etc. Great for romantic night walks

Don't bother with a tour!! . We booked a tour, after going to Amsterdam and loving the river tour. I've got to say though it's not worth the money. The boats is crowded, steamy (so you couldn't see out) and uncomfortable. The plastic seats didn't help your experience! The river tour is a lot to do with cathedrals when you can understand what the guide is telling you. We went on the big red bus tour and much preferred that so if I was to go again id save my money and not bother on the river! I imagine if you went in the summer and the roof was down on the boat it would be an entirely different experience but ours wasn't pleasant.
Take a walk along the banks. The view of the city with the Seine is what Paris is all about. A photo with this is a must. No fee to walk along it!
Romantic river. This river is the lifeblood of the city. Walk along its banks, cross its bridges, watch the boats, travel on Bateau Mouche. It even live on it, in a houseboat.

Selfie sticks. Apart from being attacked buy selfie sticks and blinded by all the camera flashing I really enjoyed the cruise, welcomed with hot wine to warm you up, they invite you on board, sights were spot on and the on board recorded tour guide was helpful.. If I went again I would pay a little extra and go on a more up class criuse ;)
