A River Running Through a City. The water seems pretty clean as do the banks. There are lots of bridges. The one called the New Bridge is the cities oldest and prettiest. There are peddlers along many of the banks selling books and 'antique' kitsch.

A relaxing stroll. It's nice to do a stroll by the river after a visit to Notre Dame. There are little pop-up places where you can get posters, postcards, etc. during the day, and in the evening, it's simply beautiful and romantic. Just be careful in case there are any pickpockets lurking about, and it can get cold in the evening, especially if it's windy. You have great views of Notre Dame at night from the river banks, as well. Worth considering a river cruise - quite inexpensive at around 11 Euros, and the recommended operators are Bateaux Parisiennes and Bateaux Mouches.
Iconic. To walk where many have before even though we have been many times it still thrills to do soWe saw a bride on the River banks having her photos done to add to the atmosphere

Batobus. WE bought a one day ticket for the Batobus which was all we needed it for. Very useful to get to see the sites of Paris from the Seine. Buy a 2 days ticket for only 2€ more if you are doing all of the main sights.

Selfies on the Seine. We had a cruise on the Seine on Saturday and because the weather was so bad, we had to sit inside. The boat was very packed and we had no option where to sit.There was a couple in front who spent the whole time taking selfies. Seriously, would hate to be looking at their photos when they return from holidays (oh look, there we are, and again, and there we are)The commentary was very good, and I would say in Summer this is a perfect way to spend part of your trip

another angle to see Paris from. explore the river by Bateaux Mouches (river Boats) fees apply. the boats are nothing fancy, they are huge river boats with hundreds of fixed seat on top and inside nevertheless they serve the aim of enjoying Paris from the famous Seine River. some offer a dinner or lunch but I guess in Paris there are lots of better places to enjoy your dinner.
No, No. At first it seemed romantic...we wanted to go on a boat ride...but as we were standing in line we were almost pick pocketed and we began to feel uncomfortable so we left.

Wow !. I enjoyed waking up and going to sleep by the Seine. The boats at night are beautiful and sometimes you hear music and it is magic. By all means take the Batobus.....not a sight seeing bus, but makes stops at all the landmarks. Fun too !

lovely romantic evening. we took a boat trip up the seine was really romantic and a good chance to see the city from the river as instead of by land, takes you past the Eiffel tower , notre- dame cathedral and much more well worth a look, if you get there at the right time you can also go on a river cruise and have a meal but pardon the pun we missed the boat so got a normal one but was shocked to find how easy it was to get a meal back on dry land in one of the lovely restraints bearing in mind it was gone 10 pm when we got off the boat

Take the boat tour. Seeing Paris from a boat on the river gives you a whole different view of the city and people. There are many types of boat tours and all price ranges. So shop around for what you think you might want to spend and do. There are some that just give the tour and perhaps a glass of wine. Others have lunch and dinner cruises which can get expensive for families.
Definite must see when traveling here!. Definite must see when traveling to Paris! My wife and I had a great time on the Bat-o-bus traveling around the river seine. Great value for the price!

took a boat trip on a lovely sunny day. one gets such a different view of all the sights from the Seine, its worth the trip. The commentary was very clear and historical. All went very smoothly for embarkation and disembarkation.

Valentine's cruise. This trip was part of a booked one which included the Eiffel Tower and coach tour. The only seats that were left when we boarded were in the middle so didn't get to see that much, but we had booked for an evenings cruise so I'm sure if we had booked a daytime one we would of seen more (we will do that next time) We did find the seats to be rather uncomfortable (the bar under your legs is very uncomfortable). The view of the Eiffel Tower when it lit up was a lovely sight to see as was the view that we did get of the Notre Dame. If anyone thinks about doing this cruise I would recommend try and do it during day light - we will next time.
Great Stroll. Could have spent a day walking up and down this river, eating, drinking and shopping at the markets. All major attractions close to the river
Cruising at night xxx. Great views of the cities from our heated boat!! Romantic and scenic and then the Eiffel Tower lit up! Well worth a cruise on this iconic river.

River like!. There's nothing quite as romantic as a cruise down the Seine through Paris especially when its shared with 199 other people the majority of which are American and Canadian high school kids. Both nationalities as we know are known for there quite reflection and culture. Still could be worse could have poured with rain... oh it did!! Good value through at £20 for two for a hour or so's trip. I'm sure in spring its wonderful.

Review of the River Seine by John Sanderson. You can spend an enjoyable time on the River Seine on one of the many cruises. I always take the one hour cruise with Bateaux Parisiens which you can pick up from the quay adjacent to the Eiffel Tower. The cruise, with superb commentary and music takes you to beyond the Notre Dame and back again around the Cite island. The best view of Notre Dame is to be seen from the river. RER C will take you to Champ de Mars Tour Eiffel station.

Stunning, go at night. There are River Cruises offered just by the Eiffel Tower that you can go on. The cruises last about 1 hour and cost approx. $25USD. Must see Paris from the water, totally different perspective. So happy I built this into my trip. Must see.

Beautiful especially at night. We did a night time cruise which was fantastic aboard the the Le Calife (which we would definitely do again as the service and meal were wonderful - I did a separate review for the boat). the River is so so different at night. Seeing Notre Dame lite up and the amazing show from the Eiffel Tower is amazing. Loved seeing people sitting on the river edge enjoying the moon, the boats going past and some even a picnic dinner and glass of wine.

A Defining River. Paris is divided - though in a good way. The River Seine runs through the city, and defines it's elements in an inescapable way. It is a geographic feature, a big line on a map, but is also the heart of the city.Lovely to look at, and to view from, many wonderful hours can be spent, just walking along its banks, and using it as a framing element (in many different ways), for so much that one observes in Paris.I recommend walking along each bank, as it winds its way though a lovely city, and also history. Then, one should take one of the boat excursions, as almost everything is then seen through a different perspective.

Visiting Paris by boat. After a journey of 1,343 km, starting at Tarmonbarry on the Shannon in Ireland which included transporting the boat from the Shannon to Dover in England by road and ferry, crossing the English Channel, travelling down the Canal de Calais, AA river, Canal de la Sensee, Escaut River, St Quentin Canal, Oise River and the Seine, we finally arrived in Paris!We had a month of perfect weather however while we were waiting in Clincy on Friday night to cross Paris to stay in the Arsenal Marina for 10 days, it bucketed down!!We arrived at the the Arsenal Marina without a hitch three hours later. We travelled through the heart of Paris and along the base of the Eiffel Tower cruising for 27 km and going through one lock. There was surprisingly little river traffic (we think as it was Saturday, a lot of the barges were not working) until we got close to the Eiffel Tower and Ile de la Cite, then the tourist boats were like flies.We managed our way around them, even when they broke the red lights on the one way system around the Ile de la Cite. An amazing experience!“Adrian & Nuala are on a mature Gap Year in France. You can see more about their adventures on www.adrianandnualasgapyear.com”
The river is very beautiful. I enjoyed the river seine and even took a boat cruise up and down the river. It is the best way to see Paris and from a different angle.

An Amazing Experience.. We took the Dinner Cruise, and the food was good, but nothing compared to your normal Paris restaurant, however the cruise is for the amazing views of Paris at night, and they were breathtaking!!

A fun way to see Paris. We've done this twice. The first time we just went down and got on, the 2nd it was part of our Hop on Hop off pass - while worth the trip it was so hard to find out where we actually were supposed to go as there are many boats. I wouldn't do any with the dinner, just go do the cruise. Go at the beginning of your trip, this way you can see all the various areas you want to go.
ok but not wonderful. have taken many cruises on european city rivers, this one was not wonderful i think it better towalk the banks especially at night if you have time
It was ok.. I went on one of the river tours and I would probably never do this again. It was an experience that needed to be done I thought but that is all

By all means, do a cruise. If I were to come up with a list of 'must-sees' for Paris, I'd include a cruise along the Seine. Unlike many of the sites which are, after a while, tiring, a Seine trip is nice because it's so relaxing and a change of pace. Well worth your time.
Calm river. Nice to look across. Many tour boats. Was very windy and cold. Some interesting buildings and views looking across the river.

Simple and Beautiful!. Siting by the river, hiding from the wind, in the sunshine, eating our packed lunch, was actually my favourite part of our trip. It's the simplest moments of peace and beauty that mean the most to me. After a morning of sight seeing, it was lovely to be able to relax by the river.
Lovely boat ride!. I've been to Paris a few times and always thought it would be nice to do a cruise. Finally did it recently and it was very enjoyable! Kids enjoyed it as well.

An other to visit Paris. If you want to see in a short time the most important objectives and buildings in Paris I recommend you to take a cruise on Seine (and also I recommend this way if your children travel with you).

Seine Boat Trip. Dont waste your money. They cram "hundreds" of people on the boat who are only interested in photographing the Eifel Tower from every conceivable angle even if they are almost on top of you, blocking your view. There is no commentary so you have no idea which building you are looking at the BACK of. How anybody can find this a "romantic" trip I do not know. Much better to seek out an organised coach trip where you will certainly see more and be better informed by your guide and actually see the interesting elevations of some beautiful architecture. Make your own mind up!! I wish I had been able to read a blog like this before my big mistake.

Well worth it !. Every one should take a trip up the Seine and marvel at he sights along the way.. Excellent value for money.. Try to go around 5-6 as the Eiffel Tower is lit up and makes for a beautiful sight!!
River Cruise Was Relaxing. The Cruise down the river was too relaxing....we fell asleep during the ride!! We had just a little difficulty finding our way to the pier, but after that it was smooth.

It's a must, even for Parisians. A tour boat or a mini-cruise on the Seine is always a great time, even for me as a Parisienne : - you can admire splendid lanscapes and see a maximum of monuments, effortless- you benefit from explanations in your mother tongue - when it's sunny, it's fantastic -even if there are clouds, it is worthewhile-I often prefer the "Vedettes du Pont Neuf" because the boats are smaller, it's a little more artisanal than the "Vedettes du Pont de l'Alma" which are huge.But if you just visited the Eiffel Tour, the Vedettes du Pont de l'Alma are a hundred metres further..

Scenic paris. Boat cruise on the Seine was wonderful, excellent views and much enjoyed BA all the family.
Sitting sometimes in the lounge and out top on the upper ceck was terrific.

Great views of all the sites. We took a cruise along the River Seine impulsively, and I am so glad we did. What a lovely experience, enjoying the sites whilst drinking a glass of wine (which was not excessively over priced). The boat was warm and comfortable with great views. Waving to people on the shore line was great fun. There were no queues so was able to get on the boat immediately. We took the 4pm cruise. we did notice when we got back the queues for the 5pm tour were very long. Maybe we were lucky and chose the right time for us. Its well worth it if you have an hour to spare.
To walk along is wonderful, even in December!. At street level and river level, this is a free and lovely stroll! Stop to browse the merchants, snap shots of Notre Dame and enjoy!
Relaxing!. Loved spending some of our trip laying on deck chairs by this river! So easy to lose time just watching boats and people go past on a gorgeous sunny day!
paris by boat. Very enjoyable way of seeing Paris using hop on hop off tickets as there are 8 places of interest to see

Romantic evening highlight. We enjoyed an evening on one of the many dinner cruises up the seine. The boat was beautifully appointed, drinks and canapés on arrival, life entertainment ,and attentive wait staff. We enjoyed an array of al a carte food. All this was made more memorable cruising down the river taking in the lights of the city and the Eiffel Tower.

Excellent View of Paris... Took a cruise along Seine River about 1 hour.. Manage to view the light show at the beginning and the end of the cruise tour. Unfortunately it was during winter time, too cold that can't stay outdoor throughout the tour.. Very nice night view of Notre Dame, museums, city hall and etc..

The River of Love. I first walked along the Seine in 1970 singing 'Under the Bridges of Paris with You' and I got to do it again 45 years later. Now the place is much cleaner and does not have the smells I remember from 1970. Well done Paris.
River seine.. We did an evening trip down the Seine which gave us a beautiful view of the Eiffel Tower all lit up.The only down side was the line up yo get on the boat
Cruise along the Seine. Just beautiful, taking in the sights and enjoying a glass of wine. Couldn't think of anything better.
Relaxing. Lovely to see the River Seine and all of the beautiful buildings and bridges along the way. Well worth doing.

A relaxing boat ride down the Seine. We took a breather from the heat and had a boat ride down the Seine. You see Paris from a different angle and is quite romantic too especially at night I would imagine.
We had a deal for the boat because we did the bus sight seeing tour on a previous day, so was impressed with the value too.
The Seine River. Cannot miss the cruise. Gives overview of almost all the attractions in Paris. Nice and friendly people walk, sit and eat on borders and wave.

Boattrip Seine with Batobus. Since we walked quite a lot in Paris, it was nice to sit down for a while and still do the sightseeing. And it is a nice way of traveling for example from Tour Eiffel to Notre Dame.We bought tickets beforehand online, but there is no advantage in doing so. You still have to stand in same line to get your tickets (and there wasn't a big line anyway).Ticket is valid the whole day (16 euro's for adults and 7 for child) and you can hop on and off where you like. Time schedule is every 20-25 minutes. But we waited around 17:00 at Notre Dame to hop on again, but than had to wait for the next boat because it was crowded already. So don't use it as means of transport, only for sightseeing.

If you have the chance. take one of the tourist boats down the seine river you will see the city from a different perspective and when the boat turns to return you will get a wonderful shot of notre dame if you are on the left side of the boat expensive but i think worth it.

Beautiful River Cruise. We had purchased tickets on-line in advance on the Vedettes du Pont Neuf boats. Even though it was November, we were able to sit on the top deck of the boat with our beers. It was cold but we were prepared. We took a late afternoon trip and up the river in daylight. The highlight of the trip was the return trip at twilight when the lights on the streets, monuments and other sights were being turned on. Passing by Notre Dame was incredible and we couldn't stop taking photos. We will do the trip again on a return visit to Paris.
Walk for views. Walking along the river is one of the best ways to see some of Paris' best bridges and buildings. It's simply magical. Definitely Romantic so make the most of this freebie!

River Cruise is a must!. Do a Seine cruise by night. It costs 14 euros and offers you great views of the city illuminated by fancy lamplights and shrouded in a mist of mystery and the past. There are great music pieces played on the journey, some bits by famous French street performers and classical art chef-d'oeuvres. For a more authentic experience, go up to the upper floor of the ship. Tip: check at your hostel, chances are high you will get cruise tickets for 2 euros less.

Walk the Seine. Many people take the boat rides up and down the River Seine. However, I find that walking along the river is better. Try walking between the Left Bank neighborhood and the Eiffel Tower. Take your time and keep crossing over the Seine at each bridge. There are so many incredible sites along the way, that walking allows the time to enjoy Paris and not just take pictures from a boat.
Le Coeur de Paris. A can't-miss, no you literally cannot miss it. But even though it's gloomy and dirty, Le Seine is a great place to hang out and has some beautiful bridges.

Lovely To see The City From A Boat. We enjoyed the boat tour very much and it would have been even better if we could have heard more of the commentary- there were several very noisy tour groups on board at the same time.There were lots of brilliant photo opportunities but because the Seine was so high the boats could not go as far as Notre Dame. However, we were warned in advance, and instead the boats went further South than usual.
boat tour. It rained, so we had a difficult time watching. We were cold and a large group of toursists were very noisy and pushy. So we huddled together and did not see much.

Lovely boat journey around paris. Our trip included this boat journey. This boat was covered with glasses. It was raining when we go to this boat so the glass covers saved us. I advise to carry umbrella with you when you come to paris in rainy season. I had to buy a simple umbrella for Euro 25 on this boat to save us from rain. The trip was interesting and learnt a lot about the old french buildings and by the end of this ride it got a bit boring frankly. The narrator speak many languages which we cannot understand, thanks of a french couple who described us about the buildings. The seats of the boat very very hard and not at all comfortable. Recommend to visit if you have spare time or else there is lot to see in paris.
Picturesque river. Cruise ride was amazing.. A ride to remember. We visited in month of March, Weather was little cold but it was a breath-taking experience for us .:)
Short and sweet!. We enjoyed the boat ride at night. It was chilly so bring a wrap or jacket. The view of the Eiffel Tower at night from the boat was beautiful and I took a lot of pictures.
Amazing scenery. We took a boat trip on the Seine and it was well worth it. We went at night and you could see the lights on the Eifel Tower and everything was lovely
Scenic but cold. Winter is not the best time but still pleasant to see the beautiful cityscape along the Seine and the bridges.
Lovely river to sit by. I went along the river on the batobus and I also sat by it as I ate my lunch as some sections are lovely little sun traps
Great river.. We went in February when the seine was high and mighty. Walking along it is good - recommend. Great river.
Nice. A seine river cruise is a must you see most of the sights from the boat, quite a number of languages are available, an hour cruise costs €14 for adults

Walk or float. Best side to walk the Seine river is opposite of the Eiffel tower. Lots of scenic views or ride a ferry but I suggest taking a tour and not a diner cruise if you want to get an orientation of the city. For romance do the diner cruise.

Beautiful. Always beautiful to walk along here or to see from a higher monument. Loads of shops/restaurants/cafe's as you walk along. Drivers are bonkers though so make sure you only use the designated crossing points!
Fab. Lovely boat trip, booked on line and very easy to find your pick up and drop offs. Deffinately stay on for the last trip of the day as you see the Eiffel Tower all lit up!

very intresting. We found the tour very intresting and learnt alot about the diffrent buildings along the river seine.
we also walked alone the river afterwards and we were amazed at the urban village that went all the way along there was so much to do we didnt have much time to do it.
worth a visit.

In the rain in Paris. In our trip package we had a boat ride but it rained. The boats are covered with glass but hard to get a good photo. It was very nice ride in July. Thank god we had portable raincoats. The boat ride was long enough. Lots of people on boat ride with hard seats. The narrator talked in many languages about Paris and the bridges. It was a good ride to see Paris and saved my feet. I love Paris and it is a very romantic city. I would do it again on a nice day and get great photos. We met a nice couple from Germany. Very friendly in Paris.

River of love. This river has lots to say, no matter which part , lots of romance and relaxing, restaurants and painters. most defiantly try to have a cruise on Seine, every time I was looking at it, remembering Jean Val jean and Javert (Les Misérables) Hope you know who they are

Absolutely worth the 14 Euros for the one hour cruise. You can get to see the most amazing buildings in the world from this one hour cruise. We were there in Jan, so we avoided the crowds and had the whole top deck to ourselves. No one else was silly enough to sit outside in the freezing cold. On the return trip we ventured below for a coffee and wine before departing.

Bad experience. We took a boat tour on vedettes de paris today, expecting to get some insights into buildings along the Seine. No commentary for the first twenty minutes. When I asked when it was starting I got a shrug, then was told there is an issue with the commentary. Turns out there had been an issue with it all day, but they kept selling tickets. My complaint seems to have spurred them into trying to get some commentary going and they did, but only in half the boat. And it was the most basic, uninteresting tour commentary ever. The trip was not what they promised. To their credit, they gave me a refund. But the next unsuspecting boatload was already boarding, not realizing there were serious issues with the commentary.

Night boat ride. This was part of our package: Eiffel tower dinner, river boat on the Seine & Moulin Rouge. It is very cold here now, about 30 degrees Farenheit and windy, so the boat ride was cold... They have a narrator is many languages, so was able to learn about the bridges and the many landmarks. I think it would be a better attraction when it is warmer!
Great to walk along, or ride on. They do boat cruises up and down the river all day and into the night. This is a great way to get an overview of the city, get the magnitude of it all.

Bateaux Parisienne. Unless you just like spending a lot of money for no reason, do not take this boat for a dinner cruise. We had window seats but there was no commentary and our waiter was too busy serving to provide us with any information on what we were seeing. The meal was okay but when compared to the steep price ......not so good! We paid top dollar for a premium table and had a spotlight shining in our eyes from the upper level. They did turn it off when asked to do so.The river is beautiful at night but do not waste your money on the dining. The staff was not friendly and the food not all that good!. The Hyatt concierge must have received a very large kick back for selling us on this evening excursion

Take the night boat trip with dinner. We took the boat trip on a Monday night. The boat and the service aboard it were first class and attentive. Dinner on-board was excellent, far exceeding what we expected. And the pianist and violinist provided a wonderful backdrop as we travelled up and down the Seine. The night-time perspective of the buildings along the river were quite stunning as was the journey under each bridge. It gave a whole new meaning to the song "Under the bridges of Paris"!! And it was very good value for 2 and a half hours.

Best way to experience the Seine. Having taken the boat and found it uninspiring, I highly recommend a stroll along the bank of the Seine, sampling coffee shops and the many other shops offered to tourists - many more than we saw during tourist season. so much more to see than from the water. Stop off at Notre Dame. Enjoy the bridges COVERED with padlocks mostly with lovers names on them. Wander where you wish Hop on the Metro or bus - but on a nice day there is plenty to do and see. I highly recommend it.If you found this review helpful, please note below. I appreciate it when others also give this reminder.

Evening wine on the river. We did both a day river tour and a sunset one... Mostly to see as many sites as possible during our stay.Both were great deals, very relaxing and interesting.On the evening boat tour, we noticed a ton of locals, sitting on the banks with wine & some had dinner.The next evening, we grabbed a bottle of wine, some bread & cheese and searched out a spot along the river to enjoy the sunset.What an amazing experiance!!

Beautiful visit in night time. We had visited during late evening time..the guided tours...worth..they usually starts at specific interval of time...like every hour or so..good views of most of the places to be visited in Paris..Must do if you have got time in evening-night...

A fun boat tour. We did a boat tour combo with a cabaret show and it was a lot of fun. The food was good (not amazing) but it was all about the view and getting an up close look at the Eiffel Tower. I couldn't get enough of that view!

Wonderful!. If you get the chance to cruise down the River Seine at night then do so, it's truly magical. Absolutely amazed at all the different bridges, their designs and architecture. To see all the famous landmarks, buildings lit up is truly magnificent!

Nice walk. The river is nice, clean and wide. You can make a nice stroll along the river. Some companies are also offering cruises, but some of them are litte bit more expensive. On the other hand it could be very romantic especially in the evening.
Take a boat ride. Walking along the edge of the river is actually pretty boring. But seeing Paris from the river on a boat is great.

Bateaux Mouches. We did an afternoon tour down the Seine on the Bateaux Mouches. The tour lasts about 1 hour and 10 minutes and travels towards Notre Dame and then back down the river past the Eiffel Tower and Statue of Liberty. Beautiful houseboats along the river. We were able to see a more modern area of Paris as well. Short information is given about historical areas in a variety of different languages.
A visual treat for the traveler. Paris from a whole different perspective. Just sit and watch beautiful boats and people going about their daily business or lovers strolling hand in hand.
A very pleasant trip. We took a basic 1 hour river cruise and really enjoyed it. Discovered things we didn't know. Highlight was seeing the statue of liberty
take the boat trip. you need to take the boat trips to really feel the river. there are also different trips that take a route inside smaller canals.

Views from the Seine not as good as being on land. If you think you are going to see Paris by cruising down the rover you are wrong. You may enjoy the journey, you may enjoy the food and the atmosphere, but travel round Paris by road/metro if you really want to see it. Even in winter the level of water in the river is too low for you to see too much above the river banks.

Always a favorite walk in Paris. From the bookseller stalls to the boats in the river, the Seine is a favorite to walk along for blocks or even miles. In warmer weather, take a picnic! We love to walk up one side and down the other-perfect!

A great place for a walk, it it's sunny and warm. I walk along the river when I need a break from the buzzy Paris. There is so many things to see in Paris, and this was s where you can get a break... But it has to be warm and sunny!

Beautiful at night. Just beautiful to cruise around, at night and look at the sights and the lights. Very relaxing too! Can be a little chilli so dress warmly and remember to take some gloves and a hat during the winter months.

Very very nice. I think the best way to see the river is by cruise, so book a cruise. If you get a sightseeing bus tour ticket, ask if it includes a river cruise, some do, mine did. You get to pass all the famous bridges, see most of the monuments, take awesome pictures, and it's very relaxing. I don't know about all the cruise ships, but the one i traveled in had good bathroom facilities, cafe machines, and the crew was very nice. Totally worth seeing.
Well, Paris has much better many things.. Well, Paris has many things much better than the River Seine. I find difficult to write something about it. Just a river.
Take an evening cruise!. We did a wonderful Champagne tasting cruise on the Vendettes boat. Enclosed and cozy in winter. Beautiful views of sights along the river.
relaxing view. the boat ride across the river is amusing and you get to see all the historic important monuments around the river. the guided tour is awesome

aug 2009. boat ride in summer along the seine river is something you cannot do without when you go to France. It's not expensive and you will have a good time on it, Take in the sights as you cruise along.

Love Love Love. So romantic ! Its beautyful when you see all this bridges over Seine. At night its light under all bridge and its realy lovely.Some of the bridges , you also can place your hanglocks on !

Quite enjoyable and relaxing. We did a river cruise and it was a fantastic idea to get to know the surrounding areas. The boats are in excellent conditions and never full, we enjoyed so much as it goes at steady pace so you can admire the landmarks

Beautiful. Took a cruise on the Seine River and it was a lovely experience as it passed through several famous attractions such as Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame Cathedral. Would definitely recommend this to my other family members and friends.
Great. We booked a champagne cruise through viator. The guide Lindsay was amazing. She told us everything even little quirky stories. Go down at night.

If you haven't seen the Seine .... The Seine is the biggest French river and probably the most important one: 776 km long, from Dijon to Le Havre! Visiting Paris, boat cruises are a must and there are many companies operating them. I took the "Batobus". Its "passport" allows you to board the boat as many times as you want during the period acquired. Its eight stations - Tour Eiffel, Musée d'Orsay, Saint-Germain-des-Prés, Notre Dame, Jardin des Plantes, Hôtel de Ville, Musée du Louvre and Champs-Elysées - will offer you a perfect Paris sightseeing, beautiful photos and unforgettable memories to take home. Enjoy!
By Bateaux Parisienne. On board commentary in 6 languages. Glass all round view. Warm interiors. Choice of inside or outside seating. Enjoyable hour cruise along the Seine.

Beautiful bridges!. Read about the history of the River Seine and learn about Joan of Arc's time... a river cruise is a wonderful way to see the city, learn a little about the history and importance of this waterway. Beautiful photographic opportunities and sightseeing.. gorgeous bridges!
Bato Boat Ride. The river flows from the centre of the city and eiffel towers is on the bank of this beautiful river.Batoboat rides is worth and enjoyable.
Nice to walk. In Paris you can stroll on the bank of the river Seine. You will see many small stalls with all kind of things you do not need but want to have.
Amazing. Did the cruise on the Seine - had a covered boat, good digital coverage of the sights along the Seine. Worth the money, a must do...

River boat tour. Purchased a joint big bus and river boat tour ticket. River boat wasn't as good as the bus trip in my opinion but was a lot warmer! The operator gave a voice over explanation of the sites as well as the recorded tape that can be listed too via earpieces in many languages. It's a great way to see Paris.

My favourite thing to do in Paris. Hands down my favourite thing to do while in Paris is walk along the Seine. During the day it's beautiful walking from the Eiffel Tower right down and past the Notre Dame. It's very relaxing and peaceful walking along with a hot chocolate or something warm in winter. At night it's just the same but on points of the river you can see the Eiffel Tower lit up. Very romantic! Haven't done a boat ride down the Seine but have heard it is recommended.
Relax and enjoy the Seine!. No matter what boat you are on, you will enjoy the river and all of it's beauty!Go at night, or day, enjoy the music and fine food. You will never forget it!
Boat trips on the Seine are a great way to see the city. A relaxing trip on the Seine is a great way to see different parts of the city and get a bit oriented along the river.

Great views. Took the Batobus which is a shuttle service on the Seine that makes eight stops: Notre Dame, Jardin Des Planties, Hotel de Ville, Louve, Champs Elysees, Tour Eiffel, Musee D'Orsay and St. Germain des Pres'.

Just amazingly romantic. The boat tide throughout the river was so nice and romantic. Couples should embark on romantic rides. The sites are things to behold. I love the lock bridge. Heard that the bridge was slowly ...... Due to the weight of the locks

Different perspective. The boat tours are an alternative way to reach tour sites rather than hop on & off buses. I would choose the double decker type next time with more outside seating. Also if you want to do a dinner tour, make reservations a few days ahead to be on the safe side.
Best Time of My Life ♡. This is the Best Time of My Life ♡.. a walk thtug the river.. or a cruise.. or just grsp a coffe and sit there watching the view. . This is the most romantic place on earth

Romantic way to see many Paris sites. From a Seine River dinner boat tour from dusk into night the beautiful city of lights comes alive. The views and architecture of so many sites on and by the river is very special and the food and music are enjoyable and a romantic way to sight see around Paris. The Eiffel Tower light show was spectacular and the views of all the sites from the Seine River add another perspective to those you will go to and see in person. The Bateaux Mouches glass enclosed dinner cruise was another wonderful way to experience Paris and its many unique and wonderful treasures.

Breath taking.. Worth taking a river cruise at least once. Some offer dinner others just do tours. If you decide to go I recommend going at night so you can see the Eiffel Tower lit up and if you're lucky you get to see it "glitter" on the hour. It's an amazing sight.

Beautiful!. Even though we were in Paris in winter and had overcast weather the whole time, the Seine is a beautiful, evocative river worthy of many photos. The numerous bridges are fascinating, some even encrusted with gold paint. We caught the Batobus - a hop on, hop off water bus that does a great circuit past all the major stops of interest. We recommend this way of getting around in Paris in conjunction with the amazing metro.

Bateaux Parisien fine dining lunch at River seine. We are thankful for our tour agent Carinne for booking us at this boat. We thought we'd get cold having lunch on a winter river cruise. But aside from proper ventilation, it was a fine dining experience while appreciating the great 360 degree views of Eiffel and other tourist attractions while onboard. You get to enjoy champagne, white wine, red wine bottles per table but you can't take them home with you. Food is awesome, great taste, creative presentation, average portions, a little pricey. The river itself isn't pristine on winter but it doesn't matter, you get good food while listening to a recorded audio guide aboard the boat.

Grab a picnic and join the locals!. We had a great time watching the comings and goings along the river! We bought a yummy picnic at La Grande Epicerie (across the street from Le Bon Marche) and walked to the river's edge, where we found a bench. One of our favorite memories of our visit to Paris!

Easy to overlook!. A stroll by the Seine is an absolute joy. It is easy to overlook the river when one is determined to discover some new tourist attraction or visit one of the top ten attractions in Paris. It is well worthwhile taking a walk up and down both sides of the river especially near Notre Dame when, at night the views are amazing!

Heart of paris. River Siene has something to offer to everyone. Bank of the river is beautifully done and have nice seating arrangements. Bridges are quaint, peaceful and romantic. Jog in the fresh air in morning, have a picnic with your family, make a wish in Lover's Bridge, hold hands with your loved one and watch the sunset standing in the bridge, or have a romantic boat cruise at night, River Siene is truly the heart of Paris.Not to forget, the grand view of Effiel Tower, Louvre and Notre-Dame from River Siene will mesmerise you.

Romantic walk. When in Paris, I love to drop of the street down to the walk way along the river. Easy to access, safe and romantic. Think of all the peoples lives affected (the history) by the river Seine. If the river could only talk!
Magic. Apart from seeing the river on our various tours we also ran along the bank of the Seine for about 30 minutes in the early morning. It was a beautiful experience - even in Winter!!

The heart of Paris. The river is the backbone of Paris. Wonderful sightseeing! Worth strolling along its banks until you get to the Louvre, the Museum d'orsey or just to one of the lovely coffee shops available. Trying the scargot is a must!

Nice cruise at night. Excellent way to see the city by night. We did a dinner cruise on the river. Relaxing and enjoyable after walking around the whole day. During the day it may be better to get onto one of the boats where they actually tell you about the sights as you pass them by.

Must do a river tour to orient yourself with Paris. See lots of highlights from the river. Bateaux Mouche is convenient and reasonably priced. You get great views of Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Louvre, D'Orsay...

Great beyond Paris as well!. My husband and I enjoyed a 10-day river cruise (roundtrip Paris) over the Christmas 2014-New Year 2015 holidays--and although we've walked along and over the Seine many times during many Paris visits and dined on a Seine Paris bateau, we'd never cruised beyond Paris on the Seine. I highly recommend it! We passed and stopped at many charming villages (which we explored with local guides and on our own) and docked for two days at Rouen before continuing toward Honfleur and then returning to Paris. You pass through a number of locks--and sometimes the river is too high to get back to the city of lights--but it's an experience that allows you to expand your vision of what this wonderful waterway means in a variety of areas to a variety of residents.

Boat trip down the Seinne-brill!. One hour trip down the Seinne awesome, the sights really great! Saved my tired legs a lot of hard work. I could now select if I wanted a closer look at some of the fantastic sights. So many to consider.

More than just a river: a good place to have a sack lunch. We enjoyed sitting by the river banks, enjoying the warm Parisian sunlight, just a few blocks away from Notre Dame Cathedral. It was fun just to watch the ferry boats full of waving and inebriated tourists.

Beautiful!. The River Seine is a very beautiful city river. The heart of Paris it flows all through the city, an integral part of what makes Paris such a romantic city. You can take a ride on a boat to see the sights from the river. Otherwise, take long romantic walks along the banks of the river and watch the sun go down. Highly recommended!
Easy way to travel. On the river... this was the easy way to travel. Just hop on and off with your day ticket. Nice way to view the city and to relax at same time.
serene. We had done a small cruise on the river siene and just loved the ride... there was a slight drizzle the day we were taking the cruise and that made is even more romantic..
Paris by night. We took a cruise around the river at night and saw the main sights. It was very beautiful. And affordable. A must do when in Paris.

Great to Stroll Along.... . This is like no other... All the gorgeous bridges that stretch across it, took a stroll along only part of it and could have walked for many hours more, was incredible, a lot of the attractions in Paris can be seen from a boat ride here :)

Francofile. Wet and cold but a tick box experience. Not much happens on the Seine and apart from seeing many of the important sites of Paris, not brilliant. Not a patch on the Thames. Our experience was hugely enhanced by our daughter in law bringing a bottle of champagne on board!
Comfortable cruise in the river. A good cruise in beautiful weather and with recorded commentary could view many important landmarks on either side of the river
Good to sit down!. This is a beautiful way to spend a couple of hours in Paris by resting your weary feet and enjoying the sites.

Trip down the Seine is a must!. A trip down the River Seine is a must if visiting Paris. There are numerous tour and guide boats that will either give you a guided tour of what is in Paris as you pass them, or you can buy a day ticket for a hop-on, hop-off boat which drops you off next to all the main Paris tourist attractions. Luckily most of the attractions are next to the banks of the River so you do not have very far to walk.
Boat tour on the Seine River. We both found the boat tour relaxing and and interesting. We recommended that you experience the boat tour do some research on the different tour companies.

Relax and see many of the main attractions from the river!. We took a cruise on the Seine to take a break from walking during our recent vacation, and it was a wonderful experience that I would highly recommend. Many of the most famous attractions are visible from the river, like the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, the Louvre, and the Grand Palace to name just a few. The trip was relaxing and peaceful, and one of the few activities where you do not need to fight the crowds!The city also looks much less congested and more "open" from the river, which provides a wonderfully different perspective.

Take a Stroll. It is wonderful to take the time to stroll along the river. I like to start on the Right Bank (Louvre side) near the Il de Citi (Notre Dame Island) and walk down river. I keep to the water as much as possible although some stretches come up to street level. I have walked this stretch on the Left Bank as well. Great in the early evening as the light fades and the City of Lights comes to life.
Great to walk along.... The river is very beautiful, and since it is all around Paris, it's hard to miss it. lol It's nice to walk along it and even nicer to go on a boat ride.

Wonderful cruise on the Seine. We had prebooked this cruise and it fell on Sunday, 11th January which may have been why it was very empty. We were lucky enough to have wonderfully blue skies and the cruise was amazing. Well-worth taking to view the sights along the Seine.
Beautiful and soulful. We arrived in Paris in mid of December. It was quite cold.But the Seine river was beautiful and soulful as ever. The Roue de Paris added to the light and beauty of the River.

The spirit of Paris. All major cities in the world were built around a river in the past and for Paris, it was river Seine. The river complements Paris and when in Paris, one must keep some time, just to walk or relax along the river side. The road runs along the river in most parts of the city center. You can choose to get in the inner lane to avoid traffic and enjoy a care free walk. There are numerous tours available on boat which will take you to all the way across the heart of Paris. It is a different way of exploring the city altogether. I truly admire the musicians on the road and how they fill the air with serenity; the area along the river provides the perfect place to enjoy that. There are a few food stalls and small souvenir shops as well which come handy for a quick bite. For me the river side completes the Paris experience.

By boat, or walking, one of THE great rivers of the world. Whether you stroll along the banks, or take an hour river cruise from the Eiffel Tower (part of the Paris Pass discounts, saving about £12 each), this is a wonderful stretch of water. Lots to see either way. Walking in the evening allows wonderful views of a beautifully lit city. We visited in winter, river cruise was very cold!! Take warm clothing if you choose this option. Fantastic.

Viking River Cruise up the Seine. Amazing cruise up the Seine River from Paris to Normandy and back! Wow! Gorgeous views, several stops along the way, one in particular that was especially nice was Rouen. Lovely town, nice tour thru the town and I bought a lovely piece of porcelain made there and was being painted by the artist there on site. Loved it! Fabulous views along the river that you just have to see!

Walking around Paris. My children and I did a lot of walking while on vacation in Paris, and to be able to walk along the River Seine was great. Not only was the noise of traffic less, but there was actually a good amount of "kid" related things to do , at one place there was a little rock wall for kids to burn off some energy and the games and a maze painted into the pavement further down the walk. Loved it so much we went back everyday !

A must for visitors with a different perspective of paris. Batobus takes you to the heart of Paris on the seine, to reach the various quarters of the capital. With 8 stops on the route, Batobus shows you a different view of Paris.

Stunning views and Romantic. You can see almost everything from here. Walk along the river and get lost in the magic of Paris. We didn't take the cruise because it was too cold but I want to go back in a better weather to enjoy everything this river hast to offer.
In Love. When in town I jog here, hang out with friends, take walks in the evening or whatever else comes up. One of the best city riverscapes in the world.
Take a nice walk :). Worth a walk if you have the time :) took a quiet relaxed walk along the river and it was very enjoyable having the time to discover monuments and the individual bridges.Enjoy!
Seine River Cruise. A very good introduction to Paris...get see all the major Paris attractions and good photo opportunities
Wonderful. A majestic river cutting a beautiful city !! Various attractions along the river and very romantic !!

Cruise and Walk to experience the Seine. From on foot viewing art offerings along the West Bank, or strolling beside pleached trees on si the Luxembourg Gardens side, to a very basic tourist cruise, or even on the train that travels along the Seine to Verseilles, the river Seine is the life-blood of Paris and should not be missed!Experience it as many ways as possible, by day and by night taking time to drink in all that it offers....cross as many of the intriguing bridges as you possibly can as you explore inner Paris. Walk along its banks to get to the Eiffel Tower.Hop on and hop off a river cruising boat, or do a round trip.Around every bend there is something to discover, from its intriguing bridges, to the numerous sculptures and memorials as well as iconic buildings that are located on its banks to experience the Seine is to experience Paris.Don't miss wandering along the lower levels of the Seine to see the amazing stone levies and ancient moorings near the Ille de St Louis, along from where the tourist ferries board!It's not necessary to spend a lot of money on a Seine cruise. You will get the same information on a no frills one as you do on spending a great deal of money on a dinner cruise.Simply enjoy; ou la la!

along the center of Paris. Strolling along the promenade, you can see the main attractions of the city center. It should be borne in mind that a number of large stream of cars, someone may seem noisy. Winter windy.

River Seine is beautiful :-). It's a great place to visit as it's a beautiful place and plenty of surrounding cafés and bars etc. we had coffee & croissants sitting next to the river. When I'm next in Paris I would definatly book a river cruise as I'm sure there is much more of the river to see. Recommended.

Great experience. Cool weather. Felt peaceful. . This river is amazing. The only thing was that the water in the river was brown in color. The pictures showed that it was blue. Felt a little dissapointed. The weather was good. It was peaceful. Try a cruise, you'll enjoy it.

Beautiful artery of the city.. The Seine runs through the city like a roaring artery. I lost count of how many times we crossed it but each time I was in awe at the beauty. The city is impressive during the day but is trully beautiful at night.

Lovely, peaceful being near the Seine. It is such a thrill to watch the boats go by while sitting along the river enjoying a glass of wine...or by being on one of the day or evening river cruises or a lovely stroll along the river.

Romantic cruise with Romantic river.... I had a chance to cruise along the river Seine. If you have a chance, you must join the cruise and you will see many well-known places, located close to the River Seine.Enjoy the cruise!

Breath taking views!. We opted for the first cruise that we could get on, and were not disappointed. I made sure it had seating outside, so we could take pictures. We purchased our tickets at a kiosk, so we didn't have to wait. It was close to the Eiffel Tower, close to the bridge.The views were spectacular! I highly recommend seeing Paris this way. You will not regret it! We passed the Notre Dame, where we had attended mass the night before. This is how we spent our Christmas Day and we had the best time seeing the sights of Paris.

Amazing River. The Seine is the second-longest river in France. It runs northwest from Burgundy, passes through Paris, and eventually empties into the English Channel at Le Havre. The scenery will not disappoint river cruisers who are excited about the romance of Paris. In addition to seeing architectural marvels like the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame cathedral, the Seine river has 37 picturesque bridges in Paris alone! The famous Rive Gauche (Left Bank) is one of the most romantic districts in the city. A Seine river cruise through France is ideal for art, history & wine lovers. Explore Seine river cruise packages below and view applicable river cruise deals.

Lovely river walk even in the winter time. Many beautiful bridges and walkways are along the Seine. Make sure to find the bridges with all the locks on them, no too far from the Louvre or the Musee di Orsey. There are vendors all over the place that want to sell you locks, Eiffel Tower replicas, or roasted chestnuts, but don't let that discourage you from taking a walk along the River Seine.

Must do the river cruise!. Me and the girlfriend went on this and it was amazing! The boat, the food, the wine, the atmosphere everything was top drawer. If you go to Paris you simply have to do this....we went during the day but would definately love to go at night.
River. Beautiful! Went on a boat ride out on it from the tour eiffel. Definitely recommend doing this or at least seeing it from a bridge!

Be careful which cruise. Worth the tour as the Seine is the aorta of Paris , but be sure to check out the tours and what is provided. Sometimes much cheaper to cruise with a multi pass...Paris Pass would be the best buy but others cheaper than doing the cruise only. Unfortunately the cruise we chose had no commentary and it was our first day, so chose carefully before purchasing, if you want information other than naming the site

Trip up the river. For those who don,t want to walk the length and breadth of Paris,a river cruise is a good idea roughly costing 14euros for a day,you can get on and off near to most of the main attractions.if it,s raining,no problem,the boats are covered with a glass roof.

Classical concert. Book one of the evening classical music tours along the Seine -- you will have a very peaceful experience, listening to great music as the boat takes you past Paris lit up at night.

Every time more beautiful. You cannot miss Seine when in Paris. If you take a cruise, try to put one more love locket on the Port des Arts, walk along the river bank or simply take a small walk in Paris, you are bond to appreciate it at some stage. I never imagined I would enjoy a walk on its river bank during the end of December but I took the greatest photos ever of the Eiffel Tower at sunset.

Take a boat ride and see the sights. I remembered the "Bateaux Mouches" from my French classes in High School, but that's really a brand more than a type. There are a couple of different places to take the boat ride down the Seine and it's worth it. Bring your camera, get some wine before boarding, and SIT to see the sights.Well worth it.

The Rive Seine. The aorta of Paris. Without the river there is no Paris.. Walk along the great paths that follow the river, see the beautiful landmarks, amazing bridges, river boats, and listen to the birds and people that pulse along with the flow of the river.Not to be missed. Actually is hard to miss as just about all of the museums, palaces, and iconic Paris places to see are on the river front.

Crusing up the River.. We did an hour trip on one of the small boats passing many landmarks. it was a cold windy day and would have been better had the day been warmer. There is a covered section for those wanting the shelter but the views are not quite as good as standing outside to get photo shots.
Super views, a must do!. Paris is even more beautiful from the Seine. We did a dinner cruise and it was absolutely breathtaking at night! We used Viator.com to book our cruise and they were perfect!

Night River Cruise at Christmas time. Great!!!!!! However, I bought the Barefoot Contessa's
new book...and she goes to Paris every New Year's.
I LOVED HER NEW YEARS NIGHT IN PARIS,,,READ
IT FOR YOURSELF, That is what I'll do next time I
visit my favorite City. Take the Taxi for the evening to
visit all the famous places and see the lights.
Romantic. The river Seine is most definitely better by night when the lights are twinkling on the water. So romantic to have a walk around here.

Not as interesting as land. Many supported languages. Not that well done lots of lags in dictation
37 bridges all one speed no slowing down to view, lots of space on board
Might be nice at night
Just beautiful.. Specially at night or dawn. It is amazing to see so many people riverside with a glass and a bottle of wine. Excellent to take the tour and dine on the cruise.
Just amazing. You can not visit Paris without walking on the river seine especially at night I recommend a walk from louver to Eiffel tour after sunset about 30 to 40 minutes
Loved the River Cruise. I think the River Cruise you get across from the Eiffel Tower is wonderful. They go down the river till it splits and then around to the other side. You get to see it all!!!

The Love River. The Seine River is part of arguably the most romantic setting in the world and as part must be seen by boat to fully appreciate the views it has to offer. See a lot of the attractions form the boat and at night places a new outlook to your Paris experience.

Would definitely recommend taking the river cruise. We took the river cruise and discovered that many of the top attractions and museums can be accessed via the river. We hopped on and off the river boat to access the museums that we decided to visit. Notre dame cathedral, museum d orsay and close access to other museums as well.The view of the city from the river was amazing! And you could see all the bridges from a different angle.Would definitely recommend that you take the river cruise!

another river. not quite what we expected, probably de to our lack of knowledge. Expected the river banks to be more vibrant, really no different to River Thames but with different architecture along the banks.

Good way to see the sites. Loved this hour long tour that cruised the Seine. Seemingly the tickets cannot be purchased ahead of the cruise which is a down side. Great view of many of the bridges, good photo opportunities and interesting narration by tour guide.

My little river boat trip along the Seine. This past December 2014 I was indeed lucky enough to spend 10 nights on the MS River Venture cruising the Seine from Paris, France to Rouen and Honfleur to name a few ports of call. Although the weather was frightful, the drip was delightful! France was decked out in her Christmas finery and the little towns we stopped at were....magical. The trip was sponsored by Vantage travel and they gave a 5* plus value for the money. Just magical....
Don't sit in front of talking people. People behind us did not shut up. I could not hear the loud speaker as we were going through certain attractions.
Boat trip. This is a must just to see the many bridges! The buildings are amazing and everything is on such a large scale, it is quite awesome.

The heart of Paris. Paris without the Seine would just be a city of beautiful buildings and great art. The Seine gives it a different kind of life, and signifies the diversity of the city through the many uses of the river and its quays. Much of Paris grew from the river trade and services that supported it, and much of it today is oriented to the river. It gives you perspectives on the city that are perfectly scaled for the cityscape, and contribute to the light that Paris is known for. If you're in Paris you actually can't help but take in the river, but take time to appreciate it. Stroll, have a picnic, check out the barges that people live on, take a boat ride, especially at night.

Beautiful night lights. We took a boat ride after sun down when the city lights up. I do not recall the boat operator but it was located on a side tributary off the main river and we had to go through a lock to access the main river, the lock was an added bonus to experience. Snacks and drinks can be purchased on the boat. The Eifle Tower light show and Notre Dame are easily seen from the boat. Most of the boat tours end in Sept due to cooler weather so check dates.
Great Boat Trip. We did a boat trip as part of a tour and the whole family loved it . It was a reasonable price and a great way to see Paris and all the bridges .

Great way to start Paris. Strongly recommended for first time visitor, this river contain more than 10 Paris bridge which was beautiful by the way, you can also see almost all attraction in Paris since most of them is at the river bank, just take the cruise, day or night... It's equally remarkable...From there you can find your way for most of the attraction in Paris... The cruise would be 1hour with French, English and Spanish speaker... Overall, love this place and it's a great way to start Paris

Main river in Paris. The River Seine is in the middle of Paris & cant be missed. There are many bridges that you can view the river from. One of the best vantage points to see the river is from the Eiffel Tower. If you go up the Tower you a bonus of viewing all the landmarks plus the Seine River.

Go for a boat ride at sunset . Took my parents here a few years back in the spring took the boat at around 6-7pm to get great pics of the seine at sunset .Will be back to go for a picnic with cheese and wine on the riverbanks soon , saw lots of people doing this
Something not to be missed. The scenery on the river cruise was very good and its something I would recommend to anyone who has a full itinerary in Paris.

A must!. You must go on a cruise on the river seine - you get to see so much in just a Couple of hours and the info you get from the guides is great. We also hired a guide to take us on a cycle rideAround the city backstreets and saw so much we wouldnt have normally seen. It was the best bit of our 3 day stay!

a beautiful oasis in the city. Perfect for strolling along and taking in the sights and sounds of the city. I enjoyed numerous walks along the seine during the day and in the evenings I would sit down at the river's edge with a good book or just people watch. I was amazed at how many local Parisian's hung out at end of day and socialized with their friends, sometimes there would be dance lessons going on or musical instruments being played. There are numerous "river buses" (bateaux-bus) available - reasonably priced that will take you along the seine, with numerous stops along the way, to get off and visit an attraction.

the heart of paris. parisians and tourists alike always walk along the cobble-stoned walkways of the seine - what i dislike is sharing it but it cannot be helped - you see the glamourous side of paris, shown to all from the river .. take time for a three-hour walk down one side and back up the other..
So nice. Love to come back in spring and sitting there to enjoy the life of people by the river. Or we vill come back in early summer when all the trees are opening there flowers and leaves
nice sunset. Come here to catch the sunset and you won't be disappointed. Really relaxing to walk down the river after a tour of the various attractions.
What Romance?. It is hard to feel the romance of walking along the Seine when there is human feces scattered about. Clean up the city and find a place for the homeless.

Seine River. Been to Paris several times. Have not gone inside to all the famous places. We usually have dinner, lunch or drinks with our many friends in the City of Light. I've have passed the Eiffel Tower several times, but not inside. Been to the Notre Adams Cathedral, inside, very large, very impressive cathedral. But, you must see the famous SEINE River. No real current to compare with my hometown, New Orleans, Mississippi River. You must go on the Bateaux mouche, the dinner River cruise of the Seine. Great dinner, wine, scenarios. You will see Paris from the river. Not to see inside of all the sites. You can do that tomorrow. But you get a good idea of Paris while you sail around with great food and wine. Do take the river cruise. You want a real Martini? Go to Harry's New York Bar near the cathedral. Most bartenders in Europe think a Martini means just the Martini & Rossi wine, could be dry or sweet (red). (UGGH!) Try Harry's. All good taxi drivers know where it is located.
Beautiful river with many amazing views. From touring on boat or foot this is the heart of Paris. Many iconic sights are along the river to be enjoyed at your leisure.
Stroll along the Seine. Walk along the Seine gives you a chance to spot the several attractions Paris has to offer. At night the lighting along the bridge and on the other landmarks is worth seeing.

Yes it is that Cool. We love walking up and down the river, it is lined with artists, book sellers and small souvenir shops. As for the shops along the river across the street, you can find anything, including great antiques. The bridges offer great views of many attractions and also great places to sit a have a sandwich and watch the people. At night the romance is palpable and the quaint restraints that run along the river are a fantastic place to stop for a drink and to look at all of the lights.
Walking spaces down by the river continue to improve. Once a dimly lit place of question, the walkways down by the river are now well-paved with interesting attractions and places to sit.

Take a cruise on the river. A cruise on the river with hop on hop off is a nice way to spend the day in Paris and see all the central attractions. We had taken the navigo travel card as we stayed over a week in Paris and with this card we got 25% off cruise tickets.

Lovely way to spend the afternoon... A relaxing way to spend a few hours after a day of walking! Pick up one of the several river cruise operators who operate hourly tours up and down the Seine. Lovely photos plus some great commentary to enjoy about the history of the sights and in particular the bridges. The Eiffel Tower is really impressive from the river. If you are after outside seating, worth arriving at least 15-20 mins before a scheduled departure.

Get a boat tour before you do anything else. My partner and I, despite being previous visitors to Paris, decided to kick off our first trip together there with a boat tour of the Seine. We found it was an excellent idea, as with so many of Paris' most iconic monuments and buildings positioned on or close to the river, we got an excellent overview of the city's attractions and their history before proceeding to visit as many of them as possible.

This is my view. I have rented at apartment at 57 Quai de Grenelle with a wonderful view of the Seine. It does not matter, day or night , the view is wonderful. The river traffic is entertaining and at night the light show is spectacular.

Must go at night. We got the last boat out and it was lovely at night on the top deck and got some stunning pictures, we didn't book but think we got lucky so to avoid disappointment get your ticket in advance. even though it was June it was cold on the top deck so bring a jumper or coat

Too beautiful it looks unreal. I love how the water from the river glints when the sun shines. It's too beautiful for a photograph it looks unreal when you haven't seen it up close. I recommend you take the Seine River boat tour as I wasn't able to due to the lack of time, but they say it definitely is worth your while.

Enjoy it the way you want. You cannot miss the Seine when you are in the center of Paris. Various ways to enjoy it :you can join the multiple runners ( on the left bank ) , go for a walk or choose one of the many boat trips. These very from the simple hop on hop off taxi to the romantic dinners at evening.
River cruise. Well worth doing, lots of good info and very scenic.Good view of Notre Dame, the palace, the bridges, etc.Guide spoke several languages.Liked everything.

Great river and boat tour!. I went to the boat tour with my girlfriend on our first day in Paris and it was so romantic! We also learned a lot from the audio tour! Recommended for everyone, especially on the first day since it gives an overview of the paris highlights!

River full of historic moments. Liked: the ferry going by the river, and the bridges over it, specially the one with thousands of "love locks".
Dislike: the smell of urine when walking by the side walk of the river

Worth a casual stroll. There is nothing impressive about a river, but it felt very relaxing to walk along the river and to go down the steps to the river level. It was a very relaxing contrast to the museums etc.

Seine - the romantic river. Take a slow stroll along the river Seine. Numerous famous landmarks can be seen not to mention the numerous coffee shops which can be visited, it's peaceful and romantic if strolling with a loved one. Take some time to unwind.
Needs cleaning. . The river is not very nice. Kids used to swim in it but not anymore. Walking along the river it had bad smells - mostly urine. This river is in my bottom 10 bodies of water.

Breathe in the romance and atmosphere. If walking along the Seine was the only think we had a chance to go in Paris, I would have been content. Walking along at night, in the rain, surrounded by lights and people I love. Bliss.
Pretty river walk. Great walk by river espicially during christmas. We enjoyed visiting the little christmas shops.its also fun to watch the different boats

Nice way to see the city. We had booked tickets for the Eiffel Tower for a late evening entry so we came in a few hours early and took the 1 hour Siene river cruise which starts right across the Eiffel Tower (we used Vendettes de paris tour). The cruise is a great way to see the city. I would recommend doing this on the first day of your Paris trip. That way, you can get a feel of the attractions on offer in Paris and then decide which ones you wish to see during the next few days.
The open tour bus is better. Went on the night cruise and while the views from the river is quite nice it cannot beat the open tour bus in terms of the places that you see.

Most romantic part of the trip. The most romantic way to experience Paris is completely free! Strolling along the Seine was my husband's and my favorite part of our anniversary trip to this beautiful city. So picturesque, and so many genuine things along the banks!

Dinner on a Boat with music is magic.... Take a trip on a "Bateau Mouche" - River Boat ; by day, you´ll have the advantage of having a clear view of both "riversides", by night - my favourite - chose one that has live music on board: you´ll never forget it !
Wonderful experience.. Wonderful way to travel and see the sights. You can hop on and off where you want, stop for a beer or a light snack, and away we go again. A must.
Fast running and attractive at night. The Louvre is a living part of Paris with lots of traffic day and night. The lights reflecting in the evening are gorgeous, and well worth the walk.

The jugular vein of Paris. The river Seine dots the topography of the epic historical city of Paris. The unmistakable river with its ever-flowing calm water is the epitome of the culture. Sitting on the banks of the river is an amazing experience. The boat rides that are offered and the Hop on hop off tours are great at helping one enjoy the city and explore it to the fullest.
romantic. try to walk around river at the evening..very romantic..try to found table and have dinner on the ship restaurant.if you are in Paris..dont miss this..
Beautiful walk. The Seine is a huge river with nice walkways and bridges and beautiful camera opportunities! Always something new to see. Very quiet before 8am except for a few joggers!

This covers it all.... While in Paris on a pilgrimage we decided to take a ride down the River Seine. You can sit inside with headsets or you can sit up on the top and take in the beauty of it all. We had toured with a guide and saw all of the sites with him, but seeing them from the river tour was even more exciting. While visiting Paris, I highly recommend this as an added bonus to your trip.

A walk next the Seine in Paris.. The Siene is a large river. Many many bridges to cross over. All different. Pont Neuf doesnt mean Nine but new. And it is still prety old. Dozens of little shops selling books records etc etc.unbelievably cheaply. (If you saw Midnight in Paris you will recognise them) If you didnt see it - get a copy - it has beautiful scenery of Paris. and its an excellent movie.

Great place to take pictures. We took 2 different boat tours down the Seine. You get to pass by so many attractions and it is a great way to get some fantastic photos. The price per person is very reasonable for a boat ride. That's why we went twice.

Boat ride worth experiencing. World knows Paris as a romantic city. I guess one of the main reasons for this fame is the splendid Seine flowing across the city. The boat ride on the river in the evening is like a dream. It's an experience in itself to view and feel the Parisians enjoying along the banks of the river. You can get some great photographs of the city and its bridges from the cruise. Do remember to carry your wide angle lens to get the best of the shots.
The best place in Paris. To feel like a Parisian, you must act like one, and pass all day along the Seine is a pre-requisite.

Cruise down Seine. We had dinner the the Eiffel Tower Restaurant then cruise down the Seine which was excellent to see the sights in the evening. It was a clear beautiful night. The walk from Eiffel Tower to boat wasnt far which was really good too.

Take a Viking River Cruise on the Seine!. My husband and I had the good fortune to take a Viking River Cruise on the River Seine. It was so beautiful and what a relaxing way to see it. You can't go wrong with Viking River Cruises!

Good fun ... Try to get around twice.. We caught a batobus hop on hop off tour... It is a 24 hour pass, so we used it to do a lap (about 90 minutes) while waiting for our Eiffel Tower slot. We admired from the river all the attractions we had seen previously but from a different perspective. After watching sunset from the Eiffel Tower, we boarded again (just across the road) and saw the sights by night. There is no commentary, it is a ' budget' kind of cruise (16€), but we felt we got our money's worth by going around twice. The second time we disembarked at the second last stop- Champs Elysses and walked to the metro from there.

very nice. its beautiful, very nice walk by the river and we also did the seine cruise!! its a must do! we did the cruise at night and it was so nice and peaceful with beautiful lights everywhere and so much history. Kids would love it too

A Great Place for a Stroll, But Beware of Scammers. Yes, it's everything people say it is, it is infested with scam artists. The 2 currently popular groups are the dropped ring people and the fake petition girls. We've had ample exposure to them in the last 4 months.Let's start with #1. You are strolling along when you hear a clink of metal on pavement immediately followed by a person asking you if this "is your ring". Of course, you say no. He/she then explains that he/she just found the "gold" (actually brass) ring, that it is obviously very valuable, and that he will sell it to you for a fraction of its value because he/she really needs the money. Best approach - ignore him/her. Most gratifying approach - tell him/her in French that you may not be a moron, but he/she certainly is.On to #2. You are crossing the bridge (or in the Tuilleries, or in front of the Louvre, or walking along the Seine) and a couple of well dressed, earnest young women who look like college students approach and in impeccable English (slight upper class British accent) ask if you speak English. A positive answer initiates a request to sign a petition. While investigating the petition, their accomplices either rummage through your purse for your wallet or pick your pocket. The best answer to the question is "no" in a language other than English (Nein - German, non - French, anyo - Korean, ohi - Greek or ack - Inuktitut: all work quite well). The best answer I have seen in 4 months here was delivered by a cop on the Quai d'Orsay. He saw a group of these people on the opposite side of a generous sized mud puddle. He sped up to the puddle on his mountain bike, hit the rear brake hard, and skidded sideways into the puddle, soaking the lot of them in muddy water. It was brilliant!Forewarned is forearmed.
A beautiful walk. I loved walking along the seine. It is a peaceful area within the bustling city. I loved seeing the house boats and watching the bateaux-mouches.

Quick view of Paris' historical monuments. A cruise on this river is a must when you are in Paris, especially your first time. The earlier in your trip you take this cruise, the better it is. I say this because, this cruise will give enough history and perspective of the most popular monuments in Paris to enable you to decide which ones to visit as per your interest.The river in itself is quite scenic and its wonderful to cross the beautiful bridges on this river, almost every bridge has a story behind it.Make sure sure you take a corner seat on the upper deck if you want to take a lot of pictures.

Paris from the Water. Take the time to take a bateaux ride along the Seine. It'll give you another perspective of this beautiful city, one you won't soon forget. The bateaux cruise from the Eiffel Tower to the Ile de la Cite and Notre Dame Cathedral. If you're lucky enough to have a sunny day, the beauty of the bridges, and all the iconic monuments will take your breath away.

Dinner Cruise. We did a dinner cruise at night along the Seine. It was beautiful and very romantic having the city lit up next to you as your traveling down the river. It is a bit pricey as it was nearly 160 euros per person but this is an upgraded seat with a few extra menu items. Next time I would probably go with a less expensive seat as the window was a nice to have but with the boat being so empty, I'm not sure it was worth the extra money. Definitely was a nice addition to the trip and I would repeat it if I had the chance.

Nice Place to Stroll. The upside is that there is always something interesting to see as one strolls along the river banks. Whether it's sight-seeing boats or working barges providing the attraction, it is never boring. In addition, the river runs alongside some of Paris' most famous attractions, from Notre Dame, the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, Musee Orangerie, to the Eiffel Tower. And the bridges provide additional sightseeing attractions; my favorite is Pont Alexandre III with it's gold-topped columns; it connect les Invalides with Champs D'Elysees.

A Great Journey, physically as well as historical and sight-seeing One. One must take a FULL Cruise, starting from the highest point, down to the lowest point, with a drop of some 27 meters ( say 90 feet ) along the River Siene. This cruise lasts some THREE Hours, to take one down the memory lane, of the historic development of this great Ancient, though Modern City of Paris, which surprisingly has a height difference of some 90 ( Ninety ) feet, from the highest level to the lowest one.The Tour Operator, had great knowledge of the City,s History, the chronology of the development, the Engineering as well as the Social aspects of the development.It is great & thrilling to know and experience of some NINE Gates, along the entire journey in the cruise along the River Siene, as to technology, of its conceivement, in those historic times, the very high-end engineering of the operation of the Gates, how the ship is made to drop the levels at the various gates, as to how disciplined the Residents are to accommodate partial closing of thoroughfare, of human and vehicular traffic at intersection of the drop gates, etc. etc.It was a great and thrilling experience, filled with nostalgia of the past as could be seen, experienced and known from the highly and well informed guide-cum-operator of this Full Journey.
A river. Quite dirty but it's nice if you're into watching (or traveling by) boats. Cleaner than the Thames :)
