Great Experience. Went on the Bateaux-Mouche.An amazing experience.See lots of Paris in 1hr 15min.Well worth the 13.50 Euro.Would do it again.Very little wait time since the boat leaves often.

Beautiful river. If you have been run off your feet seeing everything in Paris I recommend taking a morning off and wandering down to the Seine. It is impossible to avoid seeing the river on your way to the various attractions of Paris, tours and river cruises, but it also happens to be a great place to chill.We strolled down from Montmartre, buying a picnic of bread, cheeses and ham on the way and sat on the stone path between the river and the walls for lunch. We had a great view of the bridges and the eiffel tour from where we were sitting, and it was a great spot to people watch too (lots of couples and Parisians)

Good way to explore Paris. Along the river Seine from the Gare D’Austerlitz on the Quai Saint Bernard is a stop for the Batobus one of a number of companies running tour boats on the river. The boat stop is in walking distance from the railway station and is one of 8 stops. Once aboard the boat you can hop on and hop off as you travel as far as the Eiffel Tower and back. So you can visit a multitude of sites such as Notre-Dame then travel onto the next site. At the same time you get a good view of the city that lines the river. You are also not affected by the traffic jams that can be encountered. There are also companies who do a river tour and include a meal – either lunch or dinner. The Seine is also the place for moored restaurants and don’t forget to see the 2 bridges - the Pont des Arts and the Pont de L’Archevêché which have millions of padlocks (love locks) placed by couples. The Seine is also a working river and you may encounter some rather long barges where one pushes another, quite a sight. But each journey reveals new things.

Walk Along The Seine. A walk along the Seine is one of those things that any couple in love must do while in Paris. Get an ice cream cone (or Gelato) and take a romantic stroll along the Seine. Enjoy people-watching, enjoy each other's company, enjoy life. There is no place on earth that is more romantic than Paris and a walk along the Seine is the pinnacle of what Paris has to offer. Enjoy the sun setting over Notre Dame and enjoy the beauty of the architecture and life that is swirling all around you. For another view of the city, a river cruise or even river dinner cruise along the Seine cannot be over-rated. Both are must-dos for a first-timer in Paris. Yes, they are touristy but they are the good type of tourist trap and they will give you a truly unique view of the city.Take your time, relax and remember that you are on holiday while you enjoy this landmark.
Boat cruise well worth it. Great overview of the major edifices along the river. Little brisk in the winter. A dinner cruise April-October evenings would be quite romantic.
Good little cruise. We did the hop on hop off buses with the cruise included, was a nice trip, saw things from the boat you wouldn't see from the road. Homeless must be above average!!

Take the River Tour. The river tour is worth the money. You can buy it also as part of the hop on hop off bus tour. It gives you a different vantage point of Paris as well as more historical information about the various buildings and streets surrounding the river

Ask questions first... I took a 2 1/2 hour cruise down the Seine...about 1/2 was actual tour, the rest was spent going through 8 gates on some passage...got rather boring, nothing to see, just sit. Make sure your tour DOES NOT include going through these gates...wasn't worth the price and waste of tourist time. Sorry, but being honest.

La Seine, Paris. Lovely stroll. You can go over so many bridges, see the Pont de L'archeveché reknowned for its locks that couples put there and throw away the key in the Seine. Lots of little streets to walk along closeby.

"By the lovely river Seine". If you're new to Paris, the Seine will help you identify north and south Paris. But you've really got to walk the river -- take in the bridges and other beautiful sites -- to come to know this magical city!
Beautiful ride. Winter time is easy to get tickets but be careful when it rains, it will be difficult to go up on the deck to really enjoy the view.
Wonderful, romantic, perfect. This was brilliant, went with my husband and as the darkness fell it he whole of Paris lit up and it was marvellous. Loved every minute.

Bateaux 1 Hour River Cruise. Visited Paris in November and purchased the Paris Pass for 2 days, included in this was a 1 hour river cruise. The boat was lovely and clean and very spacious most people want to sit up on the roof of the boat so it was nice and quiet inside. They played a bit of music which was nice if you weren't interested in listening to the information, however if you do want to listen to the information the music was a bit irritating and it was a struggle to concentrate on what was being said.The boat goes past all the main monuments and the information given was very informative and not at all rambly! Time went so fast and we really enjoyed ourselves I would definitely do this tour again.
Nice. The whole waterfront has been cleaned up in recent years and is very picturesque. The water tours seem a bit pricy especially in the wintertime.

Atmospheric at night. A river walk and bus tour are a great way to see Paris and it takes on a lovely lively atmosphere at night.We felt very safe indeed and discovered lots of places we would have missed if we had just stuck to the 'recommended' sights

Cruise Was Nice!. Upon visiting Paris we took a river cruise along the Seine. It was a beautiful day and was a great way to see the city in a relaxing environment. There was no feeling of rushing around to see things whilst on the boat, we could enjoy the surroundings and take in some breath-taking architecture. There were some people, who, every time we went under bridges, cheered but this was soon halted by the guides who asked them to stop and recreated that peaceful atmosphere on the cruise.
Take a walk along the River Seine!. If you're in Paris, you have to take a walk along the River Seine. Take your time and enjoy the views, the Pont Alexandre, and the carved trees (sweet).
beautiful. The river Seine is the centre of Paris and it wouldn't be Paris without it. Great impressive constructions line its banks and is quite magical to behold.

Iconic Seine River. You need to walk along the Seine, you really feel like you are in Paris!! They have boat trips during the day and night. We were fortunate enough to cruise the Seine from Paris to Normandy and the ship was docked near the Eiffel Tower, so the views were spectacular! If you don't want to do the boat tours, you can get tour guides who live on barges to take you through the city via the Seine. Very enjoyable! Lovely way to see Paris!
Night Cruise is Excellent. Take one of the night cruises, the lights are fabulous and the experience is completely different than the daytime views. We enjoyed a champagne cruise.

Value for money. This is an excellent way to see Paris with a commentary in various languages. The sail takes about an hour where you see the look Paris and a good method to get some great photographs

We always do this boat trip during the day time. Always take this boat trip during the day time and know the excellent commentary by heart!!Good to see the beautiful bridges adorned with angels and the sights of Paris.
Boat ride is overrated. Instead of the boat ride get a small snack and something to drink and relax on the banks of the beautiful river.Its way better than the crowded boat ride!!

A must do night Cruise. They have various cruises running during the day and night time. I would highly recommend doing the night time tour where you get to experience the beautiful city at night. It's just so relaxing and a beautiful experience, especially when you have been walking around the city during daytime.

One of the best. Walking along the Seine is really enjoyable (just not after dark). There are stairs to the quay and paths to follow. Some boats are available for a dinner cruise, but they are quite pricey. Some areas have booths set up for selling art and miscellaneous.
Boat trip. Took a night boat trip.It was raining so stayed inside. Thus able to hear the excellent commentary.Good mixture with some history.
beautiful river. Rented bicycles and had a great time riding next to the River Seine. There are great walking trails and bike trails. Had fun looking at all of the house boats along the river.
best walk. There is nothing quite like walking in Paris along the Seine with its many beautiful bridges from which to explore different neighbourhoods and to take in views of city.

Drift off into the past, and see it from the present. I was just enamoured by the Seine. There is something magical about crossing the bridges, and leaning over looking at the water drift by. The Quay walks are something in themselves, and the artists along the walks are worth checking out. It costs nothing, and yet when one considers that this river has been flowing by for centuries, it is worth the experience of simply being part of this ongoing flow of history
Great Trip!!. Saw Many wonderful Historic Sites, and one of our passengers fell in the river, but was saved by boat coming in other direction....all good!!
1 hour river cruise. Take the cruise early evening/dusk from near the Eifel Tower. Nice to see Paris lite up. Expected to quenue, but the cruiser is very big.

Cruise the river at night. a river cruise at night is the best way to experience the Seine. The City of Lights becomes just that. Best option is a dinner cruise particularly on one of the smaller boats. A delight.

Great River Cruise. Did the river cruise which is worth the money. Great experience to view Paris at night. The lights of the Eiffel tower was worth the money itself . Food was average as it is on a boat.

Cruise the seine. Float down the seine on a Saturday night and see hundreds of young people set up for a social evening along the banks.Sharing wine and picnics , playing music and generally hanging out on a summers evening it is a real treat

Boat tour is a must. A great way to see the city from another angle is to cruise the River Seine. You'll see all kinds of sights. From gardens on some of the docked boats in the area, the Eiffel Tower from below ground level, the "locks of love" bridge, etc. Nice, relaxing trip...one you won't want to miss.

Sunday stroll. Walking along the seine on a Sunday morning is a brilliant Parisian experience. Everyone is out promenading, there are extended families, joggers,lovers, photographers and tourists all out enjoying the views and being able to walk along the roads that have been closed. Definitely a must if you are in Paris on a Sunday.
Visit to Europe. During our visit to Paris, we have experienced the river cruise on the river Seine - from cruise the beauty of the city is excellent.

Love it. What a beautiful river parting the banks. River cruises run often and you can catch the Baltobus at many of Paris tourists attractions. It cost about 15 Euro for 24 hours and a great way to get around, I prefer to walk along the paths along the river Seine from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Damn to admire the views and observe the culture of this incredible city. Takes. Out 2 hours but a beautiful walk.
River lifeline of Paris. Great way to see Paris is by taking a cruise on the River Seine. The river is clean and has lovely embankments.Many bridges which are brilliant pass over head.
Iconic. A trip to Paris is not complete without a stroll along the Seine. Beware of the gyspies looking for tourists to prey on. A river cruise will give you a greater perspective.

Wonderful view. We walked along the Seine, from the Alma Marceau tube station up to the Tulleries. It was wonderful. Lovely to see boat houses for the ones who live actually in the river. Even in winter, the view is fabulous, among the nude trees and lots of other tourists. Put on comfortable shoes, and enjoy the ride. You won't forget it.

Bus tour along the river. I took the L'Open Bus Tour along the green line which toured along the Seine. The tour crossed many of the bridges and I was told of the history of the buildings and bridges along the river during the tour,

It's a river.. Nice river. There is paved bank you can walk along as well as along the street that runs with the river. Many attractions, Notre Dame, Mucee du Louvre, Effiel Tower, etc. It nice at night contrast of dark river with lighted attractions.

Boat trips. We went on a boat trip, not on the palatial Bateaux-Mouches but on the Bateaux du Pont Neuf - from the landing stage on the downstream tip of the Ile de la Cité, just close to the Pont Neuf - actually the oldest bridge on the Seine in Paris. It's a romantic location - green and leafy in summer and was the setting for the bitter-sweet film 'Les enfants du Pont Neuf. I reckon we saw more of the river than would have been the case from the more oppulent big river craft. It was a great trip.

Great adventure for the price. Very relaxing, guided tour. Perfect weather! Would do this again in a heartbeat. Remember to bring a lock for the bridge. We wish we could have found a lock vendor close by. We would have liked to leave our mark on the bridge. History meets present day. Loved it!
Evening cruise. Great for a nice romantic cruise down the river in the evening, bring a light jacket or sweater Incase it gets chilly

Photo opportunity. . Take a cruise to take photos of landmarks from a different angle but sit in the open spaces as inside can be limited. See the locals enjoying leisure time along the banks. Or be like the locals and take some cheese, a baguette and a bottle of wine sit on the shore and enjoy the passing river traffic.
nice walks along the banks of the river. In addition to the traditional "bateau mouche" rides, walking along both sides of the banks of the river is worth it, day or night.

Birthday surprise. Went on boat trip down on the river seine the views are stunning the buildings are beautiful and the Eiffel tower looks stunning food and drink available on board the weather was perfect to do a lots of sight seeing.

Great both at day and night. Lovely - we took a bat cruise and it was so relaxing. A really great river, and so beautiful at night.
Loved seeing the padlocks :)
Brings tears to our eyes every time.. Sixteen Parisian visits and counting. We love the Seine scene so much some day we hope to live in Paris.

Magical. This would have to be a visitor's dream come true. I love walking the Seine and looking at the book stalls and such which dot the tourist track, some are quite quirky!
A must do when you visit Paris.

Rive gauche. Take time to stroll along Rive gauche when in Paris. Soak in the atmosphere around you. All the book sellers have their stalls there.
Wish I could speak french.
Cross a bridge or two or three. So many photo opportunities.
Paris is great in winter. Grey skies are so romantic.
Love France!

A boat tour is a must do. We tool a cruise of the seine from Crossy sur seine up beyond Le Pec and back again. It was a fantastic trip! A boat trip on the seine either within Paris or outside Paris is a must do for any tourist.

Decent River Cruise. We decided to take a river cruise with the Vedettes du Pont Neuf company. The tour guide was very informative and spoke clear French and English via the boat tannoy system. The cruise was an hour and about the perfect length of time.

Great way to see Paris. I had never been to Paris before and wanted to see everything and do everything, but this is impossible on a short break.I didnt know what to expect when we boarded the Ms Botticelli, we where very pleasently surprised, The staff where excellent all the way through the trip, The food was excellent and they had a very good wine list. The entertainment was good and very French but thats what you go to France for.The ship was very clean and warm. The beds very comfortable The organized trips on the coaches from the ship where very good and seeing Paris from the Seine at night was great,I would go back tomorrow if i could.Well done to the crew of Ms Botticelli.I

The real heart of Paris. You *must* spend a little time on the Seine when you're in Paris. A friend and I strolled along the river one afternoon, and the view of half a dozen bridges aligned on the river literally takes your breath away. We also admired the "Love Locks" on a bridge near Notre Dame.A few days later, I was walking along the river at dusk. I was pleased to see so many joggers, people walking their dogs, and lovers enjoying the riverside. The poplars(I think??) were so beautiful with their golden leaves. It seemed that every houseboat, and even some tugboats, had boxes of geraniums along their portholes.Sunset along the river was stunning!I took a ride on one of the bateaux, the tour company that's based at the very foot of he Eiffel Tower. It was so pretty as darkness fell on the river! Another time, however, I'd like to take the boat ride in daytime, for a different perspective.

River Seine Cruise. We took a magnificent River seine Cruise with Avalon Waterways in October, 2014. We were celebrating our 39th wedding anniversary and it could not have been more special. We left from Paris and headed north to the beaches of Normandy, stopping in many quaint cities and towns along the way - passing through many locks (which was fascinating to watch!) The highlight for me was standing on the bridge in Monet's garden…my #1 bucket list item is now checked off! We spent 3 more days in Paris at the end of the cruise. I highly recommend this.

Amawaterways AmaLegro - Seine Riverboat cruise. This was my 1st river cruise and it surpassed my expectations! We arrived very early and crew were there to help us with luggage and greet us. We then spent several hours wondering around Paris while our room was being prepared. From that evening on, it was 5 star treatment by the staff and much to our surprise, there were tons of guests within our age group and several sets of sisters in addition to us. The rooms were comfortable and spotless! The food was excellent and we enjoyed seeing the staff in town at every port buying local breads, fish and veggies for that evening. I was also impressed by the wine. This was the 1st all inclusive we didn't have to pay extra to get decent wine. It met or exceeded our standards 95% of the time and they were anything but stingy with serving it :) I cannot say enough about the crew. John, the cruise director was hilarious and everyone made fast friends with him. Lazlo, the maître d’, was very quick witted and met or surpassed the level of service I require of my special events. And you just fell in love with the wait staff...Elena, Alex and Johnny were great fun! And the Captain was very charming to say the least...You were given plenty of time to see the sights on land and it was very enjoyable cruising the river. The only thing that might be considered is offering more updated entertainment in the evenings. With river boat cruising becoming more popular among younger clientele, this is necessary. And I think the older guests would enjoy it as well. Thanks to the Ama family and all the great friends we made on the trip!

Wonderful Tour of the City. We ended up our tour of Paris with a river cruise on the River Seine. I highly recommend it. What a wonderful way to get a feel for the city. We saw the lock bridges, Notre Dame and the Eifle Tower to name a few. Thoroughly enjoyed it.
Walk alongside. There is something fairly romantic walking along the River Seine even on your own. You can see many of the sites and get a good feeling for the city.

Fantastic view of the city. I took this trip it was about half an hour if I remember it correctly. It was January so it was a bit cold but anyhow it was something really worth it. You can the city from a very unique perspective which cannot be seen walking or in any other way. After this trip you will really fall in love with the city.

Two things to do by the Seine. Don't waste your money taking the boat trip. Instead, if it's a sunny day, get yourself some picnic items either from one of the many markets (eg Eglise st Gervais on Wed or Sat) or the market near the Bastille on a Sunday, and then eat your lunch by the river. In the evening, after dark, enjoy the lights by the Seine. It is wonderful strolling territory, and always plenty of Parisian life around the river at night. A camera is a must.
Not to miss. Not to miss a different view of the city and something that is not very expensive (which is rare for paris!), very easy going with friendly staff

Take a cruise. If you are lucky enough to be there on a balmy moonlit evening then take a cruise as we did. The commentary was excellent as were the views of the buildings along the banks and of course the Eiffel Tower lit up.

Maybe Paris' Best Feature?. Walking along this jewel, day or night, is one of the most rewarding (and free!) experiences you'll have during your stay in Paris. Many of the city's attractions, Musée de Louvre and Notre Dame Cathedral for example, are dotted along its winding banks, along with endless cafés and restaurants. There's river boats available if you're looking to cruise the Seine, but they're quite expensive. I'd strongly recommend grabbing some lunch from a nearby café and relaxing on the river's edge.

A true life experience.. We visited Paris in October and stayed in an apartment across the road from the Pont Neuf. Every morning when leaving the apartment we were confronted by the Seine. How beautiful!Very close to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Eiffle Tower and Musee D'Orsay......fantastic.There were also little stalls along the river, selling various bits and pieces which were very interesting. They sold padlocks that you put your name on and locked onto the sides of the bridges, which we did.They are also cruise boats, which are pretty good, take you down the river and show all the important site, different perspective from the water.Wonderful experience.

Dirty River. The river didnt look too inviting, but all the pretty Parisian bridges mean you have the luxury of not getting your feet wet to cross it... handy. The riverside bars charge a nice premium to look out over the traffic lined dirty river. Not exactly romantic but hey.

The beauty of the Seine. I live right up the road from Portland OR - so I am accustomed to cities on the water. BUTnothing prepared me for the beauty of this River at night! Simple breathtaking - I don't know how else to put it.
A Sunday stroll. Try to visit on a Sunday when they close the road to traffic. Walk along in the sunshine and maybe stop to take in the view. Take a drink or cake!
Rive cruise. A relaxing way to see the city and major sights from water-level on a sightseeing boat. But do take time just to walk beside the Seine - it is enchanting.

River. you can have a cruise ride for river seine; either book the ticket on spot or from airport itself, combing with your hop on-off bus tour @ 36 euro. I like the nice view from the launch and there is no dislike

It is the center of the city and everything is around it. Nice place to walk too.. The River Seine is not really an attraction, but the location of the much of the most important sights of Paris. From Notre Dame, to the Louvre to the Eiffel Tower, so many sights are along the river. Seeing the city from a boat tour is a great experience; we used Bateaux Parisiens (reviewed separately). Another nice site are the locals relaxing along the river reading, napping or enjoying the company of friends.

Take a river cruise!. We took a 10 euro river cruise and it was so worth it. You get to see all the sights and we did it at night which made it that much more beautiful. Seeing the lights blink on the Eiffel Tower from the river was awesome.
Nice way to see paris.. If you want to see paris this is one of the best way to see paris.Best view cathedral. Good information on board. Well equipped arrangements. Really happy.
Worth it in good weather. We took the trip in the Winter but still warmish. It does give a different perspective of the City. Not really worth it in the winter if you are also doing a bus top tour.
Don't miss a cruise into Seine. It's so romantic to have a cruise into Seine River. Prefer open ships, late afternoon time, so you will get the change to see Paris day and night.

Superb views over the monument. we took a classical 1-hour cruise on those large glass boats. the cruise itself is nice as you get to see most of the monuments but the boats are not the most comfortable as they are set with plastic chairs.

Evening cruise on the Seine. What a great thing to do. Go at dusk then you get to see Paris in the light initially. Then the spectacular sights with all the twinkly lights shinning. The Eiffel at night is very special.

Batobus trip. Brilliant way to view the Seine and most attractions . Tour guide gave a great talk in many languages and consideration was given for me to get on to the boat first as I walk with a stick

Seine Cruise. We have recently completed a 7 day river cruise with APT/Amawaterways. Our third with APT and as well orgianised and professional as ever. A relaxing and informative trip that was at a pace we enjoyed with quality local guides on every shore excursion.
Essential. A river cruise is essential to getting some of the better views/highlights of Paris. Viewed from the river some take on a completely different perspective. Try it.

One of the most romantic places I've seen. River Seine indeed deserves the attention and admiration it gets from all visitors and Parisians.
Sunset by the river and seeing people relax and cosy up with Eiffel in the background makes for perfect setting for a romantic date.

Take a cruise out of Paris. I have done dinner cruises before and thought they were good but this time we cruised from Paris to Normandy and back. The Seine is absolutely a gorgeous river with incredible scenery. Get out of Paris if you want to see this river at her best.

Great both at day or night. If your here with a lover go for a boat trip on the Seine at night, perhaps with one of the luxury lines. Its such a romantic thing to do and is one of the best travel memories of my life. Of cause you should also take one of the turist boats by day as so many beautiful buildings in Paris are located at the seine.
Romantique!!. A leisurely stroll after a hectic day of sight seeing is the best recipe to end a tiring day in Paris.
A little cruise. We took a night cruise of the seine...it really shows why Paris is called the city of lights. Seeing the Eiffel tower light up at 8pm onl;y added to the ambiance.,
Nice cruise down the Seine. Always have liked the water and to see Paris from the Seine is a great addition to seeing it on foot

The only way to see it, is by boat.. The River Seine is just a river, but taking a boat ride does open up a great view of the building along the river. If you are walking along the river, you miss a lot that you see from the boat. One of those things that can't be missed, if you can afford it.

Best Vacation Ever. We went with high expectations and they were immediately exceeded. Can't say enough about the quality of service and the courtesy shown by the crew. Food was amazing!!
Five starts is not enough for these folks. We'll be on another of their cruises in the near future - hopefully!!

niceeee. i would defo recomend this , wait until late afternoon just as it starts to go dark because you will not take better photos of yhe eiffel tower than when you are on this little cruise up and down the river,you get to see the various bridges that you would only walk or drive over and never even notice otherwise, defo to do.

Best experience in Paris: jogging around La Seine. I love jogging. So it was my dream to jog on the banks of La Seine. During my 7-day stay in Paris, I jogged four times around the river. The river is so beautiful in the early morning, when the sun is about to rise, the banks and river and the streets are all so quiet. The pretty bridges on the river have nobody around, you get to have them all to yourselves, with the old palaces, churches, towering buildings all around you. It's such a fulfilling experience. While nothing can beat the museums and Eiffel Tower, I'll say that nothing beats jogging along La Seine either.

Hop-on hop-off. Great way to spend a day visiting different sights without walking for hours or been stressed that you don't find car parking... Easy to get off these boats taxi services are excellent on the beautiful seine.

It's just a river but it's great!. The hustle and bustle of the area surrounding the river is fantastic. Markets, dancers, musicians, painters etc. just a lovely feel to it. Although at the end of the day it's just a river. I was amazed at the bridge that is covered by the lovers padlocks. (Sorry don't know what it's called!)Will definitely be returning to take a boat trip on the river.

Bucket List Trip. Bought a two day Paris pass and it included a cruise on the Seine, really enjoyed it as we got to see things we wouldn't have managed in our time allowance. If we had been aware of which pier we were going from it would have helped, because we missed the time we wanted to go because we went to the wrong pier and even though there was five minutes to go they wouldn't let us on, it departed that bit earlier. We had to wait for the next one which put our schedual out for our other attractions.

A beautiful river.. I loved everything about the River Seine. We walked along the River Seine many times and also took a boat ride. The boat ride was amazing as went cruised past the sights of Paris. The River Seine is the essence of Paris.
Seine River. Had a wonderful cruise this is one not to miss.Loved all the bridges and seeing the smaller version of the Statue of Liberty

A Cruise is a good way to relax for an hour or so. We took a river cruise in mid afternoon - after a heavy day of walking on the many street of Paris. Just sit back, watch Paris slide by. Observer the park, see dances practicing the Tango on the side of the river
Lovely and convienent. We enjoyed our Hop on Hop Off boat ride, made getting around easy and enjoyable, very reasonable price

You haven't been to Paris unless you spend at least 2 hours here :). The river, the bridges , the buildings by the side and the view of Eiffel tower all the time. We couldn't ask for more during our visit to Paris this November. Add some really good weather and we hit the jackpot! We walked from the Notre Dame to the Louvre walking alongside the river all the time. Beautiful.. beautiful place! Feel the romance in Paris by strolling by the banks of the river. There a lots of small restaurants and cafes right by the bank ( steps will lead you from the road to the bank of the river. Walk here to avoid all the crowd and noise from the road) We also took the 1 hour cruise ( vedettesdupontneuf.com) which was really good. I think it costs around 14 euros if you go and buy at the counter by only 10 euros per person online for the evening cruises ( cruises before 1:30 pm cost 9 euros when purchased online)Walk along the banks in the night time and see the illuminated side of Paris. Not to be missed!!! :)

Take a ride on a tour boat!. I had bought the Paris Pass, which is a great deal, and as part of the package I had a ride on the Seine with Bateaux Mouches. I could go anytime day or night, and chose to go when all of Paris was lit up! And this was a great choice! This company has a recorded history of what you are seeing in various languages, English being one of them. Sure, they pack 'em in, but it's a great way to weave some of the city's major sites together with the thread of the Seine!

Paris without Seine would not be Paris. You cannot go to Paris without a stroll along the Seine.You see plenty of the nice buildings and monuments.You have the romantic bridges and bookstands and whenever you're hungry, look at the onther side and you'll find a nice bistrot.

A magical trip!. We took the cruise because it was included in the Paris Pass. We had done it on a previous trip during the day and weren't particularly impressed. Tried to board at the Montebello Quay by Notre Dame and found out we had to go to the Eiffel Tower. It took a bit of walking to find the right company and when we did the next trip was full and there wasn't another one for an hour. They don't operate at 1pm or 7:30 pm. Otherwise they run every half hour 10 am to 10 pm April - September. We didn't know it, but we actually lucked out because as we boarded it started to get dark and all the lights went on in all the buildings. The Eiffel tower started blinking and the whole trip seemed magical! A totally different experience from the day trip. We had dinner at one of the restaurants as you come off. The food was great! A wonderful ending to our day.

A beautiful river in open surroundings. Loved the views, the river trip boats, the drinks and snacks availability.Beware approaches by women asking for your signature to a petition, that becomes a request for donation.

Cruise and View. Took the opportunity to take a ferry from the Eiffel Tower to the Notre Dame Cathedral along the sine, great relaxing way to spend a morning, can grab a pastry and coffee on board, nice way to spend some time in Paris

fun walk and surprises along the way. River water is never really blue but, nonetheless, it is lovely.Being in Paris and looking down at the water and all the wonderful houseboats is really special.If you listen carefully ,you might hear the sax player under the Pont Neuf.Walk along the river or take a river taxi(which lets you off at several attractions).It is imperative that you try the "batobus" if you have tired feet.It can be very relaxing and not very expensive.There really isn't anything bad to say about any part of Paris.It is by far my favorite city and the Seine is one reason why.also be sure to stroll when the sidewalk shops are open and artists are working.

Bateau Mouche. A relaxing and informative ride up the river on the bateau mouche. It was like any river cruise in the city. It was cold though so take something to keep you warm, also small children may get a bit restless if you are travelling with a child. Facilities on the boat weren't great, there was no coat hook on the door and the floor was wet.

Take the boat at night!. I suggest you pay a boat ride on the Seine at night, it's an incredible experience. We visit the Eiffel Tower and did the boat trip after, at sun down. Gorgeous! I wish we had got tickets for the boat lines near the tower. Get map before buying online.

Batobus.. We used the batobus to get up and down the river. 8 stops for 18euros over 2 days, hop on hop off. Starts at 10am till 7pm in the winter months. Our hotel was near the river so it was easier for us to use the batobus than a sight seeing bus. No real timetable except for the first one of the morning but we worked out they were about every half hour.
Different View. A river cruise is a brilliant way to see some of the architecture from a different angle, and is a particularly good way to view the Notre Dame.

Boat trip. A huge boat used for the hour river trip. It was lovely especially as it was beautiful weather, too many iPads being used as cameras so the view was spoilt. Need to restrict this a little. People were so rude and never sat down. Well priced boat trip and worth doing it.

Walking the quays of Seine.... It has become a tradition for us: every visit to Paris we start with a long walk along River Seine. This is the most enjoyable way to explore Paris for us: we always find something unexpected. We usually start at Jardin de Plants and walk the quays of Seine up to the Effel Tower; it is a long walk but nothing could be compared with it. It the best way to enjoy total harmony and elegance of the City of Lights passing Ile de La Cite with magnificent Notre Dame, lovely Jardin de Tuileries, the Louvre, all the beautiful bridges, the Invalides, and finishing the walk at the Eiffel Tower. It so much fun to watch Parisiens, street artists, tourist crowds. I love it in the rain and on a sunny day - always delightful. We also took a boat trip once to see the bridges at night and it was spectacular. I hope to be back in Paris in 2015 (we try to go there every two-three years) and enjoy my favorite stroll again.

Beautiful and romantic river!. I love the bridges across the River Seine. Each bridge has wonderful views of the river and the city, and I really like the colourful love locks that cover some of the bridges. The river looks a lot blue-er than the river Thames back home!

Very beautiful both day and night!. Walked along it during the day and took a dinner cruise at night! Very beautiful at night with all the monuments lit up! Can be very congested at times around some of the popular parts of it!
Try to do it in Summer. The River Seine is beautiful and the boat tours are great, but next time I think I'll do in in Summer

Wonderful ride, book online and no need to queue. I was very pleased with the ride over the Seine. I booked online with Bateaux Parisienes, just print the ticket and go straight in. Sometimes these kind of boats are old and dated, not this one. It's very new, you can seat outside with a background Parisian music or inside where there are phone guides available (included in the ticket). We did this the moment we arrived to Paris, very nice way to kick start our trip.
Beautiful. One of the many romantic locations in the city of romance! A working river that affords many picture opts!

Great for a stroll or a river trip. We often walked along the Seine while moving between attractions in Paris. Both during the day and a night it is quite romantic to stroll along watching life moving up and down the river.The plethora of bridges make it very simple to include any length of stroll at any time so you can choose how long/far you walk.We also took one of the many cruises along the river at dusk. The city is very pretty from the river (although you won't see much of it) and apart from the cold (November - we shudder to think about the middle of winter) it was an enjoyable but not ecstatic experience.Certainly worth including in any visit to this city

Gorgeous. All parts of the Seine that we saw during our trip were gorgeous. The water was a beautiful blue and was visible from so many cool bridges (and the Eiffel Tower of course) Wish I could have taken a river cruise. Maybe next time!

A must do when visiting Paris. Go at night and take one of the river cruises, the buildings and sites are beautiful at night. Included in the tours are handsets where you can choose your language and listen to the information about the historical sites you see while on the river cruise.

Lovely river to tour. We went on a little river cruise which took us past all the monuments and you could see a lot of the city in the space of 2 hours. The only snag was that when you went inside the boat to warm up, the camera showing the front of the boat had a flag in the centre, so you couldn't see the view.

Love this River. So great to walk along this river near Notre Dame, and then as you move west of the Île de la Cité, under the one of the overpasses, you will see Valib bicycles, and it is wonderful to bike along the river until you reach the Eiffel Tower

Some peace in the city. The Seine offers an escape from city life, without having to leave the city. You can stroll along it's quais, climb down the stone steps from the Pont Neuf and visit the little garden on the tip of L'Ile de la cite and see Paris rising up around you. Walking along the streets on either side of the river you will find small bookshops operating out of kiosks that sell everything from used books, to post cards, to prints of fine art.

No Seine? No Paris. There wouldn't be a Paris if there weren't a river going right through it. It adds a special touch to this city, it's obviously not going to be crystal clear (it's a big city that has been here for a long time, of course it's gonna b a bit dirty), but its beautiful. I didn't take a boat ride, but I did drive next to the river every chance I got. There's nothing like driving at night by the river, driving passed the conciergerie, louvre, then orsay, pont Alexandre, then suddenly catch a glimpse of the sparkling lights of the Eiffel tower from afar. The best part is that the river is next to most major tourist attractions so you will always have many opportunities to take a moment and watch the river and the beautiful architecture in the background.
Awesome view. Breathtaking view of Paris. You can see all the people who enjoy the parks along the river. The bridge, museum and feel like you are France

So French, so grand. No trip to Paris would be complete without a stroll along the River Seine. I strolled both the left and right banks, stopped along the way at the many cafes and watched the world go by. Yes it's busy and crowded but you can ignore all that and take in its beauty, Paris always pleases.
beautiful river. make sure you take a cruise down the Seine; most have English narration and it's great to see this beautiful city from the river

Beautiful Bridges. We walked along the bank then took a river cruise from the Eiffel Tower and really enjoyed the bridges along the way. I believe there were over 20 that we passed under and each was unique. While this is obviously a tourist activity, it was a fun way to view the city.

If you are in Paris, take a stroll at the Banks of the Seine. if you want to get a sense of Paris, just walk the Banks of the Seine, this is the real heart of the city, this is where all parts connect

Best to take during sunset. Best time to go is sunset. While viewing the buildings during the daylight and night give it two different perspectives. Awesome to romantic. We took the 1700 boarding for 17euros.

A Different Way To See Paris. We took the cruise at night. It was really lovely! Folks waved to us from the bridges and banks. Lovers kissed. The pace was slow and the scenery magical. The part I enjoyed most was watching my wife try to photograph everything she saw. To me, it was a waste of time. Paris is simply too beautiful to be captured in a photo.

Therapy. The boat ride in the Seine was really therapeutic, took some very nice photos of Paris. Yet another huddle marked off my life bucket list. The meal was fantastic aboard the boat, the company was great too!
Pretty. Walking along the river affords beautiful views of Paris neighborhoods. More trash than I expected along the lower river trails.

Take the batobus tour around the Seine. Its kind of tour which allowed you to hop on hop off from most of Paris attraction, from Eiffel to Arc de Triompe, Musee the Louvre, Notre Dame, etc. If you dont want to take the metro, this one is a good alternative to enjoy the attractions from Paris as well as the beautiful river

Means different things to different folks. Cities invariably build up around a regular source of fresh water. While the Seine is unlikely to be a source of water for anyone in Paris anymore, it's serving different roles today. Commercial river traffic continues with barges of different sizes continuing to ply up and down the river, tourists can enjoy a sightseeing cruise to see the various landmarks and bridges, the banks of the river allow for a nice stroll or a relaxing lie-down. Paris has done a good job of incorporating all of these things to help the Seine continue to play a significant role in the life of the city. The city also feels different depending on which part of the Seine you're along. In the middle of town around the Ile de la Cite, it's historic and regal with a grand cathedral and palaces. Near Pont d'Iena, it's more a celebration of life with views of the Eiffel Tower and the Palais de Chaillot. And there's a more working class environment near the Pont National.

Stroll the banks or cruise? Do both!. Strolling the banks of the Seine was something I had long wanted to do, and it doesn't disappoint. Just something about this magical city, that even a stroll along the river is something special. Complement the experience with a cruise on the river itself & see the city from an entirely different perspective. You will see many of the famous landmarks. Personally, I think it is a must do at least once when visiting Paris.
Do this at night. Use feet or the buses during the day see the sights at night on a cruise it gives everything a new perspective.
Romantic. It really romantic especailly in the night then theres the bridge with padlocks that have the names engraved on it.
Batobus. The Batobus is a great and flexible way to get on the water without the constraints of a tour, and takes you to/from all the main attractions promptly
A great way to get your bearings. We went on a tourist boat to have a rest from walking everywhere and it was lovely to see Paris from this angle.

Very advisable. It is worth taking a boat ride along the river Seine , you´ll see the city from a different angle, We took it at about 5,30 pm and it was really amazing to see the sunset and its effect on the river and on the city itself.You´ll have a fantastic view of the bridges and some really beautiful boats. I wouldn´t advice to buy the snaks they offer with the tickets, they are expensive and the quality is poor.
The boat tour. Very cool... best time to go is in the evening before-during and after sunset.. great perspective on parisian monuments.

Check Out Boat Cruises Ahead of Time. We took a nice stroll along the Seine at dusk. You can see a lot along the way and people are out enjoying themselves. We were hoping to take a river cruise on one of the many boats. We thought it would be easy to figure out how to do this, but we couldn't find any signs to tell us where to go. After a very long walk, we finally found an information booth. The attendant was very rude. To catch the cruise, we were told we had to walk all the way back from whence we came. The moral of the story: if you want to take a riverboat cruise, check on how to do so ahead of time and know how to find it!

very nice cruise. Awesome views and very romantic....People were enjoying in groups...every time a tunnel came, people will speak loud in chorus...it was fun..my 3 year old son was jumping in enjoyment

See the Seine from the water. The river-level view of Paris provides a different perspective of this great city. Houseboats, bridges, barges and landmarks show the bustling city from another angle -- well worth the time!
Nice way to see the City. A cruise along the Seine is a great way to see the city most cruises pass all the best landmarks and its a great way to spend an hour or so.

You will enjoy the trip. If you are visiting paris your visit will not be complete if you dont take a Seine River cruise All the attractions of Paris are on the bank of river. You can also walk on the beautiful, romantic bridges built across the seine. Entire attractions of Paris can be visited if you follow the river. You can enjoy street food, music, dance culture etc. etc. across this river.You should visit it

Dreamy Summer Nights. During the summer cafe's and bars open up on the rive between the Eiffel Tower and Ponte Alexander III. It's such a lively atmosphere that isn't touristy. Once I watched a opera being played on a blow up screen. There it's so much fun to people watch grab a drink and have a late night stroll.
A Treat. On a lovely sunny warm Autumn afternoon, a thoroughly enjoyable gentle cruise down the Seine with great views of many landmarks. Treat yourself :)

Bateaux Mouches. Take the river cruise if at all possible. This provides a very nice view of many famous landmarks like the Eiffel Tower, Notre-Dame and Musee' D'Orsay, etc. Gives a nice perspective and would recommend doing it your first day in Paris as it gives you a good sense of orientation when you start your walks around the city.
Great way to see Paris. With the Eiffel tower as your backdrop you pass some of the known landmarks making this a ideal way to see Paris. Very romantic must.

A winner on the Seine river. There are several river boat companies that go along the Seine during the day and evening without offering a meal. This is fine and sufficient to enjoy the lovely sights of the buildings sited along the river. I usually prefer to go on a tour at dusk and after dark about 20:00 at the earliest, so that the buildings are illuminated and the Eiffel tower looks beautiful against the dark sky. On the hour, the tower lights scintillate !!That being said I prefer to have dinner on board. When I have guests from out of town, I reserve at the Capitaine Fracasse, - Bateau-croisière sur la Seine. Embarquement Quai de Grenelle. I have had dinner on that boat several times and we have not been disappointed. Recommended.

Crazy beautiful. I have always believed that the best way to see a city is via taking a walk in its nooks and corners and its deepest alleys. Surprisingly River Seine was a beautiful surprise too. As you pass through the Pont De Arts and stroll through the banks of River Seine, you can almost smell the city's pee-stinky banks, yet the art and history has been so well maintained that you will melt with the city. Such is the beauty of the Seine, such is the beauty of the city! Who doesn't love Paris?! :D
Beautiful! . Visited summer 2009-One of my favorite pictures from my trip to Paris is one of me posed on the side of the Seine. Absolutely beautiful and makes you feel like you're in a movie!

very romantic. i love this river and honestly each time i travel to paris i find many improvements ,it becomes more in order and very organised and clean plus the bateaux touches and the floating restaurants are very tempting

3 course lunch with champaign and wine and a river cruise. We booked a cruse via viator during lunchtime after being told by a friend that this was a must. Little did we know...but the cruise was too long, almost 2 hours and the food was horrible. Would not recommend this to anyone.

Walked both sides. There are so many things to see! Be sure to walk both sides of the river. On the river you'll see tour boats, some of them serve meals. It also looked like people could moor their houseboats on certain parts of the river. Many of the sights of the city are near the river so it's great to walk along. We loved that you could cross the river in several places, and the bridges are beautiful.
Beautiful. We took a river boat cruise and it was well worth it. We later had dinner at La Nouvelle Seine on the water. It is the most romantic river I've experienced.
Take a cruise- worth it. The cruise is only an hour, but gives you a wonderful perspective of Paris. The highlight was an upclose view of the Eiffel Tower- which of course is spectacular!!

perfect way to discover paris. donne it several times always breathtaking to see paris from the riverside been there on chartered boats for a cruise of a couple of hours but did swell the touristic boats like 'bateaux parisiens' or 'bateaux mouche' last is perfect for tourists ( would rather do the simple tour than dining on board which is to expencive for what it is and have dinner in a decent restaurant;try to do the tour after sundown you won't regret thanks to the lightning of the city
Midnight in Paris. Having a tour with an entertainment ship on this river may be interesting especially in summer and in the night

Port neuf river cruise. This is the place to take a boat ride on the seine. You have a real person speaking to you instead of listening to a recording and pointing out all of the things to see. Its great fun and I believe the metro takes you really close to this location.

Nice for a walk when it runs through the nice parts of Paris!. Nice for a walk when it runs through the nice parts of Paris! When I was there in 2006 I had the privilege of walking along the River Seine in the 1er Arrondisement. What a memorable walk it was.

River tour is highly recommended. I was able to take a tour on the River Seine. Since my tour was combined with a tour around the city I was not able to pick my boat. I didn't have one with the view from up top, so that I would highly recommend.

Walking is fine but Take the boat ride too. One can walk along the Seine and enjoy the shops and bistros. But taking the boat ride along the Seine is also quite fun - you get to really see the layout of the city with the major attractions along the way. The price for the boat ride is quite reasonable, particularly this time of year (fall) . One can also take the dinner cruise, more expensive and longer.

Pure Paris. Impossible to avoid the Seine, and why would you want to? Separating Rive Gauche et Droit, with many beautiful bridges crossing it. Make sure you head over to the Pont Des Arts bridge (where the locks are) after visiting the Louvre.

Rest your legs.. Get on the glass roofed boat which can seat hundreds and rest while the guide recording tells you in 8 languages about the history and architecture. A very pleasant hour or so to rest your weary legs.
A must do in Paris. We saw all the sights of Paris from an entirely different prospective from the river. Well worth the small fee to take the glass top boats and see it all

Oh the beauty of the Seine. The river is wonderful especially in the evening hours. The lights of the city the sheer romance of it , whether on the river in a bateaux mouches or taking a stroll alongside the river.
The boats can be very crowded in summer , sometimes uncomfortably so , but there is no doubt the view along the river is spectacular.

Anytime, at any visage, the River Seine is worth a visit. Have been here many times--strolling along the left bank, taking a river cruise--any way you can experience the River Seine is worth it. Favorite part is lovers who hide in the shadows day and night along the River Seine. One of the loveliest rivers in the world.

Great River cruise.. I would highly recommend a river cruise here. You can get various timed trips. You get to see many of the highlights of Paris from the river. The only bad thing about the cruise is that there is no cover on the top deck. If it is cold or raining it is very uncomfortable. That and overcast skies do not allow you to see any sights. Other than that a very nice and comfortable cruise.
A beatiful view.. There was beatiful view from Seine. I saw many things when I swim on this river.I like this very much.
Stroll it!. Bridges, monuments, famous buildings, river boats, people-watching. Take a cruise and see it all again from the water.

River Seine Cruise. The one-hour cruise is wonderful. The seats on top of the cruise boats are fabulous - everyone has a great view. The narrative is interesting and clear. A relaxing way to spend an hour in a busy city.
Love to walk along west bank. Good place to people watch walking along the west bank. Buy a souvenir or just sit on a bench and study the Parisian light.

I love this river.. I love running along the banks of the River Seine. Take a cruise along the river as well preferably twilight so you can see the Eiffel Tower sparkle once an hour. Cruising along the River Seine you will notice Paris's unique architecture from buildings to bridges. I highly recommend this one.
smells like urine. walked down the seine a bit along the river (down) but the walkway smells like urine. uck. i wanted to like it a lot, but only liked it somewhat.
River tour. We took a riverboat tour of the area. We found the tour provided a good historical background as well as an opportunity to see some bog the sites from afar.No dislikes

Always Beautiful . I've been to Paris three times now and every time the first thing we do is take the tour boat in the evening. I think it is a lovely way to begin a vacation in Paris. Simply sets the stage for a wonderful time.

Loved it!. Took a boat tour that took us under 32 bridges, it was so romantic. The Seine is surrounded by beautiful old places that I wouldn't get tired of seeing all the time. Very romantic place, you see happy couples everywhere and we even saw a proposal from the boat. I think she said yes...

Sunset boating or cruising with dinner is what makes you see Siene close and personal.. With all great respect to any river, you need to be in your formal best, with a hot lady along with you and let wine flow. Slowly with sunset the air gets chiller and the soft music plays trick with your wine. Everything looks beautiful. I was so immersed in the eyes of my lady, water from Siene had to wait.You make your choice!
Cruise the Seine River. A trip to Paris isn't complete without a trip on the Seine River. It's romantic. The sites of Paris were beautiful from the river.

Excellent. An excellent way to get round to all major attractions in a day as this cruise is a hop on hop off cruise and the ticket lasts from 10 am to 7 pm. That gives ample time to visit at one's leisure without the pressure of having to use the metro!Disliked that there is no guide to explain some of the buildings which might have a historic significance.

River boats!. Night-time trip on the Seine is great photographic opportunity. I would choose a smaller boat next time and one that did not blare explanations of what we were seeing in 7 or 8 languages sequentially and through loud speakers!

worth a boat trip. Boat trip was reasonable in price but would have liked to go further and explore more fully. However, you need the time for this and would have preferred a more open boat as weather was really good.

Cruise Paris on a boat. One of the lovely ways to see a lot of Paris is from the cruise boats that go between Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower. The boats stop at major locations such as Louvre, Musee d'es Art, and it is a lovely relaxing way to see the great landmarks from the water. You can also walk along the banks of the river or ride a bicycle, so plenty of ways to be near the water. Some people even sunbake at the water's edge. The River Seine is a very long river and has many gorgeous village along it's banks.

Night Cruise. The City of Love definitely shines at night from the River Seine with the magical sparkling Eiffel Tower as the crescendo to a lovely river cruise. Travelling along the river around dusk shows off the beauty of the building silhouettes' and the subtle lighting then finished with the spectacular light show off the Eiffel Tower, it really is worth doing a river cruise while visiting Paris.
Take a city boat tour. You can see all sights by boat. The bridges, Eiffel Tower, Napoleon's tomb, Notre Dame, etc., are all on the route.
beautiful. Runs through the city and when you have found the river you have easy access to the rest of the town.

My most unforgettable night in Paris. We were on the fantastic Yatchs de Paris. It was the most unforgettable night in my life to have a dinner cruise aboard Don Juan II on the beautiful river of Seine. I will never forget the beautiful Paris night I had with my husband.

Superb birthday celebration on the Seine!. I was lucky to be invited by a friend to a great birthday celebration for his wife on a modern restaurant boat on the river Seine. The weather at the end of October was surprisingly nice and pretty warm for the season.Some eighty guests enjoyed the cocktails and the set french dinner menu in an elegantly attired restaurant with some Parisian (Piaf) music surrounded by the beautiful sights and lights of this stunning capital made this for a very special evening. We got back after a four hour ride at about midnight. The service and the food were great! Highly recommended and a great way to celebrate a special event with some unique memories.

While it's just a river.... the small cities and villages along its banks are one-of-a-kind. We took a river cruise from Paris to Normandy. We visited several of the cities along the way. The churches in the small towns are just as breathtaking as those in large cities.

If you haven't walk the banks of the Seine you haven''t been to Paris!. A moment in time that once experienced remains forever. How could one say that they had been to Paris without mentioning the Seine. Each time you turn you are confronted by a different Paris. Its the blood that courses through the veins of this City.

This is not just a river. The River Seine is probably, next to the Eiffel tour, the most popular tourist attraction in Paris.Take note, that the river is an active working river. Freight traffic on the river is contract. The sight seeing river boats are totally secondary.By all means do go on a sight seeing river boat cruise on the Seine. From a historic perspective alone, it is fascinating.There are many companies that offer the cruises.

Wonderful Seine. What more can one say - it is just a beautiful river and well taken care ofParis Plage in summer , is paid for by the city of Paris and has many free attractions and activities Our grandaughters rode the free bicycles . At weekend nights there are live bands and dancing

good but crowded and the commentary was not clear. Bateaux Moches were found good but were crowded and most of the commentary was not heard. lThe loudspeakers and the sound system needed to be optimised. The tour was shorter that expected. Still, it was an addition to the tour.
At peace on the Seine.. Do take a boat ride on the river Seine. There is so much architecture, history and beauty to see along the way.

In Seine. We bought a two day hop on hop off bus ticket that included a cruise trip up the Seine which was lovely. I have previously used a hop on hop off boat which is perfect for many of the tourist spots. The river is tidy, the bridges and views are amazing and spectacular at night.
Breathtaking view. River cruise at dusk leaving from the Pont Neuf bridge. We enjoyed seeing the lights of Paris come to life.

Bateau mouche. I liked the boat trip in thevafternoon until the dusk it was great , paris and the seine are so magical .From a boat you get a different perspective and see many landmarks in a different way. Well worth your time, especially beforevdark .. Must gooo

If you have little time in Paris, one of the boat tours are perfect to get it all in.. I don't remember which tour we took, there were plenty of them at the base and across the street from the Eiffel Tower. We got to see many of the sights from the outside and learned where everything was at. Not to bad for the price, but we did get rained on, even in June.
Boring. I red at home about that cruise and loved it, but in real, it`s not romantic. We all set very close to another turist, view is nothing special...

Under the Bridges of Paris with me. I think the Seine is one of the most romantic rivers in the world. Take a stroll on the cobble stone tow paths along the river towards Saint Michel with the Notre Dam in front of you. Stop for a mozerella sandwich from a tiny kiosk at the edge of the water and write you name on a huge blackboard hanging on the wall. It is all truely magical: the best way to experience one of the most famous landscapes in the world. During August some of the tow paths are taken over as beaches! Real sand is brought in. There are free sun loungers and deck chairs and of course children with buckets and spades
Longest river. The Seine is a 776 km long river and an important commercial waterway within the Paris Basin in the north of France
A different view of Paris. From a boat you get a different perspective and see many landmarks in a different way. Well worth your time, especially if the sun is shining!

So Romantic (Though the water is disgusting). Loved the view and the culture surrounding the seine river. The vintage magazines and colorful parisian art work make for great collector's items and gifts. The small booths along the Seine has the best books!

Possibly the most beautiful river in the world at night. Very much against my wife's wishes I made her take a walk down the river at night and what a site. There are walkways directly against the river you can access by taking stairs. Or you can walk up near the street level. There are also boat tours, usually lasting an hour and traveling between the Eiffel tower and Notre Dame that leave from Pont Neuf.

Sweet Romantic Place in Paris. Seine is a big part of Paris experience. Few things that can be done to enjoy this experience.1. Cruise Trip: I would highly recommend a cruise trip. Cruise are available in different prices and different duration. You can have you dinner or lunch on the cruise as well. This is a lovely experience. 2. Walk along the seine from Notre Dame Cathedral to Eiffel Tower. It will take around 90 min to 2 hours. But I loved it. 3 Camping along seine. There are people who camp in the nights of summer... 4. Just sitting and having a drink is also a wonderful experience.
Peaceful. Walked along the banks of the River Seine and enjoyed watching the river boats full of visitors taking in the sights, so peaceful.

Trip down the Seine... We took the river taxi and got on and off at different points along the river. Of course, the Effiel Tower and Norte Dame are visible along its banks..a must for the Paris traveler.

Beautiful River. This is a beautiful river, and I doubt anyone going into central paris would miss it.
You can get boat tours which are nice if you want to see things from far and quickly.

Start at dusk. I've done the river boat trip during the day & at dusk. Definitely do it at dusk right before it gets dark. Paris comes to life as the lights turn on. It is something truly magical. A great trip even in the daylight. Great for taking pictures.

River Cruise. Take the night cruise as its very beautiful, and take the illuminated tour.
The cruise is very beautiful and the city looks great in the night. The night cruise is a bit expensive though.
one of my favorite things to do. get lunch at the Bon Marche food court or bring a sack lunch and sit on benches down by the river. a peaceful respite from sightseeing.
Nice view!. This is a great way to get to know the city. Walking, running, there are boat tours, no matter how you go, you just have to. Breathtaking view, including Eiffel Tower.

Excellent different view of the city.. Going from place to place on foot or via the Metro are good ways of getting around, but a trip along the river helps place everything and you see it from a different perspective.There are guided tours (Bateaux Mouches and Vedettes de Pont Neuf) available, but I opted for the Batobus. This is more like a ferry service, where you can buy an all-day ticket and hop on and off as you please at any of 8 stops between the Eiffel Tower in the west and the Jardin des Plantes in the east. Take a good map and your camera and hope for a clear sunny day!

I never tire of this - if you come to Paris - it's a MUST!!!. The trip is 45 minutes and is really interesting and beautiful - with either an Audio guide or a guide who speaks English...The attractions is known as the Bateaux Mouches - but there are many different companies who run them...I recommend the Vedettes du Pont Neuf : http://www.vedettesdupontneuf.com/home/ as you can buy your ticket cheaper online in advance and you are not committed to a specific boat - you can go at anytime on the day that you've chosen. Boats usually go every half hour but check the times as they vary depending on the season...Also if you finish up nearing lunchtime - a lovely restaurant nearby (just at the side of the Louvre) is called: http://lefumoir.com/wordpress/.Last thing - there are other boat companies that do this trip at night whereby you can dine while doing the tour (no guide of course)....Enjoy! K
Great Views of the wonderful buildings. It was nice to see all of the buildings from the river and with a tour guide giving you some of the history.
Not to be missed. A dinner or lunch down the Seine do not miss we use the Bateaux Boats they serve good food and great views from their boats
Beautiful strolling. Tired of line of predictable Brand shop? This district is the solution to inspire you what Paris only can bring!

Catch the boatabus. Great way to travel between landmarks and very romantic at night with the Paris lights. You can catch the last boat from Eiffel Tower (7pm) and cruise the full length of the Seine back to the Eiffel Tower for no extra charge. Only downside, don't depart the final trip unless you want to walk back to where your staying.

River cruise. We took the nighttime cruise from Pont Neuf, and got treated to a spectacular lighting display from the Eiffel Tower! A great way to see the city in another light, and the unique bridges.
Must do. Used the river taxi during the day, got off & on to see all the sights, wish we had done this on our first day. Took some great photos.
Houseboat heaven. All along the river is beautiful and I was very pleased NOT to see garbage in the water. Just cool looking houseboats/ tourboats and swans.

A night on the River Seine!. We had a free Paris Pass coupon for a boat cruise on the Seine. We picked up our river boat across the street from the Eiffel Tower. I have to say this trip afforded me some of my best pics while we where in Paris. It was romantic, a little crowded, but hey, where in Paris is it not crowded. I would recommend taking any of the many cruise offerings available along the Seine. If you can make it late afternoon when the sun is beginning to go down!

The place to be.. Everything revolves around the Seine or should I say floats atop the Seine. There are so many bridges in Paris, tiny bridges to walk over the Seine. There are parks, restaurants and romantic spots beside this tourist attraction.

Paris Honeymoon *** 1980 ***. Bateaux Mouches on chilly evening, October 1980. We were the only passengers onboard. River pilot invited us into his nice, warm pilot house where we conversed in our broken English/French and inhaled gitanes smoke. An experience I'll always treasure!

Warm evening helped the experience. Lovely trip on our first night. Beautiful evening so sat outside. the trip took an hour but well worth it. Bought a combined Tour Eiffel and Bateau tickets. Bateaux Parisian were the company.

good alternative perspective. well worth the ride. worked well as part of the hoho ticket and lets you see otherwise inaccessible spots. ideally located to do immediately after the Eiffel tower (see related review). the multi lingual guide on board complements the recorded commentary and many of the landmarks can be seen from a totally different perspective and provides some great photo ops.

The Locks on the bridges is a crazy idea. It was beautiful to walk along the river and just enjoy the beautiful weather. It is a shame that all those crazy people have put their locks on the bridges as it has really spoiled them. We really enjoyed our meal on the moored boat looking at Notre Dame in the background with the accordion player providing the background music.

Romantic !. What a beautiful river. We walked by it by day, and cruised it in the evening. The banks light up like a fairy tale, and the sounds of the city take the ambience to different level. A beautiful river in a beautiful city.
River trip. Well worth a trip see the sites from a different perpective. Get an outside seat if the weather is good.
A relaxing walk. We had wonderful autumn weather so it was a joy to walk along the Seine sepaecially in the part where the city of paris has made a garden with sculptures - great at no costs!

Wonderful 8 day cruise.. We sailed on an 8 day cruise Paris to Normandy and back to Paris on the Viking Spirit. The ports were fabulous. Very interesting. We saw Monet's Garden, Giverny, Vernon, Rouen, the Beaches of Normandy and more. The scenery along the Seine was beautiful.The Viking Spirit was a great River Boat. We couldn't fault the staff. Food great, cabins small with plenty of cupboard space. Lots of fun. Would definitely recommend this cruise on the Seine.

You Must Have a Boat Ride. We walked along the Seine which was lovely, but really liked the overview from a boat! We went late in the day when we could still see the architecture and the bridges connecting the left and right bank, each one being different. We picked up a boat at Pont Neuf which was nice.

Superb!. When we couldn't get up the Eiffel Tower we chose to go on a one hour boat trip instead. We took the 5pm cruise which was stunning. We saw all the sites as the sun was going down and then when we arrived back at the Eiffel Tower at 6pm, it was lit up and a light show started. Stunning!

Walk the banks and streets - you won't be disappointed!. I spent several hours in the area of the Seine, and while it wasn't the cleanest river I had ever laid eyes on, the atmosphere varied so much, it was magical. From the local, laid-back atmosphere of the flower stalls on the streets right next to the river to the tourist overload that is the Ile de la Cite, there was something different around every corner.There's also a near-deserted part of the river, on the opposite side to Ile de la Cite, where you can sit and watch the world go by (interrupted infrequently by cruise boats going up and down the river).

Walking along river seine is an experience. It was great to walk along the river sieine .there are various glass cabins along the river on the road to rest ,playing areas for kids and various river cruises...overall I went there everyday..

Seine pickpockets. Beautiful experience lovely warm weather but BEWARE of Romany gypsies trying to pickpocket with picking up a gold coloured ring nearby and coming up to you asking if it's yours ! Whilst you busy some pickpocket is doing over your bag , they work in pairs so beware of other further up following you

Pleasant. The banks of the river are great for strolling along to get away from the noise and the traffic. Looking at the boats, barges and taking in the the general busyness of the river traffic is interesting. There are lots of exits so you are never too far from a cafe or, even better, do as the Parisiens do and bring your own picnic! We took a boat trip and that was also worthwhile.

take the boat cruise. A boat cruise on the Seine is worthwhile - great way to see some key sights, great photo ops. There are several companies that do this, so do some homework and shopping around. Some are longer with meal service. Most typical cruises are about an hour. Two of the larger companies are close to the Eiffel tower and several hundred meters down on the other side. Kids like it too, as it is different.

Loved the River and the Bridges. Really enjoyed the River as well as the bridges, especially at night when all the lights are reflecting off the water. When on a great Boat Cruise, sorry I can't remember the name of the boat, but the food was excellent and enjoyed the lighting of the Eiffel Tower from the boat.However, we stopped an purchased a lock to place on the bridge and my husband was pick-pocketed by the man we purchased the lock from. His own fault though as he had the money in his jacket pocket-ugh!
Not worth almost $200 per person. The food was okay. Nothing special. I would recommend spending the money on another restaurant and get a real 5 star experience.

just a boat trip. went on this after we had visited the tower and were just ready to sit down and have a rest, we visited late Pm just as it was hgetting dark which you would think would give the best views of day and night. But we ended up with a boat full of tied children and parents that wanted to keep them going, but not for children just not enough to interest them. the info over the tannoy was quite lame and I would not bother with this again unless I was going late and perhaps having a meal on one of the boats

Cruise it if you can.. The best way to see a river is to be on it. There are many tour boats that travel the river and can give you a great view of what Paris has to offer, The Eiffel Tower, the Louvre, Notre Dame as well as the left bank. Well worth the time. The down side of the Seine is the amount of trash and debris in the river. Not the cleanest river in France.

Great evening cruise. We took the hour tour rather than the dinner cruise. Great views that you normally won't see on land. Also take the tour during the evening....great to see the many landmarks all lite up !!

Take the river boat tour. Loved taking the river tour. It was nice to learn about the area along the river. A few times the recorded message came after being past what they were describing, which was a bummer. Otherwise we enjoyed it.

River Cruise a Must. One of the highlights of our Paris visit was a river cruise at twilight. Things look different from the water and we enjoyed the river very must. Also nice to walk along the river and see things that way also.

River cruise. Did an evening tour and it's the best time to see Paris..signed up with big bus tour and assistant was very helpful. If u wait to sign up till 4:00 pm, u get a better deal for the next day.

OMG. Strolls along the Seine keep us going back to Paris.Remarkable, romantic & picture-perfect.Bridge after bridge (particularly in the core area) with fantastic panoramic views of the river, the life blood of the city.The bouquinistes (used book-sellers) add colour to the parapets; you won't find any English language books of note, but they sell postcards, fridge magnets, posters ...

Boat ride with dinner. Traveled down the river Seine on a dinner cruise, the food was very delicious and we were served champagne and wine with the meal, the sights we saw were fantastic. I highly recommend this trip when in Paris.

Seeing Paris from a different view. it was a beautiful day in Paris do the cruise was definitely a good choice for a sunny outing. The starting point is at the Eiffel Tower so very easy to get to. Make sure you know which dock to go to for the right boat as there are many boat companies at different docks.The wait for the boat and the embarking was a bit long even though we had our tickets in advance. The boat was clean and neat, the upper deck was quite crowded, not sure what it was like inside. The cruise along the Seine offered us the opportunity to see Paris from a different angle and it was most enjoyable. the time spent on the cruise was just the right amount of time, not too much but not too little either. I would recommend later afternoon and people getting their tickets in advance.

At last - sightseeing cruise achieved.. Having visited Paris on many occasions we finally got round to completing a boat trip. It was an extremely pleasant experience and great to see the city from a non pedestrian angle. Absolutely loved it - especially at dusk so we caught the sun set going out and the lights coming back. Highly recommended

River Cruise. We did three river cruises on the Seine, one at night to see the city lights. The night was warm, in one area there was a jazz band and a little further on people were dancing on the banks of the river Seine. It was cool I have never seen that before and it was nice to see the Eiffel Tower all aglow. On one of the day trips it decided to rain, heavy rain and one side of the boat was unusable because of all the rain coming in onto the seats. We still had a great time, we were in Paris!

Short cruise - great views. This Seine river cruise, that matched up with a city bus tour and front of the line Eiffel tower is well worth it.
