Be prepared however, to be left there, as the tour ends at the Eiffel tower/Cruise area and you have to find your way back to your hotel yourself. The Metro however is easy. The cruise showed amazing sites you can see as easily from the streets or bus. Its only an hour and has very very good audio guides too.
ok. short cruise will take about an hour. will cost you 14 euros per person. It is little bit overcrowded and basically you will see what you already have seen.

The bridges of Paris. A romantic weekend wandering over the bridges of Paris, watching the tourists at pla,y, the life on the river and the magnificent buildings that line the Seine is a must. I could have sat there for hours - but my time was limited. I very much look forward to my next trip

love locks. i absolutely loved the "love locks" but was sad i hadnt brought my own. definitely bringing one for my next trip. it was amazing how there is a river that just flows right in the middle of everything.
A boat trip down the river. If your short of time in this city this is a worthwhile activity to do. A informative hour down the river.

A fun afternoon. A great way to spend the afternoon: pack a picnic and watch the world go by while sitting on the bank of the river. We took a night cruise as well which was well worth the money. It allowed us to see all the sites and sounds of Paris illuminated.
Sightseeing. The Seine River dinner cruise at 6pm was awesome for our last night in Paris. We enjoyed the tasty meal and our waiter was informing us of the varies bridges.

The River. Seen this so many times on the telly. We walked along the river like a tv advert. There are giant boats doing fancy dinners all along the river. They look a good trip, but never managed to squeeze one in

Lovely cruise on a romantic river. You admire all the attractions near the river, starting from the Eiffel, Palais de Chaillot, Musee du Quai Branly, Musee d'Art Moderne, Grand&Petit Palais and others, admiring all the bridges, gliding under smoothly on a comfortable river boat that offers you enough space to strall or to seat while listening to the guide on your language. It reaches the Notre Dame and turns back to the Eiffel. I loved it.

An hour well spent. A great way to rest weary legs. Picked up the ferry near Notre Dame. Good commentary. Went down to Eiffel Tower and back. It was a lovely sunny warm day. An hour was about the right length of time.

A MUST VISIT. No trip is complete (or even started ) without a boat trip on the Seine. There are many available organised river trips that will give informative commentary, however it is worth considering The Batubus, a hop on/off service, that enables you to get to and visit many of the major attractions without the additional taxis or Metro costs.A riverside walk certainly around The Eiffel Tower is to be recommended.
Worth a visit. We spent an hour on a cruise between the Eifel Tower and Notre Dame. Goose value and an excellent audio commentary to boot

Good Walk. I walked around the banks of river. It is nice for picture and to rest. It is dirty and not to scenic but you can find spots that are nice. In some sections you can find boats restaurants around the river. The are also few tours companies that takes you around. You also have to be careful which parts you walk around because it can be a little solitary for a tourist.

See the Seine at Night. River tour with "Vedettes Du Pont Neuf" . We bought our tickets for the river Seine tour from Bike about Tours at a discount price. (10 euros from them) we went at night so we could see the Paris lights. Wonderful one hour tour which we really loved.

The most magical and romantic rive. A day did not go by during our week in Paris that we did not take a stroll along the left or west banks of the Seine The water, boats, iconic bridges and people watching is the best anywhere. Watch locals strolling hand in hand, riding bikes, lounging on boat decks, jogging and couples embracing and kissing (you cannot escape the Parisian's passion for each other in the form of PDA).

Dirty...but romantic. This is definitely a dirty river, but it a nice romantic place to visit. However, stay away from it late at night as crime does increase. Be smart and you will enjoy this location.

Beautiful boat ride!. We took a evening boat ride down the Seine. It was absolutely beautiful. I wish we would have taken it earlier in a stay, because they pointed out things that we may have done had we known it was there. So now we will have to come back!

Choose river trip carefully. As it was a lovely day we went on one of the many river trips. It was ok but after the initial announcements no further information was given so you did not know areas you were passing or what most of the buildings were called. Would try another company another time.

Part of the Paris puzzle. How do you describe a city river? Sung about in endless poems and songs, a witness to the turbulent history, this river has seen it all. Beautifully encased in those banks, the river is a potent backdrop to the beauty of Paris. Must be enjoyed both from the water and from the banks to be fully appreciated.

Go for a ride - See the sights from the Seine. Purchase a whole-day ticket, this allows you to get on a river boat and ride to the end. Then jump off, explore and come back and jump on to see the next stop. Stay on at dusk when the lights come on and you'll be amazed.....gorgeous. You won't be sorry you took a day doing this.
Seine Cruise. We did the Seine Cruise on our last day. It was relaxing and the guide was very informative. Great view of the Eiffel Tower from a different angle.

Wonderful River Cruise. Our holiday in Paris included a river cruise, we managed to get a seat on the top deck a good position if you want to take photos.The view of Paris from the river was fantastic.,The tour lasted around an hour and a half,and you certainly see a different view of Paris. Unfortunately for us that day there were a lot of noisy youngsters on a school trip and they never sat still for two minutes ,they were not in the least bit interested in the sights ,what a waste.We couldn't really hear much of the commentary either, but the weather was so nice and the scenery brilliant it was well worth doing the cruise.

Romantic cruise on river seine. Even though i had done this cruise earlier, this time it was with my wife. the temperature was about 10 deg C and windy but the views and the facades of buildings are always worth the cruise on river seine. Would recommend it as a must do in Paris especially if you take it from Eiffel tower banks.

every flavor of thing along the banks.. beautiful vistas, quai side vendors and walking areas. All sorts of activities to partake in or watch along the way. Stay AWAY FROM THE SHELL GAMES. Take part in the Paris local activities or have a seat along the banks and let it soak in.

7 Day Paris Trip. Wife and I who are in our 70,s stayed with my son at Suresnes for 1 week and traveled into centre of Paris on a daily basis using the tram Metro and RER We purchased a 7 day Navigo pass costing 26 Euros each which was invaluable when travelling around and saved lots of time from queuing for tickets. Be sure to take a passport size photograph when buying the Navigo.I would advise you also purchase a reasonably sized transport system map since it is difficult to read and confusing to follow the small travel guide maps You can obtain a Lecture Confort Paris transport map at the major stations covering the whole of Paris segregating the Bus, RER ,Metro and Tram systems which is easier to follow.We initially found it difficult to follow the systems when changing from one to the other .You will generally find a sign at the system entry point outlining the directions of travel and this is duplicated on the platform.We found it easier to establish the terminus points on our route to establish the platform and then check the actual stations on the platform sign .This ensures you are on the correct platform We purchased a 6 day Museum pass for 69 Euros each which was also a good investment since it gave us access to about 20 Museums or places of interest and we had no problems in queuing for access.We found most of the museums very comprehensive and large in size necessitating more than one visit making the museum pass invaluable for repeated access.Take the museums at a leasurely pace and appreciate the architecture as well as the exhibitsWe tried to spend half a day walking round a museum stopping for a snack at lunch then walked around the various districts of Paris in the afternoon before travelling back later in the day .Avoid the rush hour or you will finish up packed like sardines in the transport systemWe generally bought sandwiches , fruit and a drink in the supermarket for lunch and sat in one of the many parks at lunchtime.The warnings about pickpockets displayed everywhere must be taken seriously ,avoid all people with billboards,be alert at all times and ensure you have zips on all you coat pockets,carry a money belt if necessary and only sufficient cash for the day.We were almost caught out on our last day when entering a metro train when a girl tried to stand between myself and my wife and obstructed my attempts to pass her .Fortunately I had a Liverpool sense of humour and I took hold of her hand and suggested we have the next dance .This unerved her and she rapidly moved up the carriage and exited at the next stop Paris is a fascinating city and we will be going again in 2015

River Seine. Like no other body of water anywhere, but what else could you expect from the city of Paris? It is beautiful whether day or night. Take a boat cruise to truly enjoy it - we have done the day and night cruise. Our favorite is the night because of all the lights througout the city, and it's more romantic.Go down to the rivers edge by taking the stairs down from one of the bridges and walk along the river. It is very peaceful and lovely.

Cruise on the river was great!. I can't remember which one we took, but went at dusk. Nice to see Paris lit up at night. All sorts of cruises to pick from in a range of prices, with some being dinner cruises. Nice commentary. They are located across street from Eiffel Tower. You must go on one!

Absolutely wonderful! Day and Night a must!. We booked a daytime river cruise tour from our hotel concierge and enjoyed it so much we decided that we had to come back that very same night to see it all over again at night. It did not disappoint us and was fantastic! It was so romantic and different at night along the entire river banks. The Eiffel tower at night is great to see all lighted up and then hard to believe that it could be even better when it twinkled on the hour with a fantastic display of lights! Do this as a must both tours - day and night. We also recommend having your picture taken by the photographers ours was a real treasure for us. I guess because we enjoyed ourselves so much that it really showed in the pictures - we all thought (four of us) that we looked at least ten to fifteen years younger! It was worth the money!
Riverboat!. We didn't do the river tour this visit but I highly reccomend. We bought a lock on our anniversary and attatched on fence above the River Seine on our 30th. anniversary.

Getting about on the river.. Cruise the river or hop on / hop off. We took the Batobus. Inexpensive way to visit all the sites near the river and view the city as well. The ticket lasts all day, hop on hop off as you please. The ticket office is at each stop as is a major attraction.

Nice River Cruise. We went on the cruise, it was very nice to see the city from the boat during the day. We were supposed to go on it at night but had to reschedule during the day. We couldn't get our head sets to work. But the views were spectacular during the day.

Nice to stroll along its banks. Strolling along its banks it fun and relaxing. Along the way you will find shops offering old books and prints. Boats navigate along or house boats are moored along the banks. Cross some bridges and take photos. Gorgeous.

Seine - ic walk. The Seine is made for walking by, I don't know a better river to do this by. There is such a lot going on and the river banks are so wide. You can get caught up in crowds, especially if you are in an area where the pleasure Boats are moored, but there are plenty of exits to get you back up to street level. We walked from the Tour Eiffel to Notre Dame and it took about 1/2 hour at a really slow pace as we were looking at everything.
Beautiful night cruise. Paris at night is even more exciting than day time, this is one of the most fascinating city in the world

Walk....Talk.....and Muse. Forget Paris in April................any other time is just as good but cheaper..!!!October walking along the Seine is an experience everyone should have.....grab some wine,bread and cheese and sit for a picnic lunch......................DON'T buy ANY paintings which are ALL prints with a bit of paint here and there.We looooooove it.!!Oh..............they have EVERY kind of tout an con man for the sleepy and unwary..........
Pretty view but that's about it.. The River Seine Cruise is just something that all tourists go for the sake of going. You can snap many pretty shots (in the day) but that's about it.

Splendid. Crossing the River Seine on a brisk winter day with the sun shining made me feel all warm inside. It's a beautiful river with great views of stunning buildings around, and there are a lot of beautiful second hand book stalls along the river near St. Michel station.

Senic Walk. When I visited Paris back in 2011, my first experience along the Seine was to visit all the vendors set up along the river selling their goods. Bought some really cool stuff while walking along the river. During my trip in 2014 did not make it to the river during the weekend when the sidewalks are lined with vendors, but I did manage a walk along the river the day before I had to leave. It is just a beauty in the fall with all the colors of the leaves and the Eiffel Tower in the background. Truly a romantic walk for anyone.
Cruise. Take the cruise at sunset and see the tower from the river. Coupons can save a few euros. Easy metro stop. And worth the effort
Beautiful. We walked along a fair bit of the river and went over by bus - it is absolutely beautiful and very clean.
Our Trip. What a lovely way to spen an evening, dinner on the Seine is a great experience to have when in Paris.

Tallow trees!. The only reason I am writing this is to mention something that flabbergasted me. While strolling along the Seine in St Germaine de Pres we noted, as we have in the past, the very nicely tended large trees planted along the river Two foot trunks. We looked at a few fallen leaves and then did a double take of these things. These are Chinese Tallow trees!! This is one of the worst invasive, nasty species in the tree world and certainly not indigenous to France. If you don't know about this tree, Google it. They are illegal in some jurisdictions. Wow.

Gorgeous. Strolling along the Seine is like stepping back in time, given that it is yet fringed (thankfully) by Hausmann design. Pack a lunch with wine and take in the sight as you sit, legs dangling, along its borders or stop in at one of the restaurant serves that border the waters. Either way is certain to bring joy and ease.
The Seine is still the life blood of city of Paris. We love Paris. We love the Seine. It helps making Paris so beautiful. Walk, bike, or boat it. You won't be sorry.

Seine wonders. Absolutely the most amazing of environments surrounding the river, awesome place, could spend days weeks exploring and never tiring so much to see and do, we brought home some art work from here by local artist, what a treasure.

Relaxing Cruise. Taking a Cruise on the River Seine cannot be missed as one can see Paris from another perspective. We passed all through the main Landmarks and after spending a hectic day around Paris we needed this relaxing hour to wind up. Should do this again, but this time at night!
A cruise on the Seine is wonderful. We cruised the Seine with one of the bateaux Parisiens cruiser, a wonderful experience and would highly recommend.

Take a boat down the river. Take a boat down the river and see Paris from a unique view. It is best to view from the roof of the boat but the downside of this is that you don't hear the audio guide. If so then take a Paris tour on land prior to a river cruise.

Peace and Quiet beside the river!. After walking miles with my mother I just wanted to sit down and enjoy a bottle of bordeux we bought at the local shop, we got a couple of plastic glasses and chose to sit by the River Seine, we watched the boats go by and people walking along with their dogs and jogging, it was very relaxing and calming!If you do have a moment, even if you don't want to drink, sit for 5 minutes and appreciate the come and go of the boats up and down the river
Boring - waste of time. I found it boring, much better to get on the hop on & off bus. Couldn't wait to get off the boat. Wouldn't recommend

A relaxing cruise. We took the late afternoon Vedettes du Pont Neuf one-hour Seine cruise tour. The tour commentary was given in French and English and was an excellent overview of the sites along the river. The cruise is very relaxing and informative. With a do-over I would try the evening cruise with the lights.
Sweet night river/dinner cruise. Calife boat dinner cruise was terrific. We'd been to Paris several times, but never done the trip. Our whole family enjoyed the trip!

The Fabled Seine. Winding through Paris, the Seine River demarks the Left Bank and numerous famous buildings. For the best experience, try the Batobus, a long, doubled-decked boat that allows you to disembark at several points and rebord after seeing the many sights.
beautiful. just in front of our hotel. Very handy way to get up and down the different attractions and Arrondezments. Beautiful. Seen in many movies!

dirty. the seine is very beautifull, but unfortunzatley dirty, a lots of bottles and papers and other stuff swimming inside. sometimes you can see dead animals like rats or fishes, wich is normal for big city.if you take the little boat you better take it in the evening, it is nicer to see paris in the night with all the lights

Pre booked this cruise to…. Ensure we didn’t book the cruise near the Eiffel Tower that gets filled with all the tour bus groups. Only did this cruise because our children hadn’t done it. Not a great river to cruise along because the Seine sits so far below street level you only see the tops of all the sites, you don’t even see the whole of the Eiffel Tower and as for Notre Dame you are lucky to glimpse the top half.So take the cruise for cruising the Seine not to get great photos of all the sites listed in the brochure.Boarding at Pont Nerf with two boats running and trips leaving on the half from 9am, no need to book exact day or time just turn up. We were on the 4pm boat and for an hour we were informed of all the sites along the Seine in both French and English. It was a great way to spend an hour resting the feet before taking on the next walking stint through Paris.

A Romantic river!!. A romantic river in the most romantic capital in the world! The view is awesome from everywhere you see it,there are about 37-38 ponts,each one with a different name and story..Don't forget to take the bateaux mousse and go on a cruise day or even night..

Great Way to Tour Paris. I decided to take the Hop-on, Hop-off River Seine Tour which was excellent. The boats stop at all the popular attractions so it's a great way to get around and avoid the traffic. You have a great view from inside with large glass panels so you don't miss a thing

Lots of action. The River Seine is a working river that flows straight through the centre of Paris. The River Seine separates Paris into the right bank and the left bank with each bank having its own unique identity. There are a number of places on both the right and left banks where you can get right down to the walkways that run alongside the Seine and you can walk along the Seine. The walking surfaces are not always that good so be cautious. The alternative is to watch the flow of boats and barges on the Seine from one of the many bridges that link the right and left banks of the city of Paris. The Seine is a busy working river and you will see lots of tourist boats and barges making their way up and down the river. The River Seine as it flows through Paris is an interesting stretch of water and worth the time to visit and watch the river flow.

Beautiful river in the heart of the city.. I like how the river is clean. You can walk along the river to go to most attractions in the city. Definitely walk along the bridges with the padlocks. A must see.

Lifeblood of Paris. At some point, take a cruise on the seine....if you hate crowded boats. Take the dinner cruise on Le Calife....small intimate boat. NOT a tour of the seine river, so don't expect loudspeakers. Opt for terraces dining or rooftop. Good views. But inside ok too since you see what is happening more in the quais Also I loved the seine cruise leaving from Republique as you get to go see the locks. A bit long so get off after locks and take metro back.
Cruise is a must. Had a cruise and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Its great for taking pictures and gives you a view of most sights.
A must. The Seine is a backbone of Paris and every visitor should experience a bateaux mouche boat ride in the evening to see this city of lights all lit up. It's unforgettable.
Panoramic!. Took a river cruise! Very nice way to see all the bridges and various landmarks. Would recommend experiencing this.

Beautiful day or night. We walked the Siene during the day and took the Pontieff cruise boat in the evening. It is beautiful to see Paris at night and very romantic. It's a must do for tourists and locals.

dinner on Bateaux-Mouches. The most romantic dinner ever. I'm from New York and usually the food on these dinner cruises is not the best -- but not here. We did book the Excellence menu and were not disappointed.
It's Free. Don't just walk the river banks once. Do it at different times of day, particularly night and do it at different points. Great for photography.

River tour of the Seine. The Seine is magnificent by day but especially at night. The bridges light up and show a different side to Paris and the monuments look amazing with back lighting. The boat company we used had been recommended by a walking tour company and was pretty average. The seats did not fold down in some cases and made finding a good seat hard once a lot of people were on board. We saw people sitting beside the Seine simply enjoying the water and watching the many boats going up and down. If you go to Paris, hit the water and enjoy !
A pleasant way to see the sights of Paris. Well organised and good commentary but not if you choose to go up on deck, suggest you would need fine weather to really enjoy

Cruise by the night over looking the Eiffel. such a beautiful cruise. but do go during the night time to see the lights and beautiful architectures of churches and museums and buidlings. you can see the Eiffel from far but truly beautiful at nights with its lights. various types of bridges too!

River Seine Cruise. The River Seine Cruise was one of the highlights of my visit to Paris! The architecture! The bridges! Loved our river cruise! Was disappointed though to see bottles and debris floating in the river at one section.

Great trip. We took this trip down the Seine at night and it was a lot quieter. It was also nice to see the City lit up and the Eiffel Tower with all it's lights twinkling on the hour. Would definitely recommend this boat trip.

the Seine by night can not be beat!!. we walked , rode and crossed the Seine many , many times during our visit, but our first night in Paris we took a barge ride on the Seine to see the many lighted monument and bridges. it was a fantastic sight, one we will not forget for a long time!!

night tour down the Seine. Okay, I really can't stand doing touristy things with other tourists. It makes me feel creepy and cheesy and just oh so obvious and typical. So standing in line with hundreds of anxious tourists made me feel slightly homicidal. getting on a big tour boat sounded like pure unshirted hell. But actually, once we got going, I didn't even notice the other people. I actually liked Paris at night from the Seine. I didn't like Paris in general but seeing it at night from the river was a very cool experience. I would highly recommend it- but maybe find a smaller boat with less people.

Unique river..... Did a barge trip for ten days. You get the change to see the Seine in a special way from a boat. Once out of Paris the river and banks are beautiful. Lots of trash in Paris area of the river.

Don't Visit Paris Without Walking its Banks. The banks of the Seine are a UNESCO World Heritage Site for good reason, with many historic buildings and sites close by or easily visible from the river. But the Seine deserves recognition as a tourist destination of its own. Whether viewed by day or night, the Seine is a delight for the eyes and a passageway to many generations of history and culture. Even the busiest of Parisians, whether walking along the Seine's banks or across its bridges, can't help but slow down and admire the rewarding views.
Great boat tour. This is a must do for any traveller to Paris. Excellent commentary from the tour operators, great length of the cruise and best to go around sunset!
Boat trip was superlative. Boat trip was superlative - all the sights without the drudgery of walking - great value 14 Euros - Paris is a very spacious city great if you are very fit

Hop on Hop Off Boat Tour on the Seine. This is a great way to ride on the Seine and see the sights of Paris. We had a 1 day ticket and visited the Louvre, the Notre Dame and the D'orsay. It makes other stops as well.
Great way to enjoy the "must see's" in Paris. Take a boot trip and enjoy all the must see's within a 1-2 ohur boot trip (you can jump on/off) and it is priced at fine level.

What a beautiful river. We did 2 cruises on the Seine and loved every minute of them. The bridges and buildings take on a whole different character when viewed from the river. Our cruises were connected to our hop on hop off bus tours. A great way to see Paris.

It is a magic cruise. When you are in Paris, never miss a Seine cruise, it would be a saint if you miss it, finde your way to the Seine banks where you'll finde a whole life going on, walking on the banks of the Seine river is fun & relaxing, there are a lot of activities going on overthere that you should discover yourself, along the banks of the river you'll finde many tickets selling points related to different river crusing companies, i recomende the Botbus which give you 8 stops corresponding to 8 attractions( i where you can leave the boat at any one of them, visit the attraction near by & get back and board yourself to next boat using the same ticket ( hob in hob off) it costs 16 € per personEnjoy
So romantic. We walked both sides and I have to say the left was much better. Rich in culture, game stations, kids activities. Love how they make use of old ship cargo holders. Very resourceful
Night Cruise on the Seine. Beautiful new perspective on the landmarks and monuments of Paris. Highly recommend a Seine river cruise, especially at night!

River Cruise. We did the river cruise as part of the Paris Pass and becasue we had very little time in Paris, this cruise gave us a good view of some of the major attractions. The running commentary in 5 languages is very good.The only irritation was the other people on the boat who does not have the necessary respect for one's personal space or to sit down and allow everyone to appreciate the view

Bateaux Boat. Very cool. Sounds chincy, but do the first boat of the morning and it is cool .We saved it for the last day and were not disappointed. Grab a seat on either sone on the top deck and you won't be disappointed.Avoid sitting downstairs because you will mss the 360 degree view and all the amazing photo ops. Just be prepared for the old people that insist in standing up the whole way around do that others canon get the photos they want. I think they do it on purpose, so be quick with the photos and don't spend any time lining shots up. Just snap and you'll be amazed.
Lovely Walk. Always make time to walk down the Seine Tranquil beautiful Take a boat trip relax Most attractions within easy walking distance of the river
Batobus. Had a two day ticket was great value stopped at major attractionsTimed it right for lighting up of Eiffel Tower then used metro home to hotel Very goid service

River Cruise. we found using the river taxi as most enjoyable way to travel about. Major attractions are easily visited from the river and stops along it by taxi. Night time travel is an experience with the lights, peacefulness of the river, the restaurant boats and the people sitting along the river enjoying the evenings.

Best viewed from above. The grandeur is best viewed from above on one of the many bridges. The romance is lost once you go down to river level, it becomes a hangout for a picnic with wine and friends.

Fantastic Summer enjoyment. The river banks are set up for the summer with fun park like settings along the way. Places for kids to play ball, roller skate, a sand beach, music and dancing. Lounge chairs are everywhere available for you to enjoy while watching the boats and parade of people go by. So relaxing.

Just a marvelous walk. Just a marvelous walk both side of the river and also to cruise. For a less crowded tour of the Seine go from Pont Neuf with the vedette de pont neuf. Live commentry - no tapes or earphones - and come back to the Pont Neuf for lunch

Great way to see some attractions. We did the 2 1/2 hour Canal and River trio by Viator. The canal portion is slow at best with too much time spent going through the locks. Do yourself a favor and just do the river tour.

Boat cruise & foot bridges!. Amazing that this river feeds so much life! The foot bridges with the stories of the lock and it's importance to love in Paris! The cruise shows you a different perspective and allows you to enjoy the river that sustains Paris!
Beautiful scenery. You can't go to Paris without taking a tour on the river. Just lovely and interesting angle on everything.

A one hour boat ride really orients you to Paris. I really enjoyed the boat cruise. The guy was not know was understandable, but the views were wonderful and the understanding it gave me of the layout of central Paris was priceless. I recommended it.
Beautiful. I Love this river, it has so much beauty and history, perhaps not like the Thames but is prettier. Such a range of things to do from walk to sun bathe to tourism...

Allow some time for a cruise. Cruising the Seine is a great relaxing way to see Paris. Unfortunately we weren't happy with the Bateaux Parisiens cruise company as we were kept waiting in the heat for an longer than necessary and their boats seem shabbier than others on the river. On previous visits we'd used Bateaux Maches and they were cleaner and more comfortable.
River Cruise. After our visit to the Eiffel Tower we took the river cruise on the Seine in the late afternoon. It was great to see the sights of Paris from the river. Definitely worth the money.

Boat cruise on the River Seine. We took a boat cruise. It is very inexpensive and so worth the hour. Go around dusk to see the sun go down on Paris and enjoy the lights. We went at 7. Perfect timing to see the Eiffel Tower sparkle.
The City of Lights. Did the nighttime trip on the Seine...would highly recommend it as opposed to the daytime. Paris is so beautiful at night, and this was a great way to see it!
Beautiful at Night. We took a tour a night and it was so romatic the lights, the people and the music, just overwhelming, felt like I was in a movie.

It must be done at night. We decided to the River Seine Trip on the last night of our holidays and it was everthing that we expected it to be.We met lovely friendly people on the boat and we had a good laugh. The staff were friendly and helpful to us.
Beautiful sight. Went on a night cruise on the river and what an experience. It was one of the highlights of my tour. Was so nice seeing everything by night. Just opens your eyes to a different view.

Despite the rain, the romance of the Seine reigned. Unfortunately, it was cold and rainy every day of our visit here, but this did not deter from the magic of the Seine. As we walked along its banks, I heard myself humming the melodies of Edith Piaf and Yves Montand... Next time here, we will definitely take the bateau-mouche (it will be a spring of summer trip)!

Simply beautiful. Paris would not be what it is without Seine. It simply adds to the beauty of Paris. Seine with Eiffel in the backdrop. Late evenings and cruise dinner...all this is simply a photographer's pride...

Batobus. I can recommend the Batobus boats as they do a round-trip of most of the major sites along the Seine in central Paris. You can buy a day or 2 day ticket and then just hop on and off as you please.

Clean water of the river. The river winds its way through main places of tourist attraction of Paris. A beautiful view of the river can be seen from second stage of Eiffel Tower. I you has time you can enjoy ride in a small ship open to the sky. The best thing is its clear water.

The beauty of Paris!. The Seine River is just beautiful and such an amazing part of the city. The gorgeous bridges, the boats, the people... the heart of the city. Taking walks along the Seine was one of my favorite things to do in Paris. The views are so refreshing, peaceful, entertaining, and breathtaking. You can see some of the most famous landmarks walking or even cruising along the Seine. Soak up all there is along the Seine and enjoy!

Cruise. We had a cruise on the River Seine in the day time. I had a cruise at night before which I found was much better. The day time cruisedid not take you far enough up the river to see everything. At nightyou return to see the Eiffel Tower with all its lights on, a wonderful sight.

River point of view. Good point of reference when you are lost. Great way to see the sites from the bateaux. Daylight with tour commentary. Night time to see the lights of the city. Good way to get to the Eiffel tower instead of walking or by metro.
Fun!. A great way to see Paris! Fun trip up and down the river. Great information. Annoying people in front blocked our view a lot but all in all definitely on the must do list!
Take the Batobus. Take a day ticket for the hop on hop off river bus, and cover most of the River sights and bridges in a day. Avoid in the wet, but great on a sunny day.

Take your time strolling the banks. We visited Paris in the summer, and cliched as it might be, it was lovely to stroll along the banks of the Seine, especially in the Eastern parts of the Left Bank, where there are lots of activities and art installations along the banks itself, isolated from the busy street and throngs of tourists above.The Batobus was a wonderful boon for us. We had decided to explore Paris fully by foot, and the Batobus day-pass gave us the best of both worlds: saving on travel/transport costs and time whilst still getting the same scenic tour of the Seine as the one-trip tour boats, albeit without the tour commentary.

Pretty city river. The Seine winds its way through Paris. Indeed, it is because of the Seine that Paris came to be. Today, it's banks host various attractions of this beautiful city, like the Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower. Walking along the Seine , if one has the time, is a nice activity for a tourist. In the summer, it is even possible to spread a picnic blanket and watch Parisians walking by.

Night tours are amazing. We visited the Eiffel tower during the day and saved our river tour for our night trip so that we could experience the twinkling lights from the water, and we weren't disappointed. Although we booked our tickets online in advance in order to save money and guarantee a spot, tickets could easily be purchased at the window. It's apparently completely hit or miss on the crowds though. I read in advance about how important it is to line up early in order to both get the best seats and sometimes even be able to board, but we were there for the 9:30 cruise on July 31st and barely the entire top of the boat was full. I recommend sitting on the right side and close to the front even for the best views.It was magnificent seeing all the people lined up along the river in the various groups having mini parties up and down the river. It looks like so much fun!! There was everything from lounging couples to full on club party atmospheres with music and dancing.During the day, the river is lined with vendors and little spots to sit and relax with a snack or drink.
River Boat. Took a river boat opposite the Eiffel Tower which was good value to see the sites from a different angle. We were lucky with beautiful weather
Wonderful. Just walking around the Seine was amazing, so much to see. We walked from Eiffel tower to Notre Dame took about 30-40mins was absolutely wonderful.

Calm in the heart of Paris. I love rivers and the Seine must be a favourite. Beautiful to watch the river craft, better now cars are more restricted along the banks too. A real refreshment when tired from long city walks.

Relaxing ride and nice lunch. Our Hotel gave us an hour cruise on the Seine and a free lunch afterwards.We enjoyed the history given on the cruise.The water is clean and it was very relaxing.All of Paris is beautiful to see.This is another way to do it.

Wonderful to take a boat. There's many ways to know this historic river. You can go walking through its sides, knowing its bridges. There's lots of options to go through a boat tour, even with a dinner included.

Romantic. Me and my partner went on a river cruise at night along the river Seine. It was a beautiful evening if not a little chilly very romantic and very informative, our guide was brilliantThere is also a lovely little bar as you get off the boat.
Seine River by Night. Loved the Seine River Paris Illumination Tour. Traveling the river by night is the best way to see the City of Lights!

Do a boat trip. We had a great experience on our boat trip. It was almost serene to just sit back, relax and take in the beautiful surroundings and get a different view from the many attractions we had visited.

River Cruise. Our river cruise was conducted by a lovely college student. We saw so much from the Seine. All large river cities were built along the water so you could literally see the Best of Paris.

Walk along the Seine instead. Instead of spending time queueing and sitting on a crowded ferry we did something we now consider our best experience in Paris: We walked along the Seine from the Eiffel tower to Musee d'Orsay. This walk has been upgraded to i clude lounge chairs, climbing walls for kids, outdoor serving ++. It's free, and much better than the boat trip.

Relaxing time!. We took a boat tour after a friend advised.It was a very nice experience as you can relax and enjoy one hour.All were very organized and we received many historical info regarding all the buildings along the river.We booked just the cruise without lunch/dinner as talking with some other people food on board in general is very poor.

One of the greatest rivers of the world. I have always loved the Seine. It is beautiful and there is always a lot to see and a lot of restaurants to eat in. The Bateau Mouches are interesting to observe and many of the main sites of Paris are along its banks.This year, I took part in the run from the Eifel Tower to Versailles which involves running along the river to Issy. It was a delight. We also went for several walks along the river, which is really the thing that holds Paris together. It meanders greatly and always seems to be changing direction. A good place to view the river is from the top of the Eifel Tower
adele. city is noisy. but river. ı cannot tell ıt. just walk. just watch the river. think your love. forget the rest
river trip. Had a 1 hour sight seeing tripo from base of eiffel tower excellent trip but no food on board and poor food available on the shore side
Walk Beside it, Cruise it. Stroll alongside, take a boat ride, cross bridge after bridge. Stop and savor the views around it. This is Paris!

THE BEAUTIFUL RIVER SEINE. Our hotel arranged a river dinner cruise for using Paris de Yachts. The food was awesome and the cruise gave us an opportunity to sit on the outside upper deck and watch all the sights before and after dinner.

Sailed down the Seine. Well worth taking a sunset boat ride, the light is amazing and you get a different perspective. We were encouraged by our friend who had been last year and we were pleased we went. Not very expensive either.

Beautiful and inviting!. I love hanging around the Seine! It's fun to watch all the boats and people. Be sure to go on the boat tour! You buy your tickets down the stairs by Notre dame! Relaxing and informative!

Peaceful walking Place in Paris!. The lower road next to the River Seine is closed to traffic. It's a nice place to get away from the tourists. There are places to get something to eat a long the walk.
River Seine. May sound corny, but take a boat tour. You'll be glad you did. Everything looks different from the water. And the trip is surprisingly romantic!

A Bateau Rouge is a must. Always take a boat tour. Its an hour long, lovely at almost any time of year, and just a nice relaxing way to enjoy the gorgeous architecture of Paris...plus great photo opps.

Dinner cruise - Bateaux Parisiens. Liked: Great views of the Eiffel Tower. We took pictures of the Tower wit the full moon in the bacvkground. Good food. Great service.
Nothing to dislike. Would highly recommend this cruise.
Awesome river cruise. Beautiful day in late September for a river cruise. Was able to see all the sights during the cruise.

Something for everyone. Safe and friendly to all a walk along seine is a must. Have wonderful areas where kids can play. Have nature areas where people can go relax on hammocks. People cycling, skateboarding, rollerblading, running, wonderful on a summers day.

The Liquid Heart of Paris. Nearly all things worth seeing in Paris are a long the Seine River. Physically, the river is not impressive in size and it totally "civilize" with concrete, parks, buildings and it is well used. We took the night cruise on the Seine and saw the Parisian's having late dinners, making love, dancing, and listening to music all along the banks. On the hour the Eiffel Tower start flashing its beautiful lights. Again, not to missed.

Always near it. Yes, every places are conected with the river, and i cant stop to ran near in. Dont walk only in the streats that goes near, go down the stairs and walk slowly nesr the water.... What a peace .... I have been there at 6.30 in moorning.... Beautiful fotos.

Ride a bike along the Seine. This is the best way to experience the Seine and save your feet but beware that many of the bikestations malfunction and you need to limit each trip to 30 mins to avoid extra charges. Try to get a map of where the station nearest your destination is located to avoid time wasting at the other end.

Night cruise on the river is a must. There were many options for a dinner or evening cruise - white linen table cloths, two-hour cruise (E100/pp), dinner on shore, one-hour cruise (E35/pp) cruise only (E15). The city and the Eiffel Tower are spectacular at night. On our cruise someone narrated the sights. there were snacks and wine/beverages available. We loved it - I would do it again in a heartbeat.

Just beautiful.. What's not to like about this beautiful river. A boat trip is a must and there are many tour options in this regard. Seeing Paris from the River Seine is special and not to be forgotten, Notre Dame , the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower and so many other treats to savour and remember.
Gorgeous. The river is beautiful! especially at night it's a lovely spot to go and sit by the water with a friend or spouse! (bring wine!) :)

Do this first. We did a one hour cruise the first night we arrived. It was a great way to get a feel for where the major sites are to get your bearings.
We took the 8 pm cruise so the Tower lights were just coming on.
Very cool to see the light show on the Eiffel Tower.
Beautiful. Any visit to Paris requires a stroll along the river. Perfect for photo ops, bridges galore and riverside parks. Loved!

nice and cleen. i remembered river seine not so clean
last visit i found it cleaner and well preserved,
left bank between pont d'austerlitz and musee
d'orsay is easy and convenient for walkers;with
small gardens,ramps, art objects and boats-
and beautiful view of paris

Relaxing.. Walk beside the river and enjoy the views.Evening time is great for a river cruise.Pay between 12-16 euros for a great cruise on the river and see a different view of the Eiffel tower,notre dame.Louve Etc.Well worth the money.

River Seine and Canals Tour. Enjoyed the River Seine and commentary about the key buildings along the river. Fascinated by the tour of the canals, particularly the canal running under the Bastille and passing through the locks. Booked through Viatour.

River Seine. This tour was combined with the tour from the Eiffel Tower. Such a great end to a glorious day. Weather was typical fall weather for the US, just gorgeous all around. Captured some beautiful pictures off the river, especially of Notre Dame Cathedral!

It's alive in daytime and at night. In daytime it's fun to see boats and barges zip by transporting loads of tourists and other cargo:) At night beware of homeless people and rats! The rats are fat and big as cats. They are well fed and are not afraid of people. Rather people (especially young women and girls) are afraid of them.

Great alternative to see Paris. I liked that I was able to see the people dancing in several spots. It was endearing to see people having fun in public! I probably wouldn't have see this if I were walking or on a bus tour.
Cruise. We took only the daytime cruise (as opposed to the evening dinner cruise). Very informative, but the view of many of the landmarks was disappointing compared to the view from land.

Superb.. Obivously, walking along the banks of the Seine is free. It's great free fun.The longer the walk, the more enchanting. (And the more tired your feet will be, but who cares.)Bring your metro card in case you find yourself too far from your hotel with too tired feet.Hint: Bring a padlock from home with your names engraved. There's a bridge over the Seine with literally hundreds and hundreds of locks from people all over the world.
Site seeing River Tour. take a trip down the river,there are lots of tours to pick from.this will show you all Paris has to offer and more.It's total different from the street.
I love this river. The sunshine again makes this a perfect day. Either walking or cruising, a romantic and quite beautiful way to spend a day.

Cruising. We did a night cruise, was awesome to see the Eiffel tower all lit up at night was probably the most quietest part of the city. I didn't find the city very romantic at all, but here it was if you wanted it I suppose.
Get on the cruise. It is great way to see paris to get on the cruise for sunset, it is beautiful, the building along the river are so nice, you feel so relax and during sunset.
Quintessential Paris!. What is a trip to Paris without a walk over the Seine!....so many views from either side of the bridges....wonderful walking, wonderful lights in the evening..wonderful Paris!

Hop on/off tour was good. We cruised with the hop on and off tour. A little crowded but had a seat. We did it one way all in one go. Didn't get off and on again. Nice to see the river from this angle.
A boat trip is a must do. The river seine is a main thoroughfare for lots of the icon must sees in Paris. Catch the ferry to the Louvre and see Paris a different way

AMA ALEGRO Paris/Normandy Cruise. Sept 2014We are fairly seasoned travelers. We had looked forward to this cruise and expected high standards as we have traveled with AMA on once before. They exceeded our expectations.The crew very professional and warmly courteous, food /service was very nice.We especially enjoyed the tours which were included in the fare. Monet's house and gardenswe're much more impressive than I had expected, Rueon was impressive and the light show on the Cathedral was just amazing, never seen anything like it. You can see it on YouTube but it doesn't come close to the live experience Normandy, Omah Beach and the American cemetery, what can one say....Also, I have to say we were blessed with just perfect weather 70/80f during the entire cruiseThe passengers were mostly seniors, nice group. Piano music every night, a few nights they had local entertainment.We had a French Balcony which was very comfortable but not muchroom to spare.All in all I would highly recommend this cruise.

Viking River Cruise on the Seine. My wife and I just completed a River cruise with Viking on the River Seine. We started in Paris went up to Normandy and back to Paris. As we cruised the Seine we had wonderful views of the Limestone cliffs towering above us and the beautiful homes that line the small villages. We stopped in Giverny and went to Monet's home and visited his gardens. We sailed down further and stopped in the town of Rouen. We did a walking tour of the town and visited the location where Joan of Arc was burned at the stake. At night they have a spectacular animated light show that is shown on the facade of the Gothic Notre Dame Cathedral. We visited the Normandy beaches (very touching and moving) and then started back to Paris. Along the way back we stopped at Les Andelys and visited the ruins of the Castle Chateau Gaillard. Built by Richard the Lionheart in 1196. Even in ruins its an imposing structure guarding the Seine.As for the Ship. We were on the Viking Spirit. The accommodations are on the cramped side but other wise very comfortable. The ship was kept clean. The lounge area was very comfortable The staff on the Viking Spirit was over the top nice and always helpful. My wife and I would definitely do this river cruise again.

a lovely cruise. We booked a cruise for the river and canals, but underestimated the time to get to the meeting point. We missed that boat, but just caught another boat to cruise the Seine. Beautiful river with lovely bridges and great views of the city. We then walked down the stairs and walked along the river on the left bank, and thought of Gene Kelly dancing his way on the walk in An american in Paris.
Walk, don't sail. I recommend walking the embankments. The general river cruise is just a teaser; you need to get ashore and experience the riverside life!

Batobus every time!. This is the way to travel for me - up and down the Seine in a boat, taking in the wonderful architecture and the bridges (especially Pont Neuf and Pont Alexander III) There is nothing quite so romantic.

Dining by the river. We enjoyed the area and lunch by the river cruise dock but we didn't go on it because of two things… with the high walls, the views don't seem to be the best, and also there are several different types of cruise boats so inquire which one you are buying for… some are larger and open on top while others are smaller and closed in.

River Cruise is wonderful. Superb experience with a river cruise that takes you past the best of the monuments & heritage places. A dinner on the cruise is like the icing on the cake. Totally worth it.
Night cruise. Highly recommend doing a night tour, we used CROISIERES RIVER CRUISES.....just a wonderful experience.
Just beautiful. Don't forget to take the Bateaux-Mouche river cruise. We took a day-time cruise - views of Notre Dame and close up of the Tower. Awesome.

Seine River- Night Illumination Tour. The Paris City Tours included a River Cruise, Coach Bus Tour of Paris Monuments by Night and Dinner at a lovely French Restaurant in the Champs Élysées. All went smoothly and as advertised. The tour was relaxing and enchanting with the romantic lit river and up-lit grand monuments. A wonderful and worthwhile experience. Food was good too.

It is wonderful. There is an easy understanding between the parisian and the Seine. They are friends. Tourists quickly understand the welcoming of this wonderful river. The boats, the bridges, the gentle mobility of the slow. You just want to be near it and life does swarm to the banks. Just lovely, night or day

Rats at night. Walking along the banks of the
Seine is a highlight but at night when to here are fewer people rats scuttle and plop into the river. Chose your spot and your time to go.
Scenic boat ride. A must do in Paris is to take a Seine River cruise. You get to see a completely different view of Paris.

Boardwalk all the way. On both sides of the Seine river there is a boardwalk allowing you to walk close the the water. Plus it keeps you away from the busy streets of Paris. Note: if you are looking for food or bathrooms, you will not find many here.
Don't miss a ride on the Seine. The boat ride is a treat and there are some that are hop on, hop off. We did the Bateaux Parisiens, which was a wonderful experience - worth it.
Take a river cruise. A river cruise can give you a good ideal of how Paris is laid out. Its nice to not be walking all the time.
Big body of water. Might be good to take a cruise on. Just saw it walking by. Lot's going on here. Would visit it the next time around.

seine cruise. this was a lovely cruise.1 hr from 8pm.
just as we got on the Eiffel tower lit up.
the sights were great and the boat very spacious.

Hop on and Off. The fastest and most preferred way for a tourist to get around Paris in a day going through 7 historical sites
You also do have an option of taking a Cruise by the river for Dinner while take you through breath taking night lights of Paris and majestically lit up Eiffel tower
River trip. took this trip one afternoon, well worth it. Quite a long trip but very informative and leisurely, but a bit too many tourists.
Very Pretty. It is really nice to just walk along the river with plenty of pretty buildings and trees on either side

Seine River Boat Ride at Night Perfect Birthday Present!!!. We took a Seine Boat ride @ night and it was the perfect birthday present seeing the city lit up at night was so breathtaking and beautiful!!! Seeing the Eiffel Tower all lit up was icing on the birthday cake!!! :)

A walk along history. No visit to Paris is complete without a walk along the River Seine. History sails by as you meander along either side of the river, which is always lined with visitors, regardless of the weather.

Waterryyy ;). The river is so beautiful especially at light when the bridges are all lit up. The water seems to go on forever and its lovely when your walking by the river at night and you can still see all the boats going out for the evening :)
Lovley day.. Very interesting, superb weather, a very well worth trip, would certainly recommend this, and would do it again.

Huge river, lined by book, map and poster sellers. as above.
really enjoyed browsing and bought a couple of posters.
very peaceful walking water side and beautiful between the Louvre and Notre Dame

Awesome. Is there anything to dislike about the Seine? I doubt! The most romantic walk I have ever walked. Perfect place to be in Paris anytime of the day. And walk along it, although the Seine River Cruise is also good but the real deal is walking and enjoying the view, the ambiance, the culture of Paris.

A must when in Paris. One can walk for seemingly miles along the promenade alongside this beautiful river, all the while enjoying the hustle and bustle of the vendors and also of course the fine buildings that line this river. Also not to be missed is a river cruise which takes about one hour and has English commentary with respect to the sights and buildings. We also took a dinner cruise that was most enjoyable.

Such a long river that you can stroll along and see lots of activity. Lots of bridges to cross and lots of painters and souvenirs on sale. Many river cruises, including meals if desired and check out the padlocks that line one of the bridges - a tribute to lovers from all over the world.
Beautiful River Seine. What a lovely river. It was great over the weekend to see so many people out enjoying what activities are on offer along the riverside. Lots of amazing bridges.
Great trip, a musts do.. Best to,do two trips, day then evening to see Paris at its best. Learn the history from a qualified tour guide . So,much to do,in Paris a week is not long enough.
Romantic cruise. Cruising the River Seine is one of the things you shouldn't miss when in Paris. It's so romantic and you will definitely enjoy the beautiful views.
Dont miss this. We took a dinner cruise, the food was deluxe the service 5 star and the sites kept me clicking like a crazy person with my camera. All in all it was devine.

The best river in the world. The Seine is my favourite river in the world.
You can do anything here.
From an expensive cruise,to the economical hop on and off river buses,to a simple stroll that costs nothing.
All of which done with world famous sights to see.
You can breath the culture along the river bank.
Paris en Scene. Make sure you take a cruise ride on la seine to get the full experience...we enjoyed a beautiful 3 course meal on Paris en Scene...would def recommend to others
the river. The river was like any other but had some breathtaking building along side it. Very nice for a leisurely stroll.
<3. beautiful ... just how it looks in pictures ... i also defintely recommend taking a cruise on the seine especially at night !!!

Great place for a walk. We were staying near the Eiffel Tower and were looking for a quiet uncrowded place to just walk and get some fresh air and excercise. Along the banks of the Seine was just right. And oh what scenery both on shore and on the river.

Walking in Paris. The walk along the River has beautiful views and is a people-watching MUST. There are several vendors set up along the waterway - some great artists - wish I had a bigger suitcase to bring more back!

Very Romantic River and A Cruise Will Give You The Best Of Seine!. The bridges are cute and the locks of love are phenomenal. Walking over the bridges and surrounding the river banks are awesome experience.
relaxing river trip. The river trip was brilliant and well worth the 13 euros. You can get a really good view of the Eiffel tower as well. I just wished we gone on the hop of hop on instead.
Dinner cruise. Everything we could have wished for. a great night. plenty to drink and the food was lovely. A great atmosphere on board with friendly and helpful service.

Night River tour. Night river tour is the best option to see Paris in night lights without any "foot work" It is quite relaxing and you can target some of the places to visit them during the day.
I took Bateaux Parisiens which is right next to Eiffel Tower, quite easy to be found.
Cruise!. Worth the $15 for an hour long cruise. Great view to see the sights. Nighttime offers a different view as well.

Wonderful night cruise with vedettes du pont neuf. Leaving from this location seems to be the way to get on a boat that has an upper deck. This really allowed great views ( get there early as the upper deck filled fast). The trip was an hour with a French and English guide pointing out the major sights. A really lovely way to see Paris at night.
River Seine. Went on the boat trip , it was very informative and relaxing , lots to see and hear about .It was a beautiful day .after the boat trip we walked alongside the Seine for a bit .Lovely .

walking with romance side by side. Seine has her own personal charm only saying "Seine", and taking a riverside walk, from a bridge to another, or with a boat is really special. the wind is always there to just remember not no stay to much in one place and to continue admiring the soundings.
This is Paris. The River Seine is Paris. Watching the boats is as relaxing as walking along the river. There are some nice little bars along the way to get a drink.
We booked a river cruise to take in the sights. A good way to see the sights along the river. Informative guide and in English. Would recommend for an overall view of Paris

Just Beautiful !. We have seen and travelled on many rivers throughout the world on our travels but the Seine must rank in the top 5.We did an 'Aperitif' cruise with Viator ( don't bother, it didn't even come close ).We also did the ' Batu Bus' ? Also with Viator. ( they are 'on sellers', by the way ).The get on, get off cruise boat that travels the Seine stopping at many interesting places. Great value for money.I could write about the ridiculous queues to get into the attractions along the Seine but in this day and age of everyone wanting to see the World and now being able to, it is a necessary evil. I'm glad we saw all of these wonderful attractions 30 years ago when the World was a lot saner. Persevere and queue... it is worth it !

Who keeps urinating?. The walk along the River Seine, day or night, is romantic, whatever the occasion. The evening wine, beer and bagettes avec fromage are a highlight. What is NOT is the stink permeating from all of the walls and especially the underpasses around the 5th quarter. Who is in such a rush that they have to urinate along this public walkway? I mean, puh-lease. It's likely 99.9 per cent men, and that said, why can't you fellows hold your bladders, or go find a toilet? Enough already. The consequences of your selfishness stink.
Boat Tour- Eh. I did a tour of the Seine. It was unexciting. By the time they said everything in 5 languages, you were well past whatever it was.

Great riverside walk. I've always wanted to stroll under the bridges of the Seine and to do it on my honeymoon was very special. Many of the interesting landmarks in Paris are on or very near the river so there is plenty to see and the large variety of boats (pleasure and working) plying their trade means the vistas are always changing. The weather was perfect and we loved it.
Dine in luxury. We had a lunch cruise, what a great idea if you've never done it, do it. So much to see and the food was divine.
Bateau Mouche. We took a trip along the river with Bateau Mouche and found it very good value. It was 1 hour 10 minutes with commentary in English too and only 13 euros.

Enjoyed our river cruise. Walked over from the Citadenes Hotel and walked along the Seine. Didn't have reservations,etc, but located a place to board one of the river boats. We didn't have to wait long and really enjoyed the sights and information provided by the tour guide.
Boat Tour. Took the 1 and 1/2 boat tour (les Bateaux-mouches) at around 8pm. Good to see Paris at night from the river.

Something new every time. A working river that's also great for tourists. See the working barges, tourist boats and so much more - including hordes of Parisiens eating and drinking from picnics at the river side. Great.

Do the evening 2 hour trip. We took a boat trip up and down the Seine from other side Nortra Dame. The boat has to go through a lock which is another experience that can be done. The ride is lovely and serene.

Paris To Normandy. We took a river cruise on the Seine from Paris to Normandy. I enjoyed browsing through the historic and picturesque villages where we stopped along the way. I did not enjoy some of the refineries and industrial areas that we passed. The Normandy beaches were an emotional and moving experience, but the bus ride there and back to the ship was too long.

Beautiful at night. There are multiple river cruises that are available through out the day on river Seine. This is one of the best ways to understand the history and geography [ :)] of Paris.There is an hour long cruise ( very informative), a dinner cruise and also a hop-on-hop-off day pass.
Good but...... Nice place to visit in the evenings. walk along the banks. cross the bridges. Council needs to clean up promenade as lot of spots had stench of urine. Spoils the beauty & romance
A Fun Tour. This was a fun thing to do. We really enjoyed seeing Paris from the water. You were able to see things from different vantage point, making for lots of different and amazing pictures.

Cruise on River Sienne. I love the dinner cruise on River Siene at night. Last time was January and Paris weather was mild. The boat was enclosed with large windows to see most of the sites. There is nothing like seeing the Eifel tower in all its lighted glow at night from the Siene river. Definitely do not go for food. The wine was tolerable but I could not eat food. Maybe some of the other cruise lines have better food but again I was not there for food. In fact I was glad food was terrible. It gave me an excuse for late night meal back in Bastille area where I was staying. But a cruise on Siene is a Paris must. My third time.
Recommend Evenig Cruise. We did this our first night in Paris and it was a fine way to enjoy some of the city sights. Relaxing and beautiful as the buildings are lit for the evening.

Get on the river...to escape the traffic. Tour the river at night and see the city in a totally different way. There are a number of boating companies to accomplish this. Explore each and every bridge that covers the Seine..they all have a story. The river has a fun and younger vibe at night...get ready to see the young people of Paris hanging out and enjoying the peace and quiet. Worth it!!

A relaxing way to see Paris.. There is something calming about travelling/visiting cites on a boat, you can see as much without the crowd around you. I have been on those tourists boats before (les Bateaux-mouches) but as one of our relatives had never tried it before and has difficulties walking, this is a great way of seeing this beautiful city. Interesting and anecdotal comments in several languages from individual headphones. These boats have open windows, toilets and food/drinks vending machines on board. Just sit down (indoor or outdoor), relax and take lots of photos like we did.

Walk near it, ride on it -- a MUST. Our first evening in Paris, we treated ourselves to a memorable meal and river tour aboard a 1939 boat named Le Calife. We walked home to our hotel across Pont des Artes tisking not only at the overabundance of locks, but also at the presence of street vendors continuing to sell locks after portions of the historic bridge collapsed. During several days of our visit, we returned to the Seine, looking at it near the Cathedral of Notre Dame, near the Jardin des Tuileries. We crossed over several bridges (there are 37) marveling at the art and architecture. We enjoyed tales of growing up on a barge from our Citroen tour driver. The heart of the city.
nighttime romance. The music being played that echoed when going under a bridge was obviously selected to set the romantic mood to fit the sights of Paris at night.

I was entranced. The Seine seems to be so much a part of Parisian life ... no matter where I went in Paris, I found myself looking for a glimpse of the River. We took a dinner cruise at night and everyone in Paris seemed to be on its banks talking, laughing, dancing and enjoying their evening with friends and family .. I loved that!

Beautiful. Such a lovely walk along the river took us about an hour and a half to walk from the Eiffel Tower to Notre dame along the river. So romantic and so many sites to see. We also went on a boat trip along the river which was much quicker but the walk was much more enjoyable :-)
Beautiful view. 5-6pm visit would be better, the wonderful view of the city on both sides are unparalleled, light breeze, simply beautiful and romantic.
Just sit down and relax. Get something nice to eat and drink and set down next to the seine. This is what the french do and you should definately follow their tradition!
Aussie Travellers. Loved walking over the bridges. Loved the sandy beach near Rue Saint Marcel. There are interesting barges.

Batobus. Our visit to Paris this time included rides up and down the seine on the hop on hop off Batobus. This was so easy to use and had good access. The queues were not to long and you can easily buy a ticket on the day with no need to book in advance.Well worth the money to view the sights of Paris from the river
The heart of Paris. Jogged in the morning, walked all throughout the day, and strolled along it at night. Beautiful river in the center of the beautiful city of lights..
Romantic River Cruise. I like being on the boat and being able to see the scenery as we passed by. We were on the top deck and you can see so much more from the top deck.
Romantic Stroll. It was a dream come true to stroll along the Seine in the evening. It embodied all that I thought Paris would be. Can't wait to go back.
Bateaux Parisienne. Pricey at €132 but, food exquisite, wine superb & live music devine. Well worth it for a special occaision, like my Sister's birthday! Or for the Romantics amongst you.
River of Dreams. The Seine River cruise is a must while in Paris. You will never ride down a river with such beautiful sites around you. So romantic and breathtaking.

A Good Way To See the Sights of Paris. One thing all visitors to Paris should do is to have a ride on a Bateau Mouche. Most go from Pont Neuf and upstream as far as the Eiffel Tower and back down around the Ile De La Citie. The cruise lasts 1 hr and is good value. One tip though. Don't have a beer in the bar while waiting. 10 Euros for a demi!! Take your own.

Classic Paris. Pont Neuf was as usual and any crossing of this historic River is exciting. There are bridges full of padlocks and paths to walk under to get a different perspective, especially at night.

Nights better. Fabulous, go at night, we did the last cruise (10ish) from the Port Nuif bridge, island side ( this was tricky to find). Hardly anyone on boat and the young lady did a splendid commentry both inb french and english.
The bonus was a perfect warm night and the lightshow on Eiffels tower
Boat Ride. We took a family boat ride (4 of us) & went under many beautiful bridges & could see many great buildings on both banks of the river.

Pleasant walk. Pleasant walk. A nice relaxing way to spend an evening, if you have time. Several places to access the river walk. Watch out for bicycles and skate boarder's. Check out the bridges, many are ornamental. Take your lock onto a bridge, if you're in love.

1 hr River tour is well worth the price. Has a hand set to be set to your language and explains the main sites as you go. I recommend sitting on the outside rather than inside. A lovely relaxing hour tour.

Riverwalk. We used Batobus for our walk. There are some options for river's walk. One of them is Batobus. It has 7 stops and you can use it for one or two days.It is a hop on hop off type.Others options are with cruise boats. They travel on the Seine and you can only see the town or see and eat and drink on the board.

The thread that runs through Paris. The River Seine is the connection point of everything in Paris, from here you can see and explore all the wonderful sights and scenes of Paris. It runs past the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, and most of the other must see's in Paris. There is also floating restaurants on the Seine that enables you to have lunch or dinner while floating past the sights on the walls of the Seine.Truly amazing.
Romantic Paris. Taking a boat ride on the river seine is one of the most beautiful ways to enjoy its sights. Its especially romantic on nice evenings where you can appreciate the lights.

Loved it!. We got a boat ticket that enabled us to get on and off the glass covered boats at various attractions up and down the Seine. The river lets you go past gorgeous attractions and just soak in the atmosphere of Paris. Well worth a visit to have a look at the gorgeous bridges, especially on a nice day like when we were there. Would recommend the pass that let's you get on and off the boat over two days for just 18 euros.
A great way to see Paris.. A fabulous way to see Paris in the day or at night is via a trip down the Seine. Look out for the bathing beauty!

Romantic and beautiful. The most Fantastic river cruise I have ever had, mainly because it was in Paris.... My favourite place. It is lovely to see The Eiffel Tower all lit up at night from the river. During the day it is super too.
Do not miss the Seine River Cruise. My husband and I and our friends decided on the evening dinner cruise on the Seine. Music, Dancing, great food!!! We loved it and would do it again!!!

cruise. went on the river cruise at night and fabulous would do it again but get tickets first is a must as the queues go on forever will probably do the cruise with meal next time, you have a running commentary on the cruise which is great as it not only gives you where you are and what to look at but also the history of paris and it is well worth it only 10 euros bargain to say the least and it takes about an hour
One of the best value trips ever. Lucky with weather, but what a great service, like it so much we, went three times, try the last boat at 7.15 great night shots
Eiffel to Notra Damn. We took the Ferry from opposite the Effiel Tower to Notra Damn. An awesome way to see Paris from a different perspective.

So Beautiful!. The Seine River is such a beautiful place to just relax and walk around or just sit and look at for hours. Everything about it is so pleasing to the eye. I would definitely recommend tsking a bost tour right st sunset down the river because you get the most besutiful views of different areas in Paris, especially Notre-Dame and the Tour Eiffel. Thid little tour is a must!

Autumn walk by The River Seine. A casual stroll along the banks of the River Seine reveals many of the scenic delights of Paris. The Eiffel Tower, D'Orsay museum, lovers walking, bridges crossing, River traffic, living history, Le Louvre, cyclists, tourists, locals. All doing their own thing.River cruises & floating restaurants are very easily approached from many stairs & vantage points.

Must do!!!. This is my favourite bit of Paris, intact if it was my first visit i would do two seine cruises, one in the morning and one at night. Because its pariss!! This time i did it around 7 pm, its lasts for about and hour and the twinkling of eiffel tower had just begun. The twinkling happens every hour for 5 mintes and the view is breath taking!

Views that we remember very fondly. Our “Paris and the Heart of Normandy” cruise aboard the Viking Spirit took us from Paris to Rouen and back. The Paris segment of the cruise was very enjoyable, providing views that we remember very fondly and photos that we’re glad to have in our collection. No tourist should consider his/her Paris resume complete unless it includes a sightseeing cruise on the Seine.

Free sparking Water Dispenser on the left bank side.. WE were walking along the Seine on the left bank and we found a water dispenser that dispensed COLD sparkling water by one of the exercise areas along the river. What a treat! It was hot and sunny and we filled our water bottle two times.
Peaceful with nice views. I recommend a boat ride on the Seine for a different perspective of Paris..makes for a nice relaxing break to other tourist activities.

relax and enjoy. Following the guide of another reviewer we arrived in Paris late afternoon after a long 19 hour trip. We went for a trip on the Seine and it was a great time to relax but see some of the highlights of Paris before heading back to the hotel. Would recommend to anyone

Nice. It is indeed a historical river. It does seem to criss cross all over. Wider in some spots then others.
Seeing a river in Europe is a little unusual in its self,always something calming about water views.
it's so romantic. no matter if you choose to walk, take a boat, grab a drink, or simply fall into your nothing box, you will feel what the english word romantic truly means.

So nice strolling along this romantic river.. I am more than sure that of all the rivers I've seen this is placed in the top 3 of the most beautiful rivers in the world. Simply because it is a magical river, full of history and romantic at the same time. Admire this beautiful river by day and equally in the evening or cross it on board one of the many boats that sail daily up and down the Seine. Bridges and beautiful angles for breathtaking photos for what is undoubtedly one of the top attractions in Paris.

Wonderful tour. Great way to see Paris in the evening. Lines to get on the boats are very long and pushy, once on the boat it was a really nice little tour. Not to long just right and very informative.

Amazing service. The meals were average but the service was immaculate.The wine list was somehow under stocked.I went for lunch with my hubby and our taxi driver took us therewhen we requested to go for a meal.

Take a boat on the river and visit Paris from a different angle. it is a marvelous way to visit Paris to take a boat on the river Seine. There are the typical Bateau Mouche and also boats run by the more or less state owned but and metro company. You won't be disappointed.
Nice Day for a Cruise. Cruise venues are everywhere. Probably stay away from those that offer food packages. If you are an American, make sure you get an English speaking guide.
Very Romantic. Make sure you take the time to take a tour on the River Seine. The views are awesome and the trip very relaxing.

The Seine IS Paris. If you had only an hour in Paris - walk along the Seine. The newly pedestrianised section is brilliant - and with the bridges being so close to one another it is easy to cross from Rive Gauche to Rive Droite - always something different to see and it is just experiencing Paris walking along its embankments.

The river amore. The walk on the lower path near the river is very scenic and pleasant. some of the bridges that you see are beautiful. also, there are many restaurants to be tried on the river barges.

River Seine lunch cruise. I would highly recommend this river cruise. I purchased this as an excursion to Paris on the cruise I was on this summer. The food was incredible, lots of wine (it's Paris), and stunning views of both sides of the river. Amazing, I am now dreaming of my return to Paris and the River Seine. A must do if visiting this beautiful city.

River Seine cruise on MS Anacoluthe. We travelled on the Seine having booked a 6 day cruise with Great Rail Journeys. Following a Eurostar trip to Paris and a coach to MS Anacoluthe we were welcomed by a fantastically friendly crew who spent the entire cruise making us comfortable. The food was excellent - especially the 4 course dinners with an endless supply of a choice of wine. The highlight of the cruise was the passage through the floodlit centre of Paris with the flashing lights on the Eiffel Tower. Other places visited during the week included Monet's garden at Giverny, the Sevres porcelain factory, Conflans Ste Honorine (with a fabulous chapel in a converted barge) and other wonderful towns and chateaux in the Paris environs.
