The boat is a converted barge with 25 cabins, bar, library and lounge and plenty of comfortable outside seating. It would make many 5 star hotels look insignificant. Thoroughly recommended.
The Real River Walk. The Seine River in good weather is one of the great evening strolls of any city in the world, the City of Lights is well named
I love it...... Fantastic with walk or with river ship is great experience..... I want more....please.Is better on sunset time because the light of Paris city is really great.

Wonderful to see. Walked on both sides and walked across it. Wonderful site and surprisingly clean. Saw nothing floating on it, no garbage or refuse.Lots and lots of boats traveling on it in both directionsAlso saw quite a few barges where people seemed to be living and even some eateries.

Paris from a river point of view!. My husband and I were in Paris for 3 days before joining a river cruise through Europe, and this 1 hour river cruise along the Seine was a highlight for us. Seeing Paris from the famous waterway was delightful, and the awesome sight of the Notre Dame Cathedral just on the banks really took our breath away. There is optional commentary on board if you wish, or you can scoot up to the top deck and just snap away as we did. The sun was glorious and everything was picture perfect. This river cruise is highly recommended, so just leave an hour aside for this and you won't regret it!

great river tour. Bring a hat and sit at the top in open so you get a view of both sides of the Seine and sit opposite of the dock close to the front to take pictures and video. Great way to get a general feel for where things are. Some hotels give free seasonal tickets

Best way to get to all the major sites. Hop on Hop off is the way to see everything. 18 euro for a two day pass and you can hop on and off as much as you want. They leave every 20 minutes so not a real wait either
Nice scenery. I think is very nice to go cruising on time night, we did.The lights are so beautiful and so romantic if you have somebody to cuddle and keep you warm.

ROMANTIC, ROMANTIC, ROMANTIC!!. Just imagine listening to all those scratchy versions of La vie En rose on your old ep's,then imagine surveying beautiful architecture along the banks of this beautiful river.Then listening to the voices of the vociferous gallic voices as they chatter away, their fast flowing competing with those of this romantic river as it flows along this vibrant city, the finest on earth!!

River cruise on the Seine. I took a river cruise with my family and we were headed toward the eiffel tower vicinity. They are moderately priced and can get you to different parts of the city rather quickly. You will be amazed at the number of bridges you see along the way.

A nice view & a refreshing breeze. The river is lovely to look at, a nice break from all the stone and concrete. Many natives seem to flock to the bars down there, such as Flow, and relax in beach chairs. If you take the cruise, just don't pay for the picture.

just right amount of infomation. took a typical tourist cruise for 1 hour, from Notre Dame area, good commentary, about the right amount of live (not recorded) information given by 'Chloe', and she was happy to answer any questions etc

Best transport method to see Paris. Spent end of May in Paris and the River Seine boats allowed us to take advantage of all Paris attractions. The access is superb using the'' Bato bus'' boats. They are regular as clockwork and allow you to sample the main 6 attractions close to the river points . Notre Dame is best viewed from all points from the river and the speed is slow to allow you to get some superb photos in a relaxing setting. The central part of Paris is served by the river and its boats are convenient for most attractions. We had a 2 day ticket for 18 Euros and walked the rest of the time. Very novel,cheap and convenient way to see Paris . Also warm and sheltered from the occasional rain !! .

A great experience. This trip is well worthwhile. It is wonderful to view the monuments and museums from a different perspective and it gives you a good idea of the layout out this beautiful city. It takes about an hour.

small yet beautiful river in the heart of Paris. the river itself is very small and narrow but what a beautiful scenery it has!! you look ahead, behind you, left and right... everywhere you look, you can find a beauty in the city of Paris. just relax along the shore or go on the cruise!! the night view is the best!

Grab a deck chair and people watch. The weather was great, it was lunch time and the sunshine and water beckoned. We had an apartment near Quai de la Gare and situated on the banks of the Seine were all these little cafe/restaurants complete with deck chairs. We found a couple on the edge of the path, ordered a beer each and sat in the sun and people watched for an hour. Fantastic way to feel 'Parisian', get some vitamin D and just relax.

Great relax after an agitated day in Paris. After going through a lot of places in the city, taking a tour (dinner or not) helps review all that was visited and getting to know a bit more. Very relaxing and very enjoyable.

Boat Tour. We took a boat tour of the Seine during the day. I have previously done a tour at night. Both are well worthwhile although quite different. We had a student as tour guide and this was live not a recording. It was pleasant and very interesting.
Beautiful. Our hotel was on the banks of the Seine, so we had a beautiful view. .We walked along the banks in the evenings.

Very romantic at night. Take a river cruise, preferrably a dinner cruise at night on the river Seine. Very romantic and the famed Parisian lights all over the city can leave you breathless. You can admire the city on a different angle here. The lights are simply fantastic as buildings became "alive". Great views that are priceless!

Filthy & smelly. We took a long walk along the Seine river, thinking that it would be pretty romantic but we were so wrong! There were strong stench of urine & some human feces along the walkway. Omg it was so disgusting! However, the river was clean & there were even ducks swimming in it.

River trip, by boat. For old time's sake, we did the boat trip to sight see. I enjoyed it but missed the excitement of having our troupe of little ones along. It was a fine day and it is a good way to get to see the bridges and sights from a different angle.

A magical river in the heart of Paris. This is the river to take a relaxed boat ride, eat good food, and drink excellent wine. The Seine is the essence of European history and the life blood of history. One can only imagine the intrigues that occurred during the World Wars and the Cold War. A perfect location for a new spy novel.
Seine. Walked along the banks and took photos from top of Eiffel Tower, much water craft on it, and the original Statue of Liberty
water. nice way to travel around paris, met some nice people so that makes a huge difference, very relaxing in a city that often isnt

So many bridges & pretty scenes.... There are many ways to see the Seine --- bridge, boat, cafe on the side... We walked over many of the bridges of Paris and each one has a beautiful view. Go over the small bridge that is behind Notre Dame. It is covered up and down with love locks with a beautiful view of the back of the cathedral and gardens with the river in sight.

take one of the river boats, its a nice relaxing way to get about Paris & some larger attractions are near river stops. I liked that it was a smooth and pleasant ride, enjoyed to an extent the quiet, but it would have been nicer if perhaps they have provided some information about the city/attractions during the trip rather than just acting more like a ferry

A beautiful river to cruise on. Walking alongside the Seine lets you appreciate its beauty and the surrounding sights. To see the young parisiens having picnics together in the evening creates a wonderful atmosphere. We also had a 2 Hour evening Dinner Cruise and this was probably the highlight of our trip to Paris

Excellent to get your bearings. The Seine Rive divides Paris in two, the Rive Droitte (Right Bank) and Rive Gauche (Left Bank). Take any of the ferries, during the day and specially at night. You should do this the first day of your visit, in order to get your bearings of where everything is.

Relaxing to sit on the bank. My friend and I sat by the river to take a break from all the walking. It was so relaxing to soak up the sun! And we took beautiful pictures of the city sky line. I would bring drinks and snacks next time. It seemed like we were the only ones with beer or champagne.

Cruise the Seine on Yachts de Paris. we arranged a private cruise on the Cachmiere with Yachts de Paris and it was wonderful. Gives you a whole different perspective of the city when you see it from the water

SPEND AN HOUR. 20 euro, an hour of time, and a great overview of Paris. Several companies offer this tour. They all offer this tour with a meal. Grab a bakery item, save yourself 50 euro extra, and spend the extra 2 hours walking the streets of this city. Don't forget to buy a bottle of coke with your name on it. Eiffle tower one end, NoterDame the other. Enjoy

Locks. Our family put locks on the bridge. Bought our locks from the vendors on the bridge. Felt bad when I counted my change…I think it offended the vendor. Because they were very friendly and helpful.

Take one of the dinner bateaux for a dinner cruise, can´t miss. We took and evening cruise at the Paris Marina, right below the Musee de Orsay. There were hundreds of romantic couples in picnics along the way and the views of the beautiful bridges and the Eiffel Tower were fantastic.
River Seine cruise with dinner. Very good cruise with excellent meal and service; expensive but well worth it.Good night views of the Parisian landmarks visible from the River Seine.

A very hostoric way to experience the city. Travelled along the Seine River and enjoyed each spot of the city. I could see clearly the panorama of PARIS and I concluded that going through this river is a must when visiting Paris.
Lets take a walk!. Stroll along and people watch. Look in the book sellers stalls, yes some of them have books in English! And finish your day with an evening boat tour.
Pleasant. Good area to walk around and soak in the atmosphere. We went there on day one and had a lovely long walk soaking in the sights and sounds of the city.

Amazing at night. I recommend you to take the trip at night! Much more beautiful!
It will be the cheapest if you take the open tour bus pack with two days of tour + cruise which is only 42 euros! (no advertising lol)

Lovely relaxing way to see the City and sights. On our first day in Paris we took a cruise on the River Seine. It took about an hour and twenty minutes and takes you to see all the famous sights around the city.It was a lovely way to get to know the city and plan what you want to see and where you want to go during the rest of your trip.

Fun river cruise! Would recommed it.. The price was affordable, the views were great, and they have an indoor heated area in case it starts raining (like it did to us). We did the cruise at night, and it was very romantic and peaceful. Seeing the Eiffel Tower from the cruise was absolutely amazing. They also explain what you are seeing as you go by it. Lasted about 30 - 40 minutes.

Lived up to expectations. We did the Bateux Mouches dinner cruise with friends. Marvellous evening as food, wine and music coupled with such great sites all contributed to a very successful night. Highlight was passing the Eiffel Tower when it sparkled. Amazing site. Service was friendly and helpful. Would strongly recommend.

The heart of Paris. It wouldn't be a trip to Paris without a walk or boat ride along one of the worlds greatest rivers. The beach with topless women in summer is a bit strange and awkward at times if your walking but typically French.

Terrific way to see Paris. We took a boat tour in the early evening and it was a great way to see a slice of the local way of life, so interesting to see many enjoying learning to dance, dining on the edge or just enjoying an evening walk along what is a nice river. We also found it a nice place to walk along on our way to many of the Paris attractions and found many places to eat or stop along the way.

Beautiful Paris at night. We did a 1 hour cruise at night it is just a beautiful cityWe liked Paris at night , it was just so much different than dayWe did not like the seats on the boat, it was a bit cramped and I am not that tall
Float through Paris for an hour. A nice peaceful hour spent, seeing the sights from the river, fairly informative recorded guide. (Note that the bars by the river and tower are more expensive)
Get a ticket for a boat trip.. The best way and the only way to see the Seine is to get a ticket on one of the many boat trips, well worth it!

A great way to see Paris. We went on a one hour cruise which was made very enjoyable by the girl, a student, who gave the commentary. She was bright and bubbly and very informative. We bought our ticket on the river bank and then had to walk a fair bit further than the girl who sold us the tickets said it would be. Tip is, buy you ticket where you get on, at least then you know where it is. It is nice after all the walking, to sit back and relax while you take in the sights and have the places you have been looking at explained to you. The cruise also provides great photo opportunities.

You can't miss it. If you're in the city it's there all the time. I love the way the boulevards are so clean and how the little boats are all tied up at the various quays. River traffic is quite busy too. There are plenty of bridges to lean on and just watch the boats sailing past underneath - a favourite pastime of mine.

I love this river. Wonderful views as you walk along the bank, and even better if you have a boat trip. There are so many places to sit and watch the world go by. If you go to Paris, you must not miss a trip on the Seine. It is stunning at night either from the river bank or from a boat.
Seine Dinner Cruise. We did the Bateux Mouches dinner cruise on the Seine our first night in Paris. It was wonderful. The music was great, the food was delicious and it is very spacious.

awesome energy!. We had 2 picnics and many walks along the Seine. It is a place where all ages and classes go to enjoy life. We loved seeing business men and women in suites and dresses sharing wine or champagne with friends, the joie de vivre of Paris. People cycling, walking, roller blading, eating, chatting - a wonderful place. The water dispenser near the Pont Concorde dispenses SPARKLING WATER! How French!

So much to see. We took a one hour cruise and there was so much to see! The Seine is such an integral part of life in Paris and this only becomes obvious with being on the river. We saw freight being moved, people transported, tours, houseboats, weddings, people strolling, people sunbathing, bicycles, etc. And then there was the amazing history and architecture! It's a must for a visit to Paris.

A MUST in Paris. Just about the best way to see the area around the river is on the hop/off tour boat. Not expensive and you can spend a pleasant day visiting, the tower, Notre Dame, the Louvre, Champs Elysee and the Arc de Triomphe.
River Cruise. Had a lovely morning cruising up and down the Seine, beautiful weather helped but we saw all the well known buildings from the comfort of the upper deck

Stroll or Cycle down the river Seine. Went on tour with a group of friends. A great stroll around the River. Disappointed I didn't get to go on the River cruise, but I took a bike tour across it and was simply stunning.

Magic from every angle. Make sure you take the time to view this beautiful lady from every angel. A boat ride is a must, walk the paths, explore the sellers' stands that line the banks and cross the many bridges sunrise and sunset or hop on a velib (almost free bike system) and cycle both sides. TIP: Enjoy the river like a true parisian - red wine, cheese and baguette at sunset with friends!

A Must Do in Paris. This is a lovely place to just walk along and watch people. We also went on an evening cruise which was really nice. You get to see Paris in a different way. The French love to gather along the river and socialise at night which was just lovely to watch.

Walk the sides and the bridges!. I loved the booksellers' stands on the banks and the views from the bridges. Also, there were musicians--including a stellar classical pianist on his Yamaha piano (not keyboard), on a couple of the bridges. The views are unparalleled, and there are wonderful cafes along the banks of the Seine. Stop and have a cafe au lait or a glass of Champagne...
Boat ride. We had an hour boat ride and it was really nice and calm and informative. We got the boat near the eiffel tower. It was a pleasant ride

Excellent & Serene!!. River Seine is definitely a must visit with its relaxing & serene ambience.The cruise ride is a great experience with local folk dance & music.The great surroundings & ambience makes it a perfect setting.

Beautiful boat ride.. Combine it with a hop on hop off bus tour you will save loads. Nothing to dislike. The architecture you see along the way is stunning even for those who like me don't know a lot about it.
Boat cruise. Take the cruise. It is not so expensive (around 14 Euros) and you can see all the bridges and have a nice time in the Seine.
Lovely. We traveled down the river under all the bridges while served a wonderful lunch. Amazing experience!!!
Relax.... People were out on river cruises while others were sightseeing from the walkway by the river....and others laying down to soak in the sun's rays!
The Seine. Central to Paris, very busy with boats, bridges and wonderful sites. I live on the water and always enjoy being on and near it.

don't miss it!. Walking, or for that matter driving or cycling along the Seine (roughly between Pont de la Tournelle and Passerelle de Passy) is one of the best ways to enjoy the city, and to admire some of the most beautiful sights ; you pass along Saint-Gervais, the Hôtel de Ville, Île Saint-Louis, Notre-Dame, la Monnaie, le Louvre, musée d'Orsay, place de la Concorde, Assemblée Nationale, Invalides, jardin des Tuileries, Trocadero, Eiffel Tower, musée du Quai Branly and yet others... It might be worthwhile to take a boat for a cruise - prefer the smaller one!
Beautiful river. We loved looking at the river seine, it really is a very beautiful river that is very well keep. We did take a short river taxi and that was fun!!!

Boat trip from Pont du Neuf. Just a fantastic hour, sitting atop a leisurely boat trip with commentary on various landmarks to be seen, enjoying the sunshine. This helped us pick out places to visit but also places to tick off the list. Really stunning value

Bring your own bubbly!. Part of our Paris tourist card package was a cruise on the river Seine. It was winter so it was freezing! We chose to take the cruise in the evening so that we could see the lights. One word, gorgeous. Paris by day is beautiful. Paris by night is downright romantically gorgeous. We chose to take the cruise on our anniversary and we brought our own bottle of wine with plastic wine glasses on board with us. Sitting out on the open deck and sipping our rose wine was an experience not to be forgotten. Although you might be thinking, cheap plastic wine cups??? Trust me, the view, the ambience, the company more than makes up for it.The cruise was a wonderful reprieve from the rush of getting through all of Paris's sights. For a heavenly hour, it was just me, him, the wine and Paris. The cruise covers many of the major attractions from the outside. I saw the Louvre, part of ile de la cite, the Musee d'Orsay, the bridge of lovers...If you're planning to do the cruise in the winter, a really warm coat, gloves, scarf, wooly hat and ear muffs are a must to prevent freezing to death! A once in a lifetime experience.
View this from the Eiffel Tower. Took some fabulous photos of this beautiful river from the Eiffel Tower. There are some great river cruises

Batobus well worth it!. If you are travelling the different sights along the Seine i would use the Batobus. Hop on hop off sevice, boats very 20 mins from top attractions. Its a very nice clean river to travel on and great to see the city at night from the water.
Charming. I sat on the bank of the sein with a friend and had a smoked salmon sandwich from a near by bakery with two rasberry macaroons, I realy enjoyed it

Beach party from mid July to mid August. As big rivers go through big cities, this is much like many of the others. But one really cool thing in Paris, from mid July to mid August, they import a bunch of sand and for a stretch of about 1/2 mile they create a beach! Lounge chairs, dance floors, activities, bars - just like you were at a beach!
River Bus. Excellent way to see Paris from a different view point One two or three day passes , on and off service so easy on the feet and some companies combine with a bus tour
Night trip is best. There are many companies doing trips.Best to book before you leave the UK.Good value for money we booked with Viator which included a city tour.

Night River Cruise. Worth doing but sit at the back of the boat so you get the really good photos. The Eiffle Tower lit up while we were docking so I missed some really good photo opportunities. Saw so many things on the river that I never realised were there!

Seine Cruise, Paris-Normandy on Avalon's "mv Creativity". Leisurely sailing down the meandering River Seine (pronounced 'Senn') and back, was just so luxurious on the "m.v. Creativity" in Avalon Waterways' 10th anniversary year. The food and beverages, accommodation appointments, service, ship administration (especially that of hardworking tour director Janoz and his efficient staff), on-board entertainment and shore excursions were nothing short of superb. Passage through the locks gave us a singular appreciation of just what engineering feats it must have taken to construct them, and the skill it must take to negotiate them. The passing scenery was generally so pleasing on the eye, as urban residential, commercial and industrial communities were, by and large, successfully screened from view by thick vegetation growing down to the riverbanks. European white swans glided along the waterway with teal and mallard ducks, moorhens and other waterbirds adding fauna interest, besides the various pleasure craft and working barges with their ubiquitous little family vehicle parked on the aft deck, to our stately journey. The dozens of moored houseboats gave us an idea of just how vital this waterway was to communities along the way. Picnickers and fishers along the banks gave friendly waves as we glided past, our wake drifting without rancour towards the shoreline. Scheduled ports of call at Vernon (for a visit to renowned artist Claude Monet's extensive gardens and chateau at Giverny) and Rouen (where the maid-soldier Jeanne d' Arc was gruesomely burnt at the stake) for optional coach trips to the Normandy landing beaches of WW11, the coastal town of Honfleur, the historical tapestry at Bayeux, St Therese Basilique at Lisieux, or the delightful mediaeval village of Beuvron en Auge with cider and calvados tasting at a local distillery, gave those who participated, exciting adventures to savour and over which to reminisce. Back at Rouen, home to the maritime tide known as "le Mascaret,"a highlight of one night was to join the assembled crowds to experience the imaginitive son-et-lumiere projected onto the ornate front of Rouen Cathedral, the clever illuminations augmented by realistic audio broadcast through loudspeakers mounted nearby. On the return journey back up the Seine, stops at the twin towns of Les Andelys - Grand Andely and Petit Andely (giving energetic hikers the chance to climb up the white chalk cliff to view the ruins of Richard the Lionheart's Chateau de Gaillard fortress) and Conflans, where exploring up and down the serendipitous winding streets augmented a visit to the unique "Bateau Chapelle Je Sers" (a former barge fitted with stained glass portholes now serving as a church that ministers to seafarers )at the quayside, gave visitors regional town experiences quite different from the sophisticated attractions of Paris. At the famous City of Love, optional tours to Napoleon and Josephine's intriguing Chateau Malmaison or the tiny village of Auvers-sur-Oise(where Vincent van Gogh spent his last tortured months) presented dramatically contrasting choices. Our uninterrupted views of the illuminated Eiffel Tower and its hour-on-the-hour twinkling phenomena from the aft deck of our moored vessel, were pure-gold moments to behold. On our final night aboard, our group of revellers was skilfully manoeuvred by coach through the fascinating streets of Montmartre to sample the sybaritic delights of the Moulin Rouge of Henri Toulouse-Lautrec fame. Our delightful riverine odyssey came to a close with regret the following morning. We took a taxi (a charge is curiously made from where Paris taxis are when drivers receive the booking to where you board the vehicle, like an extra flagfall even before you begin the journey to your destination) to our city hotel, our sanctuary for a couple of days before embarking on the long journey home.

Heart and Soul. As romantic as the books say. It typifies what Paris is about with all the lovely bridges, houseboats and cruise boats sailing up and down the river and everybody walking along the banks, just beautiful.

Dirty but pretty river. The Seine River is very dirty and what you would expect for a big city, everything seems to happen around the river. There is always something happening on the river and it is beautiful at night time.

The Seine River - Rive Gauche & Rive Droite. Loved walking on pathways lining up The Seine & seeing an array of River Boats -Péniches, lining up on its banks. Also so many different beautiful bridges along the way....

Beautiful to walk along. We walked along and across the river many times while visiting Paris. It's part of the city's personality. I loved watching the boats and the people and the art along the street next to the river.

Simply beautiful. Every picture you take looks like a postcard! The views from each bridge is more beautiful than the last. My family took cruise that was so relaxing and again, the view of the lovely architecture was fantastic.

Wonderful combination of sightseeing and relaxing. Seeing the Seine, with all the beautiful architecture on either side, is absolutely beautiful. We did the Batobus trip and loved it so much that we decided to stay on for a second trip around. I loved seeing how the people of Paris use the river. Some little beaches are filled with umbrellas and sun bathers, whilst on other banks there are socials and even dances happening. Friends sit along the walls playing board games or just chatting, and there are house boats and restaurants and even floating gardens. This was a super way to see part of Paris AND get from one side of the city to the other whilst relaxing.

Loved it!. Loved going down the River Seine on the water taxis. It was beautiful. Loved walking along the River Seine too, with the side walk cafes and beach area. I could have stayed there in one of the beach areas all day if only I had enough time! Magical!
It's the Seine. Best place to take a run- long sidewalks and it's like a mini-tour pf Paris..best time in in the morning- so quiet.
Sunset River Cruise was fabulous. I took the normal Cruise, but I highly recommend to try the cruise with meal. To be in this fabulous river enjoying your French meal will be great:)

Take the tour!. It’s a must! If you are in Paris you should take the boat tour to Seine. Day or night it is equally fascinating as you’ll have the chance to see the city from a totally different perspective. The cruise is a great way to get familiar with many of the city's most stunning monuments, historical buildings, bridges and people alongside the river. The route is lovely, the city is great and the river banks are well maintained, offering a great chance to enjoy the cruise!There are many boat types, operators and packages to choose from. You’ll notice some huge or smaller docks with vessels waiting for you. Get informed before you choose but don’t be too anxious to find the best. Everything is “:best” in such a marvelous city!

Romantic Evening Stroll. We walked the river in the evening. It is one of the best ways to see Paris light up. You have wonderful view of the Eiffel tower as it lights up for the evening. The museums along the river are lit by the night lights and provide for great photo opportunities. You can spend the evening strolling or sitting and watching people go by. It is a great romantic walk and a wonderful way to enjoy Paris.

loved it. Probably the best part and least stressful day of our trip was a river cruise along the seine. The cruise last around 2hours and started near the Eiffel tower and went down as far as the monde du Arab. My wife said it was the most romantic part of the trip even though it rained some of the time and we had to sit inside the glass covered part of the boat.
Batobus. Use the Batobus, stops several places along the Seine, get on off as many times as you like. Very cost effective.

It won't disappoint if you know why you are going. The river water is not really the point, in itself and the boat trips are only one part. The point of going to the river within the heart of Paris is that it helps to put the rest of Paris into perspective. It gives you light, or a clear view of the night sky.... It also gives you unrivaled views of much of Paris. The sides of the Seine are perfect for walking, running, dancing, skating, or taking children to climb, jump or ride bikes. Depending where you go you will always see something of interest - a pop-up dj with a small following, a busker, a temporary bar or waterfront juggler and of course an endless array of beautiful bridges, statues, the (other) statue of liberty, the Paris plage, exhibits of green living, bio foods etc etc. In winter, it makes a great place to escape the crowds. And if you happen to be outside of Paris it's edges also become a wonderful green space. Don't assume you can just 'do' the Seine, and cross it off your tourist list; it takes time to get to really appreciate all it has to offer (just as Paris does). And for those who have commented somewhat negatively that it is 'long', please go back to basic principles! This is not a tourist attraction in itself, it is a river that just happens to provide a whole range of fantastic activities and viewing points in an already beautiful city.

The Seine River tours give you a great perspective!. The tours are wonderful. The dinner tours are hit or miss; we had a bad experience on our last outing, and actually saw one waiter pouring wine back into a bottle, then serving it to another table. No more dinner tours for us.
River Cruise. We went on a night time river cruise which was wonderful because of the views of the city lights and the Eiffel Tower lit up at night.
It's the heart of Paris. But it's a river like all the others in the world. The boat rides offered are a nice way to see many of the famous sights and are fun but very touristy.
Go the afternoon / sunset tour. I've been on 3 x of these tours. Best one by far is the sunset river cruise.Don't forget to pack a bottle of french wine and some glasses.
amazing walking through night time. This river is quite long. Night time walks and seeing the Eiffel lit up is absolutely amazing!! Romantic and great for picture taking.
Great tour. Tour guide spoke 8 different languages amazing! very clean boat, toilets to use, and refreshments available.

Enjoying the Seine on foot!. I love walking, especially on trails by rivers and in forests. The Seine walk is a long one but if you love the water like I do, you will find the activities and the scenery very interesting. So much life by the river and on the river, as one observes the many barges that I think are homes for some people. I loved taking pictures of local life.

Romantic Twilight Cruise. There's no better way to see Paris then a cruise down the River Seine. We booked a twilight cruise and saw the Eiffel Tower at sunset and then nightfall on the return leg of the cruise. This was truly an amazing way to see Paris and its beautiful landmarks, including Notre Dame! The river boats have indoor and outdoor seating, and refreshments for purchase. I highly recommend a cruise down the Seine river.

A Walk Along the Quay. We walked along the section that is the marina. The view of the houseboats, from large to small, from elegant to near dreck gave us a different view of Paris. Later we walked along a section of the opposite bank which was rather sterile. For a different view of the Seine we would recommend walking the marina area.

Sailing Away. A trip by Bateaux Mouches on the River Seine day or night is most memorable. I went during the daytime. It was most rewarding to sit back, enjoy the sceneries and historic buildings. There are several boats sailing up and down the River Seine at regular times. Take some sandwiches and water to make the trip more relaxing. I sat on the upper deck which I highly recommend. A must for a Paris trip.

A Nice Romantic Trip .... The sun was shining, the river was shimmering, and the atmosphere on the boat was palpable.My partner & I were one of the first in the queue, so we decided to pop upstairs quickly on the top deck to get the best seats at the back. Great decision.We took some amazing photographs of most of the decorative buildings and the beautiful art-deco bridges. However, my favourite bridge was when the announcer mentioned the 'bridge of love', and when our boat passed underneath the bridge, there was many a romantic kiss going on with some couples onboard - to much applause!I'm an old romantic at heart ... I loved it!

Relax and enjoy a baguette here. When in Paris, experience what life as the natives do. Grab a baguette from a local grocery, an assortment of cheese wedges and something to wash them down, sit on one of the many benches along the Seine and take in the slow beauty of the river and it's impressive views.
European holiday. You must do a cruise on the river seine whether couples or families, and the guided tour was excellant . Best to sit on top of boat if possible the views are fantastic

River cruise. Spent 11 days on a river cruise on the Seine. Beaches of Normandy to Paris. Wonderful quaint French villages along the way. Would have missed out if a lot if we had tried to do this on our own. And many Frenchman do not speak English, so I'd really be lost.
Take a Batobus. Easy to get around between Notre Dame and Eiffel Tower with magnificent views of bridges, other architecture.

Got to Like This. Well, you've got to like this river, with its history, beauty and soothing character. *Watch out* for pick pockets, gypsies (don't fall for the old "is this your ring?' sham). If you like long, picturesque walks, this is one of the best in the world, but careful of where you are.
Dinner cruise. Beautiful views of Paris. Dinner was a formal affair with good food and wine. We got back to the dock at the foot of the Eiffel Tower just as all the lights came on. Spectacular .

Overrated. Not to be Debbie downer to the hopeless romantic out there but the river cruise is not that great. Maybe it would be different if I took the cruise during the day time but it was just average. its like taking a cruise on the Mississippi river.
the river. river seine is so beautifull to see when you takes a cruise .as you pass the view on both the side is excellent to watch
romantic trip. we took the hop on and off boat which stops at 8 stops inside Paris, the tour is beautiful in the evening especially, and is very convenient and the staff are very helpful.

Romantic!. Wander the bridges and find your favorite. I don't know what it is about this place but after 27 years of marriage, this place remains inspiring. We don't kiss often in public but we do in Paris. Sitting on a quai at sunset with the locals is always a party. One night we were told there would be fireworks. Crowds gathered and dispersed; no fireworks. No one seemed to care. The Seine was more than enough.

A must do!. We were on a luxury dinner and cruise boot, but even the batobus , it is a must! The river experience just give you a wonderful feel for the city , the history and the overall sight seeing!

Not what I expected. People have mentioned strolling along the Seine and sitting on benches. I did not find one place to sit on a bench along the Seine. I was expecting greenery, grass, benches, vendors. I never found a place like that.
River cruise. Make sure that when you are in Paris that you take a river cruise, get to see the two islands clearer

See the sights from the water. A relaxing way to see the sights from a river cruise. Much more relaxing than being in the traffic. The boat was full and seating limited. Plenty of places to get off the boat and the river is nice and clean with changing scenery.
One hour was just right. We took a 1 hour cruise which covered lots of interesting historical sites yet left us enough time to see the Eiffel Tower and many other River attractions.
beautiful. it was great but you shouldn't stand in the sun or you'll get burned. the weather is nice and you'll see the attractions from the outside in a glace. not bad for a quick view of the city.

Fantastic river cruise.... We did a evening river cruise on the River Seine.
Another must do when in Paris. To see this beautiful city from the water is just amazing.. Loved it.

A great way to see the sights. I took the hop on hop off bus with the hop on hop off boat. It was a three day pass. There are eight stops and you can see the Seine River and get to your tourist destination. It was good having a choice between boat and bus and gave a different perspective. It is different to a cruise as there is no commentary but I had that on the bus.
River cruising is the best. Traveled the Seine on a VIking River Cruise, lovely at night with all the lights, especially in Avignon!
Parisien atmosphere. To see this everything you fill like parisien.To see this everything you fill like parisien. Immediately.

River Seine cruise. Early on August, I did the cruise, it was part of my Paris Musseum Pass. I really enjoyed it, I took it in the afternoon, the weather was nice, it started near the Eiffel tower, we went under a number of beautiful bridges and saw a sucession of prestigious monuments around, the views were very beautiful.

great i took a night trip. wow what an experience passing all the famous land mark of paris,the night sky was navy blue and with all the lights of paris this was fantastic,people along the banks walk or just chilling also very informative
Walk along a historic river. I was able to find a footpath right along the river. The sun was setting and the sky was pink. Beautiful shots everywhere I looked.
Sit and watch. Easily accessible, and a great place to chill out. The Batuboat is a great addition to any Paris trip and gets a different perspective on the city

✨🌜For couples lovers💞✨. We strongly recommend that you take a dinner cruise ,
Glass of wine and Special view of the city of lights. Perfect romance That you have only in Paris.
You can also choose without a dinner cruise,But dinner makes it a perfect experience.
Tip. Ask for a table by the Window.Recommended successful pictures proffesional camera.
😉

Great to get away from the buzz. Walked along the Seine on both sides and had a great time with the kids. On the south side, there were fantastic recreation spots, dotted along, with equipment for working out / playing, cool boxes to climb on, games and mazes painted into the pavement, swing ball tennis to play,boats etc to look at. On the north side, a little further along, is the Paris Plage. Tons of sand have been shipped in and there is a whole section of mist things, which are great to play in / get sprayed by on a busy hot day. Free buckets and spades, deck chairs etc there for borrowing, as well as coffee, ice cream and beer!!!

Walking along.....a better choice. We took the river cruises and we walked along the Seine on both banks.....The choice?....Walking wins in a walk!! I would suggest the inexpensive Vedettes cruise if you want to be ON the water; but to walk the banks or on the streets with the vendors/kiosks is so much more fun, interesting, informative...and Parisiene. When possible, we would take the bus around Paris and always try to find ourself near the Seine for a busstop..we would use the Seine as the "center point" and branch out from there....it also was great that way because you could never get lost, always knew that if you walked enough in one direction, you would end up at the Seine.

Take the boat tour at dusk!. If you board the boat tour just before dusk, you'll see so much more -- daylight from the Eiffel Tower the turnaround beyond Notre Dame, then the lights at night on the return. The Eiffel Tower is no amazing when it's lit! Would do this again in a heartbeat!
Dinner Cruise. Take a dinner cruise if you can. Beautiful way to see the city at night and the food and entertainment were second to none.
Superb. Love it's serenity and character. Take a cruise on the water taxi. The lock bridges are growing in number and are great fun to add one of your own.

Good and not so good view of La Seine. Tourists can see the good and not so good view of the Seine river depending on where you standing. Like everything about Paris being artistic, romantic or dirty and disturbingly annoyed by street vendors and scams
A boat trip is a must do. Another highlight of the city. The trip is round trip so try to take it in the late afternoon. All buildings seemed impressive, especially when it got dark.

Not the first thing you want to do in paris!. Its is extremely touristic, maybe if you lack something in paris you can do it, the tour in the river is nice, but walking through paris is even nicer so dont put it as your first choice in paris
River cruise was relaxing and enjoyable. You can see quite a bit on a river cruise on the River Seine. It is also nice to take a break from walking and sit back and soak in the scenery.

Lovely river cruise. We travelled on one of the river cruises down the Seine and it was a great way to see the sights of Paris you would probably miss. The commentary was very informative and exceptional value for money.
We would definitely recommend!

Relaxing, nice way to see sites.. Take a hop on, hop off boat and see the river and sites in a relaxing manner. You get to see most of the main sites from a different perspective and without the crowds. Try an evening cruise when everything is lit up.

Excellent! Great way to see the city. Despite having been in Paris a number of times, I've never ventured onto the Seine and i've been missing out! I would absolutely recommend the Bateau-bus for seeing the city from a different perspective as well as it's convenience for getting around major sites. Being able to hop on and off easily especially in the city heat instead of the metro avoiding crowds was brilliant.I'd most definitely do this again and would recommend anyone travelling to Paris try it out.
Worth it.. Well worth it to get a good view of the city. You can see places that may appeal to you as you go around the city.

Lovely Evening Picnic. We were staying at a hotel just near Pont Neuf. In the evening we noticed a lot of people having picnics on the river bank. Next day we stocked up at a local market. That evening we found a nice spot on the Left Bank side for our picnic. It was a lovely evening enjoying our meal with a good wine. Watching the various ferries sail past and the sun slowly set was very relaxing. Thoroughly recommended.
The best way to know Paris. walk along the river Siene, admiring Paris arquitecture, it´s people, bridges, cafés. It´s free and beutiful

Travelling on the Seine. i bought a 3 day ticket for the city tour bus( green bus) which is a hop on hop off service around the city . it included the pass for 3 days on the bus and a boat trip of the Seine for 49 euro . The boat trip was so relaxing and you could stop off at the different stops along the way. We got lots of history information from the commentator on the boat. Just bring a jacket, a drink and your sandwich- and enjoy-C'est la vie
Beautiful. We did the seine cruise in the evening and seeing all the sights lit up was spectacular we both loved it
paris plages. Beaches as at the coast, cool location. Boat trip could be romantic during the night on a boat, which is too crowded
River. We did not take the boat trip but instead walked along the shores of the river.Very nice to sit along the river on a sunny day and have lunch.
Boat trip. We went on a boat trip down the seine with dinner this was excellent, the food was excellent and see the sights at night was lovely

Best thing to do- walk along the river Seine. Best thing to do- walk along the river Seine. Nothing like a walk on the banks of the river Seine. You could walk on the pavement and admire the displays of paintings, old books, souvenirs. You could also see the boats passing. You could enjoy the monuments on either bank of the river. Take a bateau-bus instead of metro and enjoy the fresh cool breeze and the view to visit the monuments along the river. Go for a river cruise by bateau-mouche in the evening or at night when all monuments are lit. As the boats with floodlight pass by if you are on the bank you can see the monuments come alive with the light. If you happen to be near Notre Dame when such floodlight falls on the gargoyles and the towers of the cathedral, you will see the cathedral plunge again in an eery darkness as the boat passes away. You could also enjoy each bridge. Le pont des Arts with all the cadenas - the locks, the wooden bridge, the grandeur of Pont d'Alexandre... You could also go down the steps and be closer to the river and walk along in some places. Go down in Ile de la Cité and visit the tip of the île. You could even plan a small picnic there.

Great to ride the Batobus, even in the rain.. You can see so much from the river! Beautiful bridges, famous buildings and of course the Eiffel Tower. We didn't take a 1 hour tour but instead got a Batobus hop-on/hop-off ticket. This was ideal as it allows you to get from A to B as well as get a trip along the river. It meant we could ride along the river at different times during the day. We enjoyed the river both by day and by night.
Leisurely Stroll. There is plenty to see by just taking a leisurely stroll along the Seine. Stalls. Cafes. Markets. Landmarks, all just a few steps from each other.

Exciting. I went up and down the river.breath taking scenery,I saw all the major attractions around Paris.there were things that I did not no there too I.e -statue of liberty .you could not get bored there at all

Great walk next to Orsay Museum. We walked miles and miles alongside the river and really enjoyed our time. Some parts aren’t made for strolls, but the reconstructed parts next to Orsay Museum and Port Alexandre were really great, full of different attractions or board games. Good place to relax for both kids and adults.
Hire a bike and ride along the Seine. If there is smog its free to hire the bikes :) but if not it is still magical and a good price. I would recommend stopping off at Notre dame

Seine v Thames. The Seine is a beautiful river which goes through Paris. You can sit on the pleasure boat and enjoy the sights of Notra Dame Cathedral, The Eiffel Tower and other parks and historical buildings as you leisurely sip a beer wine or cool drink. Relaxing it is.

The Seine. What can I say, impressive stretch of water. The hub of Paris.I must admit in doing this review I spent so much time enjoyingRestaurants and Bars, I cannot recall their names!! As an ArtistI did visit some wonderful places! This Hotel is brilliant value!!
Lovely to walk along. Enjoyed various areas of the Seine during our trip. Particularly liked the 'padlock bridge' which glitters in the sunshine

i told myself it is real. yes me it is real, and you are on the boat on the river Seine.
even i thought how could capture this moments more having many photos for myself and the river would be in each and every photo.

Excellent River Cruise. Great relaxing cruise along the Seine with good commentary provided. Well worth the trip. A view of Paris from the Seine is an excellent way to see the sights. An outside seat in the fresh air is the way to go if possible.
Seine at night. We took a boat out pre sunset and back after dinner. The contrast in the ride was literally night and day. The night trip home was kea feud, gorgeous, and not yo be missed.

A must before you leave. The on and off tour are great but we took the hour trip to see all the sites at night just at sunset we got great shots and the life on the seine with restaurants and many boats the Parisians really know how to live
Peaceful and lovely. Although not clean! Not a fish lives here according to one guide. But the Seine has so much color and history that you just can't miss it anywhere you go.

This is not just any river. Where can you see the splendors of a more famous city than on the River Seine? From a boat ride, everything looks unique. The detail of the bridges, the view of Notre Dame, and the waves from total strangers 'connect' the travelling visitor to the city's people. Day or night, the River Seine is Paris as much as any of its other attractions.

The new banks look terrible!. When I heard they were remodeling the banks between the MO and the Eiffel Tower, I expected something appropriate to the neighborhood, well it is really ugly, it reminds me of the bad docks of the Netherlands.
Bateau - Meal on the Seine. 18.45 trip on the bateau with a meal and wine is a superb way to look at all the landmarks on the Seine at Paris. The food is good too.

Vedettes du Pont Neuf. Took a one hour cruise, Vedettes du Pont Neuf, which sails from halfway across Pont Neuf. Great value at 10e. Booked online beforehand. Commentary in English, and with humour. Took the cruise on the first morning which helped with our sense of direction and locations of some of the sights.

evening tour recommended. Save the 1 hour tour for the evening, my husband and I did both the day and night tours and found the evening tour much less crowded, atmospheric and a romantic way to end a lovely evening out.

Well Worth It. I think this should be done for the overall experience - the views, the atmosphere, etc. The rooftop allows you to stretch your legs, smoke if you are so inclined, and make sure you are in the best position to take plenty of photos. I'm also pretty sure they time it so you are near the Eiffel Tower on the hour so you get to see it light up. The food was good but not great and the service was a little mixed, especially towards the end when the staff seem quite focused on clearing up so they can get away as quickly as possible. It was a bit of a battle to get our coffees whilst at the same time they were trying to get us off the boat.But despite all that it still gets 4 stars - which is a testament to the city landscape.
Beautiful. We took a hop on hop off boat for the seine river ..it had 8 stops .. Had a nice experience ..practically covers all the important destinations to see
Speed on the seine. We did Paris Speed which is the speed boat trip. We took my mother aged 78 and 3 kids9,13,15. My mum screamed the loudest!
greta trip. Always worth a trip - we got an extension to our hop-on hop-off bus ticket which gave unlimited travel on the boats - excellent value

River Cruises. We took two, one at dusk, which was just gorgeous to see the sights along the river as it was getting dark and lights were coming on. The other, Batobus Paris, hop on and hop off tour during the day where we could cruise along the river and stop and get off to see sights easily and hop back on to go farther along and return to our home station to get back to our hotel. This was a lovely and leisurely way to move along the river that I would recommend to anyone who would like a day with a more leisurely pace.
Peaceful Cruise. Take a cruise from Eiffel Tower for an hour along to Notre Dame. Breathtaking views. Worth the money.

A Fun Walk. My grandson and I walked from the Tuilleries to the Ile de la Cite. The bridges are interesting. One bridge had lots of locks attached to the railings. People locked in their love on the bridge. There were so many locks on one bridge that people started attaching locks to a second bridge
Lovely boat trip. We took a short river trip with the Vedettes de Pont Neuf company and enjoyed a pleasant hour on the river on a drizzly Monday morning. Highly recommended
wonderful cross section of humanity. Loved wandering the river, seeing the houseboats, the people lounging, and all the locks on the bridges

Beauty flowing through Paris. River Seine is like a lifeline, take a romantic walk along its banks or go on a cruise, you will love it. Or simply stand on a bridge and watch the rain make ripples in it. On a sunny day have a cuppa in a Cafe overlooking the beautiful Seine, any way you see it you will have an amazing experience.

Paris plage!. This is just to say that the paris plage invention (from july to mid august) is really working. There is an actual sand beach with parasols along the Seine on a long central stretch (from about Bastille to Concord). Normally there is an expressway but it is closed and you can stroll on it. Impossible to bike on a sunny day, there are so many strollers!

Very wet, just as a true river should be.. Obviously I walked the banks many times during my three month stay in Paris. Paris Plages, where they turn the bank into a beach is OK, it is nice to sit on a deckchair, watching the world go by. What else is there to say? Take a towel if you plan to fall in.

great way to see the city. what a great river with such history we took the 1 hr river cruise ,great day ,there are a few mega cruise boats which cram on 100s of people didn't look like fun ,ours was a smaller boat with 7 people on board ,there are also hop on hop off boats which would be a nice way to see the city apart from the hop on hop off bus ,you get to see Notre Dame the padlock bridge and a host of other great things,do it!

Beautiful River Sight in Great City. river Seine crosses the city of Paris that cut it north and south. What I like most is the various great design of bridges crossing the the river. The walking paths on the river sides are also very interesting. I believe visitors feel relax walking by the river sides.

April in Paris. We were there in april 2 years ago and fell in love with the Seine. the sidewalks along it are wide and you can go from area to area in Paris and feel safe and adventuresome! We used the botobus often and other times we walked along the river and enjoyed the places to explore up the steps on to the sidewalk. Interesting from Notre-Dame to the Eiffel Tower. There are so many places to stop and look. Loved looking at the live aboard boats moored there. One of the reasons it is so easy to get around the area in paris is the river and people giving you directions for places to explore. We enjoyed it a great deal
Very romantic even though is full of tourists. I liked the views from the river and the lights when it was getting darker. I didn't dislike anything
great time. Great way to get acclimated to the city by tour boat. We had flown all night and were exhausted. This helped us get our bearings on a beautiful city.
Always within eyesight. We walked along the river as much as possible. The best way to see it all was on the river boat tour. It was a nice way to take in all the sites in a short amount of time.
River tour. We loved taking the tour down the Sein. It was a great was to get some amazing pics of the Notre -Dame Cathedral and it was just a relaxing ride. We got off at the Eiffel tower.
Amazing tour. You have to take a tour at seine, you will see most of well known landmarks of paris and take amazing photos with them.

Great Cruise. e took a cruise up and down the river to see the city from that perspective. Very relaxing and great angles for pics of the Eiffel Tower. We took the ride around 6-8 pm and the tower did its thing with the lights, just as the cruise came to its end. WOW, Nice to see.
Nice river. Walking along the Seine was good. I wish I had taken a boat trip while I was there or used the Batobus :(

See Seine cities at ease. We fancied a return trip to the Seine, which we had visited several times by car, so decided to do it the easy way by taking a cruise with Croisieurope. They offered a seven-night cruise on the MS France, with optional excursions at various calling points, with the opportunity to visit the locations under our own steam: this meant that we could stay aboard, in a comfortable lounge, with a free bar, if the weather should make a visit unattractive.We crossed to Paris by Eurostar, then took a taxi to the berthing quay - as this is some distance from the Gare du Nord, the taxi fare was 35 Euros. We boarded at 6.30 pm, and our luggage was collected by a crew-member, and taken to our cabin, then we had a welcome/information meeting, followed by dinner. Tables are allocated for the duration of the voyage, and we shared with two delightful ladies from the Midlands and a younger lady from Los Angeles. Except for passengers who have special eating needs, there is no choice of food, but we were very pleased by the quantity and quality of the offerings. Wine and water are served with lunch and dinner . We then had a scenic cruise through the lights of the city, and returned to the berth.On Day 2, breakfast was a little chaotic, and the location of our table adjacent to the toaster, the egg-boiler and various other food items gave us particular problems. There was an optional city tour, which we had booked (as we had only visited Paris on about 60 occasions), and we were shown features which we had not seen before. This was the only excursion we joined. The afternoon was free for passengers to visit the city individually.Subsequent calls were at:Vernon, for optional excursions to Monet's house and gardens at Giverny;Duclair, a smallish town, affording an optional excursion to the "Abbey trail", visiting several historic buildings;Honfleur, one of the most picturesque cities in France, with the opportunity to visit the invasion beaches;Rouen, with an optional guided walking tour of the city;Les Andelys, for an optional visit to a couple of Chateaux - not much appreciated by our dining companions, who opted for the experience. The ship berthed at Petit Andely, which has an interesting church and a ruined castle.We thoroughly enjoyed the cruise: service was extremely good in all departments, the food was interesting and good, the lounge was large and comfortable, and offered the free bar and a variety of activities at night and during the day when the weather was bad. Mike, in charge of the Reception desk, was a tower of strength - no problem beat him.http://www.croisieurope.co.uk/On the last day, we had to leave our cabins by 09.00, Mike told us that we could wait in the lounge until we were ready to leave, and he arranged for a taxi to pick us up for the journey back to Gare du Nord.Bad points:The cabins are not capacious, but they are clean and comfortable, with two large picture windows in ours.Cabins on the lower deck are reached by winding staircases, which caused difficulty to some passengers, one of whom had to descend backwards.All of the general facilities are on the upper deck, so it is best to request a cabin there, to avoid the continual need to climb and descend the staircases.
Best to walk!. This is a beautiful river to walk! start by the National Library then walk to the Eiffel tower, it is one of the best ways to experience the whole centre of Paris.
Sail down the Seine. Did not like how we were packed on the Boats but the actual trip was really good and worth the money.
Best crusie on the River Seine. Took a Boat ride , was very romantic . Loved every min of it . The city is very beautiful and enchanting.

Must take river cruise. You can take it for the day time or the night. We took it right after the sunset. It has both English and French. You can buy the ticket online first to save you time waiting to buy the ticket there.The cruise gave you a basic idea of what's worth seeing and how far they are from each other

It's a River. We took the boat cruise and the scenery along the river was beautiful at night. It was a bit chilly when we went, but nothing a warm jacket couldn't fix. It was a fun way to see the city.

Beautiful River. We were on a bus tour and took a boat ride on the River Seine. It was beautiful. We got many great pictures of the bridges and historic buildings. They take your picture and you can purchase it at the end.

Take a cruise or walk along the river. It wouldn't be Paris without the Seine and its bridges. Take a cruise to appreciate the river and the buildings alongside it. It may be touristy but it's the thing to do. Several companies give you the choice of which kind of boat to take. You may also walk along the river in many places (attention: don't be shocked if some areas smell of urine; you can guess why). Many people have picnics here in the summertime. Don't forget the bridges, where you have awesome views of the city, including the Eiffel Tower!

Walk Along, Cruise, or just Watch this River. What more can be said about the Seine River that hasn't been personified, touted, sang, written, or just shared with others,...than find any way possible to enjoy the beauty and breadth of this magical waterway.It's rippling current will transport you somewhere in time. It's beauty and serenity will soothe both your mind and heart. Somehow that river is itself an ethereal wonder.

Nite cruise on River Seine. The building along the Seine are so beautiful when you take a nite Bateau Mouche. They look so different than they do during the day. All along the banks of the Seine, there are people dancing, walking, and having a great time. The Eiffel Tower lights go off each hour at it is an amazing site to see.

Batobus boat. We had a few trips on the Batobus during the weekend we spent I paris. It is lovely to travel along the seine watching the world go by and seeing all the beautiful buildings along the route.
Take a boat on the River Seine. This should be high on your list. Take a boat that has a tour guide. It makes a big difference. This winding river is wonderful to look at and wonderful to ride!
Les bateaux. The weather was great making it a great sail. Which was very informative. The sights are unbelievable especially all the ornate bridges.
am must do when in Paris. We took the trip around the River Seine at sunset and you must put this on your list of things to do in Paris.

Alive.. Being by water makes people relax and feel like they are on vacation. Young , old ,families were smiling and taking in the sun. By the quays , les berges have been expanded for pedestrians to enjoy. Could spend hours just hanging out . Bridges have beautiful artwork. Passes alongside major historical and ornate buildings. The Seine captures the beauty and vibrancy of the city.

Bateau boat. Beautiful trip down the Seine on the Bateau Boat. Purchased the combined l'Opentour and Bateau boat tickets and found they were a great way to travel. We had our elderly mother with us and it let her see all of the major attractions without the need for too much walking.

Lovely stroll. During the summer there is much to explore along the river. They have cafes and benches with greenry so you can sit and nap. Kids have a playground area they can release their enegries. Also various booths of artist selling things. And in the evening with the sun setting a very romantic stroll.

Serenity taken from the river. The river was wide and flowing..we took a boat ride which allowed us to escape the crowds and get some summer air while looking at some magnificent buildings and history Paris has to offer. Next time, I will rent a bike (cheap and available all the way along the river) and ride the wide paths either side of the river. It was a nice way to take in some sights without the franticness! No river pong either as with some city rivers.

Lovely. Such an easy and enjoyable walk with so much to see,.Many of the main attractions are close to the Seine and easy to get to get to. There are so many bridges so it was easy and fun just being able to cross over to get a different perspective

Beautiful champagne river tour. Went on a champagne boat road and it was gorgeous, packed but still lovely. views were gorgeous and the narrator made it personal but chatting to the guests and giving them little challenges along the way!

Heart of Paris. Impossible to imagine Paris without.... Stroll along the river - and a cruise to complement it. Nice options available, foe example starting at the eifel tower. It's great to do after dark, with lovely illumination and Eifel tower sparkling wonderfully a full minute at every full hour.

Take the time to walk along its banks during the day and night.. Always something going on along the banks of the River Seine. It's great to see that the river is once again becoming the centre point of this amazing city. Take a stroll during the day or night and experience all the sites of the city.

walking along the Seine on a Sunday. With all the families strolling and playing at the spots along the river one gets a unique feel for the joy of life that has been an integral part of Paris life for centuries.
Riverboat Cruise. This was a great cruise and another way to see Paris. We were with a private tour group, so we had excellent meals and staff.

Walking recommended for the young and the old who are in good shape - we weren't!. This is a review of the River Seine - NOT the boat ride! Let me say that we walked, and walked, and walked until we were worn out. I do recommend the boat ride for photo opportunities and a chance to rest. We didn't take the boat ride and I wish we had! We saw a great many things, but were just not in good physical shape.

Worth a stroll. I loved all of the various places to sit and relax along the river. It is interesting to view the Paris sites from the lower level of the riverside. The bridges themselves are beautiful to see from below, and of course, the staircases made me think of Gene Kelly and Leslie Caron in American in Paris.

Watch the world go by.... One of our favourite things to do in Paris is to visit a boulangerie and then take our picnic down to the Seine and sit and watch the world go by. In early and mid August there is a beach area plus there is also lots of interesting activities - kite flying, giant board games, unusual greenhouses, and plenty of seating to while away a few hours.

Avalon River Cruise: Paris to Beaches of Normandy. This was our 8th river cruise in Europe, but our first sailing with Avalon. It was absolutely phenomenal. The crew was attentive, kind, friendly, and the food was nicely presented and also quite good. Cruise included Monet's Gardens and Van Gogh's town. A side trip to Honfleur was optional and worthwhile. Beaches of Normandy of course was a highlight. River cruising has taken off in the travel industry and we really enjoy it!

seine cruise. Took a cruise with the kids along the Seine. We took the one near the Eiffel Tower. It was crowded but the breeze in a hot day was enough to calm you. It was nice just sitting and enjoying the view of the river, bridges, buildings and people waving at you, while listening to information regarding the area.

Very nice. Have sailed down and walked along the banks of the Seine so many times. The banks are very busy during the day with the usual touristy stalls and artists but you do see the hustle and bustle of the city. In the evening the walks are wonderful as Paris is lit up and the activity isn't so chaotic. Lovely strolls along the river but obviously be careful. River cruises are great as you see everything and pass all the bridges. Plenty of photo opportunities.

Be sure to take a boat ride.. I would highly recommend to take a night boat ride. After spending a day in the busy city, it is so relaxing to take in the sights in a nice quiet boat ride. It makes the city seem so magical and seeing the Eiffel tower twinkling makes it well worth the trip.
Seine River Cruise. A peaceful one hour journey up and down the Seine River. Relaxing and full of photo opportunities that can only be seen from the boat.

The heart of Paris. Enjoyed a river cruise on The Seine the last time I visited Paris.This time I enjoyed a stroll along the river during the evening,admiring the bridges & boats.The whole area was lit up & it was lovely to walk past some familiar sights & photograph them at leisure.

Great river. Be sure to take a boat ride on the river. We did the one hour tour at night and see the great sights of the city. There are also dinner cruises that looked like fun, although they are considerably more expensive. The river is crossed by 22 bridges. Some points of the river are considerably wider than near Notre Dame. This is a beautiful river that you'll want to spend time walking along.

A cruise on the river Seine .. is another magic way to discover Paris. I really enjoyed the river cruise , especially at night , sailing on the river , admiring the lights of the city reflected on its surface . I enjoyed seeing city attraction from the cruise , and admiring the 32 famous legendary brides of paris enlighted in the amazing nightTake the Bateaux-mouche or the "Bateaux-Parisiens"It is another magic way to enjoy and discover this amazing city

Work in progress. At this moment, parts of the road next to the seine are closed for works. Because of this, you cannot walk along a large part of the Seine. Of course, the main road higher up is still available, so you can still enjoy the view on the river and monuments all around.

batobus. you can hop on and off at 8 stations all day long. at 16 euros it's a bit expensive, especially when there are a few of you but it's a relaxing way to travel. boat usually pretty crowded, you might not even get on at the first queueing, and there is no refreshment though that's just as well as there are no toilets either
Relaxing. Well worht doing as it is a good way to relax away from the crowds but still get a good view of a lot of the sights of Paris

Loved it - so romantic & beautiful. Paris the city of love...the river seine just adds to the whole romance. We did the cruse during the day and a dinner cruise at night. Seeing Paris from the river just makes the city even more appealing. My husband was so skeptical about going to Paris, but he fell in love with the place and would go back again....
Evening Cruise. Take the evening cruise and see Paris come to life at night. You will not regret it. It is simply quite amazing.

A river cruise really does Paris justice. We did a 1 hour river cruise which was fantastic. You see a HEAP of "big ticket items" on the cruise including Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Louvre, d'Orsay, bridges+++. Compared to other cities ,particularly London where we had just come from, a) a big proportion of attractions are within eyesight of the river and b) it is a _nice_ river and quite clean. A really good "bang for buck" way to see lots of things briefly and get oriented to the city.
Cars on Boats. What a beautiful river - beautiful bridges, bordered by beautiful buildings - floated on by beautiful boats (with cars) - glorious!

Seine River Dinner cruise - very average. The river seine is lovely, but unless you like very average food with cheap wine don't do the seine river cruises, unfortunately we did, the food was awful! However the cruise itself was good so book a river tour and eat elsewhere!

Very well organised Boat trips. The queues for the boat trips were not too long and the trip was well worth it!The boats pass many of Paris' main attractions. We did the trip at night to see the buildings all lit up and were not disappointed.
Handy. Great river boat hop on/hop off system - it was very handy and pleasant for getting around to the nearby sights.

Perfect for a day trip or two. The best way by far to orient yourself around Paris the first few days of your visit, Hop on hop off boats such as the "bateau bus"are perfect for this purpose--go for it. You will not be disappointed.

FABULOUS VIEWS. We walked from the Ile de la Cite/Notre Dame along to the bateau mouche at Alma. Lovely bridges and amazing architecture - great for photographers. Plenty of places to stop and admire the buildings. Well worth the walk (and it's all on the flat).
Take the host your. We Got a different perspective from the water. The crew and guides were Very informative. Not too crowded.

Beautiful River Dividing a Beautiful City. The Seine brings life to Paris. From the graceful way that it moves through the city to it's magnificent lights in the evening and to all the Parisiennes who sit on it's walls in the evening just gathering to talk and drink and relax it is truly the heart of Parisand the strips of beach that it affords the locals right in the middle of a bustling city is amazing The Seine is like poetry with its bridges and murals and old world charm
The cruise on this river was good.. As we cruised you could so many of the historical buildings, including the Eiffel tower. It was well worth it.

Beautiful - Great Experience. It's probably hard to be in Paris without somehow seeing the Seine. We mostly saw it on foot and crossed some of the beautiful bridges near Notre Dame. It's not really just about the Seine, it's all about the retaining walls, bridges and the beautiful buildings on it's banks. It's a must see while visiting Paris.
seine is paris. i think the seine river is paris and paris is seine.you can see a lot of buildings besides the river when you are travelling on passenger boats.

Follow the river Seine!. If u havetime to walk along the Seine in Paris, do it! At your leisure, there are some great photo ops. I like the Latin Quarter near Notre Dame walking toward the Louvre and stopping at the bridges....I have even walked from Notre Dame all the way past the Eiffel Tower and it took me a few hours, but I had the time. It was really nice around Invalides to the Eiffel Tower.... A great experience and a great way to see a lot of Paris!

Relaxing. After the hustle and bustle of Paris and it's attractions it is somewhat relaxing to just kick back and watch Paris glide by. That said unless you go early most of the tourist boats are quite full and you may have to wait in line. I can't say that the views are stunning as generally all you get to see is the facade of the buildings but it is a good orientation to parts of Paris.
Take a night time boat tour. At night- it is an amazing trip. Get seats or stand upstairs if it is a double deckered boat- you get to see so much of the city and the people. Lovely.

Busy. We were surprised that this river looked quite clean as the city has a lot of litter. The boat cruise was very good, but be aware that the only thing cheap in this city is the wine. Maybe other things are, but to me this is an observation due to us being recognized as a tourist. However the river is very nice and I recommend it to visit.

On foot or on boat - worth it. The river cruise is a great way to view Paris and take in the sights. The commentary is well judged and doesn't detract from the experience. It's also worth taking a stroll along the river. Highly recommend.

Magical Seine. Lovely River similar to Thames. We bought a padlock and wrote our names on it and padlocked it to the love bridge across the Seine. Didn't get a chance to go on the boats but they looked great.
Nice. I took the river seine cruise and it shows all important scenes in Paris, also sitting on one bank of the river is very charming.
Take the cruise. The cruise along the river is a great experience! Very relaxing with beautiful views! They sell the tickets right at the river... take the stairs down and you will find offices.

Chateaux Parisienne. The dinner cruise served in a glass covered dining room offers excellent food, wines cheese and desserts while you enjoy the spectacle of lights along the banks of the river. The bridges are a charming mix of past and present.

Romantic river cruise. This is one of the must do's to get the feel of Paris and its culture and people.The Seine river is lined with beautiful quays and crossed by 37 bridges, including Pont Neuf, Passerelle des Arts, Pont Alexandre III. Even if you are new to Paris and you don't know French the cruise has a personalized phone by your side that has language options to choose from and you get a step by step information on the various monuments that you pass-by during the cruise.

Get to the banks and relax. The best of Seine is what is called "les berges" - a very nicely restored area where you can cycle or simply take a walk with many nice arts places, nice cafés and some ecologically restored places. You can find silence, simply enjoy the nice scenery and avoid the noice and smell of the large city. For me the most lovely place in Paris!

A must do!. Whilst in Paris you must do a river cruise, there is nothing quite like floating up the Seine on a boat watching everyone strolling along the riverside hand in had.It is lovely to hear the commentary of the sights and bridges you go under.Lots of different companies provide all different types of cruises and can be found under the Eiffel Tower by the river.Enjoy!

Such a groomed River. This river is not at all what I think of as a natural river. The entire river through Paris is bricked/cemented. No natural bank at all. Having said that I think that's part of the neatness of it. Not at all like our North American Rivers. Take a ride on a boat and see it or walk along some of the pathways that are all along it.

Give it a stroll!. wherever you stay in Paris try to be fairly close to the Seine. It's a great way to navigate if you get lost easily like me! It is also a wonderful way to unwind. Stroll along it like a Parisian. Enjoy a pastry and the lovely views. In the summer they build a hilarious beach on the lower portion by the river. Walk slowly and admire the surrounding architecture and sights

Great to walk about. The River Seine essentially defines Paris. No visit of Paris is complete without a walk along the River, crossing the various bridges and enjoying the beauty. Be prepared for a lot of tourists doing the same but this is one very touristy activity that one should not miss. Many take the river ride but that seems way too touristy for my taste.

Great place to hang around and very romantic!. Loved the boat ride along the Seine River! Very romantic! Can't wait to go back! Walking by the river bank was so nice. Get a drink in the evening and sit and enjoy the city!!!!
BEAUTIFUL SCENERY AND RIVERBANKS. Distances very great for people with limited ability to walk and places to sit were not very evident.
Once is Enough. Yes, we took a boat ride. No we won't do it again. Been there, done that. (We like boats, too.) There are just too many museums to see and too little time for anything else.
