Great place to see at night. We felt quite safe strolling the river bank in the evening along with all the great places to eat and people to watch. A lot of fun activity, day or night.

What a hangout. The city has revolved around this body for a thousand years and still does. Pick a spot, buy some drinks and enjoy. Wave at the tourists on the boats, watch the city lights come on, take a leisurely stroll along the banks, splurge on a boat cruise. Paris and the Seine are inseparable.
So so romantic. I now know why paris is the city of romance.. walking by seine or just sitting by the river with wine. its just blissful.

Whatch out for the Scammers. Beautiful and great atmosphere all around , bought padlocks and attached them to the bridge in memory of our trip . Signed the bridge too. Watch out for the girls with clip boards claiming to be collecting for handicapped children, it's a Scam just walk past them .

Must do. Walk it during the day and at night;
Unless you have the Paris Pass and the Seine River cruise is included, don't waste your money on a boat tour. Most of the boats smell like excrement and they are packed so full that the ride is uncomfortable.

Take the BateauBus. Instead of the fashionable and expensive Bateaux which serve food, take the Hop on Hop off Bateau Bus. There are 8 stops and you can spend the day hopping on to different sites. We got off at Ile Saint-Louis for the best ice cream in the world Berthillion. Fabulous, pretty street with the ice cream as well.

loved it !. got ours with the paris pass - would have preferred to go at night but was concerned about being out on the streets late. Lovely visit of the buildings surrounding the Seine from the river view - to to the upper deck for better pictures.

No place on earth like it. You can't go to Paris and not stroll along the Seine. It's best to take a daytime cruise and a nighttime cruise--the City of Light is beautiful at any time of day. I wouldn't waste money on a cruise that included a meal--there's too much beauty to look at.

Take the Bato bus water taxi. A great way to travel around the city is by water taxi on the Seine. It stops in 8 places every 15 minutes and it gives you a nice view of the river from the Eifel Tower down to Notre Dame. Buy a pass for more than one day and get on and off as many times as you like.

Loved the beach on the side of the Seine. Part of the banks of the Seine are turned into a beach during August and have deck chairs along the beach. Great for watching the tour boats go past. Other than that there are numerous floating bars and restaurants along the side. Worth also taking a boat trip along the Seine and see Paris from a different perspective

Fabulous experience. Loved walking along the Seine with its purpose made seaside alongside. It has plenty for families to enjoy with bucket and spades, deck chairs, play areas, street entertainers. A really magical place with activities for children in one area. Also done a River cruise which was informative and a lovely way to see the sights.

Locks on the bridge and river lunch. took a cruise down the river Siene as part of our hop on/off bus tour. It was very nice but too brisk to be out on deck. The boat conveniently has covered areas that you can see all of the sights through. The lunch was a bit pedestrian, not the best, but it was a nice part of the entire experience. When we disembarked we took our locks and locked them on the bridge and through our key into the Siene.

A river cruise here is a must!. A wonderful way to spend a morning or evening in Paris, so much to see during a cruise on the Seine, plenty of great photo opportunities. We also spent time on The Plage by the Seine, the man made beach area, perfect on a Summer day, and the views of the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame cathedral from the river are awesome.
Don't miss it!. Very informative in many languages. Comfortable boat, coffee machine on deck.. You start the trip enthusiastic to know Paris, and end it adoring Paris.

Ride the Batoboats. I enjoyed the sights along the river by taking advantage of the Batoboats, which with my student ID only cost $10E for the day. There are other river boat options that have greater comfort, but if you're trying to keep costs down this is a nice way to bounce around between locations as well as to get some nice views of the city and the river. The back of the boat has an open space that, while it doesn't have seats, has the best views. If you're weary, then just relax in the seats and watch the city go by.

Highly recommended. We bought tickets for a boat that goes to the most famous places in the middle of Paris. The tickets were valid for a day, so we could get off the boat whenever we wanted and then jump on the boat again. Highly recommended!

Batobus cruise. Instead of an expensive bus tour, use this hop on hop off boat and tour the Seine and get across the city while resting your feet. The greenhouse effect will make you hot so sit near and open window and pop upp to take unique photos from the river of the Paris sites. Clever use of city space! LOVE the beaches trucked in for the summer along the banks...plenty to see!

Loved this cruise. A Seine River cruise is a must if you are visiting Paris. The river is beautiful as well as the sights you see from the boat. The tour was given in different languages. I recommend an evening tour, when you can see the Eiffel tower shine with lights. It is magnificent!

Glitter all gone. Plenty of boats to choose from for this river trip but be warned, very busy. We visited a long time ago and think that all the bridges must, at that time, had a fresh coat of paint as they were glorious. Afraid now they are all tarnished and dull and the river experience was spoilt for it.

Chilling out the Parisian way. Most tourists miss this obvious site, banks of river Seine. Specifically the promenade area. Locals come there to relax, party, get together, have a drink, roller blade, or just to hang out. I have never experienced such laid back enjoyment where groups of people are just hanging out and having a picnic at 2am. We went there several times since once was just not enough with our own picnic and bottle of wine! There are maps and details of the promenade available, but we just found a popular or scenic spot and hung out there, sometimes for hours.

Beautiful river. We had couple of walks along by the River Seine while staying near Paris. Its a beautiful river with interest around every corner. Our part favourite was the section near the Musee d'Orsay where there were loads of activities for the kids to try - including a huge chalk wall. We spent of couple hours here passing the time of day......very relaxing!

Pretty to walk along!. The Seine is fun to walk along and it is a great way to get around the city and locate yourself. Whenever we used our maps, the Seine was a great point of reference. If you walk along either side you are sure to find plenty of beautiful sites and wonderful surprises!

Wonderful part of Paris. The Seine winding through Paris is a great place to just walk along and take in all the sights along the way. It was lovely to just sit and watch the world go by and take in everything down at the river.

Pleasant way to escape the heat of the city. Caught the bateau mouche from Pont d'Alma and travelled up past Ile de la Cite and back again. Not cheap and OK, the commentary got its lefts and rights mixed up, but a nice way to spend some hours on the river. Only downside is the pushing and cramming of what seemed like hundreds of tourists all in a panic to photograph everything from Notre Dame to a floating wine bottle!

So much to see. On our recent trip to Paris we spent time walking along and near the River Seine. It is the heart of Paris. Everywhere you walk you see so many wonderful sights.and such different architecture. Take a break and sit beside the Seine and watch everything and everyone who passes you.

Sweet Air. The air on the river is sweet. and then when you see the very attractive women sunbathing in bikinis on the side its even better. the breeze was so welcomes in the hot sun and we too a boat which was nice and relaxing!
a stroll along the River Seine. I recommend a stroll along the River Seine to come to know something about Paris and to eat in one of the restaurants on the way

Can see almost all famous Paris sights. I walked along the Seine east to west from Notre Dame to Eiffel tower and I was able to see pretty much all the beautiful landmarks I wanted to see because everything is near the river!

In-Seine-ly Beautiful. We rented an apartment several blocks off the Seine in the Latin Quarter. It was a delight to be so close to this picturesque river. We walked, ran, biked, boated, drove and segwayed across the Seine many times in our week here and each time gazed adoringly in either direction. Having seen so many film scenes shot on these bridges and streets, it seemed like one big deja vu moment after another. Linger long and often if you make it there. This is a special place.

The Heartbeat of Paris. You must spend time walking, biking, watching or boating along the Seine. The river and its banks are the true embodiment of the city. Each bridge that spans it differs in architecture and adornment. I would strongly suggest a Bateaux-Mouches cruise to enable you to slowly take in all of its rich offerings. These are not expensive, and well worth the time. Their speed allows you to take many pictures of the sights along and close by the river, and of the Parisians who sit along its banks. Some of them wave as you go by! Late afternoon is a lovely time.
A bit overrated...... We rode it in the day and we rode it in the day....too much commercialization and concrete around takes that charm away or probably we were expecting too much....

lots of people strolling. People strolling along the Seine, whilst taking in the wonderful weather. Walking in Paris is delightful and easy. We observed many barges on the Seine, and were delighted to see people riding bikes with their market vegetables in the baskets.

Take a boat ride. We took a boat ride along the river seine at 930p--just about sunset--it was a beautiful night and its so beautiful to see the city from the boat--so much fun to see all the people just hanging out along the river--having picnics etc...

Very relaxing boat ride along river seine. We took a bout tour from behind the Eiffel Tower. You hold a handset to your ear which has many languages to choose from. It's such a relaxing way to travel and the surroundings are beautiful. Great view of Notre Dame also. You can sit inside the glass cabin or outside and enjoy the breeze. Great way to spend an afternoon
So Pretty & Very Romantic. We walked along the river, this is one of our favorite things. We did the classic touristy thing of putting a lock on lock bridge.

Wonderful. The Seine was bordered on both sides by games tables ith free games, table tennis, mazes, fitness trails, dance platforms, art work, gardens, bistros and boats. There was even an imported beach on the right bank with deck chairs, parasols and loungers. All of these activites are provided for the Parisian people along the Seine at this time of year. It was a wonderful experience to wander along the banks and do as much or as little as you liked. We even had a tango lesson. There are benches and seating along the length and many public facilities. As these had no cost many people spent time there but it was never overly crowded.

Romantic in the rain. The Seine cruise was fantastic with the best food we had in our time in France. So calming and the wait staff were excellent. The lights of the city and the Tower Eifel were surreal, altogether it was perfectly french and soooo romantic!!
Very nice view and river. On this river you can feel the Paris soulIts very nice and romantic, BEAUTIFUL!And wonderful view all around

What a beautiful walk. I was solo and walked back to the Trocadero area where I was staying ... from the Louvre. every mile had a water fountain - 1/2 of them were for free "eau gazeuse" very nice - very pedestrian friendly.
pleasant. very clean along side the river you can walk a long side it for a long way. I always enjoy going there, it cool in summer, and there are not a lot of people walking there.

Seine River Cruise. I enjoyed being on the boat, however, the only attraction that was lit up was the Eiffel Tower and you could have seen that from anywhere. Also, we could not hear/understand the person telling about each attraction as we passed it. So, was a bit disappointing.
Lots of excitement. Loved walking around by the water, looking at all the different art that vendors had. Lots of history. A great place to slow down to a slower pace.

Pizza on the Seine.. The Seine was all set for summer. Arty displays along and around the banks and there was a beach and deck chairs along the banks. Seemed very popular. We had a pizza and a beer at one of the food vendors.

have a stroll. We arrived at the metro station which was the closest to Notre Dame Cathedral and then we were walking to the Louvre Museum. The river was amazing, you can see an old prison nearby, the oldest bridge in Paris. There was also a small "Eiffel Tower" made of red chairs - awesome. Just enjoy the sunset near the Seine River - magnificient views :)

Under the Bridges of Paris. Had a river cruise under the bridges of paris & enjoyed every moment looking at the historic places including the Seat of government. Each bridge had it's own distinct character & a story linked to it which was fascinating.
Nice early evening boat trip. The boat trip affords very good views of Notre Dam the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre. The river banks could however do with a good tidy up.

Check out the beaches !. The city of Paris closes part of the parkway along to Seine to make a beach complete with lawn chairs and sand. It's wild. People really use it and it's wonderful to see right in the middle of Paris.Check out the Bateaux Mouches that go up and down the Seine. It's a wonderful way to see Paris from a different angle. Some of the boats are floating restaurants so you can enjoy a meal during your river cruise.
Beautiful. this was a high light of our trip , just loved it my wife was over the moon cant wait to go back one day , but will stay in the heart of the city next time

Grab wine & cheese and settle in for a picnic!. If you're looking to just take in the sights/sounds of Paris you can walk along the Seine from the Hotel d'Ville to the Eiffel Tower. However, an even better experience is to show up along the River and set up a little picnic. We did this on a Wednesday afternoon (5pm and stuck around until 10pm). Drinks, eats, and good times with friends. It all felt very Parisian. The afterwork crowd gathers around 7pm... so get your spot early.

Surreal!!!. I walked the river every morning during my recent stay. You can just sit and watch all the activity of the Seine or walk or jog. There are many bridges that cross the Seine, try to walk over all of them...you won't be sorry.

Stolling along. I know it's a river, but in July the create mini beaches along side especially around where the Notre dam was which is quite different and well used by the locals,as you walk along there is a model of the Eiffel tower and it's made from folding chairs and is amazing.and views accross to the other side is very good as well

Good Experience. A cruise down the Seine river is like the story of Paris unfolding in front of you. From Eiffel, to university area, to cathedrals, to museums, to people sitting on banks to enjoying and waving back at tourist/travellers. The cruise just bowls you over.At the cruise start/end point good Souvenir shop was there.

Lived upto expectations. What can you say about the River Seine that has already been said, its such a lively and interesting walk as we walked from Notre Dame along the banks dropping in at the Louvre on our way to the Eiffel Tower, Lived up to my expectations.

Drink in the view, the atmosphere, the experience... but not the water.. Tired of the metro, which is a great way to get around but not what you'd call scenic, we walked to the river intending to buy two day passes on the batobus (hop on/hop off, 8 sites along both banks of the Seine). Comically, everyone we asked for the location to buy the tickets directed us to one or another of the "tour" cruises, so we ended up strolling briefly through Ile de Cite and walking back and forth between Pont Neuf and Pont Marie several times on both sides of the river (getting sand in our shoes but thoroughly enjoying the people watching at Paris Plage in the process). It was fun, just not the fun we had planned for the morning. We started out ignoring the petition girls, and ended up laughing uproariously every time one approached us; and, we kept count: 25 petition girls (and a couple of boys) in between 10 and 15 minutes at Ile de Cite between Pont Neuf and Pont Au Change. It was almost disappointing when we only drew a 1/2 dozen while sitting on a bench later, near L'Orangerie. Don't they know the whole world is on to their scam by now? Finally bought tickets to the right bateau (near Pont Louis Phillipe, on the Paris Plage side) and floated back to the Lions Gate to spend to afternoon in Jardin du Tuileries (and decide not to spend a couple of hours in line at Musée de l'Orangerie before buying a Museum Pass). Used our tickets again the next day to float more of the river. Floating on the Seine w/o a tour guide jabbering in one's ear... bliss!

Great views of the city- take a cruise at sunset!. I wouldn't recommend taking a picnic and eating along the river, nor a jog, due to the strong stench of urine. That being said, you MUST take a cruise along the Seine! It is absolutely exquisite at sunset! Really awesome to see the architecture as the sun sets- a beautiful blush color against all the buildings!
River Seine. Lovely river trip on the Seine up to Normandy. Went thru a number of locks. Giverny and Rouen were highlights.
makes you fall in love with paris. took a boat ride along seine..one of the best iv done.. just transport u to a difference place and time altogether.. would do this again.

Like a post card. Go to the local shops and get something to eat and a cheap bottle of French Wine, then go down to the Seine in front of the Ile Saint-Louis and watch the river and the city of lights come agloe. Do it with someone you love.

The heart of the city. Go on a river cruise at the start of yourstay. The commentary tells you so much and it gives you a good idea of the lay out ofthe city and where to go next. Paris from the river is definitely thebest best way to see it and it gives you a rest for an hour!

Paris is the river. The first time I walked across the bridge to Place de Concorde I knew I was in Paris! This time I took a boat tour on the Seine and tried to name, and photograph every bridge as we went by. Notre Dame Cathedral is on an island in the river, The Louvre, Musee D'Orsay and the Eiffel Tower are all beside the river. Get a ticket of an on/off boat and you can use the river to get from one to another.

Seine River. we took a cruise on the Seine River to go see all the landmarks in Paris........................lot of stairs to go up and down to get to the boats so need to wear good shoes. since the steps are not all even

Ideal city walk in Paris. It's perfectly possible to walk from the Eiffel Tower to the Louvre and Notre Dame (or vice versa). The walk is a few miles but with stops at cafes along the way will walk quite easily.

River Seine is a must-do. We walked for miles around and along the Seine during our vacation. Good weather and bad, it was a staple to our sightseeing. We combined our Eiffel Tower ticket with a Seine boat ride which was worth it. Seeing all the spots on the ride was relaxing and picture perfect.

Dancing on River banks. Where else can you see tango, jitterbug, waltz on one riverbank? How about the Eiffel Tower pics and Norte dame close ups from the hop on off batobus? Ok so there are rats at night. This is Paree

Worth it.. The Seine is a great way to get around Paris. You can get the Batobus which stops at several major locations. You can hop on or off as you wish all day and it's great for taking photos. Also there are plenty of more leisurely cruises where drinks and food are available and you can relax in style and soak in the remarkable views as you cruise around Paris. Also, there are plenty of things to do on the river banks.

Take a boat ride at night!. Take a boat ride at night down the Seine. We saw all of the people hanging out on the river banks and everything was so beautiful at night. Highly recommend it but bring a sweater even in the summer it can be breezy. Wait until it is dark though - we took the last ride around 10 pm. It is well worth the money.

thoroughly enjoyable cruise. Although we have taken many cruises, we found this one to be exceptional. The staff and service in general were excellent - nothing was too much trouble. The food was much above average and the tours good. Although I notice that one commenter mentioned the relative lack of activities on board, I see that as a advantage. (Who needs casinos and dancers?)

bateau mouche. we usually go to the boat trip if the weather is good. These boats leave every half an hour and you don't need any reservation so it's easy to do at any time. Also evening time is nice to see all the city lights.

A relaxing way to see Paris sights.. We caught a Bateaux-Mouches riverboat and relaxed for the next 1 and a half hours. You see Paris from a different perspective and via the announcements on board, learn about some interesting buildings and bridges.
Nice way to take in the city. Nice river to see the Parisian sights lots of different offers don't get ripped off! Peaceful on a nice day! Lots to see plenty of pictures to be taken!

Illuminations not as great in summer. While the view of the City was wonderful, we hoped to see it all lit up but with the sun setting later, we missed most of the night view. Either do it in the day or don't expect a night of lights.

Gorgeous stalls by the river. Along the River Seine is an abundance of little stalls run by local Parisians selling art work, posters, antique books and general souvenirs. You will find these stalls between the Musee Louvre and Notre Dam on both side of the river. It is a lovely walk along the river and you get a wonderful sense of the Parisian culture. General souvenirs are generally cheaper here too rather than purchasing from a store.An ideal walk along the river would be from Notre Dam to the Eiffel Tower as you pass major attractions such as Musee Louvre, Musee D'orsay and can admire the may bridges connecting one side to the other.You can also travel along the river by boat by taking the hope on hope off boat which will take you to major attractions along the river if you chose not to walk.

Best part of paris. The seine is the best part of the city. view it by boat or by land. bring some lunch and sit by the banks. Or take a sight seeing trip and enjoy the views. Sit back and relax and enjoy the river flow by.

Take the cruise. We went on the cruise. It's a nice, quiet, relaxing ride from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame and back. The presentation highlights all the sights along the river. Great to take your first day there to get a plan of where to visit. As for the river, it's the lifeline of Paris. A lot of its main sights are located along the river. Many locals walk or hang out here, especially the youth. Do be aware if pick pockets in the more crowded areas. Overall, absolutely loved the area. My wife is already asking to go back.
Nice sight. We took the River Cruise, as a part of the Paris Pass. It was great to take a scroll down the river with the Eiffel Tower and the background and watch folks just hanging out on the banks.
The cruise. Nice river to see and explore. Go to the 21:00 cruise to catch the lighting of the Eiffel tower. This is a site that you don't want to miss.

Beautiful scenery! Different perspectives by river cruise, bus, and walking at different times of the day!. We experienced the Seine River from different perspectives. We saw the river by strolling, river cruising and by bus. We enjoyed very much strolling by the river bank at the street level as well as at the river level by walking down by one of the bridges. At the street level, we enjoyed the view of the river, the beautiful architecture of the buildings and bridges from near and far. Everywhere we turned, there was something interesting to see. Walking at the river level and by river cruising, we saw a different view of the river. The buildings along the river were partially obstructed at that level, but we were able to appreciate the different bridges along the river. We saw the beautiful details of bridges like Pont Alexandre and Pont Neuf, and discovered some interesting statues by the bridges, that we couldn't see from the street level. Strolling at the river level, it was very peaceful away from the traffic and busyness of the city. Also at the Ile de la Cite, we discovered a beautiful peaceful park at the western tip of the island.From the cruise boat, we were able to enjoy the view of the Ile de la Cite, with the stunning Notre Dame. And enjoyed the sights leisurely.On the double decker bus, we appreciated different views of the river as we were raised from the street level. The sights are more spectacular at sunset as the sunlight changes the visual perception of the colour of the buildings, bridges and the river.

Lovely evening. We arrived in Paris on the Friday of our Wedding Anniversary, and decided to book this tour for the evening. The menu was lovely, the service was great, and they all spoke English (and they seemed to appriciate my attempt at French, which I admit is very very rusty!) Only thing I would suggest, is that they include some live music as there was nothing other than eating the food or looking at Paris by night, which if you were not by the attractions you wouldn't know what they were, as nothing was mentioned.

Everyone should see the River Seine at least once in their life.. What a beautiful river. Lots of boat tours are available for a closer looks, but just viewing from one of the many lovely bridges is worth the price of admission!
PS There's no admission!

Use the Batobus to exploire the Seine. Cheap, easy to use and lovely it brings you to the main sights near the Seine. The children liked it and it gets you out of the crowded atmosphere during travel time.

Awesome Stroll. We walked along here both near the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame. It's really peaceful and everyone seems to gravitate towards it. Near Notre Dame, you can actually walk along the lower level and enjoy a baguette from one of the nearby shops.

A VERY SAFE WAY OF SEEING PARIS. This is a very safe way of seeing Paris. My wife and myself cruised the river and lucky it was such a beautiful hot day so it was perfect. Due to the very high risk of being robbed in Paris this is a very safe way to see it specially for woman on there own as they are targeted by robbers.

A romantic scene. Take the batobus and you will see all the attractions first hand. Remember to visit the bridges near the notre dame and walk along the left side where you will find all sorts of goods, even though some of them are a bit pricey without actually worth the buy.

Beautiful River. The Seine provides so much wonderful scenery as you make your way through Paris. I experienced two riverboat excursions on the River and sat by its banks and ate a breakfast roll with coffee one morning. The river is wonderful.

A romantic and lovely river cruise that will leave you unforgettable!. A cruise along the Seine River in Paris will create unforgettable and lovely memories. The scenery is remarkable and so beautiful. The cruise sails through the river slowly where you can catch a good but different view on the major landmarks in Paris, such as the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame Cathedral, museums, monuments and statues etc. But you are not standing at the foot of the Eiffel now but it is "behind" you as the cruise sails as your backdrop and so its a good photography spot. What romantic it is when you are photographed with your loved ones.The water in the river is clean and crystal clear. The cruise will pass through several bridges, with people waving at you! One of the bridges is the Pont de Arts (Lock Bridge), where you can find many people here, especially couples who come here to put a lock to symbolise their love. The feeling is nice and so heart warming.We took the cruise at mid-day as part of our group tour itinerary and despite of the sun, its not warm at all. You can choose to sit inside or go out of the deck to enjoy the breezes. We believe the scenery will be even nicer and more beautiful in the evening from the lightings of the buildings.If you are visiting the Louvre Museum, why not take this cruise as it is nearby and offer you a different experience and taste of Paris, the most romantic city in the world! You will not regret it but have sweet memories!

Cruise it!. The Seine is gorgeous. I walked it and I cruised it, and I think I got more out of the cruise. You see more angles of the city's monuments, such as the Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower, as well as the Louvre and the Conciergerie. The Cruise at sunset just rendered me speechless.
Dinner on the river. The dinner cruise on the Seine was very enjoyable! Food and service was average but the scenery was great!
Beautiful place. We walked over a few bridges and along the river side and this is a really beautiful river. Also lovely to see from the top of the Eiffel Tower.
Too commercial. We took a ride on the boat but was too hyped . The round was not worth the amount one spends on this boat ride

The very best way to finish your trip!!. So..... this is the 2nd time ive done this food and cruise thing.
This time was with Bateaux Parisien
www.bateauxparisiens.com
Nice boat, nice crew, great food, fabulous trip down the Sienne.
3 course meal, a singer and all the sites........58 Euro each (its worth it!)
Walking. Walk along the seine it's very romantic :) very beautiful when the suns setting and the tower sparkles

Is there anything you can do or see here??. It's hard to imagine any city on the planet that doesn't have more going on with a river that traverses its core. I think it would be impossible to visit Paris and not at least see the Seine as you pass from one district to another, as there are bridges every several blocks. We have never been on one of the tour boat rides that so many do while in Paris, but you can experience it in so many other ways without leaving the banks. Whether on foot (strolling, jogging or running), roller blades, roller skates, bikes, pedi-cabs, you-name-it, you can follow it either side at street level or down at water level for miles and pass so many well-known sights, up close or even at a distance. Had it not been so hot when we were there, I would have gone for a run along the lower promenade close to the water level, which by my eye looked as though you could do for miles without having to stop. Additionally, there are hundreds of little kiosks along the length at street level that sell every imaginable item, not to mention cafes to sit, eat and look out across the river's beautiful panorama. This is a must-see, as if anyone really needed encouragement!

Gorgeous, Day or Night. Can't help but fall for its charms, as you lean over a bridge, day or night. Fun for sitting in the shade with an ice cream, legs hanging over the concrete retaining wall.Fun for people watching at night. Lots of questionable activity on the lower level, rive gauche, near Notre Dame.

Picturesque and historical. I walked and rode buses across several bridges, very pretty river with tremendous history and gorgeous bridges, with buskers and lots of photo opportunities. As well, you can walk for miles and miles along side the river.

A must in paris. Yes Paris is very touristy. Sometimes you just have to give in to that. Walk along the River because it's beautiful! Do your best not to eat along the river, though. It's too easy to find expensive unenjoyable food there. My suggestion: stop in at a wine shop, a cheese shop, and a fruit market, pick all your favorites and set yourself up along the river. You won't regret it.

Famous river in Paris. My wife and I stayed in a one bedroom apartment near Pont Neuf, within a short walking distance to this river. We walked along the river-front, every day for 3 days, while walking to various tourist attractions.We had done a boat cruise in 2006 during our previous visit.

wow wow. The river divides the city of paris. and very beautiful, we could enjoy dinner on a cruise with the strains of live music. during the day and night does not distinguish the beauty of this river ...
love it. very romantic cruise we have done on this river covering almost entire city with panoramic view of effiel tower .

The heart of Paris. We were in Paris for a week and walked along the Seine every single day, sometimes in the morning, sometimes at midnight. It is a magical space. Each bridge offers different vistas, each time of day different kinds of energy. Our favorite time was going out at 9:30 or 10 in the evening and enjoying the cool of the evening with all the millions of other Parisians.

Evening Cruise. Used Paris Pass and enjoyed an evening cruise with my friends. Ride was comfortable and the sights lovely as the sun set and Paris came to light (bridges, Eiffel, Notre Dame, neighborhoods, etc.).

An incredible way to soak up Paris. River Seine is a beautiful waterway that goes right through Paris. The cool thing is that you can take a leisurely walk along the river or take a boat ride to get a different perspective. We did both, as we walked from the Louvre to the Eiffel Tower in the daytime and took a boat ride at night. I recommend Vedettes du Pont-Neuf, as this was a great way to see the city lit up and to get some great pictures. In addition, you get to see all the young Parisians hanging on the banks of the river eating and drinking.

Do the boat ride. Aside from the fat tire segway tour, this is a great way to see some of the city.. also, great people watching. do it at dusk, or a little later... you catch the boats by the eiffel tower. lotta fun, and relaxing at the same time.

River Cruise was great. We did the 1 hour cruise. It's amazing to see the beauty of the bridges. The carvings are fantastic and can only be viewed from a boat. Great way to see Paris from a different perspective.

Relaxing way to sight see. We took the boat trip toward the end of the day and was able to see some amazing sights while enjoying the boat trip. You can see the Statue of Liberty and how much smaller she is compared to the one in the U.S., Napoleon's castle and a statue of Louis XIIII, Notre Dame and the Tower Bridge.The best was the Eiffle Tower, towards dusk the Tower would light up and a georgeous backround with the beautiful sunset made for a beautiful pic. Some of the sights were lit up towards the end of the tour such as the statue of Louis XIII and the Eiffel Tower. The boat was a bit crowded but you can see many sights. My favorite sight was watching the people sitting on the banks of the river just soaking in the sights.

Worth a visit. Did not go on the hour cruise but many in our group did and were delighted with the sights along the way. I liked the way that they put sand along one part of the bank of the river with Palm trees etc so people in Paris can go and sunbathe and picnic as if they were at the seaside, what a great idea. This was being set up on our visit.

Great to see day or night, on foot or by boat. There are so many sights you can see just by walking along this river. The views are great both day or night. It 's worth seeing both in daylight and after the sun goes down for a different perspective. In addition to walking, I recommend taking a one hour boat cruise (as opposed to the hop on/off Batobus service). There are many companies that do this sightseeing cruise and most seem very similar. After spending a lot of time trying to compares the different companies online, I just chose one that was recommended by the hotel. As far as timing, I recommend a night cruise that starts about 30 minute before sunset. That way, you can get some pictures with good lighting and also see the Eiffel Tower sparkle. You will be sharing the boat with a hundred other people but it still manages to be very romantic.
A Beautiful Walk On A Sunny Day. If you go to Paris, you just have to do this walk, along both banks - taking in the views and the riverbank cafes etc. Just lovely.
Always something going on!. In the 4 days we were in Paris we were drawn to the River Seine each night. One night there was a 9 piece band by the banks and always great to stroll around.

The River Seine, a different perspective.. The River Seine, a place to walk, to sit, to meet, to see and be seen, a place of quiet contemplation, a place of lively conversation. Take a stroll,sit, take a river taxi or a river tour and get a different perspective of this great city.

night tour lights were nice,, but pics ????. so we took the last tour of the evening and the boat was a little more than half full. the great thing as night in the summer is that it was cool and less crowded. however at night, you are not going to get the pics , that you would during the day, so if you are looking to get lots of great pic, i would pick a daytime cruise, we , however enjoyed the cruise very much.
Always nice on a sunny day. Its always fun and relaxing to visit Paris by boat. Just sitting at ease and watch the city pass by. Need more?

Overrated. I think there are two types of travellors to Paris. They love it or find it overrated. There were some nice parks in Paris. watch for dog do do tho.I thought the Seine was dirty with no wow factor to offset. Other then a French gardener trying to pick me up, most of the shop keepers etc were not that friendly.

excellent way to see the city. The river has so much to see. There are fantastic bridges and lots of famous and historic buildings visible from a unique perspective. Gorgeous at night and on warm days!
Nice view. Take the time to hop on a cruise (if not you can always cycle) on the lovely banks of Seine. You get to see the Eiffel Tower (good spot of a nice photo) and the Notre Dame.

Synonymous with Paris and romantic at night. This must be the most relaxing way to see Paris. Some of the boat tours are a bit expensive and personally I think just taking the ferry or a day pass or two day pass with the Batobus is the best value for money. Quite a number of the main attractions of the city are easily accessed by boat. The river is also romantic at night and there are plenty of walkways for a stroll along the banks. Often this will include passing permanent market stalls along the river and a good way to select a cafe for lunch!

1 hour tour of the Seine. We got these ticket free with our booking at Mercure Hotel. It was with a great tour, covered boat so you are protected from the weather (cold and rainy) if it's hot, may get too hot ....in there. You can sit outside, however you will only be able to see one side of the river at a time.

A river with many old buildings around!. The river goes through the Paris. Most of the Paris monuments and old buildings are around the river. We have walked about 3-4 hours along the river and enjoyed the views.

From Eiffel tower to Notre Dame. The way this river goes thru Paris next to so many beautiful sites and the possibility to walk along almost all the length is very cool, but half of the walkways are on the water level where you can see nothing but walls and all kinds of people hanging there, especially around Notre Dame and Latin quarter. A lot of stairs, narrow walkways and security alerts but also many parts with broad walkways, beautiful bridges, some of them pedestrians only, if it's nice weather it can be very nice sightseeing walk.

A lovely walk!. Make sure you take the time to walk and relax along the Seine in Paris. Great places to sit and have a drink or take something with you and picnic along the way. Great things for kids to do and see like games speed badminton. Even had a lovely 10 minute massage one day under a bridge:) And people watching is fantastic, love the rollerskaters dancing with their boom box or the skateboarders!
Beautiful View. Take the time to see the Seine from various "ponts". Each one gives a different perspective. Great for people watching as well as getting a view of sites.

So much better than before. Paris used to turn its back at the Seine - like Rome still does to the Tiber and many other cities too. However, Paris has recognized the potential of having a clean (or relatively clean...) river with areas for recreational use right in teh center of the busy city. The Seine banks today are full of people and energy. Young and old. Plenty of places to sit and enjoy your food - whether purchased on the spot or carried with you for the purpose. Walking or cruising - both experiences are so much more pleasant today than 10 years ago!

A Night River Cruise. Last night we went on a river cruise on the Seine. It was a great evening and the lights and buildings were beautiful. I would recommend it --the price was around $10 AND in several areas people were dancing along the river at an area made for dance.

The Seine Is Paris!. Water is life. The Seine is the lifeblood of Paris.You too will have no doubt seen it in countless movies?Imagine you are Audrey Hepburn, cruising it with Cary Grant, or exploring the art work on the left bank.You'll have the romance of Paris, even if travelling alone!Glorious bridges and an island that gave birth to this enigmatic city are amongst its highlights.Its shores are awash with so many iconic museums, that art and culture meld into your veins.But beware; once you have traversed its shores by foot, or boat it will call you back!And just think of all those visionary and inspired humans who have also travelled this same path: Simone De Beauvoir, Monet, Cezanne, Coco Channel, Emile Zola, Marcel Marceau, Marie Curie, Jaques Cousteau, Robespierre, Toulouse Le Trec, Claude Dubussy, Chopin, you will be with them and all the thousands of French intellects who have helped make the world a better and often, more cultured place!Voila!Vivre le France!Vivre Paris!
peaceful . despite all the hustle and bustle, taking a stroll along the river seine is quite peaceful and relaxing. there's so much to see and plenty of cafés along the way that you can't go wrong!
River Cruise. Taking the river cruise enables you to see things from a different perspective. Very relaxing! :) we were able to take some awesome pictures! :)

dreamy. see it from bridges, walk along it, cruise on a boat down it and listen to the history. IN summer there is a beach with real sand brought in and lounge chairs - being from CA I enjoyed seeing but would not hang there. Try Batobus where you can hop on/off to see the different sites.

Best way to get to attractions. Loved the river was quicker to get to attractions as no traffic better air quality and staff on boat friendly. Nice views as we went along the river great for children. Loved the bridges and the lock bridges.

Get on a double decker bus for the best view. From the seat of one of Paris's numerous double decker buses you get the best view of the lovely Seine River. You can see the jogging path below the walls that hold the River banks in, you don't miss any of the diverse bridges - make sure you bring a lock with a message for that one, and enjoy one of the most storied rivers of the world. If you have more time do a dinner cruise and become part of the River. You won't regret it.

Boat trip with Bateaux Parisiens. 1 hour trip on a small boat, shows you main sights, commentary a bit muddled as trying to do about 4 different languages. Toilet on board. Good for children and those just looking for a quick tour of Paris from the river.

Hop on hop off Seine boat journey. Seeing cities from the river is always a positive as far as I'm concerned and the Seine trip was really good. As the name suggests you can use it as you please. We used it instead of the metro some of the time and found it to be pretty reliable and relaxing

A Different View of Paris. While in Paris make sure that you take a boat tour of the Seine River. It provides a different perspective of the city that isn't available at street level. While on the boat make sure to get some photos of Notre Dame Cathedral from this angle. A water cruise also allows you to see the architecture of the bridges - something that is not visible from the land. Many have ornate figures and designs on them. You will also see Paris life along the river bank - couples walking, people eating lunch, children playing - it is almost another world along the river below the city streets - much more quiet and peaceful. You should also try to take a walk along a part of the river just to say that you have done it. Very enjoyable way to spend part of the day and escape the lines in the museums.
Great for strolling. West Bank area strolling is fun. Many days there are vendors on the street level that sell all kind of collect abeles, one of a kinds as well as the standard tourist souvenirs.

Boat ride in the rain. Unfortunately it started pouring during our boat ride but it was still nice to mellow out on the boat for an hour. We did this on the first day we arrived nice way to just unwind after a long flight. Would have liked to do it at night but it gets dark so late in the summer

Beach in Paris. !!. We came here in august when the pre was a beach set up along the river seine near the louvre museum with music and real sand and umbrellas with deck chairs. It was lovely and something different.

A FANTASTIC BOAT CRUISE. This was included in the Paris Pass but no special line, we had to wait about 20 mins. A very educational tour that gets you prepared for your walk of Paris. You get a view of all the main sights to visit. Take this early to get a good idea of what you want to see again closer.

For a different perspective of Paris icons. A boat ride on the Seine during the day is worthwhile. Great views of the bridges, buildings and of course Tour Eiffel. We have also done a night tour but didn't see as much as during the day.

Be choosy about your boat ride.. I wanted a refund of our boat tickets for our ride on the River Seine. My seat was facing one side of the seine, so as we passed Notre Dame and the Ile de la Cite and I was unable to turn around even to see them. There were too many broken seats or broken headphones. When I walked back to the TI to request a refund, I was told they did not handle the money, I would have to back to the boat.

Seine River lunch boat cruise. Another "must do" when in Paris. For couples - and more - this is not only a romantic voyage on the Seine, but also a sightseeing through some of the heartland of the city. Good food and more than enough to drink gives a thumbs up, however, the announcements - in English - was too few. A tip to the people running these cruises would be to tell more about history and buildings throughout the cruise. The live music was allright, but from my point of view as a tourist I would like to have some more information during the sightseeing. As for the music, I could always find a place to buy some romantic French music for my wife.

Good Views. Everywhere the River Seine passes, there are very good views of the river and the buildings beside the river. This makes the river very interesting. The bridges that cross it are also quite interesting.

Walking along the River Seine. Walk along the banks of the Seine any season of the year and enjoy the beauty and romance of Paris at its best. We stayed in an apartment on the left bank with a view of Notre Dame from our lounge, and this part of the Seine is particularly lovely to walk along. Street level is busier and noisier, but you can browse among the Bouqinistes – booksellers of used and antiquarian books, posters, etc. This is a UNESCO World Heritage site and the ‘green boxes’ get opened up as shops. And of course you walk past so many magnificent iconic buildings in Paris too!There is also the wonderful bookshop Shakespeare & Co where so many of the great writers of the twentieth century used to gather. Allow time if you are a booklover.Or walk along the lower embankments alongside the Seine where the locals are walking, fishing, jogging or soaking up the sunThere are the very touristy boats which are great for first time visitors – in fact a must – and also provide good transport to get to the various main scenic attractions that are close to the Seine

a worthwhile trip. Take one of the many tour boats on the seine and just enjoy the guide. I am not the tourist type, but on this trip my family really wanted to go on the boat ride. It was great. Just to view the art and sculture work on the bridges, something thats hard to see from the bridge but easy from the boat. plus to see the usual sights many of which we had visited in the previous two days for a different view. This was well worth the time and money. Try for an evening ride and take a light sweater.

Enjoyable trip on the Seine. It's a comfortable way to travel through Paris. Buy a hop on hop off ticket for the day and see Paris from the river. Stop along the way to visit famous French attraction.
Excellent place. You can enjoy walking all the river. There are places where to stay and have a drink. Or just sit down and enjoy the view of the different monuments of the city.

A pleasurable cruise and a quiet walk. THis is one of the life bloods of Paris. We took a 1 hr cruise, also walked along the banks and shopped along the book stalls Very relaxing and fun as well as seeing keey sights like the Eiffel Tower, The Louvre, Notre Dame, the lock bridge and other famous bridges that cross the river. And when we needed to take a break, we just sat along the wall and experienced the river life.
Great one hour tour. Well worth taking this quick tour. Great sights and perfect for taking pictures. Line was not too long like the Eiffel Tower so you don't kill half your day waiting.
Lovely at night. We went on one of the boats at night and it was really lovely to see all the buildings and bridges illuminated.

Rest on the Seine. When you have wore thin of walking and need to rest, a trip on the Seine refreshes and rejuvenates. It's great to be able to stop to see the sights and return for a brief reprieve. We love to watch the boats from the bridges and imagine the stories behind the couples picnicking an the quay.

Nice to way to see all of Paris. Book your tickets at the France Tourism Office- by the Louvre- they were cheaper thant at location.You could seat down below or up above, open air, nothing to obstruct your view.
heart of paris. The river is the heart of paris. Do go for a cruise along the river. It covers all the major destinations in paris.
Nice one hour cruise. Not only was it a place to give our legs a break from walking around the city, the sights are just beautiful. The commentary is great too!
Dinner Cruise- with fireworks. fantastic! It was Bastille Day and I was able to book the cruise for this evening! What can I say, the fireworks show was magnificent!
Great vantage point to see Paris.. It's efficient and a great way to view the city. I highly recommend, and it's fun.Great vantage point to see Paris.

My review. As part of our tour, seine river cruise at night was also included which was amazing. All the attractions in paris are worth seeing.U will see many bridges on the river that connects both sides.Its worth viewing the buildings in paris at night with all lights glittering.The most important thing i felt was that though the river was flowing silently,the current waves were unpredictable...same like some people who always smiles and talk less and u cannot know what is in their mind even if u r with them...
mm. So gorgeous it was such an awesome back drop to so many photos...... :) loved the street artists as well

A wonderful expanse of life affirming water, but .... The stench of stale urine as we attempted our regular morning walk spoiled our outing along the banks of the Seine. Despite this, the Seine is still a gracious, quintessential part of life in Paris. A great people watching exercise, there's never a dull moment along the Seine ... gaudy cruise boats, gaggles of tourists, amblers, nutty exercise fiends, dog walkers, all the beautiful bridges - and of course, lovers ... there's snippets from all walks of life.
Do a river trip. The trips along the Seine are great, either during the day or at night. They offer a different perspective of Paris and are a great way to see many of the best sights.

Relaxing ride along the Seine. It was lovely to sit on a boat and view the Seine and the city from the river. Even if you have walked and driven by the river, it is a different experience by boat. We went in the evening, and it was light for the first half, but getting dark on the way back. This meant we got to see the Eiffel Tower lit up as we returned. It is also fun to walk over the Seine, and see all the lovers' locks, and read the messages.You can walk down by the river, and we saw that on summer evenings, people bring blankets, and picnic by the river, or enjoy refreshments and relaxing with each other.The one negative of the boat ride was the annoying people who were noisy, or jumped up to photograph each other with no regard to the other tourists, but that is no fault of the cruise.

Nice down time. A boat tour is always fun, and sometimes can be just too long. The one hour tour which numerous companies offer seems to be just right... I was just getting bored as we pulled into port.For families... pick that point where you want to politely strangle your lovely children (and I really truly love my kids, they are the center of my life), but there comes a time where for me at least on trips where they get to be too much... and they are probably saying just the same thing about you.This is the perfect time for this boat ride.

A lot to see but beware. We spent a fair amount of time near the river. We took a river boat tour which was nice and a chance to see the city without walking. It was an interesting view of Notre Dame.
We visited several sidewalk vendors and artists along the river.
We also ran across a couple of groups of pickpockets...so beware and plan accordingly.
serene. Great place to walk, stroll and see the views from the city. Make sure to see the lock bridge from the river and watch for people throwing keys!

A lovely cruise. Part of a package arranged through the hotel was a 1 hour cruise along the Seine. Starting from by the Eiffel Tower, it chugs along to just past Notre Dame Cathedral before returning on the other side of the river. Commentary of landmarks via telephone, in various languages.

RELAX AND ENJOY THE SIGHTS OF PARIS.. A very nice trip on the river Seine for one hour plus.Good commentary in french and english.Very good way to see the top places to visit.You can book online before leaving the uk.

Very good around the small island, average else where. My heading says it all. Fairly bland concrete boundaries in most places with no features of interest apart from bridges. Off the t
Op of my head just more vegetation somehow inserted would make a great difference on the banks. Again the heavy traffic around much of the river bank detracts.

Do the boat trip past Notre Dame. The boat trip up and past Notre Dame and back is a very good way to see some stunning architecture and sights of Paris. I highly recommend this - it's not crowded and it's a very peaceful way to get around. You can get the boat just down the stairs to the Siene next to the Eiffel Tower.
The aquatic soul of Paris. Take the hop on and off Batobus for a thrifty was to cruise the river. Then book on one of the boats which traverse the Ile St. Martin canal for another view of Paris.
Nice time, but could have skipped this. I don't think this boat tour of the Seine was wort the time. The best part was seeing the Eiffel Tower twinkle two times.

Nice boat ride - Great light show from Eiffel Tower!. Cruises are a nice value, very interesting. try and get the boat that leaves 30 minutes before sunset, that way, when you cruise back to the Eiffel Tower, you'll see the light show. Fantastic!
Take one of many river buses. We bought a two day pass on the river bus and it was great to get on and get off at major stops. Very convenient and didn't have to learn the metro system again.

So romantic. Maybe this river offers the best views ever. I love to stroll by both its sides and I really like that you have the opportunity to do so very close to the river, in comparison to many cities that this is not the case. Local benches and little shops complete the most romantic city routes!

Cruise tour takes you close to City. This tour is very nice if you wish to see major parts of city in short duration. The cruise is nice and seats were comfortable also.
Though some of seats were not in good condition. Its always better to get soon on board so as to get seat of your choice.
Best viewed from upper level corner seats.
Romantic site. Such a beautiful, romantic site whether riding on a boat on the river or standing on one of the many bridges overlooking the water. Place a lock on one of the bridges.

Nice way to see the city. We took the river cruise which s a bridge away from Notre Dame. It is a nice way to see the city and get a feeling of the history of Paria.The cruise goes as far as Eiffel Tower. If doing it in summer go as early morning as possible o you an sit up top which is open. Ou want to avoid too much sun. Tickets are available close by but coud possibly buy them as the dock. It was a nice peaceful interesting hour with good commentary.
Peaceful and Serene. Make sure you look for the small statue of liberty along the way. This was a great way to get some good photos and get the lay of the land in Paris.

Bateau-Mouche diner and river cruise. After a day of sight-seeing, jumping on and off the Metro and consulting guide books, it was wonderful to step into the elegant atmosphere of the Bateau-Mouche flagship lounge and be shown to our table. While we were treated to music by a violin / piano duo, we sipped our champagne and selected our dishes for the evening. Then we began our leisurely progress along the Seine, past the great buildings and land marks of the city. We returned the waves of other river cruise passengers, as we slipped by in our class salon as we enjoyed our meal. When dessert was finished and the coffee produced, we came alongside the glittering tower and were sure we'd been transported to some fairy tale landscape. To the strains of romantic French favourites, we were brought safely home, full of pleasant memories and incredibly delicious food. Merci BM, we will return!

Hop on hop of cruise. This was a brilliant way to explore Paris and see the beautiful buildings. We used the hop on hop of option and then in the evening did the entire trip from pont alexandre iii to enjoy the sun going down, this worked well for us to get the metro back to the hotel

Great way to see the city highlights. La Seine! Divides the two banks, left and right, but from either side she is beautiful. We had the opportunity to take two cruises, one during the day and another in the evening and both were different yet gorgeous. There is a lot of traffic on La Seine, but you lose yourself in the magic and don't see it anymore.This is a great way to start your vacation in Paris!
Looking at it or being on it - you can't do Paris without it. You just must see it. If you can walk down by it. At least walk over it....and kiss somewhere near it.

A must-do walk for romantic couples!. I fell in love even on a rainy day! The atmosphere is contagious! Walk by it hand in hand and take a bout tour through! Paris is even more inspiring from the river!
Beautiful way to see the city. Did a river cruise and dinner on the river. A beautiful way to see the city whilst eating. You go past most pf the main attractions around Paris.
Seine cruise is like a dream. You have to take a cruise to enjoy a non-forgettable experience that gives you great views of many of the most famous attractions in Paris.

A must see in Paris!. I have taken a tour down the Seine twice and have loved it both times! I definitely recommend doing it at night. Seeing Paris all lit up while cruising the river is relaxing. There are several operators to choose from right next to the Eiffel Tower. We did a tour where you take in the sites (not a dinner cruise). There was too much to see than to worry about food. It left on the hour so I had terrific photos of the twinkling lights of the Eiffel Tower. It even started raining and it just added to the experience.

Pretty, even in the rain. We did a river cruise on the Seine which basically takes you one way to the Eiffel Tower and the other direction to Notre Dame. Well worth it to learn about what you are seeing in the oldest parts of Paris. Even in the rain, it was special.

River Seine. Well you're going to see it whether you want to or not..kind of hard to miss..and if you do the boat tour..I'll venture you'll only do it once..it's fast..about an hour..and in my opinion not worth the 14 Euro ticket..this July was my third visit to Paris and my first boat tour,,,I didn't miss anything by not going sooner...

A little wine.... Buy some cheese and biscuits, a bottle of wine (make sure you have a bottle opener because most wines are corked rather than screw top) and sit by the river on a clear evening. Along the bank there are various points of interest - artists, musicians, events.

Family fun along the Seine. We walked along the Seine with our daughters, aged 6 and 9. It was a lovely relaxing walk out of the bustle of the touristy areas. There were also activities along the way, drawn on the pavement or wooden benches to balance along, as well as watching all that was going on around us. This was my favourite part of our day trip to Paris.

Night time cruise is awesome. There are several cruise operators to choose from, I took two different ones at different times in Paris. I do NOT recommend dinner cruise, because you don't want to try to eat while watching the scenery. In Paris, dinner is a romantic affair, so focus on dinner and enjoy the food and great French wines and the conversation. Do the evening cruise to enjoy this amazing city of lights. Get your camera ready for some photo opportunity.

The heart of Paris. One can walk along the river Seine, in many different areas and atmospheres.From Notre-Dame to the Statue of Liberty, by the Musée d’Orsay, le Louvre, the Tuileries gardens, or by boat on the Bateaux-mouches.By rain or sun, it is always a pleasure…

Beautiful as always!. I always enjoy a boat tour on the Seine--especially on a Friday or Saturday night. It is fun to see the locals wave at us and drink wine along the banks. The scenery is always spectacular!!
Pleasant one hour cruise. Did the cruise on a Friday afternoon from near the eiffel tower. Interesting informative and very relaxing. The cruise gives a different bviewpoint to the boulevards.

The best way to take in Paris. My boyfriend and I booked the site seeing cruise with Bataneux (possible typo), who are stationed at the foot of the Eiffel Tower.The cruise was about 12 euros each and lasted an hour. The River Seine is lovely and has some beautiful views of Paris. There is also an audio guide if you're interested. I'd say a cruise down the river is a must, a lovely relaxing way to take it all in.

Lifeblood. You read that Paris can be as congested and polluted as Beijing...not so in Spring - Paris in Spring is Spring - and the Seine is its lifeblood. Forget the crowded tourist boats...take your time, take a jambon fromage baguette and walk slowly along the river of Paris, up and down the stairs, back and forth across it's bridges, all of which are different - watch the barges, luxurious and workmanlike - one can still see the importance of the river in providing a conduit for produce, equipment and building despite the cascade of tourism...fishermen, barges loading and unloading, floating restaurants, hopeless charter boats, gorgeous canal boats - one can see all of Paris in the Seine.

Scenic promenade. We enjoyed the outdoor market and the lovely scenery as we walked along the promenade. Views from either side of the river are grand. The weather was rainy and a downpour happened just as we left the market but it was full of atmosphere and a good place to have a bite of lunch.

Seine Helps you View & Enjoy Paris Highlights :-). I read in a article that the best way to start a city exploration is to use the Hop on Hop Off Bus .... the RIver Cruise is a far more enjoyable and pleasant way to achieve this and in the process see the beauties of Paris :-) ... there is no question of missing this ... We hit this place with a large gorup of 20 with 50 50 split of adults and kids. the queueing is quite efficient and is a cinch to settle down My Reco's include1. Plan for this immed after your Eiffel Tour ( Staring point of Cruise is just opposite the Tower and can be done easily )2. Bata Moucheaux and Bato Parisienne are companies that i have used and both were equally good3. Day , Evening & Night cruises all offer different light settings and have thier own charms ... however for a good look at the attraction try the evening cruise first4. Kid friendly and they enjoy it thoroughtly 5. Carry your camera fully charged as the Photo Ops herein is different angles and is rather good :-) :-)
great cruise on the River Seine. Wonderful view of all the famous sites to see on the River and in Paris. The weather was warm and sunny. Paris looked fabulous from the River Seine.

Water Taxi is a huge plus!. To see the river at your own pace I recommend the water taxi (Batobus). Just purchase a day pass - it stops at all the major attractions until 9:30 pm and you can move at your leisure. We stopped at the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Hotel De Ville and the Jardin Des Plantes (which included the managerie) in one day while enjoying the river and bridges. And no sore feet!
Family holiday. Cruise nice but it was terribly hot, and the boat was very very full. The glass windows were filthy and you could hardly see out. They don't bank on you returning.

The Seine is lovelier than words. Took a river cruise leaving from the Eiffel Tower area just before sunset. Sunset reveals yet more Parisian magic and seduction. Waiting for my boat I saw two mimes by the Seine (I couldn't resist saying that.) Light winter sprinkle during the cruise that added to the magic. Returning to the Eiffel Tower all lit up at dusk is unforgettable. Tip. Get up on the top deck in the open, even if it is sprinkling.

Take a walk, bike ride or just sit and watch the water.. You can't miss the Seine if you are visiting Paris, like London, you will most likely cross it several times during your visit. Many people however miss the opportunity to walk down along the (paved) riverbank on both sides. These are great places to take a long relaxing stroll, or just sit and watch the water and boats go by. At night, the river comes alive and the banks are filled with people dancing to music, sharing a glass of wine or beer and couples who are enjoying the romance that is Paris. Slow your vacation down and take a stroll by the Seine...
Bato Boat. Well worth using the Bato Boat to travel up and down the Seine River and stopping off at landmarks along the way. We used a daily ticket and made great use of it. Such a beautiful trip
Wave at the boats. Everyone is happy by the river. Lots of entertainment near key attractions like Notra Dame. It's fun to wave at people as they go by in the boats and they always wave back.
Cruise. Nice hopon hopoffcruise in 8 stops through the river. This was included in our l'open tour hop on hop off bus.
Romantic. One of the most romantic places in the world! The bridges along river Seine offers amazing view of the Eiffel Tower. Remember to leave your love locks behind!

Worth while. We travelled to Paris in winter and chose to do the Seine cruise. We were very pleased with the cruise in fact it surpassed our expectations. The view of the Notre Dame from the Seine is so special. V

Informative, relaxing. We went on the River Seine in 1999 with family and it was a great way to see the historical parts of Paris in a relaxing way. The speaker was informative and spoke in English for us.
Nice to do a tour. We did a tour on the Seine river and it is a must see. The tour took about an hour and half and it is worth it. It is nice to see the city from the river.
Gliding Along. Lovely cruise regarding what we saw. Lots of people - some of them pushy and rude. Would do it, however, every time in Paris.

Avoid the rush and noise. Walk along the River Seine to get to the Louvre, Orsay, Orangerie, Eiffel Tower and you can avoid the traffic noise, crowds and still see all the sites; plus the bonus of a picturesque view of the river and all the boats.

Beautiful by day and night!. My first trip to Paris started off with an evening cruise on the Seine and it was absolutely beautiful! Walking along it during the day is just as nice! A definite "Must Do" while in Paris!
River Seine Boat Ride. We took the one hour boat cruise for the first time, it was very nice. Many people will wave to you while you are on the boat.
Pretty river cruise. The Seine river boat trips are a great way to see a lot in a short time without walking everywhere. A great overview.

Loved Floating Along. We were only a block from the Seine so we experienced it on almost a daily basis. We bought a Batobus 5 day pass and used it to slowly cruise our way along the Seine for the majority of our sightseeing stops. It was fun and relaxing. Maybe not the quickest way to get around but we loved it. On a few afternoons we took snacks, wine (the guys took Cuban cigars) and we just sat at some little places to hang out. In the evening we saw people picnicing, fishing or just sitting around enjoying the river. There are so many parts to this river to explore and enjoy.

Viking River Cruising. We were fortunate to cruise the Seine for a week aboard the Viking Pride long boat. We started off in Paris near the Eiffel Tower and were able to enjoy the view while slowly floating up the river. The river flows northwest towards the North Sea emptying at Le Havre. The river is serene and the landscape is quaint and alluring. We went through several locks, the last one involved going down 20 feet to nearly sea level. When the weather was sunny, we dinned on the top deck while watching the passing landscape - a great way to enjoy the scenery and the Seine.

A must for visitors to Paris. One can cruise river Seine in an hour boat trip, or with a dinner, or yet better with a hop-on hop-off boat. This river Seine cruise is a must for first time and multi time visitors to Paris since the view and the experience can be astounding.
nice trip. well it is good u can see the touristic places i paris while a drive n the explanation in many languages its wroth and also a t nigh with the lit paris loking so sublime

Very nice from all views. We crossed bridges, rode on sightseeing boats, looked down from the towers of Notre Dame and the upper levels of the Eiffel Tower, and the river is a pleasant experience from every vantage point. A walk along the river from any of several access points is a must.

Nice way to pass an hour. Take a boat tour - only way to see this attraction. Took the tour from the base of the Eiffel Tower, which was fine. Check to see where other companies go from - in case there is one closer to where you're staying.

Silent cruise. Be careful which company you choose to cruise the River Seine with. A commentary would have been helpful on the boat we had a ticket for because of the tour bus we had chosen. Having had a great cruise in London this was really missed. The walk along the river between the past all the outdoor games, gym and things that people could freely use was great.
river cruise. very nice dinner on the River the service could have been better but over all nice time we didn't get our second bottle of champagne

Take the Batobus. One of the best deals in Paris is the 16 euro Batobus water taxi. It does a loop around the most important sights, Notre Dame, the Eifel Tower, the Louvre, and several others. You can hop on and off and it is a lovely relaxing way to see Paris from the Seine. Highly recommended!

Enjoy the flow. I took batobus tour on river seine . Loved the gracious river , the sunset and changing colors of the water with beautiful historical buildings .. Just a slow pace ..letting the experience run your life for couple of hours .....

Small River Interesting Bridges. Seine is MUCH narrower than Thames (as we just visited London so hard not to compare), with bridges more clustered, thus more crowds along the river banks. It is very pleasant to walk along the river and cross each bridge.

great cruise for someone not particularly keen on cruises!. we took an hour long cruise on one of the smaller boats, thinking our kids wouldn't really sit much longer than that. You get a different perspective of the city, the bridges are great and it helps you get an idea of distance, where things are in relation to each other. Would reccommend even if you're not really a boat trip person.

A great way to see the amazing sights of Paris. The River Seine is beautiful and a trip down the river gives a great view of many of the sights of the lovely city. On a sunny day though it can get very hot on the boat trips so take a cap or an umbrella with you!

Wander Along in Bliss. We walked along the Seine near Notre Dame and again near the Eiffel Tower. Both locations were so picturesque it was almost painful!! We saw the Paris skyline, complete with tiny chimneys, couples making out on park benches, and beautiful boats both sailing and docked. There is so much life and beauty along the Seine!
boat tour. Would highly recommend the NIGHT TIME boat tour so you can see the city and all it sights illuminated. Daytime would be blah!
Stroll by the river banks. Stroll by the river banks and enjoy magnificent views of the city.hear music played by artists getting together at night
romantic. Walk the river Seine with the one you love. Very romantic and cool in the month of June. We skipped adding a lock to the bridge of Love out of respect for the city and the Seine.

Late Evening Seine Rides r Fantastic. We thoroughly enjoyed the late evening river cruise - beautifully illuminated Paris. Watch out for too many student groups as they can get noisy. Seats on outside of boats are nice too.

What a romantic place for a stroll. Well it's Paris. You're walking along by the river. You might walk past a platform with a disco ball and disco music playing. You might walk past a "beach" in the summer. People go past on the Bateaux Mouches and wave at you. The bridges are lovely. The buildings are amazing. It's a very special experience.Grab someone you love, or go by yourself. Stroll along and just take it all in. I have taken a Seine cruise in the past which was also fun, but really, take time out to walk here if you possibly can.

Good cruise experience. For 10 euros, the river siene cruise gives a unique opportunity to spend some relaxing time in paris. One can watch the ancient and famous buildings of the city while sitting in the cruise. The one hour long cruise experience adds to the knowledge about the city as well as gives a glimpse of the major landmarks in the luxury of the cruise. A must try experience in paris.

Take a riverboat cruise at dusk.. Our riverboat tour was narrated so we saw and heard about the bridges of Paris as we passed under them, plus we saw the Eiffel Tower lit up at dusk. This was a beautiful way to see Paris.

A cruise on the Seine. I traveled with a group of travel agents and no one knew who we were, so we were treated the same as other tourists. We rented a boat with a very adventurous driver. He was very thorough in explaining the history of the era and pointing out many things of interest. We did not make it back for a night cruise, which i will do next time.
A unique perspective of Paris. You can sail down the river or sit on the sides with a bottle of wine and cheese and enjoy the sites and sounds of Paris.
Paris on the Seine. Lovely cruise on the Seine from Paris to Normandy. Lovely cliffs and small villas along the way. Loved it!

Crowded River Cruise with 300 5 year olds!!. We went on a mid day cruise from the Eiffel Tower. Unfortunately 300 5 year olds went at the same time! I love children but clearly the cruise was too long to keep their attention span. It was very difficult to hear the audio guide over the screaming. We wanted to go on the cruise again but didn't have the chance!
Relaxing cruise and dinner. Nice view of Paris city, relaxing and comfortable. Would have enjoyed it more if the cruise was added an additional hour.

Fall in Love with Paris!. Beautiful! If you come to Paris...walk along the bergeres of the sene river....everybit as romantic as you´ve read about it in books, everybit as beautiful as in pictures....

RiverBus!. Take a two day batobus which is just 20% more in px compared to 1 day pass and worth to take multiple journeys on this boat and all the major attractions can be covered by this boat journey.
Cruise. I would recommend taking one of the dinner cruises, make sure to book an outside window table. Great food lots of drinks, a band and amazing sites
Great Cruise!. Rode a hour non-stop cruise down the Seine. There is no need to book tickets in advance as they run often. Great relaxing cruise at the end of an afternoon. Great picture taking!
The most used river I ever saw. If you are not on one of the river tours you can sit anywhere along the shores in the many parks and watch all the many boats go by.
Batobus. Best deal was batobus. Unlimited rides for the day super friendly staff. Stefanie was very helpful. Great was to get around and have time to see views from the river.

A River Walk with Extras. We enjoyed the excitement of finally being there, but did not appreciate the ruse that an unscrupulous woman tried to pull on us with the "finding" of a gold (NOT) brass ring she wanted to give us in exchange for money for a Coke. BEWARE: This same ruse was tried on us again over by the Orangerie, and a friend had it done to him on his trip in the same area.
Great way to see the city. Great explanation (in English) of the historic city sights. Do this first to help plan the rest of your visit.
River views. Neat river and sites to see. I would suggest strolling along the left bank with a lot of vendors, artwork and food. Fun place to go.

La Rive Gauche. What a great reprieve after a 9 hour plane ride and a 4 hour shuttle to the hotel...we walked along the Seine, on the Rive Gauche, hand in hand, first night in Paris and just feeling that this was the star of what was to be one of our most romantic holidays. We had a cruise included in our package so we headed to port de la Bourdonnais and were on our cruise within minutes.
