We marveled at the numerous beautiful bridges, the amazing architecture and the sights we had only read about mere days before. This is the Seine...yes, but there is Notre Dame and the Louvre and oh...Pont des Artes and Pont Neuf and all the sights we must explore further...that is the Seine.

Boat trip on Seine. Granted I have the attention span of a gnat, but unless you like being stuck on a boat full of tourists putting up and down the river for a couple of hours, skip this. Yes, you'll see things from a different angle, but 2 hours is a long time to spend doing it...at least for me.
Evening under the stars. The dinner cruise was most delightful and turned out better than I had expected. The food was good, the service quite pleasant and the sights of the city outstanding.
we ran over there. We jogged and walked over the Seine any times. It is stunning as a city centre location. The Seine has many famous bridges, many are covered with locks.

Excellent cruise and dinner. Use Viator to buy the tickets in advance. I recommend to only take the dinner and not to combine it with visit of the Eiffel tower, Lido or Moulin Rouge. It will be too much.
The Eiffel tower shall be visited early in the morning.
A magical boat ride!. We took a small boat down the river Seine in the afternoon, and it was remarkable to see the famous sights from this vantage point. I would definitely recommend it to all.

Use the Batobus!. Being a ferry traveller from Sydney it is wonderful that you can do a similar thing in Paris. It gives you another wonderful way to enjoy the different areas, from the Eiffel Tower down to the History Museum. We buy a 2 day pass and just hop on and off - fantastic especially if you are not a happy "Metro" traveller.

lovely float on seine. I loved floating down the River Seine but was disturbed by some of the sights along the way! The buildings were interesting but some of the people along the way were rude! it is a beautiful city river ride that deserves a toast to surviving the best and worst!
Very Relaxing. All the monuments can be viewed on the river and to be able to get on and off at each sight for me make this the best way to see Paris. Batabus a great way to travel

Nice boat tour to see quite a few sights. The LOML - Love Of My Life - and I took a boat tour which started by the northern part of Pont Neuf. Sorry, can't remember the name of the company or the boat. The info given was nice and quite helpful as to all that we were seeing as there is quite a lot of stuff that can be seen from the river. Learned and saw quite a bit more than I really expected.
Cruise the Seine. It is magical.. Highly recommend taking one of the river cruises, especially at sunset when the city lights up as you cruise. It is an amazing experience you won't ever forget.

Very charismatic. As part of our tour bus ticket we went for a boat trip, the staff were informative and helpful. It is a lovely way to see parts of Paris easily missed. Children did not appear to enjoy it as much as their parents as there was not enough protection from the sun and the heat as could have been beneficial

Good views of several Paris Sights from the boat. I would recommend booking on a boat tour to get a decent overview of several great Parisian sites. The Louvre, Musee de Orsay and Cathedral of Notre Dame are just a few of the sights you get an interesting perspective on from the boat. We booked on Bateaux Parsian and the dialog was decent, available in several languages and gives a good overview. If you have a short time in Paris this is a good way to spend a couple of hours (1 on the boat and 1 getting tickets getting on and off) If the day is hot get a seat outside as it will be very uncomfortable inside. Our boat was all glass and we sat inside and we were baking by the end.
Great River Cruise if the Seine. This was one of the highlights of Paris. Pre book you tickets if you can through you hotel to save being disappointed and long queues.
Romantic Seine. Did not have a chance to take a cruise along this famous river, but passed along it many a times while in Paris. Definitely a romantic place to visit and spend time at!
Nice little cruise. I love river cruises, and I love Paris , so what more can I say... We also cruised on a beautiful summer evening, so it was very relaxing and pleasant.

Very pleasant trip on the Seine. Went for a trip on the Seine with the tour company Les Vedettes des Paris on a recent trip to Paris. The tickets cost 14 euro each. We bought them right there at the pierside, near the Eiffel Tower area, and the boats, which are quite large, leave I believe every 20 mins. It takes about an hour, up and back on the Seine, pointing out the sites, most of which you may have already seen from your walking tour, and other visits. But the weather was beautiful, and it was a lovely trip, and well worth it. Ice cream afterwards at the pier!

Beautiful Walk. The river is a lovely walk if you find the ferry a little too crowded. There are parts that have less tourists. Watch out for the scams, the begging for money, the found wedding ring that you can have for some money, as it doesn't fit their finger, surprises, surprise. Ignore these people and just soak in the river views.

Very relaxing. You get to see a lot of interesting attractions as you cruise on the River Seine. It was interesting to see so many people hang out along the river in the evening. Sunset on the river was a sight to see.
Take a stroll. If you have the time take a leisurely stroll down the bank from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame. It is so much better then taking a tour bus.

The Ultimate Introduction. The Seine. Mythical. Magic. Whatever your time frame in Paris, you can afford a one hour Seine cruise and you can't afford not to take one! The cruise from Pont Neuf is one of many offered and all provide a tremendous introduction, albeit brief, to the great sights of this city. The guide offers a very informative background on the bridges and the buildings you will pass as you cruise throughout the heart of the city.

River boat tour. Took a river boat tour when I was in Paris late May of this year. Weather was nice and there was a muliti language audio track that you could listen to (earbuds supplied). Some details of the city are best seen from the water. Worth the price.

the Seine is the heart of the city. If you love Paris, you love the Seine. I'm not talking about the boat tours & dinner cruises (which might be great, I don't know). I'm talking about the quais, the bridges, and the water itself. I'm always happy to sit and watch the water, no matter the weather.

River Tour. Took approximately a 1 hour boat tour on the river. The beauty of the architecture and the view along the river is great. You get so many beautiful shots of the Eiffel, Notre Dame, the Louvre. It is a pleasant relaxing tour that was well worth the time. If the boat is not your speed, a walk along the river is very nice and the people were extremely friendly and the views are almost as nice as you walk. Either way I would recommend spending time along or on the river.

So charming. We went on a tour of the River Seine and it was just so lovely. The views are amazing. There are some cute spots along the journey where people dance along the river and of course the famous lock bridge. We were on a boat with hundreds of people. Next time I would see if I could book a smaller boat to have a different experience.
Different point of view. Walking or by a boat, you can see a different point of view of Paris. When it's hot is very pleasant to stay in the riverside drinking and eating something!
Ah, the Seine. a new worthwhile experience was to walk down-below, along the Seine; one experiences the decoration of the walls and the ground, and so much more

Wowww. I'm in love with it,,,,better than a GPS,,,,,lol,follow the river and in both sides you will see the best ,all Paris have to offer....a diner cruise will be a amazing experience .A bit pricy but totally worthy.

Don't miss the Seine. Weather strolling down the riverbank, looking at the river from one of the amazing bridges or riding on a riverboat cruise- the Seine River is a part of Paris that makes it Paris

Just do it!. If possible, would highly recommend a river seine cruise, it is one of the best ways to tour the beautiful city. We did it during sunset, and captured beautiful shots of the tower, as well as the river.

Dinner cruise. I booked the dinner cruise with Bateau Parisienne. The food was wonderful. i was with my teen daughter and we don't drink, but were provided with juice and Coke (both are nearly as pricey as wine). The meal was filling and we were able to walk outside to snap pictures. The live music was also very enjoyable. This was the highlight of the trip.

Great evening cruise. We had a wonderful cruise on the river. We got to see Paris in a different way. The tour was well worth it. It was nice to see the sights in lights. Eiffel Tower was awesome in the evening light . Fun to see everyone on shore having their dinner and wine along the river banks.

So relaxing and glistering in the sun. Ahh the beautiful Seine that runs through Paris. We caught the batobus river boat daily from the various stops around Paris. Loved gliding down the river in the summer, watching the people sun baking, reading, sleeping, having drinks along the seine. No yo mention the various bridges.

Champagne river cruise. My sister booked a cruise down the Seine, during which we were able to sample 3 different champagnes (full glasses of each!) over two hours. It was a delightful evening. If you queue early, I recommend it so you can find a spot at the front of the boat. There was a photographer onboard as well. A perfect evening.

sight seeing along the seine by boat. we had booked the sight seeing tour coupled with a lunch deal on one of the river boats. the weather was excellent and the 1.5 hour tour enabled us to witness many of the great building etc of paris.we were seated on top which allowed us a good view of the proceedings and to soak up the excellent atmosphere of this tour. Photo enthusiasts will benefit from the varied points of interest to be captured on' FILM'. We thoroughly recommend this experience as usually the boats are moored just below the area of the eifel tower which in itself is a further attraction.

Loved the quiet. Waliking along the Seine (below at water level) is truly mesmerizing. Strange trees that have survived and grown out of teeny spaces. Cobblestones that may have been in place when Jean Valjean walked to streets . .Choose a foggy evening or dusk, and transport yourself hundreds of years into the past . . .

Dinner with champagne. Some of the boat tour offer a night dinning experience. We opted for the luxury dinner menu which gives you a really good choice and champagne with you're meal, you also get the dinner tables at the very front of the boat which means you get uninterrupted views of the city as you travel down the river they also have huge lights to illuminate the buildings so you don't miss any of the stunning building that line the rivers edge.When heading back towards the Eiffel Tower you get an amazing view of the light show that happens every hour you also get a close up view of the Statue of Liberty that is stituated in the centre of the river. A truly romantic and beautiful evening.

History. If you're in Paris, you have a chance of meeting one of the most famous rivers in the world. A river which is part of so many humanity historical facts. You also will find lots of famous attractions in Paris if you just walk on the rivers side. Actually, Seine is better than GPS if you plan to go from Notre Dame to Eiffel!

Amazing Boat Ride. My husband and I took a sunset boat ride along the Seine and simply loved it. We had so much fun people watching along it's Left Bank. There were small groups of people sipping wine and picnicking, lovers cuddling and two separate dance clubs dancing along the river. For the short time we stayed in Paris, this was one of our trip's highlights.

The Centerpiece of Paris. The river defines the city and just strolling along its banks will give a wonderful picture of Paris. Much of the architectural richness of the city is apparent from the Seine and by all means, take a cruise. There are many services, including dinner cruises to choose from.You will also note that the citizens use the Seine for their own pleasure, having their wine and whatever on the banks.

Good if you've seen it all. We took the river-Seine-tour in late May 2014 from Pont Neuf, near Notre Dame. First things first, the straight up sightseeing tour would not be my first choice to see the city. Take the "hop on and off" first, because you see more and get closer to the sights with the bus then with the boat. I've taken this tour before, and it should have been "been there, done that", the boat tour is only exciting for one time/tour only. It's also weather dependent, meaning cold weather/winds/rain can be bad, but on hot days it could be a delight.If you are running out of sights and what to do, off course a tour on the Seine is recommended. The guide is good and you get some history and facts about the sights along the Seine.

Dinner on the Seine. Though we had been on a river cruise we opted for the dinner boat LeCalife. There are two menus. We chose the less expensive one (67 Euros) and were not disappointed. Food and service were outstanding and the cruise through Paris was delightful. Beware, however, that the boat returns at about 11pm and is far from the Metro or cab stands. Hailing a cab is nearly impossible.

Walk along the lower banks - another world!. I love to descend to the banks (usually around the Pont St Michel area) and walk along at river level. There's a whole separate world down below - artists, strollers, people lunching or sipping on a bottle of wine. Boats moored - and this will let you discover the vibrant world of those who live on the boats & barghes moored along the banks of the Seine!

Take a boat. Very nice trip. We took one of the "bateaux mouches". You don´t have to book in advance. There are severa providers so you can choose. You can book a table for dinner on some of them- we did not try this but we plan it for our next Paris visit.
Boat trip on the Seine. A different view of the architecture adjacent to the Seine. Take a boat with multi language commentary and learn the history of riverside Paris

Look around. Took a boat ride. The river is just a river to look at, but the banks and how they are constructed is awe inspiring to see. And the arches on the river show the history in scroll work, artwork.
Go at night, see the Eiffel Tower lit up!

Pretty but not particularly noteworthy. This is a nice enough river but it doesn't seem to have the character of other rivers in some cities. Perhaps that's because the river is down low with concrete walls on the sides in the middle of the city.

Tour the River. It was beautiful loved being able to take in the sights in a different way. Loved the tour we took that was a part of the Paris pass we purchased. Was a purchase well worth the money. Loved it and all the different opportunities to see different things.

Overwhelmingly awesome!. Just a couple of hours since arriving in Paris, we headed on a Seine River cruise. Seeing all the landmarks along the river was quite an experience. I think I took pictures just to take pictures! All of it was just amazing & worth the price of the fare. I highly recommend to any Paris 1st-timer!
tour. this way you get to see a lot of the city.the view from the river gives you a different perspective plus a narrative of what you are seeing

Stunning. We attended a harbour cruise on the River Seine and so were able to view Paris from a totally different angle. The Eiffel Tour is amazing at night when lit. It's best to be outside as the clarity of vision is so much better. A must-do.

Lights of Paris at night. Take a tour just Before dark where you CAN sit outside to see all the lights and mostly the Eiffel tower open up it's magic ! You have audio guide and you Will see where the parisien go to have a drink and have fun along the Seine and all the different bridges and architectural design. Beautifull relaxing after a day of visiting Paris! Enjoy !

We always end our trips here!. We always take the Seine river cruise (Bateaux Mouche) as a fitting end to our trip. We do this at night to enjoy the lights, but they day time would be great as well. We like seeing the Eiffel Tower twinkling away and it seems a sentimental good-bye to a city we love. It's the City of Lights afterall!

Pick your cruise carefully. If your feet hurt and you want a good view of the Tower a boat cruise is a good way to spend some time. We didn't do enough homework and ended up on a boat that did the tour in 5 languages. This meant we got a very mediocre tour, no real information just a few tidbits of history. I don't think we would do the same boat cruise although we would do one if we did better research.

One of the best ways to see Paris life. The barges are touristy and crowded. But if you want know what young Parisians do on a Friday night, there may not a better way to see the sights. Better yet. grab a bottle of wine, and some cheese and bread, and find your own spot in the stone beaches.

Romantic River Seine. We have been to Paris a few times now and each time we just love to walk along the river and take in all that Paris and the river has to offer, which is a lot! There is so much to see, art and artists working on new works, beautiful buildings, icons such as Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower of course and of course there are lots of river cruises you can take to take it all in from the comfort of an open deck. Dotted along the river in certain places you can partake of a meal on one of the barge like restaurants or there are lots of places to stop and have one of the best coffees you will get anywhere in the world at one of the cafés dotted along the river and the streets weaving alongside. A trip to Paris must include some time exploring the river Seine!!! Enjoy!!!!
Peaceful travel. Get ther early for good seating and enjoy the information provided for your journey. We did not take the food choice

Relaxing look at Paris. I loved the view of Paris from the Seine. I took a short cruise and saw the bridges from underneath and saw the way the city lives all around and over the river. Really beautiful!

Magical. There are so many special places along the Seine ... the many bridges offer perfect lookouts over the river and whatever beautiful photographic spots that dot the river as it winds through Paris. Some of my favorites were Pont Alexandre, Pont Neuf, Pont de l’Archevêché (the one with all the locks), Pont Saint Michel (where you can frame a gorgeous photo of Notre Dame with millions of people). Also the upstairs terrace at Musée d'Orsay and the Eiffel tower provide elevated views. Another favorite spot is walk down the stairs and along the river - again especially near Notre Dame.

Cruise the Seine at night.. We cruised as it was getting dark after having dinner at Eiffel Tower. It was beautiful seeing the lights come on all along the Seine and the amount if people that picnic or just have a drink whilst sitting on the bank is incredible.

Beautiful cruise and lots of information!. We really enjoyed the one-hour boat cruise; I can't imagine visiting Pairs without including this in your plans. There was a lot of information to absorb, but it was presented succinctly and interestingly. The architecture, the bridges, the monuments were all stunning and the pace was leisurely enough to get a real "feel" for the city. Would recommend also taking the bus tour to maximize your Paris experience. Personally, because of all of the historical information, I think this would be best for children 12 and above..
River trip. Really good way to see the beautiful buildings and decide where to visit.Went on an over an hour round trip
Always Beautiful!. The Seine is so beautiful and romantic! Lots of awesome bridges! The breeze is lovely.A river cruise with Amawaterways is always a good idea as is Paris!!

unique view of Paris. We had taken a private driving tour of Paris when we first arrived in the City. We saw most all of the sights I had on my must-see list. The last day in the City we took the river cruise which left from the Eiffel Tower. It was impressive to see all of these famous sights from a different perspective. Viewing them from the river was a unique experience. The guide spoke at least 5 languages and gave a very informative commentary. In addition, a headphone was available at each seat so you could listen to additional information in your language of choice.

bateaux parisienne. The dinner cruise on this boat is first class albeit pricey. we took the table for 2 by a window & thoroughly enjoyed the food . Service for the meal was excellent with freeflowing wine, This cruise had an excellent combo with a great vocalist, and of course there were the sights & lights of the Seine. At 11 o'clock as we disembarked the Eiffel Tower displayed an awe some light show not to be missed . Worthwhile ex perience!
A nice river cruise. We took a river charter up the river, it was a great way to spend the early evening, we were just getting back as the lights were coming on on the Eiffel tower.

well placed. I wouldn't recommend a boat trip. Take a walk. The Seine is a commercial artery and away from central Paris, you are in industrial Paris very quickly.Fortunately, the French wisely placed the Louvre, the d'Orsay, the Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides and just about anything you want to see right next to the Seine. So break out the hiking boots and remember that several glasses at a bistro on the way are essential French.Visit the d'Orsay. Hundreds of paintings and not a single smile on any of them. Really.Akso French.
Shortcut. By taking the tour learned about the hop on hop off water taxi which really helps getting around if your not in a hurry. For us the only way to go.

Paris from another view. I like to explore a city from various angles and sailing on the Seine seeing Paris passing by was lovely. Not onloy relaxing but romantic and enjoyable. A must to do in Paris.

A cruise on The Seine, a highlight of Paris. A cruise on The Seine takes you along this beautiful river and under some of the most fantastic bridges. It's a good way to get oriented in the city. On a sunny day it's a way to relax for an hour and see some excellent sites.There are several choices but we have always been happy with Vedettes, either from the Pont Neuf or Port de Suffren at the Eiffel Tower. The commentary is good and the man taking photos is a real pro. He's so quick and makes everyone look good. As we took so many of our own photos we were prepared not to purchase these, but they were so good we bought them all.

Worth a couple of hours. We did the River Seine cruise that is linked to the Hop On Hop Off bus tours, and it was certainly worth the money to get a river view of many of the cities most famous monuments and buildings. Recommended.

Beautiful. The scenery is just spectacular. All the bridges are just wonderful! Beautiful. I took a boat cruise and it was wonderful although there was a lot of homeless on one side but the other side the tower
Nice cruise. See it from the water level. Paris has tonnes of tour, but you must take a 2 days pass of the L'OpenTour and include the river cruise. It covers so much of what need to be seen.

A romantic cruise on the Seinne. A trip to Paris wouldn't be complete without a cruise down the Seinne. The boat we travelled on had headsets in a number of languages with additional information offered by the staff. The trip took one hour departing from the Eiffel Tower going to the Isle de Cite and returning. It was relaxing and informative.

Bridges galore. It is well worth taking a boat trip along the Seine as you get good views of most of the famous landmarks and buildings along the way.
Try to avoid school parties if possible as the kids scream as loud as they can while passing under each bridge.

Batobus for me. The Batobus is smaller and cheaper than Bateau Mouche. There are no crowds to block one's view, one can hop off and on at all the special places along the river. But, if you want food, lavatories or commentaries this is not for you.

take the cruise boat. Originally I thought it is too tourist to take the boat ride cruising around the river, but it turned out the best thing to do for viewing the beautiful Paris city's river side. Then it also gave me briefly idea of where to stop by for more detailed walk around for rest of visiting time.
Have lunch along the river. This seems to be a very local thing to do; grab some bread, cheese, wine, good company, and sit along the seine river to enjoy a relaxing afternoon.

A Beautiful River, a Pleasant Walk. The river that runs through the heart of Paris, the Seine has been very well-treated in recent years. There are "river busses" one can buy tickets on to travel up and down the river between famous landmarks at a comfortable pace for viewing, but faster (and less tiring) than walking.If you choose to walk, you will see works of art installed here and there along the river, kiosks selling books and art along the street above the river, and cafés and restaurants all along (including some on the river itself).
recent visit. one hour trip they take you under the various bridges and you get a combination of an audio commentary and the rest from the female guide.worth a one of trip
Beautiful and Relaxing. Enjoyed walking along the Seine - beautiful day or night. The boat tour is a nice way to see the city.

Sunset cruise is the best. We took a cruise just before sunset and it was a leisurely way to see all the activities along the river. There were people dancing and enjoying dinner along the river banks. We saw many of the famous historical buildings and the highlight was watching the Eifel Tower light up.
Just okay. We used our Paris Pass to take the cruise on the River Seine - we were a little disappointed - but it was a nice break from the heat of the day (temps were around 27c)
Night Cruise. Cruised the Seine at night and had spectacular views of the Eiffel Tower and the bridges lit up plus down to Notre Dame, was only an hour but still ok

Weekend night meeting place for the young. Of course, the Seine is a legendary and romantic river that must be seen and walked down, but what entranced me was that on Friday and Saturday nights, at least in the Latin Quarter area, people bring blankets, bottles of wine, six packs of beer, and Pringles potato chips and sit along the river, socializing into the night. A folding table or two sometimes supported more elaborate fare. It was a French form of tailgating to celebrate the city and we loved it, although agreed that we 60 somethings would have a hard time arising from those cobblestones after a few hours. But I intend to join them the next time we're in Paris!
Enjoyable cruse. We took the tour boat without stops. It was a fun little excursion. Had to pick and choose as several seats were broken. Informative and well worth the money.

A lovely walk with some beautiful art and bookseller booths, beware of tourist traps!. We thoroughly enjoyed our walk along the Seine. There are artists working and selling their work, booksellers selling vintage books, magazines and other paper goods and other pleasant vendors along this lovely walk. Be sure to stop by the famous Pont Des Arts (love lock) bridge. Locks are available at vendors to purchase or bring your own. There are portions of the River Seine walk that are tourist traps with aggressive vendors, especially by the Cathedral of Notre Dame. Restaraunts along this river walk tend to be expensive. I highly recommend taking an evening or two while in Paris to enjoy a leisurely walk along this lovely river.

nothing special. Unfortunately this was not of any interest, it was nice to float down the river, but nothing really to see and the bus tours take you everywhere and give tons of facts. it was nice but wouldn't recommend or do again. Now there are river dinners, that would be nice to do.
Enjoy a stroll. Lovely to escape the traffic and larger crowds of people and to just stroll along enjoying the views.
River Seine. We took a batobus and did the cruise at night.At night time its lively on the banks people sitting drinking wine. Its great to walk along the Seine in the day if its a red hot day.

A must cruise preferably at night. See Paris at night on the River cruise and enjoy the city form another view. You get to see the city perfectly lit, especially the Eiffel Tower changing Colour. A must see/do cruise preferably at night.

Great way to see Paris on a first-time visit. We took a leisurely cruise along the Seine on our first day in Paris to get a feel for the city. Good way to see all the key sites, such as Notre Dame and the Louvre. The view of the Eiffel Tower from the Seine is much prettier than the view closer up. Most river and bus city tours include English translations or have English audio options. Follow up the river cruise with a hop on-hop off bus, and then you'll be ready to navigate on your own.

Bouquinistes along the banks of the Seine. "Les Bouquinistes", the booksellers of Paris,are located on the Right Bank and on the Left Bank of the Seine.They are part of Paris heritage with their green boxes carried of single copies of books, magazines, postcards collection, art,stamps.There you can be in touch with true Parisian culture.If you have time, you can visit more than 200 riverside "bouquinistes".I'm sure that you'll find something extraordinary....at least a great photo near them.

Lovely river. Totally enjoyable taking a cruise down the river and seeing the sights from the water. You can't go to Paris and not take at least one little tour on the water and have a crepe on board the boat

Life and pickpockets revolve around the Seine. Be sure to allow time in your schedule to walk along the river-just pick a bridge and begin walking. Take a boat cruise that lasts about an hour to rest your feet and enjoy all of the buildings along the way. Summertime in Paris brings throngs of people to the river so be very alert for pickpockets who prey on the tourists. Also, I must caution you about a couple of common scams you may encounter. First is what we call the "clipboard girls." They are VERY AGRESSIVE and will pester you for blocks pushing their clipboards in your face trying to get you to sign a sheet of paper that resembles a survey or petition of some sort. While you may be tempted to sign their form to get them to stop harassing you DO NOT SIGN anything. We were told this is committing you to a financial donation or something to get you to give them money. The best defense is to pretend you do not speak English when they ask you at first. Another scam to be aware of involves coins or a gold ring that the person alleges that you "dropped." They appear to be poor and humble expecting that you will give them money to reward them for returning the item. While we, fortunately, were not a victim to this scam, several others on our tour were approached. Be careful! We heard that if you take the ring and do not give them money they become extremely aggressive which could easily escalate into a hostile situation threatening your well-being. The police do nothing to protect visiting tourists, so be cautious when approached by anyone. Do not stop to engage them- keep walking away is your best defense here.

Lovely Way to View Paris. The Seine is a beautiful river with many bridges crossing it. It is also an ideal way to view Paris. The Batobus, river bus, stops at several major sites. By a two day ticket, get on and off as often as you wish.

a cruise on it is a must.. thr iver seine flows through paris n a cruise on it is a g8 way to see the many paris structures.the river flows from the east to the west thru the heart of the city n divides paris's left bank n right bank.its good to take a stroll along the river n watch the boats go by.also many small vendors sell souvenirs n ice creams along the banks.good to sit n watch the world go by.....we took a cruise starting from across the eiffel tower.it was very good n they give audio guides which offer english commentary too.aboard the cruise we saw many parisian landmarks n mouments like the many canals n bridges,notre dame cathedral,railway museum,louvre museum ,eiffel tower n others..lasts for abt an hour n a good experience.we dint have time or else we would have loved to do a dinner cruise which we hear is very good.dont forget to carry a good camera since u will be taking many pictures.
Walk, See, Buy. Walk near the river. Take a 1 hour cruise trip ( station is under Pont Neuf).Buy some magnets, posters, ards from small stores near the river.
best way to see attractions. this was outstanding and we loved the whole paris experience - best way to see all the sights by Batobus water taxi.there are long queues in summer

A Boat Ride With Many Photo Opportunities. Viewing both banks of the River Seine as you float up and down the river provides a very different view with some very nice photo angles. You can see the Musee Orsay, the Eiffel Tower & other famous buildings with a perspective that is much different from what you see on foot!
Long walkes along the Seine. It is beautiful to walk along the Seine and several tourist sites are close by. Buy an ice-cream and sit in the sun and watch the boats go by.
Very calming. The River Seine is really quite beautiful and calming as It weaves through Paris. There always seems to be a boat cruising on it and people strolling next to it.
Walk and take a boat. The seine has so many picture worthy places along its shores. We walked alot of and made use of the Hop on and off Batobus.

Rich atmosphere. You can get a great view of the river by standing on any of the bridges crossing the river but why not take a walk down the stairs and directly walk alongside the river? It was a great experience for me.

A river to be enjoyed time and again, day and night by boat and on foot. There's plenty to see and the first time visitor is advised to take a cruise by day and by night to fully appreciate its beauty. In addition a stroll along the banks is de rigeur and parts of the river certainly are romantic by night. By day one can also browse through the sidewalk vendors near the Ile de la Cite to see the old books, comic books, and other types of documents that draw all sorts of collectors. My favorite method is to join a guide for a walking tour along the most historic stretches. There are floating restaurants running day and night.
excellent views. Loved walking along riverbank. Quiet and peaceful on isle saint Louie. We also took a river cruise and a great views of sights along the river.

A different perspective of Paris. A cruise tour on the Seine river gives us a different and beautiful perspective of the Paris city. You can buy the tickets on this website (www.city-discovery.com) for several river cruises throughout the day and evening, including cruises with meals. Really worth it.

River Cruise down the Seine. I took a river cruise down the Seine during my last visit to Paris in the fall, and the experience was lovely! It's a great way to see many of the beautiful sites that Paris has to offer while relaxing and enjoying the atmosphere. I would definitely recommend going on the cruise before going to see any of the other attractions as it gives you a sense of where everything is located and a glimpse into some of the city's hidden jewels. The cruise is inexpensive and the timing is very flexible. The cruises run from 10 am to 10:30 pm everyday, and the duration is an hour long. The breathtaking scenery is well worth it!

Stroll along the a Seine. Dropping down to the riverbank at the Eiffel Tower, if you stroll along the Seine in the summer there are many bars with music and deck chair seating where you can enjoy a cocktail or other drink while catching some rays. Also there is a floating gym and swimming pool but there was a long queue for this so get there early if you want to swim in the pool on a boat!

River Seine by night!. My partner and I took a boat cruise down the river Seine at night it was simply gorgeous it was FREEZING but well worth it, you can also see the Eiffel tower light up at night on the boat cruise - I cannot remember the name of the company we used, however i think any by night would be well worth it.

Another river. This is just another river. Nothing unusual or dramatic about the Seine. The Seine is unusually clean compared to the Liffey in Ireland. Enjoyed the walks almond the river and seeing the sights.
Local walking and the River Seine.. Walking along the river, especially through the Musee de la Scupture en Plein Air. Also we loved the Jardin Des Plantes.
River Cruise ... Take the river cruise on the Seine.. Either lunch or dinner ..I prefer the lunch cruise as one can see Paris as only one can by boat. Worth every dime !
Promenade is fabulous for children & adults. This has been redone since I was in Paris last and there are a ton of free entertainment venues set up all along the Promenade. Fabulous!

Not for the disable!. Very disappointing as there are no ramps access to the quays. And the people who sell the tickets tell you that there are some ramps in some place, but these are only to disembark or embark the boat on few stops. Avoid if you cannot manage steep stairs!!!A pity, as the cruise on the Scène is truly spectacular. The bus boat however can get very hot under the glass roof. Avoid hotest times of the day. Some organised tours take you directly down to the boats.

Seine River cruise, Paris to Normandy, June 2014. We just returned from our Viking River cruise (11-18 June 2014). We had heard fabulous stories about Viking, and the trip was quite pleasant. It was not way above the Uniworld cruise we took a few years ago, as we had been led to believe -- both ships were of equal quality, and the cruises to different sites equally enjoyable. The staff were terrific, and the food was usually quite good. The excursions were delightful, and we were surprised to see the amount of beer wine that was provided by the ship without cost during meals. Overall, it was a great trip, and we have some wonderful memories of the Claude Monet house and gardens in Giverny, the beaches at Normandy, and Versailles!!

How can you not?. How can you go to Paris and not experience the Seine? There are boat trips, bike trips and every major monument is on or near the river so you are bound to see it. But I recommend taking time to walk the river, both from up high at street level and where accessible down at water level as well. Great activity for the late afternoon / early evening when all of Paris is out and about!

enchanting Seine. a cruise on the Seine is one activity not to be missed... ours was included on the booked tour and we are so glad that we availed ourselves of it. we got there late afternoon after a visit to the Eiffel Tower so we were buzzing with anticipation. after a slight mix up where to board we found the correct boat. the views were just wonderful. Parisiens were sitting by the side of the river picknicking & drinking and just enjoying the beautiful afternoon. It was very windy above deck but a fantastic view, but also a great view from our seats too. The history, the architeture of the beautiful old building , the atmosphere just picture perfect. on our return it was dusk and watching the sun set in the Northern Hemisphere a first and unforgettable sight. We saw an enormous chandelier lit from its window in one of the Museums along the Siene and the locks that glistened from the bridge at dusk were enchanting... Do not miss the opportunity to cruise down the Seine there is an array of different modes and prices and a dinner cruise would be wonderful as well.

None more beautiful. The Seine will add calmness to your visit. Find a way to cross several of the bridges, follow its path from your perspective on the Eifel Tower, read up a bit on its history. The Seine is the spirit of Paris.
Quintessential Paris. We took the boat trip at night - delightful especially when the Eiffel Tower sparkled. We had dinner at an exciting, boisterous restaurant on the left bank - fun!

Good for the price we paid. Took Bateux Mouche. Crowded ship. But expected for the price that we paid. Would recommend taking a private cruise with dinner, instead of the regular 12 euro cruise, if you really want to enjoy the cruise alongwith some privacy. Overall good, as we got to see the beautiful sunset, people and the lovely bridges.

A Big River. Take a cruise on it if it fits your schedule. The Bus tours offer better views of all the sites of course, so if you have to choose...But you do get a sense of history on the boat, and a good view of all the bridges.

Embrace the lifeblood of Paris. A daytime cruise or evening dining experience on the Seine opens up new views and ways in which to observe Paris going about its business. Take every opportunity to peacefully cruise by this wonderful city and see it in new ways.

Take the one hour bateau paris ride. We had a Paris Visite Metro pass which gave us a special price for the one hour river cruise. It's a very enjoyable cruise and the one hour passes very fast. If you stay upstairs you don't get the commentary which comes in four languages. But if you stay downstairs you won't get the fresh air and "feel" as much of paris. The river seine would be really romantic during the night but alas in June, the sun sets after 10pm, so we couldn't stay up that late :-)

A beautiful ride on the Seine. We had a gorgeous ride on a riverboat cruise that came with our Hop On Hop Off bus tour. You could view some of the monuments and museums from different angles when you went down the river that made it worthwhile.

Cruise at River Seine. We used Bateaux-Parisiens for our cruise as we saw a promo at tour agency for 10 euro per pax.Boarding point near Eiffel Tower. Many tour group brought the tourists for the same boat ride, hence waiting time could be long. We took the cruise around 4.30pm, sunny and rather hot day. The 1 hour cruise provides audio guide and is a great way to see the prestigious monuments within Paris.

Romantic and lovely. It was quite an experience to walk along the Seine and see the numerous footbridges, packed with "love locks"! We loved watching the people sitting, sunbathing and picnicking along the banks as we strolled along and took in the beauty of Paris.
Batobus. We utilized the Batobus for all the main sites. Took it in the morning afternoon and at night. The last night we took it around 8:30 for one final ride around. Full circuit takes 1.5 hrs.
boat tour. we took a wonderful boat tour up and down the siene, which is another great way to see the city. On land is one view, but from the water its spectacular

Relax and have a cruise. We used Bateaux-Mouches for our cruise but there are so many you can just take your pick, excellent cruise about an hour long, saw all the main sights so dont forget your camera

Relax on the Seine. This is a perfect way to see and visit the major tourist attractions for Paris. It is a good way to explore for everyone. Take the batobus or do a dinner cruise along the seine. The only con I can think of are the steps. Some of the stops only have steps instead of ramps. Be prepared to o a two many carry with wheelchairs and strollers. Still worth it in my opinion.

Paris. Got to Paris via Eurostar and dropped off at gare du Nord upon arrival we saw army guards with machine guns the smell of urine walking to our hotel along the seine and the river terribly littered. Our hotel and restaurant was great as well as Versailles and overlord d day tour , but the city itself was filthy and very unfriendly. If I never get to Paris it will be to soon. Not to mention trains were on strike. Hard to understand why people were so unfriendly when tourism has to be a big help to their economy

Dance tango like a Parisian.. This place is full of energy and fun. stroll and view the different amphitheaters. dance tango like a Parisian or have snack on the grass. this is what the locals do after a day of work

great tour. We did a river boat cruise on the River Seine and it did not disappoint! The cruise took us under all the famous bridges and past infamous monuments and provided excellent photo opportunities of Notre Dame and the Eiffel tower.

Good to do a river cruise. As far as rivers go it is not the prettiest river I have seen nor were the banks of the river nicely landscaped however it was good to see people drinking wine, enjoying a picnic, playing music, exercising or just going for a stroll - it was like what you see in the movies or read in a book. I guess it was worth doing to be able to say we cruised down the river Seine!!!
Beautiful. Lovely to walk or ride a bike along the River Seine. Lots of activity on the water with boats cruising along.

Walk the river front away from the traffic.. This is a fun Parisian outdoor space with cafes, benches, learning centers for children, and all sorts of surprises. Great people watching on the weekends!

Seine in the countryside. Staying near Giverny we cycled around the local villages which border the Seine river, a beautiful and tranquil area of France, well worth taking a day or two break from a hectic city visit.
Lazy afternoon!. We took a cruise on a tourist boat, price very reasonable "get on and off" at various attractions. Would do again.

Take a CRUISE!. Best way to see the city is after the lights go on after 10:30pm with a cruise on the Seine. Make sure you download the guide from the tour website before you get on the boat as the commentary is very hard to hear once the boat is moving. The Eiffel Tower is breathtaking from the river.

Walk Along This Whenever You Can. We walked miles along the Seine during our short stay in Paris. Great views and gets you away from the traffic. We took a great river cruise from Pont Neuf on our first evening which went up to the Eiffel Tower and then down to Notre Dame before going back to Pont Neuf. An hour cruise for 14 Euros each, seemed very cheap by Paris Prices.

Great views from the river and well worth the cost. There are many boats to choose from and I have no doubt they all offer the same, great views and some interesting audio about the history and buildings seen from the river seine. The only negative was the poor quality of the audio but still enjoyed our sailing.Would recommend this as a "must do".1

Very Pretty!. The River Seine is very pretty and a great place to take pix! Did you know that there are THREE Statue of Liberty's in Paris?! One of them is on an island in the Seine! If you have extra time on your trip. Search for them and snap a pic!

outdoors fun. Not found in any book we saw, but below the river promenade, next to the river, in a large area west of the louvre there are all kinds of outdoor activities. Our grandchildren had a wonderful time with tetherball, climbing structures, and hanging bars.

River Bus. Another view of the sites of Paris worth taking in.
The very sunny day of Friday 13th a little uncomfortable for folk must so used to sunny climes, but still very well woth the experience.
Give it a try

Beautiful View. This was one of the activities I wanted to do when I first visited Paris in 1997 but could not due to time constrain. Glad I made it this time and it was with my husband. We couldn't stop clicking our camera as we cruised.The only dissappointing part was we couldn't take any night views as the sun only sets at 10.30pm. Other than that we enjoyed the view.

Rejuvenated Seine. They have closed down the traffic lanes on the died outside the musee d'orsay and the pedestrians have claimed it back. Great place to escape from the museum madness and take a walk and view all the modern art installations. Bring along some wines cheese and baguette and escape it all.

Every view of the Seine is striking!. Every bridge over the Seine offers another view. So much history, all the activity and beauty along the way. A cruise was a great way to rest the feet and take in yet another view of all the sites to see.

Magical on a boat at night. We have done cruises on the seine before and while they are very touristy, they are a great way to appreciate the city and its fabulous architecture. This time we did a cruise by night and had dinner on the boat. It was magical!

River Cruise. When looking for a Seine River cruise consider Vantage Travel! The experience was great, the tours memory lasting and the attentive service on board the MS River Venture more than one could imagine.We spent 3 days visiting Paris and 10 days cruising the Seine from Paris to Normandy - definitely very memorable.

Pretend it's a taxi and it works. The Batabus is a great way to get around Paris and do some sightseeing. We took a taxi to the Eiffel Tower, walked around and then got tickets for this boat to take a quick ride down the river and exit at Champs Elyesee. The cruise is relaxing, takes around 10-15 mins between stops and you have to wait for passengers to get on and off, but if you are not in a hurry and want to get a quick boat ride and taxi service to your next sightseeing stop, this is a good way to go. There is no commentary - and that is made clear when you buy your tickets so I do not understand why people are complaining here. It is a ferry service - not a sightseeing boat! Bateaux runs sightseeing boats and they are much more expensive if that is what you are looking for.If you want a leisurely way to get to different points, this is a great way to go. TIP: Warning though, the boat has fixed closed windows and mid to back of boat is extremely HOT and sweaty. We stood outside on the back - but I could imagine in the summer the ride is grueling, so beware of that. When we got off the boat at our stop we noticed that towards the front of the boat there were air conditioning blowers right behind the captains station. Not sure if all the boats had it, but don't race to the rear of the boat as we did when we go on, see if the AC is on in the front and it'll make for a much more comfortable ride.

It's a river.... The river is a must see just for the fact of saying you've been there. My only complaint was the restaurants located along the river edge (near the Eiffel Tower). Bleh. Skip them...you're not missing anything.

Wouldn't do it again. We booked a Seine River dinner cruise for 4 and paid $1137.59 total, the boat was very nice but all it did was motor us a tiny canal sort to say and see some of the famous buildings, Honestly the whole time I kept thinking OK we could have eaten at a really nice restaurant and the took a private limo and saw the same thing for less. I was not impressed to say the least. When you book one of these river cruises you will remember what you read here and think OMG he was right, don't get me wrong its not horrible, its just average but NOT worth the dinner price we paid to sit in the front of the boat.
Best of Paris. Probably the best thing about Paris. La Seine and all its bridges. The view is always beautiful especially at night. There are always many interesting things to see.

River Seine cruise and lunch.... We booked this through Viator and paid for the Premier lunch, which was worth every penny. You're at the front of the boat with lots of room, unrestricted views and in my opinion, a much better service with more food/drinks. We were given a glass of champagne when seated, followed by a glass of white wine with our starters. A bottle of red wine is then yours to drink as you please. The food was lovely and the service was great, there was a really nice atmosphere at the front of the boat. Not the cheapest way of having lunch in Paris, but if you're wanting to do a cruise I'd highly recommend booking a river cruise on the Seine with lunch.

Romantic. Walking along the river Seine was nice. You can see friends gather over some chips, bread, fruits and wine and you have an instant picnic...Its very relaxing to see other people enjoying the day along the river....cheers!
River Seine. Walking along the river, families and friends enjoying themselves. Sitting on the bridge overlooking the river, listening to musicians play. Great for people watching.

Would be better. it was raining so no one is allowed to go to the upper deck of the cruise boat. photo taking is not so desirable either, but it was enjoyable as you noted of the scenery along the river, the many different design of the bridges, the buildings on both sides. it should be better on a clear sunny day. Will have to go again.
Charming. Loved strolling along the banks with the local artists, barter with them. Buy a lock and attach it to one of the bridges. Even enjoyed the buskers who were quite talented and amusing.

La Seine. As it passes around Ile Saint-Louis and Ile de la Cite, La Seine is not the most beautiful river in the world. Over the centuries, it's natural banks have been replaced by stone embankments and quays, and at this point in the city, it's more of a wide canal. However, La Seine is arguably the most famous urban river in the world and is not to be missed! I believe the river is best experienced while leisurely strolling along its banks. I like to take the stairs at Pont Saint-Michel and walk along the river bank as it parallels Quai des Orfevres. A good part of the walk is shaded by a line of trees and is dotted with numerous benches. I prefer to sit on the edge of the stone embankment and let my feet dangle down the side. Enjoy the river's cool atmosphere and the numerous bateaux as they cruise on by. And don't forget to bring a little something to eat and drink. Walk on down to Pont Neuf and enjoy the pretty little park at Square du Vert-Galant. A small point to remember is that the late-night revelers sometimes use the walkway under the bridges as a toilet so it's best to step lively when passing through.
Wonderful way to start our visit. We took the scenic boat ride up and down the Seine. It was the perfect way to start our visit in Paris.

uninspiring experience. Went for the boat trip down the Seine. To reach the boat walked along the Seine and had to contend with the smell of urine most unpleasant. The trip was boring! Commentary was adequate but nothing very interesting. The buildings are pretty but they are all very simiar, I also found the bridges functional but ordinary. London has nothing to worry about!

A Must for All in Paris. Whether you are strolling leisurely along the river side or taking one of the 1.5 hour cruise, you'll love every minute of it. No matter if you go during the day or in the evening, the scenery, the beautiful bridges & the architecture is just breath-taking. It may as well be the most memorable time of your life

Pick a nice day. We did and we thoroughly enjoyed the experience. get a different perspective of the city from the river but a good one. Very different view point from the bridges etc. but worth the effort. We did this on a Sunday morning and there were not to big a crowd, I guess they were all at a church service.

Walking Experience is Best. Walking along the banks of the Seine allows you to really experience the vibrancy that this waterway and its environs provide. It is a part of the city that doesn't quit until the wee hours. Views from the bank at the stroke of midnight when the Eiffel Tower provides a delightful light show was an unexpected treat for us. Cruising is fine too, but you see so much more when you take the time to enjoy a stroll. Be sure to see the bridge(s) of betrothal locks and enjoy the many historical buildings that line the banks. Also be on guard for the scammers who try to sell you a wedding ring that they "found."

This has to be done - wheelchair review. this is a wonderful and relaxing way to see the sights of Paris. Day or night. Wheelchair accessible for getting onto the boat. You will have to stay on the front main level and cannot get up top. Like me, we had the bottom all to ourselves - it was lovely. Pictures and views are still great and NO fighting or head shots of other tourists.
It's between the river and you.... walk along the river, count the bridges, preoccupied in your thoughts and find a piece of yourself...

Good experience. Our tour group had arranged river Seine cruise by Bateaux. This had a very long deck and its open deck alone could accomodate lot of people. Cruise was one of the longest we had experienced - lasted more than an hour. Nice relaxing experience overall. Can obtain photographs in background of Eiffel tower, see many bridges across Seine river including Alexander bridge, and can admire on the numerous beautiful buildings along its side, as well as Notre Dame cathedral. Lots of people relaxing and enjoying their food along its banks.Water was relatively clean and free of floating materials. This cruise did not go till statue of Liberty.They have this cruise every half an hour.

A money's worth!. I did the night cruiser cuz I'd like to see all the sights with lights. It was really good in this point, cuz Paris at night is absolutely amazing! On the other hand, was quite hard to see some places, cuz was just too dark. But as a general opinion, was incredible and its a must do thing in Paris!
Lots to do. Rent a bike, take a walk, play games, people watch. This area is beautiful, all the bridges are different, worth spending some time down there.

Great day in the sunshine. The day was so nice it was time to finally try a boat ride on the Seine and very pleasing it was. We used Bateaux-Mouches and had a great hour on large boat , viewing Paris from a very different perspective.
Perfectly Paris. No trip to Paris is complete without a boat ride down the Seine. You get a different perspective on many landmarks plus it is fun to watch local strolling along the banks.

Worth a boat trip. Pleasant to have a boat trip along the river, if you visit in the summer make sure your chosen boat has some covered area. The boat we used was all see thru and when the sun came out we all baked. Nice ride tho.
when in love. You could walk anywhere, the Seine with its cruises, the people, all of it combined, the scent, the sound. There are many charming walks there when you are in love.

Ornamental bridges. Take a boat ride in the evening and see all the beautiful, ornamented bridges crossing the river. People gather along the banks and the atmosphere is amazing. All the famous buildings are well lit and stand out when darkness falls. Bring a good high ISO camera with a wide angle lens and get some great shots also of the Eiffel Tower.

Average. We did a dinner cruise, which was at 7 pm in June 2014, unfortunately it was daylight, not the same effect as it would be if it were dark.The meal was hurried, not relaxed, a mixed set entree was given, main was a choice of chicken or fish, if you wanted meat an extra 7 euros. Dessert was a tasting plate of miniature sweets. Just average. No atmosphere. If the staff were a bit more customer friendly and they had a French singer instead of funeral music, it may have been better.

A must. On the last night of the Tauck tour in May we went on a private boat for dinner and the tour of the River Seine. It is a must .As it gets dark you see the city light up .It is truly so very beautiful.
Just a river. what was appealing about the Seine was the walkways along side - they were very clean with no trash or unsavory characters

Beautiful walk along dirty river. The Seine is like a central vein in Paris, since so much happens around it. Tons of people are always sitting alongside, hangouting and picnicing next to it even though its dirty. One of the best and free things to do is just walking alongside the Seine on either side.
Take the river cruise. This is a great way to see the city. Very relaxing. When you are on this cruise you can see where you would like to explore further after you get off the boat
cruise it. Take a river cruise, they are all the same, it is a great break from all the walking and you see the city from a different prospective.

River cruise. This was another thing on our list of must see. We took a river tour, & learned many facts & history of the bridges & buildings along the river. Our guide was a bit boring, we might as well had a tape. Next time I'll listen to Rick Steves & save my money

Running along the river. If you can, plan a run along the roads near water level on either bank on a Sunday or public holiday. The authorities close the roads on those days and literally hundreds of people get out to run or rollerblade along them - this gives uninterrupted running for kilometres in each direction.

Seine River Cruse. Just besides Eiffel Tower. Cool and chill Drive.
Views and monuments keep you occupied.
No rest for Camera. Lots of bridges with good architect work to cross during the river cruse. Kissing under the lowers Bridge has its history... but gives u an opportunity.
YOu need to go. absolutly different view of Paris, it really must do thing, and very interesting excurion on board, very recomended

You'd be inseine not to do this!. We thought it would be a bit tacky but it was excellent. The meal was fabulous as was the wine and the waiter plus there was a lovely French singer on board. We booked it through our hotel and it was very good value too for the quality of the food and wine and the service.

Great views and good commentary. I joined the Bateaux Parisiens cruise for free admission with the Paris Pass. It was a really good hour long cruise seeing the main tourist attractions of Paris from the river. A good commentary although this was via a bulky hand held device.
Well worth the wait.
lovely river trip. As the title says, Lovely trip down the river, great for sight seeing, Well worth doing if in Paris.

good trip for free.. We did the river trip on Bateaux for free it was included when we booked hotel.It is a nice trip but hte boats are packed all day.very informative although the toilets on board are a disgrace!!

Batobus. We spent a day hopping off and on the batobus for a ride on the Seine. Beautiful scenery with the added attraction of being able to hop on and hop off at different attraction sites. Well worth doing.

Your own private Paris. One simply must experience this magnificent perspective of one of the most beautiful cities in the world. Please do yourself a favor and take the boat trip on the river! You will be happy you made the effort. Truly, it is a much different view than one could have while walking the streets. It is a movie of the city.
It deserves 1 hour of your time. Take a day river cruise combined with a Paris by night ! The cruise takes about one hour, with some guiding

Unique view of Paris. The river cruise provides a unique perspective of the city and its many noted sites. See Notre Dame up close. Travel under the many bridges watching and avoiding the busy traffic above you. The Seine is still a transportation highway. The river cruise presents a quieter less hectic way to see this amazing city.
Romance extraordinaire!. Can't leave Paris without a night cruise on the River Seine. You will see all the sites of Paris and the gorgeous people having a wonderful time.

Beautiful River. The Seine is a beautiful river located in the heart of Paris. It is clean and filled with houseboats. There are several beautiful bridges that cross over the Seine. I recommend taking a stroll along the Seine. Its a great way to enjoy the sights, every step you take will give you a glimpse into to Parisian history. It is clear that the French pride themselves on keeping their city clean, organized and beautiful. I was very impressed.
A walk along the River Seine.... Don't just look down at the Seine from a street or bridge, go down and walk along the banks. It is a magical place!

Trip on the Seine. We opted for the 14 euro trip for a one hour journey. It was very educational and had a headset for points of interest. I would recommend the Seine trip to help you to find your bearings around Paris and plan your trip accordingly. There is an option for a lunch cruise, however, it was 69 euros for 1 hour and 15 minutes which we felt was not worth the money...the same at night was 115 euros minimum each for a 2 and a half hour cruise.

A nice way to see the sights. We walked along the River Seine during our stay in Paris on most days/evenings. There was a lot of hustle and bustle and It's magical at night. On one of the days we took an hour long river cruise. This was great to see more and learn a little more too. Definitely recommend.

River dinner cruise. The river dinner cruise was beautiful. The food was amazing, the staff were friendly and spoke english, which was helpful. The view when the sun went down wow, the lights on the tower amazing. Thank you

Best way to see Paris. The batobus is brilliant. Amazingly, the people who run it are charming and helpful even when you buy a ticket! You can actually tick off all the "sights" in a day and then explore Paris.

The icing on the cake!. Our last day in Paris and after seeing the louvre decided to take this hour long cruise. It was so beautiful and relaxing and we could see the beautiful buildings and learn some history this was great.

Sit and People Watch. We loved walking along the Seine and enjoying the river traffic and people watching. Take a break at one of the riverside outdoor cafes and have a glass of wine or beer and relax Also, the river offers a good route from getting from one site to the next. Its a pleasant stroll from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame along the Seine.
Historic Main Street. Traveling on the BatoBus, walking along the banks. Watching the people, gazing at the buildings, seeing the skyline. The river is from where the city of Paris emanates.

worth a walk and a ride. we visited the River 2 days in a row once during the day to walk along the road it was really nice and there are a ton of neat art projects and things to see on your walk it is a long one though I would pick out the spots you want to see and walk along that section we saw tons of people enjoying the day on our walk we opted to walk during the day as the front desk clerk at our hotel said it can get a bit unsafe to walk during the evening we came back the next day at night and took a river cruise we saw a ton of people partying along the river some areas were well lite and then some others were really dark so I think this is what the desk clerk was talking about we enjoyed both walking and the cruise it is worth seeing. We started our cruise in front of the Eiffel Tower make sure you check out the cruises there are a ton of different ones and some are better than others.

Always bustling. People hang out here, walk along here, stop for lunch, walk their dogs, run, etc. great place for all that and more! Greta navigation point to many great attractions, all along the river :)

Worth a walk. You can walk by Seine next to the street or down, next to the river banks. There are lots of people running, walking, chatting, dating down there and some small restaurants and bars available in a few points. Good walk to feel the Parisian spirit.

Nice View. Go with the boat. It's only about 1/2 hour ride from the starting point. The boat would go as far as Eiffel Tower and turned back. You would get to see Notredame Cathedral and other museums. It's really nice to take a picture of Eiffel Tower from the river. Go to the 2nd level of the boat and find a seat all the way in the back.

Push photographer let it down. Took a Seine river tour to pass some time - After being herded on to the boat we were faced with a pushy photographer who insisted on takinh cheesy photos to flog you later - After that we just relaxed and let the boat do it's thing up one side down the other, not really seeing much but a nice trip. Wouldn't recommend it though, it's over priced and a little pointless really

What can I say?. Surely there's nothing new to say about this river. No doubt, however, the weather never quite repeats exactly and it could hardly have been better. Not too warm but pleasant. One was constantly looking into a low sun, giving the whole trip a cinematic quality somehow - only better.
A special place. Paris is built on this river and adds to is beauty, history and elegance we were on a cruise on the seine and it was superb,we travelled for 7days. There is so much to see.

Oh So Romantic. When I went to Paris with my family, I went thinking that Paris being the most romantic city in the world has got to be a cliche. Boy was I wrong. It IS romantic in every single corner and angle. And the River Seine is one of the living testaments to that. I remember riding the boat thinking that someday I will share this with the love of life.
Beautiful. Definitely take a boat cruise during the day and at night. Learn a little history about Paris, the bridges and take in the sights. Very relaxing.

Fantastic. I would definitely recommend taking a trip down the Seine - you get a great view of Paris, especially the Eiffel Tower and the Notre Dame, especially if you are lucky and get a fantastically sunny day as I did. The Bateaux Mouche isn't very expensive and you get 70 minutes on the boat with commentary. It's great fun to wave to people on other boats or on the pathways along the Seine - a definite recommendation.

Romantic. I did the champagne cruise along the River Seine. It was an hour which was the perfect amount of time. More than an hour would have been too much. It really was a cool way to see another perspective of Paris and while tasting champagne was an added bonus!

Be careful. The river provides a magnificent view and you will probably have to cross it many times during your stay in Paris. However be careful with the con artists by the river. Do not play the "find the ball" game. It looks very profitable however it is all a scam. People who are around and actually winning are in it too.
Cruising the Seine. Everybody should do a River cruise, you get to see so much more of Paris and if you choose to eat at the Eiffel Tower, even better. The food was amazing.
Great walking. Walking alone the Seine is an experience not to be missed. It goes for miles through beautiful Paris with incredible sites to be seen.

Always Worth Visiting. The Seine is the core of Paris. A walk or boat trip will allow you to see many of Paris' most wonderful museums and attractions. As a waterway, it throngs with sightseeing boats plus cargo barges and small craft. One time we saw scuba divers being trained. There also was a lot of waterfront entertainment. We have been on several Seine cruises and are particularly fond of the evening trips. The river becomes quite magical with the many lights. Seeing the Eiffel Tower strobe lights from the water is wonderful. We also decided to put an eternal lock of love on the Pont Neuf. This is a fun activity and you can buy a lock from one of the many vendors along the riverbank. Some of the bridges are completely covered in locks which in the sun makes them glitter. The Seine offers something for everyone!

Great way to enjoy the city of lights at night!. Taking a Seine river cruise is a fantastic way to see a large portion of the city in a short period of time. In particular the night cruise offered a great view of the main sites lit up at night. A definite must in my books!
relaxing on the river. Loved this view of Paris - totally different from the land. Commentary was not the best quality but overall well worth it.

perfect stroll and view of Eiffel Tower. Nice for a walk after dinner with a view of Eiffel tower. There is also a river cruise. Perfect for jogging or talking a walk. Also perfect for a picnic with the family.
Sit on the benches on the banks & enjoy. Take yr coffee etc and sit on the many benches provided on the banks do Seine and watch the passing boats.

See it by day and by night. This is so peaceful. I suggest getting a BatoBus (sp?) hop on/hop off pass and enjoying the entire circular route. I know other reviews mentioned doing it early in your visit and I agree. This company doesn't do a night cruise but we caught the last boat leaving the Eiffel Tower and it was dusk. By the time we finished the last loop, the bridges were lit up and it was beautiful. We used our same hop on/hop off from earlier in the day and there was no additional charge.

Paris IS the city of lights. The cruise down the Seine was one of the highlights of our stay in France. We sat almost at the very tip of the front of our boat and had marvellous views of the banks bridges and people lining the river. The food wine and champagne were great but compared to the view definitely took a back seat. Our turn around in the river signalled our cruise was half over, but the best was yet to come. As we approached the Eiffel Tower for the second time, it began to sparkle with lights. The captain could not have timed it better as a chorus of oohs and aahs echoed amongst the passengers. We had heard about the lighting effect that has been installed on the tower, but to see it in real life was simply breathtaking.

Go and have a boat trip along the Seine. We took the occasion and booked a dinner on the Seine. What a great idea, it was the highlight of the journey! We entered the boat at Pont d'Arts, next to the Louvre and had a trip along the Seine (with a delicious dinner) during the three following hours. We saw many of the most important buildings and monuments of Paris: Notre Dame, Musée D'orsay, Le Louvre, Pont Alexandre III, the Tour Eiffel (great views!!! at night), the small Liberty Statue, Invalides etc. It is really worth to spend some time and money in such an activity!!!

Great Trip. I love travel. Back in May 2011, this trip on the Seine was glory. To view Paris from the River completes the excursion after touring the sites on land. What a marvellous way to relax in the company of a loved one and allow the mind to wander in the awe of the serene surroundings.Photography is a must.

Up The River Without a Paddle. A river cruise is mandatory for the first time Paris visitor. It helps to get ones bearings and to see how the major attractions relate to each other. There are many to choose from. If you have a museum pass, you get a discount on some. Board at Pont de L-Alma near the Eiffel Tower.
Beautiful and restful. Beautiful river trip with lovely buildings and bridges would do this again and again especially on a sunny day. An excellent way to see many of the major land marks of Paris

Perfect sunny weather walking. The Seine is a beautiful river, so much cleaner than the Thames. Paris seems to have made a real effort to keep it clean and ensure the banks in the main part of the city are vibrant and enjoyable to stroll along. On an evening there is lots going on, with people eating picnics, etc. During the day there are games you can play or just simply stroll or sit and soak it all up. Wonderful way to see the city too just ambling along the bank.

Great for a stroll. The best part was the south bank near the Musee D'Orsay - where there were a number of activities (free concert, a skateboard venue, informal stalls etc) and a booth to book a cruise or boat trip. Lots of cafes nearby too if you need a break from your walk.

Last Hours in Paris. enjoying river seine with batobus, an hour going around with batobus to 8 stations. the few from the river was absolutely amazing. EUR16 per person for a day pass worth every penny.

Night or day boat ride is a must!. There are glass boats leaving from the Eiffel Tower. Get the tickets at the little machine, no waiting. €12 per person. Took the ride 8 times and lived every single one. Audio in several languages for free. And since it's a single level boat with glass ceiling, you can sit anywhere and see all the sites. A must!

Relaxing way to see Paris by day or evening. We used our Paris Pass to take the River Cruise on the Seine. Cruises leave every 30 minutes, so no problem with long waits.Multiple key sights along the Seine - Louvre, Notre Dame, Musee D'Orsay, Eiffel Tower, etc. so able to see so many famous sights.Boat was filled - often difficult to get a good photoDon't use the cruise to take photos - just for relaxation and enjoyment onlyOnly Vending machines on boat, so take your own snacks if desiredBathrooms were clean

River Seine nighttime boat ride. This is the BEST way to see the city of lights. The boats are open-topped, slow to let you take in the sites, and you can walk around or sit in place. You cruise past Notre Dame and other well lit places of interest, including some of the most dramatic bridges known to mankind. Our cruise was topped off with a glass of wine as we went by the Eiffel Tower all lit up and glowing on a beautiful May evening. Note: The Eiffel Tower puts on a light show every hour on the hour starting at 11pm til about 1am. We missed it on the boat but were able to see it from land. This boat cruise is an absolute MUST for anyone wanting an elegant and/or romantic view of the city of Paris at night!

Crown of Paris. River Seine is an ornament to Paris. Without it Paris wouldn't have been that beautiful as it is now. We took a day cruise to River Seine and we absolutely loved that! Bridges were beautiful and decorated with artistic sculptors. After all it's a river in Paris!

Excellent. We really enjoyed our cruise along the Seine. It was a beautiful sunny day and the views of Notre Dame and the bridges were great. Really worth a visit and money well spent and it was the highlight of my stay in Paris.
Nice tour. we did this late in the day, started at 8pm and thoroughly enjoyed it. very nice complement to any land tour as it gives you another perspective of Paris.
Part of a tour and great!. Amazing view and well worth the effort.. Our tour was an hour and I loved every bridge we went under and building we saw! Do it! Early in the day.

Take a cruise. Took one of the one hour cruises up the river. It was lovely but felt we could have been given a little more information - difficult to do I guess when they are announcing it all in three different languages over the tannoy! Take the open top bus tour for more detailed info. The river cruise was still very pleasant - especially in the sun

iconic river. I had a portrait drawn of my daughter by some illegal impoverished artists (yes,.. I'm being romantic), it was hilarious when the police came to move us along and we followed them (the picture was half finished!!) The Seine is every romantic cliche ever written, there is so much to see and do within just a 2 or 3 km stretch you will never have to get into a taxi (this is a bonus). Enjoy it, we cruised up and around it just past flood time, and heard lots of stories worth repeating here, but just get on a cruise and listen yourself. This is Paris!! This is the Seine!! You'll double take every time you see it on telly or movies again - and you will see it.

A must do!. This is particularly a must if you only have a few days in Paris as you get to ride along the river taking in the attractions that you might not get to see and it gives you better bearings of where the attractions are.We had a lovely time following the river and wish we had more time to do it again. It's both interesting and peaceful - I recommend doing this either around midday or late afternoon as it gives your feet a nice break from all the walking in Paris.
