Paris residents hate tourism.. I understand living in Paris and bombarded with 50 million tourist a year is tiring, I've been here twice. First time it was magical and elegant. This time it was dirty, rude and every stop had some sort of tourist grab. The topper for me is when my daughter pee,ed herself because she did not have money to pay to us the toilet in a mall in which you want us to shop. Absolutely classless. Seen this toilet charge threw out Paris, are u kidding, what a slap in the face for tourists. Paris residents need to realize if it was not for tourist you would be in huge financial trouble. I nor any member of my family will return to paris ever. This year I took note of how big a cesspool paris is. Just booked a two week holiday to Switzerland, lucern, to be exact, the choice was easy, Switzerland is beautiful and guess what, No Toilet Charge. Paris you need to class it up a lot or eventually the new generation will not stand for your classless actions. We r not cattle so stop hearding people, and your bread sucked, not sure what you have left to advertise. There was not one romantic spot to be found unless you enjoy being begged to on subways, harassed in the streets or overcharge to see a piece of history that can be found on Internet. Good luck but you will not get another dime from me. If your looking for a great holiday, come to New Brunswick Canada. The only thing you will walk way with is a smile. Good luck!

What's not to love?. We took the BATOBUS - fantastic way to get around when the weather is nice. - you can hope on and off up and down the River Seine. it was 16 euro for one day or 18 euro for 2. :-)

A Stroll/Dream Come True. There is nothing like this lovely experience of a stroll along a river that has such history, beauty and romance associated with it. After stopping by the museums and gardens along the Seine, do stop and sit a while, as many French and tourists do, to enjoy this treasure that is quintessential Paris. Drink in the sights, sounds and view of the lazy river that will become part of your memories of a lifetime.
Seine. Good way to see city by boat. At times strong smell of boat diesel fuel.Walkways did not go the full length so you had to join the mad traffic on the Paris roads
The river. Just follow the river(siene)! Along the way are amazing bridges,cafés, shopping, art museums magnificent buildings and churches ect.

Walking By The Seine. Is there anything that says Paris more than walking by the Seine? I think not. Cross the bridges, visit the sights, but walk along the Seine. The river is arguably the source of the city's charm. Paris is one of the most beautiful cities in the world and to be able to safely walk close to its beginning, it's present, and it's future is something not to be missed; and it's free.

Sunday stroll along the Seine. From Saint Michel to the Eiffel Tower with great weather to stumble across a rock band playing was a pleasant surprise. The locals and tourist were out in force but it was not difficult to negotiate at all.

Lots of Free Entertainment. Loved walking along the River Seine - plenty of free entertainment especially for the kids inc Giant blackboard with chalks, table tennis in a skip & even an art gallery outside!
Take the cruise. Cruised the Seine as part of a tour group. Good way to see things and get your bearings around the city.

Beautiful.. It is lovely to walk along the river bank and watch the boats chugging up and down. It is even better to keep swapping sides by crossing the bridges each time and then waddling further along. A lovely morning spent strolling.

Dream come true. I haven't wanted to walk along the Seine for as long as I can remember. My wish came true earlier thus month. I walked and biked along it several times. Many locals & tourists enjoying the area. It's in the middle of everything and simply glorious.
Luxury on the Seine. Yachts de Paris has an excellent dinner cruise on the Seine. Very upscale, amazing food and incredible views!

Boat Ride was great. We took a boat ride down the River Seine at sunset and it was amazing. We had looked into a dinner cruise but at 100 euro or more per person we felt it too extravagant. There are several companies who offer boat tours for a mere 19 euro per person and the views are certainly the same!

Average - A river!. Didn't travel on the river, but took many walks alongside it and across the many Bridges over it. Nice to be near, but nothing spectacular. Looks Great from the Eiffel Tower though, I'd advise to go up there and see it from that angle :)
So much to see. Not only is the river pretty to look at, but ere is so much to see along the banks of the river. Tourboats, waterbus, boats converted into homes, cafes, etc.

A lovely place for a stroll. It was a place to relax and enjoy. I stopped at the bridge with all the lovers locks. Amazing! There were barges with roof gardens. Be careful with your belongings. 3 girls approached for me to sign what was obviously a bogus petition and came rather too close. I had my handbag well held. Other than that it was a beautiful walk.

You must walk along here.. Between pont d’lena and pont de sully is a marvellous walk. Plan a day to walk out one bank and back on the other – have lunch and dinner out in one of the many fantastic cafes and restaurants and then get the Metro back to your hotel – tired but deeply satisfied that you experienced this wonderful river!

Another point of view of this wonderful city. A great experience. Great views, lots of pictures to take and easy going. Food is not top class but service is efficient and polite. But who cares about food with such views!

very romantic. much cleaner than the thames.some great locations along it to either have some food or drinks.also some really great romantic locations just to lay about and spend some nice and relaxing time

Never imagined the beauty of it all!. There is so much to see from the River Seine! We took a lunch cruise along it and enjoyed the beautiful views while dining on delicious French cuisine and champagne. That's definitely the way to see the Seine!

You have to take the river cruise while in Paris. It's not just another boat ride when you can cruise by some of the best sights in Paris, France and the world from a comfortable different point of view.

A different view of Paris. Took a boat ride on the Seine. Beautiful! The buildings are hundreds of years old and still beautiful. The view of the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame and all the fantastic bridges are magnificant beauties in the Parisian sun! A different view from the Seine!
A dream come true. First time since visiting Paris that I took a Seine river cruise. Beautiful weather, sunny and cool, interesting dialogue from tour guide.

dinner cruise. We really enjoyed our cruise! It began at 8:30 p.m. and dinner was served right away. We were able to taste 5 different appetizers. The main course was chicken (our choice), it was alittle dry but the flavor was good. It included a cocktail, wine, water, and coffee. The best part was seeing the Eiffel Tower all lit up from the river. We thought it was alittle pricey, but afterwards we were so glad we did it! It was well worth the 75 euros. Very relaxing and enjoyable!

One of the worlds most beautiful and relaxing sites. We ended up taking the 1 hour river tour because the lines at the Eiffel Tower were too long. It was one of the best things we did. We were on a 2 hour city tour, our first time in Paris, and this worked out just fine. Very relaxing tour with a good guide to explain all of the sites history and bridges. We did not make the nite tour, but that is a must see, as everyone told us. The city at night is spectaular.

A must-do for any trip to Paris.. My husband and I just made our first trip overseas, and in each city we visited, we made sure to do a river cruise. We did the Seine River cruise at nighttime, and it was an absolutely magical experience. Paris is lit up like no other city I have ever seen and is definitely the most beautiful city in the world. There are many bridges and points of interest along the river, and the river cruise is a great way to get ideas for other places you would like to see during your visit.
Enjoyed. My entire visit to Paris was all about accumulating experiences and this was my first experience in Paris. Enjoyed it but wish I had been able to hear the guide.
Take the river cruise first. I suggest that you take the river cruise before you walk around to see the sites; otherwise you will just cruise by things you have already seen.
Bateaux. Took a boat ride down the Seine (from Pont Neuf) - it was interesting and very beautiful to see Paris from the river view.
Great Walk on Sunday. Roads will be closed to cars on Sunday but on any day if the weather is halfway decent a walk along the river is walking through at least 200 years of history.

Beautiful River in Paris. If you are in Paris and you have the opportunity to stroll, cruise, or picnic along the Seine, do it!There are so many historic sites and picturesque views along the Seine. It is such a romantic place for couples and is also a nice place for teens and families to hang out and enjoy themselves as well.

Seine River Boat. Seine River boat ride was nice, but bit more like water taxi, and we only took one ride back to our hotel. My poor mom's back was hurting, so we had an early dinner and called it a night. The nice thing is that the tour guide translation was in many languages. Our hotel was right on the Seine, and near the Pont des arts. It was nice to see it from a different perspective.

Magical riverside picnic spot. We brought a picnic of charcuterie, baguette, fresh fruit, fromage and vin with us, and sat on the bank of the Seine river just across from the Musee d'Orsay for a beautiful sunset picnic. One of the best evenings of our trip.

Take a river cruise. We had only 1.5 days in Paris and we wanted to see as much as possible. While we spent much of our time walking around the Eiffel tower, enjoying crepes, and just soaking in the atmosphere, we also wanted the chance to see without taking a bus. We elected to take a river cruise which lasted 90 minutes. We had the pleasure of a well informed guide, and the access to translated recorded messaging which provided a near "self guided" tour while we road the gentle boat. Bring some bottled water and wear a hat. If it's windy, you may wish to sit on the side of the boat with the windows down (fresh air and nice breeze). If it is a windy day, they don't open windows on both sides of the river boat.

Let the time pass by. At times while on vacation you feel like you have to see everything because of time constraints but not in Paris.My favorite is the river Seine by Notre dame where you can just get a bottle of wine and sit by the river ,people watch and just enjoy the day.The latin quarter is in close proximity where there are nice restaurants and the area is beautiful once the lights are turned on.

Paris, je t'aime!. A trip on the Bateaux Mouches on the River Seine is a must for every first time visitor to Paris. We went on an "illuminations" tour which began at dusk and ended in the dark with all the monuments gleaming like jewels. The Eiffel Tower was breathtaking. A most romantic experience.

Lovely walk. Enjoyed a lovely walk along the Seine from the Trocadero to Ile de la Cite. It was nice and peaceful despite the main road nearly as we enjoyed the view across the river including some fantastic houseboats:one had a living roof and very own wonderful vegetable plot which was beautifully maintained.

As others have said, the lights at night!. My friend and I walked about two miles along the river at night, approximately 11pm. We had no issues with walking at night. When you cross the bridge from the Eiffel Tower across the first street and to the right is a Crepe stand that serves excellent street food and the prices are cheaper than the stands right outside the Tower. Grab whatever crepe concoction that you want and walk along the river walk with it. At 11pm there were a few people around doing the same thing along with a few bikers. We started from the Eiffel Tower and walked down 1.5 miles to the Pont des Invalides bridge and back. It was great! A spectacular view of the Eiffel Tower the whole way along with watching the boat tours on the river. It was fabulous.

It's a river and not so romantic. Took a cruise along the Seine. Saw lots of people lazing along the banks and a few doing things that they should have been doing elsewhere. Movies over romanticize it.
Not so fun.... It's like going up to the Eiffel Tower, only go if you are excited about the experience and you are willing to spare some of your time in Paris, if not, enjoy the city walking instead.
boat trip and mea;. had a wonderful night on a large glass fronted boat up and down the river fantastic entertainment and a very nice meal well worth doing when in paris

Fresh air. Hop on hop off bateau , ticket valid for 24 hours , slower than metro but good value for money . Shame stops are only in a circular route so some journeys can be quite long , no toilet or hot food facilities

Take a Boat on the Seine. No trip to Paris is complete without a boat trip on the Seine. There are several companies to choose from. Some start at the Eiffell Tower and others at Notre Dame. They all loop east around Notre Dame back past the Louvre to the Eiffel Tower. They then turn around and head back to Notre Dame passing Musee d'Orsay. We took a water taxi called Batobus. It makes several stops at attractions along the way. You can get off and back on anytime during the day.
Small but nice!. You can enjoy a long walk along the sides of the river enjoying the architecture and the lovely bridges. the wide spreaded trees make you enjoy your time.

Romantic. Great place for romantic walks with your loved one, especially on the lower level. I wouldnt recomment to run there as the cobblestone is uneven and you could injure yourself if your not use to it.

Take the river Cruise. This is a must do while in Paris. The drive through all the bridges and seeing the sites from the river gives you a real feeling of the city. I was told it is better in the evening but it was a little cool so we opted for the sunny part of the day.
Bateaux Mouches. Evening cruise and dinner on the boat is brilliant with good food and excellent service. Not cheap, but good value for money.
River Cruise. Great trip down the Seine. very informative and info given in English, Spanish and French. Beautiful sights to see. Defo reccommend.
An essential walk. Another essential Paris element is a walk down the river (or cruise). Take your time and just soak in the atmosphere and admire the bridges and buildings

If you have time to kill in the afternoon. Spend a nice afternoon walking along the River Seine if you have time to spare in-between attractions. The river is well-kept so there are always people hanging out or jogging along the river banks.If you love looking at vintage French books and seeing street-side artists paint like me, you can also see a few of these mostly anywhere along the street sidewalks near the river. Great for photos/shopping for knick knacks.
WOW!!. The river flowing across the city. This is Just wow!! Even all the bridges constructed over it are SO BEAUTIFUL!! The ferry ride is REALLY recommended!!

The lights!. We took an evening cruise on the river and see why Paris is deemed, "The City of Lights". The views from the river are wonderful and the architecture is spectacular. I would highly recommend an evening river tour.

Lovely stroll on a fine day. The River Seine, while not the prettiest of rivers (which inner city river is?) is still a beautiful landmark of Paris. We visited during the summer and during one early evening we walked along the River and found may couples and young people sitting on the edge drinking and having picnics which was nice to watch. We also did as the locals and found a patch of grass and enjoyed the summer night. We didn’t try the Batobus but they looked like a fun alternative to see the river and get from A to B.

Bateau mouche. Right at the foot of the Eiffel tower, on the wharf, you access the bateau mouche.We were a business group of two tables and had an excellent time on board.The ride was smooth and very pleasant as we enjoyed the end of the day and the first dark hour of the night.Nice show on the Seine with a great lighting in place.The service was friendly and efficient, and the food was really good.Nice champagne too, which, in this kind of atmosphere enahnces the evening,Bravo!

Boating with the masses. These tour boats are huge, and the commentary can get on your nerves, as can snippets of French music ( we never did hear all of Vie en Rose ) , but the views are worth the price and the upselling spiels, so turnoff the headphones and read a guide book or take your wifi tablet
good. Good trip went on in evening very busy so think you would need to book can get good photos off tower ase you leave and return to ndock
A walk to remember. I love just walking in the afternoons beside de Sena. It´s amazing it´s like time never passes. Seing the sunset in a bench it worthy,

A must-do !. One of the most romantic cruise ever. You can see a lot of Paris most beautiful and emblematic monuments on the way. Getting the tickets can take some time as there is always a line, especially when the weather is sunny... A good idea can be to go through a travel planner (we used ParisByM.com), who will book the tickets for you, either in complement of other activities or just for the cruise. Or to book a lunch or dinner including the cruise, in advance (this option is more refined, ideal for a couple, without the comments on the audio-guides).

Seine Slightly Disappointed. I'm not sure why but the Seine and its banks were slighly disappointing to me. I thought I would favor it much more than the Thames in London but I love the leafy areas of the Thames and the Seine was more open and just not as lovely as I expected. I realize I'm probably in the minority and although I'm glad I had the opportunity to see the Seine, this did not live up to my expectations.

Down by the Seine. It's an hour's cruise passing through all the Parisian attractions like the Notre Dame Cathedral, Eiffel Tower and various attractions of the city from a different angle as seen on land. It's an invigorating cruise with lots of camera clicking and merry making on board. A happy memorable cruise that lasts and to take home with.

The most beautiful river in Europe!. For the first time traveler like me, cruising the seine river by taking a bout tour is definitely a must. I bought the ticket in front of Eiffel Tower and just sit down, enjoy the magnificent view of Paris, relax, feel the breeze, then stopped at Louvre and headed back to Eiffel again. Superb.

This is your Paris Ticket to Ride. If you haven't discovered this travel gateway to all that Paris has to offer you've literally missed the boat. Bateaux Boat 2 day or 5 day pass saves time and money, every 15 to 20 minutes you can get on and off at every major landmark, the only way to tour Paris. Keep in mind L'Tour Eiffel doesn't light up until about 10 in summer months so plan on ditching the boat and taking a taxi home about 12 euro's, be safe...

Fun Birthday. This isn't the typical touristy meal on a dinner cruise. The food was excellent as well as the drinks with excellent wine recommendations by a knowledgable staff. The view was amazing with excellent timing of the light show at the Eiffel Tower.. You will not be disappointed.

Seine River Cruise. My husband and I took a week-long Avalon River Cruise, on the boat Creativity, down the Seine to La Harve, and the beaches of Normandy. We shared differing opinions on certain aspects of the trip, but I will focus on mine. We had a top floor suite, and by far the best view from the boat. The outside wall of our room was a large sliding glass door, so our view, docked and moving, was spectactular. We did not have a balcony, but would not have used one if we had one. The ship's engines are running 24/7 and the unpleasant diesel fumes are unavoidable with the doors open. The little time we spent in our room was to prepare for our next excursion and to sleep. The ship traveled at night and as the Seine has 6 locks to navigate, along with limited habitation on the banks of the river, there is little to see. Also, the ship docks at spots along the river that are for convenience, not for prime views. If you remain on the boat during the day there are commom areas for better views and comfort. The room itself was the most efficient use of space I have ever experienced. Closet space and storage was plentiful. Even with a king size bed we could move about in our room. The bathroom and shower was also quite spacious for one person at a time.The food on the ship was plentiful and of more than sufficient variety. I never left the dining area hungry. However, I have to say I was somewhat disappointed, as I was not always satisfied with the taste of the food. It often lacked flavor. As the week progressed, we began to see the previous days food recycled, and frequently not good. I ate a great deal of salad, and pasta with sometimes only butter, salt and pepper. I need to add that my husband was very satisfied with the food.The cleanliness was excellent. Our suite, the dinng areas, and the rest of the ship was spotlessly clean.In the beginning of the cruise our staff was courteous, and as the week progressed they became very friendly. The cruise director explained that this was the first sailing of the season with this specific crew. The performance put on by our crew at the end of the week was a great deal of fun, and reflected the personalities of the staff, as we had come to know them.Our cruise director was impressively professional, attentive and kept us well informed of the events and schedules. We had a considerable amount of confidence in her ability to mange any and all aspects of our experience both on and off the ship. Even when one of our tour bus was tied up in traffic for an hour and a half, she was there to greet us with a cheerful welcome, and helped everyone find a way to look at the experience from a humerous perspective.We had two options for excursions each day, and we could also change our minds the day before. The excursions were well planned and delightful. We were happy with all of our excursions. The motor coaches supplied for transport were of good quality and very comfortable. All but one excursion required transportation to the site. Be prepared therefore to spend more time in transport than you might have expected. Rounding people up, getting them on and off the bus was often time consuming, and cut into our time actually spent at the venue. That aspect was disappointing, especially when we arrived at the WWII museums, beaches and cemetary. A full day trip, starting earlier in the day, and returning for only a light evening dinner would have been preferable.The people you meet on the crusie also make it uniquely special. We talked to many couples from a variety of countries and locations. Finding couples close to our age and also our energy level was challenging. We were informed by our travel agent in advance that this might be the case, based on the specific destination of our cruise (WWII memorials). Two couples we really bonded with, while playing cards and a fun dice game during our evening crusing, expaned our social experience, making the entire trip so much more fun. We still communicate with them since our trip.This was our first and only cruise. In terms of cost, this was a very expensive trip. Gleefully, my husband and I both found it to be the trip of a life tiime and well worth the money.The overall Seine River cruise was wonderful and we plan to take another river cruise in the future. This was our first and only cruise

Batobus commuter boat!. We got 2 day tickets for the batobus commuter boat the travels the Seine every 20 minutes or so. With its hop-on hop-off availability, we found it a marvelous way to get around to all the major sites conveniently, cheaply, and pretty comfortably. We had beautiful weather during our stay which made this option more enjoyable. Highly recommend to get another view of Paris!
River tour. We did the boat tour and it was a great and leisurely way of see the sites and choosing which to go to later. It was a bit hot on the upper deck.
Relaxing. Nice relaxing way to view the city. Lots going on the river bank. Must do. Gives a better view of the bridges that you cruise under. Even kiss under the lovers bridge.

Just from the embakment. We, unfortunately, did not take a boat ride on this river. However, just walking by and watching the Parisian life, the young people, lovers, old men with dogs, amateur fishermen and boats passing by gave me the pleasure of seeing this marvelous town as I always imagined it and seen in many movies. During my one hour stroll I took at least 80 photographs which I will proudly show to my friends back home. Beside the beautiful scenery it is very relaxing walk after a good French lunch of Chateubrisnd...
Beautiful Paris. My wife and I went to Paris for the weekend and took a boat trip along the Seine it has to be the best way to see the city. We will certainly return to this beautiful city.
Cruise. Should I wait to buy a ticket for the cruise on the River just in case its raining? Should I purchase a guided tour or just a ticket for the boat ride?

Enjoyable Cruise on the Seine. In May 2014 my wife and I took an AmaWaterways Seine River Cruise on the MS AmaLegro from Paris to Normandy and back. Overall we were extremely pleased with the service we received on the MS AmaLegro. Our suite was nicely furnished and there were a fresh fruit tray and a couple of bottles of iced champagne waiting for us. There are four suites on this particular ship, and all are identical. Our suite came with a computer, wifi access for our iPhones, a separate shower and bathtub, refrigerator, a sitting area adjacent to the king bedroom, a French balcony with floor to ceiling windows, and a large flat screen television, which has a camera feed that allows one to see the progress of the ship on the river. Our suite was clean, regularly serviced, and well appointed. The executive chef and the seven sous chefs prepared meals using fresh regional foods; the food was plentiful, delicious, and attractively presented. The fact that there was no assigned seating for meals was also a plus; we were able to sit where we pleased and with whom we pleased most of the time. We met some very nice people. The service throughout the cruise was attentive and friendly. The information regularly provided and the daily newsletter outlining times and descriptions of events and activities was a good touch. Musical entertainment in the evenings was also enjoyable. The transportation (coaches) to sites off the river were of high quality and the drivers were very good. The seven local tour guides contracted by AmaWaterways were knowledgeable and were attentive to the needs of the groups while still maintaining control. Too, the idea of dividing passengers, where appropriate, into groups based on their physical ability and agility – active, regular, and gentle – certainly met with approval. Based on this initial experience with AmaWaterways, we would be inclined to take another river cruise, perhaps on the Danube.

Evening Cruise on the River Seine. We took the evening cruise ... 9 PM on the Seine and it was magnificent. If was such a great way to see more of the city architecture. I was dark by the time we arrived at the Eifel tower and it was so impressive not to only see it with the lights but we were passing at the time they set the sparkly lights on. Extremely romantic and exciting. We took many pictures that are fantastic. We didn't take the dinner cruise .. and don't stress over which cruise you take. There isn't much difference. Just make sure you can sit on top of the boat in order to get the full view and impact of the beautiful and relaxing trip on the river.

This place is good no matter how you choose it!. Whether it's to walk along the banks and get some exercise and check out the views or to take a an evening cruise with a good glass of French wine or both as we did, you can't miss on this one!!
Beautiful. Beautiful river, definitely recommend a boat trip down the river seine. It's a great was a great way to see the sights of Paris!

River Boat Tour. I took the 1 hour tour along the Seine, It was quite enjoyable and got some good snaps. It gave me a snapshot of where all the main sights were located. It made it easier to go to places to visit. The guide was very informative. I would recommend.

Not the cleanest of rivers. Walk along the banks of the river or go on a river cruise, even if its the Batobus. The Seine is certainly not the cleanest river about. So much effluence and toxic waste has gone in here that even after years spent cleaning it up has had little positive effect, its still murky brown. However the city is divided between the left and right banks and cruising the river would allow one to see the historic buildings and bridges.
In seine!. From the left bank or the right bank, do not miss the vendors along the bank. I have found some great old, old books snd prints and old magazines and newspapers.
Mucky water!. Wasn't impressed by the dirt alongside the river. Apparently lots of rough sleeping using streets as toilets and no street cleaning in sight. Lots of beggars and unofficial hawkers

A must in Paris. I enjoyed our cruise down the River Seine. It gives you a great perspective on the City of Paris and allows you to experience Parian life from a distance. We saw people relaxing, a model doing a photo shoot, children playing, etc.

Catch the Batobus and see Paris from the river. We travelled the Seine on a Batobus, the ticket was for the day and you could hop on and off for the whole day. It was a lovely way to see Paris and it was a less exhausting way to see the sites. Beautiful travelling along the river and you have time to take in all the attractions and soak up the atmosphere.

River Seine tour is a colorful way to untangle Paris. The Seine is like a ribbon that wraps Paris' many layers into one tidy bundle. A trip aboard a bateaux is a graceful way to see iconic sights near but apart from the streaming hordes of tourists but close enough to glimpse the everyday life of bustling Parisians. The view from the waterfront is steeped in the city's abounding history of palaces, principalities and polite people. Boat ride costs range from a few Euros to more than 100 Euros, so shop carefully. And beware the scamsters who pop up in front of you to "find" a ring and attempt to lure you in.

Beautiful and Romantic. See all the famous sights and learn a bit of history while taking a river tour. Or take a Hop on Hop of bus. Buy your Skip the Line tickets for the Louvre and other museums and skip the long lines. Check with your hotel. The Eiffel Tower is so beautiful at night, lit up against the Paris sky. Paris is an amazing city both day and night, but take your rain gear.

River Cruise. Did a 7 night river cruise on the Seine with Viking and it was delightful. Lots to see! Easy. Beautiful land on both sides of
the river and the river locks are interesting .

Wet, but very enjoyable. It was an awful pity that it was raining during this night trip down the Seine. We passed many spectacular and beautiful buildings but the most spectacular view was the sun going down which made the bridges look like they were on fire. The Eiffel Tower looked wonderful lit up (you may have read my previous dislike of this monument during daytime).
Boat Cruise at night!. Paris looks brilliant at night!...the boat cruise is far better during the day than at night! Picturesque!
Romantic. One of the best places to see the best of Paris is from the Seine. This is incredibly charming. A wonderful experience

Adventures on the River. My recent Road Scholar trip included a 6-night journey to Normandy from Paris in a Croisieurope River Cruiser. This is definitely the way to travel the Seine. From Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower to all the small half-timbered houses and chalets that look as though they jumped from a children's book, there is always something to see on the Seine. Little wonder the Impressionists used it so much.
boat cruise. the cruise took you all around the famouse bridges and showed you the famous buildings including up near to where lady diana died.

Seine on a Sunny Day. Beautiful walks along the river banks on Saturday in glorious sunshine. Great to see how clean and tidy the area was with many people tucking into picnics. Great afternoon for a boat trip in the sun.

Disapointing tour on Sein - and keep away from Paris Traveller Pass. Disapointing tour on Sein with Bateeaux Parisiens. Their audioguidesystem didn't function - so I experienced one hour on Sein looking at a lot of buildings and monuments wondering what I were seeing?.Warning: Don't buy the Paris Traveller Pass - most museums have temporary excebitions, and none of them are included. The trip on Sein are a robbery and transportation tickets are far to expensive - you have to use most of the day to travel to get value for the buy!
One hour boat trip a must. The one hour circular boat trip from the Eiffel Tower is great for getting your bearings and at EUR14 per adult is pretty good value.
Great way to see Paris from the water. This was a beautiful day on the river seeing all the buildings that we had been through or were about to go and see.

walk beside it early in the moring or join the locals late afternoon. In the early morning it just joggers & dog walkers. By the late afternoon on a warm spring day tourists & Pariennes alike sit & enjoy the sun, the view. the boats & barges. truly magical.

Take a strole. Take a strole along the river or a boat ride to get a feel of the REAL France. So calm and beautiful, what a way to enjoy PARIS. Plenty of boat rides to choose from. You can hop on and hop off, dinner cruise, or take a 30 minute ride. You must cross the bridge and stop and read all the locks that are attached.
The heart of the city. Walk along the river. Take an autobus or bateau mouche and you will fall in love with Paris.Browse in the bookstalls. Cross the bridges.The heart of the city.
Brilliant river cruising. Went on a dinner cruise along the Seine River and thoroughly enjoyed it. The food, drink and sightseeing was fabulous.
A River. A river through Paris entrapped by concrete banks. Not a feature opf great beauty but has devel;oped a cachet through the years.

Sit on the cruise for sightseeing is great. We sit on the Cruise for visit Seine River on the night time. It was great, we took alot of photos, see love bridges with milions key love there :-)... Very impressive. This is the first time i visit Paris, and i love this city for special architecture, famous perfume, Eiffel tower,..I will come back for longer staying for sure.

city of lights.... Do this -- the city is so gorgeous at night from the water and you will know why people call it the city of lights. We bought tickets online through viator and they were good whenever we wanted to redeem. So just buy a bottle of wine and show up! The night cruise is the best...

Beauty and Grace. This is a beautiful and graceful river dividing the right and left banks of Paris. Make sure you cruise along the river on one of the boat tours. The best way to see the sight along the river.

Do the cruise at night time. We did the Seine river cruise at night time and were not disappointed. The city is stunning all lit up. My first glimpse of Notre Dame was while I was on the cruise. It took my breath away! A must do in Paris.

stroll under the bridges. really lovely to stroll under the bridges - the Pont Arts was amazing with all the locks that couples place on the bridge to signify their undying love. In the sunlight the bridge looks like gold, grap a fresh ham and cheese baguette and sit on the seine for a picnic lunch in the sun

Paris is connected by this river that runs through it, and then forks with bridges connecting all.. Notre Dame the Louvre all are located somewhere off this river.Bridges connect this busy river. Traffic on beside and over all of Paris. At the river there are steps to climb down and actually enjoy. There is seating.This afternoon we spotted folks bring their bottle of wine and lunch.We had lunch at a cafe on the river. The bridge painted Parisan grey with gold leaf only visible from below. Beautiful.We watched the multitudes on boats enjoy cruising the river.Sun was out great day on the River Seine.

A Dazzling and sparkling experience. This experience is an outstanding memory through out my life. Breezy evening on the boat with sparkling waters and music on board. Taking the tour all along the river passing the famous museums, replica of statue of liberty, and the palaces. Food on board was exemplary. Sitting with all nationalities and enjoying the evening was wow. This is every body's must.
Beautiful. Take the Bateaux cruise ans see and learn about the place. Wonderful afternoon in the sunshine, well worth the €13.50

Highly recomended. Seine river cruise is an experience one should not miss during paris visit...we took this cruise at night but day cruises are also available. .the ticket counter is just behind the eiffle entrance...do try to club this with eiffle tower visit...the cruise starts from eiffle along the left bank upto the nortre dame explaining each monument while sailing across the left bank under the series of bridges...the audio guides were provided with each seat...then it turns and travels along the right bank describing the monuments on this side of the bank...the cruise is well furnished with two televisions magnifying the monuments...wines and food available along with few cruises...professional photography options also available...the cruise is well airconditioned..in winter nights when we travelled it was warm and cozy..one can also stand by the railings enjoying sound of Seine waters and crossing under many bridges including pont neuf and for a lovely shot outside this warm glass sitting chamber...it was complete value for money ...like a little summarization of the city's history..
View after view. If you want to see what Paris has to offfer this is a must, we did the Batobus which stops off at 8 different locations. All very relaxing and chilled!
Scenic. We liked the "lock" bridge, where we wrote our family names on a lock and tossed it into the river. We walked along the river on the lower level, very nice.

View from Pont Royal is breathtaking!. Walk the Pont Royal to get the most awesome view of Paris in the World. You can see the Eiffel Tower in looking one way and the Ile de la Cite and Notre Dame the other way!! WOW!!

A relaxing way to see a part of Paris. After a tiring day walking this is a nice way to relax and enjoy the sights. We did this during daylight and again at night which was fascinating to experience and is recommended.

the bridges of Paris.......... the Seine is just a river, but what makes it special of course are the views around it - at night to see the Eiffel Tower lit up, the bridges, the bookstores on the Left Bank - these are what make the River Seine so attractive.

two hour ride..... see Paris, the bridges, Notre Dame etc. from a seat on the water without traffic, lights or a bad cab driver... Great way to see the highlights before choosing where to go next.....

Worth the Ride. You gotta take a boat cruise on the Seine. We took an evening one where the lights were just starting to come on, so got to see the Eiffel Tower lit and twinkling with lights! We did not take the dinner cruise because we felt it was too expensive but if money is no object, I'm sure it could be very romantic.

romantic evening river cruise. Cruised with Batueax Parisiens . Had lovely meal & wine great seat & views saw several landmarks . Highlight Eiffel lighting up . Crusie lasted 2.5 hours pricey but well worth it
Calm, serene.... River seine is an extremely nice place, just to sit quietly and relax. The cruise is equally amazing.. The bridges on the river reminds of the rich heritage.. Really great..

Wonderful Views. The river appeared to be very clean and well looked after. Viewing Paris from the river has got to be the best way to see it. So many bridges and historical architecture all around. A boat trip is a relaxing way to get a load off your feet and still be moving!

One of the greatest rivers in Europe. There is always something to watch on this great river winding its way through Paris.Although very touristy its worth taking a boat trip and seeing the sights from another dimension.Walk alomg the tow path also on a sunny day,its great.

River Cruise. While in Paris we went on a river cruise at night. It was a great night. Would recommend to do this. We were on a bus tour which is full on but when you only have a set time it is the way to see everything. Hope to do all this again one day.

River cruise. The cruise from the river gives a different perspective of the buildings like Musee D'Orsay , Notre Dame and Ile de la Cite. It was cold and windy in December but still a memorable experience. A must do when in Paris.

Take the trip - it is brilliant and you get your bearings. Took the boat trip along the river and got our bearings and saw everything from a different perspective. Brilliant views of Notre Dame as photos of the back not really possible from the shore. This trip was relaxing and enjoyable.
Paris landmark. Paris without the River Seine is incomplete. Lovely area with artists, parks, walking pathways. Riverside is our favourite place for running in the mornings.

Best River tour ever!!!!. You must take this tour!!!!! Paris looks even more beautiful from this river tour. The tour includes audio equipment so you can listen to the driver as you ride by many beautiful landmarks of this beautiful city. Definitely, a boat ride that cannot be missed,
Give yourself to Paris. To stroll along it's banks is to become a Parisian. The bridges, the boats, and the monuments all combine to make you feel the warmth of the city and its people.

Perfect walk. Sat by the Seine eating strawberries in the sun and it was just a perfect moment in Paris. Really the heart of Paris is the Seine from Notre Dame to the Eiffel Tower. Perfect for a walk or to just sit and relax in the sun. Bring some food and eat here, because it is simply great!

Herded like cattle. If you have had the opportunity of doing the quick tour through Paris like on the Hop On Hop Off Bus, don't bother with a cruise down the Seine. We were herded on like cattle, and the commentary was poor. We thought it was a waste of time and money. Very disappointing.

Walk of relaxation. Strolling by the Seine passes an hour and is very relaxing. You seen many barges going to and fro. At one point you could walk down some steps and dip a foot into the water if you desire. The Seine is not particularly clean but there is no smell.

Boat trip. If you want to make a brief overview about Seine surrounding you must definitely go on a boat trip. It takes usually 1 hour and the average fee is 14€ per adult person. You can also pay for 1 or 2 day boat hop on - hop off shuttle (Batobus).

Nice to stroll along.. The river Siene is a very pretty river to walk along and cross the numerous bridges that span it. It was good fun to walk across the bridges- walk down to the river and even have a picnic lunch by the quay overlooking the water.Also highly recommended would be the 1 hr boat ride on the Siene which takes a circular path and shows all the famous monuments from the river. Gives a different perspective from the water and the boat ride is worth the money.
Nice by day but fabulous by night!. Do a night dinner cruise. See Paris riverside from a different perspective. Eiffel Tower sparkling on the hour. Even the Statue of Liberty.

OK. What can I say ... it is river through a city. However, I think it would have been nice to just sit on a bench with my lunch. I was upset when a man in a speedboat deliberated swamped a group enjoying their lunch on the edge. Of course it smelled like urine under the bridges.
Interesting Boat Trip. Located at the side of Notre Dame Cathedral is a boat trip which takes you down the river senie and provide a historical tour of some of the buildings and bridges.
Book a River Boat Cruise. The River boat cruise we took was a lot of fun, and very informational. Definitely recommend it, as you will see some of Paris's highlights from the river.

A river is a river. Wrong!. This was the river that ran through the heart of Paris. We criss crossed it in our rental and saw and experienced both sides of what the river banks offered. I only wished we took a boat tour on it. I guess they call Paris the city of lights for a reason and the Seine definitely had it's charm even at night.
Highly recommended. See Paris by boat, night or day, highlights main attractions, good value. Eiffel looks spectacular by night. A must for anyone visiting Paris.

Can never get enough. Board the river cruise using the Paris pass or go to any other river cruises. The view is stunning and it's best to go with your loved ones. Do pack an umbrella if you are going during October as there might be rain.

River cruise - worth trying. This was recommended at our hotel (le robinet d'or) and we liked the idea as we have previously been to Paris and wanted something different. The good thing was you'd paid 15 euros and could hop on and off....so one payment and 8 stops - Very enjoyable

Dinner cruse is breath taking!. My wife and I went on the dinner cruse and we where blown away by the views and whole experience. The cruse was expensive but well worth the money, we passed the Eiffel tower just as the lights started to sparkle this was breath taking as we sat sipping champaign.
Perfect for Pictures!. I love taking pics on the banks and the Seine or having a croissant! Brilliant if you want to pretend to be Parisian! lol
Pretty smelly. Beautiful to photograph but be careful standing downwind, or inhaling too deeply along the river bank.

River cruise. We did a boat cruise starting from Eiffel Tower and went along to back of both city islands and return. Took a bit over an hour. It was the cruise included in London Pass. The commentary was done by one girl in 6 languages fluently and then threw in 2 more 'roughly'. She was impressive. She also made jokes along the way so it just wasn't dead-pan talk. The city is well worth seeing from the river as well as being relaxing.

Do not waste time or money. DO NOT waste you money on this tour boat. The guide barely spoke English and managed to word out a sentence, and if we were luck-two, about each point of interest along the river.The cruise should be sold as French speaking only !!. The sound system on the boat was so bad that we could hardly make out even the few words that were spoken in English.Definitely take a boat tour around dusk to see Paris in lights.
Scenic!. We caught the boat near to the Notre Dame, it was a sunny day and we enjoyed a very pleasant hour admiring the scenery.

So romantic. Hop on one of the many tour boats and glide down this beauty at night to see the Eiffel Tower all lit up. My favorite part of my visit was roaming up and down this rivers banks. Right out of the movies!

Lovely views.. Took the Batobus on a day ticket; 'hop on hop off' (16 Euros) to travel between main tourist spots (8 stations-Tour Eiffel, Musee D'Orsay, Saint Germain-Des-Pres, Notre Dame, Jardin Des Plantes, Hotel De Ville, Louvre & Champs-Elysees - loop). It's a lovely way to travel although the boats were packed (queuing as ever) and very noisy (people noise). Still you could stand on the stern and take in the fresh air and sound of the river. The views from the river are so different from street level and it gives you a different perspective of the city. The boats run around every 15 minutes so you can visit different areas over the day. You could easily use this as the main way to see all the top tourist spots.

Gives you an idea about the area....toilet horrible. National Holidays included an hour boat ride on the Seine. There was a commentary included. Pleased we went on the boat but unfortunately the state of the toilet "put a dampener! on things.

Romantic time. I am booking Bateaux parisiens from inter net. When i get there just show the ticket , so no need to wait long time. For me i dont like this boat because have mirror close over the boat. I see boat from another company open air. Its much more better. This boat have audio guide. I have been there in the evening . Its so romantic and i been this for the frist day of my trip. So u can see every thing around and u can plan for the next day. Its use time like 1hours or one and half.

Take a River Cruise at Night. There are several river cruises that will transport you on the River Seine. Do so at night so that you can see the magic of the illuminated bridges and a spectacular light display at the Tour Eiffel. You will see more than the mind can take in. We will repeat this trip when we are next in Paris.
Night river tour.. Taking the night river tour is a must. Paris from a different perspective at night. Not the dinner cruise, Just the plane ol river tour. Do it.

A definite must do!. We used Bateaux Parisiens as part of our Les Rouges hop-on, hop- off tour to enjoy the gorgeous sights, snippets of history and information and to see this beautiful city from a different angle.
A feast of sights. An hours cruise overloads the senses and re enforces what an extraordinary city Paris is. All boxes ticked!

Illuminations Tour. We took the Illuminations Tour on our first evening and it was a great introduction to Paris. You get to see the main sights and is a useful way to get your orientation. As we visited in August most of the tour we were on was done in daylight - maybe the next time I visit Paris I will do the illuminations tour in the dark!

Grab a Bateau Bus ticket. This is just a hop on/hop off bus ticket only on the water. No guided tour or huge explanation of the various sights. But it is good value for money and affords a really great view of the Seine from the water. You get to see the under side of the bridges. Amazing art and sculpture. Also, viewing the Notre Dame from the water is spectacular. It really accents how very..... gothic it is and how terrifying it must have been to prisoners being transported there in its chequered history.

At night, it is beautiful. Although we walked across the bridges of the Seine a number of timesduring the day and evening, but the dinner cruise was tops. Our party of nine had made reservations before arriving in Paris. One of the party had suggested the cruise and the rest of went along thinking that it would be one of those touristy cheap tricks. We boarded the boat just before sunset. We were served wines and a sampler of appetizers before a wonderful meal. The food was a very pleasant surprise. It was good and well prepared.The sites from the boat after sunset were wonderful. When the Eiffel Tower lights came on, it was magic.
Nighttime Cruise. Seine should be experienced at night. The buildings are aglow making the river even more beautiful. Take a quick one hour tour from Pont Nerf to hit the highlights.

River cruise. We had dinner on one of the river cruises and I couldn't fault it. we didn't have a reservation and they were kind enough to fit us in. The food was really good and was great value for money. Three courses and a half bottle of wine while cruising past the Eiffel tower for 45 euro. Really enjoyed it.
Cruise the River. There are many boats available for crusies on the river. Great for sightseeing. Great photo opportunities. In the heart of the city and easy access, near the cathedral.
Beautiful. A beautiful walk in Paris. There are a lot ob beautiful bridges (do not miss Alexander III). If you run, you must wake up early and run here. You will not regret it.
Evening Boat Trip. Take one... the city at its most beautiful.The bridges all lit up, Notre Dame, the tower all golden and, on the hour for five minutes, sparkling too.
River Cruise. It is very nice and many type of cruises are available i do recommend to take both night and day cruises with guide if you have time you will enjoy it.

Great cruise. Had a cruise down the Seine. Very informative and interesting sail. Quite a few different companies to choose from. We used bateaux Parisienne and they had English speaking commentators. Would recommend this as a good alternative to the bus tour or walking.
Go early morning. Walk along the Seine early morning before all the tourist get up and your will experience a peaceful and serene Seine.

We stayed on Ile de la Cite, so we spent a lot of time walking along the river. We enjoyed the river views at all times of the day. We crossed many of the bridges and enjoyed the river walk. We didn't do a cruise but it could be something to try next time.

Cruise down the River Seine. We were on our first trip to Paris and wanted to cruise the Seine. We chose to get a hop-on, hop-off ticket which allowed us to cruise around or get off any of the eight stops and get back on when we wanted. It's very relaxing and the cruise goes by all the famous places in Paris you've always wanted to see. We got off at one stop and walked along the banks through beautiful gardens. It was fun to "people watch". A lovely afternoon.

Heart of the city. We walked it from Notre Dame to Eiffel tower experiencing the bridges, the stalls, parks , atmosphere and the people. A typical yet unique Paris experience. We also took a trip on Veddettes de Paris (thanks to Tesco vouchers) which was very good with an interesting commentary and a chance to view the sights and the river from a different viewpoint.

... Romantic..... My wife and I spent 4 nights in perfect Paris some days ago....We were recommended, by the great restaurant Cafe le Paris in the Latin Quarter!!!, to take this sightseeing at the river Seine... No regrets!!! This was just great.... So many perfect spots and things to see... Everywhere along the river... The tour guide on the boat was great! She told a lot of stories and had such good history skills....I am not sure how many bridges we actually did go through, but there were a lot...!!!!!! Very nice and excellent construction works... You will get a great view of all the ancient and perfect buildings along the river like the great Louvre and Notre Dame.... From the river you will be more aware on HOW great these buildings really are!!! From greatness to smallness: we even passed The Smallest House in Paris.... Such a tiny little house, pressed between the more "ordinary" houses at both side of it.... I highly recomend a romantic trip on the river Seine......T

i love it. Even if you cant get the pronunciation right you will fall in love with this river. One can spend endless hours just watching it. The beautiful walks along the banks, the fantastic bridges, most of all the lovers. I would strongly suggest the one hour cruise it might seem like a a kitschy thing but an evening cruise provides great photo ops and you can get a perspective of the city that you cannot get from land.
River Tour. This was great. The tour was leisurely and passed many great sights. Easy access and well-run tour. The crew was friendly and helpful.

Oh the Seine.... Always beautiful! The views are terrific from atop the Eiffel Tower to the riverbank. A not to be missed site. The history of this working river is unique and wonderful to read and learn about. Stop and take a leisurely stroll, watch the wildlife or the boats pass by, you will wonder where the time went.

Worth the money. We took a boat trip from the jetty near the Eiffel Tower. A 12km trip takes about an hour and is well worth it. The cost was €42 for 2 adults and a 15 year old. You get a great view of Notre Dame as well as some of the bridges over the river, the D'orsay and other buildings. Don't miss it.

Take the river boats. We took a boat tour and it was well worth the money.I wish we had taken it the first day, it gave you an idea where things were located and an idea of which things you did not want to miss.

Beautiful River~. The river is so lovely from the many bridges which cross it. To think about the many people who ventured up the Seine is remarkable. I thought about the Vikings who tried to siege Paris, when the city was only located on the Island. Loveliest of rivers!A lifeline though Paris:)
Great Intro to Paris. Hoped on a night river cruise the first night we arrived in Paris. Great way to set the mood for our trip and see the highlights before we hit the pavement walking1
Meander and see it all.. Just "strolling" on the quais by the Seine invites the imaginative and creative spirit....very rejuvenating!
It'a River. The best value seems to be the Batobus, which has 8 stops and you can hop on and off as you please. It stops at or near to the major tourist sites. Very convenient.

Must do in Paris. Paris was built to been seen by the river, it is a must do when you are there to take a river boat tour. It allows tou to see all the bridges and many main attractions. We went right at sunset so on the way there we seen things in the light amd after we turned around we seeb everything lite up with lights. It was the perfect time to go.
Serene!. Very calm and peaceful to walk on the shore as well as the cruises.A must watch for all - Family/Friends/Couples.
Beautiful. As imagined it would be.. No better way to spend an evening in the company of that special someone other than on a cruise on river Seine. highly recommended.

Gorgeous river. We walked all over Paris and this beautiful river and it's bridges are the one constant. It was always sparkling and loads of people were taking cruises. There is always something to see on the river

Just like the movies!. The River Seine is so beautiful with all of the different bridges that provide different views. The Pont des Arts is a pedestrian only bridge. We also did a river cruise with Bateaux Parisien, which we boarded right near the Eiffel Tower. Try to take the boat at twilight so you can see the city of lights at night and sit upstairs to see the amazing views.

Can't Visit Paris Without Doing A Boat Trip.. A boa trip along the River Seine surely is a must. We did it on a bright crisp winters afternoon with a warm croissant & a hot coffee in our hands..... marvelous. A great way to get your initial bearings in this wonderful city.

Just as you imagined it would be. Walling along the Seine with that special person... nowhere else can you get that feeling, that thrill, that "Oh, I can't believe we're really here!" moment, and it's only one of so many available to you in Paris. Best is from the Pont des Artes to Notre Dame, or from St Germain to the Eiffel Tower, Long walks, but it's Paris! Do it and be sure to take a photo!
Beautiful Seine River. Amazing Seine River Cruise at sunset. Definate must do when in Paris. We loved the experience and would recommend to all who visit Paris especially in the spring.

Slightly disappoiting. As per the title, we were slightly disappointed by the view from the boat. This was perhaps because we had done an open-top bus tour the day before and had a better view. However the commentary was informative and the river extremely clean. Beware of con artists in the area. Twice people pretended to have found a gold ring by our feet. I assume the would then offer to sell it to us for a knock-down price. We did not engage them and they walked away, but be aware.
Great night cruise. This was a lovely way to get a different view if the city and probably saves lots of walking. You can get on and off
Lovely walk to 'feel' Paris. Grab a sandwich and sit by the Seine on a sunny day and wave to the boat tours - a lovely French feel.

The river's a breeze. A stroll along either bank is a cost- free pleasure in Paris, that so many miss. Wander, take a picnic, meet the locals, enjoy an antique market, cross and count the variety of bridges. Above all enjoy the cooling breeze whether walking or on a short, relaxing cruise. Frank Murray (Scotland)
Batobus. It was great price and you could use it all day until 9.30 at night on and off as many times as you wanted - great way to see Paris

Spectacular... specially at night!. Don´t miss taking the night Paris tour through the River Seine. Its so beautiful and so romantic. You also get to lear a lot of history while in the water. There are so many briges and buildings and how the lights make them look at night!

"Le charmante de Paris". The Seine is there, no lines, no tickets. And I can honestly say, there is little that can compete with just strolling along it a sunny spring morning. The Seine is one of the elements of Paris that contribute to its unique atmosphere. Why not having a picnic on the river bank with a dear friend =)

River Seine. There are a few river cruise boats, so check out a few before you decide which one you want to jump on. I wanted an open deck area on the top, so I had to find the right boat. I even saved 2 euro by looking around. They are usually about an hour and it's worth it. You pass many monuments along the way and great picture taking. A great intro to Paris.

city visit. Have been twice to Paris and have to very different experiences of river trips so be aware which one you take some have automated commentary others have personnel with local knowledge . Bestntri9s were from effiel tower side of river.
River cruise. Beautiful area, crowed, get there early. River is awesome to see, picture perfect for a lot of sites.

Enjoying playing tourist. What a better way to unwind than to cross Paris on one of the boats plying the Seine. No need to listen to the commentary given through earphones, just relax and enjoy the sights. I love to have friends visiting, it gives me the excuse to enjoy playing tourist.
try the boat trip. Get on the boat trip to see Paris from a completely different prespective. A great view of Notre Dame

If you have time then you should enjoy the view of the city. There are plenty of ferries and which offer different services. Some are with lunch or dinner and some are with hop or and hop of services. If you are interested the simple service will take you about one hour round trip and you can see all the attractions which are along the river. I would recommend to take the evening cruise when the sun is about to set so you can have the magnificent view of the city in both at day light and under lights. There are combine tickets can be purchased with other attractions so you can have some discounts. L'open tour has some combo tickets you can use the both services.

A bit of a boat ride. A great and relaxing way to get your bearings and see some of the sights, be careful of some of the operators, we paid for a dinner cruise and got a cruise, when I question the girl at the counter, she was as cold as the river, but still a good experience

JUST OK. Everybody said "oh you got to take a river boat cruise" on the Seine river. We took a non-stop day cruise that lasted about 45 mins. The weather was beautiful and we sat up top and it was very enjoyable. Bad thing is the sound system is worthless and we were right by the speakers. We took and day and a night river cruise on two different boats with two different companies and both sound systems were terrible. The cruise itself is very low key and relaxing. If the weather is nice i recommend taking the cruise and sitting on the top deck ;)

Walk, Cross, or Sail. River Seine is one of the major and free attractions in Paris with the exception for the ticket for boat/cruise. Walk along the right or left side and cross one of the bridges to enjoy the view.There are banks/benches on one of the pedestrian only bridge and it is great for people watching and taking pictures.On our last night, we took the guided river tour and saw the magnificent Eiffel tower with musical lights and the other major buildings around. The bridges were also lit and the lights reflected on the river.It was an amazing sight to remember and a grand finale for our Paris trip..

Interesting view..... When you go to a city it is always good to see the city from different view points. Taking a ride down the Seine is a great way to see the city from a different view. There are some truly beautiful bridges in Paris and you get to see them close up this way. Also, when you come up to the Eiffel Tower, you have a full view (great for pictures) of the tower. It is a fun and interesting way to see the city and the children on the trip seemed to love it as much, if not more than, the adults did. Go...take a ride...you will enjoy it.

A great boat trip. You can get a deal when on the cart rouge ( red bus) which we took and this guaranteed a trip on the Seine. Very picturesque. You travel under a few bridges if varying design and there are many 'house' barges and moored boats of differing variety. Marvellous architecture on the banks of the Seine. A recommended trip. Cheers

Beautiful Evening River Cruise. I took my partner on an evening river cruise to propose to her and it all went perfectly.( Yeah me and hundreds of other people have no doubt proposed on these river cruises but I never said I was a romantic trail blazer.)The staff were lovely and friendly and the service was excellent. The meal was superb and the cruise timed perfectly so that the onboard entertainment coincided with the landmarks as you pass by.For example as we passed Notre Dame Cathedral the on board singer sang a beautiful haunting aria which fitted perfectly with the setting and was quite moving.The entertainment was at all times lovely and subtle, never cheesy or garish.Highly recommended.

Boat ride. After walking along the Seine and enjoying all the little book stands and the beautiful sights, go to the bridge at Pont Neuf and take the River Seine boat ride for a wonderful over view of the city of Paris.

Very Enjoyable.. We took the 10pm Bateaux Vedettes du Pont Neuf cruise which was 13 euros but I had booked it in advance online for a discount of 2 Euros each. We sat outside on the top deck and we caught our first glimpse off the sparkly, twinkly Eiffel Tower, beams from it shone in our direction every few seconds for about twenty minutes, always a thrill! It was a lovely way to see Paris, our guide pointed out the main sights and we passed 22 bridges, just as many landmarks, countless Parisians partying by the river on a Saturday night. Do dress up warm as it can get windy, a very enjoyable evening.

Makes navigation a breeze. I contribute most of my ability to navigate Paris to this river. If you know which side you are on and which side you want to be on then it will be much easier to get there. Most of the popular attractions in Paris can be seen from the river. Many parisian youths hang out along the river at night so depending on your level of comfort with throngs of foreign adolescents the river walk may be best traversed during the day.
Boat trips good. We used the boats to get back to hotel, having bought a pass. Walked miles to sights then rested on way back with the scenery being moved for us! Very useful.
Great river cruise. Take a cruise at night. So romantic and you will see many buildings from a different perspective. Stay outside on the boat for a better view of the bridges and sights.
not much to see. went on the boat cruise on the river not much to see from the boat apart from the Eiffel Tower and prince Alexandra Bridge , which you can see from anywhere
Beautiful. Especially at night, take a dinner cruise at sunset. Everything lights up at night and beautiful sunsets.
River Seine- so much to see along its banks!. Many of Paris' main attractions are on the banks of the River Seine. A trip on the river at day and night is a must when you are in Paris.
Cold, but nice. Many boats travel up and down for tourists. It was fun to see the river and understand how it was a major waterway for the Paris economy.

Very touristy but quaint postcard stands. Drove by River Seine many times.Lots of water traffic and intriguing newspaper, souvenir and postcard stands.Views from the a River banks are spectacular and of course we wall want to experience the Left Bank
Romantic. Walking along by the river looking at the buildings and the bridges is fabulous and so romantic. A river cruise is also amazing. A must see in Paris.
Ambassador European tour. Take a boat tour on the Seine, it is worth it!! The bridges are both beautiful and many!! Great photos shots of the Eiffel tower too! Very relaxing and you see so much!!
Pleasure at leisure. Boat comfy , good commentary, a relaxing way to sightsee. Watch out for large groups of Chinese tourists who will trample on you to get poll positions for photography.

Batobus. We brought a ticket fairly late in the day, as we had been busy doing lots of other things, we did wish we had known about the value sooner, we would have probably brought a two day ticket or even the combined one with the bus. As this is a very good way to get your bearings and see where you would like to spend more time.
Seine cruise. A lovely day with sunny, warm weather meant this was a very good way to see Paris from a different angle. Good commentary in English and French. Boat boarded at Pont Neuf.
Incredible!!!. Me and my boyfriend, we took the Seine River Cruise, this cruise was a great experience. The excursion tour guides were very knowledgeable about the history of the areas we visited.

lovely river. It is nice to have a stroll along the river bank in Paris and maybe sitting somewhere along it watching the world go by. While by the riverside we even saw a bunch of people swimming in the Seine. It is also a good plca for s boat ride.
Batabus. The Batabus hop on hop off river boats visit all the riverside attractions at an extremely reasonable rate. Rarely full and fairly comfortable.

An interesting walk along the Seine. There are all manor of interesting things to observe as you walk along the Seine. It is a worthwhile activity. There are quite a few vendors selling everything from books to music to paintings and more. They also sell locks - which you can sign with a permanent marker and attach to the bridge along the Seine. There are literally millions of these signed locks attached to the bridge. Of course there are boat rides you can take, but walking will give you a real street level view of Paris and Parisians!
Beautiful stretch of water. Clean and beautiful river, comparing to London or some cities where it's dirty. Cleaner and greener or blueish at places/times
Gorgeous. Great trip down the river. Good to see all the sights. Was a little bit over priced but everything in Paris is.

Nice boat trip but not very informative. We travelled with Bateaux Parisiens on a very smart boat with two decks. The internal lower deck had individual audio guides with a choice of 13 languages. However, on the open top deck there were no audio guides, just loud music. The trip was pleasant but you didn't learn anything of the sights of the city

romantic. very romantic cruise, if you have a gf/bf, ask for others to take a picture of you together. bring camera, good one :) take lots of photo. take the cruise from Port de Suffren, take the 'Vedettes de Paris' cruise. prepare money, but worthed.

Under the Bridges of Paris!. We had a boat trip from the Eiffel Tour round the Ile. de la Cite and return. Seeing all the popular sites illuminated was fantastic. Look out for the sparkle lights on the Tour on the hour! The cruise is excellent value with interesting commentary and traditional French music. A lovely way to see Paris in the evening.

THE Seine. Just go for a walk on the embankments.... Weather or not, rain or not, even if there's snow, it's one of the greatest walk you can have. And if you're in love, walking there together is just sweet :)
Great for an afternoon cruise. Walk down to the seine and jump on a river cruise, affordable, no bookings required and a great way to spend an hour or so.

Great family walk. We walked on the left bank from the level of the Louvre to the Eiffel Tower. two adults and two kids ages 5 and 10.What a great walk! Many people, fun activities for kids, so that they do not get bored. There wwas rockclimbing, rope climbing, hopscotch, and a floating park with hammoc nets over grasses!I will rememebr this for a long time!

A Paris Must!. Day or night, a walk along the River Seine, or over one of its many bridges, is something you cannot avoid while visiting Paris…and who would want to! The view changes with each step you take and will undoubtedly be mesmerized. Along the walkways and bridges you will experience some of the best that Paris has to offer. The best part, it’s all FREE!
a trip on the seine. we had a boat trip from the base of the eiffel tower round Ile de la Cite and back which was fantastic. A lovely way to see the centre with a helpful commentary. excellent value.

Love love love. After the Jardin des Tullieres, we walked along the Seine before venturing up the Champs de Elysses. The Seine was full of people, tourist, fashion, Parisians, cafe's, bikers, skate boarder's, roller bladders, and boats. Just a marvelous walk.The next day, we crossed to go to the Musee des Orsay, but hit a bit of a snag, for the first color race in France went along the Seine. Great fun.

The Seine Meets all Expectations. The movies make a cruise on the Seine seem like a romantic and up close and personal view of Paris. In this case it is not movie magic but real Parisian charm that makes the cruise so special. The cruise my wife and I took was the highlight of our trip to "The City of Lights". The romantic French music played on the speakers ("La Vie en rose" by Edith Piaf is our favorite) made for lifetime memories as we passed by some of Paris most famous landmarks. We will do this on every trip to Paris.

The River, She's Magnificent!. I took a boat tour, and it's well worth your time. It started from the Eiffel Tower, looped around after 10 miles (?) and returned to the tower. I enjoyed mostly the gentle lapping of the river with the sun shining on it.

Batobus. We bought a two day pass for the waterbus for 18 euros each and were able to jump on and off as much as we wanted to. One thing to be aware of is to queue at the entrance at each stop - it will save any confusion.

Felt like a Sign!. My first look at the Seine was special as a boat with my hometown's name floated past and it seemed like a sign! Beautiful and full of history...the Seine and Paris are impossible not to fall in love with.

Visit but Be Careful!. I definitely recommend walking up and down the River Seine, visiting the booths for some unique shopping and walking across the bridges, but be careful for the gypsies. Yes, I said gypsies. One very aggressively pick pocketed my cell phone!

The heart of paris.. Great views and photo opportunities along almost every stretch of the river on both sides. Definitely worth a river boat tour - paid 14 euro for an hour guided tour which seemed very reasonable

What's not to love?. If you are in Paris with someone you love, you must spend some time on the Seine. The Bateaux Mouche is a relatively inexpensive one hour cruise that covers many of the Paris sights. The river is beautiful at night as well and there are great views from the numerous bridges that cross it. The Seine is a must see when in Paris.
Average. Not spectacular, as this was my fourth time in Paris, I was not very happy with the river cruise, needed more information.

Lovely sites. We took a cruise along the Seine (Bateaux Mouches - see separate review) and enjoyed the unique view of the beautiful sites in Paris. Our hotel was near the Trocadero/Eiffel Tower and so we jogged down to it one morning and jogged along the Seine, across Pont Alexandre III bridge and back. Nice jogging paths available along the river.
Sunday Morning walk. Best time to go. The walk from Marais to Musee D'Orsay is wonderful. No traffic except locals on pedal scooters and bikes and some great views

One of my favourite rivers.... Lovely river! Actually bluish, unlike the Yarra and Thames city rivers. We went on a cruise...a lot of the attractions are on the river's edge, so it was beautiful to see them all from the water.
Lovely views. Lovely views as you walk around Paris. The Love Bridge near Notre Dame is al nice picture spot as are views with the Eiffel Tower in.

Walking the Seine. There is nothing more Parisian (in this New Orleanian's opinion) than walking along the Seine on a sunny spring afternoon. Forget all the frenzy tourist stuff for an hour or two and stroll!
Very romantic. The river at night time is gorgeous me and my boyfriend at the time nearly walk the hole length of it and got lost.

This was the most incredible trip!. This trip is everything you could hope for. The river boat is like a hotel, not a cruise ship. Due to the smaller venue, you get to know the staff and other passangers. The tours are the best, well executed I have ever done. All of the tour guides are well educated on a wealth on knowledge. Just keepin mind there is a fair amount of walking on the tours. Not difficult walking but walking. They do provide a gentle tour at each location.

Loved it!. The River Seine runs has the Notre Dame Cathedral on one side and vendors selling art and other souvenirs on the other side. There is a cruise, so I ecommend this and making reservations in advance.

Well worth the trip. Brilliant way to get around Paris without wearing. out your shoe leather! Tip though use the Bateau Bus rather than the tourist cruises. This is cheaper but visits the same places and is the local commuter bus. At 15 euro per ticket it allows 8 stops along the river at places like the Notre Dame Cathedral and you can get on and off it as many times as you like during the day on the same ticket. However there is no tourist commentary or toilet on board, though the time between each stop is roughly 10mins.
Worth a boat trip. We enjoyed seeing Paris from the river and it gave us a rest from walking in the city. Well organised and reasonably priced.

River Same?. What can I say about the river Seine? Well it was big and wet (standard) but at the same time not falling from the sky which is a bonus. It didn't smell of effluence but didn't brim with crystal clarity. It is like all major river that pass through urban areas, a place to go on a boat and be given a tour. If that's your thing give it a shot but you can see just as much from the banks.
joyful ride. its serene, peaceful, remarkable and breath taking, you will love every sight of it. take it all in and see how people enjoy nature and life

Choose your boat carefully. Purchased tickets on the dock area below the Eiffel Tower from a kiosk...then realized the boat didn't have an open upper deck. Very crowded on board, and the roof overtop of the boat restricted the view. Make sure you select a boat that has unrestricted visual access

hop on hop off boat. We bought a ticket for a day hop on hop off, there is no tour explanation of what you see but it's a much easier way to get from one point to another without traffic and great sights!

Beautiful and Romantic. The river Seine is the center of all of Paris, from the cities beginning on Ile de la Cite to it's spread on the left and right banks.
