Whatever you do in Paris, the river will be ever present. You stroll on it, cruise on it, commute on it, ride the metro along it's west bank and take pictures of it from ever observation point. At night it is lite and spectacular. My fondest memory was a romantic dinner cruise. No matter how or when or where you see it, it will leave lasting impressions. As it flows past the Eiffel Tower, under the beautiful bridge that connects the Grand and Petit palace to the Invalides, past Musee d'Orsay and the Louvre and on to circle Ile de la Cite and Ile St. Louis and the cathedral Notre Dame, a ride on the Seine captures more sites than any other in Paris. So walk or cruise it or just ride the Batobus that shuttles you from one end to the other. Make a point to do at least one ride at night. It is a whole different world.

A great place to have lunch on a sunny summer day. I walked along the Seine after visiting the Louvre and walking across Pont des Arts. I found a nice bench near Pont Neuf to enjoy my hunk of brie and baguette for lunch. Having lunch along the Seine is something everyone should do once while they are in Paris.

Really should visit ..... When visiting Paris, one really should spend sometime around the Seine. It seems that Parisians really use the their river - both to live on and to play by.We took a boat trip at dusk and all along the banks, there were people walking, running, picnicking, lounging, dancing and relaxing. The only exception was the stretch where the road drops onto the riverside.The boat trips are inexpensive and gives a different view of the city and taking one in the evening, means you get to see all the significant buildings - and of course the Eiffel - lit up.I'd say definitely spend sometime by the river while you're in Paris and soak up the atmosphere.
A nice Parisian experience. We did the dinner cruise and it was great. You can see many of the sights cruising along the river. It was a great experience and i would recommend it highly.
Beautiful walk. While walking around Paris, you can't get away from the Seine. It is everywhere and every view is different. Take a river cruise.

Beautiful. Pools made on river are really historical. you will enjoy doing photography of these. lighting during night is beautiful. Don't miss it. River Tour is optional. Don't think worth spending money on that
Take a tour in winter - meet interesting people. Take a tour in winter, on a cold, rainy afternoon, and you'll meet far more interesting people than you will in summer.
Be a Parisian!. Take the time to grab a bottle of wine and have some lunch anywhere along the river! It was relaxing and fun people watching! And less expensive than a restaurant!
take a tour of the river. you will enjoy the views if you cruise the river - there is so much to see, just from this angle. You will enjoy it.

take the tour at night. we saw the Seine during the day and took the river tour at night. it is worth seeing with all the lights on. its a different perspective. loved the fireman who live on the boat on the River Seine. they were playing volleyball in the water. Fun to watch

The Seine at Night. Spectacular view of the bridges of Paris from the river at night! Each bridge is unique in its architecture and style. Beautifully lit!! Breathtaking view of the Eiffel Tower. We used the narrated tour company that leaves from Pont Neuf. One of our most memorable experiences in Paris.

Romantic walks. Went there with my wife, walking around the river, casual stroll, relaxing like the parisians, sitting by the river side, it is just amazing. The areas around Eiffel and walking towards Louvre by the river... it is worth doing it.
I liked The Nile most :D. Nothing special about it except the lovers lockers :D but its okie :) I liked the Nile river in Egypt much more ;)
Gorgeous walk. Definatly worth a walk along from Champs Elysees to Norte Dame. Beatiful with all the bridges along the Seine.

Pleasant ferry journey. A nice way to see some of the local sights and avoid the people traffic for an hour. We passed under several bridges and saw Notre Dame and Le Louvre before going there on foot.

A must do!. No visit is complete in Paris unless you hop on a boat at night to experience the Seine. The lights of the Eiffel Tower and the ornate bridges, the sight of beautiful buildings as you travel along the Seine are just memorable.I have visited a couple of times, once with dinner included on the boat and the atmosphere was very elegant with beautiful music. The other time I purchased tickets for dinner at the Eiffel Tower which included tickets for the boat cruise. Both times I have not been disappointed.Don't forget your camera!

Take a boat cruise down the river at night…wonderful. you can board a boat right next to the Eiffel Tower. we took a cruise down the river and it was awesome. you get to see all of the sights but all lit up and the view of Notre Dame, the Louvre and the Eiffel Tower are worth it. So great!

Enjoyed the evening sight seeing on the river.. We took a one hour cruise from the Eiffel Tower and back just as it was getting dark. We bought the tickets and chose the time we wanted to go on the boat.

GREAT ATTRACTION IN PARIS. The tour to Paris city will be incomplete without experiencing the enchanting Boat cruise in River Siene.Siene River runs across Paris and there are number of bridges over the River connecting both parts of the city.As a part of the city tour,we had a cruise for about 1 hr in the River.Really enjoyed the great sights on the banks of the River like historic palatial buildings.Tourists from across the world were either walking on the banks of the River or cruising in boats of different sizes downstream.The sights of the majestic Eiffiel Tower and Cathedral were in fact feast for the eyes.It was very memorable indeed.
Bateau Mouche tours. These are excellent tours and can be prebooked, the office where you pick up the coach is a little difficult to find so give yourself a bit extra time to do so.

Go at dusk to see the houseboats. We used the Seine (via Batobus) to move through the city. The high point was at dusk. It was easy to peer into the houseboats and see how the river-dwellers live.
Needless to say, the path along the Seine is also great for a walk.
Gorgeous Views. Gorgeous views. Had a tour guide to give us information on different sights. A peaceful ride, cutting through the City of Love.

Slow down and review your life. After quitting my crummy part-time job with a narcissistic self-serving boss whose idea of leadership was "do as I say, not as I do," I decided I finally had it. I sent an e-mail one Monday morning quitting my soul-sucking job. My trip to Paris was already planned. Upon arrival in Paris with glorious sunshine, I decided part of my problem was that I worked in an office with no windows, walls painted a putrid yellow and fluorescent lights that were constantly buzzing.So I sat on the banks of the Seine and let the sunshine wash over me restoring my soul to its original condition.Do the same...you will see what I mean.

River boat trip. No sightseeing day is complete without a cruise on the River Seine. The trip covers all the main sights of Paris and the boats are very comfortable with translation equipment to help you along with the history side of Paris.

Fine dining on the Seine. We booked a lunch cruise with Bateaux Parisenne in advance from the u.k.When we arrived it was straight on to the boat, no waiting. We booked window seats, and it was well worth paying the little bit extra. We enjoyed a Kir before setting off. I had the duck starter, which was delicious, as was my veal main course. My partner had the duck main course, which he really enjoyed as well. The standard of the food was very high, and our waiter Thomas was very attentive.There was a singer/musician to entertain us as well, it was a lovely experience and i would fully recommend it to anyone visiting Paris.

The Pulse of Paris. The Seine runs right through the heart of Paris, and should be considered a monument itself. There is so much life and culture along the banks to experience when here. At night, especially, the locals and tourists alike sit along the banks with bottles of wine and soccer balls, and you can truly see the more relaxed side of Paris.
Dinner on the River. Fantastic experience of high quality restaurant dinner (first class tickets shoud be bought) on the boat passing away magnificent buildings and monuments.

nice cruise. We took the seine river cruise at night from Bateaux Mouches. As expected Paris was amazing at night. We had to wait and queue for around 40 minutes and the boat was full. people were sitting on the sides of the river drinking wine and enjoying their time. Loved the tour overall.

Loved It!!!. The River Seine runs has the Notre Dame Cathedral on one side and vendors selling art and other souvenirs on the other side. There also river cruises along with restaurants right on the river. It's definitely worth seeing!!!

Relaxing on the river. Did the boat trip down the Seine with Les Bateaux Parisiens and found it very relaxing in the centre of the city. Commentary was provided as we cruised which added to the trip as it is always nice to know what you are looking at. Did this trip included with the Car Rouge bus trip and found it was well worth the money.
Romantic Strolls. Lovely to stroll along the River Seine. The Architecture is amazing on both sides.Loved the Lovers Padlocks on the Bridges
Seine River Cruise. We took an evening Seine River cruise. You could see all the monuments and as it got dark they all lit up. Recommend this and making reservations in advance.

This is Paris. The river is as iconic as the Eiffel Tower or Notre Dame; the vein that runs through the city connecting so many of its parts. You cannot avoid it if you tried, and why would you? It's beautiful. On a sunny day a stroll along the water is all you need to feel the heartbeat of this incredibly historic city.
Boat trip. We did the boat trip from the Bateau Mouche and it was excellent. The commentary was very good. It maybe would have been nice to buy a drink on board!
I love the River. What a great place to walk, the river has lots of footpaths on either side, lots of places to sit down and rest and lots of things to look at. I love Paris
SO romantic. It was romantic just looking at the river seine. I felt like I was in a Norman Mailer novel. I left a piece of my heart in Paris.

Never reviewed a river before but...this one qualifies. The Seine is not just a river, it's a centering soul of Paris. Last time we took a Bateau Mouche (riverboat tour) which was really fun. This time we used it as our compass, traversing the Rive Gauche and Rive Droite over the various bridges, including the Pont de l'Archeveche where the hundreds of thousands of 'love locks' are getting so heavy parts of the chain link fence fell into the river! There is very bad pollution in Paris right now, so sometimes standing on the bridge looking torwards the Palais Royale is a little fuzzy, but it doesn't matter. The Seine is the center, the heartbeat of Paris, home to lovers, tourists, sun gods (we saw one very brave soul in his Speedo lying on the concrete), artists and history. It's hard to miss the Seine if you're in Paris, but make sure to spend a few contemplative moments just looking at the water, the Louvre and Hotel des Invalides (I think I've got that right), and remember how many footsteps, proposals, kisses, heartbreaks, brushstrokes, words and life has travelled with the current on the River Seine.
Peaceful. We didn't take a boat tour but it was still a peaceful day. The day we were there only a handful was out and about. So, we were able to experience the site without any distractions.
Hello Sailor !. The river bus Batobus, which is a day fare with hope on hop off at some 8 points around the river is except value and an interesting way to the various areas of most interest.

Spoilt by kids. We were looking forward to this tour ever since we booked our flights to Paris.Once we got out our tickets from the ticket booth and got onto the boat we were disappointed as around 50 young school kids were on our boat and were noisy all the way through the boat ride we changed seats a couple of times but made no difference, this would make it hard for us to hear the commentary.Otherwise the tour was interesting and you get to see all the major placesThe tour would have been nice if the kids weren't on it

Peaceful. Took the usual boat tour down the Seine. However there was a peacefullness on the river. People sitting by the Seine enjoying friends or a meal but with no fussyness. If you have the opportunity, take at least one hour, buy yourself some refreshments and take a seat by the river and you will understand what I mean.
A calming influence in the city. The down time is quality walking along the quai des tuileries to the champs elysees. We used a whole day to just do nothing and walk by all the gardens and fountains.

See the City at Night by Boat. Don't miss time on the river Seine. I great way to see the sights of the city while relaxing with a drink. I wouldn't pay for the river cruise but do see the city from the river vantage point.
Terrific Ride!. I had to take a boat ride on the Seine because I was able to see so much. The architecture of the buildings lining the river is amazing, such beauty to see!

5 Days in Paris. We walked the river on both sides almost every day. We used it a navigation point. If you can find the river Seine you can find your way to where you need to go. The bridge with locks is located by Cathédrale Notre Dame de Paris. We missed the trees bluming by a week there lots of buds on the trees. There are side walks at the river level and above the river. There a many sites to see along the river. It is worth the time to walk the river from Cathédrale Notre Dame de Paris to Eiffel Tower.
Nice walk. Forget the boat rides and grab some lunch and sit on the edge of the river. It is romantic and many times locals are just drinking and hanging out!

Scenes of Love. We visited Paris in a time when the weather was just perfect. It wasn't too hot or too cold. The Seine River was one of the top Paris attractions to visit. We purchased a Paris Pass and this allowed us discounted admission on several attractions. The Seine River cruise is so marvelous. The departure area for the cruise is very simple to find, at least ours was. I don't know if there are other departure points, but ours way right across from the Eiffel Tower. Boarding the boat was done really quickly and efficiently and the staff was great. The Seine River is great because along its banks are some of the great Paris attractions and monuments like Notre Dame. While cruising and people watching you can see the people put on a kissing show for the cruisers. That was fun. This is a must visit when in Paris!
beautiful morning and evening. lovely to stroll along and crossed by the most lovely and interesting bridges a breath of fresh air running through the city
Nice River. You must take a river cruise on the seine it take about 45 min to an hour but you get to see a lot of paris monuments at night with the lights it is even more breathtaking

Walk along and breath in!. River Seine is your personal Paris tourguide as it flows along all the major attractions and history of the city. It has many beautiful bridges like the New Bridge with Love-Locks and Alexander Bridge. Make sure to take a boat ride to get away from tourist crowds and soak in the atmosphere from another perspective!

Wonderful sight. Amazing river views spreading down a vast part of Paris. Well worth doing for photo opportunities. When walking along river sides to attractions be mindful of the gold ring scam where someone picks a ring up and asks if it's yours shows you the hall mark then gives you it despite your answer and attempts to keep going and tries to charge you varying amounts of euros.

Wonderful Paris cruise. Boarded the MV Botticelli and enjoyed every single minute of it.The crew and staff were superb and the food was amazing,although you don't get a choice of menu it never failed to deliver well presented,hot and with a French flavour.Gala night was great too We were blessed with wonderful weather so were able to take advantage of the sun deck and being moored so close to the Eiffel tower a great view.I would not hesitate to recommend this cruise
Relaxing cruise. Although it only lasted an hour, the cruise along the Seine was worth it. You get a feel for Parisian life on the river and a different view of some of the loveliest sites in Paris.
Cruise on Seine. The fantastic cruise we had and enjoyed every moment of it. View of the Paris and attraction on the way is breth taking. If you visit Paris make sure you take this Cruise

Music at night, beside Notre Dame. Myself & my partner came to Paris for a romantic holiday, and we found a wonderful spot at night during the summer, of this man playing music by the stairs down to the seine bank, beside the Notre Dame. It was really romantic, very chilled out with a nice cold beer. He would get at least 30 people down sitting down listening to him. Definitely look out for him if you're around the area.

A must for anyone visiting Paris!. We walked along here from the Saint Germain des pres area to the Eiffel tower, at first on the street level which nice as they are lots of market stalls lining the river selling vintage magazines, prints and other souvenirs. We then walked along at the lower river level which was really lovely and a great way to take in Paris as the Eiffel tower gradually comes closer and closer. The paths become wider and busier as you approach the tower with some eateries, little play parks and lots of people cycling, roller skating, jogging and walking hand in hand with their love ones. This is a real must for anyone visiting Paris and highly recommend it.
river boats. take one of the river cruises, you will not regret it! the view of the city from the seine is incredibly different than from street level!
Very enjoyable cruise. We had a 1 hour cruise from The Eiffel Tower down towards Notre Dame. The buildings and bridges are beautiful. We were very pleased that we did it.

Lovely in the Sunshine!. Lovely for a stroll along the bancks with the many traders selling Art and memontoes of this lovely city. Some of the Architecture is just stunning. Grap a cruse for an hour down the river for little more than £10 and see the wonderful bridges from a new angle.

Big. The river itself is much the same as most other rivers in heavily populated commercial areas. The buildings along the bank are mostly old and usually come with an interesting history. 1 hour boat cruises are available for about 15 euro's

River Boat Cruise. This is a must, don't skip out on the River Boat Cruise. They explain everything you go by and a great time to take pictures. I suggest taking this cruise early in your trip as it gives you an idea of sites you may want to see.

Picturesque. Runs near to the Notre dame Catherdral and it gives you a chance to get some beautiful pictures, especially at night when it is all lit up.
Amazing
Boat trip. Went with friends in January, good way of seeing Paris & the various attractions. Make sure you wear something really warm as can be cold breezy but most enjoyable boat trip.
peaceful. have a little stroll along the Seine from the Eiffel tower - excellent views, especially on a sunny day - so romantic!
Beautiful Seine. A must-visit in Paris. I can spend the whole day just walking along the banks of the Seine. Had fun time at the love bridge. Would love to go back to experience the river cruise.

Get the Batobus to fully enjoy the river!. The Batobus pass means for a full day or more you can go up and down the river Seine as you please, stopping at all the major sites. Would recommend as its a great way to see the river and its sites.
Boat trip. Lovely boat trip bit windy & cold but a good way to spend a hour getting to see each part of the city
Romantic. I liked it looks like walking in museum of art because of what you see on the both sides of the river.
Lovely evening cruise!. What a beautiful way to see another side of Paris. An evening on the Seine river. I was able to get some fantastic photos! Great experience!

Walking along is a great program in Paris. The river Seine is in my opinion great to walk on the paths along its sides, especially close to the Boulevard Saint Michel and Notre-Dame area.When the vendors of old books are placing their stands it seems like coming out of a post card.The trips with the famous boats that cross the river, although quite touristic, its impossible to avoid once in life. I have done it many years ago, so I don´t feel the need anymore. Walking during a nice sunny day, even if a bit cold, like are the temperatures in March, is still a greta program. The views are unforgettable.

A gray river. We went there for a boat ride. It was just ok tour. It was a raining day plus we went to most of the famous locations already. We just felt sleepy ..... We went to Tokyo.s boat that was passing several bridges just like this one before. So I think Tokyo one was better and more fun. I was surprised that seine river is so muddy and gray. This is not a very romantic river,The most interesting part was the bridge had tons of locks. Amazing.,

nice boat trips. I took a boat trip on the Seine, this is a really nice way to see the city from another angle. I would strongly suggest the trips with the major companies (they are all mostly the same with prices of 12-15 euro for 1-1,5 hour trips),

An essential part of a trip to Paris. The river is beautiful, especially at night. We ate at bistros nearby, did a little walking and took a cruise. It is so charming here and an essential part of any trip to Paris!
Fall in Love All Over Again!. There is nothing more romantic than this. Dinner on the Seine River in Paris. Be sure to make reservations.

Strolling along the river. The banks of the Seine, dotted with bookstalls, tables of trinkets, art work of various quality, and people of every nationality, race, and heritage is like walking in time immemorial. Start anywhere, walk as far as you like, stop in a sidewalk café, and sitting near you, sketching on a pad, may be the next Degas or Dali!
Relaxing Boat Ride. Took the river cruise in the late afternoon. You get to see all of the bridges and their glory. Lots of good information on the audio. If you have time on your trip do this!

Night Tour. We had walked all that we could but to squeeze in a little more, we took the night boat tour on the Seine and enjoyed it. It had been raining a lot so the river was muddy but it was relaxing and saw and learned new things. Going in November, it isn't like summer since there were few vendors along the banks but it is still a very romantic walk even during the day. Watch out for the pick pockets and scammers along here. I was approached by a woman with the "gold ring" scam. Nonetheless, it still is the Seine, enjoy it's splendor.
loved. Loved the stroll along the river , especially the bridges with napoleons emblam , nice and clean now , they have really cleaned it yp , reccommended .
ABBA Our last Summer. Listen to the song then walk hand in hand with the one you love along the Siene and you will tick it off your to do list before you die but be warned your not the only one.
another must do. the river trip is worthwhile and a must do, depending on which lines, its about two hours. Three languages spoken

Boat Tour. We decided on a bus and boat tour around the city to give our feet a little rest. We caught the boat from the foot of the Eiffel tower and enjoyed an hour long trip. The ride was very romantic and gave us different views of the Seine and the various buildings that line it.

Nice open air shops along the seine. The river is a good gauge of where you're going and which direction you're going if you get lost. I also love the open air shops where I've bought a couple of cute posters. Be weary of the restaurants lining the area. Total tourist trap, especially the ones that have neon signs that say "pizza" or "hamburger" or anything of that sort. If you're into that go for it; the view and the people watching is amazing.

cruise combined with Paris pass. went along for the cruise and it was lovely sitting there and watching the bridges pass by. We went under 22 bridges and saw many of the sights of Paris from the Seine.
river seine boats. we took the boat circuit in cold, drippy weather. nice views of paris architecture. do the trip with sunshine, or warm night and it is a good ride.

Hop on and off. If your not up to walking all of Paris, you can take a boat ride for a small fee, almost like a bus on the water. They make several stops and you can get on and off as many times you like, from Notre Dame all the way to the Eiffel Tower. Ticket is good all day, for multiple uses. Just make sure you ask before you purchase your ticket so you know you can hop on and off. There were many boats to take in the beautiful Siene River, even dinner cruises are available, so you can choose how you want to see it.
A must do!. It's a good way to get a broad view of the city, as you pass the differently styled bridges and the major sites that are just along the river. It was fun (though cold)!

BE VIGILANT!!!!!. We are both Londoners so not strangers to a city but on 2 occasions, both by the riverside we were stopped by gypsy women who we're trying to pull a scam. One had a child, one was dressed a one of the many runners along the Seine.They come up behind you and pretend they find a ring by your feet, ask if it is yours and then offer it to you. The idea is if you take it they ask for money. The rings look authentic but they are worthless. My advice would be do not even gage in conversation, just ignore and walk on by!But be careful as this is clearly an organised scam and you never know who might be watching.
A good trip on Seine. We had a Red bus tour tickets and this included the River Seine Cruise which was a really nice relaxing way to see most of the sights of Paris.
It's a must cruise!. Fantastic cruise on river Siene,suggest you do it before the sun set,so you will get to see the best of both worlds!!
Go Take a River Cruise. Took a sunset river cruise down the Seine and saw all of the main sights in Paris. There are also areas that you can walk down next to the river. Definitely go!

Beware of the "I've found this ring" scam.. I walked from Place de La Concorde to Notre Dame and was disappointed there wasn't more going on. I think I'm yet to find the best bit of the river. I also got scammed by a very convincing woman who appeared to pick up a ring in front of me, ask me if it was mine, give it to me for luck and then ask for money to feed her child. I'm so cross that I fell for the scam as I've travelled widely and have always been on my guard. I opened my purse to give her 10 Euros. She asked for more and before I knew what was happening, grabbed a further 40 from my hand. She then hugged me and thanked me before walking off. Grrr!

Great views along the Seine. A quick and easy way to see a lot of the major attractions in Paris and to get your bearings. There are several tour operators offering boat trips and a hop on hop off round trip round the major attractions.

A beautiful walk and it's Paris!. I can't imagine Paris without walking along the Seine. We chose Sunday when all the residents were out enjoying a sunny day, as well as tourists. It was so interesting to see how the French enjoy their city!

Not Great At Night. Me and my fiancé went on the 1 hour seine river cruise with optional aperitif last week in Paris. We went on the final boat tour of the evening about 8.15pm. We were really looking forward to this as we kow Paris is the 'city of lights' and were hoping to see some great attractions. Apart from the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame I cannot recall any other sights that stood out. It was too dark to see anything and the 'commentary' was so quiet I couldn't hear a thing! The best part of the trip was the free glass of champagne! Would go during the day and with a different company next time.
River Tour. River Tour was well organised. Can't really say anymore just a tour that stopped at various locations, would have helped if there was more of a guide on board.

ms Botticelli. My wife and I went with friends to spend Valentines in Paris. Travelled by Eurostar and Metro and had no problem. Arrived at boat and very pleased with appearance and decor.  Problem for us was the food, only choice was take it or leave it and though presented well it was not all to our taste. As there is no choice of menu there is not much you can do about it. On third day we took ill, severe diarrhoea and sickness. Spent rest of day and night in bed then had to hope for the best for journey home. It is now ten days later and still ill. Doctor visited today with lab results. Campylobacter ( food poisoning ). Certainly a Valentines trip to remember

Well worth a boat trip on the Seine. We took a round trip on a boat on the river Seine which was included in our two day Parisian hop on hop off bus tour. The trip commenced and concluded at the Eiffel Tower for us. We went in winter and started by sitting out the back of the boat. However by about the midway point we got too cold and it was great to be able to go into the heated part of the boat to finish the tour.

Great boat ride.. Took the evening boat ride along the Seine. It appears so different at night and so beautiful. The guide was very knowledgeable and shared it. Well worth the money to see. Wish I had taken the day ride also to see the difference. This was my 3rd visit to Paris, but first boat ride.
Boat Trip. Good trip along the River.Not Batbus, would recommend you do an actual Tour Boat. If the River is High, this will affect what a Tour Boat does.

Not sure how one can review a river, but this one is great!. As I say, it seems odd to review a river as a whole, but as this runs through the heart of Paris it's worth appreciating. A river tour can really help you get your bearings in the city and is a good way to start your trip to Paris. Walking along the promenades on the sides of the river is another way to appreciate the city on a sumny day.

River Cruise. Excellent value for money - an hour's trip embarking at the Eiffel Tower. It was lovely to see many famous landmarks from a different perspective. Informative tour (in English as well as French).

Certianly not for swimming lol. The colour of the water is not the nicest you will ever see - think on a tummy bug & what can be passed ;)The hop on hop off river boats are a great way to see Paris & are handy to the major attractions - its also a nice change from sitting in traffic jams.They arrive every 25mins approx from 10am to 7pm.Book the 2day ticket as it is only an extra few euros Clean & comfy

A trip through french culture and history. What ever you do, dont miss a tour down the Seine. This is the center of the French history, their culture . If you can only stay in Paris for a short time, head down to the Seine --lots of restaurants nearby, near the Louve, Notre Dame as well as many parks, neighborhoods and those lovely bridges

Bateau Mouche. This was the first thing we did to get a feel for the city and where things were. It gives a different perspective from walking and you get to see some interesting architecture and statues on the bridges. It is easy to find and gets everyone in the mood. The cost was reasonable and we felt it gave us a clear starting point that wasn't too taxing after a the journey to France.
Batobus is fab. Get a Batobus pass to hop on and off. It's the best way to travel in Paris.Also the open top hop on hop off buses are included.

Le Calife. Want to do a dinner cruise. Do Not go past Le Calife. A smaller boat, but absolutely fabulous food and fabulous tour of the Seine. Don;t go the bigger boats, do this one for sure. Leaves from near the Louvre

Lock Bridge was a hit. Grandaughter knew all about this. I had no idea what she was talking about. We purchase a lock from a street vendor, wrote her name, locked it to the bridge along with millions of others and she threw the keys in the Sienne

love you Seine. Paris has too much to see, even 5 days you have to skip lots of stuff to see, but I decide last thing I want to do is to take an evening boat tour of Seine river. We have been walking around the Seine river many many times over, it is most beautiful river I have ever seen. Specially the bridges, all kinds of bridges with different shapes, I enjoyed them so much. After missing 6:30PM boat, finally I boarded 8:00PM tour and it was fantastic tour, the wind was clam, the banks on both sides of river fill with bright lights, you can see Notre Dame, Louvre Museum and Eiffel Tower, first time to go under the bridges and hear the river flowing and singing, you can feel the heartbeat of Seine! You can smell of Seine! I almost felt that my Valentines that evening was Seine river, was Eiffel Tower, was Paris!

Must-take ride. It costs around 15 euro to take a ride on one of the boats. We took our next to the Eiffel tower, it is a nice experience because you see the city from another perspective and also the most famous attractions.

Just lovely. What more can you say?. I recently had a whopping 8 hour layover at CDG on my way back to the States, so I decided to make the most of my midday break. I stored my luggage with Bagages du Monde in Terminal 2, hopped on the train, and headed into town. This was a definite whirlwind day, with me attempting to maximize the big sites, seeing as it was my only time in Paris thus far.I got off the metro, stepped out, and boom! I was right in front of the Eiffel Tower. How cool! Look, I'm a heavy traveler and while I'm generally sort of meh on big touristy sites. . . c'mon, it's the Eiffel Tower! And it was right there!I walked along the Seine for a while. I'd stop, take in the view, take some photos, then slowly walk on. I eventually crossed the river at Pont d'iena in front of the Eiffel Tower, then walked down the river before eventually wandering down various streets and making my way to the Arc de Triomphe. It really was a lovely way to spend an afternoon and I highly, highly suggest it.Also, I was a single female and felt perfectly safe the entire time. Yes, there are panhandlers and scammers-- just tell them no, ignore them, whatever. Several that came up to me led with, "Do you speak English?" to which I said, "Absolutely not." I walked off as they sat bewildered. A firm no and a glaring b-face will get you far in world travels, let me tell you.

highlight of trip. We loved our narrated tour of the Seine. It was nice to sit on our boat and look at the architecture of the amazing city. It was amazing to see the whole city from a different percpective.

Croisiere Bateaux Parisiens (river tour). Boarded boat at Port de la Bourdonnais for a narrated tour in late afternoon on the Seine. Just right. Skip the ones with overpriced meals and enjoy the historic information on this one.

Wonderful; In Paris And Beyond. The Seine means "snake" and it is so named because is loops and winds its whole length. In Paris this isn't so pronounced, but I'll get to the snake-aspect later. My wife and I spent one day just walking along the Seine through Paris, crossing EVERY bridge. The Seine gives you open spaces to see more sights, so each bridge is a fresh viewpoint. And some of the bridges themselves are worthy of seeing. Take a boat ride down the Seine. Each lunch facing the Seine. Walk along the Seine. Really, this is a nice way to spend the day AND get a little exercise. Now...take a boat cruise down the Seine from Paris on one of the river cruise lines. Those boats are long and narrow and hold maybe 140 people BUT the cool thing is that you see the river all the way to Rouen AND make stops at many super little towns along the way. Old towns, old streets, old buildings, old castles. And from Rouen you can take a day-trip to the beaches of Normandy. The Seine is a wonderful river to enjoy.

Seine the joy oh Paris. Travel through the river was treat to watch and surrounding is scenic, You can see this for whole day and will not get tired of it. You can see all the monuments of city through this journey.

Best night of my life!. We booked a dinner cruise on the Seine and I felt that this was one of the best things I have ever done! The cruise itself was spectacular but everything about the experience was superb! The service , food , ambience was simply stunning! An unforgettable night!

River çruise at night. Trip to varies would be incomplete without a night river cruise.River cruise takes you around the city and you get opportunity to see Eiffel tower and other attractions of Paris - illuminated. View of Eiffel tower during night is magnificent and unforgettable. A must cruise during night. If you can afford some more money, then enjoy dinner and drink during cruise.

Les Vedettes du Pont-Neuf, River tour cruise. This is a must when in Paris, You cruise for about an hour but you ride in comfort on a big boat, you can take lots of photos of many attractions. Beautiful views of the Eiffel Tower, Orsay Museum and the Bridges are exquisite. Loved the Love Lock Bridge.
Amazing. We didn't actually plan to do the cruise but were too early for our appointment so killed some time with a cruise. What a delight! We thoroughly enjoyed the experience.
great walk. This was also located not far from our hotel, the beauty of where it is, helps you to stay on track and helps you to follw a path so your in the main area of Paris.

Lock Bridge. We went to the lock bridge to put our padlock on. Was just lovely. I could have stayed for hours reading all the locks. We had been to a little tourist shop nearby who engraved a lock for us, very cheap as well. And somehow we managed to find a space on the fence. Really just such a romantic experience, it was the 1 thing i wanted to do while in paris and it lived up to all my expectations.

Cruising the Seine River… in January?. I almost decided to do a river cruise as an afterthought as it was one of the few “must-dos” I missed when I first visited Paris in 2008. Although I believe there are numerous companies to choose from I was practical and embarked on a voyage with Les Vedettes du Pont-Neuf, located on the northern edge of Ile de la Cite near, you guessed it, Pont Neuf bridge. The company has a website that you can pre-order tickets on and accepts walk-ins as well. The dock for departure is easily accessible and contains a small shop and bar/eatery that you can hang out at before or after the cruise. Customer service was smooth and efficient during all phases of the experience: ticket purchase, boarding, and exiting. In addition to bilingual dialogue during the cruise they also have a free pamphlet in English that you can use to follow along.I assume the itinerary for most of these experiences is fairly standard. We started with a river view of the Louvre, progressing along the northern shore of the Seine while viewing the Tuileries garden and various bridges. Dialogue was piped in along the way, with a long pause as we neared the Eiffel Tower, everyone took their pictures, and we turned around. The south side of the river was our friend on the way back as we passed the National Assembly, Musee d’Orsay, and Notre Dame cathedral. After rounding the islands we ended up at our starting point sixty minutes later.The cruise was decent enough, but the major problem I had with the experience certainly wasn’t with the company I chose but rather the time of season. If you are ever wondering what turning in to an ice cube feels like then try to stay out on the deck in 30 degree temps while taking pictures of the shore…. And I’m from Minnesota! The wind was a killer here more than anything and really put brakes on what is probably a decent experience at most other times of the year. There are many advantages to visiting Paris in the off-season: less people, less expense, and therefore less hassle among them. Unfortunately, a relaxing cruise on the Seine River is something that is probably best left to the shoulder season or for those early risers in the peak months. Les Vedettes du Pont-Neuf is the company to use if you’re so inclined.

Beware of scams on the river!. Visited Paris for a month and spent many hours walking along the river to get from venue to venue. One our first day we were approached with what we came to know as "the ring scam". Someone walking towards you appears to pick up a ring off the ground...they ask if its yours...if you say it isn't yours, they try to give you a reason to take it anyway. "Its against my religion to wear rings. Why don't you take it?" "I'm already married...why don't you give it to your girlfriend" "Its good luck if I give it away" Anyway, you'll take it and they'll walk off. 3 seconds later they come back, suggesting that you give them a couple euros...after all, didn't they just give you a gold ring?Don't fall for this scam and be on the lookout for the guys trying to pull it!

Wonderful. I loved all the promenades and other walking areas they have built around the river. It's lovely to walk along with the river, I would also recommend taking a trip on bateaux boat or other such boats which give you a trip along the river and providing a view of several landmarks of the city.
Cruise is a must. If you're in Paris a Seine cruise with a camera handy is a must - do. Try and do the longest stretch you can.
Brilliant. Regular river taxis take you cheaply to or near most of the sites and you can be extravagant and have a meal and guided tour as well.
Touch of French. Its nice that you can see this river from anywhere in Paris. The bridges over it adds to its beauty by looking so elegant

Gotta take a river tour. This is a very relaxing tour to take. You see quite a lot of touristy stuff. The narration of what you are passing is quite interesting. This is a must do when you are in Paris.

Great way to spend an hour. Unless you have good feet and don't mind walking for hours, the river cruise is a fantastic way to see the city, (especially in the cold months) several companies offer deals and can be had on the net In advance . We had a deal with Cityrama which include cruise, bus and show for 120 euros, which for 6 hrs was great value.

Walk the Banks and Take a cruise. Today I was a tourist. I had already walked the banks, the quais, the book stalls. The Seine cruise was worth the time and cost for me. I took the cruise at dusk as the sun set and the City of Light sparkled.
Beautiful. Walk along the river in daytime and again at night- it changes with the lights. It is a nice area to walk along it. Quite breathtaking!

Nice trip around Paris on the Seine. Had a nice boat trip in late afternoon in early November last year. It was quiet and relaxing and there was much to see. I am attaching some photos to illustrate the sights. Highly recommended.

Overview of Paris in 1.5 hr. We had purchased the Paris City Passport (recommended if travelling on your own) and the river cruise was a part of it. We had a nice cruise on the deck of the boat in the evening. You can see most of the tourist places. Its a cool idea to have a river cruise in the evening.
Beautiful. River cruise in the evening is a must -- most beautiful views, romantic atmosphere, slow and tranquil. A unique Parisian experience.

City of lights cruise. I would advise anyone who is interested in this cruise to go in the evening. Its really very pretty and scenic. It takes about an hour somebody takes a photo of you or group of you which you can buy at the end. The one thing which was a bit of a disappointment was the commentary. There is a ear phone thing at your seat from which you choose the language you want to hear the commentary, but mine kept on switching to some other language or turning off - i noticed a few other people also said the same. after 10 min i gave up and just admired the view. I am a wheelchair user and had no problem getting on or off BUT alot of problems getting down to ticket office from street level. As i can walk a little i slowly walked down but my husband had to carry the wheelchair down somebody helped him otherwise quiet a few steps down and back up!

Calife dinner cruise. We had a fabulous cruise down the Seine taking in the sights and enjoying a delicious three course meal with champagne. We chose the 67 Euro menu and the final bill with a bottle of wine and coffees was 85 Euro per head. Great service too. The timing of getting to the Eiffel Tower just as the sparkling lights came on was an added bonus. Definitely recommend.
Overrated. Walked along the Seine a couple a times in different areas... the bridges feel kind of similar to each other and the river seems shallow and brownish
Sunset cruise. Had a lovely sunset cruise on the seine, enjoyed watching all the people dance and picnicking next to the seine. Sunset cruise with a bit of champagne was truly romantic. We loved it.

Batobus, a great choice. Seeing Paris from the river is a great experience. Batobus service costs only 8 euros and the visitor may hop on and off in 8 different places, including Tour Eiffel, Musée D'Orsay, Notredame, Louvre and Hotel de Ville.
la Seine by boat. beautiful river enjoy it at day from land and don't hesitate to take a tour in the Parisian boat called Bateaux Mouches at night

Boat. To fully appreciate the Seine, take a night time boat ride. You will see the "City of Lights" at its best.
Side on the top level and enjoy.

Worth the ride. The river in itself holds nothing special, but the view from the bridge is what makes this a special treat. Don't confuse this with a hop on hop off service and just enjoy the ride (especially in the evening) and you my dear traveler will fall deeper in love with Paris.

Lovely for a stroll. Went on a couple of boat trips on the Seine, both at night. Absolutely stunning scenery from the boat. Also spent many hours strolling along the edge and just sitting watching the boats go by.

Paris landmark. Walking along the river and over the many bridges is a must while in Paris. It is beautiful regardless of the time of day or the weather. My favourite time to visit the Seine was of an evening, standing on any of the beautiful bridges and admiring Paris in her evening glory. We took both a day and night cruise on the river and saw the major sights in different lights.

Take a boat ride!. Many of the most famous landmarks in Paris are visible from the seine if you take the cruise. It's probably an hour long. Lots to see; even wah bridge has it's own story. We love Paris

Rating a river seems odd, but.... This trip, and the one before it, we really got into watching the Seine. We noticed that other people were doing the same thing. It had been raining, and the Seine was not its usual green color, it was high, choppy and muddy on our first walk, near Quai D'Orsay. Lots of others out walking, many people taking pictures, we admired many kinds of boats.A few days later, on our last day in Paris, we decided to start on the Left Bank, east of Pont Neuf and just walk. Few people were there - there was a place where the Seine was close enough to touch if you were careful, so one of us did that (there's something really fun and mysterious about touching famous bodies of water - people come from all over just to see or touch the Pacific Ocean; we feel that way about the Seine). As we walked, we saw new perspectives on Notre Dame - but particularly on the bridges. The one bridge with the old style mortar made of pebbles was fascinating. Since there were few others there (young kids drinking beer, quite friendly and polite as we passed), we could almost imagine ourselves in another Paris, where boats still tied up to those iron rings and where those old doors opened and boatmen came out...it was quiet and lovely.But seriously, what else could the River Seine receive...except 5 stars? (It's also fun to cruise upon it and all that...when bored in Paris head toward it; when you see a bridge over it, cross it!)

quiet time for romance. perfect for a midday walk in gray weather, fun to view the city bring in sand and create a beach along the river to satisfy the desires of summer sunbathers. Take a ride on the Batons Mouche to see the river-side sights

December on the Seine to Normandy Beaches. After previous land tours to German and Austrian Christmas markets (Christkindlmarkt) we decided to see some French Christmas markets and visit the Normandy D-Day landing beaches of June 6, 1944. Had been to the American Cemetery and Memorial at Omaha Beach during a bus tour of French chateau country in 2010 so this time we chose the Canadian Commonwealth Battlefields excursion to Juno Beach offered by Viking River Cruises. Our cruise started at the Paris Quai de Grenelle side of the Seine River within view to the Eiffel Tower. For the Christmas season the Tower sparkled with thousands of pulsing lights on every hour during the evening. Close to our ship dock was a Novotel Hotel where some people had stayed before embarkation. They found it modern, convenient to the Metro and a short walk over to the River Spirit. Also close by is the new (fall 2013) indoor Beaugrenelle shopping mall which includes high-end fashion stores, a Fnac audio-video outlet and even a Marks & Spencer offering British food specialties. Prior to leaving Paris, cruise passengers had a city tour by bus and an excursion thru the Metro to the Christmas Village (Village de Noel) of small white outdoor ‘cabins’ along both sides of the Champs Elysees. Nowhere near the quality of German Christmas Markets but the lights at night were wonderful. We were in Cabin 321 on the River Spirit and cruised to Conflans, Vernon, the white cliffs of Les Andelys then Rouen (historic Joan of Arc sites and a small Christmas market) stopping along the way west to dock overnight and take included walking tours. Mornings were misty but the sun arrived for the afternoons. Instead of standing up on deck to see the lock passages, the in-cabin TV had a channel with live cam transmission of the process as well as each site where we docked. The cabin was small but functional with a sliding outside ‘picture’ window (not the balconies of larger river cruise ships) and a bathroom with shower stall and curtain (again, not the glass enclosure of larger ships). At Conflans we boarded buses to Auvers-sur-Oise for an included excursion to artist Vincent van Gogh’s 1890 room and landscape inspirations. Unfortunately the bus for Group 2C had been left outside overnight and the windows on the left side were covered with opaque white frost. As we were being driven, our local guide Anne-Claire kept pointing out what we could see to our left only to be told time and again that nobody could see out of those windows. When we arrived at our destination she claimed it was impossible for our driver, Patrick, to clear the windows because he could not reach that high! Viking’s Program Director Annika was able to enlighten Anne-Claire and Patrick about the use of long-handle window cleaning equipment because when we returned to the bus the windows had been scraped clear of frost and polished.Food on board the River Spirit was excellent with a buffet breakfast that included North American staples – cereals, eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, plus fresh croissants, smoked salmon, soft Normandy cheeses, yogurt and fruit. Lunch on board was served either in the dining room or, a lighter version, in the forward lounge. Dinner was served at 7:00 PM and included a choice of appetizers, main courses and desserts plus the option of selecting from a list of “American Favorites”. Wines and beers were available along with non-alcoholic beverages. We enjoyed the optional oysters and champagne tasting (39 Euro each) although the Champagne Cartier Brut was not that dry and did not retain its bubbles in the glass. Oysters are a French holiday favorite and the how-to-open-oysters demonstration by ship culinary staff was both informative and humorous. A good time was had by all (except the oysters).Before dinner was the Cocktail Hour then the daily Port Talk about the next day’s itinerary and, after dinner, entertainment back in the Lounge with music by ‘Blondie’ at the piano and presentations on topics such as Painters and the Seine, French Lessons, French Cheeses and, Christmas Carols. On December 12th three buses took passengers from Rouen on a day trip to the American or Canadian WWII beaches. Since we had already been to Omaha Beach on a previous tour, we opted for the Juno Beach tour with only 23 people. It included a stop in Bayeux with its cathedral and museum to see the 11th century tapestry, actually embroidered linen 230-feet/7- meters long depicting the Norman conquest of England. We passed the British War Cemetery outside Bayeux then joined the two Omaha groups for lunch at the 6 juin Restaurant at Les Arromanches harbour on the Normandy coast. Next we went to Juno Beach Information Centre (be sure to make time to walk down to the actual beach), the Pegasus Bridge and Museum at Ranville (check out the movie The Longest Day), the isolated Canadian War Cemetery in the middle of farm fields at Bény-sur-Mer then Australian/New Zealand military graves nestled near a country church at Saint-Désir. A full day and we got back to the River Spirit docked at Rouen well after dark but in time for dinner.On our return to Paris some passengers took optional excursions to Versailles or the Louvre but, having visited them many times before, we stayed on board and stood on the top deck of the ship as it cruised under Seine bridges and along suburbs and industrial yards. Eventually we had to go below as the older bridges were very low but, in the evening as we approached the Pont de Grenelle and our dock again, the captain stopped in front of the lighted 37-foot/11- meter replica of the Statue of Liberty on the manmade Île aux Cygnes (Swans Island) so passengers could take photos of Lady Liberty. Overall, a great cruise. One of the best we have taken. Highly recommended.

Paris (Seen) By the River--Wonderful!. Walking along the Seine (possibly on a Sunday, when the streets along the river bank are closed for traffic) is a wonderful experience--vistas from the various bridges may be picture-postcard type, but who cares?

Been coming here this is our Third time!!!!!!!. Love, love, love walking along the Seine. Sooo beautiful, and relaxing. We have done a river cruise read our reviews and it is wonderful especially at dinner time! So much action along the seine! At nite people out and about singing and dancing. People having wine and cheese enjoying the ambience! Walking at sunset towards the Eiffle tower just took our breath away. So much too see and along the way you can sit on park benches and take all the sites in. Walking along the river front you can see all the house boats. The people are so friendly too! We walked late at nite, and never felt threatened. Come and see beautiful Paris. It will take your breath away!

Paris on the cheap. And scenic. And romantic.. The Seine is a beautiful place to eat at, view sights from or walk along on by yourself or your significant other. Skip the cruises, which are generally run by trite guides, who believe that all tourists to Paris go for is a sighting of the Eiffel Tower.
i Love This Water Way. You can cruise it, you can walk it, you can run it, or you can just sit near it and watch the people and boats pass by.

Nice river walk. Liked the nice wide pavements.The mesh barriers on the bridges are covered with personalised padlocks.
First time come across con people pretending to find a ring you have just dropped.

Great way to see one of the most beautiful corridors of Paris. The river cruise takes you along one of the most beautiful areas on one of the most beautiful cities in the world. If you take the cruise Ina sunny day you will have a experience that will stick with you forever.
Beautiful Walkways. on a fine day there is nothing better than walking along the river seine and taking in the sites. especially near the island where Notre dame is situated

Beautiful, fast, and majestic. There are many places to stroll by the river. In winter, it's cold but still pleasant. The river runs very fast. There are many boats with tourists that pass by. Very romantic and relaxing to be by the river. One slight disappointment is the strong odor of urine in many places by the river banks.

Scenic view to enjoy the sights. A tremendous way to stroll and enjoy historic and local sights. We actually enjoyed a dinner cruise that went up & down the river. It passed all the beautiful buildings and landmarks. I was amazed with all the great looking and well maintained building along the river. A romantic destination for all.

Lovely place for a walk. The pathways along the river are a lovely place for a stroll. The scenery is nice and there are often artists and other entrepreneurs. One word of warning - the spots under the bridges are often used as public urinals, so avoid stepping in any puddles and don't be alarmed when you smell the stench of urine.

Must-See(ine). Taking a stroll along the Seine is recommended for anyone visiting Paris (whether on your own or with your significant other or family). The river connects many attractions in the city and its banks boast with stalls selling "oldities" (old magazines, HQs, photos and all). Although bateau-mouche trips are offered, my personal suggestion is give your legs some exercise and walk your way along the river and let yourself be amazed by what Paris has to offer.

Beautiful. No better background for a romantic photo than the river seine and all its beauty around it. It is near to a lot of restaurants so its great to have a romantic lunch nearby before taking a slow cruise down the river!

Romantic and very "Parisienne". The Seine is a very nice place to have a pic nic on spring or summer, the riverbank are very romantic for lovers. A nice cruise is to make with the company "les bateaux mouche" you can see a lot of monuments from Paris, sittting in the boat on the River Seine ! so cute !
Lovely. I went on a boat tour down the river and it was well worth it, lovely and relaxing, and beautiful scenery

Best seen at night 'Romantic'. The river seine is one of the most romantic rivers in the world. It is..in my oppinion best seen at night. Ths lights along the river from the landmarks are simply stunning. Certainly one of thd best places to propose in my oppinion...and no its not a cliche !!!! The river is stunning. I recently did an evening river cruise with my wife and it was breath taking.
Walk every afternoon ,you will find something new.. If you have time,if you want rslaxation with walking and watching, if you are sad or tried or angry ,just walk along side the scene river.

Its a River. The Seine was pretty at night and a helpful reference point when asking for directions, but at the end of the day it is just a river. A river in a famous city, yes, but still a river, its not made of jade or anything. I didn't take a boat tour, it was fairly freezing when I was in Paris, so maybe that would have changed my mind. It doesn't really matter what any of these reviews say anyway because if you are touring Paris you will see the Seine, whether you like it or not. It just depends on if you want to pause and absorb its splendor or walk parallel to it while sightseeing and give it little more than a mental, "Yep, thats the Seine".
Nice. River Seine is really amazing with its beautiful bridges and river rides. It is also nice for a stroll.
Romantic. Took some gorgeous pictures at Sunset. Nice for a stroll. Didn't get chance to go on a cruise but I would have liked that.
Take photo. There are some bridges that attach the sides on the top of the Seine River. You must take photos when you are at the bridge with the view of this River.

Beautiful at night. I highly recommend the boat tour at night. There are headphones so you have a recording of what you are seeing and the history of the bridges you are going under, but seeing the city from the river lit up at night was spectacular.

Get a bike and wait until sunset. I hadnt been on a bike for ages and I really dont do excercise but my husband and I rode along the river at sunset and it was the most amazing feeling. We locked out padlock on lock bridge and rode around without a care in the word. There were people with picnics on cheese and wine just sat watching the worls go by. Lovers kids, children played and adults partied... What a place

A Real Sense of Timelessness. It was a chilly, windy Christmas Day, but the sun broke through and the river views were splendid! I felt like I could have been standing there at any point in history. There is so much architecture to view along the river, and of course the lock bridge was quite stunning. One has to wonder how much weight is added to the bridge from all those solid padlocks!
gotta walk it. It is romantic and historic. Loved seeing the views both walking the banks of the river, crossing the bridges and taking a boat ride .

River Cruise. Brilliant! Very comfortable, light and roomy river boat. It was a cold day but inside all the glass windows it was lovely and warm and a great way to see different views of famous Parisien landmarks. A bar on board would have been nice though.

Bateaux Mouche a must do in Paris. Its a must do in Paris for tourists, the Bateaux Mouche from Point de l'Alma, it was 12 or 13 euro each and it lasted for 1.15hr, its great for the information given and also for taking photos. there are also other boats that do dinner and cruise.
River Seine. Comfortable boat with excellent views of all the sights along this great river. Excellent commentator on points of interest!

River cruise a must do!. I finally did a river cruise on my 2nd trip into Paris, and it was fun alot of history provided during as well! There are many many boat companies along the River Seine, and it's wide open to which one you want to use; there are some that are just a cruise down the river and then others that offer lunch/dinner as well, both daylight and evening cruises! You sail right next to the Eifell Tower and Notre Dame perfefct picture opporunity as well as the bridge with a mini Staute of Liberty! Fun good times to have for the whole family!
so romantic. walking along the river seine, visit very beautiful bridges and pass famous river and thinking about this romance river through the heart of this crowded city

The Seine. Let's see I counted 32 bridges across the Seine. It is a wonderful way to see Paris both during the day and at night. Whether you choose to walk along the banks or take one of the boat trips.
Awesome. Most of my trip was spent alongside this great waterway. Only sorry I missed the boat, so to speak, not having enough time to take a river tour.

3 stops. Taking the Seine River Tour is a great way to get to see the must see things in one day. We took the tour that took us to the Louvre first, then we had lunch at the Eiffel Tower and on to Notre Dame. Our guide was very informative and you get to bypass all of the lines, and there were many. You also get to see where some of the other sites are so you can get to them easily.
Night cruise is a must!. Best way to see the city at night hands down. If the weather permits, definitely sit outside and enjoy the city of light by river.

Walk, Jog, Boat. We saw the river by all 3 means. The boat trip was very good but with lots of different languages to translate, the explanations were very brief and not always clear. Still, very good value and well worth doing. Walk along the Left Bank for a nice stroll, watch out for joggers and cyclists.

Seine River - What would Paris be without it?. The Seine River cuts through the middle of Paris, separating the Left Bank to the South and the Right Bank to the North. On both sides of the river you can visit important and interesting districts and neighbourhoods, with many world class attractions, museums, churches, gardens and parks. A very good dining and shopping environment can be found on both sides of the river as well. Important islands can also be found in the middle of the Seine, mainly the famous Ile de la Cite, where Notre Dame Cathedral is found. The Seine is crossed by many bridges, several that make interesting stops to make for tourists. Our three favourite are Pont Alexandre III, Pont des Arts and Pont Neuf. In addition to visiting the bridges, it is very much worth walking along the river bank to enjoy the river, city views and the interesting stalls selling souvenirs, books and trinkets to help you remember your time in Paris. You can also take a river cruise or dinner cruise along the Seine if interested in spending time directly on the water. Overall, while not a major attraction of the city, the Seine River is an important part of Paris and it greatly contributes to the make up of this wonderful and beautiful city. Paris wouldn't be the same without the Seine.

Just another River. Many take the river cruse. That is not really necessary. From the many beautiful bridges in Paris you can get a great view and feel for the River Seine. It really is just another river lined by concert and stone in the middle of a busy city. Walking the very wide walks on the river give you the same views and saves you 40 euros or more for your family to use on great food.
River Cruise. Went on this at night. The lights are gorgeous however cannot see architecture of the buildings. Food was great with many different wines and deserts.

Not so much a river as a raging torrent. I love the Seine. It has to be one of the most beautiful rivers flowing through a gorgeous city. It makes Paris, as far as I am concerned. When we visited in December Europe was flooding and the Seine was running almost out of control. Looking at the speed of the water and the way the boats were battling we decided to give a river trip a miss. However, this should be an option to seriously consider under normal circumstances.

Wonderful!. This was my second visit to Paris and I still enjoyed my time as much, if not more, as my first time here. I would suggest talking a river boat tour as it enables you to see the area in a whole new way.
Romantic. walking along the river seine specially at sun set was very good and I loved it. we can visit very beautiful bridges, Eiffel tower, notredame chatedra and ... in this way.

Romantic Stroll. There's nothing like a romantic stroll along the Seine in the dead of winter. No fighting the tourists...just watch out for 10- year old pick pockets that grab and run, especially near the Eiffel Tower.
Good tour. We did a tour of the Seine and it is a good way to see the sights of Paris. Did about an hour cruise and got to see a lot of the sights. A different way to see Paris, from the water.

River Trip - The best mode of transport. Fantastic get on, get off service, allowing you to visit various parts of the city quickly.
Reasonably priced, quick and efficient.
Walking. Walked for about 2 hours, great way to see Paris and find your bearings , crossing the bridges to the different quarters

nice long stretch of pedestrian walkway. you can literary walk for miles along the Seine without the fear of being run over by a car. You can get right up to the edge of the river and watch the many ferries and river cruises that go up and down it. You also get a different perspective of the many bridges across the Seine and can admire the architecture more closely. I liked the wrought rion footbridge in particular.But, in some parts not much has been done to make the walkways attractive and can appear drab and uninteresting. indeed

Very nice. took a river cruise on the river taxi services they had. it was nice, but trouble finding seats (we were 4 with a baby). also the windows of the boat were dirty and could not see the monuments well and the pictures came out fuzzy. overall it was an ok experience, but had to be patient so that eventually we could sit together.
Nice to walk along, & take pictures.. We walked along the Seine in many places. The Holiday Inn Express in Crimee is on it. Lots of nice photo locations for lovers.
Afternoon cruise. Lovely way to spend an afternoon, you see so much of the city in a relaxed atmosphere, with a good commentary in Enflish.

River trip through Paris. Beautiful, you can see Paris from a different perspective. It is a lovely trip. Try to get there early as the boat line fills quickly and you do want a window seat. You can also go outside if you wish.

Enjoy the beauty of the monuments and view along the Seine. Pronounced "sin" or "sen", the river is worth a boat ride but better: take several long walks down the left bank or the right bank. A good start is from one of the two original islands. (Ile de la Cite or the adjacent Ile Saint-Louis). Get a guidebook such as Rick Steves, to point out the must see's and start at Notre Dame cathedral on the île de la Cité. There are several companies providing not just boat rides or tours with lunch or dinner.
An Admiration Surroundings!. It is an hour boat ride of River Seine, and you will be surrounded by magnificent buildings with romantic ambiance.

Dirty. There are so many waterbodies in cities that are clean and well maintained. The river system in Hamburg is a pleasure. For all its romantic allure, this river is a dirty body of water. The French really need to get their act together and clean this up

Take a boat ride. A great way to see the city in comfort and at leisurely pace is to board the local boats that tour the Seine. Your views are a different perspective from the boat and it is a good idea if you have children to cruise the Seine to give your feet a rest
A cruise is a must!. For all the beautiful sights, you need to do a cruise on the River Seine! They are quite inexpensive and a means to view the better parts of the city

normal..no much to see. It s only a old fame to take a cruise by the seine, the are several companies that offer it the average cost is 15 euros, it last 45/55 min.. for me I think that walking you find better views in different angles of each building, palace or monument, I took it because it was included in the Paris passport package. ( this pass it's a really good way to discover Paris and save time and money)

Along the Seine, by foot!. A walk on either side or on any bank of the Seine may find a surprise in every kilometre and it's even better when the city is buzzing with local workers and the tourists are slightly less in number.From artists, the many sales stands (book, flowers and food) to the individual bridges, with their locks, good looks or just gilded to shine, the Seine captures your senses as it flows as the life blood of Paris.Summer of fall it changes; there's a beach in summer to keep a few locals home, there are the ever present tour boats, who ply their trade with efficiency and always there's food hawkers within 'cooee' for a coffee or something to eat if you feel the need.A day or a week by the Seine will allow you to grab just that little more presence of Paris... without the Seine, Paris just wouldn't be the same!

Lovely to walk along. Title says it all. Very pretty place to walk along and admire the Parisian streets, buildings and architecture. Wonderful to do this during the night to see the building aglow with warm lights. River cruise is brilliant!

What a busy river. This is why Paris is. You must cross over to get to la Cite' and Norte Dame. But if you take a minute to think about the river its self, notice which way it flows. Know your right bank form your left. Where ever you are, which ever bridge you choose, look down and you will see how busy it is. You can take a boat ride and dinner from one end of Paris to the other. Expensive but fun. You can stop at those green boxes to shop for souvenirs. They use to be books. You will see lower walk aways for "lovers". Paris loves it Seine, and the river love Paris right back.

Lovely. I love the Lock Bridge.. and its very nice to put your lock there - however what did annoy me was that this one particular bridge was being copied and more bridges were following.. I also saw some locks on the eiffel tower.... loses the novelty really!
Nothing much to see there. Only if you take a boat it might worth to see it, I walked there with a friend and took some pictures with the bridges.The best place for me was the locks bridge.

Boat trips are quick and superficial but are a good introduction for the novice visitor.. If you are new to Paris and this is your first visit, the boat tours along the Seine will introduce you to many of the attractions so that you ca decide what you want to see and do, in the event that you have arrived in Paris with no plan and did not do your homework before arriving. The tours are more spectacular at night, when the monuments are illuminated (assuming that the weather is good). There will be many photo opportunities but don't expect to learn a lot of details about the individual monuments and buildings, and depending on the day and season, the tour(s) can become a little like a cattle car. If you have the time, walking (or biking) along the Seine is likely to be more rewarding and you will see a lot more details. There are lots of bridges that cross the river, so that you can weave back and forth and repeatedly cross the river for a different perspective. For example, take the Metro to Alma Marceau, cross the Pont d' Alma, come back and reward yourself by sitting down, outside at one of the restaurants there (Chez Francis is good, there are other options), and watch the people and traffic flow by. The Pont des Invalides, Pont Alexander III, Pont de la Concorde, Pont Solferino, Pont Royal, Pont du Carousel, Pont des Arts, Pont Neuf, Pont au Change, Pont d'Arcole, Pont de Tournelle, Pont de Sully, etc....all will service your purposes admirably by giving you a great view of the river and the boat traffic. Don't be in a hurry, this is Paris. The people watching people opportunities are fantastic. So are the photo opportunities (even in bad weather).
river boat well worth time and money. It was very crowded when we travelled to Paris--christmas to new years, but the river trip for 90 minutes is a must do.

Enjoyable. We took a nice one-hour boat ride on the Seine. The views of all the famous landmarks from the Seine are really good, and you can get good pictures of the Eiffel Tower without having to visit it.Views of Paris from the Seine, especially at night, are fantastic and you'll find you may not even have to do much more sightseeing afterwards, if you want to go shopping.

Do Not Miss The Seine Night Cruise!. I've taken the night cruise on the Seine with two different groups of people and both times everyone has agreed it is well worth the 13 EUR! It's a lovely ride that begins and ends at the Eiffel Tower. It is a wonderful opportunity to see the sites and hear about the various bridges, statues and buildings. This is a must see.

The Padlock Bridge. We went to Paris and my oldest daughter really wanted to see the bridge with the locks where people write a note on the lock, lock it on the bridge and throw the key in the water. She wrote a note of love to her boyfriend, Zach, back home. We took lots of photos! We then walked from the Musee d'Orsay to Notre Dame the river and some streets. We enjoyed it very much. It was just so peaceful and there is some much architecture to see along the way.

Great Illuminations. Highlight of our trip was the private river cruise we book through Uniuqe Paris. We wanted something special to celebrate our anniversary evening, and this private river cruise did not disappoint. During 1,5 hour we were alone on the river....the most romantic moment for my wife.
Beautiful. This is a beautiful place to take photos, I did not go on river boat tour as it was chilly but you can't miss this spot when you go to Paris.

Simply one of those places that you need to experience!. Pick a dry day and just walk along either bank of the River Seine. I recently walked about 1 km either side of Notre Dame, on both sides of the river - there is just so much to see, and photograph! Don't be put off by the crowds of people (something that I usually try to avoid), they're only trying to experience what you're enjoying. Notre Dame is beautiful to behold from any angle; enjoy the artists and art-sellers along the bank; the thousands of padlocks on the railings of the bridges; the little squares just off the main thoroughfares; people-watching; the wonderful architecture of the larger (and smaller) buildings etc, etc!Best of all, apart from whatever you choose to buy, it's free!

observe the life of city. You need to walk along the river to observe the life of Paris. I do not know whether I can comment on this beautiful journey, but I started walking from Notre Dame towards La tour Eiffel along the river Seine along the way I encountered the different seasons from rainy to sunny sky, romantic notions of Paris displayed by enthusiastic couples, believers and non-believers alike were trying to imbibe that wonderful environment.

Relaxing, informative, eye-opening, picturesque, enjoyable!. We enjoyed an hour-long cruise on the River Seine during a Saturday evening, as part of a package tour which also included dinner at 58 Tour Eiffel and the late show at the Moulin Rouge.We boarded the cruise boat at a quay adjacent to the Eiffel Tower and we sat on the large open upper deck which proved to be an excellent viewing position as the cruise progressed along its course. We were able to view a number of very well-known attractions and landmarks both on the left and right banks, from a unique viewpoint on the river.The Eiffel Tower was unlit as we departed but was brilliantly illuminated in a multitude of colours as we returned at the end of the cruise. Amongst the other places of interest that we were able to view during the cruise were the Musee de Louvre, the Musee d' Orsay, the National Assembly building, Hotel d'Invalides, Pont Neuf, Pont Alenadre III, the Grand Palais, Ile de la Citie and the Notre Dame.One of the fascinating aspects of the cruise was the fact that in the vicinity of Notre Dame cathedral and Ile de la Citie the areas were crowded with Parisiennes sitting on the edge of the river banks, enjoying the warm evening and watching the river traffic go by.We throughly enjoyed our cruise on the Seine and wished that it had been of a longer duration. Highly recommended!During other days during our Paris stay we walked along both banks of the river and across several of the pedestrian bridges across the river. These experiences gave us the opportunity to take in and experience other aspects of the river and it's surrounds which were not obvious from onboard the cruise boat.When you visit Paris, you must experience the River Seine in one form or another, whether via a cruise or by walking, to truly experience the essence of this fabulous city.

Boat trip. Did a one hour cruise on the Seine. Gives a great perspective. Well worth it.Great commentry in 2 languages, including English. Always learn to much about a place when doing something like this.
Cruising the Seine. After a meal at the tower this was the perfect way to end the night. Very informative and fantastic shots of the tower all lit up and some of the bridges.
