Worth a trip. We went for the river tour in morning when the best thing you can do is enjoy the monuments and historical places along with all those pictures. I would have preferred this in night with a dinner on boat but we had a flight to catch so have to settle in morning itself. A good tour and it possible go for the smaller boat capacity instead to large ones as it can get too crowded at times.
Very relaxing. A one hour river cruise is all that was needed to view and see Paris by river. The staff was great and very friendly.

River of the City. As with many great cities, there is always a river that captures the very essence of its spirit. For Paris, this river is, of course, River Seine. It is a river you simply cannot miss while in Paris, and would end up, crossing it, one way or another. My family and I had the opportunity of taking a stroll along its bank one late afternoon after crossing Pont Du Carrousel (bridge) and walking down a flight of steps, before walking the entire length to Pont De Concorde (bridge) on our way to Champs Elysees. In between, we stopped to sit on one of the concrete benches to admire the river, its surrounding, the buildings and indulge in the french pastries we'd bought, very happy to simply enjoy the moment. It was incredible how peaceful the bank was given the fact that traffic above was near chaos! On another occasion, we took a night cruise (Bateaux-Mouches) along this river. Exactly at 9pm, before the cruise set off, we saw Eiffel Tower fully illuminated, blinking blinking, like hundreds of stars lighting up the night sky. It was quite magical, especially with the light drizzle. It was whilst absorbing all the sights of the lit buildings like Notre Dame, Lourve, Musee d'Orsay that it dawned on me just how easy it is to... not only fall in love in Paris, but also to fall in love with Paris!
Take the cruise at night. It is worth to book a cruise of one hour at night 13 euro where you can see all beautiful monuments illuminated and beautiful

night boat cruise on Seine, beautiful. Seeing the sights of Paris by night on a cruise on the Seine is wonderful. Everything is alight and in December and the Eiffel Tower is not only lighted but for 5 minutes per hour the lights flash giving a shimmering appearance. The boat was clean and orderly and the trip a little over an hour. However getting to the dock on Saturday night is time consuming as the traffic was AWFUL. but , still , Try it, you'll like it.

A boat trip and evening dinner - A Must. We took a trip on the Seine at night. This was a great way to see all the sights at night lit up. Our trip was just over 2 hours and we were taken past all the main attractions. If you are looking for a romantic evening, then this is a must. The boat was very good, modern and clean, and the food was also excellent.
River Cruise. A total treat. From Paris to Rouen on Viking. By bus to the beaches at Normandy. Many interesting stops along the way.Highly recommend this mode of travel..
River Seine. That was an excellent choice to take a dinner cruise at night. The food was excellent, and the Eiffel Tower was magnifcant, especially when the lights started to dance

All around you!. In Central Paris, you cannot miss the River Seine as it runs through the city. It is picturesque from above as you walk the many bridges and walkways but make sure you actually walk along the river and spend some time there. Have a meal at one the many cafes and enjoy a boat ride. At night the view of the Eiffel Tower from the river is AMAZING!! You really cannot miss it. It is all around you.
Just enjoy. It is free, beautiful, good ambience and always easy to find so just relax. Don't do anything, just be.
Travel along the Seine to see the sights. We travelled on the Seine River as part of a tour package. It was well worth the trip to see Paris from the river.
Stroll the banks for the magic of Paris. Plan to stroll both the left and right banks for the sights of Paris, as well as the boat traffic on the river.

day for pics, night for lights. We love walking the river, it's peaceful and intriguing. The boat tours are great but if you good pics then go during sunlight hours because the night pics won't come out well for majority of cameras. We had a fairly high dollar DSLR that we borrowed from a friend and still didn't work but it was beautiful to see at night. Perfect for adults with or without kids.Our 6 year old and 20 month old enjoyed it so we were able to just relax and take in the sights
A travelers delight!!. Had been on a seine cruise last July.....one of the best way to watch the beautiful city of Paris........so romantic.......

A little romance. There are a number of foot bridges when your get close to Notre Dame which have thousands of pad locks attached to the side railings and there a few river side stalls that sell small pad locks.Or your can take your own and write on it and throw the key into the Seine
Looks lovely at night all lit up!. Nice to walk long also last year had river cruise which was both good and romantic! Of a night the city lights reflect in the water and it just looks so lovely.
Take a slow & long stroll. It's always nice for strolls along the river. Check out the bridge of locks (just to take photos) and so much more!

Love walking at Paris.... We walked all the way from Musee de louvre to Notre dame enjoying Seine River. The best walk in my life... loved every view around. It was Christmas season and nice to watch all the decorations and small shops selling all vintage stuffs. Will came again.

A Seine River Cruise is a Must. One of the most delightful ways to view Paris is drifting on the Seine from one end of Paris to the other aboard a tourist boat or dining cruise. Some of my best photographs have been taken from one of these boats. Evening is especially fun and as the Paris lights illuminate the night sky when the sun sets, it is unbelievably romantic from the bow of a cruise vessel. I'd highly recommend it as an intro to Paris OR when you want to rest a bit and watch Paris float by. And of course it's a wonderful time to steal a kiss...or propose.
Start Here. Your first night you have to start (what will become your love affair with Paris) n a Seine River Cruise. It's a great teaser of what Paris is. . . sexy and sophisticated
Never walked by the river. Had to try this at least once...even found some orange metal chairs from an art exhibit...this was a fun side trip.

Go two time once in day once at night. Really a touist location for major dividing line in paris. Some sides are swanky high end others the locals hang out at. Wonderful for walking and viewing from the many bridges.I recommend a night time lights boat tour on the river to see many famous building you probably saw from the street but look so cool from the river.Must do even if the boats are not real upscale and kind of corny. You go to see the sights and then stroll the banks. Actually kind of efficient to tour a lot by boat.

Don't miss it. After many Bateau Mouche tours on the Seine, I am still blown away. NOONE should miss a boat tour of the Seine. It would be like coming to Chicago and not doing a river cruise. The lights are fantastic. The guide is unobtrusive and you can tour the whole thing out if you wish. This time we were appalled to discover a group of teenagers screaming while waiting to get on the boat. They turned out to be lovely--all from Central and South America on an outing and screaming for some "famous" star. They ended up speaking perfect English to members of our group and were unfailingly polite--can't imagine an American kids as nice as they. They added to the joy of this nighttime excursion. This is tour is one of the great experiences of a lifetime--tourist or not. DO IT.
River. As many other rivers running through the cities. We spend some time on the coast of the river during sunset and it was very nice.

Take a break for a moment…. Between rushing to put another ugly lock on a once beautiful pedestrian bridge, dumping your trash (key) in a beautiful river before rushing off to a crowded, diesel belching bateau, you might consider a nice, leisurely walk down the quais of this wonderful river. The views never get old, the grandeur of the banks, with the steady, timeless flow of this river that has seen so much history is truly revitalizing every time i visit Paris, summer, winter, spring or fall. As i tried to explain to some guidebook death march tourists; "If you spend your visit rushing from one monument to the next museum, you will miss Paris entirely." This is the best place in the world to DO NOTHING. Wandering down the Seine is a great way to take part in this great traditional pastime of doing nothing. Don't miss it.

Wonderful river. River Seine is so beautiful and clean with its nice view and romantic bank. The architecture designs along the river is so lovely making for an amazing walk becomes more and more charming and attractive. Absolutely great!!
Dinner cruise. We had an evening dinner cruise on the Seine and to see the Eiffel tower twinkling was just beautiful,we were with a tour group and we had a terrific time with friendly people.

Walking or by boat.. The banks of the River Seine are beautiful and clean. The architecture along the river is beautiful and it makes for an amazing walk. I also took a boat ride down the river which I took from the Eiffel tower and got to learn quite a bit of history so I would highly recommend doing that too. You can go right down by the river as well to walk along it. We had brought ourselves a little picnic with a bottle of wine and just sat and watched the boats go by. Much cheaper that having lunch in a cafe and it was a better view.
Very neat, great way to see sites. We traveled the river on the hop-on, hop-off "Batobus" so that we could see the sites. Much less expensive way to cruise the Siene!
fabby. I took a boat down the river and it was soo fun! I loved it and we tucked into french chocolate biscuits as we did so! Absolutely great!!

Great way to rest your legs. I booked a one hour cruise and watched the world go by. The river itself is nothing special, but the views are fantastic. Going by boat along the river is a great way to get your bearings before embarking on foot or on the metro to the major sights.

Beautiful boat ride - very scenic!. I have been on the Croisiere Bateaux Parisiens on two occasions. This is one beautiful ride that a visitor to Paris should not miss. The boarding point is very much near the Eiffel Tower. I would suggest that after the Eiffel Tower tour, one must immediately proceed for the boat ride. The boat takes you to all the places of historic importance in Paris along the river shore. The boat has a phone attached to each seat - you could hear a commentary in the language of your choice (quite a few languages supported) while the boat moves along. You could also move along the stern of the boat to enjoy the views.
A great little bargain.. Use the Bateaux Bus in Paris and save a bundle. This hop on hop off transportation is a wonderful way to see the Seine and get to all the major parts of the city.

River go with the flow flow flow. When you have a river crossing a city, speacially an old city, you have half of it all to get a the most beautiful surroundings. You can like or dislike, but you have to walk around the Seine banks. There are a few places really calm and beautiful, at least while you're not seeing some boat reallying the river downstream. Honestly, I was freightened for the people that were inside the boats. How the hell do they have time to enjoy the ride? Clearly the river is dumpster and I can't even tell which colour the River is.Anyways, from the Eiffel Tower to the Ile St Louis, it's a lovely walk (it could be the best...)

Can't help but see it!. The Seine River is very hard to miss when you visit Paris, and offers many wonderful views whether you are by The Eiffel Tower, Assemblee Nationale, Louvre, Ile de la Cite, Hotel De Ville, etc… Each season brings its own charm.
Boat. Christmas lights at night good time of year to go up the Seine by boat. The Eiffel Tower had the most amazing flashing lights. Very good commentary all the way in a lot of different languages
Great view!. It's a very charm view. Although the river is kinda nasty and brown, the things around are amazing! :)
Amazing !. Brilliant sight - well worth going there and spectacular at night !Amazing stone work on each of the bridges over it. A must see attraction when in Paris.

Mandatory boat ride. You'll see more of Paris's charms from this boat ride than anywhere else. And if you're really adventuresome, rent a bike and pedal along the shoreline. It's the center of Paris's romantic charm.

stunning views. Stunning walk taking in Paris in the sun, by the river with my wife. Stunning views. Have also taken a boat trip along the river before which is a must as it's a wonderful way to take in the city!

Impossible to miss. The only question about the Seine is how you'll experience it. Take a cruise, especially after dark when the buildings are floodlit and the Eiffel Tower sparkles at the top of the hour. Walk along the banks (preferably in daylight or when it's still crowded). Cross all of the bridges. Have the ring scam tried on you a few times. You don't have to do it all at once, just avoid the temptation to do all of your travel by Metro and take advantage of opportunities to see more of the river that is the heart of Paris.

A Great way to see Paris. We caught the boat from the Ile de la Cite, itself well worth a visit because the little island is the energetic centre of the city. The boat ride is inexpensive and lasts for just over an hour during which you get to see many of the iconic sites of Paris including the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame cathedral. The views from the river give some great angles for photos so being out on deck is a must for photographers. The commentary is interesting and in English as well as French. I'd say this is a good start to a visit of Paris because you get a potted history and views of some sites all in a short space of time - then you can go and explore for yourself in more detail. For a different experience you may also want to try the evening cruise to see this beautiful city illuminated, its much more romantic seen from the water -enjoy!

Have to experience a cruise. It flows through the middle of Paris and is hard to miss. You can see it from different bridges across the city , walk alongside it and have a river cruise. We had viewed the river when walking alongside throughout the time we were in Paris and decided to inquire about a cruise. We walked upto pier 3 without reservations to book an hour cruise. There was no fuss as the ticket operators were very friendly and were able to fit us on a cruise later that evening which cost 10 euros. Whilst on the cruise you could listen to the guide telling you about the history of Paris and the river aswell as pointing out the landmarks you were passing or you can walk about the boat taking photos of the city. The cruise was scheduled only to be for an hour however it lasted 1 hour 45 minutes which was fantastic. Its a definite must do when in Paris its in-expensive, a lot of fun and a great way to see all the landmarks in the city.

Cruise on the Seine, departing from the foot of the Eiffel Tower .. We booked the cheap and cheerful 10 Euro /1 hour boat tour by French company CEETIZ.The tour can be booked on line - no drama`sShow up at pier 3 - just below the Eiffel Tower any time between the morning and 21.30hrs (winter schedule) and the boat casts off approx. every hour. It heads off towards Notre Dame and returns to pier 3 in about 65 /70 minutes. There is a commentary provided at each seat - also there is a customer service rep who also adds colour commentary along the way. there`s no refreshments etc on board but None are advertised or expected.Its a nice trip and you can go outside onto the deck an take pictures as conditions allow........It`s a `no brainer` 10 Euro`s each for that experience - get it booked!

Beautiful river. If you visit Paris it will be hard to miss the River Seine as it flows right through the heart of Paris. There are many ways you can experience it: views from the Eiffel Tower are exceptional; crossing the many bridges; walking alongside it; take a river cruise, especially at night when the city is lit up.

Really…rate the Seine?!. The Seine is one thing London doesn't have. You disagree? Okay, how many times on a given London day do you cross the Thames? Right. It is not a good day in Paris unless you (re)cross the Seine at least once. It is the Aorta of Paris, changeable with the time of day and season of the year. You cross it like a grand boulevard, over different bridges with into different epochs of the city's history,skirting islands, ogling the Eiffel Tower, etc etc. That said, I love the Thames, too….I just don't get to/need to use it as much.

Moonlight on the Seine. You can't avoid the Seine in Paris, and that is a wonderful thing. It's woven into the city's culture, history, and daily life (at least for tourists). But there s one experience I cannot recommend highly enough: cruising the river at sunset or at night. There are several ways to do this, and they aren't that expensive, nor do they need to be. I have been fortunate in being able to travel a fair amount and enjoy fine experiences. But nothing compares to the joy of seeing the city glide by while the lights sparkle on the water while you are with the one you love. My wife and I have tradition of doing this on our final night in Paris. It is our way of saying farewell to our favorite city and pledging our return. It is a wonderful way to wrap up a visit.

A river that just flows atmosphere. Many city rivers are pleasant places to walk along . But the Seine has that something extra . An atmosphere of sophistication and culture. Left or right bank they both have something special to offer. And there is always a small cafe, not far away, to relax and take the weight of your feet . The Seine ... We love it !

Batobus great for getting around. If you want a good introduction to Paris, take the Batobus tour. You pass by many of the main attractions and can hop on and off as many times as you like. More limited than the Metro but much more fun!

A hearty endorsement for the Batobus.. As an alternative to the crowded metro and buses, the Batobus proved to be a very safe, enjoyable and inexpensive way to travel to and from the main attractions that are within walking distance of the Seine, on either bank. The locations of the 8 stops afford convenient access to all of the main attractions. We purchased the 5-day pass and took advantage of the opportunity for unlimited boarding and disembarking use that is a feature of that option. The vessels themselves are pleasant and provide great views of what's on the river, the beautiful bridges and the riverside structures. I only wish it didn't stop running so early in the evening.

rises and falls with the tide. We cruised with Grand Circle Cruise Line from Paris to Rouen, France in Normandy at the end of November. The scenery is beautiful. There are old castles, buildings withing limestone and centuries-old villages along the river. Unfortunately, we were unable to cruise through Paris at night to see the city lights this time of year due to high water levels. The River Seine rises and falls with the tide.

Nice. I am reviewing the River Seine cruise - at 15 euro it's not that pricey. Stop at few touristy places (not bad).vTake it if you feel like it. It should have been better to take it night time, too bad I didn't have the time. I'd probably take up the cruise if I were to visit Paris again.
Beautiful. It is a beauty...It is right in the heart of the city...and a BEauty visible from most of the places...u cant not see it wen in PAris
Fast water. Surprised by the volume and current. Ships had to fight hard. Bridges offered great views. Lovely around its quays.

The cold cannot put me off. Despite the cold November wind I had to stoically walk near the river, which trust me, is colder than walking between the buildings that lines it. But if D'Artagnan or Pardaignan did it, why not I?A really enjoyable walk which seems to be the target of other fellow youngsters: 'the oldies' probably prefer a cup of tea or glass of wine in the cafe not far from here.Highly recommended
Paris Vacation. Love the scenic views along the river. Stroll along the walk ways and bridges, you will stumble upon a lot of magnificent building and historic places.

Batobus is the way to get around!!. We booked a two day hop on hop off on the batobus. Lots if the points of interest are along the river so this was brilliant!! Highly recommended. Would definately book again.
Innocents Abroad. Took a leisurely boat trip on the Seine, enjoying the sights from the river which give a different view than from the road. Pleasant and enjoyable and relaxing.

The boat ride is wonderful. The fastest way to get a summary of the city of Paris's important places. Looks great during night. Many hotels offer the ticket for the ride anything between 6 - 10 Euros. This ride is best taken during night to see the illumination effect.

An excellent way to see the city.. My husband and I walked along the banks of the Seine on a number of occasions to explore the city and when we were on our way to specific attractions. This really is an iconic part of Paris and whether you walk the banks or take a cruise there is lots to see of this beautiful city by sticking to this river. If walking, the paths along its banks are excellent and very easy access. Highly recommended.

The BEst Views of Paris. The best way to view Paris is through river Seine. We took the River cruise and hop on/off bus. The river cruise was the excellent to see the beauty of this fascinating city. One not only enjoys the river itself rather the major buildings all along this river in a circle. The flotilla type of boats are good to enjoy the all around views on both sides of the river. Its a quick and a befitting way of exploring Paris.
L'excursion en bateau. Taking a boat tour on the Seine gives you a different view of the city. Very educational with breathtaking viwes. A wonderful experience not to be missed while visiting Paris.

7 night cruise, Paris and Normandy. This was my very first cruise so I don't have anything to compare it to but I have to say, this will be a hard one to beat and it did set my cruising standard to an initial high. This was a great experience and I learned a lot! There is really nothing that I didn't like. The food is fantastic and the staff is very attentive to your needs. We traveled with the whole family and my wife and I were probably the youngest people in the ship. This is not like your regular "party animal" cruise ships such as Carnival etc... this is a very classy educational cruise. At every port, there's different tour options and its all inclusive. I suggest to do the bike tour and sign up asap due to the limited bikes that they have on board. Most of the guests were actually middle aged folks (i am being politically correct, but that means old folks) but that actually made it fun to hang out with them due to their outlook in life. If you like a laid back cruise, good food and wine, historical and educational tours, this is definitely for you.
A Boat trip to remember. Loved it - it was a chance to look at the detail of the bridges, lovely to see all the architecture from another angle. Relaxing, friendly and worthwhile experience.

Very Romantic!!!. We walked along here one night and just took in the scenery! And then went up on the "love bridge" and locked away our love forever !! Lol it was sooo romantic ! So blessed my DH gave me this for my 50th bday!!

Seine river cruise on Bataeux boats was a great experience. This was a great way to see many of the sights of Paris along the Seine! The boat cruise is around an hour and a half and it has an audio phone for each seat that will give you the history of each sight as you pass it in whatever language you speak. Is it touristy? Yes, but it was definitely a worthwhile relaxing way to see a bit of Paris!

Enjoy a Stroll or a Cruise. During our visit to Paris, we enjoyed walking along the Seine. The book sellers and other vendors provide a different perspective along this vista. We also enjoyed a night cruise along the Seine and it was good to see Paris from the water and the lights, notably around the Eiffel Tower were impressive. We were lucky with fine weather which added to our enjoyment.
Riding the Seine. A river you always hear about and now you are there. You can walk down by it on a walk way. We also rode the Batabus which was nice. You can get off the batabus several places.

Not very exciting. Bateaux-Mouches evening cruise. Due to the Seine being swollen and running fast was not able to do the full cruise which should have been going past several of the famous Paris landmarks. Instead of which we had make do with the Eiffel Tower and the Statue of Liberty. Of course, we weren't told this until we checked in to the boat. We went ahead anyway, but in hindsight wish we hadn't. It was a lot of money for very little. Even though we had the Prestige menu, the food was very disappointing.
Take a Stroll. The boat trip is well worth doing but its wonderful just to stroll along so much to see, take a while to just sit and people watch, you really know you are in Paris, Wonderful!!!

Take the cruise at night!. We visited in Nov and there was quite a bit of rain. The water levels were pretty high and our ride was shorter than an hour.
The Eiffel Tower was so beautiful at night! We all 'wowed' when we saw the blinking starry lights on the Eiffel Tower while we were on the cruise.

Seine River cruise. I really enjoyed the cruise as it was good to see Paris from a different angle and at 13 euros it was very good value for money.Our guide was an excellent ,charming english speaking young lady and gave a very informative talk. the weather was fine but chilly so it was good to sit outside and enjoy some fresh but chilly air . We had an excellent view of the Eiffel Tower, some beautiful bridges and Paris has its own mini Statue of Liberty.

Stand on Pont Neuf at Sunset and Have an "Awe" Moment. Much like its sister rivers, the Seine is just a highway for commerce and travel. And, at times during the day it seems much more functional than beautiful with the barges and boat loads of tourists. But come sunset on a partly cloudy day, as you stand on the Northeast corner of the Pont Neuf, the clouds turn shades of yellows, then oranges, then reds and the Eiffel Tower stands in the distance. And, all of those colors are reflected in the river. Then you are in romantic Paris. You want to stand there and capture the moment forever. But slowly it continues to change and the colors deepen.

Bateaux Parisien cruises in November. The Seine was in flood and so there were no stops allowed on the other cruise so we chose Bateaux Parisien which does not usually do stops and generally does a circuit tour. We did a circuit from Tour Eiffel to Ile de la Cite which should have been less than the 14 euros charged. The commentary was clear (and included in the price) though the phones not very clean - mine smelt of garlic and curry !! The guide gave instructions in three languages and very well too. The commentary seemed to start with each bridge so this was the time to put the device to one's ear. Whilst this does give a different view of Paris if you are short of time, especially in the winter there are better things to do.

not really worth it. We went on a boat trip at night. To be honest it is better seeing the lights particularly the Eiffel Tower not on the boat. Was very disappointing. Maybe in the summer it is better when you can sit in the open.

Take a Walk. Took a walk along the Seine from Notre Dame to Eiffel Tower and It really was a memorable experience. Walking along the Seine and over the various bridges such as the “Love Bridge” was very pleasant. The atmosphere was very romantic, lots of couples were “locking the love” and you could feel the love in the air! There are many cafes and restaurants around the river and you can stop there for a drink and relax. I would recommend evening walk, so much to see here, history and modern life, side by side. It is the life blood of the city, so much has written about the Seine, Paris would not be the same without it.

La Seine, La Seine. We loved the boat tours. We took 2 or 3 while in Paris. One during the day and 2 in the evening. They were informative and loved looking at the sights both day and night. Gives you a great perspective to see the river in both daytime and nighttime.

High Water. The water was very high due to a lot of rain in November 2013.We went on a Viking River Cruise and were bused to ConflansTo start our cruise. Seeing the sites along the way was a wonderful way to is France.
good boat trip on the Seine. 1.5 hour boat trip on the Seine, boarded just opposite Eiffel tower, good value and not too long on the water

Must do at night. Probably just repeating what others have said , but a night cruise on the Seine is just incredible. Wish we went on an open top boat, but then we got a few rain drops, so it worked out. Bring a camera and some wine and it is a great way to spend an hour or so.

Night time on the seine. We took the night boat on the seine.Fab for pictures as all the main attractions are lit upWent on with my husband and 2 children age 10 & 13 and even they loved it.Commentary is given in all different languages via a phone on the side of your chairIt was raining when we went and the glass top wasn't great for taking pictures so we went outside.Had a picture taken on entry of boat with the beautiful lights behind.Cost 10 euro to buy at the end of trip
Sit wisely. If you take one of those boat tours; a) sit on the left side cuz almost everything to see is on that side b) avoid the middle isle or u won't see anything at all.

Nice scenery, smooth sailing. The Seine River some of the dirtiest water that I have seen but you still have to take a boat ride. The scenery from the river is beautiful. If you take a Seine River cruise (hop on hop off) you will be able to see all of the beautiful monuments as most of them are close to the river. You can get off at any stop, explore and get back on again and do it all over. I think it’s worth it. My favorite part is seeing the Pont de l'Archevêché. This is the bridge where couples go and buy a lock, write their names on it and locks it onto the gate on the bridge. They then throw the key into the River which symbolizes their eternal love.

A relaxing boat ride with awesome views of Paris!. The river seine in Paris it's relaxing and beautiful. You can take the boat across the river and stop in different location . Indoor or outdoor seating. Great way to spend your day/ evening in Paris! One of the many great ways of transportation while still having great views . I strongly recommend the day pass.you would n't regret it.

Insane for the Seine.. We travelled in the Seine courtesy of Bateaux Parisiane boat trips. It was a lovely day and an interesting journey. There was commentary on and off. We would have liked a CD of the commentary as, with taking photographs, one often missed the commentary on the day and there were lots of fascinating facts; however, 15€ was ridiculous and the rest of the 200+ fellow travellers onboard must have agreed for no-one bought a copy.

A nice way to spend an hour on the Seine. Whilst the day was a lovely one, we needed rest so took to the Seine River cruise to see the sights from a different perspective. A 1 hour cruise that takes you past all the sights. Musee d'Orsay, flower markets, Notre Dame and many more.

River Cruise. First we got our wine, cheese, chicken and bread. We ate under the bridge. Then we jumped on a cruise. What a great way to see Paris. The bridges are beautiful. The buildings amazing. Don't forget to look for the smallest apartment on the island!!

Romantic Seine. Yes, it's true. Parisians stroll, bike and rollerblade along the Seine with their lovers and families every Sunday. Visit the many artists and find keepsakes to take home with you. Booksellers line the upper banks, and be aware and respectful: Most of them do NOT allow photos of their tables and books, or of them. You may wonder why street vendors along the Seine are selling padlocks with three keys. LOCKS OF LOVE. Yes, it's touristy, but do it. Buy a lock, write your message of love on the lock (with a supplied Sharpie) and, with the one you love, find a place to lock it on tone of the bridges. Each person keeps a key, and you both toss the third key in the Seine. Very romantic. Really, it is very romantic and emotional, especially when you both return and find your lock. Very romantic.

Mediocre. We did a night cruise on the River Seine and it was ok. We also got some food and had a picnic on one of the days we were there. I am a little disenfranchised with Paris as a whole, and so was not very impressed. The areas by the river seemed dirty to me. I would probably pass on the night cruise in the future.

Worth a trip..... We did the 1 hr boat trip on river Seine as it was highly recommended by colleagues.Its definitely worth it if you want to see Paris from a different perspective while enjoying a relaxing cruise on the river.

Best walk in Paris.. While in Paris walking along the Seine is a must! Not only it offers a different view and perspective of the city but it is full of history. Not to mention it is incredibly romantic at dawn.

beautiful river. take a cruise if you have the time, or walk along the river over the pont des arts or pont de l'archeveche and see the love locks. You can buy oil paintings and art. I reccomend Bateaux Parisiens.

NIGHT TOUR!. Do the night tour! It is absolutely amazing to see Paris lite up at night. We got there around 5 or 6pm and walked right in, although we had a Paris Pass. Inside and outdoor seating on the boat and great views of the Eiffel Tower!

View Paris from water level!. This cruise was only for about 1 hour. Its worth doing as you get a view of Paris from a different angle. Again do the headphones, as this provides you history and relevance as you go passed landmarks.

Consider a night cruise. We booked the cruise the last night of our stay in Paris. I really wanted to see Paris at night from the river and even though it rained the entire ride it was still totally worth every Euro.
A must see for family, children and elderly.

Spend some time walking along the river. There is so much to see on either side of the river Seine, that it is worth spending some time just strolling along the banks, looking at the city. As you wander, you will pass significant monuments (like the Notre Dame cathedral) as well as quirky book stands (open in the afternoons) and a variety of bridges (notably one covered in locks).We took a bike tour that went along the river for a while and it was my favourite part of the tour because you can see so much in a short period of time. It was so relaxing to bike by the river.

Lover's Bridge Over the Seine River~Where Love Gets 'Locked'. Everyone knows Paris as ‘the romance capital’ & the ‘city for lovers’. A few years ago, a new fad started, when love-struck sweethearts started to lock padlocks onto the chain link fence on the Passerelle des Arts, which crosses from the left bank to the Louvre museum....yeah, we got locked too! I remember like it was yesterday...The Seine River...Getting "Locked"...Sitting in the small café, drinking latté with the delicious French deserts....we had brunch at Laduree....the best tea & macarons in Paris!I live in the United States. We ordered our lock before we left to go to Paris. They sell locks on the street, but they are very simple. If you want something nice & engraved….order it before you go.

A romantic walk along the Seine is quintessential Paris.... You cannot go to Paris and not be compelled to walk along the Seine. Just do it, it is beautiful during the day, but even more stunning at night with all the monuments lit up.I recommend walking from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame in the late afternoon/early evening to see the lights and hear the bells.

Amazing. Fantastic experience with great Architecture all around. Bridges were beautiful and every Bridge was different than the previous one in design. Just the cruise was a bit crowded and dinnt understand the information which was recorded.
river cruise. A cruise along the river Seine in the evening is highly recommended. The buildings of Paris are lit up and the on board commentary is very informative. A lovely romantic evening.
What a view. The best of Paris trip. Worth going around a number of times. Rain and cold make it a great experience.

Great place to have a different dinner.. We loved having a different dinner just at the side of the river.
It's romantic and you enjoy another part of the city.
You must know that it's not fancy, it's more of a casual plan.

Good introduction to the River. Brief first ever visit to Paris and a river cruise with the commentary is a great introduction to the city and some of the historical sights. It's a great way to watch the world go by, and appreciate just what Paris has to offer from a seat on a boat travelling on the River Seine.

See it in the evening!. Experiencing Paris at any time of day is nice, but an evening cruise on the Seine is wonderful with the lights - especially near the Eifflel Tower. Cruises including lunch or dinner can be expensive, but there are many nice ones available for just sightseeing which won't break the bank!
Just walk. So many things to see and do along the banks, hire bikes ,run or just walk as we did , Saturday afternoon ,place was full with children and families ,art etc...lovely.

Just take a walk. This is a simple, free way to discover Paris. There are many beautiful buildings along the river and many of the main attractions (Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame) are on the way. It really is a beautiful walk whether night or day.
Great value great views!!. the 'Bato bus', I recommend you get on early in the day to get moneys worth, but you see so many amazing buildings whilst relaxing in a glass roofed boat!

Lovely river cruise. Booked a river cruise through Viator, with hotel pick up. Worked great, with our own mini bus and driver (for five of us). Boat and food good, great views (sparkly Eiffel Tower) and wine, good service and a disco on board to end the night. Driver then advised us on a couple of clubs and drove us there (normally would return to hotel). Highly recommended.

A must do. For first time visitors to Paris, please do the boat trip on the River Seine. You'll see all the main attractions in Paris and also have stunning photo oppertunities especially the Eiffel Tower. Worth the money.

Pretty architecture on the banks.. There is a lot of pretty architecture along the banks of the River Seine. I took a boat cruise from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame and back. It was semi-interesting. I don't think I would ever do it again though. If you take a hop on hop off bus or another sightseeing tour then you'll get to cross the bridges and see the river that way.

Night Cruise on Seine. The city of Paris is so beautiful at night. This is a must. There are many over-prices dinner cruises if you like. We opted dor just the plain tour. 10-13 Euro, depending on company. Well worth the money for the view. Cruises run all day until 10pm, last cruise. I suggest night cruise, its beautiful scenery.

Loved it!. We walked alongside the Seine twice - the last being the day before we left Paris to head back to Australia. Because the paths are flat and it's easy walking - it's not a hard walk. The river is alive - many, many tourist boats, we even witnessed some sort of celebration/dedication (maybe ashes had been scattered into the river) where a group of young people were gathered with a picnic - and were individually dropping roses into the river. Late am and afternoon there are lots of cute and quaint little stalls that open up - selling the usual touristy stuff, some have old books and wares - and they are not 'in your face' pushing for sales as in Asian countries. A nice way to view Paris from either side.

Do It Once in a LifeTime. There are many dinner cruises up and down the river after 6PM to see the City of Lights. And yes the magic is there, music, lights fine wine, nice food, dancing and romance. Oh yes the lovers kissing all along the banks of the river in the evening are REAL!

Unforgettable. Don't visit Paris without taking at least one cruise on the Seine; it's incredibly beautiful and gives you a capsule overview of the major monuments in the city. Sunset over the Seine was lovely, and I'm told that the nighttime cruises are beautiful too.

Boat cruise. Wonderful way to see the city - dress warm this time of year (November)We used Bateaux Mouches whicj were very easy to find and large boats so plenty of seats to choose from. The cruise took just over 1hr.

A Special Paris Treat. Silly but so Paris ... a must in fact.The River Seine , or perhaps "River Insane" as my wife and I along with most travelers to Paris spent hours attaching our "lock of love" before throwing our keys into the Seine with hopes of eternal love. Also like others we spent a whopping $5.00 on the lock that we adorned with $100.00 worth of engravings. Regardless all seemed entirely appropriate and while the others sights were enjoyed, the craziness of the "lock of love" tradition was still the highlight of our trip. Perhaps this makes us both insane romantics but if so, so be it.Doddsy

Any bridge overlooking the Seine is great. But I would suggest the Pont de l'Archeveche or the Pont des Arts where people in love bring locks with their names on them and lock them onto the bridge. Go see. Bring a lock!

beautiful River. taking a boat trip is a must loads of fantastic bridges with plenty of history, I normally take the boat trip from pont neuf 13 euros which is a bit expensive to what it used to be alternately you can take the batobus but you don't get the commentary.

Batobus great way to see sights and rest. We bought the two day pass. Our strategy was to cruise the Seine between museum visits to giver our feet a break. This was our pragmatic way to see the sights and rest as we'll.

Beautiful, especially with a crepe in hand!. Grab a crepe or a baguette with cheese and sit along the walls over the Seine for a relaxing view of the fairly swift moving water. You can watch many tourist and trade boats pass by. Great for a sunny afternoon break!

Must do if in Paris. The trip down the River Seine was fabulous, we were very lucky, although we went in October the weather on the day of our trip down the Seine was lovely, it gives you a great view of all the major attractions, while enjoying and sharing the sights with tourists from all over the world, my sister and I had a great time ( including out new found friends Pat & Sheila, thank you) . x
Lovely. We enjoyed a night cruise on the River Seine. The sights were fantastic with good narration. Beautiful photo shots!

Lovely at night!. The night cruise on the river is one great adventure!The whole city of Paris is lit up and wonderful.I feel around 7to 8pm is the best time for this.The Eiffel tower and almost allimportnt placescould be seen on the river cruise!The river itself is a very prestty sight with a lot of lovely bridges upon it.

Take a boat trip. We took a trip in the late evening from the Eiffel Tower so Paris was lit up. There are a lot of very well run boats offering trips - ours was very comfortable but a lot of others we saw seemed very corwded

A different view of Paris.. What a wonderful way to see the City of Lights. During the day we used the Batobus which is a hop on, hop off venue. Get the 2 day pass, very economical. Has stops at 8 different areas along the Seine . At night, just stand on any bridge for the most spectacular view, especially if you can see the Eiffel Tower aglow.
Paris by night.... You should visit it by night... It's really nice walking along the river with all the lights. From one of the bridges you can see the Eiffel Tower.

Nice but not the legend you imagine it to be!. Any river is beautiful, so is Seine. It's not special enough for the legend you imagine it to be. A stroll by Seine however, is a must do, if you visit Paris. I found the decor on bridges interesting.

Bateau Mouche. There are so many many Bridges over the River Seine ,1st arrondissement is the closest to where the Louvre ,famous Champs Elysee road ,la place the Concorde,Arc the Triumph located of course.Hotel a bit more expensive than on the other side of this River Seine.We bought this 2hours Diner Cruise of this cruise group called Bateau Mouche (there are plenty of other cruise to choose from) and I love it their food and the service,night time cruise seeing the eiffel tour lights up you feel happy ,romantic

high light of our trip. As well as going to the Moulin Rouge with my wife for her birthday, we also booked a dinner on a cruise vessel on the River Seine. The boat was mainly glass from the water level up so you really could see everything along the banks and further.The dinner was very enjoyable and the entertainment was just as good. Whilst being wined and dinned we had time to take in all the sights just as the sun was setting. They say Paris is the city of love, well on this dinner cruise, it really is. One of the most romantic moments I have ever had. Really enjoyable and a must, must must.

Viking Pride- Seine River Cruise Paris to Normandy. This was our second River cruise experience. The last time was 2011 on the Rhine and both were with Viking River Cruise lines in Oct. What to say about this particular trip on the Pride: From where it docks it is a 40 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. Our trip did not include any pre or post trip extensions so it was fortuitous that I booked the Eiffel on my own online prior to the trip for the evening of our arrival (10 pm worked out great for after dinner walk at 9 pm). Had I not done this, we would not have been able to go up the tower as no time was alotted but for viewing from a distance on the standard tour. Also, nighttime is THE time to go if you only get one time to visit as you get to see the tower sparkle on the hour and the view of Paris from above at night is breathtaking.High points of this particular cruise: Normandy beaches- very moving and informative. If you are non US citizen they have alternate cemetary/beach visit for foreign soldiers. Speaking to those guests said equally moving as well.Low point(s):If you take away the Arc du Triomphe, the wonderful Museums and of course the Seine with the beautiful Alexander and unique Locks bridge, you have to wonder what the heck is with the NY/SF style shopping, McDonalds, Starbucks, Banana Republic etc? Nothing here you can't get at home except for the tag that says France. That definitely took away from the 'romantic' feel/beauty of France on the Champs D'Elysees.Another Low point:Foodborne illness on the ship possibly from ordering a turkey sandwich at lunch (had steak Charlemagne the night before- served very rare as is customary). Who orders a turkey sandwich in France? Lost a day and a half of touring sick. Live and learn. Mustn't eat with impunity.Other excursions included- Paris bus/walking tour (viewing things from afar or simply while riding the bus), Claude Monet's house, and the towns of Les Andelys, Conflans, Rouen.Purchased the optional Louvre and Versailles tours. They were nice.Made some great acquaintances on the trip, Didn't need our outlet converter as there was one 110 in the cabin.If you've never been the Paris/France before, this is a low stress way to do it as far as having things planned for you, But once you have done it, you will probably come away with enough info/knowledge to make/plan the trip on your own at your own pace and leisure. I found the French to be very courteous and helpful etc. (preconceived stereotypes notwithstanding) and yes I found their English invariably better than my French.

Romantic and what a way to see the city. We actually did 2 River Cruises. We used Vedettes du Pont Neuf and it only cost 10 Euros per person online, good deal. Anyways, we did one right at dusk, and another when it was fully dark. I'd recommend doing 2 as well since the price isn't bad, compared to some of the other companies. It's such a different sight to see from the River during the day versus at night. Also, if you're going to take the 8 pm cruise, which is on the 2 story boat, get there early, to ensure that you get seats up top. Anyways, the River itself goes all throughout Paris and really is something. Gives you a different perspective to the Ctiy.

crowded, carry cash for tickets.. Could not take the cruise as they did not accept cards at the counter. Carry cash. It’s spread through out the day, so you can choose your timing.Very crowded though.

Worth taking a cruise on the Seine. We took a dinner cruise on the Seine on our first night and it was amazing. It gave us a feel of the city and its major monuments. We saw a lot of parisians drinking wine on the banks and saying hi to the people on the boats. We strolled by the river many times and crossed its many bridges. Very romantic!

Cruisie the Seine After Dark!. The evening cruise on the Seine was so beautiful it will last in my mind's eye forever! The major buildings are lit up at night and the reflections on the water are just gorgeous. I took several photographs and especially enjoyed seeing the Eiffel Tower lit up and sparkling on the hour. It was definitely a highlight of my visit.

A Romantic Evening Not To Be Missed!. Bateaux Parisiens - Premier service- very expensive but well worth it for a special occasion. Table for two at front of boat, champagne, red AND white wine...excellent food...sooooo romantic as you cruise along the Seine seeing all the sights floodlit at night. Good subtle live entertainment. A wonderful one-off experience!

Imsomma. The only nice thing about boat trip on the Seine is that u can see more Paris, more hidden corners, more historical places, that might be closed from ur eye while riding round the city in the bus.
Take a boat trip down the river. Batobus HOHO was a great way to get to the sights along the river without squeezing on the busy metro

Interesting river. the river Seine has fascinating history and is definitely the life blood flowing through the city.I found the cruise we did was very overcrowded, a bit rough and ready and not that comfortable. I would choose a different one next time.It was probably one of the cheaper ones.

Amazing. One of our favorite Paris memories. We went at night. The bridges lit up were amazing. There is no other way to see them like this. Loved the views of Paris at night from the river. It was magical.

Boat cruise. This evening we took the one hour Bateaux Parisienne tour. This left from just near Notredame and required no prior booking. The ride itself was great just on sunset, but the commentary could have been much better. It was hard to hear, then it was hard to understand and there just was not enough information. I come from a country that has some of the longest inhabited areas but our recent history is nowhere near as rich ( in my opinion) as European history. Every part of the Seine,both banks and buildings, has a story to be told, so why not share it with visitors to this wondrous place. A worthwhile experience, just room for improvement.

Fun to walk. This is a great place to stroll along....both sides. If it weren't for the River Seine and the Eiffel Tower I would have lost my bearings a lot. It's a fun place with lots happening no matter what time of day...wedding's, photo shoots, people watch.

chose the right time. The Seine is the heart of Paris, it flows through the city and draws Parisiens and visitors like a magnet. Photographers wishing to capture the river at its best should spend a day at least getting to know the river, its many splendid bridges and wonderful architecture before opening their camera cases. It is beautiful in the right light.
See Paris in style... See Paris on a different view by the River Seine. It's a good way to miss the traffic and the crowd and just relax. I also like the river because it seems clean.
The Seine by Batteaux. Wonderful, relaxing way to see beautiful architecture along the Seine. Excellent narrative in English (multiple languages available).

The Amazing Seine. It is one of the best and most beautiful views of Paris, from the river. It is a perspective not to be missed. Whether is a dinner boat ride (a bit pricey but romantic) or a cruiser full of people, it is amazing. We took it at dusk, watched the sun go down, and the lights go up in Paris, it was magical to see the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower, lit up, Notre Dame and all the great architecture along the river. One can see that this is where life began in Paris.

Love it. Went on a cruise, and just love viewing the sights.Have been to Paris many times, and every trip I always cruise the Seine. I love the buildings, love seeing the people walking along the edges, love the many beautiful bridges, you see the Eiffel Tower as well.

The river calls to thee!. I took a boat tour up and down the Seine at night. It was very good and they had music playing. Roomy boat and comfortable seating. The river goes by so many sights and is just as nice during the day.

CRUISING THE SEINE. We enjoyed using the Batos Boats, as it rained almost incessantly. They are useful as hop on, hop off to explore sites along the river when walking is not pleasant. You never tire of looking at the unique Parisian landscape, (despite the bad weather when we visited!).

Just a beautiful walk in a beautiful city!. It is so relaxing to walk by the river Seine, with all the historic sights there in view. Sometimes you are walking by the Eiffel Tower, other times by Notre Dame. Don't miss having dinner at some of the many excellent, reasonably priced restaurants in the Latin Quarter as you pass by!

Le Marina de Paris - Sensational Dinner Cruising. The most romantic and un-cheesy dinner cruise on the Seine which exceeded my wildest dreams. Perfect and beautifully delivered with delicious and imaginative food. Well worth booking.

Romantic river. just like Nile river but of course smaller and narrower than Nile river.
I fell in love with it. and it is highly recommended to have a cruise for couples.
Bateau Boat Tour. We took this at night and it rocks. Beautiful lights, just an hour, we sat outside and listened to the narrative audio tour in English. Very pretty, well worthwhile.
nice but it smells :). it was a nice atmosphere to walk along the river... it smells bad the view is beautifil.. definitely should take a walk along the Seine.
Boat on the Seine. Lots of bridge kisses on this tour. We learned alot about the buildings we passed. Wished it was a longer tour, but it gave us the highlights.

The River Seine is a Peaceful way to see the City. We got a ticket that allowed us to take several trips on the river. It stopped at the six main stops. We found it to be a great way to see the city. It was a little cool and windy even during the day but a break from getting to places via the subway. It was very romantic after seing the Eiffel Tower to go back toward the Hotel via the Seine River, we were about the only ones on the boat and it was a mild night after it stopped raining. It was very special. I highly reccomend taking at least one trip on the river while you are there.
Its a boat tour. Saw lots of bridges, great architecture, had to hold large, bulky speaker to hear tour. Didn't realize the back of the boat had an open air access until the last. Look around.
Great way to see paris. If you take the bato bus, you'll have seen heaps. Paris is beautiful from the river. Love the bouquinistes along the river as well - selling vintage prints, books etc.

River Seine cruise. Good food, wine and service. Our table was right next to a glass window where you can see the different sites. They had musicians playing the violin and piano. There was so much activity that we missed some of the sites in the itinerary. Notre Dame and Eiffel Tower should be viewed during the day and from the River Seine at night.

must be do!. Especially dinner cruise is very romantic, it is also alittle bit expensive but this is normal for Paris! Parisien and Botaux Mouche are the best companies. we did with Parisien, it was wonderful! sotrongly recommended!

walk along river seine. we took a walk along the river Seine, it was breath taking, beautiful buildings , and churches all along the river Seine, one can take cruise along the river as well , and you can purchase ticket which can use for two days, its like an hop on and hop off system when you on the cruise, can get off at any stop along river and as well as board it again. very pleasant cruise along the Seine, recommend a trip on the seine a must, one of high lights of Paris.
Great Boat Trip. Took a one hour cruise and it was brilliant. Views from the river are marvellous and give a completely different perspective.

Another way to see the city. There a number of bateaux on the river. We selected one that left from the foot of the Eiffel Tower. The trip was about and hour and fifteen minutes. We had a good commentary on the historic sites along the river, heard about the 39 bridges that traverse the river and motored along the river around Ile de cite and Ile St. Louis and around the islands back to the tower. It is a great trip night with the lights of the city or on a clear day. Your perspective changes of the sites and you are out of the hustle and bustle of the buses, cars and tour groups wandering the sites above. There are lots of good photo opportunities while you chill out and learn something new about the city of lights.
Nice river to go cruising. But full of dirt and boats. I don;t think the cruise without dinner is worth it to tell you the truth

nice stroll on a sunny day. A great place to take a walk or catch a breath. There are 32 bridges on the river in Paris, some of them more impressive than others. The Oldest bridge is the Pont Neuf. If you are the kind of person who likes watching boats this is a great spot.There are floating restaurants, discos, cafes and free benches for all those who are just as happy to enjoy the same view with their own wine, bread and cheese from a local grocer. confused about the terms right bank and left bank? The system is very simple and was devised because the river's curvy nature often does make orientation difficult. The trick is to remember when you face downriver the left bank is on your left and the right bank is on your right. If you can't figure out which way the water is flowing (don't look at the boats, they go upstream too) drop a leave or look for some debris and see which way it's floating.

A pleasant and relaxing way to see Paris. We traveled down the Seine several times while in Paris, and found it to be a nice relaxing and pleasant time away from a very busy schedule. You were able to see so much of Paris while floating down the river. We went once just as the sun was setting and got some spectacular pictures of the Eiffle Tower. A very nice break from a busy visit. Loved the river trips.

A Must in Paris. A trip on the River Seine was a must do for us, and I expect many others, it was a delight to cruise along and see Paris from a different aspect. What a beautiful city., make sure you do it.

Trip along the seine. We took a tour boat trip along the seine. There are many to choose from we just chose the boat house with the biggest queue. It was a lovely calm boat ride with a telephone apparatus that talked about the history and lots of information about the seine. I would definitely recommend a trip along it as there is so much interesting history and places to see from the river.

under paris. The Canal St Martin boat trip is woth doing. Travelling through many lochs and under the streets of Paris was an interesting experience and at times quite exciting. It is a two hour trip leaving from Musee D'Orsay.
It's not Just another river.... There is much to see and enjoy along this river be it tours by boat or by foot or even by bicycle. The highlights are the bridges and the array of architecture

Evening boat tour. We decided on the evening boat tour on our last night in Paris. It was sunset and a perfect way to end our trip! We took the Bateaux company that left from Point Neuf near the Île de la Cité. They do some narration along the way and if you time it right you can even see the Eiffel "Sparkle" as it does on the hour!

Spectacular. We took the dusk Parisienne Bateau boat ride around The Eiffel Tower along the Seine River..Well worth the trip..Beautiful at dusk saw the Eiffel Tower blinking lights as we returned to the dock..Such a sight to see..recommend this trip highly..
Gotta see it. As everyone says it is just so romantic. Ignore the Eastern Europian scam artists everywhere and enjoy the bridges, take a boat ride. Just soak up the most romantic city in the world.

A Dinner Cruise on the Seine is a Must. Enjoy a 5-course meal, complete with all the wine and champagne to accompany the meal, as you cruise the Seine and enjoy the iconic landmarks of Paris illuminated and up close.

Go for an opern air boat trip in good weather. I have done a trip on the Seine several times and this time did it with Bateaux Parisiens. It was the least enjoyable of all my visits because it was a single deck, inside only boat, we were near the back with the noisy engine and visibility wasn't great. The audio guides were pretty poor as well. A previous trip on the top open air deck of a different boat was much better
do it. this is something you just cannot miss, go across from the tower just before dark and you will be mesmerised by the tower in the dark lovely x
Great way to see Paris. Catch a river cruise from near the Eiffel Tower and see Paris from the River Seine. Well worth a trip.

fast flowing and clean. our last morning we walked along right next to the river as far as the tip of Ile de la cite....you get a different feel... away from the traffic and all the people... there was only the occasional jogger or dog walker... you also get a different perpective on the various bridges you pass... there are plenty of stairs along the way if you want to go back up to the roadside.... peaceful...

A Relaxing Cruise. If you haven't got the time to see everything you want along the river, the cruise is the best choice. It is relaxing and informative. It also provides you with a prime position for taking pictures of all the famous buildings.

River tour. After going up the Eiffel Tower, we took a boat tour of the Seine. Our tour price included a soda and crepe which were great on a hot July day! The river tour was relaxing and informative as you float by many of the Paris landmarks. We did the tour that is across the street from the Eiffel tower and to the left, down the stairs along the River.
Picnic. We sat on the banks of the Seine and had Wine, Chesse and bread for a romantic picnic, very serene...

Walk it, cycle it, boat it!. It's hard to give a rating for the Seine.At different parts of it, I have walked it, cycled and also taken one of the 'bateaux mouches'.There are many different faces of the Parisian Seine, and I loved all of them.I don't know how it will be in the winter; however in the summer it was feel of people from tourists to local students - different crowds at different spots.Especially in the summer, this seems to be one of the most lively parts of the city, with people having picnics, playing music, or just walking around.Once you've seen the Paris of the monuments, this is the Paris of the people.
Seine River. you must take the boat ride down the Seine river to enjoy more of Paris it allows you to get on and off at your leisure

Bouteux Parisean - Lunch Cruise. This was one of the highlights of our trip. We booked the lunch cruise down the River Seine during our recent trip to Paris. From start to finish this was a top-notch experience. I received online confirmation of my reservation. They checked us in quickly when we arrived. Tip: book ahead of time online through Bouteux Parisean, not tour companies. Although in Oct. the tour was not full, so you could even book it at the Seine pier when you arrive if you want to take a chance. The food and service were excellent! We were given champagne, and wine. All of the Bouteux Parisean staff was professional and friendly.It was a relaxing, gorgeous tour of Paris by boat. The singer on the cruise was even fantastic. A must to do when in Paris! I would do it again - no doubt!
River boat tour. It is worth taking a boat trip during the early part of your visit as it allows you to gain perspective and glimpse areas you may not have time to explore.

Batobus. Take the Batobus and hop on and off all day, to see the major sights of Paris - an excellent and relaxing way to see the attractions. Plus the staff are really helpful and knowledgable.Pay for 1-2 or week long passes, it saves time and money, oh, and leg work

If you don't walk the Seine River paths you'll miss out on so much!. The pathways along the Seine River have wonderfully clear views of the buildings that will astound you and make you ooh and ahhh. Don't miss crossing each bridge (especially the Pont Alexandre II) as you come to them as each crossing has either statues, "love / promise locks", views of the river, and other wonderful secrets you can discover. Down by the Eiffel Tower the pathway has a photography display from around the world that very interesting to walk among. At night you can see the "City of Lights" in all the buildings and attractions and enjoy the displays while taking a leisurely stroll. The Good: The sights, seeing the city unobstructed from the river and all the historic buildings that make up ParisThe Bad: some of the bridges can be very crowded with people, bicycle and motor vehicle traffic so be watchful and careful.The Ugly: There are Gypsies that will try and swindle you (they will amazingly pick up a "gold" ring right in front of you LOL we had 2 right in a row do the same trick) or keep you distracted to pick your pockets and lots of beggars.On the scuba bubble scale I give this river 7 out of 10 bubbles.

Take a river cruise. I suggest the evening City of Lights tour. It is a riverboat and tour given in multiple languages and at night. I don't particularly like the restaurant boats as you pay rather high prices for mediocre food, are packed in and cannot enjoy the sights.
Great sights along the river. Although our cruise along the river was a bit too chilly and the commentary in english was hardly audible, the river with its myriad bridges didn't fail to impress.

Visit from Australia once again. Of course when in Paris what do you have to do ,go for a river cruise on the River Seine.. Think of the song "Under the bridges of Paris". Delightful way to spend a few hours, morning ,noon or night. Not expensive, just sit back & relax & enjoy.

It's a river.... surrounded by great buildings, churches, life, street vendors, coffee. It's not so much the river and river boats, its the life that is on both sides of the river that is interesting.

A walk not to miss!. How could one go to Paris and not stroll along the Seine? You can't and you shouldn't, as that stroll will take you by all the sites, from the library, to Nortre Dame, to the Eiffel Tower, and then over to the Champs Elysees, wonderful!

Take the bateaux mouche ride on the Seine at Night. They don't call it the "City of Lights" for nothing. Which is why the tour on the Seine via boat should be done at night. Weather permitting, sit on the top and have the breeze on your face as you are driven by the Eiffle Tower and Notre Dame. We did not take the dinner tour, as we did not have the time, but we had plenty of time at the 9pm tour to enjoy the ride. A quick tip: If it's chilly, bring a blanket...it's worth being outside of this trip. Also, throw in a small bottle of wine and some glasses...makes for a romantic time!

Great way to see Paris. What a great way to see Paris is on a boat. Floating along the seine passing notre Dame cathedral, Eiffel tower in the background and the beautiful architecture along the seine is magnificent. The commentary on the boat adds to the experience. A must when in Paris.

Beautiful way to see parts of Paris. There are many companies that do boat tours of Paris and many have English speaking tours. But my first two visits to Paris I chose to use the Batobus. It is the least expensive and is basically a hop on hop off boat ride without an audio or live tour guide. You can stay on it as long as you like during operational hours. They are clean and convenient. There are a plethora of spots to view the Seine...to have a picnic, absorb the beauty, or to take a nap!

Dusk boat ride on Seine River. While I enjoyed my visit during day, one of mt top experiences was our boat ride before & at dusk. (chartered rides available). What a perfect ending to our daytime adventures with the most gorgeous sunset colors . . . nothing more peaceful than gliding down the river on an early June evening while viewing all the surrounding landscape.

OK Way to See Some Sights. Took the cruise right before sunset. Big boat, big crowd. Crowds are the theme for Paris. At least it was an opportunity to take a load off the feet from walking all day and take in some sights.

relaxing view. A very pleasant 1hr+ spent viewing the sights! Went on Bateau boat cruise so no commentary as on previous cruise some years ago.Enjoyed it but having a commentary definitely adds to the experience.
see Paris architecture from the river. Did a 3 hour tour with dinner on a boat down the Seine, lovely calm way to appreciate the architecture of Paris
Now this is Paris. What a lovely place to take a bottle of wine some cheese, bread and fruit and sit and watch the boats go by and the sun sets. Very relaxing and oh so Parisian to do! Bonsoir!
Nice cruise. Day cruise was very nice and relaxing. Interesting to see Paris sights from a different perspective. Audio guide in English was helpful.

Batobus is a must. Walking along the Seine is great to soak up the sites & sounds but if you want to get from one place to another the Batobus is a must. You can see the same views as the tour boats and you are able to get off at any of the eight stops along to Seine to visit the adjacent attractions. We bought a two day pass, only €3 more than a one day pass, not really knowing how we would use it. But with unlimited number of journeys it proved very worthwhile.

Buy a Lock. Walking the Seine on a Sunday afternoon will be like a little trip into graciousness. People well dressed and quietly conversing are interspersed with young atheletes running and young lovers caressing. It is magical. Delightful. So Parisian. Take time and take a little stroll.

River cruise. Went on this absolutely amazing we dined took in the views which are lovely at night the French music made it so romantic for our anniversary food amazing and quite filling I even got a red rose from the waiters they were very pleasant and couldn't do enough for us photos taken as well lovely
Still there!. Yep, You can walk along it, sit by it, watch people. Just like people have done for centuries! Try to stay up wind however. Sometimes it smells bad.
See Paris from a different perspective. Do a canal tour both night and day. Such a lot to see and you are bound to get a great commentary of the sights as seen from the Seine.

Seine River Cruise. My husband and I visited Paris France this past summer ( August 2013). One of the nicest experiences we had was a lunch cruise on the Seine river. It nicest to book an outside view seated by the river and not the middle of the boat. We had the hotel concierge book it for us and then took a cab. You have a choice of several entrees along with an appetizer and dessert. Also, red or white wine is served based on your selection of entree. A singer walks around the boat and sings songs in French. One of the highlights is at the end when the boat approaches the Statue of liberty . They then play the music real loud and its the song "New York, New York" ( the English format of course) It so nice to view all the happenings on the River. Great pictures of museums......especially the Louvre.

Good intro to Paris. Just got of the plane....got into apartment...not really wanting to do much else....great thing to do for your first activity. Walk down to the river and hop on to one of them....When you come around the river and see the Eiffel Tower for the first time, it is very impressive.

Not to be Missed: Night Cruise on the Seine. Along with our friends my wife and I took a night cruise on the Seine. The trip is a loop that goes in one direction to the Eiffel, which is spectacular. If lucky you will go by when the lights on the tower are turned on for 5 minutes. The boat then loops back toward Notre Dame cathedral and beyond. It is a guided tour so you have the opportunity to learn about some of the more well known sites along the Seine.

The romantic Paris..... Just standing on the bridges, watching the tour boats and barges floating below, with the backdrop of the most romantic city in the world.....I can feel the emotions still. The river that flowed through Paris when it was a small Roman fortress, still streams placidly along. I am so privileged to have seen it myself!

Beautiful sights along the Seine. We took a water tour.. We recommend getting tickets to a water tour. We took BatoBus but there are a lot of choices. Batobus sells week long passes. For four people, two adults and two children it cost about $80. You get to hop on and off at all the beautiful sights. It's a great way to get around. The captain speaks French, Spanish and English as he describes the sights seen. There are a lot if beautiful bridges to see. We recommend BatoBus.

Batobus. Loved going up & down river Seine on the batobus. No queues and a beautiful way to see Paris. All good sights along the river where we got on & off. Loved looking at the architecture and bridges which were much prettier than I thought.

The path to see the best of Paris. If you are going to Paris, the best way to visit most of the attractions is quite simple...just follow the River Seine...at least 90% of the attractions are close or besides this river and also, the path and views are amazing. The best place to go for a romantic walk or have a good time with friends with a good wine...just embody the French style and enjoy it.Se voce estiver indo para Paris, o melhor jeito de visitor a maioria das atracoes e muito simples...apenas siga o Rio Seine...pelo menos 90% das atracoes sao proximas ou do lado deste rio e o caminho e muito bonito e otimo para uma caminhada. O melhor lugar para uma caminhada romantic ou para passer bons momentos com amigos tomando um bom vinho. Apenas incorpore o estilo frances de ser e aproveite.

Romantic + Interesting. Very romantic strolling along the Seine & interesting to view all the happenings along the river. We had locks made and engraved in the US before we left and everyone loved "locking" their lock, making a wish and tossing the key into the river, delightful! We took a cruise down the Seine at sunset which again was romantic and interesting, we passed some outdoor party areas filled with young people, the historic sites, the views, a must do when in Paris!

The historic Seine!. Thoroughly enjoyed the evening cruise from Pont Neuf (on the vedettas - smaller boats) - not expensive, and if you time it right, you will pass by the Eiffel Tower when it is "twinkling." Skip the dinner cruises - just enjoy yourself and watch the lights of Paris float by for an hour or so. During the day, take a walk and enjoy the wares of the bouquinestes (green boxes on the river where books, prints are sold - very interesting history - they are now a UNESCO site, too).

Nothing Special. Took one of many Seine river cruises. Took a half an hour to get to the Eiffel Tower, then a slow 180 degree turn and a half hour back. Our tour had French/English commentary on the way to the Eiffel Tower, then no commentary at all coming back. The highlight was my first close-up view of the Eiffel Tower. That was impressive. Otherwise you can get a much better experience just walking the same area that the boat covers, plus you will get to see a lot more as the river has concreted banks and walls along the entire length of the tour and you really can't see any significant distance back from the river due to the high banks.

Don't miss on your Paris trip !. The river is beautiful day or night. I took the night cruise and enjoyed the city in lights. Easy boat ride that will not make the rider motion sick (and I always get sick) have a cocktail and sit on top to enjoy the best views

Never enough,always exiting. We can't count how many times we have been to Paris and we always stay very close to the SeineLove walking along,looking at the books ,people, eating near by....In the early morning or late at night...The best about Paris.

Not just another river!. Know matter the bridge the views are different in each direction. You can get confused by river. If you are standing on a bridge and the water is flowing away from you then to your left is the left bank. This helps keep you orientated by twisting and turning of the rivers direction.

Cultured. We took a boat ride along the Seine during our visit which lasted approximately 1 hour and cost €13 each. I enjoyed the tour and in particular I enjoyed viewing all of the historical buildings and bridges along the way. It certainly gave me a good sense of what the city was all about before I went wandering on foot. I was impressed with the banks of the Seine and would love to go back and wander along the banks on a warm Summers evening, it was simply too dark and cold to do same in October.
Great way to see the City. I recommend that tourists do the boat trip before seeing all of the sights. It helps you to get your bearings, and see the different parts of the City.

So much to see, so little time.. You must take a river cruise (and there Re a few) or just stroll by the river by foot. You will get more mileage by taking a cruise and will see about 18 attractions. You can get the hour cruise or get on and off all day cruise. Whatever you decide a must do on everyone's list. Lots of stalls up above selling souvenirs, books, art work. We actually saw a bride and groom taking pictures by the river seine and lovers holding hands and kissing. It is just such a romantic area.

Nothing Special. If you expect a romantic river with grass-lined riverbanks, look somewhere else. This is just an ordinary river lined in concrete, as is most of Paris. Certainly nothing romantic about it.

Cruise is a good way to see the area. We booked a tour through Cityrama that included the river tour, the Eiffel Tower and a bus around the city for our first night in Paris. We didn't do the dinner, but since we got into Paris early afternoon, we had time to unpack and get acclimated to the area and how to get to the tour office.
