Taking the River Cruise was timed so we got to see the great sights of the museums and Notre Dame during daylight, and at sunset as we were turning around to dock, we say the Eiffel Tower, that is just steps away from the cruises light up. We had the bonus of having tickets for the tower, and then a narrated bus ride around the other city attractions at night. FABULOUS beginning of our 4 days!
River tri glass top boat lunch. Glass top Bateaux for Sunday lunch was brilliant lovely views, nice staff, food not so good but only 2 hours long.

paid more for too little. Our choice was the highly rated Bateaux Parisiens lunch tour. We paid extra to sit in the glass enclosed front of the covered boat. The extra glass provided a good view of one side of the river going and the other side returning, However, the sound system did not work in the overpriced front of the boat soooo we had no explanation as to what we were passing or approaching. Additionally, the extra glass made the area hot and a bit uncomfortable. The food was ok and the service was mediocre. Buyer beware!

Dinner Cruise truly AMAZING!!. My husband and I enjoyed the best ever dinner cruise on the Seine River while visiting Paris in September. The cruise was callled Carte Bancaire Emv Banque Populaire Rivs de Paris.Was truly magical and seeing the Eiffle Tower all lit up and sparkling while sailing by was something that will always stay in my mind. Best memories of Paris and what an amazing way to see all the wonderful sites of Paris than enjoying a fabulous meal while sailing down the Seine River! Was worth every penny!!

The Event of Paris. If you have only one thing to choose, do the river dinner. Dress up, purchase the side window (front not worth the extra money, not on a window is not experiencing all one needs to) and be prepared to wine and dine. This is the best view of Paris.

Best way to see Paris!. We only had a few hours to see Paris and this was recommended! We took a river cruise and it was the best advice we received! We had a ten hour layover on our way to Latvia so we headed into Paris and took a one hour cruise down the Seine. Sure, we couldn't go IN any of the museums or attractions we saw but we had great views of the city.It was a beautiful day, temps were a little cool but not bad. We could see the Lock Bridge, the Notre Dame Cathedral, the Louvre, and many, many other famous attractions of Paris! So beautiful, for first time visitors, a must!

Batobus well worth while. Batobus is a takeoff on the Hop on Hop off red busses around many tourist cities. This is a Seine Bateaux that only runs during the day and stops at eight docking stations on either side of the river. Examples are Gare Dorsay Museun, Notre Dame, Eiffel Tower, some misc gardens and the zoo, Louvre Museum, etc. fare is 15 euro, stops are spaced about 15 to 20 minutes between stops. The big advantage of course is that the boat is not in the Paris traffic and not an underground Metro trip where the sights are rather minimal. The boats are clean, all clean glass for total viewing, and comfortable seating. Our first experience, but a very positive one. I think there are Paresians that use it as a commuter vessel.
Cruise at night. Take a river cruise at night. The city is beautiful lit up, they play the French music, it's charming. Z One of the highlights of our trip.
River Seine by boat--magnifique. Evening barge trips are the best but lovely anytime. Eiffel Tower and other sights are lit at night.

Beautiful Scenery!. The River is beautiful overall, there is so much going on around it. You can walk past the river, cross many bridges and shop along the river. All of the house boats are very neat to see as well. It's interesting to think where all of these people come from, all the boats are so different from one to the next. I have to say it does smell kind of icky in some areas but that's to be expected. We took a river cruise which was very nice to see the city from the water. A definite must do for anyone visiting Paris!
Boat and bus!. Try to get the red bus ticket which includes an hour boat trip on the Siene - so worth it after a long day of walking around! Value for money!

Cruise. Absolutely breathtaking at night. To see all of the lights and see the Effel Tower with likes and the beautiful bridges and the calmness of the people on the side of the Seine having wine and treats was so relaxing.
Ile St Louis. Fantastic to walk along the banks to get away from the hustle and bustle... So romantic... If with your partner bring a padlock <3

Dinner on the Seine. If you would like a memorable experience, take a dinner cruise on the seine . You will have a delightfull meal whilst enjoying the sights of Paris,even the Eiffel Tower lit up at night. Simply wonderful
Boat-trip down the Seine was amazing. 1 hour round trip down the river on one of the hire boats, some amazing sites and scenery to view. Some of the agriculture is unbelievable.

Do the river cruise dinner at night - it's spectacular. We loved our dinner cruise down the Seine River - it was easily one of the best things we did on our trip. Very romantic, very beautiful, and the food was amazing (we booked through Bateaux Parisiens.) A great way to spend the evening and to see the attractions lit up as you cruise down the river (including likely seeing the Eiffel Tower sparkle once or twice!)

See all the locks on the bridges, avoid the river cruise. This was the second time in the river cruise. I would skip it. You can see the same from the road. But be sure and ask someone about the locks on the bridge.

Bateaux Parisien cruise is a must!!!. Take the Lunch cruise on the Seine after a visit to the Eiffel Tower,spend a bit more on the champagne lunch selection for the best seat and 360 degree panoramic viewing windows. The food was surprisingly good on a pure tourist trap operation as was the service, the wines and champagne complemented everything nicely. The time slid by like the various monuments and museums. Well worth it!!!

You take a book ride. No trip to Paris would be complete without tacking a boat ride along the river. Buy a get on get off ticket as it goes pass a lot of attractions. Pick a beautiful summers day and you will not be disapointed.
A lovely view!. We spent many hours walking along the Seine to get to and from our hotel/other destinations and also took an evening cruise - FABULOUS!!

Beautiful. It was a bitterly cold and wet day for a walking tour of Paris but once we got to the river we immediately forgot about the miserable weather and just wandered along both sides of the river taking in the sights using our imagination as to what it would feel like on a nice war spring day.Just wander along the river with a map that indicates what the sights are and who knows where it will take you.

a must do when you're in paris. bring a camera. I'm serious, the view when you get on a ship on Seine is just beautiful, you even see Eiffel's tower from it, Musee d'Orsay and many other things. But if you don't take the boat trip, you can also enjoy.. take a stroll down the river or just sit by the river with drink and enjoy because it's lovely, I, myself have done both of those things and I really enjoyed... you should definitely not miss this out, because you'll eventually regret it, so visit this <3regards

is a must. if you go to Paris, you need to take a tour on the river sienna in afternoon when the sun is not strong. The speaker on the boat explained each building very carefully that were across the river. The speaker spoke many languages. The chairs on the boat were very comfortable. I could rest my back.

Take a river boat cruise. There are several river boat cruises that can be taken from nearby the Eiffel Tower. Also dinner and night cruises are available. The trip goes past many of the main sights with a commentary. Brilliant.

Lovely Sunday Stroll. Nothing beats a walk along the Seine in the early fall. It was Sunday afternoon with a little chill in the air, lots of French families enjoying the sunshine, watching the boats float by. You can see many of the famous sights as you slowly stroll the day away!

Worth it if you can find a quiet spot. We were trying to fit in by doing the whole picnic on the Seine. It was so worth it! We found a nice quiet little spot, popped open our wine, and munched on our olives and crackers.
Good and Big. There are many special and differents brigdes. Good to relax and take a boat. Have not diferets smells. Leave a lock on bridge close the back Notredame.

Lights of Paris. Another way to see lights of Paris is to book one hour river cruise at night. Loading dock is on same side as Eiffel tower. Be first in line to get better spot on top deck. Depend of time of year might be chilly.You will be amazed by this short tour and you will see Paris and lights from different prospective
refreshing view on the Paris. If you go to Paris with kids, then I recommend to take Seine cruise - kids will love the atmosphere and nice views on the city.
Clean and well maintained. The river has several cruises and can be taken on the night . Though I did not have much time to see it through the night. Its certainly a worth while tour during night.

Seine dinner at night. We went on a seine dinner cruise..great way to see most sights,paris looks great at night,great view of Eiffel Tower too. Dinner was quite good and I recommend this as a nice way to start a night.
Tour. We took the tour option and had no regrets, the view of all the famous landmarks form a different viewpoint without all the walking!

Cruising on the Seine is a tour of French history. The river Seine runs through the middle of Paris. It is fair to say that when you take one of the many boat tours on the river, you will get a summary history of the city. We love to take a boat both during the daytime and the evening when the twinkling lights of Paris seduce you.Even if you just sit in a cafe at river level which you can do in a number of places( beneath the Alexander Trois bridge on the left bank and also down near Notre Dame also on e left bank) you can become mezmerized by the boat traffic. It is not as dramatic as the port of Hong Kong but still fascinating. When we take a boat, we prefer the Vedettes de Paris, which one can get at the foot of the Eiffel Tower or near the Pont Neuf end of Ile de la Cite. This company is smaller than the Bateaux Mouches and the chairs seem more comfortable. Either comapny will offera very reasonably priced and interesting tour. There is another company that runs the Bat-o-bus, which is like a water taxi. You can get on and off at one of many famous tourist sites along the Seine. One place you can pick it up is at the foot of the Eiffel Tower but check their website for other locations. it is more expensive but offers a speedy way to get from one site to another.You can walk along the Seine at river level, in many parts of Paris, and this can be fun. In the summer, there is a beach and palm trees, and tropical drinks. On Sundays, you can also bike along the Seine in several places.It offers something for everyone, including runners who want to get away from the traffic and be inspired by the river.Outside of Paris, the Seine meanders through bucolic countryside and can be fun either for a short trip or an extended visit of the countryside.
Hop on Hop off Cruise. The Batobus 'Hop on Hop off Cruise' is a pleasant and leisurely way see the City. From Eiffel Tower, Musée d'Orsay, to the Île de la Cité.

River Tour. I would recommend the hop on hop off boat near the eiffel tower, it is 14 euros each and the ticket is valid for the whole day. You can see quite a lot using the boat and it avoids the traffic problems around Paris.
Viva la France!. There is something about Paris...and this river at night. True it is not the cleanest, but leaving that aside, you can find the charm in this beautiful city :)

Best place to relax with great views of Paris monuments. Walking to all monuments along side the banks of river is highly recommended. It is also good place to do picnic with kids. Sundays mornings are even better and quieter.Try to find a cleaner place to sit since some areas are very dirty.

River Seine. You can't really miss it. At some point you'll either be crossing it, going underneath it or going alongside it, whether you are walking, cycling, on a bus, metro or taxi. It is the beauty of Paris, with all it's bridges, having been witness to the history of this city.Stop and take it in.

The magic of the River Seine.. On our last two visits to Paris we have used the river cruises during the day to see most of the famous sites. It is easy to use the hop on & off cruises and adds that little extra to your trip. On reading some of the reviews for night time cruises may-be we will try them on our next visit.

Paris from the Seine. It was late March and we got a €20 price for approx. 2 hours on a 1/3rd full boat. We got luckywith the weather as well. It is a great way to see at least the exterior of traditional Paris witha good commentary as well. It started and terminated opp. the Eiffel Tower and went as far as the Notre Dame Cathedral.The cruise solved our lunch decision as well as our boat moored right alongside a restaurantboat which was excellent value.All round it was a very good experince
Lovely ambience. It has everything, from boats for dining on, plenty of room to walk, lots of boats, easy to get on and off wherever you like, nice vistas, you can relax totally.
Boat tout. Awsome!!!Love the boat and abe tto hop on and off along the water.Whish that had brought and umbrella it rain on us.

Take a dinner cruise. The River Seine is magnificent at any time, but our lasting memory is the dinner cruise which started in daylight ( this was in October 2012) And we reached the Eifle Tower at dusk just as the lights came on. By the time we had turned around the Tower was at is sparkling best and provided a magnificent photo opportunity. The meal was also first class but that woudn,t have worried us as the scenery along the river at night is stunning
better at night. the river is busy with lot of cruise boats .At night, all bridges are lighted. People are on the banks having a good time and giving waves to people on the boats.
Romantic. River Siene is very romantic and just as described in all books and movies it may inspire you to sing...but trust me stick to sipping wine and it shall be better :)

Beautiful, day and night (:. We went for a stroll along the Seine on foot during the day, afternoon to be exact and it is beautiful. You will see things from a different perspective and also see stuff that you won't see anywhere else in Paris and again it is beautiful. We decided not to do the River Cruise as I had read that it was expensive but on the very last night of our holiday as we were near the Notre Dame, we saw a boat ticket stand and decided to check the prices which were at a very reasonable 14 euros each. I think it was one of the best hours in Paris. Seeing Paris from this river during the night is amazing especially if you're with your loved one.

Too crowded and noisy. We went on a sightseeing cruise with the Croisiere Bateaux Parisiens, along with what seemed like hundreds of other people. We were herded like cattle on to the boat and managed to wedge into some seats at the back. It must have been a day for school outings because kids sat along the side and screamed everytime we went under a bridge. It was impossible to hear the commentary on the phones located at each seat. Some good photo opportunities were provided as we passed the signature landmarks - Notre Dame Cathedral, Musee d"Orsey, etc. However, the whole experience was not worth the time or money.

a delightful way to spend a late summer's evening. We had a boat trip organised as part of an evening Fat Tire tour. Got on the boat at about 10pm and the views of floodlit Paris and Eiffel Tower were fabulous. An excellent way to finish off an evening tour of Paris.

Cruise day or night. Walking alongside the Seine is a lovely thing to do in Paris, but a river cruise day or night is another wonderful way to soak up the Parisian atmosphere. I do recommend Bateaux Parisiens only because they go every half-hour and do not wait to fill boats like some other companies do. Boats depart not far from the base of the Eiffel Tower. It's only a one-hour cruise and most companies offering cruises offer commentary in a variety of languages.

Inseparable part of Paris. If you are in Paris, and wish to see the attractions, and take in the Parisian atmosphere, a stroll along the Seine's banks, or crossing its bridges are a must! I would recommend this at sunset, when there still is a little light in the sky, but all the lights are on: a stunning impression of Paris, a classic! Enjoy!
River Seine. Lovely to see from atop a bridge, but lovely to take a River cruise and enjoy it even more! The experience was wonderful.

Stunning view. We took the seine river cruise as our hotel gave us free ticket. Just go to the area of Eiffel Tower site, there are many seine river cruise available there. Just buy the tickets on site. I truly recommend this activity as it offers very great and stunning view of Paris. We could see notre dame, louvre, Alexandre de pont and many other great buildings and glimpse of parisian's way of life from the boat. The cruise takes approximately 1 hour. We started to take the cruise 1 hour before sunset. On the way back to the port near Eiffel Tower, we had great time to enjoy sunset from the deck. It is truly magical and romantic way to enjoy paris. As we arrived back to the port near Eiffel Tower, wait there for another magical moment, the sparkling light of Eiffel Tower.
Bateaux mouches. Good value over an hour ,gives a good feel of centre of Paris and what to see also a sense of grandeur. Of a European city
Very Clean. It's a beautiful river that runs through Paris. It's clean and well maintained. There are boat rides to take and bridges that span the river everywhere you look.

Its a river. Well, although I like sight seeing, I couldn't see what was particularly distinctive about this river. While any river is always beautiful, especially now I live in London, it wasn't really a breathtaking sight.

Shame about the noise. We booked our Paris trip through National Holidays so our cruise ticket was in included in the price. Like every other part of our visit it was all a bit hectic. There must have been about 6 groups of school children, led by teachers who to my disappointment were ignorant enough to hold their arms out in front of our group in order to stop us getting on before them. Once we sat down the views were beautiful. Being able to see so much of the city whilst travelling along the river is a great experience but the huge downside was that every 2-3 minutes we passed under a bridge at which point every one of the hundreds of kids screamed and shouted. I know kids are kids but after the fifth or sixth time it got pretty annoying and the teachers showed no sign of caring. However, we still enjoyed the cruise and the river itself hosts some impressive scenery.

Relaxing 1 hour trip with historical commentary of Paris. It was really nice and relaxing to float down the river seine for an hour and get the historical commentary of all the buildings through a phone set in the chair and of course seeing all the beautiful museums from the boat allowed us to get some really nice pictures. The kids loved being on the boat and they take your picture before you board so was really nice to get that picture at the end which costs 10e. One of the bridges is full of padlocks where couples seal their love and throw the key into the Seine. Lovely to see the different bridges of Paris too. I think if we were to do it again we would go at night-time to see the lights. We went in the day-time cos of the young kids. It was nice to get a different angle of view of the attractions. You can also go out on the deck if you don't want to stay indoors or sit on top of the boat. I also suggest you pre-order this trip online before you go on it to skip the v long queues.

Romantic Stroll in Paris. Be a river cruise or just simply walking along Seine river are great activities you can do while in Paris. The views of the historical buildings from the river are magnificent. I recommend a night cruise as the city is like a dream at night.

Key part of any Paris Visit. The river is a key part of any visit to Paris in my view. I have enjoyed doing so my visits. Even on business, I always made time to walk or jog along its banks. It provides a key guide to where you are in the city - albeit sometimes confusing as it twists through the city.So many of the cities icons are located along or near it. Whether the Louvre, Musee Orsay, Notre Dame Cathedral, Pont Neuf, the Lock Bridge, Eiffel Tower, etc, is your destination, the river is there.The boats, barges and houseboats add interest and imagination opportunities to the experience nod it feels safe in the evening - not an easy achievement in today's busy cities.

Must do a River cruise. Well went on the night time cruise of the Seine and it was beautiful! The Eiffel tower was glittering just as we left for the cruise, the sky line of beautiful buildings was amazing and the host was lovely. This cruise was so good we decided to go on it during the day as well. Its such a lovely feeling sitting on the top deck with the breeze in your hair cruising the Seine in beautiful Paris. I loved it and definitely recommend this.
excellent. we cruised in the evening seeing all the sights of this beautiful city and the tower lights up every hour . It was amazing.
Lovely. Include a walk along the Seine as it is wonderful. Crossing the many bridges will also be a visual treat.
all aboard. No better way to appreciate the sites than by a cruise on the Seine. On board commentary very informative, totally relaxing, totally inspiring. A must do when in Paris.

Romantic Seine. A walk along the river is a must do. We walked up one side and crossed back and foe a few of the many bridges which is an experience in itself. One of the bridges is full of padlocks where couples seal their love and throw the key into the Seine.There are many places to eat and drink along the way. During our stay we also took an evening river cruise which lasted one hour. It started at the tower which was twinkling at the time of leaving. The lights of the buildings and bridges are amazing, passed under 21 bridges including the wish bridge. The tower was twinkling again on our return. A very romantic experience.

Well worth doing. Paris has some beautiful bridges. Lovely to see from a different viewpoint. Try to go in an open boat as the glass roofs can be dirty and hard to see through. Especially beautiful at night. Also a good way to get on and off at major attractions as you avoid the traffic. Metro is quicker though
Under the Bridges of Paris. Take a boat trip on this most romantic of rivers and see many of the main sites of Paris. The hop on/off boats are recommended and well worth the price.
A stroll alone the seine is Paris. If you spend any time at all in Paris walking alone the seine is unavoidable. It must be done.better take a boat ride either during the day or evening.

Vein of the city. A great place to walk or run along as there are paths and roads all along it. Also great for river cruises and also the restaurants along the banks. A bit dirty but that's to be expected. It's fun to watch the boats pass by from one of the bridges but I stroll along the seine is a must do in Paris.

Peaceful. I love water so anything on water is good for me. Went on the sightseeing tour along the Seine, on and off to see all that was to see, river fairly clean and lots of boats anchored in places and the river restaurants are plentiful.

Great fun. One of the good things about a boat trip down the river Seine is all the stuff you see. Forget about all of the boring tourist traps and look for the interesting stuff. Massive barges with cars on the back deck, vegetable gardens and lawns. Giant plastic bubbles. People doing weird stuff. What fun!
Take the cruise!. Had a very interesting hours cruise. The best way to aclimatise to your new surroundings. It gave us bearings to explore Paris during the week.

A scenic boat ride around river Seine. We took the boat ride to rest our weary feet from all the walking we have done but this boat ride which took about 90 minutes was great. Seeing almost all the monuments in another perspective like Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame Cathedral, the bridges, especially the one that lovers or couples will close their eyes as they pass through the bridge and make a wish and seal it with a kiss.A must try for anyone with weary feet or not, the best time is before dusk to see Paris come to life.
Beautiful. Lovely beautiful river and is a lovely attraction in the middle of the City. Lovely to get a boat trip on the Seine and is a great navigation tool. Lovely.

Boat trip on the River Seine. The batobus is an enjoyable way of getting around and seeing the many sights of Paris as it allows you to hop on and off at different places; the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame and the Louvre to name but a few. The glass roof and sides make it easy to see everything. It is fairly large and often busy but there is one about every 20 minutes. It costs about 15 Euros for an adult day pass.
Take a trip by night!. My first stop in Paris was at the hotel. The second one was at the Bateaux-Mouches late in the evening. It worths every cent!

a must do in paris. cruise down the river seine a must do, took a cruise as part of a dinner package, dinner on the 1st level of the Eiffel tower followed by river cruise absolutely brilliant , you see a lot more of paris

Magnificent. A must do in Paris, beautiful views of everything along the river banks. If you use the hop on hop off tour you have to include the river cruise as an option, it's the best way to see it all.

Iconic Paris location. A stroll along the Seine must the ultimate Paris "must do" - great to see the iconic bridges from a different viewpoint and hold hands walking along this busy and lively river. Our only warning is watch out for any puddles - the smell will tell you it isn't water (such a shame but seemed to be the case under every single bridge).We had a lovely wander along the banks, around the point of Ile de la Cite, and later in our trip a dinner cruise on Le Calife that took us past the Eiffel Tower just as the twinkling lights came on. Gorgeous. As well as being a lovely attraction in itself the river also serves as a useful landmark/orientation for exploring the city.
Great views and a great way to get around. We traveled on the Batobus and with other river operators. The Seine is a great river to get around Paris.

Nice River. I didn't get on a cruise, we just grabbed a beer and nibbles and sat by the river and watched the cruises passing by. whether you are considering a cruise or not, it is a part of Paris that is expected of you to see. Bateau Mouche is the most popular one is is a 1h30min cruise around Paris.

Beautiful at Night. We took a boat ride at dusk down the Seine and watched all the lights come on. We started and ended at the Eiffel Tower. I see why they call Paris "the city of lights". It was beautiful and majestic.

Drop your luggage and start on the Seine!. I always recommend starting your visit to Paris with a Bateaux-Mouche tour! It's the perfect way to orient to the city, you'll cover all the major monuments in 90 minutes and you'll learn some interesting details. I've joined friends visiting no fewer than 10 times over the last several years and I never tire of the ride. I highly recommend (can't stress this enough) taking the Bateaux-Mouche located on the Pont Neuf bridge called Bateaux Vedettes du Pont Neuf. Having sampled the various tours offered, if you speak English or French this is the tour for you. There might be spanish too, can't recall. If you take the "original tour" located at Pont Alma, you'll hear in EIGHT different languages, that's the Louvre, but you won't hear any additional details. For what it offers in multi-cultural capacity, it lacks in content.Our friends at Bateaux Vedettes du Pont Neuf offer a great tour for 8 or 9€ depending on the time of the day, and buying your tickets online is less expensive than walking up and paying 13€ at the time of arrival. They offer wine and beverages before departure and some you can take along for the ride. The boats are clean and safe and their staff is pleasant.Daytime in the sun is great, but seeing the city at night also has it's merit. No matter what time of day you pick, this should be on your TOP 5 things to do in Paris list!!!

Much better than it looks. A boat trip on the Seine river might look like a tourist trap, but it is actually, by far, the nicest way to see the city. A large majority of Paris' historic buildings were built along the river (the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame cathedral, etc. The full cruise lasts around 90mn, offers great views and a decent running description and commentary, and traffic jams are blissfully not to be feared.Highly recommended

In-Seine. Who would thing a smallish river running through a city could hold such joy, its a lively river, not just the tour boats but boats and barges or every nature ply the rivers course, from the boats on the river you can see so much of Paris' iconic beauty and famous monuments, the bridges are beautiful and the two Iles one with Notre Dame Cathedral and the other filled with quaint hotels and shops, to picnic on a bench with a bottle of chilled Champagne and a panini from one of the many local shops and watch the world go by is wonderful, the banks hold such history locals and tourist alike walk, sit and just relish being blessed with the time to enjoy this delightful part of Paris.

Crusing the Seine. We took a Impressionist artists tour on a tour boat. Saw the beautiful architectural along both sides of the Seine while listening to a young woman lecture on the works of Monet andManet. Would love to do a cruise on the Seine at night.

Lovely cruise.... We sailed for an hour in the evening on September 25, 2013. The first half hour was in daylight, the second half of the hour it was dark. We saw the views from two different angles...great time to sail... Friendly staff, safe boat captain piloting us....good price we paid

River Seine a beauty. Not only is the Seine a beauty, it's banks are lined with beauty abounding! So many sights to see, one can see something different each trip. And at night, the banks light up like the Eiffel Tower.
Nice walking. It's great to walk along the Seine and see what the locals are doing. Vendors are open at least four days a week with books, trinkets, etc.

Not just a river. This is the river that runs through Paris. We took a boat that makes 8 stops and you can get off and on all day. The bridges are all different and very interesting in their own right.

Excellent Panaramic Views. However you traverse the river do it. Hopefully it is not raining when you do. From the river you can see the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre and Notre Dame. You will wonder why the side railings on the bridges are different colors and what makes that so. People hook locks in the chains. The purpose of putting locks on the bridge railings is unknown to us. But there was a guy selling locks. For what we wondered.You might catch a view of two lovers kissing on the bridge or sitting on a bench on the side of the river. You might even catch a view of people walking their dogs. And depending on the time of day, you might even catch a beautiful sunset.Do this even if just to be able to say you did.
do it on a boat. go croze inone of the boats in the river!!! very nice very romantic. you can also stand on one of the bridges and jst watch it.

The City of Light is defined by the River Seine. The City is divided by the Seine River. With some exceptions, most of the big business commerce is conducted on the Right Bank which boasts some great sites as well, including the Louvre, the Tuilleries, l'Opera, Madelene, Place du Vosages, Place Concorde and many fine restaurants and shopping opportunities. It has a more urban feel than the Left Bank which, in my opinion, is more picturesque. The Left Bank is justifiably renowned for its many beautiful sites (the Eifel Tower, Musee d'Orsay, the Sorbonne, St. Germain des Pres, and lots of fine boutique shopping and restaurants. The Seine itself is a major attraction. Both during the day and at night, many people stroll along its banks or perch on its ponts to watch the views. There is an isle in the middle called the Ile de la Cite on which the Notre Dame Cathedral and St. Chappelle sit. But the river is not just a site for tourists to visit, it functions as it has for centuries as a major route of commerce.

Just amazing. We stayed right on the river near the Notre Dame Cathedral, we walked every night along different sections. There is nothing like walking arm in arm along the river on those balmy late September nights - magic!!

The heart of Paris. The Seine River was our guide line to to navigate Paris. I expected it to be smelly and dirty but no...just beautiful. Photo ops everywhere dividing Paris. If you have time just stroll along the river taking in the sights and sounds. It doesn't seem touristy at all. Many locals enjoying relrelaxing moments, musicians a d other street entertainers gather around different bridges but never too many. Just talented locals enjoying their day...not at all like street vendors.

Sheer enchantment. Dozens of songs and movies have romanticized the ancient walkway banks of the Seine. Nothing short of a personal walk along those storied paths with someone you care about can come close to conveying the true feeling. Browsing the artist stalls while watching the riverboats pass under the bridges could be the world's most romantic pastime. Standing in the middle of one of the less traveled bridges and observing the river in both directions is a rare treat.

A Paris must!. By a baguette, some cheese and wine and find a quite spot along the Seine in Paris to just sit, relax, people watch and boat watch! Guaranteed to be one of the best lunches you will have in Paris and so relaxing! Too often we get caught up iffy he sites and never truly just see Paris! Try a few sketches or write in your journal while there...you won't regret the time!
A Must when in Paris. Cruising on the river Seine is a must when in Paris.Delightful by day & spectacular by night.Get the feel of this romantic city.

" beautiful landscape ". The best way to look at it is paris by night boat trip on the river seine. A completely different paris by night, romantic and full of light. I feel like the world is entering a fairy. A boat trip on the Seine river to see the stunning architecture of the famous bridge in Paris was built on a 700 year period. Great view of many of the important places in the city. A boat trip on the River Seine lasted about an hour and we are very satisfied .. Paris deserves the most romantic city in the world out .. Me and my boyfriend are very happy to be here. We really love it
Eat and drink by the Seine. I love the Seine, i recommend going at night when all the Parisians are out, take some food and a bottle of wine and just relax...a perfect evening

Paris at night. The best way to see Paris at night - Paris city of lights!
Experience it your self & I am sure you will not regret adding this into your itenary.

Romantic heart of the city. You can't avoid the river if you visit Paris. A boat trip on the Seine reveals the stunning architecture of the bridges built over a 700 year timespan. Fantastic views of many of the important sites in the city. The trip we took had an audio visit in half a dozen languages which was well supplemented by the commentary of the hostess on board.

The river of lovers. Cruising under the bridges of the seine, at sunset, with your loved one (even if you have been married for almost 50 years), is an unforgettable experience. So, fall in love and cruise the Seine!

Cruise on the River Seine. I was told that aside from key museum musts, a cruise down the river is a first-timers requirement!Make sure to use the Bateaux Mouches company. There are a few river cruises but this one offers a guided tour down the River Seine. Be to sure to ask!!! Pro: The tour is amazing! You have your own head set (14 different languages). Con: You can only listen to the pre-recorded audio guide on the lower level, NOT the upper, completely open, endless view level.Pro: The lower level has windows that are open wide enough for you to take pictures without any glare.Con: You can't see all the monuments/structures/etc. from the lower level.Overall, well worth the money. You can always go again and sit on the top deck the second time around...at least you will know what you are looking at and the history behind it!

River cruise. I highly recommend taking one of the many river tours that are offered. We took an evening cruise that has inside and outdoor seating. The cruise took about 45mins and included a tour guide pointing out various sites along the way. The best photo opportunity is to get a seat outside.

Paris at Night. Lovely to see the city from another perspective. Paris is beautiful from any angle and seeing it from the River Seine is no exception. The cruise at night is a wonderful alternative as you see everything lit up in lights including the twinkling lights of the Eiffel Tower.
Great Views. Took a boat trip on the Seine which lasted for about an hour. Got to see lots of Paris sights and informative talk too

Take the one hour boat tour. Even though we walked the Seine on both sides, we decided to take the one hour boat tour on our last day in Paris. We are so happy we did. You have an audio guide to tell you the sites near the river. Really recommend to all.

Beautiful romantic river. So storied and just a great ambiance. We walked and cycled along the Seine several times, took one boat ride. Beautiful place to picnic, sit and people watch, get a great view from the many bridges, browse books at the green boxes along the river....

Not so special river. I don't know why everyone loves seine river. Comparing with other river in Switzerland, this river is quite dirty and too busy. No swan and too many boats on the river and cafe by the river.
It doesn't give any romantic feelings at all.
Beautiful, beautiful!. How wonderful to daily cross the bridges from the island to Paris proper. As soon as you cross, there are painters, book sellers etc. Paris at its best
must do. took a cruise down the seine, in all the years visiting, never did before and was quiet and serene way to see some of the sites and the crew very friendly.

Beautiful waterway. We stayed in the Latin Quarter of Paris and enjoyed walking along the River Seine on our way to Notre Dame Cathedral and to the Louvre. The bridges across are wonderful and it's a beautiful view of the city.

Take the dawn tour. One has to take a boat tour at the Seine. Especially at dawn when sun downs and lights are coming on. It is just great! We took one of those big ones and were thankful that the PA system did not work, so we could soak in the atmosphere without being disturbed by the electronic guide voice.

Ahhhh...the most romantic river in the world. This iconic ballet of a river moves through the heart of...in fact IS the heart of the City of Lights. You can ride on it (Bateau Mouch, Batobus) you can dance on it (many clubs on houseboats dot the banks), eat on it (dinner/lunch cruises; cafe/houseboats; grab a baguette and cheese and plop down), walk along it, bike along it (in summer there is the Paris Plage and on Sundays it becomes a giant party), flaner along it with a dog, a toddler, a lover; feed the ducks or fall asleep on a bench. You will find music and art and, yes, broken bottles from nights of revelry. Just cross any bridge...you might find an artist, a musician or you might want to take a photo of the thousands of locks that lovers and friends put there - pledging fidelity and throwing away the keys. The seine is the best freebee, I think, in all of Europe. You don't need a lot of money to just sit and take in the view...just time.

Beautiful scenery!. We took a one hour cruise and it was so lovely. Each attraction was lit up along the way including the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, each perfectly sculptured bridge, we have champagne and creeps on board and the tour guide told us some very interesting facts along the way!

Take the boat!. We bought tickets for 2 days on the batabus which is a covered boat that stops at all the sights along the Seine. You can get on and off wherever you like. It's a great way to see the monuments and wonderful to use when your feet can't take another step!

River Cruise. We went on a Sight Seeing River Cruise (1 Hour) we chose the night departure since we had already seen the city on the Open Bus - it is beautiful at night - especially the Tower all lit up

A Must See. Take a boat after dark and see the sights at night. Paris, after all, is a city of lights! We took an hour long boat ride with Champagne, but next time I think I would prefer a dinner cruise. Lots of boats to choose from.

just a river. not as beautiful as expected and the people on the banks sleeping in cardboard boxes was not nice.
the bridges were beautiful and we were surrounded by history

Beautiful River. You must walk along the Seine at night so you can see the boats that glide along quietly with everyone aboard them obviously enjoying the time on board. During the day take the Batobus, you can buy a 2 day ticket which is great as you can jump on and off, you can see what a lovely city Paris is from the river.

A great stroll.. One of my favorite places to walk. Avoid the hustle and bustle of the street, and walk along the Seine. Not only is it a peaceful and Parisian walk, but you can follow the river to all of your favorite monuments... from Notre Dame, to the Louvre, to The Eiffel Tower!

Included in Paris Pass. Get on the cruise ship at the Eiffle Tower. Takes approximately one hour for the complete tour. Tour guided in your choice on language. Very good at explaining the points of interest.
Batobus - great!. 15€ for a day pass. Good value. Difficult to find the stops when on land, so really watch where the stops are when it stops!

A River Tour on the Seine is a must. I took a river tour on the Seine. It is a must for people with little time. All the magnificent building and monuments come to life. I walked along the left bank, viewed works of budding artists and just thoroughly enjoyed myself.

cruise. took the one hour cruise, it was nice to see the backs of buildings that you might only see the fronts of with the Hop on Hop off busses. the evening one is good as all the lights come on while you are cruising.

must take a boat ride. even if you spend few days walking in whole Paris only after a boat ride you can realy understand the greatnes and all the beauty of the city of light. I strongly recomend boats near the eifel. the ride is very pleasant and the guide is god enough for all the understand
La Seine. You have to bike along this river, walk or at least have a beer along the river. So beautiful but so are most things in Paris!

Nice. We ha to walk from one train to another train station because of security reasons. So we ended up walking near the canal/river, it was a nice hot day, and it was really nice. Defiantly a place to stroll if you have a few minutes.

Day or night, the river is the essence of Paris. Strolling along the Seine by day, watching people, watching the boats and soaking up the sunshine is a wonderful way to spend a couple of relaxing hours in Paris. Surprisingly you don't encounter many other tourists. A night cruise on the Seine is a must - the city comes alive in a magical way, especially the Eiffel Tower. One of the best memories I have of Paris is the night cruise - an Edith Piaf song playing as we went past the spectacularly lit tower.

The vibe surrounding it, not the river itself. Had a great evening sat on the banks alongside scores of other people enjoying a few beers, with the Eiffel Tower in the background and tourist boats sailing by. The river like most is somewhat green but a great way to spend a chilled out evening.

Always a treat to see the Seine. We love to go to the Seine River. Actually, in the past few days, we've been there several times. Today, we were there at least 3 times. Got some great camera shots tonight - potential painting coming up.
Nice boat trip. Pleasant journey up the river and back. The sound system was better on the outside deck than inside.
Well, Of Course. Stand on a bridge and gaze at the river and the city along it's banks! Walk down to one of the seating areas on the bank and sit and reflect. It's the reason Paris is there.

another view of Paris. we took the Cars Rouges (a hop on/hop off bus) and for 9Euros more, it included a little cruise on the Seine..it is well narrated and it's a great way to see Paris from another angle.. the Bateaux-Mouches offer the same for about 10-12Euros

21 Day Romantic Seine & Rhone Paris to Barcelona APT tour - AmaLegro. My family and I recently came back from our 21 Day Romantic Seine & Rhone Paris to Barcelona APT tour in June 2013 on board AmaLegro and AmaDagio. We all had a wonderful time there and I would like to use this opportunity to share my experiences and thoughts with everyone. Hopefully, people would find my article useful in their decision making and preparation for their trips with APT and/or AmaWaterways.There are 2 parts of my review: part 1 covers 3 days in Paris and 7 day on board AmaLegro, and part 2 covers 7 day on board AmaDagio and 3 days in Barcelona. This is part 1 of my review.Our trip started with 3 days in Paris where APT organised a city tour visiting the second level of the Eiffel Tower on Day 2 morning and a welcome dinner cruise along the Seine River, followed by a Paris Illuminations Tour on Day 2 evening. There were 3 “Freedom of Choice” tours offered on Day 3 morning. All of the tours organised by APT were quite good, but the quality of food and services from the welcome dinner cruise along the Seine River was below average compared to the food and services offered on board AmaLegro and AmaDaigo.We stayed in Hotel du Collectionneur Arc de Triomphe for 3 nights. The hotel rooms are spacious and well equipped. I enjoyed their breakfast buffet very much as there was wide range of delicious hot and cold food available. Services from this hotel were wonderful and it is within walking distance to Avenue des Champs Elysees and Arc de Triomphe.There was a problem with our Paris trip due to the last minute change in itinerary by APT. When we first booked our trip in October 2012, APT brochure indicated that Paris itinerary only has freedom of choice tours available on Day 2 morning and we would have Day 3 completely free. So our family had planned to take Versailles excursion with APT, and organised our own tours via Internet for Day 3. But by the time we received our confirmed tour itinerary which was just 3 weeks before departure, we found out that Paris itinerary has changed significantly. This was a shock to us and completely threw our initial planning into chaos. First, we were not happy to receive the confirmed itinerary late, e.g. 3 weeks before departure, instead of 4-6 weeks before departure as it stated in official APT documentation. Second, I was not able to get any clear and consistent answers from either travel agent or APT call center staff about the finished time of the morning tours in Day 2 and 3. Everyone was telling me different answers which made it impossible for me to make any arrangement for the afternoon tours. When I discussed this timing problem and sudden cancellation of Versailles tour with both travel agent and APT call center staff, the answers I got were along the lines of “please talk to your tour director once you arrived in Paris”. I did not feel comfortable with APT’s approach of leaving everything to the last minute. Based on my previous experiences travelling with APT, I did not believe it was feasible for 1 tour director to address 100 people’s enquiries completely and successfully on Day 1. We only had 3 days in Paris and there were so many things we wanted to do and places we wanted to visit. In the end, we forfeited the “Freedom of Choice” tour on Day 3 and arranged our own tours to go to Versailles in the morning and Louvre in the afternoon. I filed a formal complaint to APT after the tour and I was able to resolve this issue successfully with APT.After 3 days in Paris, we were transferred to Seine River on Day 4 late afternoon where our luxury river ship, AmaLegro, awaited.Compared to our previous experiences with AmaBella and AmaVerde travelled from Amsterdam to Budapest in 2011, AmaLegro is very similar to those 2 ships but a few years older, e.g. all of the facilities and set up are similar. There are public lounges in the front and back of the ship, free internet and Wi-Fi access, and gym. The cabins are well equipped and reasonably spacious. The food and shore excursions were certainly the highlights of my cruises. The quality of the food (3 meals, morning tea, and afternoon tea) was excellent and services from the restaurant and bar staff were very attentive and always do their best to anticipate customers’ needs. For example, unlike AmaBella and AmaVerde where I always had to ask (or should I use the word “beg”) to have my water and non-alcoholic drink refilled during my meals, AmaLegro is the only the ship where my drink always being refilled before it ran out, I never had to ask. However, if you only drink alcohol, then there won’t be any problem because the wait / bar staff constantly walking around with red & white wine to refill everyone’s glass. Also, there was no limit on the drink (included in the fee already), so I have seen some people started drinking from the afternoon all the way till late at night. For people don’t drink much alcohol, you do feel like you are substituting other people’s drink.My favourite shore excursions along Seine River were (1) Giverny where we visited the home of Claude Monet and its famous gardens; (2) Rouen, heart of Normandy region; (3) picturesque Honfleur; (4) beautiful Les Andelys and Chateau Gaillard built by Richard the Lionheart; (5) Chateau de Malmaison, home of General Napoleon and Josephine. All passengers on walking tours were accompanied by Quietvox and people could join different groups to suit their fitness level. There was daily information session every afternoon by the tour director informing everyone the details of shore excursions for the next day. Our tour director, Mr Peter Whitehead, is an Australian who always gave animated information sessions filled with lots of humour.If you are planning to participate in Rouen cathedral light show at 11pm, then please make sure that you take a torch with you from the ship reception before you leave. And always ask your tour director where to meet once the light show finished. There was a problem at the night walk to the Rouen cathedral during my trip, e.g. on the way walking from the ship to cathedral with our tour director, Mr Whitehead, there was no information from him about where to meet after the light show and he didn’t organise any torch for us. So after the light show, all of us were very confused with what to do next, and it took us a while to find Peter W because there were many people and not much light in the square, then we have to walk back to the ship in the dark by ourselves.Despite the excellent food and outstanding services provided by the ship crew, and mostly well-coordinated shore excursions, there is a critical safety concern associate with the design of the spiral staircases to level 1 cabins. Compare to all other stairs in the ship, the tight construction of these stairs with narrow staircase width, steep gradient, and handrail on only one side, they are not easy for the elderly passengers to use. With majority of the passengers on board over the age 50, every day I saw elderly passengers struggling with these stairs. I am a much younger person and even I found the stairs gradient very challenging. I always had to slow down and hold on to the handrail tightly when walking up and down the stairs. I felt climbing up these stairs was like a rock climbing exercise because these stairs are just too steep. When my family and I raise our concern about the unsafe design of stairs to level 1 cabins, and asked if we could have an upgrade to upper level cabins e.g. either we paid extra or for free, given the ship was not at its full capacity. Peter W said that he would investigate but he didn’t think upgrade would be possible. He never got back to us. During the same conversation, Mr Whitehead also indicated that “we got what we paid for” and we should already know there are stairs to level 1 when we booked our trip. I found Mr Whitehead’s comments rude, unfair, and I felt his tone was quite condescending. Later, I found out tour director’s room is on level 2, so he might not aware of how difficult these stairs are to elderly passengers, thus, dismissed our concern as just some silly nonsenses.We were aware of the existences of the stairs at the time of booking, but we didn’t know the design and shape of the stairs to level 1 is so “elderly user unfriendly”. There was neither information nor photos on APT brochure providing any indication on the shape and design of the spiral staircases to level 1 cabins. When we were on-board AmaBella and AmaVerde last time, we stayed on level 3 and the stairs were easy. If we were given clear information (e.g. photos) about the design and shape of the level 1 stairs at the time of booking, then we would be able to assess the situation accurately and make an informed decision, e.g. we would not have chosen level 1 cabins. All other stairs in the ship are quite easy to use.I filed a formal complaint to APT after the tour to raise my concerns on the (1) stairs safety, and (2) unsafe and poorly coordinated nigh tour at Rouen. APT addressed my concern about the night tour swiftly by immediately issuing a memo to all tour directors and ships that they must provide torch to passengers for all night tours. APT told me that because the night tour to Rouen cathedral was an informal tour, therefore our tour director, Mr Whitehead, thought there was no need to do any coordination. APT was initially sceptical to my concern about the level 1 stairs and told me that these staircases comply with European safety standards, and since nobody ever complaint about the stairs and have been no accidents recorded, then it must be an isolated problem. Our tour director, Mr Whitehead, declined any wrong doing in telling us “you got what you paid for”. So I had no choice but to liaise with other level 1 passengers and encourage them to contact APT and tell APT what they thought about level 1 stairs. In the end, APT agreed to pass on my suggestions regarding a second handrail to AmaWaterways for future consideration, and APT would encourage anyone who has disclosed their mobility concerns to book cabins on level 2 or 3 in the future. APT refused to refund us the portion of gratuities that would go to tour director, Mr Whitehead, because that was already included in the overall fee. I was very disappointed with their decision because I thought gratuities were supposed to use to encourage good performance, not insulting customer.Overall, my family and I had a lovely time in Paris and on board AmaLegro. It could have been perfect holiday for us if it wasn’t the dangerous stairs and humiliating experiences with the tour director, Mr Whitehead. We do not hold any grudge or vendetta against APT or AmaWaterways, but we want to share our experiences with people who are considering taking the European river cruise with APT / AmaWaterways, so people would be much better prepared than us. Personally, I am disappointed with APT / AmaWaterways for not accepting my suggestions of proactively showing photos of spiral staircases to level 1 cabins to customers who are considering booking level 1 cabins as that would help customers to do an accurate risk assessment and make an informed decision. I wonder if such conduct would be counted as “misleading or deceptive conduct” under “Australian Consumer Law” because the law requires a business to tell a customer all relevant details about a product or service, e.g. a complete story. A business is legally required to ensure that the overall impression conveyed is complete and accurate taking into account all illustrations.
Cruising Along. Great trip, we are going at dinner cruise, quite impressive with all the light around Paris and the food quite good to

Serene(Seine) and Divine. Serene + Divine = Seine. We took a cruise on the seine river for more than an hour and passed through all the beautiful bridges and monuments.If someone has shortage of time to checkout all the monuments in Paris, take this cruise. You could see almost all from the boat.Seine inspires the romance in u...grab it.
Nice Lunch Spot. I would recommend to anyone to grab a sandwich and beverage and have a seat beside the Seine relax and enjoy the views.

Excellent cruise. We took an evening cruise with dinner. 39 euros for an hours sail. Best thing we did all week. A glass of champers, a 2 course supper (fish or chicken) and a free bottle of wine too. Wonderful !!

Nice for a walk but avoid urine alley. It is a pleasant walk along the river front but avoid the sections that have covers/tunnels. This is where (presumably) men relieve themselves at night and the stench of stale urine is most revolting!
I wish the authorities would install CCTV cameras or hose it down every morning as these sections of the Seine walk are most unpleasant.

BateauxMouche dinner tour. This experience costs a minimum of 99 euros. There is live music - in our case a violinist and pianist. The dinner was three courses with a cheese course and coffee. A glass of fizz and a bottle of wine between two people is also included. Overall this probably represents reasonably good value by the standard of Paris prices but we made the mistake of asking for a glass of red wine to have with our cheese. 2 glasses = 20 €. Just so's you know!! The service was at best average. The views, on the other hand, are unbeatable. Then again - you can see those for free!!

Do it with a Cruise. Even though walking around the Seine its a nice things to do, taking a 12,5 Euro bateau mouche at night its a must, not only for seeing almost all the bight sights in Paris, but for also the the work in the lighting on those monuments! A beautiful ride at night time for an extremely reasonable price.
Highlight of the Trip. Took river cruise-one hour-was a beautiful way to see the city-very nice. Definitely do this. We booked it with a tour of eiffel. But by far-cruise was the best.
Do a boat ride at night!. The mass of tourists aside, the tour is great. Do the boat by the Tour Eiffel. Look, avoid the camera.

Cruising around romantic Paris. A great cruise around Paris on a unique form of transport along the river. Along the river, I was able to see different places in Paris in a different light, after all, I was cruising on a river. The sunset view is truly amazing.
Overrated. We took the Bateaux Parisiens cruise which was just average. One does get a slice of history but it is a very small slice. In fact walking along the river is much more fun.
Nice at night. The view was beautiful and will recomend to do it at night and the service was god as we'll but the food was not as good

River cruise in Seine. I enjoyed river cruise in Seine river. It was a nice experience in the night.You have to buy ticket . They will take you along the river and city looks beautiful in the night.If you visit Paris you must enjoy river cruise in seine river.
River boat tour in the day and dinner cruise at night. More to see for a river boat cruise during the day. Spectacular night light show on the hour for Eiffel tower

Oh Paris - what a beautiful river.. The Seine has a right to be called one of the most famous and best rivers in the world. It is just wonderful sitting by the riverside having a drink at a bar, or just strolling along enjoying the people watching.

Ideal way to take in the city views. We took a cruise along the Seine starting off near the Eiffel Tower it travelled down the river passing all the great buildings and bridges. Once it passes the Notre Dame Cathedral it turns around and comes back to the tower. We did the trip twice, in the day and at night. Definitely worth doing and overall takes about an hour

An enjoyable trip. We had an enjoyable trip down the river seine. There are many different trips available and we were very happy with the one that we chose. The trip lasted about on hour and was quite reasonable priced. We were also able to purchase a glass of wine or beer for our journey. A relaxing time

Take a boat ride. This is inexpensive and a great way to see the sights for not a lot of money. The day we went out, it was hot, so we selected one of the smaller boat companies that had upstairs, outside sitting. The large boats have a plastic enclosure that may be good if it's cold or rains, but must be like a hot house when it's sunny out. The tour was in 3 or 4 different languages so everyone could understand what was being explained. I must admitt, it was a little hard to hear sometimes, but it was a great hour spent.

Cruised the river for a week. What better way to explore the meandering, winding Seine than on a riverboat. We stopped at quaint small towns and villages that dated back to the 1500's. Also stopped in Rouen,toured the grounds of Monet's Giverny and loved the peacful calm of cruising the Seine.
Lovely Evening Cruise. We cruised the Seine at night and got to see Paris with a different view. We were lucky enough to be at the Eiffel Tower twice when the twinkling lights were on. Loved it.

Really excellent boat tour of the Seine. We used Vedettes du Pont Neuf for our tour - and it was excellent. Our guide, Sam, spoken excellent English and was very interesting with the history, the local information and fun tips about the sights along the way.We sat up the top in the open since it was a lovely day, but all their boats looked as though they had covered seating for not so nice days.
Batobus the way to travel. Take the Batobus and enjoy the scenery from the river with the added bonus off being able to get on and off as and when you choose.

Ferry Ride on the Seine is Amazing!. Be sure to take the ferry up the river! We took it at night to see Paris Illuminated! The Eiffel Tower twinkles, the bridges with hand carved faces come alive and the thousands of people that gather on the river banks with a bottle of wine to socialize and watch the boats go by make this a one-of-a-kind experience!

The river doesn't smell!. Everyone kept telling us that the river smelled bad but it does not. The worst smell was the diesel exhaust fumes from the barges and there weren't even that many barges. The river cruise we did was delightful and informative and of course wandering arm in arm does the embankments was sublime.

not that great. I'm sure the sienne is nicer outside of the city. In the city, its just a river and most of the view of the city is blocked by high walls. We were bored to death on the taxi boat. I wouldn't bother again
A must. There is so much history when you take a ride down the Seine. It's an hour tour. Bring your camera and sweater,(depending on time of year).

Great Overview. I loved that I could get a view of many of the places I wanted to visit by cruising the Seine. It helped to get a feel for the location of the popular sights and gave some historical background information.
First view. It worths to see the city for the first time, but you will pass on the streets on margins many times on turistics bus and others. So I would no consider as first priority.

Great people watching!. Great to walk along, over and beside. Beware of women who "find" a gold ring you supposedly dropped then ask for a reward. Fake gold, Just shoo them away, they will leave you alone. Beautiful to walk along during the day or night, nice places to stop and get a drink or something to eat.
Great River. So long and walked quite alot of it. Didn't go on a boat as husband wasn't keen but I wouldn't of minded.
Always pleasant!. Always nice to sit around, take some pictures and have a coffee, also visit some fairs and maybe night clubs on it's border.

Nice scenary in City of Love.. what really distinguishes Paris from any other european city is Seine River. This river is very nice and romantic to sit on any of the sides of the river.
I highly reccomend visiting Effil Tower t6o better view this nice river as a full picture or peice of heaven through the top of Effil Tower.

Lovely day for a boat tour.... Yes, we went from the Eiffel Tower Tour to the boat ride on the Seine. The day was sunny, took lots of pictures, and learned a lot about the buildings bordering the Seine.

River Seine Boat Tour. Took an evening (not yet night) boat cruise on the Seine after visiting the Eiffel Tower.13 EUR each.One hour trip.Worth every second and every EURGives you a beautiful overview of the city. Helpful tour guide comments via loudspeaker.One of the top things we did in Paris.Can get drinks and snacks on the boat.Not crowded.
Different View of Paris. If you want to see all of Paris I would recommend a cruise on the Seine. Great views of the Eiffel Tower and things you wouldn't see from land.

don’t miss it. A boat trip is not to miss – spectacular views! But there’s more. The Seine embankment represents a most attractive place for bookworms. The bookstalls here display old books of any writer, any genre. They also sell postcards, bookmarks and lovely souvenirs. Besides, this summer a large part of the embankment was made a promenade zone with a labyrinth, a world map, games, restaurants, benches and what not. Not far from Musée d'Orsay there was a photo exposition “Soul of coffee” – exciting life stories! So, when in Paris, go down the Seine, it might be an adventure.

Take the time to walk down this historic river. There are SO many sights and sounds to see when walking down the banks of this beautiful historic river. Take the time to do so and you will be able to see a lot of the beautiful historic buildings that Paris has to offer. Or why not try a boat trip if you dont want to walk?

RIVER TAXI. We took the River Taxi and you can get a ticket that lets you hop on and off up and down the river as much as you like. This means you can we all the sights on the river which is better than the Metro . Well worth using this mode of transport for a view of Paris in a different way.

Romantic at Sunset. Bring a bottle of wine and sit on the banks at sunset with a view of the Eiffel tower. That's what the locals do. It was so romantic watching the sun go down the pretty colours of the sky changing and the lit up boats going past on the river.
Romantic. very romantic way to spend your night and might be the best place to propose if want to leave a life-time impression...bring jacket if travel in spring or autumn

The Seine is the heart of Paris!. The Seine being the heart of Paris, sailing it is a must to get the full Paris experience. Choose an evening boat, leaving on the hour so that you can be close to the Eiffel Tower when it sparkles on the half hour. We took the Vedettes au Pont Neuf Service with a good live comentary in French and English. Well worth the experience.

Seine by night. We did night boat trip from Pont Neuf, this took about 1 hour was guided and to be honest the guidewas not very fluent in English. The trip was ok though and was about 13euros, no food or drink included in the price. Take your own.

Always Love the Seine. From any viewpoint the rive offers something new for you to enjoy. Especially from the water, Paris looks so much different than what you may have seen before.Take a boat cruise from Vedettes des Pont Neuf on the tip of Ile de la Cite. Buy tickets online in advance to save 25%. You can get an email on your smartphone to show them and can take a cruise any time you wish.

Great at night.. Went on the 9.30 pm and enjoyed the Eiffel Tower sparkling.
Great way to see the major buildings of inner Paris.
Peaceful journey and nice to see others enjoying the Seine.
Great memories of a good trip

Comfortable way to make contact. Taking a boat trip is easy, convenient and one of the best ways to start one's trip to Paris. Even if you see just the segment at the heart of the city, it is enough to fire up your imagination and make you think a hundred places you want to go next. Going at night is much better than by day and a summer one for sure. All the main buildings are illuminated and you'll get a chance to see also the vibrating life on the banks of the Seine: dance festivals, lovers walking hand in hand, jazz jam sessions, people just enjoying the stars. A good memory maker for sure.

A river for all seasons.. I love the Seine. It is beautiful, it runs right through Paris. You can leisurely walk beside it, have picnics next to it (we saw many people doing that), take a tour of Paris on one of the many tour boats or just sit and contemplate the beauty of the area.
ok. it was nice -- but because it was a bit cool out, we sat inside and one doesn't really get to enjoy the whole essense of the trip as if went outside-- still recommend it as a "must do"
I love travelling on water. I always purchase a day pass for the Batobus and just sit through the whole trip watching Paris go by. Later I also get off at some of the stops for sightseeing.

Vedettes de Pont Neuf. Do take a tour. It was very nice. We had a young guide witch told us interesting good to know facts not just history of Paris. The view is very nice, especially over the Eiffel Tour and Musee d'Orsay.

Nice Walk. I enjoyed walking to destinations along the river; however, there were scam artists along the way so be wary of anyone pretending to find a ring, asking directions, or getting too close to pickpocket. Walk with someone, not alone. If someone says excuse me, wave away.

Take a cruise & enjoy!!. The only way to relax & enjoy the magic of Paris is on a cruise with a commentary which provides you with everything you need to know about the richness of Paris' history. I was amazed at the number of local people who enjoy the river with numerous picnics & lunches shared on the banks, a delightful way to spend an hour.
Dinner on the Seine. We had a lovely dinner travelling along the Seine. Good way to get great photos. Paris looked fantastic at night.

Take the riverboat ride around sundown.. The Seine is full of tourist boats, but it is an interesting trip to see some of the 37 bridges that cross the Seine. It is also interesting to see some of the attractions from the view of the river. During the trip we saw a section of Paris that people come to to dance. How wonderful!
Dinner optional. The cruise was shorter than we thought, 1 hr. Dinner was good (not the buffet). Barely had time to eat before it was done. Not sure the extra money was worth it for the dinner.
Love the Seine River Cruise. A very relaxing & enjoyable way to see all the sights Paris has to offer ! You can get off when you please or you can do a return trip.

Excellent. Free and most relaxing place, get your drink and sandwich and go for it. I can spend an entire day just laying around here and listening to music and just watching the water and people passing by.

Walk along and enjoy the sights.... We walked along parts of the Seine and enjoyed seeing the tourists, wedding parties, families and couples who were also enjoying it. We sat at sunset and watched the colors change on the water. We also went during the day and put a locket on the bridge fence. What a great and romantic thing to do.

Batobus. Took the Batobus so that we could hop on and off at 8 locations between Eiffel Tower and Jardin des Plantes. The boat does not offer a guided tour, but well worth the price of the tickets to save all that walking between each of the major sites.

Do not miss a Seine River cruise. Absolutely a great way to see the sights and relax for a couple of hours. The dinner cruises are a little over rated but still very enjoyable and give a wonderful perspective at night.
Undecided. On some days this river is beautiful, serene, and pulls you in. On other days, it is stinky, bug filled and less than loveable. Fun to see all the shades of this river :)

Tour. Sounds Cheezy but you got to see it at night from a boat. Not that the boat is great, it isn't, but it lets you see what happens on the banks of the river at night and then you can be a part of the true youth of Paris. At night it seems all the youth show up on the banks to sit and love, dance, have fun, listen to music, liven up the banks. You will see Paris is an ancient city with a young heart. Wonderful!

River Seine by cruise is most amazing. It was really a pleasure to have enjoy Paris afternoon in such manner, a slow cruises on the river Seine. Eiffel is spectacular seen from the Seine river bank. And along the cruise, we can see all those beautiful arches and sculpture of the bridges along the river. Must find yourself a spot on the deck to enjoy the sun and the wind if not too cold. The only minor thing I found is that, there should be a special spot even on the open deck for smokers so the nonsmokers would not have to keep avoiding their smoke. And they way it will be save for children to enjoy their cruises as well, away from smokers. That day when I was in the cruise, there are some school teachers bringing todlers for an excursion trip, and I saw the teacher busy hauling the children away from smokers.

Sights by Night. This was gorgeous. Cruising along watching the lights come on in the buildings along the river including the Eiffel tower. So beautiful. I would like a soundtrack to be playing. No taxi on debarkation so late at night. Had to walk quite a way before finding a taxi and had to flag him down! just luck

Nice view of Paris. I enjoy seen paris from the Seine river. We travelled on the hop on hop off boat. So we could go on our own leisure.
I enjoyed having a picnic on the river's banks while live jazz musicians played their music. . I feel I truly enjoyed a Parisian life style regardless of the short length of my trip.

the river. The Seine was within blocks of our hotel so we would walk there often and just watch the river and the people go by. we did take the boat bus for the entire loop it goes on. That was interesting to see all the beautiful buildings along the ride. You can get off and on the bus 8 times on one day, so it is a nice option if you are tired of walking.
Boat trip on Seine. Great experience, and fantastic value for money. Worth going on one as you get to see most important attractions and have a guide tour explaining their significance.
Seine Cruise. Beautiful scenic view of a wonderful city. It's a must to see all the monuments from the Seine, on a short cruise. An enjoyable way to see many of its historic bridges

Seine River cruise. a must! Eifel awes with sounds of "aaws" and "aaahh" when lit up... if one takes the early evening ride, to catch Eifel lit up is a treat,indeed. Cruising past landmarks of Paris, get off your seats & enjoy the scenery with the cool breeze on your face ...For lovebirds and newly-weds, dinner on the cruise opens up possibilities..., but book early to avoid disappointments.Take the night cruise, discover the romance in Paris!

Great way to see Paris and save your feet. It was our first day in Paris. Arrived from USA about noon and took a 3 PM boat trip. Was a great way to get settled in Paris without walking so much. Would do it again for sure

Paris to Honfleur on the Seine. We took a tour focusing on the Impressionists with Road Scholar. After 4 nights in a hotel in Paris, it included 6 nights on the MS Seine Princess from Paris to Honfleur, France, near Le Havre. It was a wonderful trip and we enjoyed every minute on the Seine. The river ship was comfortable, intimate, and offered wonderful French food. The staff made us all feel like we were family during our 6 days aboard.We docked at various locations, such as Vernon, Rouen, and Honfleur on our voyage to Honfleur. We spent our days sightseeing, still focusing mostly on the Impressionists. A standout during the tour on the Seine was a visit to Monet's home and gardens in Giverny, a "must" for any fan of Monet's works, especially his "Water Lilies"I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone who meets Road Scholar's eligibility requirements.

A must to see Paris by night. We arrived at Pier 3, boats go every 30 mins. Highly recommend this, even though it had been raining we stood outside to take in the atmosphere of Paris and was not disappointed. Took lots of photos and then had a wander back down the Scene to our hotel. It was a great way to get our bearings for our sightseeing the next day.Downside was the handsets were pointless and nit much help.

Lovely tour. We did the river tour and it was beautiful. Very enjoyable. The only downside was that my guide thingy wouldn't change from Spanish so I didn't quite get the full experience. Other than that though it was a lovely, relaxing, enjoyable little cruise

A great way to see the sights!. Went on a sightseeing cruise on the River Seine,it was a great way to see the Eiffel Tower, Notre-Dame,the Louvre and many other attractions.ood value at 13 euros each.

Surprised. I took 3 years of French and did not learn much because I was not a great student at the time, but I knew the Seine was in Paris. What I did not know was how beautiful the river actually is. When we first arrived in Paris, we went over the river a couple of times on buses and I was immediately enamored with the river. When my wife, two daughters, and I went up the Eiffel Tower, we saw how beautiful the river is and see how important the river is to Paris. We eventually took a boat ride up the river from the Musee D'orsay and enjoyed it, but we had just as much fun walking along the river and watching the boat traffic go up and down the main artery of Paris. The bridges are all fascinating and my daughters particular liked the bridge with all of the locks. If we ever go back to Paris, I plan to spend time just sitting and watching the river again.

Boat trip is a great way to see Paris "Lights". We went for the 8:30pm ride and arrived at Pier 3 15 minutes before it set sail (September 2013). Great way to see the lights of Paris as night approaches. Be careful of the bathrooms on board-very unpleasant smell! Recommend you use a toilette prior to getting on board.

Wonderful!. Wonderful and beautiful especially at night. I would recommend taking a boat ride at night to see the lights of the Eiffel Tower. Take a stroll with your lover around the Seine, very romantic.
Paris at night on the Seine River. Been to Paris before but never taken the cruise. Take the Seine River cruise at night. It can be romantic if your spouse/partner is with you.
Cruise time. Take a cruise on la seine!! Once you are on board, don't just sit there, go around the balcony and take as much pic as you can! You can get the overview of Paris within 1 hour.
