Cruise was breath taking!!. Brillant, very romantic..got to see so much.. Pre book your river cruise..so you don't miss out!! Enjoyed this tour the most in Paris!!
beautiful. beautiful river....lovely feeling to walk around and see all the amazing sites close by. a stop in the bridge with the love lockers its a must do!
Nice Cruise. We did the cruise the first day in Paris so that gave us a idea of where places are. We were also going to do it by night but the night we were going to do it ended up pouring.

A great way to see many of the Parisian landmarks. a boat trip on the River Seine is a fabulous way to relax and float past some of the most memorable landmarks of Paris, including the many bridges, the Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Notre Dame, several museums etc. -

Nice cruise.. The Seine river cruise is nice because you get a different view of many structure, including Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower. The boat has large, comfortable seats and a snack bar with an assortment of chips, cookies, coffee, soda and water. Nice and relaxing.

WOW. We did a 10:30 pm cruise on the Bateaux les Vedettes . The light show was amazing. The tour was stunning as well as the sights from all the partiers along the banks enjoying the weekend weather . Great Take

Take a Boat Ride. A boat ride up and down the River Seine is a must. We took this tour our first day in Paris. The tour guide pointed out the many attractions we would want to see and spend time at. This was a wonderful wait to start our month long holiday in Paris.

A romantic cruise along the Seine. we loved the little 1 hr ride up and down the Seine. Very fun and relaxing. You can see alot of the major Paris attractions along the river including their Statue of Liberty

River cruise. We did dinner and a cruise and it was a beautiful way to end our visit. Food was much better than we expected as we did this for the experience and not the quality of the food. We had done a hop on hop off cruise earlier in our trip and that was a great way to learn about the city and get off at points of interest.
Great trip up the Seinne. We went on 1 hour trip leaving at 8pm - perfect timing as was just beginning to get dark and the Eiffel tower was lit up on our return

Nice Journey. My mom and I enjoyed the river twice on our 3 night visit to Paris. The first time was on the hop on and hop off boat. It was very hot and we thought we were getting on boat cruise, but is was a non-guided water taxi. It was good for us since we had done a lot of walking and need to cool off and rest, but we wanted to hear something about what we were seeing. Our next encounter was we took a river cruise with a snack after our Eiffel Tower visit. This boat cruise was narrated and we enjoyed this much better. We also were able to have crepes and a drink for relatively cheap. No need in booking with a tour group. You can do the Eiffel Tower and the river cruise on your own. Look for coupons for the river cruises, we saw some after the fact. Enjoyed our time on the river. We even got to see people jump off of the bridge for enjoyment.

Save your money and walk along the Seine, don't boat. I kind of felt sorry for all the people trapped in their Seine boat cruises while we were free to saunter along and take things in on our own. Both banks of the river have beautiful wide walking paths, and you get to be surrounded by Paris, rather than a sound system in English telling you what you're seeing. Bring a guidebook and do your own tour!

One hour of scenery - Not to be missed.. The trip takes in most of the important structures on the banks of the Seine river. passing under many splendid bridges. Viewing the Louvre, Notre Dame and Eiffel Tower.

A good alternative way to see the sights. we took a one hour scenic cruise - the boat was very large and almost full - a very good commentary in three or four different languages.Having gone on a hop on hop off bus tour this was a good laternative way of seeing the well known sights close to the river

Beautiful River Seine. You wont miss it if you are in the heart of paris. Go for a boat ride or dinner on cruise if you have time. Its worth it. Or else the some open bus tour operators gives combined pass for boat and bus. It is the best way to discover the beauty of Seine running through the heart of Paris

Busboat. The trip down the river on a boat was way above expectations with a good " captain" on the boat pointing out the various attractions in both English and French it was useful to explore the city hopping off the river boat with our day pass

A great way to see the attractions of Paris. Loved it. We did a night cruise from the Bastille area, up the Seine and back for two hours. It truly is a great way to see the attractions from the comfort of a well equipped boat. I would however recommend you do the night cruise, the lights of the city are just unforgettable.

a must for day 1 in paris. we pre booked the river trip through Tesco reward points which was very good value. We decided to go on our first day as at was an easy and pleasant way to see the city then decide which places we would visit during our short break in Paris. There is so much to see that you cant see everything on one short trip. the rest of the sightseeing was enjoyable but sore on the feet !

Take a romantic boat ride in the evening .... Your trip to Paris will not be complete until you take a boat ride on Seine. Scenic view from the boat ride rivals the majestic views afforded by the Eiffel Tower or Arc de Triomphe. If possible, go on a clear evening before sun sets and watch the setting sun cast a magic glow to the city. It is just beautiful!! Don't miss it.

Batobus. This is an excellent way off seeing Paris. You can hop and on the boat at 8 stages. The commentary on the Monuments and bridges is excellent very good English. The only problem is at certain times you cannot all the way down the seine as the tide is too high and the boats cannot get under bridges and dock at mooring stages.
Nice cruise. We caught a boat along the river with commentary it was great. You can see a lot from the river see all bridges, Notre Dame etc it was great

Go at night!. Paris is amazing at night. Be sure to take the open tour not the covered ones. People are out sitting by the Seine having wine, entertainment can be seen and hear...and the Eiffel Tower is magical!
Good way to see Paris !. You have to try this tour if you never done it. It is very interesting to see Paris from la Seine. You'll know about all the bridges and monument, museum and more.

Must do. The Seine is central to most Paris landmarks. We chose to buy a Batobus pass that allowed us to get on and off whenever we liked, for a whole day. Excellent value and far fewer steps than the Metro. And when it rained, we just stayed aboard and enjoyed the ride.
Relaxing. Walk the Seine and emerge yourself in the beautiful surroundings. We were at Notre Dame at sunset and got spectacular pictures across the seine.

Romantic trip.... One of the most romantic things to do generally is s having a tour with a boat especially here in Paris where the boat ride in Seine can offer you a easy going tour where you see most the interesting monuments of Paris

Cruise Down The River..... After a romantic proposal on the Tower this was the cherry on the cake! The tower was lit up in all it's glory - approx 700 lights!? Just a few less than in my home!!! Ha!!! Sailed down the river with the funniest girls from West London - mother/daughter and friends! Great Girls and thanks for a laugh and chat! This was a great time for us to reflect on our day and enjoy each others company before heading off to the Moulin Rouge! Again this was part of a tour and was extremely well organised and even a photo op as we boarded the ferry! Great way to see the Cathedral and other landmarks in a relaxed fashion!

Did the Batobus Tour. What better way than to actually get on the Seine. This was a terrific tour although because the heavy rain that Europe had last winter made it a little difficult to get to all places that we paid for. But it was a once in a life time experience for us and we thoroughly enjoyed every minute. There were so many bridges we went under and a couple that we got out and walked over which was just as good. This tour is an absolute must and the best part is that you can hop on and hop off. Stay and look around at any things you want to see or just get on and get to the next thing. I loved our time on the Seine and am so happy that I got this experience.

A Walk through Time. The banks of the Seine, dotted with bookstalls, tables of trinkets, art work of various quality, and people of every nationality, race, and heritage is like walking in time immemorial. Start anywhere, walk as far as you like, stop in a sidewalk café, and sitting near you, sketching on a pad, may be the next Degas or Dali! Just take it all in, no charge, of course!

Romantic. I have traveled to many cities around the US and other countries as well, but Paris and the river Seine is the most romantic by far! Everywhere you look along the river there is a couple holding hands, kissing, with a picnic basket and a bottle of wine.

Cruise on river Seine - Decent. A must do activity when you are in Paris. You should do it on day 1 in Paris as it helps you finalise your list of places to see.Evening of night cruise definitely scores over the daytime cruise. It was good but could have been better. May be I expected more from the cruise but it was quite an ordinary arrangement on cruise.

The Seine by day. This was our 4th time in Paris and our 3rd time to do the trip on the Seine. Every time I gather more information and seem to appreciate it more and more. By day or night this trip is a must

Nice view from different angels. Seine is exposing the explorer with different angels of Paris. Great taste for long stay vacationer. The price around the boat tour terminals is expensive so plan to bring your own snack.

Great point of interest if you get lost..... I took many strolls along the river from early morning to late nights.....a great way to navigate through central Paris and see many sights along its path! We took a dinner cruise along the river and it was fantastic to see all of the sites once the sun goes down.
A must to take to finish off your site seeing. Beautiful cruise to take u see Paris in another angle and see the most amazing buildings. I loved the cruise a great way to see the Eiffel tower

Nice Boat Ride. We took an hour-long boat ride from one of the several companies near the Eiffel Tower. Narration was available in several languages by use of an earphone--which was difficult to listen to. The ride was fun but nothing spectacular.

Walk across the bridges. It's interesting that all of the bridges are designed differently. We put a lock with our names on the pont de Archeveche. Later, we went back and were able to find it easy enough. That was pretty cool. The Pont de Archeveche is nice, view of Notre Dame and easy walk over to Ile de la Cite and Ile St. Louis from there.
River could be cleaner. I liked that there are some sandy beaches but it is a big question if you can swim in a polluted river?

Trip on boat. EXCELLENT.... on the day and night.....the bad is to wait till u arrived to the boat... is beautiful during the night.. where the buildings are iluminated.. some of them seems to be a photo...u can stay inside or outside on the boat....the architecture is fantastic...and the way that the French take care of the buildings is superb...is a great city... during the night u can see the Eiffel tower iluminated...is something amazing...
Boat ride Seine. I am a cruise junki, it will not be fair for me to rate, but this cannot beat Bhosphorus cruise - the best river cruise I ever had - Istanbul 2011

Lovely. Cruising on the River Seine in the Batubus is a relaxing way to take in the sights of Paris, its a hop on hop boat that drops off at all the beautiful sights of Paris or you can just cruise and relax
peaceful. it was a very peaceful place to sit and people watch. we could see the Eiffel tower from here, so we enjoy the light show and the boats going by in the water.
Last night wonderful experience. A must!. It was our last night in Paris & for the final night we enjoyed the Seine river cruise. Paris at night is spectacular!!

Just splendid. A lovely river to explore, either by boat, take a bus trip along the left bank or walk down along the riverside, its truly lovely with lots of bridges crossing back and forth for easing exploring.

Day and Night both wonderful. We sailed the Seine both day and night and the experience was magnificent! The guide on the boat spoke about 5 languages! The trip was comfortable and well commentated. Music appropriate to each landmark is played as well. Oh and I discovered Paris has a sandy beach! Who knew?

Take a cruise and go at night with a bottle of wine. We loved our cruise in the Seine River. We also loved walking by the river at night and siting by the river to enjoy the views. There are many people there at night so it feels safe. Bring a bottle of wine and some cheese to snack on and enjoy!

Don't miss the experience. Take any open top tour boat for a cruise on the River Seine for views of many Paris attractions. Take the cruise at night and it is magical! There are many bridges, one more beautiful than the last one, lit up and beautiful. You can take a dinner cruise also but, I think eating would get in the way of the beautiful sight seeing (there is one dinner cruise that charges from 210 euros to 250 euros per person). If you go to Paris, a River Seine cruise is a must.

old world charm. The cruise down the Seine River is always nostalgic. Loved the point where they slow down upon reaching the Eiffel Tower do we can click pictures at ease. The guided tour makes you actually feel the pulse of the city charm.
Strolling by the Seine est manifique!. But if you've not done the Bateau Mouche dinner cruise on the Seine, you've really missed a treat!They have now got it down to a fine art!!

Lovely in the day, lovelier at night. The river is best explored I think by boat. They have the ferry/ boats services that goes down and up the river. It very picturesque in the morning, u could identify most of the main attractions, the lourve, the Musee d'ordsay, the Effiel tour etc. it's very idyllic . In the evening, Paris the city of lights lights up, it a different kind of charm that u find along the river.

Boat rides. Taking a boat tour down the Seine is a great way to see the city. There are many places to exit, go exploring and then get back on the boat to another destination. A nighttime tour is especially noteworthy

Relaxing. We walked and took the river cruise. A lovely way to see the Paris sites. If you sit on the lower level they have a phone receiver you can listen to narration in the language of your choice as well as a TV screen so every seat is a good one.
Definitely take an evening tour. You will love the views at night. The view of the Eiffel Tower lit up and up close from the river is completely magical.

Love it!. We walked the river every day and never got tired of it. So much to see in the area, however, you have to watch out for the scam artist. We were approached many times by what we called the "Ring Bearers". They pretend to find gold wedding bands on the ground and are willing to give them to you for good luck. As soon as you fall for it they want money from you. Obviously the rings are not real and worthless. Amazing to see how many people are approached in a day!
The poetry of Paris. All of most noir and romantic you can immagine about this city you can find on this river. The history and the passion of this city kindly swimm on the River Seine

a trip alongside the river. Was amazed to found out that the river water is more clear than I imagined. Is nice to walk along and see people showing various old things. The less side is that there are few areas/bridges where you feel a smell of urine.

Best way of seeing Paris in short time. Seine river can be said as heart of Paris, flowing through the city passing nearby all major tourist attractions. if you are short of time (like in my case) and want to have quick view of Paris city, do take cruise on Seine river in evening and trust me you will really enjoy.Most of the places are visible from this river and itself the banks of this river are quite beautiful with good building lined up on both sides.It is really a relaxing time while taking cruise on Seine river and enjoy the evening.
River Seine. A must to take a Launch trip on the Seine and save the legs in exploring the waterfront scenery and buildings.

Relaxing view of Paris. I stepped aboard a shuttle boat and had a tour of the areas around the Seine. The tour was informative and picturesque. The tour guide spoke in several languages and there was food and beverages available for purchase.

Seine river tours. you wish to travel on the river it s lovely at night with Paris all light up. A suggestion , dont book with a travel agent. just go down to the water front and just get on a bateau mouche right there for a lot cheaper.

Beautiful sunset. This was my favourite part of the day! After being a tourist all day it was nice to unwind and have a drink watching the sunset or cruising aboard the Bato-bus! I love it and would recommend taking a stroll along the seine! There was always something going on.
The boat was accessible. We were able to get a great ride on a boat down the Seine but they didn't have a place for me to park but was able to park in the isle.

Interesting. We loved taking a boat ride on the Seine River and what was really nice was see the families/friends who would meet with wine and food to just enjoy the evening. Next time my husband and I would definitely do that.
Beautiful river in the center city. Liked : easier access to main tourist destination variety of boat tours during daytime and nighttime
Great Walking. Its just a great place to walk and how amazing are the various bridges. I think it is Pont Neuf with all the brass locks, really interesting.
Take in the River. No matter how long you are in Paris, schedule some time to walk down the river. Take a picnic. And take Bateau Mouche to tour it.

The Voyage to Honfluer. Our boat took us on somewhere near the Palais de Chaillot. Our first major stop very early in a day was to see Giverny. What a delight to be there in stillness, before hundreds of Japanese tourists lined the trails and walks. We made other stops, including Rouen, we saw Rommel's headquarters, and the weather and the quiet river Seine gave us a soft touch. Honfleur was jammed - I forget what holiday it was, but the crowd did not alter our delight with the art. As it figures in the Hornblower series of novels I read at age 15, the place was full of ghosts.

Stroll Along the River. Don't miss the opportunity to walk along the Seine - not on the street - but below - right along the river. There are beautiful homes on barges and other vessels. Catch a boat ride and enjoy the city.
Evening Cruise. What an absolutely lovely way to spend an evening it's a must do. It was romantic and beautiful. We will definitely do this again next time.

Boat tour on Seine. You just have to do it...this time we went on Sunday morning at 11 a.m., lasted about an hour. Good commentator, in English and French. Weather was beautiful and it was a pleasant way to start the day.

Seine River. Great way to see a snapshot view of Paris when you don't have a lot of time to walk around the city. Boat tours take you around the city and history info is shared by tour guide on the boat.
Seine, Amazon, Nilo, Thames, Mississippi.... one of the most iconic rivers in the world...I did not take the boats to see it better, but crossed the bridges back and forth a lot of times...

Perfect for a lovely stroll. There are all kinds of boats and tours you can do up and down the River Seine. My husband and I booked one through Meeting The French tours and it was a lovely champagne cruise up and down the river highlighting all the major attractions . We saw many other tour boats doing the same .The river seine is adorned on either side with locals and tourists alike , some come to read a book , others to drink wine and break bread , and ohers just for a lovely early eveing stroll , or a early morning job . It really is nice and although the water is very dirty and you wouldn't want to go swimming its still worth a look .

Great place for picnic. We did the boat cruise and traveled a few kms. There is so much to do along the seine. We seen heaps of people from large groups to two having picnics on the riverbanks, people having dancing classes, reading books, playing games. It's just a great place to be. I wish we had something like it in Australia.

a must. Nobody should miss this experience; If you can take this in the evening around 7-8 PM it will be nice. Such a glorious site as well as sight. Why I suggest late evening trip is that you can see the E Tower with lights. The trip is long enough to see almost all the tourist spots in evening glory especially during week ends you can enjoy the sight of partying parisans on both sides of the river
Tour Paris from the River. Very well priced, Our tour guide as quite informative, The hop on and hop is the best value, Almost on major sites can be reached with the water taxis

This river actually smells quite a lot!. There were boats on it but were very expensive and looked like they were about to sink anyway.
DEFINATELY Paris has got a lot worse in recent years.
No more romantic place anywhere. Take the river boat cruise at night. If you go about 9:30 you can watch the sunset then watch the lights all come on. Just awesome

Wonderful. Eat at a corner café and take in all the beauty of the Seine. People watch, take a river boat cruise and make sure to add your lock to the Ponts des Arts bridge with your significant other.

Dirty dirty water, lovely views. The river itself is really dirty, our first day there the fire department was cleaning out their hoses into it. The actual views are great especially at night. I love that there are bike paths and running paths to stay active if you are on vacation. The newly installed left bank across from jardin tullieres is really cool and modern. Definitely worth a stroll
Romantic. Bridges over the river are so romantic, pay attention to the locks on the bridges tied by lovers apparently, very cute
Nice River. We took complete trip of Seine River on one of the boat which is really wonderful. It was included on the Hop-On Hop-Off bus ticket. Recommended to exercise it.

Nice boat trip. We were luckily to be gifted a free cruise on the Seine, which came with running commentary and appropriate music. Having been to Paris before and used the 'Bateuxbus', the cruise was not really that much different. Worth it if you are on a romantic break though

Lots to see and do, perhaps more great things on this river than any other. Notre Dame, Eiffel, the Louvre, etc. It's hard to have a more spectacular stretch of river. A river cruise is a great idea and a walk/bike ride with stops at all the famous sites...well...you just have to do that.

Amazing view of Paris , from Seine. We experienced the Seine river tour on our December Winter Europe tour.The cruise was memorable , we can see Paris glow in the night.Altough the temperature was freezing cold , and winds are chilling , i cannot help myself to go on the decks and take pictures.We passed by several bridges,the Eiffel Tower, Musée d'Orsay, Saint-Germain-des-Prés, Notre Dame,Deville hotel, Jardin de Plantes, , the Louvre, and Champs-Élysées, along the way.Took about 1 hour + to complete the cruise.Highly recommended attraction if you visit Paris !
Not what I envisaged. Ok, not what I envisaged the foreshores need to be cleaned up and some more greenery planted. For such a famous river it seemed poorly up kept.

River cruise with a view. My partner and I went on a dinner cruise alone the Seine in July 2013. Dinner was lovely and the views were amazing. I would definitely recommend it if you have a free night in Paris.

Splendid. Took a guided boat trip on the river, beautiful way to see the city. You can also take an evening cruise including meal though these looked pricey.
There is a number of companies providing cruises and we found pre-booking on-line to be beneficial

Paris by night is the best. This was a beautiful boat tour...you can go during the day but the evening is absolutely the best. Breathtaking and gorgeous views with the city lights will give you an experience you'll never forget. Many tour operators speak English and will provide an interesting and historic view of one of the world's most fascinating cities.
Amazing. Take the boat cruise and admire all the famous attractions. However, I would advise you to walk along the Seine as much as you can,because it is a wonderful Parisian experience.
Take a Cruise. We took a cruise around the seine river. Tickets can be purchased from opposite the Eiffel tower, near the river. Again night time is best.

Boat trips are great to get about. We got a day pass for a boat trip which visited all the attractions along the river Seine. You can get on and off as many times as you like between 10am and 9pm for 15 euros each.

amazing Paris. you must buy a padlock , write on your names and lock it to the Pont Neuf bridge. Each time you return to Paris - try and find it again ! Great River Cruise , and hop on and hop off bus good too .

The best way to see so much of historic Paris. Every traveller to Paris should take a boat trip up the Seine. It's the way to see so many of the city's finest buildings, and the boat we chose from the quay by the Musee d'Orsay had a first class recorded commentary. Do it early in your stay then choose from the fifty or so attractions you pass as to which ones you want to spend more time at.Some trips offer dinner. I've tried this but found it a bit inconvenient. The river trip is mostly better by day and it's hard to concentrate on one's dinner and the magnificent architecture on the banks.The quais are also one of the best places I've ever found to go jogging.

A Little Bit of Relaxation. A very enjoyable way to spend an hour seeing the city and many of its landmarks from a boat while enjoying the last rays of sunshine. It was only 13 euros and it gave our weary legs a rest. It's not until you are on your way down the river you realise how many bridges cross the Seine.
Pleasant, price affordable. For 12 Euros you can do a day boat ride and sit back, relax, and see the lovely sites along the river.

Very nice. Boat ride ( there are 2 or 3 different companies) was very nice. I don't recall how much we paid, but one thing irritated us. Most places in Paris charge a person to use the toilet. This is one thing if you aren't making a purchase there, but I really feel that when you are spending money on their attraction, they could at least let you use a toilet. It was .50 euro to use a filthy, tiny bathroom with 2 men standing outside handing you a Kleenex because there are no paper towels. We were a little disgusted with that after paying for the boat ride. However, the Seine itself was a nice historic ride.

Boat Tour from Notre Dame. Between Notre Dame and the Latin Quarter, on the Latin Quarter side of the river. Smaller boats and not so crowded. Some of those larger boats from the more travelled spots are packed. Takes you all the way down to the Eiffel Tower and back.

Boat cruise on the Seine. We stood in line for ages and took a night boat cruise on the Seine - we got a bit of a discount because we had a metro pass each for the day - the toilets were disgusting though (no door on the men's but they used the urinal anyway!!) so do not count on going to the bathroom on the boat, go before you get in line. It was very pleasant and the Eiffel Tower was lit up by the time we got off. Something you must do at least once.

A Fab Night. We took the dinner sailing trip which lasts for 2.5 hrs. The view from the boat was perfect and returning back in the dark, afforded a spectacular view of the Eiffel Tower. The food was excellent as was the service. Alcohol was free throughout the meal and included table water and coffee. It is expensive though...£150 per person on the boat we chose and we were not dressed for the occasion as we booked on the spur of the moment, but the management were quite happy to let us on board in out tourist scruffs. The on-board photographer was a bit pricey @ 20 euros per photo. They need to understand if they lowered the cost, they would sell more.

Best in August during Paris Plages. It's a narrower-than-I-thought river that bisects the Right and Left banks of Paris, with a roadway on either side. Nothing special. Ive seen better rivers. However, mid-July to mid-August, they do Paris Plages, with a beach and activities and restaurants and they close down the roadways to auto traffic. Much more interesting!

Nice!. Especially on warm days it's nice to make a boattrip on the Seine.With Bateaux Mouches you get a whole tour with some information about all the buildings you see dureing the trip. It's very touristic, but it's nice.

What an Experience!. We had the pleasure of strolling along the River Seine on a Thursday evening this past August. We enjoyed seeing many people having an evening picnic while enjoying a wonderful sunset. The music was playing, and the wine was flowing. It was truly a magical Parisian evening....We returned again on the Sunday afternoon and experienced a totally different ambiance. More relaxing and lazy enjoyment of an afternoon in the sun (no wine or picnicking noticed this time:)

Batobus is totally worth it. You absolutely MUST take a cruise on the River Seine and the best way, in my opinion, is the Batobus. This is a hop-on-hop-off ticket and allows you to ride all day (or for a discounted price, additional days too). They make a loop and stop at all the top attractions: Eiffel Tower, Musée d'Orsay, Saint-Germain-des-Prés, Notre Dame, Jardin de Plantes, Hotel DeVille, the Louvre, and Champs-Élysées and back again to the Eiffel Tower. See Paris from a whole different perspective from the water. Also, Paris at night is spectacular. You will know why they call it The City of Light.A word of warning however, I don't recommend the Batobus as an alternative method of transport. I had the idea that I could float along, see some sights, and get to the other end of the city efficiently. This is slooooooow transport, so don't try multi-tasking like I did. If you need to get across town quickly, take Metro. If you are in no particular hurry, the Batobus is a nice option. The entire round trip takes about 90 minutes.P.S. there are vending machines onboard

Sunset. We stayed on Ile St Louis for a week and couldn't avoid the Seine.In the evenings we'd walk the perimeter of Ile St Louis and take in the magnificent views from the island and bridges.I'd recommend you build time into your itinerary to experience the river this way.

Nice cruise. We did the 1 hour river cruise. Bought tickets at the dock, though I believe you can get a discount online. It is worth it as it allows you to see the city from a different perspective. Great if you only have a few days in the city. Great to do with children.

Too rushed & crowded. If you really want to cruise the River Seine rather than walk then I strongly advise avoiding the 1 hr trips. They are too rushed & too crowded. If you're on a tight budget though or your holiday package includes this then sit in the uncovered section of the boat where the view is good, inside the boat is too crammed & you can't see properly especially if you're short like me!

Sailing into Paris. We took our motor cruiser over to France and made our way from Dunkirk to Paris On the Canal du Nord over seven weeks. The trip by canal is THE way to see Paris from a different angle, the mixture of water, trees, nature and then - Paris comes into view! The mixture of old and new architecture is second to none and a great experience. The French canals have lots of facilities for gas, electricity and water and in a lot of 'Port de Plaisance' (which are places to moor your boat), there are usually shops within an easy reach. We were able to eventually moor our boat in Paris Arsenal Marina for a cost of 28 Euros a night which might seem a bit pricey but where else could you get a place in the middle of Paris for that amount of money? This price will alter with the length of your boat, ours is 38 foot long. Also, they have all facilities such as washing machines, showers, electricity, water and free wifi. I appreciate that not everyone is going to be able to do this but if you can, I strongly recommend it. An alternative to see Paris from the water would be to take one of the river cruises which are very popular but I am not sure of the cost of these. There are a number of companies doing the same thing and I am pretty certain that the prices will be within a euro of each other. The boats do move very quickly but cover a good deal of the Seine (some even come into the marina!) which saves the old shoe leather and poorly feet! Additionally, along the Seine, you can rent sun beds, umbrellas etc to relax on the man made beaches which are very clean and well maintained. You can't go in the water obviously but there are 'mist showers' where you can walk through to cool off. There are toilets (clean) and first aid response on the shore and on the water too. All in all, it is a fabulous holiday spot with something for everyone. Is it pricey? Not as bad as you think it would be. There are lots of little restaurants who do toasted sandwiches, salads etc and they are probably on a par with the UK. Beer is expensive at around 8 euros a pint but wine is cheaper!

relaxing. after dinner at the Eiffel Tower we did a cruise on the river it was very relaxing. The cruise normally goes for 1 hour but because there were so many boats on the water the cruise took nearly 2 hours it was great, would highly recommend it

"Must Do". We really enjoyed the Seine River cruise and think it is a "must do" attraction while in Paris. You get to see the beautiful architectural buildings, Notre Dame, magnificent bridges, and great views of the Eiffel Tower. It was one of our favorite excursions while on our Cosmos, Best of Europe tour.

My dream excursion. After seeing the movie ANGELA, where the main characters ride up the river, I have wanted to do the same. Pictures galore and sights flashing around you will fill your scrap book. We went at about six o'clock. I think had it been at dusk we would have never gotten off the boat.

The Cruises are Worth It!. You won't get a better view of Paris than you do from the River! You also need to take a few minutes and walk along and look at some of the wares from the vendors selling along the river. Again, a can't miss in Paris!

Walk the Seine and enjoy the scenery. Although others have commented about taking boat cruises along this beautiful river I advise a more traditional approach - walking. We did notice the many cruises going up and down crammed with tourists and thought it was not for us. You miss out on being able to stop and enjoy the view, shops, the artists selling amazing posters, art and other interesting things and little cafes along the way. You can walk down right on the river or along the streets above. Visit a supermarket and buy some bread and cheese and sit down on the rivers edge and enjoy the feel of Paris. This is much cheaper than the overpriced restaurants in the tourist areas. The bridges are also worth looking at as they contain a lot of history. Most of the main attractions in Paris are either on or a stones throw from the Seine so enjoy at your leisure. The best part of walking is that it is free.
A very good romantic walk. The bulidings on the river are amazing.Don't miss the sights when the sun-sets and all the glass windows turn red and orange!

THE river. When you think of Paris, Seine comes first to your mind. You can't leave Paris without having walked along the river, cross the bridges, take a look at the bookinists. It's really worhthile to cross the river with a bateau mousse, enjoy this lovely route and admire the most significant monuments of Paris. Although it may seem dirty, it is important to know that many kinds of fish live in its water.
River Boat at night. Take a jacket, it does get chilly in the evening! The tour is short and precise. Eiffel tower at night is gorgeous!

Bateay Mouche. We have taken a cruise with the boats called Bateau Mouche. This is in George V Avenue perpendicular to the Seine. The cruise took us through the main monuments of Paris and it was an excellent cruise.
Worthwhile. A great way of seeing different parts of Paris and to get your bearings relaxing after lots of stairways in the metro great commentary

River Seine. An absolute must, we did this late in the day on our arrival day. This was a great choice to see the city when we were very tired from an overnight flight. Just sit back and watch as you cruise by. Did a lot of research trying to find "best" boat but seemed like they were all about the same.
Don't miss an open air boat ride on the Seine. We have done this ride in full sun and at dusk when lights came on in the City of Lights...awesome ride...loved it.
Paris Trip. We took a dinner cruise on the Seine on Le Calife. Great food and views. Saw Notre Dame, Eiffel Tower, Statue of Liberty from our table.

good price. great price around 9 euros for a trip on the bateaux from the eiffel tower to notre dame and back, running commentary in all languages if you want it. some great views from a different angle.

A nice walking tour. Really nice banks of the Seine river, great places to take romantic photos. A bit cold in October, but absolutely worth it. Many bridges to be back in the city streets in just a minute or two. In the evenings it has a special charm.

Bâteaux mouches. It was a beautiful trip along the Seine. Don't be put off by the long lines. They are well organised. If you opt for a bench at the front of the boat, you'll think you will get a great view and in comfort. Not so! The minute the boat sets off, people will stand in front of you and block your view. Opt for a seat on the upper deck.

Gotta do it. It is a must, and a must during sunset. Take the cruise from a point near the landmark that you wish to spend some time at. Time youself to include queue time so you can get on the boat around the time the light are being turned on. Some piers have vending machines that sell tickets that can save you half an hour to queue for tickets. Many operators are on the Seine doing identical thing. So decide where you want to get on (may it be near a subway station, or a landmark you want to visit) and go.
Clean but smaller than you would expect. Maybe I am used to the Thames, but the Seine seems cleaner and smaller in comparison. Cleaner is good, smaller not so good...

Great place for a picnic after a day of Sightseeing. There is something special about this river. Surrounded by beautiful century old buildings and rich in history, it’s the perfect setting for an evening picnic. I didn't do the cruise on this visit, but it's always a greay way to appreciate the city’s beauty.

Started the day well. Purchased the tickets as part of a bus tour of the city (discounted with bus tickets). Modern beautifully appointed vessel.The hour trip was fantastic and you get to see the city from a completely different angle and various aspects and landmarks close up. Commentary available down stairs

Take a Boat Tour. Make sure you take a Boat Tour of the Seine and bring your camera! Don't be surprised, though, when rude tourists mess up your shot by standing up randomly to get their pictures. Still, you enjoy the architecture along the Seine and don't miss the beautiful statue of St. Genevieve, patron Saint of Paris. The tour begins near the Eiffel Tower and is an hour well spent!

A leisurely look at Paris. My sister & I did the 1 hour cruise along the River Seine. It had been a warm and busy day for us , so a cruise late afternoon was perfect for a sit down and at the same time see the sights /landmarks of Paris.The commentary was a little difficult to work out @ times ( it was in both french & english), but that was not a problem. Very enjoyable afternoon, would recommend this tour.

Cycled down seine river. River seine was amazing, with most of Paris attraction on either sides of it, you will probably not missed it, every part of the river highlights the different beauty of is river, to think that it was dirty and littered in the past, this river is one of the amazing river that run thru the city, day or night, it is amazing, I cycled along the river on my own with my fiancée , it was easy to rent , follow the traffic and stop where u like to pose for a picture. Try it !

Always delivers. i have been to Paris may times, and the River Seine always has something to offer. Fun to take a walk, and picnic on its banks, Parisian style, or take a river tour, they may be 'touristy' but a wonderful way to see Paris, especially at night when the buildings are illuminated. Can't wait for my next trip back.

Best deal in all of Paris. We had the great fortune of discovering the Batobus. Translation: water taxi. For 15 euros per person you can ride the Batobus all day, and hop off and on as many times as you like. For 18 euros per person, you can buy a two day pass, which is what we did. The Batobus makes eight stops. Our fabulous hotel was in between The Hotel Deville stop and the Notre Dame stop. Batobus runs from 10 am until 9:30 pm. Other stops along the river include Champs Elysses, The Louvre, The Eiffel tower, Musee D'Orsay, Saint Germaine, and Jardins de Plantes. Batobus offers spectacular panoramic views and convenience. All along River Seine are cafes, the beaches, houseboats and the most amazing architecture one could imagine. The river is beautiful day and night and has a life all it's own. Approaching I'lse de Cite and I'lse Saint Louis by boat creates quite a spectacular visual. If you've never seen Paris from the River Seine your missing Paris.

Enjoyable way to see many Paris sights. My French host bought day-tickets for a Batobus boat trip that performed a fixed circuit passing by many famous museums, churches, bridges and monuments. I believe the cost was 15 Euros a ticket, which is not cheap. Anyway, it was a beautiful sunny day and a very pleasant way to see so many sights. The boat travels down one side of the river and returns on the other side. Although the temperature was 31C, a pleasant breeze from the clean, green-coloured river kept us cool. You are allowed to leave the boat at any of 8 locations, returning to board a subsequent boat (they arrive every 20 minutes). We did this once at the Notre Dame stop. Commentary is provided in four languages and you are given a leaflet that shows the route to be followed and all the possible points when you can leave the boat. It was a very enjoyable ride, although I think it would be much less good on a cloudy or raining day. During August there are many such boats on the river, all of which are almost full of passengers. It seems that you can always find a seat, though.
River cruise from Pont Neufchâtel. Excellent cruise - book in advance to get cheaper tickets but excellent trip and well worth the money
Friendly. Do the one hour tour. Lovely perspective off all the sights from the river. I booked the bigbus tour and cruise combined from home before I left.
brilliant. Used The boat that leaves fro Pont Neuf. Excellent value for money Nine Euros for an hours trip. Very comfortable and superb commentary.

Beautiful sight to behold. Pure natural beauty
Fine architecture along its bank
Well-engineered bridges
Scenic as you take a leisurely stroll...
And enjoy every minute of it!
Amazing scenery. Although I saw it more then 10 years ago it stays an impressive view, But just to have a picture taken and a nice memory, we will not forget the beautiful surroundings

Best place to relax and enjoy the paris lifestyle. Best place to visit in paris, great bridges to observe and if you have time take a late afternoon off to relax sitting on the river side while enjoying music or a nice picnic. Definitely do the cruising

a lovely place to stroll. the bridges are interesting & walking along the river affords a nice view of so many of the famous sites in Paris. Sandy beach areas with chairs are in place along the way & has created a nice gathering place for people. the upper level walk is full of street vendors (blocking the view below) but it is a part of the tourist scene & makes for some good people watching, as well! It is also a good way to get your bearings when you arrive so you can chart out your plan for sight-seeing.
A must. I would reccommend that you take a boat trip down the Seine - panoramic view and very god value for money
This is a must do. WE decided to head up the seine on a river cruise and this I feel is almost a highlight of the holiday. Am pleased we did this mid afternoon so my photos are really spectacular.
One hour cruise is memorable experience.. The one hour cruises give a worthwhile visual of the key sights from a different perspective and is a positive experience.
River Seine. Buy the day ticket and travel up and down it all day to see your attractions. A bit expensive but much better than walking.

Relaxing Dinner Cruise. The 2 hour dinner cruise was the most relaxing evening after a hard day. The meal was very good and the wine was pleasing. It was the first time i was really able to enjoy my surroundings without being hot or pressed by too many people.

Get a 5 day batobus ticket. 1 day, 2 day or 5 day pass. Google search batobus Paris. Great way to travel in nice weather.
Goes to all major attractions in central Paris.
Well recommended.

Seine river trip. There are regular boart services from the bateau terminal on the Seine , the trips take around sixty minutes ad do a loop around the Isle de Paris , There are a lot of interesting bridges , good communications , and many points of interest ., the boats are catamarans , extremely stable and chug along at a respectable pace . The whole experience is a relaxing epsisode , welcomed after a long walk around the Louvre , there are restaurants , shops and toilets along the quayside on permanently moored boats . Within a few yards of the Eiffel Tower
Very peaceful. Highly recommend taking the boat at night. It is really beautiful see everything lit up. All of the brideges that you pass are very unique and interesting to look at for sure.

The river just makes Paris great. Paris would not be the same without the River Seine. We spent hours walking along the river. Exploring the bridges and the places alongside the river like the Palace de Concorde and the area around the Louvre.

Wonderful Experience On Cruise. Took a river cruise to view the night line of Paris. The view of buildings after dusk from the river was amazing. At certain point of interval, the Eiffel Tower actually glitters. Very romantic view.

Boats trips are a must. So much to do in Paris, but it is lovely to take time out and see it differently. A completely new perspective can be had from seeing Paris from the Seine; it definitely has a different romantic atmosphere! I would recommend going when the lights are coming on and the sun is setting, just beautiful.
Scenic view of paris. One can enjoy famous landmarks of paris through it. A evening boat ride is must if you want to see paris in night.
lovely river cruise. Brilliant river cruise, high recommend. lasted about a hour, saw lots of the sites from the Seine. Staff on boat wonderful
Walk by or take a cruise. Walk by and breathe fresh air, hold hands and enjoy romance at sunset.You can even take a boat (which we didnt but heard rgey were worth a try).

Paris Lock Bridge. If you have a love wish, here is the place 'Lock Bridge'. For those of you who haven’t heard of them, here's the story. A couple writes their names on a padlock and locks it onto one of the bridges. They then throw the key into the Seine River as a symbol of their undying love. I had mine how about you?

This river is like a beautiful song!. Make a boat tour, just walk on the shore, make a picninc, eat, drink , realax, sleep, cycle, listen to live music round the clock, play music if you like, meet interesting people; I am just wondering about the list of unending and beautiful activities that you can do round the clock if you are around Seine! This river is like a beautiful song, everytime you sing or listen to it, you will discover something new!

The Seine. This river travels through the heart of Paris and provides a well-remembered division in the city. The RIGHT BANK and LEFT BANK are derived from the rivers flow. . .if the water is flowing towards the sea it is the right bank. The Louvre, Gardens, etc are on the right bank, with the Eiffel on the left bank.
Be sure to go on a river trip. the river trips are wonderful during the day and even better at night . Definitely well worth the money!

You should not miss a cruise. Boats are very comfortable and the cruise surely worth the price. My only question is why the tour was in french, although the cruise is touristic and all of us were not French...

Boating on the River Seine. Took a one hour boat tour; felt like we were on our own personal cruise ship. Music to entertain us along with spectacular views of all the places we visited. Very reasonable tour!

River Cruise. We took a late night cruise up the Seine and it was amazing. So beautiful to see everything lit up and to see the differerent bridges. The locals hang out on the river banks with wine, food and music so it was so fun to see that.

A lovely night tour. We did a night tour in the river of the romantic city, it was amazing. Seeing Eiffel Tower at night is just another different experience. You get to know a lot of different attractions around Paris as well. I strongly recommend the tour, if not, just walk along the river anytime and enjoy the atmosphere!

The most boring thing I did in Paris.. So the first part of this boat trip is fairly interesting, you get to see lots of different land marks that are pointed out to you by the guide. But then you have to turn around and go past all the same things again... I will admit I know it is shocking but I fell asleep! Maybe as someone younger it was not well appreciated, a maturer person may find it more interesting- I also think a night cruise would be better.

Majestic. Visited on the eve of Assumption Day and there was a procession of boats and a beautiful sunset over the Seine. When we walked along it the next day, we loved it in the day time. I would suggest that the authorities hose under the bridges as the smell of urine is overwhelming in some cases.

For constant travel up and down the River Seine try the Batobus. The Batobus has eight main stops at all the relevant places to visit and explore, hop on hop off, no commentary, but a boat every twenty minutes makes it a good way to travel even if it is just for a rest from walking.
Lovely walk. Lovely to stroll along the banks and take in the sights. A people watching must. The bridges are fantastic!

Sensuous Seine. What's more romantic than a walk along the Seine? NOTHING!! Day or night, it is one of the most romantic places on earth!! Walk across the many bridges, and be sure to bring a padlock to attach to one of them to ensure your love forever!! The Seine and its bridges are breathtaking. You can also take a boat ride on the Seine or splurge on one of the dinner cruises. While those venues are fun, just walking along the river while people-watching and taking in the Parisian scene is quite enough!!

The Paris beach. Literally, Paris lays down sand, palm trees and hundreds of lounge chairs to create a "beach". In other times of year the river is a calming water feature and makes you feel more like a local than all of those tourists floating by in the giant boats.
Great tour. Go in the evening on 9 pm tour and you arrive back at the tower just when they turn on the twinkle lights. Beautiful!!!!!

a peacefull place. this river is so pretty yet so busy at the same time .we loved the fact from every bridge we saw a different sight . and been able to walk along its banks and sit and watch the crowds while in the August sunshine .a wonderful place to catch your breath in a very busy city
Nice views on 2 banks. It was a nice ride down to Eiffel in the tourist boat, pass by Musee dOrsay, Le Jardines, Notre Dame,. Buy a hop on and off tickets and spend the day exploring. Will be fun.

Best night time activity. At night, just walk down along or even better, grab a bottle of wine, some good company and go down right along there and hang out. Many locals hang out down there and the vibe is amazing. The seine at night is my favorite part of Paris.
Bateau mouche. A very relaxing way to spend some time. Multi-lingual info. The queue moved very quickly and it was a good way to get your bearings around many of the famous sights.

crepe and wine. great view,didn't do boat trip so busy and boats were cramped with people.We sat and had a crepe and some wine by the Seine and people watched,lovely and relaxing.Seine very clean looking,very busy with people and boat traffic but still relaxing atmosphere.

get a day hop on hop off boat ticket on the river. This is a good way to get from place to place easily or enjoy the view from the river on a round trip for orientation. You need a sunhat. Basic tourist info in french English and spanish.

Don't miss a night time cruise. We did a night time cruise and what a treat it was. NIghttime is really the ONLY way to see Paris from the Seine. Lasts about an hour. Great views of the Tour Eiffel. Pretty good guided commentary in English and French.

Take a cruise on the Seine. We took a cruise on the Seine and it was one of our highlights in Paris. I highly recommend taking a cruise around sunset and in the summer! You can hear music being played, cruise past dancers, admire lovers lounging in the shady grass.

Nice place to stroll. We (2 adults and 4 children) had to walk from the Pont Alma to the Musee d'Orsay so we decided to go via a riverside stroll along the Seine(I want to say the Left Bank). Apparently the city has just recently revived the area along the riverbank by making it pedestrian only and putting many play areas, benches, and washrooms over a 2 mile stretch. It was entertaining for the kids to jump onto the various playground sets, etc. so we didn't hear too much complaining about the distance we walked which was nice. I wouldn't necessarily make it a point to come to spend an afternoon or anything but it is nice for a break from the hustle and bustle of museums and other busy attractions.

Garrod August 2013. We travelled along the river swine with cassettes du pont neuf and found it lovely. We went on the evening trip so Paris was all lite up and the announcer was brilliant with describing all the interesting facts about Paris
Beautiful way to see Paris. Free with the Paris Pass. Boards just beside the Eiffel Tower. A good way to see the city. Lots of street artist by the Quay.

An Evening Stroll. First evening in Paris and a stroll along the Seine.A busy evening on the water with sightseeing trips and the police boats whizzing up river. Very relaxing walk was had watching all the activity , plenty of places to stop sit and take in the views opposite. Every where being very clean too.
Relaxing walk.. It's a nice, relaxing stroll. Make sure you grab some ice cream along the way to make the walk more enjoyable!

Beautiful way to see the Eiffel and Notre Dame. We just ran and hopped on a night river cruise, cash only, and it was great. The guide informed us of all the sights we were seeing along with a little history of each thing. The views of the people all over the banks, the Notre Dame cathedral, the artificial beach they truck in, and of course the Eiffel Tower twinkling at night made it an amazing tour. There were storm clouds rolling in and a nice breeze to cut the heat in July, but it didn't rain on us. Someone threw an egg from a bridge that hit the deck. The next day in line at the catacombs I mentioned it to a family in line and they laughed, stating that they were on the same cruise and it had hit right by their legs. It did not detract from the tour and was a fluke. I'd take the tour again. I wish hey went down past the Eiffel to SW the Statue of Liberty there on the river.
Beach fun!. We were there the last week in July and they bring in TONS of sand and it was fun to see how they made a beach w/all the stuff you see at the beach, along w/the crowds!

fantastic. booked a one hour cruise , just awesome good value and great photo shots.
Just great memories.
great memories as we passed by , puts the old River Thames to shame in my opinion.
In Awe!. Took an hour river cruise and it basically mapped out our entire Paris itinerary; Louvre, Love lock Bridge, Notre Dame. Fantastic introduction for our first day in Paris.

Loads to do - get a tour. Quite a few big cities have rivers flowing through them and by nature the earliest settlements are around the banks, but the Seine may probably be one of the best rivers flowing through a city when it comes to attractions and activities on its banks.You have the Eiffel Tower on the western end facing the Trocadero, as you go east you pass the Invalides, Pont Alexandra III, then the obelisk, later you come past Jardin Tuleries and the National Assembly, also pass by both Louvre and Musee d'Orasay. And then you finally come to the 2 islands which are the oldest settlements in Paris. All along you pass underneath various bridges, many of which have thousands of locks showing the pledges of many a lover. During summer months you'll find that the city administration puts up loads of deck chairs along the river for people to relax along the plage (beach).There are various companies which offer tours on the Seine and I would certainly opt for the night rides as Paris and especially the Eiffel tower look beautiful lit up. Go drench yourself in beautiful Paris.

Great way to see the sights. The boat we took was not too expensive and it was the best way to see some of the sights. If the Eiffel Tower had been twinkling when we passed there it would have been spectacular.

twilight. I was advised to make sure I took a twilight cruise along the seine while in Paris. I am so thankful for that advice. It was a reasonable cost and worth every penny. Don't go in the daytime. Remember Paris is the city of lights and it is magical at twilight. The Eifel tower lights up and flashes during the twilight cruise. it is amazing and gives you a real sense of Paris and its ambience.

Absolutely wonderful. Get the Bato Bus, you can get on and off as often as you like, use it for transport, not just sightseeing. The river takes you passed many great sights of Paris, and is a great way to take a breather if you have been pounding the streets.The day pass is 15 Euro, 2 days is 18. get the 2 days, it's worth it

Very good :). 13 Euro's for adults & 5 Euro's for children over 4, under 4 Free. We bought our tickets from the ticket office at the bottom of the stairs which are opposite the Eiffel Tower & then boarded after about 15 mins.Boat very clean, Staff nice & friendly.The cruise was nice & informative.This is the 2nd time I've done it so would leave it a good while before doing it again.Enjoyed it & so did my family :)

Floating down the river. It is always fun and necessary to cross the Seine in taxi or by foot to visit all of Paris but the boat rides on a hot day can not be beat. Take the ride to the Effile Tower or explore the other end to the last stop where you will find a park; a private carasoul museum and delicious worker's traditional cafes. I always but the two day pass when on rare occassions it is desirable to escape the heat of Paris.

Boat tour! Loved it - saw a lot. Great for kids.. We had just a couple of days in Paris and excellent weather (lucky us!), so the river boat tour was an excellent way to see a lot. It was hot and sunny for us on our one full day in Paris. We'd seen the Eiffel Tower the day we arrived, so that was checked off the list. In the morning we went to Jardin du Luxembourg and played in the playground there, then got lunch and a snack from a nearby boulangerie. Then we walked a bit and, given the heat and our kids (2 and 4 years) complaints of exhaustion, we decided to do something that involved sitting: a river cruise/tour. We didn't have to wait in line at all really. We bought tickets and got on an open top boat. It wasn't that full (off-peak season, mid-week, afternoon). It was pretty long - almost 2 hours - we were delayed by some kind of filming by the river on the way back. The boat tour moves along the river toward Notre Dame. Government buildings, Historical sites, and the many bridges are some of the attractions you see. Some of the bridges are quite old and the tour guide announcements mention this. The views of Notre Dame are beautiful from the river. The tour goes around the island and then heads back down the Seine toward the Eiffel Tower. And then turn around again to go back to the nearby dock. This was pretty great, because we could not have seen so much in such a short time any other way. The kids were thrilled that they could sit or walk around a bit without us fretting over the roads and traffic.It was truly a very pleasant experience floating down the Seine on a sunny day - just lovely.Even though the temperature was around 80F that day, it felt super-hot on the open deck of the boat. Take something to drink!!! I got a bit of sunburn. Granted I was not wearing block and should have been, but we didn't set out with a plan to go on the boat cruise. Wear sunblock!!!This is an excellent opportunity for photography. But all the passengers recognize this. So you'll need to stake out your spot, especially if the boat is a bit busy, to get an unimpeded shot.

Promenade heaven. Walk both sides of the River Seine. Take your time and stop at the many cafes along the river. It is a perfect place to go for a long walk daytime or nighttime and experience the fantasy views of many of the major landmarks of Paris. Cross the many bridges, put a padlock on one of the pedestrian bridges and join the thousands of others who do this to guarantee they'll return to Paris in the future.

Stay out of the boat. I guess everyone needs to do the Seine if you are in Paris, but the river is so low below the bank that there is not much perspective. We used the Bateaubus - a hop on and hop off so were able to be returned to the Eiffel Tower stop just as the lights began to twinkle at 10 OM. That was a great sight.

Take a walk, or sit and watch. We walked along both side from the Eiffel tower to Notre-Dame many days. Always beautiful boats, bridges, cafes, people just sitting with a bottle of wine. Feels like Paris.
Well worth the money. A great way to see the city, I would recommend doing the trip one hour before sunset and do not bother about dining on board do it else where when you are back on dry land.
Padlock. Head over to Notre Dame and put your padlock on the bridge, plus you could lose an hour reading the thousands of padlocks on the bridge. A lovely memory to leave behind.

superSeine. from any bridge, its a most beautiful and romantic view. my favourite bridges were near Musee D'orsay (heart lockets on the bridge for romantics...bring your own lock or get ripped off), or near the Louvre.

Almost Romantic But Still Worth The Effort. We decided to go for it-- a full dinner cruise on the Seine river. Unfortunately our trip got off to a rough start as the taxi driver had no idea where the pier was located. I guess he just got off the boat... Anyway we walked about a half mile near the Eiffel tower to find a bustling port of river cruise boats. Boarding and check in was well organized and we were guided to a table for two alongside a glass covered cupola allowing us to see everything along the river. The trip lasted over two hours, the food and wine were excellent-- not unlike a well recognized cruise ship meal. There was live entertainment and plenty of landmarks to see both in the sunset and in the dark. The program was hosted by Bateau Parisienne on the Diamanté. We would recommend this experience for visitors who want to see Paris but don't want to walk a lot. Make sure your cabbie has a GPS!
Seine River cruise. A relaxing way to spend the time, but not necessarily the best way to see the sights. The tour guide was wonderful and full of information.

Batobus is a great way to see the main sites. We purchased the two day a la carte with the open tour bus. This has been a great value to get the overall view of the different Paris neighbourhoods, and the main areas along the Seine. It is really well organized and comfortable.

Plage, a little silly. Every Summer the French establish a beach along the Seine. Its a nice idea but not practical. First, it causes a traffic jams because of the roads that are closed. Second, its so far above the water line to make swimming impractical. Not a place for tourist.River tour boats are a better choice. Pick one up at the Eiffel Tower.

wonderful. best part of paris being by the river. from taking a boat trip at night to finding randomly near the notre dam people randomly gathering and dancing to old time music at night. i fell in love with it and the people.
A must ride. If you're smart you'll buy the pass for the all day ride. You get to leave the boat and come back all day as long as you like.

Dinner cruise on the Seine. Stunningly romantic. Would highly recommend to anyone. Bateaux Parisiens made everything perfect. Lovely food, great atmosphere and seeing all the sights as the sun goes down - what more could anyone want?

On a boat tour or along the quays. Either way, it's an amazing experience. In the summer, there's so much going on along the quays. Bring lunch and a bottle of wine and sit on one of the benches or any other place suitable for sitting (there are many) and have a picnic along the Seine. You'll see many residents doing this especially on weekend evenings.Take a leisurely walk without any destination, just enjoy the scenery. Or take the Batobus to get to your destination.
So much to see and do.. With the Paris Plages, walkways, dinner cruises, beautiful bridges, wonderful sites, what's not to like. Paris literally revolves around the Seine.

Without her,would you still come?. The river is a magnetic drawcard from anywhere in Paris.It flows right through the heart of the city,bordering ten of the twenty arrondisements. Don't stand at street corners with a crumpled map trying to work out which side of the river bank ,you are standing on. The trick is, face down river,the Left Bank is on your left and the Right Bank is on your right. There are 32 bridges on the river some more impressive than others. The oldest ,Pont Neuf has been immortalized by artists,writers and the movies. Its a great place to hang out on a bench under the willow trees or sun bake on the embankments.Dont forget the mesmerizng treat of watching the boats float by. Another popular bridge is the Pont des Arts. Its made from metal and is entirely pedestrian. Stand here,gripping the rails and gape at the most stunning views of Paris. Look around and you will find it a great place to hang and use as a pick-me-up zone. People bring wine,and picnic whilst strumming guitars. The atmosphere is festive .  Below the bridge is a bee-hive of activity with joggers,cyclists,strollers and sunbathers making use of the elegant stone quays. The quays run along the entire length of the river. This is where 'Paris-beach' is.The river banks are always good for exploration,with floating houseboats,restaurants & cafes. Check out the various water levels from past floods and the giant iron rings to tie the river barges to the docks. The very best way to get the feel of the river is by boat. There are many boat tour operators offering services from taxi boats to private dining experiences. The leading company is Bateau-Mouches and another company explores the canal St.Martin. The batobus sails up and down the Seine from the Eiffel Tower to the Institute du Mondo Arabe with stops along the main attractions. Like a hop-on,hop-off bus,you can travel up and down the river at your pleasure.

beautiful river cruise. paid like 13 euro for the one hour cruise along the river. cruise start at the foot of Effiel Tower and goes all the way to Notre Dame where the boat will turn around. take the cruise during sunset and watch Paris transform into a nighttime wonder...
Wonderful way to spend time.. We booked a cruise down the Seine with Viator. The trip itself was great and would recommend but be aware you have to queue and the lines are long.
boat cruise. Take a cruise down the Seine, whether it's for an expensive meal or just a tour boat, it's worth it to see the sites from the water! :)
tour. Traveling the Seine was great but we didn't need to do a tour. I would just take the Batobus and see the sights

On/Off boat tour was perfect!. This is a must when you're in Paris. You get on/get off whenever you please, visit, dine, whatever, then return to the boat whenever you wish. I thought it was one of the better ideas we had to tour.
Batobus is excellent value. Buy a 2-day Batobus ticket and you can hop on and off as often as you like a get round the major sights in comfort

Take a long walk along the Seine. I started my glorious walk along the Seine starting at Notre Dame and stopping along the way at Musee D Orsay then on to the Eiffel tower. The photographs I took were so beautiful and the crisp Sunday morning air made the walk so refreshing!

Don't miss the boat cruises !. Don't just look at the Seine from the bridges, take the boat cruise!It's beautiful, romantic and you get 'like you are in a middle of a fairytale' feeling. Especially by night, I would never take a cruise by day because it's not so fascinating!The prices are good, you can take either a luxury one or a most ordinary boat, and you'll have the same impression, so it's not a big deal which boat to take, the Seine and all the surroundings are the most important :)When going by night, wear some sweatshirt or a jacket, either going in the summer or in the autumn, it can become really cold.Enjoy the Seine!

Charming Seine. We went on the river side from Tour Eiffel up to the Pont Alexandre III, and on the other day from Cite to Louvre. We felt a charming atmosphere, admired nice view and saw plenty of relaxed and cheerful people enjoying the tremendous environment. Seine is beautiful, you can never get tired from ovserving it and want to come to the river again and again.

A cruise on the Seine - a great way to see Paris. The river is lovely, green, clean and iconic, like Paris, the city. It is the lifeblood of the city, and a cruise on the river is a fantastic way to see the great sights of Paris, and Parisians sunbathing on the banks if its summer. Most of the major attractions can be accessed from the river, but its also very pleasant on a boat, without traffic jams or the street noise. Definitely highly recommended - do a Seine cruise, or better still, a hop-on, hop-off, river bus service such as the Batobus.
Sunbathing by the seine. We visited the free beach at the seine les plages and spent a lovely afternoon sunbathing, we walked along the seine and watched some fantastic street performers too.

Cruise o-la-la. my wife and I had the great fortune of cruising the Seine River from Paris to Normandie . this unspoiled river retains much of its splendor and glory and is not littered with overbuild of many locals in other cities. we took the River Baroness, which is operated by Uniworld and spent a wonderful week visiting Rouen, Les Andellyes, and Giverny. this five star Cruise allows you to move beyond the sometimes graffiti filled concrete of industrial sites as you sail northward. the daily routine is rise early, eat well, and tour often but is a great way to enjoy the countryside. the wait staff is friendly and eager to please and the meals are prepared with special care. The tours are lead by skilled English speaker locals who bring the history and culture alive. although, I wish they would bring out the Christian roots a bit more. overall, this is an excellent way to examine the seine river and the northern route of the river to the English Channel.

River Seine. The best place to view the river is by the Eiffel Tower or the Notre Dame, as there are river boat cruises here and crepe stalls. It is not the most picturesque river hence the average rating.
Its all here.. Instead of a boat trip we walked and what you find along the banks of the Seine was fantastic and in places entertaining from games to music to wild flower gardens.

The most romantic river in the world.. The Seine is the heart of Paris. The river evokes the ages and lovers of the city. Stand (preferably with soneone) on the Pont Neuf, the Pont des Arts, and/or the Pont Alexander the III bridges and watch the barges float up and down the river or watch as lovers walk arm and arm. The Pont des Art has the best view and it now has thousands of brass padlocks placed there by lovers who have engraved their names on them. after they 've locked the padlocks on the bridge they throw the key into the Seine. The padlocks are a symbol of commitment. On a sunny day the padlocks make a stunning view as they glitter in the sunlight.

A relaxing waterboat ride but expensive. A slow and relaxing way to see Paris.
Great views along the river, and a very regular service on the river boats.
Only problem we found was it was costly for the short length of time we were on the boat. It's worth walking along to see the other prices charged

Great navigation. Because of this beautiful river with lots of beautiful bridges. It is very easy to navigate if you have a map. Just pinpoint all the locations you want to see and then walk/bike along the Seine and you will have all the attractions nearby.

batobus - river seine paris. We bought a 2 day Batobus pass, and definitely got value for money. The boats do a round trip where you can hop on and off at different sites. The boats are very regular (15 mins) and run through until 9.30pm. Far more scenic than using the metro.

Boat Trip down the Seine!. We did an organised tour and a trip on the Seine was part of it. It was a very cold, breezy day however this did not ruin it one bit! It is a good way to see what lies along the river and there are loads!! It's all impressive and gives you a good idea on where to start your sightseeing once you are back on land.

A different perspective!. We took a cruise with Bateaux Rouge at 7:30pm. It was the perfect time as it was light enough to see everything and then we got the sunset coming back! There's lots of houseboats along the river which are neat to see. The perspective from the river is much different than on the street. I wish I would've taken this the first day so we could've seen all the different options of interesting places. There is a beach area east of the Louvre and past Notre Dame on the left bank is a garden with dancing -- so cool! Instead of running around doing all the sightseeing, it would've been nice to just sit along the river at one of these spots and people watch.
Very pretty. Kind of hard to miss this River if you are in Paris. It is worth seeing and very pretty day or night.

Most romantic hour!. We took the lesser known boat Parissiene and went as sunset- fewer queues and lovely trip down seine with all attractions pointed out. Language translations weren't often comprehensible but we were there to look!

Paris from the water. The banks of the river are free to wander. You can walk here at night without worry. There are tourist boats for tours, but just walking or sitting here is very relaxing. People jog, picnic, and party here late into the night. It is quite romantic. If you have the extra time do come see the riverfront.
Nice and relaxing. After strolling all over Paris. This was a nice break from the heat and allowing us to sit and relax or an hour.

River cruise is a must. We loaded just after a rain. Outer seats a little wet but lived with it. Recommend seating on left when facing towards front of boat. We sat on right and missed close up on a couple items. After we walked the paths along the river edge
A nice leisurely way to see Paris. A nice leisurely way to see Paris. There are several companies you can use to see Paris from the River Seine. It is a 'MUST DO' whilst you are in Paris.

Beautiful to cruise. The Seine Cruises that leave from the Notre Dame area are well worth it. They are not that expensive, and they go in a loop, so you can hop on and hop off as you please. So many beautiful sights to see on the river, especially in the summer, when Paris does all the beach scenes along the banks. It was a very pleasant trip, and beautiful views of Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower that you can't get in any other way.

You have to take a walk along the Seine. It's just classic Paris. And at night it is even more beautiful, as the sun sets and the lights go on. Make sure to turn your heads on the top of the hour to see the Eiffel Tower sparkling!

Batobus the best way to experience the Seine and Paris.. Batobus boat i day pass get on and off in 8 locations. best way to travel. We deboarded a Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Museum D'orsay, Notre Dame, great picture taking on the boat

bike tour. Take a rent bike and cycle along the canals, watch boates go up and down and bridges turn round to let them pass, sit on the riverside and have a cup of coffee, pass the huge Geode or go into the submarine at near the sports grounds!
Calm and inviting!. A late night walk along the river, what more could u want for romance! During the summer, they have events along or near the river! And free dance lessons!
Beautiful. Loved the river seine, you can walk, sit & watch the ferries go by , take a river cruise, just relax & take it all in.

Try Paris by Boat to relax and see the sites. It was simple to book a trip on the river – just turn up and pay the ferry man. A little like the ferry on the Thames (for those that know it).1.5 to 2 hours and you get to see many of the sites from the various Palais’ to Notre Dame on the open air top of the boat of the Bateau Mouches. (not massively over-crowded and the seats were ok). There were option to dine but we had already bought our French stick, camembert and red wine so we just went for the cruise and fed ourselves in the local park.On a hot summers day great way to experience a tiny part of a beautiful capital:)
Amazing. This is the way to see Paris on the water bus which costs Eur15 for the entire day. Best value in Paris. I loved being on the water and it was a beautiful day to see Paris from the Seine.

River Cruise was a little disappointing. the cruise along the Seine was good in that you saw Paris from a different perspective. The commentary was also helpful. Unfortunately being squashed in like sardine took the gloss off it a bit. Still worth doing but not a great experience.

get a seat outside. Seine river cruise, a graet way to spend a couple of hours, with all the great views of Paris as you drift along.
