My tip, get a seat out the back of the boat (if it is not raining) much better for taking photo's, the inside of the boat gets steay with all the people, giving poor photo opportunities.
The all in one paris. This is one of my favorite way to see paris. It's one of the must do for me. And it has a special feel... I just did the river Thames cruise but frankly, there is no comparison.
Lovely strolling along the river. Its beautiful strolling along the river. I did quite a lot of it. It's exhausting but well worth it.
Can't miss it if you're in the center. Not the cleanest river but nice to see boats and a great landmark to keep you grounded as to where you are.

Take a evening boat cruise on Seine. As the day were hot in Summer, we prefer to take 22:00 hrs cruise ride. it is a 1 hr trip & you get to see the city with different perspective. starting in front of eiffel tower it circle paris. The youth gathers every evening on riverside to hangout. There is provision of headphones with recording in many language which narrates the city & monuments as & when they come during the trip.

Stroll along.... The river is great to walk along or have a picnic next to. There are a few great parks next to the river which make for a great place to relax and watch the boats float by. Relaxing and a pretty view.

Dinner on The Calife on The Seine was Great!. You have many choices as to dinner cruises on The River Seine and I found the food exceptional on The Calife. It was a two hour cruise and I learned of it on this website...and it proved to be a great choice. A lovely sunset, a good wine and a nice lamb shank...perfect.

Boat Cruise at Nite. Make sure and book a boat cruise at nite to see the true city of Lights. We managed to find one that was only 12 Euros and did not include dinner. They sold champagne on site before you board the boat. Make sure you take the two level boat so as to enjoy the evening from the top level.

The beach comes to Paris. It's summer and any Parisian who didn't get to leave on vacation doesn't miss out on the beach! The city pours tons of sand on the walkways along the river, imports pots of palm trees, drops Ina few volleyball nets, boules courts, lounge chairs, cafes, entertainment and welcomes everyone to Paris Plage! The price is right too. It's free! Great fun to drop in and see what's going on. For singles, couples, groups, and families with kids. Something for everyone. The city's throwing a party, and you're invited!

"Isn't it time to get a bottle of wine and sit down by the Seine?". There is NOTHING as romantic as getting a (cheap if you like, €1,50...) bottle of wine and go down to the river quay. There is a lot of people sitting down and having a picnic but the atmosphere is calm. The view is stunning! Small and big boats pass by... The sundown is maybe the most beautiful I've seen.Must be experienced!

Like any other river. . .. The Seine has become so traveled that the river itself is quite polluted. The scenery as you travel by boat, though, is wonderful. You have the opportunity to see many of the Paris city sites as well as the locals and visitors who are having a picnic, wine and cheese, etc., on its banks.

la plage and seating. we walked along the right bank from Notre Dame, there were several seating areas which appeared to be free, to just chill and relax with a picnic. we took a seine cruise with bateau bus which was okay in that you can get on and off as and when you want to for one price so it was great for sightseeing but there was no comentary to point out interesting places.
Great views at night. Saw the Eiffel Tower lit up at night, enjoyed walking along the river for miles Very relaxing. We did a one-hour boat tour as well and crossed several of the bridges.

A lovely way to see the city. We visited Paris for two days and made good use of our 2 day Batobus tickets, its a great way to visit all the attractions, you get to relax on the boat then take a brief walk to the attraction and then back to the boat (you can get on and off as many times as you like)!Also loved Paris Plage, what a clever bit of CR/PR by Lafarge!

Serene. Its my second time to visit Paris and see the River Seine and it still makes me giddy out of excitement. It really never gets old. I still feel like I'm Sabrina (Julia Ormond version) looking at the river while writing on my journal. There's just something about it when you're staring at the river with the bridges on the background - romantic, serene and just so Paris.

Great way to see Paris. My family and I used the Batobus all the while to navigate our way around the sights of Paris. It is a beautiful and relaxing way to get a perspective on the city. The river is so clean, and travelling this way along the Seine gave us an opportunity to appreciate the many beautiful buildings that are visible from the river, and a real sense of place. Loved it !

Stroll... buy a scarf, enjoy the view. We love walking the Seine. Photo ops, great views from The Eiffel all the way to Notre Dame. Esp. lovely along the area by The Louvre at dusk, catching the city lights and the waning sunlight in the same photo.
Cruise. We took a cruise along the seine. It was beautiful but not as spectacular as I thought it would be. Worth the while though.

The Boat Cruise is well worth it. Take the cruise in the early evening - around 8 or 9 because it takes an hour and you can observe the sunset and the Eiffel Tower lighting up. We didn't need a reservation and they run evry 30 minutes. There is an audioguide phone to listen to as you cruise.

Summer- Paris Plage. A long stretch of the Seine is turned into a free articifial beach for the summer - free loungers, water, good times. A great way to sit around and enjoy some great Paris feel without having to pay EUR 5 for a weak coffee. All are welcome, so plunge in - my husband and I packed a little lunch of bread, cold cuts, jam and fruit and spent a lovely lunch sitting by the river. The free facilities are first rate- clean loos, free water, different kinds of sun chairs and loungers...
Take a cruise along the river. We travelled twice along the Seine on 2 separate Viator tours. There are many lovely sights to be had and a great way to get to the Notre Dame Cathedral.

Paris Plages is not to be missed.. It was really nice to experience being at La Seine during the summer time and enjoy Paris Plages. Kids and Adult alike are having a good time and enjoying the sun and just relaxing.

Spectacular.. I am so glad I finally visited Paris recently and got to go on a cruise on this very beautiful river. It makes the Thames look dreadful in comparison. Paris is well looked after. Cannot wait to visit again!

Romantic. we took a cruise in the evening and the view was spectacular especially during the sunset hours, watching the setting sun over the horizon as we cruised down, it's no wonder people say this is such a romantic place to be.

Pick a bridge and Stare out to magic. It is the most beautiful and romantic city to view in the daytime or at night. There is a bridge of locks now which is where thousands have professed their love on a lock and attached it to the sides of the bridge. It's amazing to see. Boat tours could be nice and there's even dinner tours.

river 'bus'. we got the 'river bus'. cant remember what it was called. but you can hop on and off throughout the day for 15 euros. totally worth it. Although we didnt make the most of it. i would recommend doing it on your first day in paris. because you get a free map - defo worth it. Get the louvre, E-tower, N-dame, done. if you can get all this in one day = miracle. then go back out on it in the evening to get to destination for dinner. we didnt do the tour but the 'river bus' was worth it. alwaya a good laugh to wave at the others boats, when people wave back, always makes a smile.

Take a night cruise. We really enjoyed our night cruise down the Seine. It was wonderful seeing the city lite up and we have some great pictures. We brought a bottle of wine and really enjoyed a relaxing night.

Wonderful day for a trip on the Seine. We had wonderful weather which certainly made a difference. The boats of which there are many to choose from pretty much offer the same. The quality of the boats and the viewing position vary, on this occasion we travelled with Ceetiz, comfortable in need of maintenance with quite a few broken seats but the trip down the Seine was very pleasant and enjoyed by our grandchildren.

Our favorite part of Paris!. We loved the Seine and ended every day walking or having a beer in one of the open carts along the riverside. Lots of places to sit, relax, people watch and something about the river. Our favorite place to be. We even took a river boat tour.

Walking by the river and enjoying a picnic!. During the summer months this river is a great location for many people to enjoy and bring food and drink to drink and let time just pass. Its really a joy to watch groups of friends having fun, eating food, listening to music or reading books. It is also very romantic to just sit with a loved one and soak up the sun. A beautiful river, in a beautiful city!

Wonderful. A cruise down the seine, while very crowded, was a great way to see a lot of the sights. They manage to herd the crowds through quite well but the quickest way to get to the head of the line is by booking a tour which includes the cruise.

Choose your boat!. Our provider wasn't the best. The information was shouted in 5 languages with hard seats but very quickly the magic of Paris beguiles and you are captivated by one of the most beautiful cities in the world.
seine cruise. fantastic went on a cruise with afternoon lunch food was wonderful complimentary wine with every course fantastic sights was treated like royalty well worth the trip
Wish we had taken a boat trip. The river Seine is just beautiful to behold, if we had more time, we would have definitely taken one of the boat trips up the river.

Scenic. We did the night cruise. It is easy to see why Paris is the city of lights. It was nice to see all the people hanging out along the river, drinking wine, partying, or just romantically relaxing.

Nice and romantic. We went on the Seine with a "bateu", a nice boat where we had a glass of wine.I recommend you to stay down in the bateau, because on the top is pretty cold, if outside is autumn or winter.You will see a lot of bateux on the river, its a nice atmosphere, great if you are with your lover.

The heart of the city. The Seine is the place we kept coming back to - on the Batobus going down the Seine was my first view of the Eiffel tower, a stroll along the Seine where hundreds of people were picnicking and dancing on a Thursday night, a wonderful dinner in the Latin Quarter with a view of the Seine and Notre Dame.... This river for me will remain the centre of my memories of my first trip to Paris.

So many riverfront cafes. Keep walking past the Notre Dame, or just go to the little boat on the river which serves as a cafe and enjoy a java as you admire the Cathedral. There are so many riverboat cafes that you can't try them all in one week. Or, just walk along the river and enjoy all of the bridges. The sidewalks are large and a great way to get out of the pedestrian traffic for a while, or just a few blocks.
always magical.. Water always heightens the ambiance and views. Loved it especially around Isle de City and Notre Dame.

Disappointed. Went at nite with a thousand other people on a boat. Although they have seats you have a hard time seeing because of all the people standing in front. You also can't hear anything. Won't recommend this to friends.

Boat trip through time. Lovely trip along the Seine viewing the beautiful Parisien architecture from a different angle. Good value as the trip lasted a good hour and a half and an interesting commentary was included.

River cruise. My boyfriend and I viewed the Seine by a river cruise, and it was wonderful. It was a beautiful day, and we had the breeze drifting by us as we watched Paris buzzing. We even caught the odd sunbather!

See the Seine!. The best part of Paris for me is the Seine River! We took a boat ride at sunset and hundreds of people were walking, talking, eating, drinking, dancing, playing, partying and waving to boats for what seemed like miles along the banks of the river! What a wonderful place to congregate! Beautiful, free, and so full of life and joy!

The Heart of Paris is the River Seine. I am a Pisces so maybe this explains my love for rivers. I love the clean, evenly flowing Seine with a passion. The scenery and bridges are gorgeous and its banks are the perfect place to people watch or to just watch boats going by. I love the cruises/boat rides and just getting out on the water is exhilarating. You can see the bridges, banks, people , and even the Eiffel Tower as you cruise on by. If you love rivers, boating, and lovely scenery, spend some time here.
Good way to see the city!. We used the Batobus on the river to travel between sights, and it worked very well and was a great way to see the city!
Cruise the River. We went on a 1 hour river cruise. It is not what I expected. The boat was very crowded. It is a nice boat ride anyway.

Boat Cruise on the Seine. Definitely a must when in Paris, and ideally right around dusk. Cruise up the Seine and see the sights, starting at the Eiffel Tower, and by the time you return you will see the city in all its illuminated splendor.

Give yourself an afternoon to enjoy. Post up on one of the banks de la Seine for an afternoon. Bring a bottle of wine, a baguette, and even some laduree macaroons to soak up every bit of Parisian culture possible.
Cruise. We went on a champagne cruise on the Seine, it was so much fun and the weather was so nice. Go in July.

You do not need to spend a lot to sail. Take the Batobus which gives you a round trip sail from the foot of the Pont Alma without the commentary and allows you to hop on and off en route or just stay aboard. Be sure to check final pick up times if you get off. Snack machines on board. Possible to see evening lights including Eiffel Tower. Interesting to see who else is on river and shore and go go under all of the beautiful bridges.
the river. I have stayed in a apartment overlooking the river and found it a good spot to look at the marine traffic and the famous tower

Beautiful!. I hadn't thought the River Seine would impress me as much as it did. It was very relaxing to take your lunch and sit along the bank watching the boats and people drift by. During July and August there is a beach available and it is immaculately kept. Beautiful and enjoyable.

Seine Dinner Cruise. We selected this cruise as a way to celebrate our daughter's 18th birthday. The scenery was incredible, the food excellent, and service outstanding. The staff and other patrons could not have done more to make this a birthday she will never forget!

this is Paris. We have all seen the River Seine in movies, its actually better live. I definatly suggest a boat cruise. We went by a group dancing on the edge, so cool to see.
But really wish we could have relaxed on the river's edge with a bottle of wine like the Parisians. Awesome!
Nice Tour. Our guide was very knowledgable and the tour was very relaxing. It left promptly and returned on time.
WONDERFUL. I had two river cruises and this is not to be missed. Try and get one with dinner, it is really worth it and make sure you see the Eiffel Tower at night, quite amazing

Bring your camera. The boat ride on La Seine is accompanied ith a historical naration given by the boat crew in different languages.As you embark professional photographers snap photos which you can buy when you return.It was also interesting to see that throughout the river both sides you can see all types of parties and festivities taking place, most of them free.
Beautiful & Fun of Things to Do. The Seine was so much fun we had the pleasure of being there for the music festival and there was always something going on. We loved walking along here.

Batobus. Lot of boat trips on the Seine and it is the best way to view the city if you have done too much walking. Take the batobus which lets you get on and off all day and the boats are every 20 minutes. No commentry either which is a plus for me
Excellant Location. For a fab time and totally free walk along the west bank - there are puzzles, climbing walls for the kids and lots of pop up bars and restaurants for the adults.

A boat trip on the Seine is the best attraction of Paris. Very few capital cities have taken care so much of their river as Paris has (see London or Rome). The Seine is a nice "promenade" by walk, on a bike and even better on a boat....during the day, you get to see beautiful views of the main monuments from a different perspective, at night the monuments are lit so it can be very romantic...The boat tours depart mainly from the Eiffel Tower and last usually about 1hour 30. The best option is probably the Batobus a hop on - hop of boat which has stops at the main attractions on the Seine and costs 15e for the day and 18e for 2 days. Great way to discover Paris center!

Beautiful buildings to be seen.. We did a cruise from the Vedettes of Pont Neuf and really enjoyed the experience. There are lots of beautiful and famous buildings and sights to be seen from the river and therefore lots of photo opportunities. The young man who did the commentary was knowledgeable and gave us the chance to ask questions. The river seemed very busy with cargo traffic. NB, if you go to the Vedettes do watch out for pickpockets at the foot of the long flight of stairs; we fell foul of them!

Schenic Seine. It is quite enough to just cross the bridges in Paris, pausing, leaning over and looking at the beauty of the river itself. The River Seine is as part of Paris as the Eiffel Tower and snails!

relaxing trip. Batobus tour on the river Seine. Relaxing - saved feet from walking even more miles !. Scenic view of attractions which allowed us to either stay on boat or disembarc and view fromland.Best way to view statues and bridges as many had fabulous designs not visible from land.

Cheaper than any week-long river cruise. It you want to take a river cruise, but don't have a week to spare, take a Batoboat on the Seine. You can get a ticket for one day, two days, or five days. You can hop on and off too. When you hop off, you can either go back to where they let you off or, if you're wandered, go to another stop. The scenery is amazing. By that I mean the bridges, the monuments, but most of all the people lining the shores on either side. there are machines for minor refreshments, but best to bring your own. and bring a camera.

important river. I have to say that I only saw the section in Paris. The current was not slow, and the water was not clear. But it is so important to Paris, making Paris a charming city, and the bridges make Paris walkable. Unlike a visitor like me, Parisians know its practical importance.
Batobus. The step on step off bus boat is great. Make your ticket last until dusk and you´ll have a romantic trip or a scenic trip. Do not miss!

Take a cruise on the River Seine. THere is a tour you can take on the River Seine. I strongly recommend taking it a night and see all the sites lite up. You pass all the popular spots including Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower. So beautiful at night from the River.

You can see all the best bits from the river. Our visit to the river Seine started out as a leisurely stroll and after about 2 hours we were getting very sore feet. We noticed that you can get a guided river cruise up and down the best parts. It took about 2 hours and covered from the Eiffel tower down to Notre Dame. There was running commentary of what we were sailing past in 5 different languages. Simply the best way to sight see on the river.

A very nice stroll!. There are at least two ways to enjoy the Seine: walking the along its banks and by boat.I did both an prefered the first!Though the cruise along the river it is very nice, with all the explanations, and the stories of each bridge, it is much nicer (in my personal opinion) and if you have the time, to stroll along the river.We started on one bank and were crossing the bridges and checking the different banks by block. On one side you have a quiter city, the Notre-Dame, the Musée D'Orsay, even close to the Tower it is more peaceful; on the other bank, you have traffic, shopping streets, the cafes, the Gares... it is really nice! But it takes time!If you don't have the time, then take the cruise!
Lovely way to spend an hour, or two. Beautiful perspective on Paris, with commentary. Next time will do the evening dinner cruise to combine many of the best features Paris has to offer.
sardines on boats!. too many people cramned into extra large boats, people shoving in left right & centre! total disorganised chaos!

NIght ride is fun for relaxing!. If you are too exhausted to take another step after a day of sightseeing - consider taking a tour down the Seine on one of the many boats that depart from the quais near the Eiffel Tower. We visited in June and knew from a previous night that the Eiffel Tower lit up at 11:00 p.m. so we booked the 10:00 tour hoping that by the time we returned we would see the tower light up! Our timing worked out great - after a nice tour down the Seine with audio of the sights along the way - our boat trip ended at the base of the Eiffel Tower right as it lit up! A sight to behold! On the boat - try to sit up front versus under the awning for an unencumbered view of famous Paris buildings that pass along on both sides. There is a bar on board and you can get a beer or chilled glass of champagne to enhance the trip! Not to be missed and it will give your feet a well deserved break!! You can catch a cab back to your hotel right nearby- here's a tip - walk a block or two from the Eiffel Tower to avoid the lines for a cab!

Best part of the Paris trip. The Seine River area in city center is reason enough to come to Paris. Notre Dame, The Louvre the Bridges Hotel deVille and all the other attractions in this area are the ones you remember when you get home. It is also crowded. Plenty of places to eat plenty of places to shop and lots of opportunity to just sit and people watch.

Evening boat trip. Book a boat trip along the Seine and enjoy views of the grand buildings of Paris. Go on the top deck for the best photo's and different perspectives of Notte Dam, Eiffel tower, bridges and much more. Do an evening trip like we did and see Paris by night all lit up especially the tower. View lots of bands and people picnicking on the river banks. Excellent photo opportunities. Don't miss this one.
Boat trip well worth the time and effort!. take anyone of the boats on the roundtrip around the isles and you will not be disappointed...take many pictures!!

Lock on the bridge!. I really loved the seeing the River Seine and placing a lock on the bridge with my family. It is a nice area around the Louvre, where you can get many nice photo ops and stroll alongside the river looking at some of the souvenirs and artists selling their works.

Seine was sensational. Go for the night cruise to cool off rather than get sun burned. We left Pont Neuf at around 10PM for the one hour cruise which brought us back by 11PM. It was cool and also got to see the Eiffel Tower lit up at night. Great night activity during the summer heat wave. Remember to bring cash as they did not accept a credit card.

A Must Do in Paris. We stumbled upon a terrific dinner cruise - 39 euros per person - included wine and dessert - just walk on at 745 pm - back at 930 pm - comfortable chairs, enclosed behind all glass roof and wall, air cond, - this was the best bargain we came upon in Paris. They also have a 545 pm tour time. Pick it up right on the river at Bvd du Palais near St Chapel.

So much to see and do. We took a private cruise down the river and got a chance to see all the different things going on down the banks of the river. There are dance lessons, music, a beach (I think it was just here for July) with live music, gardens, food and people just sitting at the edge of the river. The river really brings out the spirit of the city.

Magic and romance. River Seine gives us multiple options. You can walk and sit along its banks, cross and admire its bridges or take a ride on the batobus and other ships that sail it. The tickets are around 15 euros, and the batobus lets you get off and on at each stop.Another romantic option is to leave a lock in the POnt des Arts and throw the key to the river! Enjoy it!!!

Beautiful, Winding River!. We had a dinner cruise aboard a private yacht as part of our Tauck tour. It was wonderful! The day was so hot (95 degrees F) but there was a welcome, refreshing breeze on the river at night. There are great views of The Eiffel Tower and even the original State of Liberty! (Just like the one in New York City except much smaller).

romantic. we did a river cruise at 10.30pm it was very romantic passing under all the bridges and seeing all the people gathered on the banks of the seine dancing and playing music it was just lovely.

The Seine is Paris!. This is a lovely river to walk along - you will see some amazing buildings, bridges and statues and it's free! Plenty of opportunities to take photos. We were there on the final day of the Tour De France and watched the cyclists speeding by - fantastic. Would recommend one of the River cruises to see Paris from the river.

Long Boat Ride. Took a very crowded evening boat Ride. We found it interesting on the way up and around the Ile De La Cite but found it less interesting on the return to the dock. The guide was interesting on the way up but not much to talk about on the return trip. Also didn't help that it was raining. Would probably not do it again if I were to return,

Hop on hop off boat. About 18 euros for a 2 day ticket - enables you to hop on hop off ata number of areas from Hardin des planets to theeiffel tower - great views of Notre dam - we watched the Bastille day fly over from the aft deck which was fab - great way to see Paris for footsore travellers! No vocal guide so only use for getting from one place to another - otherwise buy a ticket for one of the boats that do a guided tour - these are v interesting as tell you the history of all the buildings bridges etc
Bateaux Mouches. Bateaux mooches cruise along the Seine...a nice and relaxing experience & a different way of taking in Paris and appreciation of history & the sights.

If you miss a Walk Along the Seine, You missed Paris. It really doesn't matter where you are along the Seine, where you walk, or what you do. It is the quintessential Parisian experience. Stroll day or night - see all there is to see on either bank - but be SURE to spend time doing this!

Freebies!. Beautiful walk with loads of free things on offer. We had a go at badminton, climbing wall and rowing machines but there is also loads of other stuff and plenty of places for food etc. Didn't try the boats but they looked to be a great way of seeing the place.
See it!. Take a boat or go on a walk, but see the Seine and see it because the Seine is the artery of the city. Views from the water include the amazing bridges and of course Notre Dame.

"STUNNING". We did an evening boat trip along the River Seine and it was great to see the sites by night - beautiful views. The atmosphere along the route was amazing to see all the locals + tourists out on the sides enjoying the summer weather! A must on your to do list whilst in Paris.

Another splendid cruise. The unique views of the great attractions are always a highlight of our visit. The bateaux come in many sizes and shapes but there is always room for them all. We recommend Bateaux Parisiens.

Omnipresent!. Whether you admire it from the top of the Eiffel Tower, walk along the banks, or over the bridges, or even from the water (boat trips) you'll feel attracted by the river no matter what! It's quintessential Paris and makes the city so much better.
For suggestion and recommendations on trip ideas, check out my blog:
http://disdatdudder.blogspot.com/2013/07/paris-mon-amour.html

Scenic Seine. Walking along the Seine is always a lovely experience weaving along each of the bridges. Ponte des Artes has this gimmick of attaching locks with lovers names on them ... I hadn't noticed that last time I was in Paris!

Go at Dusk!. A lot of the prepackage tours bundle a tour of the river, with a visit to some place else, but I suggest you only do the river tour and do it right after visiting the Eiffel Tower. Make sure you have a camera capable of ISO 6400 or higher (for fantastic images) or with a strong flash (images are okay). It's good to familiarize yourself with the major landmarks ahead of time, so when the boat guide mentions a place or person, you'll have bnetter insight. My family really enjoyed the tour at dusk ...around 9:00pm-ish.

Take the Batobus!. The Batobus is a great way to enjoy Paris. You can get a 2 day ticket and take it from sight to sight. We ejoyed going to the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower, the Musee D'Orsay, Ile de la Citie, etc. all while enjoying the beautiful style of each Pont (bridge). Highly recommend!

Go on cruise. We went on a lunch cruise for out daughters 22nd birthday, it was wonderful. We paid for premier so we were at front of the boat so we had great views and the lunch (and wine) was very nice. The waiter was very good pointing out all the interesting places

use the Batobus for a cruise on the seine. This is a 8 stop boat ferry which is equivalent to the hop on hop off bus but on the river Seine. It stops at the Louvre, eiffel tower, notre dame, orsay museum, as well as other tourist destinations. it only costs 15 euro for 1 day, 18 euro for 2 days and is an easy way to enjoy the seine whilst getting where you need to go. the boats arrive at the various stops in roughly 20 minute intervals so you don't have to wait long and the first boat is 10am with the last at 9.30pm. It's a very convenient and relaxing way to see the major sites of Paris and is glass domed so you can take as many photos as you desire.

Try riding along the Seine on a Velib rental bike. Before you go to Paris, visit http://en.velib.paris.fr/ and buy 1-day or 7-day access to the ubiquitous "Velib" public rental bikes. You will get a subscriber ID and PIN code. Then ride along the Seine River... a wonderful way to see it, and quite low cost also.

Beautiful, historic, relaxing!. We took an evening cruise. It was lovely taking in all of the sites and our boat guide was well versed in the facts. Beautiful bridges and buildings as well as all the history you want. Photo ops galore!

Boat trip .... We purchased an all day boat ticket for €15 and used the boat service to travel up and down the Seine to see the sights of Paris. It was a joy to be on the river in the heat of this July ... highly recommended.

More beautiful at night with all bridges lit up.. You will see parisians hanging out after hours along the seine with their food and wines and beer. They have dancing lessons along there for free (i am sure thats only for summer or not?). Different sections with different types of dances. I find that the urine smell along is a little difficult at times. We took the cruise at 10ish and got really good photographs of the eiffel tower and other monuments (esp. if you are into photography since the sun does not set until 10ish.).

Take the cruise. In the evenings, the Parisians bring their wine and food and go down to the banks of the Seine to hear music and meet friends. Take the evening boat cruise to see this fun sight as well as the amazing house boats. It's a great way to see Paris from a new angle. Plus you can sit down for an hour!
Scenic boat ride. The boat rides down the Seine are not to be missed. This is an excellent way to see Paris without the crowds. Great opportunity for taking memorable photos.
Take water!!!. Great informative trip. Breeze helped keep temps down but vending machine had run out of drinks so thirsty. However was very enjoyable.
The River is 40 feet below Street Level. We didn't go on the cruises because it was so low below street level. It's pretty to look at, but didn't feel the need to go for a cruise.

Take a cruise at 9:30 at night!!. In the summer, Paris goes all night. If you cruise on a smaller boat at about 9:30, by the time you approach the Eiffel Tower, all the lights come on and it's beautiful!! There are people waving at you and dancers all along the river. The architecture is stunning. I love doing this on my first night in Paris--it never loses its charm! Dont miss it. Go down below the bridge right at Notre Dame for the best size boats. Very affordable without dinner.
River Cruise. Take the time for a river cruise, whether its a simple up and down the river or a nice dinner, great way to see many great buildings.

A cruise is the best way to see the Seine. A must is the hour long cruise from Point Neuf. Great value at 13 eur. The cruise takes you up past the Eiffel Tower and back down past Notre Dame. There is a historical commentary on all the sites and bridges. Highly recommended.

Rhythm of Paris. Like many cities that are governed by their river (e.g. Chicago, Montreal, etc. in the city of Lyon, one of the French culinary capitals, it has two rivers), Paris is no exception to the heart-beat created by the water that surrounds it. No need to do costly river boat cruises just walking the numerous bridges, spending time at any one of their piers is enough to experience how much the river has shaped the soul of Paris. Would recommend you walk across a number of significant bridges back and forth from various points along the left and right banks. Do so at various moments of the day and evening, early mornings, late nights. Have a meal at the many Parisian brasseries and taverns with their "formule de jour" and sense the rhythm of Paris - breathing life into its people. Amazing beauty.
Cruise on the river. Took a guided cruise along the river which lasted over an hour for only €13 each! Going along the river you can see most main marks like Eiffel Tower and Notre-Dame.
AWESOME!. Went on an evening dinner cruise and had a fantastic time! Booked a cruise with La Marina de Paris, via VIATOR. It was the highlight of my trip! Strongly recommended!

A way to size up central Paris. 75 minutes on one of les Bateaux Mouches from the Pont de l'Alma gives a great opportunity to get Paris and its principal attractions and monuments in perspective. Easily accessible by bus and a short walking distance, one can then decide where else makes an attractive place to visit or stroll along both banks of the Seine. Reasonable price with limited waiting for regular trips.
Bateu-bus. Not sure if that's the right spelling but this is great value for money. Get a multi-day ticket and use it to get from one attraction to another.

We enjoyed the river. We went on Viator tour that include the river and tower.The river part had a lot of small school kids - lot of noiseYou do see quite a bitAlways take a jacket doing anything in Paris wendy and a little cool June 2013
Nice sightseeing. Having a cruise on the Seine is an excellent opportunity to see key elements in Paris when you have your feet already tired.

Did the lunch, wow it's great. Take a lunch tour it is more than you expect! Food fantastic, entertainment, wine...ooh la la I went alone since my husband was in a meeting and I had a great time. Met really interesting people and had a fantastic lunch

Does everything a river should. You can't argue with the Seine. Like all proper urban rivers, it flows smoothly and efficiently through the city and doesn't smell too bad. Its waters are sufficiently bouyant for boats to float on it. And it looks romantic at sunset. Thumbs up!

Lock Bridge. There is a bridge overlooking the Seine that has hundreds of thousands pad locks. the couples come and put there pad lock on the bridge and then throw the key in the Seine to seal their love. Some of the locks look midevil.....
Ahhhhhhh. Try a leasurely stroll anytime of day but for extra extra charm sunrise or sunset are truly a miracle to behold. Take a cafe noisette and delicious snack sit and just take it in!

A great way to see the city. All Hop on hop off bus excursions include a trip on the Seine river a great way to see the city starting at the Eiffel Tower down to past Notre dame cathedral Good commentary

Great running venue..!. I ran along the Seine nearly every morning I was in Paris. It's a great way to orient yourself and drop off to see all the sites. I used the morning runs to help decide what we would target to see that day. You can run below the street level and get the extra workout from the cobbles or run the sidewalks and dodge the folks heading into work. Either way a great way to wake up!

Nice place for a relaxing stroll. Walking along the Seine River is a calming experience especially with a loved one. Enjoy watching the Batobus and other tours pass you by and watch the sidewalk artists showcasing their craft along the roadside. You can also look through the books and magazines at the kiosks and then look for the different bridges filled with locks such as the Alexander III. Visited July 2013.

The Music is a best cheesy, but it's the Seine!. One day in Paris tour included our River Seine Cruise. Choose a window or outside seat quickly to get the pictures you want. It is not a boat where you can to walk around. You pass Notre Dame Cathedral and other sites. If you take the boat...they will give you a narration in the language you need.
Stroll the River Seine. In any direction stroll the River Seine and take in the beauty of the boats, parks, museums and bridges. Absolutely lovely. Find a quiet spot and just watch the river roll.
Take Time to Sit. The Seine is beautiful and there's a feeling to it that is hard to describe. Pick a bridge and just sit. Listen and feel the river. It's an incredible experience.

Beware of overcrowded boats!. We were booked onto a Seine river cruise through a tour company thru Viator called CityRama and did not get to pick out our boat. This was a tour with the Eiffel Tower, a city tour by bus, and a tour of the Seine River. It was a nice tour of the city in a nice air conditioned bus, and the extra money to not wait in line at the Eiffel Tower was worth it. But then they give you a ticket to go on a 1 hour tour of the Seine River at the "orange" dock. The boat was super crowded, no drinks, and very little air movement as it had a partial clear plastic ceiling. It was like being in a bus that held 550 people and every seat was taken and it was very packed. It was not a good tour, hard to hear the announcements in 5 different languages. Spring for a larger boat, with two floors, or perhaps a boat with dinner. We passed these boats and they looked much better. Or better yet, do not book with CityRama for the Seine River, but they did a good job with the city tour if you want a motorcoach and the Eiffel Tower. However, if you pay for the open double decker bus, there is no need to also see the city by motorcoach.

Take This Cruise. We wanted to see Paris from the Seine, and the ride was really a treat. We boarded near the Eiffel Tower and went from there to Notre Dame and back. A beautiful ride! A beautiful city.
river seine. it's legal to drink alcohol on it's banks...so perfect for a summer's day picnic and a bottle of wine from the local supermarket!
lunch on the seine. we had a lunch cruise on the seine I can recommend it the food was very good and the wine flowed we had a lovely cruise up the seine and back nice if it's a special occasion

pretty. take your time and stroll by the Seine. Lots of people sitting with friends and a bottle of wine, people playing guitar, etc. Also use the Batobus to get around. Lots of fun to be ON the water.

It's a walk along the Seine - what could be better?. Just stroll along the Seine - multiple times when you are in Paris, if possible! Watch the Batobus and other bus tours go by, find the multiple "lock" bridges, enjoy watching the sidewalk artists at work (upper level, usually), pore through the books and magazines at the Book Seller's kiosks near the St. Germain du Pre area. You'll feel like you're in every movie about Paris you've ever seen!

walking on the Seine left bank. we decieded to take a walk on the bank of the river Siene after the boat tour that we enjoyed (1 hour). It was real fun. there is a beautiful promande, children playing,exebitions and sport attractions (we did some).It was a very relaxing time without 'thousads' tourists, for a short time we were Parisains.

Love river. Paris is not Paris without the Seine. Nearly all landmarks can be found along it: Tour Eiffel, Invalides, Tuileries, Louvre... to the east side you have some more modern architecture. Falling in love with the river, you are soaked in the millennia of art and history.

Live the life!. I love that the river comes to life at night with people gathering to eat, drink, sing and dance on the warm evenings. There are no dramas, no violence and no issues. People gather there to relax and enjoy, play their instruments, sing, read or just be there. Take the time to walk along the river banks and take in the local culture.

Dinner Cruise. Night time dinner cruise was very relaxing and a neat way to see the sites. I recommend sitting on the right side of the boat, as you will be able to see Notre Dame much better this way.

River Seine--A Paris Delight--In Any Season!. Whether it is your first or your thirty first trip to Paris, you cannot help but fall in love with Paris when you stroll along the Seine! In the winter, a late afternoon or early evening stroll will feel cozy as you are bundled and arm in arm with your Amour along the choppy river. In the spring you will feel life coming into bloom and in the summer, there is so much activity--from young people having picnics, to older folks walking their dogs, to musicians giving free entertainment and to the Seine "Beach" in July. Yes. if you are in Paris now, you can enjoy a makeshift "Pliage".You can walk along the Seine at any given time and never see the same thing twice!And...............it's free! That means you will have more money to spend during the "soldes"!Hope you enjoyed this review and thank you so much for reading!

One of the best 'strolls' in the world...... Order good weather and take a stroll along any part of the Seine to people watch. No doubt about it the French are amongst the most stylish in the world and here you get to 'mingle' and gain fashion tips :-) For the romantic amongst us - this is a 'must do'.............

Take the Cruise at night.... We took the one hour cruise at night and one in the daytime.I wish I had tried the dinner cruise.I think it would have been romantic albeit not great food I am sure.Paris lit up at night is the draw.

Dirty river....but try and ride a boat on it!. The river Seine is definitely not a river you would want to fall into. After years of pollution, industry and sewage, it's color is a constant brown. The river has an incredibly fast current as well, so stay out! The best way to enjoy the river is strolling along in on the banks or taking a ride on the Batobus.

Seine is France's second-longest river!. I went for Seine dinner cruise, it is a truly enchanting experience. Whilst you glide under the bridges of Paris in a luxury glass-covered boat enjoying your dinner, an orchestra and singer will entertain you. You can even get up and dance to French and international classics. Bateaux Parisiens selection of delectable dishes prepared on board will inspire your pallet, not to mention the carefully chosen wines.
Take a ride. A boat ride down the Seine is nice but I would do it in the evening when the lights of the city come on. Going under all the beautiful bridges is wonderful. Short trip though.

Beautiful to Behold. It was such a thrill to walk along the Seine with the sun glistening off the water and think of all the history that has taken place either on the water or along the shores. I appreciated all the bridges as they are a beautiful thing to see as well. I think the best way to take it all in is with a leisurely walk. Bike riding can be tricky because of the high number of pedestrian and auto traffick.

A sense of place. OK, it is a brown, working river fully entrapped in stone banks and there are way too many tourist boats buzzing up and down, But, it is the Seine, and it is Paris and there is so much history. It is worth a boat ride just to see the bridges from below (though do read up on them first). I used the Batobus service for a hop-on way to get around. Slower than the Metro (or walking) but a great way to see.

Paris by boat is lovely. The boat from Ile de Cite in the evening is lovely. It's a good way to see a different side of Paris and apart from the opportunity to buy a romantic photo from the snappers that take everyone on the boat, it was a pleasant and worthwhile trip. The boats fill up quickly so get there early. The trip last about an hour and costs 13 euros and it's worth it. The commentary is good and sights are worth seeing. It's not something I'd do again, but once is a must. However, don't get tricked into having the luch or dinner cruise unless you fancy taking out a second mortgage or have money to burn.

Nice to walk along, cruise not necessary.. The Seine is a wonderful attraction and you will appreciate the fantastic views from its bridges.The best of what we saw was found on foot. The cruise was quite disappointing and a waste of money.But it might appeal to others. The bus tour would be a much better way of touring the sights.
Use the Batobus hop on and off. We booked a two day ticket for the batobus and used it alot to get around. Was great early evening to see the tango dancers on the banks of the river.
In-Seine. Definitely the reason Paris has a reputation for Romance. Delightful walks along the Seine. Avoid the water transport.

Riverboat cruise. We walked over and signed up for a river boat cruise. Came with TWO bottles of wine and a long (two?) hour tour. It was so, so, so lovely. The boat was encased in glass which was good because we had short amount of rain. it didn't matter to us. Everything was so amazing nothing else mattered. We bought the photos they took at our table and I'm glad we did - a great memory of a perfect trip. It wasn't cheap, but the food was great and it was worth every penny.The cruise was perfect. Paris was perfect. Put some effort into learning basic phrases and local culture, and try to blend in. Then you will have the best time ever.This was a couple's cruise feel - we had a dinner cruise. There were no little or loud children at all. So, if you are a family, check into this carefully because I'm sure any loud family would have received plenty of sneers.

A Peaceful Cruise. We took a cruise on the River Seine. Most tour boats cruise at a very easy relaxed speed. Thus it is most enjoyable but would have been better with perhaps wine and a small meal. Ours did not have that. The river does seem to be a very busy waterway as barges and many tourist boats are seen. From our boat we could not see too much as tourist except the taller structures. Therefore one is more resign to just enjoy the ride itself. However if the boat we were on had an upper deck to be higher up, perhaps we could have seen more.
Great way to see all the sights. Take a water taxi to get around. All major museums, cathedrals etc are located either side of the river. Local vendors selling wares along both sides.

Follow the Seine. Most reviews focus on Paris city...go further along the Seine, out into the country. Truly lovely. No wonder the masters of art have been inspired to put the Seine in their paintings.

Take some looks on Paris from the Seine. Just take some different looks on some corners of Paris from the Seine during a river cruise ! We did it ! It was amazing ! Especially when the weather favors you with the sun shining :-)
Nice view. We catch the boat niece you can see nice view while you at the boat.... Very nice experience.... Paris is nice.... Our third honeymoon..

Glorious. The most beautiful spot surrounded by magnificent buildings, statues, parks and gardens. The bridges that span it need to be seen to be believed. The boats that ply their trade just add to the while ambience of this perfect place.

Seine River Cruise. We did the cruise down the River Seine which had some amazing views.Only thing I can say about the boats be sure to pick a good company the one we got on had plastic above the boat acted like a magnifying glass and made the ride in the boat very hot so we moved to the outside of the boat at the back side of the boat. None of the staff warned us that the turn at the end of the tour would throw water all over the side of the boat soaking everyone sitting there. Spoiled a nice cruise.

Go at Night. Not during the day. Also, sit on the outside seats, on the right side of the boat going forward. It's a close to shore view, going and coming, and an unobstructed view from people in the middle section. Make sure you boat goes by Notre Dame, because many do not.
A great view of the city. This is a wonderful way of exploring the city in a comfortable and relaxing manner. The tour was about 90 min. and you got a great sense of the city and its vibrancy.
wal along the Seine. Dont miss a stroll along the Seine early evening music beautiful views and great local feelingLike the high line in NYC

Mouche Bateau rides on the Seine. Loved the boat tours on the Seine. Notre Dame was maybe more picturesque from the boat. The Eiffel Tower, the "Torch" which memorialized Princess Diana, the impressive old buildings...just a calm trip in a whirlwind city

Love this river.. It really is a living masterpiece, it seems alive as it busily flows carrying tourists along in the bateaux mouches, bato-buses!
They have prime view of all the stunning architecture, statues and bridges when travelling along it to see the sights. Not to be missed- day or night!
Great end to each day. After a busy day sightseeing, we would end each day strolling by the Seine. We loved it! It is the perfect way to end a long summer day in Paris.

The sunset was stunning. I chose Botaboat to enjoy cruising the river. It has multiple stops including the famous Notre Dome, Champs Elsee, Eiffel Tower & de Lourve. I cruised during late evening and the sunset was awesome. Prepare you camera to capture some stunning photos.

Definitely do this!. There's nothing nicer than a boat trip in the evening sunshine. Well worth the 13 euros each for an hour. The tourist information is given in several languages including English although sometimes difficult to hear above the noise of the engine.

River Seine for walking. I did a river cruise at night, but I don't think it's really necessary. Paris is small enough that walking between different tourist attractions is definitely doable and really beautiful when you move from place to place along the river. It's still enjoyable even in the cold rain because there's so much to see.

Great fun.. One of the first things you should do in Paris. It's a great way to see the sights and get your bearings. We bought out tix on the left bank by the Pont Neuf. The cruise was one hour long and the commentator very informative. There are also photographers onboard who will take a souvenir photo of you if you wish.

Cruise on river seine was awesome. For an hour cruise we were quite impressed with this little cruise. Our ticket for hop on and hop bus included the cruise as well, and what a good experience it was. It felt like i was on a love boat especailly with the parisian medley playing in the background as we cruised along the river and watched the city go by with the ancient and wonderful buildings museums to be fascinated with.The boat leaves every hour and comfortably seats over 100 people.

It is relaxing , but no wow. If you have had a tough day on your feet , then taker the boat trip on the Seine. It can become very crowded , but find a centre seat at the back and you can relax for 2 hours and just take in the viewes. It is not expensive at all.
very informative. my tour boat was comfortable with a very informative commentator .I liked the whole experience seeing the buildings from the river and the island was fab
boat cruise. the dinner cruise on the river was an experience of monumental gastric proportions. The price and the sites are a once in a lifetime dinner experience with outstanding views of paris.
Bateaux Seine River Cruise. We were booked on the lunch cruise: we were wined and dined from the time of boarding until we departed. This was a great value for the money.
Romantic and beautiful. My favorite place in Paris is below the Pont Neuf sitting on the tip of the dock and just waching the boats as the pass or looking delightly at the other bridges over the Sena

No better way to see & fall in love with Paris. Take a walk along the river or a cruise down it. Either way- the river is a must experience for those who truly want to feel the magic of Paris. Going back for the 3rd time this fall and this is one of the things I'm most looking forward to! Check out o chateau for a great champagne tasting river cruise experience!

1-hour river tour - centuries of history. A river tour on the Seine is a quick and easy way to see monuments and historic buildings from a unique perspective. I recommend the top deck for unobstructed viewing; however, the rear section should be avoided due to engine exhaust fumes.
Sunday walk. Take a stroll on Sundays, near Notre Dame, and slowly browse the stalls along the seine. The shopkeepers are o lovely and IRS just a perfect way to soak in the essense of Paris.
#1. The River Seine has left me speechless. It is the best place to go to do nothing. I spent many evenings here, eating and thinking.

Grab a bottle and a friend or two then head over. Try what the locals do. Get a nice bottle of wine and head over. Sit down and chat for hours about nothing. Then wave to the cruise passengers. Watch them wave back with excitement, saying there's another tourist! Because no Parisians truly do that... so they will be amused.

AMAlegro cruise to Normandy (yawn). If you want a restful, peaceful week floating from Paris to Rouen and back, this is the trip for you. However, if you are looking for something more lively, this isn't it. We met some very nice new friends on the boat, and had an amazing guide (Barbara) who did an unbelievable job showing us the Normandy D-Day beaches. However, if you do not meet compatible fellow passengers and/or don't get Barbara as your guide, you will be disappointed. There is nothing to do on the boat, and our Cruise Director did the minimum. We booked one of the four suites on board and were comfortable. The bath was large for a boat. The regular cabins were "cosy". The food on board was above average, with the fish dishes very well done. Service however was rushed, and dining hours were annoyingly limited. Staff were uniformly friendly. One big plus is that the tours are included in the cruise price. This is a major savings!

Magic of the Seine River. This was a great way to see most of the structures in Paris at least the main structures. If you dont have time to visit them all you have the opportunity to see them. This is especially try since the streets are so busy with cars on the road. It was also a great way to see the Lock Bridge. This is definitely a must for anyone visiting Paris.

It's worth a cruise...magical. I loved going on a river cruise and would have spent a lot more time by the river, if we'd had more time. It was lovely to see all the sights, hear the music and see all the people.

vADETTES DE PARIS. Walked from Ile de Cite to within 20 yards of above, only to find the way blocked with metal gate, lumps of concrete and scaffolding. No steps in sight to walk around and disembarking passengers were hanging onto scaffolding to walk on a very narrow walkway overhanging the river. Needless to say, we did not get our cruise! The Seine is lovely.

Exciting. Such an array of beautiful architecture in the buildings and bridges along the river Seine. The Batobus was our flexible form of transport as you can hop on hop off at all the main features of Paris. There are also dine and cruise ships which looked great particularly when lit up at night. Various bars along the Seine to sop for resfreshment.

A must see; Paris night. We loved floating down the Seine at night because Paris is the city of lights at night. Taking in the wonderful land marks especially seeing the strobe lighting at the Eiffel Tower after dark.

take a walk. The walkway along the Seine is one of the truly romantic places in the world. You walk by beautiful houses and decorative lamp posts, see the Eiffel Tower in the distance, can walk up to any one of a number of bridges and look down the river, stop at a cafe along the route and browse the stalls of antique book and print sellers and all sorts of souvenir stalls. And if you are in good shape it's a great way to get from one place to another since many wonderful attractions are near the river and you can avoid the heavy traffic almost always present in Paris. There are also Batobus stops where you can hop on and take a circuit of the main section of the river. You are too far from shore to really see much however. There are also Bateaux Mouches boat tours which are beautiful at night.

A Boat Cruise is a must!!!. Our friends had told us that on the day we arrive we will be jet lagged and the nicest way to give yourself a sense of where everything is would be to took a boat cruise (1 hour) 13 Euros /person down the Seine. It was as nice relaxing way to start the holiday. Our cruise was with Les Vedettes du Pont-Neuf -middle of the Pont-Neuf bridge. The guide spoke good English and had a good understanding of the architecture and history of the area. While we had been looking at mapping before travelling to Paris they really helped with orientation. The tour went from the Pont-Neuf one way to the the other side of the D'Orsay Museum so you could see the Eiffel Tour and on the return it went around the islands so that you went around Notre Dame.
just walk from one end to the other. So beautiful! We took a dinner cruise; it was the most romantic time! I have pictures of Paris on a rainy spring evening that I will always remember!
River Walk. Walking along the river is an awesome experience ... cobble stone sidewalks, bridges and beautiful architecture, and all the magnificent sights of Paris.

relaxing way to see the town. super relaxing and enjoyable. We used our Paris Pass to ride the boat up and down the river. The bridges were amazing to see from water level. The hand held boat receivers to listen to the tour guide was a pain - we couldn't listen and hold our cameras at the same time - so we just took pictures.

An hour well spent. I took a boat trip with my family one evening at 8 oclock. This was great to see all the sights and enjoy a different view of the eiffel tower and the notre dam. As the weather was good lots of Parisians were picnicing along the river banks. Would recommend this trip

Row row row the boat gently down the stream.... Do this at the end of a day. Sit back, relax and enjoy the scenery. You are so tempted to take off your shoes and put your feet in the water. Do not miss out on a boat trip. The commentary as you go down the river is quite interesting.

A height of activity on the weekend. On the Weekend it is a party atmosphere, as you along the river there are many activities from live music to step aerobics, and for the children painting and even climbing frames.
It seems all Paris comes out on the weekend and enjoy eating and drinking by the river.

A beautiful area. Just being in Paris for the first time was overwhelming but to wonder along the Left Bank of the Seine taking in the atmosphere and enjoying all those delightful little bridges is an iconic experience.

Batobus is great. Buy a ticket to the Batobus and hop on and off the Whole day.
The boat goes up and Down the river all day, and takes you to all the important Places you want to see as: Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Luxembourg Gardens,Notre Dame and more.

The artery of Paris. The best thing about the Seine is that it is there and all free. It can be enjoyed from bridges, the Ile de la Cité and Ile St Louis and from many points along the banks which give access to places to sit, contemplate and picnic. The volume of water passing through is also impressive and these days, the river is comparatively clean as the sewer service of the City of Paris cleans it of debris.
Always fantastic. Just to walk beside the river, to take a cruise day or night - really this is the heart of Paris. The cruise shows just how Parisians and visitors use the banks for relaxation.

Relaxing Time Along the Seine in the Batobus. Myself, husband & 16 year old daughter did the '1 ticket 8 stops' on the Batobus which was a lovely relaxing way to end a tiring day. You can choose to hop on and off, but we had already done this on the bus, so we just enjoyed a leisurely time viewing the sights from afar and enjoying the water.
Mutch to see on one hour. You can see lots and lots of things from a boattrip and its not expencive. Eiffel tower, Louvre, Notre dame, concorde

Take the trip. Took a 1 hour trip on the river. Enjoyed it a lot. I suggest you look into the boat that allows for on and off service. It has about 8- 10 stops and you can get on and off all day for one fee.

Romantic. By day it is lovely but in the evening it is a romantic place to walk along the banks of the river hand in hand with the person you love. In the early night the flood lighting shows off the buildings.
Great Views. Excelllent way to get a bearing on where everything is. Well worth doing at least once. Did day trip but expect its very pretty when lit up at night.

Must do in Paris. It really nice to take the hour long cruise- we did it without dinner so that its cheaper and one can relax and see a lot rather than concentrating on the food. Its definitely recommended.
Not bad!. This tour around Siene river isn`t so long but the atmosphere that you feel is undescrible. It`s a very romantic place.

BatoBus is a must. What a great trip on the BatoBus - for €15 you get a ticket that allows you to go round and round all day long if that is your preference. There are in fact 8 stops at all the tourist stops so you can hop on and hop off at your leisure. For an extra €3 you can get a two day ticket. I recommend that you get the two day ticket to fully enjoy the experience that is Paris.Great place to visit!!
Nice!. It's a wonderful way to learn of the other places you may want to visit which are all along the River Seine.
Nothing spectacular. Not much to say...just not that impressed. The area around the Pont Alexander III bridge was the most interesting. The bridge is a great sight.

Take a boat ride or two.... we loved it so much we took one the first morning of our arrival and one on the last night of our trip. If you take the 10pm boat ride from the Eiffel Tower, upon your return at 11pm the Eiffel Tower will sparkle with a special light show for 5 minutes. It is a great way to orient yourself to the city. You can rent a bike and bike along it, there is art to be viewed, and a mural size chalkboard for children. It's dotted with cafes for a quick bite or drink.

Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh. Fun to thing of the city putting down sand on some of the walkways to imitate the beach during the summer. Lovely views even with leafless trees. This would be marvelous in the summer, heat or not.Lots of boats of all sizes and utilities - homes, freight, tours, swimming pools, restaurants. And to think you're only partway to the sea.

Trip on the river. We had booked this tour for our 1 day trip through paris trip- Guided city tour, skip the line Eiffel with lunch on 58 and end by 1 hr cruise. Guided tour and the Eiffel tower was good and we njoyed it but the cruise was ok..nothing special.My husband wanted to skip it but as we had already paid for it and the tickets were in my hands, so i said let's do it as its only for 1 hr. We took the cruise around 1500hrs after our lunch and it was not a clear sky nor sunshine day. The weather was like it can rain anytime.The cruise was ok - glass ceiling with around 200 seats and they had few seats in open air too. The day we went it was cold approx 14C so sat inside. The crew only spoke French with few basic english words. Had to listen to Audio guide which was not comfortable as the audio guide was heavy and in shape of mobile phone, so it was heavy after holding it for a while. So didn't bother listening after a while... Basically u see the view by the river for 1 hr. Starts and ends near Eiffel.
Boat trip. Nice boat trip up the river , got to see the sight and take a few pictures while sitting down . Perfect

Stunning and worth a lunch or dinner cruise on. Enjoyed an evening dinner cruise with bateaux and a lovely way to see the sites. Lovely meal on board and a very sophisticated way to spend time with a loved one or friends.

The river flows through the heart of the city. What to write about a river? Well, the Seine flows right through the center of much of the city. Close to its banks are so many iconic places that you will be seeing in Paris: Eiffel Tower, Grand and Petit Palais, Place de la Concorde, Musee d'Orsay, Musee de l"Orangerie, Tuileries Gardens, the Louvre, Latin Quarter, Hotel de Ville, and more. Two islands in the river, especially the Ile de la Cite with the Notre Dame and Sainte-Chapelle but also the more residential Ile St-Louis. So many bridges, some plain, some fancy, some historic. A bridge called the Pont Neuf (or new bridge in Engish) but it's the oldest bridge still crossing the Seine and it connects the banks of the river with the Ile de la Cite. A bridge with a million locks on it that makes it sparkle. Walkways along the river with so many lovers walking hand in hand. The many boats that you can take for an hour cruise on the river. To the north side the Rive Droite or Right Bank. To the south side the Rive Gauche or Left Bank. Well, not every famous thing in Paris is next to the river but the Seine really is the center of the city in lots of ways. Plus you just can't miss it considering all the places that are next to it or in it or crossing it.

Relaxing. I always do the river Seine at night as the Eiffel Tower looks beautiful at night. This trip is lovely and relaxing and gives you a different view to the landmarks that you will have seen on the open top bus or even ground view. Well worth the price which is indeed good value.
Hop-On, Hop-Off. Try Batobus for hop-on, hop-off places from Tour Eiffel through to Notra Dame. Euro9 for a day ticket with 8 breaks is very good value.

night cruise on Seine. Take a night dinner cruise on the Seine! Paris by night is absolutely fantastic. We took the cruise expecting the worst in food service etc as these are more often than not a bit of a bun fight. What a pleasant surprise the organisation, service, food etc etc turned out to be exceptionally good and for €100 per person was worth every cent. Recommended !!!!

Seine River. I highly recommend the night dinner cruise. I took my 2daughters and my Aunt and we had the most memorable experience. The tour and dinner take about 2 hours . It gives you a whole different feel for Paris at night. When it gets dark and you see the Eiffel Tower blinking you can't get enough photos!

Our Wedding Anniversary Cruise!. As it was our 10th Wedding Anniversary, we thought that a cruise to see Paris from the River Seine would be different, and it certainly was!!A commentry is given in any language that you select. It is extremely informative and there is an enormous amount of history attached to this beautiful city. It is definitely worth taking the cruise as it gives a different perspective of the city.Next time we will cruise at night to see Paris lit up by lights!!

What can I say, it is the Seine!. Although the water is dirty, the magic of the River Seine is not diminished. Walking along the Seine is full of romance and history, and seeing artists along the shore, sunbathers lounging on the cement (!), and all of the beautiful buildings and bridges along the way are all memorable parts of the Paris experience.

I'm surprised this is even something to review?. How do you review a river? Well it's the center of Paris so when lost just ask where it is and you'll find your way. It was fun to walk along the river from the Notre Dame to the Eiffel Tower.

definitely take a river cruse. take a night time cruise...Paris is so beautiful at night ... you will not want to miss this one! There are so many beautiful attractions along the River Seine. At 11pm, the Eiffell tower lights up on the hour!

Murky. It's murky - but many of the sights are right on the river, so I would recommend a river cruise. Don;t expect the audioguides to work or much from the tourguide if you are travellng with Bateuax Parisiens.

The best thing in Paris?. After my second boat trip, I like it better. Not the superexpensive Bato Mouche this time, but the Batobus. Worth the much lower price. You see a totally man made river (only the water is natural), a lot of nice bridges (and one really ugly new one), the trees on the side, and a different view of the buildings (which look much better from down on the river). There are romantic walkways and island parks (Point Neuf is the primary one). This is the best outside attraction in Paris. But it varies dramatically from place to place. I like Ise de Cite and the opposite bank on Rive Guache the best.Be preared to walk. No handicap access to most areas. Access to food/drink is spotty. Access to toilets is non-existent.

Most unforgettable moment in Paris. My family cruised the river on Bateaux Parisien included in our Paris Pass card (although we still had to queue twice, first for the ticket & second to board the boat). The commentary gave us information about the parts of Paris that we passed along. But one of the most beautiful moments in Paris was when we strolled from Musee Louvre to Musee D'Orsay, bought sandwiches, quiche & most delicious eclairs in Maison Guyard behind Musee D'Orsay and ate them on the embankment of Seine under the bridge. Feeling the breeze on your face and hair, watching boats passing by, it's just heavenly. If you happen to be in Paris you should try this.

On a boat along the Seine. Everyone recommend that we do this during the evening to see all the lights of Paris. We travelled during Summer and the days are long and the sun don't go down till late.... so no lights for us to see.

Free thing to do in Paris. Walking the banks of the Seine will take you past all the major sites in Paris - Notre Dame, St Germain, St Michel, museums (O'rsay, Louvre, Eiffel Tower, etc). Beware pickpockets and scam artists (a favourite is the 'found' gold ring where they ask you for money in exchange for keeping the ring you supposedly dropped - it plays on your greed)

Worst part of our trip. First, let me just say that the tour was beautiful, staff was friendly, and it was a chance to get off our feet and see some of the great sights. Now, I'm not one to write bad review and complain, but we had such a lousy experience with this one that I wanted to give future visitor a heads up.The reason why we had such a negative experience was because we happened to be one of two couples that were stuck on a boat with HUNDREDS of kids on their field trip literally screaming, spitting and hanging off the side! HUNDREDS! It was the most horrible part of our honeymoon and we were stuck with it for an hour!I know it's not the staff's fault, but out of respect for other visitors, they should designate certain boats for field trips, etc. So if you decide to take this cruise (which would have otherwise been pleasant) be sure to get off and take the next boat coming.

So charming!. I wanted to take the river cruise for dinner but then I saw the boats and decided not to. They looked like bad buffet style food but I would imagine the tour would be nice. Lovely to see from any mode.

Take the river cruise. another must do in Paris! This gives your quick tour of major sights in Paris from a nice beautiful perspective from the river! It was just a bit chilly when we took this ride, so do bring a jacket
The place to ramble along. Just wandered along, seeing the scenery and boats, crossed Pont des Arts in the evening allways something going on. Free enjoyment!

An encapsulated version of Paris.. We had a short trip on the river in the late evening. The breeze was wonderful, shared with friends and a glass of wine, but the view of the Effiel Tower sparking in the night topped it all!

We Walked and Walked Enjoying It All!. It was May and rains had made the waters of the Seine too high for much of the boat traffic. None the less we enjoyed the view and walked and walked over bridges and on paths seeming never to tire. The beauty of the place kept our energy up as each view was more lovely than the last. We hope to return some day!

River of Classic Sights. Traveling inexpensively with Batobus, we gained a wonderful riverside view of the Hotel de Ville, Notre Dame, the Louvre, the Musee d'Orsay, the Eiffel Tower, and other Paris highlights.

Water Taxi on the the Seine. Granted it's much more expensive that using the subway especially since you already bought a full-day pass but this is really a great way to see all the Paris spots! You're not in a dingy subway underground and you're on the Seine in Paris!! Live it up...

Make up your own mind. We had purchased the 48 hrs travel card in Paris which provided us with a discount to a boat trip if purchased with Bateaux Parisiennes at 10E each.You are herded on to the boats but there are plently of spaces. The commentary is provided in English and there is additional commentary via a handset in the seat, which is a little naff.We were both feeling unwell, so this provided us with a seat for an hour, whilst able to enjoy some of the views. The Notre Dame is beautiful from the river. We went during the day but can imagine a night time trip is spectacular.Perhaps if you went for a more expensive trip - it would not feel as if you were being herded on and off the boat.

Great river cruise. My wife and I took an hour long river cruise. It was amazing. You get to see so much. Only draw back was a bus load of British teens who were very loud and were giving the finger to the locals and tourists ashore.

Beautiful Seine. This river has such a romantic vibe about it. I loved the house boats, and Quais. Some very beautiful bridges, like Pont Neuf, and Pont Alexander both at opposite ends the Neuf with its medieval austerity and the Alexander gilded and over the top.

Do the Cruise with Champagne Tasting. After reading about the mediocre meals on most river cruises, I wan intent on avoiding them and stumbled across the champagne tasting instead. If you are looking for a tour of Paris, this is not it. It is a class on champagne making/language/tasting etc, with romantic Paris as a backdrop. You might want to bring a baguette along, no snacks are served. You are seated beyond a velvet curtain in a VIP type setting. We had a blast!
A river cruise is a must. You can not get a real feel for how lively the Seine is unless you take one of the many river cruises. And at night it is even more beautiful.

Do a boat trip.. The best way do see the River Seine is on a boat, the trips are cheap and well worth doing. You'll get to see some great landmarks and take some good photos. The only problems are that it's just a straight run and its quite short.

La Seine - toujours un plaisir.... ;-). A boat trip along the Seine is a great way to see Paris and just to relax. You can use the BatoBus service which allows you to get on and off as many times as you like, there are lots of parks and historical sites along the way. Have a picnic at night on the river banks and enjoy the great Parasian Feeling... ;-)

Corny but perfect. On our last afternoon in Paris, the sun came out and we walked home slowly along the lower bank of the Seine. We ended up stopping at nearly every available bench, just to soak up the views and enjoy the people walking by. Evenings are beautiful as well, when the lights come on.

Dinner cruise perfect after transcontinental flight. We booked a dinner cruise with Best of France Tours and we had a table near the front of the boat where we could see everything. We had just arrived from the USA in the afternoon, so this was a good way to start of our trip. The food and service were great and we found this a great way to become acquainted with Pairs.
A must if it is fine. If the weather is kind a boat trip pn the Seine is a must. You see so much at a lovely pace. The guides are informative and their English is pretty good.

Take an evening cruise on one of the bateaux mouches. We used the Bateaux Parisiens line, dock near the Eiffel Tower, since it was included on our Paris Pass. Now, THIS is living in Paris! It was a Friday at 6 PM, and life on the riverbanks was amazing - lovers kissing, students dangling feet in the water, friends sharing a picnic and a few beers, couples dining on the many floating restaurants moored on the south band, some party boats getting ready to "pump up the PARTY!", a floating police and fire station (on our way back to the dock we saw the police boat in action doing a rescue!), and great photo opps as you pass by the monuments of Paris (Notre Dame and the Sainte Chapelle) and under the famous bridges (Pont Alexandre III, for example). Your Paris Pass avoids most of the lines. A hint to disabled travelers - France is VERY welcoming for handicapped people - my husband walks with a cane, and when we arrived a staff member conducted him to a special area where he could sit down, and we were the first ones onto the boat (for best views, sit in the outside seats, closest to the bow of the boat). this was my favorite experience in Paris, just magical!

Dinner Cruise. We took a dinner cruise through Baton Pariesian. FABO night! White glove service which began and ended @ the Eiffel. Pulled up just in time to see the brief light show (happens nightly for 5 minutes)!

River cruise down the Seine. The river boats leave just at the bottom of the Eiffel Tower and are a great experience. Try to do it a high tide though as the walls of the river are about all you see at low tide. Some of the speakers did not work but that doesn't detract from the buzz of the other passengers enjoying the sights.

The best value in Paris. The best value in Paris is a ride on the River Seine at Bateau Mouche for around $12. The boat will take you up and down the Seine on a 2 hour journey. The view from the water is something not to be missed. You will find Bateau Mouche near the Pont d 'alma.

BIG Waste of Money. Bought expensive tickets for BatoBus on the Seine and they never advised us that they had to eliminate certain stops because of prior flooding. We caught the bus at the Eiffel Tower stop and took it to the one and only stop near the Musee d'Orsay. From here we could get a second batobus however they only run every hour!!! So you had to sit on concrete to wait and wait to get the boat to go to Notre Dame.
