In addition, unlike the other boats on the Seine, this one has no commentary so you cannot identify what you are looking at. Lots of Euros to go one stop and never go on again! AVOID this rip off

Strolling along Seine is a must-see!. Just seeing all the bridges and the architecture on both left and right banks is a treat! there is so much history behind this river area it makes the walk very interesting.
Lovely boat ride. The Batobus that circles the Seine with many stops was our main form of transportation to all of the sights. And what a great boat ride!

Wrong time of year!. We took a cruise along the river in the early evening. It was lovely and relaxing, but June is when the older children have just finished school and there were parties of shrieking, whooping teenagers on the boat as well. The student guide had problems finding a quick space to tell us what we were passing. But put this down to us being elderly and just wanting a quite, peaceful, romantic trip on the river. Can't blame the boat company!
another must do. did this trip as it is another must do. We did it in the afternoon, good to sit and get some rest while enjoying the view of the river banks of Seine.
A cruise, a must do. The river is very busy but the least one should do is take a hop on hop off boat. Late afternoon is a lovely time on the Seine

Dinner by candle light.. Do take a trip on the river on the evening excursion. The experience is a delight. Good food, music and a terrific atmosphere and all of Paris lit up for the night. One of the best experiences and ways to see Paris.
boat trip - seine. paid on site for one of teh boat trip companies with audio - a fabulous and relaxing way to see teh main sites by the seine. a good way to work out the geographics

Such a cool place. We enjoyed walking along the river at night, when most of the crowds had gone elsewhere. One night, around midnight just past Notre Dame we stopped to watch a street performer who had a guitar and amp and was playing some cover songs we liked. After a while a crowd of local teenagers had gathered and were hanging out drinking a bit and watching this guy play. The songs were mellow and everyone was so laid back. With the lights reflected off the river, music and such a beautiful night it ended up being super romantic and one of our best nights in Paris. Funny what happens when you don't plan things out ;)

River cruising, my next hobby. We took a short river cruise for dining on the Seine this time and it was truly a cool experience. You get to see most of the sights real quick, and if your waiter is like ours he'll get the time to show you and even explain the sights. We will do it again if given the opportunity.

A great way to see Paris in one hr. We took the cruise at 13 euros each. It lasted one hour and we passed by many great attractions. The Eiffel Tower, Musee d'Orsay! Norte Dame and many more. The commentary was in English and French but it could not be heard very clearly from the upper deck because of the cruise engine and wind, so we went to the lower deck instead.You can buy snacks and beverages at the bar but it was costly. Overall a must try experience in Paris!

Very tourits but you have to try. The first time that I went to Paris, I confess that I avouded some typical tourist programs. And the Bateaux Mouche was obe of them. The second time that I went there, I tryied the tour and I have to confess: it was great! You will have the opportunity to see the city fron a different perspective.

River Seine. Took a nighttime river cruise that lasted about an hour. It was beautiful to see the buildings all lit up and the Eiffel Tower light show was fabulous. Nothing more romantic than a stroll along the river. We loved our visit.
take the boat tour. your feet will thank you, and there's a lot to see from the water anyhow. you can get then just beyond the eiffel tower, and theres places to eat there as well.

Worth it!. We booked a night dinner cruise through Marina de Paris. The food, the cruise and the evening were amazing. The food was very good, the service great and the cruise along the river unforgettable. It wasn't a sightseeing tour, it was dinner. When something interesting came up it would be pointed out. Otherwise we were left to enjoy the cruise, food and company. This is something we will do every time we're in Paris. A little pricey, but well worth the relaxation and memories!
Lifeline of Paris. Go in a cruise along the river.You see all the beautiful building on both sides of the river.River passes through and and thgrough the city and cuts it into two unequal halves
Great. Good way to end a day and ride the Bateaux Mouches on the top deck. Worth the 40 minutes, after you have been walking all day.

Smooth sailing. The river cruise we took was so relaxing and we got to see so many beauitful building from the water that just took your breathe away.The history of Paris is so great and a great way to see lots of it is by river
River cruise. Took the cruise at twilight and as we were returning the city lit up. The Eiffel Tower was magnificent for the. Boat
See the sights. Had river cruise picked up at the Eiffel tour and goes past all sites with a guide. Well worth doing. Travel by day or night.

Croisiere Bateaux Parisiens. Lovely informative cruise along the river Seine taking in the major historical sites that we could not get to see up close and personal because of priorities and time restraints.

The cruise is a must.. Doesn't matter which cruise venue you select, at least choose one that fits your budget. The cheapest will give you the same unforgettable view. Caution, during the summer months, seeing the city lights at night will not happen unless you book after 9:30pm. Remember, a must on your list.
Interesting seeing all the bridges. Quite nice, the river had so many bridges, a few we're covered in locks which was interesting. Well worth tour time, cruise takes around 1 hour

Take a boat ride. It was cold, but worth every shiver. We went at night and the lights were beautiful. Dress warm in the winter and take a sweater in the summer, as it gets a little chilly on the water.

Dinner cruise. Nice relaxing evening with another couple passing by iconic landmarks and interesting canal boats. Starts late because it is still pretty light during June. A little touristy, but still enjoyable.
excellent. We had a wonderful trip down the river for an hour lost count of all the bridges we passed. recomended.

Narrow it down?. Had a very pleasant stroll on the south bank north of Jardin des Plantes last week. But frankly this is also because there is a dedicated garden in that location along the Seine. It's impossible to review 'River Seine' in earnest - even assuming that we're only reviewing the Paris section the area is altogether too large to constitute an attraction in and of itself.

Just stroll along side the river. Just stroll along side the river @ day/night. It's a wonderful experience in itself. At night paris is so very beautiful that a walk along side river seine would be another experience that you can cherish lifelong.... Take ur walk !!

The walk and view - worthwhile. Whether standing on the bridge overlooking the Seine, or walking along it ... this brings many reminders of one of my favorite movies: Charade. In the movie, Audrey Hepburn and Cary Grant walked here and sites of the city attracted me to visit many years later.

River Cruise was THE best. Our lunch cruise on the River Seine was wonderful. We passed by most of the monuments in Paris. At the same time we enjoyed a 3 or 4 course lunch with 3 different wines. The scenery and the food were great. Highly recommend.
A lovely river. I loved the Seine and its many bridges. I enjoyed taking the Batobus down the Seine, which was handy for hopping on and off to see the major sights.

Twilight River Cruise. I always go on a evening cruise in Paris. The scenery was beautiful but the lights weren't turned on the monuments since it didn't get dark until 2230 hours! The price was worth the 13 or so Euros though and the boat wasn't crowded. We sent on the Vedettes Pont Neuf.
Noisy. Noisy people on the boat who were not asked to be quiet by the staff ruined an already mediocre overview of Paris main monuments.

Lovely!. Follow the Seine on either side and there are always wonders to behold! I love all the painters and stalls of used booksellers who set up shop along the river. Its romantic and sweet, Paris for lovers!

beautiful and take a river cruise!. enjoy a river cruise and get good photos of the Eiffel Tower - even better than getting up close to it! and... if you have a spare hour, save yourself a visit to another 'sight' and just amble along by the Seine :-)

Boat ride. Take a boat ride on this river. It would cost you about 5 Euros...It takes you through various stories of history as the boat sails. Paris visit would be quite incomplete without this ride..

get on the boat. the bateaux bus was awesome....offers hop on hop off service get on at eiffel tower and get on and off at numerous stops along the seine would recommend your return trip at night to see the city lights.
Fabulous and peaceful. The river is serene as can be. The young artists who practice their craft are a joy to watch, as well. Richly detailed landscapes.

If you jump in the water are you inSeine?. Boats full of tourists move up and down the river, under the bridges, and past the famous river banks lined with large trees and old stonework. The Seine quietly speaks for itself.
River Seine cruising. Great way to get around Paris is to buy a water taxi pass cruising on the River Seine. Hop on/off at tourist spots. Great sights to see from boats and very relaxing.

This is what Paris is all about. Wandering along the banks (quays) of the Seine is one of the most charming ways to experience Paris. We travel frequently to this lovely city and both agree that Paris is to be "soaked up" this way! You will discover the little hidden out of the way places along the route. Best done with a little picnic of a baguette, cheese, fruit and maybe a little vin. Enjoy!
boat tour is good to get a feel. the river is a great way to see the town in a river cruise. get an English tour and you get a great feel for the river sights.

Go at Twlight. There are multiple companies that cruise the river- and the trip is a must see. Twilight was beautiful- decide how much ambiance you want ( just a ride- a ride with wine or food?) and plan accordingly
Fabulous, even in the dead of winter. We took a nighttime boat ride on the River...and got a great and distinct view of the city...I would love to come back in summer and do it again.
Sunshine by the river. We waked from the pont Neuf to the Eiffel Tower and it was amazing. No need for anything more although a glass of wine on the way adds to the experience!

La Seine. It would almost be impossible to visit Paris without seeing the Seine. You'll enjoy daytime walks along the banks, sunset vistas, and the beautiful lights at night. Paris provides a potpourri of the senses, and the Seine most of all.

Take a river cruise ride. If you are in paris, make sure you take the river cruise ride once. Do not go with the dinner offer as its not worth. You can take 1 hour ride where they will show you all the famous monuments of the city.
Tis a long river. Took a cruise along the seine which was very informative and enjoyed seeing all the different buildings without the hassle of the crowds
Best way to enjoy is walking along the banks and taking a picnic. You can also take a cruise and hopefully be 'mooned' by the rambunctious locals!! many operators provide lunch and or dinner cruises

It was a nice break but a little long. River boat ride courtesy of our Paris Pass. It was a nice break from walking but I thought an hour and half was too long. Started near the Eiffel Tower and went well past Notre Dame. After passing Notre Dame there wasn't much beyond that. I would have enjoyed cruising to Notre Dame and to Lady Liberty (we saw her briefly from metro train).

Different view of the city. The view of the bridges are worth the price all by itself. I love the detail of all the different bridges over the Seine. Peaceful, no hustle and bustle of the city, just beautiful

Great for walks and sunset. Our most recent stopover in Paris was blessed with great weather and as a result, was able to spend much time outdoors on the streets of Paris and along the river Seine. It was a tad cold but the skies were blue and the sunsets were gorgeous. Walked and explored many bridges and took tons of photos of the river and the sunsets at the end of the day. Understand perfectly why people find Paris romantic. Gorgeous.

A must. I have been in Paris like 6 times and this is the first occasion I have done the River Seine. My husband and I love the hour you are in the boat through the River Seine. It is another way to see Paris. We did it late in the afternoon and we were coming back all the lights were on. Beautiful!

Defintiely worth a boat trip .... Very good - certainly a good way of avoiding a long walk! Reasonably priced ... we went from the Ile de La Cite Vedettes ....quite a lot on construction work going on though along the bank. Younger people may prefer to the Batobus which you can get on and off as much as you like.... I think.
OK. The River is okay. I took a night and day short cruise on it. Lots of attractions to see, and being on the water is calming to me.

The Charm of Paris. The river Seine is charming but together with the river , go the bridges. They are so individual and fascinating in their variety. I wanted to walk across every single one. Alas , I ran out of time !

A Riverboat trip. We took a Uniworld Riverboat trip north on the Seine. Saw Rouen, Giverny, Etretat,Normandy beaches, etc. The riverboats can no longer go through Paris so we took a smaller line for an hour trip to see Paris from the river.

A Cruise the Seine is a must do when in Paris.. We did many of the typical things in Paris but I will be forever greatful that a local person talked us into taking a boat cruise on the Seine. Your trip to Paris will not be complete without it!!

Dont miss the river cruise. Magnificent experience. 1 hour river cruise was worth and relaxing. The recorded commentary in English had explained about the importance of every attraction we covered. Don't miss it.

Sunday Stroll. We could wander along here forever. At times we almost had the Seine to ourselves apart from the occasional joggers who made life seem too fast and furious. And of course, the obligatory boat loads on their luncheon tours who we pitied because they seemed so caged in and missing the subtle delight of 'meandering at one with the river'.

Cruise the Seine or regret it forever.. Even on a cold and rainy day, the Bateaux River Cruise was worth every euro. And quite honestly it was inexpensive as far a Paris attractions are concerned. A one hour boat ride in a glass enclosed boat with a tour guide who speaks around 5 languages and shares all of the wonders along the river with you as you slowly work your way up to Notre Dame and back. Don't miss this wonderful ride.
Great walks and picnics. We walked down by the Seine river each Day. Many folks were having a picnic, bottle of wine, or just chilling. Sometimes you can see ducks strutting around.
Boat Tour. A great way to get around the city with all of the traffic while getting to see all of the major landmarks and getting commentary of some of the history of Paris.

A great way to See the sights of Paris!. We went on a cruise down the river on a boat following our meal at the Eiffel Tower resturanrant. A great way to see many of the sights from Paris, with the trip including an audio commentary with lots of information on Paris and its highlights.

walk and rest on the banks, take a boat between the sites. indeed the Seine is a extensive activity for the tourists, and also for the locals. when you're walking the Quartie Latin or the Marais, take some time, walk down the stairs and have a seat on one of the benches, look at the water, at the boats, at the loving couples and at the bridges and relax. than buy a pass ticket and hop on the BATOBUS boats and just get off at the next attractionn you wanna visit. a great way to see Paris. important: do not bother with those fancy yachts etc. it's just a tourist trap. you wanna eat? go to a small bistro as far as you can from the center, a place where they don't know English and don't have English menus,

The Amawaterways-AmaLegro Cruise on the Seine-Solo? No Go. I am a very well seasoned cruise traveler. I have completed at least 10 plus and traveled all over the globe- as a solo traveler. I just came back from the cruise to Paris and Normandy.If you are a single woman..stay clear. This experience is not for you.The whole thing is basically fine until we go into the dining room. The Head Matri 'D is in charge of the open seating arrangement. On the first night there is a seating at a captains table . So far so good, right? The second night forward the head marches you around to seating and asks the diners if they would mind if you sit there? The diners look up from the table and shoo you off- sort of an excersize in utter rejection. Not bad if you like to be treated like a piece of meat. I think it might be more appropriate to inquire at a table then escort the woman to her seat. Then the next night when I am sick of this routine- I inquire if I could be seated with the other singles on board- his answer? "I don't know who the solo travelers are" This is from the Head Matri'D.I spent the last few days holed up by a window in the corner- now tired and defeated and dreading going into dinner. The other issue was I met 2 lovely ladies traveling together- sisters. One of them needed to be carted to an emergency room with stitches after falling down one of the departure ramps. The ramps were quite steep and carelessly placed with many elderly passengers- the ramps wet from the rain. All in all - I think the solo traveler can better spend their travel money in a better spot.

Feels good!. It just feels so good to walk along the Seine...and new very interesting developments are being prepared, which will make it even more pleasant.On top of everything it is free, and there aren't that many free things in Paris....
FLOWING PAST. This majestic river with its multiple stunning bridge imposes its presents as it dominates the area though the city. Walking along the banks was superb

Relaxing way to see the river view of Paris. A cruise down theSeine is a lovely way to break up a day in Paris. We relaxes as we enjoyed the city from a different viewpoint. You can see details of the buildings of Paris, including the Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower that are impossible to see on land. Well worth the time and money.

great view. Siene cruise is excellent way of viewing the historical buildings that line river. As it was raining we were could enjoy the ride without getting wet. The only problem was the speakers were hand held and were not give headphones which could have been easier.
Take the BOAT to transport between sites!. We took a boat over to the Louvre! It was fun to travel on the Seine and this avoided a lot of frantic traffic! We loved it!

Historic Seine. The Seine river takes on significance as one reflects on the historical dimensions of the river, from the founding of Paris, to the dynamics of WWII, including the Deportion Point right behind Notre Dame, etc. Bridges are historic and beautiful. Walk down on the river bank and then walk among the book stalls on the street level. Time well spent.

Le Capitaine Fricasse River Seine Cruise. Don t do it ! Overpriced and boat departure point is difficult to find . Arrived first so at front of queue. Should have left at 930 but did nt board until 1015. No apology from anyone. The man who was to greet us and board us was downright rude and went speaking to the French people behind us as if we weren t there . Had queued from 830 as we d read its first come first served but we were rudely and dismissively told where to sit . The 'tables for two ' have a couple if centimetres to the next table and are in rows - so there s no privacy and they re such small tables that you feel as if its one long table not several smaller ones . Food was lovely and waiter nice but the cramped conditions, wait and unbelievably rude man at the start ruined it . The sights of Paris at night are lovely but there are lots if other seine cruises with nicer boats too so go for one of them .
Must see. Walking along the river.........and taking in all that's happening on the water........combined with the architecture and bustle of the busy streets.......it's timeless.

High River. Because of the flooding the boats were not able to go the full length of their stops so be aware before you buy your ticket...a night time cruise was wonderful but the timing did not allow you to see the twinkle lights

Give the Batobus a go!. Its great to see the Sienne on the Sienne and the Batobus (a small ferry) was great to travel by. You can jump on jump off at several tourist stops which made them vary easy to access.
Great to be back. Walked miles in Paris, always love walking by the Seine. Wish we had bought a padlock from home to add to the many on the bridge.

A multi-faceted part of Paris. This river was beautiful to see and stand by, during the day and in the evening, when we walked from île de la Cité to the Louvre, seeing the groups of young people enjoying the quais close to the river's edge and the couples on the bridges. We also enjoyed the Batobus, touring up and down at will, between Pont Neuf and the Eiffel Tour as well as up the other way past Notre Dame.

Sit Back and Relax. A liesurely trip along the Seine is a great way to see Paris and just to relax and take it all in. We used the BatoBus service which allows you to get on and off as many times as you wish. I would suggest at least a two day ticket if possible and you are then able to use the service to access most of the main attractions.

Boat ride. Took a boat ride down the seine. Cost 13 euro each and 5 for children. Great way to see some of the landmarks of paris. Trip was 1 hour long. English speaking guide and a friendly boat crew.

Nice but .... Beware while walking by the river. Whilst meandering along the pavement by the river just after the Place de La Concorde we were accosted by two very aggressive men with clipboards shouting at us and attempting to thrust pens in our hands to sign up to something or other. We knew it was a scam and refused to sign, trying to walk away but they blocked our path and one of them had his face within about 4 inches of mine. It was very frightening. The authorities need to put a stop to this, but nobody seems to be bothered.
Very Romantic. Love seeing Paris from the Seine, a completely different take on the city of lights! Would recommend taking a night tour.
Picnic. Had a wonderful picnic on he river banks. Took a river cruise that was very informative. The cruise could have been a little longer.
Exciting water..... What can I say about a river? Well, the Seine is an exciting river because of the wonderful views of the bridges and Parisian buildings on the side.

Boat ride was fantastic!. Me and my dad went on the boat ride along the Seine... well worth the money! It allows you to see Paris from a whole other perspective while the tour guides provide you with lots of interesting stories and facts. Look out for the bridge with all the padlocks! Lovely!

A must. Beautiful and romantic. Lots of parks and historical sites along the way. Wonderful history and architecture to be photographed. No visit to Paris is complete without it. I can't wait to return.

So romantic. Even though I have been married 42 years, I had to get a smooch from my other half. The Seine does that to you. So beautiful with it's many bridges, pretty buildings, Notre Dame. All best seen from the Seine. Do a river cruise in evening, a must.

Nibbling Paris from Seine. The daytime boat ride reveals how are the City and the River intricately weaved. The historical evolution and the geographic extension of the different areas of modern Paris with so many bridges built over the Seine make you think of Paris in different perspectives of politics, war, revolution, industry, technology, paintings, literature, fashion, cuisine and culture. The sight of the majestic buildings and palaces on both the banks of the river : the massive Lovre complex, the Musee D'orsay area, the monumental Notre Dame cathedral , the sleek and sharp American Church, the legendary Eiffel Tower, the Alexander Bridge, the Assembly House, the golden top obelisk at Concorde Square would keep you mesmerized. In one bridge near Louvre, umpteen number of locks are tied on the railings would amaze you. On the opposite bank near Notre Dame cathedral, the shops dealing in old books would allure you. And, on the beautiful pavements on sides of the river Seine, you would watch people walking as the river flows. On completion of a round trip, you would enjoy some refreshments in the restaurant on Seine and think of another boat ride in the night.

Boat cruise is a must do!. My husband and I went here for our honeymoon and the cruise is one of the things he planned for us to do. It turned out to be one of the best things we did on our honeymoon! We opted out of the dinner cruise as I tend to get sea sick, but instead did the open top boat cruise. I loved it!! It was definitely worth every cent as you get to see many awesome sights from the river all lit up at night and at once!! We saw the Eiffel tower and Notre Dame, which were utterly breathtaking! We went under the lovers bridge as well. It was really beautiful. I liked the cruise without dinner as you get more of a chance to enjoy the area around you and its a great thing to end your day with. Our tour guide was also hilarious and spoke great English. It wasn't super loud either, so if you are more interested in spending a romantic boat ride with your partner, other than being educated on the sights, that is still a possibility! A must do!
River Seine. The River Seine is like one giant - but skinny - park that meanders through Paris. No trip to Paris is complete without a visit to the Seine.

Dinner Cruise. Save up & do it. worth every penny, euro, dollar, yen. Dont even hesitate. Just book it. Went with Bateaux Parisienne. slick very well organised. Tip: get dressed up unlike some, booked the mid price and found ourselves moved up to the premier. Cant guarantee it but it worked for us

AMA waterways cruise on the Seine. What an experience from the staff to the tour guides, this is an exceptional company. We traveled to Normandy and back to Paris. Stopping along the way to see the many villages along the river. The most notable being Monet's house in Giverny and Van Gogh's apartment in Auvers-sur-Oise.
Simply magical. A casual stroll along the Seine is a must in any trip to Paris. The views from the various quais and bridges are scenic. The cobblestones wreaked havoc on my knee/ankle joints though.

Take a boat ride. You will not regret it.. The views from the tour boats on the Seine are great and give you a perspective you do not get on land. Like a cruise on the Thames in London, you both sight see and relax which makes this a good choice in the evening before dinner

Best jogging path in the world. I travel a lot, and when I do, I bring my running shoes with me. The Seine is one of the best running experiences around - full of great people watching, wonderful views of the city at every turn, and a nice way to see the center of Paris.

Another tour that you should do. Yes, the river cruise alone the Seine is a must. The boat tour cost
is very reasonable and the experience is excellent. You will see many land marks alone the way. The night cruise is excellent.
Dirty river. Nothing wow about it, nice going under the bridges though. Fun watching it rise and the Parisians with cheese and wine on the banks enjoying the night.
Boat ride on the Seine. In the morning. A nice way to see everything we had seen by land. Individual speakers are used for commentary.

scenic. Due to high tide we were unable to go on top of the cruise still we found it adorable. Its banks and bridges are so well preserved and buildings around it are to be seen. It is only good to be there in sunny day otherwise you may miss the fun. Best part - Statue of Liberty and Eiffel Tower together...

A must in Paris. Every time that I go to Paris I take a cruise in the Seine. It is always nice and beautiful, specially at night. No, it is not a tourist trap. A good way to relax from a night trip and recover from jet lag. Do it in your first day.

A beautiful experience staying on the Seine and a great landmark!. We were lucky to have fantastic views of the Seine from our apartment on Ile St Louis. We spent many a wonderful morning and night admiring the dramatic sunrises and lively light show of the evening Bataeux Mouche Cruise boats! As first-timers to Paris on this trip, we also relied on the river as a great landmark on our aimless traversing of the city! We found the hop-on/hop-off Batobus to be a great and inexpensive way to get our 'bearings' on our first day and spent many hours wondering the banks of the Seine both during th day and late in the evening after dinner - beautiful :)

Boat ride down the Seine. Done a river cruise with my partner and it was fantastic. We set off at 9.55pm from the foot of the Eiffel tower and just as we set sail the tower lit up the sky. The trip itself was very interesting and some of the photos we got are amazing. Would recommend this trip to everyone. 13Euro per person at the ticket desk so no need to book online.
Cruising the River Seine. Great cruise on the River Seine, you see so much from the river in a short space of time, ideal if time is an issue.

La Seine. I just love hanging out on one of the beautiful bridges in Paris watching the commercial traffic go by. Some of these barges are quite long-like maybe 150ft and how they navigate through the islands(Isles de la Cite and St Louis) is amazing. Most of the barges have live-aboard families-and cars, dogs and kids can be seen on deck as they go by!A sunset on the Seine is something to put on the list of things to see while you can

Not as commercial as you would think. It was great to walk along and enjoy the views without commercial establishments littering the sidewalks. Avoid the street vendors selling Eiffel Tower replicas. Their prices are always changing and may range over 1000% depending on how much you show interest or disinterest in their goods. The street sifr cafes should not be missed.

The most romantic river in the World ?. Lovers flock to it. The bridges, islands and quais all interact to create a series of sights and views that leave you with the feeling that you have been part of a dream where romance is the eternal reality.
Bring your running shoes!. Bring your walking or running shoes and take a journey down this amazing river. Nothing beats running past the Eiffel tower!

Good tour of Paris by the river. We went on the Petit Bauteaux 1 hour river cruise... it features 22 bridges (if I didn't remember wrongly) and you get sights of castles and many landmarks. It is a great way to see the city and definitely worth the price. For children 3 years and below, it's free. Would suggest you bring your own food or eat before the ride because the eateries around the area is expensive and serve lousy fast food (not comparable to McDonalds).

A cruise down the Seine is a must when in Paris.. The seine is at the core of Paris and a cruise by day or night (two very different experiences) is a must.Spend an hour relaxing and listening to descriptions of the sites.It can lull you to sleep at the end of a busy day.The listening equipment can be a little hit and miss.Do not take this as part of a package - it is easy to do yourself and you are not locked into silly schedules.

Cruise not great. Bateau Parisienne one hour boat cruise on the Seine was not so much. Yes, we saw the sights you'd expect from the river, but if you had toured these places on foot or by motor the cruise was superfluous. Best thing about it was warm smiling hostess who oriented guests in six languages to a well-deserved round of applause.
Great walk to burn off the macaroons. The river is beautiful in spring and summer, walking along it is a great way to experience the Parisian architecture.

The Eiffel Tower illuminated is spectacular but little else. Choose your boat carefully. Ours had clearly seen better days. many of the seats were missing. Toilets were disgusting. Eraly evening City Tour is much better. Luckily it was bank holiday so streets were clear.

great views form the river. Used Batobus and although half of the route was closed due to the flood, still enjoyed viewing Musee d'Orsay, Louvre, Pont Alexandre III, Eiffel Tower form another perspective.
A great way to relax and take in the views. Would recommend to anyone looking for a break but want to keep taking in the essence of Paris. There are a few companies we used Bataeux-mouche.

A part of Paris. As I was right opposite the Seine near Notre Dame I saw it every day and also did the oat cruise at 9.30 at night.Because of the amount of rain the river was in full force and looked quite menacing
Just lovely to stroll along and also on the Island

Brilliant River and Riverride. Like every mighty river has flourished a city on its banks, River Seine is no less........ Paris hugging the banks of this lovely river is special. THe Boat ride is brilliant and as again, a bit of good weather will make all the difference of making this trip memorable or miserable. Unless a foggy night, a night boat ride on the boats are romantic....

This Makes the City. When you imagine Paris, you have to picture the Seine River along with the Eiffel Tower or any other landmark. To visit Paris and not do at least one boat tour is like visiting the Empire State Building and not going up! You can choose from simple cruises to elaborate dinner cruises. I would suggest at least two. One during daylight and another in the evening. Ah, Paris!!

Beautiful. Beautiful, romantic, everything is amazing, especially if you take a river cruise at night when the lights are on all of the buildings. Definitely take a river cruise whenever you can so you can see how wonderful the city is.

Seine is Seine. The river in Paris really charmed me. There are some 100 bridges over it, in Paris the best one is Alexander the 3rd. The bridge is amazing with its' ornaments. The view towards the tower from it is a good place for pictures. The other good place over Seine is towards Notre Dame - again some 12 bridges. The river is calm and beautiful, full, you can enjoy yourself in the boats floating on it.

Save to visit on clear days. Best keep some activities for clear days and others for when it rains.....yes, even in Paris it rains during your holiday. Walk as long as you wish, on both side, day or night.
relaxing. The cruise was very relaxing. THere are places along the river especiallly from some of the bridges that are spectacular views.
What a View. The sights from a Seine River Cruise are incredible. The ornate bridges, buildings, and islands are incredible. Loved this view of Paris!

over crawded - no place to sit. we had a river cruise by bateaux-mouches,the river view was good, but bateaux-mouches didn't open upper desk area,and allow too many people on board, many of us have to stand on the whole cruise,people who are seated cannot have good view because a lot of people standing.safety is also a concern. avoid bateaux-mouches.

You may want to take a day cruise.. I took a day cruise long time ago, and this time I tried a night cruise. There was not much to see at night. So I felt that the day cruise would be better than the night one.

Best way to see the city by far.. Bought a Batobus day ticket at 15 euro each (18 euro for 2 days) and spent a day going up and down the Seine from the Eiffel Tower to Muse De Orsay, Notre Dame, The Louvre etc. hoping on and off.
Much nicer than using the Metro.......
great views of Paris. We took a 2 hour non stop evening cruise from Pont Neuf. Wonderful way to see Paris in the evening light. Students give live commentory during the trip.
River Cruise!. If you get the Paris Pass, a river cruise is included! (Start at the Eiffel Tower.) Use it - It's well worth it. I prefer the river cruise to the bus tour.
Great Views. Book a River Seine boat tour - you get to see things you might have missed on a Hop-On-Hop-Off tour ride.

This will float your boat!. Best few euros investment ever.........fabulous way to see Paris.....this is a must do If you are limited for time.Make sure you take the camera. After the cruise grab lunch then stroll up the steps to the Eiffel Tower and enjoy a Glacé .......great day out.

Boat Ride at the River Seine. It gives you a different prospective of the landmarks/sights of Paris although not much more from what the hop on and hop off bus will. I preferred the night boat ride on the River Siene because I saw it featured on TV before we arrived. Was so looking forward to the lights unfortunately night came so late and it rained 4 days out of our 5 day stay.- it was just too cold and too wet to take the night boat ride.

A Romantic River in Paris. The Seine is lined with many famous buildings. It is worth a river cruise to look at the buildings from another aspect. The bridges are unique and some were built centuries ago, ie Pont Neuf. The Louvre is there, the Musee D'Orsay, Hotel De Ville, Boulevard St Germaine - I could go on forever. The streets are fairly flat so walking is no problem.

Do the boat cruise!. So worth doing any kind of boat cruise down the river, you get to see whole different side/ parts of Paris, The cruise we were on had really good commentary, and i am not a real history buff but even i found it very interesting! There are so many bridges and it is all just lovely, and relaxing to get comfy and just go with the flow! It was definitely worth the money!
Romantic. Most romantic river ever!Next to the Eiffel Tower.How good can it get.Love Paris and River Seine.
Walking across the Seine River's bridge of locks.. We walked along the Seine River and crossed the bridge of locks on our way to the Cathedral of Nortre Dame.
Do the stroll :). Nice strolls, day and night. Nice views. We didn't do a river tour, but we would've, if we had time.

Good experience. Just spend some time in this river cruise, you can see so many bridges that this boat goes under. No two bridges are the same. A lot of old buildings are just on the side of this river worth to be seen. They too offer lunch and dinner and of course you have to pay extra to this food. a very nice experience. When in Paris do not miss this

A bottle of wine, a baggette, some cheese and you. Take your loved one, share a bottle, bread and cheese, in front of the Eifell Tower; romance at its most precious, and a definite item on my bucket list. Cheap and easy.
Do a dinner cruise. Did a dinner cruise in the evening and saw everything lit up it was beautiful, although a touch chilly on the top deck

Impossible to Hate!. The Seine is a quiet, constant companion in Paris. Admittedly we spent less time walking along it than crossing it. The many bridges let pedestrian traffic flow back and forth in such an easy going manner. From the bridges you can get beautiful, unobstructed views of the city ... and each time such a different view. We didn't take a Bateau Boat, but I never felt the need to get right out on the river when the bridges were so pedestrian friendly. In a way each bridge reveals a bit about what that area of the city was all about, from the locks on Pont Archeveche to the art nouveau lamps on Pont Alexandre III.Get out and walk -- stay in good light after dark! During the day you can enjoy the sellers on the Rive Gauche side near Pont au Double.

You can see the major sites in a nutshell.. We took the river cruise located closest to the Eiffel Tower out of convenience. It can't comment on the price per ticket since we went with a tour guide, but I would say that for what was experienced I would hope that it wouldn't cost more than 15 euros. It can be a little irritating because if you arrive late, you probably won't get a window seat. However, you are able to walk out on the deck and view the sites from there (if it's a sunny day. Unfortunately for us it was cold and rainy.). I noticed most cruises will go past the Louvre, the major bridges, Notre Dame and a few other key locations. It also provides a commentary out of a small, phone-like device that offers 9 languages. I can't say it ever got boring because I enjoyed the view. Things are very different from a boat perspective. It also provided vending machines with teas and coffee. I enjoyed it, all in all.

Peaceful walk. We strolled along the Seine from Notre Dame to Orsay and found it peaceful... a nice break from the crowds. After our walk, we decided we really didn't need to do the boat trip... we had seen from shore what we would see from the boat, and the exercise did us good!

Serenely peaceful. Placid and serpentine, River Seine adds to the magic of Paris that it is. The bricking along the coast of it provides an apt setting to people watch and simultaneously enjoy the serenity amongst the cacophony of tourists all around in Paris. Touring Seine during the evening hours is strongly recommended since you might discover an altogether different Paris.
Skip dinner cruise. Skip the expensive dinner cruise and viewing the city from under glass. Take a one-hour open-air cruise instead.
Had the greatest experience going on a boat. This was the greatest experience we ever had going up the River Seine. This was a delight and a lot of fun our children had a blast and so did we!!!
River Seine. Did a Tour of the Eiffel Tower dinner and Seine River cruse, it was great, dinner was a different as it was a 3 course dinner and with small portions, the river night cruse was great.

Long Lines. It takes for ever to board the boat. The lines never seem to end.
One hour cruise of seine river not bad.
All the monuments and buildings can be seen by walking.

one hour cruise is fun. If you have time, this is a fun thing to do. Sightseeing Cruise lasts about an hour or you can do dinner cruise. Boat goes as far as Eiffel tower and then turns around and goes past Notre Dame, giving commentary on the sights and bridges of Paris.
Go during sunset. Go in the evening hours to see the city before and after sunset. As a bonus, on the return trip, you can see the Eiffel tower lighting up.
The life of the city.. It was fun to see what attracted the Parisi tribe to the area so long ago. The book sellers along the bank we also the best place to buy souvenirs and artwork.
cross many bridges.. beautiful and worth the time to cross as many bridges as possible . check out the Locks and key on one of the brildges
Breath of fresh air .. Boats are near the Eiffel Tower . The trip takes around 1 hour and costs around 13 euros . You see most of the monuments while cruising down the Seine river .

Walking along the quay. I would advise you to not take the cruises because they are very boisterious and not romantic as one might imagine. It would be better to walk along the river at night particulrly if you are facing the Eiffel Tower and see when it sparkles.

Bateaux-Parisiens Lunch Cruise on the River Seine, Paris. We booked a lunch cruise on the River Seine, Paris, with Bateaux-Parisiens on the net prior to going to Paris. The website was very informative and gave all the different Cruise and Meal options available, (which was very useful as my wife has a food allergy and she could see what was being served in advance) and sent you confirmation e.mails on your booking. The location of their boats is at the bottom of the Eiffel Tower and easy to find. The meal was cooked beautifully and nicely presented. The wines were of a good quality and the service from the staff was attentive(Particularly Pedro our waiter who happily pointed out different sites along the way and was able to translate and answer any questions you had.) We boarded at 12.30pm set of 12.45pm and got back approximately 2.30pm. The cruise was at a leisurely pace and there was no rush to finish each course. This was an anniversary lunch for us, and was a wonderful experience which we would recommend to anyone else. If we went back to Paris again we would definitely do the Diner cruise with that company.

paris trip cannot complete without this!!. just go for stroll along the river seine. I stayed for 15 days in a hotel next to the eiffet tower facing seine river. And I didnot miss single day going for walk along river seine. It is so lovely and relaxing you will never feel bored!! there is a cruise also operating in the evening . Spend time leisurely along the river side to make it lifetime memories!!
Sunset cruise. Awesome way to see Paris at night. At the end of the cruise the tower lights came on. Glorious! Worth the hour

Point of reference. Great walk down the river as you tour Paris. I used it as a reference point to get where is was going. Lots of people selling paintings and souvenirs at nice prices. My advice! You did not drop a ring. I was approached 5 times by scammers trying to con me. Either ignore them or just tell them to get away. watch for pickpockets too.

Take a cruise. A very romantic setting. If you are a couple visiting the city, then I would highly recommend a boat cruise with your significant other. You have various options to choose from... A sightseeing cruise or a dinner cruise or a wine tasting cruise... If you have Paris Pass, then it offers a complimentary cruise along the river which passes below the many bridges adorning the city.

Sunset cruise. We took a sunset cruise which started at 8:45 pm from near the Eiffel Tower. There are a number of boats at that time and each carries a large number of people on two levels. You see almost all important monuments, including the Notre Dame, that you have seen during the day time on a Hop-on-hop-off bus tour, but this time in different light and from the river. The sights are beautiful, and the views of the sunset are fantastic.

Dont miss river cruise in seine when in paris at night.. We booked ticket for this cruise through our travel agent in India.It is worth seeing.One should not miss it when in Paris.One can enjoy beauty of Paris on both sides of Seine river and see many historical bridges over the river(many centuries old).One can have a glimpse of Architectural marvels of Paris on both sides.You can see sparkling Eifel Tower from Seine.It is terrific.

isango seine river cruise, moulin rouge & eiffel tower dinner. we booked and paid for this all in one evening with ISANGO. They debited my credit card a cruise, dinner in the eiffel tower and last a night at Moulin Rouge. The day we were going, the cancelled us, saying it was overbooked. I went online and booked moulin rouge directly (it was a fabulous show, but a terrible start with lining up in the rain for an hour) and a week later they have STILL not refunded the nearly $700 AUS they have 'on hold' in my account. Not happy at all

The Magic of the River Seine at night.. Absolute must to visit - we walked after dinner to the river at Pont d'Austerlitz [about ten minutes from the hotel] and the view to the north was of the rear aspect of the Cathedral at Notre Dame just beyond the Ile Saint-Louis not very far away. The lights of Paris and all along the river are magical in the evening. We crossed to the left bank and walked at leisure to the Jardins des Plants which is also well lit in the evening - along Quai Saint-Bernard, where we found the locals playing music and dancing on the river bank in about five separate areas - complete with picnic baskets of bread cheese and wines. How civilised is that ? The whole evening was enchanting - we sat and watched, and walked, and sat again. The Novotel was a welcome sight on our return at around midnight.

can't miss it. It's in your face! Kidding aside, you can obviously not miss the River when you're in Paris. We did the cruise with Bateaux Vedettes du Pont-Neuf and enjoyed it (night time/sunset). Get your tickets online, you save 5 euros pp!

A river made famous by movies. Romantic, for a boat ride, an afternoon stroll, a cup of cafe. People watching. The Batobus is the best way to see the city, stopping at eight points. We spent many happy hours strolling along the seine. There is so much to see.

A must to do in Paris!. After seeing the Eiffel tower, walk across the street and take a riverboat cruise on the Seine. There is not a better way to see Paris and the important sights! It is cheap, 12 euro. Lasts about an hour. We do it each time we are in Paris. A must to do!!!

A nice break and a chance to rest your legs!. You get a great view if you take the boat. Its a chance to sit and relax and watch the sites pass you by. Its just over an hour long and really worth the 12.5 Euros each. The bridges are wonderful with states and decorations.

River Seine-- beautiful walk along the banks. This river snakes its way thru Paris, has some beautiful bridges linking both banks and most bridges have a historical story attached. Well maintained with gold statues. Also you can take a cruise from strategic areas along the river. surrounded by breathtaking architecture.
Small river. It's not really a river, from everything I've read about it I expected much more. It's an avarege smaller river. It's more about the bridges

Boating on the Seine. We had both done the river cruise before but decided it was worth trying again. Long lines and crowds made getting on and off a trial of ones patience. The English narration was a little off from the places we passed but prior experience made up for this gap. A dinner cruise would have been a better choice.
All about Paris. We were having a boat trip in the River Seine. This trip will tell you a lot about the city, its history, buildings, and beauty.

Paris to Normandy on Viking River Cruise. The river cruise from Paris to Normandy down the Seine River was one of the best vacations we ever had. The staff on the ship was courteous, the food tasty with local flavors and dishes enriching your palate nightly. The daily excursions were fantastic as the local guides used by Viking were very knowledgeable and communicative. The land transportations was first class as Viking paved the way to your day of pleasure and education with first rate buses. The night before we docked in a City we were briefed by the Program director on what to expect and a brief cultural lecture on what we were to see. The head chef also spoke nightly, engaging us in what to expect for dinner. Viking is a first rate organization delivering a first rate vacation. Thank you and koodoos to the entire organization.

Beautiful river, fantastic body of water for a romantic cruise in the city of lights!!!. I enjoy river cruises and a Seine river cruise is a must do. We cruised the Seine with a local cruise operator and enjoyed the breathtaking views and the monuments around. The flashing Eiffel lights can best be enjoyed from the waters of the Seine. Additionally it gives you a different perspective of the City and also a close view of the monuments and attractions situated near the river side. No cruise can be more romantic with a view of the Eiffel under a full moon.

Picturesque. What a splendid sight! So pretty and such a delight to walk along side. A brilliant way to get to and from major attractions by foot as you don't realise how long you've been walking for!!

Breathtaking. Of course, that could be because of the cold and the wind! There's something truly magical about strolling the banks of the River Seine. It is something you just have to do. If possible go for a ride on the river as well. It exhilarating. Bateau us is a useful form of transport. And, of course, it is close to most of the major landmarks. It's also fun to see all the artists; talent abounds. Lots of books too.
Take the cruise its very romantic. The Cruises are expensive as is most things in Paris, but it was very enjoyable, you can quickly see so much of Paris cruising up the river.

Nice cruise-monuments on both banks. One must take a boat ride down the river Seine. You will be able to get a glimpse of the history of Paris and its monuments. Its awesome and the audio commentary is also very useful.
Nice way to rest the feet. Sitting down, taking in Paris and seeing it from the river is a very pleasant way to spend a little over an hour!

Absolute Joy. There is nothing else I love more than spend hours walking along the Seine, there are just too many things to look at and enjoy. You can spend time gloriously and breath history and beauty of Paris. My wife prefers the boat dinner which is also lovely, either one (or both) is something that you will not forget.

grand. You can walk up and down and over all the bridges and each one brings you out to a new vista and somewhere else to view, the river cruises are as good as you pay for, next time i would go for one with a meal on board,
The River Seine. We walked there during the day and enjoyed the river with a view of the Eiffel Tower. We also enjoyed the view at night.

Boat tour. found this to be a good start to our vacation. The tour guide provided a good orientation to the city and its history and landmarks. Great to take the sunset tour for beautiful pictures of city landmarks.

Seine RiverEvening Boat Tour. A great tour of the cityby boat in the evening we followed this up with a bus tour of the city so all the attractions were lite up we got some great photos, you get all the info about the city during both the tours , we then went on to Chez Clement on the Champs Des Elysees the food was not that good we were expecting better.

Night boat trip up the Seine. A night trip up the Seine is a must. Whilst its crowded on board you can get some great photo's as the boats have giant spot lights on the side which light up the river banks and bridges. You can sit inside but if you want to see the sites and take photo's wrap up warm if you are there in December like us as it gets chilly/cold. There are plenty of interesting sites to see and the Eiffel Tower with it's changing coloured lights is a photographs dream. Before you buy your tickets make sure the boat is going the way where you want to go as some of the trips go different ways up the Seine.

Love a view of the Seine River!. I love our view of the Seine River. In a very congested Paris it give you a feeling of beauty and space. When we are not in a rush we like to take the Batobus, which is a water bus on the Seine.It stops at major points and gives you the opportunity to see Paris along the banks of the Seine and above.
A little green - but cool. We hung out here one evening with all the young Parisians. What a fun place to hang. Must walk along it's banks or sit along its banks on a warm evening.
Went on a night river cruise. The river cruise is a nice chance to get off your feet after a long day of sightseeing. It's a nice way to see the city quickly and a good intro if you've just arrived.

The River Seine. The best way to see the city of Paris is to take a boat ride on the Seine at night. there are a lot of boat companies and you can choose the one that's suits you best. Night time on the Seine with a glass of wine. enough said

Bateaux Parisien Lunch Trip. On Sunday 5th May I took my wife and myself on a trip on the Seine.148 Euros got me a Privilege class 4 course meal with nuts, wine, Kir and Coffee.The trip was supposed to take us on a two and half round trip past the sights of Paris including Notre Dame, Musee Orsay and the ill de Cite.Unfortunately due to the river being in flood, the boat could not go under some of the bridges. So we were informed that we would go in the opposite direction away from the city. In compensation we were offered two day ordinary boat trips along the Seine, valid for a year.Initially we were a little disappointed but found the trip out of the city quite interesting and rewarding.Generally we found the whole excursion very good. We were treated well. The staff were professional and friendly. The food was fine but not over generous, but there was plenty of bread to make the meal adequate.The on board musac was okay and the female singer pleasant and not over powering. Having a table next to the window made all the difference as you could observe many aspects of french life.In conclusion it was a memorable occasion

Great Cruise. The Cruise was nice and there weren't very many people (compared to the rest of Paris). I got to see everything but seeing is not enjoying. Don't go on the cruise thinking you will be able to get great pictures of Paris. It isn't happening, the boat sits too low in the water. Also, I purchased a ticket online which stated I would be able to have a small snack on the cruise. I exchanged my printout for a stub and was told on board my stub was not good for a snack. After departing the boat I returned to the counter to ask what happened. It was a different woman working and she claimed my printout was no where to be found but due to the price I told her I paid online it was "impossible" I would have received a snack. Despite the title of the email I showed her on my phone saying "with optional snack". Just rude unappreciative customer service.

Take your time.. Don't just look at the Seine and go. Go right down on to the banks, walk under the bridges, rather than just over them, and check out what is down there. This area of Paris has a pretty dark history and it's worth checking that out too! This is the main artery of Paris, give it some time :)

Take a ride on the river!. Don't miss a trip to see the sights along the banks from a different perspective. Walking along the quays is one thing, but looking up , feeling the motion of the flow of the river and experiencing the sights and sounds is an unforgettable experience.
Pure Parisienne Experince. What can be more Parisienne than a stroll along the River Siene? I can't think of anything more relaxing and enjoyable and romantic. Go during the day as well as at night.

Such a beautiful River. We took a dinner cruise at night on the river. It was so pretty with the building lit up. It is a very interesting river, with couples eating beside the river and people playing music. Very nice indeed.

What can you say?. The Seine is a bustling avenue of it's own with the batobus that can drop you anywhere along the route for an inexpensive ticket. A great way to see the sights. We didn't get to partake but will definitely have on our agenda for next time.
Peaceful. It was so nice just strolling along the Seine. We walked the Seine on the day we visited the islands.

The only way to give your feet a rest!. We travelled on the Sein with the boat company near the Eiffel Tower. It was very busy crowded and noisy. I would look for a smaller company if ever I do this again. But - its worth the ride if only to give your feet a rest !! You see a lot of sights.

River Trip. We had a wonderful river trip on one of the many excellent tourist barges. The staff were helpful, the explanation that accompanied the trip was super. Passing under the Bridges one could see their beauty and you also got a fantastic view of the Flying Buttresses of Notre Dame.
The most romantic part of Paris.. In the afternoon the book vendors open their green metal stalls and offer trash to treasures. At night the view is beautiful and safe.

Center of city. The center of the city is the river. There are a lot of things to visit along, from Eiffel tower to Jardin des Plantes. It worths every euro to take a batobus ticket and enjoy the Seine.

Skip the boat ride.. Maybe there are some better rides but I would pass this up. It was hard to understand what the guide said and she did not say much. Except for the view of Notre Dame it was not worth the time.
Stunning. Gorgeous! Enjoyed some delightful views from the higher tower floors, and also during a simple boat cruise one night.

Historic river. The seine winds it's way through Paris and can be observed from many places along beautiful bridges with gilded statues and stone work. It's a wide river with good views of Paris adorning either side.
We had a good view from Notredame over the Seine - there are many river cruises to be had too.

good views. take the glass roof boat ride on the river to see the sites. If you have a good camera, you will get good photo ops. Tour is in French with headphones. You get on and off near the Eiffel tower.
Romantic memories. Showed my children the bridge where my husband proposed! It was nice to see loads of 'love locks' at the same spot!
Have a picnic. Buy a bottle of wine and a baguette sandwich and eat it beside the Seine on a clear night. The areas near the Eiffel Tower and Pont Neuf are perfect for this.

Boat tour. We bought the red hop-on, hop off bus pass that included the river cruise on a warm, sunny spring Sunday. Long lines and no signs or people to tell us which cruise was affiliated with the bus. My husband and I waited in the wrong line for 45 mins. The cruise was pleasant to see people hanging out by the water on the first sunny day after a long winter. The earphones didn't provide too much of a description along the way.
Great Way to see the city. The sights you see along the way are outstanding and by making the walk you will get very familiar with the layout of the city!

A Must See - by night!. The river is beautiful, no matter the time of day. However the best way to see Paris, in my opinion is from a boat after dark. There are many choices for cruises. Do some research and then pick one because this is NOT to be missed. The most incredibly romantic experience EVER.
Beautiful. La Seine is very beautiful. It s better to take ship to have the vue from both sides of the river, but most of the time, it s a bit cold to take the ship.

See Paris from the river.. River boat trips leave from the river bank very near the Eiffel Tower. This is a challenge but If you can, try to leave while it's light out and come back after dark; you'll get the best of Paris in one trip. The boat goes around the island that was the original city of Paris then back to the Tower which, when all light up, is spectacular!
Good experience. Best way to see Paris? I don't know but yet River Seine boatride was good. I enjoyed the boatride with friends and good weather in September!
Skip the expensive river boats.... For the price of 1 metro ride you can experience the river cruise and the tour guide for way less than if you pay for the tour that costs about $100.00 USD.

Heart of Paris. Seine river is the heart of Paris and it divides the entire city into 2 banks. There are more that 20 bridges across Seine. We did the Seine boat cruise since that is the best way to see the river sights. During the boat cruise we got to see the 2 islands of Seine, Eiffel tower, Pont Alexandre III and many other famous bridges, the concierge etc. There was a lady giving an overview of attractions as we passed by them, so it was pretty educational. We also passed by Seine numerous other times while visiting Notre Dame, Grand Palais etc.

River Seine boatride was terrific!. Enjoyed the boat ride on River Seine! Nice to hear what you are looking at! Lovers Bridge was pointed out so went back to put on our padlock and throw the key in the river!

Seine River. A ride in the ferry on river seine will take you to almost 7 tourist spots and a nice view of Eiffel. Clean water river, with sparkling light reflections of the city in it, makes it look fabulous during the night

Got to do this!. Best way to see Paris - especially at night with all the lights of the City - is on a river cruise! A sumptuous dinner cruise for a romantic interlude would be ideal but not necessary. Best way is to just give yourself the chance to sit quietly, admire this great city and imbibe the atmosphere.

It's a river that runs through the middle of Paris. I am not sure how you can visit Paris and miss the Seine since it is right there in the heart of everything you would want to see. Even though we did take a night boat cruise, I found all the tour boats to be a bit distracting. It was also cold the night we went on the cruise so I really do not think I took it all in like i would have if I was not freezing. I would have loved to see the Seine the way the impressionists saw the Seine, but I guess I can just look at Sisley's works for that. Walking, crossing, boating or just gazing at it from above thinking of all the people who have come before you and will come after you is worth the nostalgic glance.
love it. theres this nice little boat that will give you a tour around the river. Very nice but i wouldnt do it during the winter time since it tends to get really really cold

The River IS Paris. There are so many ways to see the River Seine and you should do them all! Walk along its banks and feel like you are in every movie you ever saw about the City of Light. Take a tour boat by all means. One in the daytime and for certain sure you must take an evening tour. See the lovers along the river strolling and kissing as the night comes. Watch all the wonderful buildings bathed in the lights of the city. There are small groups of musicians playing along the banks and families with a picnic spread on the ground. Float slowly under the magnificent bridges built to honor Queen Victoria and Napoleon. Have a heavenly view of Norte Dame as the sun is setting and the lights are casting shadows. It is everything you thought it would be and you should absolutely take time of the River Seine. Not just to make a few photos from atop an open tour bus, go to the river and step on a boat. Have a seat or have dinner. Have an adventure.
Serene. Beautiful river with beautiful bridges. Great watching all the boats sail by. Take a tour on the Bateaux Mouches!

Take a river cruise at sunset.. We took a river cruise at sunset that lasted an hour. It was great seeing the colors change on the buildings as we floated by, finally seeing the Eiffel Tower light up and sparkle at the top of the hour. It was a great way to spend an evening in Paris.
magical. everyone who visits Paris must take a walk along river Seine day and night to enjoy its beauty.a tour with the hop on hop off boats is also recommended!

Nice to book a boat ride at night. We took a boat ride right before sunset so by the time the boat was on its way back they had turn on the lights of the Eiffle tower. It was really windy and we had a long wait on the way back but it was fun and I would prefer it to walking by the river cuz you get to see more without getting tired.
Wonderfully romantic. There's nothing more romantic than walking along the Seine in the rain. It's Paris and it's wonderful in any weather.
Take a boat tour!. We took a boat tour (there are several to choose from) that lasted 1 hour, and only costs 12 Euros per person. Plentiful outside and indoor seating.

Maybe the best way to discover Paris. Even as a parisian, the beauty of Paris can be daunting when you get to see it from the river; it is just a different point of view which always works for me when I do it with visiting friends. Batobus is one way to do it, but even the very touristy solutions work fine.

better by night. I decided to do the river cruise...by night and I still remember it. The night was cool, I was the first person to get in the boat and the last to leave it. The explanations were very thorough, and the people enjoyed the several translations available. Paris is majestic by night.

Seine River Tour at night. I would recommend taking a tour of the Seine at night. Paris is more beautiful during the nighttime, and the view of the Eiffel Tower is a memory making event when its lights are on.

morning run. If you are planning on a run around the seine, here's a suggestion. Starting at either Notre dame or the Bastille, run on the left bank not the right - the footpath is far more spacious. Also take one of the many tracks/roads down to run alongside the river bank. The gardens are lovely to run through , and less fumes. If you start at the Bastille, you can run along a canal off the Seine where the houseboats are moored, then cut across the iron bridge that operates as a lock to the right bank. You can also take in the romantacism of the lovers lock footbridge near Notre Dame.
Fresh Air!. When it's getting hot in Paris, a boat trip on the Seine is a must. Pamper your feet, relax and enjoy. Here is more: http://madaboutparis.com/tours/crusing-on-the-seine.html

Follow the river. Our hotel was about 2 minutes from the Seine. We then walked from Notre Dame, down the Seine, put a padlock on Pont d'Art and carried on walking down to the Eiffel Tower. Gorgeous day, gorgeous views.
Bateaux Mouches worth the price. This 90 min trip was very good value for money, You can take your own food and wine on board so what better way to see Paris than from the water..
Great way to see the sights. The hop on/off ticket on one of the river lines gives a great view of the attractions and a means of getting around if you don't want to walk or do a bus tour.
Very nice. The simple tour, one hour cost about 13 Euros. It's nice, secure, for couples, friends and families. You have a phone that has many languages and a lot of teaching.
Well worth a tour. This was a really good trip and well worth the money. A ticket lasts all day and you can jump on and off to please yourself. An easy way to see the sights.

Amawaterways River cruise on the Seine. We cruised from Paris to Rouen on a longboat Amawaterways River cruise, and back. Going through locks was fun. The scenery along the Seine does not match the scenery along the Rhine. It was mostly trees full of mistletoe, limestone bluffs, and small towns here and there. There was not much river traffic compared to the Rhine. It was relaxing to be on the boat. The food was excellent.

Stroll, sit, enjoy.. We felt safe the entire time we were in Paris. Just be smart, like you would in any city. The weather was so nice, there were lots of people scattered along the Seine at night, sitting by the water. As we went by on our Bateau Mouches cruise, they waved and danced. A lovely river, from any perspective. Each bridge has it's own story.

Beautiful River, but you cant see much from the tour boat.. The River its self is lovely and you can sit along most of it on the river bank and enjoy the sunny days. but if you are hoping to see everything buy the many tours that run along it. You will only get a quick far away glimspe as the building are quite far away.

A boat trip down the Seine. We walked into the tourist information on the bank of the Seine as they had tickets for 9 euros for an hours boat trip. We picked up the boat from the island, the girl who was giving the commentary was very good. It was a nice relaxing hour as we could rest our weary feet and enjoy the sights of Paris. Really good value.
Special treat. We were fortunate to have lunch on a Bateaux Parisiens. Lovely river cruise and delicious lunch served by friendly efficient staff.

Magical and Convenient - Perfect for Family with Kids!. The enjoyed the River Seine cruise a lot! We were able to see Paris in different angle and we managed to go to Paris tourist destinations along the river conveniently. Plus sitting on the benches along the River while waiting for the boat is simply magical. We feel that time stops for us. The kids love the river cruise. We feel that this is the easiest to see Paris for family with kids!

A must do Seine River Cruise, Excellent!!!. We were on Thomas Cook Tour, the seine river cruise is must and highly recommended. in one hour cruise you can at least see all those attractions from outside , which you can not visit because of time . A very good panoramic city views so keep your cameras fully charged.

Another point of view.... You haven't seen Paris until you see it from the river both during the day and at night. Batobus is a wonderful to see the sights and get around the major attractions during the day. And several firms give night time tours for a reasonable cost. Or do as we did and splurge on a dinner cruise, great fun!
The beautiful Seine. It is fun to sit on the benches close to the rivers edge and watch the boats of tourists go by. Its very peaceful and an excellent way to end your day.

River Seine - Beauty at its best. My wife and I did a combination Dinner on level one at the Eiffel Tower followed by this River Seine Cruise then a late show at the Lido. The River Seine Cruise took us all the way past Notre Dame one way and back the other. The scenery on both banks and the explanations by the tour guide gave us a great understanding of this very real part of Paris. Loved it.

Wonderful Bridges. We went on a one hour boat trip from the Pont Neuf in Paris it cost us 13 euros each and was worth every penny. You go all the way down to the Eiffel Tower and back up around the island. The bridges are wonderful to see from the river and we had a very good commentary in English as well as French.
The heart of Paris. Like all major rivers it is peaceful and relaxing to walk besides. Next visit hope to actually take a trip down the Seine

great for morning jog...but. pretty as usual, I jogged/walked early morning. the street level was fine, but if you need to be careful of uneven paving if you run along the river. I zigzagged crossing from one side of river to the other and took lots of pictures. pedestrian bridges are prettier.
THE REAL TREASURE OF PARIS. Even on a cold rainy day in March walking along the Seine is a true pleasure because of sights and the absence of tourists. , .

Romantic and free. Paris is an expensive city - but you get full value for walking along the river day or night. It is mostly clean, well lit, though you need to watch your step for missing cobblestones. Take a look at the docked boats and watch the regular stream of tour boars and cruises. If you prefer to ride rather than walk - you can buy a 5 day pass on the Bato-boat for 21 Euros and use it as much as you want until 9:30 at night.
lovely. would hav liked to do a river cruise but felt we didnt hav time to spare will do the next time we come to paris

Europe Trip 2013. So very cold. It was a night tour on the river. Lots of rowdy kids on board who were pushy and disruptive. Had to go downstairs because of the cold and noise. Otherwise a good thing to do!!!

AMAZING, RELAXING & ROMANTIC. We went on the cruise, which was really nice. It was so peaceful and relaxing as well as romantic. Worth doing, not expensive, and really gives you a nice quick view of some of Paris attractions. I would suggest to anyone, but especially couples.
Great Boat Ride. Take a boat trip, it's better than an open top bus. It's a great way to see Paris in all weathers. Commentary in English, French and Spanish. Most go from the Eiffel Tower.

Lovely Cruise!. Thoroughly enjoyed the cruise along the Seine, well worth the trip and very well priced. It was a little bit chilly in April but they had covered seating with heating. It was a good time too, travelling up past the Notre Dame and back.
Pack a picnic. On the one sunny day of our trip we bought cheese, fruit and wine and went down to the Seine to picnic, people watch and watch the books go by

Peaceful walk with many sights to be seen. I and my partner walked between Notre Dame and Eiffel Tower. It's a very nice walk and you see a great deal of sights externally in passing like the Louvre and the Musse d'Orsay. I would suggest being careful particularly around the bridges, there are a lot of people who are clearly pick-pockets- mainly young boys and girls who are asking for donation so do be wary.Aside from that it’s a lovely walk that shouldn’t be missed if you have the time to do it.

MS Botticelli River Seine cruise.. We joined the MS Botticelli after supporting a family member in the Paris Marathon, the second time we have been on this particular cruise. The Botticelli is a hotel cruise boat catering for 154 passengers. The food is excellent, even though you don't get to choose what you would like. OK, there was an odd item on the plate that didn't suit my taste but you could easily leave it and still enjoy the rest of the dish. Everything was prepared and served with care and great attention to detail. The choices of all inclusive wines were very good. The staff are lovely, very helpful and obliging. The entertainment, by the crew, was a little old fashioned and typically french with a lot of emphasis on mime, but it made an interesting change.We will take a river cruise again, but in warmer weather so as to enjoy the sun deck and the odd trip ashore. Overall great value for money and very relaxing.
Lover Locks. The bridges over the Seine are fabulous walkways to look at the boats, the lover's locks, sit on a bench and people watch, or just watch the river go by,
Boat tour. These are great ways to see Paris and if its cold the inside is cosy and heated, definelty do one as they are reasonably priced also and also come as part of the bus tours

Best way to make sense of Central Paris. A cruise down the Seine is one of the best ways of making sense of Paris. The tour guide's commentary really gives you a heads up of what's what and how to get from one end to the other. It's also got brilliant views.

Loved the cruise.. We did an evening/night cruise on the Seine, a very memorable experience. It was very relaxing and the commentary was very good. Loved seeing the sights from on board and we got to see the Eiffel tower light up on the hour.

Perfect Landmark!. When walking around Paris the River Seine keeps you from getting lost! Walk along it and check out many museums on both banks. Keep walking and you will eventually hit most all of the sites from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame. The River itself is very murky. And winds blow constantly when you are near it. Have a jacket with you-you will need it!

Take the low road. After battling the crowds walking along the top of the wall we descended the steps and walked along the bank at water level from the Louvre towards Place Concorde. Hardly anyone else around and we got to see the river from a whole different perspective. From the underneath of the bridges to the barges tied up with people living on them to the ducklings swimming in the rubbish along near the shore. Excellent.

Paris's snaking magic. The Seine is what makes Paris the magic it is. It cuts the city into left and right banks. Dotted along it the most beautiful famous sites of the city, under it's bridges in themselves sites to see. You can walk it's banks and sit on the many benches spotting along the riverside...and dream. A lunch spot and an evening romantic wander. Watch life pass by.

Great way to see the city. We booked the Batobus tour from the Eiffel Tower stop, it takes in 8 of the main attractions along the Seine and you can hop on and hop off (no tour guide) and is a superb way to see the architecture and views of this stunning city. Highly recommended.

A dinner cruise is very beautiful. We took a dinner cruise on Bateaux Parisian which was the highlight of our week in Paris. The city of lights at night from the river is especially wonderful. Our meal was the match of any we had in Paris. Filet of beef cooked as ordered with wonderful sauce.
