Great Trip. Im sure all the boat trips are the same, but the river is a great way to see the city! Especially in the evening, very romantic indeed, but very cold, so make sure to wrap up!

Romance. Nothing more romantic than a oat ride or sitting on the banks with bread, cheese, and wine and your sweetie. Fn to walk along the quails browsing through the kiosks at have been there forever.

River Boat. A boat ride along the Seine is a MUST DO! take the open top boat and book the cruise that is an hour before sunset. It is two trips in one, daytime up the Seine to Notre Dam and pretty city lights and nightime on the way back down the Seine with the majesti Eiffel Tower all lit up! Two photo opps. The best boat is the one - if you are facing Trocodaro with your back to the Eiffel Tower, there is a carousel on the left, go down those stairs and take that boat. Sit on top out in the open - dress warmly!
Must Cruise the River Seine. I loved cruising the River Seine. Took about 1 1/2 hours with great views of well-known sites. Wonderful!

A pleasant evening cruise. We took the River cruise at night when the crowds were gone. We took the last cruise of the evening and it was a very enjoyable pleasant way to see the city at night without the crowds on board. I recommend it if you can. I'm sure its nice during the day too but the crowds are much more intense then.

river. i brought tickets for 24 hours ,so that for 2 days i could ride the boat to view the attractions along the river,at every stop there is an attraction to see,its the easiest way to get around to see every thing if you have limited time,there is also boats that have dinner and shows along the seine in the days and also at night ,quite romantic

A tourist must. The Boat ride on the River Seine is a tourist must. It is nothing spectacular but still very interesting. You start and return to a spot in front of the Eiffel Tower. The boats are very large and leave very frequently. Sit back and enjoy.

Lovely to watch the world go by. Grab a coffee and sit by the river seine and watch the world go by, lovely way to spend the day, also take the time to catch the "Batobus" and sail down the seine for a different perspective.

Bateaux-Mouches pretty boring.. Took a cruise on the Bateaux-Mouches from Alma-Marceau which wasn't too expensive, but the audio guide was very weak. They do not appear to sail at 2pm, so we hung around for 40 minutes which was quite boring. Boat has no food on board.

good value of money. I chose river cruise with dinner on board,and that was late evening so it was opportunity to see all iluminations of main attractions in Paris,and i enjoy that.Food aswell really nice, 35e pp

Gorgeous walk along the river. Sneaker up and just take everything in. Its a beautiful walk & lots to see along the way. Made me fall in love with the city. Lots of sites and architecture to take in along the way. And perhaps if the sun is out, a boat ride along the Seine would add even more fun. Must visit both in the day time and evenings.; completely different feel to it.

batobus trip. We did the batobus trip , which you pick up at the Seine near the Eiffle Tower. Such a good value trip, you get a ticket for the day and you can jump on and off the boat at 8 different points, a great way to see the city.

Paris. fun to walk along and I would have loved to have done a river cruise but it had been snowing just before we got there and the cold weather stayed. What beautiful bridges and just view while walking along is breathtaking
Take this Tour!!. The Seine River Cruise - at night, is a wonderful way to see the lights and bridges of Paris!! It is quite special to see the Eiffel Tower at night!

So peaceful!. Beautiful walk- I wanted to walk forever!! I would recommend visiting late evening so you can experience the banksides by day and moonlight!If you want to spend a little, indulge in a Seine River cruise with dinner on board- amazing!!

Use the Batobus. Loved the cruise along the river, even better as the ticket bloke let us on for free when he saw we had tickets for the other company who offer rides and we had queued in the cold at the wrong place. What a star. Who said the French are misserable? Great way to see the sites. Loved it.

Bateaux Mouches. I've been to Paris many times and this was my first trip on a Bateaux Mouches. I thought they were going to be really expensive, but that was not the case. It's a fabulous way to see some of Paris. Thoroughly recommend it, especially if you are with the one you love.
Kick back with a picnic lunch.. The wide low banks offer a great opportunity to kick back with a picnic lunch. Just watch out for the waves.
Great views!. A sight to see from both the riverside and on a river tour! RIver tour is best at night! Lots of walking. If taking the boat tour - be sure to dress for it in the colder months!

Cruise by dusk. Wonderful way to see Paris in both the light and the night. Loved seeing all the picnics along the riverbanks and finishing up at the Eiffel Tower at night time was a real WOW factor a must do in Paris.

A Way to Start Your Visit to Paris. This was my second time in Paris, and am I glad I started my second visit with a morning seine cruise. It's worth every penny. I prefer the morning light to take pictures, but they go day and night. Buy your champagne before you board the boat as they don't sell refreshments onboard.

By day or night, the Seine keeps up its elegant and tranquil facade.. By night, the lights of Paris, and its magnificent historic buildings reflect on the Seine as in a Van Gogh painting, making it the ideal romantic rendez-vous.
nice river cruise. taking a river cruise in seine starts from below the effile tour . you enjoy the journey whatever your language . i my self perefere night river cruses to enjoy the city of lights
nice walking area. Very nice area to walk and see the river, boats and shops. Nicely maintained, clean. Bridges were very interesting.

Take Stroll Day or Night. You can take a boat tour if you want, but we didn't. We walked on both sides during the day early and late evening from the Tower Eiffel to past Notre Dame. One evening there were so many small bands playing on the bank we almost forgot to walk. So many different bridges to walk under and across. Great for romance and people watching there seems to be something always going on, artist, tours, lovers, music, lights, etc.

River cruise a little crowded.. It seemed like every time the river barge passed under a bridge everyone onboard felt the need to whistle or yell. It kind of took some of the romance out of the tour. A much nicer, though more expensive, evening was the dinner cruise. Very nice.

Get some wine. Just get some wine, snacks, and hang out by the river in the evening. We also did the Seine boat ride at night and it's pretty to see the city at night. I recommend doing this on your first night there if you don't have an actually plan for the trip, so you'll have some idea of what to see or do.

Romantic evening river cruise - River Seine. We boarded our boat at the foot of the Eiffel Tower for an evening cruise that started about 8pm. Sunset was beautiful. The river tour included Notre Dame Cathedral and many other landmarks. Beautiful architecture. As we returned to dock at dark, the Eiffel Tower strobe lights were turned on and it was a breath taking view of the tower. Took some fabulous pictures on the cruise.

Best Boat ride ever!. I was so suprised at the quality and length of the river Seine boat tour, I did not take the dinner cruise, just the boat ride, we passed so near the really big sites, I felt like I had a real sence of Paris because of it. I only had 1and 1/2 days in Paris so I had to pack in a lot in a short period of time, be sure to do this you will love it and it is a great value for the money!
Pleasant way to see with city. We used the batobus to get around one day, deciding it was a cheaper way to have a boat trip, coupled with a useful way of getting from A to B. Got to be done.

Lovely sunny river cruise. Following completion of the Paris Marathon my family and I decided to take a trip on the river (my excuse for a sit down!). My daughter loved seeing the sights from the river.
A trip on a Bateaux Mouches is a must!. Many boats to choose from to do this great river trip. We had a commentary on board. There are boats that do a cruise and lunch or dinner so shop around.

Great trip. Take the time to do a cruise along the river. Its a good way to figure out the lay of the land on a first visit to Paris and you'll get to see al the important attractions. Also lovely for an evening stroll

Great. You should take a boat ride down the Sienne, You will be able to get a glimpse of the history of Paris. Understand the significance of each of the bridges and the cultural shift that took place at each of these periods.
A good introduction to Paris. We took our children on a bateau mouche the day we arrived in Paris. It gives you a great insight into the city's architecture and is a good way of resting weary legs!

Free views!. It is a great free treat over all the various bridges through Paris. Yes you can take a boat ride for various fees but why not take a leisurely stroll along the Seine and use them all for many a photo opportunity.

River Seine. This is a wonderful tour, whether you go in the daytime on an open craft, or in the evening on a dinner cruise with the city lit up like a jewel. Seeing the city from a different perspective than the streets makes you feel like you know it even better.

lovely area. wonderful walk along this river from eiffel tower to notre dame and back up on the other side lourve to trocardo, views are lovely set out a day when you can stop off and have lunch along the way,be prepared to walk.

Great 1 hour cruise. I would do the night cruise it was fantastic
we did the 9pm cruise but get in early in the winter to gets seat on the inside of the boat!

nice restful trip..... We took the Beaux Marchant (sp?)River Tour because we found a coupon on line... but any of the boats will do. Take the time to relax and see some of the most popular sites from the water. Wear some warm clothes especially if you go in the evening.
beautiful:). Beautiful river :),,, the cruise was a wonderful experience, you can see the wonderful architecture, cosmopolitan city :)
Romantic. I went on a boat trip on the River Seine and it took about an hour. We went under all bridges and it was very romantic and lovely.

Discovery and learning. History of Van Gogh at a small village near Paris along the Seine River. You should go all the way to Normandy and visit all the world war sight, museum.
Visit and stay at a small town name Honfluer was excellent choice

Paris sights from the river. On the same day of my birthday CityRama took us on a trip down the Seine and the views from the river were great, You have headphones to listen to the tour in different languages, The Tower at night with the search lights cutting through the mist was magical, great picture taking there. Gets a litte cold at this time of the year but all good.The only thing to note City Rama operate from a central locality near the Eiffel tower but to join your bus tour you need to walk with your tour person to this gigantic underground bus terminal, I think that people we had on our tour that could not walk well got driven there. Also i noted that one elderly gentleman was very frail at the Moulin Rouge and the tour master talked to the managers of the place and got him into the Moulin Rouge early to sit down. You may not realise they have a strict police that no one no matter who you are can get in ahead of the que, everyone is equal. Great time.

Seine river cruise and canal tour. I pre booked this tour on Viator. I was making the trip to Paris with my husband. On the day in question 27th March, we found our way to the afternoon ''pick up' point by the canal. We went by Metro which in any case involved changing trains 3 times but then we found that one of the stations was closed meaning we did not stop and each had to buy a further single journey ticket to go a different route ( no one's fault but an aggravating factor when you are wasting your time!) we arrived and then using an inadequate map/plan (provided by Viator) we eventually found the meeting point with half hour to spare. It was very cold (again no one's fault but ...........). As the due time approached it became clear that something was awry there was nobody else waiting and then 20 further minutes past by and we gave up. Upon returning to the hotel and checking emails we found no cancellation. I sent an email asking for an explanation and refund. Back in UK and another week later with no reply I contacted Viator. I was told I had been sent a cancelation email and my account was refunded 2 days ago - 1st April (5 days after the tour date). I subsequently found the 'cancelation' a couple of pages into an apparently unsolicited email dated 17th March, trying to sell me other tour products. There was no 'sign posting' that this was a 'Cancellation of tour' email. Further - the email was a full 10 days before the tour date, meaning the refund when it came was over 2 weeks after the cancellation. I have no idea what the tour would have been like, we wasted half a day of a 4 day break, I would recommend going through anyone other than VIATOR. Btw the refund is still to show in my account but then it is still only 3 days since it was made.
Night in Paris. We drove at night by boat and spent a wonderful time on the Seine, then we went to dinner at a small romantic restaurant

River cruise. We used the boat tour that is included in the Paris Pass. I was not impressed to say the least. It was extremely crowded, noisy, and I could not see hardly anything out the window. The lines to get onto the boat were ridiculous, and lots of big tours which always trump the individual ticket holders. I would skip this tourist trap.
Champange River Cruise. Fabulous darlings!! hic hic! Booked a lovely cruise through O'Chateau. A lovely way to see the sights and sample some lovely champagne. Highly recommended.

So Much to See. I can highly recommend a trip on the Seine. We were fortunate enough to have a free trip included in our package so I can't comment on prices. I was surprised at how much of Paris you see from the boat, it also give you a whole different perspective.

Romantic Strolls...... Enjoyed walking on both sides of the River Seine. We saw many boat tours sail by and the people looked as though they were enjoying the river. The glass toped tour boats looked just like they do in pictures. A stroll along the river is a must do!

I love the boat tour. Not cheap, but such a great way to see Paris.The last time we went it was even free as we got complementary tickets from the hotel we were staying at.We had done it the day, so this time we went at night and was very romantic. We even snuck a little bottle of wine on board and sat at the back outside and nobody saw us with our little glasses... so don't tell anyone we did it.

nice and romantic. the river goes in the middle of Paris, if you take a night trip in the "Bateau mouche" you'll be able to see the city at night, but miss the bridges, since they are more obvious during day light...a must do, but be careful it tends to get very cold at night
Paris break. Lovely place for a walk although you need to watch your step as otherwise could end up having a swim!

Beautiful River. It was a beautiful river and has so much history. I recommend taking a walking tour or get a travel book that gives you information on how the river has given life to Paris for centuries. It really puts it in perspective.

Beautiful pics of River & Eiffel tower at dusk. I got some gorgeous pics of the Seine with the Eiffel Tower in the background just as the sun was going down. Probably not the cleanest river in the world, but I wasn't drinking or swimming in it, so didn't make any difference to me!

River Cruise. I'm glad that I was able to join some foreign colleagues in the cruise. It was very informative and had a chance to view the rear end of the Notre Dame Cathedral and other significant sites which can be viewed in the river side,

Beautiful River. During the day the river can look quite boring nonetheless a lovely walk. During the evening the river looks lovely and is lit up nicely. Well worth a walk along the river in the day or in the evening. The river cruise during the evening is beautiful.
Peaceful travel. Used the batobus for two days after walking for a couple of hours. Well worth money and toured up and down the river which is especially magical at night.

Beautiful River Siene. Beautiful river with numerous bridges each one different than the previous one. A boat ride on the Siene river shows the city and its buildings from a different perspective. A must do in paris.

Pleasant time next to Seine river.. It is very peaceful and pleasant to walk around the Seine River. There are so many sightseeing locations along the rive, such as Eiffel Tower, museums, restaurants and others.
Great river. A river cruise in Paris is a must do. Several cruise lines are available and you'll remember the experience.

Take your time to walk along the river you will not be sorry. We spent a lot of time walking along the river and just enjoying all the distractions along the way from the wonderful buildings to the main attractions. Finding the bridge with all the padlocks on and adding ours was a very special moment, very romantic, throwing the key into the river really did symbolise something special to us both. All the little nic nak shops along the way sell the usual from fridge magnets to pictures and a good place to get your little gifts and reminds of you trip to Paris. We did a boat trip too its a very nice way to see the city and you can hop in and off as you want to do the sites along the way.

Loved it !!. We took the cruise on River Seine when we visited Paris and had a wonderful experience. The River passes close to some of the best known attractions in Paris including Eiffel Tower. This is a must do when you are in Paris. Make sure you find some time to sit and relax on the bank of River Seine. It is again great experience.
bateau mouche. Well wotht the 1 hour trip on the river. Commentary pointed out the usual sights. seats were plastic and could be a little more comfortable but just a minor point

Beautiful. The river makes the city! Always moving. Always flowing! Beautiful to watch as you walk across one of the many bridges or beautiful to take a river ride and enjoy this mos famous river in Europe!

Take a boat ride down the Seine. Taking a boat ride down the Seine is a great way to spend your first day in Paris. It allows you to get your bearings of the city and take in some breathtaking landmarks along the way. I took the batobus, a water taxi in a sense, that allows you to jump on and off the boat throughout the day. It stops at Notre Dame, the Eiffel Tower and several other iconic stops. Much nicer than taking the Metro when you want to see the sites.
Batobus a great way to see the sites.. We took advantage of hopping on and off the Batobus to visit all the main sites and travelling the Seine, good value and very enjoyable!

Toured the Seine in the evening on a dinner cruise.. The city lights are awesome. The Eiffel Tower is glittering and statuesque. The mini statue of Liberty is lighted, as is the many other building located on the Seine.

This is how a river should be treated. Paris does for the Seine what few cities do for their rivers. For example, the Tiber running through Rome often resembles not much more than a wide ditch, while the Seine is flanked on all sides by beautiful buildings, lots of trees, book-sellers, and wide sidewalks for strolling. Really beautiful. On a first trip to Paris, you really should do a boat ride on the river.
Excellent great pics. It was flowing fast , great way to see the city, definitely must have photo opportunities.It was abit dirty but it did give a different take on Paris.
Wonderful. Wonderful Seine in Paris merit the trip. i am a parisien guy from 50 years...always the same feeling than this townn is construct under the names o beauty and harmony

Good way to start out a trip to Paris.. There are at least a couple of boat companies that do tours on the Seine. My friend and I decided to go on the Batobus. Unlike the more famous Bateaux Mouches, which do a full narrated tour, the Batobus gives you hop-on, hop-off service for a full day or more, depending on the length of the pass you purchase. Although you don't get a narrated tour on the Batobus, you do get to ride in beautiful glassed-in boats, which provided much-needed protection from the freezing winds on the day we rode. I think the Batobus gives you a nice view of the city flanking the river, and a reasonably-priced form of transportation if you want to visit a number of tourist highlights in one day. I would even consider taking a Bateaux Mouches tour in addition to the Batobus, in order to learn more about al that can be seen from the water.

Boat ride. The 1-hour tour of Paris via the River Seine was worth the time and money because we got a really good overview of most of the sights of Paris with a little information. Made out planning much easier.

une bateaux sur la seine. love it on a rainy day when up and down and up again. Different perspective from the river. They boat was roomy and bright and the staff very friendly. No food but stopped and had tea and croissants on the Ile de?

Best view of Paris. A river cruise is by far the best way to see the sights and beautiful variety of bridges along the seine, we set out across the road from the Eiffel Tower and the cruise took us down as far as Notre Dame around the island and back up to the Eiffel Tower the beauty and history of the many bridges we passed under was very entertaining even the kids were kept amused, lifelong lovely memories with my kids, i highly recommend it.
nice river side to take a walk. I got some coffee and just walk around the river. It was nice just to do that.I would try the river cruise next time!
Cruise it. Take the cruise on the Seine. Little bit of history and you get a nice view of Paris. Go during the evening or night to see the lights. Bring a bottle of wine and soak it in.

Lovely. What a lovely place. Lots of little stalls along the pavements selling paintings, postcards & pictures. Such a lovely atmosphere. Look out for Pont Des Arts taht leads to the Louvre. This is full of padlocks along the sides of the bridge. You can actually buy a padlock on the bridge. You put you & your loved one's inital's on it & throw the key into the river. It'll bring you good luck & bless your union (as it were). Quite romantic & a lovely memory to make. We visited in March but I bet it would be lovely & full of activity in summer.
The River!. Sitting next to the River drinking a cheap Merlot and eating baguettes was one of my dreams, this came true and what an experience! Something everybody should try.
Cruise on the seine. Would highly recommend all travellers take a trip on the boat it is a good way to see all the sights and chill out from the hustle and bustle of Paris

Batobus. The Batobus on the river is a really good way of seeing both the sights of Paris, including all the main bridges, and this form of transport allows you to "hop on - hop off" as you wish at most of the primary tourist locations. For just 15€ you can use the boats all day and have lovely views of Paris and the river whilst doing so.
Promenade. It is nice to take a walk up and down the river, to sit and read a book, to tke a boat for a tour of Paris. During summer - Paris Plages.
Nice views. Enjoyable ride, nice views of the central Paris, beautiful city... a city break that will be remembered!

Paris from the River. A new perspective of Paris and you will see so much more than from any other mode of transport. Combine it as a package with the 59 Tour Eiffel Lunch as a pre-book and no queuing!

Local spot at night. We were fortunate to personally know some Parisians while visiting Paris, and one of the best experiences we were able to have was going to the Seine at night time. If you walk down to the small areas next to the Seine, at night there are tons and tons of locals just sitting there hanging out with friends and enjoying a drink and smoke. We bought some beer and headed down there around midnight. Mostly teenagers and young twenties crowd. Myself and my traveling companion seemed to be the only two tourists. Great experience!

Dinner Cruise on the Seine. A great way to get an overview of famous landmarks including the Eiffel Tower lit up at night. However, our weather was cold and rainy which fogged up the windows and it was hard to see out. All in all a fun time with our private group charter and the food was great.
River Seine. Do go on the boat trip as you see more than you can just walking around. The river is a must-see and the guided trip is interesting.

siene walk. The river is long and with a dirty appearance. The walk abouts along the river are nice and the walk is long but exciting. All along and aside the river are impressive buildings to watch and details on the bridges on it that are well worth it the walk. The river ferry are welll worhing

Relaxing way to see Paris. This was a very relaxing and enjoyable way to see a different side of Paris. We did the cruise at around 5pm which coincided with us arriving back just as the Eiffel Tower was putting on her sparkling lights display (on the hour). The boat tour we did departs from the dock just below the Tower. Strongly recommend

The river in the heart of Paris. Altought the river is not that clean, it gives you a unique sensation being close to the river that cuts the city of Paris. Don't forget to go to the island where the Notre Dame is. That sure is the heart of the river, in the heart of Paris.

River Cruise, BORING!. Everyone told me this was a MUST do. Cruise down the River Seine. What a waste of time and money. Maybe if you are older and can't walk it may make sense. You cannot hear the audio tour guide as it is played very low and everyone talks over it. Also you are low in the river and can only see the top 1/2 of most buildings. It was so much nicer just walking along the bank and looking across the river. Take a map and you will see and learn so much more. Spend your money elsewhere.

Paris Wouldn't Be Paris Without It. The title of my review says it all. No city I've been in is beautified so much by the waterway that runs through it (the Ile de la Cite helps). If you want to be on it, skip the tour boats and ride the hop-on, hop-off Batobus on a day pass

Wonderful!. If going for the weekend, get a Batobus ticket and hop on and off the boat to see all the major sights. If you sit at the front you get wonderful views through the arches of the bridges as you cruise round. Whichever side of the river you disembark there is always a nearby bridge to cross to the other side if you need to.
Not the prettiest river to cruise!. Worth doing cruise as an easy way to view the city, but not a particularly photogenic river in itself.
Super romantic, fabulous views & Photo ops!. We took a Seine cruise, it was phenomenal, so romantic. You need to do this in Paris! Very great staff, great set up, I'd do it again!

Noisey. Bato Boat, little or no commentary, noisy kids running around and why must people keep leaving the door open when it is freezing. If you couldn't be bothered walking this might be useful but if you need to travel around the city I suggest the Metro.

Seine boat tour. The Seine boat tour was delightful. One can hop on and off at any of the places the boat stops. My family group got off at Notre Dame, toured the cathedral and had lunch before getting back on the boat. A tip: Don't begin the boat tour at Le Tour Eiffel, as there is an enormous line for tickets there.
Boat rides.. Another Paris must....The views are different from the water and better at night with all the lights....
River Seine. Very romantic in the evening with all the lights arround. Take a sweater - it is cold in the evening even in the summer.

See the sights from the Seine. We loved hopping on and off the Batobus to see the city. Great photo ops of ornate bridges and beautiful buildings while you glide down the river. Great way to See Paris!
La Seine: this is Paris!. Do not miss a trip by a "bateau mouche": it is great way to have a first view of Paris! I took one from the Pont Neuf, but there are other by Pont Alma.

Perfect after several hours of walk. After we have been walking for around 4 hours, this was the perfect 1 hour cruise tour, where you can enjoy Paris from another perspective and meanwhile you can also relax. It was really nice and I'll be doing it every time I go to Paris. It costs around 12 Euro.
Lovely dinnner cruise. Expensive but a wonderful experience to take a dinner cruise along the river and see the sights lit up.

River Seine. I went to Paris for three reasons: Louvre and Mona Lisa, Monet's Garden, and to see the Palace of Versales. I only had 3 days, so did not research what else I'd see on my booked tour. Therefore, just seeing the River Seine with all the historic old buildings was fantastic. We walked across a bridge with locks stuck on to it and looked down at the river boats by Norte Dame Cathedral. I felt drawn into the past and it was lovely!!

Grab a boat and enjoy a float. We really enjoyed the boat trip down the Seine. The one we took was open air and there was a commentary that talked about the bridges and other points of interest that we passed. The kids loved the fact that we were on a boat. Would recommend as a change of pace if you have the time.
serene!. justw alking alongside this river was very refreshing. with so many botas and so much activity...people cruises and all....its a beautiful river right in the middle of paris...worth a visit!

Living on the Seine. Staying on the floating hotel on the river sine is the best place to sleep in Paris hands down. Every morning you leave the boat and do what you do best when visiting a new strange city. The evenings on the boat were magical. Live shows, wine, dinner, wine, quiz's, wine!! All of this while you sail up and down the river in the evening seeing all the sights lit up. I will indeed be returning and taking another cruise of the Seine.
Great Cruise for 13 Euros. Just down the steps from the Eiffel Tower. About an hour on the boat and go up river past multiple city sites including the Louvre and Notre Dame.

So relaxing and saw all the sites. We did a sunset river cruise on the Seine our last night in Paris. It was so much fun. We stopped at the small restaurant right on the bak before hand, and had a quick drink. Then we stopped at the liquor store and bought some nips and soda. The tour guide was very good, and spoke both in English and French. We passed all of the sites: the Eiffel Tower, all the famous bridges, the Louvre, the jail where Marie Antoinette was kept, everything. The sunset was beautiful, and the cruise was a lot of fun. You have to do one.

At night or day this is great.. We took two tour here, one was a lunch tour and it was magnificent. We also took the night illumination cruse and it was also very good. This is a must on any Paris trip

Dinner cruise is the way to see city at it's best. We took a dinner cruise and seeing the city from the river was amazing. Any of the cruises will give you the perspective of seeing the city at night from the river. Whether it's a "sightseeing" cruise or a dinner cruise really makes no difference...

No traffic paris tour.. I took the 6pm river siene tour just in time for the sunset. It was a great experience seeing Paris in a different way. I gues it was more relaxed than the hop on hop off bus tour. Water was calm thought it was chilly. But you can stay inside the boat if you wanted to be warmed up. You get to see most of the attractions lighted and it was a great sight to see. And it was soothing bec of the french songs being played for an hour.

A must see and do!. The river Seine reminds me of the river Thames, just a french version! hahawe did the evening river cruise meal and the day time cruise. Would reccomend both! Its just so lovely sitting on the open top (although VERY cold in Feb) and taking in the history and views of the city by water. my fiance and i did the evening cruise with the meal and i will never forget, mainly because it was the night we got engaged but what a set up! the Seine by night is stunning.

Beautiful boating on a rainy day. This trip was to celebrate my other half birthday and as he never done a boat tour on the river Seine since he had been going for God knows how long. I surprised him with a trip, it was a showery day but we had a fabulous time admiring the stunning architecture, the monumental historic buildings and with the boat cruise you see Paris differently. Ohh the beauty of the Notre Dame, is the most moving sight.

Try the Boat Tour.. Me and my boyfriend went on a boat cruise down the river seine to see all of the attractions by river. It lasted about an hour and was lovely to see all the sight, and the staff were very informative. we went at about 5pm and it did start to get very cold so its advisable to wrap up very warm! Great value for money!
Relaxing stroll. It was so enjoyable to watch people relax and just stroll along the river. We in America do not understand how to just appreciate the views and soak in the beauty of it all.
Batabus. Got a two day pass for the Batabus and it was great. We kept going the long way round to make sure we got our moneys worth.

Sightseeing made easy on the Bateau bus!. 7 stops along the Seine all located near the main sights - Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Louvre etc. 15e each for an all day pass enabling you to hop on and off as you choose and a great way to view the city, especially for children.
Lover's paradise. What can I say? It's the River Seine. Stroll along the banks, with Notre Dame as a back drop. So romantic, it's crazy! Enjoy!
Romantic view. Get some fresh bread, wine, cheese, and fresh fruit and take a seat along the river. Nice view and good people watching. Don't forget to take a river tour...
Boat-a-Bus. Dont miss a boat ride in River Seine , travel in boat ride preferably at dusk , being in river seine when eiffle tower lights were switched ON it is amazing view to capture in you camera.

Catch the Batobus!!!!. We found the Batobus near to the Eiffel Tower. This was a really good way to see 8 popular sight in Paris. The cost was 15 euros per person for the day, but you were able to 'hop on' and 'hop off' as many times in the day as you wished.I would recommend you travel on the Seine to see the 8 sights then get off at each stop or the ones you want to see. The Batobus runs frequently so you are not stood around waiting to be collected for a long time. A really good value way to visit top sights
Its a River. We did the batoboat to get around and couldnt really see the romance in the Seine.. but it was a great way to get around..
Great way to see city. The boats are best way to see city in short time! Very fun and translation available in multiple languages! A very nice addition to the trip!
Batobus. Got 2 day ticket for the batobus so spent lots of time sailing up and down. Nice way to get around. Amazing bridges.
Wow!. Amazing on the Seine, looking at the beautiful architecture. We went on a cold but sunny day, early in the morning, when the river is still quiet...a moment of peace in a very active city.

Lovely Seine. we were going to go on a boat ride to see Paris by night which was recommended ...but we ended up walking alone its banks...it was great and the sculptures on the bridges were amazing. It would be great to return in then spring or summer where this would be a great place to sit and watch the world go by!
Try the Bateau Bus. This is a great way to travel with hop on hop off for a day or more. There is no tour guide but you get great views and can move freely in and out of the cabin.

Do the cruise late afternoon to sunset. The cruise will bring you to different popular attractions along the river. With the help of the professional guides, you will get very good trivias and insights about Paris and the places around. The tour is well-organized and reasonably priced. When you do this cruise late afternoon you will experience the two faces of Seine - how it looks during day time and how it looks with all the lights on. You will also see when Eiffel tower starts to light up - it's really a great experience.

Hugo. Watching Hugo made me thinking of going back to Paris and just keep walking right next to the bank.Walking at night and watching the light from the Eiffel Tower that reflects through the river was fantastic.

River Seine. Coming from Sydney, I think I am a little spoilt with our amazingly beautiful clean harbour. The river Seine was murky brown and ugly. It is such a shame being surrounded by stunning architecture to look down on sludge. It didn't mar my wonderful time in Paris, just an observation.

Soak up the history. If you want to get a quick historical lesson on Paris history then take one of these tours, they are both relaxing and very informative and in a matter of 2 - 4 hours you can gain a good knowledge of the history of this great city.
Go on a night cruise. Great to stroll the banks and cross the various bridges during the day , seeing the artists and street vendors , but even better at night to see the landmarks under lights.
Water bus is Best. Get a Batobus, best thing since sliced bread. 8 stops at all the best attractions, it made our weekend.

Just like the river Thames. Well, it's a river. A long, long river. It's not the most loveliest of colors. At night it is beautiful with all the lights. But be very careful of pickpockets. My mum had her purse stolen by the Seine

Just wander along the quais.. In Paris one doesn't need to do more than just walk and where better than along the Seine. It is a much more attractive river than the Thames, cleaner and not tidal. In good weather we love to picnic on the stone quais along with all the students. And we are no longer young!

River Cruise on Seine River. Do not miss the river cruise. It is an easy and viewful way to see Paris as Paris icons are built beside the river. Even though I have done this cruise, I would do it again if I am in Paris as it is such a pleasant way to view Paris architecture.

Very fast flowing.. Walked back and fore over this and saw something different every time. You must try and go over the bridge by the Louvre and see all the padlocks with messages of love its very touching.

Sane on the Seine!. Take the boat tour down from the Eiffel Tower around past the Isle de Paris, best at night where the spectacle of Paris can beviewed lit up in all its glory!Carry a mac or coat as if it rains, the inside of the boat gets full quickly and you may be stranded on the deck absorbing Parisien rain into your clothes! You can also book trips to Giverny and Monet's garden - an absolute delight for lovers of art and gardening!
Lovely. Buy a ticket to see the city from the river! It's amazing, you have views of Notre Dame, Musse du Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, Eiffel Tower, it's a must do!

Fast flowing and potentially dangerous. The winter of 2012/13 has seen record rainfall in Northern Europe. Like many rivers, the Seine has been working hard to shift the water to lower ground, and is currentlyrunning very fast indeed.My wife and I wanted to take a dinner cruise on the river, but were told that they had been suspended for the time being. We were able to take a guided tour (without meals) one night and the sights were magnificent, with lights reflecting in the water.

Go by Bato Bus. We loved the Bato bus which is the best way to travel around Paris and very frequent - they seem to come every 20 minutes in low season - I think much more frequent at other times. They are very good value and can buy multi-day tickets.They stop at all the tourist destinations and it is great sitting by the Seine waiting for one to come along!

Wrap up warm. If you're here in the winter wrap up warm as the wind can be fiercely. Plenty of riverboats paying their trade, and lots to see and do. Walk along the embankment and see the shops, or down by the waters edge. The latter can be a little tramp ridden so keep your wits about you.
lovely!. river seine is calm and composed in itself. beautiful with lovely cruise trips every hr . It is completely worth the night cruise- best view of the cities best!
very informative. We took a boat trip and loved all the information we were given as we went along, we loved all the different bridges. beautiful view of Paris.

A different view. The hop on/off batobus is great value and a good way to get around Paris. The many bridges are all worth a photo as is the Statue of Liberty. The view of Notre Dame Cathedral from the river is stunning. There are several cruise boats offering meals and entertainment onboard during the day and evening. All can be pre-booked.

Just like we expected. Our time in Paris seemed intertwined with the Seine. Lost count of how many times we crossed this river, Viewed it from the tourist bus - walked a good bit of both banks - and then a Batobus cruise just as evening was falling. Daylight when we left the quay below the Eiffel Tower - on the return journey lights were coming on along the river and when we got back to the Quay - voila the Tower was lit up - just magic. This is why we came to Paris. We visited in September 2011 - so this review is very late.

romantic river. I visited La Seine by batobus (the boat). You buy a ticket under 15 euros and you can use the boat during all the day, there are approximately 10 stops to get on and get off. very romantic is that boat during the night when Paris is all illuminated. Another recommendation is to buy the bottle of the wine and sit down next to the coast of La Seine river and just observe all the boats and people around you...
River Seine. Cruise the Seine River at night from the Eiffel tower to Notra Dame it was great...like going back in time. Paris is a beautiful city.
Lovely walk along the Seine. Walked from The Louvre to Notre Dame along the river. Was a lovely day and enjoyed the walk and views from the banks of the river.

High tides curtail route. Because of the water level the usual route has to miss out the Ile de la Cite which is a great pity as this is one of the highlights of the route. The price seems the same however!

Mais, bien sur.... Walk the banks, take a cruise or (best of all) buy a ticket for the BatoBus and jump on and off. From the river, the banks of the Seine give your bearings of all the 'major tourist attractions'.... if your first visit, then it's a must (and kids love it).
Do the river cruise!. Make sure you do the river cruise here and do it at night! It's very romantic and very relaxing! You can see so much from the boat and without having to walk so far!

The perfect romantic dinner. We had a river tour with Botbuses and it was perfect. The sun had set over Paris and the lights and views were just beautiful. You go beneath the eiffel tower to enjoy the amazement of it. The dinner was gorgeous too.

Inconsiderate Passengers. Our boat trip was enjoyable and the young lady talking us through the experience had a wealth of knowledge. Unfortunately loud talking passengers spoilt it by making such a noise that you could not always hear what was being said. We ended up moving seats so that we could hear and learn from the excursion

Boat cruise on the Seine - crowded but still nice. You see all the monuments,which is just great and even if the boats are usually full, it is nice toe in a slow pace and enjoy the view. Comments good be better, as well as the audio machines used.
Must do. Start your trip to Paris with a river cruise. Great way to see the sites and get a taste for what's to come. Many different operators so not hard to find one.

Romantic ooh la la!!. Fantastic cruise- saton outside- a little chilly seeing as it was November- but nonetheless- a memorable experience.
When in Paris......

romantic. i really enjoyed walking up this fantastic river..we also used to batobus ..it was cheap and a great way to get around and enjoy the river seine.we also enjoyed the bridge with all the love padlocks on it..very romantic

Take a cruise.... Beautiful area. Take a cruise (at night even better) to see the river and all the monuments and buildings on the banks of the river. I used the Bateaux Mouche company for my cruise. Nothing fancy but it was worth it. Didnt do the dinner cruise but I hear is a good experience. Check with the cruise line how far along the river they can go or go due to different water levels. Ours couldnt make it to Notre Dame even though it was supposed to.

River Cruising. Cruising the river is the best way to see what's along the banks of the Seine. We did it it at night from the Eiffel Tower & on the return trip witnessed the spectacular light show the Tower puts on at night. It's also lovely to stroll along the banks of the Seine.

How do you rate a river?. I'm not sure how one rates a river, but without the Seine Paris loses its focal point. Walk along it, gaze into it, marvel at it as flood stage (as we did in February), browse the book kiosks, etc. But don't judge it. It's just a river.
cool. Went here with school in July 2012, there is amazing views of an amazing body of water, i highly recommend walking down near the river at night, the reflections and stuff are amazing!

Magical. Strolling along the banks of the Seine at night, the river lit up by street lamps and reflecting golden light, it truly is a magical experience. I had the pleasure of a walk along the Seine on a cold January night recently and it was a big part of my time in Paris. The atmosphere was incredibly relaxed and serene with the river being illuminated in patches from nearby lights. I did not take a boat cruise so I can't comment on that but I do believe it is a much more fulfilling experience to walk along the banks.
A charm of Paris.. Take an afternoon to stroll the Seine and enjoy this differential Paris. Everything is special. And with your love it became an excellente memory.

Fishing in the Seine & Boat trip. Had a brilliant time fishing in the Seine, and caught many little fish! (None that big!) But still had a brilliant time! I also have been on two boat trips on the Seine which were incredibly fun :)

Very enjoyable experience.. We didn't have long in Paris, so we decided to do the one hour cruise. We booked it online and saved ourselves €5 each, bringing the cost from 13 to €8. It's a lovely way to see where everything is situated. Would highly recommend it.

Magnifique!. I love walking down the Seine River while in Paris. There is so much to see and do. During the summer, groups of friends and couples will sit along the river while eating baguettes and drinking wine. You will hear accordion music and see the amazing sites of Paris.

Magical. although it can be very cold in January/February time you can not visit Paris without visiting the Seine and crossing it's many bridges. Also visit the "bouquinistes" that sell antique books, postcards and small souvenirs by the banks of the Siene.

A must whilst in Paris. A great way to see all the sights of Paris at a leisurely pace. Shop around for best price and if you want to hear the commentary then avoid after school finishes, it got a little loud!
Just after lunch is quieter..

Like something from a film. We walked from the Eiffel Tower along to the Louvre, a very peaceful and relaxing walk. The weekend we went it was about 35 degrees in Paris, and the trees provided shade from that along the walk. We got confused by the cycle lanes, almost ran over a few times, but eventually made it across to the Louvre. Somewhat underestimated the distance. Perfect walk
Calming. Loved the calming effect--it really makes Paris so special. It was cold so we walked around and did some people watching. Disliked the cold day!

Free and Beautiful. I've definitely done my fair share of walks down the River Seine and I always appreciate new things each time. There's beautiful buildings lining the banks. The bridges are all unique. And, perhaps my favorite, is the venders. Take a look through their booths, you might find some truly exciting things
January 2013. What an amazing river dividing the city of Paris. We enjoyed strolling along both banks and would have loved to have done one of the dinner cruises if we had the time.

Wonderful boat tour. It is one of the best thinks to do in Paris after Eiffel tower, it is really relaxing and enjoyable a boat tour where you are passing by so many sites without any traffic. Just take a seat and enjoy Paris.
Very nice. I liked this a lot. Gives you a perspective to where things are located within the city. We bought some champagne on the boat and enjoyed it with the whole family. It was a great memory.

Cruise. We went on a boat cruise on the river which was really great because you see all the landmarks from a different perspective. The commentary was ok but it was an evening cruise so we saw everything lit up and as it was just before Christmas all decorated as well

Dance to the music by the Seine. All the bridges and quays we saw were special in one way or another, but one of our most memorable times in Paris was watching the dancers at Square Tito Rossi on the Quai Saint Bernard on the left bank near the Jardin des Plantes on a Saturday night. Having read about it on a tourist website, I wanted to at least see it even if I didn't take advantage of the free tango lessons given in the early evening. We never did see any tangoers, but found instead a happy, eclectic throng folk dancing to a band composed of picturesque instruments while all manner of boats passed by. We spent a couple of hours on the stone steps watching the dancers and picnickers before moving on to try an ill-fated attempt at the Eiffel Tour, passing other groups with vastly different types of music along the way.
You can't been a cruise down the River Seine. Very relaxing and thoroughly enjoyable as you cruise down the Seine taking in many of the Parisien points of interest.

this is so relaxing. A nice break from the rush rush , you see all the architecture, and beauty.
Plus if you make acwish , your wish wil come true
The most eautful sites in Paris.
Would go at least three times, one at night, dinner cruise.and paris lights
Be aware of your surroundings.

Breathtaking. We took a Seine river cruise and it was the greatest! We saw so many of the major sights. It was really neat going under all of the bridges. I would highly recommend that if you are going to do one thing in Paris, it would be the water tour!
Iconic River. You've only really seen Paris once you have seen the Seine. My favourite spot is near Notre Dame which feels like the definitive Parisian experience.

Picturesque Seine. Most great cities seem to be centred around a river and Paris is no differrent. The Seine flows through the city and both the left and right banks are filled with shops, cafes, souvenir sellers in the city itself and musems and other attractions elsewhere.It is very clean river and easy to walk along and enjoy both the sights of Paris and the boats and watercraft on the river itself.
Beautiful. Even in freezing winter the river is a must see, the sights are beautiful!! Be careful of people trying to scam you over a "found" watch or something.

One of my favorite things to do in Paris!. I don't know why, but I really enjoy walking along the Seine or taking a boat tour! I love people watching while doing it! I feel it really gives you a great view of Paris and the natives while you watch them dance and sing along the river with their friends on the weekend!

Nice Day Cruise. We have enjoyed a nice day cruise on the river Siene. It is admiring how many landmarks can be accessed via the river - Hotel de Ville, Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Mussee Oray, Jardin des Plantes etc.. On the river I really admired the architecture and diversity of the many bridges which cross this river. You enjoy viewpoints to the mentioned landmarks which are not usually accessible by land. The highlight was when we arrived under the Eiffel tower giving our back - as we turned we were justed under the tower amazed at the grandeur of the tower itself. Very enjoyable ride and spectucalar landmark seeing through the river cruise.

The river. It really depends on from where you see the seine. It's a very polluted river but some places are very nice. People are having a glas of wine next to the river in the sunset at some places. Rive Gauche is the big new urban redevelopment along another part of the river. Some parts are just big big roads while others are more cozy like around notre damme. At one point you can see the original statue of liberty.

A romantic night time boat trip. Just an excellent way to see the different sights and places of Paris at the river edge. Definitely a night time ride is the best ... to see the beautifully lit archaeological structures and of-course the Eiffel Tower

Dinner cruise on Seine. Thank you to the Trip Advisor member who recommended the Bateaux Parisiens dinner cruise. It was our 25th wedding anniversary on January 1, 2013 and we went on the dinner cruise with 3 other couples. It was one of the highlights of our trip. The food was upscale and good and they are very generous with the wine. There was a live combo that provided music that didn't overpower dinner conversation. You don't feel like you are on a boat as it is very steady. The overall atmosphere was very elegant. Most people were dressed up for the 8:30 dinner cruise. There is a photographer who comes around the tables taking photos which you may purchase (a nice momento). They are located across from the Eiffel Tower.
Great!. Great place to take some pictures. Nice view and lots of places to eat or boats to take a ride.There are some little places to buy old books

A fantastic way to travel on the Batobus on the River Seine. A great way to get about and see the sights. We bought boat ticket to take us on a round trip got the boat from the Eiffel Tower and it stopped at all the locations, you could hop on and off and it was great value for money. I would definitely recommend the Batobus for children and adults.

Beautiful river , night time cruise is a must. The Seine is a must see, no doubt if you are wandering Paris for any amount of time you will come across it anyways. It can be a bit off putting in places with graffiti but that adds to the character of the city. I did day time and night time cruises and personally you can beat a night time cruise with a glass ( or 2!) of red wine on the top deck, on a spring evening :) seeing the Eiffel Tower all lit up as you cruise by cant be beat.
Great way to see the sights. Like - take a tourist trip to get the feel of Paris before you decide where to goDislike - Not enough bank-side cafe's/bars etc

Very interesting. Walk around the river was amazing. All the major attractions are along the river. Its better to take one of the cruises just to familiarize yourself with the area and locations of different touristy places you are interested in visiting.

very romantic. We had the pleasure to enjoy a romantic dinner on the cruise of "Capitaine Fracasse". The dinner was very good and a very nice atmosphere. We had a predefined menu and the red wine which was included had a really bad taste. The quality of the wine which they included in that package was really not the best one!

No need to use public transport!. This river offers every type of cruise you could want. I did a batobus cruise which was only €15 and worked as a hop on hop off service. This cruise took us all the way down the river to Norte Dame and allowed us to get off at each attraction we went past. Another boat came every 25 minutes so was perfect way to discover the attractions in your own way at your own speed!We spent the day doing this and got all the attractions we wanted to see done in a day!Also a nice alternative to walking! Which you end up doing a lot of around Paris.
Do a river cruise!. What a great experience to see Paris from a different pespective. I recommend doing a sunset tour to see golden hues on the buildings, etc.

Amazing Seine tour by boat. To run Paris in two days just pick the nice boat tour on Seine river and connect it at the convenient stop with the Yellow Bus to go further on.We picked the boat tour at the stop next to Notre Dame, said to be the most convenient one and left the boat at Eiffel Tower stopafter an amazing river cruise, flanked by astonishing monuments each side of the river, St Germain des Prés, Rive Gauche

Check it off the list. Took the boat tour down the Seine.
Every bridge is historic, every wall is historic....its Paris. Of course its historic. Should you choose to take tour, be warned, local males tend to urinate all along those historic walls. Rather vulgar.

Get off your feet and still see a lot..... When in Paris you will do a LOT of walking. A great way to get off your feet and still see things is by taking an afternoon Seine River cruise on one of the bateaux mouches (river boats). You can also take a dinner cruise at night and see the attractions lighted up ....but the afternoon cruise (lasting about an hour) is more reasonably priced. Either way, it's a wonderful way to see some of Paris while resting.

The Seine in the evening. Take a tour of the Seine with Bateau Mouche. The view, even on a couldy day is extraordinary, especially in the evening. At 10 p.m. the Tour gets lighted - something not to miss!

ok. it has to be really nice in the summer..we went last weekend when there was 3-4 inch of snow..so I was freezing ..if the boat would have been warmer inside, I would have been probably enjoying the cruise a little more..other than that I prefer walking
Boat. The boat ride in the evening is the perfect opportunity for memorable romantic Paris. It truly is the city of lights.
Great place for romantic stroll. Not just any body of water...it's the Seine River. The Seine evokes a mood of romance , beauty and the embodiment of Paris itself. The setting is serene and peaceful!

Even more romantic in the evenings. It's amazing anytime of the year or anytime of the day.I never get fed up river sein.I do fly to Paris often for my work.I love to walk during sunset and under the moon light.

Boat cruise of the River Seine. This past June (2012) I was part of a tour group that included a "boat cruise on the River Seine". The boat was pretty large and the seats were filled to capacity. The people (mostly high school age) were loud and totally obnoxious. Everyone was talking over the boat host and you could barely hear the guided tour on the head set. I was so disappointed as I had looked forward to this boat tour.I know of other people that had taken boat tours on the Seine and absolutely loved it. My suggestion to folks would be to look for the smaller tour boats or possibly a dinner cruise with folks that you can trust won't be yelling to each other from one side of the boat to another. Paris was a gorgeous destination on the tour but the boat ride was not such a good memory. Maybe one day I will return to Paris and re-do the boat ride on the Seine.
July 2011. Beautiful, clean river. We strolled down the Champs Elysees with the Seine to our right, walking towards the Louvre.

Boat trip worthwhile. Its always worth taking a boat trip along the river Seine to see the sights that you may miss by foot. The river was quite high in January with strong currents which made for an interesting commentary in French and English as the boat was racing past sites. The Eiffel tower looked beautiful lit up for Christmas at night.

River Seine Tour.... This cruise took us under the 32 bridges of Paris and the scenery from the River is spectacular... this tour is also beautiful by night (Illuminations Tour)... Paris is a romantic and wonderful City aptly named "The City of Love"...

Love the river.... I did a one hour cruise on the River Seine, and thought it a wonderful way to know the river the attractions along the river. I also walked along the banks of the river...just strolling along. One afternoon I bought some Pierre Hermes macaroons and ate them along the banks of the river when there was a light breeze blowing. Excellent, romantic way to spend the afternoon (even by myself!)

u must have this experience. u can go to eiffel tower then have a walk to the river. don't buy water or juice from the shops on the river it is very expensive try to take those things with u. don.'t for get ur camera. u can get the ticket to a boat tour very very nice a wounderful time, u can have a sit on the river side just chatting and watching the river. it is unforgetable experience.

How strange to be able to review a river.. ...but why not...the Seine is the heart of Paris...flowing intentionally through, around two islands...it's impossible to experience Paris without crossing over or under it. Make a point of kissing your loved one on the lips every time you cross it. Grab a baguette, put on baggy green pants and a beret, and wander along the banks. It doesn't get any more Parisian than this. Oh Loire river I love you.

A great way to see and get to know Paris. We had a riverboat on the Siene and this was a brilliant way to get to know Paris. We were provided with headphones to listen to commentary when passing through historical landmarks and points of interest. Well worth the money, would definately recommend.

boat ride on the river. It was awesome ,was there with my husband as part of our honeymoon we took a bus tour around Paris visited the tower and took a boat ride on the river, would love to go back there some time in the future.

good. well worth a trip, spoken in several languages so all can enjoy. lots of seats so you're not fighting to sit down. takes an hour and that it about long enough. They take photos of you before the trip that you can buy on your return. They cost £12 so be prepared if you want one!!
Beautiful. ....we walked along the river almost everyday...its beautiful and serene...being a rainy cold day, we were not able to take the cruise, maybe in summers it will be a must do thing to do...

Very Scenic. We walked all the way round from the south bank to the north side. This is one of the best way to see Paris, it will take a whole day, but its worth seeing paris properly, plus you have some of the main sights located next to it.

A must, when visiting Paris!. This is one of the best river cruises in the world! What a beautiful city. A different view from the water. This is a must when visiting Paris. Bring a good camera. Memories for a lifetime. You can also enjoy lunch/dinner and drinks on board. Highly recommend.

Beautiful Walk. One simply cannot visit the city of lights and not stroll along the winding trail of the Seine...from famous iconic landmark Eifel Tower to the historical district of Isle of St. Louis near the famous religous institution Notre Dame Cathedral...whether it is a brisk Christmas breeze or a warm fragrant spring breeze...the stories this river can tell...simply magical.
January, cold not too much activity on the Seine. I am sure i will have a different view on a warmer day. However the plus of being out of season is less other tourists
Boat Cruise is Amazing. Was beyond cool to see the attractions around paris from the boat at night. The city is beatiful at night. I highly recommend this. Worth every cent
Lovely. We had a boat trip due to time constraints. We saw quite a lot of historical buildings along the River.

A Paris "Must-Do". At some point during your visit to Paris you have to get on the river if only for a single trip. The sights from the Seine are unique and you will remember them always. The view of the Eiffel tower and all the bridges and museums are very worthwhile. We were fortunate enough to catch an early evening cruise so we got to see the tower lit up while still having enough light to see all the detail on the bridges and along the banks of this dynamic river
boat trips. boat trips and river dinner is a wonderful experience which will educate you more about paris history

Bateau Mouches. Went on a river trip down the Seine for the first time - very good fun. The top tier of seats was out of bounds as the river was so high ( problems getting under bridges!) and we couldn't go down as far as Notre Dame - but a good trip. Approx €23 for 2. Plenty of photo opportunities and a different view of some famous landmarks!

If you have walked the London Embankment and enjoyed it. you will enjoy walking the Seine..... The borde du seine is more open and enjoyable than our Embankment and it is easy to get on and off of boats (les bateaux) if you get tired.. or walk the Main quays....
Beauty.. It is such a beauty. Without River Seine, the view from Eiffel tower will be much less impressive. This river is born for Pairs. Truly amazing.

Perfect for couples!. Take the night tour..it is sooooo romantic. When you're done, get a hot nutella crepe from any of the kiosks near by and enjoyyyyyyy. If you have kids with you..I don't recommend.
Boat cruise well worth doing. The jet-lag had the girls asleep in minutes, but we enjoyed the cruise immensely. A great way to see Paris at night. The lights. The sights. The beauty. Wonderful.
Average. The boats trip was crowded and the commentary was barely audible – That being said the view of some of the bridges was amazing – next time will make use of the river taxi service
Bateau-Mouche river cruise.. I would definitely recommend taking a river tour in Paris. It's the best way to se the city's landmarks with a commentary in several languages.

Well worth the walk. Its true, walking along the river is a joy. Its a beatiful river with lots to see along the way. First day, got a bit lost and wound up walking through a flower shop area and pet shop area - neat. The little trinkit and artist shops (really just sheds that fold up when not in use) that line the walk along the river are neat. Do it.
Lovely there. Its great place hang around at the weekend with the bottle of wine!!! Its lovely there, very relaxing and safe, enjoy!!

night time boat tour very enjoyable. It was certainly a highlight of the trip. We used a Cityrama tour group through AAA to get our night time tour of the River and were very happy with it. Boat has outside and inside seating. Lasted about an hour.
Beautiful. You can't really avoid seeing it.. It's worth stopping on the bridges to take a look though and if boats are your thing, take a trip.

Great leisurely stroll. A highlight of our visit, walking along the Seine (multiple times) was relaxing with generally wide sidewalks, the artist/book stalls, and the interesting variety of houseboats.

How can i describe her beauty?. Seine is just stunningly beautiful. It's so peaceful, clean and quiet. Everytime i stroll along the river, i feel deeply grateful to the nature and human kind that produces such beauty. 非常漂亮，走去各大景点的路上会经过的。

Great for sunset!. We went on a cruise with Batteaux Parisian. If you hold a Eurail ticket, you get a river cruise half price. It takes an hour, which is enough, but well worth the time! You have the opportunity for great pictures, especially of the Eiffel Tower on return to dock. Lovely river cruising though can be crowded and unfortunately no private boats. Maybe try a dinner cruise? We didn't do that but might be romantic? :)

Best seen from River Cruise. Went on a River Cruise with Bateaux Parisian, there are lots of river cruise boats right next to The Eiffel Tower, it's about 13 euros for a tour of the river where you will see all of the main sights. They eave on average very hour, there's also a few restaurants down there on the same stretch of river.

Bateaux Parisiens Lunch Cruise. The lunch cruise was simply awesome. It took us up and and then back down the Seine. This is a glass sided boat which made for wonderful photo opportunities especially of the Eiffel Tower. Elegantly appointed with fresh white table cloths and china you know you are in for something special. The 3 course meal was fantastic and very gourmet and there were 3 bottles of wine per table served. Our waiter did not speak much English but that was not a problem and he had a wonderful sense of humor that kept us laughing. We were pleasantly surprised to also find a lovely woman singing to us all with popular French tunes like La Vie On Rose that just added to the overall experience. The meal is preset when you pay for the cruise and I say definitly go before visiting the Eiffel Tower. Then sit back and enjoy.

A great way to see part of Paris. Inevitably, it's a bit limited, because you can see only what you can see from the water. We took a Bâteau Mouche, because my wife had emjoyed such a trip several years ago, and were not disappointed - particularly after the multilingual commentary had stopped and we were permitted uninterrupted enjoyment of the sights. It's not expensive at €11.50 for the 70-minute journey, and the €20 Champagne added to the jollity.

good cruise but crowded and too cold. I guess i came during christmas time so obviously everybody wants to ride the cruise...it was overall ok but the weather was too chilly for me to enjoy during winter
River magic. We stayed in apartment overlooking the Seine it was fantastic. Early morning and afternoon walks along the banks on Ile St. Louis were romantic and peaceful. We intend to do it again.

Sit back, relax, go to sleep... If you are only visiting Paris for a couple of days do not bother going on the river cruise. We found it too long (2.5ish) and time consuming. In my opinion you would be better off visiting the Cathedrals and museums themselves.It was a cold and miserable day when we went which didn't help either.

Be sure to take a walk on the Seine. Walking along the Seine is best in the morning I think. The city hasn't started moving, the streets are pretty clear, the noise level is low and it is nice to just walk along with the sound of the water. There are many places to drop down right next to the water, and be sure to do so.

Beautiful stroll along the banks. What can you say about a River? It's PARIS! It's the life blood of the city which was settled by the Parisi, it's romantic, and beautiful, it's lovely at any time of year, even when it's cold and windy.

Incredible views. I took a walk along the river, and also got a short 1 hour river cruise. Both are highly enjoyable, there are stalls selling souveniers, and both good and bad painting, various prints and anything touristy you can think of. Plenty of fabulous bridges to look at/cross over. A cheap river cruise is well worth it, you get to see Paris from a totally different angle, including le petite statue of liberty.

It's not Paris without the River Seine. What can you say? It's the river Seine. Walking along the river at dusk is just perfect and romantic. The view of Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower are just postcard perfect.
Wear your walking shoes.. You can get "lost" walking on this scenic route so wear comfy shoes. You'll pass museums, cafes and people hawking their wares. Great way to see Paris very casually.

Great river! Great boat cruise. River is not too choppy! Nice slow paced boat trip
We opted for the bait taxi, which was smooth, reliable and dropped you off at all the main attractions around the city, a better way to view the dirt than the underground we felt

You will not get sea sick!. A boat tour on the River Seine is recommended. You can get a boat right below the Eiffel Tower. Guide spoke in several languages so no one is left out. Can have up to an hour waiting time, but it is worth to see all the sights.
Take an hour boat cruise. This is a great way to get an understanding of the city in an hour. Go during the day... Perhaps avoid lunch cruises as the food leaves a little to be desired
Take a boat trip down the Seine. I took a boat trip down the river on a beautiful sunny day, you could see all the historic sites and bridges. Loved it and would do it again and again and again.

Relaxing, Insightful, Lovely. Part of a short break to Paris, no trip to Paris is complete without a trip down the River Seine.Went in March so slightly cold and some rain but still enjoyable - it's an experience so lovely to take everything in.Nice commentary for those who want to be covered (in case of rain) and want to listen to history, etc.Great seeing Notre Dame, brings it into perspective, if you only know if it from the Disney Film.Really nice experience, would definitely do it again.

Romantic river cruise. We went on the lunch cruise as part of a full day tour. We are glad we made this choice as it turned out to be one of the most memorable 'events' of our trip. The entire ambience - plenty of food and drinks, excellent view of the city, and live performance to top it off - gave a good 'taste' of Paris and romantic in our humble view. Do try if you have a short time in Paris (believe its only under 3 hour and offer lunch and dinner).
Scenic. Although i only got to see a small part of the Sienne it added to the attraction of the city. Not as calm as the Thames.
River Seine!. It's the river Seine!! If river thames is a matured gentleman, Seine would definitely be a good looking lady full with experiences of life!!

Take a stroll and enjoy. Walking the Seine is relaxing and worthwhile. Enjoying the bridges that cross over, the water moving slowly along, even the shops with the vendors peddling pretty much everything makes for an enjoyable day.

River tour. There are several tours. We took a sunset tour from the Eiffel Tower & returned at dusk. Other tours are available such as a water taxi and a dinner cruise. The taxi goes the same route but you get on and off privledges. You cannot go to Paris without doing one of these tours. Floating down the River Seine provides some of the most beautiful views of the city.

Splendid at night!. Going on the river cruise at night on a Friday was fascinating and just plain cool to see all the passer bys and what real Parisians did along the banks of the Seine River. There were groups of people drinking and chatting, groups of people having fun, large gathering of salsa dancing, musical instrument players etc. just very entertaining. The surroundings and night lights were beautiful. Definitely take the cruise at night, mind you it's a bit chilly!!

Stay Sane on The Seine. The Seine is beautiful and tranquilly flows through Paris and beyond. The booths all along the river are nice for tourists or art and literature enthusiasts alike. If you like, you can take a boat cruise up and down the Seine, or just walk along its banks on your way to Pont Neuf or Notre Dame.

Not Paris without The River Seine. Any city that encompasses a river is beautiful and Paris is no exception. Wherever you look, it's there - adding to the beauty and history of this wonderful tourist destination.

River Seine observations. disapointed that most buildings and the river bank's walks are not lighted at night. During the day, stalls and vendors along the river sell the same tourist junk. "old posters", paintings/prints and trinkets. We took the dinner river cruise and walked along the east and west banke from the Louvre to Notre Dame mostly in light rain. A lovely time if you just try to enjoy your surroundings.
beauty. Nothing beats walking along the Seine. We could wander for hours. Try dinner on a boat -- we enjoyed Le Calif.
What am i looking at???. I love walking along the river, but my French is terrible and i never know what i am looking at. People of Paris, us tourists need more historical plaques!

Awesome views. The river tour is a must do. Just walk across the street from the Eiffel Tower and take the stairs down to the right - get a ticket from the kiosk and get on a boat. You will see so many sights during the tour and there is a guide available on the boat with several languages available as well. Very reasonable cost to do this and totally worth it!! Make sure your camera is ready you won't want to miss anything.

Our last summer. My husband and I walked along the Seine.It could hear ABBA's song, our last summer, in my brain.I can still recall our last summer I still see it all Walks along the Seine, laughing in the rain Our last summer Memories that remain...................................It was so romantic even though it was third time to visit Paris for me.

Paris is so beautiful viewed from the Seine!. A 'bateaux mouches' trip is a wonderful way to get a feel for Paris as so many of the wonderful buildings can be seen from the river. There were so many iconic sights that it was difficult to know which way to look. Learned a lot from the excellent guide on the boat. No queuing and reasonable cost. Also used the 'hop on/hop off' boat (Batobus) which was a great way to view different parts of the city - think they offered a 2-day pass which was good value.

Exceptional!. The river tour of Paris was simply outstanding -- it was included in our Paris Pass. Boarding at the Eiffel Tower, we listened to Edith Piaf sing "La Vien Rose" along with the commentary -- available in several languages.
Don't even consider missing this tour!

A cruise to remember. We took a 1 hour cruise down the Seine during the afternoon. The boat was totally glass enclosed...great views. We saw points of interest from the north to south. Translations in various languages...just a lovey way to spend some time while in Paris. (The Eiffel Tower nearby is a great backdrop!)

Shapes the city, but quite murky. It is a river. It flows quickly, but is quite murky, possibly from industry, possibly from sediment. I'm not sure what else to write about it. Go on a boat and see the city maybe?
Fun Boat Trip. We boarded river cruise by Eiffel Tower. Cruised up and down the Seine, commentary using audio headphones was good. About an hour cruise. Would definitely recommend doing this.
Beautiful at night. Took a cruise down the river at night and the lights on the buildings were amazing. Got some great photos of the Eiffel Tower at night.

You have seen it in movies now experiance it for yourself. There are places along the Seine where you can dine, have a cocktail enjoy the tourist boats going up and down the river or climb on one yourself. Depending upon where you decide to view the river it will seem like an old friend that you remember from a Hollywood movie like midnight in Pris or one of the other scenic films of the last fifty years. A walk along the Seine from the D'orsay Musem toward the louvre and beyond will have you looking at old posters displayed along the river as well as some inkling of Parisian Cafe Society. Just beyond Notre Dame as you cross from one side, (Right Bank) over to the Left Bank, the Isle of St Louis you will encounter street performers playing accordions, Guitars and Mimes who stand perfectly still. the Ilse of St Louis neighborhood boasts the best ice cream in Paris and many quaint restaurants and sweet shops all near the River Seine.

Evening cruise. Thanks to my wife for prioritizing a cruise on la Seine. Ours was a one hour cruise on a cool October evening, and we elected to sit on the upper deck in the fresh air. After hustling through the city during the day, we found this a relaxing and interesting way to conclude our trip to Paris.
