The Eiffel Tower, rising up above the river in golden lights against the night sky, was spectacular.
At night during the last days of December. Cool and rainy so dress in a warm raincoat and a scarf. So romantic and beautiful. The history is a bonus. Tour given in several lanugages.

Boat Cruise and enjoyable. Lovely Seine Cruise from Pont de Neuf on Ile de la Cite; it was difficult to understand the guide as she had a thick accent, but was a lovely tour to see the overall sights and get a lay of the land

A wonderful walk or take a river cruise. A walk along the Seine on a bright morning in Paris is a must. Beautiful buildings and streets kept spotlessly clean. We enjoyed browsing the riverside stalls selling pictures, posters, books and magazines. A really great way to see Paris either on foot or a river cruise. If the latter, buy your tickets in advance and queue 15 minutes before departure.

You'd be Inseine not to.... Just an amazing few miles of waterfront through the heart of Paris. If you have plenty of time then you can walk along the riverbank and make little detours. We went and did the boat thing. There were places I wish it had been slower or could hve stopped but overall the boat is a good way to see the sights along the Seine and still take it all in. We got the Bateaux parisiennes. If you are French apologies on the spelling. You get the boat right at the Eiffel Tower pretty much. Recommend the bateaux parisiennes because you get 25% off with the Paris Visite card which I recommend you buy at the RER station at the airport or wherever you arrive. Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, louvre, place de la Concorde and the rest all right there. A nice place to take it all in is the Trocadero. Probably wouldn't swim in it though!

Take a boat ride. We took a river boat ride at night; however, to our dismay it was raining heavily. Paris is known as the "City of Lights" and the ride has the potential to be one of the most romantic things to do while visiting Paris. With some luck, you will have a clear night and will be able to be on the decks, instead of inside watching a video on the monitors!

Take a mini River Cruise at Dusk. Interesting experience.Lovely way to orient yourself to life on either side of the Seine in Paris, especially just before dusk.Our boat ride began and ended near Notre Dame. It was conducted by a College Student (replete in her berret and pea coat) who was practicing her English. She was pretty good.Got to see the Eifel Tower lit up & we were close to it. The ride was nice. The explanations were good and enjoyable.If the weather permits you to go on top, do so as this way you have unobstructed views of either side of the shoreline.Realize that there are also "Dinner Cruise" versions of this on other boats. However, they are extremely expensive and not what we were looking for, especially with all of the great restaurants surrounding us.
Must do walk. What a lovely walk, peaceful and very scenic. Easy to stroll for a few hours even when it's cold. A must on anyone's list when in Paris

See the Mini Statue of Liberty from the Riverview. Definitely, take a boat ride down the Seine. You get to see a different view of the city and the mini statue of liberty on the isle on the Seine. If you go here as one of your first trips while in Paris, you can get a better idea of where everything is located and then decide what you want to see.

View the Seine on all angles. I have only seen the Seine from the bridges in the past, however this time we did the night cruise. Just amazing! Even braving the extreme cold was worth it especially watching the twinkling Eiffel Tower.! Wonderful memories.....don't miss it!
great landmark. you can't get lost if you follow the river. most of the major attractions in paris are a hop,skip and a jump from there. love it!

Evening dinner cruise--unforgetable.. the numerous bridges, romantic walks along the banks, watching the locals dancing & partying along the banks, the evening cruise with huge bright lights illuminating the buildings--enjoy it all.

How do you review a river...?. It's wet... and it wind's its way through Paris...OK... joking aside, we used the Batobus but due to the high level of the river half the stops were closed and it didn't go past the Louvre. Disappointing but who am I to argue with nature? The ticket for the remaining stops was valid all day for this hop on/off service and was reduced to reflect the limited stopsThis gives a completely different view of Paris, letting you get a great view of some of the riverside buildings and gold adorned bridges. I can't echo Edith Piaf as I have two regrets with the Seine... I didn't get to see Notre Dame from it and that we didn't get to do it at night. Maybe next time!
Great day out. Loved going along here by boat, the bridges are fab, even better looking at night all lit up. not a bad thing to say
Nice views. I thought it was a lovely, beautiful river to walk along. I enjoyed taking the walk along it especially by Notre Dame.

Great place to relax with a bottle of wine. Two of our five nights in Paris ended with a bottle of wine on the banks of the Seine. Quite the popular past-time, I would recommend this experience to anyone, regardless if travelling alone, with friends, or especially with a significant other.

Romantic. Take a walk along the Seine, cross the Pont des Arts bridge, get a lock and write you and your lovers name on it, lock it on the bridge, and throw the key away, in the river! Pack a picnic, and watch the sun set as you sit and eat and drink, on the Pont des Arts.

Be careful of your boat tour. I recommend looking for one of the smaller boats for a tour. The one we did was the 600 person boat, not quite romantic with screaming kids, no beverages and old style commentary. A walk down the Seine is amazing.
Beautiful. Must see in Paris. Beautiful site at night. We watch the people cruise down this river on a tour. This river connects to so much.

a good walk for both day and night. Walked along the river both during the day and night. parts of it are beautiful. some are right along traffic. great people watching. find the part where they have book stands, i cant read french, but the feel to that area is great! Didnt get to do a boat tour but i bet it would be great. some parts are great for running but you should map it out ahead of time so you know you are somewhere that you wont hit a lot of traffic lights.
Great walk. We walked along the river, all the way from Notre Dame to the Eiffel Tower and back. Very scenic and easy to walk with good paths and varied scenery along the way.
Worths a visit to Pont Des Arts. The bridge which crosses Seine River provides a romantic feels for the sight of all the love padlocks affixed to the bridge.

Romantic. You see it in the morning or you see it in the evening, it is full of romance. I watched it through lovely parisian cafes and experienced it through boat rides, it was a wonderfully romantic journey. Will come back again!!

Highly recommended by day or by night. We did the same boat trip on the Seine twice (afternoon and evening) and enjoyed both experiences immensely. Daytime and night time offer different facets of the same trip. The trip takes an hour leaving from below the Eiffel Tower, traveling upriver to just beyond Notre Dame and then returning. Booking to leave on the hour in the evening means that you get to see the Eiffel Tower sparkling as you leave, and then again as you return. The staff are very helpful offering commentary in multiple languages as the trip goes along. Onboard commentary is also available from the handsets by each seat.

Do the boat trip by day and by night. The Seine boat trips (and walks on the banks) are really interesting. The bridges and buildings that are along the Seine are impressive and you get to see other interesting things, like the houseboats.

for romantic afternoons. like romantic walks with a nice view? make sure to walk along the River Seine (it's free) and when you feel like it, make sure to have a drink or a meal in one of the cafes or restaurants
Get a good feel for the place. Traveling by boat is great. The rate is reasonable: 15€ per day per person. You have a chance to rest your legs or warm up before you're off to your next sight.
Romantic and picturesque. We enjoyed a romantic stroll on the wide boulevards that line the Seine - breathtaking at night with the lights of boats and restaurants dotting the river.
I don't know how to rate this.... I will try to say that the river banks are super beautiful, and one of the greatest places to walk when in the city. Summer smells like pee...
Batobus on the Seine. Wonderful way to get about and also see the city. Friendly staff on the boat. Seeing Notre Dame in the gathering dusk, floodlit, was just stupendous.
Boat ride on the Saine at night.. The best even in winter time. Pictures of the tower and Norte Dame Church incredible. Best viewed with your lover or spouse. Very romantic.

Beautiful Bridges. We walked along the RIver Seine, and walked over many bridges. There is one bridge that has Love Locks. People buy locks, write their names and the names of their loves, and then they lock it onto the bridge (fences) and throw the keys into the river. There are lots of bridges, pretty trees, and easy paths to walk along. The river and bridges are part of the charm of the city. Even in lousy weather, it's delightful!

No Better Way to View Paris Than at River Side. On the first day of all my trips to Paris, directly off the plane, I head straight to the nearest section of the Seine and I walk along it to the Eiffel Tower. I recommend this to all visitors of the city. Not only does this allow you to get some blood circulating after a long flight, but it orients you to the layout of the city. Many of the city’s landmarks can be seen from the river. Lining it is the Eiffel Tower, Invalides, Petite Palais, Grand Palais, Place de la Concorde, L’Orangerie Museum, D’Orsay Museum, Louvre Museum, and of course Notre Dame. In between the major landmarks are gorgeous, historic bridges and an occasional stretch of vendor stands that sell mostly print souvenirs such as cards, posters and magazines.The river tours can be hit and miss. Sometimes the boats are too crowded and in the summer the heat through the standard boat glass ceilings is unbearable. Make sure that you investigate before taking a cruise. You don’t want a heatstroke or to find yourself without a seat for the duration of the cruise. I don’t think I will ever take another cruise on the river because of these problems and also because—unless you get on a hop-on/hop-off service—you won’t be able to investigate at your whim the many shops and stands that you pass. Worse, the bridges are best on foot, but you can’t experience that on boat. Speaking of bridges, make sure to visit the Pont Alexandre III which is an ornate Art Noveau bridge between the Invalides (military complex with museum and Napoleon’s tomb) and the Petite and Grand Palais. It’s the most picturesque bridge in Paris—with the Eiffel Tower as a distant backdrop. Another great bridge is actually a non-descript pedestrian wood-planked bridge (Passerelle Solferino, now called Senghor) that links the Tuileries Gardens with the D’Orsay Museum. On the sides of the bridge are steel-fencing barriers--not pretty, but here lovers will attach a padlock with their names inscribed to the barrier fencing and toss the lock’s key into the river below. The idea is that the lovers are permanently locked. Sweet! (Btw, I don’t know if the city legally allows this. Lock at your own risk! But isn’t love with it?)

It's a river!. The Seine was very muddy when I was there. I went on a cruise at night which was lovely, I was very cold but that's because I was standing outside taking photos. The inside was warm and toasty. The Seine is very nice to walk beside, you can go down stairs to be right with it. I was a little disappointed that I couldn't find anywhere to sit right beside it and have coffee. Never mind.
River seine cruise. Highly recommend, very relaxing and enjoyable. Can look at the scenery without the usual touristic rush :)
Evening cruise. Take an evening cruise in the covered boats near the Eiffel Tower. Paris is illuminated and sparkles! This was a highlight of our trip!

See it at night. Amazing!. Take the Batabus (family pass was €35 for 4 of us). It makes 8 stops up and down La Seine. It's slow moving but that is not a bad thing. The views at night from the river are incredible and should not be missed.

Dreaming on Seine. I love to take trips on boat especially when comes to the river of Seine and Bateau Mouche. This time I just admired the bots rolling down the river in the splendid twilight of Autumn after experienced the spiritual atmosphere of Notre Dame Cathedral. An air of mystery and Middle Age surrounded me and my friends apparently waiting to face the Royal Squad of the ancient Fortress ...

a good way to see Paris. We took the Batobus from the Notre Dam and I could say that it was a great way to see Paris. We used it as our hop on and hop off bus, a little walking from the sites but it was a nice change from taking the metro.

Wonderful Walk at night. A brilliant place for an evening stroll. Normally along the edge, especially on the Latin Quarter side you can walk without lots and lots of people pushing you. Hint: Buy a take away coffee or snack and make a moment of it.

Not the best part of Paris, but worth it.. My sister and I took a boat ride with a few too many kids on board. It was a noisy, but it was still worth it to see Paris from this perspective. For example, Notre Dame looked entirely different to me from the Seine than it did from the streets around it. You really get to see the architecture of many famous building and museums in a way that you cannot see up close. Board your boat near the Eiffel Tower. Recommended.

Beautiful. A lovely stroll down the River Seine is a must when in Paris. So many interesting sights and resturants, churches, boats and landmarks. The highlight for me was all the locks, left by lovers, on the railings. It was simply amazing to see. Just beautiful.

Charming seine river night tour. A romantic, charming seine river cruise at night. We see illumination on bridges, buildings and the night scene of Paris. A totally different experience from day. Try it and you know what I meant.

Seine River walk. We walk everywhere and we highly recommend walking along the Seine in the central Paris area. There are many interesting restaurants on boats and barges. In addition, check out several of the bridges where friends and lovers have left thousands of locks on the side railings of these - its amazing . There is lots of river traffic and it makes for an interesting day or so of exploring.

A lovely together place.. We received a "free" bonus from our hotel deal a one hour trip down the Seine. Pier 3 on the RHS from the Eiffel Tower was an excellent choice as the multilingual tour was well presented brief in parts but the scenery and location was magnificent. The city is mostly clean and well patrolled by what appears to be "12 year old boys with guns". In reality they are young antiterrorist troops and they appear well drilled and trained.The choice of food vendors is excellent and having a crepe on the banks on a sunny day was a perfect end to a cruise.

Beautiful way to see Paris. We took a cruise along this river. This is a beautiful way to see many of the touristy spots in Paris. There are a lot of tour companies. I can imagine it gets very crowded during the busy season. We took a tour during the day, but I've heard it's beautiful at night.

Don't miss a stroll along the Seine. Walking along the banks of the Seine is a great way to spend a Paris afternoon. We did not take the boat trip, because we felt we could see more on foot. Notre Dame and the many squares that open out to these river banks are some of the most picturesque spots in Paris. Try to catch it at night too, when the buildings along its banks are lit and the magic of Paris is amazing.

Walk across a bridge, any bridge. For me, no visit to Paris is complete without walking across a bridge from one bank to the other, standing and looking over to the river, slowly enjoying the view.It is one of the essential things to do while there.
Boat trip. We had a wonderful fine dining experience on board one of the boat trips along the river. An ideal way to see many of the sites of Paris.

Evening dinner tour. My wife and i booked a luxurious evening dinner and boat trip on one of the many boat trips that are on offer on the riverbank. The views at night are spectacular when everything is all lit up.

Wonderful boat rides. We had a wonderful trip down the river with the boat rides that were on offer all along the seine. The children loved it and the weather was amazing. We travelled in June July so perhaps the summer weather was an added bonus.

Great way to see the city of Paris. The boats are glassed-in and have small, outside seating. Great views of Paris. Easy to plan where you want to go from there. There are taped-recordings with headsets to identify what you are seeing with brief history.

See Paris from the river. Whatever else you might do in Paris - walk alongside the river until you see a kiosk advertising the BatoBus, buy an all day ticket, hop on the first boat to come along and go up and down the River Seine and get on and off whever and whenever you like. No need to pick up a time table, they'll be another one along in a few minutes. It's a great experience and a great way to see Paris.
Not worth a boat tour. The river does not really allow you to see the sites. So if you have time you would better stroll the sites rather then speed next to them by a boat.

Attractions galore. You can see many tourist attractions along the seine.
There is even a smaller version of the statue of liberty and a free public gym under a bridge along the seine. Could occupy yourself with a quick stroll or a whole day near by.

Walk, dream, buy yourself an old book. The Seine is a river to walk alongside the banks, not to sail through it. Stroll without rush letting your mind travel back to the times of the Vie de Boheme, watch the flowing waters remembering all the famous suicidal attempts (as that of Auguste Comte) and successes there happened throughout history. Enjoy the imposing views of the islands and Notre Dame, and buy yourself an old book (prices need discussion) in the eternal Rive Gauche posts.

Gorgeous, a highlight. I took Bateaux Parisiens for a nighttime sightseeing cruise. I think nighttime was the perfect time, the bridges and sights lit up. The cruise boat was warm and cozy (it was December), the glass was very clean for your viewing and it was comfortable, the program was nice. The price was so reasonable. I wanted to do it again but did not have time.

lovely boat ride. we bought a day ticket for the Batobus, its stops at 8 attractions including the Louvre, Notre Dame, Eiffel Tower. can jump on and off as you want. the river was nice, banks were clean and water didnt smell, lovely Bridges
canal boat. got a canal boat trip that took us through the old canals and locks of Paris. Very good guided tour full of history and stories. Started n/east of city and went to centre of paris.

Take a cruise up the Seine. Take a cruise up the Seine to see Paris from a different angle. We went at dusk which was fantastic as the lights came on and slowly illuminated Paris. Many companies offer dinner cruises - shop around for a bargain.

Walk it, Cruise it. Whichever way you look at it, the River Seine is an integral part of Paris. It is necessary to walk its banks and also take a cruise of some kind to fully appreciate the beauty of this magnificent city. We have walked the Left Bank from Notre Dame to the Eiffel Tower and returned via the Right Bank. This is only a portion of what one can do, but it allows you to soak up the unique atmosphere of Paris and appreciate its beauty.Each time we have visited Paris our strolls across and between Pont Neuf and Pont des Arts has provided us with the opportunity to purchase original artwork from local artists, painting on the street. They may not be Monet artwork, but they are original and provide us with a wonderful reminder of what we have seen and enjoyed.There are many tourist cruises that are available to tourists. We bought a two day BatoBus ticket which is a "hop on-hop off" system. It stops at eight wharfs during its round trip of The Seine and accesses the major attractions in Paris. We thought it was great value, and although there is no commentary, it is an efficient and quick way to get to and from destinations, particularly if time or weather becomes an issue.Paris is, (and I am not telling anyone something new), a beautiful, exciting and unique city. Using The Seine, as part of visiting this city, is an integral part of the experience.

Picnic on the Seine - a must!. We picniced on the Seine and it was lovely! I totally suggest it for everyone traveling to Paris. We took food from places near our hotel and then took the metro over. The spot we chose was a short walk from the metro and had a lovely tree to laze under as we ate. So relaxing.

Pick your cruise carefully. The river is beautiful and a good start for a first day on your trip as you get to hear a lot about different attractions around the city on the cruise.We got on next to the Eiffel Tower and with the visit there and the cruiose that pretty much took care of a day of sight seeing.... a good combo in my booksIf this review was just about the river I would be giving it 5 stars however I am going to say that as most people see the river via a cruise just be careful which one you go on. We upgraded to an option that included food - i say food, it was a microwave meal.

The place to be if you love to walk. You can walk most of it path around the Seine, but be careful as its primarily large cobble stones. And these stones also precludes riding a bike around it (we tried). Such a great angle for taking photographs of Paris.

Beautiful walk. So much to see along the Seine! Great place from which to have first sighting of historic buildings and the Eiffel Tower. Fun bridges like Pont des Arts with love-padlocks or Pont de Alexandre III with its statues and gilded posts. Wouldn't be Paris without a stroll along the Seine! Watch out for the gypsies...they are everywhere and will try to trick you out of money (the ring trick or survey trick). Just keep walking!
Romantic Walk.. We walked along the Seine admiring the bridges and we were not disappointed! Not as busy as the streets above!

Take a walk. Go down the stairs and walk along the water. Imagine Victor Hugo, Vikings, la femme Nikita, etc. Imagine the Beatles on their first visit. Toute le monde has walked these stones. In August they even have 'la Plage' for beachgoers here.
Lovely Walk.!!. Going to paris and not walking along the river Seine is a miss.!! You have to walk along river Seine to enjoy it.! you can take the river cruise too but i still prefer walking down.

Great for a leisurely stroll.. There is lots to see along the banks of the Seine. People watching is great, and shopping is divine! You can find everything from souvenirs to art, to clothing, to knick-knacks. It is wonderful to watch the rising and setting of the sun change the city of lights.
Beautiful day and night. Did Bateaux Mouche boat trip late afternoon looks beautiful when dark when illuminated, then walked back to our hotel on the Champes - Elysees

One of the best river cruise ever. Booked this tour via City-Discovery, had to go to the travel agent next to Palais Royal subway station and include a bus tour with Paris lights, was a bit rainy but was magical cruising the River Seine, commentary was via a big silver handset by the seat which was not good however the views from both sides are excellent A must do on a wintery Paris night !
Seine. The River which flows trough Paris. We only had rain so we couldn't enjoy the nice views a long the riverside
Take the Dinner Cruise. Had two trips on the Seine. One during the day and the other as a dinner cruise at night. Great to see the comparisons.
Beautiful. One of the best things about Paris is just wandering up and down the Seine over the bridges. Visit Pont des Arts to see the lovers padlocks.
The most famous river in the world. Walking along the Seine during the day or evening is a relaxing way to see and celebrate being in Paris.
Simon London. Had a boat trip along the River at night, enjoyed looking at Paris all lit up, walked along the riverbank in the daytime also, very pretty
Walks along the river. We walked along the river morning and evening and enjoyed the river traffic. You might enjoy a river cruise on many boats available, but mostly around the Eiffel Tower

Absolutely Breathtaking!. You will never tire of walking on the many bridges, each one different in design.
Or walking beside the river.
Or taking the boat ride day or night.
And the sites around, the architecture, cafes
Always breathtaking & always something new to discover!

River Taxi. All of the attractions are located very closely to the River, and it's the most important landmark for locating yourself. A walk along the river is very nice as you find small parks and cafes/resaurants. We took the BatoBus, which is a 'River Taxi' that you can get on and off throughout the day. We had a two day ticket and used this as our transportation to the attractions. Well worth the money.

Best used river. On a tour if European cities, taking in many river journeys & this was the very best. Paris has worked hard to maintain the dignity of it's river banks, fighting off the graffiti, dirt & general degradation so many other cities have given in to. The embankments were alive with hundreds of people dancing, playing guitar, picnicking & simply enjoying the warm night air. Wonderful!
See sights close up. Take a Batobus - river "taxi" and see the sights up close from the water! You'll get some great pics and a different perspective of the sights.
The connection. Walking along any portions of the river is an experience, as are the parks, and sidewalk cafes. I will return as often as I can.

Stand on a bridge!. Take a boat tour, have dinner, enjoy the sites without having go walk anywhere. If you're not on a boat, it's still nice to take a stroll on the banks, taking in the best Paris has to offer.

River Seine. People in our tour group that took the boat cruise up to Montmartre were disappointed but taking a taxi there was costly. We crossed the river from the Louvre and Notre Dame. Tons of shopping and restaurants

Wonderful walk along the river. The boats, the people, the chance to pace yourself while wandering along a beautiful river - that was my experience with the walk along the Seine on a rainy, cloudy day. Wonderful

Make Sure to Take a Dinner Cruise on the Bateau Mouche. Quite a memorable experience to dine on the beautiful Seine in the evening. The Eiffel Tower is beautiful and gleaming and sparkling at night along with the rest of Paris.
A little pricey at about $100 per person; however, worth the splurge.

Pont Des Arts - Lock and Load. Paris and love are cliché. Spend enough time there and you realize it is like any other great world city; it's a city. Few capitals effortlessly define themselves like Paris. On my latest trip I discovered one more reason to believe this place continues to punctuate its place on the map.Take Pont des Arts. A pedestrian “pedestrian” bridge over the Seine near Pont Neuf, transformed from a utilitarian viewpoint into a statement living up to its name. Someone got the idea that attaching graffiti in the form of padlocks might make an interesting art exhibit. Simple in concept, complex in execution, the wire mesh railings are now covered in locks with names of lovers inscribed as a symbol of eternal connection and love. Voila. Masterpiece.You can spend hours perusing the collection, studying, photographing, dreaming about what the owners committed to with their act of public declaration. It is an art installation extending the Parisian perspective to street level. The city, for its part, embraces these acts of defacement in exchange for an expansion of its own identity. What a pleasure to sit there in the middle of the span and feel the harmony surrounding you. Go, feel, act. Bring your love and your lock and make a stand on the Pont des Arts for the world to see.

Champagne River Cruise. Would definitely recommend. Great way to see the city at night. It was a chilly November night but we were inside the front portion of the boat so we were warm, sipping champagne and admiring all the sites. Fabulous!
Awesome. Boat tours which are inexpensive while tour all the major attractions and pick you up every twenty minutes to go to the next attraction. This was best of 2 weeks in Paris
Must see. Very romantic, especially with a view of the Eiffel Tower at night. A stroll along it is just part of the Paris experience, especially the bridge with the locks!

Fantastic lunch on Bateaux Parisienne. We had a fantastic lunch on this boat which took in the sights along the banks of the Seine. The food was first class. We had a Kir Royale on joining the boat and then a choice of wines to go with the four course menu. The staff were friendly and helpful. We would definitely do this trip again and would have no hesitation recommending it.

Beautiful Workhorse. Peaceful, beautiful, lonely, crowded, used and abused - see it all here. You can see all of this an more by walking both sides of the river from Champ de Mars to Pont Neuf. The areas on both sides of the river (and in the middle) can keep you occupied for years.
Great trip down the Seine. We did the tour at night and it was amazing as the sun goes down.We loved the amazing sights from the River Seine at night.

Beautiful Trip. Got the one hour boat tour from the Eiffel tour. It was cold but they had a warm covered area. Commentries excellent and views fantastic. Travelled with someone on their first visit to Paris and they thought they were in heaven. Got discount too by showng Paris Visite ticket. Don't think about this trip just do it!

Must see. Walking along the Seine is a most while in Paris, the scenes of the grand old buildings on the prestigious left bank, makes walking down the seine to the Eiffel Tower a memorable memory. Walking hand in hand with my loved one, made the experience more special
Cruise from Bateaux Mouches. We had a free cruise included with our hotel room. Go at night! See the monuments lit up and the Eiffel Tower sparkle every hour!
Must see. I recommend that you take a walk up on street level to see the various vendors (books, posters, magnets, etc), and then walk down by the water. Very romantic and lovely!
Pure Romance. The bridges on the Seine are quite possibly the most beautiful bridges in the world. I would not hesitate to recommend a boat trip on the Seine to see every one of them.
romantic. we love walking hand in hand and seeimg other couples doing the same on a bright winters day Then a coffee at a pavement cafe or maybe a glass of wine and people watch

Happy hours close to the River. Get out in the "La Cite" metro station with beer, wine, chips (or better, cheese and bread) and go close to the River by "Pont Neuf" bridge and do a Pic Nik! Beautiful view of Eiffel Tower and sunset.Superbes 5 à 7 possibles avec de la bière, du vin, et de la nourriture! Belle vue sur la tour Eiffel et sur le coucher de soleil.

boat trip. very good trip from just below the Eiffel Tower the cost was 12euros on the boat for 1hour with your own commentary very warm inside on a winters day plenty of room very well worth the money
Beautiful!. This river is so beautiful, and we very much enjoyed walking alongside it! It's one of Europe's treasures!

Great river - shame about the criminal gangs. We visit Paris every year and this is the worst we've seen for gangs of pickpockets haunting the riverbank and tourist attractions. The latest dodge is to stop a tourist and suggest they've dropped a coin or a gold ring. While you are talking to them the rest of the gang (nicely dressed teenage girls) come up and steal your bag. We saw police towing cars away nearby but taking no notice of the gangs at all. Another dodge was some sort of petition for the blind and deaf on the Pont Neuf.

Nice - both day and night!. I love water - and the River in Paris is nice. Not the most nice thing in Paris of course - but a great place to go and view the city and get your bearings. I took the batobus - that was cool!

Seine. My favorite, Very romantic, beautiful, great tour at night and during the Day
amazing and a very nice romantic cruise

Traveled from Paris to......... We sailed the Seine from Paris to Normandy and back to Paris. It was a river cruise no the "Viking Pride". The seine is at its best this time of the year, the trees are changing and weather can been beautiful, but on the cool side. There is much beauty to see not only in Paris on the Seine but everywhere on the Seine.
Evening Boat Cruise. The food was good not great but the sights were outstanding, Paris with the lights at night so romantic.

Picnic. We got our baggette,Camembert cheese and bottle of wine. we went to the little point on the westermost island. It felt very french to picnic while we watched the tourist boats and commercial barges pass. It was good except for the inescapable smell of urine that you find along many parts of the Seine
The Heart of Paris. We walked along the Seine on both sides and loved every minute of it. Seeing the boats and bridges with the Eiffel Tower in the background was truly beautiful.

Fun By Day, Romantic By Night. A short trip or dinner cruise on the Seine is part of the iconic Paris experience. While the dinner cruises may be a bit pricey, the Batobus during the day is a pleasant, picturesque and not outrageously expensive way to travel among many popular attractions. For walking along the Seine, supportive shoes are helpful -- many sections are cobble-stoned and could be problematic for one with balance issues. All-in-all, time on the Seine is second-tier Paris must do (time permitting.)

Parisian Beauty. A must on any trip to Paris is a stroll on the Banks of the Seine, natural Parisian Beauty. Transporting you away from the hustle and bustle of the city, you can just lose yourself in the natural tranquility and beauty of this great waterway. Also, it is a great way of seeing many of the sights from totally different angles and views - A Definite Must!
Dinner on the Seine. Had dinner on the Seine before going to the Moulin Rogue arranged via viators, definitely a nice thing to do although I did think it was a little rushed

Second visit to the river,. This was our second visit to Paris, and in both of them the Seine river visit was included. Comfortable shoes, camera on hands, and you will surely have one of the most beautiful trips. Great views of the tower, latino walk, museums, ille de city, etc. A must do in Paris
Lovely walk. Walking along the Seine from around the Louvre to Notre Dame was a delightful way to spend an evening.

wonderful cruise. We cruised the Seine with Viking. We thought it was lovely. The trees had colorful leaves and the grass was still green. We visitied Rouen and Les Andelys and other towns. Rouen is a lovely town with a wonderful old square. We saw were Joan d'Arc was burnt. There are many timbered houses - Norman style.Les Andelys is a beautiful very old village. There is a more modern town of Les Andelys but we didn't go there. Richard the Lionheart built a castle in the town. We found a wonderful bakery and a shop called Tapestry (I think). Great shop.The river is a very worthwhile visit. We are happy we did it. Seeing the countryside was beautiful.

Response to CanadianCouple56. I was disappointed to see the feedback from CanadianCouple56, as Blue Water Holidays did everything possible to ensure a smooth booking process. The customers contacted us on 30 July 2012, booked their cruise on 31 July 2012 and we sent their tickets immediately upon receiving them from CroisiEurope in France on 1 August 2012. Also, the couple actually booked a cruise on the Rhone in southern France so I’m not entirely sure why they are commenting on the River Seine page!

The most romantic experience!. Well, we were there on our honeymoon, and let's just say walking hand in hand down the banks of the Seine with the woman I love is no longer on my bucket list!! Also went on dinner cruise on Yachts de Paris and that was remarkable!
Hop on hop off boats. Could sit on the boat and see all the sites or hop on and off as desired. An excellent way to get around and see a lot
Take river cruise. There are many tour along it .Choose the one with upper deck to view the building along the river and when you pass aifel ,take a picture on deck t

Port Neuf Tour was of Great Value. Be patient if you arrive for the Seine River Cruise and the "Tour Boat' is not full. In my many visits I have discovered that many of the Tours both from Port Neuf and beside the Eiffel Tower seemed to always wait for an almost full load before departure. The Tours and sites are super for photo moments if you are on a limited time for a visit. All of the major attractions can be viewed from this type of Tour.
Don't fall in. One of the most romantic rivers in the world and worthy of the title. Everywhere the eye can see is Paris at its best and brightest.

Pretty, iconic.. This river has seen more cameras, and actors than one can shake a stick at. songs have been written, and poems created to honor the romance of this place. Kiss someone you love as you enjoy a quiet moment.
over rated. The problem with the seine is that the city is so high you cant see much from the seine. totally overrated

Nice to see. Took a boat cruise but the boat doesn't always provide the best view - make sure you sit in the very front or back so you can take good pictures. Otherwise, you will have obstructed photos.

For the experience. You can't go to Paris without walking along the docks and bargain the bouquinistes! Spend a good hour just strolling around and taking in the scenery (tourists and locals). You'll remember it for the rest of your life!

A river is a river. What can you say, river with lots of bridges. Some of the bridges (pont neuf) have lovely gargoyles on their lampposts. There is also a fad for people to put padlocks on the bridge railings. Look good.

A MAGICAL EXPERIENCE ! AGAIN. We have done this trip a few times now and each time is like the first time very romantic and interesting everyone should do a river seine trip you wont be dissapointed !
Nice for a stroll. Quite pretty to walk along in the evening, but mind the Parisian youths drinking. Much quieter than walking along the road.

Memory you will never forget. We took the cruise both during the day and at nite the nite cruise was breath taking a memory I will never forget. The boat was crowded we did find a seat outside which was great till it started raining but not hard nor did it spoil the cruise. I would never leave this off of the agenda.

Only walked the banks so far...... We walked the banks of the Seine twice on our first full day in Paris!!! During the day it is lovely but at night it comes alive with stunningly lit up riverboats and the reflected lights from the Eiffel Tower!!! The view of the Seine from the Tower is also a stunning one!!! Very romantic!!!
Just. Just walk. Just take a boat ride. Just sit and soak up the sites. Just people watch. A great way to spend time in beautiful Paris
lovely. This is a great place to walk. Watch out for the scams, though. Those "gold rings" that someone finds and wants to give you for "Oh, maybe a coin for a coffee" are fake.

Watch History Flow By. Being at the River Seine is so romantic. All the bridges, all the kiosks selling interesting art and all things French, seeing Notre Dame, seeing all the museums, seeing the government buildings, and seeing all of this both day and night (especially at night) is breathtaking.

Great way to see the many sights of Paris!. There are many cruise companies that will take you on a circular tour of the river through the heart of Paris.
A great way to see the sights without tiring your legs. Many cruises offer hop-on hop-off tickets, which are an economical way of traveling from one attraction to the next.

Beautiful walk.. We walked from Notre Dame Cathedral all the way to the Eifel Tower. Purchased some small art pieces from a local artist. Put a lock on the "lock bridge". Stopped at a small cafe for a snack. Just loved the walk on a beautiful spring day.
Take a walk... Walking alongside the Seine gives you a good view of Paris. If you walk there you cannot always believe you are in one of the major towns of the world.

Just walk and walk. and then take one of the boat rides in nice weather if you like that kind of thing. Have lunch at one of the cafes with a good view. You can sit for hours and people watch in a beautiful setting.
The Seine. You must walk along the Seine. It's beautiful, and time seems to stand still. Sit and watch the boats go by and enjoy Paris. It is free, and the people watching is worth it.
It's wet. Went on a boat trip but most of the river has high banks so not much to see, it was a little boring !

Better at night. We spent a lot of time walking along the Seine.I have to say it is so much more picturesque at night (I am starting to think this is true with all cities!), so don't dismiss spending an evening doing this. What is also great is that you can walk along the riverbank in a lot of places, so you're off the road. Not only is this a lot more quieter, but it helps gives you a real romantic sense of being in Paris.If you are here as a couple, try and bring a padlock with you and write your name on the padlock and lock it one of the bridges as thousands of other lovers have done.Also check out the Pont Alexandre III bridge which is stunning!!
River Cruise on the San Juan. One of the most pleasant evenings I have ever experienced.Great service, food, and the scenery.......not to be missed.

Evening Cruise. we had a cruise at 5pm in the evening so it got dark as we were leaving the foot of the eiffel tower so when we came back round all the lights were on it was beautiful, we had a cruise with the company Bateaux parisiens :)
Omnipresent. Everywhere we went, we could see the River Seine and the Eiffel Tower. So we always knew we were in Paris.
Relaxing!. wether by land or by water, it is very relaxing to pass by the Seine. make sure to be at the Eiffel area when they light the tower. view is stunning!

Value. Bought a 2 day pass on the Batobus, covering travel on the river and the open tour buses. Booked on line so had to collect ticket but found it very difficult to find the office. (on riverside opposite Notre Dame) 4 open topped buses and river travel allows you to get off and onas and when you like. Just to sit and go up and down the river is worth it.

Do the River Cruise. We took a cruise up the River Seine and loved it. The bridges and buildings are spectacular. We went just before the sun went down, so the light on Notre Dame was gorgeous. We were also in time to see the Eiffel Tower light up. Breathe taking trip.

Perfect for a Boat Ride.. I suggest that all visitors take a scenic boat ride on the river seine. The views are spectacular and historic: You can see the Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower from the river among other sites. A boat ride at night on the seine is very romantic too.

Lifeblood of Paris. The city is built around the vibrant river. Tour boats ply the waters day & night. Massive bridges, some built hundreds of years ago, connect the left and right banks which sit high abo.

Not sure what we're missing. We walked along the seine all the way from the left bank near the Notre Dame to the Eiffel Tower. Most of the way was uneventful, sure a few nice buildings including Musee D'Orsay but nothing that you won't see in the rest of Paris. The river itself isn't clean and there were ring scammers that were unpleasant. In all, maybe if you go by river it is faster, but we thought walking along the Boulevard St Germain was far more interesting.

Do the boat trip at night. I know its cheesy but whilst in Paris... We did the hop on hop off boat trip and for 15 euro for a day pass where you could get off and on at 8 stops it is well worth the money. It wasn't a guided tour but some of us had been to Paris before so didn't need it. Did the loop and got to the Eiffel Tower for 7pm where the lights were amazing and the sparkles began... great fun and really enjoyed it... I think well worth it.....

Boat Tour is a definite. We took a 90 min boat tour of the Seine on our last day in Paris... great for either first day or last.. gives you overall sense of the layout of the great city... Tour was informative and photo ops abounded... Lots of different kinds of boat tours - just walk along the Seine to review them all and make your choice..

Casual Walk With Romance. Perfect place for a casual stroll along one of Europe's most famous rivers. You can walk along the river on your way to the Eiffel Tower. Be sure to stop at the Pont des Arts. It is a pedestrian bridge in Paris which crosses the Seine River. It's also known as "The Love Lock Bridge." Here, couples can write there names on a lock, and attach it to the chain link sides of the bridge.
Take the river tour, you will not be dessapionted. The river is very beutiful att night and you can see too many sites, everything is just amaizing from the eiffel tower to notredam and so on
Lovely boat and lunch. One hour on the boat then lunch by the river, good value for the combination. Good commentary in English, well run
Most romantic. Just beautiful with all the bridges and those boats going by at night all lit up. You have to go that area at least once in your life. It should be on everyone's bucket list.

Dinner cruise.... The cruise was great....seeing the sights along the river. The food was average at best....food was warm ....waiter was overworked...go for the views.....no English skills at all...odd because this was a three for one trip dinner cruise Eiffel Tower and moulin rouge.

Expected More. I have long heard of the beauty of the Seine and surrounding areas, to be honest it was a pretty river when travelling on it, the information you are given and the different view points are wonderful. But the surrounding areas and all pretty much busy roads with lots of cars running up and down. Get away from the roads and you are back to parks and beautiful buildings.
Great boat trip. Going to Paris you do need to do a cruise down the Seine, its awe inspiring to see Paris from the Seine

Must do!. My husband and I visited Paris in October 2012 and I loved seeing the River Seine. We took a walk along the river during the day and took a sightseeing boat tour at night. The boat tour along the Seine is definitely beautiful at night but the lights from the boat are really bright. Definitely a must do in Paris!
by boat or walking. every time you will find it different, this autumn it was bright and calm. start from Invalids and go ahead - better to do on Saturdays,as lot of musucians perform:)

Landmark of Paris. The Seine surprised me. It was much rougher than I expected and faster flowing. Full of boats and action- I really was disappointed that I didn't take a boat ride down it but November was COLD!That being said it was so picturesque and really helped me navigate the city and figure out were I was-

Great place to walk. The river in Paris, take a stroll and see the locals at play. The riverboats are interesting and you may take a night cruise and have dinner while you take in the sites. Shop the vendors along the street and get great books posters and local art.

Wonderful.. Every city with a river is cool in my book and this is one of the most famous. We were in Paris on the day of a huge fishing competition. It was quite strange to see lots of people, right in the city centre walking around in their fishing gear. 2 degrees when we were there, ouch!!

It's notclean, but itdoesadd romance to the city. Beautiful. Catch a ride on the Botobus for a cheap and easy tour from Eiffel to Notre Dame. Especially beautiful at night, but overcommercialized with the floodlighs on the tour boats.
Bateau Mouches. Cheesy, but it's a must to do once! Try to avoid going on a boat with a school party on board, they can be incredibly noisy!
great walk. We went for a very enjoyable walk along the banks of the River. A very pleasant way to spend some time

Excellent River Cruise. A river cruise along the Seine River is a def must when in Paris. Try going at night. Try to go early so you can get a seat on the outer edge of the boat. Also sit on your left. When turning back the Eiffel Tower will be by your side and the way it illuminates at night is just a beauty to see. Also bring a jacket. It can get quite chilly. I went in June and needed a light jacket and scarf.

A river boat down the Seine. It was included in the Rouge Hop-On bus tour for a small charge.Well, it was raining and cold but can't fault anyone for that. It is worth doing no matter what. You see a different view of Paris this way. Our trip took an hour round trip. I think there are very expensive dinner cruises available and longer reiver trips, but for us, the one hour solution was fine.
Absolutely Romantic. One of the best ways to see Paris! Make sure you get a great picture while passing the Eiffel Tower.

Take a boat ride!. We took a batobus from Notre Dame area to the Eiffel Tower, and thought it was a great value. This is an economical and pleasurable way to see beauty in between. Perfect for children too.

Lovely boat trip, helped by excellent weather.. There wasn't really anything to dislike - even the substantial queue moved steadily. We had bought our tickets as part of an open-top bus tour and the boat trip was something I was particularly looking forward to, especially as I had last done one about 30 years ago and wanted to share the experience with my husband on this holiday for our wedding anniversary. We had a good seat on the top deck of the boat and the commentary provided was in excellent English.
Worth the walk. I walked a good length of the Seine and it's worth the time. Bring a jacket, it's always cooler by the water. Another UNESCO site done!

a nice place to see. Such famous river , how can you miss it ? you can not miss such Seine River to feel the power and sense. It was nice for us to walk around there and have a cup of coffee there. Nice !
walking in paris. to get a feel of the true paris and feel like a parisienne. one must definatley take the time to stroll along the banks of the river seine enjoying a baguette

La vie est belle. Nothing like a walk on the rivier of the seine... it is magic!!!
Unfortunatly i could not find already a good quality price restaurant on the river but i keep searching!

Night time cruise. We went for a cruise along the river at around 6pm. We travelled from the Eiffel Tower down past Notre Dame and then back. It was wonderful. The tour was informative and very relaxing. I would recommend that this is done after dark. The view of the Eiffel Tower is simply amazing.
river trip. depending what time you travel the best time is after a nice meal and a late trip on the boat to see the city skyline all lit from the boat
The River Seine is very romantic. Great walk around the banks of the river Seine, the view is magnificent and great for photos, I only walked during the day and I loved it

Mystical and magical. Loved walking along the river at all times of the day and night. The street lamps at night time highlight the activites and beautiful ancient buildings; reflections are magical at times. Avoid the demonstrations, the gendarmes are quick to cordon off the crowds, and it's hard to get around them if they fill up a quay.
Bateaux Parisien. Very expensive €320 for two, but for this you get the best views, excellent food, champagne on arrival and the wine is included. Welll worth it for that "special occassion"

Admire the Bridges!. Look closely at the bridges, each is different, each is good, some are spectacular, but all make up a big part of Paris. Pont Alexandre III and the Zouave on Pont d'Alma are two not-to-miss sights. Notice the faces on the side of Pont Neuf. In Paris, beauty is in the details.

Just a river.... It's a river! Ok, so you don't go to Paris to see the Seine.... But you'll definitely pas by as there are so many beautiful things in the Left Bank as well as in the Right Bank!
Pay attention to the bridges, I particularly like the Alexandre III, when you're heading to/from the Grand Palais and Petit Palais.

Excellent Batobus!. What a way to see Paris! My husband & I paid 30Euro for 2 tickets for one day to hop on & off wherever we fancied (you can also use these tickets on the tour buses). From Notre Dame to the Eiffel Tower, from the Louvre to the Champs Elysees! The staff speak good English & show you all the interesting places along the Seine, different buildings that you wouldn't necessary know about, they are friendly & provide a very informative service - we would definitely recommend seeing Paris this way!

Afternoon cruise. We took an afternoon cruise on the Seine and it was fascinating seeing Paris from the water. Next time I would go at night to get a different perspective but in daylight you can see the architecture and life both on the river and on both sides of the river. I was amazed by the houseboats that are moored along the banks - three deep in some places.

Relax and enjoy.. A cruise on the River Seine is a great way to see parts of Paris.
Relax and enjoy watching the scenery and well known buildings as you cruise. Also to see people of all ages sitting on the banks enjoying a picnic and a wine in the evening. Would love to join them!!

Boat trip not necessary. The Seine runs trough Paris. A walk along the river is beautiful. there are also many bridges that offr spectacular views throughout the city. We took a dinner cruise. The cruise was not neccessary to enjoy the river. Paris is small enough to walk and enjoy the river and sights along the river.
Good way to see sights of Paris. We got a boat trip along the river taking about an hour we got to see the main sights of Paris while also enjoying the atmosphere of Paris as well.

Lovely to walk down. Lovely to walk down, we walked from the D'Orsay, past the Louvre, down to the Notre Dame and Latin quarter where our hotel was. Great views and lots to see, you can go down the roads at the side and venture inwards if you like.
Summer fun!. The river Seine has many places to picnic , meet friends and enjoy the evening! We go to Pont Neuf to enjoy a boat ride then walk to St. Michele for dinner!
The artery of the city. Dividing left and right - the best part is not following a map and just walking along the river banks on either side and feeling like a true Parisian.

lots of interesting sights. the seine is the heart of paris, you can find all the main attractions along it (eiffel tower, louvre, notre dame etc.) the best view of the eiffel tower is from the river and i would advise you to take a boat ride on the bato bus, a cheap way of travelling round with 8 stops where you can hop on and off as you please, or just cruise up and down the river, with lots of great photo oppurtunities.

ROMANTIC!. Go with someone you love!!!!! At night, sailing on the Seine is quite romantic! The only clause is that you might not be able to see sights being pointed out clearly!There are different packages to choose from,some you can have dinner as you sail.....ask ,the French are always very willing to help!

1 hour cruise. A brilliant introduction to the history of the buildings and bridges by the seine.If your feet are tired and you are not sure which tourist attraction to visit along the seine then use this mode of transport to take a look form the outside and guage

Batobus is the way to see it. The hop-on/off Batobus is fantastic. We have done hop on/off bus tours before and found them unreliable - ages spent waiting for them to come but the Batobus was great - just 8 stops that cover the main stretch of the Seine and we never waited more than 15 minutes

Beautiful. Take a tour of the Seine while in Paris it is a nice way to see the city. We used the Batobus - with a 2 day pass it was a nice way to go from one side of the city to the other and not be underground!
A rainy day on the river. It was raining and cold so we had lunch on the river, it was really good. Nice food and not that over priced!

Beautiful night & day. You can take many different boat cruises, from tours to dinner or booze cruises along the Seine. These tours are much better than the bus tours, in my opinion. The view of the city is beautiful, and it also gives you an idea of where things are located in the city. In the summer, they have the "Plagues" where they bring sand to the river along with palm trees and beach chairs. Above the water along the river are a lot of paintings and touristy-items for sale. Great for a stroll when the sun is setting, or at night when the city lights are reflecting on the water.

Batobus. We had a two day pass to ride on the boat. 8 stops each with too many monuments and museums to choice from. Great value for the price and like the metro pass, invaluable to get around the city.

Take Cruise. We took a night time cruise on the river and were greatly impressed. Don't miss this chance to see Paris from a different perspective. There are many options - simple cruises to dinner cruises. Both day and night. Not to be missed. Dress warm for the autumn evening tours.

Boat trip. Walk along the Seine and also take a boat trip, its is really a must to see Paris from the river! Furthermore, the hop on hop off formula is just perfect, as it allows you to visit everything around the Seine. Make the most of it, because a day ticket is quite pricy!
Took a cruise. Not worth the time. Enjoyed walking along the river and thru the streets. Too many people, uncomfortable seating.

Boating down the Seine. The river has a life of its own. Calm and beautiful it divides the city into left and right banks. We took a boat tour and saw lots of beautiful buildings and got a bit of a lay of the land. Went under many bridges. Looks for the locks on the bridges where people put a lock on the bridge and throw the key into the seine. VOILA

Beautifully scenic at every turn. Just strolling along the river banks of the Seine is beautiful. So many bridges that cross over it with fancy lam-posts and statues. River boat cruises are well worth the money and very informative

The heart of Paris. Lots to see from both a cruise and from walking the banks. We didn't go on a Bateau Mouche but on a smaller boat moored on the Left Bank just beneath the Notre Dame. The commentary was in 4 languages and provided a great introduction to the city. We sailed as far as the Eiffel Tower and back and felt we had good value for money.
great way to see different sites. They make multiple stops so you can get off at a different place than where you board; less expensive than taking cabs! I think it was only 16 euros
Very walkable. Do the stroll along the west bank and imagine the history that took place here. The walkway is well kept with kiosks serving tasty pastries and strong coffee.
Beautiful.... We took a boat tour of the river on Valentines day and I was amazed by all of the bridges we went under and the river's history. The most beautiful river in France!

the best way to see paris both day and night.. we used the batobus and were able to get on day and night with the hop on hop off ticket. a fab way to see the sights and city lit up at night. very pleasant staff too.

Walking the Seine is a must. When I am in Paris, I walk down along the Seine from Notre Dame to Museum d'Orsay. There are street vendors along the quai sides, which sell everything from souveniers to antique books. I just love the walk and the views are wonderful.

Seine more than just around the monuments. We enjoyed the Seine in the monument area and the Bateaubus ride on the Seine. However, we were lucky to stay in Bologne-Billancourt near the Seine and got to see how the people there actually use the Seine lining it with house boats, etc. Also, the river traffic is better enjoyed away from the normal tourist areas. While there are not the bistros and cafes along the Seine that one finds in Paris, the outlying areas of the Seine are enlightening and enjoyable.

Most beautiful at night to walk bridges. did a river cruise, BATO bus. was worth it to get on and off at major sites. gave a different perspective of the banks. Magical at night with the reflection of the lights

It is View form, not the River itself that Matters. The Seine is a river with beautiful shores and views. As a river itself it have no green spaces, natural banks, etc... The view is beautiful, the bridges beautiful, the river is a river, is that confusing.... Lastly, the boat cruises can get boring and it jetlagged are likely to put you to sleep. Don't do first day.

Paris by Night.. A beautiful night cruise on the Seine River, loved every minute, I would recommend this cruise as it is very informative of this area of Paris, a time to broaden your knowledge of the buildings along the Seine. Very romantic

The most beautiful river in Europe to walk by!!. The Seine is the lifeline of Paris and bursting with charm and history at every turn. The best way to see the sights at first is along this wonderful rivier to get a sense of the immense and artistic layout of Paris! Day and nightime are great for different reasons - I prefer walking to the river boats but each person can choose -
good experience for kids/ couples. River cruise over 1 hour covers all attractions by river side..Take a boat with part covered (heated) and part open area. A photographer's delight!
bateau mouche. i recommend you a little croisiere auround the seine, cost less than 10 euros and it s beautiful at night time, go for it!

Great view of Paris. Took a cruise on the Seine and it was beautiful. Wish it had been longer. Saw the Notre Dame and that building with the two clocks. The have a guided tour on several languages on the boats. They also take your picture and you can buy it at the end of the tour.

Don't miss it!!!. We took one of the various boats to the Seine. Ours was a hop in hop off boat, with some convenient stops in the main attractions. The ticket is valid for a day so you can enjoy the museuns and stroll the city.

Lovely, picturesque heart of Paris. From any angle this river provides a framework of so much history and culture of paris. The quais provide lovely, romantic paths to stroll, the bouquinistes sell out of print books and prints of the city, and historical monuments rise from its banks.

A good way to see a part of the city. A good way to see the city of Paris. I would recommend to take a cruise in the afternoon with two or three courses of food, so you could enjoy the Parisian food along with it.

A relaxing and nice way to enjoy the city. We took a cruise on the Seine and enjoyed it very much. We were particularly fascinated with the various bridges, some with gargoyles on them, one with padlocks all along its railings. Seeing the city from this view is a great idea.

Great by night. We did a Seine River Cruise in the evening which was a lovely way to see Paris by night. We passed the Eiffel Tower and many more other sights of Paris lit up for the night. Lovely and relaxing.
Beautiful view of the city!. We took a boat cruise on the Siene - it was a lovely way to view the city and all the amazing bridges!

Very relaxing and nice scenery. A must for eveyone.. a beautiful cruise on the River Seine, a great way to get the highlights of what Paris has to offer and a great way to relax!Beautiful views of the Louvre and Eiffel tower and much more..Best time to take the cruise around 6pm. You will get thr daylight going there and dusk comming back..We enjoyed every minute of it.

Go in October when there aren't so many crowds.... Fabulous river boat trip, really lucky with the weather - very cold, but beautiful sunny day. The sights truly lit up. Quite inspirational and incredible architecture. A real treat.
Dinner cruise.. An evening dinner cruise on our final evening. Seeing the city lit up at night is beautiful. We traveled with Bateaux-Mouches. Service was great. Food was some of the best we had.
A must in Paris. What is there not to like. Take a cruise either day or even better at night. Most cruises offer a meal as well.

Walking along the River Seine in the evening. We enjoyed walking along the River Seine after dark enjoying the views of the lighted buildings, bridges and Eiffel Tower. (It is also a good photo opportunity although a tripod is helpful for better pictures of the lighted buildings etc. at night.

A MUST DO. Don't miss a boat cruise on the River Seine, a great way to get your bearings and the highlights of what Paris has to offer. Take it again at night for a totally different experience, especially if you time it to end up at the Eiffel Tower and catch the light show.
Info. If you have time, walk from NotreDame until Comcorde by following the river, stop by at some brasseries, drink wine, eat ice cream, enjoy the view.

Very nice walk along the banks of the river!. Clean surroundings and very nice to just walk along the banks and admire the different Parisian architecture. Lots of small stalls selling antique books, magazines and knick knacks.
Did not see any WC along the way except in the establishments.

Beautiful. do a River cruise during the day and a early evening, if you have the time and if you arespending a few days, get a batobus ticket, fun to do the river & hop on hop off boat....I never got tired at looking at the River !!!!!!!!!

Must do in Paris. Loved the trip on the Seine River!
I could see so many things in one hour, and the bridges.. Great. Marvellous.

The 1 hour tour was a great way to start expolring Paris highlights. Wait for a clear day as you cannot see much in the rain.. There are plenty of tours to choose from and we preferred a smaller boat. We were very impressed by the number of languages our guide spoke.

Tranquil. The River Seine is beautiful. We stayed in the left bank and were going to the shows in the right bank, so we were on the bridge to cross in the morning and at sunset. It's beautiful in all the different lights of the day.
By Boat. Beautiful views of the Louvre and Eiffel tower from the tour boats. Inexpensive, and just long enough!

Beautiful. A lovely place for a walk, a trip along the Seine or just a coffee nearby.
Dislike....cold weather where you cannot enjoy it
Another river. Although those of my friends who took the boats across really loved that experience and the view. They say the short boat trips they did really added to the Paris experience.

Relaxing cruise. If you've been on a cruise on the River Thames in London then here is your French equivalent. As you would expect - informative, looking to the left, looking to the right. Gives you a scale of the touristy areas to visit and highlights the main places.

Seine River cruise. We had booed the Seine river cruise along with our hop on hop off tour. It was 1 hour tour with normal waiting times because there is tour every 30 mins so not long queues. The ferry in which were taken around was a closed one, make sure you sit near the windows. The lady was talking something in English?French? God knows what, which we were not able to hear clearly and after sometime we gave up and just looked around.The trip was not too bad to just sit back and watch but we were almost bored by the end of tour and wished we could have avoided it. Reasons:1. we could not hear the commentary2. It was closed so no excitement of sitting in open and taking picture.

So many ways to enjoy the River Seine. It's hard to chose from the many options of enjoying this experiance.We wanted to take the lunch cruise on the Bateaux Mouches with an accordian player performing as we viewed the sights.That was fully booked so we decided to do the illumination cruise on the Bateaux Parisians.It was lovely but I would advise the Bateaux Mouches for that because it has an upper deck and it would be better for taking pictures. We had a reason for taking the Bateaux Parisians which I describe on my trip report.
ahhhhhhhhh. walked couple of times, and also from notre dame to the eiffel. amazing in every hour ! you must walk at his banks

Everything you expect but not Venice!. Everything you've seen in the movies, and really a treat to,walk. But it's not Venice... There's something special though about walking the river is a city where everyone is in a hurry..

The Seine is part of the beauty that makes Paris!. We went on a river cruise along the Seine and I enjoyed it much more than I had anticipated. It was amazing learning about the history along the banks of the river. Walking along the banks is also a rewarding cultural experience, where you can just soak in the Parisian atmosphere. Depending on where you are on the Seine, you can buy a hot chocolate on the side (or in winter a cup of hot wine), gobble on a freshly made crepe and buy a second-hand book or trinket from one of the green stalls. The Seine is definitely part of the Paris experience!!

Nice to stroll and perve. If you visit Paris you must take a walk down the River Seine. Its a really nice way to see the city and learn about its history and architecture as well as perve on the Parisian women
Lovely just to stroll. Joined the locals on a Sunday just strolling along the riverside. Lots of interesting stalls and cafe bars.
River Cruise. We did one of the one hour Seine river cruises. Great for seeing lot's of famous places from a different perspective. Inexpensive at 12 Euro.

Good place to wander. I really enjoyed wandering along the Seine...There were little stands selling stuff and it was really beautiful. If you go down by the river (not up by the bridges), there are some cool boat cafes down there that are worth checking out.
Scenery on the Seine. We went on a river cruise as part of the Fat Tyre Paris by Night Tour. Shared a glass of wine and enjoyed watching Parisians party on the banks of the Seine and on the river

Wonderful to walk, and take a boat ride down the river. This summer i was fortunate to spend 9 nights in Paris.On a number of occasions I enjoyed walking along the river Seine.There was a beach set up, with hundreds enjoying the sunshine.Great atmosphere too.I also took a boat ride from Eiffel tower one evening, along the river , enjoying the lights that are on all of the buildings.Music and dancing along the river.It is one of my favourite spots to spend time in Paris.
All it can do is flow. Wider than I remembered, and the bridges are always lovely. Nicest spot is always near the Tour d'Argent, looking at Notre Dame from the left rear quarter.

A Different Perspective. Taking a cruise along the river Seine gives you a totally different perspective of Paris and in my opinion was thoroughly worth the money spent. The cruise was relaxing (after all that walking!), and informative, the views were beautiful, and we got to see some of Paris' other top attractions which was great. There also seemed to be plenty of different tours to choose from as we hadn't pre booked ours and that was in July!

Iconic River. Last September we decided on what we thought could be little tricky or even a tacky evening out, a dinner cruise down the Seine! It turned out to be one of the best evenings we've ever spent together and we did it again in October this year. The best way to see the river and a splendid dinner to boot £130 for 2.

A good way to see the city. You can walk by the margins or, preferably, take a boat cruise along the river, where you have a different perspective from the city. I would recommend in the evening, so you may also see the light on La Tour Eiffel.

River Cruise. Taking a river cruise is a relaxing way to see the sites of Paris. Many of the dinner cruises book in advance and fill up early, but we decided to enjoy the cruises without dinner, so that we could choose our place of choice where we knew the food was exceptional. Sometimes the best vacations are the ones most spontaneous!

Wonderful. If you visit Paris you must take a river cruise down the River Seine. Its a really nice way to see the city and learn about its history and architecture. A typical cruise will take you about one hour.

Lovely for a stroll. Great to walk along the road beside the river and see all the stalls, bridges, buildings etc. Make sure you find the bridge near the Louvre with all the padlocks on the sides. We also did a night time cruise which was nice but I think you would see more in the daylight.

Take this river cruise. Depending on what time of year you go, you want to start at or just before dusk so you are take in this great City of Lights. We didn't feel the dinner cruise was necessary (too many great places to eat on the north and south banks). It's also best to get to the dock about 30 minutes before cruise starts so you're assured of getting seats next to glass.
Beautiful at night A must see!!. The river looks amazing at night a must see, walk along the North bank and see some nice shops as well

Fly boat. Loved the tour, but take a warm coat and scarf! The tourist info is available in several languages and we were able to better assess what other sites we wanted to see after seeing and hearing about them from the boat.

Unbelievable!. Make sure you take the time to stroll along the banks of the Seine. Cross over the bridges. Bring a lock to put on the Pont d'Arts. Take a dinner cruise to see the night lights of Paris and the bridges.

Take a Cruise on the River Seine. Cruising the River Seine at night was a wonderful way to experience even more of this dynamic city. Buildings, the Eiffel Tower, the Lourve and more gain a new charm from the water in the evening.

What else to say?. I love when cities worship their rivers. This is the case in Paris (and not in Sao Paulo, where I live). I have been here three times and during this last trip took, for the first time, a night boat ride. I never forget it.
Take A Boat Tour Of The Seine River. Beautiful River that dissects Paris, has beautiful views of Paris and many of it's top attractions and other bridges.

Walk along the Seine to become sane. The Seine is the river that threads through Paris. A long walk along the river is to tour Paris from an aquatic point of view. Notice the restaurant boats that are docked and do not hesitate to book dinner in the evening while cruising the river ... but don't get there late :)

Must Do. This is the cheapest, quickest and most comfortable way to see Paris. Simply take the metro to the Cite stop then walk down the Seine to one of the launch points on hop on. Bring a camera and take photo's. The boats have covers so don't let the weather stop you and have your zoom lens ready on your camera for some excellent photo ops.
Bateau Mouches. We took a trip just so that we could rest our aching feet for an hour. It was a good way to see some of the sights though.
Nice boat ride. We took the boat ride up and down the River Seine. It's a nice romantic way to spend the evening with someone you love.

Not just any walk..... The River….so many stories are shared along walks by the river and in Paris, it is so true. The best thing to do in Paris (and it is free) is to spend hours (or a whole day) just exploring the life along the river. You’ll see couples strolling hand in hand, children riding scooters, adults riding their Velibs, and many a tourist snapping pictures of the life that surrounds the river. Starting at any end, you’ll not be disappointed. You can make your way from the Eiffel Tower all the way to Notre Dame enjoying all the views that the river offers.It is the pulse of this city and with it the energy gives life to your visit.

River Boat trip!. We went on the Hop on Hop off boat trip which was quite reasonable! We didn't have to queue for long & you can get on it right opposite the Eiffel Tower! It takes you to all the main sight seeing highlights & you can get off for as long as you like when you like!

A River Runs Through It.... I found it very relaxing to walk around Paris and often times be walking along or over the River Seine! I found it to be clean and free of debris. My husband and I took a river cruise which was a nice way to see Paris.

Not to be missed. We took one of the many available boat rides at Bateux-Mouches on the Seine. We went at night and found the experience to be wonderful. One of the best ways to see 'the city of lights.' There are operators who offer dinner on their boats, but we decided not to indulge. If you visit Paris, do not miss a boat ride on the Seine!
Nice Walk. This is great to walk along. There is a lot of history also..make sure to get into a tour group. The free walking tours are great.

The River Seine, Evening Cruise. What a truly enjoyable way to see the city and the highlights! Every city should be so fortunate to have a river run through it like Paris does and to have so many outstanding sites along its banks! It was an eventful trip down the Seine! There were people sitting along the sides, some on a blanket and some of course....with a bottle of wine! The highlight of the evening cruise for us, rather than a daytime cruise? The twinkling of the Eiffel Tower....Oh, what a beautiful site!

Beautiful site. We didn't have an opportunity to take the river cruise but the view alone was marvelous. We walked along the river almost everyday. It is very busy with lots of boat traffic. The Seine looked very clean.

a must. taking a boat for an hour along the river Seine is a must. for you can see the magnificent architecture from a different point of view. and you can see so much more than what you expect by walking the streets, like Le Zouave under one of the bridges., for example. It is a fun, interesting, calming,and educating experience.Not to be missed

A Great Place to Walk on a Sunny Day. If you're in Paris and have a sunny day you have to walk along the Seine. It's part of the Paris experience. You can walk for miles. You also can take a boat ride.
Dinner cruise amazing. Do bateaux Parisians dinner cruise(illuminations) - magic! Nice cuisine, beautiful setting, light music

Try the Batobus. A bit of a play on 'bateau' and 'bus' and is essentially a bus on the seine. Is fine as a way of getting from one end of Paris sights to another but not really a substitute for a boat trip on the seine if you want a running commentary and explanation of the sights. The organised boat trips seemed to swamped with Japanese tourists who get in your way at every opportunity, want into take pictures regardless of whether you are in the way or not. They will reach over, under or around you in order to take a photo. Hugely irritating. Is October a popular japanese holiday period?

Lovers bring a lock!. It is noted that lovers bring a padlock and on the bridge conecting one side of the Seine River to the other place their lock on their chosen site then throw the key into the river. Believing that this ritual locks them together forever!

Riverboat cruise. The cruise down the Seine is an excellent experience.
