You board at Bateux-Mouches and spend a lovely hour-and-10-minutes listening to the stories about the wonderful monuments on either side, as you drift past them at a leisurely pace. The boats are huge and take hundreds of people. And for a few moments, time truly stands still.

boat trip with dinner. it is a very nice boat trip, high quality on the boats and the sightseeing is beatiful. still, the price for the trip is to high, will not recommend to anyone with a budget, there is a lot more fun to do for a fraction of the cost of this event.
Breath taking.. Dinner Cruising the Seine is the way to see it. it's a sight to see. A book can be written about our experience. It's a place to come back to again and again.

Great for a stroll. Strolling along the Seine gives wonderful views of Paris and one can feel as if one is part of a movie. It is also interesting to watch the river traffic, the working barges as well as the tourist vessels.
An amazing adventure. This is a tour that should be taken after dark. The City of Lights will dazzle you with its radiant charm in the evening hours.
nice walk. we walked the seine (when we found it) from the eiffel tower to notre dame. Very nice and a few super pretty bridges along the way.
Walk. Get off the bus or tours and walk this wonderful area. You will see and hear amazing things. I saw bands playing, people dancing, or couple just walking hand in hand. Magical

Lovely walk. It is a lovely place to walk & watch the boats go up & down the Siene & a great place to catch some sun ,there are chairs to rest on when you are tried ,usually there is some one selling water along the way .It is also a short cut from the Traffic ,

A boat ride at the Seine. Took the evening river cruise and was a little disappointed due to the rain, but never the less enjoyed it for the rain stopped later on. Love all the bridges, the historic places that we passed by, the timeless atmosphere and the overall experience.
Nice cruise ride. we first saw many places in the city. then in the evening we took a cruise ride which was amaging in the evening time. don't miss it

Take a cruise or just walk along it.. The Seine river separates the city into two and most of the main attractions are nearby. We took a cruise an we walked along the river for hours taking in the scenery. I love Paris can't wait to get back ther again.

a must do on a nice day. WE walked on both sides one side was like a market place of art , all sorts of lold literature very Parisien books , antique items etc . The other side a nice wide walk way right along side the river , we loved the bridges and watching the tourist boats go by .
But of Course. Long term dream to walk along the water itself. So many romantic movies have been sited here. I pretended I was French!
Well it's the River Seine. Last time I was in Paris I was 20. I am now 65. I can't believe what has been done to this city. It was upsetting.

take the batobus (boat). nice way to spend an hour and see the top sights from the river. You can hop off and view a sight and get back on to finish your trip. After some long walks, simply board the boat and give your feet a rest.
Sister trip. We did a dinner cruise down the river. It was nice to see the Eiffel Tower lighted at night. To see the bridge and nice places were wonderful. The cruise was pricey $100 pp.

River walk. The river was quite a grey colour, but it was autumn. There is a wonderful bridge near Notre Dame that is festooned with padlocks and little messages. Unique. There were still a lot of artistes around the Seine, despite the weather.
Best way to see Paris!. What better way to see a city than cruising down the river that goes through it! We used the Batobus hop-on-hop-off water taxi and had a great time! A must do while in Paris.
Bridges River Statues Bridges River Statues. What's not to like; it's incredible! The bridges are beautiful all adorned with padlocks from lovers in Paris and so many gold statues and steeples...
A must. We cruised the river Siene and its's one of the best and relaxing way to see the city. A must do! Some river cruises are better than the other but the scenery is the same...excellent!

Enchanting. It would almost be impossible to visit Paris without seeing the Seine. You'll enjoy daytime walks along the banks, sunset vistas, and the beautiful lights at night. Paris provides a potpourri of the senses, and the Seine most of all. I highly recommend a boat ride (which you can research in the forums here to decide which one suits you best) at the time of day or night you wish. We bought our tickets online, at a discount, before we left and were able to choose the day and time while we were there. We chose a 9:30 pm cruise for the lights--especially the ones that twinkle on the Eiffel Tower. We did not want a dinner cruise, as the food reviews did not seem promising. Whether you stroll, boat, or picnic by the banks, the Seine awaits you!

Batobus great way to get around on the river. Has all the right stops, you don't get there really quick but if you are hoping to catch the sights and get a few great pictures its the way to go. Get at least a two day pass. Clean, efficient and friendly staff.

most romantic evening. We took a three hour boat tour of the Seine at night and it included champagne and a FABULOUS dinner. The ambiance was so romantic. Best duck fois gras I've ever had and a wonderful gazpacho soup. Seeing the Eiffel tower lit up at night from the boat was spectacular, much more impressive than in daylight. What impressed me was how many Parisians are along the riverbank at night at cafes etc. or just strolling. And most of them waved at the boat! There was entertainment on the boat and the singer was lovely though her choice of music I felt could have been better. I would have preferred songs like "Je suis Malade" over Adele. She certainly had the chops to sing like that. All in all I loved, loved, loved this excursion.

Well Worth It. We recently took the Baton Mouche, a boat ride, down the Seine one evening. The cost was 15 euros per person for a one hour trip. The city at night looks very impressive. The Eiffel Tower was a sight to behold at night when it is all lit up. I would recommend this tour.
beautiful. Must must must take a boat cruise. Its beautiful view of the city from the cruise. Please plan the visit at night after sunset.

Maybe the best thing to see in all Paris. The walk along this river is very beautiful; in fact I’ve had several people tell me it is the best thing to do in all of Paris. Whenever I’m visiting a place I always try to make my way down to the water in the afternoon, when the light is the best for photography. Paris may be the best place to get those pictures of the sights, capturing some of the water in the shots across the river. We spent a great deal of time walking along the bank of the river on our visit. I’d read in two Paris guide books that you can catch a river cruise down beyond Notre Dame Cathedral and take it to the Eiffel Tower. After a very long day of sightseeing and walking way beyond what we were up to, we learned that this information was completely false. After finally reaching the dock where we had read we could board the sightseeing boat we learned that you can only board the boat at the Eiffel Tower end of the cruise and that the boat will take you down to the Notre Dame dock, turn around in mid river, without stopping and then take you back to the Eiffel Tower starting point. This was very discouraging and we had to just stop and rest for some time along the river while we formulated a new plan. Once we finally found the nearest metro station we made our way to the Eiffel Tower dock, determined that we were going to get a river cruise in if it killed us. In the end, we did get our cruise down to Notre Dame and back. We were exhausted, my wife wouldn’t even get out of her seat during the whole cruise of about an hour, but it was beautiful to watch the sights of Paris slip by as we sat there on a sightseeing boat. I took more pictures during that hour than any other on the whole trip and just maybe the sun was in an even better position as the light for photography seemed perfect. Maybe those people who told me sightseeing along the river in Paris is the best thing to do.
Batobus. Great way to tour the river. 8 stops , hop on hop off as much as you like, stops at some great attractions

Lovely river in a lovely city.... Every great city has a river.I like Seine very much.It is charming,pretty clean(We saw a swan in Seine in the city center),not smelly at all,and so many of Paris main attractions are close to the river banks.Take a boat tour along the Seine,relax and enjoy in the pretty bridges,and see a Paris from different angle.I see the Seine as a heart of Paris,and it is just as charming as city itself.
The people. The people on the margins of the river, drinking, talking, dancing........fantastic.Do a cruise in the river.

Wonderful. This river is enchanting, it is a lovely walk from Gare d' Austerlitz along the left bank on a nice day and you may come upon a market on Saturdays. On the bridges there are often street artists who are sometimes excellent. At night it becomes so beautiful especially around Isle de la Cite watching the boats go by.

Nice boat tour. Enjoyed seeing Notre Dame from the water.. We went on a boat tour from near the Eiffel Tower. The boat was very convenient to reach from there.Although I enjoyed the boat tour, it's not something I would consider a Must See in Paris. It's nice to see Paris from a different perspective if you have the time. If not, I wouldn't lose any sleep over it. I am going to Paris again in a few months with some other friends. I will not suggest that we go.
Fun, Fun, Fun. In the summer, its beautiful to just hang out on the steps and walk or bicycle around. Boat tours are nice to orient yourself around the city.

Great view from a different angle. I definitely recommend taking a Seine River cruise. There are multiple options.. some even include dinner / lunch / entertainment. We took the basic one that leaves from the Eiffel Tower port. It was about an hour long and was a great way to see the city from a different prespective. Allows you to see the full scope of many famous buildings & monuments and gives a very good glimpse of the city especially if it is your first time here. I recommend sitting on top of the boat as that is where you'll get an un-obstructed view. It's pretty neat going under all the bridges as well.. especially Pont Alexander.

Informative. This is something nice to do when you first get there because the cruise covers all the major monuments in Paris. The boats are overcrowded though and is covered by thick glass that is foggy. I took the tour at night because that's when the Eiffel tower is illuminated but you can hardly see anything from the boat and you can't take pictures. I wouldn't recommend this tour to someone.

Lovely to look at and delightful to cruise. We took a boat ride on the Seine and enjoyed spotting the sites visible from the river. The river itself is blue green and we got great pics of the Pont Neuf, Notre Dame, the Eiffel Tower from the boat.
Nice cruise. Such fantastic view, Paris at night is beautiful, no i would say breathtaking. It was relaxing, an easy way to see Paris at night.

Nice way to relax. We took the batobus from near the Lourve. There are stairs leading to the river level. We were a family of 4 and had a buggy there aren't any lifts but I suppose this is normal?
So not suitable for wheelchair
brilliant. the boat trip is always so nice passing all those bridges . But this should be done in the evening around sunset time to enjoy the splendour of all the landmarks of Paris.

A peaceful historic waterway. Major issue here is the pickpocket people . We were approached 3 times in one day . One of these was particularly frightening . Four women jumped in front of us almost nose to nose , yelling and waving arms frantically . They upset the mode for the rest of our stay in Paris and the reason we will not go back The filth on the streets and the people smoking is another reason
river cruise. We did a river cruise along the Seine. it is worth doing and i would advice to do this at night. As you will get to see the Eiffel tower sparkle on the hour.

Boat Trip. Well worth taking the boat trip on the Seine, Easiest one to get is beside the Eiffel Tower. Its also cheaper if you buy a both a city bus tour and the boat trip together. 1 or 2 day passes available and can be purchased on the bus.
Pretty and romantic. Visit on a Sunday and peruse the book stalls which are kept in the funny green boxes all along the walls on the banks of the river.

You have to go on a boat tour.. we went on the one departing/arriving near Norte Dame. the boats are smaller and if you are staying near them it is a good spot> recommend going at night> you go to the effiel tower then back.
Great boat trips give you a real feel of Paris. A beautiful river with amazing bridges - the boat trips are very reasonable and well worth it if the sun is shining x

Gorgeous, do this early in your visit. Do this trip early in your visit to get your bearings as it really is quite easy to get around in Paris to all the attractions, even on foot. Hd a lovely evening cruise as part of a package, they are always full so don't expect a romantic evening. Probably better to have a dinner cruise.well worth doing this one.

Great way to see the sights. We took one of the river cruises, but not on one of the really big boats. It's a good way to see all the main landmarks, and get a close up view of the many beautiful bridges. The tour guide gives you a running commentary on each attraction too, which was great. We really enjoyed it.

Big river. Although it is clearly a very magnificent river we did not take a boat trip down it but have regretted this since returning to England. It would have probably been the best way to see Paris but if like us you don't then walking the banks of it is pretty impressive to.
Cruising the Seine. We took a night time cruise down the Seine. It was beautiful. To see the Eiffel tower lit up at night was just magical.

Paris' Lifeblood. The Seine is jammed packed with history ranging from industrial,millitary and tourist and if you have the time it's well worth taking a walk along the riverbanks and crossing the various bridges and even taking a boat cruise from Pont Nerf.
Bateaux Mouches. Great Time for my honeymoon. The inne Illumination cruise was a great ending to my first parisien visit.

Great introduction to Paris!. We cancelled our dinner cruise and decided to take a day trip to view the River Seine. We really enjoyed sitting on the top deck and listening to the commentary while taking in the sights of Paris. It provided wonderful picture taking opportunities!I would recommend this trip as a great way to continue your sightseeing while giving your feet a rest!

Very nice near the tourist areas but.... We found the river to be very scenic near the Isle de la cite with good walks but we made the mistake of also going up river near the Gare d'Austerlitz. The underpasses at the bridges were full of homeless and quite a few drunks. There are also scammers at work in the better areas. One trick is to drop a "gold" ring at your feet and ask for money because you are so lucky!
Boat Trip on the River Seine - Fab!. Really great tour of the sights from the river. Very entertaining and a great view. Highly recommended 12.70 euros each

great view. I recommend to take the boat tour and enjoy the city view from another perspective, you get to see how much this city has to offer, the only thing will be to do in in summer or when weather is not cold.

Boat Cruise. This was a really relaxing way to see some of the sights. After 4 days of walking all over Paris and the metro it was lovely to have a rest on the boat. Seeing Notre Dame from the Seine is awesome.
Take a river cruise,skip the foody ones!. In sept/oct it's cool down there, worth the one hour time, very nice experience...it's all about the bridges!!

An excellent place to see some of the sights. Toured this twice by boat. Loved the bridges and the banks either side. The river is clean and the current allows a smooth ride for those afraid of motion sickness. Definitely recommend this experience. Also, very pleasant to stroll the banks hand in hand with your loved one.

bateau mouche. went on a bateau mouche trip,lovely way to see paris by night.
set meal with duo singing.
good atmosphere.
photographer takes lovely pics for 20 euros.
So romantic. Went for river cruise and it was worth it! It was romantic and you get to see Many historic monuments! Will do it again!
Can get cold. No trip is Paris is complete without a ride down the River Seine. It can get cold and windy even on the most sunny days so prepare. the sights are charming and very romantic.

Took a river tour at night!. Loved the views at night of the Eiffel Tower and all the bridges and buildings including the Louvre. Did not do the dinner tour but just the tour and it was magical at night.

very romantic. i did the river seine cruise in October 2012 well worth it. It was fantastic and really enjoyed it. I spent my cruise with my partner my daughter and of course myself. you cant come to paris and not do the cruise along the seine. you will never forget it i promise
Beautiful. So much fun to walk along the river and "people watch." So much going on, yet so peaceful. Always makes my trip to Paris.

seat by the seine. lovely views, sitting eating a berthilllon icecream!!however spoilt by a stupid woman who wanted to walk on my feet even hough she had room to walk along the path!!wach your feet whilst admiring the views!

Lots of experiences along the way. You can walk, ride a bike, be on a bus, it doesn't matter. Something to see all along the Senne. You can take a boat ride day or night. It winds through most of Paris creating the right and left banks.

Beautiful!. We did a cruise down the river at 9pm, it is a wonderful way to see Paris of an evening. Starting at the Eiffel Tower and travelling down past Notre Damn. Even walking along the banks of the seine during the day is lovely to escape the busy roads!!
Up, Down, All Around. Walk up the Seine, walk down the Seine, criss cross back and forth on the bridges, stop to have a bite, a coffee, a glass of wine and walk a bit more.

The true centre of Paris. Make your way to the Eiffel Tower side of the Seine at around 8 pm and enjoy a €12 cruise up and down the river. As the lights go on, you'll be amazed at the beautifully lighted buidings, bridges, and ships on the river. The amount of maritime traffic is really amazing. Best of all, you get another view of a great city at a very reasonable price. Bateaux Mouches; not to be missed!

not just a river. nothing to dislike here, as the title says,not just a river,we took a river cruise with dinner(part of a moulin rouge and eiffel tower tour),just amazing,most boats are surrounded by glass, giving great photo oppotunities,lots of bridges, great food,try it ,you will love it.
nice. i did like the boat ride, did get see a lot of the history in all the buildings we passed, would like to have seen more of the river but that would have been priced up

Great place for classic photos. I didn't do a tour on the river but didn't feel like I was missing out. But the many bridges are a great place for sightseeing with unobstructed views and a great place for gypsy sightings. :) And people watching. The river in the background is such a great backdrop and make sure you go under the bridges and walk along the river. Stop at the artists kiosks along the river. There are some great souvenirs and art there. A walk along the river is a great way to spend a day in Paris

Beautiful. Walks along the Seine in the evening are lovely and romantic. One night we copied the young college students and bought bread, wine, meats and cheeses and sat along the north bank eating and watching the sun set.
Without it, there would be no Paris.. It still flows. It still tolerates the Bateaux Mouches. It still hosts the city's magnificent bridges. It never seems to change. And that is a good thing!
it's a must do on a sunny day. Buy some amazing cheeses, breads, chocolates and a bottle of wine. Find a place on the steps or along the banks and let the afternoon slip away. It's pretty magical.

Walk along the banks. Loads to see, felt like being in a movie. Could not resist the urge to board a tour boat to see all the bridges. The river banks felt very sae either in the evening or during the day.

Take a stroll!. Strolling along the Seine on a warm and sunny day makes you feel a little like a resident of this fine city! Take the time to look at the book stalls, and to pause and admire the beautiful bridges, as well as the architecture. And stop for refreshments along the way, chose an out of the way spot - we found an excellent tiny restaurant, on a tiny street, in the shadow of Notre-Dame. Excellent food and service!

Beautiful at night. We took a river cruise at night and it was pretty cool. You could see all the the major sites illuminated and we watched the Eiffel Tower sparkle on the hour. You have really great views of the Eiffel Tower. The boat tour was about 45 mins so it was plenty of time.
Living History. What a thrill to stand on the banks of one of the most storied and painted rivers in the world. I pictured the Impressionists standing beside me.

Walk till you drop..... Walking along the Seine in Paris is like no other stroll on earth. There is so much to see and experience along here. I spent about three hours walking from the Île de la Cité all the way to within a 1/4 mile of the Eiffel Tower and it was one of the highlights of my trip to Paris. I am sure that if walking is not your gig or you have health issues that the river boats would also be a great experience. Me, I like the walking. There are some amazing street vendors on the upper levels of the walkways along the river so be sure to keep an eye out for them.

CRUISING TO ROUEN. We got on a Viking ship docked near the Eiffel Tower and cruised to Rouen and back, taking in Omaha Beach and the American Cemetery. Normandy is very scenic. We stopped in Vernon, Giverny, Rouen and two other small villages.

Paris itself. There really are no words that can do this river justice. It is the lifeblood of Paris. A never ending procession of barges moving household furniture, bateau mouche, tour boats and the like. Wonderful place to stroll, sit and watch life go by, and even swim in summer.

Enjoyable. We took the bateau bus having been on the Open Tour Bus (highly recommend that). It was pleasant but compared with the Thames, you can't really see anything as the Seine is so low down with high walls and walkways alongside. Not a patch on, say, the canals of Amsterdam and Copenhagen, either.
the guide to the city.. love crossing back and forth across the many bridges. and walking along the streets beside it. always boats coming and going.

RIVER TRIP ON THE SEINE. This was a brilliant trip we went in the early evening, so we were able to see it in daylight and also when it became dark and the lights came on, if was amazing. The commentary was very good explain the sites as we travelled along.
Romantic. We placed a lock on the bridge behind Notre Dame and threw the key in the Seine. One of only thousands, but it was cool nonetheless.

Lovely. Do the night tour on the boats. It is amazing seeing Paris at night from the river gives you a amazing perspective of the city. We also liked sitting down there to eat to get away from the crowds.

Cruise not to be missed. take a cruise along the Siene with the one you love for a once in a lifetime experience , just totally romantic , take the sunset cruise from near the eiffel tower as you will see the landmarks in day light and be startled by the night lights of paris before you finish . the audio guide helps a lot

week long boat trip. Uniworld excellent...........up to Normandy and Giverney and more.
super service, food, trips off board.

A stroll along the banks on a Sunday is 'magnifique'. There is a buzz of traffic but somehow it is peaceful as you stroll along the banks of the Seine.We started our walk at Pont Neuf and then went down the steps onto Quai Malaquais on the left bank.There are barges and boats of every description tied up alongside the Quay, many look like they are lived in with gardens of flowers. Such a peaceful scene in bustling Paris!We walked under Pont du Carrousel admiring the same views as depicted in many Impressionist paintings, with the Louvre just across the river.Take the path up to the main road and cross the Seine at Pont Royale. You are then able to walk along the banks of the river once more on Port du Tuileries.We finished our inspiring morning by climbing up at Pont Des Arts just outside the Louvre.

Beautiful river!. The boat cruise is a nice way to see the Seine - from which you can see most all of the major sights of Paris from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame. But the best way to see the sights and the river is to stroll along the banks!
Get a boat tour!. Getting a boat tour is definately a great way to see Paris especially if you're only there for a short time.
Really worth while. We did the Seine boat trip free with our Paris Pass, It was about an hour long and on a beautiful day. The views and trip as a whole was brilliant! Deff worth doing.

River cruise. There are various river cruises. We only went on a cheap one as it was our first day. It was lovely, typical french music in the background and lovely views of paris. It was very cold though! Refreshments are served on most boats. The boat takes you up by the notre dame and finishes near the eiffel tower.
relaxing boat ride is worth it. ittake a boat ride down the river for a rest from walking and enjoy the different perspective on the city. They all have a narration.
Cruise along the Seine at night. Super, rather crowded, multi-lingual commentary via speakersets, beware pickpockets getting off the boat.
City Lights at Night. You cannot leave Paris without enjoying this wonderful evening cruise... buy a bottle of wine and enjoy... make sure your camera is charged
In Seine. Scenic river that meanders throughout the city. Many river boat tours to enjoy scenery from. Bridges are magnificient.

Good way to see the sights.. The night dinner cruise is the way to go. A glass rooved boat, being served a lovely dinner, seeing the sights illuminated at night and the Eiffel tower sparkles on the hour. Heaven.

Great way to see Paris. From the top a Notre Dame I saw boats on the seine,so I went down and got on one. The boat I took basically loops around the seine all day until 7 and makes 7 stops. You can get on and off as many times as you like. I rode around the Seine for many hours and went to Notre Dame, Louvre, champs Élysées, Eiffel Tower. I had the best time. The boat took us right to the base of the Eiffel Tower

Lovers paradise. The Seine is a magical dream world in water the changes around every bend. The sights and sounds the people that walk and live around this river are perhaps unaware of the sheer magnetism of the lifeblood of Paris.

Great tour!. We did a tour of the seine river, loved it! Def should be one of the first things you do when in Paris because it gives you an idea of where everything is. I would suggest a night tour, beautiful!
You know you are in Paris.... The true sight to realize you are in Paris! Beautiful stroll along the river. Recommend the ever popular boat rides...we took two: one in the afternoon and one at night.
Nothing like it. The river cruise was great. Although you can sit on the inside, we chose outside seats and it was well worth it. This offered great views and also a good position for taking photos.

Good views for tired feet. If you have walked you feet off be sure and do the Seine river tour to see Paris from a river view. It is very informative and guides are funny. It takes about 45 minutes and givers you a nice view.

Interesting angle. Seine River cruise was part of our tour booking so we went. Long lines as usual but handled well. We went after dark and it was raining so wasn't that great for viewing. I would have preferred a daytime trip. Or passed it up completely. Just sounds like something you must Ro. But you really don't :).

Go by Batobus. Get a 2-day pass (the cost for day #2 is only about 3 euros) and use this rapid transit, water style, to get to your favorite museums. It runs pretty regularly, about every 25 minutes, and you can see all the sights up close. We enjoyed the morning exercise groups working on their yoga poses and all the young couples walking together. The second hand book stalls line the Seine's upper level (street level) and their merchandise for sale is quite varied. Go and walk the Seine, ride the Batobus, and immerse yourself in the Paris experience.

This is the very heart of Paris. You've got to take the time to walk along the banks of the Seine. There are art vendors and book sellers at many, many points aong the way. It's just a pleasant way to spend a little time and to relax in this oh-so-bustling city.

The city's river. The Seine runs through Paris and can be viewed from several areas. Depending on the time of year, you can take a river trip down the Seine. I would recommend you do this at night in order to see the city lights from the river. Trips (especially with dinner) can be pricey.

Romantic Seine. Cruise, walk, cycle or just sit along the Seine is absolutely romantic. I am amazed that this river has been kept as clean as it is. This river has so much character with the buildings, attractions, bridges and scenery along the river. Its no wonder the Seine is an attraction in its own self.
At night.... Magical... you get to see a good part of the city from the boat tours, the guide I had was very well informed! recommended!!!

Unique riverside. Its nice to c the civilisation in one glimpse & quite economical way of seeing more places in less time and money....:)A Must do activity while in paris.Eiffel models can be bough quite cheaper, but to b bargained (u can see lots of indians, particularly our punjabi paapaes (felt lil uncomfortable with them,as they were not leaving us till we bought). Do not indulge in any activity with the unknown, particularly with negros and non frenchs...just for caution, better not to bargain with them.
The boat trip is a must.. I strongly advise taking a evening dinner cruise along the Seine. It is fantastic. The food is amazing, the atmosphere was great and the views were incredible.
Ok. You'll see it during your walk through Paris.. You don't need to worry about visiting it. You'll see during ahy walk by the city. Try the boat tour, but don't have it as a must see activity.
Tour of River. Tour of river at night was nice. You can google some of the boat companies and some offer a discount on the tickets.

Bateaux Mouche Boat Tour. You can get a great view of Paris with the boat tour which costs about 12 Euros for a hour and 15 minute boat tour. I recommend doing this the first day of your Paris trip because it is a relaxing way to start off the trip and it also helps orientate you around the City and the landmarks you'll likely see. We went in Mid Sept and took a tour at night. Its beautiful to see the city lights at night and the Effiel Tower all lit up. I recommend bringing a heavy sweater or jacket for the night tour.

Beautiful river cruise with Bateaux Mouches. very good information and lovely pace, length and views of the architecture along the route of the Seine, I would thoroughly recommend it for less than 20 Euros!

Do the Batobus. Batobus, 8 stops around major tourist attractions, frequent service (every 20-25 mins), 15 euros one day, 18 euros two days. Starts at 10.00am and last boat at 7.00pm from Eiffel Tower. Makes getting around Paris easy.

Boat tour on the |Seine. We took one of the short tours on the Seine. It took us to all the major sites. Awsome views of the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, the Bridges. The Louvre, the prison where Marie Antoinette was held before her execution.
Overrated Views. I was not impressed by the boat ride on the Seine. The embankment diminishes the views. Worth doing once but the boats are crowded.

can see everything on a river boat. We spend most of our time on the river either walking or on boats. we found it easier to get the batobus from place to place rather than walking everywhere and it was a pleasant ride while you take in the sights. The love bridge was especially a highlight as we were on our honeymoon and put a padlock on the bridge which symbolises a locked relationship and you throw the keys in the river.
river cruise tthe way to travel.. Excellent views of main tourist attractions. Lots of seats available. Very relaxing way to absorb the beauty.

Beautiful!. Strolling along the Seine, one cannot help but smile. Honestly, I kid you not! Whether it's because of the myriad examples of beautiful architecture, the very pretty gardens, the character of the street vendors, or the humour of tourists taking boat tours along the river, who enthusiastically wave at people strolling along the banks... walking alongside this famous river just makes one happy. Or perhaps it's just because Paris is a wonderfully clean, relaxed city, filled with lovely, good-natured, and very polite people!

Limited views. We took the cruise "Batobus" which is hop-on/hop-off at about 8 stops and is good value if taken as an extension of the Open-top tour buses. These 3 intersecting bus routes have 1,2 or 3 day tickets and we found we could get to most tourist areas by using these. Better than Metro as you spend more time with things to see and that is what we were there for.The Batobus cruise was slightly disappointing. Views OF the Seine are better than views FROM the Seine, due to the narrowness of the river and the high paved banks, but done this way it is good value and convenient. The boarding point at Musee d'Orsay is a bit hard to find. Make sure you have the right bridge.

The lifeblood of Paris. Winding through the city, it still comes as a slow surprise to see it again. The old stone bridges, teh mansions along the banks. It provides a point of difference in its leasurely manner to the cobbled streets of the old city. A must for every visitor.
Great boat cruise at night!. The dinner tour at night was just great. I was with my girlfriend and another coupole and we just loved it.
Boat ride. Didn't get to ride the boat in the evening with the lights everywhere, but still enjoyed the ride, saw parts of the city not visible from the roads.

Take a boat down the Seine. Take one of the many boat trips down the Seine is a great way of giving you a quick orientation of central Paris. There are plenty of dinner boats if you want a romantic experience. Also the Batobus hop on, hop off boat is quite good. You can get a ticket which lasts 48 hours and the boat has eight designated stops along the Seine from the Eiffel tower, the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay and up past Notre Dame. Boats leave each stop every half hour with the last boat about 7pm (check timetable). One big word of warning - PICKPOCKETS! We had the unfortunate experience of having my wife's purse (credit cards, licence, cash etc) taken from her bag as she paid for tickets at the Batobus ticket box beneath the Eiffel tower. Groups work this area and pick their targets so be extra vigilant with your belongings. If you are in a queue, don't be pushed and shoved as the body contact is what distracts you from noticing your belongings are being targeted.

Lovers Lane. All the movies have it right. Romantic---day or night, but especially at night. So beautiful as the reflection of the Parisian skyline sparkles on the water. Wish I could click my ruby slippers and be back there describing the feeling of the moment!
Night Light Cruise. We did walk along the Seine during the day and found it clean and quiet, but it was the night cruise that made it spectacular as Paris by night is beautiful.

dinner cruise. as part of the tour, we took a evening dinner cruise on the seine that leaves from the Eiffel tower site. Surprisingly the food, for a river cruise of this type was quite good. The scenery was very nice also.

Contemplatve. This serene waterway that connects the right bank from the left inspires contemplation of everything that is Paris. Having seen and drifted on it for four happy hours, one of the happiest experiences of our visit.

stroll along the seine at least once in your life. so much to see! in summer there is the beach and always plenty of boat traffic. take the bateau bus hopping on and off all along the seine tovisit attractions nearby. visit the artists and souvenir stands baking onto the seine or have a drink or meal on one of the floating restaurants

Cruise it!. You have to take one of the boats (bateau) that will sail you along the river and give you a wonderful quick view of the bridges and some buildings, etc. The history and the beauty of the buildings along the river will make you fall in love with Paris
Wasn't that impressed. We walked down the banks of the River Seine and I have to admit there was nothing special about it. Sorry France!!
River. Nicer than expected as I had been told the river can be smelly and not very nice. Walked along it and found a 'beach' area with children playing and it was very nice to sit by in the sun.

Relax. A boat trip along the Seine was very relaxing, a great relief from all the crowds every where. A super way of seeing the sights with out the hustle and bustle of people and the sad sights of homeless and beggars on the streets.
Have to take the river tour at night. Absolutely amazing at night, any other time in my opinion would be a waste. Nothing like seeing the city in lights.
Relaxing cruise on the Seine. We took a river cruise along the Seine River and the scenery was fantastic, the crew fabulous and boat immaculate. Very relaxing was to see the scenery. Leisurely pace.

Take your cruise just before sunset. Went on the river cruise just before sunset in September. Weather was beautiful and the cruise was terrific. Lasted 1 hour, and you got great views of the bridges, Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, and numerous others sites. Took my 73 year old mother, and she loved it.

Enjoyable boat cruise. Our 2 day hop-on hop-off bus ticket included the Batobus and so We spent several hours, day and night, cruising on the Seine, a very enjoyable experience. Much to see - people sun-baking on the river banks, the great buildings (Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame) from a different viewpoint, the river traffic. Relaxing, good value and worthwhile.
beautiful view. beautiful view and we enjoyed the night life at the edge of the river. we did a bateau mouche cruise and we wouldn't do it again, not special but for the price.....it is ok
Scenic Seine tour. We all (eight of us) went on the Batobus with a day ticket and it was very good value. We took full advantage of hopping on and off to visit varios attractions.
Use the Batobus. Great way to see the major sites along the river. The 'Batobus' is an economical, hop-on hop-off boat that will get you easily to the key sites along the Seine.

Cycle the paths of the river!. The best way to see the river is by cycling next to it! The velib systems great, hop on and hop off, highly recommend taking a bike and having a leisurely ride along the banks, the sights are wonderful

Best way to see Paris.. You can get a boat trip which takes you on a guided tour of the river, which is very interesting, but probably the better idea would be to get a Bateaux (riverbus) ticket to visit the various attractions. The boat journey is great with or without a guide, have a map to hand, but the various stops are clearly marked on the boat.

Take an evening boat tour!. A tour of Paris should include an evening boat tour of the Seine. You can see all the city lights including the Eiffel Tower and people sitting by the river's edge - many with wine and picnic dinners. Its easy to see why they say Paris is for lovers!

An evening cruize. We met some people from Belgium that advised us to take the cruize on the Seine after dark and we are so glad we did. The twinkling lights make everything so much more romantic and beautiful.
Romantic. Had a great time strolling along River Seine. I can just sit there on the bench for hours. The bridge is the perfect place to view the sunset. So romantic!
great trips. lovely walks along the river, boat trips avaliable, we had an amazing boat ride and the view of the tower was beautiful
as romantic as ever. Beautiful bridges and good to take the river bus and stop off where you want to go. And, best of all, they seem to have got rid of most of the eastern European tricksters

See Paris from the river and escape the traffic and noise.. See Paris without dodging the traffic by stepping on a canal boat and gliding past the famous landmarks: the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre, Notre Dame and many more plus the stone bridges. The river, once the transport hub of the city is still used by industrial vessels carrying gravel and containers as well as by sightseers in perspex-topped boats. A five day pass is good value for 21 euros on the Bateau Bus.
Sailed on it. Everything was wet underneath and everything was dry above. These reviews can be tiresome. If you go on the sein get a boat. Cars can be leaky.

We chose the River trip for our last night in Paris. We chose the 1 hour round trip for the end of our day. There is audio for each seat, but we chose to listen to the nice music and see the Seine slowly. This is THE way to see the banks of the Seine and what couples are doing. From small blanket picnics to just holding hands or kissing. Paris is just the most romantic place. After the ride we walked to the Eiffel Tower to find a nice dinner and wait for the lights to come one. What a great evening.
Romantic. Brings out the good in people, silent, histprical, glamerous and full of love.if you are alone, with the ones you love, on a business trip do not miss this out, specially at sunset

Night illuminations.. Well worth the cost. At 9pm the Tour Eifel lights come on and have laser lighting and the gentle trip down the Seine looking at the monuments and people gathering under the bridges was great. The only thing that we didn't like was that there are 2 boats with huge floodlights on the sidees to light up the river and you just get dazzled leaving your eyes with white spots.Good photography can be had. Beware of the guy who comes round with a camera and practically puts it in your face. He's a tout and the photo will cost you 10 Euros to buy at the end.

Nice for a stroll. I witnessed Paris Plages for the first time on my most recent trip to Paris - what a riot! The banks of the Seine are a nice place to walk and watch the boats. Be sure to check out some of the famous bridges too!

Take a night cruise on this river. The boold line of Paris, this river offers so much beauty to the city. Many beautiful bridges cross it and it provides a great point of refrence when you walk around the city. Take a night cruise to enjoy the lights.

Paris by water. We took the Batobus for our Seine tour and it was fun to be able to hop off and on the different boats and visit the different stops. You purchase a day pass for 15 E, adult, and they stop at 8 different sites along the river between the Eiffel Tower and the botanic gardens. Great way to see the river and the city. The boats run about ever 20 minutes so you have just time enough to get off at the Eiffel Tower, get a glace and eat it and get back on the next boat. You can of course stay as long as you want. The last boat is at 7 PM.

Relaxing. We took a boat around the city. It was nice and quiet with beautiful views of the Paris. We learned many things about Paris and it's history that I never knew, so it's worth the trip on a nice day.
Peaceful. We walked along the roads along the Seine a few times as we enjoyed it very much. It has great place to people watch. Really enjoyed Cafe De Pont Neuf (hope I have that right).

Good way to see most sights. If you are on a tight schedule then definitely use one of the Seine boat tours. We used the one linked to the open top bus tours and wished we had done the boat part before using the bus routes. Much quicker and custs out all the delays

Worth a tour. The river itself isn't anything special but if you take a boat cruise on it, you'll get views of this magical city that are unparalled. The stunning structures that border its banks are a photographer's dream. And walking along its banks is a great way to spend a couple of hours. Just sitting and watching can make for a great day.
River to be seen. What great place to take a sightseeing boat trip day or night. To stand on a bridge and watch the river traffic, or to stroll along.

Cruise or stroll either is great. Almost everything in Paris is along the Seine. To get anywhere take the #72 bus. It runs from the Eiffel tower to Hotel de Ville. Over the course of a week we covered most of its length at least once. By all means take a river cruise. There are many lines. If it's a night cruise I recommend the Bateaux Mouches which have large flood lights which illuminate the river banks.Take a walk along the left bank starting near Notre Dame and ging left along the river. In the evening there are often groups singing and dancing at many locations along the river.
Dianne S. We did the evening cruise which left at 9.00pm so gave you a different view of the banks of the Seine it was really pretty at night with lots of activities happening on the river bank

Stop by the willow trees to soak the sight of the Louvre in!. Morning walk past the artists and booksellers stalls is such a treat. Just soaking the sight of the beautiful little houseboats and the louvre through the willow trees is just beautiful... It would be perfect wasnt it for the traffic but it's a city after all!

Take a cruise at sundown. On the recommendation of a friend we took a cruise that started at sundown. It was beautiful as all the lights of Paris came on. Yes, you are lower than the streets but seeing the bridges from that level gives you a different perspective. This is one for the atmosphere not the actual viewing of the individual monuments.
Cruise the Seine. If you're in Paris it is well worth a cruise on the Seine. We did one at night and it was worth the effort. Entertaining, informative and seeing the City lights!

Cruise was lovely. A lot of people grab some food and eat by the river. We went on a cruise which was great!
It was around 20euro each which included a wine and a snack. The tour guide tells you all about the sites you go past

Bateaux Parisiens dinner boat cruise a must!. We celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary with a dinner cruise on the Seine with Bateaux Parisiens. A must for any romantic! The views of the bridges, people watching along the Seine, not to mention the wonderful meal, was a delight. Highly recommend this to anyone.

Interesting River. You can walk along the river banks or just sit and watch the various craft pass by.You can take a one or two hour sightseeing cruise for about fourteen euro, or take a lunch or dinner cruise. All excellent value for money

very beautiful. we had long walks across the river,i liked the view,the weather was ideal,i miss it already.the river seine has also and boats for boat -tours, although we did not have one,we enjoyed the river so much.

give it a walk. There are so many ways to enjoy the Seine River, but go for a walk on the easy paved walks on either side of the river. Cross some of the bridges for a different perspective. It is a great place to escape some of the hustle and bustle of this metropolis.

Take the Batobus!. The Batobus is a water taxi that continually circles up and down the Seine stopping at attractions like the Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, etc. You can hop on and off all day. Beautiful views from the water give you a great overview of Paris if you ride it around the entire circuit. Cheap fare and easy access from so many Metro stations makes this a real winner!

Get Local: Skip The Cruise & Hang Out on the Water's Edge. I did the river cruise years ago & yes, it was nice. Good food, lovely atmosphere, and the scenic Paris going by on the other side of a window. But now I like more local & authentic experiences so I prefer to sit along the river as those same cruises go by.For those of you looking for a more authentic, and perhaps youthful, experience: try a pic-nic (or better yet: a night-time pic-nic) along the river's edge. Pick up some small items from a grocerie store (baguette, wine, cheese, biscuits, whatever). I don't know about the day, but I know that at night you won't be alone! It's a very popular place for young Parisians to meet.Right down on Quai de la Tournelle was my favourite spot at night. (you can Google Map the name or Notre Dame and you'll see the quai just on the other side of the river from Notre Dame Cathedral). The cathedral is lit up across the river & the lights from the cruise boats light up the area as they pass.Average crowd: local ParisiansAverage age: mid-20's early 30'sAverage atmosphere: friendly, joyful, often friends jamming with instrumentsThough it's night and there is drinking, I've never felt in danger there. It's quite busy on weekends with plenty of people around.
Canal or River, that is the question.. It's pleasant enough, but sits low with high walls on both sides, making views from boats rather lacking, compared to say the Thames.

Fabulous Dinner Cuise. We cruised the Seine River on a dinner cuise. The boat was beautifully decorated with white tablecloths & candles. The name was Bateaux-Mouches. There was wine, of course, & appetizers. I had bbef that was very simliar to Filet Mignon. Very delicious. They served 3 different kind of cheeses & for dessert I had White Chocolate and Caramel Pyramid. My friend had Baked Alaska. Scrumptious! And then Tea, Coffee & Cognac. It was on the expensive side but worth every penny while seeing most of the sights in the evening lights. Wonderful trip!!

My favorite moments in Paris spent relaxing along the river with my wife.. My wife and I enjoyed sitting along the river, quietly enjoying a bottle of wine, some cheese and a baguette several times dying our stay. Watching the boats, the tourists and the world pass by was delightful. The pigeons are fairly aggressive walking around there. And there are spots where the smell of urine is a little overpowering.

It's okay to cruise, but maybe not next time. Too hot on summer tour. With a very heavy speaker that you need to hold to you ear, a paddle telephone! Spoiled everything. I really do not recommend, unless you will have diner at twilight cruise.

River boat cruise. While we did an hour tour on the river our purpose for this trip to France was a river boat cruise. The river boat cruises are restricted from the area of the river that is part of the city. You do get to see the sites from the river up close. It can be a little cool on the river so you might want a sweater.
Paris Plage. The seine is lovely for a romantic stroll, and even more fun when Paris plage is in town. You can eat an ice cream and sit on the sand and watch the world go by.
Interesting. The day we went on our River Cruise it was overcast and very cold. We still enjoyed it and you see a lot of statues on the bridges that you normally wouldn't see. A lot of gold around.

a must for all. we were there during the plages season so it was ironic to see palm trees and sand with people sunbathing.The history and majesty of the bridges (loved the lovers' padlocks) finding places where so many films had been shot - best of all - having my own photo taken "sous les ponts de Paris" as sung by Eartha Kitt
Nice guide by boat. It was a different view from the river: recommended. Especially when it started raining a nice boat trip in a boat with glass roof was nice :)
Beautiful!. The river is a lovely part of the Parisian landscape. Exploring the many bridges that cross it is a great way to pass the time.
Take the batobus. You can hop-on hop-off or just stay in your seat and enjoy the sights, great views from the Seine, convenient ride.

Enjoyable Hour. We took the boat trip from the Eiffel Tower, usual trip round the Isle de Cite, approx 1 Hour. Very enjoyable, with lots to see and reasonably priced 9 Euros each, as we had a discount voucher from magazine. Highly recommended if the weather is good.

Batoboat ride down history. Loved being able to hop on and off the boat on the River Seine to see all the main attractions. The Seine itself was amazing to see after many years about reading about it. There were other boats that you could stop and have a meal on. I never realized how long the river was.
Lovely. We booked a 1 hour cruise on here, was lovely. Can see all the monuments such as eiffel tower, notre dame etc,

world historic site. the best way to see the seine is to take an hour cruise. it stops by the eiffel tower -- just walk towards the seine and your can't miss it. the seine reminds be of a vein pulsing with life. we saw tango dancers, notre dame, orsay, louvre, -- a thousand years of history

Beautiful sunset cruise. We took the boat cruise just right before sunst, watching the sun disaper on the horizon was great. AWSOME pictures.the boat ride was great as it gives you a audio tour as you go. Bridges were great to see from the river.i would recommend this ride. We purchased it thru the red double decker bus tours. Bus tour and river cruise was only 33euros well worth it.

A beautiful boat ride. Scenery was wonderful. The scenery was incredible. It was also a great was to see the back of the buildings, which were just as beautiful as the front.The bridges were also beautiful. A must do in Paris

Fantastic waterway. The detail on the bridges are amazing. It is an excellant highway through Paris. We used the Baton Mouche to get a gist of the City and then used the Batobus to get around hopping on off.
V good. Cleaner than I thought it would be. Beautiful scenery all the way. Nice place to see. And its free! Unlike the rest ofbparis!
A great way to see the city. You get a different perspective from the river and it is a great way to see the city and it is a great opportunity to take photos

A magnet .... Our family of four were always drawn to the river to see what may be going on for the day. Our apartment in the Latin Quarter was just across the road - so always walked beside the river. We enjoyed several parks and the summer beaches, particularly the cold water sprinklers! Our 10 year old daughter was delighted with her swim in the Piscene Josephine Baker one day. The tourist boats kept us entertained with their activity too.
An afternoon in Paris. just strolling and looking at the architecture. Couples could buy or bring a lock and add it to the many on one of the bridges.

Take a boat ride from anyone!. Riding along the Seine is like none other. Most tours will discuss all the bridges and their importance in French history which make the tour interesting.But if you are not into hearing the stories, sit back and relax. The ride down the Seine, which typically starts and ends near the Effiel Tower, is one you will not forget.
lovely stroll. we strolled down the path in middle of the seine, the weather was beutiful and lovely views of the eiffel tower, bit dusty underfoot though so wear old shoes.

Good way to see Paris. For only €11, the boat trip on the Seine is well worth it. There is an audio narrative pointing out the key sites, plenty of space to move about the boat to take video footage on both sides, really enjoyed it, and very good value for money.

A trip on the Seine. The Batobus on the Seine River was great. It was reasonable to pay for the day and be able to get on and off when you wanted to see the attractions that you passed by. It was a great way to relax as well as travel the distance along the river seeing the many monuments and historic buildings. We used it to go from our Hotel to the Eiffel Tower as well. It was very pleasant with lots of places to sit and relax and/or stand and take photos of the scenary along the riverfront. It was reasonably priced for the day of touring.
bateaux mouche. we took a different boat line, one whose location was more convenient to our hotel. the trip was nice, the seats on the boat were DREADFUL.

Surprisingly Clean. I was surprised to see plant life in the Seine. Judging from other major European rivers, I had expected a brown river, like the brown Danube, but was surprised to see a green river with no unpleasant odours at all. It was a real pleasure to walk along both sides of the river at various times of day. There are even some boats alongside that offer food, wine and coffee.

A good way to see Paris from a different angle. My husband and I went down the River Seine one evening on a dinner cruise, organised by Cityrama. It was a great way to relax, have fun and see the sights of Paris from a different angle. The cruise lasted for about an hour and we got the chance to see the Eiffel Tower, many of Paris's landmarks and the beautiful architecture of the buildings that run along the length of the river. Also many of the bridges are adorned with interesting sculptures and statues.There are a variety of different boats that traverse the river during the course of the day and there is always something interesting to see, as my husband and I actually walked the length of the river one day from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame.Whichever way you travel it is a wonderful way to pick up the essence of what makes Paris.

Dirty. I expected the Seine to be beautiful and enchanting. I was sorely disappointed with the state of the river. It was dirty and some areas of it smelled pretty foul.
I would still recommend walking along the river or taking a river cruise, because you get to see Paris from a different point of view. Just don't expect too much.
Do the night river tour if you can. Both the day and evening river tours are great but the evening tour is dramatically different with the lights and views of the city at night

Romantic. This is my romantic scene of paris. you always see it in the movies, it's full of tourist but also locals hang out here. I love hanging by the river specially if you are a couple, when it's darker with the moon light

For the tourists, sandwich lunch and the romantic. You can go down the river in any number of tourist boats and see interesting buildings and beautiful scenery, or you can walk along the riverside pathways, stopping to sit and swing your legs over the river, eat your sandwich in the company of lots of others.

must do. We took a tour of Paris that included a ride on the Seine at night. There are many Bateau Mouche to choose from. We had the perfect evening when the lights came on and saw the Eiffel Tower at 9pm when the twinkling began. It was just magical. Try to include this when you are in Paris, you get to see the major landmarks and the kids partying along the river.

Stroll, relax and SIT!. Stroll slowly in a warm evening- the seine really is much cooler than the city. We took the river bus from le marais all the way down and walked back around 9.30pm. So many parisiens picnicking, relaxing and cooling down. The city is so well illuminated at night that it is like visiting another place. It's essential to stop, sit, and soak it up. Force yourself!!

Go by boat. Its a great way to relax and see many wonders including the Eiffel tower light up if you take a night cruise. The French make such great use of the spaces along the banks. Take a dinner cruise and sit back and enjoy!

Cruise on the River Seine is a must do.. Great view of Paris and surrounding areas. You can have a dinner cruise or order snacks and refreshments delivered to you on the cruise. I recommend late evening at sun down-8:pm and returning to a beautifully lighted Eiffel Tower.
Walk the quai. Walk the quai and see natives and tourists alike. At night, you'll see younger groups picnicing and enjoying lots of bottles of wine.
So pleasant. Took a river cruise both during the day and evening. Spectacular views and atmosphere all hours of the day and night. Felt safe walking all areas.

Take an evening boat right. Lots of options. Took an evening boat right - really, really fun. Lots of options in terms of price (with and without dinner, for example. Strongly recommended because you get a great view of some Paris landmarks and the river is really cool at night.
Full of life in the summer. Tons of boat trips going down the Seine, people sunning themselves along the banks and street entertainment along the bridges (especially around Notre Dame)

A nice relaxing boat ride. We caught the water bus, which was hop-on hop-off for 15 euros each and lasts the whole day. It was a great way to see the city and enjoy the views. Whilst the river is central to the city, there is sometimes a bit of a walk to the sites. Would recommend it. If you do get the water bus please be aware that it is not a guided tour.

Cruisin. We took a one-hour cruise on the Seine, that provided commentary on the passing sights. It was a lovely relaxing way to see Paris from a different angle. You can catch it at the base of the Eiffel Tower.

Batobus on the Seine - way to go. How do you get a feel for paris without getting footsore? Take the batobus. We spent a pleasant Sunday having bought a ticket for 15 e. getting on at the Eiffel Tower we cruised up to Musee de orsay, Saint Germen de Pres, Notre Dame, Jardin des Plantes, Hotel de Ville, Louvre, Champs Elysees and back to Eiffel. Getting on and off and visiting the sites made for a pleasant stress free day.
A national treasure!. Walking along the river in the midst of the city compels everyone! It is clean, scenic and filled with sidewalk experiences. If you have time for a cruise, even better!
Walk and sail. Did a dinner boat cruise on the Seine. Lovely experience. Also enjoyed walking up and down the banks in the evening.
Under the Bridges of Paris. You MUST take a tour by boat under the nine bridges of Paris, especially at night. It is a most informative, romantic, and worthwhile voyage.

Smelly. Walking along the Seine could be a delightful experience if it wasn't for the horrible smell of urine all the way along from Notre Dame to the Eiffel Tower. It was so bad we had to walk on the road but even there the smell was bad.

The heart of Paris beats here. To truly get a feel for this wonderful city, take a walk along the Seine. The history and architecture surrounding it is just magnificent. Even if you don't have time to take a cruise, just enjoy a casual stroll on both sides - Rive droit and Rive Gauche (the right and left side of the Seine). There are small vendors along the side selling paintings, drawings, and little keepsakes of Paris. You can stop by a cafe along the way for a croissant and a cafe au lait. Make sure sure you go down the bridge that has all the "love locks" along the side of the bridge. You write your name on the padlock, lock it around the bridge wires on the side and then throw out the key in the Seine, that way your love lasts forever. That's what they say anyway. Whichever way you go in Paris, you will inevitably hit the Seine. To go from the Louvre which is on Rive droit to the Latin Quarter which is on River gauche, you have to cross the Seine. And that's just one example. Oh - and make sure you take a picnic with you one day and sit along the side of the Seine like so many other Parisians do. You can even bring a bottle of wine. Enjoy the food, take in the surroundings, and just fall in love with Paris! :)

THE BATEAUX-MOUCHES. A trip down the Seine on the boat is an excellent way to get a different view of Paris. These boats run day and evening trips. If you want to splash out a bit they also do dinner cruises.

Much improved. The Seine has always been a focal point in any visit to Paris. The areas arount the Cite ares thronged with people, not only on the quays, but also on the multitude of enormous cruisers which seem to be a big draw for tourists, both day and night. in fact Paris as a whole and the river in particular are remarkably unspoiled since I first visited 50 years ago. A stroll along the banks, crossing the many beautiful bridges is a must. What has improved are the embankments alonh the whole length of the Seine in Paris. Not as much fun as the South bank in London, but still, most attractive.

Wothwhile. We went on the river cruise as part of a bus tour which went for about an hour. It was a great way to see all the landmarks of Paris and a really great way to get some fantastic pictures. The boat was huge, not luxurious that for sure.
beautiful way to see paris. we went on a night cruise it was breathtaking the city of lights it certainly is beautiful way to see paris

Nice Hangout. We took a cruise on the River and while we enjoyed it, you can simply go to the River and sit, relax, hangout with friends, sip a bottle of wine, or just people watch. There isn't much going on so you have to make your own fun. The area tends to get very noisy with kids drinking and hanging out in groups. It is also dark in some areas so I would be careful. We never felt threatened, however, and had an amazing time.
Do this first in Paris. We were advised to take a boat ride down the Seine on our first visit to Paris. It was very informative and gives you a good sense of where the sights are located.

Charming River Bank. Like a park, beachfront, and river all in one - a charming, hard to encapsulate experience. Really enjoyed seeing all of the people enjoying themselves by the riverbanks in so many different ways.

Ideal Paris. I spent a fair bit of time walking along the River Seine. It is a beautiful portion of Paris. You can see a lot of the famous areas of Paris while walking around here and it is a picturesque area of Paris.

A Glorious Stroll. This was the highlight of my brief stay in Paris. The level of history, architecture and beauty of this walk through the heart of Paris from the Tower to Notre Dame is as good as it gets. If I had more time I would have taken a boat tour as well. I will definitely return to Paris someday and repeating this stroll is first on my list of things to do.

Fell in love all over again.... breath taking ,calming..its amazing one of teh brideges that cross over the river are for padlocks for lovers to put there own representation of their love on the bridge..hubby and i did this on our wedding anniversary.....so romantic :)

hang out and enjoy at night. My teenage daughter and I strolled down by the river one warm night in August. There were little stalls selling crafts and food. Plenty of people were picnicking and buskers were playing music. It was kind of magical...just hanging out, lights twinkling off the water, doing nothing special -- except being in Paris! And, it felt completely safe (for 2 ladies) -- no worries about that in the least.

Bateau bus.. Great way to see the city from a different angle. The bateau bus is hop on, hop off, 15euro for one day or 18euro for two day ticket. Go on the river at night, Notre Dame looks beautiful and the river side is dotted with people dancing and singing.
Lights. The view at night. Like it all. Very relaxing. Just watching people along the Seine enjoying and taking their time to look around and enjoy.
A nice walk. If you just want to see Paris on a walking stroll, this is a nice place. Along he iver there are a number of sites as well as various vendor.
A great trip on the Seine. We had a trip with Bateau Parisienne and the guided headphone was excellent with lots of interesting information.
Great spot to relax. I was amazed to see how many people were there on a Friday evening...seems like a popular hang out spot. Relaxing atmosphere. Awesome view to see the boats sailing by.
beautiful. Amazing view! Walking along the Seine was a highlight of my trip to Paris. If we'd had more time, we'd have liked a boat tour of the city along the Seine!
beautiful walk. walk from the eiffel tower along the south bank to musee d'orsay for a lovely 30 minute stroll that takes in some of the highlights of the city.

Night cruise. We went on a night cruise which lasted one hour.Definitely must go at night for viewing the city of lights at night.diffferent view of builidings as compared to day.We enjoyed every bit of it
Pleasant taster. Did the round trip from the Eiffel Tower to the Isle de la Cite. English commentary pointed out major places of interest. A good introduction to our stay.

Go at Night. Sit up Front. Great tour up to Notre Dame and back down past the Tower. One suggestion and one caveat. Go at night to see the lights (better than Vegas since it's all real) and be sure not to sit in the back up top. The exhaust is almost sickening. Up front or inside and it's no problem.

Use the Batobus..... Use the Batobus to travel the river, fantastic value for a 5 day ticket (hop on and off as many times as you want) 21 euros, and it stops near to the main sites, this is a must, and its at a leasurly pace along the beautiful Seine...

Boat trip. We used the Batobus (included in 2 day hop on-hop off bus ticket), and it was great. A quick and easy way to reach sightseeing venues. Boats every 20 mins or so, clean, with excellent viewing.

The backbone of a wonderful city. You couldn't possibly visit Paris without spending some quality time by the banks of the river. There is so much going on it's amazing, and of course there are the many briges crossing the river where people gather to relax and eat food whilst listening to musicians perform. Take time one evening to walk the banks and take in the sights and sound of this wonderful city.

THE RIVER SEINE. You have to go by boat or take a cruise, you will enjoy it in the evenings. The river is clean and does not smell bad as we find in some places which accumulate wastes. You should take atleast an one hour cruise tour on this river, you will like it.

got to do it. we pre-booked, which was a godsend.But if you are only staying for a couple of days,it is well worth doing. You get to see so much from the boat, plus they have phones on each chair so you can hear all about the buildings you are passing, in English too. we would never have seen so much in the days we had in Paris if not for the cruise

Three hours of gourmet indulgence and a chance to rest your feet!. We had booked a lunch cruise with Bateaux Parisiens and it was excellent. Good food, good wine (plenty of both) good service and good views.
See the sites from the Seine. Many a boat cruise available on the Seine. Sit and people watch from a boat instead of a cafeand see the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame etc from the relaxing Seine.

I can spend hours there. Strolling on both sides of the river, or taking the "bateaux mouches" for a few hours on the river is just something that I could do over and over again. Romantic if you have someone to share the experience with, or simply beautiful if you are by yourself.

Must do trip.. Most boat trips are the same so doesn't really matter what one you take, we took Bateuax Mouches. 11 Euros. Very informative, very good value. 1h 20M. You see most sights from the boat, Louvre, Notre Dam, Palace, Eiffel Tower, and lots of others. Translations in French, Spanish English, German, Chinese and Italian.

Beautiful sights along the river. We walked along the Seine both during the day and in the evening. It is simply breath taking. Many of the must see sights are along the river. I would also suggest you take a cruise along the river to get a different perspective. Very romantic!

An Alternative Great View of the City. Having a trip on a Bateaux Mouches cruise boat is a great way to view Paris. The river Seine winds through the heart of the city so most of the major sights are within sight. You can take a trip during the day or at night both are great as the main attractions are well lit. If you really want to push the boat out you can have a trip with lunch at the weekend or a trip with dinner every night. The boat is a great relaxing way to see Paris, enjoy.

A Must-do activity. We did the cruise in the early night. It was a very good experience. We see a lot of famous landmarks along the way.The recorded guide is played in several languages which is very helpful.
Don't miss!. Walk the banks of the Seine, both left and right, and splurge on a river cruise, especially at night. Well worth it!

Stroll the Seine - An Experience Not To Be Missed!. The river defines Paris.Strolling the left bank on your way to Notre Dame or on your way to or from dinner is a memory not to be missed.The river boat cruises allow you to see it all. My suggestion is to board the boat at dusk and make your way to Notre Dame just as the sun sets. That way your trip back is after sunset and you can marvel at The Eiffel Tower as it comes alive with all of it's lights. What a wonderful experience.
River Boat Ride. We took a romantic boat ride in the evening along the Seine. Beautiful bridges and carvings and history as well as the Eiffel Tower at night with all the lights on.

Bateaux Mouches. You need to experience two things when you first visit Paris and that is a trip along the Seine by boat and the Tour Eiffel summit. I did these two experiences within the same afternoon as the weather was hot and within that afternoon had experienced the best. Both came with guided tours and refreshments on board. Able to walk around and take in the french atmosphere. This trip only cost 11 euros return and is not a hop on hop off boat but you can get the autobus which is a hop on hop off boat trip which allows to see the sights afloat rather than use the red buses for a parisien experience. Nothing to dislike about this trip but Fabulous !

liked the cruise. We liked the cruise in the river Seine in the afternoon. With a couple of drinks you can see so many places while on the boat. This is a relaxing way of seeing so many places without walking by foot. Just have a cruise in the afternoon and relax for some time while cruising.
Dinner mmmm. We had a dinner cruise organised with the hotel and was excellent, the four course meal and wine were very enjoyable especially to see all the sights travelling up and down onthe boat.
get the batobus. great way to see the sites. get the bato bus- hop on and off very inexpensive and regular service. great.
River Seine. Took a lunch cruise and even though a bit pricey, there was music, a singer and a nice air conditioned comfortable cruise up and down the river.
Ride the BatoBus. We enjoyed giving our feet a rest and riding up and down the Seine on the BatoBus -- buy a multi-day pass for only a few euros more than a single day.

River cruise - recommended!. We took a late afternoon river cruise for 12 Euros and it was fab - we had a couple of drinks on board and saw lots of sites that we just didn't have time for in the 4 days we were there - it was our honeymoon and was definitely a romantic trip to remember.

Balanced being in Paris during August!. Having the Seine, though we didn't swim in it but we walked back and forth multiple times made you feel a tad cooler during the head of Paris in August. Loved all of the bridges. Loved all of the locks that people added on the bridges. Charming.

Go at Night also. Tke the Bateaumouche dinner cruise.....fantastic.....food is good, champagne OK.....wine good.....music......and of course the Eiffel Tower at night........not that expensive for what you get

Excellent!. This is an excellent attraction & something which should definitely should be done if visiting the city. It gives a bit of perspective of where the other attractions are plus gives a bit of history about what's being seen. And why Parisians love their city so much!!

i would love to walk along it everyday if i could.. i went to Paris during the Plagues, pop up temporary beaches along the seine, there are bars, stalls, buskers, a lush feel about the place, in the evening there is nothing better to do then to relax with a couple bottles of wine, some bread and cheeses and with your feet dangling over the edge of the seine, all of the historical building all lit up, boats going past, it is beautiful.... definitely recommend for couples.

Stunk of urine.. The River Seine is a great river but the smell of urine around the Notre Dame region is unbearable. We walked from the Notre Dame to the Musee Louvre but the stench at 0830 in the morning was over powering. Nice river boats and the staff on the Batobus were great and worth the ticket.

A relaxing way to see the sights.. We went on a boat trip on a Sunday lunchtime, and booked it with a glass of champagne. We bought macarons earlier and ate them on the trip, whilst listening to the guide describing each landmark we could see. A great way to have a relaxing morning seeing the sights without suffering from sore feet!

Lovely trip. We went on a lovely boat trip on the river seine. The views were beautiful and the setting was quite relaxed and romantic. It's worth seeing the landmarks from the river as it shows things not normally seen when on land. Highly recommended.

Wow, River Seine!. Impressive river with great building alongside. Plus you'll get to buy soem artistic souvenirs along the river banks - pls don't get your souvenirs from elsewhere. This is the place to get the most beautiful magnets, paintings, post-cards, and even old French books. Take your time to walk along the river banks and experience being a Parisian!
Nice boat trip. Nice boat trip with one of the organised boat trips on the River Seine. Gives you a nice view other than the one in the streets.

"Beachside" at the Seine. The summer "beach" with sand and children's entertainments was as amazing transformation of the street along the bank of the Seine! What a wonderful idea for sunny, warm days of July. I had never seen pictures of it, nor heard that it was done by the city of Paris for the people.

romantic and great place. wonderful walk by the river and the beach on the river is a great touch. The old ice cream maker on the seine is a great treat his ice-creams are worth more than the 2 Euro he charges. It is so amazing the flavours and the fresh taste you will not enjoy any ice cream better than his! 3 generations of icecream makers ! WOW,SUPER AND AMAZING!

The Waters of the Seine. While we were there we took one of the many cuises up the Seine and there many beautiful bridges along the way and even a small copy of the Statue of Liberty which was a gift from France , been inside our Lady Liberty but it was so long ago i hardly remember it
beautiful. The seine is breathtakingly beautiful and a great place for picnics definately worth a stroll along the seine, sit down have a picnic or go on a river dinner cruise.

great boat tour. It was more fun than I thought it would be. A very enjoyable ride down the river. A full hour with an interesting commentary on the way.A great way to see stuff and decide where to go next.
Nice romantic cruise. We Tom the cruise at 9 pm in summer. It was really hot during the day and was nice and cool along the river. Nice and romantic at night. Must do in Paris.
One of my favorite sights in Paris. Loved walking along the Seine, riding on it, buying local artworks from all around the beautiful River Seine.
ok. At least I can say I saw it...Not a particularly pretty river. Took a ride on one of the river tours and enjoyed that.
