A good walk spoilt. I have done a few river cruises but chose not to sail down the Seine as I prefer to walk and stop and linger over points of interest and there are many. Don’t let the title put you off as I thoroughly enjoyed walking down both banks from the Eiffel Tower to Bercy. My main gripe is that stretches of the walls and fences are covered with tall wooden boxes that vendors use to sell everything from books, paintings and the usual tourist tat. As I am not 2m tall these boxes obscured the views and detracted from the overall enjoyment of the surroundings. It was made worse by the fact that many appeared not to be in use. Perhaps the local authority should remove those not in use.The big plus of walking along the Seine is that you find places that you would not see from a boat.
great views. took a tour boat on the seine 12 euros well worth it to see some of the sights from a different angle good commentary on the boat

how do you rate a river?. well, it helps if it has cultural connotations from les mis. to an American in Paris...the Seine is one of the great city-rivers of Europe, and strolling along its banks on an autumn afternoon is a magical experience.

a must do activity while in Paris as well as VeLib bikes. It is something that every visitor to paris shoud do is see paris while traveling via boat it is a great view and so beautiful. Another must is to then rent VeLib bikes and see things from the ground level. that bike system is great and all you need is a credit card even though it can get pricey if you keep the bike all day. but if you only use it for 30 mins it is free and then you can keep exchanging them each 30 mins if you so choose. but that bike system is great. just make sure you have a make of all the bike pickup and dropoff locations in paris. (normally included on most maps of paris)
Boat cruise!. I did not do this, but I would love to cruise the Seine. Well worth taking a walk/drive along the banks at night to appreciate the beauty of its bridges!Really beautiful.
Relaxing trip. Took an hours boat trip up and down the river which made a change to the bus tours. Didn't think you got to see as much as the bus tours though but at least we can say weve done it

The Seine at Night. Especially great for kids is the later night cruise on the Seine when the monuments are alive with lights and the Eiffel Tower puts on its hourly light show. Not cheap, but certainly worth it but try, if at all possible, to go mid-week when you might avoid some of the crowds.

River Seine - a little disappointing. After all the hype, I found this river to be a touch disappointing. The concrete river banks and lack of grass did not encourage me to sit beside this famous river. Ever present cigarette butts and the urine smell marred my impression of the great and romantic Seine. (I did love the bridges though)

A lovely walk. I walked the length and breadth of the River Seine, as well as taking a dinner cruise along it. It was so relaxing and beautiful I can't recommend it enough. Definitley soemthing to add to the huge list of what to do in Paris!

Lovely walk. We walked along the Seine for part of each day we were in Paris. The pedestrian bridge with the locks left by lovers was a new sight. I love watching the boats go by, looking at the books and generally enjoying the ambience.

Boat tour. We did a boat tour on the River Seine the first night we arrived in Paris. It was a perfect way to orient yourself to the city and figure out directions. The first sight of the Eiffel Tower is stunning and I recommend going to the park nearby(with vino and cheese) to watch it light up.We had a great time.

See the Seine and the city from a boat!. The River Seine is how one gets oriented in Paris, right bank or left bank. Many of the city's museums and cathedrals are located along the Seine. My favorite way to experience Paris is from the Bateaux Mouche, a commercial boat ride on the Seine! You can even watch the Eiffel Tower sparkle! Get on the boat before dusk, cruise down the Seine as Paris lights up! Great English narration too.
bus boat. did the bus & Boat 3 day ticket , great way to see Paris, very relaxing taking the bus boat, guide was really informative and quite a refrequent service.
Take the cruise. Paris is best seen at night. A great way to see Paris at night is by taking an evening cruise. You will understand why the call Paris the City of Lights.

At the beach in Paris. Sand, drinks, suntanning on the banks of the Seine? You bet! What a novelty. Also a chance to play Bocce and walk over the bridge covered with lovers locks and glistening in the sunshine. Just remember to hold your nose when walking under the bridges to disguise the urine.

Busy but beautiful. Purchased a two day round trip family ticket- reasonably priced.Relaxing but interesting. The river was very busy, but the boat was comfortable and gave us a preview of some of the sights.
Great way to see Paris. We took the Batobus trip around the river and loved it. Jump off, jump on all day. The views and photo opportunities are great! Worth every penny.
Bit Pointless. We did the obligatory river Seine crusie along with every other tourist. Bit of a waste of time really as we had better views of the landmarks on foot. Wouldn't do it again

A romantic boat ride. Its extremely beautiful to sail in river Seine in the evening. Perfect to start at any of the starting points of the tour (cause they take you a full circle anyway) by late afternoon (when you still have some day light) and end into the night with a dinner on the river.

Batobus is great value. We brought a 2 day family pass. You can get on and off the batobus at about 7 or 8 different stops - all at major attractions. This was a great way to get about and nice and cool on the water on a warm day.

sailing on the river seine. we took a both ride up and down the river seine i day time and saw a lot of monuments and famous bridges it is a good way to see paris from the river seine and a nice way to relax your feet for a while :-)
A must. Wonderful dinner cruise on the Seine. Beautiful views and very romantic experience. I will advise everyone to do it

Evening river cruise. Very commercialised and no food or drink on the boat. However, the cruise was excellent. The commentary could not be heard too well at the front of the ship, but it was lovely to see life along the banks of the Seine. There were several groups dancing inclduing tango and country style. We had a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower all lit up and lucky enough to be very near at 10 p.m. when all th light on it were flashing - quite memorable.

nice walk!. the river seine is a love and very central way of getting around paris as there is a bateau bus service that runs up and down the seine regularly all day! you can also walk up and down it as well and it is a loverly little walk for couples especially and there are many riverside cafes and restaurant up by the eiffel tower on its banks!
Nice ride at night.. Took a river trip. The food was delicious but nothing like the Chefs on the train to the south of France. Keep your hands on your camera and always count your change.
A Must-Walk. Got to walk along this river to get a feel of the beautiful buildings, sights in Paris. It was very hot in August but the mild wind made it a pleasure for a leisurely walk.
Beautiful at night.. Nighttime Paris is amazing! The river is beautiful - a must see! Took a tour and walked along it - lots of activity along it - both day and night.

Seine River one-hour cruise is fun. The one-hour Seine River cruises leave every hour. We took one and really enjoyed it. You can sit under a roofed portion of the boat or outside. We chose outside. It is a very nice way to see that part of Paris. Take the cruise at night too for a very lovely nighttime view of Paris.

Cant miss the Seine. Walking down the Seine is picturesque, its clean and the comings and goings of the boats is a watchers paradise. Paths down the side of the Seine are clean. Dont forget to watch the mime artists on the bridges

Take a walk at night! Do a river cruise!. Two huge recommendations: take a walk at night and cross a few of the bridges, very romantic and has great views (Pont Neuf, Alexandre, etc). Also, if you have time and budget take a Seine river cruise (non-dinner options are very resonable). We did Bateaux Mouches, but I'm pretty sure any of them is great. Take the cruise at around sunset and you will get to see the Eifel Tower lit up. Well worth the trouble a MUST due to its easy access (we bought tickets same-day and had plenty of room) and value.
:D. What happens if you jump of a bridge in Paris....You would be inSeine...a small joke I always liked. Now the river is full with history and it is worth to take a cruise..Good for sight seeing

River cruise and open top bus for 33 euros. It was a fine day which helped and at lunchtime we jumped on the red bus at the Champs Elysee by the Arc de Triumphe. We jumped off at the Eiffel tower and mused about in awe for 10 minutes, gave the queue a wide berth and hopped on the river cruise. An hour later after a fabulous trip up the Seine taking in the delights and Paris plage we got back on the bus and off to La Fayette where we stopped for a late lunch and caught the finale of a Romanian street pickpocket team at work.They are fast and really do exist, believe those signs and never let your guard down in Paris.Back on the bus and back to the Arc de Triumphe where we took in the city views. A fabulous day out for 33 Euros a head and less for kids.

beach on The river. In true eccentric style each August along the Seine they create a beach area with sun bed chairs and showers, ice cream parloursreal sand, crazy golf and loan a book areas. You have to see it its crazy but it works. Beware the thonged man !!
Filled with sights, do a cruise. This river is filled with sights and history, would suggest doing a cruise tour or even a dinner cruise. Just don't jump in because the water isn't so clean.
Must!!!. Me and my husband did the cruise on the last evening and loved it. If you are in Paris you must do it. We did the forty nine minutes one.....but you have choices.
Breathtaking!. Every movie you've seen with the Seine in it becomes real when you see it with your own eyes. Walk the cobblestones below!

Wonderful way to see lot of Paris. We took the evening cruise. It was a very good way to see some of the key landmarks in Paris which we would have otherwise missed.The host of the cruise talks about each of these landmarks as an when we passed across them, both in English and French.There are a lot of cruise options, we took the one that starts near eiffel tower.
Must do the river cruise.. Loved all the sights of Paris from the Seine. Did a day cruise, would of loved to done a night time cruise to see everything lit up.

Scam - beware. We walked along the Seine every day and evening. It is well lit at night and busy at all hours. We always felt quite safe. However, on one occasion we were offered a gold ring which had apparently been found near where we were sitting. It was offered as a gift and good luck. The "finder" then returned and asked for money for coffee. We had no intention of getting our money out in front of him and he took off with the ring. There are several of these fraudsters along the Seine and we observed the way in which they work. They quickly drop the ring (mostly into the sandy paths) then offer it to unsuspecting tourists. This practice seems rife along the banks of the Seine. Be aware !!

Thread of the City. The River Seine is the thread of Paris, winding its way through one of the world's greatest cities. It offers a pathway through neighborhoods and historic sites, providing walkways on both sides - both upper and lower level - and a fitting foreground to Notre Dame and so many other places.

Beautiful Way to See a Lot. We took the boat cruise on my first night in Paris. It helped us get oriented and decide some of the other places to visit. Chairs are comfortable and the information given on the loudspeaker is very helpful.

lots of tours - really worth an hours break from all the walking. Liked - Our tour was good, restful and informative
Disliked - girl in ticket booth was really rude and disrespectful

Stunning way to see Paris. If the weather is nice, I would definately recommend a Seine cruise or boat trip because lots of important landmarks are along the Seine and it is a great, and more peaceful, way of seeing them all in style!

Every city should have such a river. We kept coming back to the Seine, either walking beside it, or crossing one of the many beautiful bridges, or enjoying a different perspective from a river tour boat. "Les Plages" a summer "beach" along the right bank, was a delightful surprise, as Parisians enjoyed a lively Zumba class, a quiet drink, or playing in the sand. Saw many people relaxing with a simple picnic.
Take a boat ride. Took a boat ride and it was a refreshing break that allows you to see many wonderful buildings, bridges and sights along the way.

A Must. My girlfriend and I took a river cruise after a long bike tour one evening and it was amazing. We were tired and the Cruise was a great and beautiful way to relax. I would highly recommend it, especially with a bottle of wine. Very romantic.

Travel Republic - Paris Dinner Cruise -a complete waste of money. We booked the Paris Dinner Cruise Etoile service via Travel Republic. The boat company was Bateaux Parisienne. The TravelRepublic website details stated that they ensured that two people do not have to share with anyone else, and that they ensured the tables for two are available, regardless of the service chosen. Our evening was completely spoilt by having to share a table for 6 with 4 other people. We were clebrating our wedding anniversary, and after paying £184 for our trip, I can assure you we were not very happy, and it completely spoilt our evening. On top of that, we were given a half a glass of wine each only, and being seated right in the central isle of the boat, had waiters rushing passed us all night. The waiters had no time for anyone, and the live music was no better than kariokeThis was a most disappointing evening, and we were completely underwhelmed with the whole experience. It was a complete waste of money. We complained to Travel Republic but, as expected, got no response.

Dinner cruise. Expensive, but worth it to enjoy Paris by night. We sat right at the front of the boat - excellent views. Haute cuisine food and lashings of champagne.Photos by official photographer v expensive - 20 Euros for one snap - didn't buy it!!
lovely. various boat trips, very enjoyable. its nice to stroll along the river bank or hop on and off the boats.

Before sunset is best. To catch the very best photos catch a boat before sunset!The light in Paris has inspired artists for generations, and you will be inspired how photos taken almost in the dark look fantastic, reflecting off the water, the sandstone, the sky itself, only seen from being on the River Seine.

You will see this if you go anywhere worth while. While we didnt take a ride on the Seine, we did walk the bridges over the Seine, and although its not the cleanest river you'll see, it is still a pretty amazing scene to see. Especially the love locks along one of the bridges.

Another view of Paris. I would highly recommend to anyone visiting Paris (especially the first time) to take a cruise down the Seine. If you can do it at night, even better since the City of Lights really does glow after the sun goes down. We did an afternoon tour with Bateaux Parisians (right across from the Eiffel Tower) and found their boat/guides to be very nice. Unfortunately it begain to rain just as we boarded the boat, but their inside coverage is nicely done with clear glass so you stay dry while still being able to view the sights. On a previous trip, we did the night cruise on a March evening with Bateaux-mouches and it was very cold outside on the upper deck. Be sure to consider the weather when booking a tour, but don't hesitate to cruise the Seine if you get the chance.

best Boat rider ever. just like in the movies with the artist on the side walks, it was amazingly special! We had a wonderful afternoon and the breeze was perfect for the stroll down the river. Everyone was so kind.

Tourist trap on the River Siene boat tour. If you go to Paris, I would skip this. The sites are so much easier to see in person on the street, instead of on this massive river boat tourist trap. There are just throngs of people and the give the tour in about 8 different languages and it is really annoying. If they would just stick to French, English and maybe Japanese or Spanish it would be so much better. Or break up the trips into different times for different languages. Having to listen to the same sentence in 8 different languages is so bothersome-they could be spending more time talking about thing as you go by, but since they have to say the same thing 8 different ways, there is no time to say much. I didn't like the tour, however, it was cheap, like $13 USD.
Cruise on the River Seine. This was a lot of fun. The guide gave a very interesting naration as we cruised the sites of the city and was also happy to answer questions.

One of my favourite walks. Whenever we travel to Paris our trip is never complete without a stroll along the riverbanks.There is always something to see. During Jly and August the Plage (beach) is in place.Workers eat their lunch on the numerous benches, the families seem to bring every family member with them.In the evening people turn up with small picnics and bottles of wine and just socialise. This does not just include young people, its all ages. It seems to be so natural, obviously it is something that has been done for years.We have seen stalls set up, dance lessons taking place, dance groups setting up. Just recently there was even a free rock concert.It is one of our favourite ways to spend an evening

clearly beautiful. we took the cruise along the river, the river was clean and well minted the view from the river was amazingly beautiful. you can see building, churches, museum from the different angle and you can produce lots of beautiful picture also !

A typical river right through a big city!. I think afterwards that we should have been taking this tour at night time instead. It was fantastic to go under the bridges of Seine but it would have been magic if you had been there during the night hours, I think to see all the lights!!

The boat rides are a wonderful way to see the city at night.. The illuminations of Paris along the Seine are wonderful when viewed with a glass of wine from the boat tours. Every time I visit Paris it's on my to-do list. Romantic and reasonable way to enjoy a leisurely glass of wine.
BEACH IN PARIS?. During the summer you get a man made beach on the banks of the Seine. This is peaceful, tranquil and just lovely. Free deckchairs and parasols.....recommend
Magical. So french, walk along the Seine hand in hand with your lover, wonderful barge's passing by, cross the river to see the latin quarter.
Always Wonderful. Beautiful at anytime of day or in any weather. Crossing and recrossing the bridges can make for a charming day.

Cruise on it, or walk along its banks but visit it you must. So much of Paris is about this river. And depending on the time or day of the week that you visit, it can be different each time. We enjoyed walks along it during the day - busy and crowded. Then later at night, still busy but not as frantic. We cruised along it late one Friday night - vibrant and fun. We did a walking tour and were taken to locations where there was no-one but us. I'd love to see it in summer with the temporary beaches set up. Don't go expecting to see lovely clean blue water - you wont see that, but it is still one of the best locations to visit in Paris. But don't just go the once.
A place in the sun. A walk along the bank of the river to take in the many sights including the beautiful Alexander III bridge and the quirky beach.

Start with river seine. We should start the Paris tour with this. They guide will explain all the attractions and we can see they all are very close to each other. That gives a nice idea to plan rest of tour. If you have time, plan with dinner in the night. It is expensive but remains as a good memory.
:-). I love taking photos of bridges and there is no shortage of beautiful old bridges over the Seine. We took a river cruise that provided me with many picture opportunities.

The most precious experience in Paris. I went on a boat ride that was simply one of the best experiences of my entire life. I watch the sunset and when the night came the city was so full of lights like I couldn't believe. If you are looking for something that will make you feel alive, beautiful and inspired, you should go on one of these boat rides on the Seine.It will also provide you all the romance you need with your loved one ;)

You can't miss it. The river is nice. Lots of people hanging out, having picnics, drinking, and peeing in the corners. There a many boats on the river, batobus is a decent transportation option but it is slower than the metro.

Feel like a true Parisian. Walking along the Seine was the first time I felt like I was "in Paris" during my visit. It is very clean: I visited for 8 days and saw only 1 plastic bottle in the water one time. That was it. Clean, beautiful, and sitting down any place along the quai overlooking the water to people watch, converse with friends, etc. is truly wonderful. Take a baguette, cheese, and a bottle of wine to the Square du Vert-Galant at sunset for a truly Parisian experience.

The Seine River is splendid!!. The River is a fast pace and gorgeous! I highly recommend taking a stroll by it and experiencing the majestic beauty for yourself!! If you are in Paris, take a river cruise and view the other side of the city!!

Walk or take a boat. Walk along the river or take an evening ride, relaxing wither way. Lights are gorgeous from the river at night. We were there in June and it can get cook at night, so be prepared for varied weather. Been to Paris 3 times and always enjoy it!

It only takes 2 hours for memories that will last forever!. We had a complimentary tour on the Bateaux Boat from Air Canada Vacations. We had spent all but the last day on land seeing just about every sight by both day and night. Because the tour was not going to cost anything and we found out it was only 12 Euros per person anyway we almost did not do it. GLAD WE DID! It is a whole different perspective from the river. TIP: When boarding the boat we went to the water side seats facing the opposite bank. This way we were out of the sun and saw all the points of interest with the best possible views. The folks on the opposite side may have had a very different experience....a poor one.

Heart of the most Beautiful City in the World. The River Seine is the focal point of the City of Paris. People enjoy just walking along the river and looking at the City sites. Try the "Batobus" which is a very good way to see the beauty of the buildings, bridges and monuments all along the river. These site seeing boats are everywhere and are really a tourist favorite.

Paris Plage, fun on the beach in Paris. If you are in Paris in the summer months check our Paris Plage, the beach on the banks of the river Seine. It is almost surreal at first glance, trucked in sand to make the beach and people lounging around, playing in the sprinklers, having a beer, playing boules. But and you wander along it all becomes somehow completely normal.
take a boat trip. far the best way to view the city. take a boat trip you wont be disopointed its costs 12 euros and you see most of the big attractions and go right past norte dame
Great cruise!. We had the Paris Pass, so we took the 1 hour Seine cruise. We got fabulous photos, met wonderful travelers from around the world & soaked in Paris from the water. Great time!!
Batobus. The Batobus is easy to use and is a hop on- hop off system. We stopped at 5 different stops to visit places of interest.

A fuss-free way to view Paris. Like: Fuss-free and can view the buildings that we passed by with guide-along. Can view better and take better photo from the cruise as there's not blockage. Another view of Paris- eiffel tower.

Freezing Cold!. We went on a Seine River Cruise after our dinner at the Eiffel Tower. It was about 9.30 at night and there really wasn't that much to see.The Eiffewl Tower looked great all lit up but it was so cold on the cruise it was hard to concentrate on any thing.
Enjoying the Batobus. We wanted to go up and down the seine to enjoy the various Paris sites. This is a relaxing way to travel and take your time.

Parisian at the core.. You truly know you're in Paris when you walk around the Seine. Music, art, cafes, people. It is a lovely experience and quite a nice from the hustle & bustle of city life. (Although you're very aware that you're still in an urban environment - but it is calming at the same time.) It won't be hard to explore as there is easy access to the paths right by some of the major attractions in the city. Don't miss it.

Big slow boat with lots of tourist. This only goes around the island. It was relaxing. Not much action. I could have slept. But you have to take at least one boat ride to say that you actually did it.

Thoroughly Enjoyable. A bustling river,with many trip boats and houseboats.So many bridges,such wonderful views! Be aware of the eastern europeans who play the drop the ring in front of you scam-then call after you-just ignore them.You have been warned!Walking along the banks of the Seine gives you a real feel for this beautiful city-hand -in-hand with your lady....what else!

Take a Boat Cruise and see it all.. One way to see Paris is from a river boat cruise. We did this (with our kids) and we all enjoyed it. Our cruise lasted just over an hour and we were able to see most all major attractions.

A must if in Paris. Taking a ride on the many different boat options on the Seine River is a must. They are prepared for every type of weather. When we began our tour it started to rain and the glass windows on the side rose to protect all the passengers. The guide spoke 8 fluent languages. That was amazing.

Beautiful but stinky. The rivier is amazing to see with all the ships bringing cargo through. It is a beautiful walk along the seine but certain areas smell dirty and stale. Follow the tourists and you wont get lost since everyone is headed in the same directions and this way you wont end up in an alley lone.

cruise the Seine. One of the must do things while you are in Paris is to cruise theSeine in the evening. You can do this either including a dinner or just by itself. Choose one of the later times as then you will seethe Eiffel Tower light up, which is a spectacular sight.
Beautiful. We loved it, it was a beautiful day with the sun shinning on the river. Wonderful to be in Paris and experience it's treasures.

Breathtaking at night!. We took a seine river cruise at night and it was beautiful! the bridges were all lite up and is very breathtaking. The Eiffel tower is right next to it so I recommend giving both beautiful attractions a visit at nightfall.

Who wouldn't love the River Seine!. Walk along its banks and you'll feel the romance of Seine/Paris. Check out the Padlock Bridge and either bring your padlock or buy there to attach it to the bridge. Then throw the key. Keep your love in Paris!
Lovely walk. Like most big city rivers the Seine is not as clean as it could/should be. But strolling along its banks is still a peaceful romantic thing to do

Dinner Cruise on the Seine. I would definitely suggest dinner on the Seine using one of their boat services. We used the Bateaux Parisiens line and it was quite good; dinner is okay but the experience is worth it. Take the 8:30 PM cruise and see the Eiffel Tower's light show (on the hour) as well as the many other monuments along the Seine.
Lovely boat cruise. It makes sence to take up some boat cruise - you see Paris from another point of view. In my opinion - without lunch.

Beautiful experience.. If visiting Paris you MUST take a boat trip up the Seine. It was great to see all the well known sights from a different view. We used the 'Batobus' company which lets you hop on and off depending on which type of ticket you buy.

Be ready to fall in love. the bridges for couples and love all over sena are lovely! impossible not to think how much romance this place has lived.
Be ready to check out the libraries on the side with a LOT of books, posters... culture! simple lovely! unforgettable.
Not that great. You always hear wonderful stories about walking along the Seine in Paris- Have to say it left me pretty underwhelmed.
Friday fun. The river is a wonderful view anytime, but the young people picnicing along the Seine on Fridays is a site to behold. Who needs a beach!

River Seine cruise from Pont Neuf. The cruise along the River Seine starting at Pont Neuf with Bateaux Vedettes was really beautiful and very romantic. The tour guide was a French student doing an internship and she was extremely well informed, transmitting her knowledge about the sights in both English and French in an entertaining, enthusiastic and engaging way. We recommend a trip at dusk so that you see the river by daylight and by night on the same trip. We found the small boats more personal than the larger Bateaux Mouches.

Only way to see a lot of Buidings. This way you see a lot more than you can see walking around, Paris is a very large city with a lot of history. The cruise is worthwile not only do you see what is on both banks but it also help to see things you can pin point to return to on dry land. We had alredy covered a lot of paris when we decided to take the cruise and we did seee a lot we had missed walking. Some building you can take better pictures of than on the banks

Nice tour. We chose a dinner cruise at sunset for our River Seine experience. It was well done. The food was good, the architecture surrounding the river was glorious--a good experience. It can be a tad expensive.

Worth the money.. I booked an everning meal aboard a glass cruise boat. A little pricey and had to pay for a window seat too.I wasn't disappointed since my wife really appreciated it.The music was saxophony of well known romantic ballads which set the mood.The sun was still out at 6:30 and still quite warm.The waiters helped us choose the lamb for main meal and lemon something for dessert...fabulous food!We saw the various bridges and buildings such as, The Louvre, Notre Dame, Mussee D'Orsay etc. A great romantic mood setter...well worth the extra!

Brilliant for Walks and amazing crusies. Walking along the Seine was gorgeous, probably helped by the beautiful weather we had, but still the atmosphere was relaxed, there were people everywhere reclined and enjoying the quiet surroundings. Also there are amazing cruises available, me and my boyfriend choose to do a dinner river crusie - Bateaux Parisien - along the Seine - sooo romantic and perfect for our weekend away!

Cruise the Seine in Paris. The cruise along the Seine which departs near the Eiffel Tower, is a nice way to see Paris from the water.The commetary is very informative and you can get photos of the bridges and other landmarks from another perspective.

Take the Cruise sightseeing. Make sure you take the sightseeing cruise. I guarantee this is a great way to get oriented of the must see while you are in Paris. You can have nice view of the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, many bridges including the lovelock bridge. You can also see the locals around the river on a picnic.

Do yourself a favour!. Doesn't get any better (or cheaper) in Paris. Go to a Mono Prix supermarket and purchase the followinga) One bottle of red wineb) One cork screwc) Two plastic wine glassesd) Two ham & cheese baguettese) Two chocolate eclairsNow stroll down to the bank via any side ramp. Sit in the sun & enjoy.Now that is being in Paris.Ohhh and don't forget to kiss your partner at some point!
must do a river night cruise. Lovely river with a tour on a boat a must to see the eiffel tower at night much better than the day and the building lit up, great!
River Cruise. Good but it was a hot day not attractive like cruise on river Thames. Cruise on river Thames is more attractive.
Beautiful on a sunny day. I love walking up and down the river when I'm in Paris, it's a great way to see a host of beautiful buildings which line either side.
how to rate a river???. wow oh wow the colours reflected off the Seine at sunset are unbeatable with the soft colours of the Paris sky. A soothing calm yet very busy working river.

Beautiful!. As we stayed in the centre of Paris, we walked across the river Seine daily. The ancient bridges are beautiful, the cobbled paths along the riverside are amazing. Really advise if you have the time and budget to book one of the upper end market River Boat Restaurants for dinner. Paris at night is superb!
Gypsies on a Bridge , be aware. Be careful on bridge you can meet gypsies, they will try to cheat you by saying that you drop a gold ring or something , money could be. do not take it in your hands.

NOTHING SPECIAL. It is a river which splits paris in to 2 sections. The water is very brown , sort of reminds me of the thames river in London. It is nice to just walk along the river banks . There are some floating restuarants on the river , but i did not try them. Again , nothing special. Dont come here if you dont have to.

A cruise on the Seine is a must. A batobus trip on the Seine is a must to feel the Parisian romantic atmosphere. If you have more time in Paris and intend to visit more attractions then I would recommend you the Batobus that has stops next to most important attractions in Paris. You can have one day pass for just 15 euro and jump on and off whenever you want. A full tour (let’s say you start and end at Eiffel Tower) takes about 80 minutes. Main stations are: Eiffel Tour, Orsay Museum, Saint German des Pres, Notre Dame Cathedral, Jardin des Plantes (Plants Garden), Hotel de Ville (City Hall), Louvre Museum, Avenue Champs Elysees/Triumph Arc, Eiffel Tower.If you do not have time to jump on and off the batobus you might consider dinning on the Seine. There are other companies that have restaurants on their ships so make an advance reservation.Whatever the reason and how you’ll cruse the seine, the pleasure and the memories will remain forever.

Take a boat ride. A boat ride on the Seine is very worthwhile, not necessary to take the most expensive, or do a dinner cruise. It is lovely to see the city from this vantage point and very relaxing. I believe the one we used was called Vendette, very reasonable, very nice guide
Worth the trip. We took an evening cruise and very much enjoyed it. It is a great way to cover some highlights. The tower at night is beautiful.

A quintessential Parisian experience. This river defines Paris. Many of the famous monuments and museums are close to the river. The best part of the River Seine experience is just to walk along it, taking in all the sites including the tourist boats (bateaux-mouches). It seems there is history at every turn.

do a cruise but do not walk along the bank. the river bank smells like toilet , due to people urinated under the bridges, it very nice to check out all the bridges and take some photo, a river cruise is a must to get a few of the city

Great! Batobus trip, seaside walk and picnic and icecreams next to the Siene.. What a lovely experience. And rather odd to be walking along the banks of the Seine to witness children building sand castles while their parents sunbaked on the sand, in hammocks or on deck chairs. Further on a cooling mist of water sprayed upon the people passing by. Further on still children played on equipment, a sand sculpture created a sculpture, People sat around or lay around, as drinks were served. You could have been at a beach resort on the Med ! Very weird experience.

Nice views. River side views were great(and free) and there were sand beaches next to the river. No possibilities to swim but you can enjoy the sun. I think nobody wants to swim there, water was all green and dirty.

Great for a boat cruise or a picnic. Whilst its lovely to walk along the Seine in the centre of Paris, my real recommendation would be to do a Bateau Parisienne or similar cruise in the evening, leaving from below the Eiffel tower. Timing this with the lighting up of the Eiffel tower is a lovely activity to do (the tours have a built in audio guide explaining the history of the monuments you pass as you move down the river). As you travel down the river, you will see hundreds of Parisiennes with Wine and full on picnics having either romantic picnics or small parties with friends. My second recommendation for the river would be to join them!

Faster way to see Paris. If you are looking for to see Paris in different view, riding boat through River Seine is one of the recommended methode. You can see many key buildings from the river itself.

Interesting River Seine & canal cruise.. Spend a morning relaxing on the small boat making your way through the locks on the Canal St Martin. Very interesting away from hassle of the city. Leave from near Musee d'Orsay & we returned on the metro.
Must do. Lovely to travel up the Seine and see the sights and architecture. Stunning. See the museums on either side and the Tower.

One of the best things about Paris. Everything really good is by the river, the Eiffel Tower, river cruises (which i recommend), and places to eat.Over the summer months there is also a little beach put up by the river, with sand, parasols, chairs and sprinklers for the kids. It was actually quite amazing.You can easily get onto the side of the river and walk beside it. Early in the morning it was nice to feed the little family of ducks we saw and to feed the tiny birds too.

Take an Evening Ride. We traveled the Seine at night, and were treated to all the local historical sights lit up against the night sky. Upon our return to the Eiffel Tower, the tower lit up as well. I would highly recommend it!
Boat tours. Lots of options but the one we took was from Port du Conference and was an hour long mass tour which was fine on a sunny day.
Romantique. It was wonderful to see the throngs of people out at 10PM relaxing and enjoying each other's company.

The Heart of the City. This beautiful river goes through central area of Paris and almost all the major attractions are found on it. There are many beautiful bridges going across it, most with their own interesting history. We also took a boat ride on the Seine and truly enjoyed it.
it is very good experience. If yo find a good and luxury ship and yo are traveling wit your love , you can find a very suitable , calm and beatiful sphere in seine
Night time Cruise. The night time cruise is well worth it! Paris is a beautiful city by night. We chose the nighttime cruise with a glass of champagne, very pleasant.

It's all that. Your money will certainly be well spent in a boat cruise there, or even just on a hop on hop off boat, which is also a nice deal if you wish to see the main touristic spots without walking too much or taking the not so nice subway.

Take a boat trip. The seine can be best visited from a boat. We took a hop on, hop off Batabus. It is a boat which stops at 8 famous sites. When you are able, visit Paris Plages. It looked great from the boat but we had no time left to visit it.

The best way to see Paris!. My family (including two teens) thought that our river cruise on the Seine was a real highlight of our trip to Paris. We would highly recommend a cruise on the Seine for anyone wanting to enjoy the city while getting oriented to the sites.

Take the Boat. For an overview of some of the best sites take a river cruise. Ten Euros for an hour enables you to appreciate the external architecture of the buildings and bridges alongside and over the Seine

A lovely evening. A dinner cruise with Bateaux Mouches was indeed an evening to remember. Spread over nearly 3 hours, you are taken down the Seine in a glass roofed launch to see the sights of Paris, from the river, accompanied by soft music, wine and a typical Parisian dinner. After having seen the sights by daylight, the very same monuments and museums look even more beautiful bathed in incandescent lights and should not be missed.And even if you have seen the Statue of Liberty on Liberty Island in New York harbour, it is always nice to see her elder sister on the Seine.A must do - when in gay Paree!!

Blue Water Holidays sells it but Croisieurooe Europe makes it worth while. We had a bad experience with Blue Water Holidays (the cruise specialists from the UK). Once they take your money you have to drag details out of them like where to catch the boat and what the time of departure is and so so on. They hire young people that are not aware of the traveller's needs and thus leave you stranded. Three phone calls from France and several e-mails was enough for me to write this review.
Breathtaking sites. take an evening river boat tour on the Seine. You get the best view of all of the major attraction lit up at night. It is a must do in Paris.

Visit the Love Lock Fence. On the Seine, near Notre Dame Cathedral is a fence with literally thousands of locks attached. Couples have placed a lock (usually with a message), and thrown the keys into the river. Very cool....needless to say, my wife loved it!!!

Beautiful views. Take a boat tour at dusk...around 9pm so you get some views in daylight and night views so you can see some of the more popular sites. Beautiful tour and the locals that sit on the river edge sidewalks are friendly and seem to enjoy watching the tourists go by...I think. It was fun.

Life to a City. The Seine is so much a part of Paris that it is its artery. Most of the main sights of Paris are viewed from the river and the walkway along the riverside keeps everything linked and provides a good way of navigating your way around.
Beautiful. Loved it just to walk along this famous river was thrilling. To sit and watch this working river is a must.

Great, scenic river trip. We took a trip on the Batobus tour on the Seine from the Eiffel Tower to The Louvre. It was a great way to see the main sights of the city and we highly recommend it. Children under 3 go free and an 'unlimited' day pass was €15 per adult which was very good value. The service runs very frequently, c. every 10-15 minutes.
Strolling the Seine is lovely. For our anniversary we walked through the gardens outside the Louvre, and then walked along the Seine at sunset. It was so pretty and relaxing.

Beautiful. The Seine River should be a "must" on everyone's trip to Paris. The many bridges are so charming to cross. We did an evening river cruise and it was a perfect way to gain a new perspective on Paris at night.

Nice tour. We took one of the evening boat rides on the Seine and it was really nice. Lots of people on the boat, but comfortable seats and a nice overview of the major attractions. The tour came highly recommended and we'd recommend it at well.

Bastille Day Fireworks. Braved the crazy crowds to watch the best fireworks i have ever seen. the river is always full of excitement and if you wander with out agenda you will always find some thing a little bit different. Salsa, or fire breathing, or a sandy beach...

Take another look to Paris.. The fisrt time we had an hour ride through River Seine by boat we admire Paris in a very different way. It was not very long, we did´t got tired and it was just fabulous. We got the boat near Notre Dame.

Wonderful. Wonderful particularly on a sunny day - take a picnic to Paris Plage or just walk along the banks and cross the bridges - wonderful views of many historic buildings. Take a Bateau Parisien for a one hour cruise which is worth the money (about Euros 10/12). Queues move quickly so worth the wait - boats run all day and late into the evening. You see all the sights including the Ile de la Cite and Notre Dame.
Its nice. Just a river, but it leads to everything. You'll see all kinds of attractions just walking along it. Its inescapable and peaceful.

Boat trip. I would highly recommend doing a river cruise as soon as you arrive in Paris for the first time. This way you can get your bearings and see where everything is. I would also recommend walking along the river. There are so many picturesque places to see.
Great boat trip. Great boat trip enables you to see the sights from a different angle great view of the Eiffel Tower and the beautiful bridges.

Try a boat ride!. What is so great about the river is all of the bridges going over it - each lit at night! All of the buildings bordering the river are lit as well. I highly recommend an evening boat ride to check it out!

Paris' lovely river.... While Paris is full of monuments, cathedrals, museums, and cafes, at it's heart lies the beautiful River Seine. The Seine seperates Paris' Left Bank and Right Bank as well as surrounds the lovely Ile Saint-Louis and Ile de la Cite.Crossing the Seine are a series of lovely bridges, some with some amazing history. There are also some gorgeous walks alongside the river as well as several river cruises. The Batobus water Taxi makes eight stops along the river at key points and the hop on/hop off boat is a lot of fun and a relaxing way to enjoy the river. The Seine is as much a part of Paris' charm as anything else. It's also one of the most romantic parts of the city. Whether you're on a cruise, a stroll, or just gazing over one the Paris' many wonderful bridges, the River Seine is a magnificent part of the City of Light.

Very Nice. Took a one hour boat ride on the Batobus. They have headsets for all passengers in many different languages (no extra charge) and it's like getting a guided tour. Really pretty. There's also something called the hop on- hop off boat ride which is for an all day pass and then you can get off and back on whenever you want.
Beautiful. You can walk along the Seine, have a picnic by it or go on a river boat tour. A must to do in Paris.

A nice evening. We went on a 1 hour cruise down the Seine in the evening. It was a nice way to see some of the sights but most of all was an incredible way to get to see the way Parisiennes come down to the banks of the Seine with a blanket, cheese, and a bottle of wine and just socialize. I loved that part of the Parisienne lifestyle!

One of my favorite places in Paris. Grab a bottle of wine (or in the winter, make up some hot wine in a thermos), and picnic on the Seine. Better view than any other restaurant. Its a quiet place to read a book, take in some sun, or listen to others practicing an instrument. This is my preferred running route as well (along the banks of the Seine - pretty much traffic free - go earlier in the day to avoid the pedestrians). PS Bateau Mouche near Pont des Alms is my preferred boat trip - currently 11€ for a one hour trip.

Excellent. The weather was fantastic and i think this helped, but going down the Seine on a river boat tour was stunning, you get to see all the major sites in Paris and learn some history along the way.

River cruise only way to go. To view the icons of Paris by boat has to be one of the highlights of our holiday.Dining and sailing past the Eiffel tower, original statue of liberty etc while dining on a beautiful meal was undoubtably one of the things I would do again .

Batobus. We hopped on the Batobus at the Eiffel Tower. We decided to try it out because one elevator was broken at the Tower so it was a two hour wait! So, we bought a two day pass for both the Batobus - which goes along th Seine - and the Open Tour double-decker buses. The Batobus has a lovely tour of the Seine. There are eight stops and you can hop on & off at these stops as long as you ticket is good. We enjoyed the bridges, the Notre Dame views all around, and the Louvre. It was wonderful.
Nice walking. Came overhere during some beautiful sunny days. Really nice to sit there and see people passing by. Also possible to start a talk with people.

What's not to like?. Just spend a day walking along it. The experience is well worth it. This is where you see how beautiful the city can be. Make sure to go to the Left Bank as well as the more tourist areas.

River Cruise. With the Paris Pass you get a free river cruise that is about an hour long. Loved this cruise and the banks of the river were just full of young people having a glass of wine, chunk of cheese and bread. All the locals know how to have fun, plus you see everything from a different angle.

Take a river boat trip!. An excellent way to see the City, take an open topped boat trip from the smaller operator on the river near Notre Dame (just over the bridge and down on the right)The commentary is informative and in English, in fine weather it was good value for a 1 hour tripSit on the top deck in the open at the rear, everyone rushes to the front seats but the commentary is more audible at the back!

A sail up the Seine - a must do.. We joined a 1 hour river tour complete with commentary passing some beautiful monuments, Notre Dame, the Louvre, Orsay, the Invalides and the fantastic riverside walks in this area. We enjoyed it thoroughly and the cruis provided further views of the River Seine and the Island locations along it's banks - the hour passed too quickly.
Beautiful in sunshine!. Lovely walking along the Seine, pretty bridges - especially the padlocks! Nice to sit on one of the pedestrian bridges and watch the world go by....

Just a dirty river. Was expecting much more lifestyle along the river with grassy banks and people having picnics. I guess my preconception was Hollywood, because the reality was a concrete and brick walled river, dirty, with old boats and graffiti. Only really good views (from Batobus) are the bridges and Eiffel Tower (though you should really get off the boat for the night view)

River Cruise. Amazing night tour, takes you around the entire length of the river witin Paris, and covered all the major attractions. Plus if it drizzles while you are on the boat, trust me, its just gets more awesome

great place to walk and enjoy the city at your pace. a great place to check out old books, art and other cool old stuff. The water itself is not so clean but the boats and bridges distract your attention anyway. At night there are these very youthful cool, music and dance parties near the Austerlitz train station area. There was heavy beat music, folk music and ballroom dance in each of three areas. Check it out after 10:00 PM

Take a cruise.. A fun way to spend a warm evening. See Paris from the water and you'll have a new appreciation of the city of lights. This is a worthwhile activity. There is SO much to see here. Even a walk along the baks will make memories to last a lifetime.

Take a river cruise!. The river cruises aren't that overpriced and are definitely worth it. You get to see all the normal sights in one river cruise and get a comprehensive tour of Paris. Avoid the tour that is right by the Eiffel tower because it is the most expensive.
Fascinating and beautiful.. I loved this. Don't miss it if you do Paris. The views are fantastic and the bridges interesting in themselves.

So beautiful. We took advantage of our hotels free river cruise, I know it is touristy and we have done it before but it is a nice way to see Paris in the sunshine. The river bank walks are so pleasant and clean, we had a great time.
Busy. At places along the banks it is dirty and in various states of dis- repair. Not really a great place for a romantic walk along the river

a "Must" that can be easily missed. We did that because our 9 year old daughter insisted but honnestly, I would have passed. I would have preferred to take advantage of the 2 hours ( 1:30 for the trip, and 30 minute wait) - to walk in the Marais.The audio-guide is clear, but eventually you get to see the monuments quickly and from one side and can barely take pictures if not seated at the edge.Maybe the open bus tour would have been a greater idea...

The heart of Paris. How can you go to Paris and not visit the Seine? One evening we took an hour boat ride just to see many Parisian landmarks from a different perspective. Strolling past the bouqinistes is a favorite walk in Paris.

See Paris from the water, a view not to be missed!. If you have plenty of time, make sure you go for a boat cruise on the Seine. You can catch a boat at Ponte Neuf. From the river, Paris is beautiful. You get the best view of the Eiffel Tower from the water, as well as the other beautiful buildings which make Paris unique. Also along the Seine, check out the stalls selling rare books and posters. When we were there there was a market selling produce and offering wine tastings from the south of France.

Good to take a cruise or bato bus shutle on a hot day. We took the bato-bus tour in our last day and was a nice experience to see all the major attractions from the River (Orsay Museum, Louvre Museum, Notre Damme, Tour Eiffel , Pont Alexandre, ..). It was a very hot day , the only day of our stay when we did not have to walk so much and was good to spend a part of it on the river.

Walk by the river and a boat cruise. We took a Discovery Walks tour and it was nice and funny. We enjoyed the walk by the river bank, which ended in the small park near Pont Neuf (under the statue of Henri IV). On another evening we took a boat cruise from Pont Neuf (Discovery Walks give a coupon with a nice discount on these cruises). The cruise shows all the landmarks along the river and the various bridges across it. If you take the cruise on the sunset hour (or later), the buildings along the river are beautifully highlighted. Take some warm clothes with you if you take the cruise in the evening.

Amazing. Its awseme ride... Being weather alomst rainy, the rever cruise was awmse.. the food served by nearby shops is also very good. There are few road side shops selling candy and other stuff which are very cheap and nice to buy..

The City of Lights. The Seine at night is a must, especially on a beautiful summer's evening. Stroll along the banks, watch the passing river barges and observe the many stunning buildings along the way which are beautifully lit at night.

Pleasant and relaxing way to get through Paris. We'd bought the Hop-on, Hop-off bus passes (42 euros for 3 days), which included the Seine boat. This was the best value as the buses were heaving, average wait was 20 minutes and the roads were jam-packed in the centre. So the glass-topped boat with plenty of room and a guide speaking 3 languages, made it an enjoyable 20 minute trip from the Eiffel Tower to the Notre Dame.

River Seine. Did this cruise twice. Relaxing and wonderful. But remember that many of the historical building are located along the river. I enjoyed walking the river and crossing the different bridges.
Boat trip. The boat trip and lunch was an excellent way to experience the multitude of sights on the banks of the Seine. As a special occasion it was well worth the expense

Gotta Do It. The Seine is beautiful and cannot be missed. We did an hour long tour close to sunset. I believe you can get a discounted tour ticket as a part of L'Open Bus Tours (on and off), but we did it our first day so paid full price. Many dinner options while cruising are available, but pricy and dressy. You can also walk or jog along its banks. There are so many famous sites along it. There is also an on and off boat (BatoBus) that you can pay for; we did not do that.

Baton Mouche. My husband and I received a wonderful wedding gift: one trip through Sena River. We took the Baton Mouche by night with dinner. You had to wear elegant clothes. There was a violinist playing live. Dinner was incredibly good and service was impecable.You can take gorgeous pictures of Tour Eiffel at night on the top deck, and so we did.I fully recommend this trip.

must do the walk, and hold her/ his hand.. absolutely amazing especially during the night time, when buses of tourists no longer exist. And the lights help to paint a sensational atmosphere to the scene. i can't say more, see for yourself.
Beautiful place for picnics and lots of cruise options. We spent many nights on a picnic by the Seine, the best way to take in Paris, I think. We also had a lunch cruise one day, very romantic!
romantic cruise. take the Bateau Mouche dinner cruise. Well worth the money to see a different side of Paris while having a fabulous meal, entertainment,and the lights of Paris

Recommended river trip on a busy river.. Lovely to see so many people enjoying the Seine! Houseboats, floating restaurants, a constant stream of bateaux mouches, fantastic houses and architecture, great history and even an imported artificial sandy beach (complete with large, living palms) make this a really worthwhile trip - especially impressive at night!

Tres Romantique!. We spent ALOT of time walking along the River Seine while visiting Paris in July 2012. We took a boat cruise, walked along the water, criss crossed the many beautiful bridges. I could spend a week just doing this, it is magnifique!
great to take lunch on a boat. I dfiently recommend tkaing the boat tour @ seine river . You will see the city from a different angel. I very much enjoyed it.
Evening cruise is a must. Take an evening cruise. We took a romantic cruise at 9pm and managed to get a spot on the deck. Just when it starts to get darker.
Just wander along the banks. The best way to see it is to just wander along the banks and you will see all the beautiful bridges. A must see at night.
The River Seine. I did not take a trip down the River Seine, but saw it and the boats, etc, on my recent trip to Paris. It was good to see a site that I have heard so much of.

Ile Saint-Louis. I've added Ile Saint-Louis here because there is no other place to put it.With Notre Dame, Sainte-Chappelle and the Palais de Justice, Ile-de-la-Cité is so overdone. Head on back behind Notre Dame and cross over on the Pont Saint-Louis footbridge and be transformed back in time.Still-quiet back streets and upscale restaurants, but without the hoards of tourists. Be almost the only one there ;-)

River Tour. Highly recommend taking the river tour......added a little romance to our anniversary trip. You just get a great feeling travelling on the river -almost calming as opposed to the crowded streets and subways
Feel the city, for free!. It´s the vertebral column of Paris. Allways with great views, wherever you are, with sellers of gravures, paintings and antiquities close to the Ile de la cité.
charge your camera and take a tour!. Take the tour over the Seine. Greater picture shots than on land especially the Eiffel Tower. Great narration of every site on board.
Lots to see. Took a boat trip,plenty of seating and options of either inside or out.Very comprehensive trip and lots to see.

Batobus. Very good. Best way to see Paris. 8 stops at all the main sites. can get on and off as many times as you like. After our hotel staff the staff on the Batobus were the next friendliest we found

It's a river.... Personally, I didn't think this was the highlight of my trip, just like any other touristy river, it was rather dirty and at some parts smelly but it's beautiful, depending on the location you're viewing it from.

the Bat-O-Bus. I hadnt actually heard of this before I left, but it is a hop on hop off tour of eight different attractions in Paris, it was wonderful. Champs-Elysees, Eiffel Tower, Musee d'Orsay, Notre Dam, the Louvre and others.

Very scenic. We took a boat just beside the eiffel tower, u could sit inside or out. Commentary on board was very good and in all languages. Make sure ur camera is fully charged because there is plenty to see.

Boat trip on the Seine. This boat trip was sold in conjunction with the Red Bus tour and was really great value for only EUR6 in addition to the bus. It lasted one hour and had an excellent commentary system in multiple languages and the vantage point from the river was excellent.
A river with a character. Paris legendary river. It is the heart and soul of Paris. What is Paris without The Seine?

Never want to leave.. Would highly recommend the Botabus tour, it costs just € for adult (€7.50 under 16's) this is a great way to cruise along the Seine. There are 8 stops along the 2 hour journey and you can hop on/off all day long. The laid back attitude is so evident along the river, it's just wonderful. Be sure to take this journey on your trip to Paris. You wont regret it!

Take the boat tour. Seeing the river Seine in one thing....taking the boat tour gives a whole other level of experience. Notre Dame from the river and the eiffel tour take on new looks that can only be experienced from below
Must walk by the river. Many parts get crowded but some ca be very quiet and restful if you know how to find them .

Boat tour was too crowded. river Great. Boat tour was too crowded but the pics I was able to take from the boat were amazing. It was neat to people watch the Parisians sitting along the River Seine and they would often wave. Recommend a SUNSET time cruise
Lovely. Having a picnic right next to the Seine is just lovely
so clean!. compared to the thames, the seine is beautiful, it was so clean! take the batobus, it's brilliant and you can see so much, and very cheap for getting around!
A relaxing Cruise. Thoroughly enjoyed our Seine River Cruise in the afternoon, it was lovely to be able to sit and see the different building as we sailed past and listen to the commentary.
artists and paris romantics. To walk from the Eiffel tower along the river side is so cool. The local artists are out and the Parisian lifestyle.
Hop on Hop off. Great way to get around for the day and see the sights, got chilly in the evening.

Beautiful!. My husband had arranged for us to take a sunset cruise on the River Seine. It was magical! The River itself is beautiful, but even more so at sunset. We had a great time - we got to see some places that we ordinarily wouldn't have seen by being in the car or on foot. I'd highly recommend a River Seine cruise!

Peaceful, serene river. The Seine is a nice waterway to walk along or get a boat in Paris to explore further. I haven't been on a river cruise on this river but I have walked along quite a bit of it and it is quite well maintained and scenic. It makes for some great photos at the bridges which provide great vantage points over several of Paris's land marks. There is a beach along one side of it that has sand and umbrellas which I found pretty funny but it added to the character of the river I guess.
Most Cities would die for this!. Take the boat trip, a bit cheesy but you will see a different view of the riverbank and the city around it

Boat tours are great!. We did the Batobus boat tours. They offer 8 stops at the big attractions and have enough boats that we never waited even on Bastille day. Great way to see the sites and gain perspective on the city in a relaxed way and to get around.
Perfect Paris.. There's so much to look at along the Seine - tourists, locals, the boats bobbing by... Nothing more to say...

Cruise on the Seine river. Had a fantastic look on various landmarks of Paris on the cruiseship. Paris is ever more beautiful and amazing viewing from the Seine river cruise. Travelers should definitely take a cruise on the Seine river to see such a romantic side of Paris.

Relaxation. Great way to see many of the sights and sounds of Paris. Enjoyed the tour and commentry very much. Just did the no frills 9 Euro tour with France Tourisme and definately got our moneys worth.
Worth every Euro. The Batobus bus is excellent value for money, you can hop on and off at any of the 8 stations in the day. We hopped on at the Louvre and got off at Notre Dame. €15 1 day pass.

Great way to get oriented in Paris. My wife, daughter and I recently toured the River Seine on a tour boat. While there are plenty of tour boats (some very fancy and some rather utilitarian), I'm not sure if it really makes a difference since the views are what really counts. I'd highly recommend making this one of your first things to do when visiting Paris. You get a little history, but more importantly, you'll get an idea of the lcoations of some of the city's major sites. Even in the rain (most boats have both interior and exterior seating), it's quite beautiful.
Take an evening cruise. To really appreciate the river, we took a dinner cruise at dusk, arriving at the Eiffel Tower just as all the twinkle lights came on. It was romantic, relaxing and magical.

Must do river tour. The river tour is a must. Most guides push the night tours for the view of the lights, but first, do the day tour. It gives a great feeling for the history of the city, with its many bridges, and monumental structures. Just sailing around Notre Dame makes the trip worthwhile.
Alive Day & Night. Paris has many pedestrian bridges over the seine. It is beautiful to walk around the river anytime as your perspective changes with the light.
Take a boat ride. You can so much of the Paris "coasts" in less than an hour on a boat ride. Or just sit along the banks with a bottle of wine...

Great views from the Eiffel Tower. I took many, many pictures from different vantage points along the River Seine - it always offered it's beauty. When we went up to the top of the Eiffel Tower I discovered that there was an entirely new outlook to the river.

Here to Eternity. My wife and i had a stroll down the Seine one evening on the way back to our hotel near the Louvre, it was impossibly romantic. A warm Autum day we strolled arm in arm aloing the river bank watching the street entertainers from the Tower to the Louvre, it is well worth the walk, just keeps your wits about you for beggars...

Lovely romantic cruise on the River Seine.. We went on the a river cruise on the river Seine. We boarded just near the Eiffel tower. We opted for the Champagne package and we sat at the back of the boat on our own. The boats can get quite busy so it was lovely to sit at the back on our own and sip the champagne. This is a great oppotunity to take some gorgeous pictures especially fo the bridges. There is a comentary along the way to tell you where the sights are. We went on the boat just before sunset so we got the view in the daylight one way and the city lights on the way back. The Eiffel Tower is gorgeous when it is lit up.
A Trip down the River. Took a night trip down the Seine which was lovely to see all the monuments and bridges lit up at night.. well worth doing

The best way to see Paris if you're short of time. If you get the chance, do this first as it gives you a brilliant overall picture of Paris and what you might want to see in more detail. It's relatively expensive and we couldn't hear the commentary very well (it was incredibly windy) but it was definitely one of the highlights
Worth a boat trip just for the views. Great way to see some of the icns of Paris and get some history via audio recordings in many languages.
Picnic in Vernon. Theres a lovely area in Vernon along the Seine near the old bridge and mill house. It's a lovely place to stop when biking. Be sure to bring wine, cheese and baguettes.
True Parisian experience. Loved walking down this river seeing the sites and hanging with some of the locals. I would also recommend taking a boat cruise down the river. Very Romantic!
Interesting. We did a trip on the seine as part of the hop-on hop-off bus tour and it was a very informative and fun way to get around. Well worth the trip
So Scenic, so beautiful!. It is such a beautiful river. I love it! It is so peaceful to walk on the banks and we took a boat ride- it was great! I think the Seine is such a great asset to Paris.

Historic river. Strolling along the Seine is a magical experience. Check out the booksellers' stalls along the way. But look out for pickpockets and scam artists: one of the scams was that someone would "find" a large gold ring on the ground and detain people by asking if it was theirs. I didn't fall for it, but beware.
Enjoyable walks. Delightful way to see Paris - relaxing and very informative
Down by the Seine. The River 'Taxi passing the many Bridges to arrive at the Notre Dame Cathedral

great day out. take the boat trip along the seine great fun and fabulous way to see more of paris
always a hit with the kids

Revolutions started here. Walking down the left bank it was not difficult to imagine the world events that had their genesis along the Seine. A pleasant stroll out of the Paris heat and nice views of the river and watching people just chilling out.

Unmissable walks, cycleways and boat cruises. Who can tire of the Seine? Summer and winter, it's always changing. Take a bike and cycle along the paths that line the Seine and watch the serene waters, the glorious Haussmanien apartments lining it (envy!) or just go for a walk. Not for nothing do all numbers in Paris start at the Seine: it's the true heart of the city.

MAGNIFIQUE. Went on an evening cruise. Lovely atmosphere and a great way to end the long weekend break. Nice to see people along the banks enjoying themselves in a civilised fashion. (Liked the band practicing their brass instruments). All the classic buildings were lit up and the Eiffel Tower scanned over us with its searchlight.

Bateaux Lunch Cruise in Paris France. Fabulous Service, good food, lots of wine and great views . The perspective from the river just made me want to spend more time in Paris seeing the frontside and the inside of all the fabulous buildings we passed. I will definetely return to Paris.
A civislised way to get around. The Batobus service is a great way to travel and take in the sites either side of the Seine.

Do the boat cruise on the Seine. This is an excellent thing to do to see some amazing sights while floating peacefully along the Seine. We went on an early evening tour and it was very pleasant after a very hot day walking about. Some friends had suggested it to us and it was well worth it. Don't both with one of the dinner cruises - we've heard the food is not that good - but instead opt for the tour and then take in some food and wine afterward.
River boat trip - fab sightseeing. €12 per person to see the sights from the river boat - well worth a money and 1hr of the day well entertained...

The Seine at dusk is a must.. We took our whole family for a trip on one of the many Bateaux-Mouches that run regularly along the Seine. A beautiful way to see the city with commentary in lots of languages. My favorite part was gliding back to the port right on the hour to see the Eiffel tower come to life in a shimmering display of lights. Romantically breathtaking.

Romantic!. Peaceful and calm. The highlight of this area is the locks on the bridges!!!! Strolling across the Seine admiring the many many locks that are hanging is so sweet. So many declaratons of LOVE!

Bridges and Boats. This is a historic river and has been a centre for trade and people for thousands of years. The French people are very good at preserving their history and the river abounds in history and fabulous French atmosphere.

Mediocre. I surprised my mom with a dinner cruise with this company. The boat was on time, beautiful and clean. The crew was friendly and helpful. That said, we felt pretty rushed through dinner. It was a 2 hours cruise but there were several courses. The menu was extremely limited, with the only entree choices being cod and veal (you could order steak for an extra 10 euro but we'd already paid 140 euro for 2 dinners). Honestly, I would say the food was just average. Not quite what I expected for $85 per person. We only had the opportunity to go to the top deck and look around from outside the boat because we ate quickly. There was no time to enjoy a drink on the deck unless you skipped part of your meal. The only other problem I had was that the cruise company employs photographers to come around during dinner and take posed pictures of you in an attempt to get you to buy the pictures. This was annoying and a cheap attempt to get even more money out of us. It wasn't just us-other guests were obviously uncomfortable and put off by this and it really ruined the atmosphere. Overall, the cruise was nice but for the amount we paid, I was hoping for more. As a note, it was billed as a "night tour" but in the summer, don't expect to see the city lights. It doesn't get dark until 10-11pm so don't expect an illuminated Eiffel Tower. Overall, the boat was beautiful and it we did have a fun experience. It didn't seem like a great value for the quality of food and duration of the excursion-even an extra 30 min would have been great to get to enjoy the deck.
romantic. very romantic lovely in the night time when it dark..
All the main sites, one river.. The perfect way to see Paris is by the river. You can see all the main sites from it and is the heart of the city.

riverboat dream. well, the weather was a perfect European summer's day! the River Seine beckoned so we hopped on one of those glass topped river boats right near the Eiffel tower, down a few steps too easy.The boat ride takes you past the back end of alot of Paris and it's fascinating, loads of secret passages leading down to a getaway boat on the river.We also loved the back view of Notre Dame with it's gargoyles and different statues.The whole tour took us about 2hours but it was so relaxing and you can have a glass or 2 of vino!

Gotta do this. We took the "BateauBus" to see this. It starts at the base of the Eiffel Tower and stops at several places. One ticket gives you all day access to the boats, so you can get off and on as you want, or just cruise up and down the river. No tourist narrations, though.
Great experience. I took a hop on hop off batobus and it was really great experience. I do not need stay waiting long time and the staff is nice. The sight seeing view is marvelous. I recommend it.

Beautiful Lifeline through Paris. We loved walking back and forth across the Seine during a recent trip to Paris. The many bridges were all more than friendly to pedestrian traffic, and allowed for lots of great picture taking. So pretty!
Beautiful Seine. The Seine is an interesting river that goes around and through Paris. We walked along it and did a boat cruise. It is lovely!
A night tour. It was a dream coming true ... A night trip in the river after visiting tour d'eiffel ...
Wow. Took friends on the Bateau Bus and they said it was wonderful. We agree
Best way to see the city. Excellent on the Bateaux Mouches but the trip has been shortened substantially

Watch out!. Yes, of course it's beautiful! But watch ot for pick pocket kids who congregate on the bridges and prey on tourists. If anyone has a clipboard and asks you to give money to a deaf school...DONT DO IT! Ignore them!
Romantic. Walk or cruise to see the best sites and people-watch
Worth doing once. Not as good as going on the Thames in London but worth doing once
Take the boat tour!. Gives you a great feeling for the left and right bank. Also, just very relaxing and great for resting tired feet. Worth it!
must visit for that feel of paris. the river cruise in the clean calm waters going through the historical sights of paris
A bit grubby, but a great history. Disappointed it has been so graffittied, but the history speaks for itself. Night cruise was lovely, but crowded.
Stunning. We did a cruise on the first evening we arrived. It takes you past most of the highlights that you want to see. Arriving back in time to see the Eiffel Tower all lit up and twinkling.

great way to see the attractions. We took a boat taxi and it was a great way to see many of the attractions as they are all around the river bank. The two day pass is a much better deal and worth it if you will be in Paris for a couple of days. I would do it again.
slow. boat tour gave recording of sights in many languages, so you never got much information on any one site

Sunset Boat Cruise on the Seine - A Must. We took a boat cruise on the Seine at Sunset -- it was the perfect ending to our week in Paris -- and definitely one of the highlights of our trip. We went at sunset when you can clearly see all of the sights along the river and when the buildings on either side of the Seine are being lit up for evening viewing. It was also wonderful to see people sitting and/or picnicing along the sides of the Seine. We went on the 10 pm cruise and as we were returning (1 hour cruise), the Eiffel Tower was lit up and then twinkled for a few minutes (at 11 pm it twinkled for about 5 minutes) -- it was majical. If you take the 10:30 pm tour, you will be too far down the Seine to see the Eiffel Tower twinkle. Don't miss it twinkling -- it was truly spectacular! There are several companies that run boat cruises. We took Bateau Parisien. It was fine (just show up and pay or it is included with a Paris Pass) and casual and there is a head set (many languages) to listen to a narrative of the sights and some French music as you sail on the Seine. I didn't give it an "excellent" rating because on the Bateaux Parisien boat we were on there was a group of 25+ 12-14 year olds and they were totally obnoxious standing at the sides of the boat, yelling and hollaring to bystanders to get their attention, and ruining the enjoyment for others. While it was not the fault of the Bateaux Parisien company that these children were misbehaved, the staff did absolutely nothing.
the heart of paris. the seine is the main heart, containing the blood that makes paris one of the greatest cities in the world...walks along both banks...finding YOUR bridge is a wonderous search

Amazing Experience!. I absolutely love going up and down the River Seine. The views are absolutely amazing, especially at night. There is so much to do along it as well. Another great highlight is the 30+ bridges along the river at various points. I'd highly recommend taking a stroll along the Seine or taking a cruise along it. I'd recommend Bateaux Mouches.

It's a river. Really nothing terribly special about the river, other than the impressive city built around it. I did note that it was quite silty, seemed to flow faster than most rivers I was accustomed to on the east coast of the united states, and found it fascinating as it flowed north, which not many rivers I'm used to do. I walked along it for hours and enjoyed the views of the city at night from its banks and I'll certainly do it again next time I visit.

Just fun :-). It is very nice for everybody that likes rivers and cities. You can take a ship. I took the Batobus. No guiding, but you can look around, make pictures with your camera and you can drop out at any of the 6-7 (?) stations incl. Louvre, Notre Dame, Eiffel tower, Musee d'Orsay etc.
Bat-O-Boat. Travel by bat-o-boat and get a river cruise at the same time save your legs as this does a full circuit and you can get on and off at all the major attractions
Memories. Stand on a bridge, any bridge, and remember this beauty and the times you have been here before. You don't need to pay for a boat ride, just feel the breeze and close your eyes.
River cruise. River cruise was enjoyable. Good commentary from guide on boat. Scenery was very nice. Beautiful city.
