Bateauxbus. To travel between the various sites along the Seine a day ticket on a Bateauxbus lets one hop on and off at will at eight different locations all day. Highly recommended

A great experience. A fabulous way to see some of the iconic sights from a different angle and to get your bearings is to do a relaxing river cruise. We bought tickets for the hop on / hop off Bateau Bus which was very convenient.
Great Trip on our last night. Boarded at the Eiffel Tower, paid the extra bucks for a glass of champagne & reflected on the wonderful 3 days I spent with my girls in Paris!

Get ready to be MOONED by the rash Parisian Teens. Avoiding eye contact with the teens that hang out on the bank or you will get symbols and signs that you do not want to see.
Does it ruin the cruise. NO Its the French Mental push-back on the tourist trade that supports their welfare checks.

Whatever floats your boat. I'm biased in that I love riverfronts so my 1 hour cruise was a joy even in the poor weather today. Whether on foot, boat, bike, or car; you should take time to travel the Seine and see the sights....I recommend a cruise. The Paris pass included a tour otherwise we might have missed out. Don't miss out, this should be on every visitor's agenda.
Fun. We took a boat cruise on the Seine, and it was really neat to see Paris from the river. Seeing Notre Dame from the river was a special treat.
Just like in the Movies!. We so enjoyed the visit to the Seine River. Quieter part of the town with places along the way to reflect and take photos

A Relaxing Stroll on the River Seine. Is there really anything more romantic then a quiet stroll along the River Seine?We loved the people watching. We opted to not take a cruise though as there were just too many tourists...
Paris integrated the River Seine as a work of art into the city landscape.. The City of Paris literally integrated the River Seine as a work of art within itself into the city landscape.
Fab for boat trip!. Take in the city from a different view, relax and enjoy a drink or even a nice meal from the comfort of your seat while takingin in the breathtaking views of Paris!
Wonderful sights. Very good cruise along river showing Paris in all it's splendour. Excellent photo opportunity at every turn. Highly recommend. :)
A Sight Not to be Missed. We went on a cruise on the River Seine at night time and would recommend this to anyone visiting Paris.A must do while in Paris
Romantic cruise. I attended the second cruise on the Seine, but the experience was the same: nice and romantic...

Lovely walk. A lovely walk along the banks of the Seine, taking in the sights of the boats and families enjoying themselves. We crossed via several bridges including the one where lovers have put their names on hundreds of padlocks on the stanchions.
Charming!. Seine River has its charm...You can't visit Paris without taking a cruise on the river. All boats are well equipped, elegant, spacious and you are able to enjoy and relax...

The river is nice from a boat ride or a walk along the river. We have been to Paris four times and try to stay close to the river Seine. If you decide to take the romantic boat ride at night (something we did), you will not be alone. My husband and I thought it would be a quiet romantic night on the river looking at all of the lights. The boat was so crowded I wanted to jump in the river to get off of the boat!During the day there are artists selling their goods and lots of shops and restaurants around. It is also a great place just to sit and people watch.
Take A Ride. A boat ride on the Seine is a great way to get information on the highlights in Paris. The ride is smooth and comfortable a great way to see the city

The serene Siene. What can you say about the River Seine? Beautiful, romantic and busy! I've never seen so much activity on any river before. Whether you sit on the banks or sail on it, it is just totally amazing!
nice and cool on a hot day. Nice views and a good cooler break (temperature wise) from the rest of Paris.We used the batobus, highly recommended

at last!. I took a cruise on the Seine and it was marvelous! to float by all the lovely architecture is an experience for the eyes and the soul. Gliding pass Notre Dame with its flying buttresses, floating by the smallest house in Paris, and just enjoying the ambience of the whole experience is NOT to be missed!

Take a boat tour but walking is better. The queues to get to the River Cruise are terrible and had to wait at least 1.5 hours which in a way spoils the enjoyment. I think walking on the left bank is a better bet to see all the bridges and the historic buildings

Over rated.. Sailed on the Bateaux Mouches river boat on our last evening in Paris. Felt that the views and overall sail down the river was disappointing, not many areas with lights, only on the main buildings which all looked very grey and colourless . Lots of drunk looking teenages and tramps hanging about along the side of the Seine. Didn't feel romantic at all.
Lovely stroll!. We loved just walking along the river seeing the bridges and boats as well as people watching. Wear sensible shoes the ground is a bit rocky there.

Nice Tour. Riding on the Seine gives the opportunity to see many significant sights in Paris. Time of year was rather cold so we had to sit in the enclosed glass section. No problem with the view even from there. Must see!

Take a cruise on the River!. It was great! Dinner was top shelf, lovely music, great company made this cruise unforgettable! We saw everything from the river and the lights were wonderful. A little $$ but well worth it!
The River Seine. Of course any visitor MUST stroll along the Seine...We took a boat ride which we loved...
Great River!. What's there to say about the Seine except that it's historic and beuatiful and right in the center of things. Nice place to walk.

A wonderful stroll. The River Seine is a great stroll for those who are not in a hurry. If you don't have time to visit any museums or monuments, just walk down the banks of the Seine. There is a Statue of Liberty which was a gift from the United States, but Americans often don't realize that the US gave them their Statue of Liberty (the original).

Day Cruise. My brother kept telling us to take an evening romantic dinner cruise, however, I wanted to actually "see something" while on the cruise so we opted for the daytime cruise. We chose a day when our feet were exhausted from walking around - which, unfortunately, was toward the end of our stay here. I would recommend going on the cruise one of the first days, to get your bearings in the city.

It's touristy - but you have to take a trip down the Seine. Truly, for this one you just have to lump the need to avoid touristy things and take a trip down the Seine. We took the late evening trip this time, so didn't get to see the Tower lit up, but did get to experience all the locals who grab their wine and cheese and head down to the banks of the Seine for a relaxing evening along the river. You also get your bearings within the city.

Scenery and scenery. Take either the Batoboat which allows you to get on and off at the many attractions on the Seine or take a dinner cruise. There is also a walking path for as long as you want to walk
So beautiful!. Had dinner just across from Notre Dame...at the bistro with the Perrie bottle topiaries out front....great dinner and good value (for Paris).

went by canal boat. I would recommend a smaller boat. The trip was not memorable and not as enjoyable as I would have liked. Going to Paris and seeing the sights should not be done in a rush. Felt like I was on a conveyor belt. Hard to take pictures, hard to hear what was being said. Bit of a let down.

Boat trip quite fun but limited view of main buildings. The boat trips from the river below Eiffel Tower are well organised and cost €12 for a one hour trip in huge boats. For first-time visitors to Paris, I suspect this is more exciting than to someone who has visited many times. The view of individual buildings is quite limited but it can give a feel for position of those main buildings which line the Seine

Perfection. It was so beautiful and calm and serene. Our hotel was very close so we went there quite a lot over our holiday and it was lovely, peaceful and perfect, it was a creative place as well, we saw some girls drawing it and writing stories as well. I would definetly recommend it by all accounts. Amazing. A real memory to take back home.

Not for swimming. The Seine is fun to walk alongside. It brings all kinds of memories from so many movies and photos you've seen all of your life. You can almost hear the haunting music from those films and it is very romantic, especially in nice weather when so many people are out strolling along it.
take an eveing cruise. ok it is a river, sometimes dark, very deep thru paris and about Ile de Paris, the original city of Paris before it grew to the other side of it's banks
Easy way to travel in Paris. We had no trouble using this mode of transport - ferries are regular, cost is reasonable, stops are at major tourist destinations.
So relaxing. The boat cruises on the river are a must, you get to see a whole different side to the city. In the evening take a bottle of wine down by the river and enjoy the atmosphere of Paris

Nightime cruise is a once in a lifetime event. Take the PM cruise so you will be on the water at 11:00 PM for a perfect view of the lighting of the Eiffel Tower each night.Skip the dinner cruises. The food is not up to Parisienne standards.Find a nice place for an early dinner like the L'Epi Dupin in St Germaine (better make a reservation for the terrace a few days in advance) before hand OR visit Le Bon Marche (also in St Germaine) and purchase a baguette, Serrano ham, some fruit and maybe a small bottle of wine to nibble on while cruising.
Gives another view of the city. Take a boat tour, it's worth the price of the ticket.

Great walk, lots to see. I had planned to go the Louvre my first day in Paris but it was Tuesday and the Louvre was closed so I walked along the Seine to Notre Dame and then back to the Eiffel Tower along the opposite bank.
Great way to spend the day.
Another Paris must!. Best to purchase a bus/boat combo ticket for however long you need it - you can use the boats and buses to access most tourist sights

Top pick. The Seine River Cruise is my all time favorite attraction in Paris, and is especially charming at night when the tower and city are aglow. It is such a nice perspective to see the city from the water, with no traffic. It is a must do!
Cruise the River. For the best of Paris from the water, take a river cruise. Great views of all the icons and bridges. A must do...
Great walk, great sites.. The water, the boats, the bridges, the famous sites seen from the river, the bookstalls. The Seine is essential Paris.

Always a lovely walk.. Always a lovely place to take a stroll and soak up the atmosphere of Paris, lovely view from the Pont Neuf bridge with the Eiffel tower and other buildings. Look out for the bridge with all the padlocks, people write their names on a lock and lock it to the bridge.

Cruising down the Seine. Walking along the Seine is wonderful - to take a cruise on it is even better!!!! It is especially lovely to do as it begins to get dark and the lights of the city sparkle. We did the hour cruise and that was perfect.
Especially brilliant at night. Take a night cruise - so peaceful and apart from the bustle of Paris's traffic.

The reason why Paris was settled in the first place. This was the main means of transportation around Paris and from Paris to the sea in former times and the reason why Paris is where it is today. It's less important as a transportation system today than as a route for pleasure boats, and a cruise on a hot summer day is cooling, if expensive. Until recently the city of Paris had even set up an artificial "beach" along the river in the summer.
Beautiful river to cruise on!. Take a river cruise! The one hour cruises are well worth the money!
great trip. We enjoyed a luncheon river cruise and saw the city from the Seine
beautiful. Be sure to take a trip on the Seine in a bateau. We used "Batobus" You can get on and off at 8 different stops. What a nice way to see Paris
Sitting by the Seine. Grab a croissant and a cafe au lait and just take in the sight

simple, free, relaxing. perfect way to spend sunny day in paris, walking down the seine, appreciating all the bridges and buildings as go. also nice to take boat trip at night to see paris light up and the eiffel tower crossing the skyline

Good overview. Someone suggested taking a cruise on the River Seine, "to get ones' bearings," and we were glad we followed this advice. We actually had gotten up early and already climbed the Eiffel Tower and then went on the Seine. We saw many famous landmarks and learned some interesting historical facts as well.
Amazing. Went on a boat trip down the Rive Seine. Seen beautiful sites. Got a good view especially of the Eiffel Tower
Dinner cruise. We thought the food could have been better but the cruise its self was good, nice views and good service

It's great at night. We took a cruise down the Seine our first night in Paris. It was just the 1 hour cruise with no fluff. Bring your own champagne, food...Go at 9:30pm when the Eiffel Tower light turn on. It's amazing.

beautiful view and romantic area. everytime i went there i always feel in love, first when im single i wish one day i will come back here with someone special, and my wishes came true. i went with my bf,after he walk as my fiancee and then be my husband and last time i went with our baby. this river have so many memory for me and many people. especially there is the lock bridge which so many lover put their lock chain on it. maybe they really believe their love will be locked with the one their loved if they put the chain there. and its been years they did it. its eerie to walk on it. such a romantic and beautiful memory. wht i hate is some spot smell of pee of people, its reallu disgusting. and some part dirty with wall spray drawing which make the wall dirty and looks bad.over all its a must to walk around the river everytime u visit paris.
Gorgeous. We walked up Rue de Rennes from our hotel and as we came out of a narrow boulevard the Seine, the Louvre and the bridges came into view. Spectacular!

Relaxing boat ride. We took a boat ride/tour up and down the Seine during the afternoon and found it very enjoyable. Wait for good weather to do it. The history of the many bridges was interesting to me.
See my review on Bateaux Mouches. Unbelievable...see my full review on the attraction Bateaux Mouches (company that organises boats on the river siene!)

Take a boat ride. We took an evening boat ride after dinner on the Seine. It was quite beautiful and just as we got in front of the Eiffel Tower, they started the light show which goes every hour in the evening.

lovely. it is nice to take a boat tour on -- see all the places you have been. A good break for your feet or at the end of the day. The Batobus is a decent way to get from one main site to another if you don't mind missing walking the streets or taking the metro.

Sites by the seine. We enjoyed a lovely evening cruise along the Seine using Vedettes pont-neuf. Sets off by Notre dame and takes an hour to travel down to the Eiffel tower before turning around a circling around Notre Dame. This was a very good tour with a guide giving commentary in French and English.The price was only €12 euros each and highly recommended.Best way to see the sites would be at night to enjoy everything lit up - especially the Eiffel Tower.There are plenty of cruises available at all prices but this was perfect for us!

MS Botticelli from Paris to Honfleur. My wife and I went on a river cruise on MS Botticelli from Paris to Honfleur and back. This was a great way to see the Seine and it's towns like Rouen and Honfleur. The food was not always great but everything else was very good.
Romantic. The river was so beautifully It up at night with. All the buildings along side, and the view of the twinkling Eiffel tower from pont de neuf bridge at midnight was spectacular.

A very good river cruise. I would highly recommend a Seine cruise to see all palaces and historical buildings in Paris. I took a 10 pm cruise, and therefore, could see Eiffel tower in lights. It should go up to Statue of Liberty, but not covered by the Cruise.

The Seine is the Historic Life of Paris. The river front of Paris is beautiful A walk down the Seine, especially at night can be breath taking. My only complaint is that there are so many tour boats going up and down the river they can be distracting. There seem to be more trees lining the river than I remembered in past decades. That is a good thing if one is walking along the river on a summer's day.
evening ride. best way to understand parisian life is by the water!

The bridges are amazing. A boat trip along the Seine is a must for any tourist. You get a great commentary and learn all about the history and all about the bridges that cross the river with great regularity. A fantastic way to enjoy the river. Or you could just stroll along the banks, how lucky that Paris escaped the World War II bombing and retains all of its splendour with the Seine running through its heart.
Beautiful. Loved walking along the river. Look for the bridge with the locks! You write your names on a lock, lock it on the bridge and throw the key in the river! Very romantic.

One must visit. This is one of the best cruise experience you can have....On the river there are cruise going and it is really nice to have dinner or lunch inside the cruise....one of the fun experience you can have.
Romantic stroll. Beautiful day, walking the Seine with your lover, how romantic
Great place. You can stop anywhere and enjoy the view, have a picnic, people watch and just take paris in.
a landscape view of Paris. wide sight of best palace of Paris to take a breath or have a ride on a boat (I suggest Canuxrama canal tours)
Gorgeously Romantic. Taking a sunset walk on the Seine could not be more romantic. Pack a picnic, pop a bottle of bubbles and soak in the romance.

Best part of our trip. We had a day cruise out on the Seine and loved it that much we went back again another day for the evening cruise and it was spectacular and definitely the highlight of our trip.
A nice experience. We rid this cruise from a small office near Eiffel Tower. It costed 11 euros per adult. We liked it a lot as it passes through all of the ancient buildings in Paris.
Picturesque. What can you say about this? It is beautiful and wonderful to stroll around.

could it BE more scenic and atmospheric?. Man this is a full time job. I loved it OK? I come from the land of the river Usk. This one is pretty, has landmarks, well-dressed people, nice shops, and whatever people tell you, cheap food unless you've gt a real thing about it.
Taking a Paris tour the easy way.. If you don't like traffic and congested tours, take the boat ride on the river Seine! The night/dusc tour is the best!
Even in the rain the boat cruise is a delight. We had a fabulous ride on the River Seine in one of the bateaux mouche. We had lots of rain, but it was still excellent.

River cruise a must!. We made sure to spend our first evening in Paris on a cruise on the Seine at twilight. We enjoyed a smooth introduction to the attractions that surround the river, as well as a perfectly timed view of the sparkling Eiffel tower. Absolutely a must!

Take a river boat tour. One of the first things we did in Paris was the river boat tour. So glad we did as it got us acquainted with major city sights very quickly. We went with Bateaux Mouches. Although we were among the last to board, there were still many open seats on the upper deck. There was some narration of the sights, be we paid no attention to that. Just gliding down and back up the river and enjoying the views was more than enough for us. This was an afternoon cruise and the weather was just great, so our spirits were high too. I suppose that the city lights at night give you much different views, but in the daytime you can see all the details in the various buildings, museums and monuments. We very highly recommend river cruises.

Lovely watch out for con artist though. Its lovely to walk along and lots and lots to see. Watch out for the con artists though, pretending to find a mens gold band, offer it to you, then asking for money - Its a con!
Lovely to walk. There is so much to see right along this river. Great for walks or bike rides. We saw many people picnicing along the river.
Worth doing. We did a night cruise. There was too much talking to hear the commentary but it was good to see Paris at night. Shame about all the rubbish along the banks and cigarette butts
River views. So romantic. The boats traveling along the river were so picture like.
Wander the river banks. Views to left and right - ornate bridges and many famous sites Take your time - stroll, eat, drink and stroll again

Got to be done. Taking a boat trip down the Seine is a must for any visitor to Paris. In all weathers the boats are plying up and down full of visitors from all nations having a good time. See the sights of Paris from a unique angle, the artery in the heart of the City.

Nice view of Old Paris from the river Seine. This was a nice way to spend our day in Paris after visiting the Eiffel tower. They have 1 hour cruises with enlish audio guides that describe all the important monuments along the seine river. I definitely recommend the cruise, since it gives you an overall view of where important places and neighborhood along the river are. There is also a hop on, hop off boat along the Seine river which we did not have time to go with, but it may be worth checing out.

The Best Cocktail Bar....CASPERS. Caspers is an amazing and one of a kind cocktail bar, I loved it and it made my holiday! The service and cocktail selection was excellent. The decor was quirky and made the bar special. Would defo go back to have have a french blue....fat box and to see Casper!

Great value. We took a Bateau Mouche on a whim and discovered parts of Paris that we would otherwise not have seen. A great way to spend an hour and to appreciate the Seine from a totally different perspective.

River Trip at Night Time. This one dinner to remember. Go for the more upscale and expensive boat. It is unique combination of good food, music and unbelievable views. We had 3 of them and will take more in a future

Paris' Great Attraction. We walked along the riverbank and every few feet there was something new. The views of the monuments were so different from the riverbank, a different experience of Paris, I would suggest this for everyone!
Take the last tour on the river. and you will see the awesome city lit up in all it's glory! worth every penny and the hour of time.

Beautiful scenery. Walking the the river seine was great as there is so much history there, and so much to see. Great to people watch, there are restaurants all along the river, so can always grab a bite or seats to sit and watch . Highly recommended , especially on a beautiful sunny day lol

For a tourist - must do. Paris is beautiful at night from the river. We booked online (Vedettes); the commentary is basic and does not do the views justice, so switch off from listening and enjoy the sights

Interesting and Informative Cruise. This river cruise was an hour long and the student guide was very knowledgeable. The guide gave interesting information about the history of both Paris and France. We enjoyed both the cruise itself and the information about the city. The Seine River cruise is a good way to see a lot of the city in an hour.
Boats and river walks. The dinner cruise boats serve surprisingly good food.
By Boat at night. A boat trip at night was a great way to see the sights and lights of the city. Timing is key.
Cruised in the evening. Don't miss taking a Cruise down the Seine a lot to see and very surprised to see all the people on the banks having picnics and parties ......a fun night !!!

Amazing!. To stroll on the banks of the Seine is like going inside a a romantic story or feel like  in a thriller with the remarkable background of Paris.
Close to the Botanical Garden is a magical garden on the banks of the river and It is also recommended to wander around the islands and watch the river

A cruise down the Seine is a must!. We were told by a number of people to do a cruise down the Seine to really see Paris and I must admit this is true! You can get some incredible photos of the Eiffel tower, Notre Dame.....all the great sights. Especially if your time is limited to a day or 2 in Paris, this is a great way to cram a whole lot in.

The connector of Paris !!!. One can easily call this river the connecting dots for Paris. It basically connects every place in Paris and you can simply enjoy the ride in the huge steamers. Simply amazing experience and worth cherishing.
Experience it!. Very enjoyable. Make sure you choose right boat. We chose Bateaux Mouches and it was Good
A beautiful cliche.. I love rivers and harbours and ports so in my element here, not enough time spent on the river unfortunately.

Great views.. Simply romantic... We had a 1 hour boat ride on the double-decker boat. It was brief and to the point. The views were incredible and it was great to see all the landmarks from the river.

made for lovers !!!!!!!. when i saw the river seine i felt like i found something i was searching for my whole life !!!!!!!! get yourself a bottle of wine and sit there with your love one and enjoy the sun setting !!!!!
Love the river cruise at sunset!. I love to do this on my last evening. Try to time it so you are catching the sunset!!!
A Boat Trip on the Seine. Finally got away from the crowds who husle and jostle you at every Paris attraction.. comfortable boat despite poor weather

Lovely boat trip. We took an 80 minute boat ride (cost about a £10 each) all around the Seine and it was wonderful. Saw so many parts of the city and you really get an amazing view of the buildings from the river. They point out all the landmarks but annoyingly they do it in about 12 languages which can get a bit tiresome after a while.

Excellent les Vedettes du Pont-Neuf. We joined les Vedettes du Pont-Neuf cruise at around 9:30... Enjoyed a lovely sunset scene in Seine. The guide is good. Provide a lot of information about the buidlings around each side. BTW, we bought the ticket online and got some discount.
Boat Ride. Although we did not have time for a boat ride it will be on top of our agenda next trip.

On foot or by boat. The Seine is a great iconic location. Pass time simply strolling along the bank or take a cruise. I never tire of seeing the wonderful landmarks and it provides amazing perspectives across the water for many photo ops.
What views!. Lovely to stand on the bridges on a sunny & look down the Seine with all the famous sights as a backdrop
Nice walk in good weather. Take a nice walk, when the weather is good. Nothing special next to the river, but on the street you can buy some gifts.
a most. i nice river to walk along, several nice bridges to cross the Seine.

Relaxing and scenic. When you visit the Eiffel tower, you will surely be tempted to take a cruise down the river Seine. A one hour cruise costs from Euro 18 upwards depending on what you want included in the package. (drink , snack, etc)....Well priced for the duration and the ambience.The cruise takes you down the river and under 22 of the many bridges across the river. There is running commentary in 3 languages (French, English and Spanish), which is very informative. It covers most of the important attractions like the Notre-Dame, Louvre, Ile de la Cite etc.The bridges are so beautifully architectured and each bridge has a story to tell. The sculptures on each bridge are stunning. When we got off, there was a troupe of performing dancers (male dancers in female costumes) dancing enthusiastically - I guess this is really not a regular feature there.... There are little cafes around the boarding point - so you can grab a snack or coffee too after disembarking.The weather, however, needs to be perfect - we went on a beautiful Saturday evening with the sun shining brightly till late in the night. The very next day however, it was pouring heavily.... So do keep the weather in mind before you make arrangements for this cruise.

A Lovely Way to End the Day. We took a one hour cruise on the Seine and it was a wonderful way to end a tiring day. The views are different from the river and it also assisted us in defining where we wanted to visit on land. Next time--a lunch or dinner cruise!
We loved walking the Seine.. Beautiful scenery...we especially liked the park area on the right bank as you are making your way closer to Notre Dame. Very romantic :)

As romantic as always!. We were walking by the Seine when a spring deluge erupted. It was April in Paris. Our good shoes got sopped. No problem. A nice glass of red wine at a local bistro and we were good to go. The Seine was as beautiful as ever and to stroll along it and watch the boats cruise up and down- c'est la vie!

River Seina. We have one hour round trip on a bout . Wonderful pictutres : Notr dam de Paris, copy of Statue of freedom (gift to America from France). A lot of bridges, wonderful surrounding. One very bad thig-one hour guide (robot) told about trip in French and two sentences in English

Relaxing walk day or night. Something free with no lines! Good lighting after dark in the region of Ile de la Cite with many strollers that contribute to feeling of safety. A good way to settle a large dinner particularly in a small group.
GREAT SEINE RIDE. You have to enjoy a trip down the Seine on a balmy summer's eve with temps of around 30 C. We saw sunset and then the lights go on Eiffel Tower and bridges. Well worth a trip.
super. a must . take a boat ride and see most of the well known sites expensive but a one off really enjoyed.
River boat cruise. Pleasant! Good stops. Lovely views of Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower.
Seine. Walk the embankment, stroll the bridges, enjoy the scenes and character of the different parts.
Great way to see the city. We took a one hour boat tour and it was wonderful the views were amazing and NO lines
Beautiful!. Great place to take pictures! Beautiful in the daytime and at night. Gets very windy when you're walking along the river or if you're in the tour boat.

Batobus. The plexiglass covering of the Batobus was very clean and allowed me to take many photos of interesting buildings from the river - some of which are superb. Eight stops along the Seine, and all of them interesting.

Walking around is magnificent, but also take a boat ride at sunset. We just walked from the Eiffel Tower to Bastille and back in 3 hours on both sides of the river. Magnificent. A sunset boat is also very romantic, a bit cheesy yes, but oh well, sometimes being cheesy is fun
dirty. took the dinner/cruise which was lovely. a most enjoyable moment
Grab a baguette, cheese and some wine. Pick up some bread, wine and cheese, grab a blanket and sit on the banks at sunset, especially with a view of the Eiffel Tower.

DON'T BUS IT ... BOAT IT!. We didn't do the hop on hop off bus, we just booked the trip down the Seine. it's give you a great awareness of the layout of Paris and it was such a lovely trip with excellent photo opportunities. We would really recommend this as an alternative to the bus. You can practically walk Paris anyway so why not start off with a boat ride?

A relaxing hour. Learn a little about Paris on a hour trip along the seine or a longer one with lunch. Where you join the boat there is a little cafe that serves excellent meals at a resonable price. We combined this with going up the Eiffel tower as they are close to each other.

More than a River. I like to wander along the banks of the Seine, camera in hand, clicking away at the ever changing scenarios that appear.People, dogs, boats, bridges, musicians - you name it it's happening here!Return as the evening unfolds and delight in the hundreds of locals and visitors enjoying picnics all along the banks of the River Seine - a special scene on a warm summer's night ...
river boat. We had a wonderful boat tour on the Seine. We bought our tickets ahead of time and walked right on the boat. Tour was informative and a nice length, one hour.

A Beautiful Waterway. Cruising along the Seine River provides a vacationer with a look at the Parisian City and a great deal of its infamous history. Super way to get an overview in a short period of time.

€11,50 well-spent. In case you didn't already know, the Banks of the River Seine are designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and has been for at least a decade now.And the best way to enjoy it for free is to walk along the Rive Gauche (left bank) and Rive Droite (right bank). Or if you wanna be insane, then spend €11,50 and take a Bateaux Mouches river cruise in the Seine. The journey will take an hour and 10 minutes passing under about 20 of the 38 bridges that span the River and allowing you to view the monuments up close. You will head down towards the two islands and circle back towards Eiffel Tower. Can you tell which is the right bank and which is the left, and which is port and which is starboard? =PDuring summer time, there are no illuminations cos of the long daylight hours although the Eiffel Tower is lit after 930pm. Regardless, it's a tradition for me to take the boat each time I am in Paris. It's still the City of Love even if it is not the City of Lights. =)
This river is worth the trip.. The Seine was nice as usual. The boats were fun to ride.

Take a boat ride. If the weather is good, take a boat ride just before it gets dark. Go down the Seine at dusk and watch the city light up when you return. This is a great way to see a lot if you do not have much time. It is also great to do before you wait for the eiffle tour to sparkle - A MUST SEE
It's the River Seine! Come on!. Surrounded by beautiful architecture, crossed by magnificent bridges, navigated by spectacular vessels!............what's not to love!

Good view of many of the main Parisien attractions. I took a river cruise by Bateaux Mouches, and saw many attractions lining the side of the river since historically many places depended on the river for essential transport.To see what lies along the Seine, see:http://www.bateaux-mouches.fr/en/peniches-paris/boat-route-map-15.htmlhttp://www.bateaux-mouches.fr/template/maps/en_roadmap_750.jpgWhile cruising is one very convenient way to enjoy the Seine, I noticed many people opting to walk along it. That would be an experience as well, though obviously it would take very much more time to cover as much as the cruise did.

Hop on the river boat tour for a glimpse of the famous attractions.. A great river tour at night with the backdrop of the Eiffel Tower as well as all the monuments. Better to sit outdoors than in. Though it might be a tad cold in the winter, the view is worth it.Be careful of rats swimming in the river whom might jump aboard the boat.

Save it for a sunny day. Go on a boat tour and see some amazing things along the river Sienne.Be sure to go when it is sunny because only the upper sundeck of the boat offers the visibility that you will be looking for. Save the rainy days for the museums.Even though our boat trip got sabotaged by rain, I would defintley do a tour down the river Sienne if in Paris again.
EASY WAY TO SEE THE RIVER. The river cruise was only for about 1 hour. It is a nice easy way to see this part of Paris and worth the time and money.

Festival Atmosphere. Walking along or just staying put to watch the people go by, almost anywhere along the Seine river is a great place to be. Evenings by the university in the Latin Quarter has a festival type atmosphere with musicians playing and people visiting and dancing.

Take a boat trip. In the past we took the Bateaux Mouche. This time we took a boat in the evening where you embarked beside the Eiffel tower. It was only 12 euro and was very relaxing. You see the main things - the Louvre , the Musee Dorsay, Notre Dame and lots of others. The commentary is in several languages and quite clear. But the boat just went one way up and back, whereas in the past the Bateaux mouches went up to that little version of the Statue of Liberty and back. This boat didn't go up that way. But having said it was lovely. We went at 10 p.m. so we saw the lighting up of the Eiffel Tower at 10 and on our arrival back at 11 also. I can recommend this boat trip.
Join the real parisiens in the evening. Strolled along the Quai Saint Bernard and watched tango on the edge of the Seine
Beautiful bridges.. Nice to take a boat tour downtown Paris to see the monuments and bridges, especially at night. Watch out though. Some of the boats are grossly overcrowded and look top heavy.

Peaceful. This is a beautiful and peaceful river to walk along, I also took a river cruise which explained about all of the bridges.During the day there are lots of stalls along the river selling souveniers and paintings!
lovely. we walked along everyday on our way to eiffel tower, beautiful views, barges and bridges!
Curise on the Seine - a must. lovely relaxing way to see the sights and gives you a chance to rest the feet from all the walking!! we booked online and saved €5 each
Walking and Boat. We took a few cruises on the Seine and also walked around quite a bit. Watch out for Gypsy scam artists!
Evening cruise. We took a late evening cruise so we could see Paris lit up at night! We did not do a dinner cruise.

Great value of money!. This experience was wonderful and definitely worth it! You get to see most of the important sights, at your pace, the boats are frequent, very enjoyable and relaxing! It also saves a lot of time for those on a tight schedule and your feet will be grateful!
A trip up the Seine links all the places to visit together. We selected one of the smaller boats which cruise up and down the Seine and we where very happy with the experience.
Romantic Walks. The River Seine is even more magical at night than it is at daytime. Its pleasant to walk, safe and clean.

Our favorite place to walk is the River Seine. Every time we visit Paris, my husband and I like to stroll down the River Seine hand-in-hand as the sun fades into the distance. [It is important to note that this is after the vendors have closed.] Ahh, such good times. I cannot wait to return to Paris again so that we can enjoy walking down the river once more.
magical. I don't know what it is about this river but it was just magic. I dream of walking along its banks again.Cruising down the Seine at night was one of my favorite things we did
absolutely - yes !!. One of the easiest and cheapest way to sail along the Seine is on the BATOBUS hop-on hop-off boats. 15 Euros for a one day adult pass - very good value.
The famous river. Walked along the seine and the view was good. We even took a few pictures of Musee de Orsay from where we were standing. Occasionally tour boats would pass by carrying passengers...
Take the Seine in and just stroll. Paris in the summer is crowded, but it was the only time we could visit. Walks by the Seine help clear the mind and offer a relief from the crowds.
Its a river, but it feels "special". Nice promanade. Nothing particularly special, but it just felt nice and Parisian. Cool vendors selling antique books and maps on the banks.

batobus. hop on hop off one cost 12 euros and worth it, you can use it all day, finding the area you liked best and going back to spend a little more time if you want, staff on board were very friendly and helpful

Dinner Cruise from pier at Musee d' dorsey. this was really good , although if you like your meat well done make sure you ask , as the choices offered were rare and medium , and the medium would be rare to most british tastes. My friend is vegetarian and they catered for her with no fuss at all, and she said it was very nice.it was a really fun trip , suggest you do the 8.45 as otherwise you would not see Paris lit up which is to my mind the whole point of it. Eiffel Tower was spectacular especially with the added bonus (you have to see it - so I wont spoil the surprise) and was really fun with appropriate music played at certain sights. By the end of the evening the whole cruise was singing along and some were up dancing. The staff were really friendly and appeared to be having as good a time as the guests , quite a feat as it was their second cruise of the evening !! Highly recommended.

You should take the cruise of Bateaux-Mouches there. On the first day of our trip in Paris we took the cruise. Highly recommended. We have took the wonderful photos during the cruise. Metro Alma Marceau - to get there.
Great Ride. We sat outside and saw everything, the ride was smooth. The best bridge was the one with the lovers locks, most romantic
A Must. A marvelous way to see Paris without any effort. Just float along and enjoy the beauty of this city
easy travel to different places. Easy and cheap to get up and down paris. Also the arch bridges are beautiful.
Tip. Save your $$$ and get a boat bus all day pass and you can frequent up to 8 key tourist locations...you will get to see experience the River Seine too.
Great cruise. If in Paris this is a must as it shows the centre of Pasis from the river....Awesome

the lifeline of Paris. Enjoying views of the river from various bridges and monuments is a favourite activity for us during our Paris trips. This is best appreciated by walking extensively across the bridges in the city and if you want to see the city from the river take one of the numerous river cruises. If possible, take the cruise by day and night to see how the monuments come alive at different times of the day..

A WALK ALONG THE SEINE. We walked along the Seine from Nortre Dame Cathedral to the Eiffel Tower. A distance yes, but so worth your while! Just enjoy the river, the boats, the bridges, all the other sightseeings and the artists along the way. When you get to the Eiffel tower, buy yourself a chocolat crepe, sit down in the library gardens, and simply enjoy being there...
Boat trip from near Eiffiel Tower. Ideal opportunity to see Paris centre & select where you want to go afterwards. The Audio Guides give good info.Only 1 hour or so.
Dinner and sightseeing. We took the river tour and dinner package, the sights were wonderful, the food was good. The staff indifferent.
Bateau Mouche. We had dinner on the boat while cruising on the river for 2 1/4 hours. It was a very special experience and the food was lovely.

Wonderful views of Paris. The river seine trip was well worth taking. Seeing Paris from the river is a wonderful way to see it. I didn't think much of the narrative because I couldn't hear it with the sounds aboard the boat. The trip was relaxing after a day of constant walking.
Beautiful. We took a Batobus tour around the River Seine and really enjoyed the beauty of the history on each side.
River cruises are very relaxing. Bateaux Mouche cruises are inexpensive and a relaxing way to unwind and give your legs a break.

A must do trip day and night. A trip on the Seine with one of the boat companies is a must for all visitors to Paris. Last time we visited we could not fit it in, this trip we did it during the day and were so impressed we did the 10 pm cruise - Paris by night has a different perspective. The view from the Seine is different to walking the streets or riding the Metro, so is amuse for all visitors.

Bateaux Mouches. Fantastic evening dinner cruise. It had such potential to be tacky but it was brilliant, from the welcome at check-in to the bottle of chilled Blanquette on board. The service, views, music and atmosphere were great. Highly recommended and well worth the 99-125Eur pp.

The artery of Paris. We took a 1h boat trip on the Seine with Bateau Mouche. It's a nice way to see the city. Although, I did not quite like the concept of the whole boat trip. A microphone voice is telling you what you are supposed to see in 8 languages, and if you are not familiar with the city, you can only guess what they are talking about. Otherwise it was a nice experience. A walk at the riverside (between Tuileries and Eiffeltower) is not very exciting/beautiful, there are nicer riversides...

beautiful river!. I loved this river. It weaves all through the middle of Paris. I definitely recommend a boat cruise. I did one, and it was wonderful. I did it at night (which I definitely recommend!), and it's a great way to get a new perspective on the city and see a lot more of it. Since I went in March, it was a bit chilly when you were on the top which is uncovered, but the view makes the temperature definitely worth it. They also have recordings playing in many different languages informing you on the things you're seeing.

Sunset.... You may choose to do this at night, but I would say time it for sunset, as the light is amazing from the river. If you want to get some real good photos then this would also be the time - also most romantic!

The Best Overview of Paris. Before you start visitng specific sites, it was great to see Paris from the Seine River, helping us to see the location of attractions we wanted to visit. Many of the most visited attractions are visible from the Seine.
This is the famous River Seine?!!. I thought it would be much larger and more impressive. The people watching is outstanding though, and what better way to see all the bridges than on a boat ride?

Walk the river banks!. The Seine divides the city into the Left Bank and the Right Bank but the river also unites the city. To really appreciate Paris, spend a day walking up one bank and back the other. I did that in my younger days, and walked a good 20 miles in the process.

Be sure and cruise it!. A great way to get an overview in a relaxing way! You can catch a sightseeing cruise easily most days. It's also fun just to stroll along it and cross the bridges. You really felt French walking along here and viewing the artists that are out sometimes.

Interesting tour, great guide.. Booked a tour on the Seine through Vedettes du Pont Neuf. An hour and a half tour past all the main attractions with a French guide who spoke well in English too (although we had to put up with an annoying English couple behind us, who criticised her accent!! Quite annoying).The tour was interesting and well organised so I would recommend booking through this company.
Use th hop-on hop-off to tour. The river flows through the heart of Paris. The best way to see it is with a hop-on hop-off boat that stops at the major sights.

Beware of scams and pickpockets!. No couples trip to Paris is complete without walking along the Seine and buying a locket on one of the footbridges to inscribe your lover's name alongside yours. Do be vigilant at all times! There are scam artists watching. Do not stop to talk to anyone that claims to have found a gold wedding ring. We had two individuals on two different days stop us with this claim, and we had the smarts to ignore them and keep walking. We searched the Internet later to see if other travelers mentioned this, and there are scads of stories cautioning travelers to not stop and talk to these scammers. Some are trying to distract you for another to pick your pockets, and some claim that religious beliefs prevent them from wearing jewelry, so they want to give it you you and then hound you for monetary remuneration.

City of Light~ Night Boat Tour. Took a Boat tour of the River through Bateaux Mouche. The cruise afforded beautiful views of Paris ~ The city of lights. The tradition is that you scream & wave as you pass under bridges~ Ditto on bridge crossers~ Got a bit annoying. So it wasn't the most romantic way to go.... But beautiful none the less. Try to go on the top of the hour to see the Eiffel Tower twinking lights. WOW!
Beautiful views. The boat leaves across from the Eiffel Tower. Great views of the city from here.
Dinner Cruise. This was a very pleasant experience, relaxing and picturesque. The dinner wasn't great but the experience as a whole was good.
River cruise. A beautiful boat ride and enjoy a phenomenal way to learn about and watching the river with a large number of sites.Recommend everyone to go to this wonderful one-hour cruise
get up early!. Hop on and off using the riverboat service but avoid crowds by turning up early. Sundays have no service

Relaxing. Loved this part of Paris we arrived early to beat the usual french que and were quite supprized that we had and so boarding was made very easy and we were on our way on a what I must say is a very leasurly cruise down the Siene river .The comentary was exellent even if we did have to wait for the english version to come around before we could understand it , but all in all we absolutly enjoyed this part of our Paris tour , very informative and worth the 12 euros that we payed per person .Good value as the cruise goes for 1 hour and gets you out of the rat race traffic that has become Paris .Peter and Sue
Great way to see the sights. if you don't get the Paris Pass, book the hop on hop off bus and boat package..... great way to get around
River Full of Monuments!. Did the River Tour, Its amazing how almost all Palaces, Landmarks and Important Buildings are situated on the seine, idilllic photos can be taken

Trip down the river was a highlight!. We took a boat trip from the bottom of the eiffel tower with a company that charged around 12eu, and left every half and hour or so. We went at around 8pm. Paris really does look differently from the river and we really enjoyed our 1hour long cruise with comentary. Just as we arrived back at the eiffel tower it was getting dark and we had amazing views and photo opportunities.
The best river in Europe. Explore the bridges. walk its riverside avenues. ride the boats. my hotel room had a great view of the river and the liberty statue.

Lunch on the Banks of the Seine.. How romantic that sounds. We bought take-aways from very clean Vendors, freshly made and found a quiet place to sit on the Bank of the Seine and enjoy watching the barges and other river traffic going past. Just absorbing the ambience and beauty of the trees. The River was not that clean, but it did not matter, just being there was enough to make the time spent worthwhile.

Nice on a night boat tour. I took a boat tour that started at 9pm and ended close to midnight. It was nice to see the Seine while it was still light. I was amazed at how many people live in riverboats. What a life! When it got dark, all the lights made it look like a different city. Very beautiful!

Gargoyles and padlocks!. We took the evening river boat trip and it was marvellous. So many sites along the banks. The superb comentary was available in several languages using a strange hand held metal speaker. Next time we would probably like to have the dinner cruise trip.
Nice cruise. We took this cruise along the river and enjoyed every minute of it. Another way of discovering Paris.
a lovely sailing trip on the seine. We took the batobus, which gave us the possibility to get on and off, severel times, and visit severel places. A very good expirince.
Lovely walk. Had a lovely walk by it. We decided to stop and have a beer at one of the bars. A bit disorganised and very expensive.
Beautiful!. Nothing pleased us more than going for a stroll along the Seine, both during the day and at night. Lovely site!
a night tour on the river is recommended. even it's cold in april in paris, a night tour on the river, with or without dinner is both recommended, to discover seine at night!

Life Flow of Paris. I love cities built around rivers ... And most of the old ones are. It's orienting for tourists, and most of the historic buildings are nearby. We are staying in the oldest part of Paris - the Latin Quarter, left bank. It's an easy walk to the Seine and the grounding centerpiece of the city - Notre Dame. The bridge we cross to Ile de la cite (one of the two islands in the Seine & the one that Notre Dame is on) is the bridge with the love locks (a colorful variety of padlocks added by lovers from around the world). In two days we've already seen brides on the bridge being photographed, students picnicking beside the water, and varios tourist boats traversing the waterway. Our favorite was a boat playing loud upbeat music while a Zumba class danced wildly on deck! The bride between Ile de la cite and Ile St Louis (the second small island) is one that's always full of performance artists -usually musicians. We've even seen two pianos rolled out on the bridge for a jazz ensemble. Visual artists also set up to sketch those walking by. Many of the big museums are on the Seine - such as the Louvre and the D' Orsay. Great photo ops are had from the opposite banks from these magnificent structures. .We plan to take an evening boat ride before we leave to see the "city of lights" at her best (though in early June its light until 10 pm). The Seine is a great place to begin and end your trip to Paris.

The heart of Paris. Take one of the river cruises with guided commentary along the Seine on your first day in Paris. It's well worth it for an overview of this beautiful city from the river that gives it life.
The river with a thousand bridges over it.. There's nothing not to like. The river, its banks, the bridges (beautiful and impressive) crossing it, the magnificent buildings reflected in it.
Take a river trip in good weathe.. enjoy a leisurely cruise, sip some wine, view the sites and have a narrated tour that is informative, relaxing and very worth while.

Gorgeous!. If you are in Paris, strolling the River Seine is an absolute must! I would suggest visiting a few times for a stroll as its beauty changes throughout the day. In the morning, afternoon, evening and at night its beauty transforms and is absolutely wonderful. The view of the Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower are absolutely gorgeous too. The bouquinnistes are also wonderful to look at too! If you have time I would reccommend the boat ride tour!

First thing to do when you arrive in Paris. A boat tour on the Seine River is an ideal way to start your vacation in Paris. The tour is about 1 hours and helps you identify some of the major sights in Paris. Cost is 12 euro per person. Well worth it.

Evening cruise on the Seine in a different "light". An evening cruise on the Seine is a good way of appreciating the banks & activity on the river in a different context. We took one of the bateau mouche leaving from Pont Neuf (the "new" bridge completed in 1608). I guess what makes the difference between the cruises is the on board tour guide. Ours was a young lady that was new to the job and probably worked twice as hard to answer questions and deliver her comments. The pay isn't great so make sure you leave a tip. It can get windy on the river and if you're in an open section bring something for the conditions. Overall very enjoyable and worthwhile
Just a river. It's a river... It looks nice, but ultimately it's just a river...
Take an engraced love padlock with you!. Enjoy walking along the river side..and take an engraced love padlock with you to attach on the railings of Pont des Arts!

Great to look at and wander around the area. Being around Paris is an experience in itself - in most trips there isn't time to visit every attraction but part of the fun and the beauty here is to walk between attractions crossing the bridges over the Seine and simply enjoying the view. There are also plenty of cafes and shops to look at as you walk around.

An obligatory tour. It is pretty hard to be a first time visitor to Paris and not do the river cruise. Some things one just has to do. That stated, if you are short of time, there are better ways to use your time. An extra hour or two in the Louvre would be my recommendation.

C'est formidable!. How can anyone not like the Seine? It's such a wonderful experience strolling beside it - especially on the Left Bank with the views of the Louvre, the Ile de la Cite and Ile Saint Louis and Notre Dame. And the there are the bouquinnistes with their green boxes. While I've given up finding a first edition of Balzac, or an autographed Gide, there's still a wide selection of literature both French and American (in French. The French must like John Steinbeck judging from the number of his works I've seen). Back to the river itself though, the last time I was there (May, 2012), someone must have fallen in judging from the number of police boats I saw going by. On calmer days, you can watch seagulls or ducks.
Boat trip. You have to go down the seine you see all the landmarks from another angle and its so relaxing
Boat ride recommended. Weather was great which helped but a great way to see some of the sights and get a feel for Paris

Beautiful by night. We took a cruise in the evening and the experience was great. You can see the buildings with lights and the Eiffel tower that looks even bigger whilemis lighted in the night. Everything on the shore looks different when is night time, more romantic
Boat trip up the Seine a must do. Enjoyed our boat trip up the Seine. Did it during the day but would have liked to go back at night but ran out of time. Magical

a nice cool way to spend an afternoon. Take a boat ride on the "Bateaux" and experience a beautiful scenic trip up the Seine. You will see different neighborhoods in different "arrondisements", as well as experiencing the canals and underground tunnels of Paris.

Grand bridges. It had all the side shops selling paintings and post cards which gave a quaintness to Paris and as one would imagine it to be. The ferry ride on the Seine takes you around all the places one intends to visit and see at length while visiting Paris. Walking along the quay and along the river is a fine and pleasant experience
Like 2 Days in Paris. Just like the Movie, a Boat trip is a must, to sit back and take in the surroundings!
Paris Pass. This pass gets you a free tour down the river!!! do it!

Nice to Walk Along the River Seine. The River Seine snakes around the city or Paris. Alot of beautiful bridges along the way. Nice to take a cruise on the river, especially at night going past the Eiffel Tower when it sparkles. Took alot of nice strolls along the river.
so parisean. took the seine cruise aboard the bateau parisean. was well organized and interesting commentary. was truly a high point of the trip, would probably be nicer at night

Les Vedettes du Pont Neuf. We arrived early into Paris and had to wait to get into our apartment so wandered down to the Seine to have a look around. We spotted the Les Vedettes tour boats traveling up and down the Seine, so decided that would be a great way to get a first view of the city. We enjoyed it very much, and it helped orientate us to the city, for our next 3 days of walking and sight-seeing.

Constantly changing. A stroll along the river, in any of the many places where sidewalks are available, will allow you to see the river, its bridges, the boat traffic, the city, and other people in a different way. Standing on a bridge and watching the flow of river traffic offers great photos, with one or another of the many monuments of Paris in the background. In my view, a boat ride sounds good but proves frustrating in practice. You are very low on the river, and often can only catch a glimpse of the tops of monuments, and other buildings lining the river.
Suprising what you can see!. Grab a River Tour to see most of Paris's Jewels. There are lots to choose from at the foot of the Eiffel Tower.
Saturday night cruise. river cruise was great as the sun was setting, commentary not always in teh correct place

batobus. We took a weekend ticket for the batobus, so we could hop on and off. Itwas great cruising along the river in the early evening seeing all the groups picnicking on the banks of the river. We also used it in the afternoon as a place to sit and rest. On one evening we cruised up to the eiffel tower to see it lit up.

Cruise Along the Seine to see Paris. We took a river cruise and loved seeing Paris from the water. The Seine snakes its way through the city and gives you great views of some of the best buildings and monuments.

how do you review such an extensive attraction?. Is the commercial artery of a city and has been for many centuries.The left and right banks are created by it and this defines the development of modern Paris.Is the second longest river in France at 480 miles/780 kms so seriously would not expect it to be clean, are critics on this site being very unrealistic. There are37 bridges over the Seine in Paris each with it's own history, character and appeal, how can these be reviewed as one entity? Since 2002 parts have been classed World Heritage sights, so it can't be that bad. Being in Paris for 3 weeks I walked the river from Parc Monceau in the west to Bercy in the east, on different days. The views have been a look at the history of Paris and it's architecture , culture and soul. End of sermon!
Pleasant River Trip. Took about 1.5hours and was a lovely trip up and down the river taking in a lot of sights. Avoid the very front or very back of the boat or you will get swamped by photographers.
Good to take a stroll by the Seine. Don't take the dinner cruise. Take a stroll. You will enjoy it much better.A must on a sunny after noon.

Breathtaking views.... We took a trip down the Seine after exchanging some tesco club card vouchers!! We got on board just at the right time as not too packed and got a seat easily so about 10.30 is the perfect time.The views are amazing and you literally get to see everything all at once and getting some of the history behind it. Takes about an hour and you get to see the Louvre, Notre Dame, The Eiffel Tower, The National Assemblie, Arc De Triomphe, The Cenetaph and the 32 bridges that go over it - each with a bit of history attached.We chose a nice day and so sat on the top deck and it was lovely to sit and relax while hearing about some of the lesser known facts about the history of Paris. I think we used Bateaux des Vedettes - company. Can't fault them.This is the one thing I wouldn't have missed in the whole trip to Paris...

Romantic. Nothing like a walk along the bridges and walkways of the Seine River. So romantic. If you sit along the shore you get the feeling like you're in the days of old. Riverboat cruises constantly move up and down the river. Many of the Parisian locals enjoy the walk along this river and you can see local artists and musicians.

Night time cruise. What a wonderful way to see Paris at night! The locals wee out on the banks, dancing, gathering and gettinginto some mischief! A different wasy to see the area and learn about some more of the history. The audio phones were not working the greatest however.
ye. aw so cute! everyone waves at you going by - it's so fun! We met loads of people on it too. It allows you to have a preview of Paris from the water and a man explains it all so it's dead good
Over rated. The Seine cruises were too pricey for my budget but it shouldn't be bad. Besides I found the river too tiny to spend much time on. Crossed it a few times while visiting other monuments.

Bateaux Mouche Cruise. This is a really good way to see Paris in an hour & half for eleven euro's. It's also a great way to give your feet a rest & see some sites that maybe you won't get to in a short visit. Views of Notre Dame were my favourite.

A visit to Paris without an evening cruise is incomplete. A Seine River cruise is a good, relaxing way to end a long travel day from abroad. It also allows one to see major sites and help decide what to see in the ensuing days of the visit.
Great Walk!!. It is a great experience to walk along the Seine both next to the river itself, and above along the street.
Do it when the lights come on!. Loved cruising the Seine at night... Fun to see the lights of Paris come on.

Be sure to take a cruise on the river but. check out the "boat" you are on. Some are gigantic floating barges which you have to sit on a small seat. When the barge is crowded, you can't get good photos because of all of the people standing on the side of the barge. But, don't miss this cruise in Paris!

Great Way to See Paris. We took one of the boat cruises on the Seine--ours was an hour long--and thoroughly enjoyed looking at the city from our seated position while not having to walk, walk, walk. The narrative was very informative and the sound system was clear.

Avalon Seine-Normandy River cruise. Just beautiful, especially when the sun shines! Passing all the beautiful little towns and stopping at some of them was so much fun. You haven't seen France if you haven't seen the countryside, it is beautiful.

A must, preferably at night. A work colleague and I had one night in Paris and neither of us had been there before and thought an hour long cruise down the Seine would give us a good flavour of the city.We opted for a cruise with a glass on champagne for €18, but you can just do the cruise for €12. They also offer ones with some food, but I wouldn't bother from what I could see was on offer once we were on the boat. The champagne was of decent quality though and worth the extra €6.We got on the boat at 10:30pm and I would definitely recommend seeing the Seine at night. All along the Seine there were hundreds, if not thousands of young people (late teens to 20's I'd say) sociallising with a bottle of wine and maybe a bit of food. There were more and more of them the closer we got to Notre Dame. There was music and a wonderful atmosphere created by them.We did the first part of the boat trip on the top of the boat, listening to the recorded sightseeing tour and then when the boat turned round we went downstairs for our champagne and sat out on the front of the boat.It was a lovely warm night and a lovely experience I plan to repeat when I go back with my husband.

Romantic at night!!!. If you are on a budget!!!! Go to the supermarket and grab a bottle of wine..... $1.00 a bottle in the supermarket and grab a sandwich from the boulangerie. Grab someone special and look and listen to all the Parisian sights and sounds. Check out the beautiful bridges, the people and all the Paris ambience...... J'adore Paris!!!
River boats. Take a river trip and see Paris from the river,a great way to relax after sightseeing.
A body Missing and dirty. We walked along the river. The police were diving lookingfor a missing person. There was rubbish along the sidewalks from the night before. Vomit near a bush. Yuk!

Busy. I was impressed with the way Parisians use the river and river bank. In the afternoon and evening there were always groups of people sitting, drinking, eating and just enjoying the river. Lots of river traffic and always something to see.

Fantastic. Just go to the Batobus, and for 15 Euros a day you can hop on and hop off at key points. You can also see so much of the beauty of Paris and the Seine on this tour. Its gorgeous and you can do it all day.
http://www.batobus.com/english/Batobus-navettes-promenade-paris-seine-tarifs.htm
Beautiful. Walk next to the River Seine at sunset, or sunrise. You can even take a short boat ride.
Night cruise. A wonderful experience very romantic which is what Paris is all about
Batobus as DIY boat. Tour and taxi. We used the day pass for a quick do it yourself water tour and also as a taxi to see Ile St Louis and nearby sights. Easy, on time, plant of seats.

Got dirtier - too many vendors spoil views. There are so many vendors with storage boxes, that they spoil the view of the Seine and buildings. It's unfortunate. Also, it seems much dirtier than 15 years ago when I last visited.
So many views..... As you walk along the Seine there are so many things you shouldn't miss...the bridges, the people, the statuary. Don't miss taking the time to breathe it all in.
Beautiful sights. My family and I took the Bateaux-mouche (not sure if im spelling it right) cruise at night and it was absolutely breathtaking.

Not to be missed!. A walk along the River Seine is not to be missed while in Paris! The variety of bridges, the house boats, the river cruise boats, locals and travelers enjoying the sun ... We spent a half day just strolling and enjoying the sights. Great place to capture some fantastic photos!
Lots to see & do. Batobus gives you great views but on a hot day it is hot! No river breeze on the boat!

Bateau Mouche at nite. The pros are that it is a wonderful way to view the Eiffel Tower at dark and Parisian buildings along the river. Owners boats are tied up and so unusual in their designs People are everywhere sharing wine and meals on the banks and parties abound everywhere. The ambience is lovely on the boat.The only negative is the food...Not good for the most part. If one goes without the dinner, I think it is a wiser choice.There is lovely service but forego the dinner even if champagne and wine are included in the price.
lover´s river. A romantic place. Take a boat and you can enjoy a romantic trip. Cross the river trough the bridges and bring a lock to fasten forever your love
Best way to see the City. We took a boat from the Eiffel tower and its really the best way to see the sights. Cost was reasonable at 29 Euros for two adults and a child..

river cruise - meh.... we went at night... firstly, we were overrun by people walking around the boat and standing everywhere you would want to look and my fiance litterally got camera's given to him to take pictures for people (no asking, please, thank you - very rude), so we decided to move seats -then, after about 15 - 20 minutes, i was bored. Couldn't see much from the river, it is quite low down and the banks very high (not like in London where you can see everything from the river), maybe in the day time it's different, but I wouldn't recommend it to be honest.

A make believe beach in summer time. Visiting Paris in summer time had the added advantage of a fantastic man-made beach along the river! The additions of giant, surreal beach chairs which can accommodate 3-4 people was a welcome surprise.
Really fabulous at night. We got a boat at the Eiffel tower and took the one hour loop around the st Louis island, the sights along the siene are fantastic....really glad we did this!

Romance isn't dead. Well what can you say about a river I hear you ask. Even though we had our 2 kids with us one of the most romantic things we've ever done was walk hand in hand along the river. Don't know how they do it but it really is a magical place.

the walk is wonderful. We walked from Notre Dame to the Eiffel Tower, while it was a very long walk, I was able to capture many pictures of prominent sights along the way and the view of the tower from this side is also spectacular.
Eat. The food was good, and the ride was a great time. Enjoy and then go out for a great night.

Romantic Seine. I took a river cruise along the Seine and was able to see the sights from a different angle. Even the Eiffel Tower looked different from the River. The cruise was an hour long. The only thing wrong was that the headphone was not working (it was kind of like a corded telephone) so I didn't always know what I was looking at. Good thing I had already seen many sights the 2 days previously. The company was Bateaux Parisiens. The cost was 12 Euros and it departed from the base of the Eiffel tower and ended back at the Eiffel tower with the amazing view. I recommend you go near the end of the day but while it is still light outside so the sunlight dances on the water. Very pretty and romantic. People on the shore wave at you. You can see people on Ile de la Cite and Ile St. Louis along the shore which made me go back there and enjoy the park/shore. People picnic there and just hang out. I saw ducks and even a swan in the Seine. If you just walk along the Seine, there are some parts that smell like urine. Homeless people often sleep under bridges. You can see sleeping bags and their belongings. I didn't feel in danger though. Maybe at night, I would have felt differently. If you take pictures along the Seine, they all look postcard perfect.

River Seine boat tour. We took the boat cruise at night and it was lovely to see the lights of the city, the boat goes down past the Eiffel Tower so you get the classic night view all lit up. My one disappointment was that I was hoping to learn more from the tour and even though we were sitting right next to the guide we could not understand anything she said, it was all a monotone and completely ignored by everyone talking all around. So yes for the visual experience, no for the tour part of it all.
Great restaurants for lunch. Stop by any of the "boats" docked along side for a great lunch. There is one by the Notre Dome Cathedral that is wonderful
nice. nice for having a tour on bateau mouche or vedette. nice view with time to rest
Take a cruise (and dinner). Is well worth it, specially if you take the 9 pm or later cruises.
Cruise is awesome!. The cruise on this river was a fantastic experience. Would definitely do it again.

"Romantic Stroll". It was wonderful to walk along the Seine with my Husband. Amazing how fast the current is. You can see wonderful sites from this venue. Sort of the water view!!! They do have boat trips but we did not have the time to do one. Will definately do, next trip.

Take a cruise. We took the Bateaux Mouches boat and had a great time. Note that there are stairways in the rear of the boat, so you can cut through the downstairs seating to get upstairs in the rear rather than waiting for everyone to cram up the stairs in the front of the boat.
River Seine. This river can take you to the most fascinating places and attractions of Paris. Highly recommend a boat trip on it!

Beautiful and lovely to walk or take a river cruise at any time of the day.. Even though it was raining when my husband and I visited Paris, it couldn't stop us from a seine river cruise. I strongly recommend the "autobus" where you can get on and get off at your leisure in a one day period all for one price. It really gives you a perspective of the city in one day, and allows you to do a lot if time is an issue for your travel to Paris.

A lovely River. But the boat was full of elementary children who talked constantly, making so much noise we could not hear the narration of what we were passing. Perhaps take the ride at night without so many kids. Must have been a school holiday!

Great Place To Walk and Roller Blade. Great place to walk and roller blade. lots of places to rent bikes and roller blades. Lots of bike paths that follow both sides of the Seine. Many parks, green spaces, coffee shops and places to pick up snacks to eat by the river. Many roads by the Seine are open to bikes and walkers only on Sundays. Parisians love to picnic by the Seine

Don't Forget the Seine!. You cannot forget the Seine. There are many river cruises. It really gives you another way to see Paris. The boats are very stablized, giving you a smooth ride. Even if you get seasick, you'll be fine. Try to sit on top for the best photo taking opportunity.

Heart of an Ancient City. Take a boat trip on the Seine for unforgettable views of Notre Dame Cathedral, the Eiffel Tower and the many beautiful bridges spanning the river. In summer you will also see many sunbathers on the banks of the Seine. A world heritage site not to be missed.
a non forgetable time. i enjoyed my visit to the seine rever specially afternoon time and under the bridge near by effil tower area. a fantastic view .

Gorgeous walk through history. Look past the odd homeless person who may be splayed out having a nap and revel in the promenades along the historic Seine. In nice weather, put on your walking shoes and walk as much of the city as you can.
looks wet enough i guess.... ...and after all what can you ask of a river?there are cool book stalls and such of course.
A cruise is a must. A cruise, preferably one in the day and one by night to appreciate its beauty and that of the city on its banks.
Walk along the River Seine. A stroll along the River Seine is a wonderful adventure!

on and on and on .... We did the river and canal tour, starts near the Orsay and goes up river to the entrance to the canal that goes under and through Paris. It was a high ok, mostly because the talker/worker was so interesting. Spoke well and worked her b--- off! The trouble is the concept itself: most of the trip is spent in the locks which are interesting, to a point. There are just too many of them and it gets to to be same ole same ole fairly quickly. And there are the tunnels. Too many, too long. Another quirk, if you want to do a sail by of the Eiffel Tower, this ain't it. That's in the other direction. The boat could go down river a bit, but it doesn't. And Notre Dame, well, that's nearly straight up and you see the towers but you can do that on just about any bridge in Paris. Glad we did it but wouldn't do it again.

Night cruise was great. We did the night cruise, it was about an hour and half cruise, just lovely for night time photos.. we sat outside as the night was mild and the crowds on the bridge and sitting on the banks all waved and sang... it was lovely
very wide. we did the night cruise and this was very good with all the buildings and the tower lit up very impressed

Boat tour worth one trip. We've been to Paris before without taking the river tour. It is a different way to see Paris and worth the 45-60 minutes of the ride. As a note, if you arrived in Paris via the EuroStar train, you may be able to use you train ticket to receive a discount on the river tour.

Take the river cruise - day or evening. We have taken the cruise both at night and during the day, both were great. It's a fun way to see some of the sigths in Paris and also just sit back, relax and enjoy yourself for an hour. After all that walking around in the city, you deserve a break!

River Cruises. Dinner cruise by night; fabulous.
Daytime sightseeing was brilliant, but the commentary was not clear.

Sailing in Paris. I am attracted to water and boats and there is no better way to sail on the River Seine than taking a trip on the Batobus. Buy a a season ticket as it works out much cheaper than a single trip. We bought a five day ticket. Whichever ticket you buy be it a one day or more you can get on and off at the stops this river bus makes at all the most important places you would want to see in Central Paris. To get back on the boat just wait 20 minutes or so at any Batobus stop, all the way from the Eiffel Tower to the turning point at Jardin des Plantes. The boat then returns to the Eiffel Tower.

Batobus. We went on the river seine on the batobus which is like 11 or 12 euros each to hop on and off where and when you like to see the tourist attractions of paris. its really lovely and a great way to see paris.

Boat tours are worthwhile. The Seine isn't particularly beautiful (polluted and brown are better adjectives). But it's surrounded by beautiful urban scenery.I'd recommend a river boat tour early in your stay in Paris. It will take you by some of the main attractions of the city, and give you a sense of scale and orientation for future explorations. We took a tour on a relatively small boat, docked just below the Eiffel Tower. The tour took an hour, cost about 12 euros per person, and was enjoyable because the small boat was not too crowded.
