Such a beautiful place.... So sad the water is polluted. Still a must see. The street vendors, the bridges, etc...

Taking a boat down the Seine. such a stunning way to see Paris... lots of options but we took boat that operated as a bus - hop on hop off. Moves slowly- limited commentary but one does not need it as things are well signposted on maps. 15Euro per person.

Vedettes PontNeuf guided tour. A great way to see the city on a sunny day and orientate yourself before planning your itinerary on foot! Cost 12 euros each w tourist coupon, good value with live commentary in English and French. Very efficient booking system and regular departures. Grab a beer from the deck bar before you take off!

Batobus. A good way to see Paris and the Seine especially if you are not good on your feet. You can get on and off as much as you want in a day-last boat 9.00pm you can stay on all day if you want. It stops at all the popular sites Eiffel Tower, Musee D'Orsay, Notre Dame etc. Costs E15 for a day but E18 for 2 days. Boats arrive at stops about every 15-20 minutes. Only bad thing no shelter if you are waiting in the rain.

Ah, la Seine!. Whether you are alone or with your love or friends, how can you not enjoy your stroll on the quais!Always something to discover. On nice days bring your pique nique and enjoy the view, wave to the tourists on the bateaux moochesIf only the city of Paris could keep the waters cleaner!
batobus. spectacular though warm.... being on the water! part of the L'Open Tour. batobus and reg bus quite nice/convenient.
River Boat. This is a great way to get to see Paris from all sides. Take the ride on the docks right in front of the Eiffel Tower. They run every 20 minutes all day. Just purchase the boat tickets !

Take a river ride. Take an evening river ride. Very cool after dark. Don't fret to bring from home a padlock. People attach them to the many bridges that cross the Seine. "a lovers in Paris" romantic thing. My wife looked forward to it. She signed the lock with our names and date of our visit

Oui! A must see!!. How can you go to Paris and not meander along its banks? I've also taken one of those river boats at sunset which I have mixed feelings about. On the cool side, you get to float down the Seine and see a lot-including the Eiffel Tower being lit up against the dusk skies, Notre Dame and more. On the not-so-cool side, these boats often become booze cruises filled with loud raucous partying teenagers. There are other dinner boat cruises which are likely calmer more idyllic ways to float down the historic Seine if you're interested in a little cruise. I also recommend grabbing a baguette, cheese and a bottle of wine and wandering down for a little picnic on the edge late afternoon or early evening. You'll find many others will be doing the same...join the crowd!
Relaxed. I don't speak any French so if u want to take a tour along the river just ignore the attendant and enjoy the view lol

I Love Walking Along the Seine!. There are literally miles of walkways along the Seine. Some sidle up to some of the busiest traffic in Paris, but that does little to dampen views of the river. There is an intimate park at water level just west of Pont Neuf that may be my favorite. It can only be accessed from the middle of the bridge on the west side, down narrow stairs. There is another small park on the south bank opposite ile de la cite that is also rather nice and more modern. There is a great walk along the barges on the north side of the river just beyond the obelisque. All these places get you away from traffic noise.Pont Solferino is a pedestrian only bridge communicating with the center of the Tuileries that shouldn't be missed.

Lovely view of historic sites - many lit at night. We took an evening tour and liked that the buildings were lit on the way back to the dock near Eiffel Tower. Tower lit-up shortly after our retun too.

Time well-spent in any weather. We took Bateau Parisiens, included with the Paris Pass. The commentary gives context - even the music was worth listening to. Interesting to get a different perspective.

Forget the cruises, take a nice stroll along the Seine!. Took a beautiful walk along the banks of the Seine, as I headed towards the Notre Dame Cathedral. Gives a completely different perspective on many of the sites. Well worth the walk!
1st night in Paris, a must trip. beautiful way to begin one's trip after arriving in Paris on one of the many tour boats that travel the Seine almost non-stop

Poor River Seine. I was disappointed to find out how Dirty the River was, there is absolutely no awareness or responsibility to preserve and Keep Clean, very Sad , the River deserves much much better than this, Plastic bags, Beer cans, Wine bottles are lined up along the shores :(:(

Nice river walk but............ We went on the boat tour and its not worth it. Its very crowed and all you can see is the tops of the buildings (we had to sit inside) maybe if you got on the upper outside deck it would be better but it was a waist of time for me

Canal Cruise. A great way to want to spend half a day in Paris is to visit the the Pere-Lachaise Cemetery in east Paris where you can see the graves of Jim Morrison, Chopin, Sarah Bernhardt, and many others. It is shaded and a wonderful place to stroll for an hour or so. Then take the Metro to Juares and take the Paris Canal cruise on the Canal Saint-Martin, which takes you through several locks, past Notre Dame, onto the Seine, and ends near the Musee d'Orsay. It is a very scenic, relaxing half day.
Night cruise. Take the night cruise just before 10pm: it is around 1 hour in length and you will see the Eiffel light show twice, both at 10 and 11pm. Worth the late night!

Boat Trip was really good!!. This was the first thing I did when I reached Paris. We took the boat troip around 10 pm and it was really nice. You could see all the monuments and its even better and calm at night and less crowded. The commentary that they give during the cruise was also very good. It gave me an overview of where things were and then I knew exactly where I wanted to start from the next day. Have fun!!
good view of city sights. We enjoyed a cruise on the River Seine (just under an hour). It was lovely and gives a different view of the city sights with an interesting commentary in about 4 languages

River Seine - Boat Ride. The River pretty much "inhabits" most of Paris; so, no matter where you go, you will have a view of it. I would recommend, however, taking one of the river cruises BEFORE you start sightseeing; it is an inexpensive way to have points of interest pointed out to you and (through free audio-guides) the relevance explained.
Take a cruise. They offer audio cruise tours down the seine. Its fun, relaxing and you get to hear a little about things you wouldn't see from the streets.

Cruise down the River. We were in town for a birthday party, being held on a Seine yacht. Cruising in the evening was wonderful, our return pass by the Tour Eiffel was timed to match the lighting of the strobes.

Lots of padlocks. It was fun seeing the little souvenir and art booths along the banks. I noticed that in certain places where you can cross over bridges, there were hundreds of padlocks placed onto the wire fencing along the bridge. Vendors sell the little padlocks so you can put you and your loved one's initials on it and "lock your love" in Paris.
Take A River Trip. Sounds touristy and boring, but going down the river on a beautiful day or early evening is a great site and very romantic. Highly recommended.
Guides holiday. Great value for money if you take a boat trip and very informative too!
take an evening stroll. There is a little walkway down to the Seine near the Petit Palais where there are house boats and great views.
You've got to be kidding. Why would you need a review? It's iconic and the soul of Paris, if not France. Cross every bridge,walk the islands. If you don't have time, take a picture......

Walk along the Seine. Would recommend walking along the Seine to enjoy the views, but don't take a boat tour or river cruise hoping to see anything other than other boats on the river. Same your money (and time) and walk along the Seine.
Not enough accordion players. Opportunities for a romantic stroll and surrounded by tourist attractions. Nice way to pass a couple of hours.
excellent tour. I took the boat tour and it was great , excellent wheather, great tour guide. Had good time.
Water Cruise. It was a lot to see. It was an exciting and educational experience. The bridges were great to learn about and getting a close up view.
Fat Tire Bike Tour. The river in Paris was not that pretty, but we took a Fat Tire Bike Tour to Monet's Garden and had a picnic by the Seine in Vernon. It was beautiful there!! Take the Bike Tour!!

Enjoyable even in rain. I just finished the river tour which despite the rain, was quite nice. Those that don't enjoy walking in my family enjoyed it even more, as they saw it all, while warm and sitting down. I expect the tour would be a lot better in the sun while sitting on top of the boat.While waiting groups arrived by bus, filling up the tourist shop. The warm waiting room stayed empty.We really enjoyed using the TripAdvisor city guide with Paris map to track our position, and to spot the sights. The audio guide was impossible to hear due to all the talking by the other travelers.
Try the Batobus. Gets busy around midday but a good way to see Paris.
HISTORY OF PARIS AND THE SEINE. The bridges are bautiful, archtectural masterpieces, the quays are special--its great just to walk along this river--the HEART and soul of Paris

depends upon the boat company. The Bateaux Parisiens are the best at the base of the Eiffel Tower as there are live guides on board and wonderful music to make you fell like you are in paris. Other companies make you listed to recordings often difficult to understand and in many languages. The Seine is the most beautiful avenue of Paris, even in the rain.

Its not just the River, its what you see near the River. In all Cities that are crossed by Rivers you can findsome sort of Romance and beauty.But the truth is that its not just the River , its what you findnext to the River.That is with River Seine in Paris. Imagine this River withoutthe views of Paris bridges, the Eiffel Tower and so many otherattractions that you can see and enjoy either walking by the river ortaking a cruise or just laying to its banks.So yes Paris needs the river but the river also needs Paris!!!

Lots of choice but beware bir hakeim metro station!. Myself and my partner went on a nightime river cruise down the seine. There are lots of different cruises ranging from 12 euros to about 80 euros if you want a meal. Our cruise took one hour and took in all of the major tourist sights. However, we got the bir hakeim metro back to our hotel and there are massive gangs of pickpockets hanging around that area. We saw one in action and it was frightening. They are well tooled up so don't approach them in anyway. Keep wallets out of view and especially not in your back pocket.

see Paris from the water. A leisurely trip, on a warm summer evening, with People relaxing along the shoreline, waving to you from the bridges what a wonderful way to see Paris and ebd to a perfect day.
Romantic. A must do. Picnic on the banks like a local. A very romantic destination
Dirty. Not the romantic, beautiful river I expected. I have walked many more beautiful riverbanks in other cities. Too many vagrants and beggars for me to feel safe.
Beautiful. We took a boat ride down the river and even though the weather could've been better the scenery was gorgeous! Dress warmly because it can get really chilly!
Good Views of Paris. You can see so many good views from the river. We took the Batobus, which was so much easier for travel with children.
Relaxing. Sitting along the ledge of the river having a little picnic, and a bottle of wine, on a sunny spring day. Nice!

Take a stroll just to say you did. The river may not be all that grand but you are in Paris walking on the banks of the Seine - does it get any better than that? A boat ride at night is worth the cost just make sure you are aware of which ticket you are purchasing ( you want to go past Notre Dame and some boats don't ). The Eiffle Tower as viewed from the river is beautiful as is the Louvre and Notre Dame. Enjoy your stroll and see if you don't catch yourself, when you see Paris and the Seine in a movie, fondly remembering when you too strolled along those banks.

boat ride. we caught the river buses rather than the tours, for one fee you can travel up and down for several days, a nice way to while away some hours, while recuperating from all that walking.there are so many neat house boats and barges, for a moment in time one thinks "yes I could live on the river"
Always a winner. The Seine is magnificent. A cruise should not be missed. A perfect place for a walk or just to sit a take in the atmosphere.
The way to see the city!. Book a river cruise and you will get a great view of the city

Average river made better by the views it affords. The river itself is not much to talk about, but a cruise along it with the views it offers are really good. Whether you do a lunch or dinner cruise, or a less expensive shorter cruise (cruise only) it is a wonderful experience. There are many better rivers in the world, but not many that offer the scenery offered by the Seine
Ya gotta hang out here!. Have a glass of wine or two and cruise down. It's very lovely and peaceful. Point de arts at sunset is just beautiful. Such great energy.
City lights. This is a nice way to get a view of Paris and not to be missed in the evening.

Nice but boring. I like the trip and I like the people around us just for me the time was a little bit boring becuase maybe I m too energy man and I dont want to distrub any feelings and mind of this kind of trips but also for my girlfriend this trip was tiring. From the start was nice to hear talking about many interesting things and see a lots of interesting places, briges.. We had with us one guy guidepost who was just a tlaking and talking withour any stops. So be carefull about this kind of people which can destroyed almost all ur trip and feelings from nice places and beautiful interesting things
wonderful. Loved the boat ride at night especially when they light up the tower

Use the Batobus. I bought a Batobus ticket for boats that circle the Seine, offering the opportunity to get off at 8 of the major sites along the Seine and back on as often as one likes during the day. Loved it. Would definitely do this again.
Very lovely!. Just walking across the many bridges and taking the dinner cruise down the Seine was a highlight of our trip.

Lovely walking alongside or go on a river cruise. Lovely to look at the amazing bridges and the river and all the sights around the city. Don't miss the padlock bridge which twinkles when the sun catches it - just past Le Louvre towards Notre Dame. Concorde bridge is stunning. Everything in Paris is breathtaking.

Great boat trips.. The boat trips along the seine are good value for money and you get to see the paris attractions the no hassel way.Some of the boats let you hop on and off to the sights and some of them provide you with dinner with your romantic trip.

By Foot Or By Boat Its A Marvelous Feast For The Eyes. River Seine is great to walk along, comfy shoes a must. I prefer it on sunday morningsget up early and see it at its best. or stand on one of the many ornate bridgesin the late eveing and see the tower twinkle in the distancepoor heaven.......Clive Dublin

Very interesting. We did the boat trip...well why wouldn't you...saved our poor feet from endless days of walking everywhere. It gives you time to reflect on Paris and to think about it's marvellous history.

The most beautiful river in the world. This is a special river crossing a very special city. Through its length you have the most fantastic building on both sides, the formal and institutional Rive Droit, and the more informal and lively Rive Gauche. In between, the two islands where the city was born: the hyperfamous Ile de la Cite, with Notre Dame on it, and the more intimate and romantic Ile de St, Louis, connected by a beautiful and dramatic bridge.

Batobus. For a different way to cruise the Seine, try the Batobus - an all day pass allows you to hop on and hop off at any of 8 stops - all in great locations - and it's a lot more fun than the metro!
Great Way to see Paris. Fantastic after dark when the Eiffel Tower is sparkling. It would be nice to have a better description of landmarks.
Good overall perspective. Go on a tour early in your visit to figure out the lay of the land. The one hour cruise is worth it.

a very cheap and beautiful way to see paris. very cheap and very nice trip not perfect for pics but its very nice to see paris from a diffferent perspective the voice over guide is very informative in all languages

Touristy but worthwhile ....... You get perspectives on the water that you don't otherwise get , and a cruise gives you something of a flowing , geographical narrative that walking or riding a bus can't match . So ignore the scoffers , do it . I like the Bateaux Mouche line , at Pont D'Alma .

Real relax. Fantastic views over the city. We did a Paris en Scene cruise and it was really nice (and very romantic!). You can sit and enjoy some of the best places Paris has to offer: Notre Dame, the Eiffel Tower and much more.
Fun. Took a 2 hour cruise on the Bateaux Parisiens, never saw so many people on a river bank enjoying themselves. alot of fun

The scene of Lord X emerging from the Seine (Irma la Douce). That was one of my favorite Hollywood movies from long ago!
The Seine has a picturesque attraction even to Hollywood.
And there is NO line-up!

Parisienne boat cruise. Great ways to see some of the sights, great on a sunny day, a chance to rest your feet! This was a small boat compared to the huge batobus boats which seem to cram on 100s of tourists. Out boat was half empty, great size, not too big, good seats all with good views, smooth ride. We got on at Notre Dame mooring on left bank. Cost 12 euros each, took about an hour.
Banks of the river. Use the batobus to get around the sights - excellent value and you can see the parisians enjoying picnics on the banks of the seine when the weather is nice.
beautiful day or night!. Even in the rain, it is gorgeous! Isn't that the best way to see Paris!
Must do a river boat trip. Lovely to do a river boat trip along the Seine and see all the sights..............sit at the top of the boat to get the best views

River Cruises are a must. We went on a river cruise one afternoon and loved it. The weather wasn't great but we were still able to see parts of the city from an angle that we hadn't in the days prior. We got an excellent view of Notre Dame and some of the beautiful details on the many bridges/overpasses. It was well worth it -- grab a bottle of wine and a croissant at the pier and enjoy the ride!

Great way to see Paris in the evening. Bateau Mouche has good food and it's a great way to see Paris in the evening. Romantic. Have been told there are other boat tours where you can get on and off the boat.
Great river cruise. Purchase the Paris Pass and you get a cruise free and many more time saving deals. Here is a link:http://www.parispass.com/
Romantic walk. Don't stick to the regular route, but take the stairs and walk by the river

Sunset River Cruise. Take a sunset river cruise on the Seine. If you book online, you will have the 1 hour cruise discounted from 13 Euro to 8 Euro. You do need access to a printer for produce your pass. Even at 13 Euro, the trip is worth the price. It sails from under the Pont Neuf (take stairs in centre of bridge) and heads in both up and down the river.

Majestic. A very nice river dotted with beautiful bridges full of history and surrounded by many fantastic Parisian monuments. There are also many vendors selling old books, art and souvenirs along the banks of the river.

Picturesque. Liked the bridges with padlock, looks like gold glinting in the sun. Had to buy a lock and post my own message. Lots of street sellers hassling you for money, either fake charity, items of little or no value, beggars unfortunately. However we found some street musicians that were actually quite good. There are a lot of street stalls along the banks of the seine which do obstruct your view of the river as you walk along it and it makes the pavement narrower as a result. The lower path of the seine looks pretty but there is no escape from danger for you until the next bridge and my guests were not confident enough to use those paths.
Must See. Especially good to get a Batobus pass to enjoy it thoroughly.

Romantic experience. I have gone in the river cruise through Seine twice. They take you from Eiffel tower and tour around the city, explaining each important place. The music, the wind and the air of Paris gets onto you. Do not miss this experience.

Do take a cruise along the Seine. Absolutely wonderful. Worth every cent, we didn't do the dinner cruise, just the regular cruise as we find the food on these kinds of cruses is not the greatest quality, we went to see the highlights of the city, the bridges, and paris by water. A great experience and you get a sense of the city from the river.

Seine Boat Trip. We enjoyed this trip, but select your boat carefully. Ours was large and crowded. To hear the tour in English required staying in a seat, thus not going outside for better pictures. But the voyage was worth doing.

Beautiful River. Love walking alonside the river. We also always take the boat that goes down the river with several stops. This river appears clean, no rubbish lying around. Just such a integral part of Paris

With the open roof bus. We took a 2-days pass for the open roof bus, on the advice of our hotel owner.
You see quite a long stretech of the Seine banks, the Musee d'Orsay, the bouquinistes, etc...

The River Seine. We did not take a river cruise, however, we traveled along the river on many occasions. Very beautiful in many spots and you are able to take scenic cruises, dinner cruises, etc. The weather just did not cooperate for us during our visit, unfortunately. Hopefully we will make it back one day and this will be on our list to do on a sunny day!
walk, picnic. walk along, check out the bridges, the book stalls, and all that stuff. If it's nice, get a picnic lunch. Go early, go late. It's all good.
dirty. dirty river, looks nice from a distance. the tourist boat cruises are worth the few euros IMO. covers a lot of ground in an hour.
lovely cruse. After visiting the tower just below the bridge take a lovely cruse were you get a snapshot of Paris.
Great Walking area. if you want to see Paris , walk on the streets of the River Seine as you will get a pretty good picture of the scenery of Paris
Best tine of the year. in April May - Just walk down from the Grand Palais to the Lover down the river and look at the boat houses
Duh!. This is a river. It is full of wet water. It has boats on it. You can pay to go on some of the boats. It is even a convenient way of getting around Paris.
Great way to see central Paris. Take a boat trip down the River. It is a calmer way to get around and gives you a chance to relax while seeing the sights.

Excellent trip worth. We took the Bateaux Parisiens cruises which cruises about more than 22 bridges with an audio in English and hostess speak English among other languages. The cruise deserves to be repeated over and over. There is a lot of information about the old city, and a panoramic view for the whole city. Starting from the Eifel tower, passing through many monuments and historical places. I advise every one not to miss it.

The best walk in Paris. Walking along the Seine is a must for any trip to Paris whether it is you first or one of many. A morning stroll along the quais of the Ile St Louis reveals stunning views, quaint shops and grand mansions.

boat trip at twilight. We took a big boat down the Seine. It's a gorgeous view of the city but, unfortunately, there were a lot of teenagers on the boat that screamed and yelled every time we went under a bridge.
Definitely worth a cruise. The Seine should be travelled upon via the Bateaux Mouche cruises. The sites are amazing. A must.
Great value boat trip. Loved walking by the river and boat trip was brilliant with commentary in English - learned a lot about Paris. Able to see lots of sights from the boat.

I never tire of this River. Whether walking alongside, or taking a boat trip, there is something perfectly magical about the River Seine as it flows through Paris. In summer its a wonderful place for an evening picnic; the Paris Plage is a brilliant idea, and creates a lovely atmosphere. But can anything realy detract from the wonderful archtecture and history that line its banks. Last week I took a boat from Tour Effel for the round trip to Notre Dame and Ile Saint-Loius. Spring flowers, fresh greenery, the exquisitely pollarded trees and the blossoms of sweet and horse chestnut were delightful.

Wonderful way to see the Sights of Paris. Great way to travel, cruising along the Seine with all the beautiful sights and monuments to photograph. Drinks and snacks are available to purchase on board, @ very reasonable prices. would recomend this without hesitation.

Le Loo Du Paris. We had just disembarked from an enjoyable 2:00 Hr river cruise on the Seine and seeing an oval shaped toilet near the Eifel Tower, I decided that I could well use such a facility.There were two people waiting and as the door opened a lady exiting commented that the toilet had to be “Cleaned” As my need only required me in an upright position, I thought I would ignore her comment and entered the ”Dr. Who” structure....How to close the sliding door, I did not know! However, as my back was toward the opening and my desire to relieve myself was most important – I ignored thisI obtained Instantaneous relief and pleasure ensued as I enjoyed the comfort of this “To-Be-Cleaned facility....Upon the near completion of my task, a female voice said something about “5 seconds” But I have not yet finished – I said to the wall.....Then, I wondered what was in the Red Wine they gave me on board the cruise ship?The toilet pan tilted backwards and disappeared into the wall behind it. Horror thoughts ran through my mind as to what would have been my fate if I had been seated at this moment?I then adjusted my clothing and turned to leave the oval structure...But – Madame Paris had not quite finished with my embarrassment....A Siren Alarm started to activate – I am sure it would have been heard at Versailles.... I quickly exited and started to blend in with the crowd, hoping sincerely that I would not be tapped on the shoulder by “Le Loo Police”The rest of our day was most uneventful, I guess......Some may say that this could only happen to a Grandad...... Maybe.....

Courtesy of Tesco clubcard vouchers!. Enjoyed this after a long walk from Republique to find Eiffel tower very busy - so hopped on for relaxing cruise and returned just before dusk to find no queues for the tower :-)
river boat view of the Seine. Loved the river boat view of the Seine. Gave a good idea of life on the river.

Great view of the city. Yes a boat ride down the Seine is definitely a great way to see Paris in summary. We went during the day but I have heard that it is better at night. Unfortunately the commentary we received was in such heavily accented French, from a disinterested guide, that it was useless. Perhaps ask some questions about that before commiting to buying your ticket.

Take a boat trip. We really enjoyed the boat trip down the Seine. You get to see everything in an overview. Our boat was full, but every seat, at least in the boat we were in, afforded a good view. It is really fun to go under the various bridges, works of art in their own right.
Very Informative. There are various tour boats available. We had limited time, so it was an efficient choice.

See Paris from the river. Taking a boat tour down the river is a great way to see Paris in an hour or so. Leave from the Eiffel Tower and be back in an hour and see all the beautiful buildings facing the river and all the bridges spanning it.
I wish I lived nearby. I wish I lived nearby and walked along everyday, you would probably not get old
river bus. again a great way to travel and find out even more about this amazing city from a different perspective
Purchased a ticket for the hop on hopoff. the ticket was 15euros but good value as you can use them all day.The run the boats every twenty minutes. Fun way to travel to heritage sites
wet & wonderful. The Seine would be unknown except for the bdeautiful hamlet it runs through.
Very nice. Take a boat tour and look at the city from the river! We booked the 'Vedettes' tour for only €8 (internet rate) and were very satisfied with the trip!

Good value. We got a two day pass which costs 18euros per adult which stops at 8 tourist spots. You can just jump off and on whenever you like and the boats are every 20 mins. This was a great way of getting around, albeit it a little slow.
Take the boat tour. When you first get to Paris be sure to take one of the boat tours and get your bearings of where things are and a little history.
dirty but legendary river. the whole territiry of Seine banks is a historic masterpiece - vall these briges and buildings make it very attractive for visiting aGAIN AND again
Classic Paris. A visit to Paris would be impossible without a walk along the Seine with its views of Notre Dame, the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, the Eiffel Tower, and so much more. Obviously, a must do!
Seine cruise. Nice way to view Paris from a boat on the Seine. Informative commentary in a number of languages.
Worth Seeing.. The sight here is not the river but the fact that the river is in Paris.
Take a dinner cruise!. It's worth the $$$ to ride down the Seine at night, seeing the Eiffel Tower all lit up, and sipping a glass of wine.
GORGEOUS!. World Heritage site and absolutely gorgeous. Though the river is a bit dirty it's not gross. It flows through the whole city and you can use it as a navigation point.

Don't pay the big bucks for this one!. I had a very expensive tour planned for a night cruise but just never got a round to scheduling it. Thank goodness. We hopped on an open air boat just below the Eifel Tower and sat on top. Spent $25 and had a great ride. Saw everything we wanted to see. It was perfect!

Took a Batueax. Took a 1 hour boat ride--13 Euro cash only.
They take photos of passengers at the beiginnig of the trip and upon return, one examines the photos and decide to purchase them or not for 15 Euros with Paris background.

stroll along. have a rest.. stroll along. have a rest
Enjoy this beautiful river with its bridges.

comfortable cruise, well planned and thoroughly entertaining. the cruise on the Seine river is a very relaxing and worthwhile experience. If you are planning one, be sure to find a criuse thats not too crowded, with plenty of space, food, drinks and privacy to enjoy to the core.
One of the best experiences, along with the tower and the louvre.
Relaxing. Lovely trip down the Seine was able to see alot of attractions
night trip down the Seine. good trip out and not too expensive. great to see the major sights lit up. was about 50mins so just long enough as was very cold nite.
Just a great walk.... We took a walk in the evening down the River Seine. It was a great walk with crisp airs and unmatched views up and down the river.
What can you say? The essence or Romance. Day or night.. rain or shine... walk the river..preferably with someone you are in love with...
Romance in the air. So romantic! Please do a river cruise! It is another way of seeing Paris...

Pretty. Barges filled with gravel, large billowing storm clouds and an Eiffel Tower that was hiding from view were what greeted us on our first attempt.. But we came back the next day and were greeted with bluebird skies and some incredible photos. Our third visit was a walk down the river at night, bring a camera, there are many many places you will want to stop and take photos.
A Nice Walk. Lose yourseld for the day by walking along the river. The boats, the people, and the statues are like no place else. Splurge a little and take a boat tour.

ROMANTIC AND BEAUTIFUL UNDER THE BRIDGES OF PARIS. Beginning to sound daft, everything is wow, beautiful, stunning and truly amazing, but it's true. When the sun shone and the sky was blue with white fluffy clouds the beauty and romance of the Seine was truly evident. Majestic buildings in all their styles on either bank.Here I go again the variety of bridges over the river, the architecture, their build periods from way back to present held their own particular complimenting beauty to the river.My wife and I took a walk both over and under one of the bridges and took time out to listen to a very talented street musician (he was so good I put 2 euro s in his hat and I'm a Scotsman). This some what small musical interlude genuinely added to the romance of the River Seine.A must again for all romantics regardless of age.
Batobus. Hop on, Hop off at the big name sites and sit quietly in between enjoying the river. One day pass is enough.

Always a great place to stroill and people watch. The boardwalks/sidewalks are kept clean. You feel safe because so many other Parisians and tourists are strolling there too. It is always a lovely walk with beautiful views
Take a ride on the river. Take a ride on the river cruise. Its very romantic and a great place to people watch as many people walk up and down the banks of the river.

So fun!. We went on one of the Seine boat tours our very first night in Paris. We had a blast! Our guide was fun, as were the others on the tour. You can purchase wine and snacks and take them onto the boat with you as you ride. It was truly beautiful and relaxed, and the view of the city lights and the sparkling Eiffel Tower at dusk were amazing. Honestly, it was one of my favorite things we did!
Life of the city. The city revolves around this great river. It is the energy that fuels the movement both in and around it. The Seine is what makes Paris such a unique city.

all-day seine taxi. the batobus is great way to travel thru paris. get an all day pass for 15 euros (2 day pass for 18 euros). there's 8 stops beginning with the eiffel tower & ending at notre dame. you can get on & off as many times as you want. it runs from 10:00 a.m. til 9:00 p.m. maximum 15 minute wait at each stop. the stops are on both banks of the river. it's great to walk the streets of paris, but to sit on a boat & take in the left & right bank is a real treat, especially after walking for 4 days!!!
WONDERFUL RIVER CRUISE!. take the river cruise! it is delightful and a great opportunity to take photos and see places that you might want to visit during your stay in Paris.
A Beautiful view. The River Seine was beautiful. We followed it from Paris to Normandy as it wove and crossed our path of travel.
Chrisp. The number and style of the sites and buildings which front onto the Seine is just breathtaking. So beautiful so romantic even with hundreds of fellow tourists close by.
The Promenade. You can walk for hours, and hours. Have a few breaks, look in shops, look at the river, have a cup of coffee, look at the beautiful bridges, take a lot of photos. It has everything ...

Awsome experience!. i was lucky enought to have a 1 hour cruise on the River Seine, and god was i glad once its started! I absolutly wanted to experience this at night and i did and it was really great! The animation is cute and fun with french music and everything. What i thought was cool was that there are like little phones for everybody and you had the same speech but in a whole bunch of different languanges! Super cool! The scenery is to die for!! The explanations of all the sites were very clear and interesting! All in all, one of my best experiences in Paris!

Canal and River Cruise. We booked this tour through Viator.com. It was great. 2 1/2 hours, 9 locks, lots of sights. The commentator spoke a little bit fast which made it hard to understand his English. It was cold and rainy but the inside of the boat was toasty and dry. Take refreshments.

If in Paris do the River Cruise. If you go to Paris you must do a cruise of the River Seine...well worth the cost and suggest to try and do it on a fine day or take a night time cruise. Loved every moment of the opportunity to see Paris from the River. Suggest you purchase a 2 or 3 day pass hop on hop off Le Open Tour Bus pass which covers free access to a hop on hop off cruise at around 8 different locations. Next time in Paris will do the night cruise. Easy access to get on and off the boat and all the staff are very helpful and friendly.
Batobus is great.. Loved the one day ticket on the Batobus, used it for a day time and a night time tour. Brilliant.
Boat tour amazing at night!!. Try and schedule one near he top of the hour to see he Eiffel tower light up! Spectacular!!

Bateaux Parisian Dinner Cruise. Had a wonderful experience dining on the river with Beateaux Parisian cruises. Very surreal looking at the light up sites in the evening. The service was decent and the food was surprisingly really good. We are foodies and were very pleased. The live music is a lovely touch. As we pulled in back to the dock the Tower was performing it's hourly sparkling. Couldn't have enjoyed it any more. Worth the price.

Bato for different point of view. Perfect way to see it all and rest your weary feet!! 12Euros and worth every penny for the 1hr tour. We got on at St Michel opposite Notre Dame and really loved it....Note please sit down as "the standers" are really annoying we all want to see u know!!!
Great fun. went on the many boat cruises, wonderfull you get a lot of betterviews from the river than from the land. Good value for money.

Walking, riding, sailing... do it all !. Don't swim though ! Do it by day, by night, walking on the upper banks, then the lower banks on Sundays when they are closed to traffic (rent a bike at a Velib station). The scene is very different if you take a boat (the traffic disappears by magic !). Better on a sunny day... To know where to start remember the sun is up in the east and down in the west. You want to have the sun in your back putting the best lightening at this scenery...

A wonderful walk. You can't visit Paris without walking the Seine. Take a riverboat cruise if you can. While it's touristy, it's a great time! I like the white and red boats that depart at the base of the Eiffel Tour.

Hypnotic. At first glance it is difficult to take it in and the significance of this river to this beautiful city. The history behind it indicates that once every 100 years it will overflow it's banks. After viewing the river I can understand doing just that. I would not recommend a tourist boat ride on a non-rainy day as every passenger was crammed into the first level.
Walking by the Seine. A lovely walk, pretty bridges and all the Parisian architecture to enjoy.

A Paris must do!. Take your time to walk from St. MIchel to the Trocadero for one of the most famous walks in the world. Stop, as I did, to have a baguette with a glass of chardonnay at one of the many cafes by the river and enjoy life!
Very romantic!. I highly recommend an evening bateaux ride on the Seine. The buildings and monuments are beautifully lit. The Eiffel tower is even more amazing lit up and viewed from the Seine.

Waterbus. The river Seine is a fantastic way to get an overall veiw of the city, useing the Batobus you can you can travel back and fourth getting on and off at 8 different stops at the main areas of the city, one ticket lasts all day. Or you can take the bateaux mouches tour boat which has a spoken guide that will give you a glimpse of the history of the buildings and bridges, enough to get you really interested in the city.
Most romantic walk. The Seine's bank, the bouquiniste in a spring day ... Unforgetable experience!
Romantic!. The movies have it right! In person the River Seine and the cruise we had was a great experience. All the way down to Notre Dame and the Louvre. Fabulous!

take the boat and enjoy the view. we boarded the 'Batobus' boat to cruise the Seine. This worked really well for our group as we could hop on and off all day long and at the same time enjoy cruising the seine, enjoying the views while travelling to our next destination. Much more fun that being underground on the metro.the boat stops at the Eiffle Tower, Champs Elysées,Louvre, Hotel de Ville, Jardin des Plantes, Notre Dame, Saint-Germainde des Pres and Musee d'Orsay.Very good viewing through large windows and clear roof. The host on board offers some information about each stop and was very welcoming and helpful with specific questions.

To know of and to see the ART and Paint on the bridges. The art and sculptures on the bridges over the Seine is not to be missed and unknown unless you go by boat, an easily accessible and comfortable ride.

Enjoy the walk but be careful. It is absolutely marvelous to stroll along the Seine and over its lovely bridges. It is easy to get swept up in this aquatic essence of Paris. The farther you walk, the more Parisian you feel! This said, I offer a serious word of warning regarding safeguarding your possessions (especially at the entrances and exits to the bridges). These places are rife with young bands of pickpockets who are quite skilled at their "craft." The usual ruse is for a couple of teens to shove a clipboard with a "charitable" petition to sign and, while one is engaged in avowing disinterest, the pickpocket sneaks up silently (and totally unnoticed) from behind, unzips your handbag, removes and steals your wallet, zips up the handbag...all in a mere few seconds. My daughter was the victim and her small, shoulder-strap purse was held tightly under her arm! We were extremely lucky that only a few euros were stolen before the wallet was discarded and retrieved by a good samaritan who turned it into the police station. There is signage posted all over the main attractions in Paris advising travelers to be aware of pickpockets. Of course, we thought we were! Our story ended well...most do not, according to the police. I still say the walk along the Seine is worth the potential aggravation. The best suggestion I can offer is to NOT carry any personal items or ID where they are visible. This will also leave your arms free to swing as you enjoy the sights along the River Seine!
Cruzing the River Seine. Took the boat trip but only lasted 1 hr but the commentary was very informative in pointing out the sights along the river.

Beautiful. Perfect place to have an afternoon walk. You can feel the whole 'Europe' mood while you're strolling around the Seine River. I hope I'm making sense here =)It's just a great thing to do, especially if you're with your loved one. Just wear comfortable shoes.
Worth the effort.. Very good commentary and a great way to get a first look at Paris and its landmarks.
Must have a boat ride!!. Once in Paris you must do a boat ride and see the city from a different point of view!!! It can be during the day or at night!!!
Bateau Parisienne. The trip down the Seine was good but the information on the various attractions was a bit limited

A stride along the Seine. One very nice way to discover Paris on a sunny day, a long walk alongside the river Seine. Great bridges and buildings to be seen, books sellers and some pleasant terraces to be found.Still, the sun out makes the walk truly enjoyable but does also call crowds out.

We did our little cruise with Bateaux-Mouches. Bateaux-Mouches are based at Pont de l'Alma, which very near the Effiel Tower. The cruise takes 60 minutes and operates in all weather. Well worth the money and time.
Garbage an issue. The footpaths along the Seine are wonderful, except for the garbage, cigarette butts and the dog 'droppings'. It appears Parisians do not mind the mess!
It's a river. What makes the Seine special is the view. Go at night so you will see the city lit up.

Walk along as many bridges as possible. If you are in a hurry, take a ship, but it is funnier to take just the public ship (La Navette Fluviale) at Austerlitz rather than Les bateaux mouche, just for tourists

The way to see this is ON FOOT. With our Paris-Pass we headed by normal bus (not tourist bus) to the Ile and walked along the Seine to Notre Dame and St. Chappelle - buskers all over the place, very 'French'...
Great Time. We have taken tha cruise to the river seine and it was really very nice looking all this monuments and passing under these old bridges.
Surreal. Just like out of a movie. You can see this is a major artery in Paris and makes even more charming if that is even possible..

Dinner cruise. We had a dinner cruise along the Seine and it was lovey. We went with Bateaux Parisan. They start at 99Euro per person including a dinner 2 bottles of wine etc and a 3hr slow cruise. We took the €125 option which gave us better seats. The river, the music, the wine and the sights all played out into a great night.
River Seine Cruise. Great way to get acclimatised with Paris - great commentary - loved it
Beautiful, romantic. What a romantic river...right through Paris, with lots of bridges to cross. If you are with your lover, bring a lock and attach it to the bridge wtih your initials on it!
Boat tour. It is a great thing to do at the end of the trip when your feet are tired!

The Seine and the BatoBus. We got a five day pass for the batobus - a boat-bus - and you can get on and off at ay of the main attractions on the Seine. You can ride as much as you want in five days. we would get our coffee and hop on and start the day with a little boat ride and it's a nice way to see the city at night. The seats are loud and many French children are unruly, slamming the seats as their parents watched. So, try to ignore that, or opt to enjoy the ride from the deck outside. Also, walking the Seine is nice although it smells like urine from time to time, as does a lot of Paris. They don't mention that in guide books :s

Relaxing way to see Paris. The Seine is integral to Paris' character, connecting a number of iconic places. We used the Bateaux Bus to travel from one end to another. It was very relaxing, although not to be used if in a hurry! The bridges are really interesting and have a histry all of their own. The view is OK, although the river level is well below the road. The traders on the roadsides using the river walls for support are interesting and well worth a look.

Beautiful even in the cold. Full of history, mystery (who left all the locks and why??) and still one of THE things to see in Paris. Just wish it had been warm enough for the sidewalk vendors to be open.
the Seine. The River Seine crossed by so many beautiful bridges is a must see, especially a stroll along its banks

Hop on Hop Off BatoBus. This is a great option for having a ride on the Seine while you are getting from sight to sight. Hop on, hop off at the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Musee D'Orsay -- eight stops in all and your ticket is for all day. Worth every penny!

try the lunch time cruise. we went on the lunchtime cruise and experience lovely food, wine and entertainment.
we wanted for nothing whilst we were on the boat and all the attractions could be seen. the history and information was given about the attractions as you came to them.
a fantastic experience and a must do
The river Seine. Walk up and down the banks, take one of many boat rides available, cross the bridges over and back for all the wonderful views. Pack a picnic and find a bench and experience Paris!

River Sein cruise - to much crowds. Had a cruise on the River Sein, found it very crouded and the guide just ok, not a must do. The waiting in line for the next boat is also very long, and feels like a herding of cattle.
Romantic. A stroll here day or night is very romantic and a boat trip even better at night to see the City of Lights in all it's glory

A very serene river. The banks of the Seine & the walkways were very uncrowded at this time of year. If you need the loo the moored boat/restaurants have them & the owners don,t mind you using them. The trees along the Seine were just coming into bud so if you visited in May they would look spectacular!
River Cruise. Its worth it to take a short trip on this river by obtaining a ticket next to the bridge at the Eiffel.
romantic walk. walk along the banks of River Seine, cross bridges,explore into different neighbourhood, street artists displays, very romantic
Lovely river with beautiful vieuws! :D. I walked a lot through Paris but loved to walk along the river. All the bridges are nice too. Beautiful locations to take pictures.

the Seine is the Seine is the Seine. Presque parfait. We never visit Paris without spending a couple of hours walking along the Seine. This trip it was very cold and we were only in town for two days. We crossed from the right bankon the Pont du Change to Isle de la Cite walked along the bank at the Quai de l'Horlage and came back over on the Pont Neuf.
Beautiful views!. A nice place to walk or have lunch at one of the many Bistros. It allows views of many of the great attractions. Hope for a sunny day!
Seine river boat ride. Night boat ride is a must. You see the city lit up.
Paris, my second home. Brilliant views and a lovely general area. The lights are thrilling at the end of a Seine cruise

Relaxing boat trip. I took an hour-long boat ride down the Seine River and it was great. You get to see many of the historical buildings from the river, and there is an audio tour for you to listen to as you're going down the river. It's a great way to spend an hour of relaxing after a long day of walking.
Great Walk. Love walking the river it is peaceful and a great place for a picnic.
A lovely river. Well maintained banks and bridges to enjoy. The batobus meant we saw a lot of Paris from the river.
Brill. We did this after the bike ride at night, it was great with wine in tow! and do it at night an watch the Eiffel Tower light up!

Took a 1 hr boat tour at sunset. Excellent way to see Paris from a different angle. We went at sunset and when we returned (1 hr later) the lights were on the Eiffel tower and what a beautiful view it was from the boat!

Lovely way to see so much. We got a round trip boat trip on the River Seine and it was a lovely way to see Paris. Very relaxing and nice to sit dwn and relax for a bit as sightseeing is exhausting! Would defdo again but probably on on off the boats you can hop on and off.

Awesome cruise. Take the dinner cruise on the Seine. You will not be disappointed. It takes you past all the monuments which are lit up magnificently. Every hour, at the top of the hour, the Eiffel tower gets a blast of extra lighting, which makes it simply worth the trip. No better way to get a quick two hour tour of Paris...


More
Paris just isn't Paris without the Seine. Stare at it. Go down to it. Walk along it. Walk over the bridges. Look at all the sights and listen to the sounds associated with it. Take a boat trip on it.
Consider Batobus. Consider a service like the Batobus...you can hop in and out at 8 conveninent stops along Seine...I wouldnt recommend dinner cruises as they can be expensive

This is why you come to Paris. All along the Seine are beautiful and historic buildings from the Eiffel Tower and Tocadero to Musee d'Orsay to the Louvre. Il de la cite and St Louis are in the middle of it. There are many boats that travel up and down, there are ageless street vendors with antique books, cheap art and souvenirs on the shore. The many...


More

Don't miss a cruise alng the Seine. Not only is this a beautiful way to see the city and many of it's sights, at times it will take your breath away to see the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame (respectively) come into view. Baton Mouches is the biggest and most popular tour provider for a Seine Cruise. You many want to choose the dinner option, we did...


More

River Seine-Magnificent Views of Paris. For a great orientation to this most beautiful of cities, the River Seine is the place to start. Get on Bateaux Mouches at the Pont de l'Alma. You can have lunch or dinner or just view the sites. You will see the Eiffel Tower, the Musee d'Orsey, the Louvre, Notre Dame Cathedral, numerous beautiful bridges. This is an essential experience...


More

Monumental waterfront. Found ourselves singing the lines to a John Lennon song (Honeymooning down by the Seine...). Much better experience than the Thames in London. Pleasant stroll even in blustery April weather and stunning buildings lining both sides. And the Pont des Arts bedecked in thousands of padlocks...

MUST TAKE THE BOAT TOUR AT NIGHT. Liked the information during the boat ride- didnt like the dirty windows--hard to take pictures through glass topped boat-but if thats the least of my worries on the trip Ce la vie
another must do. If you walk in central Paris you will stroll down the Seine. My favorite location is on the east bank behind Notre Dame...especially in the summer time.

Pretty. We were very located very close to the river seine and went for a walk alongside it which was very nice there are some very beautiful and very photographic views from some of the bridges along it
Perfect for a leisurely stroll!. What makes Paris feel like Paris. We spent 4 days/5 nights in Paris and our walks along the River Seine were by far what we enjoyed the most.
Don't get it. It was green and had a terrible odor coming from it. I understand the historical reference of it but honestly, it just smells.

2 days boat pass well worth it!. we paid 18 Euros for a 2 day pass, which you could use to hop on and off as you pleased. it stopped at 8 major tourist attractions and avoided the bustle of crowds and was very pleasant sailing and doing nothing but look at views!
Good. Great trip although finding the boat was hard and area not so good.

Take the BATOBUS. this boat will take you to 8 stop off ponts along the seine at the most popular points you can buy a day ticket and hop on and off as many times as you like. A 2 day pass works ou cheaper

Under the bridges of Paris. We combined the Hop-on Hop-off Bus with the hop-on Hop-off Boat, great value for money. Gave a totally different perspective of Paris to that from the Bus. The places to catch the Boat were not too clear at first, but surprisingly clear, once you found the first one!

River cruise. We did a seine river cruise with dinner as part of a tour with Cityrama which also included a visit to Eiffel tower and view from 2nd level then to Moulin Rouge show. Tour guides were great and ensured we felt safe and knew where to go at all times. Well done on this tour Cityrama.

a great moment to take in while visiting Paris. I just noticed that most of these reviews are about a river cruise ride, but I wanted to suggest a walk along the river, I feel that this is a must for all travelers visiting Paris. If it's a nice day, take a stroll along the river and watch the boats, cyclists and people passing by. It's another simple way to people watch and soak in the sights and sounds of this great city. Maybe take a break and enjoy a quick 'picnic' at one of the many benches along the way and then press on heading either east or west. My girlfriend and I did this walk from the Eiffel Tower to the Musee d'Orsay, and then to the islands for Notre Dame/Saint Chapelle.
Lovely. Would advise Bateaux Mouches from Pont D'Alma (near ARc de Triomphe), one hour, commentary

Boat trip down with a village of family members. My partner's family and I occupied nearly half of the top half of the boat. It was a lovely sunny autumnal day. We saw a lot of dancing groups practicing in addition to a lot of the landmarks. My toddler loved it. A brilliant and different way to experience Paris when you have a lot of kids with you. After all where are they going to run off too?

Sunset cruise. The boat cruise along the Seine was great.We went at dusk, so experienced both daylight and night lights of Paris.The view of the Eiffel Tower lit up at night was simply magnificent! Really enjoyed it.

The Beautiful Seine. We loved our boat tour of the River Seine. There are so many remarkable buildings to see along the way. It's relaxing and gives you a great perspective of part of the magical city of Paris.
Lots of boats. You can enjoy Paris a lot from the jumping on and off of the boats.

Great way to see Paris. We spent an hour cruising the River Seine to see the sights of Paris. It was just awesome and we went from Notre Dame and down the River past the Eiffel Tower. Highly recommended.

Great way to relax, catch a boat and let the water take you. This is a must do, take a bateau (boat) mouche and travel many times as you watch from afar the monuments and many touristics sites. You can get off and an on the boat during the day. la Seine is romantic, you don't have to do much to fall in love. let the win caress your hair and the freshness of the water cool off your skin, is all you ned to be happy and greatfull for all god given gifts.
Beautiful river, beautiful city.... Loved every thing. We had a great dinner, great company, great music and great sights.

Its a river!. Lets be honest yes the seine is in paris -but its just a river -what is around the river is more spectacular! you can get boat rides to take you up and down it and see the sights but to be honest i would walk much more pleasurable than seeing it whizz past one aboat! - when your there look at the river - think ar its the seine, but then look back as your missing everything else!!
Take the boat cruise. We went at night and it was beautiful. The City of Lights lets you know why. Listen to the guide.
only for water babies?. the seine beautiful at day and at night - the colors playing on the water from the lights of the Eiffel and Pont Neuf - thank you Paris!
Always beautiful!. We just like to walk along the river, cross the bridges, and see the iconic skyline!

Beautiful river; enjoy your lunch here. The Seine is a beautiful place to enjoy your lunch. My tip would be to go to one of the boulangers a little away from the river (try, for instance, one of the many bakeries in Le Marais), pick up some sandwiches and drinks, perhaps some ganache and a fruit tart, and find a quiet spot on the Seine. From here you can enjoy a leisurely lunch and watch Paris go by whilst taking in the amazing scenery and beautiful architecture of the riverside buildings.
Perfect Ice Cream Spot. A lovely river, with so many market stalls and great ice cream spots along the way...
Take a tour and enjoy seeing Paris from a boat. No need to buy a full day free card if you are short of time - take the 1 hour round trip from location near the Eiffel Tower.

View beautiful Paris from the river.. There is no better introduction to Paris than a boat cruise. There are several options depending on whether you want a commentary on the sights. I utilized Batobus. It stops at eight sightseeing destinations until 7 PM.Happy travels!

EVENING TO SEE THE LIGHTS FROM THE RIVER!. We took an early evening tour and upon our return lights where being lit. We saw the Eiffel Tower sparkle and many of the bridges being illuminated. Beautiful to see at this time of day.
Bateaux mooches. Take te 830 or 9 pm cruise. To see a good mix of dark and light.
perfect for a walk. it is impossible to not take a walk on the seine bank, or why not go on aboat tour. during the morning, in the afternoon or the evening. so beautiful

Was nice but probz not do it again. We got a boat trip free with our paris passes so to be honest we'd have probz not bothered even going on one if we'd had to pay. The boat ride was nice and lasted 1 hour, you got to see some of the main attractions but it goes quite quick so you don't get much time to look at things. Theres an audio phone you can listen to that tells you what your looking at which was quite interesting.
Bateaux Parisiens. Really enjoyed this cruise. It was a beautiful day and the sights were great.

Ride the batteau mouche. Well worth the price are the boat rides, batteau mouche, near the Eiffel tower, that take you down the Seine and back for about an hour's ride. Great intro. to Paris and good photo ops.
Heart of Paris. The Seine adds ambience to Paris. It wouldn't be the same without it.

Great river cruise. Took a lunch cruise on Bateaux Parisian. Excellent - service, wine, food, singer - everything you expect in Paris, including the price. But Hey! What do you expect in Paris besides mediocre, expensive food anyway? These guys exceed that & throw in a great ride.
A lovely bit of water!. The Seine actually looks blue and clean! The many bridges across this great river as seen from the Tour Eiffel is 'magnifique' indeed!
Very pretty. Walked all over this area. Incredible sites along the river. We couldn't get a boat tour.
Bateaux Pariesienne. Dinner cruise was awesome! Great way to see all the sites of Paris by night.

You must take a stroll !!!. You must take a stroll down along the banks of the River Seine, if only to gaze at the beautiful architecture of the Parisian buildings lining it. You can walk along the top with all the street vendors and stall holders selling all things Parisian or down lower (off street level) and sit along the pebble stone pathway and taking in the ambiance of Paris !!
The heart of Paris. The river from which it sprang still provides the heartbeat to Paris. What a picturesque body of water, framed by the palaces and spires of the old city.
Scenic History. Step back in time and the history of the city reveals itself from the banks of the river along with the sound tracks of many movies set here.

Great way to see the sights. Well a walk along the Seine is a must, typical Parisien atmosphere, street sellers, smell of delicious cooking... we walked along past the Pont des Arts (near Louvre) and found 'BateauBus' - we bought a 2-day ticket and jumped on and off as many times as we liked. Took an awful lot of legwork out of it and meant we could enjoy the sights while crusing along in the sunshine or at night. They stop every ?15 minutes and go from the Eiffel Tower to just further than Notre Dame and back, with 8 stops. We loved it.

Beautiful!. Breathtaking River and I had a wonderful time! I liked the view of Paris from the river and got to see all the buildings in a different lighting. I cruised down at a leisurely pace on a big boat. Not for you if you're easily queasy, though!

Get Your Bearings While You Get Your Beauty. It is odd, I guess to rate a river. But the Seine runs through the heart of arguably the most beautiful City in the world, dividing Paris' Right Bank from the Left one. With bridges, street peformers and wonderful architecture all around, walking along the river and crossing frequently from the right to left banks is a great way to get your bearings. A boat trip down the Seine is also a fine way to get a sense of Central Paris early in your trip. And this trip at sunset is a true beauty.

Dinner Cruise. We thought the cruises were cheesy until I talked a friend who used to live in Paris. It was a great experience. They played lovely dinner music while we went by all the wonderful sights along the river. No children's menu however...
Seineic Attraction. Vistas of the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, Notre Dame. etc.

You can't miss it!. If you are in Paris for holiday or even business I guess, depending on your time of stay, you will almost certainly see this attraction. And a true European beauty it is! We walked along the river for hours a day getting to various attractions. And you really feel different as you stand there watching the sun set with the Eiffel Tower in the background. All this talk about Paris makes me want to go back so badly :-)

The Left Bank. Rive Gauche is exactly what you see in a travelogue. People with stalls selling food and posters, view of churches, cathedrals and working boats - wonderful! Wear comfortable shoes - you will want to walk and walk. Watch out for the scam of "Did you drop this ring?" though!

Romantic River Seine!. Make sure to stop by the lock bridge near Notre Dame and put a lock on the bridge with you and your lover's names. You then toss the keys into the Seine, signfying your love for all eternity. The river itself is romantic to stroll along.

Nice walk but very breezy. Lovely to walk along if you arent in a wheelchair as very bumoy. Lovely sight and sounds, bit chilly in the wind. We put an engraved padlock onto the Pont Solferino for my deceased mum as it was a place she loved. Bless her
Beautiful ornate buildings along the river.. One of the most impressive rivers in the world to view magnificent architecture. It knocks spots off London's Thames!
Must do. The trip to Paris would not have been complete without a boat trip down the Seine river. Worth every penny and a great way to get photos you would otherwise not have. DONT MISS the boat trip
Take a night cruise down the Seine. Beautiful at night to see the Paris lights-very romantic and scenic!

Do it during the day...and again at night. Walking down the banks of the seine was a great experience in itself but you must go on a river cruise. They are reletively cheap and are give a different view of the city. We used "Bateaux Parisiens" (http://www.bateauxparisiens.com/index.cfm/home/LID/2?gclid=CICl9JScrK8CFeJKpgodXz0ZnQ) and they were fantastic. We then went on a cruise at night as part of a package deal that included dinner on the eiffel tower (http://www.pariscityvision.com/en/cityrama/paris-by-night-dinner-at-the-eiffel-tower-and-seine-river-cruise) and it gave the city a whole different 'flavour'. It is certainly a different place by night. I would highly reccommend both activities

angleterre adv on le pont neuf :). like: can not help but smile when we found a travel advertisement on pont neuf of river seine. it's not speaking about france or paris itself, but it's about castle nearby where we live in england entitled "grand patrimoine", great britain. thank you to make us feel home :) instead the advertisement, the riverbanks: rive gauche and rive droite are not to be missed. walking through seine and crossing one of the bridges also romantic, especially when the night fall. our fave goes to: le pont notre-dame, le pont alexandre III and le pont neuf.dislike: non.
Enjoyable. There is always something to see or do around the seine.
A river runs through Paris.. We could sit here all day watching the boats and listening to the street music. The river is the heart of the city. It would be so much less without it.
Boat trip. Highly advise anyone to take the boat trip, sensational!
Magic. There is no place like it in the world. What more is there to say.....

River Cruise. We purchased a two day red bus tour ticket and also a river cruise. Whilst the bus tour was great (hop on-hop off) the river cruise was a little disappointing. The tour guide spoke three languages and by the time she got to English the thing we were supposed to be looking at had passed us by. Also, we found her very difficult to understand so gave up eventually and just admired the view. Worth doing but not the best

pretty river Seine. I loved all the stunning bridges over the Seine and also the way all the young people went down by the river to eat their lunch also the artists selling paintings and pretty cafes, If you are going as a couple bring a Padlock with your names engraved on and put it on the bridges and throw away the key, that was one of the most romantic things I saw and I think there is 2 bridges where you can do this, be prepared as I really wanted to do it but there was no time.
Do a night cruise!. The buildings look great at night with the big flash lights on them!

Take a river tour. On our first day in Paris (after an overnight flight from the U.S.) we were pretty tired and not too energetic. The river tour on the Seine with Bateaux Parisiens was well worth the money. The overview of Paris from the water was a great way to start our week there.

Take a cruise on this River. I think the boat cruise up the River Seine was well worth taking an hour out of our day. Seen top attractions, beautiful buildings and bridges!! It does help to see more of Paris in a shorter period of time.
Touristy, but to the Batteux Marches. Windy but a beautiful 6:00 cruise...it was a great overview..

Great trip - you can see many of the great icons of Paris. The boat cruises up and down the river.
Great way to see the attractions from a different view.
I would recommend that you take the boat on the half hour in the evening so you arrive at the Eiffel Tower as it becomes illuminated.
A great spectacle not to be missed.

Beatiful. We were hesitating on this one, but it was great.We took the Bateaux Parisiens close to Eiffel Tower and made the one hour tour which is a good way to navigate the Seine and watch some of Paris from another angle. Also, a great way to rest our tired feet.I'm not really a fan of boat tours, but this one was worth it.Since the boats navigate on the right track, try to get a seat sideways on the left side and you`ll get the best view both ways.
Easyb Access. Use BVatobus to travel between sights on the Seine

Take the river and canal tour. Dress warm for the adventure, the river and canal tour was a relaxed way to enjoy and see various parts of Paris, both touristy and not. Pack a brunch picnic for the morning tour and enjoy the leisurely journey.
where postcard Paris looks best. city streets are city streets, but the view of "Paris from the waist up" is breathtaking from any cruise, day and night from the river.
Beautiful, but windy. Fun to walk along, and to cross over from side to side. Be prepared with coat and scarf as it may be windy along the river.
Take a boat. A boat trip up the river is a super way to see Paris. The river itself is not much to see but the life surrounding it is.

A World Heritage Site Not To Be Missed: The River Seine!. I titled this review the World Heritage Site not to be missed because I feel this is overlooked often. Paris doesn't seem to promote this fact with street signs either! My wife and I took a river cruise and she thought it was one of the highlights of out trip. It is cool seeing the architecture of the city from the view of the Seine. The guides will give you unique insights and after walking miles in museums, this seated tour is a welcome rest from the hustle and bustle of the rush to see all that Paris has to offer.

Beautiful. We booked a combination one hour evening cruise and a dinner at Les Ombres (the Shadows) just down the street from the Eiffel Tower. Both the boat and the restaurant had glass roofs for beautiful views.
Relax and enjoy. Take one of the river cruises, sit back and relax and enjoy the view of Paris from the river. It is a good way to wind up the day after being on your feet all day.
A must see. Recommend a ride on the Bateau Bus - travel on the river between major sites all day for a fixed price

Excellent Pictures. You must take your picture with La seine in the background.You can cross various bridges "ponts" along the bridge and get some amazing shots. The best view of the La seine is from the Eiffel Tower.

A great way to see Paris.. Everyone going to Paris should do the ferry trip on the Seine. You can hop on and off at various places of interest like The Louvre and Eiffel Tower. Or just relax and do the round trip. You pass under some of the most beautiful bridges I have ever seen.

Seine. Its nice to walk the banks. Across from the Eiffel they have restaurants and tour cruises up the Seine and back. The cruises and restaurants can actually be found along both sides of the Seine. We took one of the cruises and it was decent.
Lovely cruise. We took the Batous up and down the Seine and really enjoyed the peacefulness and stuning views.
Relaxing cruise. It's a relaxed leisurely cruise with a good explanation of the attractions around the river.

What can I say. After a day of sight seeing, it's the place to stop and sit for awhile. Watch the boats go by, watch the Parisiens walk there dogs or catch a Bato Bus for a tour of the river. A great place to people watch!
Take a Seine cruise at night!. Absolutely beautiful and breathtaking! We booked at the France Tourisme office at Pont Neuf -- a one-hour cruise for 9 Euros.
The best way to see Paris!. Don't leave Paris without taking a boat on the Seine! Just make sure you stay in the boat -- no telling what can be found in this river!
Walk, walk, walk. Paris has designed wonderful walking areas along the river Seine. Take advantage of them and walk the day away.

View from the river.. It was a nice treat, away from the traffic and noise, to glide down the river and see the beautiful bridges, buildings and monuments from our open seats. Photo opportunities were plentiful.
seine. took a river bus down the river & back to see Notre Dame

The ONLY way to enjoy Paris and Normandy. What can I say? A Uniworld Seine River Cruise between Paris & Normandy was First Class, leisurely, interesting and a pleasure to experience.The accommodation onboard River Baroness was compact but had every amenity required. The Staff, from housekeeping to Captain was First Class. Food and unlimited wine at meals was top restaurant quality and varied. Included tours were informative and also allowed plenty of free time to explore indivually.Can't recommend enough. If you want luxury while sightseeing, Go For It !
parisian charming, evocative, etc. all those adjectives that are good, romantic, inspiring, awesome..etc.

You must walk along the Seine. Whatever you do in Paris, don't miss a walk along the Seine. You have to get up close and see all the bridges, houseboats and the every changing view of Paris along the Seine. Walking is the way to go! We did take a Batobus ride as well, but I think walking is the best way to see it all.
Beautiful river. Just walk around the river. You will see all the gourgeous buildings around it; enjoy the mood!
Nice view, but too many people peed on the sidewalk. well, it's romantic, it's beautiful. but it's stink with pee smell. i think france need to build more public washroom
very nice place to have a cruise and a meal aboard a river cruiser.. loads of marvoulous bridges and buildings lining the siene river.

Beautiful. So nice to just sit down and look at it, have lunch along it. If we walked, and we did a lot since being in a metro in Paris the whole time is a shame when there is so much to see, we walked along it. Also a great way to find yourself in the map! LOL

There are people that want to scam you. The River Seine is beautiful. However, as we were taking pictures a man came up to us and bent down and showed us a ring that he asked if we lost. He gave it to me and said it was good luck and then wanted money to buy coffee and asked for as much as 40Euros. We said no. As we walked along many more of these people were trying to con the tourists.

Brilliant. this one and a half hour trip was given to us by the hotel we were staying at, and i must say it was absolutely brilliant, you see almost all the sites at a leisurely pace, the boat was full but we still had room, you are given an audio guide which was useful. I would recommend this trip to everyone and would have paid for this.

A cruise is a must do...a highlight for us!. We only took a 1 hour cruise from point neuf, but it is still one of our highlights. The "tour" itself is a little annoying (they could do without the announcer) but it's a beautiful cruise hitting all the main sights. If it's a nice day, be like the locals and lay out along the river, or take a picnic. Atmosphere is fantastic.
great view. great place to share bread, cheese and wine with a friend at sunset

Botobus. Get the pass...we got the five day pass and it was worth every penny. Unlimited usage. I could just go round and round. Everytime we got on the river I saw something new. The bridges are so beautiful!!
Go on a cruise at night!. Take a river cruise at night! Great photo opportunities and interesting facts

Take a river tour and see Paris from Seine. Take a river cruise on the seine , you csn buy tickets in the bank of the river in frount of the Eiffle tower. You can also get a cruise and dinner to dine while on the Seine. I really enjoy it every time I visit Paris.

Do a River Cruise at night!. With all of the walking you will be doing in Paris to see all of the sights, you may not get as much time perusing the bridges along the Seine. A river cruise helps you see a larger area along the water and the uniqueness of the bridges that cross it. The lights at night are enchanting.

Enjoyed our Seine boat cruise. We went on the Seine cruise that departs from the foot of the Eiffel Tower. The boat has a glass top so you are shielded from the weather but get a good view of the various buildings and places of interest along the river banks. Some wonderful architecture to be seen! We arrived at about 10am, at this time of year the boat was not too full but maybe further into the season it gets busier. The commentary is in various languages courtesy of a hand held audio guide which is very informative. The trip takes about an hour and was good value at 12 euro.

Miracle of French design. It's almost as though the French went to unbelievable lengths to design the Seine and its many bridges. Spectacular from almost any angle. View le Pont Neuf; - watch a bateau-mouche make its way down river at night, lighting up the stonework of Notre Dame. Beautiful.

Beautiful in the summer - Paris Plage!. We were fortunate to be in Paris in the heat of August and see 'Paris Plage' when they shut down one of the main streets bordering the Seine and truck in tons of sand and make it into themed beaches. We spent an hour walking the several kilometers of beach, seeing the attractions (sand castles, giant beach chairs, artists, massage therapists) as well as people watching. Several nice cafe's and gelato stands are set up as well, and bathrooms areas are set up as well, under the overpasses and are reasonably clean.
A river cruise. The only way to see this river is to take a River boat cruise for 1 week. Get to see the smaller towns and villages along the Seine.

A must. You have to stroll along the Seine. You just have to! During the day save yourself some euros, stop in a Monoprix (grocery store) and get a delicious prepared sandwich and drink for well under 10 euros and go sit on the banks on the Quais. But be warned. If you are single and a woman, you will not be sitting alone long. Whether it is someone genuinely "hitting on" you or someone trying to scam you - just be careful and smart. Polite, but smart. :)

Great Place to Walk!. The River Seine is the best place to walk in Paris! There are plenty of large sidewalks (more like roads) along the river banks that you can walk along for much of the length of the river. You get great views of all the historic buildings in Paris, but without the cars, noise, and crowds of walking up on the street. Definitely worth a stroll!

Must see. You haven't seen Paris until you have walked along the banks of the Seine River. There are all of the books sellers along the sidewalk and in some places, you can go right down beside the river and see the barges and bateaux-mouches.
