We were there at New Year's and it is still a wonderful place to walk around for hours.

Magical. The boat ride on the Seine was pure magic. the great music that was played, the history on either bank of the river, the french atmosphere is something that cannot be described, it can only be experienced. Try to take the river cruise at the right time so you can catch half of the trip during daylight and the other half while it's getting dark. When the lights of the Eiffel Tower came on, everyone gasped. It was just spectacular !!

Batobus. Would recommend to use the hop-on-off ticket for the Batobus rather than the open top bus. Jump a local bus to the tower (or one of the other stops) and get a 2 day ticket for boat. It stops at all the main attractions is much better then being stuck on a bus in traffic for ages!

Take the boat. When in Paris a boat ride on the Seine is a must-do. Actually I think it was the best part of our visit. The boats glide along all the famous sight, there are narrations in several languages.

the best in Paris. i like to walk along the river , their bridges , all the places -museums along the river .
i like in the winter and in the summer too .
The trip by boat is very good .
Take Time to Stroll!. Take the time to stroll up and down the Seine. Each visit we love the sites, looking through the book and art vendors.
Gorgeous. Peaceful, relaxing, meandering down the river with great commentary

Great way to experience Paris. My family and enjoyed taking the seine river crusie for dinner. This was a wonderful way to leave Paris. The food and the service was wonderful, different companies offer different menus so check before you book. We enjoyed seeing the monuments and the streets of Paris, from the river. This was my third trip to Paris but the first time doing cruise. I would do this again on my next trip to Paris.

So French. It seems to be one of the most popular gathering places in Paris, for all ages. There are a lot of river boat tours, of differing prices. The one we went on had a repeating cycle, and you could jump on and off as you liked, being able to spend as long at each destination as you wanted. Take your own drinks, though, a bottle of water from the dispensing machine is expensive. A lovely place to take your lunch and eat, witting by the river. Could do with a few more rubbish bins, and public toilets, though.
A relaxing stroll. This is one of the places to go in Paris when you need some time to just chill out and relax. Yes, take it easy and stroll along this fine riverwalk.

Under the bridges of Paris with ... well with a loved one of course. Make sure you try to catch the 9 pm boats, not to spoil your fun but make sure you are watching the Eiffel Tower on this cruise...Or take a cruise in the sunshine and enjoy the ambiance of one of my favorite cities of the world.Well worth a couple of hours of your time !
clean. I imagine at one time the Seine was no more than an open sewer but today, despite all the river traffic, it's very clean.
Take the bateaux tour. We just loved the river Seine with all it's bridges and all the surrounding monuments. Don't miss the Bateaux Mouches boat tour it's just lovely.

I am sailing .... Bought a day ticket on a Batobus and had a wonderful cruise along the Seine - saw the riverside sites allowing many photo opportunities. Hop on - hop off and at 15 euros for the day, I had a good time
use the batobus. batobus well worthh it. Jump on and off at 8 different stations, frequent service, good value at 15 euros

Bateaux Mouches - well worth the ride!. A Seine boat-ride is a must to see everything along the way!
Try Bateaux bus which is the cheapest- we rode from near Notre Dame to the Eiffel tower and back.It was great sight-seeing!
Nice river....!. Nice view of Siene in Notre Dame, Louvre, Champ de Elysse, Eiffel Tower. Try river bus to view beautiful tourist spots of the city.
dinner cruise. The meal was fab. the cruise was very peaceful a must to do while in paris. You really get to see alot along the river and the people on the river always waved they were so friendly.
Wonderful cruise. Beautiful weather added so much more to the river cruise, good narrative whilst traveling explaining the history

See the Seine at night from a boat.. The City of Lights and its many beautiful attractions is magnificent at night during a quiet boat ride along the Seine. Many cafes to enjoy at the end of the ride. Perfect opportunity to enjoy Notre Dame and the Eiffle Tower glowing along the river banks. Great photo op!
walk along and take in the view. take time to see the street vendors and the little bridge with all the pad locks that lovers put on the fence

Definately recommend a boat trip!. When i was in Paris, i took a boat trip on the river Seine. It was a great way to explore Paris ans see the sights, especially if you have a limited amount of time. Its probably the most relaxing way to view the city too.

River Cruise to Normany. We cruised with Grand Circle from Paris to Normandy. Our first time on a river cruise. We will be back for I hope many more. The service was great and the food excellent. The ship was clean and the people were very helpful and guided tours were fabulous.

by foot or by boat, really just perfect. If you are walking along the street above the river there are always vendors selling paintings, or food, wonderful views. I guess the guide books say its better to stay at street level than down next to the river for walking, which make sense since so many movie scenes next to the river end up in gun battles. Its not that bad, but for safety's sake a lot harder to push someone in the water from street level, and more traffic to keep people honest. A boat cruise, and dinner is the way to see it from the river level and plenty of wonderful views looking up as well.
take a cruise. any time of the year... great cruise for the entire family.
A river cruise is a must. Night cruise on the Seine was wonderful, specially seeing the Eiffel Tower all lit up

Wonderful. If you ever want to go to Paris you must go on the river seine. I went years ago but never went on a river trip but this time I did it was so relaxing no traffic no noise just beautiful scenery and you can have a drink of tea coffee or alcohol. Also you can sit outside or on top of the bat. You see all the sight Eiffel Tower, Notre Dam and more. So Go On Treat Your self. I went with my Husband and Teenage Son and they loved it. We went on the trip with Vedette de Paris and they were great and a good value price.
by boat. bateuax mouches was a great way to see the river and the sites along it

Do not miss!!!. Been there almost 1 year ago, but still remember it as it was yesterday. River cruise takes you all over Historical Paris with it's magnificent architecture, bridges and romantic atmosphere you can feel in the air. Cruise price is a bit over 20 euro, so if you already went to Paris - go for a cruise:)

take a stroll.... Walking along the Seine is one of the great things to do in Paris. In fact, walking around just about any part of Paris is great, but the Seine should not be missed. Just go where the wind blows you, eat when you are hungry, and see where the day takes you. If you want to be on the water then get on one of the boats and float a while. You can't go wrong.

Romantic Riverside Walks. The Seine is the perfect way to experience this city of romance. The water is beautiful, the view is stunning and the bridges are each unique in their architecture and history. A Paris honeymoon is not complete without a riverside walk along the Seine.
Sunshine on the Seine. If the weather plays along, it's a lovely wee stroll along the riverside. A bottle of water and a comfy pair of trainers is all you need to have a nice relaxing walk!

Do not miss it. a peaceful river, in the middle of the city crossing all main beautiful attraction, day or night, use the boat to visit, it is a delightful experience, from any ages to any ages. I love it, you get to see the boder, that you normally do not see while on land. City with teh river have definately something special
great 1 hour boat ride. a good trip for a hour dont buy a drink on the boat its a rip off!!

Romance. What a dream! These walkways along the River have to be the most romantic! Take an open air boat cruise during the day. We loved Les Vedettes du Pont Neuf just under the Pont Neuf bridge. They take Euros only. Spring time in Paris was perfect but would love to see this city in the summer!

A view of Paris from the River Seine.. We were supposed to do this trip by night to see the Eiffel tower by night. Because of our tour company the cruise was postponed until the next day. It was still a good trip down the river looking at Parismfrom a different perspective.
Tranquil walk. Head over to the Seine on Sunday when they close the road for a peaceful walk along the most romantic river in the world.

Busy boat trip. Went on a boat trip along the Seine - packed as it was a lovely day. Quite noisy too, but it was good to see the bridges. Some work going on along the banks of the river which obviously spoilt some of the views.
a great way to see Paris. I used the services of Bateaux Mouches, and the fee was quite a bargain for the quality of the tour-this is a "must do" if you are visiting Paris for the first time!

Take a River Cruise. We boarded an open air boat late in the afternoon. The cruise was about one and a half hours. Unless you take the cruise you will never quite see Notre Dame, D'Orsey, etc. this way. As we finished the cruise at sunset by the Eiffel Tower it lit up in all it's glory...wow!

Most romantic river in the world. Absolutely beautiful at any time of the day. Is the setting of some of the best meals you will have in Paris. All you need is bread, cheese, some sausage and some wine. Safe to walk even at night unlike some other cities I have been to. Just make sure it's not flooded and that you know where the stairs are if your planning on walking along and have a destination in mind. The walkways do not continue down the whole river in the city.
Batobus!. The batobus isan excellent way of getting around the city.Its not a guided tour but passes alot of the mian buildings. Its regular and reliable
Fascinating. Any moving water that travels through this architectural treasure trove can't help but fascinate.

Great way to see the sights. Don't bother paying tourist rates on a tourist boat just take the regular one and you can see most of the sights - Musee d'Orsay, Louvre, Eiffel Tower etc. for far cheaper than the others
Romantic. Very romantic. Everyone should either take a stroll with there love one beside it or a little Seine River cruise

River Seine. The Seine was a very useful landmark (watermark) to guide us when we were in Paris and it was also entertaining as there was a lot of boat activities to catch our attention. The bridges over the Seine are also very engaging and allowed us to cross the Seine when we felt like it.
Take a ride on one of the river boats. We took the Bateaux Mouches; just over an hour long. Nice to see the sights from a different angle. Very relaxing on a beautiful spring day.

Pont Neuf and River Cruise is Paris. A good way to see Paris is on the river cruise. You can get on and off at various stops and walk around or stay onboard and enjoy Paris from the water. Well worth it and not expensive. A walk across Pont Neuf is romantic and a must do in Paris. Lots to see walking from bridge to bridge with amazing artwork and artists. Truly what Paris is about.
The Seine. Nice to walk right by the river - beautiful near the Notre Dame

How romantic!!!. Perhaps one of the most romantic walks in the world. Taking a river cruise is a must especially at dusk. Inexpensive and seeing the city from the river is a site that cannot be explained except to say-Breath taking!
Try the Autobus Water Shuttle Loop. Great way to maneuver the sites of Paris around Seine in comfort and convenience
Cozy walking. Cozy walking, of Notre Dame to the Eifel Tower, and a nice view of the Pont Alexandre III

Interesting. Interesting how the French people allow such historical places to be destroyed by graffitti and trash being strewn about. We went on a boat tour and loved the bridges, but again the graffitti was such a distraction.
Wonderful Walking. Day or night, walking along the Seine is beautiful. There are places to stop and sit. Must do while in Paris!

A must do!. It was 15 euros for 1 day adult ticket or 18 for two days! Definately save the pennies, some times it was easier to get from point A to B on the boat then taking buses and metro. Its not only sight seeing experience, but convinient too!
Best way to travel. We used the taxi boat service which I think was very reasonable. Unlimited hop-on / hop-off for 18 euros for two days. Gentle way to travel through the city.
Boat ride at night.. A very nice way to see the city. Bring your own bottle of wine to save a few Euro.
Romance & History. As you're in a historical show, Parisian couples kissing on the banks are seducing to kiss your partner, very romantic.

Take the Batobus for a cruise on the Seine. It is relaxing to take the Batobus (you can hop on or off at any of eight sites) and see Paris from the Seine. You get excellent views of Notre Dame, the Eiffel Tower, etc. and there is no tiresome travelog in multiple languages.
Boat trip - go on a bateau mouche!. Pay just 10 euros and see on the boat some of the most famous buildings in Paris: tour Eiffel, Louvre, etc.

Fabulous place in Paris. Went on a boat cruise at night an amazing experience so much to see as Paris is all light up. Wonderful bridges that you pass under . Lots of little boats anchored along side a great place to visit
Beautiful river. How can you dislike anything about the Seine!!!! It is just magical.
Beautiful. Strolling the Seine is a wonderful way to see Paris. So much to see just by walking here.

Heart of the city. the heart of this city where i live since many years. Very nice bridges over this river like the Pont-neuf and Alexandre III, nice view from the boats "bateaux-mouches" for a little ballad, quite expensive but really interesting. In the night, better is the view and a feeling very romantic....In summertime, i recommand a ballad along the river on the "quais", especially on the island Saint-Louis with a good ice-cream bought in "Berthillon", the most famous sorbet in Paris.
Perfect Seine. Lunch Cruise on the Seine is the way to go. Bateaux Parisien was a great lunch cruise and my wife thoroughly enjoyed her birthday.

Batobus Tour. A great way to see the river seine. A wonderful picture point for the Eiffel Tower and there are guides onboard to point out the great interest points of Paris and architecture/history of all the bridges/houses. You can also hop on and off at certain points.

A great way to get your bearings on Day 1 of a Paris Visit. The particular tour we were on unfortunately had a school group on it that was so loud and misbehaving that we couldn't understand the commentary of our guide at all. However, the views from the river are amazing and it really allowed a quick layout so we knew where we wanted to head the following days.
Beautiful day or night. We took a hop on hop off boat ride and we got to see everything from a different perspective. It is so romantic.

I love waterways and this one is so full of life, enjoy a meal as you see the city of Paris. You have so many opportunities to enjoy cuisine and wine in Paris, you also have a number of river cruises to do this on too. I can not recall who we did our luncheon cruise with, but the scenery and service were memorable, in an oh so good way. The food was fine, not exquisite, the service was above normal, when one entree was not available we got to choose a second that came with a free bottle of wine, the day was superb, the scenery whizzed y (too much wine?) and the experience memorable. We will do so again on our next visit..

Floating Down The River. If you take a river cruise all of Paris comes to you as you relax on one of the many tour barges available. The Eiffel Tower, the Louvre, Notre Dame are just some of the site you will see.Take it a step further and enjoy a lunch or dinner cruise a most romantic event even for the coldest of heart.
We did a dinner river cruise.. We would skip the expensive dinner and do the night cruise. It is expensive, good but would have been nicer to watch the view without the meal as a distraction.

Trip from Pont Neuf. Very good way to take in a number of sights in a limited period of time. Commentary provided in French and English; cost was 11 Euros per head, using a discount voucher available on the internet. Trip lasted an hour.
walk at the evening. if you want a romantic walk in paris this is the place for you
Beautiful river at night. We went on a night cruise, able to see the major sights lighted under the evening sky. Must try at least once

Seine trip good to do but a walk just as good. I really was looking forward to the river trip on the Seine. Yes it was good to see different sights that you way not have saw if you walked IE back of Notre Dame, the mini statue of Liberty. If you like walks it is just as good. It does smell in parts too.
Romantic. will you walk along the river or take a boat ride (we did both) you will not make mistake it is so romantic, we realy enjoy
Batobus is great. Use the Batobus like a water taxi to get around. It's great, just hop on and hop off along the Seine.

romance on tap. everything about the Seine is romantic...from the boat trips to the long never ending walks along it. Its quiet and secluded yet theres always people around...couples, teens with instruments and people living on their riverboats which are so interesting to look at. If you decide on a boat trip along the Seine at night you wont be disappointed as you end up at the Eiffel Tower just as the lights flash on the hour....simply stunning.
Like a river. Just a lot of big boats but I liked it but not much to see from the road.

charming. A river that is like a lifeline for paris. Most major sites are visible from the Seine. For example, the louvre, notre dame, effiel towers as well as every day paris life passing by. You can do a batobus round trip fpr 15 euros and takes about an hour. Great to go out on the balcony area of boat and see all the different bridges structures.

It's wild it's cool it's relaxing. The river Seine plays an integral part of Paris it divides the city and flows around the central islands, there are some stunning looking bridges crossing the Seine namely the Napolean Bridge and others all architecturally lovely to look at. There are many spots with steps going down to the waterfront with plenty of places to sit and relax, to think and watch Parisian life go by, take a Bagette, a roll of Brie and a bottle of Vin Rouge and you'll have a fond memory to last you your life time.
Romantic stroll. Walking the Siene is not to be missed both at the bottom level for romance and along the top for the Bouquinistes.
A Must. If you like boats, inland waterways and land marks & History it's a must.
boat cruises. fantastic, you can pay at various tic machines then jump on any cruise you fancy with your ticket. Very informative and some great sights. Well reccomended

Best time along river Seine!. Next time when my wife and I visit Paris we plan to spend one full day walking along Seine. We spent two hours early in the morning, and two hours late night around mid night night, and it was not enough. This city is so well integrated with the river, and river with the city, that you start feeling and understanding Paris much better if you spent more time just walking along Seine.
Romantic and elegant. Strolled the River Seine and took in the beauty of Paris. Must do!
a nice stroll. Beware of con artists pretending to pick up a gold ring off the ground and pass onto you as a couple and wish you good luck. They then ask for money.

OK but it is not Prague or Budapest. The Seine is a lovely river and has a park like atmosphere and a small model of the Statue of Liberty stands guard but it lacks at least some of the magic Prague and Budapest posses. It is not on the top of my list of Paris attractions

Beautiful scenery. My family and I took the Batobus from the Eiffel tower, to Notre Dame, and to Louvre. The price was reasonable, however, I wish the Batobus would explain more of all the buildings that we past by.
Heart of Paris. Lovely views from the bridges. The 2 islands are great.

Brilliant. Why do all cities not make more use of their rivers? (Glasgow Please Note) Booked 2 x 2 day hop on hop off passes on Batobus,you can get close to most of the major attractions using this method of transportExcellent and somewhere to rest your weary legs after all the walking,whilst still sightseeing
Cruise the Seine and see the heart of Paris. Do not miss the chance to take a cruise on one of the big boats!

Beautiful and romantic. Best experienced by a pleasant stroll along the banks (plenty of places to do this - especially picturesque near Notre Dame) or else take one of the many river cruises on offer. We did both and thoroughly enjoyed the beautiful weather and atmosphere
Stroll. Walk the banks, or take a boat trip. Main thing is to enjoy.
by the river!!. You can't say that saw Paris without seeing the city from the Seine. Simply beautiful and cheap too!!

Take a break. It was lovely to sit back and take in the sights from the river, it's surprising just how much you do see and the commentry was very informative. Even better we got a 25% discount with our visitor travel card.
Amazing river to walk along, day and night!. We walked along the River Seine during in the day and night, and it is very peaceful and scenic. At night it was amazing with the lights and reflections!

Very relaxing !!. Great way to see Paris ! Their are are many landmarks very close to the river and the view from a tour boat is a different perspective and worth the small fee. A must for 1st time visitors!!
On and Off. Take the Batobus (18€ for a two day pass) and use it to travel up and down the Seine for great views and a peaceful and convenient way to travel between major sites of interest.
Great walk along the Seine. Take a walk along the river Seine from Ile St. Louis until Tour Eiffel. Nice roads and walkways along the river, in good condition, nearly any traffic.
Beautiful. enjoyed walking along the banks of the Seine and back and forth over some of the bridges and around the little back streets near to the river.
Great tour!. We embarked on the Bateau Mouche and must say we had a great sightseeing tour of Paris. A great tour!

A walk along the Seine is a must. The Seine is Paris. A walk along the Seine is a must to get a feel of a different Paris. The bridges are beautiful, and some of them are decorated by locks left by couples (the keys are thrown in the Seine). A picnic along the Seine (weather permitting) is very romantic and very Parisian. A must.

boat trip. we took the trip with the boat and we had a guide who gave
info both in french and english. Although she was sweet,
the details she gave in english were very poor comparing to
the full details she gave in french.
A Seine River Cruise is a must-do. A river-cruise along the Seine is a great way to see the city and helps to pass a very enjoyable few hours

come to Paris and walk along the Seine. It's a must. To feel Paris, you just buy a 'casse-croûte' (baguette and cheese, preferably), sit on a bench on the banks along the Seine and have lunch. Take your time. Afterwards, go to a little café, ask for a 'petit noir' or 'petit serré' if you feel really daring, sit for hours and enjoy.
Lovely. We took a short boat cruise on the Seine, it's romantic and very enjoyable especially if you sit outside.
Nice trip with Bateau Mouche. If you don't intend to take a boat trip somewhere else, then try this one. Really nice and fun.
Amazing!. Take a dinner on a river boat and enjoy the beauty of the night and Paris ville Lumiere.
Take the river boat tour!. You must take the river boat tour. There was so much to see and it was spectacular! Worth the time and money!
Bateaux Parisien Lunch Cruise. Fab - great food, great wine, amazing views of Paris - in some ways better than the dinner cruise

GO On, Walk and cross all the bridges.. We spent a day walking from the Eiffel Tower down to Notre Dam, and it was worth every bit of shoe leather to do it.There is only one way to actually see and "live" Paris and that isto walk it.Doing the "Metro" is good but not as good as all the sounds, smells, and people of Paris, face to face.
Nice walk along the river. We had a nice stroll along the Seine River. It was serene to stay there taking photographs, people watch and enjoy the view..

Relaxing summer time. DO NOT MISS THIS !!! If you are a real parisian you have to be there during the summer time !! buy a bottle of rose, discover the "paris plage" and just sit down and enjoy!!! There is an atmosphere during this time where you just enjoy yourself watching everything. It s a must do for parisians, expats and tourists !!

Enjoyed a river cruise. We enjoyed cruising around the river and there are various outfits to do this through from fine dining to just the cruise. We opted for just the cruise as we wanted to explore restaurants on our own.
Fab. If you can take a cruise boat down the Seine (but make sure you pee first, the loos on board the one I travelled on wasnt for the faint hearted....)

River Seine evening cruise is outstanding. My wife and I took the evening cruise. It was great. You not only get a great view of Paris but you get an education as well. The narration during the cruise was excellent.
Its fantastic. No mater what else you visit in Paris, you have to take a day or night trip with the famous “Bateaux Mouches". Its fantastic.

Batobus. We used Batobus to get around on the river. It is €15 for one day and €18 for two days. It allows unlimited time on the boat and there are 8 stopping locations. The company advertises max 25 minutes between boats but our experience was thet 30-35 minutes is more realistic. Unlike other boats there are no hot drinks facilities. The Seine itself offers some picturesque sights.
River Seine. Beautiful aspect, to stroll along the Seine absorbing the atmosphere of this romantic City
Relaxing!. We took the Seine river cruise after having lunch at the Eiffel tower. Its a walking distance just accross the tower. Oh, what a beautiful scenery of the river and it was enjoyable!

The romantic tour for excelence. If you are a couple you cannot leave this one out of your itinerary. And please do it at night, you will not be sorry.The views of the city of light from the boat at night are just amazing!Highly recommended.
Like a movie. I've always wanted to take a boat on the Seine and i felt like I wa in a movie or a dream when I did. It was wonderful.

Take a riverboat tour.. Breathtaking views. It's a step back in time. So peaceful compared to the city of Paris. Take a riverboat tour, day or night. And head to the old section of Paris near Cathédrale Notre Dame--we bought a couple of beautiful local oil paintings on the banks there.

Wine, French Bread, Cheese and the Seine, what could be better?. My review says it all... it was magical! Even in the cold winter, it's STILL magical. Not to be missed. Obviously, having been there both in the summer and the winter, there's nothing like the summer breeze in your hair and the moonlit cobblestone streets, but the boats and barges all decked out for Christmas had its own magic.
Bateaux Mouches. Great way to see Paris. Passes most of the must see sights. Good foundation in getting your bearings around Paris and relaxing to do after a walk up the Eiffel Tower!
Just stroll along. Bookstalls by the river was great for browsing as its not always your usual touristy souvenirs; wonderful for people watching too
The Real Thing!!. Walk along the banks, at different times of the day. There is always something to see and be seen in. Especially, walk across bridges and look around!

paris' essence. what whould paris be without the seine, the left side of the seine and the history of its bridges . beautiful views and romantic boat ride and good means of keeping your orientation in paris besides the eifel tower of course.

Beautiful walk or cruise. Its worth a walk along the borders of the river Seine, that way you will see the most special things to visit i guess. There are beautiful bridges, nice to take pics. Along the road you will find artists and small stalls where they sell things. You can also take a boat and make a cruise ofcourse ...
Iconic but dirty. The water is so brown! It's lovely how it cuts the city, but the color is off-putting.
School Tour (long time ago). It was during easter break, beautiful scent of flowers along the narrow streets, a view of Paris from the River Seine Gorgeous...!

Take a cruise on the River Seine, there is so much to see.. First time I was in Paris, they had torrential rain a couple days before I arrived and the Seine River was flooded... no boats were on the river and the roads beside the river were completely covered in water. So the next time I visited Paris we took a cruise on the Seine. Well worth the money and so much to see with may photo opportunities. Even the old house boats are a sight to behold.

Walk from Notre Dame to the Eiffel Tower. It's a long walk along the Seine and there are plenty of cute little kiosks selling paintings, books, souvenirs and little trinkets to stop and muse over. A walk along the Seine is as classic romantic Parisian as you can get. Really it could be any decade when you start your stroll, Paris is timeless.

Have a walk .... Its so beautiful and nice to have a long walk along this river. You can also find artists and small stalls of people selling things here. A way to relax and see the nice things of Paris..

so many beautiful bridges. Take a boat tour on the Seine to orient yourself to the layout of the city. Love the bridges. Love the couples walking along the quais.
Then, walk along the Seine, cross thebridges, notice each part of the city. Check out the book market.

Comme ci, comme ca.. Well, I can understand why you think it's necessary to take a bateau cruise when you visit Paris for the first time. But take care. They are expensive, the food is nothing special, and for the biggest part of the route the view from the river level is much worse than from the river bank. Anyway, the cruise is not bad,but if you like walking around you can avoid it.

river trip. we have done the river trip on odd occasions but the water bus is great and good value the stops are good for the louve notre dame and tour eiffel and in the summer it beats walking it gets very hot in mid summer and the metro is very hot so the cooling breeze on the water is great well worth it.
Boat Trip... 15euros for a day pass on the hop on/off boat bus! defo value for money - great views and friendly staff!

So beautiful!!. I took gorgeous pictures while I was walking along the river! Visit the bridge Pont des Arts, very close to the Notre Dame Cathedral where people have a tradition to fasten a padlocks to the railings of the bridge ( with their name and their beloved one's initials engraved), then they toss the keys into the Seine river to symbolize their eternal love!
Boat up the Seine. Great way to see the city. We were sheltered in a glass covered boat and could clearly see the sights. It's a great chance to get off your feet too!

Beautiful and romantic for couples. well organised and very polite friendly staff happy to answer history queries you may have, comfortable seating and good head sets to listen to history in may languages, only 9euros for a group of us around 20 went on it, thouroughley enjoyed this boat made even better by courteous staff they are up on how to welcome customers, they know how to get ahead with tourism, well recommended, will go again

See it by boat. The best way to see this river is by boat. We did the night cruise with food (which is not cheap) but it was fantastic. Paris really is the city of lights and what better way to see them than from the river. We started at the Eiffel Tower and floated down past Notre Dame and then back on the other side back up to the Statue of Liberty (Paris version not it doesn't cross the Atlantic:))The day cruise would just be as good I would think, but the Seine has a lot of history to it so make sure you take the time to walk it or like we did, sail down it.

Avoid the tourists and stroll along.... Of course, so typical of Paris, with its book sellers, Notre Dame in front of you, the whole area round St Michel (and the famous library Shakespeare and Co where all the Henry Miller and american writers used to come); Fontaine St Michel... Beautiful bridges. Boats as you go along... ad barges. And people getting the sun on sunny days... One has to go there : it is Paris !

Dark and dirty. It may be wide enough, but definitely not the cleanest in this part of Europe. Try going further down or up and visit little towns and villages that offer the charm and beauty expected from such a powerful stream.

Take a boat ride. There are several boats on the Seine, which offer still more beautiful and unique views of this spectacular city. You can take an inexpensive boat taxi ride, or opt for one of the tour boats, some of which include restaurants. It rained when we took our boat ride and it was still beautiful. You also get an interesting view of the chimmeras on the river side of Notre Dame.
day and night river cruise. Both giving a different vision. Many Bateaux cruises to choose from and leaving from various ponts at regular intervals. The night cruise with dinner is romantic.

Boat trip. Took the short one hour boat trip from just below the Eiffel tower on Bateaux Parisiens. This went as far as the Ile de la Cite and turns around just past Notre Dame, so you see the Musee D'Orsay and the Louvre amongst many other interesting bridges and buildings. A commentary is available in various languages via a handset on board. NB Legroom is very restricted on the boat but the trip is worth it as it's only an hour and you see an awful lot in this time.

Bateaux Mouche. I took the bateaux mouche......Had the flu so was unable to venture outside and take it in..boat journey was a tad too long..went during the night so the sparkling lights from the Eiffel Tour gave me the Paris experience

History in a river. Walking along the banks of the Seine on a sunny day is one of the great pleasures of Paris. The river continues to be full of life and activity and the many bridges offer a history lesson in architectural styles. There are vendors selling postcards prints, paintings and vintage magazines and books any of which make a great souvenir. I have a small etching on my wall at home that was bought here 35 years ago that is a view of the Seine. I can stand in the same vantage point today and it looks exactly the same.
Great!. What would Paris be worth without the Seine..... Go for a cruise in the river, well worth it!

Beautiful, just like the movies....except for homeless people. The walks along the seine are beautiful, beautiful, beautiful. Just under each and every bridge the smell is terrible, homeless people living there of course. The parisian feeling just gets mashed when that happens.
A Must..... for around 10 euros, you get to see everything worth seeing. Can be cold so wrap up
Walking through time.. All of Paris truelly stunning, the buildings, the atmosphere, just knowing that you are following in the foot steps of some of the greatest masters in the world!!!

The allure of a soothing river. There is something special about water - Ilive on a surf beach but am never tired of the allure of watching and listening to the waves.The rivers of Europe are different but no less alluring - all ofmy favourite cities of Europe are based around a river - they may not have the noise of a wild surf but there is a fascination and tranquility in walking by the River Seine.It is a combination of a natural resource on one hand and a man-made environment next to it.Iamconstantly fascinated by how people over the centuries have lived and developed their homes and lives.The river Seine is a living inspiration.

A walk and cruise. Its fantastic to go on foot in a walk at the river bank, or to have a cruise over its water. The first will give you the romantic feeling thats famous for paris, while the second will give you the chance to go through important land marks and attractions of paris together with going through some points in history. The walk will take you about half an hour to enjoy the feeling while the cruise time is about an hour beside the time you will wait till the schedule of the boat.

Bridge of Locks is worth it. Located just behind Notre Dame connecting the Isle de la Cite to the latin Quarter, it is very romantic. You lock your love on the bridget and throw the key into the Seine. It is the epitome of romantic Paris.
You must go on the river. We went on several different boat tours while we were there. One even served lunch. My favorite was a smaller open air boat. The city is amazing from that point of view.

Romance with the soundtrack to match!. We cruised the Siene of an evening just before our meal at the Eiffel tower. We were greeted at boarding and had a lovely picture taken. Inside it's not luxurious, think bench seats but this doesn't make it less romantic. We sat outside and snuggled up to enjoy the cruise which was complimented perfectly by the 'American in Paris' soundtrack ( one of my fav Gene Kelly movies) and we felt as though we'd stepped right into our very own romantic musical :-)

best to be seen from Quai Voltaire. become friends with the French, if that is possible or become a Diplomate, rent or buy an apartment on Quai Voltaire, you will never want to live anywhere else anymore
Seine River tour. what a lovely ride down the Seine through the heart of paris!at night is best
Very nice. Took a ferry ride on the river, very romantic, and lots of history, not to be missed.
Beautiful!. A beautiful river. So wide and ... wavy! It's lovely to see the boats go by with all the seagulls and pigeons on top. Many lovely boats there also (restaurants and all).
Unique experience. Beautiful scenery, historical buildings around, great food and service at cruise ship. Should take the cruise at least once if in Paris.

Perfect night under the stars.... What can be said that has not been said of one of the most famous rivers in the world. Cross Paris by the most representative places on the sailing countless tourist boats that provide tours of an hour or more with dinner included. What more could you ask for a nice romantic evening dinner on the Seine in the light of the moon. Happy Valentine!

Free walk. Enjoy a relaxing stroll along the Seine. Many things in Paris are pricey, so a stroll along this beautiful river is a must. Take a trip on a river cruise if you want to see the banks of the Seine and your feet are tired.
Tyremarxx. Nice river; the boats were expensive. The best part is Ile de la Cite, with the cathedral.
Cruise. Loved the sights and it gives perspective of the city. Wasn't fussed about the cruise boat and food, I just wanted to look at the sights.

lovely boat trip. you do not want top miss a lovely boat trip on Seine. it is romantic, specially during the evening and you will also find a lot of things about all the historic buildings along Seine.
Value for money. great value for money, several trips to choose from, brilliant speaking guide, beautiful views and running commentary!

place to walk. the river was a different place to walk but at the same time a little scary and that was during the day. Be careful where you walk some of that liquid on the walk way is not water. Take a boat and enjoy the seine that way.
great value. only 11 euro and you get to see loads of sights in an hour and a half, also I'm not a fan of boats but found this very steady :)

Nice walking/boat trip. Take a nice walk along the bund if whether is warm enough or if it's cold take Batobus sitting inside behind glass windows enjoying unforgettable city views. The river is so beautiful especially when sun is shining.

A River Flows Through. We love to walk along the quayside by Notre Dame and on the l'lle St. Louis. You really get to k now Paris this way. Try to take the Batobus instead of the metro, and be sure to take a boatride at night on one of the many evening cruises.
It is a must. Bateaux Mouche is a must.....night cruises in Paris are so romantic.....if not...enjoy a beer or a bottle of wine on the banks of the river

Awesome tours there but watch out for the rats!. What a river! NIce to go to a place that accumulates all these historical buildings. If you want to go, go with the Bateau Bus. Awesome company that allows you to stop in 8 attractions.

Nice, a night visit is must.. Visited at night, took the boat, its is amazing. just before we took the boat trip, we have lovely coffee and french chips at the cafe right. The trip took across the town showing all great culture and historic places and buildings lite. Champagne/wine and cheese was served. Nice cheese, different. ready for dinner once returned. good trip, will recommend.
Cruise the Seine!. Go on a boat cruise. Bateaux Mourche. Many departures daily Beautiful Paris lit up at night!

The best thing we did!. We got a boat trip down the river Seine included in our hotel price as part of a deal. I would never have booked to go otherwise. It was the best thing we did all weekend! Even though it was cold, you can sit inside or outside, they have an excellent guide. Would recommend.

Good place to have a nice walking along Seine river. It's unsual possibility to me to wake up and see such large river, very quite in its way forward. Impressive to watch outside the windows and see such great landscape. Also back from a stressful day you can take a small walking along the river and feel like a "parisienne" for a while. This is peety because the real parisienne are moving fast, thinking to their own without giving a few minutes of attention a such superb performace of Paris river. What's a shame.
Great for a stroll. You can't miss it if you got to Paris. Check out the pedestrian bridges filled with locks (of love). Stroll along teh River Gauche and River Droite.
Unchanging river. Very interesting seen from a friend's flat. Quite a lot of activity.

Take the boat ride. If you have time, you should stroll along the river. However, if you want to save some time to go to other places, take a boat ride. Dining in a cruise will be a good experience but since for me it is overpriced, I decide to take the boat ride that only takes an hour. It is like an introduction to Paris.
The Batobus. Caught the Batobus, to catch some of the sites in a hurry, but a long walk if you have time and the weather is good would be much better.
Gaze. This area is really busy but who can resist a stroll along the Seine?

A good spot for a picnic. There are many river cruises on the seine, but they tend to be over priced for what you get - a description of the sites of Paris from below ground level, so you often only see the upper parts of Notre Dame, the Tour Eiffel, the Louvre, etc. The embankments of the river are a great place to take a lunch/snack break and watch the world and boats pass. Just pick up some food from any of the numerous stores, wander down to the river, sit in the shade either on a bench or the embankment and enjoy.

Romantic trip? Bring a lock with key and your names on it!. The Seine itself is not an attractive river, but the sights along the river are wonderful. We did not take a boat tour because it was so cold during our visit! Our visit was a business trip for my husband, and their activity was a dinner/boat cruise on the Seine. We passed because it was too late in the evening, but those who went reported that the food was poor and the cruise was freezing! We walked along the River on several occasions, moving between walking tours, museums, and churches. We enjoyed the used book dealers, and bought a lock to put on the wire bridge (best ones for photos are by the Louvre or by Notre Dame). The idea is that you put the lock on the bridge to symbolize your love, and throw the key into the Seine so that it can never be found and your love unlocked. We didn’t bring a lock, but purchased one from one of the street vendors. The key didn’t work with the lock – but the gesture was romantic! We also found on the bridges that the scammers were out in full force! A lady pretended to find a wedding band, asked if my husband lost it, then asked him to buy it.
seine cruise. Bateaux Parisien river cruise and dinner was brilliant. We booked online through discount-paris. Great meal and wonderful cruise lovely staff

River Seine is brown. I was very disappointed in the River Seine as it was dirty brown. There are loads of boat tours you can take on the River, but it was not appealing to me because of the colour. I would hate to fall into that River.
So Scenic. The river is stunning, we chose the Bato Bus as our transport in Paris, it's always nice being on the water and the bridges and views from the river are lovely.

View. Take a romantic walk in the evening ...along the River Seine.. The view of the Eiffel Tower at sunset from the river is amazing to look at.. visited in Jan 2012, pretty cold for me!!! We walk quite a distance, scene gets nicer as night falls.

Evening boat cruise.. My girlfriend and i enjoyed the illuminated river cruise, and i can only describe it as WOW. The setting and the history behing paris and st-germaine is just unreal, it is a must do activity :) please do it!

Godo way to see the sights if you are lazy. It was -13 degrees Feb 3, 2012 so we thought we would warm up on a boat ride after walking for 3 hours exploring the city on foot and in the cold and wind. Surprise. The boat had one small heater on- We were so cold. However, this is a problem in Paris. All the cafes and restaurants we went to were cold. Single glazing on the windows and not much heating.

Relaxing walk.... We were very lucky as the weather during our trip was just amazing! There are great places you can see around the river walk, jump on the sightseeing boat are just to stop to have a great lunch.
Great Place to run. You can run all along the Seine. It's an unreal feeling as you pass by your favorite spots - Eiffel Tower, Grand Palais, Invalides, Musee D'Orsay, Louvre, Notre Dame - endless.

You can't miss a boat ride on the Seine. We've done a boat ride previously at night time - which was awesome and on our last trip during the day time. A boat ride is a very clever way to experience Paris & see all the highlights of places you can visit later on. During our time in early January 2012, the Seine was overflowing and the boats struggled up river. You can't go wrong!

Perfect Walk. If you want a romantic walk in the evening ...along the River Seine is the place to be.. The view of the Eiffel Tower at sunset from the river is amazing to look at..You may read about my Paris trip..http://www.cafeinks.com/archives/1267/shimmering-paris

Grab a baguette and enjoy the view. For a cheap but very special lunch or early dinner (depending on the weather) grab a baguette, some cheese and ham from the local markets and sit by the Seine to enjoy a unique part of Paris.

wow! all the sites you can see from the river. you must must must do this. i did it by myself and i almost passed on going...im glad i did. and make sure your camera doesn't die like mine did...i got an unbelieveable shot of eiffel tower from that river.
take a night time cruise!. Not sure what cruise company we used, but definitely take a cruise at night. Bring your own wine and enjoy!
A trip down the River Seine. We did a cruise down the River Seine at night. Oh my goodness. It was so beautiful. Paris really is one of the most romantic cities in the world.

Walk along or hop on a boat!. Moving along the Seine by foot or boat cannot be a mistake! You will get a glimpse of many major sites. Although, remember that when walking in Paris it is much like Las Vegas...but only in the fact that when you look ahead you think that things are much closer than they really are! It really is far away! Make sure you bring good walking shoes or get on the boat instead.
Well worth the ride.... Take a trip along the river and just admire the beautiful buildings and history.
etheridge. Take a boat ride along the Seine River and you can actually see how enormous a building the Louvre encompasses.

Beautiful. Take a walk along the River Seine and you will find everything that's good about Paris. The Louvre Museum, Museum d'Orsay, The Eiffel Tower, and Notre Dame Cathedral, not only that but countless shops and restaurants.

The thoroughfare for the city. Whether you are walking from one location to the next, or taking a boat - the Seine is really the main thoroughfare through the city of Paris. Walking along the bridges, stopping at the vendors, purchasing oil paintings, and other old memorabilia is a wonderful thing to do along the Seine. The image will be in my mind forever.

C'est Magnifique!. Perfect way to see all the fantastic sites of France!!! It was so much fun just watched Paris from the water enjoying a cup of tea and snapping pictures! Loved it!!! Great deal!!! Affordable! You can take a walk under the eiffel tower and then jump on a river cruise....C'est Magnifique!
Atmospheric. Walking the river banks through the heart of the city is always atmospheric whatever the weather.
Awesome. I love walking all long this river! Especially at night, the banks come alive!
Cruising the Seine. Great way to quickly take in the sights - we took an hour long cruise for 9 Euro - well worth it - if a little cold - well freezing actually.

Pleasant Boat Ride on a Lovely Day. From the water you get to view some of Paris that would otherwise be missed. Excellent narration in English by a very cute guide. We lucked in with the weather as it was a beautiful fall day and quite wark for October. Seating was on the upper open deck so try to get in line early and suffera little wait to get a good seat.
Bateaux Mouches. A comfortable easy view of Paris from a different angle.
One of the world's most picturesque urban rivers. One of the world's most picturesque urban rivers, the Seine is spectacular and uniquely French.

Heart of Paris. What's a visit to Paris without a walk along the banks of the Seine? This is the heart of Paris, and where it began (Point zero is on the island where Notre Dame is). We stayed near Notre Dame, and thoroughly enjoyed our walks along the Seine both during the day and at night with all the buildings lit up. During the day, you have all the tourist to gawk at (us included!), and during the night (which during January was dark by 4:45pm) it seems you have the place all to yourselves. There's a sidewalk all along both sides of the river at street level, and with the countless bridges (well, you can count them on a map if you want), it's easy to switch banks and get a different perspective. There are also sections of river level walkways (mainly for the boats docked along the bank) that give you a fantastic view of the river and different perspective of the sites. We didn't do a river cruise (too rainy and cold most of the time we were there), but will consider it the next time. We noticed that many of the bridges were clogged with padlocks on their railings. It turns out that these are "love" locks, where lovers would inscribe their names on the lock, attach it somewhere on the bridge, and throw the keys into the river as a symbol of their love and commitment. I'll hold my opinion on this subject, but it does make for interesting pictures.
river seine. We bought the 2 day hop on/off bus pass and added the river cruise. It was only a couple euros extra and we are glad we did. It was a different way of seeing the city.
Nice boat ride. We took the last boat ride, the view of each major attractions were fantastic. Especially at night!

The Lifeline of Paris. Everyone needs to take a stroll along this storied waterway. Crossing the Seine on the multitude of impressive bridges is not enough. Sit on the point of either Ile de Cite or Ile Saint Louis and soak it all in. Paris, and all that matters in the world, began right here....

Worth a trip during the day not so much the night. Taking a tour on the Sienne is excellent idea during the day as it takes in a lot of buildings you may be unfirmilar with but are along the river, it is useful to understand the layout of paris also. The evening tour can also be excellent for the lights but for me it was harder to view the buildings, so this is much better for a dinner on the river which is expensive and leaves little time to look out. Recommend a walk along in the early eve to see the lights and side, tour during day

A lively place to tour, and transport you.. The Bateau Bus is an easy way to get about the centre of Paris, while seeing some of the sights from a different perspective.A night time trip adds so much to the experience - try and squeeze it in!

Meal and river cruise. Lovely, a trip up the river and back, taking in the sights and sounds. As the sun goes down the Eiffel Tower starts to twinkle, covered in hundreds of sparkling lights, a sight to be seen.The meal is actually very pleasant and the atmosphere is really quite romantic.We had a lovely time and would definately do it again.
Romantic and beautiful architecture. Romantic and beautiful architecture and its worth to take a boat to see all he great places around the river

a must see. We appreciated looking at Paris in a different angle. Cruising River Seine is much relaxing than riding the Hop on/off bus. the slow pace of the cruise allowed us to capture more interesting details of historical monuments. We bought the River Seine Batobus pass.
nice walk. its a nice river to have a walk along, there are also river cruises you can take.

The true heart of Paris. OK, you can take the bateaux mouches for a ride, but it's just as wonderful to walk along the river, see the sights and experience the true heart of Paris (or an artery, if you prefer). Day or night, you'll see the lovers making out at the bottom of the stairways and the impromptu dance parties, and practically hear the accordion music in your head, even when it's not actually being played. The bookstalls lining the streets, Notre Dame in the distance, Ile de la Cite - there's nothing in the world like it.
Seriously, a review of the Seine?. Walk along the river in the evening or the early morning, and be prepared to feel romantic!

Lovely. It is truly what makes Paris so romantic. The boats, the bridges over it, the buildings along it the parks with lovers enjoying it...like I said it is what makes Paris so romantic. Soak it in.

A must when visiting Paris. A bateux mouche (open air boat ride) is a must down the River Seine in Paris before you visit any monument or museum as it will offer you a perspective of the city that you can't experience. One must sit in the outside top level of the boat to experience the architect of the buildings and monuments. It is narrated in French and English, but with a small handy map as your guide, you are able to identify all the buildings and monuments the boat passes through. The Bateaux Mouche at Pont de l'Alma passes over at a replica of the Statue of Liberty that France gave United States as a gift and turns around to pass the Eiffel Tower- a front row view, especially wonderful at sunset time. The boats run every 20-30 minutes during the summer and tickets can be purchased in advance via on-line, very convenient as you do not have to wait in any line to purchase them. You are able to purchase some sandwiches/baguettes right before entering the Bateaux Mouches at the vendors and bring the food aboard. There are restrooms aboard the boat as well. The 1 1/2 hr. cruise is definitely well-worth it, even if you only have a few hours in Paris! During the summer you can even see the "Paris Plage" activities along the Seine-- mid-July - mid- August. Lots of great photo opportunties aboard.
Great View. We got bicycle rides through the city and passing over the seine (Pont Alexandre, and the Pont du Carrousel bridges) was really nice. next trip will be taking a boat ride.

Romantic and scenic in any wether. Beatiful and integral part of th city, beautiful views of the architecture and Patisian life. It's easy to spend hours (or days!) on the banks watching the city go by.

What real Parisians do. Grab a bottle of wine, some cheese, and grapes and head down to the Seine on a warm summers night for the most happening place in town. Don't forget to bring a bottle opener (but if you do, don't be afraid to ask your neighbors)!

A quick way to adsorb Paris... Many operators plough through the river.. pick any one and you will definitely get a good view of Paris waterways. A few tips on the river cruise, take the one that is near sunset (you'll get a stunning view of Paris)..and get one with a guide...

Cruise at night. The lights on the Seine at night were awesome plus we saw the Eiffel Tower twinkling on and off on the hour. Was fabulous to see it then - although it was cold and wet it was a wonderful cruise.

I was Sailing. Being winter we had to wait till another 20 folk came before the boat would take off,but it was well worth it.Even though we couldn't get under Pont Neuf bridge as water to high.It was really enjoyable.
Great way to get a view of it all. The river tour is nice, calm way to see the sites of Paris. It will give you an idea of the lay of the land, and you can get some really nice pictures.

Walk the banks. Walk for miles beside the river, each bridge is very distinctive and don't miss the bridge with thousands of signed padlocks pinned on it. You will pass by the Eiffel Tower, The Louvre, Notre Dame, Saint Chapelle etc.

From head to tose. My Advice is , you take a boat nearby bibliotheque and you float till the Eifell tower in a fresh summer afternoon .... with a glass of wine, a scarf, and something or someone you love with you.
That's Paris !
great way to see paris. Bateau mouche - doesn't go long enough but that may be for the best - only showing the prettier parts
What an amazing view of Eiffel Tower!. I enjoyed most of the cruise. Must take both day and night!
River Seine. A wonderful surprise. Not often that you can take a peacful stroll in such a busy city.
River Cruise. The river is beautiful. Take a boat to really enjoy it!
Great trip. Bateaux Parisienne was supurb. Great evening. Food excellent. Service attentive.

the life blood of Paris. We love the Seine...the views from the quais especially coming from Ile St Louis going towards Ile de la cite and Notre Dame...and we took a river cruise by night to see all the monuments lit up- spectacular ! We loved the Vedettes du Pont Neuf, with whom we toured... Don't miss it! Bring your camera, bundle up, and enjoy! Romantic beyond the beyond...

Seine smile. I have been to Paris four times and never cruised on the Batou Mouche. It was a beautiful hour and a half excursion from Pont Alba and back. It is a nice view of all the monument--Notre Dame, Eiffel Tower--from the boat.
Take the boat ride.. This gives you a fantastic overview of Paris. Even in the winter it was nice.
Must go place in Paris. Beautiful place in paris with lots of history. Would be even nicer to stroll along in the evenings
Boat cruise. Take an evening boat cruise with Bataux-Mouches to enjoy all of the national sights lit up at night.
beautiful river. But this river needs to be saved from pollution. I hope they clean it up.

Surreal, Special and Fabu at Sunset!. Spoiled on this cruise with colleagues as was a private reception. However I would do the cruise again with my family and surely one at sunset. It is a fun way to see the landmarks of the city and imagine the history that the river Seine has seen. If you listen closely, you may hear the whispers....

Fab stroll. Buy a early morning takeaway latte and walk along the river.
You will come across someone who may have sleep there that night just bypass.
Seine. What a wonderful place to walk. Lined with all kinds of shops and places to eat; street kiosks selloing antique this and that, the lovelybridges

Wonderful stroll along the river. It is well worth taking a long stroll along the banks of the Seine. It's so picturesque and plenty of photo opportunities. There are also some nice stalls selling Parisien artifacts from artwork to more touristy items. If you can't walk too well it's a good idea to take one of the boat trips as you'll see all the wonderful sites that way.
Romance. This place will always be special to my husband of 45 years and I.We loved our walks along the Seine everyday while staying in Paris. We plan on a boat cruise and dinner next trip.
fantastic walk. walked along from the louvre to notre dame - gorgeous buildings all the way.

Fun way to see the city in good weather. Get yourself a transit pass, which will allow you to take the "bato bus" on the river. What a bargain! You can get on & off, ride all day if you want. The stops are conveniently located near key tourist spots, from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame.

Cruise along the Seine. This river flows through the city of Paris and facilitates access to most tourist attractions .It was pleasurable for my family and I to cruise along the river and at the same time to visit major attractions. We took a full day hop-on-hop-off boat pass - “Batobus service”. They had guides on board giving details of oncoming attractions in English which was very helpful.Walking along the river bank is another enjoyable experience , even in the rains, and a must do when you are in Paris.
Take a sunset boat tour.. Beautiful to cruise at sunset. People out on the banks and he Eiffel tower is lit up and offers a great photo opportunity at night from the water.

Just lovely. I love being able to stroll across the bridges and walk along the river. I haven't yet been able to do a cruise but plan to on my next trip. I strongly suggest taking some time with a camera and stroll along the river and take home some great snaps.
Romantic. This river runs from the Eiffel tower down past Notre Dame. Get the boat hopper so that you can get off each stop and see the scenes. Its really nice

It is very special to be able to sit on a riverbank and sip a little redwine in January.... We really felt like an original PArisien....and then if you have found your one and only...don´t forget to put your locker and the bridge...

beautiful scenes along the river. We walked along the water, and took one of the cruise boats (Parisienne) for a luncheon cruise. Walking is better. You cannot appreciate the beauty of the cityscape from the boats.
Take a cruise. There are a number of cruise companies to use but it is totally worth the money and time to take a tour by boat and see Paris from the river.

A river cruise is a must for all who visit.... The River Seine runs through the heart of Paris so a scenic cruise is a relaxing way to "see the sights" as Parisians have for centuries in a modern and comfortable way.

Not quite the Thames. I feel a bit silly trying to rate a river, but let's give it a go.When thinking about the Seine in this context one really needs a good comparator, and for me there is none better than the River Thames in London.One of the best things about the Thames is its accessibility and utility, for tourists and Londoners alike. Somehow the Seine falls down here. Granted, there is no shortage of sightseeing cruises, but there is (currently) nothing akin to the Thames Clipper river bus, and little to take one beyond the traditional Notre Dame - Tour Eiffel stretch. A great river really needs great accessibility, and the Seine just doesn't cut the (French) mustard.If you can't get onto the river then you at least want to walk by it. In London this is easy, with traffic-free paths running almost all the way from Lambeth Bridge to Tower Bridge. In Paris things aren't so simple - unless one is lucky enough to find one of the very few tow-paths in the centre, you will be forced to enjoy your river views with choking traffic either immediately beside you or even between you and the waters. There are a few exceptions to this, such as the point where the two sides of the Seine, separated to encircle the Isle de Cite, once more rejoin - but these seem few and far between.So, if you can't get on the water, or walk beside it without choking on traffic fumes, can you at least sit next to it? Well, in my (albeit less-than-exhaustive) experience, in general you cannot. That's not to say you can't sip a beer and see the water at the same time, merely that the aforementioned roads and congested traffic (not to mention street furniture, parked vehicles and trees) will almost certainly have the better view! London (and I'm sorry to harp on about this) does this at least slightly better (though I confess not perfectly) with cafes, restaurants and pubs dotted along South Bank.From reading this one might get the idea that I don't like the Seine, or fail to recognise its importance in the overall cityscape. On the contrary the Seine clearly provides a vital role, funnelling not only its constituent waters, but also significant rail and road thoroughfares through the heart of the city. It also acts as a vital focal point for people (much as the Thames does in London), drawing people to its banks and framing the buildings and monuments along its length. In the best Parisienne tradition it is a great boulevard, a place to see and be seen, a place to be and a place to travel along. It is an entity which cannot be missed ... so long as you don't mind sharing it with the traffic!

a special way to see the city. Taking a river cruise was something I really wanted to do while visiting Paris... and i think it was worth every moment. Even though it was cold and windy....It was beautiful ... It was also super romantic.. We went on our first night in paris.. and it was truly something special to see the eiffel tower glittering along the Siene. You also get to see the whole city, from the river which is an awesome vantage point. Whether your on the Siene, wallking along it or over it on an old parisien bridge...its a river with a history that surrounds this beautiful city, and you'll get to see that while exploring museums where the Siene is captured in several french paintings

relaxing. A fantastic way to work out where everything is laid out in Paris, and a relaxing way to superficially see all the great landmarks is to take a ride on the Bateaux Mouche. The trip takes an hour.

Evening Cruise was dreadful. We went on an evening cruise ... it was dreadful ... the weather was poor so you couldn't sit outside. The cruise company did not reduce the number of people on the boat resulting in over crowding and a lack of seats... I sat on the floor for half the cruise and my wife stood in the drizzle. No apologises ... just treated like cattle ... very disappointing.

Romantic cruise along River Seine. I was here in December, and had a dinner cruise along River Seine on Bateaux Mouches. The ride itself was fantastic, with excellent views of some of Paris' most beautiful buildings. Notre Dame, the Statue of Liberty and the Lourve, among others, can all be seen from here.

Cruise. I took the river cruise that went by Notre Dame and back to the Eiffel Tower. This was pleasurable, even in the cold of winter. Some of the boats were equipped with plastic windows to reduce the cold. Do not miss the opportunity to cruise the river.

Spend some time there!. The river is the place to be, at least for part of your time in Paris. It is lovely to walk along the water. In the summer, there is a beach created on road along the river. Last time there, we saw a young couple having their wedding photos taken there!

The Heart of Paris. The river is so central to everything that happens in Paris. A walk along the bank in the morning or evening is fantastic take a look at the artists and book stalls near Notre Dame, sit on the bank and just relax with a bottle of wine and a some bread and cheese it's just supremely relaxing. Personally I would always prefer walking as the batobus are like moving greenhouses on hot days unless you can get a space out the back in the open air. If you can then it's a great way to see the sights if a little expensive.
Enjoyable and leisurely way to see the views. We went on a boat trip that had no guide to give details of the attractions, but it was still enjoyable

romancing paris. if you are traveling with your love a kiss on the seine tops the trip....walking across any of the bridges touches your heart so you know you have been in the most romantic city on earth....day or night it is all good....

Walk down along the river on a sunny afternoon with your sweatheart, it is breathtaking. Go down the steps and walk right along the river with your significant other; nothing could be more romantic on a sunny day in Paris. It is spectacular. The buildings seem to rise up from the river. A river boat cruise is also an excellent way to see the river for about 12 Euro.
Classic. You must walk along the River Seine when you are in Paris, it is beautiful and free to enjoy!

I could cruise along here all day. Took my wife on a cruise on the Seine for her birthday and it was something I would do again and again. Walk along side the river as well for a more intimate experience and find how the river differs at each point along its length. Just to show how much I loved this experience. I got married on the river in a previous trip.
lovely. One could spend as many hours walking by the banks of the river seine. Either of the banks has enough history to learn and enough places to discover.
Love it!. Paris is such a romantic city! And for me, it is the River Seine that gives such a romantic atmosphere.

Beautiful by night. We dined and travelled down the river on the river boat taking in all the sites alond the river lit up..the bridges we went under had a characture of their own, there were a few. I managed to take photos of the Eiffel Tower and many other interesting sites. A very calm river and peaceful river by night.

Romantic river cruise. The Seine is a major river of North Western France and one of its well-known commercial waterways, plus a great tourist attraction, especially within the city of Paris.Taking a tour of Paris by boat is unparalleled as romantic experiences go. The city seems to be fanned out before you as you lazily drift down the Seine River or Paris' miles-long network of canals.We took a boat cruise on the Seine River(about 1hr 15 minutes) and got a glimpse of some of the city's most mythical spots; one can just sit back and revel in the fresh air and delicious floating in a scenic setting.
Lovely to watch the Eiffle. We stood by the River to see NY in with the Eiffle tower, was lovely. Some lovely bridges crossing it.

Interesting. My favorite place to see the River Seine is near the Notre Dame Church. The sidewalks along the river are filled with stands selling old postcards, books, and tourist items. One can also take good photos of the church from afar.
Winding through the Heart of the City. The place to stroll or sit in a quiet cafe - romantic, serene, a place to take a break from sightseeing and refresh yourself

Definite Highlight!. Probably one of the best and most interesting parts of my trip to Paris was the cruise on the River Seine. It was very informative, told a lot about the French architecture we cruised past and it's wonderful history. It was interesting to note the progression in the bridges as they gradually became more modern the further up we went, and seeing how impressive the Notre Dame was up close... and to think that it took two hundred years to complete!!Definitely recommend doing this, it was incredible value for money!

The Beautiful Seine. The Seine is wonderful. By all means, find a unique lock and write your name(s) on it and the date you were there (or if you are like us, and practically no one is, write your wedding date on it), and attach your lock to the wire mesh. This bridge is on the flying buttress side of Notre Dame, and is about three bridges from the Pont Neuf. Oh, and do share a kiss on the Pont Neuf.

And a river runs through it (the city, that is).. Beautiful river that runs through a beautiful city. Make sure you take one of the boat rides while visiting Paris. They offer dinner cruises as well as your basic one hour tours. If you want, you can even use the river/boats as your public transportation! They offer one day and multi day passes which allows you to go up and down the river, getting off and on as you want.
Beautiful Seine. The cruise down the Seine was one of the highlights of our trip. We had the chance to pass by all the amazing attractions. A not-to-be-miss experience!

Beautiful River Seine. We loved our tour of the River Seine. We went at night and took in all the lights and sites. It's a must see while in Paris. During the day, it is wonderful to walk around the different, unique bridges and take pictures of the boat.
Walkers. For the walkers of you out there then you can have a lovely walk along the seine dipping out sometimes into the gardens and back onto the bank

Very pleasant and good sightseeings. The Seine river is really nice. You can enjoy it on the side, with a traditional french wine or through the many boats that circulate on it.The greenish water attracts the attention and can serve as a good backstage for photos. Try also to walk around the river and appreciate the bridges of Paris.During the summer, don't miss the "Paris Plage" - a beach along the river

Perfect for a stroll. Taking a stroll along the River Seine at any spot is inspiring. We took the river cruise around the city to introduce ourselves to the the City lay-out. Excellent Choice. My visit was in March 2010..

Only went as it was part of our package, but very impressed. Our hotel package included a Seine cruise, otherwise I doubt I would have gone, but it was well worth it; fascinating history and views from a totally different perspective.

Great Place to relax and take in Paris. We walked along the Seine numerous times while in Paris. It's very lively in certain parts at night with dancing a music, and during the day (in the summer) with Paris Plage and many people having a drink and some lunch!The atmosphere was always great and being able to see all of the bridges from a different view point was also really nice!We also took two different boat cruises (just the cruise, no dinner) one during the day and one just as it was getting dark. I would definately recommend going just before dark so you can watch the sun go down and pass the Eiffel Tower all lit up at night! Stunning sights!
A must if you visit Paris. Loved the ride. Headphones provided so I could listen in Engish. Very beautiful.

Enjoy an evening cruise.. Our apartment was just across the road from the Seine, so we were able to stroll along the edge of it every evening after dinner. We took a daytime cruise strictly for the sights and photography and an evening cruise for the City of Lights glowing at night and for the romanticism.

Beautiflu. Make sure that you take a trip on the river during your visit to Paris. We combined a half day tour of Paris ending with lunch on a boat on the river. It was memorable and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Paris tour

All roads lead to the river.. Fast flowing river, brown muddy colour.
Very good for sightseeing if you take a boat ride which allows you to hop on and off .From Effiel Tower to Notre Dame.
Lovely walks by the river , even on rainy days.
take a boat trip. Good view from river cruiser, passed many famous landmarks. Too many people on boat and long wait to get on.

From the West banks to the South banks. The Seine is always your gentle guide and help you find your way back if you are lost in Paris, just follow the Seine. Best spots to admire it are the quays, where you take or not, the ferries (bateaux mouches).

Relaxation Station. A perfect place to just sit and watch the world(and boats and parisians) go by. In the summer there are more people lying on the banks, so that is the time to go for that. In the winter not so much, but you will always find lovers kissing and relishing love. You can go back and forth across the various bridges as well. We ate our lunch down on the banks. A nice retreat from tourist central.

Take a cruise on the river. If you have the time and the weather is in your side don't miss a cruise in the seine, look for one in late afternoon so you can see the sunset while navigating the river. You will get another perspective of the city and all the great buildings built by the river bank.

Beautiful sights on the Bateaux Mouches. If you truly want to see the river, take one of the Bateaux Mouches. The river, from land, is just a river; there is nothing too special. However, when you sail the river, you will see the beauty Paris has to offer. Watch people having a nice lunch on the river banks by day, or at night see the Eiffel Tower lit up in all of its glory! The river is nice to look at, but even more wonderful to sail! Try this, and you will not be disappointed!

Amazing what you can see in an hour.. Night time cruise to see the sights of the Seine. Not only do you get the amazing architecture Paris possesses but you see the Parisians being themselves along the way. While every body is looking at the landmarks I was also people watching along the banks of the river. You see the people partying on the banks and dinner boats. It is amazing what you can see just sitting in a boat for an hour.
Prolly Not Worth The Effort. What? A river in the middle of Paris...oh, let's see...I been to the Mississippi, so what's the big deal, right?
Boat trip worth doing. Went on one of the Boat trips (the one that comes free with the Paris Pass). Quite fun, easy to move around the boat (ie don't worry about selecting a seat at the start).

The essence of Paris. We stayed on the islands so we were near the river. It is a great place to walk along. The area around Notre Dame is really scenic and you can spend a lot of time wandering along the river bank and visiting shops and bars. It is a good place to get photos from and you need to visit the bridge that has all of the locks on it. At the end of the island is a memorial called 'Martyrs Frandai de la Deportatien'. It does not not appear in some of the tourist books, but it is worth a visit.
Twilight. My first night in Paris...mild winter evening with a walk over the Seine. There it was...the bridges, the boats, and the passersby. Ahhhh. Paris!

A scenic working river. We took a river cruise down the Seine and were amazed at all of the houseboats parked along the banks as well as the number of large barges working the river. We saw the locks raising and lowering the ship on frequent occasions and all the sites and villages along the way

Great way to fill in a couple of hours.
